I was excited looking at the menu, and almost went for breakfast at lunch, but since it was my first visit, I played it safe with the burger, but opted to pay $2 extra for the sweet potato fries since I saw that they came with a side of creole tomato dressing. 

The burger was okay--just a burger, although I was happy to see that it was thoroughly cooked but not burnt. The sweet potato fries were very good--crispy with a slight flaky texture. I asked if they came with some sort of sauce and Waiter offered to bring out some of the dressing. 

The bacon was left off of one co-worker's sandwich; this wasn't addressed with Waiter. Another coworker was served regular fries (kinda meh--seasoning reminded me of Rally's) instead of sweet potato fries. This was addressed with Waiter; he brings her a handful of fries on a plate and says the rest will be out in a minute. They never came, but when she was charged the full $2 for the fries on her bill, I asked Waiter if her fries were coming out soon when she asked for a to go box for the rest of her club sandwich (she's not as confrontational as I am). FYI, she said the club was delicious.

Waiter offered to separate the checks, which was fine with us. We each gave him a card, and when he brought them back, he set them all in a pile in a wet spot on the table, with a "Thanks, guys," and walked off. At this point, the lunch rush had leveled off, and there were many empty tables--it wouldn't have been impossible for him to take an extra 30 seconds with our table. We were left to sift through the wet receipts and credit cards to figure out what belonged to who. I tipped less than 20%, which I NEVER do--I can almost always rationalize poor service, but today, not so much. 

I'd heard really good things about the food at this place, and would have been excited to go back and try the breakfast menu.  I can't say that service was so bad that I would never go back there if someone else wanted to eat there, but it doesn't get a recommendation from me.

Great service, delicious food, use Yelps "wait in line" feature during Mardi Gras to get on the list and manage your wait. Had the BBQ shrimp and grits - they were amazing! Portion sizes are generous.

Well worth the walk and wait. Use the noline app! That saved a ton of wait time. Everyone was friendly and helpful. Do ask you waiter/waitress for tips as I would have missed that you could get the peacemaker which you were able to pick two different versions of the eggs Benedict. Yum!  There was nothing that was a bad pick at all.

We went the day after the Sugar Bowl and the wait was not even that bad. They were very efficient at getting people in and through quickly. I got the barbecue shrimp and grits and it's probably the best I've had. I tend to expect the worst when it comes to shrimp and grits because there are so many varying types, but this was good. The boyfriend got the migas and it was also delicious. The butter that comes with the biscuit is so so good. I would buy it by the gallon. Our waiter was fantastic. I wish I had gotten his name. But he was hilarious and made the experience. Definitely will be back next time we're in NOLA.

If you try this place the bananas Foster are a MUST. I alao had a side of Fried Green Tomatoes,  amazing. The portions are good and the staff is great. Disclaimer:if you go between the hours of 10am-11:30am be prepared to wait for about 45 minutes.  It is worth the wait.
This place was amazing! It was busy put worth the wait. The food was very much honemade. The bacon infused bloody mary was so delicious! I highly recommended this place!

SO FREAKING DELISH!! 

Out of the many many places you have to choose from in NOLA to eat we definitely made sure to make it back here a second time before going home.  The portions fill you up and the flavors are wonderful. My husband is rather picky but did not have to ask for anything to be left off. The service is friendly and coffee is flowing.

If you don't plan ahead you will have to wait in line, but it is worth it!! YOU HAVE TO TRY IT!!! On the top of our list when we go back.

Sat at bar and I've been here many times, so I thought I knew what to expect....will not be returning!

First off the bartender finally asked me what I wanted to drink, I saw espresso on the menu, I ordered it on ice and she refused to make it.  I tried explaining to her that it is simply espresso over ice, I didn't need sugar or milk, just drip it over ice, well she refused and I should have left at the point, but I stayed, and then it got worse...

I tried the breakfast biscuit, the bacon was way too sweet, almost candied and entirely too much sugar, the biscuit was also too sweet, and the fried green tomato was the worst I've had.

After making a reservation and being told to arrive at 1135, we were not seated until 1:35. First of all, we were seated next to the outside trash dumpsters. We were eventually moved but unfortunately the service was not good for the following reasons:
1. Wait for Mimosa was 30 minutes. The waitress forgot.
2. The pecan pancakes were lukewarm at best.
3. The manager obviously thought we wanted a free meal. He made a comment about the meal already being consumed.
4. Waitress kept forgetting items: ice, coke, powder sugar, lemons, extra napkins. Very disappointing.

Food good 4 stars, service not so much 3 stars. 

Came at 755 AM and there was already a line halfway down the block.  They start seating at 8, it's a big location so ur in luck if ur in line by 8 am. 

The 3 of us each got bennies that we shared: egg cochon, corned beef, and chicken st Charles.  The corned beef good (lots of meat and potatoes) but the chicken was delicious (perfectly crisp on the outside). Try it with some syrup on top!

Service on the other hand: waiter talked back and was unnecessarily sarcastic. Water never refilled, coffee took awhile.  I had to ask another server for my syrup after it never came.
The biscuits were delicious, not overly heavy or dry. The mimosa was generously sized and fantastic. We were a group of 5 and all enjoyed our food! The brown sugar bacon was unbelievably yummy!

We went on a Thursday morning it was a slight wait but we said first available and sat at the bar which was fine. I got two poached eggs you can mix-and-match which is what the server suggested which I did.  I got the cochon  eggs and the fried chicken. My husband got the pancakes and he thought very good and a lot for your money. The service was incredibly fast as well.

My family ate here 2 out of our short 3 day stay in New Orleans, so that should tell you what we thought about the Ruby Slipper. I ordered the BBQ Shrimp and Grits, which was delicious! I usually like a cheesy shrimp and grits but this was so good! I saw some people complaining about the sauce, but that is what made the dish for me, it just pulled the flavor of the shrimp and grits together. Also, the biscuits were great, warm, soft and flaky. I usually don't bother eating the biscuits at most breakfast places but these were very good. 

I got the shrimp and grits both days, but everyone else in our group tried something different each day and they weren't disappointed. My husband ordered the Chicken St. Charles (which I sampled lol) and that was some of the best chicken we've had.

I'd highly recommend eating at the Ruby Slipper.

Great breakfast place in NOLA. Excellent adult beverage menu and plenty of great things to each. Their omelets are nice size and are not short of tasty additions inside. The Bloody Mary is great along with the mimosas. Highly recommend!
Visiting New Orleans and was told to have breakfast here. While the 45 minute wait seemed too long, it was only because the food is so good! Highly recommend the shrimp and grits!!

Yummy! Good food. They serve breakfast all day. I has the shrimp & grits. My hubby had the banana pecan pancakes with eggs & bacon. 

The iced coffee is amazing, but refills are full price :-(

Our food was very good - a tad short of being "finger licking" good ;-).

I recommend this spot!  Oh, beer, wine, & cocktails are also available.

Had a fantastic breakfast/brunch here on a Sunday.  I got the Eggs Blackstone, which could be described as a version of Eggs Benedict on a buttermilk biscuit.  In addition to this, the fresh fruit bowl that came with it was really good, when a lot of restaurants seem to phone it in.  The coffee was a very good breakfast type coffee, too.  

Seating was good.  We got a nice sidewalk table.  No complaints here.
Great food and great service. Banana foster is much recommended. And is the Charleston chicken

This place is busy! So be prepared to wait. We were two people so it was 15mins but larger parties were waiting up to an hour. What is nice was there was a waitress taking only drink orders so I got a double bloody mary and my friend a mimosa to enjoy while we waited. We were seated at the bar and we both got eggs benedict plates; I had the hot smoked salon and my friend had the eggs cochon. DELICIOUS. so good. I think the waitress said they were famous for their eggs benedict selections. Come try it out, you won't be disappointed. I just do not know if i would come back with all the tasty selections new orleans has to offer; so much to try!

What a fun place for breakfast!  I had bookmarked this place to try and when we walked up, I was thinking it was going to be a while because there were a lot of people waiting.  We told the friendly hostess we'll take whatever comes first!  10 minutes later, my name was called.  

We were given a small table in the middle of the dining room, and yes, it is loud with conversations bouncing off of the interiors.  So if you're one of those people that don't like eating in loud places, don't come here.  Our sweet and friendly server, Brandi, told us to take our time, but in the meantime, how about a drink...their mimosas are huge and don't skimp on champagne!  I ordered the chicken St. Charles...crispy fried chicken benny with a delicious hollandaise on some big ass bithkits!  This was sooooo delicious!  I should've asked for extra hollandaise!

My friends ordered the southern breakfast of eggs and bacon and a big 'ol bithkit!  We shared the french toast batons....very good!  Another round of mimosas and we were good...really good!  Again, Brandi was great!  Checked in with us a couple of times, and she had a number of tables.  Fun place to eat!

We had a wonderful time, and would definitely come back the next time I'm in the area.  If you have special dietary needs, please stay at home or eat somewhere else.  If you're in a hurry, go somewhere else.  This place is not for all, but I sure loved my experience here.  

There's no place like....Ruby Slipper!
Ate breakfast three days in a row because we just had to keep going back. The specials offered were outstanding and the coffee was the best I've ever tasted. The grits were amazing

The main thing I want to accomplish with this review is to give props to our server Roy. He was a five star server, who was so nice, and very accommodating. 

With that aside, the wait was very long. But, my friend and I were able to get a really good bacon infused Bloody Mary while we waited. 

The staff at the host/hostest stand were not friendly, but at least were not rude. Except for Matt. Matt looked extremely miserable, almost like it was painful to be there.  I tried to be friendly and make conversation, and he responded to both questions I asked with very cute, one word answers, and no smile, or even a hint of a personality. My friend and I were seated by the front door, and it was cold and breezy. Another table opened up, away from the entry, so we asked a random staff member if we could move. That staff member asked grumpy Matt, who rolled his eyes, shook is head, and said "no, we don't do that". A few minutes later, we asked our kind and friendly server Roy the same questions, and he replied "sure, no problem", and we moved. 

When Matt walked over and saw we had moved, he got visibily frustrated and huffed off. 

Anyway, the food was pretty good.  One of our orders didn't come out correctly, but we didn't complain. 

All in all, the food was good, but most staff were just blah, and in my opinion, it wasn't worth the rate. The positive stars are more for Roy, who was awesome. Thank you!

Simply amazing!! The food! The Mimosas! And super friendly servers  breakfast heaven. Ruby Slipper is a must for a NOLA morning experience. Don't mind the wait because the food and service are worth every minute.

We'd visited this location once before & were excited to go again. It did not disappoint! The food is just so good! Be prepared to wait, though, because there's always a crowd. They do have a system available to check in through an app ahead of time & this is really helpful. I wish more NO restaurants would use this. We only waited about 8-10 minutes after we checked in with the hostess. The 3 of us were seated at the bar, which worked out fine & allowed us to eat rather than wait for a table. Service was friendly & food comes out fairly quickly. We ate a variety of entrees--grits (yum!), French toast batons (my son ordered these & it's a ton of food!), eggs, biscuits, and cochon eggs Benedict (amazing!). Every single bite of every single food was fabulous! This place is definitely a favorite of ours when visiting NO.

Super long waiting line at 10 am on Tuesday. So I thought it should be somethin good. I ordered salmon plate. They didn't have it. They ran out of salmon at 10 am!!!!! Then I ordered the first thing I saw on the menu since the bartender was still.waiting for the order. I just needed time.to.decide on.somethin else. Oh well.. I chose another dish on their speciality menu. Not impressed at all. There was a girl sitting right next to me didn't finish her plate. The bartender asked her what is wrong..she said that she didn't like the pancake because it was too hard to bite. How is that possible to make the pancake that way!!ANyways i will never go there again. I do not think that will be a big loss in my life!
I had the eggs blackstone, and they were fantastic. Very warm atmosphere and friendly staff, close to The Quarter. Recommend to all!
The omelet and the bananas foster was delicious. The grits were not my favorite thing but the homemade buttermilk biscuit is worth a try. The best past is the coffee which has free refills.

Great breakfast & spicy bloody Mary's. Sat at bar, service was solid and level you'd want at a diner. Expect to wait for a table. Had traditional breakfast; eggs, meat & grits. Stone grnd grit consistency and
Flavor  
Next time I'll try Benedict as it looked good.
The food and staff were excellent. Make sure you download the NoWait app so that you don't have to wait in line as long. The Trifecta plate was spectacular. Best brunch spot.
The banana Foster French toast was delicious and so was the coffee. Service was amazing as well. Highly recommend.
Service. Is poor. Rude waitress delivered my food. Manager apologized. Food was tasty until I found......A hair in it. Overall not worth the money and built in 15% tip.
Awesome breakfast!  The kitchen is seriously trying here.  Our server may have been high, but she was sweet. Don't miss this place.

Hopping, loud, bustling joint on a late Saturday morning of St. Paddy's weekend here in NOLA. Wait was tolerable, they were turnin and burnin. Had a Bloody Mary to kick off the day, and it was very spicy, and had pickled green beans as a garnish (a first for me). 

Table ordered French toast pain perdu, spinach bacon and Swiss omelet with deep fried potatoes, corned beef bennies, shrimp and grits. 

The biscuits were epic in size and flavor, kinda crusty, crispy but very soft inside. 

The shrimp and grits were good, not fabulous, lacked some basic seasoning and needed something else. Not sure. It wasn't horrible, just not memorable. I also ordered the corned beef hash side, fresh, good, again lacked some seasoning or that one ingredient that makes you go WOW. The horseradish cream sauce I ordered with it (one of the 'Bennie' ingredients) made it, that and the bottom half of the epic biscuit. The top half was munched with butter and grape jelly. Too bad they didn't have some sort of home made jam or marmalade.

I tasted the French toast, it was made with French bread (like po boy bread I guess), very good. Boss finished her omelet, the potatoes were reported as really good by number one son, I did not partake. They were small, maybe new or red potatoes that were halved or quartered and fried to a dark golden brown then had some sort of magic seasoning. The omelet was fried well in a thick circle of eggyness, then folded over. I like mine very thin like a crepe, but I didn't order it, so who cares?

Solid choice for breakfast, and they also have brunch and lunch items but our krewe did not go there. Portion size is large. No cafe au lait, but they had steamed milk? That confused me. The server didn't seem to know what I was asking for on that one. For some reason he did not charge for coffee and tea and chased us down outside when they lost one of the signed receipts during busing. We liked how a larger party could pay by the seat (put seats 1,4, and 6 on this card, and the rest on that one).  Very convenient. We had 6 people, gratuity was added for us.

I answered the survey questions and they do have two televisions at this location, the one I noticed was tuned to CNN, no way you could have heard it in this place when we were there. Probably convenient for the business types' weekday breakfast routine.

Easily my favorite breakfast spot ! The lines get long but with the option to add yourself to the waitlist , you can still enjoy a popular New Orleans local spot. The pancakes are delicious and the mimosas are large ! We went twice while we were visiting . The service is great and the portions are large . Not a disappointment.

As always, my BFF and I are always out looking for a new restaurant to try...

My first experience at Ruby Slipper was okay. The wait was 30 minutes for two people and you had to put your name on the list because there are no reservations here. 

We were seated in the far back. Our waitress was nice and suggested a bunch of her faves. I ordered the Eggs Cochon and BFF ordered the St. Charles Chicken. They were similar dishes except mine was pulled pork on an English muffin and Jonathan's was fried chicken on a biscuit. I didn't like mine. It didn't have any taste. The chicken was better. It had more flavor. 

It was very filling. I only ate one. Two was a bit too much so I packed it to go. I ended up giving it to a homeless guy because I knew I wasn't going to want to eat it later.

Wish one of us would have tried a sweet dish so we could have something different. Maybe I will try the Banana Foster's French toast next time...if there is a next time.
Not a 5 star because they couldn't get the egg Benedict right. Sent it back twice because the egg was cooked all the way through. Drinks were great though!

I will forever come her every NOLA visit! The wait can take a while, but the staff is friendly and the food never disappoints. 

A mimosa is a must they add a splash of pomegranate juice that adds a little twist.

I credit this restaurant for swapping my favorite breakfast food from waffles to eggs Benedict. My boyfriend and I made a point to eat brunch here during our NOLA stay after more than one friend recommended it.

Food:
It was bomb. Point blank period. I got the creole and pork eggs Benedict and we split a blueberry pancake. The eggs were perfectly poached and the sauce was so creamy and flavorful. The pancake was perfectly sweet and fluffy, not overdone on the edges, and we absolutely devoured it. I got a traditional mimosa which wasn't super stellar. It was good just nothing to rave about. I did see a few people with the house special mimosa which seemed to be popular- maybe give that one a shot instead. 

Atmosphere:
Casual and bustling for sure. They had the floor to ceiling window/doors which are ever present in this city. So it had a nice charm to it. It was definitely busy for a Saturday brunch however. I STRONGLY recommend using the no wait app to call ahead for you. Otherwise you may have a 1.5+ hour wait. We only stood outside for maybe 15 minutes since we took that option. 

Overall I highly recommend this brunch spot. The locals and tourists alike enjoy it, so don't miss out on some amazing Nola brunch!

One of the best brunches I've had. 
Ambiance and service- it's a fun lively service. We didn't have a wait. The staff were fast and very friendly. 

Food: 
Banana Fosters French toast- if you're looking to treat yourself, this is your treat. The French toast was flavorful. The bread was a little soggy but likely because it was sitting in a pool of syrup. The bananas and raisins compliment it well. The best part was the apple wood smoked bacon which among the best bacon I've had, thick, flavorful, and the perfect crispness

They let you mix and match the eggs benedicts. I had the eggs Cochon - deliciously juicy pork, and the st. Charles- fried chicken. The pork was really flavorful and was surprisingly good with the poached egg.

If you're in NoLA come here!!

For a place so highly rated I was expecting a lot more...

I popped in for a late breakfast early lunch. 

I was alone so I was seated almost immediately 

The place was fairly busy. Didn't seem like any of the staff were overwhelmed. 

Now maybe I ordered the wrong dish but for a place with a 4+star rating I was expecting something of significance. 

I ordered the 3 little pig omelette. 

Let's start with it took just about 25min to get served...  it's an omelette. 

It was an very uninspired dish (see photo). 

Simple little omelette. Couple pieces of sausage (mainly) and a sprinkle of bacon and ham....  apparently those 3 little pigs are on house arrest because only a couple came to my plate. 

With the entree I got a couple pieces of fruit and a dense (not flaky) biscuit. 

The best part of the dish was the whipped butter with some syrup on it...  that's a little disappointing that that's the highlight. 

And at the end the worst part. Sitting at the bar and watching two little cockroaches run around the underside of the bar...  definitely not the most appetizing thing to see but with a restaurant in this location with the door always open you have to assume there will be little critters running around.

Best Brunch!!! Mimosas, Bloody Marys, breakfast food, hellllo! You can get in line on Yelp, which is super helpful. Food is always delish and service is on point. Perfect for starting or finishing a long night in New Orleans. Exceptional service from start to finish. We were served drinks while waiting in line outside. Our server was prompt and courteous. Got in and out in about 45 minutes  I had the skinny migas on this trip, 10/10

I ordered a breakfast of steak and eggs and it was alright...the banana pecan pancakes were good, but not necessarily fantastic.  The long wait for our food was a bit annoying (especially when other people who arrived after us received their food first), but the manager apologized and our server was friendly.

If I were to come back, I'd try some specific items on the menu everyone else likes...this is conveniently located, but very popular with huge crowds as soon as it opens, so plan accordingly.
Very delicious food! Awesome waiter Just a little on the noisy side. It reminds me of the Waffle House. Would definitely go again.

How can you give this anything less than 5 stars. The food is awesome, way better than some other highly rated restaurants.

Our server was Jacus and what a recommendation, the eggs cochon, absolute must have and the st charles chicken. Awesome.

My friend ordered costa rican and it was pretty good as well. Cafe late rocks here better than any coffee shop that i have been in new orleans.

Let's start this by saying... add yourself to the waitlist as soon as you think about going! I was shocked to see so many people waiting for the opportunity to dine, but luckily the waitlist helps you time your arrival a bit better. The wait was about 58-65 mins on a Saturday morning, so we arrived close to the 60 min mark. We had to wait a bit longer to be seated, but luckily the weather held up. They have a couple benches to sit outside while you wait and they come out to call names when it's time to be seated. 

As far as seating, they have patio // outdoor seating, as well as plenty of space indoors. The service is realitvely fast and friendly. Our waitress was efficient and gave good recommendations. To me, the menu is standard, but all of the brunch options were covered for sure. My friends really enjoyed the special which was some type of seafood eggs benedict. I tried bbq shrimp and grits, but don't be alarmed, there's no bbq sauce on it. I can't say it was the best shrimp and grits I've had, but it was okay. I asked for a side of whatever sauce they put on the catfish and grits, and enjoyed that flavor much more! It also came with a massive biscuit, which I'm sure is a great option to coat your stomach before hitting Bourbon st. 

Overall, my experience wasn't anything wowing. I think it's worth it to maybe try a good amount of dishes, because based on the wait, something we didn't get must be excellent!

This was really good! Prompt seating at the bar but both times I went there was a line. However, the food took forever to come out. It seemed they didn't have food runners/helpers so the bar staff had to do EVERYTHING. They were taking orders, making drinks/coffee etc and then had to go get food too. Just poor management but the food was great!

Best Breakfast Lunch in New Orleans! Spicy Bloodies and Mimosas to die for. John is my fave. would go back again and again. all around fantastic breakfast and lunch cuisine. Just order the special already!

Very disappointed. After eating at the smaller location some months back, I expected some tasty breakfast and instead received mediocre, bland, greasy food. Server was very sweet which is the only reason I am not giving 1 star. After the second location it seems as though the food  is not what it used to be. Isn't that why we go to eat somewhere....for good tasty food?
Worth the wait to be seated.  Grab a bloody Mary and take a quick walk around the area.

Get the Chicken St. Charles. Easily one of the best items on the menu! Always a LONG wait and crowded but the food is definitely worth it. Check out the other locations if you are looking for a more quiet place to go but I feel like this location has the best original, qwerky charm. Some of the seating is in a very tall "bar" style counter which can be shared with as many people that can fit whether or not they are in your party. Definitely not an intimate restaurant if you are searching for a good "date" spot, but their daily specials on French toast are always enticing!

Beautiful , bountiful and delicious breakfast choices here. The place was packed so we sat at the bar (this is New Orleans) and got to watch some "local color" as a young man sat looking at his breakfast solid food but drank several glasses of Bloody Mary of which they have huge urns behind the bar.  
Our breakfasts were wonderful- stuffed French toast with berries and cream cheese filling and eggs, bacon, biscuit and hash browns for the protein and cholesterol. 
Food was great and the other items we saw around us looked incredible. 
Beautiful presentations, delicious food and drunks  at 8:30 in the morning. Can't wait to go back!

I got the southern breakfast and didn't have to worry about eating again until dinner time. The service is excellent and quick and the restaurant is very old and charming. I would highly recommend before a day of walking and sightseeing.
Ruby Slipper cafe did not disappoint. From the food to our fabulous waiter, Tucker. Thank you for the amazing food and hospitality.
This place is alright, it is hyped up. Food lacked flavor mimosa where room temperature, nothing to write home about.
This place was awesome. My friends and I came through one morning and loved it!  Next time I visit New Orleans this place will be a must on the list of stops!!!!

This was my favorite breakfast location, (in a city with very competitive wonderful dining).   Indulge in the Bananas Foster French Toast made with real French bread, served with generous slices of thick slab bacon.  Restaurant is casual, clean; staff extremely attentive and personable; menu diverse and interesting, but also with standard fare for the less adventurous.  Wait time approximated 10 minutes.  Reasonably priced. A definite must for downtown or French Quarter visit (5 minute walk to the Quarter.)

Wonderful place Go early to beat the crowd.   Sit at the bar!!  Awesome bartenders !! Fun !!   The food is wonderful.  And friendly staff!! Cute atmosphere !!  Fun place.   Unique place.  Your will enjoy.   The line does move fast.      Fried green tomatoes.   Great salad !!

The atmosphere was nice and the food was good! I chose the Peacemaker with a vanilla latte for a morning pick me up. The Ruby Slipper is known for its egg Benedict dishes and if you're indecisive like me, the Peacemaker is a fabulous choice! Instead of choosing only one type of egg Benedict, you can choose two from the menu for $15. I chose the mon Cochon and the St. Charles (not sure if I got those names right). I liked the mon cochon better than the St Charles. I personally thought the chicken from the St Charles was dry and they should have put more hollandaise sauce. The biscuit was also dry. Would have been better if they used an English muffin. Overall, good restaurant and good brunch spot.

This restaurant is pretty busy, we had a 45-60 minute wait but were seated in 40 minutes at the bar. The staff is very friendly and helpful, always filling drinks or asking if you need anything. 

My husband got the eggs Cochan and I got the smoked salmon Bennie. Both were delicious and came out of the kitchen quickly. The Cochan was the better of the two because the pork debris was so delicious! Would definitely recommend this place for breakfast!

I WILL NEVER COME BACK AGAIN!!! 40 minutes in line, another 40 minutes waiting for food after order was placed. Food was just average... not to mention I was sitting on a broken bar chair without foot rest and waiting for this crape. Oh BTW, I got a splash of dirty water right onto my face when they cleaned up the bar seats next to me...  Did I tell you this was just a brunch on Wednesday?!

Went here Labor Day weekend (Saturday), arrived at about 10:00. The wait was around 40 minutes and the front door staff was a little disorganized, but not too bad.  
I had the crab cake breakfast special and my bf had the Eggs Blackstone. Both  dishes  were wonderful. The crab cake was perfectly seasoned and full of crab meat and the buttermilk biscuit was divine.  My bf loved the Eggs Blackstone so much he wanted to come back the next day.
We will definitely eat here the next time we are in town.
Food waa fresh and good! Went 2 days in a row and got our fix.  Egg Benedict  was excellent I got eggs overhard since I don't like runny eggs.  The pancakes are delicious!  Prices are excellent.
Great food and and awesome and friendly service from Emery, definitely would recommend this place!

This place is spacious without feeling crowded.  The Migas (tex/mex eggs) for breakfast was Gluten Free and very yummy!  We arrived around 9:30 and probably got the last free table in the place.  

Service was fast and friendly!

This is an ideal breakfast/brunch/lunch spot. In fact, they've been voted Best Breakfast/Brunch spot in New Orleans 3 years in a row. This place will not break the bank for good food. The Bennies are great. Fantastic omelets including a build-your-own option. Check out the menu on yelp!. The staff are upbeat, pleasant and quick. Despite what seemed like a packed house and a line waiting outside, we were seated even quicker than our hostess' estimated wait time. I really enjoyed my dining experience here on a lazy NOLA morning/afternoon.

The Ruby Slipper is absolutely the best breakfast I have had in New Orleans, and maybe even my life. Usually pancakes are a close second for me when it comes to me ordering, but at the price of $2.50 for a pancake on the side, how could I refuse. As it turns out it was the best pancake I have ever tasted. I also ordered the Costa Rican breakfast and was blown away. The food quality was great and the price was absolutely fair at $28 for 3 plates. A must when visiting NOLA.
The the little piggy omelette is great.....the service was slow but friendly.  If you have time and want yummy yummy for your tummy this is the place.

I went for breakfast today, and while the service and atmosphere were good the food was mediocre. The omelet tasted like a burnt pan and the meat on the eggs cochon was lukewarm.  I wouldn't rush to return here, but I could say that of many spots.

Yassss this brunch was amazing!! Really strong, really good tequila Bloody Mary and blood orange margaritas. Fried chicken eggs benedict was everything and loved the pancake flight. 

Joined the waitlist and barely had to wait 10 mins for a table on a Friday morning. Service was fast and our waiter Justin was a honeyyy! Definitely would recommend

Really and truly, there's literally nothing bad to say here about the food. I've had the cochon dish (poached eggs, biscuits, cochon de lait) probably about four times. I had another dish with eggs and catfish. And I've had their pancakes and waffle specials and even their french fries. And all were quite good. Delicious, in fact. The one thing that keeps me from 5 stars is the size of the restaurant(s). Maybe it's unfair, but it kinda stinks to have to count on waiting at least an hour every time I want to eat there because the space is so small. All of that said, there's nothing further negative I can say about this popular local establishment. The food is consistently great, the service is always awesome (I'm a server, and therefore a picky snob), and the drinks are top notch as well. I will continue to eat here, despite the long, long waits.

Our party of four had to wait about an hour to get in, but it was worth the wait. While we were waiting in cold temperatures they offered us coffee (paid for it outside). By the time we made it inside we were hungry but caffeinated. All of us order different things, all arrived at the same time. It was beautifully presented and the taste was brilliant. I had Egg Cochon, can't recommend it enough. Beautiful biscuit, smothered in delicious pulled pork with poached egg and hollandaise sauce. The service once in was quick, efficient, and helpful. Do yourself a favor and go there if you're in NOLA.
Food was great! Everything was cooked to perfection.  In a group of 5, they had something for the vegetarian, turkey and chicken sausage. Also, portions were more than enough.
Bacon infused Bloody Mary is delicious! Might sound gross but it's a must try! St. Peter's was delicious. I had it with catfish instead of the drum but it was still delicious!
Worth the wait! Use the "No Wait" app or else you'll bake outside waiting. Great place for every palate.
Brunch with everyone was amazing and this place had the largest mimosas ever!! I think I left brunch tipsy but it was amazing hahahah

The line was already Building UP when we got here at 0745 am. Opens at 8 ordered And the last who attended US was Realty nice. Great full big breakfast. Tried the louisianan omelette, French toast And the breakfast sandwich with fried Green tomato.bon apetite!!!! Way great to start the morning

Went there this morning and literally had the worse cup of coffee I've ever had in my life.  Think someone needs to clean the machine.  Other than that, it was standard diner fare.  Nothing to get mad over, nothing to rave over.  If you're in a hurry, and staying at one of the nearby hotels, it's perfect - if you have time, walk into the Quarter and get something better (and potentially cheaper) though.

**EDIT 01/09/2013 After I wrote the above, the manager wrote me a really nice email saying they discovered later in the morning that the coffee had been brewed wrong and they threw it out.  Everybody has a bad day, so I'm giving them an additional star for being on top of things and responsive.

The food  is horrible! Bland  and not original  New  Orleans  food, just  over priced and overrated! You can stop anyone  that's from there  and ask for  any seafood  and  they'll point  you  in  the right  direction   Native  of  New  Orleans  but wanted  to  give  this  place a try and  NEVER  again!

This is the place to go for breakfast if you're in NOLA! 

Great food.  Wish I could give this place 5 stars, but the service wasn't 5 star service, hence the 4 stars.

First time I came was the first morning in NOLA (3/6/14) and I was plain jane and ordered the basic breakfast.  

My last morning I came in for brunch and ordered a double mimosa with the eggs blackstone, which were amazing!  Definitely a must try if you're in town. The mimosa was enough to make me "happy" after three gulps lol.  The bacon was nice and crispy, the eggs delicious, the sauce perfect, and the biscuit was the icing on the cake.  I do believe the biscuits are made in house and they are huge!  Must try!

Dear Evan - my very unenthusiastic server..... All the raves on Yelp try to encourage people to experience great service and food yet this is not what happened. Evan, you were inattentive, slow and pretty much just took our order  - and you didn't even get that right. My moms milk was requested at her breakfast- she got it 3/4 through her breakfast after she requested again to be brought along with the potatoes my cousin ordered with her meal, which never showed. When my mom asked for another coffee when a Nat flew into her current cup, we waited over 10 minutes while evan casually watched TV behind the bar and spoke to co workers while walking around with the coffee in hand (gross who would drink it after that ?!) The eggs Cochon were cold and definitely not worthy of its praise- I'm pretty sure my eggs weren't even cooked all the way. You go, ruby slipper , you just lost yourself a repeat visitor and gained this review !

Use the NoWait App to check in remotely and save your place in line. This helps so much plus you can see when your name will be called. If you are waiting outside they serve bloody Marys and Mimosas which is cool. I had the Eggs Blackstone which is a variation of a classic eggs Benedict. It was delicious! Service was great, fast and Kenneth was very personable. Highly recommend!
Over hyped and over crowded. Food was okay. Not worth the 1hr wait in my opinion...but not bad.
Delicious breakfast on a Friday morning. Good coffee and I had the Peacemaker. Great service too.

The food was delicious. I had the Louisian omelette and it was so good. My dining mates had the BBQ shrimp and grits and Pancakes in which they both raved. The wait was 1.5 hours. Download the no wait app from your phone to save time
In all my 20 years I have never had such a perfect breakfast. I would come back from the grave just to have breakfast here again. Highly recommend.

Love this place! I went because of Yelp recommendations when I was visiting New Orleans and returned the next day because we couldn't get enough. We were on their doorstep waiting for them to open both days and it was well worth the trip. The Bananas Foster French Toast was A-Mazing (but nothing we ate wasn't worth getting again).

My husband and I came here for breakfast during our trip to NOLA. It was a hop and a skip from our hotel so we decided to walk over and check it out. We had over an hour's wait; however the options to sit and wait were very few. There was only standing room outside. There was a server taking drink orders as we waited, which was a plus because it was pushing 80 degrees outside. When we were seated we instantly put our order in...why not?...we only had an hour+ wait. I had the Catfish and grits and my husband had the 3 Little Pigs Omelet. The fish and grits was good, although I wasn't too keen on my fish being served directly on top of my grits. My husband had no complaints on his omelet. Our server was super welcoming and friendly. She continuously checked on us and answered any questions we had about the menu. Upon returning to NOLA, I'm not sure if I'd put this at the top of my "Must-Eat" list. With the long wait I was really expecting something grand, but it fell short. I was, however, very moved by the sign explaining the name of the restaurant.

I've had some great meals here and a couple of okay ones, but overall a very positive experience. Maybe the expansion cost them a bit in consistency. The drinks are always fantastic and I wouldn't hesitate to go back when in town.
Great Breakfast/Brunch spot!  The Mimosas & Bloody Mary were excellent.  I have the the Eggs Cochon and they were very tasty.  Whatever you have I don't think you will be disappointed.

Wait was 30 minutes to get and cost me $25.00 to park as there was no street parking available today, however the food was good!  Not sure if I would go back as I think there are other options in the city!  Had the shrimp and grits....bacon was excellent however and the biscuit was just ok.

Saw the reviews and decided to try breakfast and boy not disappointed. We sat outside and had the pull pork with eggs, the byo omelette and French toast sticks. Everything was delicious, service was friendly and if you are up for it try their brandy and milk. It is a bit strong but nice enough for an early morning pick me up.

I got the Cochon signature dish.  Flavor was awesome...Only thing lacking was the temperature of the food.  Had a bite of my gfs Spanish omelette...AMAZING!...The biscuits and buttermilk pancakes were so good.  For drinks we had the bacon Bloody Mary and regular Bloody Mary...both very good.  Highly recommend this spot..worth the wait.
Had the Eggs Blackstone and chocolate milk. Worth the wait. Omg. Wow. always a long line, don't be afraid just plan ahead or get there right when they open.

Wow, woke up wanting pancakes and found this place on the google. Sat at the bar, everyone SO friendly (definitely what I'm coming to expect in this amazing town). Had poached eggs (actually poached, not in cups), grits w/ cheese per recommendation, banana-pecan pancake. Delicious, excellent coffee. You can't go wrong!

Came back here after visiting last year. I dunno what happened. Seems like the long line is unnecessary. It appears the reason for the line is just slow service. I opted to sit at the bar with my husband to cut my wait time. The bar was messy. One bartender made drink after drink after drink completely ignoring the fact that my husband and I, along with two other parties are waiting to order. Mimosas are not rocket science, take a break from mixing OJ and champagne and take our orders. We all just stared at her making drinks until finally she noticed she had an audience. The other bartender I have no idea what she was doing. She was just standing at the register "looking busy". AGAIN slow service causing this long wait. Other than the service, the biscuits were great as well as my french toast and bacon. One more thing, it's time to throw away/replace the plastic champagne glasses they look very dirty because the plastic is so worn.. just a little advice.
Service is great. Food is great. Busy place. Cool ambience. Order to share....Large portions..Enjoy....

Wow wow wow! Now I know why this place always has a long wait. The food was delicious! We ordered the peacemaker which allows you to combine two different styles of Benedict's together. We chose the Eggs Cochon & the Chicken St.Charles. Both had their own unique flavor. I would highly recommend trying these two since both are their signature dishes. We also ordered the  Banana Foster Pain Perdu. One word - heaven. It doesn't even need maple syrup! That's how good it is.

Our server, Theresa, was such a sweetheart, and the service was impeccable. The food was outstanding! I had the shrimp and grits, and my boyfriend had the Chicken St Charles Benedict. Both were delicious. Additionally we had the pig candy bacon and it was sweet without being inedible. Great choice for breakfast and lunch!

This place is OKAY. I got the club and yes, a sandwich is a sandwich, but this one was pretty disappointing. Wasn't really hot, the bread wasn't good quality, and the fries were just MEH. Not even well seasoned. The hot chocolate was decent and the alcoholic milk drink tasted like a slightly strong mud slide. Not really my thing. The service wasn't great either. Girl wasn't nice and was rushing us in and out. All in all, skip it.

Best service in New Orleans! I was losing hope in receiving good customer service in this city; however, Jen has restored my faith. I was having brunch with my family on our last day of our New Orleans visit. We waited about an hour to be sat. There were a lot of people waiting so I was hoping this meant the food would be delicious. It was! Jen, our server, walked us through the menu and gave us great recommendations. She was knowledgeable and polite while never getting frustrated with our ton of questions. I was not sure if I wanted to order a Bloody Mary so she brought me over a sample of the mix which was awesome so I ordered one. Food came out in a timely fashion. Everything looked and tasted amazing. The food, as good as it was, still comes second to this amazing service. It was refreshing to have someone so genuine and welcoming take care of us. Thank you Jen!
Yum! First stop here for brunch and it was delicious. We each had a bloody, mimosas and a different Benedict. Def visit!
It was so good the first day, I had to go the morning before I left. The service is awesome and the food is worth the wait. You will definitely leave full!
French toast was just okay, not really worth the 1.5 hour wait. You're better of just going to ihop!
solid tasting fast breakfast. All the staples. Historic charm. Low priced. Great coffee and french toast!

They were awesome and accommodating.  We did not have our whole party but they kept us at the top of the list even though they were busy.  Ate the Eggs Cochon.  It was good.  Different though because looking at the pork it reminded me of our Hawaii Kalua Pig, so was thinking of ore salty than sweet.  It still was very good.  Also. this is the first restaurant I have ever been to that texts you when they are going to seat you.

Hands down best breakfast I could have asked for in New Orleans!  There are several locations and there just happened to be one by our hotel.  I used the No Wait app to secure a place in line, and boy am I glad I did.  On a Friday morning, the line to get in was down the block. But I had "nowait" by using the app.  Eggs benedicts until your stomach is full.  All sorts of varieties of them!  And of course you can't forget the alcohol because you're in New Orleans - a screwdriver compliments it well. But if you're a Bloody Mary fan, they are famous for their bacon Bloody Mary.  If you go to New Orleans and don't eat breakfast here at least once, you're really doing your self an inservice.

They have a "special" for $6 bacon Bloody Mary's if you check in, no where in the shop nor on the app does it say when it expires but the bartender says they stopped yesterday, it's only $2.78 more but that's pretty annoying - so fix it someone. Also fix customer service.

Wade at the Magazine street location has been a true gentlemen as he helps me plan an event from 2000 miles away!

I've never been to New Orleans but when I get there, Ruby Slipper is first on my list!!

Everyone says go here...and you should! Use the NoWait App or put yourself on the virtual line on Yelp and it is a breeze! Woke up at 9 on a Saturday to put our spot in the line for brunch at 1030 and we only had to wait 15 mins when we got there.

Mimosa and Boozy Cold Brew were delicious.

All of us were happy with our meal. Was in with a party of vegans, vegetarians, and non-vegetarians. They accommodated the vegans by doing the Costa Rica Dish with no eggs and cheese. Not the most delicious vegan brunch but still good! Very helpful with the swapping and answered all Qs nicely.

Brunch prices were super reasonable and came out to cheaper than our dinner the previous night!

Delicious, $ friendly, and nifty line reservation. Enjoy!!

What a great breakfast.  I had the eggs Benedict mix and match with Cochon and the St Charles.  The biscuits they are on are my favorite.  The St Charles with the fried chicken was a great blend of savory and the hollandaise sauce was outstanding.  Adding some hot sauce made it standout.  My wife had the Bananas foster French toast which was really good and the bacon it came with was my favorite to play off the sweet French toast.
Fantastic service! One of the best meals (breakfast) we had during our stay. The Costa Rican breakfast is tasty and you have to try one of their banana/pecan pancakes.

Get. The. Eggs. Blackstone.
We were staying at The Pelham Hotel, and thought we would try the cute restaurant downstairs, even though we were still up for more cajun food. The eggs blackstone is the best breakfast sandwich I have ever had. Three of us each ordered something different and it was still one of the best places we ate at while in New Orleans.

Came here during a family trip years ago. We tried the grits and banana foster, can't remember the rest of the items. The brunch is good, not great, typical American southern food. Overall is enjoyable moment.

First time - Long wait 
Food took forever- was cold and just so-So
Would never come back!!

I dream of breakfast at Ruby Slipper. I have experienced the food in New Orleans and Pensacola. 

Make a reservation and be willing to wait- it is worth it. 

I enjoyed the eggs cochon and had to sneak a taste of the French toast - both were fabulous.
Do yourself a favor and sign up for a place in line on the app. Best bloody Mary I've ever had. Food was amazing.  Great staff

Yaassss!  The Ruby Slipper Cafe was one of my favorite stops on NOLA. Right around the corner from my hotel (Sheraton), easy bar seating, and amazing food!
In a city dense it deliciousness, this was a welcome discovery.  I walked right in on a bustling Tuesday morning and pulled up to the breakfast bar with ease.  I ordered the bananas foster french toast with a side of scrambled eggs and a cup o' joe.  Service was super friendly and super quick.  The staff referred to me as "baby" sweetie" and "my love" every time they came by and I was eating it up!  on top of that, my food was scrumptious!  The french toast was amazing and the bacon and eggs were good!  The coffee was even good and we all know that never happens.
All around a fantastic stop for a New Orleans breakfast!

I really, really wanted to like this place, and based on the other reviews, I was sure that I would. I love breakfast - I could eat it four or five times a day, and the wife-unit loves various egg dishes - so this place seemed right up our alley.  But they missed...

Atmosphere: Some neat extras on the wall, but the most interesting was mostly hidden by the server access to the kitchen.  Overall very loud since it is just one huge open area with no sound baffles.

Service: We sat at the bar and had a friendly (although loud) conversation with the bar tender. Minor complaint in this department was the wife finished her coffee drink shortly after the food was delivered and they didn't ask if she wanted more / anything else. Perhaps we should have made more eye contact while eating.

Cost: Reasonable, if it'd been cooked better...

Food: The most important part, and the reason it's 2 stars.  Sorry for all the text, I promise I'm a man of few words - so you know they're required...

Wife-unit's Eggs Cochon: overall she enjoyed them, but noted a few things regarding her plate: 1. there wasn't enough sauce, 2. her bacon wasn't crispy (as requested), 3. the egg was almost cold (even sitting on top of warm meat).  You can see from the pics here on Yelp the inconsistency in the sauce... some have quite a bit, others very little.

My "cheesecake" french toast: unfortunately worse.  Actually, again you don't have to look any further than the pictures right here on Yelp of the french toast or pancakes to again see how inconsistently they are cooked.  Mine was basically burned on one side of the bread (even darker than any of the pictures I can find posted here), and the other side was completely uncooked.  Maybe they thought it would even out? ;-)  I realize they're kinda making a sandwich with the "filling" between two pieces of french toast, but it ends up being too soggy if they don't fry both sides of the toast.

With so many other options, I'd be hard pressed to go back.

This place always seems to be packed.  The pancakes were great and breakfast/brunch selection is great.  I would definitely come back for breakfast on my next visit.  The waiter was very inattentive but the food made up for it.

Excellent once again.  Service is only about 4 stars in my opinion, but it's a breakfast joint.  

We had omelets this time, but the eggs cochon is great.

The cappuccino was amazing, surprisingly enough.

There is a lot to say about the Ruby Slipper Cafe. If youre going to come for breakfast (which isnt an option, its a must) a wait starts to form at 9AM. They do have an option that you can put your name on the waitlist via Yelp or their App which is awesome. My girlfriend and I started with Mimosa's and Boozy Iced Coffee. The drink were delicious and perfect size. My girlfriend had an omelette which was perfectly cooked & came with fresh fruit & a biscuit. I had the Eggs Cochon and I have to say, it was AMAZING and SO filling. The staff was friendly, the place has a very open atmosphere that was very lively. I would recommend coming here for breakfast when youre in town!

Awesome breakfast spot!! Our server was very attentive and personable, and the food was OUTSTANDING. I ordered the Migas which was breakfast perfection. My Mom ordered The Southern Breakfast which was also very good. 

We went a tad earlier (8 AM) and waited a whole 5 minutes for a table for 3.

A popular place! we waited about 20 min and sat on the bar.  We had Signature Benedicts EGGS COCHON and CHICKEN ST. CHARLES. The coffee is great.

Food: Great. - Unique and tasty.
Service: Great. - Friendly. 
Price: Acceptable 
Ambiance: Great - lively, good energy, a lot of sunlight

It was a great brunch experience.

Great food and great service.  My spouse and I came here one day and it was so good we brought our family two days later!   Get here early as there can be a wait.  There is a bar too!    Semi loud atmosphere but not too bad.  Service is great.  Daniel was so nice to us.  We asked him to take our picture and he was happy to do it.

So we have been trying to go to Ruby Slipper Cafe for days. We decided to get there when it opened and it was well worth the wait. I had the Praline and bacon  pancakes and a side order of bacon and eggs! Delicious . Their Bellini was good and strong. A definite must when you visit New Orleans.

I would have given a 5 star however customer service and attitudes with waitresses and hostesses seem not to work well together. 

Dem grits tho, Yum!  I enjoyed my cheese grits, fried green tomato, bacon, biscuit, and cheese eggs I had.  It was the southern breakfast.  Prices were reasonable as well. 

Now, the hostesses was complaining because she didn't want to seat people and then lied to some customers about seating availability. Smh. We all have bad days, pull yourself to the side and regroup. 

Overall it's a nice place to have breakfast, lunch, or brunch.

There was a 30 minute wait & our food didn't come out until 20-30minutes after we ordered. I got the Eggs Cochon Benedict cause of the high reviews on Yelp. My pork was really salty. Maybe it was the batch made that day? My friends got the southern breakfast (okay - bacon was good tho) & catfish coubion (good). We didn't order any of their specialty drinks. 

With the amount of time waiting in line & for our food to come out I say that your better off eating else where.

Could have had 5 stars because the food was amazing, however; the service was awful. Drinks came late, messed up the orders, little service for re-fills, and took an act of God to get and pay the bill. Little customer service could have gone a long way.

Mimosas on point breakfast was really good the service is good they are a packed house still no mess ups. Also try the candied bacon it will change your life! Thanks to Danny our waiter he is cool as the other side of the pillow!

Wow!!! We checked in online and it cut our time to 20 mins.. Our server Courtney was so sweet and welcoming. Her service was top notch!
The Peacemaker (Chacon and St.Charles)- I knew the St.Charles was going to be fantastic, but it exceeded my expectations. The egg was poached perfectly and the chicken was tender and sooo flavorful. The Chacon surprised me, I wasn't sure how good the pork would be, but it was DELICIOUS moist and flavorful. They will allow you to change the egg to fried if you don't want it poached. 
The shrimp and grits- really good, it has a lot of flavor and the rosemary adds a really nice touch. 
Bacon Bloody Mary- GET ONE!

This place has spectacular food options. The wait, as expected was over an hour and a half, but they text you when your tables ready so we walked around the city until we received a text.

I enjoyed the Bam Bam, a country biscuit with a fried green tomatoes, brown sugar bacon and an egg over easy. Would also recommend the ruby slipper mimosa or the Bloody Mary, both were delicious.
This place is well one of the best breakfast restaurants that I have ever eaten at in my life and to me that says a lot. A serious must stop and worth the wait while in the NOLA!!
Great place with a New Orleans feel to it. I have lived here for seven years and this was the place that I finally had a good PoBoy.

After a long night on Bourbon St., I needed a good breakfast to help recover.  It was 12:30 on Saturday, and I went to the Ruby Slipper.  It was busy, but I was a 1 top.  I was seated within just a few minutes at the bar top.  I was greeted promptly, and didn't wait long for my coffee.  The menu had a lot of items I would enjoy.  Which is great for a limited menu.  I had the Chicken St. Charles.  It's a biscuit split in 2 both sides have chicken fried chicken breasts, poached eggs (I got mine scrambled), topped with gravy.  The eggs were great.  The chicken had a saltier style breading, which I like, but if you're sensitive to salt, maybe not for you.  The biscuit was good, but I would have enjoyed it a little softer.  With the chicken being crispy, it would be nice to have it surrounded by softer items.  However, I enjoyed the breakfast.  I felt rejuvenated after eating it.  Service was great.  You won't get 5 star service in a place like this.  What you should expect is fast and courteous service.  You will get that here.  The team seems comfortable with high volume, and work as a team.  If you're looking for a good breakfast, check this place out.

This is a great bunch place! Great location and very close to all the major hotels. 

A few highlights:
-Portions are very good size. You will be full afterwards
-Great service! We sat at the bar and they took good care of us
-The banana foster french toast is out of this world
-They only serve breakfast/brunch. This places closes at 3pm.
-Great vibe, friendly staff and good quality food. 
-Mimosas are very good too. They use freshly squeezed OJ.

I loooove this place ! Everything I have eaten here has been amazing !  The only reason it's getting 4 stars instead of 5 is because, I can't give it the same rating as brunch at Commanders Palace andddd today's breakfast was served a little on the cold side . It still tasted amazing ...  The shrimp and grits are awesome( ask for  extra gravy in the side to dip your biscuit in!) did that sound naughty!?? Well maybe it should.  Because the banana foster French toast gave me a mouthgasm!!! I also had the eggs Cochan which was delicious! ( NO I didn't eat this all in one visit!).  
Just go for Breakfast!!! You won't be disappointed!

This was another place that was recommended. The food here was great. There are several locations is the city and waiting times can be very long. 

Our order consisted of:
the bam bam biscuit - a fried egg, pepperjack cheese, pig candy bacon and a fried green tomato on a buttermilk biscuit. The bacon was sweet and delicious and the biscuit was nice and flaky. 

The hot smoked salmon omelet comes with goat cheese and is topped with a dill hollandaise sauce. probably one of the best omelets I've ever had. 

The crispy chicken sandwich was good. I didn't care for the coleslaw. Glad we asked for it on the side rather than on the sandwich.

It seems the specials are the way to go here, the bananas foster French toast was really close to really good, where it seemed the French toast on special ( one with blueberries and cheesecake filling) lacked much to be desired. The real French bread was a special touch to the bananas foster special and I loved both bananas and raisins more than I normally do, in this situation. It would have been four stars for taste except the bread was pretty tough, almost as if it was a bit too stale in order to soak up all the flavors. Service was friendly but just okay, it took a bit to get silverware and water refills never happened. However, I do like that they use the "nowait" app which made it easy to get in and out during a very busy time of day. I had high hopes based on reviews from friends but left disappointed for the most part. Still someone LOVED it. And, if you want sit down security with a ton of options for your sweet tooth, if you're over seafood then it's got some selling points.

This place is very good. They have a big menu and a great option to mix two types of Benedict (the peacemaker). The wait is long, but they are on the nowait app so it's not so bad. All in all it's a good casual brunch place, but not as flavorful as some of the other long wait places (Cafe fleur de lis, jimmy j's)

Best place for brunch in New Orleans. Even though there were about 2 dozen people outside waiting to be seated, we waited for our table about 15 minutes only. The service was excellent, waitress was extremely friendly and attentive without being overbearing.

The food was breathtaking!!!! So good that we ended up doing breakfast there the next morning. We had the St Charles chicken and ohhhh my gawhd. The poached eggs were cooked to perfection, the fried chicken was crispy on the outside and tender and moist on the inside. These we're sitting on top of a buttery and flaky fresh biscuit. Put a little hot sauce and it's simply the best breakfast ever.

The mimosas were very good, they were the perfect ratio of champagne and OJ. We also had a Costa Rican breakfast and the Banana Foster French Toast which were also excellent.

Definitely worth the wait, a must-eat in NOLA.

We tried this place because it was within walking distance of our hotel. We used the NoWait app and were quoted a 30-45 minute wait (9:30 AM on a Monday). We were seated at the 30 minute mark and our waiter, Joseph, had our coffee and order taken quickly. My coffee cup was always topped off and the service was friendly.

I will say that it took about 35 minutes to get our food after placing our order. If you're in a rush, this might be an issue. The food was great. I had the Chicken St. Charles and I like their unusual twist on "chicken and biscuits". Prices are reasonable and the portions are huge. Now I see why there is a wait. It's worth it!

I read about this gem on Yelp prior to my trip and I knew I wanted to indulge in brunch here. I knew there would be a wait and I didn't mind. If you get there early enough, you may be able to get a table with little to no wait time. However, if you go anywhere between 9am and 12pm, you're likely to wait at least 45-60 minutes. There is a helpful app to download so you know how many people are to be seated prior to you. 
Once you enter and get seated, the place has a busy and upbeat vibe. The staff is helpful to each other, assisting with table needs. Our waitress was a lovely woman who spoke highly of various menu items. I ordered the bacon-infused Bloody Mary to start because who doesn't want vodka that has had applewood smoked bacon sitting in it for 5 days?! The cocktail had a that smoky flavor from the bacon with a nice heat! It was garnished with lemon, lime, olive, and pickled green beans-oh yeah, and bacon, too! I ordered the 3 Little Pigs omelette (ham, bacon, sausage) with a side of breakfast potatoes. I also ordered a side of "candy bacon" which is applewood smoked bacon that is topped with brown sugar and baked. It was delicious! I guess you could say I had a Bacony Breakfast! 
If you're in New Orleans, this is the spot to go for a filling brunch, great cocktails, and a friendly atmosphere!

Quick review : Solid brunch spot for visitors to New Orleans! The menu offers a great variety, so there's something for everyone. Expect a bit of a wait time if you come during peak breakfast/brunch hours.

Details :

Here are some tips.

1) Use the NoWait App to add your name to the waitlist remotely. It works wonders! My boyfriend and I added our name, walked 30 minutes from our Airbnb to Ruby Slipper and were next in line to be seated right when we arrived.

2) Order the Southern Breakfast ($9) if you want some variety on the plate. The biscuit was so perfectly fluffy with buttery flakey goodness. Plus you get to try a fried green tomato and grits (something relatively new for a Californian like me).

3) The Bananas Foster ($11) is decadent and absolutely worth trying! The bread is outstanding alone, and the flambéed bananas and raisins complete the package. My boyfriend ordered it and we ended up sampling the savory from my Southern spread and the sweet from his.

I thought the quality of the food matched the prices. Our server was very friendly and attentive, despite the restaurant being packed. 

Give Ruby Slipper a try! Just be sure to use that app.
Was there on a Sunday morning for breakfast. There was a 45min wait...but most definitely worth it. Great service...and the food was awesome!

We ordered the pork debris Benedict and the fried chicken Benedict. I forgot to take pictures because I was too excited about eating my food when we got it. The service was great--our server told us what we should order, and I didn't even have to ask. I like that.

I forgot to take a picture of our empty plates too. 

Don't forget to order the fried green tomatoes. It's not on the menu, but it's 3/$5.
So amazingly good. Go with the pork Benedict! You won't be sorry, it's so good, but split it bc it's also giant!

I'm not sure about the long wait.  We were first in line for breakfast because we were staying at the Wyndham across the street.  The food was good, but I don't think I'd wait an hour for it.  Service was good and everything was clean.

I had the PLEASURE of experiencing RS this past weekend.  Although there was a wait on Saturday and Sunday (YES..I went 2 days in a row!) the 1/2-45 min wait seemed to go by fast. They have the knack of turning around tables w/o making the experience seem rushed.  If you are lucky your wait person SHOULD be Misty! She is very descriptive of the menu items made helpful suggestions w/o making you feel silly for sticking to your first choice. NOTE: if you return. .you will probably order Misty's suggestion :o).
I enjoyed the Irish Whiskey Coffee AND the Brandy Milk Punch! The pancakes were FAB!

Absolutely a must.  Best meal in NOLA so far.  Wait time...long!  Hell, it seems you stand in line for everything in NOLA!  However, I can truly say, the meal was well worth the wait and the cold.   BYOO, really good.  My husband had the Louisiann Omelette, both cooked to perfection.  Double Mimosas...omg!  Biscuits...huge.  You won't leave here hungry or disappointed :-)  Sat at the bar and the patron next to my husband stoke up a conversation, even shared his meal with us, saying we had to try, best he ever had...St. Charles Chicken.

My fiancé was in a conference so I went alone. I felt so bad that he couldn't experience the amazing service and food with me! I had the florentine omelette and added avocado onion and bell pepper to it. Plus replaced the toast with a pancake. They easily said yes to my requests (many places do not) which made me feel even better about my breakfast. Coffee was refilled without having to ask. Server had a big smile at all times. I was full and satisfied. I highly recommend to anyone who visits New Orleans!!!
Really good food and great service. Tried and tested NOLA favorite. Don't miss..

Will come back every time I'm in NOLA! The food was amazing!! Meeting the hilarious bartenders Devon and Alex was even better. They truly entertained and gave great food recommendations. The manager Justine was a pleasure to talk to and we thoroughly enjoyed our experience. Thank you everyone for making our visit so wonderful. Will be back!!

I was hoping after over an hour wait time the food would be worth it. It was! Once they text us for the table, we sat at the bar. Good view and good food! I had the best banana pecan pancakes ever! But my main dish was the corned beef Bennie. Got caught off guard by the dill, but it was good. My buddy had the gulf St. Peter and cleaned the plate! Four stars is because the wait time was ridiculous.

What can I say. I'm from Texas and every chance me and my famiy go to NOLA this is must stop. The shrimp bogaloo is awesome. A twist from traditional eggs benedict, which adds shrimp with a tomato creole sauce. Paired with a bloody mary, you cant go wrong. They even had a special one time which was a Gumbo benedicts. Obviously English muffins, poached eggs with a creamy shrimp sausage gumbo ladled on top. This is a true gem in NOLA

Great bustling atmosphere.  We sat at the bar and enjoyed double mimosas.  The French toast was good, but not mind blowing.  The eggs cochon were really good overloaded with delicious pork and the buttery biscuit added to the overall flavor.
Food is delicious! Service is warm and friendly and energetic! Must visit! St Charles chicken and pancake sampler is a great start.

OK so you have to wait 30 minutes or so, and OK so the place is New York style with tables right next to your neighbor. I get it. But the service is really good and the food is definitely worth coming back for (we did). 

Our hotel breakfast service was ending (yeah we slept in, so what?) so the concierge recommended we walk a couple of blocks to The Ruby Slipper. 

The biscuits are just like granny used to make, and that's really tough to do. The breakfast (OK it was brunch) meal was just great both times and worth the wait.

The next time I'm in NO I'm definitely going here.

obsessed! I am SO sad that I just made it to the ruby slipper for the first time! I came with a group of girls after reading all of the amazing yelp reviews and we were so glad we did.

The hostess gave us a 30 minute wait time but it was only about 10 minutes before we were seated. We checked in on yelp and were able to get the 2 for one mimosas - which were awesome.  I also had an iced coffee which was perfect and not too weak.  

For our meals I got an egg and cheese sandwich on a biscuit it was the perfect amount of food and with bacon was very filling.  My friends got the gingerbread pancakes (amazing and tasted like desert) and a grilled cheese sandwich with sweet potato fries.

Great service! Great food! Next time I'm in NOLA I will be back!

I was expecting a little more based off the crowd of people waiting to be seated. If you're planning to go with a group, make sure to get there early but if you're by yourself, you shouldn't have a problem getting seated at the bar. In terms of food, I went with the croque madame. Don't get me wrong, it was enough to satisfy my appetite, but it didn't really leave a lasting impression.

I came back here as my visit here last time in New Orleans was awesome. Great food but wouldn't allow us to get a few extra biscuits to go at the end of our meal. No to go on Saturdays! Not even extra biscuits. Next time I'll go somewhere with better customer service.

Unfortunately the only thing that comes to mind after my meal here is how long the wait was and apparently is known for that. Two and a half hours! Thousands of reviews that already spoke of the wait and the HUGE helpful tip of adding your name to the waitlist through Yelp app. Even still, after the meal I just don't think I would come back. The food was average. I tried the trifecta egg biscuit benedicts... and my favorite out of the three was the fried chicken (st Charles). The pulled pork (Cochon) and shrimp (boogaloo) were decent, but nothing special or memorable. The homemade made from scratch biscuits were really thick and tasted undercooked. My friends also didn't finish their foods and we all agree this place was just average. Just another hyped up tourist spot I think. Not worth going out of the way for and definitely not worth waiting 2 plus hours!

The food was delicious!  The pecan praline pancakes were amazing, also the Salmon Benedict was tasty.  The wait was horrible!  I'd definitely suggest planning in advance and putting your name on the list at least an hour and a half prior.  At least the staff was super friendly, and very courteous once we were seated.
The eggs blackstone was a delicious choice paired with a cup of their local coffee. Excellent service!! (Just expect a wait during brunch time)

Came here for Brunch on a random Tuesday morning. My boyfriend and I had the corned beef bennie, the st charles bennie, a mimosa, a bloody mary, and two a la carte orders of chocolate and banana pecan pancakes Everything tasted mediocre/ok. The whites of the poached eggs were a bit too runny for my taste and the pancakes were too dense and heavy. It didn't seem worth it to spend $60+ for an "eh" kind of meal, but I will say that the bloody mary is the spiciest I've ever had, and my boyfriend's fried chicken was delicious.

Our hotel was next door , I couldn't understand why there was a long line outside this place . Boy - do I understand now ! The breakfast was awesome and the staff had great personalities. I highlight recommend the Eggs Cochon . Also the mimosas are great !
Breakfast is done right unless you've been here! The staff is so polite and the food is so yummy! The portions are big and worth the prices.
The hotel concierge recommended for breakfast. Best pancakes we have every had. The service was great. Good casual atmosphere.

First off I really wanted to like this place.
Great, friendly service and upbeat atmosphere but the food honestly disappointing. Had the bam bam biscuit which was doughy and lethargic.

It's being packed, with a line and 20 minute wait, may have built it up in my head, but while I would call this adequate I would be hard-pressed to call it more.  The food was good, the portions were ok, and the staff was friendly.  However, that just makes it average, especially in NOLA.

Mmmm.  Went at 11am on a thursday, and yes, it was crowded.  But the bar was open, which is where i like to sit anyway.  Just be sure to check in with the host before you sit there.  The girl next to me was told as much when she took a seat on her own.  I had the eggs blackstone, which is basically eggs benedict with tomato and bacon instead of canadian bacon.  Delicious.  They do their benedict on a fresh made biscuit instead of the standard english muffin, which is genius!  In a town that has many great benedicts, this could be one of the best.  Coffee and service (at least at the bar) were good too.  The only drawback was how loud it was, but that was to be expected when there are alot of happy people eating and imbibing.

Other then the breakfast that comes out of my Dads kitchen....this is the best breakfast I've EVER had!! Great atmosphere as well. We were at the door 30 minutes before the doors opened and were first through them with at least 50 people waiting in line as well. Love this place!!

This place is great!!! Was right next door to our hotel so it made it very convenient.  Each  morning we went and tried almost everything on the menu between the family. Didn't find anything that we didn't enjoy!  

Try there mimosas! 

Even if there is a bit of a wait it is well worth it!!!

cant wait to be back!
The food was worth the long wait. I highly recommend the Eggs Cochon (Eggs Benedict), probably the best things I've had in New Orleans so far!

This is my absolute favorite brunch spot in New Orleans. The wait is ABSOLUTELY worth it. Every time I come here the food and service are phenomenal and this visit was no exception. 

I got the three little pigs omelette and added mushrooms, and a bloody mary. The omelette was AMAZING. Flavorful, HUGE, filling. I could only eat half which made me very sad because it was SO good. Our server, a lighter colored brunette with 20's style hair was absolutely fantastic. She made helpful suggestions and was just great overall. You may wait up to an hour and a half here but it is worth every minute!

My Wife and I just spent a week in NOLA. We had breakfast on our first and last days at the Ruby Slipper.
I cannot say enough about the quality of the food, or the friendliness of the wait staff.
The CBH Benedict was delicious, as were the Bananas Foster Pancakes. I had the 3 Little Pigs omelet on the last day. Fabulous!
We waited for about 10 minutes for a table each time. But it was definitely worth the wait!

I was afraid this was going to be a tourist trap given all the reviews and the long wait BUT the food was delicious and the bacon Bloody Mary was amazing! we got the cost rican and pulled pork eggs Benedict. So good!

Breakfast here was amazing! It seems to be a hit with tourists and locals I definitely recommend using yelp to add your name to the waiting list. Everything from the pancakes, French toast, bacon/sausage, mimosas, potatoes,to the omelettes tasted great! If I'm ever back in New Orleans I will definitely stop here.
We had such an amazing brunch with delicious bacon bloody marys on the side!!! Currently in a food comaaaa! Eating here is a must :)

The Yelp waitlist feature was great. We were doing a city tour nearby and I popped our name on the list as we walked over to this restaurant. By the time we got there, we only waited 5 minutes to be seated outdoors. Staff was friendly, outdoors was quiet and it was a short wait to get food.

Unfortunately the food was pretty eh. I tried their fried chicken sandwich with a side of fries. The waitress said it was one of her favorite dishes. It wasn't bad, but lacked an extra bit of kick that would've made it really good. The fries aren't worth the guilt of cheating on your diet, sadly.

This is a bumpin breakfast spot,  and for good reason. The food was delicious and the menu had a lot of options. I had an omelette with spinach, mushrooms, and goat cheese with potatoes and it  was tasty and filling. I only knocked off a star because the service was sparse due to how crowded it was and some pieces of my order were forgotten until I requested them again. Great spot for breakfast, but expect a bit of a wait for a table and a busy waiter.
