I ordered the Louisiana omelet with grits and a iced coffee. All fabulous, it was more than enough to eat, I have some food sensitivity and it's nice to find restaurants that I can eat at without tweaking what in ordering. Definitely a great breakfast place

This is the best place for brunch!  The food was amazing, the drinks were great, and our waitress and wait staff were so friendly and fun!  I HIGHLY recommend the Chicken St. Charles!  The only warning I give you is to split something, the portions are giant.  Other than that, it's a wonderful brunch place!

Service is friendly and fast, food is amazing (had the "peacekeeper" duo where you can have two different bennies - one was the cochon the other the fried chicken) and we accidentally came near close (at 2:30 - it closes at 3 on a Sunday) and had no wait for a table at all. (Though didn't get to stay too long either, so it was a trade off timing wise) loved the place! Would strongly recommend.
Noisy, bustling breakfast/brunch/lunch bistro where the servers are friendly and the Bloody Mary's flow! There is always a wait, but this place is worth the wait.

This place is absolutely amazing. The vibe is dope, the drinks are strong, their food is delicious, and the customer service is exceptional! A must visit when you get a chance! This is definitely my favorite since I have visited New Orleans.

After quite a wait, seated at the bar for breakfast.  Wasn't sure about the place. The bartender completely changed my mind. She was warm, attentive and had a great charm about her. Food was delicious. Biscuits were extra large.

Wonderful cafe for brunch right in the heart of New Orleans. Just a few blocks away from Bourbon street. A group of us (7) went for brunch on Sunday. The place was very busy and there is a line out the door, but we were able to get a table after about a 20 - 25 minute wait. Make everyone in your group is there or else they will give your table away! The food is excellent. The mimosa were wonderful. I would definitely go again!

Unreal! We went around 9am on a Wednesday and didn't have to wait in line. So happy we didn't have to because all the food we saw walking to our table was incredibly mouthwatering. Service was friendly and helpful, attentive while giving everyone time to relax and eat. I had the Costa Rican breakfast complete with plantain chips, avocado, over easy eggs, and sausage. It melted in my mouth and I was elated that it was all mine. Friends also had what was essentially eggs benedict with pulled pork on it and it was everything I could ever want and more! The delicious coffee was fresh and never ending and its a place I will visit every time I'm in town and I'll wait in line as long as I need to!
The family ate there with two children and everything came out perfectly. Food was very unique with a Cajun influence and everybody loves their meal. The chicken St. Charles is a must try.

Perfect little breakfast spot hidden behind the madness that is Canal Street, just a quick 3 minute walk from our hotel. We went in on a Wednesday around 10 so we were seated right away. Our server was super sweet and knew the menu well. 

My husband ordered the Breakfast Sandwich with easy over eggs, cheddar and sausage on a biscuit w/ potatoes. I ordered the Ruby's Basic Breakfast easy over eggs, cheddar, bacon, grits and a biscuit. Everything was on point. The biscuits were awesome - probably the best we've had. We're still talking about them a week later. Super fluffy. Drool! We debated on their pancakes but our server sold us on the Bananas Foster Pain Perdu aka French Toast. Seriously, if you are dying and have one wish, let this dish be it. WOW. Perfect bread, perfect sauce, perfect sweet caramelly bananas - perfect everything. It was incredible. 

Highly recommed this place for nice breakfast close enough but far enough from tourist trappy French Quater or Canal Street spots.

The brandy milk punch was delicious and the coffee was great.  We had the house special Benedict and the Costarican.  Our food was good but nothing special.  To be fair, I can't eat wheat and a lot of the big specialties here are bread items and those looked amazing.  Everything was cooked properly.  With so many other amazing places to eat brunch and the 1 hour wait, I would try some other places before eating here again though.

Short wait to get in but was well worth it. I had the eggs black stone which was excellent!!! My wife had the banana foster which she loved. Great coffee, service, and atmosphere. Go here for breakfast!!!
Always a very long wait but you can see why. Excellent food and bloody marrys. At least an hour to wait at any given time. They will text you when table is ready.

Wanting to get a great breakfast in, we stopped in at the The Ruby Slipper Cafe.  There was about a 20 minute wait to get in for breakfast the day we stopped in so my expectations were high from the get go.  

I had heard that they offer a nice amount of breakfast alcoholic beverages but at this point I went with plain orange juice.  Maybe I will get it the next time!  I ended up ordering the Migas at the suggestion from out server who stated "I'm not going to eat with you this morning, but if I was these are the things that I would order".  The Migas was one of those choices.

The Migas is a Tex-Mex scramble with avocado, pepper-jack cheese, chorizo, tortilla chips, onions, tomatoes, etc.  I ended up getting it and really trying to just mix it all up.  Lets just say it lasted about 5 minutes or less.  Insanely good.  If you can stop here in the NO then do it.  Worth the wait for an awesome breakfast!

I ordered the Florentine Omelet, which came with breakfast potatoes and toast. The breakfast potatoes (my favorite) were well seasoned and perfectly crispy! I wasn't a fan of the excessive goat cheese in my omelet, it was spread very unevenly so there were loads of it in certain places. I ended up removing all of the goat cheese, which made my omelet much better.  I also tried a bite of the Louisianan Omelet and I really liked it (more so than the Florentine Omelet).

The service was very good! Even though the crowd was starting to pick up, our waitress was very helpful and friendly! The ambience was very typical of a brunch restaurant. This is a perfect lazy brunch destination to drink some mimosas and eat breakfast food!

Overall, decent food, good vibe, good service!

Every time were in Nola...this is the spot!! During mardi gras...please try the king cake pancake!!! And the fried green tomatoes, OMG,!! This is the first place I've tried it and compare every other place to it. They are nothing short of amazing! And the pan French toast....holy mother of god!

Came across this place when I went out for a run while staying at a nearby hotel. "Nothing attracts a crowd like a crowd" as Soul Asylum once said so we decided to hit it the next day.

Not that you have a choice but sit inside if you can. The lady calling out names on this particular day had a very loud voice and she called out names like every minute or two. Really should invest in a pager/buzzer system.

Anyway, got there Sunday around 10 am and waited maybe half an hour. As busy as it was, food service was actually not bad. However, it took forever to get our drinks before the meal at the walkup bar area and it took forever for me to get my check due to a POS malfunction. But hey, once we got the bloody marys, we were all happy. They were pretty good too. 

I got the eggs coubion which was a nice-sized portion and good. Nicely poached eggs, tasty catfish strips, sausage and other additions (wilted spinach, artichoke, etc). All on top of some baguette pieces which was a lot of bread but soaked up the egg as designed. I thought the seasoning was fine on my dish. Not too heavy either.

That's it. That's the review. The 2 others in our party had other food which I'm sure was good but I didn't try it so there you have it. If it sucked they would have said something. I'm sure the rest of their food is good but it's a busy place for weekend brunch so don't be shocked about what you're getting yourself into. Get some mimosas or bloody marys and quit complaining that it's so busy.
If you are reading this standing outside of ruby slipper cafe waiting for a table- go to the bar and order a Bloody Mary! Do it now!

Although to food was good (we had the Migas, the Eggs Cochon and the stuffed French toast), nothing can compensate for the bad attitude of the hostess and the manager. In addition, we had to wait over an hour, after we waited 30 minutes for the table in the first place. Our table was right by the door, almost touching everyone else who was waiting in line to be seated and going in and out of the door. While our server was pretty nice, we rarely saw her. 

They have an app to get "in line," so we tried to do that. We thought we would give it another chance since it had the best reviews and we thought our first experience might have been a fluke.  They open at 8 and you can't use the app until 8 when they open. At that time, it said there was no wait. We were 2 minutes away and by the time we got there, they suddenly had a 30-45 minute wait. Apparently, they don't start taking names for the list until after they have filled the entire restaurant for the first time. Which means it tells you they have no wait but there is a line around the corner. And if you are in line you still might not get a seat if there are enough people in front of you. I asked the hostess and manager why they didn't post on the app that they had a full restaurant line so we could get in line on the app and know we would have to wait 30 minutes and the response was that that's the way they do it. 

I completely understand that places get busy when they are popular, but the food was not good enough to justify the wait, the lack of service and the attitudes of the employees.

We tried to go here on Saturday and due to a time crunch we could not wait the 45 minutes. I went back today. The place was still hopping!! It was their "slow" time on a Monday at 830am. Hands down best salmon eggs Benedict!!! Fast, friendly service! Thank you!
Huge lines and could not ever get in on our visit.  We tried twice.  Expect a wait of 45 minutes to one hour outside.

Boy, when you want breakfast done right...and then some, you go here! I can see why people were willing to wait for a seat. We had to wait about half an hour, but that goes by faster than you think

Had the Bananas Foster Pain Perdu. An awesome awesome twist on French toast. Using a French baguette is genius, soft but not soggy, and the fosters sauce was delicious.

Go early and have patience if you want a taste of this French Quarter gem!

I don't understand.  The wait was twice as long as the hostess said it would be.  There was an insane line to get a drink while we waited for our table.  The other patrons were animals and about pushed me over a couple times.  I honestly was STEPPED ON while I was in line.  When we finally were sat (at the bar) after waiting 110 minutes our food wasn't even very good.  There are much better brunch places in N.O.
Service was fast even though there was a line out the door.  We were told it would be a 20 minute wait.  We were in and out the door  in 30 minutes!  Food was great too, btw!
Worth the wait for sure!!!! Fantastic food, the fried chicken and waffles were to die for!

Host was a moron. Not sure the elevator goes to the top floor. Waitress was a sweetheart. Coffee delish but cool. We ordered the bananas foster French toast, the special French toast which was Bavarian creme, three little pigs omelette, a breakfast sandwich and regular breakfast.

My bf & I came in on a Tuesday morning , and it was busy but the wait wasnt long at all. About 15-20mins. This place was recommended to me by a friend who recently visited NOLA. I'm glad we went , the food came fast, was tasty & the mimosas & bellinis were strong & a decent size! Great southern brunch! Pleasant staff:)

Cockroaches and crappy bar service

To the tourist reading this thinking about going here - save your money and go somewhere else! Don't be deceived by the high reviews - it's a tourist trap. Went there for brunch today and service was terrible. We came for the good food and reviews but left very disappointed. Bar servers don't have any listening skills and do the absolute bare minimum. We asked for a regular orange juice, they gave us a mimosa (making it seem like it was on the house). There were literally german-sized cockroaches on the bar table, and I'm not exaggerating. Makes you wonder how clean your food was prepared. And the food was seriously overhyped - our hotel breakfast was waay better. The place is dirty, not a place to consider visiting. They don't even deserve one star, if I could rate 0 stars I would.

Ruby Slipper came HIGHLY recommended but, I would not recommend. The wait time alone is crazy and you would think the food was amazing but it is mediocre at best. I ordered a "traditional" mimosas but apparently that comes with pomegranate at the bottom. Make sure yo ask for NO pomme. We were seated outside which was great. The weather was awesome. But our server more than likely forgot about us. Asked for water 3 times still never got it. I ordered the smoke salmon Benny. It tasted like it was out the can and the  poached eggs were cooked through. My mimosa was all OJ and when I asked for just champagne I was given white wine. We should have walked out of our check but waited until the manager closed our check out. This place isn't worth the wait. Trust me. As a bruncher and someone that travels for work this place would be the last place I would go too.

This place looks very chain restaurant look from the outside but we yelped it and sure enough it was amazing! Best breakfast food we had during our stay in New Orleans! Great pulled pork Benedict with a spicy jalapeño hollandaise sauce that gave it a great flare! Delicious local coffee by the name of French truck coffee which unfortunately we could not find before leaving as we would've purchased in excess! Great food, great coffee, and great customer service and very cheap to go out and eat! This place is a must go if you're looking for breakfast!

Went here for breakfast today. The service was good consider how busy it was. The food was decent. The shrimp on the shrimp and grits could've been a lil better seasoned, the applewood bacon was delicious though. Would definitely go back.

While visiting New Orleans this past weekend, stumbled upon this place for breakfast and was extremely pleased. Everything was delicious, affordable and excellent service. Will visit again next time in town.

A must stop for brunch whenever I am in NOLA. ALWAYS!  Love that Yelp offers a way for you to get on the wait list before actually arriving there. .. Servers are walking around taking drink orders while you wait... which is added bonus...whether you are inside or outside. I have not had a bad dish nor a bad drink.  EVER.

What can I say about the Ruby Slipper... It is hands down one of the best breakfast restaurants I've ever been to. I travel about 5 months out of the year and I consider myself a bit of a foodie... They always do a great job with the long wait times, I usually comes as a single and I get seated at the bar pretty fast. They food always comes out amazing and I come here 4/5 times a year, for the past 3 years. I have not had anything but awesome experiences and that's what keeps me coming back. I've hit this place three times this trip and 2 out of the 3 times Jacus has been my server. I used to manage a restaurant and I would have fought to have a full wait stay as attentive and knowledgeable as Jacus, he remembered us, knew what I had two days earlier and even convinced me to get something else too even though I wasn't sure I wanted to try it. He was spot on, the special was wonderful and I thanked him for pushing it!! If your in the NOLA area get in to the Ruby Slipper, I've tried the other locations and this one on Magazine St is the best, fight the wait or come early and ask for Jacus, if you do these things you can't go wrong for Breakfast or brunch... thanks again Ruby Slipper and I'll see y'all next trip!!

AMAZING food - to avoid the wait, download the No Wait app (you can reserve your spot and they will text you when your table is ready!) -- we had the migas (wonderful!) pancakes (wonderful!) and breakfast sliders (also wonderful!) 

Highly recommend. Will definitely visit anytime I'm back.
Good customer service but that was the peak. I got buttermilk pancakes which were tasteless. The grapefruit mimosa was good but could have used a touch of sugar.
2nd Time here for Breakfast, i make sure to eat here at least 1 time per trip to new orleans . great food , fun friendly people.  Next time LUNCH

Everything was perfection! My "World Famous" Bloody Mary absolutely lived up to it's name. My husband got the Peacemaker- 2 eggs benedict plates. The best was the St. Charles chicken. It looked amazing. He was melting over it. The eggs were perfectly poached. 

The atmosphere was fantastic. I wanted to live there. And seriously like the best body Mary ever. Also they have my favourite hot sauce right on the table. 

Now let's talk service. Our server took a little long to get to us at first, but in all fairness it was a packed house. He was my favorite server I've had in a very long time! Friendly and fun! I'd go back a thousand times just to see him.  Bullwinkle to the Ruby Slipper!!!

I want to go back to New Orleans just to eat there again!!!

Glad I got to check this place out. Super-busy, but the staff handles it well and it's worth a little wait.

The service here is excellent, and I noticed that they keep a smile on their face even with annoying travelers asking many questions and rambling on about things. I could never do that, especially while working.

The food was really good. I wish I had been more hungry while I was there, since I didn't come close to finishing my breakfast. The only thing I wasn't a huge fan of was their fried green tomato. It was different than I've had in the past... it was expectedly crunchy on the outside, but the inside was hard as well. Might have just been the one I had, though. But the eggs were good, the biscuit was gigantic, and the bacon was just the way I like it.

The I portions are on the bigger side but the food is fantastic. I wasn't a fan of the bloody Mary's here, but they have a range of alcoholic brunch beverages. They do have gluten free options. Be careful of their specials though they got us on one and charged us a lot for it so the bill was a lot more than expected :/ it is very loud inside and very stinky outside. 
Overall it's a decent place with great food.

I love this restaurant food is always amazing and so is the service. I have been to 3 different locations and they are consistently excellent. Today I had Eggs Cochon and my son had French toast. To die for!

Walking around Canal street on the hunt for some food, I stumbled upon this place. It is hard to miss as it is surrounded by a swirling mass of people, as if they were caught in some gravitational pull.

Despite the very long line, I was able to sit at the last seat at the bar (it pays to go solo sometimes). However, once I sat down, service was a little slow, In defense of the waitress, it was at capacity at around 25 people and she was the only person behind the bar. That is a fail on the part of management that couldn't predict a Saturday morning rush.  
 
While waiting, I pulled up Yelp and instantly saw my choice--the Eggs Blackstone. Pretty much eggs Benedict, but on a biscuit. If ever you should see something like this on the menu, get it!

After waiting a good 10 minutes, I got the menu and ordered my coffee. Another 10 minutes pass before actually getting my coffee and being able to order... which ended up breaking my heart--they were OUT OF BACON!!! 

Bacon being the proverbial glue that connects the eggs to the biscuit is an essential component of the Eggs Blackstone. And they didn't have any. Breakfast without bacon is like an earth without water: incapable of sustaining life. Without this, it is just eggs with tomato on some carbs. Unacceptable. In my sorrow, I ordered what appeared to be the closest thing--Eggs Cochon: slow cook pork debris served over an open-faced biscuit, topped with poached eggs and hollandaise.

True to its word, the slow cook pork came slowly. About to eat my hand off and having finished my coffee 5 minutes ago, this beast of a plate appeared before me. I didn't really know what to expect, but what I saw made me think of pulled pork in gravy sloppy joe, with poached eggs and sauce. Hiding beneath this mountain of fat and grease were some carbs in the form of soggy biscuits. While no means bad--and actually good at first--it was a bit much. A bit much for breakfast and a bit much to eat without having my coffee refilled. After putting it away, I finally got my first refill and downed that in a heartbeat. 

Overall, service was crap due to so many people and poor management. I felt bad for the waitress, but still begrudged my lack of coffee. Then for not having bacon, I am sorry. There is no excuse for an established early on Saturday morning to have run out of bacon. Together, this knocks off two stars. The food was food, but not worth the wait to get in, fight to get attention, and disappointment of maybe not having bacon. I'd consider coming back here, but only if it were not busy, which I am not sure happens.

Bacon.
Came in for breakfast. Ordered the special upside down pineapple pancakes...the best. Staff is very courteous and friendly.

Great food and atmosphere!! We eat here every trip we take to NOLA!! My friend had the bananas foster French toast and it looked divine!! If you're ever in the area definitely stop here for breakfast or brunch!

Delicious food! My mom and I split the strawberry white chocolate pancakes and some egg Benedict with fried green tomatoes because after we had tried each other's dish we wanted them both! They also have VERY excellent, yes massive biscuits. There tends to be a long line though so get there early! They're a breakfast, lunch, brunch place and I've heard they close by around 2 or 3. Absolutely delicious place with good service!

Delicious was breakfast!!!  Eggs Coconut was huge portion and the poached eggs when cracked melted into the huge pile of pork on the biscuit.  

If I only lived closer to Pensacola, Fl I would be there religiously.  

Highly recommend!

At first glance, my fiancé wasn't sure he wanted to go in, as he prefers to look at all options. (We had just gotten out of the car)
So glad he recapitulated, as he swooned over the Croque Madame breakfast awesomeness. Challa bread was toasted, with tender slices of ham and cheese inserted in the middle, and the whole thing was drizzled with hollandaise sauce and toped with a perfect quivering poached egg. Mouthgasm . Seriously. I got the Slipper Salad. The salad itself was great, fresh greens tossed with craisins and nuts, fresh cherry tomato halves, red onion shavings , and a lovely citrus vinaigrette dressing. The menu said "Panko crusted goat cheese coins " atop... There were three HUGE "coins" and I eagerly cut into one. Lovely crust, lovely texture, and then WHAM! Death by garlic. I LOVE garlic, but this was akin to swallowing a spoonful of fresh wasabi. AACK! Three hours later, I am still burping garlic, LOL.
Service was fast and friendly, but the BEST part.... The HUGE glass of champagne!!! Day saver! Woot! Oh yeah, garlic not withstanding, we ARE going back!
Amazing stuffed French toast. Reasonable wait time. Very friendly staff. Many options for breakfast with large portions.

Great brunch without the longer wait times (although I went on a Tuesday and wait time was 20mins). We had the chicken and biscuits, hot smoked salmon and biscuit, and banana foster. It was all great and our waiter was sweet and nice.

It was good but not great. 3 1/2 stars if Yelp would let me give 1/2 stars. 

This place was right by our hotel, so the first day we saw the giant line from 8:30a til 12:30 when we left for a tour. Given the line I was expecting phenomenal.  We went early and sat at the bar so we didn't have to wait.  

I had the breakfast sandwich and my husband had the southern breakfast. The Bloody Mary was good but a bit too spicy for me. The brandy milk was quite tasty. The buttermilk biscuits were exceptionally good (by my Midwestern standards). The candied bacon was tasty.

I'll bet if I ordered something different, I would have liked this restaurant better.  

We went one morning and had their Southern Breakfast and French Toast Batons.  The Southern Breakfast was good, I love their grits.  The Batons were very good.  Not a fan of the molasses syrup.  

Very good service.  A bare boned restaurant with a lot of character and local flavor.
Always fun start to the day service is pleasant and efficient, Bloody Mary are good and food is incredible.

I came here twice.. back to back actually because it was close to my hotel.  Once on Monday and than back again on Tuesday. 

Do yourself a favor use the "put yourself on the waitlist"  app it tells you how the wait is, how many parties ahead of you, and what time you should get to the cafe.  I went at 9 am on Monday I put myself on the waitlist and said 35 mins but I end up going to check in when it told me to but didn't get seated till a little after 10. On tuesday I came around 9... but no wait.  They defn make waiting for a table a lot easier when a waitress comes around asking if you want a drink while you wait.  A lot of ppl defn had their popular bacon infused bloody mary in hand while they wait. 

Service was good. Got the same waitress two days in a row even when I got seated in different part of the restaurant.  She was super attentive.   As for the food it was good but it wasn't consistent. 

Mon: We ordered Banana Fosters Pain Perdu: which is good but only if you like that kind of thing,  Stuff french toast filled with cheesecake: which basically taste like cheesecake flavor cream cheses between my french toast, chicken st. charles benedicts:  the fried chicken was little dry and lack of flavor and the egg was over cook to my liking. It was not runny at all. Maybe there was not enough sauce cuz i end up using ketchup.  We also had a side of corned beef.  I got to admit that was probably the best corned beef hash I ever had.   It was flavorful and not dry which I liked. It was different because this was the first time i had hash that was just chunks of potatoes. 

Tues:  Since I love the corned beef so much we got the corned beef bennie and french toast batons.  The batons was basically frech toast sticks. It was good maybe becuz it was easy to share and its was crunchy.  The corn beef benedict was on point. Corned beef was amazing and the egg was on point. 

Guess Tuesday was less busy for them to get my egg right on the benedict. It makes me wonder would my fried chicken been less dry if it was less busy too.
Overall great. I got the catfish and it was amazing. The grit cake is out of this world.  You won't be disappointed.

Had brunch with a group of 7 on a Saturday during a crazy convention-lockdown NOLa weekend.  Split the eggs cochon as well as an eggs hollandaise over fried chicken with a friend...it was really rich, portions were great (i.e. large).  However, the standout for me were the biscuits.  A-MAH-Zing.  My fave biscuits are still those I had made by a then-boyfriend's lovely and beautiful grandma, but these came pretty damn close.  Pillowy and fluffy, yeasty and buttery, with a great chew that didn't feel too starchy.  Perfection here.  Great first meal of the weekend.  

Bloody marys were pretty good too, nice and spicy if you like that sorta thing.

We waited on another long line in the scorching sun for another must eat spot. This restaurant was right across the street from our hotel, Sheraton Hotel which was very convenient. Luckily the restaurant had a few benches to sit and wait. They have a bar area and one of my friends ordered a drink while we chatted and waited miserably in the sun. My friend raved about her bellini drink with an extra shot of something. I tasted it  and it was too strong for me especially since I hadnt eaten breakfast.

When we finally sat down, the place was jam packed. Fortunately, we didnt have to wait too long for our food after we ordered. I ordered the Bananas Foster Pain Perdu- "Pain Perdu", or lost bread, is a french bread-based French toast served with applewood smoked bacon and topped with our Bananas Foster which was DELICOUS. Actually everyone enjoyed their food and agreed the wait  was definitely worth it. I also ordered a side of fruit and ate off some friends plate. The food was affordable and filling and is definitely a spot to check out when in the NOLA area.

No idea what the hype is about. Went here based on reviews. Had the 3 little piggies. Zero flavor. Had to put salt on my omelet. How bacon manages to be flavorless is beyond me. Im a local and I will NEVER go back. Should have known this place was touristy...ill be at Biscuits and Buns on banks next week. They are 3,000,000 times better....oh...and my stomach is upset as I write this.

With so many delicious brunches in New Orleans, it's hard to choose one.  This one is casual and breakfasty.  You will be glad you came here.  Your tab will also be reasonable.  It has a little bit of a sports bar environment, or at least it did on Saints game day, when we went.

Service was fine. They were busy.

We had the eggs benedict thingy with the pulled pork.  I forget what they call it, but do get it.  You may want to split it if you are not starving because it is excellent.

Brunch on our way out of town.  A bit of a wait, but not too bad, and definitely worth it.  Sweetie had waffles, I think.  I had shrimp and grits.  Cheesy, good grits, and very good shrimp.  Topped with an "ale and scallion reduction," I believe.  Plus fresh orange juice, and since we sat at the bar we got to watch others ordering bloody marys, etc., including some mimosas that were basically a huge glass of champagne with a little OJ mixed in.  I think Sweetie was envious.

Big fan. 4.5 stars from this girl. I'm stingy with my 5s...but this place is fab.

We had passed by this place on a Saturday around noon and there was a line nearly around the block. If you don't plan ahead, be prepared for THAT. We decided to go on a Tuesday around 9:30, hoping for better luck. And what luck we had! There was no wait, walked right in and got what was probably the best seat in the house. By the time we were finished, they were on a 30 minute wait. Boom. Professionals.

I got the Bananas Foster Pain Perdu - seriously so good. Great portion. The boy ordered the Eggs Blackstone. His only gripe was that the biscuit was a bit hard. It didn't stop him from eating every.single.bite though, I can assure you. Their coffee was also pretty darn good.

Service was great. He was willing to make suggestions which is always nice. We only had one misstep from a small miscommunication; my Bananas Foster was supposed to come with applewood smoked bacon. When I ordered, I asked for my meal and a cup of fruit. I did not specify a side of fruit, and he did not ask for clarification of whether or not it was a side or in place of the bacon. (I'm sorry, did you say IN PLACE OF THE BACON?! Obviously not). Anyway, he assumed that I meant fruit instead of bacon, when I meant in addition to. My fault? His fault? Who knows. It wasn't a big deal...once I mentioned the issue he had three strips of hot bacon to our table within minutes.

Moderately priced. Generous portions. Great service. No place like home, indeed.

I stopped in to grab a quick breakfast before heading home. I sat at the bar and ordered and got my food quickly. Staff was so nice and attentive. I got the eggs cochon - YUM! It was delicious! I got a side of cheesy grits and they were the perfect accompaniment. I highly recommend The Ruby Slipper and their signature dish!

One of the best places to have breakfast I ever visited! I especially loved the chalkboard sign that greeted us: "Congratulations, you made it out of bed." The service was amazing, the vibe was cool and the bacon infused Bloody Mary still has me licking my lips! 

Did I forget to mention my delicious omelette with goat cheese and roasted red peppers? It was my first trip to NOLA and every time I come back, I will be eating at the Ruby Slipper.

Second time back this week... It was easier for my schedule - and it turned out to be the best meal this week!

Had the omelet, the Louisiana.  Amazing.  I thought - what can they do with boiled shrimp and cheddar cheese.  They can make heaven that's what they can do.  They used thyme in it and the flavor was amazing!!!! I had to force myself to put my fork down:(

Also -I have to say, there were grits that came with.  I love grits but I'm from Chicago so I usually get the lame cracker barrel ones.  Yesterday I went to the Old Cofffeepot and had the same grits there.  Today, at the Ruby Slipper, I was served the most amazing, creamey, delicious grits ever.  That's what I'm talkin about!

I really love this place!  Quick and great food!

Okay the name alone is adorable! What a great place... homey and kinda cool! The staff Is so attentive and engaged in the menu.... the Drinks are incredible and the menu has a twist on every average breakfast food .  We sat at the very roomy bar and just loved it!

Quick service early on a Friday morning. CBH Eggs Benedict was yummy. Even though I wasn't looking forward to the corned beef, it was refreshingly different. Husband has the Louisianan and enjoyed it. Definitely a good call to go with the Double Mimosa. Overall a good experience on probably an off peak time.

This is now one of my absolute favorite places to eat in New Orleans. So delicious! The line for brunch was long, but it was also July 4th. After about 40 min, we got a seat and were promptly served by the sweetest waitress who was super attentive and helpful. We ordered the eggs cochon and the bananas foster benedict. I would order both again in a heartbeat. We devoured them both! The eggs were served with pulled pork that was amazing. Loved the hollindaise sauce, made the dish. The bananas foster was hands done delicious. Not overly sweet, bread had raisins in it, bananas were so so good. Wow. That's all.

I ordered the Migas, definitely better than in Surreys cafe, however, I could have done with a tortilla or some breakfast potatoes and could have done without the huge dollop of sour cream or mayonnaise or whatever it was that was stuck on the plate.  

Hubby got the pecan maple pancakes - they were good, but they didn't beat Surreys bananas foster stuffed french toast.  

My brother got a chicken sandwich which he enjoyed, and the atmosphere was fun.  The service was good and our server was friendly.  I'd happily go back here :)

It might be a fact - though it will take much more traveling to confirm - that you can't get a better brunch than in NOLA.  Oh my lawd (southern enough?) was this brunch delicious to the point of forcing me to redefine what I find delicious.

Lets start with the bad - not that there is such a thing.  You have to wait to come here.  There are no reservations and there will be a line.  You can't wait inside, either, so not a great place in bad weather.  People mill about on the side walk outside and across the street.  But, even the bad isn't that bad.  I know this wasn't mardi gras or jazz fest, but it was Easter Weekend and it was in between Easter parades (not to go off on a tangent, but you need to visit NOLA on Easter.  It is a trip).  Anyway, we were told a table for 2 would be 30 minutes.  It might have been 40, but not too far off, and based on the crowd, we thought it would be more like 60.  They move it fast.

Its a cute place, nothing too memorable, but bright and pleasant.  Service was great - server was on top of things and friendly.

But the important part was the food.  If I can quote Frank the Tank when he saw Blue in heaven, it was "glorious."  Anyway, I got the Eggs Cochon - I was waffling (get it, waffle? brunch? waffling?  I know I know, I'm a riot) between that and the Chicken St. Charles.  The latter has fried chicken, the former has apple braised pork debris.  I almost went with the chicken because I ate lots o' pork this weekend, but in the end, I went with the signature item and am I glad I did.  This came out with what seemed like a mountain of braised, slow cooked, pulled pork on a buttermilk biscuit and 2 perfectly poached eggs.  It was so much wonderful food.  I haven't had a brunch that good since...well, the day before actually at Stanley's...but this was much better than that, and that was great.

And, because I am a piggy and my girlfriend allows me to be a piggy and will participate in my pigginess though in no way in the world am I attributing pigginess to my girlfriend, we also got their bananas fosters french toast.  Never tasted anything like it.  You have to get this - it was so deliciously wonderful (and it came with a side of bacon, so more pork for me!). 

Ruby Slipper has to be a go-to place for you if you want a fantastic brunch in NOLA.  Don't pass it up.

Ruby Slipper Cafè on Magazine Street is Fire . They deliver and give you good tasting hearty southern food! Came to this spot two times in a row while on vacation. Known for their signature Benedict's, but at this point everything is legit and really good. Don't go to the Canal location, it's touristy and commercialize unlike this location, if you want the true experience. Servers were pleasant and friendly. They close @ 2:00pm, so come early.

I recommend their Bacon Bloody Mary, Brandy Milk Punch, and St. Chicken Charles Benedict. 
The line is so long in AM
We were here early and that was a good thing. A line quickly emerged while I was able to choose an outside table without a wait time. Ordered Eggs Benedict and was not disappointed.
Amazing eggs Benedict and I don't even like eggs Benedict. Very boozy mimosas too. Worth the hour wait.

Best Brunch place in NOLA. Simply put, the food here is phenomenal. Their Signature Dish " Eggs Cochon" is a spin off of Eggs Benidict. It is a must try if you dine here. Prices are fair and the food and service is perfection. If you are in the city, you must stop here for Breakfast   ,Brunch, or Lunch. They will not disappoint.

I already reviewed a different location for this restaurant, and my feelings are fairly similar here. Though this location was much busier, longer wait time, and more congested.

That being said, the food was quite good. I had the Eggs Cochon, and while I was never an Eggs Benedict person before this trip, I think Ruby Slipper might've converted me.
Food and atmosphere is great at Ruby Slipper Café.  Love the fact that you can get on the waiting list on your phone.

We had a good meal, it was very much a hustle and bustle place with lots of loud conversations. The service was good and the place had a good feel to it. Pick your eating time, it does stay busy with long wait times for tables

We heard nothing but good things about the Ruby Slipper Café. They have multiple locations in NOLA but we decided to stop in downtown early in the morning. We caught Lyft and made to the location packed with a waiting line outside. We put in our reservation and left our number. they said they would text us when it was our turn. 
  They had 5 picnic table on their patio which 4 businessmen were sitting at with a server assisting them. My wife approached the hostess and asked if we could sit on the patio for immediate service. she responded yes. She grabbed a couple of menus and sat us on a table. As soon as we sat our server greeted us and asked if we'd like some coffee. We asked if they offered Lattes, she said of course, Can we get two as we look over the menu? she said no problem.  As we looked over the menu we decided on trying a few different benedicts that they are known for. I ordered the Pulled Pork Benedict. My wife ordered the Bacon and chicken benedict. All came out with different hollandaise sauce. 
At the end of the day we both agreed that the pulled pork benedict was better in taste as the pork was so moist. All the benedicts are served on a biscuit not a muffin as it normally would. We also ordered a side of Breakfast potatoes and fried green tomatoes. The potatoes fried and well seasoned. the fried green tomatoes were breaded in a Italian breadcrumbs. not our thing, but I'm sure they sell a lot of those.
  The lattes were smooth and velvety and delish. Overall I would go back and try some different items.

If you're dressed for hot New Orleans weather, BRING A SWEATER!  I was in a tank top and shorts; froze the moment I walked in.  Asked two servers to turn up the A/C but finally i flagged down the manager who was happy to accommodate my request.  Our wait at 11:30 on a Sunday was about 15 minutes.  We had been told 25-30 so this was nice.  Make sure you check in on Yelp as you get 2-4-1 Mimosas!
The restaurant is cute but not over the top.  Three panels in the back talk about the food, the drink, and why they opened (to revitalize after Katrina).  I happened to visit the day before the six-year anniversary of Katrina and basically the whole city made no mention of it really.  No opinion either way on this. 
The food: my table of 4 split the Peanut Butter Oreo pancakes (3) and some of it wasn't finished, only because we were saving room for our orders.  The pancakes were a little doughy (fixed by syrup) but definitely tasted like Oreos.  In fact, huge cookie pieces were evident and yummy.  I tasted no peanut butter.  
I ordered the Eggs Blackstone.  Interesting take on Eggs Benedict but a miss in my opinion.  The server told me as he put down my plate that one of my eggs had broken and they gave me a little dish with a perfectly poached alternative.  However, after removing the broken egg (myself!) and putting the unbroken egg on top of the biscuit, i was in need of more hollandaise sauce.  Requested and served by the time i went to eat the second biscuit.  The taste overall of the blackstone, with applewood smoked bacon and tomato on biscuit instead of muffin, was okay.  The Hollandaise Sauce wasn't anything like what I've had in the past.  It was orange and not very buttery at all.  Two people who were traveling with us but weren't at breakfast with us, ate here about 3 hours after and felt the same about the sauce.  It's served with a small bowl of fruit, which contained about 7 1-inch square pieces of pineapple and honeydew, one strawberry sliced in half, 3 grapes and two small orange slices.  For $13 I would have appreciated a heartier side.  Oh well. I wasn't fulling sickenly full at the end of my meal so i kind of appreciated the fruit after teh fact.  My tablemates commented that their food was fine but not what they expected after hearing reviews from friends.  Service was good and they break out your check by seat #.  I had bottomless cup of coffee because I was so cold and it tasted fine.
If I go back, I will order the Bananas Foster French Toast.  Looked delish!

It's pretty good! A little bit too expensive and the lines are too long. 


The food is good, it's brunch. But it's definitely popular with the they like it because it is expensive crowd that is pretty common in New Orleans.


The food is good, but 15 dollars for eggs on a biscuit seems a little too much with a little bit too long of a wait.

You definitely need to use the wait list app or you will wait an average of one hour or more to get in to this restaurant.  A popular and trendy place, it seems to be a local favorite for breakfast and brunch.  The benedicts and banana foster French toast are a must try, but the fried green tomatoes are a miss (cooked down to nothing).  A nice selection of drinks, the ruby slipper mimosa is a good twist on the same old drink.  While the servers were clearly slammed, they were friendly, efficient and very accommodating.  A must try during your stay in NOLA.
Great food, great service! Try the bananas foster French toast! The wait was said to be about 20 minutes, however it was more like 10-15. It was worth it.
Got a decent omelette but my friend really enjoyed her eggs hollandaise. I think you have to order a specialty dish for it to be properly good!

I came here by myself and sat at the bar. So it was like a five minute wait. I ordered the pork Cochin and grits. It came out in less than 10 minutes. It was a good place to eat. Poached eggs were perfect, biscuit was buttery, and they gave a lot of meat.
I would totally come back to try other things.
This place is worth the wait!!! Amazing food and the drinks were delicious and strong! Service was awesome too!!

Long wait so make reservations or use open table.  They do serve cocktails while you wait.  French toast with cheesecake filling was amazing.  Would recommend getting a variety of foods and sharing.  I had the omelette and it was quite good.  Biscuits well above average.
Did a build my own omelette with potatoes as my side! Definitely some place to try while in NOLA!

Our server was a little bit of an odd duck. Excellent variety on the breakfast menu of both local specialties and traditional items. We had the bananas foster French toast, which was amazing and the BBQ shrimp and grits. The BBQ sauce mixed with the creamy grits made for an uneven consistency. I wish they would have just done grilled or sautéed shrimp with more simple ingredients like salt, pepper and garlic.

I guess it's endemic to restaurants in the French Quarter area, but I get so tired of restaurants *could* be charming - such as this one - but have terrible wait staff. Other tables (that were seated later) were waited on and served before we were, and I simply gave up on ordering one of their "Eye Opener" Bloody Marys because I could not flag a waiter down. I appreciate when waiters check in on your progress so you don't have to wait forever for the bill, but we were kept waiting (again).

So why two stars? Well, it is a cute place with a charming story, and the food is good. The Eggs Blackstone dish was good but a little small, but my husband had an omelette with portobello and Brie and I was a little afraid he was going to lick the plate.

No no no wasn't good .. First let me say this is a chain restaurant so I should have known ... Prices were ok but the food wasn't anything to be excited about . Then they sat us by trash cans outside with like 5 million flies . Never again

This is a great breakfast spot in New Orleans!  We ate here on our first morning (and subsequent mornings after) because the specials were so good.  I would have to say that our favorites were the Croque Madam which was a ham and cheese sandwich topped with a fried egg and also the CBH Benedict which was a homemade biscuit topped with house-made corned beef hash, two poached eggs, horseradish cream sauce and Hollandaise.  Now that I'm writing it, it seems like the CBH Benedict has a lot of crazy ingredients but it was delicious!  The service was good but make sure you get there early cause many days there were long lines.

Latte was perfectly made by the very busy bartenders. Took a seat at the bar to avoid a long wait. The staff here does everything they can to ensure prompt and courteous service. 

Had the biscuit, eggs and "pig candy" bacon.  Highly recommend this must do cafe!

Aaaaaamazing!!!!! We got the French toast and the peace maker with one pulled pork Benedict and one fried chicken Benedict... Lawdy it was a pure delight!!!! We split both entrees and it was so darn good. The pulled pork Benedict was our favorite. We got there early around 8am on Saturday and had to wait 10 minutes so get there early! A must breakfast spot!

WOW! Amazing benedicts! My brother in law and i got 3 orders of The Peacemaker giving us 6 different benedict's to try and share leaving us a taste of each benedict ruby has to offer. We also washed them down with an amazing bacon bloody mary that was the best bloody mary we both ever had!! My personal favorite benedict was the Chicken St. Charles. My wife had a create your own omelette and very much enjoyed it as well as our son loving his giant serving of pancakes. If you live here or just visiting this is the breakfast/brunch spot to be at!

This place was great.  All of the staff was amazingly pleasant.  There was a wait of about 30 minutes but it was well worth.  We kept our dining selection to waiter recommendations.  Shrimp and grits were fabulous and it tasted like they cooked magic into the pancakes. Great atmosphere too.

The food here was subpar at best. The boombaloo or whatever it was called was completely tomatoy and not in a good way. The turkey Reuben was drier than a dessert with minimal slaw and dressing, total let down and very pricey. The positives were the great and friendly service and large mimosas...almost got tipsy enough to forget how much the food sucked.

We stayed at the Pelham hotel connected to the Ruby Slipper and ate breakfast there both mornings we were there. Bananas foster french toast is TO DIE FOR. So good! Omelets were terrific, loved their home fries & mimosas! Atmosphere was great, service was spot on. They ALWAYS seemed to be busy which made sense because the food rocks. A must for NOLA breakfast :)

I don't get why this place is so popular and has a massive line/wait (use yelp to save a place in line!). Based on the reviews, I was expected to be blown away. Food was mediocre and underwhelming besides the pancakes. I had the chicken sandwich which is pretty sad and the fries were beyond sad (friends had the eggs Benedict which were okay). Service was friendly. Considering how many places there are to get your tastebuds rocked in NOLA, I probably wouldn't return.

Food is fine but don't go in there looking for typical good New Orleans service because you will not find it. Their story is we opened after Katrina because Dorothy came home. In this case she forgot to bring the service back. They have people running around everywhere but very few paying attention to the customer.
Excellent! In NOLA for our anniversary. Stopped in for breakfast on a Thursday. Great food. Huge portions.

Thankfully I used the no wait app as the line was horrendous. The food and the staff was perfection. I'm currently sitting on my sofa daydreaming of their shrimp and grits and the biscuits! It was all so delicious.
Really cool atmosphere and the food is great! I wouldn't go here unless I was already in the French Quarter, though.

Great food, buzzing brunch place. The place was packed so we waited 40 min for a table but got to enjoy delicious bloody Mary's while we waited. The service was quick and efficient yet friendly and the food was very good. I had the florentine omellete, while my friend had the pulled pork eggs Benedict on a biscuit. We were all happy and will definitely visit again

AWESOME place! The waiters are really professional and polite while the food RULES.

If you are visiting New Orleans and want a solid breakfast this is the spot. My wife, son and daughter all loved their meals. I has the Migas and it was delis, coffee is solid as well.

Now GO!

Just delicious. The Chicken St Charles is basically Eggs Benedict but with biscuits and fried chicken instead of English muffins and ham. Decadent but delicious! Service was all smiles. The place for busy after 8:30 but at 7:45 there was no line.

Be prepared... to either wait in the physical line, or check in online with Yelp and "wait" while you get ready or walk to the restaurant. I highly recommend you evaluate the wait time before going there! That being said, if you ignore my advice and show up (and have to wait in a long line), there is a server who will come out and take your drink order--and deliver it curbside! Definitely try the Bloody Mary.

There are a few breakfast and brunch vegetarian options, including the Skinny Migas. It's kinda like a huevos rancheros. It comes served with fresh slices of avocado and salsa. It was tasty.

The only downside to this joint is the wait time. Our server was nice, but it took forever to get our food and drinks on. We never got our coffees refilled during the hour we were there. I'm guessing it's probably better on a weekday.
Everything excellent.  Very attentive and knowledgeable wait staff. Oh ya the food was great too!!!
Best breakfast food I've had in so long. My favorite is the St. Charles (fried chicken on biscuit with poaches egg) sooooo good! And their pancakes are amazing!

LOVED IT! I wanted to eat here my 1st morning stay but missed it because it was a 2hr wait. So I got smart the 2nd morning and put our name on the list. I ordered the Lousiana omelette with a pancake and my friend ordered stuffed french toast with the same omelette. Our server was wonderful (guy with the big blue eyes) and our food came out quickly. No complaints at all. I will definitely be back!

I'm gonna give this place a 5 because the food was great! But my servers attitude was awful. I ordered the barbecue shrimp & cheese  grits the serving size is perfect for breakfast . I also had a side pancake & bacon. This restaurant has a sit down bar area, outdoor & indoor seating. It was pretty crowded I'm not complaining though because that's a good sign to me. No one is crowding in a restaurant with nasty food lol. Whenever I visit NOLA again I'll definitely stop back by. Next time I'm trying the catfish and grits

One of our best finds during our visit!! The French toast with banana and raisins was good enough to swoon over and the poached egg on pulled pork on a biscuit wasn't like anything I've ever tasted in a pulled pork...it was Devine  The coffee, freshly squeezed juices and mimosas will start your day right !!!!
I am so glad I found this place on yelp!  We had brunch there while we were in Nola. Everything was delicious!  Spicy Bloody Mary to the eggs bene  on a biscuit.
Definitely make sure to get on the wait list took about 90 minutes to be seated. I ordered a Bloody Mary with no bacon. I ordered st Pete's salmon , it was good but I didn't like the fried grits .

Lovely and great vacation breakfast!  We were seated right away, likely because we came on Tuesday late morning. Our waitress was very friendly and helpful. The decoration is lovely and I wish there were more ruby slippers throughout the restaurant. The best of all was the food!  The fried chicken was amazingly crispy, well seasoned, and not oily at all. The sauce over the dish was slightly spicy but perfect for first meal of the day!  I only wish that they serve a smaller or a half portion.

This place was amazing from start to finish. Their bacon infused bloody Mary's are perfect. I had the the cochon egg Benedict and the salmon egg Benedict (you can get 2 different kinds AKA the peace maker). Thinking about the cochon one has me drooling. The service was super friendly. Best brunch spot in Nola hands down

Youre not in Kansas anymore!  This was worth the wait!  Best breakfast ever!  The staff is professional and organized.  The food is mind blowing good!  This will always be on our breakfast list for NOLA.  You must have the pig candy bacon.  If your dish doesn't have it, order a side of it.  They also have house infused bacon bloody Mary's.  I didn't try one on this visit but the dude next me so it was amazing.  I'll get it on our next visit. I did have the Ruby Slipper mimosas and it was awesome.  Chicken St Charles was so good.  This is an amazing place fir breakfast.  The Ruby Slipper has a New Orleans heart.

Really delicious! We arrived just before 9:00 am and had to wait ~ 5 min for a table. Other reviewers were spot on. The Fish St. Peter & Eggs Blackstone were superb. Our server Joelle was very friendly, efficient and shared that everything in the restaurant is made "in house". We plan to go back tomorrow. As we left there were people waiting outside and across the street (& this is Thursday morning)!

I was part of a party of three that went by on a Monday morning.  Initially, we were pessimistic about being seated, due to a folks outside waiting to get in.  The host told us 15-20 minutes, but we got a notification text in less than 5 minutes, and we were seated.  Our server was very enthusiastic and was very responsive with our requests/orders.  The food came out quick and was very good.  The only drawback is the place is a bit cramped and small, but they did a fantastic job of getting us fed and on our way.  The next time I'm in New Orleans, I will defiantly return.

Really enjoyed this cafe! Everyone's name is baby or sweat heart. The Trifecta was suggested by my waitress and it was totally worth the calories and a great sample of 3 different styles of Benedict's and local flavor! Use the Yelp app to get on the waitlist for a quick seat.

My review is simply based off service! We checked in at 10:34am. I told the hosted that we wanted to sit either 4 at a time or 8 with all of us together & that there was no preference. We were told that there would be an hour and a half wait. The host called my phone at 12:20 asking if we still planned to dine at the rest, I said yes and he told me to come to the front door. My party of 8 stood there for more than 30 min additional waiting to take a seat. We have been sitting here since that time and have yet to eat. We don't have silverware and the waiter didn't even come back to give us an update on the food we ordered. At this point no matter what the food taste like, I am completely turned off by the service and lack of hospitality!!

The food here was awesome. We had to wait about 20 minutes cause they were packed!

I had the chicken st charles and so did my fiancé. The service was good and getting food was a little slow but that was expected with how busy they were. I highly recommend anyone to this place! We will definitely be back!

Came for brunch on a Tuesday. Place was happening, but didn't have to wait for a table. They have a wide selection of breakfast options. I got the Benedict trifecta (which was the daily special). The fried chicken one was a bit dry, and the shrimp boogaloo was just a bit weird. The "Eggs Cochon" benedict was spot on! I'd get it again. My wife had the Bananas foster french toast, it's the reason we came, and it didn't disappoint. There might be better options for bananas foster, but you'll pay a LOT more for it and have to wear a tie while you eat it. Ruby slipper mimosa and the bloody mary were meh, we'd skip the drinks next time around. Service was pretty good. It's an alright price compared to other options in the area, just make sure you choose your food wisely.

If you go to Ruby Slipper, PLEASE PLEASE PLEASE get one of their signature benedicts. That is where this place absolutely shines. I'm telling you, they are worth every penny and then some. 

Now, eggs benedict is my favorite breakfast dish, so excuse me if I sound a little fanatical. But this place has so many variations on the classic that we've all come to expect. 

When my wife and I went, I got the Cochon benedict which features a briny pulled pork on a biscuit, topped with the classic poached egg and their delicious hollandaise. The pork was juicy and tender and the flavor paired extremely well with the tangy hollandaise. 

My wife ordered the Chicken St. Charles - basically a fried chicken benedict. I'm not kidding. It was easily the star of the show. A perfectly fried chicken breast served on a biscuit and topped with a poached egg and a pork tasso cream sauce. That tasso cream sauce is OUTRAGEOUS. If you get it, you will love it, and forever be wanting more of it. No joke. My wife was in heaven. And then I had a bite, and I joined her... in heaven. But we were still alive... and on earth. It's tough to explain. Love this place, great food, great coffee, and good atmosphere. Definitely will be back!

Seated right away, but took our server, Devin, 10 minutes to come get our drink order; nevermind that we were almost The only ones in the restaurant. The food was ok at best. The service was horrible; server spent more time talking with his fellow employees thn taking care of his customers. Will not be going back.

Food was great! Highly reccommend the Southern BLT, Bananas Foster Pain Perdu and Chocolate Chip Praline Pancakes. Coffee was great too! They even had almond milk! Only downside was the bathrooms - they were gross I would avoid them.
Worth the 15 minute wait. Food was amazing, coffee was Devine n the waiter Wayne was perfect.

Will definitely be back.  Everything we ordered was excellent and supporting local economy is just icing on the cake!!   Was busy, as it should be and if service is slow because its busy, be thankful you got a seat!

This place was just across the way from our hotel. I was a bit skeptical for some reason going in, but was blown away by how awesome it turned out to be! The interior is bright and lofty, and the three of us were seated right away. There is a great story behind the restaurant and set the right mood for our meal. My sister (a professional waitress) gave very high marks to our server for her performance for being prompt and knowledgeable. I started with a wonderful mimosa that hit the spot and tasted the coffee which was also quite good. Just FYI, the banana fosters french toast is all that it is cracked up to be!!! It is beautifully presented and by far the best french toast I've ever had! The bacon was also delicious! Everyone was happy with their breakfast choices, commenting and all the nice touches, including the refreshing-ness of the multi grain toast served as opposed to the traditional white bread at many breakfast venues.
We were so happy with this place that we ended up coming here again the last morning we were in NOLA. Interestingly enough, you can skirt the high price of the Blackstone ($13) by ordering the breakfast sandwich with poached eggs and a side of hollindaise. ($6.75) You don't get the side of fruit/toast, but you still get full! The waitress the second time around was different and was really pushing the up-sales so it wasn't as pleasant, but the food makes this place worth it. A must eat!

Bottom Line: Average priced restaurant with an inspiring story and an OUTSTANDING breakfast just west of the French Quarter. Eat here!!!

Stayed at a hotel right on Canal Street.  By our third day we were looking for a good, cheap, less-touristy and more-local place for good grub for breakfast.

This place was VERY close to Canal, had no wait, had great atmosphere, and really decent food.  Great option for Breakfast near the Quarter.

Came after reading all the great reviews and seeing the awesome menu online, but our experience didn't live up to it. Our waitress treated us rudely, and we sent something back because it was uncooked and a replacement didn't come out until we had finished the rest of our meal. Not worth it.
I'm giving them four stars because the food is always delicious. However, their service is not that great.

I have never had eggs Benedict before but was told by the waitress to try it there because it was the non traditional way. WOW. I am so glad I listened to her suggestion.  I decided to do the "PICK 2" selection. I had the one with shrimp and the other with fried chicken. Amazing flavors, it was a party in my mouth.  I do not know if I can ever do bebdict the traditional way now that I was spoiled. This is a must to go to for breakfast when visiting NOLA.

Great service.
Excellent food
Good coffee, not your water down cafe coffee.
Nice atmosphere.
Will definitely recommend friends to try this restaurant.

Not bad but I would not walk for miles or wait for hours to eat at the Ruby Slipper.  The omelettes were ok  but certainly not special in any way.  Coffee was however really good!  I didn't have a bMary or the mimosas but they sure looked nice.  Service was great.

Best bloody Mary I've had in a while. All of the drinks were spot on. The eggs Benedict with pulled pork was terrific. We got shrimp and grits..(good just not great).We also got catfish but it was a disappointment..stick with the brunch items and you'll have a great time.

This place was definitely worth the wait. We came for breakfast and got exactly what we were looking for! I had the shrimp, which came with a fried green tomato, a giant biscuit, and a poached egg, all covered in a red sauce with shrimp. Everything was cooked perfectly, fresh, and seasoned to delight. I'd highly recommend for some authentic Cajon breakfast.
Eaten here many times. Going down. Bland average breakfast. Used to love it. Have not kept up. Makes me sad. Need to find new breakfast place.
Great breakfast and great service.  Can't go wrong ordering breakfast here.  Had the Eggs Cochon breakfast which they are famous for- great choice!
It doesn't matter what you order, everything is awesome, all eight of us ordered different things for brunch and we all loved it! Two days in a row!

Great restaurant! The wait was very long over 2 hours however way worth the wait! The waitress was amazing and very funny. The staff is great. The food portions are huge. So go hungry. I highly recommend this place.

It's okay. Omelettes good but not amazing, just standard. My boyfriend seemed to enjoy his oatmeal. 

The worst part was the smell of Raid that suddenly permeated the air while we were eating. It faded away quickly but my sister and I both surmised it was coming from the kitchen/bar area and it is not very appetizing to imagine roaches anywhere near the kitchen. The city seems to have a lot of roaches that come out at night (there's lots of trash bags left out on the roads for pickup) ...I'm guessing the buildings are old and there are a lot of bugs. Not something I wanted to think about for breakfast, I lost my appetite after that. Seems to be a popular place though and staff is nice.

Myself and a friend came across this cafe in our exploration of the area near the Canal Street Marriott. We both had omelettes: Three Little Pigs (Applewood smoked bacon, Sausage and Ham with Swiss cheese)  and the European (Portobello Mushrooms and Brie accented with fresh thyme). We had them done with egg whites and a side of fruit. I added a spinach parmesan bagel, which wasn't really worth the addition - not really toasted very well. Overall, we both commented that it wasn't anything spectacular. $5 mimosas were nice, but not particularly good enough in terms of mixing and parts poured. The waitress was quite attentive and energetic, but came on a bit strong with the menu items, especially getting the double mimosas. Nonetheless, the place was quite busy and decent for breakfast/brunch. Cute, open, and inviting.
Too overated. Theres usually a long wait time for regular food which i can get anywhere elsr. Good service however.

I want to start by saying my food was really good, but my drink was very weak!

I had the Eggs Cochon which was AMAZING! It's one of their specialties and you won't be disappointed. My sister had the BBQ shrimp and grits which was disappointing. The grits were not creamy enough and the meal needed more flavor/seasoning. 

Other people in my group ordered the Chicken St. Charles and the Migas. They were very happy with the Migas but they said the chicken on the Chicken St. Charles was a weird texture and their egg was poached a little too hard. 

I ordered the 19th hole to drink which is their spiked Arnold Palmer, it tasted as if there was no alcohol at all which was disappointing. 

I want to give the eggs Cochon five stars and the 19th hole one star. 

Overall I say try this place out but don't waste your money on their alcoholic drinks.

Delicious food and great neighborhood feel.

We were staying on the same block as The Ruby Slipper Cafe and trying it was a given.  We put our name on the wait list using the Yelp waitlist button.  It was so easy and got us on the list asap.

We didn't have to wait to long but if you do the cafe has chairs outside for your to rest.  

We tried the The Southern Breakfast and Eggs Chochon.  Both were very tasty and we loved the biscuits.  I loved the fired green tomato on my breakfast!  The only bad part was that my husband's poached eggs were cooked through (and that's never fun when you're expecting poached eggs).  

We also ordered a side of pancakes which consists of a HUGE pancake, which was delicious.  We also ordered a side of breakfast potatoes and we only got abut 9 small pieces of potato.  Lame!

Next time we're back in NOLA we're for sure going back.

Quick, friendly service in a bright, sunlit room (that used to be a bank).  

P.S. it is rumored that when this cafe was a bank Bonnie and Clyde hit it up.

The fact that there are a few Ruby Slippers in Nola made me feel like I was possibly in for a disappointing chain restaurant experience, but I was not disappointed! We started with Bacon Bloody Marys (yum! pickled beans were a nice addition.) There's a good amount of items to choose from on the menu and everything looked good, but I got the shrimp and grits, which I really enjoyed. There always seems to be a wait to get in, but we put our name in and they texted us when our table was ready. In the interim, we got to walk around a bit, so it wasn't a hassle having to wait. Service was fast and friendly, just like I like it!

Probably the best breakfast we had all week in New Orleans. We tried to go back a second day, but it was a Saturday, and there was a HUGE line out the door. We were starving so we went to a different place, which was a pretty big mistake as we pined for Ruby Slipper breakfast for the rest of the day. :)

Service was great. The host was amazingly friendly and gave us info on where to walk around.  The americano was pretty watered down. The costa rican was pretty gross.  Very watery for some reason as well. It was supposed to come with two eggs and only came with one.  The avocado was mostly brown. The cinnamon bun pancake was good, but not great.  We also ordered the Migas which did not have mushrooms listed on the menu and it appeared to have it in them anyway. We asked and were told they were not in there. We tasted it and it was clearly a mushroom. The waitress was very accommodating and got us a new one without mushrooms and it was very good.  They were very sorry for the mistake.  No discount or anything for possibly causing an allergic reaction.  Overall a bummer.


Thanks for your message. We did not ask to speak with a manager and no one stopped by the table. Our server did apologize for the mistake with the megas. We did not bring up the other issues. We were ready to leave.   Service and staff were great.
Wow!  Was awesome.  Great specialty variations on Eggs Benedict!  The chicken and Tasso deal was ridiculous.  First morning in NOLA and won't go anyplace else for breakfast.
Pretty good service, tasty food. Nothing too crazy here, but a great spot for some more-upscale-than-diner breakfast.

I came here because it came up on a quick Yelp search for brunch. I checked in on Yelp as a party of one, and I was put on the waitlist for about a 30-45 minute wait, which was fine because I was walking over from my hotel. Upon arrival, I was seated right away, which was great! The staff behind the bar was very courteous and friendly. I ordered the Peacemaker, with the pork and the shrimp. I initially wanted the salmon Benedict but the smoking of the salmon was going take 20 minutes. I wasn't totally impressed with the food I received-- but it certainly wasn't terrible. The pulled pork was sweet and juicy, and the shrimp was also tasty, but my experience wasn't anything to rave about. I did, however, love the NoLa style iced coffee I ordered. :)
Excellent food.  Def worth the wait!  A must visit when in NOLA.  Glad to know they have a location in Orange Beach too.

Line was soooo long during Mardi Gras, even when we woke up at 7 or 8a.m...we decided to come back when everyone left town. The line was still long but we finally got to sit after 30 minutes. The Bloody Mary was excellent but the food was subpar...I don't even remember what I ordered. But if I didn't remember, it wasn't good enough. Worth the wait? Not really...

Was in New Orleans on vacation and heard how great this place so I had to try it out and it's well worth the wait. The food is so good. Definitely will come back every time I go to New Orleans! Breakfast is delicious!

Long lines, big plates, good prices.  Standing outside for a table they have a server taking drink orders, go for the Bloody Mary, great flavor with a  generous pour.  The "Bennie's" are a specialty, assorted eggs Benedict type dishes with a variety of flavor combinations including Corned Beef Hash Bennie with chopped beef and potatoes topped with a poached egg over a biscuit. My favorite may have been the Croque Madame with coffee glazed ham on brioche topped with an egg.

Food: 4.5 Sporks
Service:  5 Sporks
Atmosphere: 4 Sporks 
Local Beer: 2 Sporks
Value: 4 Sporks

This came up as vegetarian friendly. That it wasn't. Most items had meat in it or on the side. See for yourself on the menu.  I ordered the Costa Rican, hold the chorizo. It came out with a slither of avocado, and stale and flavorless plantains. 

There was no wait when I arrived at 30min before closing which is why I gave it 3 stars and not 2.  They sat 
 me at the bar, because the tables were "closed".  But not really.  I ordered coffee but didn't receive it but was charged for it.  Alerted the waiter and he corrected the bill but failed to offer an apology or a cup of coffee.  Wow! Really dude.
Great food and service and the story of wanting people to come back to NOLA after Hurricane Katrina is a good reminder that there is no place like home.

If I was a bum in New Orleans, this is the only dumpster I would spend my time next to. The benedicts here are totally gangster. The St. Charles and the Cochon are the only way to travel. I would eat here 364 days a year if I lived here. The other day I would just grab a donut.

If you're a breakfast lover like myself, you MUST come here for breakfast while vising New Orleans.

I was waiting my whole trip to have an amazing breakfast, and found this spot here on yelp. Thank god I did my research and knew to get there earist in the am, becuase when we were leaving it was already lined up and we were there around 8:20am.

I ordered the stuffed French toast.... with cheese cake. YES, cheease cake for breakfast please. Side note: this was my first time having french toast (Weird right?) personally whenever i see someone order it, it's usually soggy and dosn't look appitizing, where as when I saw someone else order it, it looked crispy and mouth watering. 

Holy WOW. First of all, it was probably the best breakfast I've had in years. The blueberry sauce on top was a perfect blend with the cheesecake. The toast was cripsy and the syurp was warm and oh so delish.

Side of bacon AND a breakfast caesar, This was the best breakfast ever in my opinion and I'm glad I left the best for last.

Was excited to eat here. Waited 45 min. Waitress served drinks while we waited. Moved quickly. Food was not good... had four separate eggs Benedict dishes, egg was very over cooked. Basically had biscuits with boiled eggs. Even sent one back and asked for a runny egg. Still came back over cooked. Also had a pancake. But the edges had granulated flour and the center was dough. 

However, the wait staff and the bar keep were wonderful! We won't be back again. For a $50 breakfast, I expected more.

Omg, we ate so much at Ruby Slipper.  Everything hit the spot, except for the pancakes.

I'm a big PB & J french toast (comes with one piece of bacon), from the kids menu.  Best $5 PB goodness brunch I've ever had. We shared this at our table. If I were to go back, I think I would order this for myself. 

Crispy Chicken St Charles. So crispy!  This was a favorite at our table.

Catfish meal (comes with a skewer of shrimp).  Another favorite at our table, rivaling the crispy chicken.  The cheesy grits was amazing!  Love that delicious catfish.

Pancakes - don't get this. 

Corn hash beef Benedict - my husband really liked this.  

Shrimp and grits - it was good this morning when I had it,  but as I am writing this review,  I don't remember it at all. There are better grits out there.
Perfect breakfast for prepping to walk the Big Easy. Portions are ample and the variety/uniqueness of the dishes is delightful.

Devin Imbraguglio was an amazing funny and entertaining server during our experience. The fish dish with grits was wonderfully tender and grits while not my favorite were done extremely well with cheese and spices incorporated into them. I highly recommend this place and try the bacon bloody mary.

Saw this place mentioned on a travel blog and knew we had to stop by while visiting. Fast seat time, great service and even better food. We ordered chicken st. Charles and egg cochon. AMAZING. The food looked great and tasted even better. While the egg cochon was awesome the chicken st. Charles was the table favorite. Will be heading back tomorrow for more!!

Great breakfast/brunch spot near the convention center. The staff is friendly and entertaining.  The menu has lots of options to meet your tastes. 
I had a 20 min wait - not horrible since I had seen it on yelp that a wait is normal. 
I was in-between two eggs Benedict dishes= Cachon and Blackstone. Since they're served open face, my server recommended I 'mix & match' in order to try both.  It was fantastic!!
Highly recommend.

Enjoyed a great breakfast this morning! The strawberry banana pancakes were delicious and the corned beef hash was unlike any I ever had!! Scrumptious! The service was great and quick. I highly recommend!

Seated at 9:30 am on a Tuesday with no wait. Restaurant is clean and lively. Wait staff are friendly and fast. The portions are generous. I ordered the bellini double and my DH had the bacon bloody mary. I had the banana foster French toast. The flavor was nice but the texture wasn't. It was like the bread sat in the  batter too long and maybe they didn't cook it quite long enough. It was almost gelatinous on the inside. The pork corchon my husband ordered was great though.  The pork had a great flavor. I think the "runniness" of the poached eggs are hit and miss. One was poached to perfection and the the other was almost solid.  I would definitely try it again, but if I had to wait over 15 minutes to be seated I would try another place. Overall, we enjoyed our experience.

We were first time visitors and definitely were not disappointed. The wait was only about 15 minutes for two of us to be seated early Monday morning. I ordered the "Chicken St. Charles" and "Shrimp boogaloo" egg benedicts. I loved the creative spin of both but the chicken st. Charles was hands down my favorite of the two. The shrimp was lacking compared to the chicken. 

My wife ordered the BBQ shrimp and grits and absolutely loved it. The shrimp wasn't overpowered with BBQ sauce but seasoned perfectly!
Snobby staff. Very proud of their place and no customer service skills. Wouldn't go back

This breakfast was made with love. Excellent service at the counter. My friend enjoyed the St. Charles chicken, while I enjoyed the Blackstone eggs, a sort of modern eggs benedict. Fresh. We did not order from the lighter menu lol and enjoyed every bite.  Portions were hearty. The wonderful sever gave us to go coffees when we left.  Get there early.
