The line was down the street when we left on a Tuesday.

Hands down the best food I had in New Orleans, and some of the nicest staff. Don't be put off if there are people outside - the line moved very quick the first time we were here, our second visit we were sat immediately. 

My mom and I split the Bananas Foster Pan Perdu and Chicken St. Charles - SO GOOD. Let me tell you, I thought the Bananas Foster was better than any beignet I had, Cafe du Monde included. We did ask for more syrup, but we are from New England. Chicken St. Charles? It was the best fried chicken I've ever had. 

Obviously we had a good experience. So much so, that we came back a second time before flying home. Quick service, absolutely delicious food. Clean establishment. Fairly priced.
Straightforward. Classic breakfast or Southern takes on breakfast. Make a reservation or come early because they are busy!!

You want to eat here. This place is amazing. I don't remember what I specifically ordered because I tried the brunch foods of all of my dining colleagues, and they tried mine. Everything was magnificent. Whatever comes with the shrimp skewer on top is the best thing. Get that for sure. The absolute best food I've ever eaten in my entire lifetime.

The mimosas were good too, and the service was good. They were quick, but they had to be because the place was PACKED.

The lost star is only because we had to wait two hours to be seated. We were told it would be two hours, but a lot of groups seemed to wander away, so we were worried it'd be less, which is why we stayed the whole time. I'd recommend putting in your name, peacing out for an hour and then coming back. Two hours is a LONG time to hang in the sun while you're hungry. Also, tip: Stay very close to the door because if you don't jump up right away when they call your name, they will move on and you will have lost your chance to eat here. So, stay alert.
This place is amazing. The cochon eggs Benedict may be one of the best things I've ever tasted. Good omelets, bacon and iced coffee as well.
Very good.   Tasty and unique.   Very loud and noisy though.   Hostess said the wait was 45 minutes to an hour, but waited only 15 minutes!

Holy bejesus this place is epic. The brunch specialities are to die for and I've never seen eggs benedict look so good. I got mine with fried chicken but the guy next to me got the bacon version which looked just as good. The service at the bar was excellent and I was pleasantly surprised to see all different kinds of patrons. I will definitely be going back here when I'm in NOLA.

Wasn't great by any means. Very average food except my eggs were cold the first time and very runny the second time. Disappointed because of all the hype made it seem like it was going to be a great place.

Make sure that you sit at the bar. The bartender has all the great spots to go and the best menu recommendations.

Sit at the bar. The staff is amazingly helpful. Even though they were slammed, multiple people on staff stopped to give recommendations and chat. The food.... OMG. 
Sangria & Spanish omelet. That's all I got to say.

Upon arriving their was no wait line. We were able to be seated with no problem. The restaurant was clean and the staff were really friendly. After placing our order,  the food followed shortly. We really enjoyed our meal!!
nothing out of this world I dont know what all the hype is I think this is a tourist trap.

You must visit this for breakfast. Come prepared....there will be a wait....but you are willing to wait. They use NoWait app and you will get a text message when your spot is ready. We sat at the bar and for us, is the way we like to experience eating out. 

The menu is insane, I won't bore this review with much more than saying the drinks are incredible, best mimosa's we think we have had....the Bloody Mary was also one of the better ones I have had. Well worth the money. Get the Cochon Benedict...yeah.

Again on the wait...just prepare for it so youre not shocked and go do something along Canal while you wait. Besides, a wait is a good thing at breakfast...it means you are going to be blown away. Its a really similar vibe to Snooze for your Coloradans...just a way different menu.
Hands down the best breakfast!! We got st Charles Benedict and the shrimp Benedict as well as shrimp and grits. All there were amazing and huge portions.

Stopped in for a quick brekkie before my flight. I had the breakfast sandwich. Candied bacon was a great addition. Sat at the bar, fast service, friendly staff. I would have loved to have tried the bacon Bloody Mary. Yum!!!

My girlfriend and I went for breakfast mid-morning. Wait was between 45 minutes and an hour which is exactly what they told us it would be. It was absolutely worth the wait. We both had the french toast and my girlfriend had a mimosa. The french toast was delicious and the mimosa was champagne with just enough oj to make it orange. Everything was perfect.

I really want enjoyed this place. The food was great. I had the shrimp boogaloo. And my boyfriend and I shared the praline bacon pancakes. Those pancakes were everything and then some. They were probably the best thing on the menu. I would definitely recommend this place and will go back

I don't even know where to begin other than wow, this place was good! Easily this was the best breakfast out we'd had in a long time. We ordered the bananas foster french toast and the eggs bendict with fried green tomatoes. Everything was super fresh and very tasty. The tomatoes were amazing, very light and delicious. The bloody mary was a bit spicy for me, but the flavor was very good. Staff was also very friendly. We would definitely come back next time we are in New Orleans.

Pretty good but not as good as I expected.  My wife and I came here for breakfast, as it had good reviews and was so close to where we were staying(Le Belle Maison). There was a only a very short wait to be seated. My got a espresso and it tasted burnt..  The coffee that I ordered was good though.
  It was hard for me to pass up the boston creme french toast so that's what I ordered.  My wife settled on the highly touted shrimp and grits.  
  My french toast left quite a bit to be desired.  It was okay but the boston creme part of it wasn't very sweet. It just wasn't a standout in the french toast category for me. 
   My wife liked the taste of the shrimp and grits quite a bit but the shrimp were on the tougher side so that was kind of a letdown for her.  It was decently heavy on the stomach entree so that's something to consider.   
   It wasn't a bad option seeing as how it was so close by but with all the other choices in New Orleans we might have pass on the Ruby Slipper next time.

My dad and I ate breakfast here on an early Sunday morning. This restaurant was a super close walk from our hotel down the street. Staff at the hotel recommended this place as a popular breakfast spot, so I'm glad we arrived around 7am. We were able to sit outside at the one of the tables on the sidewalk.

The food was a little on the pricier side from what I expected, but the portions were really big so I didn't feel so bad afterwards. I got the cheesecake stuffed French toast which was delicious, but there was a weird tart on the side that I didn't really understand and didn't eat. The bread on the French toast was really thick and I felt like there wasn't enough cheesecake in the middle. It was still a yummy meal. I also got a side of the potatoes which were delicious and crispy. I couldn't finish my breakfast, but I was satisfied overall.

We got decent service from our waitress who kept coming by to fill up our waters. She seemed nice. A couple hours later, when we walked by the restaurant again, the sidewalk was spilled over with people waiting to get in. I didn't think the restaurant was good enough to wait a super long time for, but it was still a memorable experience.

Ruby Slipper has changed my mind about breakfast. The boyfriend and I went on a Tuesday around noon for my birthday.  There was a line outside. I wasn't sure if it was a tourist trap or because it was just that good. 

The wait wasn't long, the hostess was very friendly and complimented my name (bonus points)! We were seated at the bar right next to another couple who had just been sat. The timing seemed a little awkward as we were handled like a group of 4 and not 2 parties of 2. The bartender IDed me and didn't notice it was my birthday. Or if he did there was zero care. Doesn't bother me but I'm not sure if he knew the date/actually verified my age in his head.

The drinks were delicious though, as they should be for $10 a mimosa. The boyfriend ordered a Bloody Mary and it was nice and spicy. I think they pre-made large quantities of mix and it worked soooo much better than zing zang. 

The food!! Was the crowning point of the experience. I ordered the salmon, poached egg, hollandaise with capers on a biscuit and let me tell you, yum! The biscuit tasted house made and the hollandaise was not too lemony, overall I was very impressed. 

There are multiple locations if you aren't wanting to wait at the busy downtown one, but it is worth it! Touristy, possibly, but they got the food spot on right.

Not sure what all the hype is. total slop.
We eat out often and finally caved and tried it. New Orleans  has no shortage of great restaurants. This is NOT one of them.
They appear to go cheap on ingredients. I'm guessing because they've gotten so "big" they've started buying bulk and cheap.
Great service! Amazing food! French toast was awesome. Staff was accommodating. Join the waitlist on yelp before you go unless you want to wait longer than you have to.

If you have a tour bus at 10 and come in at 9 and your ordered is sent in at 9:06 be ready to wait till 9:36 to get a meal for two. Then be ready for the short manager with dirty blonde hair to tell you that this is normal while everybody else around you receives there food after being sat after you. I work at the Cheesecake Factory and 30 minutes to wait for ANY two entrees is unacceptable! Had to eat everything really fast but the food and. Service was fine and food was good however no compensation for 30 minute checks, I regret not walking out

Wow one of the best egg Benny I have ever had! Truly amazing along with the drinks! Had the blood orange special it was so refreshing and good! The eggs benny special where you choose between two eggs Benedict's is the best go with that one for sure! Can't wait to com3 back!
How can i put this? Hands down the best breakfast i have ever had.  Just that simple, no other way to say it. FN OUTSTANDING!!!  That is all

Other than the wait, the food was great and I the people I was with enjoyed everything too, the poached egg was great and the customer service was great. Nice atmosphere, not too noisy and in a convenient location.

Great atmosphere. Super friendly and helpful staff. The early line check-in feature is fantastic. I plan on doing that everywhere that I can. I had the trifecta and could not finish. Lots of food on your plate. You can't leave hungry!  When you arrive be sure that you check-in and that the person knows what that means. We were dropped from the line because that didn't happen. Everything else was cool!

Worth the wait for sure! They know how to make a good drink for the morning no watered down in the slightest bit. Egg Cochon and Bananas Foster Pain Perdu were phenomenal and highly recommended. Every bite was so good!

Pancakes with banana pecan were excellent. Bacon is some of the best I've ever had. Fruit cup decent sized. Waitress smartly recommended against chocolate pancakes for our kids. One pancake is plenty for kids under 12 IMO. Fresh OJ is a must. Service was excellent.

The food was amazing! I got the pulled pork and chicken Chonchon(spelling) with a well poached egg. I added cheese. It was amazing! The portion is large. I couldn't finish mine. Trust me, you don't need a side! The pomegranate mimosa was delish. The staff are friendly and the food comes quickly. I definitely recommend checking in on Yelp prior to heading to the restaurant because it's a very busy and popular place. Enjoy!
Really good breakfast spot.  Get there early to avoid the long waits.
Awesome place for breakfast.  The Banana Foster French toast is the best!!!  Service is good but get there early to get a table.
Unbelievably great local food. Waitress not only made excellent recommendations, but described the preparation in detail. Very knowledgeable.

Excellent!  We went for brunch and enjoyed it thoroughly. I had the gulf fish St. Peter and it was great. My son had the Louisianan and that was really good too. Large portions and wonderful  service even though it was very busy. Definitely a great place to eat.

This place was awesome. Although very loud it is well worth it. Try to get there early to not have to wait outside too long. We got there around 9am and got seated at around 9:20. Eggs Cochon is a must

Get here early!! Food was amazing waiter was great! The only thing I have to be picky about is I love hot syrup  and they didn't have any. I was pretty sad about it, but the server took the pancakes off my ticket!! So I was pretty happy!! Will be there again soon!!!

This place earned/deserves all 5 stars!

In town for a conference and needed a good NOLA breakfast. Knew this place was right around the corner so i decided to try it, worried that it was a tourist trap- it isn't.

Ruby Slipper had genuinely great food with that friendly Southern hospitality one would expect in the Big Easy.

Full bar. Delicious choices. Great service. Go here- you'll be glad you did!!
The restaurant was in great walking distance  from the hotel  but the shrimp and grits was aweful!!!  I had to send them back.. The French toast was a better choice.
Great breakfast/brunch spot! I really loved that we were able to put our names on the wait list before walking to the location. It's a very busy restaurant and that definitely means good!

I was really excited to eat here with my bestie the morning after attending the theatre. Seated at the bar, the never-ending blur of activity that turned out to be the bartenders/servers extraordinaire greeted us and immediately made me homesick to move back home to LA. 
And then the morning went due south. While waiting just shy of an hour for our breakfast, we saw and heard our servers get repeatedly jerked around and lied to as they were told our order, and many others for those seated at the bar, were "on their way," "the very next ticket," & "just waiting on 1 thing." No food came out for any of us. Then, after visiting with every one that had food and dodging everyone that had been waiting, the manager came to apologize (Good!) and let us know that our food was "on its way" and "the very next ticket" (No, that's not going to work after the "almost an hour" range). We left, mildly hungry, and royally pissed that they treated their staff that way. 
I'd like to think this was a blip on the radar. I've worked as a server and a bartender over several years in the past, and few things suck as much as the BOH making a mistake, not owning up to it, and leaving the servers baffled, standing around, not especially eager or able to help their hangry customers. And then for the MOD to try to keep up the pretense can feel like a punch to the gut. I've heard the food is really good. Maybe I'll find out some time. And hopefully the next time there's a mistake, the servers and bartenders will be given an explanation that's a little more straightforward.
The French toast was like dessert!  Yum!  Service not great, but the food was good for breakfast!

When we went here last September, Best fried green tomatoes, had em, the best of New Orleans in my opinion.

The other food here was very good, but I had write about that.

I shared Bananas Fosters Pain Perdu and had a brandy milk punch here. Both were absolutely delicious. The French toast was really tasty and didn't have too much syrup  or anything else. It's a sweet dish and it's a larger serving so my suggestion is to get it to share with someone and have them order something which is less sweet to also share. The milk punch was also great--it was balanced and you could taste the brandy just enough. The amount of nutmeg was perfect. We had a great bartender who was friendly and helpful. 

Next time I'm in New Orleans, I'll be stopping here or at least at another Ruby Slipper location (depending on when and where I am in the city since the restaurants are closed on differing days). I really enjoyed my meal and experience.

I ate here at the tail end of a 5-day trip to New Orleans and was somewhat disappointed after all the great food we had in the city. The place was packed but our wait was a lot less than we expected, which was great. The service was good - very efficient and friendly without being overbearing. The food was just okay, which is the reason why I'm ultimately giving this place only 3 stars. I had fried chicken and biscuits, which was recommended by our waitress as her favorite. The dish was a bit cold when it arrived and generally lacked flavor. My boyfriend had an a la carte omelet, which was better but nothing to write home about. Overall, I probably won't return here on my next visit to NOLA.

Tasted like your standard diner food. Stuffed French toast were surprisingly light and fluffy, and not heavy at all considered its stacked and filled with a cheesecake cream and topped with blueberries. Grits were good. Eggs Blackstone was O.K., biscuit was more undercooked rather than moist/buttery and the hollandaise sauce tasted like straight mayonnaise.
Again, standard diner food. I'd probably skip it - even if I was pressed for a quick brunch.

We really enjoyed our meals at the ruby slipper. The wait for an early lunch (4 people) was about half hour. The service was friendly and our food came in good time. I had the corn beef Beenie that was really good especially if you like homemade hash. The pancakes got rave reviews the shrimp and grits was good though we thought could use a few more shrimp and the Costa Rican breakfast got a huge thumbs up from my daughter.
Not that great. Long wait, and the food was underwhelming and pretty flavorless.  Not really what I was expecting. My husband asked for a side of avocado and they sent one sliver... smh

Decent place for breakfast.  We ordered 3 different benedict variations - pulled pork, fried chicken, and corned beef. They all had different sauces and the same biscuit/English muffin on the bottom. The muffin was pretty dense for breakfast. The amount of meat that was included in each breakfast really varied. They gave a lot of pulled pork, a piece or two of chicken tenders, and just 3 1x1 inch pieces of corned beef on each of the two muffins. Service was good and the servers were upbeat.

Meh. Think the food would have been a four  if it was warmer. It might have been sitting out on the counter waiting to be delivered. Didn't have time to send it back and all that jazz because I had a flight to catch. I checked in with my breakfast partner and she also confirmed her grits were luke warm as well, but she would rate it a 3.5. I had the signature dish egg Cochon and she had the southern breakfast.

The best. I don't know how else to put it. Just plain ol' delicious. The biscuits are amazing. The Southern Breakfast is my favorite. I've had it twice now. Try to orange/pomegranate mimosa. It's like 90% wine. The atmosphere is fun and welcoming and the bartender ladies are my favorite. The bacon is amazing. Everything is perfect.
Excellent coffee and omelette. Good service. Fun atmosphere. Very busy so expect a wait.

I'm not a huge breakfast person so I didn't try the fancy breakfast specials (bananas foster, couchon, etc.) although everyone else at my table took the plunge.  I just got the basic breakfast but i was thoroughly impressed with this place.  The wait was a nightmare but the food was great (i literally wanted to steal  The Louisiana from my husband).  Great distance to the French Quarter and hotels.  Worth checking out.
Just what the CBD needed - this will become a hot spot for breakfast / brunch crowd.  The food is great and service was spot on.

Ruby Slipper did not disappoint.   I was recommended on numerous occasions to check it out when in New Orleans.   I'm a huge brunch fan and tend to go often (more than I would like to admit ) so didn't expect this to be really any different from my favorite places back home.  
Well, I was wrong! The Benedicts were absolutely amazing.   I opted for the "Peacemaker" option where you can pick two Signature Benedicts - I opted for the salmon and the shrimp (Highly recommend)   My friends loved it so much, they made a point to return the next day, despite food options being plentiful in New Orleans.  If you're in the New Orleans, this is a must!

This place was hyped up big time!! The wait was an hour and the food was good! But i had way better while there (Stanley's and Willa jean) 
I got the peacemaker which is your choice of 2 eggs Benedict's. I got the fried chicken and shrimp one. Both were good but not amazing! 
Bloody Mary was great and staff was friendly

We stopped in here on a Tuesday morning because it was right across from our hotel, and my friends had it earlier in our trip and loved it. We expected to wait a while, but we were seated as soon as we arrived with a party of 3. We had a high top table in the back of the restaurant close to the restroom, but it honestly was far enough away to not be a problem.

We ordered the trifecta, the chicken benedict, and the chicken sandwich.   Everything had such great flavor -- the trifecta had a selection of chicken, pork, and shrimp on the benedicts, the chicken sandwich had a cajun slaw included. The chicken sandwich was tasty, but the piece of chicken was quite large it made it difficult at times to bite because the tomato kept slipping from between the bread. The chicken benedict order needed a bit more hollandaise sauce, but the fact they served it on biscuits was wonderful. 

The waitress was really sweet, but she was extremely busy so she did not check in on us too often. My friend wanted to get an extra order of hollandaise sauce, but it was impossible because the waitress never came back. The place was always crowded when we passed so it's not surprising that this was the case, but we did notice other waiters were more available to their tables. 

If you're staying on Canal St., I suggest stopping by, but don't count out other breakfast spots in the area which are just as good.
This is a New Orleans must..... there is a wait on the weekends but very well worth it.... staff very friendly food is amazing

Our server made this experience  5  worthy. Forgot her name but she was very charismatic and had great recommendations for everything from the coffee to the entrees. The food was excellent...posted a video on my SnapChat and had my friends drooling on their phones. I ordered the Stuffed French Toast and it was perfect. I also had a side of grits with pepper jack cheese, thanks to the server's recommendation. 
Lastly, using the Yelp app to put ourselves on the wait list gave us perfect timing. Instead of waiting outside for  the estimated 47-51 minute wait time, we arrived right when the text from the app said to and walked right in and we were seated right away. This place will definitely be on my recommendations to friends visiting and I'll be back whenever I visit NOLA again.
Great breakfast place. Very traditional New Orleans style and it's very good. Any tourists I would recommend to go here.
I LOVED the atmosphere, food was absolutely delicious, and I even bought a t-shirt!!! I would imagine all the locations are as great as this one!!! HIGHLY RECOMMEND!
Has the salmon + feta omelette. Wow! The nicest omelette I've ever had? Very likely! Not too heavy or rich with sauce. Just right!

This was one of the best breakfast we had on our seven week holiday. Firstly the service was great, our waiter did a great job. We ordered Belinis which were super yummy. I had the egg white omelette which I would definitely order again and my husband had the eggs Cochon - he has not stopped talking about it! A must visit!!

Now THIS is more like it. 
Lots of places in the quarter boast great breakfasts and are really no more than greasy spoons with a flat top grill. 
This place is creative with the menu in a southern inspired way - bold flavors - not shy on portions. 
They ONLY do breakfast and are open til 2. They fill up quick and a line forms by about 9; so, go early. 
The Corned Beef Hash Benedict (CBH Benedict) is ridiculously good and hearty. 
Good coffee.

Very popular place with a bit of a wait. The staff was friendly and knowledgeable. Our party was mixed on the food. Eggs Benedict got an A+ but the stuffed French toast though not bad was not great and came cold.

Food was excellent and the customer service was great the reason for the three stars is that they were out of chicken at 8 am ... I mean seriously if you are out of something you should let people know before they stay outside and wait to be swayed just to be told what you actually wanted to have and or try they do no have :( several others left as well when they found out they did not have chicken

My favorite breakfast in NoLA! Signed up for the No Wait App to try to beat the wait, but then ended up confusing locations with the one on Canal. FAIL. So what I thought would be a 5 min wait turned into 45 minutes. Ah well. Next time I'd probably just go to the other location as this actual location (especially on a cold day) let's in a gust of frigid air every time anyone leaves or enters the restaurant. However, I'm still giving it 5 stars because all the food we had was seriously delicious, and the bloody mary might be the best I've ever had. Our waitress was also a sweetheart and accommodated our 1 year old boy wonderfully.

Went to brunch here today and absolutely loved it. There was about a 30 min wait, but that's to expect with most good food places. Wish I knew beforehand you could download an app called "No Wait" in order to start your wait online.

Started off with a mimosa- technically a double mimosa- and ordered the "3 Little Pigs" omelette. Can I even begin to explain how delicious an omelette with ham, sausage, and bacon is?? Grits could have been better but I still enjoyed them. Would definitely recommend this place for brunch- especially since they serve during the week til 2!
Good was good but expensive. The wait took a really long time and you had to wait outside in the heat the whole time

the food is good.  you will likely have to wait for it as we did with many other hungry people on a cold windy morning.  the wait was an excruciating 40 minutes!

the pancakes and french toast specials were really special.  pancakes had a hazlenut cream and the french toast was stuffed with lemon curd...  wife had the "eggs katina" and it was well received.  the coffee was good too, and I needed a lot of it.

would I have gone here knowing I would have to stand in the wind for 40 minutes first.... probably not.  but it's not their fault they are popular.  just something you should consider before committing to a lengthy wait if it's really cold outside.

Oh wow....Did. Not. Disappoint. I almost licked the plate of my Bananas Foster French Toast. And the Eggs Cochon Eggs Benedict were amazing, too. Make sure you waitlist yourself on Yelp before you go so you save time (found out about the waitlist after we got there)...but we got there around 9am on a Saturday morning and tried a couple of the locations - they were all about at 30-45 min wait, and we only waited about 40 mins. So worth it!  Our waitress was darling and super attentive and considerate....Kitchen even got backed up, but she kept us informed and made sure we got our bill right away so we could still make our tour. Plan to go back tomorrow for round 2!

We heard about the Ruby Slipper and that we HAD to go atleast once while in NOLA. Luckily it was just two blocks from our hotel. We had to wait about ten minutes which is not bad at all because the food was amazing. It was really difficult choosing what to order because everything sounded so good. I settled on the Eggs Cochon, which is pork debris onto of buttermilk biscuits, topped with poached eggs and hollendaise sauce. It was $13, and I was nervous about the portion size but it came out and it was sizable, I didn't have room to finish it! If you have ever been to Baltimore, the Ruby Slipper is comparable to Miss Shirley's. It's delicious food, and closes early because it is a breakfast/brunch place.

This place is the best. Last morning in New Orleans before the car picked us up for the airport and we finally found this place. The food is amazing, the prices are beyond reasonable, and the staff is friendly and attentive. The French toast batons were great with the cinnamon sugar and the salmon with poached egg over biscuits was impeccable. Definitely recommend this place to anyone visiting New Orleans. Can't wait to come back.
Savory shrimp and grits. I recommend. Would skip the cinnamon pancakes, though. Opt for the banana pain perdue french toast instead!
Two days in a row for a late breakfast and both times were equally impressive. The grapefruit juice is probably the best I have ever had. Be prepared for a very noisy and echo-ie atmosphere.

My rating is for the service not the food!!! The food was amazing! We objecteted to the way our server treated a co-worker. The hostess seemed sweet, maybe a little spacey. She sat us with our server, her name I am sure was Michelle. The two seemed to be having an intense conversation. Michelle then told the hostess "to get the @#** out of my face". I don't know what preceded such a strong exchange, but it made us very uncomfortable. There seemed to be no manager on duty to report our concerns to. I was not looking for a show with my meal. We will not be back.......
My wife had the Eggs Cochon and I had the Migas; it was more than we could eat and very delicious. We will make this our breakfast/brunch place when in New Orleans. I highly recommend.

The waitress hovered like a helicopter for us to order. We were asked three tones in less than five minutes. The coffee was average at best and the food was lack lustre. I don't know why it's rated so highly to be honest.

You are in for a treat, eggs Benedict is their specialty. But the variations of eggs Benedict will please a person who doesn't like them ( my wife in name). The house special Bloody Mary is the best one we have had on our trip. Good coffee and great service. When you sit on the outdoor dinning sometimes service is slow but not here! Rear spot
This my second time to eat here. There's always a wait and it's worth it!! The food is one of a kind. I love the cochon biscuit, don't be afraid try something new. You won't regret it!!

The French toast is mediocre at best. For all of the positive reviews about the French toast at this restaurant, I would definitely pass on this item. Their coffee was average; I did not add any creamer or sugar and again not impressed. The service, however, was a different matter. From the hostess to to the servers, busboys, and bartenders, everyone is very friendly and eager to help.
AMAZING!!!!!!! It was worth the hour wait. Service was great. Food was great. definitely a place to try while in new orleans if you want a quality breakfast. and its inexpensive.

Awesome food! Service was slow but I would come back for the food! Definitely worth the wait! The iced coffee is really good!! I tried the trifecta of Benedict's and the chicken and pork was awesome! Didn't care for the shrimp one.

Favorite brunch spot in NOLA. Been coming here for over a year. Amazing food, always new and delicious specials and the staff is incredible. I recommend this spot to everyone I know that is coming to New Orleans. They are never disappointed.

Our watress Erin is tops! 

Less then five minutes after being seated she was there taking our drink order. Another five she was there again to get our food order and even made suggestions on the coffee and breakfast selections. She is very knowledgeable of the different menu items and not pushy. She made our visit here worth while. All in all we sat less then 10 minutes before having plates on our table and digging in.

I hit up several breakfast/brunch joints while I was in town for work, and this was the best I could find.  Feels like a I was eating in a very old-timey bank.  Kind of cool.  

Their Hollandaise sauce was tasty, and 20 min late began to feel the lazy sauce pulsing through my veins, whisking away my alertness.

Jonathan served us and he deserves a mention.

What enjoyable brunch after returning from our cruise. The Ruby Slipper has very unique menu with plenty of choices that you might like. The ambiance is noisy and lot of dining guests enjoying the great food. Our waitress , Brandi, did excellent serving our food order. I personally had the Corn Beef Bennie which was delicious and I am enjoying the food here in New Orleans, LA.
Expect wait on Sunday morning especially with the Saints in town. 
Come to Ruby Slipper to enjoy a very unique dining experience while your stay in New Orleans .
Horrible absolutely the worst breakfast. Cold food, overpriced, Don't eat here.
Was so good we went twice!! Had two of the benedicts, the cochon being the better of the two. Really like being able to get in line via the app.

Great breakfast spot in New Orleans, filling meals, great drinks, and personable staff. The food is outstanding for the price and they give you big portions. Would highly recommend. Definitely come here early though, we got here at 8oclock, luckily right before the line started on a Saturday morning.

We went to the Ruby Slipper to experience an authentic New Orleans breakfast. We were not disappointed. There was a line to sit but a waitress came by and took drink orders while we waited. After about 20 minutes, we were sat in Erin Clayton's section. She was very enthusiastic and really appeared to enjoy her job. We told her we were not sure what to order. Erin said, "I will be right back and I will sit down with you and go over the menu!"  Sure enough she returned a couple minutes later and sat down with us. She made a few recommendations including splitting the eggs Benedict. We had the fried chicken eggs Benedict and the pork eggs Benedict along with French toast. Erin's recommendation was spot on. This was a very delicious breakfast. Erin had great customer service and a very cute sense of humor. I told her I was going to do a Yelp review. She said, "if you like the food and service, my name is Erin. If you did not care for the service or food, my name is Angela!"  We all laughed. The food was awesome and the service was supreme. Erin made our breakfast experience one to remember. She provided excellent service and is a great asset to the Ruby Slipper.
Great breakfast! We had the bananas foster and the Eggs Blackstone, both were excellent. Wait staff friendly and helpful.

I am not a big brunch/breakfast person, but the Florentine omelette was pretty good. Came with marble bread toast and a side of fruit. Our waitress was terrific. She was very enthusiastic and appeared that she actually enjoyed her job. I wish I had that same enthusiasm for my job. The food didn't take too long to receive from the time we ordered. Everyone I was with seemed to enjoy their meal. The burgers looked gigantic. If you want a good breakfast/brunch/lunch, this is a solid option.

I don't think that I have ever given such a low review for a restaurant that is perfectly clean, and has a friendly, helpful staff.  The menu reads great, but the food does NOT live up to the descriptions.  I had the Chicken St Charles.  It was a biscuit that was WAY too large with two little pieces of friend chicken and poached eggs on top with very little sauce... bland and very disappointing.  My husband had the Corned Beef Bennie.  He loves corned beef.  MAYBE there were 4 small pieces of corned beef on the same oversized biscuit.  The dish was mostly mushy potatoes with very little sauce. Again, the place is clever, clean and the staff was friendly.  the double mimosa and bellini that we had were just ok.  It is in a great location on Canal St. but is not worth going to.

My husband and I sat at the bar, the service was phenomenal. Our tender Michael was so attentive and charismatic. The food was worth every penny and they have a really fun drink menu. Go to brunch place if you're in Nola!

Stopped in for lunch today. Fast and friendly service,  I was in and out in under 30 minutes. The brunch looked fab, but I opted for lunch and ordered the Miami Slice. The sandwich wasn't bad - I just found out I didn't like pickled green tomatoes. I will definitely go back for breakfast.

Started it off right with an awesome Bloody Mary. It took some time for us to get a seat, but getting a Bloody Mary made the wait enjoyable. It was pretty busy and there seemed to be a lot going on, but the wait was worth it: bomb food. We had some slip ups with what we ordered but the waiter and manager were amazing and really went out of their way to make our experience a great one. Definitely put your name on the wait list before you get there.
amazing. best breakfast spot in the city. I had the french toast and the migas.  Also be sure to get the locally sourced coffee its perfectly smooooth

We randomly chose this place to eat when we were visiting New Orleans. I'm so glad that we did! There was a bit of a wait, but nowhere near the amount of time we were quoted. I'm glad we stayed because the food was delicious! We had the catfish special and the salmon. The catfish special was amazing and I was jealous I wasn't the one that ordered it. I will definitely be returning on my next trip to try more of the menu.

Super long wait on Mardi Gras weekend.  Perhaps we had our hopes a little high, but we were let down.  While the staff was nice and the food presentation was good - it just wasn't anything special.  The CBH was covered in too much hollandaise sauce so I couldn't taste the meat/potatoes/eggs.  The veggie sandwich had too much bread so we couldn't taste the veggies.  We should have had the king cake pancakes or the Miami slice (banana cheesecake STUFFED French toast)...maybe next time.

The menu was so tempting that I just could not decide and relied on my server to point me in the right direction.   She said no doubt go with the fish and I was so glad I did.   It was so flavorful, in no way made me miss standard breakfast food. 
Hubs had the migas which was so good.   The flavored sour cream on the sauce was worth swimming in and the side of grits were some of the best grits I have ever had.

Loved the food!! The Mimosa was so worth it.  Don't judge me that I began drinking at 10 am...if you don't drink in the morning you can't claim you were drinking all day .  The wait was not as long as what we were told but I'm sure the larger the party the longer the wait.  Enjoy!

Have seen this place packed every morning outside of our hotel room so we decided to give it a try. The banana foster French toast was delicious and so was the cafe latte. Get in early if you can, but restaurant is worth the wait if not.
Hands down the best French Toast in existence. Highly recommend the Bananas Foster Pain Perdu. The cappuccino was a letdown, however, as was the price. Still worth a trip(s).

Be prepared to wait!!! Always a super long line but they do have an app where you can track your place in line!Definitely worth the wait though! 

The food was awesome. Our group had the BLT, the Piece Maker, and the cinnamon swirl pancakes! Absolutely no complaints. Food was incredible!! The portions are pretty big! 

The only reason I give 4 stars rather than 5 is because of the service. They seemed under staffed. We agreed to sit outside because the wait to sit inside was almost 50 minutes as apposed to 30 minutes to sit outside. When we were seated our  table was still dirty. It looked like it hadn't even been wiped down. It seemed like they had just taken the plates away from the previous customers and sat us. The hostess didn't say anything about it either she just dropped our menus. 

Other than that our waitress was really nice. Again she seemed like she had too many tables and only checked on us once.


Great place though overall would recommend! Try to get here before 9am to avoid some of the line!!
Very good food, but a very long wait. Waited 40 minutes for a table for 3. The mimosas are stronger than usual, which is good, and the Catfish St. Peter is outstanding!
Great breakfast! First place we visit every time we're in NOLA. The Cochon Benedict it's amazing! Bloody Mary with bacon infused vodka is delish.
Great breakfast food, Great service and a great big Mimosa!  Can't get better than that!

One of the best experiences of any restaurant in the New Orleans area. Even tho it was busy and did have to wait 30min for a table, it was great service. Staff was really busy but very nice. Food was great. Recommend having a drink while you wait. Best thing I would recommend to eat is the St. Charles Chicken.

I noticed this place near my hotel when I saw the crowd outside waiting to  be seated. Apparently  its a 60- 90 minute wait some days.  Luckily  I went this morning  on a Tuesday and got seated  right away. I started with one of their  award winning  Bacon Bloody Mary's . Its was perfect. Our server was Britain she was super nice, great and helpful with menu suggestions and attentive friendly service. 
I wound up getting the Eggs Cochon. That was an excellent  choice. One of the best things I've EVER had. It's  definitely  something  I cant get in NJ. My gf had the mexican egg plate which was also super delicious. 
It was a phenomenal  meal and a perfect  way to end our tirip before our flight.  If and when I return I will definitely  be visiting  The Ruby Slipper again.
Amazing! Everything on the menu looked fantastic. Said there was a huge wait but sat us quickly. Get the app that allows you to check in ahead of time. Try everything!

Really great breakfast place. My husband got the banana rasin pancakes..to die for. I got poached eggs and toast. Perfectly done. We sat outside- this place gets really busy, really fast. Waier was very nice.
It was just okay. Definitely not what everyone hyped it up to be. Have had much better breakfast at other places in NO.

I'm not sure what all the hype is about. Our hotel said this was a must go to for breakfast.  I checked in on Yelp twice by accident.  

The four of us arrived around 8:30 am on a Thursday.  Seated immediately.  The restaurant sits on the corner next to a hotel.  They share a common lobby.

I decided on the breakfast sandwich - scrambled eggs, sweet bacon, a slice of fried green tomato, with a biscuit.  The server said it was an open faced sandwich.  My plate comes and it was a typical plate.  Everything was like sides.  Why call it a sandwich?   The fried green tomato was tasteless.  Seemed it was frozen, then fried to reheat.   Unedible.  The best thing about my breakfast was the biscuit. Hubby's French toast didn't resemble French toast that we're accustomed to.  It looked like long wide banana peels.  Limp.

The restaurant had a huge blackboard strung up on the wall.  Said the name Ruby Slipper was inspired by Dorothy - there's no place like home.  I wished the food was more inspiring than the name.

I am so disappointed to have to write this review. I'm in town for my birthday and had breakfast here on 12/18. The line was long and it was cold and rainy but worth the wait. Service was great and the food even better. I decided to try them again on 12/20. It was a HORRIBLE experience. It was not busy, but yet a 15 minute wait. A couple came after us and said they'd sit at the bar so they could get seated sooner. I look and they're sitting at a table. That was strike number 1. We finally get seated and our server waits 5 minutes before even acknowledging us, but walks away saying he'd be right back. Another 5 minutes pass, he says I haven't forgotten you and again walks away again. No water, no drink order, nothing. By this time I'm frustrated. He finally comes to our table and tries to apologize but it was too late. The sad part is that he was attending to a table right beside us. All he had to do was take our order. We got up, told the host who said he'd get the manager, who never came. The WORST service I've experienced in a very long time. Don't eat there unless you're willing to take the risk of being ignored. 
#invisiblecustomer
The pancakes were delicious. The service was great. A little over priced for my taste as far as drinks but would definitely recommend.

This is an amazing breakfast venue! The ease of placing our name on the waitlist through yelp was awesome and saved us time. The  food is mouthwatering. Try the Trifecta to get a taste of different southern food. The Bananas Foster French toast is delicious! Our waitress, Shimeka, was very pleasant, prompt and had a great personality! Hands down would recommend!

Service was excellent!!! Ask for Mary she was our server and was very genuine 
Must try the Stuffed French Toast with cane butter and the Shrimp Bugaloo Eggs Benedict and the Three Little Pigs Omelette 
Awesome place for brunch!!!!
Pretty solid breakfast spot. I ordered the shrimp and grits. The shrimp gravy was amazing but I've had better grits.
BBQ shrimp n grits are good, a tad spicy though. I really enjoyed brunch here. It's a large space and the service and food is good.
Classic favorite of mine! Enjoyed breakfast with a friend and amazing mimosas! Just be prepared for the wait time

I freaking love this place.

We were totally hung over and starving our first morning in New Orleans, I found this place on Yelp.  No full menu but I saw the Bananas Foster Pain Perdu, so I didn't even look at the menu, just ordered it.

The Bananas Foster Pain Perdu was orgasmic.  Boyfriend had the Eggs Blackstone and wasn't as enthralled.  

I ended up eating there every morning.  Even the oatmeal was amazing (needed a break from the richness of the food there).

John and the other bartenders were informative, fun and amusing.  

This place was amazing in so many ways.  I loved it.

Arrive early! We got there about 20 minutes before the cafe opened (8am opening on Saturday) to avoid the wait. The service was excellent. Do not miss the Chicken St Charles! Fluffy biscuit, crispy chicken breast and Tasso cream sauce. The presentation is Benedict in style- raw spinach on the plate then biscuit, chicken, poached egg and sauce. Tasso is a 'spicy ham' pork product. I found the spice pleasant, but not overwhelming in this application

The only reason that I gave this review 4 stars instead of 3 is because I've eaten at a different location before with better results.

I had a group of 6 eating breakfast here Saturday morning.  We arrived at 9:30 and only had about a 30 min wait.....I was expecting worse.  However, when the hostess came to see us she freaked out that there were only 5 of us present (my boyfriend had gone to add more change to the meter).  She even started asking random people if they were our 6th.....ummm, chill girlfriend.  She was obviously quite flustered and wasn't dealing with the hustle and bustle very well.

I saw that the menu only mentioned the double sized alcoholic beverages, so when our waiter arrived I asked if I could have a regular size (as I have always done at another location).  He was very unappologetic when he informed me that they had recently revised the menu and only offer the double size.  REALLY?  Um, not everyone wants to get schwasted in the am.  First, I think this was a dumb move by management, and I wasn't impressed by my waiter's response.

Other than some mildly rude service, the rest of our experience was great.  Our food arrived pretty quickly considering how busy the place was.  I ordered the Eggs Blackstone (poached eggs, bacon, tomatoe, biscuit, hollandaise) and it was delicious.  My egg was a little over cooked, but it was still very tasty.  Other folks at the table ordered the Smoked Salmon Bennie and commented on how good it was.  Although the salmon wasn't really smoked salmon....looked like it had been baked....but again, still tasty.  2 other friends got the Costa Rican Breakfast and raved.  The shrimp and grits were delish too.  Overall a solid experience.....but I think the staff needs to brush up on their manners a bit.

Update: Revised to 2 stars.  I've eaten here again and another dissapointing experience.  I ordered the migas which I've had several times at another location.  They were not good here.  And just this morning, my boyfriend tried to take his parents from out of town here because they were staying near by and it's closed.  Nothing on the website....just closed for maintenance.  The folks at this location don't seem to have any concern for customer service.

This place has it all....Charm, great food and ambiance!!   The ONLY reason they did not get 5 Stars is the wife's French toast (jinga style) sticks were very very dry!   However, my dish was amazing.  The wait staff have personality and flair, and I can't say enough about the overall feel of this place!
Amazing service. Top notch breakfasts. Great coffee. Bloody Mary's done right. This place is a must go, even if there's a wait.

A really delightful spot for brunch. The wait was long...but worth it. They take your cell phone number so they can text you when your table is ready. This allowed us to walk around New Orleans while we waited. The food was excellent as were the Bloody Mary and Bellini. I highly recommend this place to anyone and everyone!

I like this location much better than the original location.  The servers have much less of an attitude (from what I've experienced) and they have much more space to accommodate the crazy amount of customers.

They make an excellent bloody mary and excellent eggs blackstone. The biscuits in the blackstone were light and fluffy, not heavy at all, which I appreciate.

My dining partner thoroughly enjoyed the french toast.

The bar is first-come, so many times there is no wait.

Very busy, use Yelp to do a check in to get a place in line then you can follow how many people ahead of you before you get there. Really good food, especially the grits and pancakes. Service at bar is excellent and friendly. Shrimp in omelette kind of bland and sometimes kitchen doesn't get the orders out in the order you come in so you may have to wait
Waited awhile but really awesome brunch and very good bloody marys. I got a chorizo scramble and split some pancakes with the group I was with. I would definitely recommend it!

Excellent! Cozy ambience, friendly staff, and quick service. Loved the online waitlist option - we put our name on the waitlist while we got ready and walked over, and were seated about 4 minutes after we checked in with the host an hour later. We didn't have to wait long, but for those that do, one of their staff walks around taking drink orders that you can enjoy on the sidewalk while you wait. The food was delicious; I had the peacemaker with the friend chicken and the cochon. I'm not sure I'd have given it five stars if we'd actually had to wait in line 1.5 hours, however. It's great, but it's not THAT great.

We heard many great things about Ruby so had to check it out. It's really cute and the staff is so nice and chill. You really feel like you are eating at a friend's house. We took a spot at the bar and shared the Louisianan omelet and chicken sausage which was good. For drinks we got tea and lemonade but the lemonade wasn't that great. It's a good spot with a lot of options so I'd recommend checking it out.

Worth the wait!! FYI, Download the no wait app! My Shrimp Boogaloo was so delicious! While we waited outside in the cold, a lady came around and took our drink order. Friendly staff and dang good food!

Arrived with 6 people when they opened at 7am for business breakfast.  2 not there yet so they would not seat us.  When seated, would not move tables so that we could talk. Acted irritated by our presence.  Got orders wrong.  Food was fine. Freezing cold AC

Where do I start with this place? So, I went on Sunday around 2:00 and it was slammed pack, but I was alone so I sat at the bar right away. There was about a 30 min wait though. This is a diner style restaurant, so it was very noisy. The service at the bar wasn't the greatest, but due to them being extremely busy I was understanding. Now that I have the my only negative points out of the way I can get to how great everything else was. The food is phenomenal. I had the grilled fish St. Peter. It is off the chain good. The dish is full of bold flavors that all combine to make your taste buds go crazy. I also had the signature Mimosa. It was very refreshing. I highly recommend visiting this place.

We went there twice for breakfast. A convenient location and not a horrible wait. Ate once inside and once outside. Had the southern breakfast, french toast, corned beef hash eggs benedict and eggs blackstone. All were good and the service good.

It might have been the best place I ate at while in NOLA. First of all, they had the best Bloody Mary I've ever had. It's bacon and bacon-infused vodka in it--so good, and spicy too! I had the trio of Benedict's. They were all good--the chicken one was probably my favorite though. The coffee and service was great too. They were also able to split checks. The one negative is that they don't take reservations. You can get in line online. We did that and still ended up waiting an extra 20 minutes, but it was well worth the wait!

We put our names in and waited an hour for brunch at the Ruby Slipper Cafe. It is a cute little restaurant with good brunch. Everything was just good. Service was good, coffee/baileys was good, bananas foster french bread was very good, and the croque madame was good. Overall, good!

This was perfect for brunch. We prefer more breakfast type options for brunch than turtle soup or anything we would have ordered at one the traditional places in NOLA. Don't let the long lines scare you off the food is absolutely worth the wait. We had 2 specials of the day. My wife an avid pancake lover order the cinnamon roll pancakes and said they were in her top 5. I had the chicken St. Charles which had poached eggs served over fried chicken sitting on fried grit cakes. The grits were amazing and the sauce and chicken combined with the yolk to make a perfect bite. Go check them out and enjoy the weather while you wait and be ready for a delicious breakfast

Holy crap, this place is amazing. Go here, eat here. DO ITTTTT.

After reading the reviews, we ordered mostly the highest recommended dishes. It was just my husband and I but we ordered 3 entrees. The French Toast (bananas, raisins and rum), the Chicken St. Charles and my husband ordered the Migas.

The Chicken St Charles is a fried chicken breast on a soft, yummy biscuit with a dollop of spicy sauce. The French Toast is amazing. The perfect amt of bananas on top of french bread french toast with a rum maple syrup dressing and raisins. Just ridiculous. My husbands Migas was equally delectable but with totally different flavors. A little spicy but not too much. 

Next time I'll get a double mimosa with my order. I don't think they do any dish wrong here.

This was but a short stroll from the Wyndham Riverfront where we were staying. It rated pretty high by the locals that I talked to. I can certainly see why. This place is packed.  There were many groups of people outside waiting to be seated. so for the sake of time... we climbed up on some bar stools and placed our orders. At the time this was the only place to sit. So with the aid of a step ladder(ha) My cute short wife was able to get situated. I felt fortunate that we got a place at all to sit.

This place is a bit boisterous (some people just don't need sleep) for such an early timeframe. When you take into consideration where you are, this makes perfect sense. The party is where you find it....or make it.

There are many items to choose from. I had the eggs Benedict w Hollandaise sauce resting on top of potatoes and corned beef hash. This filled the plate up. I was stuffed. This was very tasty. You know...food in NOLA is so good! I did, however, find just a little more room for something else. I decided to get a Blood Mary, observing that it seemed to be a popular drink here. The Bloody Mary turned out to be a good choice. Not only is it full of vitamins and minerals that the body needs for good health. There was definitely some C2H5OH present in this concoction (the reason for the drink).  It came garnished with olives, lime, and two hot peppers which provided for a nice controlled burn on the way down.

I would definitely come here for lunch, however, during this trip I planned to visit each restaurant/bar only once.

In this town you just move from one party to the next. We were here with locals....need I say more.

76/100

Great place. Food and atmosphere are on point. It's hard to find a good brunch/breakfast place. Our waitress was awesome and accommodating. Everyone working there had a smile on their face and seemed to be enjoying working there. Prices are a bit steep for mimosa's but size and flavor make a 10 dollar drink worth it. Would return for sure.

Great service and awesome Bloody Mary! Had the special which was "The Trifecta" (three of the top selling eggs Benedict) It was to die for! Would definitely go again and recommend to friends and family!

If you do nothing else, make a reservation. Luckily they allow you to make a reservation through an app so you don't have to physically be present but make sure you make one. It gets super busy and the wait can be upwards of 2 hours. They also only sit full parties.

Service isn't the best but understandable because they are so crowded. The food makes up for anything lacking. Our entire group enjoyed our food; there were absolutely no complaints. One friend really enjoyed the bloody mary as well. This place is worth the wait but only if you make the reservation ahead of time lol

Restaurant is definitely worth it. The food and service is great. Download the no wait app to hold a spot in line. Because there can be a 2 hour wait. Use the app to hold our place in line. Arrived and sat at the bar. We placed our order with the bartender MJ. He was very helpful and polite. I ordered the chicken st Charles which I highly recommend. Overall I was a great experience.
Wow this place is great! The service and hospitality are great. We waited over an hour for a 4 top. It was well worth it. Will be back for sure.

I went there for a breakfast and it was really great. The grits with shrimp and pancake were both the best I have ever had. The servers were very helpful and attentive. I would definitely go back if I have a chance.
Excellent!!!! My husband got the eggs chocon and I got a huge omelette. Service was excellent. Bread was fresh. All was delicious. I would go back here next time in town.

Be warned.....do not go to this Ruby Slipper location! This place may be newer, nicer and bigger than the other location in Mid-City, but I will never go back! The menu is similar to the Mid-city location, with some variations. They only have one kind of pancake! Give me a break! The location in Mid-City have quite a few different choices and they only have original buttermilk. And on top of that they were not even good! 

My main complaint is the service. It was busy, but I have been to plenty of other places with more of a crowd and better service. After ordering drinks we didn't get them for 15 minutes and then the waiter didn't come back for another 20 minutes to get our order. And we had to grab him as he was walking by. After taking our order, we did not see our food for another hour! And hour to make breakfast. Breakfast is the easiest thing to make and it took an hour. The worst part is that the waiter kept ignoring us, because I think he saw that we were pissed. 

When the food finally came out, my girlfriends was completely wrong! Bread instead of a biscuit, egg whites instead of regular eggs, and swiss cheese instead of american! Totally wrong, but after waiting almost two hours, she ate it anyways. 

I will never go back here, and I suggest you avoid this place!

Food here is good, very large portions.  I had the croque madame and the wife had the chicken st Charles.  

The croque madame is a ham and swiss on french toast with an egg and tangy sauce.  Its got to be over 1000 calories.  The chicken dish is fried chicken and poached eggs over biscuits.  All very good

The service is so so.  I think that the place gets way to busy for the staff and they are kinda over it.  Every day there is a line out the door.  They need more people or they need new blood.

Ineffective calling system. They send you a text to inform you that your table is almost ready, so you need to check-in. After checking in, they have you wait outside, so they can call your name. They never called our name, and/or send us a follow up text message. After inquiring about the wait, they claimed to have called our name, but they never did. They placed us back in the wait line. Ridiculous system.
classic New Orleans brunch... definitely try something you can't make at home or you might be disappointed.

Visited this location last week and I really loved the place.
Food was great, prices were very reasonable, the service was so good.
We had no wait because we used the app available thru Yelp and were seated immediately.

This place was such a great find! They serve possibly the best pancakes I've ever had. They had great service, prices, and atmosphere. It is a little crowed and loud but well worth it. I can imagine there being a pretty lengthy wait depending on the time you come, but wait! You won't regret it.

YUM!! We waited 45 mins to eat here for breakfast. It's super busy on the weekends. I think you may be able to get on the waiting list via app? It was totally worth waiting on, of course, its New Orleans, the food & drinks are always good!!

Brunch was good and affordable.
Best Bloody Mary I've had in years. I got mine bacon infused. Didn't taste the difference from non infused.
I would stick to house specials.
I got the smoked salmon, (it was cooked),
I'm used to raw. 
Wife got the catfish coubion, which was good but not great.
Erin our server was super friendly and made or experience much more enjoyable.

Bacon Bloody Mary....breakfast food is overpriced and under portioned for some menu items. Service was friendly although we had to call on the bar tender instead of the bartender asking us what we would like to drink.

Had a delicious breakfast here. Friendly and efficient service and a fun atmosphere. We got the chicken st. Charles and the Cochon Benedict. They both could have used more hollandaise. Other than that they were delicious!
Service and food was PHENOMENAL!!  This was our first stop from out of town and the saying "First Impressions are EVERYTHING" was definitely met!  We will be back!
Favorite breakfast/brunch place in New Orleans... I would always come back when in the city. :)

Great food and drinks.... Morning Margarita was awesome with fish and grits.... Hopefully u get waitress Julie, she was very funny, mindful, and polite...She suggested great items and constantly checked on us.... I highly recommend. Line us always long so it's best to get on waitlist on Yelp and then go check in... the line moves fast also

I really don't understand the endless string of 5 star reviews and the high praise this place receives. Two bloody Marys, two cups of coffee and two breakfast entrees was $50 before tip. The coffee is barely worthy of a truck stop, the bloody Marys are average and the food is ridiculously under seasoned. The service was good, and there was no wait on a Tuesday morning. If price point was a little lower I would have given Ruby Slipper 3 stars - but for $50 I must say I was pretty disappointed. There are plenty of other breakfast joints nearby that are much more worthy of your hard earned cash.
Great and food and great service every time I come to town. Highly recommend the Chicken St. Charles!

Absolutely amazing food. If I could eat there every day I would. So tasty. Great portions and the service was amazing. I booked a table ahead through yelp and got in straight away. It's very busy, even on a week day so book in advance. But I can't fault the place!
The staff was friendly but I wasn't too impressed with my omelette. Nor was anyone else impressed. I think they were overwhelmed from all the business they were getting.
great food, an amazing and fun place ,the portions are ample, a go to place when in the big easy

Ruby Slipper is always a stop on my NOLA trips.  It's so good, I highly recommend!

I'm pretty sure that I get the same thing every time, the Louisianan Omelet which is so great.  My friends have got various other dishes and they've all been fantastic.
And how can I forget?  The mimosa/bellinis are AWESOME!!!  

Like the rest of the best in NOLA, you'll have to wait to be seated.  But it's totally worth it!
You MUST GO to this place for breakfast. You won't leave disappointed. I recommend getting the BBQ shrimp and grits.

Waited over an hour for cold coffee, probably the worse shirmp and grits I have ever had, and customer service was awful! This was beyond one of the worse experiences I have had at a restaurant ever! I will not be back
Had the shrimp and grits. Not the greatest but the sauce was good. Highly recommend the chicken st. Charles it's the best

On a recommendation from the a hotel valet, we decided to try it for breakfast and we are glad we did.  They had Banana Bread Pudding Pancakes. I had two pancakes with a side of applewood smoked bacon and my wife had one with their sausage.  They were out-of-bounds good.  We will go back to this place. Our waitress, Ashley, was very attentive and courteous.
Excellent food and service! Our waitress was fabulous and the food was wonderful. She had recommendations for us that were above par for our expectations and the atmosphere was fun and welcoming!
Great food. The place was pack and extremely noisy but I enjoyed my time there. Would definitely go here again when we come back to New Orleans.

This place has a great brunch! I stopped in here during Mardi Gras and the wait was about 2 hours, we checked in online and once we got there only had to wait about 30 minutes to be seated. They had someone walking around outside taking drink orders which made the wait more bearable. The Benedict's are phenomenal and their poached eggs are done perfectly. Their breakfast potatoes are crispy and full of flavor and their bacon is thick and hearty. Their mimosas are made with fresh juice and their service is awesome even with a crazy Mardi Gras crowd.

If you want a taste of Cajun cuisine and breakfast - look no further. The wait on a Monday morning was 45 minutes (and looked worse over the weekend), but it was definitely worth it! Double mimosas were delicious, and for breakfast I ate the salmon dish with poached eggs and I was very happy that I did. My boyfriend has the Spanish omelet and he was happy with that. Our server was friendly and prompt. Overall a great visit!
Amazing - completely worth the hour wait!  There is an app where you can get in line earlier so definitely do that!

Very good. Had to wait 40 min for a party of 6 . We had no problems as it was average . Food was great everyone tried something different and loved it. Chicken st Charles was great. Turtle pancakes for the sweetooth. Good bloody mary. Neyo was a great server and very friendly.

Was in New Orleans recently on vacay with my boyfriend, we woke up starving our first day started to walk around. We saw the Ruby Slipper, it was packed, normally a good sign. The wait was a15-20mins, which we were ok with. Finally the 20mins passes, they call our name and seat us at a table. Thats where things went into a downward spiral. Our waitress came, delivered menus and took our drink order. 15mins passes and all that was brought was water, she did also take our food order.  Another 15mins pass and the mimosas finally came out (by a different waitress I might add who noticed how long they were sitting there and apologized for the long wait). Another 45mins passes and at that point we were done, we just wanted out, we still had not received our food. During all this waiting we watched at 2 other tables were sat near us and not only served beverages but their meals as well. I asked my bf to go find the manager because we were leaving. The manager was found and came to our table, coincidentally the food came out moments after our complaint was known. The manager did the approiate thing, comped our meal and we left, to NEVER come back. I should add that all that we ordered were breakfast sandwiches and mimosas. Id only recommend if you want horrible service and ok appearing food.

This was truly amazing!!!! 
Can't wait to go back. Everything we had was amazing. We sat at the bar and I ordered several things just to try them. We ended up sharing with the couple sitting next to us. Banana's foster french toast was MONEY!

Give it a try you won't be disappointed!

There is absolutely a good reason why this place was voted best breakfast in nola 3 years in a row. Decided to get the fan favorites - the peacemaker Benedict's - eggs Cochon and fried chicken st charles - both were the best must haves. Also ordered the bananas foster pain purdue with berries, bacon, and loads of special syrup. So special!

Yummy breakfast. I had the Bam Bam Biscuit and my boyfriend had the St. Charles. The wait staff could have been a bit more attentive but overall it was a good breakfast. I suggest going during the week. We tried to come on the weekend and the wait was and hour to an hour and a half! Came back on Thursday and didn't have to wait at all to be seated.
Bananas Foster French Toast was excellent. We loved our food. Great staff and atmosphere as well.
Food is amazing and affordable (based on NOLA pricing). Wait staff is attentive and awesome. Really busy, but friendly! Will definitely stop by next time I visit NOLA!!
The food is great here! Be prepared to wait a little for a table though. I had the chicken charleston and it was amazing!! Mimosas are great!
Un déjeuner dans une ambiance très  bruyante, endroit correct,bouffe correct pas le genre de place que tu retournes !

So many better places to eat in the area I don't understand why this place gets so much hype.  20 minute wait at a minimum for what I would call a creative twist on modern breakfast but the quality of ingredients dont allow the menu to blossom like it could.

I would go into more detail but why bother with all the paid 5 star reviews on here.

This place was right across the street from my hotel and I wanted to try it all week.  The last day I was't terribly hung over so I stumbled into the diner.  It was really nice ambiance and staff was friendly. I ordered the portobello and brie omelette with the pancake special of the day red velvet.  Everything was good but the pancake was amazing!  If it is the special I would definitely order at least one!
The line may be long the food is worth it! And pretty decent prices! We order the bacon maple syrup pancakes, the shrimp and grits. And all were very tasteful
TASTY FOOD - EXPENSIVE - NICE PEOPLE. There's nothing fancy about the place, but the food is pretty good. I felt like the specials were not that special, and for $13 I expected much more.

If you go to Nola go to this place for breakfast! Catfish eggs Benedict and other items are off the hook! Bloody Mary is also a nice compliment in a NO Saints plastic cup to start your Sunday. May have to wait but it's all good once you get in. Service was also great, any ask you have will be supported with a smile. Had a hard time leaving to go walk around because the place was that welcoming.

Not vegetarian friendly as advertised. Poor customer service and not willing to accommodate vegetarian needs. The promotions are very confusing as there are multiple locations. I came because of the BOGO mimosa deal and the manager rudely did not want to honor it because it was at another location. Very disappointed as I thought southern hospitality was a thing. Apparently not

I usually go to the Midcity location and this was my first time at this location.  The host was extremely nice and let me sit without my friend being there which I was impressed with seeing as how it was pretty busy and lunch time...very grateful.  My friend had the eggs benedict and I had a southwest style omelet.  Both were very good.  I've never been disappointed by the Midcity location and this one is just as good.  My waiter was extremely helpful and knew the menu.  He was courteous and continued to check on us.  I will definitely be back. :)

Ruby Slipper Cafe is a good bet for breakfast.

The Eggs Cochon (Poached Egg and Debris on a Biscuit) was simple but full flavored and filling. A bit of bacon or a side of hash browns would have rounded it out nicely.

The French Toast Bananas Foster was scrumptiouis. The crust was caramelized and crispy and the sauce was just sweet enough. No syrup required. This was a unique take on French Toast I'd love to recreate.

The Mimosas were nicely done. Nothing crazy but a nice way to make breakfast feel a little extravagant without much fuss.

The service was great. Very friendly and approachable. 

Ruby is a bit of a Dive, but its clean. Eclectic may be a better way to describe it. Its casual. Comfortable and social all at the same time.

~M

3-17-2014
We ate here with Grandkids last week. A must place to go for anyone visiting New Orleans. We arrived about 10 AM. Very very busy but was seated within 5 minutes. Had our two Grandkids. My  wife and I split the most amazing "Three Little Pigs 
Applewood-smoked bacon, sausage and ham with Swiss cheese" omelet for $10 I have ever eaten. Our Grandson chose two pancakes off Kid's menu that were huge.
Definitely will visit the next time we are in New Orleans.

I was told that they have the best shrimp and grits...meh...it was kinda too lukewarm for me to enjoy it at its best.

The eggs cochon, on the other hand, was AMAZING. MMmmm

$10 double mimosas, ouch...but if you don't finish it with your meal, take it to go.

The Eggs Cochon was amazing! The side of bacon was perfectly cooked. The poached eggs were ideal

The omelette and fried green tomatoes and the fried potatoes looked great. 

All the bread was a letdown. The pancakes, the biscuits, the toast, we're all okay at best.

Service is fast and friendly. The food did disappoint me a little. Be sure to use the waitlist feature on Yelp before arriving, that helps cut down on your wait time once at the restaurant.

Jennifer - I anticipated the food to have more flavor. Especially the corn beef hash, I think two options would be great, the house style and traditional. The shrimp within the Louisiana omelet would be easier consumed if the shrimp were diced or cut within the omelet.

Not that great... Especially for the price.. Do not get the omelet with shrimp, I think it's called the Louisiana omelet... Ewwww 
Will never go back.. Plus our server sucked..

I will come here every time I am in the area! This place is bangin' high quality food, server was fantastic and very friendly. We had six people at our table and got all of the Benedict's between us, every single one was delicious. I would have liked them on an English muffin instead of a biscuit, but their biscuits ARE really good!

So it is a long wait but so worth it. The food is so amazing. Our server, Nicole Z was very nice and recommended dishes. I had the banana pecan pancakes and they were so big I could barely eat half. Highly recommend and be prepared to wait.

What I ordered looked beautiful!!!!! However, the taste was mediocre, the ruby cocktail my sister and I ordered came with lip stick on the plastic cup - no it was not our lipstick. Overall I am disappointed! It was worth the try- since this is out first time in New Orleans .

Continuing our eggs benny quest!  Great breakfast, high energy friendly helpful team!  It was busy and everyone was cool as a cucumber!  Theresa at the bar had a great personality.  Might have to just to come back here and try another benny!

It's been a long while since my last review, but I feel compelled to issue a warning due to a bad experience. 

1. Horrible check in process. Expect to be skipped or your name called but you don't get seated because the phone app is inaccurate. Hostess staff also provided inaccurate information after we checked in and told us to wait again, but didn't call our names. 

2. You need to serve yourself. My husband and I came here with our toddler and we requested a high chair as soon as we stepped in. We asked the hostess, then our server, then a woman who might have been the manager. Still no high chair after a long while. I had to get it myself. No love for the families. 

3. Food was not worth the wait. Too oily and took a long time to come out. For a place with such high reviews, I expected much better. It was also not worth what we ended up paying for. 

All in all, please do yourself a favor and spend your time and money elsewhere!
Eggs coubion is soo good! The grilled artichokes and veggies of the dish was the best. Portion is really large. We ordered eggs coubion and eggs cochon and it was more than we could eat!

When we walked up the wait was an hour and a half. The staff was so friendly and helpful. The hostess' were so nice despite the fact that there were a million people waiting and asking questions. Ambrele and Ashley were so nice and forthcoming with suggestions on what to eat and drink. They were extremely nice and we're running around seating people as soon as tables were open. On to the food.....Sandy our waitress was so sweet and smiled more than anyone I've ever seen in waitstaff . Helped me decide on what to order, kept my drinks full and my order correct even though I added and changed it about 10 times. The southern BLT was like no the I've ever had. The bread was soft, the lettuce crisp and the fried green tomatoe was an addition that will never make a BLT at home the same...the bacon, well there's not enough positive words in the dictionary to describe it. The peacemaker made it easy to decide when I couldn't. 1 of each Benedict. Got the eggs Cochon and the Chicken St Charles. So freaking delicious. Both of them. The food was hot, the hollandaise sauce was on point and the pork was simply amazing. Im noy really sure what pork tasso cream sauce is but it was amazing. This place has ruined breakfast for me since I can't have it at home in Austin. No place will compare to this one. If I could give it a rare on 1 to 10 it would be a 100! Totally worth the wait....get your name on the list now!!!

Platonic form of New Orleans brunch.  Outstanding food, with an eggs benedict selection that alone is worth repeated visits.  Warm, funny staff with great service all around.  Drinks are also excellent.  Thoroughly enjoyable and a must-do for Nola morning chow.
Fantastic place for a staple New Orleans brunch. There are no reservations so be prepared for a wait on the weekends.
