HOLY MOLY! The food, the drinks, the service, it was great! We were also able to taste a little bit of everything by mix and matching our eggs benedicts. Also, pay the extra dollar for the BACON-infused vodka. Your bloody mary will never taste the same.

This was my second visit to this place and I was hesitant to go because I wanted to try as many flavored of NOLA as possible but due to the proximity to my hotel and the impending rain I revisited.  
Firstly this really is a must stop on the culinary tour - my first visit still has memories of those shrimp and grits that I had for breakfast - they were stellar.
Had the Louisianan omelet this time and it was good - stuffed with a generous portion of shrimp and cheese. The grits were flavorless and that was disappointing.  I ordered a side of fried green tomatoes because I will seize any opportunity to enjoy this when available.  I also ordered the candied bacon as an addition.  FGT- the tomato itself was perfect but it was heavily breaded, and not fried to crisp and I believe these may have been frozen because they were not hot and cool in center. Bacon was delicious but 2 very skinny slices so I would just say not as generous as I would have liked.  Biscuit was huge and perfect.
Side note- a couple of locals (meaning a young couple - she from east bank and he from west bank) were seated next to me about 5 minutes after I was seated.  ( at bar) they were very friendly and were the folks that make you want to come back.  The kid - he was 27 - helped himself to my cheese from the omelet, friend green tomato and was just as generous with his food to me.  Without my knowing they paid for my breakfast.  This was crazy and surprising and shocking all at once. For no reason except that I was from NJ and this is how they do things here.  That was worth sharing!
I didn't get the right food and when the server tried to fix it the food took way to long to come back out that I had to cancel it because everyone had finished eating around me.

The food was great. The problem is getting a table. We first check in using the NoWait app, which their website recommended and again when we arrived. Gave the hostess the name and phone number, after waiting and watching several parties who arrived after us get a table, we asked the hostess what the issue was, to which she applied "you never checked in".  After telling her we had checked in we were seated right away.

I can't figure out the hype. Waited 30mins to get a table and about 40 more minutes to receive the food. I ordered the southern breakfast, asked for my eggs over medium, they came over hard, toast cold and grits watery. Won't waste my time here again

Awesome vibe, great menu, hospitable staff. It's an experience unlike any other. I've had almost everything on the menu. Checkout their weekly specials - always a creative concoction. Mimosas and bellinis galore, but the Bacon Bloody Mary takes the cake! Their homecoming story and origin of their name is heartwarming. There are several locations, but this one is my favorite. However, with popularity comes a wait. Use their No Wait App to "get in line" before you even arrive.

You've got to eat here at least once! Definitely more on the tourist-y end of the NOLA eats spectrum, this little spot (at any of the locations) will give you an amazing biscuit/gravy and a potent cocktail, if you like to drink before noon. The last few times I've been, I've enjoyed nothing more than a warm biscuit and an Irish coffee with friends, and it totally worked for me. I will say, the Bananas Foster Pain Perdu and Eggs Blackstone (sans bacon for moi) were delightful items I remember being wildly satisfied with when I first started visiting this place, so give those a go. 

Bring friends, enjoy!

Great food, great service!

I came in early and did not have to wait in line. 

Highly recommended for breakfast/brunch/lunch.

This place will always be the best breakfast spot we've ever stumbled across. Worth the 30-45 minute wait. I'd even wait an hour for this spot. We got the eggs Benedict - fried chicken and pulled pork versions. It's a good thing I don't live down here, because I'd hit this spot daily.

Friends made reservations for brunch yesterday morning, crowded little corner with friendly servers and great food!  Well worth the wait, their version of Benedict dishes is off the wall yummy.  Not to mention the mimosas were killer.  If you visit New Orleans make sure this is the place for breakfast.

Do not show up here hungry. You will wait about 30 minutes outside, then line up outside once they text you, then line up inside waiting for your table. I went from being so hungry I was gonna barf to not hungry to hungry again. The food was about a 7/10 but the service was terrible. So bad. I had to ask 4 different people for silverware after our food was served. Everyone I asked was like "not my job...". Seriously, one person told me that. One server who was not ours, Warwick, took some initiative got us silverware. If I was the manager, I would give him a raise since he was the only person willing to provide service!

Amazing food that is well worth the wait. Staff was helpful and attentive. You can use the yelp app to get in line to shorten your wait. There is seating out doors that gives you a place to wait for your table. I had the build your own omelette with bacon, ham, mushrooms and cheddar, which was awesome. Would eat here again and recommend to others hands down

This place is definitely a gem! The wait is usually 30-45 minutes but if you use apps like 'NoWait' it allows you to put your name down before you even get there. Our server was very polite and knowledgeable, despite the fact that she had just started there a week ago. We were very pleased with her suggestions and attentive service. The food was delicious! The menu is very creative - I definitely feel like there is something for everyone. Pictures to follow.

First Time here had heard Great Things about it so we tried it. We had a fairly Large Party we had to be broken down into smaller groups . We didn't know about putting ourselves on a wait list online but wished we did . The Wait was 1 Hour and 45 Mins but the Food was Great. I would definitely Return and its in perfect walking distance to the Marriott at 555 Canal Street. Only reason its not 5 stars is due to the  Almost 2 hour wait time .

Your hostess is so unfriendly ! you know the red head with the red shows and red skirt.  I thought I was going to get some nice sweet southern hospiltality but akll I gotr was her screaming wait outside. HMMMM can I at least order a coffee or drink at the bar? yes, but you have to go out after. Can I atleast pay for the drink before I go out. Walks away. Worse my shrimp and grits came out uice cold I had to send it back for 15 minutes later it NEVER to return. I cancelled at te biscuts called it a day and walked over to Mothers.

Went to the mid city location and so disappointed in the small amount of "homemade" corned beef hash on my corned beef bennie. What I did get on the dish was dry and tough. Rough after a 90 minute wait.

totally worth the wait! the food was amazing and came out pretty fast. Devin was great!! very charming and funny. We got the french toast batons and there was plenty left over, and we also got the Peacemaker deal with the shrimp creole benedict and the chicken tasso one. It was my first benedict meal and it was amazing! we will be back!
Second time at Ruby Slipper and each time gets better than the last. I got the skinny mugs and my friend got the French toast sticks... Everything was amazing!
I loved this place! Excellent breakfast! French toast was mighty fine. Good coffee too! Get there early!

One of the best breakfasts we have had in a long time. Somehow through divine timing, we walked in & caught a 2 Top table near the bar with no wait. It was the beginning of our wedding anniversary weekend & we were in celebratory mode. The double Mimosa was tasty & heavy on the champagne just like I like it. ! Our server was in a good mood & we were too ! The Applewood Bacon was good, my eggs were cooked perfectly, the buscuits were really good & the friend green tomato was an unexpected surprise. My husband enjoyed his omelette & potatoes, we had so much food we could not finish it.  Our food was served quickly and when we left there was a line out of the door. I would have been happy to wait a little bit, but so glad we did not have to.

Quite possibly the BEST breakfast I've ever had. The Hot Smoked Salmon Bennie and The Peacemaker with the Chicken St Charles Benedict and Shrimp Boogaloo Benedict we're out. of. this world. Iced Coffee and drip coffee were wonderful and the customer service was super. Loved the story behind the Ruby Slipper representing Dorothy's realization that "there's no place like home," the same feeling the founders had when returning to their beloved city after Katrina. We'll be back.

Just what the doctor ordered after a long day of day drinking! I ordered the shrimp and grits which was delish. I actually went back again 2 days later and had the egg Cochon. Also very tasty! Bloody Mary's are great here as well. Service is impressive for the volume of people they serve. 5 thumbs up!:)
Three stars because the waitress was super helpful.  Food, a little ok.  Seems to be thriving more on reputation...but they were busy!

Have always loved the Ruby Slipper but was disappointed this morning and never have been before. Our food was cold when we got it and believe me poached eggs can really turn off an otherwise great meal when served very lukewarm. Will be a while before we try it again----

Um...why have I never walked in here before!?  The food and service is incredible!  Just go see for yourself!  I just wanted to think out loud about how much I like this place.  Oh...try to sit away from the air vents when it's chilly outside.  Brrrr!!!

Breakfast on a Saturday - VERY busy, ***VERY*** noisy (bring the Tylenol). 
Waited an hour for a table (hostess station was staffed by a very unpleasant woman - I get you deal with overly saturated people all day but that doesn't excuse treating me like an insect).
Our server was lovely - 3rd week on the job - and was quick to get the coffee going and refilled.
Breakfast was tough to choose. We had the bananas foster pain perdue, a Compromise with the Eggs Corchon and St. Charles Chicken, and a BYO omelet. All were tasty but the omelet was the wrong order and the corrected one was oily. 
Good food. So loud though - bring earplugs.

Excellent place for breakfast - wish I went the first day not my last - almost feel like going back for a late lunch!! Great big bar to sit at if you are on your own and the bar loves to entertain - had the special eggs Benny which they said was going to be a regular on the menu fried green tomato with shrimp remoulade sauce - on a biscuit !

Wow! Eggs Cochon specialty really was amazing! Two biscuits, covered with shredded pork, each topped by a poached egg with a perfectly soft and warm yolk, each with a dollop of Béarnaise sauce. Don't forget the Louisiana Chrystal hot sauce. Even the coffee, Jazz background music, rustic corner location, and service were good! I recommend this local diner!

I'll echo Cesar R's review of Ruby Slipper.  Very touristy.  Food is heavy Southern cooking.  

I downloaded the NoWait app, which did not work out so well.  App was saying, "No line.  Come on in."  It was more like a 30 minute wait.  This place usually has a healthy line, so I was pumped to learn about the Nowait app.  Maybe it's still getting the kinks worked out.  After we put our name on the list, it was cool to see how many people were ahead of us.  

To me, the food was a bust.  It's ok, but there are so many better options for brunch.  This was my first time, but I have driven by tons of times.  There is always a line.  I just assumed they had something going on.  They don't.  It's felt like trumped up diner food with a Southern angle.  

Our waiter was a squirrel.  Nice enough, but we were ultimately treated like tourists.  This is the dilemma for New Orleans dining.  If you go to a touristy spot, expect to get treated like a tourist.  We were rushed.  Our waiter Chris literally tried to take Shari V's plate while her fork was in her mouth.  Shari V don't play that, and promptly let him know.

In short, we won't repeat.  The place is kind of fun, but it is so easy to find better food and better service in this city.

Three locations in New Orleans folk! 

I went with my friend at around 9:30 and waited 30 minutes so to kill the time we strolled down Canal St to get to the sight of the Mississippi River. 

FOOD: I ordered the Eggs Cochon. A must have at the Ruby Slipper. The egg was perfectly poached, none of that harder center crap, just beautiful yolk all over my plate. And then let's talk about that biscuit. That stuff must be homemade because I haven't had a good biscuit like that (or is it California versus Louisiana?). The pork, biscuit, egg, all smothered in the yolk brings a sense of heaven to mind. The pork is moist and covered with yolk, the softness of the biscuit, and then egg and hollandaise-- each bite is just delicious. I highly recommend this dish and wish I could get this brunch in California! 

SERVICE: I wish I caught our waiter's name, I don't recall, but he was great. Not only did he was attractive and charming, he always topped off my friend's coffee and got me hot water. It was great service, or is it merely southern hospitality? 

Great New Orleans place to come! You won't regret it.

Well, there always seems to be a crowd so it must be good right?!?  I had the praline bacon pancakes a side of potatoes and bacon. These were THE MOST DENSE pancakes in the world. Light and fluffy is not an option... the taste was good but way too heavy for me. They were so heavy when trying to eat them they fell apart. Bacon was good as were the potatoes. Oh and you can't add to your order after placing it...

Good food! Had two of their eggs Benedict dishes and they were great! Downside tat was for $12-13 you get just the eggs Benedict. Would have appreciated some potatoes or something to go with that if it is going to be up there in price.  Boozy coffee was great and the service was great considering we were sitting outside when it started raining!

Great food..busy but moves quick.  Southern breakfast  and corned beef eggs  benedict.   Biscuits  are light and fluffy.  Applewood smoked bacon.  Great selection of different eggs bennies.  Good find.

Personally I think people over hype this place. It's good for breakfast but it's not just the best. The waiters could be more attentive but they do have good attitudes. The food just isn't on a ten to me but it is decent food. Prices are good as well.

After a solid night of partying, my friends and I decided to come here Sunday afternoon-ish based on a recommendation. Our 40 minute wait for a party of 7 was worth it. Like we ate here in April and to this day, I am craving the food. I ordered the Hot-smoked salmon bennie. I swear it was one of the best things I ate in my life. Our service was great also.

Well worth the wait to try out Ruby Slipper.

Yay, yay,  yay! I LOVE the Ruby Slipper in Mid City, but the wait... it often deters my best Sunday morning brunch intentions. The new location on Magazine, though, is much larger! With a great bar area too. Hopefully it will be a little easier to get a table. Parking is what it is downtown but otherwise, the second location has a comfortable modern vibe - high ceilings, lots of wood, much more spacious. The food I had at the soft opening was just as fantastic as every meal I've had at the Mid City location. 
I highly recommend the Eggs Cochon, Eggs Blackstone and the Shrimp and grits. If they're serving their Bread Pudding Pancake, make sure to order one on the side!
If you love the other location or have never been to Ruby Slipper - try out the new one!

The Ruby Slipper was recommended by someone we met in baton Rogue.

Certainly not disappointed.

I had the Eggs Conchon - their signature dish. Generous size and very delicious. The pork was so tender.

Another in my party had the three little pigs omelette. Tasty as well.  

My daughter had the bacon burger. Plenty of candy bacon and fries.

We hit it at opening time, seated straight away but it was filling fast. Wait staff were nice and friendly. Good came out very quickly.

Overall worth the effort.

$45 for three.
One of the best omelets I've ever had! Mimosas were pretty good as well. I hate that they close early!

Service slow and customer service not too good. Food was fair lukewarm
Not worth the 2 hour wait

Although the waiting time is quite long (I joined waitlist through yelp at 10:30, and sat down at 12 for a party of 4, the food is worth the wait! Benedicts are amazing, and blueberry stuffed French toast is just sweet to the point! Also great grapefruit juice and hot chocolate. Definitely recommend.
I am typically a super healthy person, so this place was not my favorite because it wasn't the healthiest. However, it was tasty and I did enjoy it.

This food is so damn good, I'm cussing! How is this legal?  Really?  If you are in New Orleans, come here for breakfast.  The food is so darn delicious, it sent me into a violent rage. I wanted to steal from everybody's plate. 

Must haves:
The buttermilk biscuit - you will need therapy for the ecstasy you experience. 

The Louisianan - this shrimp omelette will make you want to smack the chef. Delicious!

The pancakes - beautifully golden browned and tasty. Only the devil would make something so tempting. 

Eat here!

The ruby slipper had about a 20 minute wait on Friday morning when we went around 10 am so not a terrible wait. I ordered the southern fare breakfast and I thought it was pretty average. Not bad, but not great. Our server was very sweet though!

AMAZING. Worth the wait if they have one! The staff is more than friendly and very helpful! SOO many food options. We had the chicken eggs Benedict and strawberry cheesecake French toast. And man, those were to DIE for. I would suggest getting multiple things and sharing with another person to try it all. Amazing 10/10.

One of the best brunches I've ever had! We got there early on a Saturday around 9am and were seated immediately. When we left an hour or so later, the line was down the block. No reservations but the wait would have been worth it.

Mimosas to start, delish. I had the cheesecake stuffed french toast which was amazingly good! I love French toast in general but the cheesecake stuffing was out of this world. Came with a side of applewood smoked bacon which was the best I had of all the brunches on this trip. Friend had the migas, which is like a Tex Mex version of an egg scramble with tortilla chips, tomatoes, onions, avocados and spicy chorizos. We both thought this was a great dish.

Service was good, our server was really friendly and attentive. All in all, a great breakfast and brunch place.

Pretty good. I had the Egg Chocon. Will definitely dine here again, while I'm in town. Wait wasn't bad... used the Yelp's waitlist feature. Btw, the Bloody Mary's are phenomenal. Server was attentive and friendly.

I am writing this review as we sit and enjoy our meal and bacon bloody Mary's! The ambiance is great nice music playing and our server Raquel is top notch! Absolutely recommended! Only downfall is the hostess at the front has a sour face and a little rude but past that this place is great!

Great Bloody Mary... Very crowded, not much room between tables and chairs.  I sat at counter.  Little uncomfortable sitting at counter, no foot railing, @ 5'3" my feet dangle in some regular chairs so high bar stools are much worse without foot railing.  Definitely need purse / pocket book / sweater hangers under bar top.  I hate leaving my purse hanging off back chair, much to easy to slip off.  Food was just all right, pricy for couple of poached eggs on dry biscuit.  I will try again.
Amazing bacon vodka bloody mary! Def recommended! Trio of eggs benedict is delicious! And biggest tip for this place is GET on the WAITLIST bc wait time is around 3 hrs

I absolutely loved this place!! Stopped in by myself for a leisurely breakfast.

I ordered the dish with the pulled pork a top a homemade biscuit with a poached egg on top and hollaindaise sauce.  A-M-A-Z-I-N-G!! It was SO filling, but it was so freakin' delicious that I forced myself to finish every last bite.  

The decor in the place is perfect.  Nice size bar in the middle, with many other single diners enjoying their morning breakfast.  

Would definitely recommend this place to anyone visiting New Orleans :)

What an amazing breakfast spot, and just a quick pace from the quarter. It was hard for me to choose what to get because I LOVE breakfast foods, but I ended up with Benedict St. Charles... Which entailed two, hearty homemade buttermilk biscuits, topped with tender friend chicken and poached eggs on top. I wish I had a larger stomach because I tried my damndest to finish, but it was extremely filling! My husband had a different Benedict, also delicious, I believe it was the corned beef hash bene. His was almost as good as mine ;) The bar made an amazing bacon Bloody Mary for us, and the fresh squeezed orange juice was perfect, too! I really wish I remembered our waitor's name, he was a Latin lad who recently moved back to the area from Texas. He was so sweet, attentive, good humor, and even made me a list of places to go to while in town. He was great!!! Overall great experience. We will be back.
So great for breakfast. Food delicious. But go early or you will spend a long time waiting. Coffee divine. Also lattes.

Oh my southern hospitality at its best! The service is excellent from the moment you walk in the door. Their might be a wait so sit at the bar and order yourself a delicious mimosa! When we got to our table we were eyeing down everyone's plate. This is when I wish I lived in new Orleans so I could try it all. I went with the banana fosters French toast and it was amazing! If you are there pass by and enjoy its well worth it!

The brunch here is incredible! When I saw that they had 7 versions of an eggs benedict, I knew that I had found my people. I had the Trifecta, which is a sampling of their 3 top benedicts, and it was amazing!!

This place was overly hyped up. We had an hour and a half wait and wasn't worth it. I ordered the corn beef hash Benedict and my friend ordered the fried chicken Benedict. Neither of the dishes came with a side. The service was ok and the atmosphere wasn't what I expected.

BEST 23rd birthday brunch I could have asked for! 8 of my best friends, eggs Benny and an order of buttermilk pancakes(HAD to get 2 meals)! #nothin better after getting a little crazy than a reunion with your bffs of 12 years and the MOST DANK BRUNCH!!! THANK YOU RUBY SLIPPER!!

Clean. Professional staff. Great bar & food. Typical Nola flavors but NOT the typical heavy sauces, yeah! Eggs Blackstone - every bite is a hearty party in your mouth! Iced tea is uh-mazing, no bitter tea after-taste at all!

So glad to find a place for breakfast that is not a hotel "buffet." I can't stand those!  Ruby Slipper is my go-to breakfast place for all future Nola trips!

Yum! Great food, and great portion sizes. Waiter was very overwhelmed and busy, seemed annoyed with us needing refills and simple things like more jelly, etc. But overall a good experience. Place was packed, and it's for a good reason!

The coffee is AWESOME. We are TRUE coffee drinkers - we drink it black - and this roast was totally incredbile.  

The breakfast here is so yummy. I ordered the Eggs Cochon with fruit - so delicious. The pulled pork on the bun was cooked really well and melted in your mouth. My husband went for the Eggs Blackstone with grits. His was equally as delicious - we shared both dishes and I'm not sure which one we liked best!

I love the idea behind this restaurant - the idea that there is "no place like home" and the effort of rebuilding after Katrina. What a great place!  Not that pricey, and very casual.

BEST egg Benedict I've had. My friend had the chicken and shrimp Benedict while I had the stuffed French toast. Great service as well S/O to our waitress Mary, she was super sweet and friendly. She gave our food recommendation and did it with such a beautiful smile. Love how this place isn't touristy, it's more of a hidden gem.
Loved this place!!! Great brunch! We will be there tomorrow. The Egg Cochon and French toast was amazing!

Not too impressed with this place, atmosphere was very loud and chaotic, food was undercooked and took about 2 hours to get it and wasn't very good to top it all off, very bland and tastes pre frozen...I will say the sangria was really refreshing the service there is awesome they actually comped our meal bc it took soooo long and had noticed our untouched plates...waste of time this time but hope to give them a try again in the future and change my rating...may have just been a bad day...we ordered the eggs cochan, french toast and choc chip pancakes...so maybe try something different and you will have better luck ?

After our 1st night in NOLA, we needed some brunch to help us get though the rest of our trip.

Yelp pointed us to the Ruby Slipper, which was across the street from our hotel. We checked in with the hostess & were able to keep track of our reservation through an online app.

Once seated, we chose 2 "double" Bloody Mary's which had a generous pour of alcohol. My boyfriend chose the corned beef hash benedict and I had a BLT with fried green tomatoes. Both dishes were delicious, but I wished out waitress had asked if I wanted an alternative side to the french fries that were served with my sandwich.
First time here. Chuck at the bar recommended the Eggs Cochon, delicious! Thanks Chuck for the outstanding service! If you're visiting NOLA, put this place on your bucket list!
Outstanding!  Worth the wait.  The Eggs Benedict were fabulous.  Eggs Cochon, fantastic! Drinks were good too

Amazing eggs Benedict and French toast . I will recommend cochon and St. Charles Eggs Benedict . The wait is really long but you can check in and put your name in the waiting list on Yelp . Will come back next time I'm in New Orleans.

They print out the receipt several times to update when you order. SO WASTEFUL FOR ENVIRONMENT. Ok? Please try to stop this. 

I think this is the place that everyone goes to because they find it online and through word of mouth. We waited a long time to be seated, and we waited a VERY long time for breakfast. 

Breakfast was delicious and very filling. 

I had the southern breakfast with cheese added onto my grits, fried green tomatoes, two scrambled eggs, bacon, and a biscuit. Everything was very tasty. The apple butter with the biscuit was divine! 

Bloody Mary was on point! The staff was friendly, and accommodating. 

It can be very busy here to get a reservation. Be prepared to grab a drink and wait. It is worth the wait but it will be a wait. 

The Mr. had The Peacemaker. It was a mixture of the two Benedicts - Saint Charles Chicken and Cochon Pork Benedict. Best of both worlds. Chicken was very good. Pork was a little room temperature. It didn't come with anything (no homefries or anything on the side). It was served on a biscuit. 

Mimosas here have a fun twist - they add a splash of pomegranate juice for a pop of color.

Wow, possibly the best breakfast we've ever had. I had the Costa Rican breakfast, my 7 year-old, the chocolate pancake, my husband, the chicken st Charles, and our daughter, the Spanish omelet. I sampled it all, and wanted to eat it all... we are seriously considering going back tomorrow.

Best eggs bene in the city! Great service, tasty Mary's, delicious food and laid back, homestyle atmosphere! Don't be afraid of the line- they are fast and efficient here PLUS it's always worth the wait!

This is hands down one of my absolutely favorite places to get breakfast in New Orleans. 

Service is consistently great and so are the food and drinks, this trip was no exception. 

We started with Bacon Bloody Mary's which were served with two giant strips of extra crispy bacon, spicy picked green beans, olives and lemon and lime slices.  The drinks were perfectly seasoned. 

I had the eggs cochon - 2 delightfully fluffy biscuits topped with perfectly seasoned pork debris with 2 perfectly poached eggs and hollandaise.  My favorite dish. Perfect as always. 

He had the Gulf Fish St. Peter.  This dish is VERY filling.  The cheesy grit cakes were perfectly seasoned and perfectly cheesy.  The fish was very fresh, light and flakey and the shrimp were cooked just right. The combination of flavors with the tomatoes, spinach and creole mustard hollandaise was well balanced. 

Great service, great food.  We will be back.

Really not sure what all the hype is about. Maybe it's because I'm a tourist and not from the NOLA area. 

This was a small location with a huge line and tons of people waiting outside to be seated. That has to be a sign of a good place. I used yelp to enter my name in line so by the time I got there with my husband, we only waited about 10 minutes for our table; we were sat outside and the weather was perfect.

We each ordered an alcoholic beverage for breakfast. I ordered banana walnut pancakes and my husband ordered an omelet. My pancakes were good but nothing to write home about. They were less fluffy and more oily so the consistency was not as thick as what I'm used to. The bananas, walnuts and syrup made the pancakes better and they were pretty good. However my order came with two strips of bacon on top. I was fine with it, but that may cause an issue for a vegetarian. That should be disclosed on the menu.

My husband enjoyed his omelet. When it came time to pay the bill we definitely waited a significant amount of time for our bill, which wasn't fun since we were trying to get to the WWII museum at a decent time. 

My mimosa was $10 which was steep however they filled a regular plastic wine glass full of the drink, and not a small flute.
I LOVED this place. We were seated super fast on a Saturday for brunch. The Bloody Marys were perfect! And the food was GREAT!! Service was good too! If your in the area this place is a must.

SO good! The line is definitely long so join the waitlist ahead of time if you want to avoid waiting when you arrive. The portions are very large (in hindsight, would have shared a meal because of the large portions). We had "The Peacemaker" where you can choose two different eggs Benedict. We ordered the Eggs Cochon and The Chicken St Charles. The Eggs Cochon was the hands down winner. If you're looking for a good brunch place this is a must!

The food was delicious. Perfect atmosphere and the service that Raquel our waitress provided was phenomenal. I've never met a waitress that goes the extra extra mile to provide excellent service and customer satisfaction. She was on top of things and never skipped a beat. Thank you for making our experience the best!

I absolutely love this place. I make sure to come by every time I'm in NOLA. There's always a wait so I recommend downloading the NoWait app. They have seasonal items as well as home favorites. The BBQ Shrimp and Grits is AHHHHmazing! The Costa Rican breakfast is a must try! Seasonal mimosas, stuffed French toast and pancakes will have you thinking "why didn't I think of that?!!"  Three locations but the one on Magazine is my fav!

I became an instant rock star when I brought 8 of my friends here for brunch! We waited a little over an hour to be seated but if you download the NoWait app, you can add your name to the list ahead of time shortening your wait time. I had a simple order of buttermilk pancakes. The buttermilk pancakes was best thing I've ever eaten! It was had the right amount of cakey, fluffy, and crispy goodness to it. My friends ordered other items from the menu and couldn't stop raving about the food! Definitely worth checking out.

Two straight mornings for breakfast and both days the service and food were amazing (Bacon Bloody's, all the Bennies, carrot cake pancakes, and grits were awesome). Be prepared for a bit of a wait (use thier app to minimize the wait) but it is worth it. I wish there was a Ruby Slipper in Philly!

This place was recommended as THE breakfast place. It was packed daily but we still didn't wait more than 15 minutes. I'd recommend ordering one of the recommended selections. I had the BBQ shrimp and grits and it did not disappoint! However, keep in mind I'm a northerner who has never had a grit ;)  They are supposed to have a great Bloody Mary too and they have several types of eggs Benedict that looks awesome!  The only reason I didn't give five stars is because it took nearly 45 minutes from the time we sat down to get our food, a bit long to wait for breakfast, but they were busy. I would definitely check them out. Check in through yelp and get yourself on the waiting list and you may not even have to wait!

There is a line just to put your name on the list, but as a party of one I was seated immediately at the bar area.  I ordered the Southern Breakfast and got a side of ham steak.  I pealed off most of the breading on the fried green tomato because I prefer it less breaded, but everything tasted great.  Recommend this restaurant to those that love a great breakfast.

Voted the best breakfast/brunch in New Orleans for 3 years running and I have to wholeheartedly agree with the Crescent City voters. Be sure to use the No Wait app to minimize the wait time especially at the Central Business District location.  I couldn't decide so I opted for the pancake flight which included  3 different varieties: 1) bacon & pecan, 2) cinnamon swirl, and 3) flavor of the day which was a buttermilk pancake with Oreo crumbles and chocolate ganache which was sweet and surprisingly tasty. The pancake trio as served with 2 slices of thick and crisp bacon. Coffee was piping hot. My husband ordered corned beef hash Eggs Benedict and he loved the dish. Service was prompt and courteous.

I had previously researched some of the best breakfast spots in town and came across Ruby Slipper. Low and behold, we arrive at our hotel and what is directly next door? The Ruby Slipper. Can't say enough good about the migas. I'm from Texas and that is my go-to. It was just as egg-cellent hundreds of miles away from Texas as it was here. Cute atmosphere but almost always busy unless you come at just the right time. Worth the wait though!

We have been to NOLA several times and have stayed across the street from this restaurant. Why we have not eaten here before today is a question that I cannot answer but I will say this will always be on our list of favorites to return to. The BBQ shrimp and grits were terrific.

Came during the essences festival and the lines were crazy, however I loved the latest technology of putting us on a list sending us real time text messages and the help tracking tool to see our seating update. This allowed us to explore for an hour while we waited to be seated..(thank you for that)

Now for the food. It was amazing. I ordered the Louisianan omelet, with potatos and a side of buttermilk pancake.. and lord was it good.
The best part was the homemade cinnamon butter that was used with the home made biscuit that comes with the meal.

The service was great as well as the decor. 
If you have time I would suggest this as a brunch spot.
Super fast and dam good.  Great specials.  Breakfast all day.  Biscuits rock.

Comfort food to be sure, but options for slightly lighter fare. We tried two locations, both top notch, and I can highly recommend Britain, our cheerful server at the Magazine Street location by the Pelham Hotel. She is personable and professional, and made sure we had everything we needed.
This is for sure the one breakfast place you need to try in NOLA! ruby slipper mimosa, the coffee and bennies; you just cannot go wrong

This brunch spot looked delicious so it quickly made it to my "NOLA list", and another plus was that it was right by the hotel we were staying at. We arrived around 9am and the line was out the door. My party of 4 put our name down and waited about 30-45 minutes for a table, so we just took that time to walk around. Their "waitlist" is awesome! They actually use Yelp and you can see how many parties are ahead of you in line. I suggest getting "in line" even before heading here to save time.
Upon getting seated, we were quickly helped. The service was super quick despite how busy it was! A friend and I decided to split The Trifecta ($20) and Banana Fosters Pain Perdu ($12) along with the Ruby Slipper Mimosa ($10).
The Trifecta was great if you love eggs benedicts and are indecisive. I enjoyed the fried chicken benedict the most! The egg was perfectly cooked and the chicken was cooked very well. The Banana Fosters Pain Perdu was delicious. Hands down the softest French toast I've had! The mimosa was okay but definitely strong - so if you're feeling a boozy brunch, get their mimosas!!
Solid brunch spot and you'll enjoy their food/drinks here! Come early or get on their waitlist because they do get busy.
FOOD WAS GREAT!!! Banana foster yuuummm!!! Worth the 1 hour wait, so just know your going to wait some time before your sat. Thanks for your good service Teresa.

Crazy popular, so be prepared to wait, especially if you're picky about where you sit. Based on the Eggs Benedict (salmon and spinach) I ordered and ate, the wait is worth it. The grapefruit juice was also very good.

I visited here during my 4th of July weekend visit to New Orleans. At the suggestion of local residents, we tried this spot for breakfast. I give it 3 stars only because the man working the bar area was so nice and had a wonderful, welcoming personality. I ordered the Southern Breakfast which consists of Eggs, fried green tomatoes, grits, biscuit and fruit (sub'd for meat). The food lacked seasoning or salt, the tomatoes were too thick and the biscuit was rather hard. After the very, very, very long wait for a table, I expected more. I would think twice about returning to The Ruby Slipper.

Use the no-wait app to get in line! Goes quicker than you'd think. Good price, great food, perfect spicy Bloody Mary. I dined here twice while in NOLA for a week. The southern BLT and the Blackstone egg Benedict were amazing. You can probably share the BLT because it is gigantic. The bloody Mary's are deceivingly strong. You may not notice until you go to leave. :)  the staff was super friendly and even gave me a few extra green beans for my Bloody Mary when I asked. Will stop by again next visit!
Food and service were good. Ordered the eggs Benedict. Potatoes were crunchy and good. Needed salt. Sat outside and people watched

We got to this place really early, around 7 am, before the waiting lines were down the street. Nestled right in the French Quarter area, this restaurant has a mixture if traditional and eclectic dishes. By far my favorite dishes were the Costa Rican and the French toast. The Costa Rican had yummy crispy plantain chips that adorned the filling rice and beans classic; this dish was cooked very close to the authentic Central American way. The French toast I highly recommend at whatever time you visit--you could even eat it as a shared appetizer or dessert with other people as the sticks are easy to share and eat. My least favorite item I tried were the biscuits that were the "beds" for several of the dishes I tried. While the eggs and chicken flavorful, I found the biscuits to be a little too doughy and not as flaky as I wish they could be. All our food was fresh and very well prepared. would come back to this place.

This restaurant is AMAZING. We were hesitant about the wait and line outside the door, but once inside we found out why. The food and service are some of the best in NOLA. I ordered the Shrimp and Grits and it was great, but the real star is their specialty pancake. I was unlike any other pancake I've ever had. This place is a must stop while in New Orleans.

Our waiter Teresa is just WoNdErFuL! 
My 50/50 was St Charles and Pork #SoGood
My Ruby Slipper mimosa was good too..

But..

I checked in thru Yelp and hostess at 1311. Was texted my table was almost ready at 1315..
Then we was seated at 1358!

Teresa and food made up the added 2 stars. If we was seated and coordinated with our text better... 5 stars!

Oh, here's a Pro Tip: download No Wait app or go to browser to set a reservation. Its suppose to be the fastest entry into here  #UrWelcome
Ordered the Migas with the chorizo on the side so a family member could enjoy it. The dish hit the spot for vegetarians.

Mostly good, I had the pulled pork which was tender but didn't love the picked green tomatoes (vinegary). My husband had the Ruben, he said it was really dry. The chicken with white creme sauce and poached eggs was the favorite, we were all nibbling off of my sons late (luckily it was a large portion). Long wait time.

Food was great. Had the Pancakes and my wife had the Bam Bam and both were really good. It was a long wait but once we sat down the service was great. Our server took care of us the whole time and was very patient and understanding

This restaurant is super busy, as such they sat dining patrons at the bar. Not only was the service less than stellar (they did apologize that our drinks took 10 minutes) they must've forgotten about our food since it all came out cold. No one ever came to see how our food was so we couldn't let them know. The a la carte pancake was good, the migas were like someone dumped my breakfast on a pile of Fritos. The 2 different benedicts were what suffered the most, cold, dry chicken and very cold shrimp sauce on the other. End of story, with a little more precision and care on the employees part, this could've been a good dining experience.

We went there for breakfast and got there at 8am on sunday. Just in time! Huge line after that. Service was great. Breakfast was huge and wonderful. First time for fried green tomato and impressed. Husband had the banana pancakes and I southern breakfast. Recommend both!
The Louisiana Omelette was delicious, and the coffee and service were also excellent.

This is my favorite breakfast spot in New Orleans. The Bananas Foster Pain Perdu is absolutely amazing. They also make a great Bloody Mary for the morning after a night on the town. Any time we spend the night in New Orleans, this is where we go for breakfast. It is definitely worth the wait.
It was great! The wait was crazy tho so I advise getting on the waitlist on yelp. It definitely is a time saver! The French toast was really good.

Jacus was AMAZING! So nice and friendly! Recommended the cinnamon swirl pancakes and the chicken St Charles Benedict and it was great! Really friendly environment and the staff was high energy. I recommend anyone to try it out. Great experience.

I went to Ruby Slipper while at the Essence Festival. The breakfast was good. I had the mimosas and traditional breakfast of bacon, eggs and grits. I really enjoyed the jalapeño grits. If you like spicy food, you will like the jalapeño grits.
Food was delicious. Joined the wait list on yelp so was seated immediately. Food did not take forever to come out and the server was very friendly :-)
Great southern hospitality. Great food. Fast seating. We had eggs Benedict brisket on biscuit and eggs Benedict over chicken fried chicken on biscuit.
This was recommended to us, and what a great recommendation it was! Fast, very friendly service. And the food was just delicious. I thoroughly enjoyed the breezy, easy atmosphere too.

I was visiting from Portland Oregon and if anybody is familiar with Portland you know that is the food mega until I went to Louisiana... I tried as many restaurants as I could in the five days I was there but my go to breakfast joint was Ruby slipper café Midtown I tried as many restaurants as I could in the five days I was there but my go to breakfast joint was Ruby slipper café Midtown and the one downtown... Hands-down amazing food fast and friendly service

This diner has a great atmosphere and slightly upscale flair- we were referred here by a friend and ordered eggs cochon- so good. Bananas foster french toasted sounded amazing, along with shrimp n grits. Mimosas and bloodys served as well. The staff is cool- sit at the bar. Delish in the french quarter.

This place was phenomenal! Definetly download the app to get on the waitlist, we walked right in and even though it was slammed we immediatly got seated. Our server Julie was AMAZING, she was extremly helpful, knowledgeable of the menu, fast and friendly! Definetly reccommend this place for breakfast or brunch when in new orleans!  Food was delicious, fairly priced, and came out fast..service was impeccable. Will definetly be coming back to brunch here next time in new orleans!

After waking up at 3:30 am for a 5:30 flight out of Boston, needless to say I was STARVING when I arrived at my conference hotel in New Orleans. A friend of a friend recommended Ruby Slipper for a solid place to grab a quick bite, and since it was within walking distance in a downpour, that was all I needed to give it a go! 

After my last experience in NOLA (French Quarter Urgent Care -- see review), I am obviously a tiny bit leery of whatever I ingest this time around -- but my fears were totally unnecessary for this first meal back; everything was amazing! Our waitress was spunky and attentive, but not overbearing; the house Bloody Mary had just the right hint of spice; and my biscuits and eggs were cooked perfectly (eggs over-medium)! The staff even came over to apologize for "the wait," for our food, which was seriously 10 minutes, max -- and that was *after* one of our plates accidentally hit the floor on its way out of the kitchen!

If you're looking for a good breakfast/brunch option near the French Quarter but without the premium prices or walks of shame, I definitely recommend The Ruby Slipper (and they'll even give you To Go cups for those bloodies when you want to head out!).

So the service is really good here and the high reviews will bring you to this place. Problem is, the food isn't anything you can't get anywhere else in the country. The pork is decent, but the chicken ... this is New Orleans! Where is the seasoning? Not in this place! Overall, pretty disappointing. If you want a New Orleans experience, don't come here. Maybe run in and grab a Bloody Mary, because those are good, and find something more amazing.

This spot was located in the same building as my hotel, so my cousin and I had to hit it for Sunday brunch.  Dang!  It was b.u.s.y.!!!!  There was a 45 minute wait - but it was totally worth it.  I will say, the bacon infused bloody mary was good... but not the best bloody mary I've ever had.  but I REALLY liked the pickled green beans - never had one before - fell in love!
  (Sidebar, why are bloody mary's so popular in New Orleans???)  But the breakfast was superb!  So great that we came in again on Tuesday, which was a much calmer atmosphere.  I'd say, order anything with the plantains.  And coffee - the coffee was great!

If you pass up McDonald's to eat here you messed up. Typical Nola tourist trap. Crap food at high prices. I got the breakfast sliders, could tell if there was any meat on it or not. The meat u did taste was dry and flavorless. They have tons of better places then this in Nola,  avoid this tourist trap
The omelet was filling and delicous, The wait time was a little long , but worth the wait. They could use more room, or you can find one of their other locations

This popular breakfast, brunch & lunch restaurant has been very popular with locals. I like the one at Burgundy Street at Marigny triangle. 
They accept Nowait reservations, which limits the waiting time (nice!). It has a great ambiance, friendly staff, relatively fast service even at busy times. Food, of course, is very good. Rich menu but I tend to order the banana pecan pancakes but there are many more menu items to choose. This is my go to place for my out of town visitors and have not heard anything but satisfaction.

When the driver from the airport advised us to go to the Ruby Slipper, we had no idea what we were in for. We went on a weekend and waited about 20 minutes to get in, which we were fine with. From what we noticed, it's much busier on weekends.. So hit up a week day if you have the time! 

  We sat at the bar, which was perfect for the 3 of us. The atmosphere was so fun and the interior so vibrant with Dorothy's Ruby Slipper accents all over the place (from art on the wall to a tape dispenser on the bar!) After looking at the extensive menu we all decided on the blackstone. It was INCREDIBLE. Served on a soft biscuit, the eggs Benedict were cooked perfectly and the bacon was delicious. The home fries were out of this world and I would definitely suggest getting them over the fruit cup (nothing special there). 

  The special on the day we were there was the turtle pancake. It was a fluffy pancake with chocolate and carmel syrup and pecans. We got one to share between the three of us and although it was delicious, we were too full to finish it!

  The final highlight of the meal was the Bloody Mary! I am not typically into spicy things, but this was incredible! They have huge jugs of the mix up on the bar and add it to the vodka (filled to about 3/4 of a pint glass with ice!!!) when you order. It is garnished with a lemon, lime, olive and 2 green peppers that soak up the spice and alcohol and are a tasty treat at the end!! Just thinking about the Bloody Mary is making me itching to go back!!

Overall we had a great experience and it was worth the money! I spent about $24 with tax and tip for the Bloody Mary and the blackstone. I will definitely be going back on  my next trip to NOLA!!
We loved the Marigny location, the food is spectacular, so authentic, the service top drawer. We loved it here and would definitely go back! Have the shrimp and grits for breakfast...amazing!!

If you are visiting New Orleans, then you should definitely have brunch at the Ruby Slipper Cafe. We went for a long weekend to New Orleans with my best friend and the eggs Benedict with the pulled pork is from another world. Now let me tell you about the mimosas, if they didn't close at 2pm we could stay the whole day drinking them. What I liked the most was the service and how you can reserve a spot on Yelp before arriving so you don't waste time waiting in the place and you can do it while you walk around the neighborhood. I will definitely be visiting again.
We drove from Houston to get breakfast!!! The French toast banana foster is to die for!!!! I will not eat French toast anywhere else!!! The fried tomatoes were awesome too

Best breakfast in New Orleans by far! Friendly service, excellent food, great ambiance and reasonable prices. They also have a fantastic Irish Coffee. A go to restaurant every time we are in the Big Easy.

I had just finished my belly dance class, it was around 1:30 PM and hadn't had breakfast yet. No need to say I was starrrving! 

I am not giving a 5 star rating because of the quite long wait and the noise. I am not complaining; I know how it is on a Saturday in New Orleans.

However, the wait was well worth it! Our waitress was very nice, polite and happy. Even though there were a LOT of people coming in and out, the place was kept very clean. 
I had the Shrimp Boogaloo Benedict: I particularly enjoyed the freshness the Coubion sauce (a fresh tomato sauce) brought to the dish. With the crispiness of the fried green tomato. Yum! The portion was just the right amount (I managed to eat everything), not too salty or too dry. And the poached egg were poached to perfection!

Awesome dish for a very late brunch!

Simply awesome place for breakfast, worth the wait.   Have a Bloody Mary while waiting for your name to be called.   Entire menu rocks, try the couchon Benedict!   Busy and noisy, but the food is spectacular.

Yes it's worth the wait.  We're here on a Saturday party of 8 so we had to wait almost two hours, but there's a reason why people stick it out. I got the shrimp Benedict that was on special and it was amazing!  Lots of shrimp, perfectly poached eggs on a fried green tomato and bacon.  Berry mimosa to wash it down and another for the road. All in all great dining experience.

Best breakfast I've ever had! Get the trifecta and a bacon bloody! Life changing...my boyfriend is speechless. He doesn't think he's ever had a meal so great and he's sad it's all gone even though he is stuffed.

We ordered the chicken sausage omelet and stuffed french toast and it was finger lickin' good. Service was great and restaurant was clean definitely a great breakfast in New Orleans !!! Deff get the biscuit!! It was worth the extra calories !!! :)

First destination at NOLA and we were not disappointed. We arrived roughly around 10:30 AM on a Thursday and the place was packed! I read reviews beforehand stating that they don't accept reservations, but through yelp we can join the wait list. It confirms your place in line, tells  you a return time, and the # of parties ahead. The smaller the group the easier it is to be seated because they have bar seats that had a fairly quick turnover rate. We returned by the estimated time the wait list provided for us, but unfortunately still had a 30 minute wait. When your table is available, you receive a text.

I ordered the Trifecta which is the perfect dish for those wanting to sample all of Ruby's signature Egg Benedict dishes. It comes with a serving of Eggs Cochon (slow-cooked apple-braised pork), Chicken St. Charles (fried chicken breast), and Shrimp Boogaloo (shrimp sauteed with pork). My friends got the Peacemaker and Chicken St. Charles. We also got two sides of pulled pork and breakfast potatoes to share. This was the perfect amount (if not more) for the three of us. 

The crowd pleaser of this meal was definitely the slow-cooked pork. The pork was extremely tender, but lacked a bit in taste. The shrimp was good - had a bit of a spicy kick to it. The Chicken St. Charles was mediocre in my opinion. 

Overall, Ruby's Slipper was a solid staple to our NOLA adventure. Unless you're pressed on time, definitely stop by (after putting your name down on the wait-list).

When I travel, I usually like to try new places. But when in New Orleans, Ruby Slipper is a must every time. Absolutely best brunch around. And if you like Bloody Mary's, I dare you to try one better than the Bacon Bloody Mary at the Slipper. Made with bacon-infused vodka and garnished with bacon, green beans, olives and lime, it has a spicy kick that will wake up your taste buds. 

The wait is long. Always. So, put your name on the list, grab a drink and people watch along Canal Street. They will cal you when your table is ready.

Can't go wrong with the banana foster French toast! It's a huge serving but it's delicious. This place can have a lone so be prepared. Service was great, and fast. And they don't skimp on the alcohol when it comes to your morning mimosa. If you are in the area check it out
The grits were amazingly good and light.  Loved the whole meal.  I asked for an extra fried green tomato which I did not regret at all!!!

Best breakfast we had in NOLA, hands down.  Eggs Cochon Benedict was incredible.  Sure, I got an egg shell in one of my poached eggs which made for a icky-gritty bite, but other than that the dish was heavenly.  The dish comes with two half English muffins topped with all the goods, but no sides.  However, it's so rich and flavorful that one will fill you up! My sister and I were wishing we had shared!  My husband's migas was just as good.  We used the app "No Wait" to get in line so when we arrived we only had to wait about 5 minutes - I LOVE THIS.  Seriously, more restaurants should use an app like this.  The service was great despite the packed restaurant.  Bloody Mary's and Mimosas were both good. I absolutely loved the Bloody though.  Very flavorful and well made.  If in NOLA again, we will definitely come back.  If you're here, take the time to read about how the Ruby Slipper got its name!

3 stars only because the server was nice and friendly. The food however was disappointing. Two of us got a variety of eggs Benedict, and all the yolks were cooked solid. Flavor was lacking as well. I wanted to love this place after hearing such great things from so many people, and maybe it was an off day, but we were not impressed with the food. Also, the menu listed the coffee drinks at $3.00, and when the bill came our latte and cappuccino we're $4.00 each. I'm not going to cry over $2.00 but I think it's messed up to charge different prices than the menu lists. $45 later (before tip) for 4 overcooked eggs and 2 coffee drinks, definitely not worth it.
OH my god. This is some good breakfast. We had the specials - eggs coubion and cream caramel stuffed French toast.  Service was great too. We left full and happy. Highly recommend, will be back

Another Yelp find! And a winner at that.  This was a great classy breakfast/brunch place that wasn't heavy on attitude.  

Sat at the bar and ordered the Eggs Cochon. The server was terrific with suggestions and kept the coffee and water (a perfect morning-recovery drink) flowing.  

The eggs were poached with pork "debris" (a local dish) over a really fresh open-faced biscuit.  I'm not a poached egg person AT ALL. But I figured I'd give it a try at the recommendation of the server. Very glad I did.  Flavorful, and a good portion, with eggs runny enough to go with pork. Delicious.

It can get popular so go early.  But just go if you're staying nearby. This place (which opened up post-Katrina) is a definite find.  Love it.

House breakfast specialties all day! 
Since this was a few blocks from our hotel, we decided to stop in for an impromptu late breakfast. Amongst the menu regulars: eggs blackstone, eggs cochon, shrimp n grits, and bananas foster pain perdu

I opted for the shrimp 'n grits, which was buttery, comforting on a surprisingly chilly day. Came with a biscuit- I'm not a big biscuit person, so it was okay. I was pretty satisfied with my selection, but one of my dining companions was a little frustrated that they ran out of things that he wanted to order. For the business-conference crowd, the Ruby Slipper felt juuust right. The items were a bit on the pricey side for what it was, but still a solid place to check out.

We wanted to come here earlier but woke up late cuz we were up late...but it might have worked out best for us, because the wait was only about 10 min when we got there.  We walked by the day before and the lines were pretty crazy...so we were glad for the timing.

We opted for first available seating, so for our party of 2, we got seated at the bar.

had the bacon bloody mary, which came with green beans and olives...had a really strong kick, but I thoroughly enjoyed it.  It was like a meal in an alcoholic drink, with the bacon and veggies....bacon BM's seem to be pretty popular in the area and I gotta say that this one was pretty good.  Asked for some extra olives, cuz I love me some olives with my drank, and they happily speared 4 for me.  :) PLUS on that.

Also had the signature eggs benny...you have different ones to choose from, and if you can't decide, you can go with the peacemaker and choose two...we got the cochon (pulled pork) and the traditional bacon and eggs benny.  Wifey had a really awesome blueberry sweet pancakes...I think that's what it was called, it might have been fruit-filled sweet pancakes and blueberry was the choice this time around...but our bartender recommended it...wifey and i LOVED it!  As well as the eggs benny...prob would've ventured out a little further on the 2nd choice, but it was pretty good still).  

Service - The place got pretty busy after we got seated and we didn't get the pressure from our server to move quickly like some other reviewers mentioned, there was enough turnover and we never felt rushed.  In fact, we had pleasant convo's with our neighbors to the right and left of us, as well as our bartender.  Maybe it's just my winning personality (joke joke, it's the wifey who has that) that prevented that from happening.  But overall, all the servers were quite friendly.

Definitely touristy, but I guess there's a reason why...if you're a tourist, you typically go to the places that everyone else goes to...but you can avoid the crowds by coming early enough I think.  I also think there's another one in the area, but we wanted to go to this one, esp because it was close to where we needed to go next.  I could see that sitting with a fairly large group might incur long wait times...but again, I think that can be worked around.  

But for what we had, I would definitely come back here.

Our first brunch stop during our visit to NOLA. Sat at the end of the counter so we got to enjoy lively banter from the servers and kitchen staff. Bacon-infused Bloody Mary was delicious, as was their Hot Smoked Salmon Bennie. Staff will tell you the Benedicts are the best items on their menu -- believe them!

Tip: join the waitlist ahead of time. Saves you SOME time. I joined and it told me about an hour, it ended up being a 1.5 hour wait on a Friday. Party of five was finally seated. Three had the Trifecta, each liked a different biscuit. The best one I think was the pulled pork one. We also had a pancake flight, the best was the praline one. Sooooo good and moist. Not too sweet. The last person had a burger. That candy bacon is life. Join the waitlist, grab a drink, and wait. It's worth it.
This place is amazing! Good breakfast, excellent eggs! Always have line to have breakfast, but you can make a reservation, and it is ok! I enjoy a lot!
We came based on Yelp reviews and were not let down. Our server, Christopher K, was perfect. The food was amazing and their story is impressive. Highly recommend!

45 minute wait, but the food was more than worth it! We didn't get seated until 1:50 and RS closes at 2pm so we were just in luck. The waiter was very attentive to us 11 ladies. Can't wait to come back!

This place is awesome. We checked in on the yelp app from our hotel and then only waited about 15 minutes when arriving. A waitress came outside to ask if we wanted drinks while we waited. I had the bbq shrimp and grits. They were so good.

YUM!!!

Fantastic breakfast, cozy retro diner vibe, cool bartender.  Oh, and large mimosas!!

How could you not?
xo

My first time writing a review but this place is great!!!  
Bananas Foster Pain Perdu
Eggs Cochon

We came here for breakfast on our second day in NOLA because it seemed like an easy choice.

There was a short wait until we mentioned that we didn't mind sitting at the counter, then we were seated immediately. The counter was very busy so we understandably had to wait a few minutes to have our drink orders taken.

This place looks kitchy, lots of large posters on the walls along with some things that you'd expect to see in an 'old fashioned' diner. The food was average. I ordered a western omelet "E-Z on the cheese". When it arrived it seemed like it came with double. I picked most of it off. The eggs were mildly fluffy which I was actually perfectly fine with, but the ham was salty with a capital S.

Overall, the staff and the prices were the best things about this place.

While I'm glad we tried this 'local chain', I don't think we'll be returning upon our next visit to New Orleans.

Not long for a wait when we got there around 10ish.  We ate at the bar and the food was great and the lady with the nice sleeve tattoos on her arm was so cool.  Her recommendation was on point and she was very polite.  The one thing my girlfriend and I were impressed the most by was the gentleman bussing tables well mannered and polite. We even tipped him as well.  Overall best breakfast in downtown NOLA

Great food and prices. Had a traditional breakfast and everything was really great. There was a long line outside but it went by quickly. Our waiter was really great, I love it when I don't have to search for or hunt down a waiter to get something or they never show up again. This guy was always coming around and my coffee cup would only go half empty (or half full). One more thing I liked about this place was that they had 80s music playing in the background. I'm an 80s kid so I like that music era.
We had the eggs Cochon and eggs blackened and they were both really perfectly cooked and savory.
The best part of our breakfast was Teresa, she was awesome! Food was good and fast! We got the eggs Benedict but I will try something sweeter next time. Highly recommended

Take advantage of the reservation feature on YELP! We reserved our spot about an hour and a half in advance for brunch and we were glad we did! This place gets ridiculously PACKED. We arrived and were taken to our table in under five minutes. I had the byo omelette and it was what you would expect from an omelette. My boyfriend had the dish with the fried chicken and fried green tomato and it was EXCELLENT. We will definitely be back!

Got here early enough that the wait wasn't bad and we perched at the bar, watching the news coverage of Snowmaggedon 2016. The St Charles special was tremendous. Crispy tender fried chicken. Creamy poached egg. Perfect play of flavors and textures. So dense two could easily split it. I tackled it solo and now I need a nap.

I ordered BBQ shrimp and grits. It tasted good, but not good enough for the price I paid. Also, it was way too cold inside.

The biscuits are amazing, but that's about it.

Great breakfast and drinks. Get there early or plan on waiting for a table. We had the Mimosa's and Bloody mary's. Both were incredible and started the day off right. Our food was so flavorful and the Bacon was the bomb.
The wait was worth the time. The omelette was great and the service was spot on. Ate at another location too and it was just as good.

This place brought my friends and I back to life after a night out on the town. The Bloody Mary's were excellent, complete with pickled green beans aka my new fave.

My BBQ shrimp and grits was really good, but I would have enjoyed it more if the grits were seasoned more - they were a bit bland.  Where was the rosemary?? The homemade biscuit rocked my world though, as did our waitress (and her hair!)
They have a delicious Portobello Cheese melt and a great atmosphere.

Went there for brunch. Poached eggs were ok. Nothing special. My friend got The shrimp and gritz on the other hand which was pretty good- but nothing out of this world. Chocolate chip pancake was just ok too. The service was somewhat just ok too. But overall if you're looking for a decent brunch in the area it's a good pick. If you are a foodie and want something off the chain- this is probably not going to make you go goo-goo-ga-ga.

Came here on our first morning in New Orleans.  This was recommended by a friend who used to live in New Orleans.  I am so glad he did.   The food is so good we came back the next morning for round 2.  Everything we tried was excellent.   I had the biscuit covered with pork debris and a poached egg with hollandaise sauce.   I don't like hollandaise but our server recommended I try it on the side as they do a different type.   WOW, this stuff is excellent.   I recommend you start with a bacon Bloody Mary.  And don't forget one of their biscuits if your breakfast doesn't come with one.   They are huge, light and airy.

Was a little hesitant about the 30-45 minute wait time but it is probably the best breakfast you can have in the area. Even with the crowd service was good. Had the smoked salmon omelette and the bananas foster French toast. The omelette was amazing. The French toast was very good but no the best thing on the menu. Definitely recommend going here.

A friend of ours recommended his place for breakfast. We had bbq shrimp and grits were good but the sauce was a little too much. The brown sugar butter was amazing and full of deliciousness. This place is always packed so be prepared to wait, however the food is worth the wait.

The Ruby Slipper is a small establishment hidden amongst the high-rise hotels and office buildings, most tourist would never find. A short walk from the Frendch Quarter, Bourbon Street or Canal Street it is a good place to eat that much needed breakfast after a night on the town.  Daily specials that resemble the local fare, standard brekfast and my choice for the day, Breakfast sandwhich with house potatoes. This is a neat little place, that is highly reccommended by locals

Great breakfast spot. I experienced a short wait due to being solo. I sat at the bar and received great service. I was torn between the Costa Rican and Shrimp and Grits. I ended up going with the shrimp and grits-- however the Costa Rican looked delicious! The shrimp and grits was huge! Plenty to split! Great flavor that melted in your mouth. It was very rich! The biscuit with the inhouse butter was amazing.

This was found word of mouth.  The first time we walked up to a MOB of people waiting to be added to their 1hr wait list I was starving.  No thanks! 

Then I looked them up online and they offer this online wait list through yelp, GENIUS!!! The next morning right when I woke up I added myself to the wait list, and voilà! I arrived 15 mins early.  Got myself a Ruby Slipper and was sat on time.  

The Food is very indicative to New Orleans.  I went out of my comfort zone and tried CHICKEN ST. CHARLES 14
Fried chicken breast served over a buttermilk biscuit,
topped with two poached eggs, finished with a pork
tasso cream sauce

A lot of food you could definitely share.

Super popular place for breakfast in NO. Wait time was 20-30 minutes on a June Saturday morning at 8:30, but I got in quicker with online waitlist. I checked the waitlist later at 10:00 and it was 80-110 minutes! I sat at the bar and watched the bartender pour more mimosas than I could count. The benedicts are some of their classic dishes. Order the Peacemaker Benny and you can try two different bennys. I tried the Eggs Cochon and the Hot Smoked Salmon. Both were delicious. The Eggs Cochon was a Benny with apple-braised pulled pork and it was amazing. Staff was very friendly. I would give it 5 stars, but the service was slow. It took 30 minutes to get my order, but if you have the time, it is worth the wait!
Possibly the best breakfast I've ever had in NOLA. Amazing, great service and got some great shopping tips from the manager. Loved the coffee so much bought a bag to go.

Great breakfast find as we were just wandering around the streets of New Orleans before most people woke up.  

We sat at the bar and our server was very friendly and very attentive.  The serving sizes are big, our Bellinis were good and the ambiance is great.  Service is very quick, too.  

The prices are very reasonable but New Orleans overall seems to have pretty inexpensive food on average.

Great food! We loved it so much we ate there twice during our trip.

Service is much better at the rave than the bar.

The Eggs Cochran is the bomb!!!!

I appreciate that they have the NoWait service, to let you know when your table is ready. This is my second time here - on holiday for Christmas - so that alone proves its deliciousness.

Our table was ready much sooner than they estimated, which was grrREAT! I ordered an Irish Cream Coffee (that hit the spot) and the Louisianan Omelette (w/shrimp, cheddar and thyme),grits and a hearty biscuit. That biscuit...baby... I was in heaven. The omelette was pretty delectable, too, I just needed some hot sauce for spice. Can't wrong with the grits either.

My friend had the Cheesecake Stuffed French Toast: Meh...not the world's greatest but it didn't ruin the experience by far. I would definitely go with the Gulf St. Peter Fish and the Migas. "OMG" is how we felt after those dishes. The service is quick and very hospitable, on top of all.  I will definitely be back a third time, before heading back to NYC, next week. Eat hearty!

Great atmosphere, friendly staff, awesome food and the best bloody Mary's! I would suggest this place to those looking for breakfast or brunch. Suggest getting on the wait list to make your wait shorter than normal.

Awesome restaurant! High quality food and great environment. Within walking distance to a lot of hotels nearby and close to Canal and Bourbon street. Staff is friendly and they have a system that texts you when your table is ready if there's a line. Mimosas are good and they have signature cocktails at the bar as well. French toast is amazing and the biscuits are Devine!
Good brunch spot , nice vibe , and good service .  The mimosas were pretty good.  I've been here twice while visiting New Orleans
OMG!! great food, definitely will stop by here the next time i go to New Orleans.. theres always a line! so be prepared to wait!

Wait is loooooong (2 hours on a Friday) but food is solid. Cocktails are pretty yummy too. I got the Southern Breakfast- grits, bacon, eggs, fried green tomato and a biscuit. I inhaled it all! The honey butter was spot on. Portions are huge so share lots of sweet and savory options with your friends. Come hungry, leave full and happy!

Excellent start to our NOLA vacation by grabbing brunch here shortly after checking in. There was a bit of a wait for a table the day after Christmas but the queue moved quickly and was made much more bearable by the quality of the Bloody Mary's we sipped as we waited. Enjoyed one of the many varieties on eggs Benedict The restaurant offers with pork "debris" on a buttermilk biscuit with a poached egg and hollondaise. The egg was a bit over for my taste but the yolk was still soft. The banana pecan pancakes were incredible. All in all a great, if not quite perfect, start to our trip to New Orleans. Would heartily recommend to anyone with an opportunity and a hankering for a great breakfast.

Of course I found this gem on yelp. It was a short walk from our hotel and as we rounded the corner you can see the  crowd of people waiting to get in. We went on a holiday Monday, it was still very crowded but it was only a 20 minute wait for a party of two. The food was excellent and the service was on par.  All wait staff was really nice, very attentive and food was served fast.  Hostess was awesome getting people in. Don't be shy when you walk up, to get your name on the list you need to talk to the lady with iPad in her hand. She was quick getting people in. They have table, bar and outside seating. We asked for first available and when it was our turn we had the option of bar or outdoor.  I ordered the three little pigs omelette minus one pig (no ham). It came with your choice of potatoes, grits, or fruit and toast or a biscuit. The omelette was very big, stuffed with my two little pigs and lots of cheese.  Very delicious!  It was enough to cover me for breakfast and lunch.   Sitting at the bar you can see  all the action.  Great place for breakfast and very reasonable for all the food you get.

Bloody Mary's are really good. 

Buddies had the BBQ shrimp and grits and the French toast bananas foster. I had their version of the eggs Benedict. Indifferent to the shrimp and grits. Bananas foster French toast was super good - would recommend this to any French toast lover. The eggs Benedict comes on a biscuit with regular bacon as the protein - not the best or worst. This four star goes to the French toast. 

Not a bad location - close to canal street

The first time my husband and I went here, I was semi-hungover so I didn't have much tolerance for the extremely slow service. I needed water and food, and quick. I had read a few write-ups on the Mid-City location but rarely go to that side of town so I was excited to check out the Magazine Street cafe. 
Very slow service and when we got our food we were both, "meh" about it. It's hard to screw up breakfast (although I did get the breakfast sandwich on a very small biscuit and ended up having to deconstruct it since it was piled so high). 
Since I'm always willing to give a place a second shot, we tried it again a few days ago. On a Monday around 12.15 p.m. we sat at our table for 15 minutes before we were even greeted. All 3 of us in our party have worked in the service industry at one time or another so we're pretty patient and understanding if a server is in the weeds. I even told my husband, "If they're busy then I get it, just tell us you'll be right with us and get us a water or something!" Nothing. The host wouldn't make eye contact and there wasn't a manager to be seen. We ended up going to the bar to get our drinks, which took a long time, too, because the bartender automatically made my friend's drink a double and then had to void it out with a manager. 
We waited about 50 minutes for food, no apologies for the slack service or time of our food. There was no check-back to see how our meals were until our plates were almost cleared.
Again, the food was just okay. Definitely not worth the wait.
The building is cute and it's convenient for people on the Uptown side of the Quarter or in the CBD. The waitstaff and host all seem like they have better things to do, though. 
Icing on the cake: as we left a server was sitting outside, near the entrance, smoking a cigarette. Mmmm.

Had the Costa Rican and wife had the Bananas Foster Pain Perdue. Both were excellent, coffee was good, also had a biscuit on the side. Little to no wait when we got there but others had a short wait as we left. Highly recommend!
Love this place.  When i New Orleans I always visit the Ruby Slipper.

Wow. Coming from DC, and having a variety of brunch places, this place blew me away. Food was one of the best benedicts I've had to date. The St. Charles St Benedict was very delicious. It had a butter milk biscuit and creamy sauce with very delicious fried chicken! Would definitely recommend coming here again.

Ordered the egg Cochan and husband ordered blueberry French toast, I assume he loved it since he finished everything. I liked the egg Cochan but was not amazed by it which is fine probably I just shave different taste preference. The cappuccino was great though. Great location for breakfast right across the street from many hotels.
The Ruby Slipper I can't say anything that hasn't already been said. Food is great prices are reasonable. Kid friendly.

It's been the Gulf St. Peter every time and every time its been good! The fish is different and fresh...no tilapia and that's a plus for me. The location on Canal is bigger, but the food doesn't lack either on Magazine, they are now officially my go to breakfast place when I'm in New Orleans, they are comparable to The Flying Biscuit in ATL.

This place is amazing! Even with a 30 minute wait outside, the waitress served us peach bellini's! Once we were seated, it also did not take long for the food to arrive in a packed restaurant! The food was awesome! I recommend the seasonal pancakes (pumpkin!!) during the fall and the chicken sausage!

The bananas foster French toast was delicious. The salmon eggs bennie was good- not too much hollandaise which is how I like it. Biscuit was huge (and a little dry) but tasty. Good coffee, friendly service, fun to sit outside!

This place is on magazine street close to the French Quarter. Funky breakfast place that served s great eggs Benedict and the best corned beef hash.
Waitress was super nice and she had the bartender make me an iced Irish Coffee that was delish.
