Definitely the place to come for brekkie.

The food is simply excellent.

We arrived at 7 a.m. on a Sunday morning and there are already some people waiting. The waiter is attentive and knowledgeable. The ambience is  vibrant and bright. But what really impresses us is the food.

We ordered Egg Cochon and a weekend special Eggs Benedict (Shrimp Boogaloo Bennni). The slow cooked pork really sings in your mouth and when you think it just couldn't get any better the shrimp delivers a pleasant surprise. The sauce is rich yet sharp with a little bit of a kick. It is simply divine.

Very busy place anytime in the morning, don't hesitate to get there early. Even with a small crowd of ppl outside, for a party of 2 the wait was 30min. They have a good system in place for waiting to be seated. They use this app(Yelp) to streamline the waiting process. When you approach the host/hostess, they'll walk you thru it, and you can actively see where your place in "line" is, instead of physically waiting in a line. 
Best thing you can do: use this app and check in before you get there, no wait, closer to walking right in. 

Food: some of the best breakfast in town. Don't forget to order they're Ruby Slipper mimosa. 

Service: can't ask for better service. Pleasant and nice, to the point when they need to be. Offering drinks while you're waiting around

I stayed in NOLA for a week and went here three times.. What does that tell you?  The food's good.  Particularly the specials: pineapple/candied ginger pancakes, caramel apple pancakes, and chicken fricasse were all wonderful.  Fantastic peach bellini, and I love that the chef comes out to check on you!  The staff is really nice, and funny as well.  The decor is really charming, tall windows and ceilings, huge wooden bar and kooky artwork on the wall.  We really felt comfortable here. 

 Prices are reasonable, and they have chicken sausage, which I've seen nowhere else in town.   Only giving three stars because the turkey club I ordered the second time came without cheese (as shown on the menu) and they only brought me one slice for the whole club when I inquired about it.  Additionally, the avocado on the sandwich was practically non-existent, and it was hard to get ahold of our waiter.  And I thought the specials were a little pricey, $3 for one pancake seems high, though they are a good size.  But I enjoyed the Ruby Slipper overall, highly recommend!

Still as amazing as the last trip in October of 2013. We honestly feel this is the best spot for breakfast/brunch in the area. It's always super busy be prepared to wait for a table. It's well worth it.

Thank you, Yelpers, for directing me here. Shrimp and grits were great - the biscuit it came with was super-soft and delicious! Bloody mary comes with green beans, olive and lemon slices. A side of bacon turned out extra thick and extra crisp.

A mazing awesome breakfast spot with some great items.  I had to cochchan po boy (I believe it what it is called).  Great pulled pork pi boy with a great bite of mustard slaw.  I added a bsicyt on the side cause I can't help myself.  Everyone that ate here with me loved their meal from the st Charles to the biscuits grits and eggs.  Quick service and not even a long wait even though they may seem like it would.

I stop by ruby slipper for brunch every time I come to New Orleans for vacation and it never disappoints. If you are hungry, try their special. You can get catfish with spinach and broiled eggs. If you're not super hungry, try any combination of their sides. And then just sit back and enjoy your mimosa. Or if you partied too hard the night before, get their Bloody Mary. It's the best place to start your day in NOLA.
Absolutely amazing. We checked in to avoid the wait but mannnn was it great. Everyone ordered different things and had absolutely no complaints. Will definitely be back
Visited from St. Louis, MO and the King suggested this place. It was everything.  I ordered the Gulf Fish St. Peter and a blueberry  pancake and this was exquisite

My favorite restaurant from our trip to New Orleans. Putting ourselves on the waiting list prior to arrival view yelp was a must! The wait times here can be over an hour on a weekday! The cafe is small and everyone is crammed together, but the food was good. I opted for a pomegranate and orange mimosa, it wasn't anything special. I could've done without. They sat us at the bar, we didn't mind. I ordered the chicken st. charles benedict omg delicious! I don't think anything on my trip topped that meal. It is a must have!

Nice breakfast spot right off Canal Street. I went basic and just had pancakes with a side of grilled potatoes. The pancakes were flavorful and cooked to perfection, crispy on the edges. Appreciated they took the care to do that right. Fresh OJ and good coffee helped. Only downside was the potatoes were cold and obviously not freshly cooked.

Ruby's breakfast was amazing. My husband had a blueberry Cheesecake stuffed french toast that was out of this world. My eggs conchon was excellent & easily made gluten free. Our server was super nice & very attentive. I highly recommend the Ruby Slipper cafe.

This was my highlight of my trip to New Orleans. I have the shrimp omelette and my husband had something that was like fried chicken eggs beni. It was all great and we left feeling stuffed! I wish there was a ruby slipper in Little Rock! I would be there all the time for a great breakfast!
Overrated. Good food, slow service. Note, the goat cheese on the slipper salad is mixed with chives! So if you are like me and don't like chives, order something else.

Stopped by before the Falcons vs Saints game and I will return again and again. The service was tops. Manager and staff were super friendly despite being all decked out in Saints' gear :). I loved the Mimosas and Bellinis. Food was great too.

I can not, and i mean- CAN NOT- stop dreaming about my brunch at Ruby Slipper Cafe.  The food here will change your life. I was here for a bachelorette party this past weekend and 7 of us decided to hit up the Ruby Slipper for some eats.  This place had a bit of a wait to get in, but was worth every second.  Thinking about my brunch, i would have waited 2 days to get in. 

The hostess gave us a time frame, which was cool because we got to jump out of line, do a bit of shopping, grab coffee and come back. Once we were seated, we were immediately greeted by our amazing server.  Round of waters and yes, booze. First things first, we started with double mimosas ($10) and other delicious alcoholic bevs to get the day started. I tried a friends bloody mary (i'm normally not a fan) and it may have changed my mind on them forever. So yummy and the perfect amount of kick! Check plus for serving up doubles, Ruby Slipper. 

For food, our waiter recommended the Catfish St. Peter and described it as the "best thing on the menu".  Naturally- I had to try it. Besides being heaven on a plate, the St. Peter dish was pan-seared catfish over cheesy grit cakes topped with 2 poached eggs, sauteed spinach, tomatoes, a skewer of grilled shrimp (3) & finished with a Creole mustard hollandaise. 
Um WHAT? 
YES. SIGN ME UP. 

This was the BEST.THING.I'VE.EVER.PUT.IN.MY.MOUTH.

End of story.

Drops mic. 

I'm out.

O M Gaawwdd! Eat here! Stop researching and just eat here already. One of the best meals we've had during our Louisiana visit and that includes meals we've loved that were prepared by our Louisiana family!! 

Bacon infused vodka for Bloody Mary's.
Banana pecan pancakes.
Croque Madame.
And the special of the day...biscuit, fried green tomatoes, poached egg, in a taso tomato sauce with shrimp! What?? It's q close your eyes and just enjoy the layers of flavors moment happening in your mouth!

Great "local" type place with an old fashion sit up counter/counter service and regular seated dining. Great morning cocktails (you ARE in NOLA) and a great variety of menu items. Some traditional, some unique. Staff is super friendly, and dont come if you are in a rush.( That's not a bad thing, just an observation. )

On a business trip to NoLa I wanted to get a good taste of the local fare.

A couple coworkers joined me for brunch our last day in the city. We waited outside for the anticipated hour with what seemed to be a hodgepodge of tourists and locals. It's nice that they have the fans running full tilt, but they don't offer much respite from that humidity!

We sure were treated to some Southern hospitality. I love breakfast with all my heart and had to try the bananas foster french toast (it comes WITH bacon!!??!). The three slices of bread and mountain of bananas foster were no match for my love of breakfast...I prissed out and cut all my bread into bite sized pieces and my coworker was about to make fun of me, except I demolished that plate. The toast was so airy and sweet, the bananas foster was on point and the slices of bacon were substantative...not the wussy thin bacon you get at some bfast joints. It was SO good that by the time I was done all that was left were a few wayward chunks of fruit and the syrupy remains of the foster sauce.
The bananas foster French toast is a definite must have. It seems like it might be too heavy, but it wasn't at all. This wonderful place is really worth a visit. You won't be disappointed.

I'm a fan.
Come early or wait a long time.
The restaurant is busy so it's loud.
My husband and our friend ordered the Eggs Cochon.  We noted that the eggs in the South are very soft, perhaps not to everyone's liking.  Also, the pulled pork was quite flavouress.  We were expecting a pulled pork special of the house would be WOW, but it was  just salt and peppery and that's all.  
Everything came to our table promptly and pipping hot, so that's good.

Can't not recommend, but with so many great places to try in NOLA, this is one if you have several days in the city.  One cool thing is they are linked to an app called Nowait.  Get it and use it to avoid waiting for 45+minutes to get a table.  So here is the reason for my 3-star review:
1 Star to the Host Stand - If you don't like people don't work a host stand.  Would say this was the only experience with NOLA locals where we felt we were the inconvenient customer.
4 Star to our Server - He was awesome and explained what we should try which were all mostly good.
3 Star the food - This was our first breakfast stop in NOLA.  It was good, but we did have many better food experiences.
1 Star - The noise!  I have never been in a restaurant that was so noisy.  Try some sound dampening ceiling tiles or something.  Won't take from the charm of the rest of the atmosphere.  

So all in all, good place for breakfast, but be sure to not make it your only stop.

We found this gem on a recommendation from a friend. Britain helped us with our order and steered us toward some of the best brunch I've ever had. She whipped up a couple of body Mary's with bacon vodka they were unreal!
Britain and Shanna were gracious and are some  of the reasons that I will definitely return.

Our very first day in New Orleans... We wanted to have a great first breakfast, so we asked the concierge where she would eat & she pointed us in the direction of Ruby Slippers!!! I ordered the double Bellini and the Catfish "St. Peter" the drink was ok, I could have drank coffee, oj or some water... Now the Catfish was AMAZING, I've never had cheesy grit cakes and at the first bite I fell in love, unfortunately I couldn't eat it all and that's rare b/c I NEVER walk away from a good meal... The food was so much I had to head back to the hotel for a much needed nap... If you're able to stop in you definitely should.... I'll be having bfast there before we leave!
ABC delish!! Best  bloody Mary I've  had in a while! !! They know how to do it spicy!!! We shared the Costa Rican dish and a side of potatoes  mmm mmm  happy happy.
Great brunch here in the downtown Ruby! I had the Stuffed Brioche French Toast and hubby had the Salmon Benedict- both were great! Nice casual atmosphere, friendly staff.

Wonderful service!  Of course we had to wait, but use the yelp app and get on the waitlist on your way. Such a plus to have this offered!Even while you are waiting the staff offers drink service to you outside. If you have never been, the menu is full of delicious choices. Our party of four each had something different and were thoroughly pleased!

We ate breakfast today at this gem. We have stayed in New Orleans several times and passed this place up because it was always sooooo busy!!  Now I know why. Service was great. Although they were busy, we were seated quickly. Service was great and our server was polite. Our food was delivered in a reasonable amount of time and was delicious. I always watch to see how the employees treat each other. I was impressed that they appeared to work together. Would DEFINITELY RECOMMEND!!!!!  Enjoy!!

Went for breakfast. Food was amazing!   You have to have the pig candy. Yum!   
The staff was engaged and helpful. We will definitely go again when in Nola
A bit of a wait but totally worth it. I got the buttermilk Pancakes with bacon and pork sausage links.

My first brunch in New Orleans was at Ruby Slipper. I ordered the croque madame and my cousin and her friend ordered the peace maker eggs Benedict order. My croque madame looked really delicious and it was but I thought there was too much bread so I ended up not eating most of the bread. I also substituted the fries for a fruit medley. My favorite thing there was the biscuits that went under the benedict(s). They were very moist and soft but the exterior had a crunch which was very nice. I really enjoyed the eggs Cochon benny. The applewood smoked pulled pork was really flavorful and sweet. The chicken st Charles benny was very flavorful too. Chicken tenders were fried so it felt like chicken and biscuits. Overall we had a very filling breakfast with just a little too much carbs. The restaurant was busy but very relaxing and our waiter was really knowledgeable about the area when we asked him for suggestions.

Sixth year coming to NOLA and Ruby Slipper is a must in our to do list.  This time Jacus and Erin did a great job dealing with 4 hung over guys/gals.  We even invented a new drink with their bacon infused Vodka.  Great place, great good and great people !  Please consider making reservations ahead - be patient this place gets busy pretty quick.  It is worth it.
We went for beakfast and the Food was excellent, we waited 45mins to get in but it was well worth it. I Had Egg Cochen and my wife had Eggs Blackstone both excellent!

For the 35 minute wait time and the good reviews I expected much more. We had the Eggs Cochon and Croque Madam. Both were flat in terms of flavor.  I don't get why this place has so much hype??? Our waters were never refilled and our drink order was screwed up.

Well worth the almost 90 minute wait...we figured as much because there was a large group of people doing the same thing as us. 

I had the corned beef Bennie which is a delicious buttermilk biscuit topped with corned beef hash, 2 poached eggs and hollandaise sauce.  Each bite hit the spot.  I added a side of grits with cheddar cheese to top things off and I was extremely pleased.  We sat at the bar and had exceptional service.  

My wife ordered the chicken St. Charles which was a buttermilk biscuit topped with a fried chicken breast, two poached eggs topped with a Tasso cream sauce.  According to my wife the breakfast was one of her all time favorites...tons of flavor without being too heavy on the stomach.  

I had a glass of orange juice as well and I might be wrong but it did not taste fresh squeezed; That being said, it was much better than your average OJ.

I went to this spot and had a nice breakfast. I had the three little pigs omlette and I added spinach,a  biscuit and hash browns. The food was delish and plentiful. It seems i stayed pretty full for a good portion of the day!  It was yummy!

Excellent food and service.  I had the europen omlet (baby bellas and brie). And my friend had the strawberry pancake mix (starwberries in the batter, not just on top). Add two double mimosas and we were happy campers!

After a morning at the airport, this was our first stop! Chicken St. Charles was amazing and my wife loved the stuffed French Toast!

Great food and we are going again tomorrow!
The wait sucks but it is totally worth it!! Literally the best breakfast I have ever had!

Fantastic breakfast spot in CBD. The St Charles chicken is amazing- it was so good that I went back the next morning and ordered the same thing! The staff was very friendly and helpful and the food had a very NOLA twist on breakfast classics. Definitely a place to try!!

I love Ruby Slipper and have been to three of their locations in the city.  All of them serve the same food and it has always been excellent.  Get here early or you'll be waiting a long time on the weekends, especially if there's some event going on in the city.  Groups could be waiting a long time depending on your size.  

The entrees are amazing and creative.  The biscuits are also fantastic.  Love the food here.  They also have good morning cocktails and drinks from Milk Punch to Mimosas and Bloody Marys.

Absolutely delicious food with a very friendly waitress with a great personality (Julie)! I had the shrimp and grits and a banana pecan pancake! It was definitely worth the wait & I will return for this delicious food on my next visit to New Orleans!!!

Now if you looking for STRAIGHT UP quality BREAKFAST, don't look any further! We all know there are plenty of good restaurants in the Big Easy! However, RUBY SLIPPER CAFE have some convenient locations of which the wait to eat is worth your time!! I've enjoyed each of my selections and I'll definitely will be back. Good food and Good Service!

Oh wow. The meal is a five star meal but making me stand outside for 35 minutes in 46 degrees and wind drops a star. Ashley was very attentive and recommended eggs cubion and the caramel creme stuffed French toast. Thinking this could have been the best breakfast I have ever eaten. Hot chocolate delicious too
Don't put syrup on the French toast, perfect without it. Will definitely be back on our next trip
Stopped in or lunch on a Monday. Not too busy. Chicken tortilla soup was okay. The caprese mozzarella sandwich was delicious . If you're in the area  definitely stop in.
Great choice for breakfast. Had the eggs cochon and it was as delicious as promised. Highly recommend

I hear about Ruby Slippers all the time. I figured I give this place a try.

I ordered  all 3 of their signature items.

Eggs Cochon (2/5) - Biscuit was surprisingly amazing, but the protein was lacking salt.

Chicken St. Charles (3.5/5) - Biscuit was amazing again. And again, the chicken could use more seasoning

BBQ Shrimp& Grits - (1.5/5) - Shrimp&grits is a sensitive topic only for me because i'm always looking for the best in New Orleans. Currently Surrey's hold the title and still does. Ruby Slippers version is just a little to watery for me. Although a friend of my preferred their grit texture to be more creamy than Surrey's version.

Bananas Foster - I won't give this a rating because all you have to do is make sure it's sweet and fattening. Nailed it.

I will say this. They use the same biscuit for every dish. Their biscuit is ABSOLUTELY amazing. It was the star on the plates that had biscuits.  

The service was standard given that it was busy. Be mindful that you have to have a full party in order to be sat. 

Will I ever come back? I'll just say there's plenty more to explore in this city, but maybe for a biscuit.

Delicious food and even better service. Download the Thanx app to get a free side and to hold your place in line. Unlimited options, will be back again. Ask for Caroline as your waitress and you won't be disappointed!
Great breakfast. Love the banana foster French toast. The restaurant allows u to get on a wait list through yelp.

Like this place needs another great review, but here it goes....First of all, we took advantage of the "get added to waitlist" offered in Yelp and boy, was that WONDERFUL!  Our table was ready as soon as we walked up the first time we ate there (Friday morning - not quite as busy as weekend) and we did have to wait about 15 minutes the SECOND time we ate there (Sunday when the wait time was 110 minutes), but I highly recommend taking advantage of that!  Next, after reading the other wonderful reviews, I tried two of the eggs benedict (the Chicken St. Charles and the Eggs Cochon) and they were as fantastic as everybody says they were.  My husband had the shrimp and grits, also wonderful.  We sat at the bar and the service was great.  We also had the bacon infused Bloody Mary -- YUMMY and the mimosa.  If you need to know how good all of this was, just know that when we went back on Sunday we had the exact same meal -- and I would order it again and again in a heartbeat!  I can't believe I have been coming to NOLA for 30+ years and have never tried this restaurant before now.  Part of that was that it always had a huge line and I didn't want to wait, but now with being able to add your name to the waitlist, there is no reason not to go.
Great food and very lively atmosphere. Highly recommended but be aware it gets crowded quickly.
Have anything on the menu, it's all great! The coffee is excellent and the staff is wonderful, don't come to NOLA without stopping by for breakfast or brunch!
Great place for breakfast.  Line can be long but worth it. Enjoyed the eggs Benedict dishes. Also the bacon Bloody Mary is amazing.

This is the place for breakfast or brunch!!! Food comes in very generous portions, it's delicious, and you cannot go wrong with whatever you ordered. I asked for the special and had crab cakes with egg Benedicts. Add couple of mimosas or cup of coffee. My family and I will definitely coming back soon!

While vacationing in NOLA my boyfriend and I were searching for a delicious breakfast and found the Ruby Slipper.  The place was busy when we arrived and waited to be sat (well worth the wait). The bartenders who waited on us were extremely friendly and provided great recommendations.  I ordered the shrimp and grits and my boyfriend ordered the banana foster pain perdu, both were amazing!  We also both got the brandy milk punch.  This was delicious. We loved the punch so much we stopped in and grabbed another round on our last day before flying home.  I could not recommend this place and their staff any more highly!

Love this place! Coffee is perfectly brewed. Always a busy line and wait which is a great sign! I stop by here atleast 2x during my stay in NOLA! Waiting for my Catfish St. Peter. 
Poached Eggs (I get fried overwell) over Grilled (well seasoned, not too salty )Catfish over spinach & tomatoes over panko breaded cheesy grits - yum!  Now that's Stacks on Stacks! Oh, I almost forgot the 3 skewered shrimp staked! 
A little healthy and a little not, All on 1 plate! Listen, you're in New Orleans-- stop counting calories!! Just sweat it out!

I don't really remember this place, but I know I went there (it's on my list of "To Yelp") .. but I waited so long, and the photos don't ring a bell either.

3 Stars!

This would've been a 5 star review if not for the service. We were sat at the bar and the waitress immediately took our order of pancakes and bananas foster and told us it would be out in less than 15 mins. We had a tour planned at 11:15 and it was 10:15 at that time. We sat as all the parties after us were seated, served, and cashed out. Finally at 10:50 I flagged down another bartender to check on our meal as our girl had never come back to even check on us. After a quick run to the kitchen he said we were up next. The food came about 2 minutes later and was absolutely delicious. Unfortunately we had to eat as much as we could in 7 minutes and rush out. Such a shame because it really was very good!

I sat at the bar since there was over an hour wait. My servers name was Michael who was an absolute gem. I had two different Benedix and both were amazing. The chicken was my favorite. I think there are five locations throughout the city; I enjoyed my experience at this location very much.

Be prepared to wait a while, but the meal is totally worth it! Started off with the double mimosa which was pretty big and super tasty! Then ordered the Louisiana omelet... Yum! The shrimp was fresh and more importantly the best breakfast biscuit I've had in a while.
Fun atmosphere for brunch with friends when visiting New Orleans!

This is one of the best brunches I have had! A group of us ordered the triple sampler of eggs Benedicts and shrimp and grits. I am not a big fan of eggs benedicts but each of the three in the sampler were delicious! The shrimp and grits were also tasty but the biscuit and honey butter stuck out the most. Our waiter was very friendly and attentive. Definitely would recommend this spot to visitors.

Had the migas (my friend ordered it) and the banana foster french toast. Oh and I ordered a regular coffee (because they were out of the iced coffee that I wanted) and that was quite good too. I think it's worth mentioning that the waiter (whose name is Joe I believe?) was really nice about it. He offered to get me plain coffee with ice on the side when he told me they were out. 

The food was quite good...tho I think my meal would have been much better when combined with a savory dish like the migas.
I got kinda sick of how sweet the french toast thing was by the time I finished half of my meal. Granted though, I don't really have much of a sweet tooth (but I really wanted to try banana foster before I left New Orleans haha) so take my words with a grain of salt.

So my personal recommendation would be to get a savory dish along with the banana foster dish if you can~ 

You know what'd be awesome? If they made a combo platter where you could have a little bit of both dishes. :) But maybe that's just my brain getting ahead of me again.

All in all, this is a great place for breakfast/lunch. If I ever come back to New Orleans and I'm in the area, I'd love to come back.

This place is a staple and is worth waiting for, they are only opened till 2pm so you might want to plan ahead.  There's always a line so you might want to grab a drink and wait outside or put your number down and they will call you when your table opens up. I ordered eggs cochon which was delicious. Service was perfect and staff was great!

Loved it. First off the name was very appealing and a giant red slipper caught my attention. There's reasons behind the name that I can't quite remember that has something to do with a homecoming after hurricane Katrina. That's cool, right? The food was amazing. I had Migas for breakfast. Which was scrambled eggs, chorizo, toritilla chips, pico and a spicy sour cream mixture.
His food was awesome too. Yet I don't remember what it was called .

Great breakfast place, most places around here opens at 11 am, however, Ruby Slipper is ready to serve your first alcohol of the day.... Bloody Mary, anyone?  

H wanted to eat fried chicken early in the morning, and they just have the right thing.  Fried chicken egg benedict!  Yes, you name it, they got it.  The chicken was perfectly battered and fried.  The egg yolk did not make the chicken soggy at all. 

I had the original migas, which is like a big mess with scramble eggs with onion, tomatoes, cheese and etc.  I really like the tomato salsa on the side and asked for second, and the nice waiter charged me an extra $1.5 for it.  However, overall, it was a nice breakfast.

Beware you should use the waitlist app to dine here; you do not want to wait outside for seating. But it was worth the wait...great place to recover from a long drunken night during Mardi Gras! We had a large group, and I hade the shrimp Benedict...very tasty! I would definitely go again!

Love love love! I go here with my friends all the time for a good ole classic nola brunch. They've got a great menu with lots of choices, both sweet and savory. There's a full bar in the center so you can sip mimosas or bloody marys while waiting for a table. The service is fast and friendly. I recommend the eggs cochon -- absolutely wonderful.

Waaaay overpriced for what you get. Long wait, tables too close together, poor service. Loaded French toast was so sweet it was inedible. The shrimp and grits my wife got looked decent, but we left with a $60 tab for BREAKFAST. 

TLDR: keep walking on towards Jackson Square for some better food
All have to say.. what EVER the special is GET IT !  Banana Foster French Toast - LORD HELP ME !
Great breakfast, brunch place! Bloody Mary was awesome, get the bacon vodka! Food was great!

Ruby Slipper lived up to its expectations! 

A southern twist to your every day breakfast food. When going here make sure to utilize the app called NoWait, it allows you put yourself on the wait list from the comfort of your own hotel room. This can save you from wasting up to an hour of your time waiting outside.

Secondly, the food is at huge portions and really heavy! Have everyone grab something and share it all around.

Besides the wait, the food was delicious and staff was friendly. A great place to try when in New Orleans.
I had the Costa Rican breakfast and it was so delicious.  Service was fairly efficient given our large group.  I wanted to go back there again during our trip but the schedule didn't allow.
This is a must stop when in NOLA for a great breakfast. Have been here many times and the food is always great.

This place was awesome for brunch during buku weekend in Nola. They have a great selection of benedicts and traditional/special breakfast and brunch items. I didn't know this at the time but you can go through yelp and sign up to get into line instead of actually waiting the 15-45 minutes if you just show up. 

The atmosphere is very open and friendly but it is quite loud since it's crowded. Awesome place to go with friends for sure though! I couldn't decide on a benedict so it was perfect that they had a "peacemaker" benedict that chose two from their list. I got the shrimp boogaloo and the hot smoked salmon and it was fantastic and what a great mix my belly was so happy!

I would give this place 5 stars but the bloody mary I had was quite average. They weren't made to order and were poured out of a 2 gallon glass container that was premixed. Maybe mine was just off anyways highly recommend this place!

The Ruby Slipper gets pretty busy for brunch even during the week, so try to find as early as you can.

I shared the BBQ Shrimp and Grits as well as the Eggs Cochon with my girlfriend. Both of the entrees included Ruby Slipper's fantastic biscuits. You must order one if it doesn't come with your meal. The biscuits are soft and buttery on the inside while crispy on the outside. These were some of the best biscuits I've ever had. They were fantastic to dip into egg yolk.

I liked the Eggs Cochon a little more. It featured pulled pork, poached eggs, and hollandaise sauce over the biscuits. The pork was juicy and fatty. I highly recommend the dish. The shrimp and grits were spicy and flavorful. You can't go wrong with either dish.

I would rate it four and a half stars.
Best biscuits I've ever had. Shrimp and grits was great, but my husband had the eggs Benedict/ fried chicken hybrid and it was out of the world
The BBQ Shrimp and Grits was one of my favorite meals from my trip to Nola! Although our waiter seemed a little overwhelmed by the lunch rush, he was a trooper.

How can you go wrong with a place the has a sign stating happy hour is from 7-9am.

Their Bloody Mary isn't as "fancy" regarding garnish as some places but that isn't a negative.  The bacon infused vodka Bloody Mary is to die for.  I believe it was the best one I've had in New Orleans and that says quite a lot since most restaurants put a lot of pride into their Bloody Marys.

The fried chicken Eggs Benedict also was one the best breakfast dishes we had while there.

Can't wait to go back.

For the price, its awesome. I had the banana foster which was highly recommended. But soon after I got mine, I fell in love with every dish they brought out. Sat by the bar but the service was just as good, even expedited. The manager greeted me, and checked up on me several times. The staff worked as a team. My first stop in NOLA and Im off to a great start.
Grits alone.... delicious.. my aunt is not a grit eater but she devoured these...I highly enjoyed the shrimp and grits...I'm from Chicago but ill be back for sure!!!
This place is perfect. The service is super friendly, the bloody marys are amazing and the food is delicious. Worth the wait.

Fantastic and worth the wait! The fact that you can watch your place in line on Yelp is amazing. Best bacon infused Bloody Mary. Worth the wait just for that. Loved the Migas. Perfect serving. My hubby got The Trifecta and the fried chicken Benedict was my favorite. Staff was super nice. Highly recommend on your NOLA visit.

My husband and I stopped in here while we were visiting New Orleans on vacation.  It came as a recommendation from a friend and from reading the great reviews here on Yelp. 

We were able to reserve a seat prior to us getting there through the Yelp app. It's a great feature, as we had a 30 minute wait. They app told us what time we had to check in by with the hostess. When we arrived we only had to wait about 10 minutes to be seated. 

We both ordered the bacon bloody Mary's. They were delicious!  Garnished with pickled green beans, green olives and maple bacon. 

For breakfast I had the Corned Beef Bennie. I would definitely recommend it. My husband had the Croque Madame. He said it was the best one he's ever had. 

Overall, I would definitely recommend the Ruby Slipper to anyone who is in town.
Fantastic breakfast. Had the biscuit eggs and candied bacon. Awesome. Everyone enjoyed their breakfast. It's right off canal. Worth the stop. My friends went back a 2nd time.

While the Ruby Slipper is a chain restaurant, the flavors seemed to be one of a kind. We saved this spot for last before leaving town as it had proven to be overcrowded when we passed on the days prior. We came on a Tuesday morning and were seated right away. They do not take reservations so if you're planning on dining in on the weekend, I would suggest getting in line early for breakfast or brunch. 

The inside wasn't much to look at but fortunately your sight isn't needed for this experience. We took a little longer to order as we were told they were out of brioche initially. It was just our luck as the truck literally pulled in moments later! I ended up going with the Gulf Fish St. Peter and he had the Stuffed French Toast. Each of our plates had distinctive flavors of their own but were equally delicious. 

The staff was friendly enough, the place was clean enough and the food was certainly good enough. There is no place like home and certainly no place like the ruby slipper. Two thumbs up!!

In town for a bachelorette party and us lady's love to brunch. This place was high recommended and it did not disappoint. It was super busy but were able to squeeze in to grab a drink while we waited. The wait wasn't nearly as long as the expected wait time. Our server was hilarious and attentive. The food was delicious with great value. We are here everyday we were in town and I'll definitely will be back

There's a lot of great food in New Orleans, but this was one of our best meals! We stopped for breakfast. The fried chicken Benedict was amazing. I'm still thinking about that perfectly cooked chunk of chicken over an amazing biscuit. The bananas foster pain perdue was also fantastic. The bacon infused Bloody Mary was awesome!
Wow what a breakfast ! Had the catfish over grit cakes . It was delicious !!! The Bloody Mary was tasty too !

Great flavor but my Benedict and friend's Benedict was cold. Boozie Coffee was great! Southern breakfast, omelet with goat cheese and a very fluffy pancake were outstanding. Staff was very helpful and polite!
Terrific food. I'm from Colorado so no good southern restaurants here. THese guys had the best fried chicken ever!

Order anything and it's awesome. I had the corn beef Bernie.   Wow.  It will be a wait.  If you write negetive reviews because of wait time, GO TO WAFFLE HOUSE!

There is a reason there's a wait...it's the best in town.

I'm always on the hunt for a good breakfast joint that's also kid friendly while in NOLA. I'm glad I stopped here at the Ruby Slipper. They tend to fill up quickly, so plan on getting there early to avoid a wait. They serve French Truck Coffee here which is amazing. I had the Shrimp and Grits. Pretty decent. The biscuits are delicious. Overall, a kid friendly, tasty place.

The wait was long, but it's a popular place, and that was to be expected. You can go in and order drinks from the bar to pass the time. 

My boyfriend ordered the three little pigs omelette and it was huge... Packed with bacon ham and sausage. Biscuits were pretty good and so were the potatoes. 

Highly recommend the eggs florentine omelette for the healthy eater.  Sometimes egg white omelettes are flat and over fried. This one was fluffy and had savory portabella mushrooms and delicious goat cheese. 

Worth the wait!
Great spot!!! My boyfriend and I wanted something different and we found it.  The pancakes where amazing and bacon was to die for!
Wonderful food, friendly staff, excellent coffee! Be prepared for a wait, and that's the only reason 4 stars instead of 5! Love it!!

Omg Jason was amazing. We were so confused  in tying to decide what to eat.After our interaction with him and Sandy our waitress it was so much easier.  Sandy your  hospitality was awesome. Thank you for making this experience one to remember. You were right everything was delicious from the food to the drinks.

We visited this restaurant because of the rave reviews from others that we have read. Although our food was great, our experience was completely ruined by a lack of professionalism by management. We ordered an Arnold Palmer drink, mimosas and a Bloody Mary. When the Arnold Palmer arrived at the table it had two ice cubes in it as if had been left sitting at the bar for 30 minutes. We pointed it out to the waitress who politely said she would get the manager. The manager, Raffeal, came over to the table and said there was nothing wrong with our drink that's just the way they look. At that point we asked for the drink to be removed from the table and for him to get us another drink at which he refused and said our policy is not to remove drinks from a table. So he left the watered down drink at our table throughout the entire meal. When we were presented with the bill, that same drink now was on our check, even though the drink was never even touched. When we asked to speak to Raffeal again he became combative, disrespectful and threatened to have us removed from the restaurant because we complained about the drink. Had I not watched the table next to us complain about their food and this same manager swiftly remove their entrees and replace them with new ones then I would be more inclined to believe the policy. Another manager stepped in and removed the drink from the check but we never should have been treated the way we were by Raffeal. The only reason I'm giving you three stars is, our waitress was kind and understanding and our food was great. However, you will never receive another visit from my family again.

This place comes with a reputation and an experience to match. The cafe diner feel done a bit classier was the vibe I got. Their poached eggs are done right! Coffee hit the spot. I don't know if it was because I had had a long rough night on bourbon the night before or that this place was just that amazing but if you're in NOLA, and you go out - Come brunch here after! You won't be disappointed!

For being close to the quarters, it offered a unique take on breakfast. Sure it had the classic eggs, bacon, pancake option, but the specialities is where your money should go. Had the salmon on biscuit. The egg was perfectly poached and the biscuit did not skimp on the salmon. 

Make sure you are prepared to wait as it is quite popular (especially on the weekends). Only ding was the service. After bringing us our food, we did not see the waitress at all.

Food was fantastic! Service kinda sucked we waited at the bar only to be ignored by the two fighting bartenders while waiting for a table. We then sat down at our table and ordered a couple of simple drinks (one mimosa and two boozy coffees) and waited about 10-15 minutes for that round. Ordered a second round to go which took around the same time. When it arrived it looked like it was just sitting at the bar for about the same time we waited for it and it was completely watered down. The manger was nice enough to replace them with new ones and were immediately brought to our table. Overall experience was kinda shitty with the wait on drinks, the fighting bartenders and watered down drinks. I recommend getting your food to go or only ordering food! Good luck!!

Came to this nice little cafe on a recommendation from a pretty little local concierge at the International House Hotel. The wait was a little long at 10:30 am but there's a Lutheran convention in town so it's understandable. Staff is very polite and laces their speech with the standard southern affections, charming! The food was great but the portions were a tad smaller than what you'd normally get for the price. The Migas breakfast was an awesome mexican scrambled dish over chips, unique and it tasted great with crystal hot sauce. Coffee is phenomenal and cheap. Visit if you get the chance.

The food was good but not worth an hour wait. The Costa Rican didn't taste like traditional Costa Rican food and the potatoes tasted plain and had a weird after taste. The bloody marry and mimosas were good. The omelettes were lacking in cheese. The cinnamon swirl pancake was delicious though. Service was so so.

I ate here 3 times I think. 1 day build your own omelet. It was good. 2nd day -got the peacemaker. Shrimp Bougaloo & Chicken Benedict's. Better than day one. Wasn't really hot. Would have been much better if they wet. 3rd day -Migas. Best thing I ate here. I don't live in  New Orleans so I'll definitely do my best to recreate this at home until I return.

Service all three days while friendly, was just so-so. 
As stated many times, use the "no wait" app to secure your space in line.

Service was a bit slow. The wait time is probably so long because of how long it takes the food to come out. Our waitress was also hard to catch. But when the food came... WOW. That pain perdu French toast is the most flavor my mouth has ever experienced. Wish I could eat it everyday.
The biscuit came with an awesome cane sugar whipped butter and was amazing  Iced coffee was good too!

Lots of smiles is a good start. Pleasant interactions build it more.

Service and menu imagination are excellent. 4 eggs between 2 of us were very under done. Over medium is hard to missunderstand. The eggs cochon are brilliant and the twist on spicy hollandaise is excellent but snotty whites are not expected on a poached egg. Clarify your eggspectations and you just may enjoy it

Update: a contact from the owner asked why I didn't send my eggs back and ask for them the way I like then...I'd rather not have to clarify simple expectations like "over medium", understood the world over almost every time I've ordered them. the owner contact asking for more info and insight from me without a response or concession seals the deal on why I won't return.

Really good food. Really bad service.  During a heavy rain storm.  Instead of letting us ask a party at the bar to move over one seat which would have made enough room for our party. We were presented with the option to eat outside in blowing rain or to wait.  Once we got seated the food was great!  I had the pork hash dish, it was amazing.

This place was delicious and I'll definitely go back. I had the barbecue shrimp and grits. So reading "barbecue" shrimp and grits does not sound appealing but trust me. There was a hint of barbecue flavor that worked perfectly with the grits.
There was a lot of flavor in my dish, the only issue is that my food wasn't very hot... to say warm even might be a little much. It's a hopping spot.

I went here a few weeks ago with some friends that were in town. As we pulled up to find parking we noticed there was a line out the door. I generally assume that's a good sign but we were STARVING so we were a little discouraged. No worries though, it was only a 10 minute wait and then we were seated for breakfast. 

The service was prompt and friendly and the food was so delicious! I just ordered the basic breakfast though I was sorely tempted to try the special (stuffed French toast with lemon curd) but that will have to wait until next time!

5 stars for the service! Our waitress Erin was outstanding. She was nice and very engaging. She explained the offerings and gave excellent suggestions. I was going to go traditional southern but her suggestion to try NOLA and Ruby tradition won me over. I went with the Peacemaker, egg cochon and corn beef Bennie glade that I did. I was not disappointed. The food was good and was delivered quickly. The service was excellent! The prices are a little on the high side but hey it's Central District NOLA! The value of the service and quality of the food makes it worth the cost. I will be bacon

This was the first brunch place we hit up in NOLA and it was definitely a memorable one. I had heard about this place from a friend and she HIGHLY recommended it. 

We used the NoWait app to help cut the waiting time which helped a lot. We only waited 10 mins before we were seated. When we were waiting, a waiter came outside and asked if we wanted mimosas and we all got one. The mimosas were strong (I'm not complaining) but it cost us $10. I didn't think it was worth that much given it was so small. So just ask how much any is before ordering. 

The service was fair. We ordered the mix up Benedicts. I wish I could order those everyday. The biscuits were soft and the topping were mind blowing.

Best breakfast EVER. This gem was right next to our hotel. Yelp conveniently adds you to waitlist. We tried on a Sunday morning around 9 and there was a 2 hour wait. Monday at about the same time was a 30 minute wait. You can order cocktails while you wait and if you do have the Bloody Mary with bacon infused vodka. You will not be disappointed. 
I had St Charles St. eggs Benedict. This is the best thing I have ever had for breakfast. I love eggs Benedict but this was so special. Served on a delicious homemade biscuit instead of a boring English muffin which was perfect for mopping up the pork Tasso cream sauce with delicious bits of crispy pork that was nothing short of spectacular. Add a perfect poached egg and delicious lemony hollandaise and it was sheer perfection. My husband took one bite and said, "I'm jealous". Son had southern BLT that had a fried green tomato on it and delicious fresh buttered thick sliced bread. There was nothing ordinary about it. Delicious. Coffee was even special. A fantastic way to start the day. So glad the crowds didn't scare us away. I would have hated to miss out on that experience. I'm also kicking myself for not buying their Bloody Mary mix. I could not find it online and I need that mix in my life. Don't leave without that Bloody Mary!

40 minute wait minimum but worth it! Get their early in the weekend. 

Had the Eggs Cochon - apple braised pork on top of a buttermilk biscuit with a poached egg and hollandaise. Sooooo good!  All of the flavors together made a great combo.  Doesn't look like much but was very filling. Would definitely eat here again!

I devoured my breakfast here.  I'm pretty sure the person clearing our table made a comment about my clean plate.  I got two fried eggs, grits, and homemade corned beef hash that was oh so good.  The bloody marys were great too.  We're all about those pickled green beans now.  Oh and the chef came by and said hi and marked up our map with bars and restaurants we had to try while we were in town.  Nice guy.  Great place.

Three Little Pig Omelette with Pepper Jack Cheese!!! Fantastic!!! Great place for breakfast downtown!! I spent twice as much for half the quality/quantity at other places near the Convention Center. Best coffee I had all week... including Starbucks!!

My friend LA reads my review :( 

She makes fun of me... 

Amazing.. Epic... 

So... Just 5/5 stars...

The food was 5 stars. It was delicious. The wait time for a table was short. The food came out quickly. BUTTT don't get the coffee. First off it did not taste great or fresh. And then I got to the bottom of my cup to drink/gag on an unidentified chunky substance. The coffee ruined the whole experience for me.

Weakest meal in NOLA thus far. Had the fried catfish which was pretty bland. Husband had the Cochon po boy which he said was ok. Given all the great reviews, we may have just mis-ordered. Service was speedy.

First time in NOLA and had to try their breakfast. Food was a lot more than I thought I would get. I got the corned beef hash and eggs. Was very tasty but a bit bland on the flavor. The Pancakes are really good. Be sure to be hungry. Also try the French toast. Incredible. Service is ok but atmosphere is cute and fun.

An amazing breakfast. Be sure to use the NoWait app because even on a Monday morning, it is a busy place. My boyfriend and I had perfect dishes with strong mimosas. The biscuits are fresh and fluffy and the poached eggs are perfect. The staff is fun and friendly too.
Our first stop in New Orleans! This place did not disappoint! The shrimp and grits are delicious!
Breakfast in the Big Easy has to include this place! From the Bloody Mary's to the Fast service, friendly staff.... just awesome!

I had the Eggs Cochon which was very good but a bit too salty for me. My mom had the Eggs Blackstone and loved it. The coffee was bottomless and fantastic. My only complaint is they have a very rude hostess seating you...not a great first impression screeching names, frowning, and quickly seating you without a word.

Best breakfast in town! The wait is worth it but you can skip the line a bit with the Nowait app. The Eggs Benedict variations are fun and exciting, the creamy vanilla iced coffee is amazing, and the pancake flight is super fun. They also have a wonderful story about the name of the restaurant. This is a must for breakfast/brunch.
Decent, some locations better than others. I think it used to be better. Not a bad option for classic breakfast foods, but also not the best.

Excellent service in this place! Be prepared to wait, and check in on the "No Wait" app first to shave off some time. No outside food and drink allowed, so if you're sipping some coffee while waiting for a table, make sure to finish it off first.

The homemade biscuits and maple bacon butter was delicious. Lots of brunch options to choose from and a great location. I'd definitely come here again on my next visit.

After finding location after location of CLOSED breakfast joints (its only 10:30 am at this point) we landed at the Ruby Slipper, and they were open, packed and willing to seat us. Great choice, amazing food and drink options. I will for sure come back my next visit.

Was in New Orleans for a long weekend and had brunch here before heading to the airport to come home. I had the Salmon Bennie and it was delicious! I thought it could've used a little more hollandaise sauce, so I just asked for more and it wasn't a problem at all. We sat at the bar because there weren't any tables open (even on a Tuesday!), the bartenders were great! I also had the Double Mimosa, yum! The decor was nice and I loved the story on the menu about coming home after Katrina.

The first time I tried Ruby Slipper was about a year and a half ago and I remember having the shrimp and grits and it being FANTASTIC! This location was nice and I appreciate the design. However, the seating process is flawed. They give you the option to get on the waitlist via Yelp and you have to check-in with the hostess. When I checked in with the hostess, she told me she would text me when my table was ready. After not being texted for some time, I went back over and just waited outside. I could see that NO ONE was getting texted, instead, they were just yelling names. When they yelled my name, I heard another patron say that I had been called a long time ago, but yet, I NEVER received a text. If you don't plan on texting people when their party is ready, just tell them to wait around and they will be called. Simple.

On this visit, I initially tried the french toast logs or whatever they are called. WAY too much sugar. Then I switched and tried the steel oats. My mother tried the southern breakfast. Everything was just okay. Nothing impressed me or made me want to come back. The staff however were extremely friendly and absolutely lovely. They definitely made it a good experience! Put it this way, we did still leave hungry.

One of the great brunch spots in Nawlins. I had the Bananas Foster Pain Perdu and it was amazing. I think the French bread makes it great. Making french toast with thin bread is wack. LOL! Of course I had a mimosa. No brunch is complete without it. Also, service was great.

Decent breakfast with interesting choices.  I had the corned beef hash and was disappointed with the quantity of corned beef. It did have a delicious horseradish sauce.  The poached eggs were perfectly cooked.

 My husband had the sliders and they were a home run. A little different for breakfast but a great choice.

Our service was excellent which is worth pointing out considering how busy they were.

This is a busy place on gamedays & weekends so prepare to wait. The fast service makes up for the wait though. The food was delicious, plentiful, & the menu had tons of choices . I would definitely go back

Had the Eggs Cochon - excellent dish with a couple of Irish coffees.  Everyone sang the praises of their meals here. Keep in mind the long waits, but they do take your cell and have an app that will let you know where you are in queue so that you can roam locally.
It was located across the street from our hotel.  It wasn't a long wait even though the place was packed.  It was kid friendly, the staff was friendly, and the food was great.

LOVED this place!  Just got two eggs and some bacon. Hubby got the piggy omelet. Both were fantastic. The place looked new on the inside, but had a historic presence. Local flavor. Very friendly staff. Perfect breakfast spot!!  Lunch menu looked yummy though too! Must stop for NOLA visitors!

We had the trifecta, the Bananas Foster and the French toast as well as the peacemaker with shrimp boogaloo and cornbeef hash. We tried all the BENDICTS, quite a lineup. bloody Mary on point. Must visit, it won't disappoint.

Great food, great service! I had the Trifecta and it was amazing! I couldn't choose which Benedict I wanted so this gives you a sample of the top 3: grilled shrimp over a fried green tomato, pulled pork and fried chicken.

Extremely popular, had to wait over an hour for brunch. Nice that you can get drinks (bloody's, mimosas, etc.) while you wait, but drinks were expensive. Once inside the atmosphere is good, and the menu has a lot of unique options. We got a few of the egg's Benedict combinations. Overall food was just average (kind of bland was a comment made about multiple dishes). Although the breakfast potatoes were a hit.

Staying nearby and preparing to catch a flight in 2.5 hours, my girlfriend and I luckily had time to sit down and have breakfast at the Ruby Slipper. I ordered the Eggs Cochon and together with the Fried PeaceMaker Po' Boy from Acme, it created one of the best culinary days of my existence. No stranger to crab cakes egg benedict, this dish raised the level on what I want in a brunch entree. As I type this, I just wish I could go back. If you have a chance to visit, make sure that you do. It is worth it!
Usually a bustling place for brunch, but they can handle the traffic. Good food, can get noisy when busy.
Long wait, but well worth. Chicken St Charles is amazing! Would recommend one of the others outside Magazine for less of a wait.
The fact that they have so many options with biscuits and poached eggs. From fried chicken to the ridiculous pork on the Cochon. Book ahead via yelp and save yourself an hour wait.
The chicken St. Charles and peach Bellini were wonderful! There was quite a bit of a wait but I appreciated the NoWait app they have to make reservations. Servers were friendly and food was great.
Super busy, but delicious bananas fosters french toast. Loved that we could check in early using the yelp app.

I don't think the pictures does the food justice because it's 10x better than what it looks like in picture! First off, I think they make their coffee just right! The wait was 30min for us and well worth it! 

Recommend: chicken and biscuits. It was amazing! chicken was tender with a great batter. Also, the bananas foster was the best. just the best. My fiance and I are not fans of sweets for breakfast, but it was soooooo good! Service was also fantastic!

This restaurant is well run , and has great customer service. The Bloody Mary was just ok. They do not have Tabasco which is essential to a good Bloody Mary and essential in any New Orleans restaurant. The food is very good. I had the Eggs Cochon  which is pulled pork over biscuits with hollandaise. This was very good. My wife had the chicken St. Charles , which was fried chicken on a biscuit with Tasso cream sauce. This was also very good. The cheese grits are very weak. No flavor and cheese just sprinkled on it. 

Overall, I would recommend this restaurant.  It has room for improvement, but stick to the main dishes( not sides) and you will be pleased.

Well worth the wait! Checkin on Yelp, to put your name on waiting list, love it! So now for the food, best eggs Benedict I ever had. Wow.. had the chicken one and the corned beef. Absolutely the best.. go there.. worth the calories. Very long wait. Great service. This is definitely a place you want to visit when I'm n new Orleans. Gives you a sense of the local flavors and all during brunch. The fried chicken in my eggs Benedict was as good as any local place that only specializes in ONLY fried chicken. True gem of a place, keep up the great work!!

Food was good, at least until my wife found a live, baby cockroach on her plate. She thinks it crawled on from the counter. Not sure which is worse; thinking it came from the counter (and wondering what else is crawling around in the non-public areas of the restaurant) or thinking it came from the kitchen.
I was the early so I beat the wait.  Food was prompt and delicious.  Fresh made food, I'd be a regular bit the commute wold kill me!
We been here 3 times already for "Brunch" in the 5 days of our first time visiting NOLA. Worth the wait time! Everything we have ordered from here has been delicious.

"Over. Rated!" *clap clap clap clap clap*

Assuming you live in an area with decently good brunch options, I see no reason to wait for Ruby Slipper... unless you desperately craved brunch in New Orleans for whatever reason.

Croque Madame: sad and poorly executed. The brioche bread was dipped in an egg batter which came out overcooked and dry. The fried egg was undercooked - the egg whites by the yolk were still translucent and raw. Seriously??

Migas: decent but forgettable.

Eggs Cochon: decent and tasty. The housemade buttermilk biscuit was nothing special.

French Toast: like the croque madame, the brioche bread came out overcooked and dry. The fruit compote topping was nothing special.

Our waitress was friendly enough but it took forever for our food to come out for whatever reasons... even after we were reassured that "the food was on the pass and should be coming out any minute."

The food was great. I had the St. Peter fish meal. The only thing... there were so many flys and gnats in the place. I constantly shooed them away and the two second that I wasn't waving at my food... a bug got in it! It's worth it if you feel like shooing the bugs off constantly

We ate breakfast here 2 days in a row. The service was just as awesome as the food. The ruby slipper mimosa and bacon bloody merry is a must. The chicken st Charles eggs Benedict, bananas fosters pain Perdu, the cheese grits, all amazing!!!

Ordered a few sides and none were spectacular. The biscuit was a bit hard and the maple butter was too sweet. Cup of fruit was almost entirely melon. Corned beef hash was pretty good, but was sitting in greasy in the bowl so it dripped everywhere. If I go again, I'll try something else.

Stopped in for the first time for breakfast and I'll be back. I recommend adding your name to wait list via yelp app before going to drastically reduce waiting in line outside of restaurant. We sat at the bar and our bartender, Julie (lady w/blue hair), was excellent. I ordered the Shrimp Boogaloo Benedict to share with my wife and we weren't disappointed. It was a generous portion size which was an added bonus because we didn't need to order anything else. I also had one of their award winning Bloody Marys and it was one of the best that I've had.

A great Sunday brunch. We made it to the restaurant around noon or so and only had a 20 minute wait, which was more than enough time to get an excellent bloody mary from the bar and enjoy the weather on a bench outside. (Sidebar, when they take your name, they also get your digits, and then text you when the table's ready. Technology!)

BBQ shrimp and grits were choice, as was the big ol' biscuit that came on the side. I never turn down extra starch. Everyone at the table was more than satisfied, and we took a bloody mary for the road and spent some quality time staring into the river and contemplating life. All in all, a pretty alright Sunday.

Food was excellent, the place was crowded and noisy as heck, but my server just sucked. He was so ready to go home, and I sat at the bar, practically right under his nose. When I let another passing waiter know I didn't even get the drink that I ordered and that my waiter was uninterested, he made it up for it and very friendly.
Sheena was our server; she was so kind ! We had the Bogaloo Benedict ! Everything was so fresh !

Wonderful brunch today! One son ordered a croque madame, which he devoured even though he's not much of an egg person. The other ordered a Louisianne omelette, which is a shrimp and thyme omelette. I think he ate the shrimp out of it when he started getting full. Can't blame him. It also included an excellent pancake, half of which I stole. 

I think I ordered best: they have several takes on the traditional Eggs Benedict, and I couldn't decide between the Benedict Cochon (a barbecue version) and the Blackstone (a bacon and grilled tomato version). Fortunately, you can order a "Peace Maker," which allows you to have one of each. It turned out to be a good combo. 

The Eggs Blackstone has a terrifically crisp tomato, which may be the best use of a tomato I have ever experienced. I don't even like tomatoes much. Add in some perfectly cooked bacon and a poached egg, and it was a taste that made me feel smarter for ordering it. 

But, being in New Orleans, there was a decadent side that I just couldn't resist. That Eggs Cochon (French for pig) should probably give you a hangover if there were such a thing as food karma. It was wonderfully rich and flavorful and chewy and had just the right density. I had to force myself to quit eating it a couple times so I would have time to enjoy it. Now that I'm writing about it, I may have to go back tomorrow for more. 

Coffee was nice and strong, as coffee in New Orleans tends to be. There's no need for a Starbucks here - I don't think I've seen one, now that I think of it. The coffee all over town is better and less expensive than Starbucks anyway. Have a couple cups so you avoid the temptation to lapse into a food coma after your dining experience. 

Yeah, I've definitely talked myself into going back tomorrow.

I went to the Ruby Slipper based on Yelp's recommendations. We got there 5 minutes after it opened and were lucky to get a table. We ordered the southern breakfast and the special - red velvet pancakes. The southern breakfast was just ok. Eggs, bacon, and biscuit were good, but grits, sausage, and fried green tomato were not. Grits and tomato were lacking flavor. The red velvet pancakes were pretty bad. The white chocolate ganache was chunky and the pancakes were....just blah. After we ordered, we overheard our server tell the next table not to order anything off of one side of the menu. (The side we ordered from) He said you could get the same thing at IHOP. I wish he would've told us. I guess they do better with some of their specialty items, not traditional breakfast fare. I'll give them one more chance, but I'm not optimistic.

Visiting NOLA for two days. Ate here twice!  Fun take on Benedicts is probably the most unique offering. The biscuits were great. And the Bloody Mary was Yumi. We had one with bacon and without. The bacon wasn't too big of a difference-just had bacon inside the cup for garnish very cool atmosphere. Expect to wait at least 15 minutes or more. Only open til 2 so they stay pretty busy.

This place is a staple and is worth waiting for.  There's always a line so just grab a drink and hang outside a while, no big deal. My group ordered eggs Cochon and the st. Charles chicken. Soooo good. My double Irish coffee was on point also. Service was perfect. Will be back soon!
Bananas foster french toast delicious. Pancakes could, and did, clog up a drain. Busy place and service maybe a bit haphazard as a result, but certainly not bad.

Food was great and very tasty. The crowd out front was enormous and a little off putting. This place is popular and gets super busy. I was able to use the Yelp waitlist feature and stay at home until it was time to check in. I definitely recommend! When I came in person, I still waited about 10-15 minutes out front. They have a cocktail waitress that brings drinks over to people waiting. That part was great and she was very friendly.

Minus two stars because our waitress at the table wasn't the nicest. Apparently you can't keep menus because they only allow food orders to be placed once. Not that I planned to order more than once but there was a side my dining partner was thinking about getting. It's not allowed so we didn't get anything extra after our orders were placed. Also giving away an extra chair at my table to someone who asked for it is "frowned upon" behavior. I've never heard such ridiculous restrictions put on patrons of a restaurant. I'll definitely be going back but will try a less busy location.

If you like big hearty breakfast with morning libations in NOLA, this is the spot. I had the croque madame which was really fresh and filling. The creamy vanilla spiced chai was sooo good. Fun, loud, and lively and totally worth the wait. Use yelp to put yourself on the waitlist!!

Wait was super excessive. We signed up with the no wait app which quoted a 45 minute wait at 1040. We weren't seated until after 1 pm and when we got our food it was cold. Our server was very nice and at that point we were just so hungry we ate our food and left. The food was fair but would have been much better hot. I'll chalk it up to peak hours.

It's warm, happy environment sets the tone for a good day. My first time here I made the mistake of ordering from the "lighter fare" portion of the menu as it was more bland than anything else. If you're going to make a trip to Ruby, it's best to go all out with your choice of entree. Their bacon Bloody Mary is a must!

We really enjoyed our food experience at Ruby Slipper for brunch. It was packed, so make sure to get their app and make a reservation. This is where I discovered the BRANDY MILK PUNCH, delicious and The food was AMAZING!!!
We were super impressed with the food. The Eggs Cochon were amazing. We had to wait a while but it was worth it. Gotta try this place. The Banana Foster Pain Perdu was also very tasty.

Very upsetting to find a fly cooked into my pancake.. I'll keep writing because the review requires me to, but I really don't have anything else to say about this place. It's safe to say i won't be returning anytime soon...

Service was wonderful. The waitress was super kind and catering to us. Food was more than expected for us but it was supremely delicious. The chicken was crisp and light - an incredible complement to the egg Benedict. I recommend this to anyone in NOLA.
It's my first time in New Orleans, great breakfast. The three little pigs. Waitress was very nice.

I have one complaint and only one complaint about the Ruby Slipper: it's so popular that it took us an hour to get in. Once we were in, however, I've probably never had a better southern breakfast!! Devin kept us smiling with his service and jokes, we had a nice bro moment bonding over me banging my hot girlfriend. *fist bump* Food was amazing; rich sauce, amazing candied bacon, flaky biscuits, and the bloody Mary's were on point. 

Definitely recommend checking them out if you're staying uptown of French Quarter. Call ahead or leave your name and come back though.

OMG!!! If you have a chance to try the weekend special this week you must try the Catfish St. Peter!!!! It is to die for. If you aren't a fan of runny eggs just take it off, you won't miss it. Love, love, love it!

Had Sunday brunch here on out last day in NoLa and it was one of the best meals we had the entire trip! Wait was about 30 minutes but a double Bellini and bananas foster French toast made it well worth the wait. Wait staff was attentive and it was a short wait for our food. If you're looking for a great breakfast place, this is it!

We went to The Ruby Slipper as our final meal in New Orleans before heading to the airport, and let me just say, YUM. I did my Yelp research before ordering the Catfish St. Peter and I'm so glad I did because that dish is everything your taste buds could ever dream of. The catfish was seasoned to perfection, the grits cakes were GIGANTIC and full of flavor, and topped with poached eggs and mustard hollandaise? What more can you ask for? Grilled shrimp and veggies, that's what. Go here. Get that. You're welcome.

The ability to reserve your place in line through Yelp was SO clutch, but make sure you check in with the host/hostess once you arrive. Also, be prepared to sit anywhere (bar, outside, etc). But let me tell you... it is WORTH IT! The food is absolutely incredible and the entire staff is super friendly.

Good great, service so so. The let a damn  table hopper jump the line, not cool man. The food delivery was just short of throwing the plates on the table. 

Good food is a requirement, good service is a winner, but not found here.

We were in NoLA for Mardi Gras and it was our 1st time in the city. This is one of the restaurants that showed up in our yelp researches for good brunch close to our hotel Sheraton. Went there Saturday morning at 10am. The wait was 45 minutes. We were seated in the bar. Servers and bartenders were friendly and efficient.

I ordered Chicken St Charles ($13) which Is like chicken and waffles but with biscuit (instead of waffle) and poached egg. I found the chicken over-cooked and dry. Double mimosa ($10) was so-so. We also ordered Migas ($11) - like a tex-mex omelet. Thank goodness for Crystal hot sauce - it added flavor and a kick.

Overall it was alright. Nothing really excellent to write about...

I discovered this place through instagram and passed it several times because the line was too long. I strolled by today around noon and my party of four was seated right away. The food was amazing and we all left full and happy. The only negative (if it can even be called that) is there were no drink specials. I will definitely be going back. This is one of my new favorite spots to eat.

I just want to say I truly enjoyed the food,  drinks and service. Friendly, welcoming and inviting from the hostesses to the wait staff.  Bloody Mary's on point. Chicken st. Charles was really good.  Jacus our waiter was so attentive and just nice. Very good customer service skills. A definite must come back again type of restaurant. I would have had a pic but i was just greedy which goes to show how good everything was.

This place has an amazing menu. The line/wait was outrageous which proves it is a popular spot. I was alone so I got right in and sat at the bar. I ate off the brunch menu and it was delicious. I was in and out in less than 45 mins.

For breakfast, I always love a good Benedict. And Ruby Slipper had such a variety of benedicts, all of which sounded wonderful, I was in heaven. Fortunately for me, they give the option of mix and matching so I was able to choose two to try. I chose the Eggs Chocon (w pulled pork) and the Chicken St. Charles (w fried chicken). They were both delicious but I did like the st. Charles better. Although I'll usually go with the fried chicken. 

Service was good and friendly. I sat at the bar so there was no wait. But there wasn't a wait for a table either. I may have just been there at a good time. 

If not for my strict "don't go to the same place twice while on vacation rule", I'd be back the next morning for sure.
Use the Yelp waitlist feature. We only had to wait about 20 minutes. The food was wonderful. We tried several different types of eggs Benedict. All were great.

WORTH THE WAIT! 

I ate breakfast at the canal street location yesterday after leaving the magazine location due to the line literally being out the door. I am a very impatient person at times and did not want to wait but I was convinced that it would be worth it so we hung around. It was about 20-25mins until we were seated at the bar where I was greeted then served by Gina. I ordered the short stack with chicken sausage, which was great as I do not eat pork, eggs and their home-style potatoes. I had a cup of tea to cap off my meal as anything too sugary would have been a bit much after pouring a mountain of syrup on my cakes. 

Needless to say I loved it! I will definitely be returning there again as I am eager to try some of the many options they offer on their menu. My advice to anyone who is a lover of breakfast food would be to be patient, you will be satisfied after you taste the food.
Delish is an understatement. Decide to try this place based on reviews and I'm glad we did. The food was awesome and the staff was very attentive. If you need a great brunch place, try them out!
Get the eggs Benedict. Any of them. They are truly phenomenal. They seem to always be on a wait here but it's so worth it

Crowded almost all times of day, especially peak hours, so be prepared to wait in line, although it does move fairly quickly. Mostly tourists. Bustling atmosphere with a typical NoLa style menu of heavy, but delicious foods. I got the eggs cochon and could only eat half of it. Delish! There are so many other dishes I'd love to try.

Friendly service.

Phenomenal experience. Place was super packed on a Wednesday, but we were seated in 20 minutes. Our server was excellent and the food was perfect. Fried chicken on a biscuit?  Yes!  Shrimp and fried green tomato on a biscuit - why not?  Sooooo good. I highly recommend this restaurant.

No wonder how popular this place is. Our experience was truly a blast!!! We avoided the long wait on a Saturday morning by using the app NoWait (please go download as you will thank yourself later). As we arrived, we were immediately seated at the bar. First of all, service was top-notch. The girls who worked at the bar and who took our order didn't downgrade their passion and smile because of how busy they're. The wait for our food was a bit long but I didn't really mind because I was sipping the best peach Bellini. Then as the food finally came we were completely blown away. We got the stuffed french toast and egg Benedicts. Both were super good. Would recommend to anyone who wants a hearty brunch while visiting NOLA.

Get it together! We couldn't get a party of 8 on the app. So, we sent someone ahead of time. They gave us spot in line with a time slot. They were ready for us 35 minutes early. They put us back in wait time and then never had any intentions of seating us together. The food is great, but we came here for a special occasion where we had a large group and we ended up having to separate our group as we were trying to celebrate!!!!! Then to add insult to injury the table next to ours opened up less than ten minutes after being seated and they refused to let us move our party together.... Also, the hostess was nasty and didn't try to work with us at all...
This place must be good because Nick Jonas was here to dine. Our hotel is right next to this place so we came for breakfast and lunch.
Delicious! The wait was a little long but was totally worth it! Had the Chicken St Charles. Finished a majority of it but was not able to finish it.

We waited 30 minutes to be seated which is fine for a weekend. But once we sat down, we had to wait over an hour for our food. When it finally came, we weren't impressed. Very disappointing since so many people recommended it. It was a lot more hype than substance and the servers need to work on their customer service.
Cochon biscuit and fried chicken biscuit mix and match - DYNOMITE!!  Terrific food!!!

On my past two visits to New Orleans, we never found time to fit in a meal to the Ruby Slipper Cafe until my recent family trip here. We came as a party of seven and they had estimated the wait time to be 25 minutes so we were happy to wait. In actuality, we ended up waiting a whole hour and 15 minutes which was pretty frustrating but the meal did make up for it. I got the Eggs Cochon which was DELICIOUS. Don't let your hunger fool you though, both my brother-in-law and I ordered the Eggs Cochon and all of us only ate half of it. I would recommend sharing it with someone.

I was looking for a nearby breakfast place and found this awesome cafe. I played it safe and ordered their signature dish which is the Eggs Cochon. It meet all of my expectations. The eggs and pulled pork were perfectly proportioned. The flavors of the eggs and seasoning titillated my taste buds. Staff was friendly and courteous. The decor and atmosphere represented New Orleans well. I will definitely return when I am back in town.

There has been a line out the door every day we've been here so I popped across the street this morning to try it out. I was solo for breakfast and immediately got a spot at the bar. The bartender was friendly and helpful. I ordered the eggs Blackstone, one of their signature Benedicts, which has roasted tomatoes, bacon, and hollandaise on a cat's head biscuit. The biscuit and tomatoes were perfect and the whole dish was satisfying and well-seasoned, but my poached eggs were a bit overcooked. I would definitely go back again though, but before 9am if I was with another person.

We found this restaurant after searching for a breakfast/brunch spot. After arriving & seeing the line outside, I was glad that we reserved our table prior to arrival. The visit could have been better, however, our waitress (I think it was Caitlin...) was soooo dry & unhelpful & unattentive & her attitude was just ugh!
