The food, on the other hand, was good. The omelette was plentiful, the pancakes were hot & the atmosphere was nice.

Loved this place. A Nola must.
The service was good and the food was excellent. I thought it was going to be a tourist trap but it wasn't at all.

This place has a great vibe to it. I got the eggs cochon over grits and it was delicious. My sister had the bananas foster. She had a hair in her meal and sent it back and it took forever to bring another one. I was already done with my meal when she finally got hers. The waiter was very apologetic and friendly so it was fine and when her meal came out it was twice as big as the previous place. Besides the hair incident the food was good and I would go again just hope my meal is hair free next time.  Sorry I can't give you guys 5 stars but a hair in your food can do that.
I'm giving a "5" only for the spicy Bloody Mary.  The food was really only marginal though.

Peacemaker with st Charles and corned beef bennies. Corned beef was my favorite. Horseradish was light and not spicy. 

I would have liked more spice to the meal. Flavors too subtle.  fried chicken was crispy but needed a touch more salt. I added dashes of hot sauce to everything and it was good. 

Poached eggs' texture was very good. Very light. 

Mimosa was strong and not very sweet.

We felt like the forgotten table.  No menus for a while when we sat down at 1030am on a Tuesday.  It was busy but there were tables that sat empty for short stretches. We waited 30+ minutes for our food even though every table around us got their food- even tables seated 15 min after us. Waitress was nice and apologetic about it but that doesn't really help when you're really hungry and every other person you see is eating. We're thinking it was the cheesecake stuffed French toast order that held us up.

Very large place.  We were seated fairly quickly for a Saturday morning.  Food took a long time to come out after ordering.  I had one of the specials (Migayas) with a side of corned beef hash.  It was just okay.
Best steak and eggs I've ever had.  Nice moist biscuit and wonderful creamy grits.  I think I ended up eating here for breakfast at least four out of the six days I was in town.
Had the 'eggs and bacon' slider, oomph! The lady had the signature eggs cochon and oh my was it amazing.. We'll be back!
No matter what - don't miss this place!! I went for breakfast and had grits that were to die for. Super fun environment ... Wish I would have bought their tshirt!

Ordered St. Peters Catfish, it comes over fried cheesy grits on blocks with spinach and cherry tomatoes. Pretty good. My other half order cochon, their signature dish. It was alright, I think it's better over fried fritz instead of a biscuit.

Let me preface this by saying it was Mardi Gras weekend but man oh man was this some bad service. Had a party of 9 and even after getting the "please check in, we're getting your table ready" text, we waited an additional 45 min for our table. We finally get sat but our party was separated. My group (table of 6) waited for 12 minutes before our server even came over to ask if we wanted drinks. Some of us ordered Bloody Mary's and some ordered coffee. We then waited for her to come back and get our food order. About 20 minutes later, she comes back saying she forgot to put in the coffee order, so it'll be a few minutes. At that point, we worried she'd forgotten to put in our food as tables around us were seated after us but fed before. We then ask her and SURPRISE SURPRISE, she's forgotten to put in our order. I spoke to two managers, a white woman and a tall black guy. They came by, were polite and asked to wait 10-15 min for our food and were comp'ing our meal. We waited 25 minutes before our food came. When we called over the male manager he used curse words and got extremely annoyed that we were complaining. The food sucked balls and we will NEVER return and will deter folks from coming here. I wish so badly I had the names of the male manager and our server. They SUCK.
This place had awesome bloody marys & such a good vibe to it. Please try to make it if you're in town. My hotel was right down the block so it was convenient & just a few blocks from bourbon street.

Third time at a Ruby Slipper.  They have great breakfast food with a New Orleans flair. The price is right, as well.  This place gets crowded so make sure you go early.    This was a new location for us.  We thought it was great, although I felt a little rushed by the server.
Awesome food and drinks too. Service was great and had a great experience here. I can see why it is very busy and has multiple places all over town.

I visit New Orleans about once a year, and always come here.  I was there for the Essence Fest this year and was nervous about how long the wait would be....it was long.  However, the staff was all great and didn't seem flustered or frustrated with the large crowd.  We went 3 times during our stay and each time the food was great.  I usually get the Banana Foster french toast with chicken sausage.  It was great.  I ventured away from my norm to try the catfish St. Charles, and I was so pleased.  I really enjoy the food and the staff here!

This place is fantastic. We actually ended up coming here three times while we were in New Orleans- the breakfast was just that good. My husband loved their various eggs Benedict, particularly the Cochon version. I really enjoyed the French toast and the double chocolate pancakes, as well as the eggs and potatoes.

The line does get very long, very early, but if you download the NoWait app, you can check in and get in line in advance. We did that after our first visit and were able to time our arrival perfectly to have no wait on our next two trips.
Good coffee. Delicious breakfast sandwich  with tasty bacon and fresh biscuit.
Fantastic. Great service. Easy menu. Not pricey. Great food. Chicken St. Charles is amazing!

Well, after three days of drinking on a 32 bar Pub Crawl with 40 people from all over the county for my buddy's Five-O, this is where we called in a success.

With only 10 of us still standing we gathered her at noon on a Tuesday, had a couple of mimosas, bloody marks and told secret stories of our drunken weekend.

The food is awesome here, I had the Cochon Eggs Benedict and it was hearty and Delish! 

The mimosa was giant and the coffee was hot and not to acerbic. 

Great place for breakfast!

This place seems like it's always packed, the good news is you can get the nowait app to put yourself in line for a table.
Super easy to use and very efficient.
Oh and the food was great! I liked that you could combine two types of eggs benedicts.
Get the app to get in line.

Thank god for the doubles mimosas because the lady behind the bar is a terrible employee. She forgot everything and the boy working with her saved her multiple times and she was crabby. My wife ordered an eggs bene dish and the eggs came out over hard. We don't ever send food back but c'mon. She was obviously irritated we sent it back even after we showed her the egg. They did fix it right away but then there was something hard that resembled plastic in my wife's mouth. Umm wtf? My shrimp and grits was ok. Shrimp was small and few - grits had no flavor. Thank god for mimosas
go hungry and in a group so you can share (order everything off the menu :) everything is delicious. its a bit of a wait but  definitely worth it.

Only because we didn't order their signature stuff

It's really hard to find breakfast places in NOLA. I think because that's when most places are closing lol. From the Yelpers review, download the No Wait app. It let's me put my name down and tells you how long the wait is. It was 30 mins for us, so we finished getting ready and walked over. There was a long line at the hostess stands. I was waiting to check in and then a guy comes out and calls my name and says my table is ready. This app is awesome!!! Only if they had this in SF!

We sit at the bar and our waiter is very nice. 

SHRIMP BOOGALOO BENEDIC Gulf shrimp sautéed with pork tasso, served over fried green tomatoes & a buttermilk biscuit, topped with poached eggs, finished with Coubion sauce-the shrimp and sauce was really good, but the biscuit was a bit dry. 

BRIOCHE FRENCH TOAST
Served with applewood-smoked bacon

FRENCH TOAST BATONS
Brioche French Toast sticks tossed in cinnamon sugar,
served with applewood-smoked bacon

My friend just said french toast and it was just plain old french toast, but the ones we saw on every table was huge and fluffy! That's what we wanted to try, but opps we weren't specific. 

Got a side of corn beef hash-it was dry and a bit bland. 

They have so many locations and it's always busy I heard.

When we walked up to the restaurant...the street was crowded. I thought people were insane for crowding the street just to get a seat inside. Fortunately for us, it is a hot day outside and a waiter (Alberto) announced that he had an opening outside for 2 people. I quickly raised my hand. Talk about zero wait time! 

Alberto was amazing! He knew the menu like the back of his hand and he did not disappoint!!! He recommended the St. Peter fish. Soooo good! Alberto even talked to a couple that was smoking near our table while waiting for their name to get called. My boyfriend complained about his food because there was a simple mix up with the eggs but wanted to keep his dish so he did not have to wait for a new plate. Alberto assured him that he would have his new meal back in less than 5 minutes. It came in 2! Paying for our meal was a breeze! The waiters walk around with iPad mini. 

I highly recommend this restaurant. Great job Alberto!

Love love the place. Yelp waiting list was excellent. Was told to check at a certain time then waited another 10mins for our table, not bad. Our server was Jacus? Sp? Great service, great food, excellent coffee. Was gonna go back again the next day but it was a longer wait time :(

Like you, I came here and all I can tell you is that all the 4 & 5 star'ers are telling you the truth... This is quite the happening place with locals and visitors.  Located on Magazine Street only a couple of blocks off Canal, it's totally worth coming even if you have to wait a little to be seated because you won't be disappointed.  I called to make reservations but it's a first come first served place with ample space and movement.  

Things to have:  Chicken St. Charles, Croque Madame, Bananas Foster Pain Perdu, and anything with Benedict involved.  

Everything is good about this place from portions to prices!  And with a place so crazy busy, the service was excellent.

I was hoping after over an hour wait time the food would be worth it. It was! Once they text us for the table, we sat at the bar. Good view and good food! I had the best banana pecan pancakes ever! But my main dish was the corned beef Bennie. Got caught off guard by the dill, but it was good. My buddy had the gulf St. Peter and cleaned the plate! Four stars is because the wait time was ridiculous.
Service wasn't good. Asked for my eggs over medium and they were super runny. My husband ordered St.. Charles chicken- dry and eggs were very over cooked. Was hoping to enjoy it
Great food, servers and atmosphere.   Lots of food choices so repeat visits are a must.   Need I say more?

Expensive for breakfast but it was worth it! We are here twice and I would eat here a thousand more! I had the oatmeal bowl as well as the pancakes and both were phenomenal. Get here early if you don't want to wait in line!

Good brunch place ... nice cocktails - screwdriver was good and we had the chicken st Charles which was very good and also the French rotary with sweet potato gravy ... def a good option to try it out if u r in Nola . We tried this for a location on magazine street. Would recommend that location.
Service was excellent!!! Food was amazing. I will definitely come again the next time I visit NOLA.

Came here for breakfast  had the Costa Rican breakfast and it was DELICIOUS!!! Definitely one of my favorite foods I tried here in NOLA, make  sure to add avocado and chorizo. The service was great even though we had to wait a little bit to be seated, it was definitely worth it ;)

Ruby slippers is like a fast food brunch spot in my opinion. 

The food is ok, nothing really stood out too me. 
I think it's owned by New Orleans natives. 

If you need a QUICK breakfast or brunch I world say give them a try!

Delicious and quick! Grits were exactly what I expect them to be in the South. It was packed for Sunday brunch but the waitlist on here worked perfectly. Got on the list, walked up at the designated time and was shown to my seat. I'll definitely be back soon!

The food is cheap and that's a plus. The service is good. 

Essentially, the food seems like hotel buffet food, which I think it must be given its proximity to the Pelham. We had breakfast. The potatoes, biscuits, and bacon all tasted as if they were served out of a chafing dish rather than cooked fresh. 

The same for the coffee. 

I only wrote this review to warn others against putting too much stock in the other positive reviews. I felt like our expectations were too high as a result and disappointed by the result.

Worth the wait!!! Seriously! And if the wait is really long, they'll serve you breakfast booze while you wait!

All the food is amazing. I recommend The Southern Breakfast. Simple, but amazing. The biscuits are huge. The coffee is delicious. Best bloody Mary's I had the whole trip. Wonderful service.

My advice: Use the APP to get in line before you go for breakfast.  There was an hour wait on Sunday morning.  Using the app we waited about 20 mins.  Now to the food. WOW.  We settled on a variety of Benedicts: My SO had the special which was shrimp/sausage in a nice spicy red sauce(I don't recall the exact name of it).  I had a chicken version and a shrimp with a fried green tomato.  All three were excellent.  The biscuit providing the base was exceptional  The toppings were also very good.  Nice amount of heat on the spicy version, well seasoned chicken filet and a very tasty sauce on all three.  
We also had a couple of breakfast drinks: A peach bellini/mimosa combo for the SO and a very well done bloody mary for me. 

Overall this as an exceptional meal and will be on my list when I return to New Orleans.

If you are looking for a very good breakfast, download the app and head on over to Ruby Slipper.

Please note this review is limited because three of us had pancakes (seemingly pretty standard fare, but not here!).  These were not simple pancakes, they were more like giant fluffy flavor-filled goodness.  I ordered the pancake flight, which I highly recommend.  The bacon is crazy good, but the candied bacon was outstanding.  I had some of my wife's "southern breakfast." A southern breakfast sandwich with a traditional biscuit (which not every place has down there).  Someone at your table has to order one of these (split it if you have too).  Great vibe with a terrific staff.  One of the many great spots on Magazine.

I ate St. Patty's day brunch here. I had the cornedbeef and cabbage with mashed potatoes special. Hands down, the best cornedbeef meal I've ever eaten. EVER. It was so good, I took a picture of it after one bite. 

As for the other details you might care about...there was a wait, don't remember how long. We opted to sit at the bar to speed it up though. It was loud. The bartender wasn't the friendliest and the food took a while to arrive. Overall, if the cornedbeef hadn't been so amazing, this review would likely be like 3.5 or 4 stars at best, but an amazing meal trumps all else.

I went to the Magazine St. location. Gosh, this place feels so nice. Bright and friendly and just feel-good, for no reason that I can pinpoint. 

I was there for breakfast. HUGE helpings. Everyone in my group loved their meal. I had one of the benedicts (over house-made corned beef hash. The egg was done perfectly I ate every bite. I figured I was doing enough walking on this vacation to work it off. Ah, who am I kidding? I would have eaten the whole thing anyway because it was so darn good.

Service was efficient and attentive. Our guy was humorous and helpful. They were very busy but totally in control. It's nice to feel like you are in good hands when you know they're being stretched by a big crowd.

This place is worth the wait. And, if you download the app "Nowait" you can get in line virtually and show up when your table is ready. It worked perfectly.

Ruby Slipper is hands down THE BEST breakfast in NOLA. And, it's fairly cheap! Try the fried chicken Benedict and the biscuits with honey butter-literally amazing!  It's a must visit each time I'm in town.

First of all the location is perfect, right on Canal st near our hotel! The food was great, prices weren't too high, and the service was exemplary. We are usually pretty good when we are away from home about going to lots of new places so when the kids said let's come back here tomorrow that's when I knew this was a 5 Star place.
Delicious food and friendly service. We had the salmon and goat cheese omlette topped with hollandaise. It very well may be the best omellete I've ever had.
Good breakfast food!  You have to try a side of the candy bacon its a must if you visit.  Friendly wait staff, if you are looking for an excellent spicy bloody mary this is the place!
This was the perfect place for my husband and I. We both shared 3 different versions of their eggs Benedict and enjoyed their iced coffee. Great place,  great service hope to come back next time.

The food and atmosphere was awesome for a brunch. The Bellini was delicious. The wait was slightly long but I think b/c it was a very good place to eat. I would definitely recommend this place a must eat at.

Brought my cousins, who were in from out of town, for lunch and we have a wonderful time.  We began with cocktails and the food was AMAZING!  The wait staff was nice and the Bloody Mary's were fantastic.
The Catfish St. Peter was a great pick. Bloody Mary's are good as well while we waited.

Very popular brunch spot. It was great that yelp had a waitlist app to cut the wait time. We arrive and waited about 10 mins after waitlist. Place us packed.  The peacemaker was great and shrimp and grits was delis

The ruby slipper has been on my list of restaurants to try in N.O. The food was ok nothing spectacular. The portion of grits was so small but good. The bacon was really skimpy but taste ok. The French toast was ok too. My daughter had a kids pancake which was huge and taste ok. The food wasn't bad but nothing special about it. Not worth a long wait and thanks to the check in on yelp we didn't have to wait long. We checked in while still at the hotel.

Some places you just have to pass on in New Orleans, This is not one!!!!!!
It's not the New Orleans style I was looking for but there is TASTE in their
Food which said alot!
Another breakfast must stop. Great service, tremendous food and tasty Bloody Mary.

Got breakfast here a few times on a work trip to New Orleans and it was awesome. Fun lively open space and friendly service. Got the shrimp omelet first and the salmon benne second. Both were good. Simplified and got the southern two egg breakfast the third time, which was actually best!

Came here and put my name down for a 55 minute wait. You can access the bar to get drinks started while you wait, and my New Orleans Iced Coffee was a bit too icy, but otherwise well made. After being seated, a friendly waitress shortly came to take our order. My dad got the Eggs Cochon, my sister the Chicken St. Charles, my mom the Bananas Foster French Bread, and I ordered shrimp and grits. We also ordered a side of Fried Green Tomatoes. They were the perfect texture: crispy breading and mushy tangy tomatoes. 
Cochon: Eggs perfectly poached, hollandaise well made but nothing to write home about, pork was tender and juicy. 4/5
Shrimp and Grits: A little light on seasoning, but the grits were gritty and creamy at the same time. 4/5
Fried Chicken: Chicken was well cooked, but a little less crispy than I'd like. 4.5/5
French Toast: Served with the elusive crispy-chewy bacon to cut the syrupy sweetness of the dish, this plate was the highlight of our brunch. The rum flambeéd raisins added to the complexity of the dish. 5/5
One major complaint I had was the biscuits. Too spongy, not crusty at all. If the biscuits had been better made, the first 3 dishes would have definitely turned out better. 2/5

Overall a great brunch place. I'd return for the French Toast and iced coffee alone!
As fabulous as everyone says and worth the wait. Do yourself a favor and check it out.

This place was convenient, super clean, very funky decor, and, best of all, had GREAT breakfast!  

The omelette choices were varied, and all a bit different from your normal omelette fare!  The coffee was yummy, the ingredients in our breakfast all fresh and super tasting.  

This isn't your cheap breakfast spot to just have an egg and coffee.  The food is a bit more elaborate and unique!

Most disgusting place I've been to! Very very dirty! The container the coffee creamer was in was so dirty inside! The coffee cup was also dirty inside! Food came cold & the chicken salad sandwich was sour!! The walls, ceiling & all the vents in the restaurant are caked with decades of dust & dirt! I can only imagine what the kitchen looks like! Gross! The owner should take pride in his/her business & clean thing up! If this place is voted best in New Orleans, than were in trouble!!

We stayed at the Pelham which is just above the Ruby Slipper, so we ended up coming almost every day we were here.

The food and drinks are outstanding. We tried a few of the benedicts and would ABSOLUTELY recommend the Eggs Cochon and the Smoked Salmon. We also tried the French Toast Batons and some pancakes and both were good.

The only reason we gave it 4 stars and not 5 is because the service isn't great. That and on the weekend, make sure you plan to put your name down 1-2 hours before you hope to be seated. That being said, you can add your name the waitlist here in the Yelp app which helps.
I had bananas foster French toast for the first time here. I thought it was great.

While visiting NOLA, I was told I had to be sure to have breakfast at Ruby Slipper Cafe. I ate breakfast here on Wednesday morning around 9:30. There was a bit of a wait when I arrived, but not too bad. I only waited about 15 minutes or so. Once seated, I ordered an omelette with potatoes and a pancake as the sides. Everything was fresh and delicious! My friend had Eggs Benedict and she said it was amazing as well. I wish I could remember which Benny it was she had - but the biscuits looked amazing! I highly recommend Ruby Slipper Cafe. Great eats. Quick service. Friendly staff.

One thing worth knowing before coming here - use the app available on the website to save yourself a lot of wait time!

Their various Benedicts are the stars here.  The one with fried chicken is truly the best.  I thought the house specialty Eggs Cochon was just ok.  French toast batons were out of this world and the pancakes were light and fluffy.  I wish I could drink their coffee every day.

Sneak away from the insanity of Bourbon or your hotel's "breakfast" buffet and you'll find this cutie diner-style brunch. The eggs sardou was delicious but not filling at all and, in my opinion, overpriced. My dad, the french toast guru, said his breakfast was "not the best he's had"  but still enjoyable.

The food just did not live up to the hype and the 45 minute wait to sit outside and sweat while eating wasn't worth it either. My Spanish omelette was good, but not great. I would try another brunch place especially if you are expecting prompt service. There were several times during my visit that our table waited on water for more than 10 mins. Also, the bartender was extremely rude. Instead of being greeted with a drink menu we were yelled at "WHAT DO YOU WANT?". Overall, I was extremely unimpressed.
Great food. Great service. This is a MUST do while in NOLA. Chicken St. Charles is where it's at. Michelle was the best!

Great place for brunch. Highly recommend the Bacon Bloody Mary that they are famous for. The bananas foster french toast  is a must have. We ate outside and had great service. All in all our group loved the food and felt pricing was fair since the food and service were so great. Would highly recommend this place and will definitely be back if we come back to NOLA.

I ordered the Peacmaker, which allows you to split between two entrees.  On our waitresses recommendation I went with the pork Cochin eggs Benedict & the fried chicken Saint Charles eggs Benedict.   A great recommendation!    Both were amazing. I highly recommend.  My wife had to drag me here as I did not want to wake up early & was not that hungry.   It was definitely worth waking up for.  One of the best breakfasts I've ever had.  Their mimosas are really good too.
Loved it the staff was friendly and the food was spot on.  Besides where else can you get a mixed drink with breakfast oh ya!

From DC. I had a bruch in here. I ordered egg cochon, Vanila coffee and buttermilk pancake. Pretty much enjoyed here. My server was awesome. But I feel like the majority of New Orleans restaurant was quite outdated and not clean.

Eggs Benedict. Our waiter noted that diners can mix and match these, so the two of us tried four different types of eggs Benedict. Such a fun and tasty way to do breakfast/brunch for those who love eggs. They're filling though, you'll either want to walk the entire city afterward to burn off the crazy calories or just nap away...

Good breakfast spot. Very busy. Sat at the bar. I ordered the shrimp and grits. Was ok. I don't eat shrimp and grits normally so its not what I was expecting. I was expecting a different kind of grits.

Polite staff. Clean.
Everything I could ask for in a meal. The food was fresh and AMAZING! I ordered the Chicken St Charles with scrabble eggs cheese eggs. It was a good time!! I would definitely go back.
Great breakfast/brunch place. Everything on the menu is delicious. I would recommend their specialty dish the Eggs Cochon. The chicken St. Charles was also very good.
Pros: Good food, decent atmosphere and great drinks! Cons: long line/wait, building is old and dusty needs a facelift.

After the long wait, drama from scammers on the street. Finally my family & I got into The Ruby Slipper around 2pm when they closed but it's okay. The food was alright they did run out catfish and some of us wanted the St. Charles plate :-(. I'm from Louisiana and I just can't understand why people can't use seasoning or butter. Those who ordered grits at my table did complain that they were not good, how do you not put butter in the grits? Moving on, I had the BL2T which was okay as well, the challah bread was too thick for me I just ate the bacon and the tomatoes. The fried green tomato on the sandwich could've been fried crispy it was soggy on my poor little sandwich. The mimosas are TERRIBLE! I'm not sure what type of champagne was used but the mimosa literally tasted like beer, the sangria was better I would advise you get that. The service was good! Les you are awesome buddy he was very nice to us, overall my visit to the ruby slipper won't be my last but I'm not rushing to get there again.

Definitely recommend! My boyfriend and I sat at the bar and were immediately greeted. All bartenders working were extremely friendly and the service was excellent. 

The bartender asked if it was our first time there. (It was) He gave us a few recommendations and was very patience with all of our questions. 
 

We both ordered "The Peacemaker" with Cochon and St Charles Chicken. Outstanding! The pork was so amazing and so was the fried chicken. 

I would definitely check this place out!

Joined the waitlist on Yelp and got seated within 15 minutes of checking in on a busy Sunday afternoon. The Chicken St. Charles was amazing and so was the stuffed french toast!

Just one of their huge mimosas will have you feeling pretty buzzed by the end of your brunch. Overall, love this place and will definitely come back next time I'm in NOLA!

I have always wondered why the line is so long at this restaurant and we decided to try it on this trip and now I know what I have been missing. The food is good and the service is awesome. There are always a lot of people waiting but there is a hostess that  seats people and she has it running like a well oiled machine. Take some time and see for yourself.

Was told to be sure and visit the Ruby Slipper while on my first trip to NOLA and I was not disappointed! The hostesses (Kaitlyn and Nicole) seated us quickly and our waitress was great! The eggs cochon was yummy and so was the made to order omelet. This place is worth the wait!

Delicious brunch! The hubs got shrimp and grits which he said were phenomenal. I got an omelette which was delicious. We used the waitlist option on Yelp and didn't have to wait when we arrived for our designated time. I would definitely recommend this place if you are visiting and looking for a good brunch.
Food was great service was fast we will be back!! Thanks I love this place we went back twice during our trip!! They have a. Very cool app to cut down on wait time

The best thing about this place was that the bar keep made my favorite breakfast wakeup call. Red Bull & OJ and only charged me for an OJ. That was awesome. As far as the food, it was sub par. They make the french toast with french bread, it was not my thing. Also the bacon was tiny. If not for the RBOJ it was a two star at best place.
The Bacon Bloody Mary was the best! The wait time although not the best. The food was somewhat worth the wait but never again will I it two hours for brunch.

I was visiting NOLA and of course using Yelp to decide where to eat and I made sure to bookmark Ruby Slipper Café.  My friend and I used the Yelp app to get on the waiting list and I am glad we did because the wait time was over an hour and so were able to add our name to the wait list before we left our Airbnb.  By the time we got there it was about another 20 min wait because we didn't want to sit outside, but the food was everything!  I ordered the Bacon Praline Pancakes with a side of eggs and cheese grits.  The sweet and savory flavor of the pancakes was perfect and there was enough to last for 2 more meals.  Highly recommended!

We had an okay experience at The Ruby Slipper. The dining room was loud and cold. The stuffed French toast and candied bacon were great, the florentine omelette was fine, and the chicken sausage was hard as a rock. The servers (we ate at the bar) did a fine job. The food, in general was overpriced, so we won't be back. There are dozens of other options in the CBD and FQ.

After waiting for over an hour when we were told it would be 40 minutes (and even when we checked in we were told 5 more minutes, but 10 minutes later it was no that was a mistake it'll actually be 15 more) I was ready to write a scathing review. 

But then the food came and it was delicious!!  The Migas were the best I ever had. The red velvet pancakes were divine. Everyone's food was amazing.  The service at the table was prompt and good.  

It's worth the wait!

Great spot. Our server was friendly, informative, and attentive. My bacon breakfast sandwich was very tasty. The biscuit was fantastic! Fair prices, good quality. Would definitely come back to this establishment!

We went to the Ruby Slipper on a recommendation from the concierge at our hotel and loved the food and atmosphere so much we came back twice! Hands down best breakfast/brunch I've probably ever had! We came as a group of 6 and everyone else felt the same way.  The bananas foster French toast is like nothing else! And the pulled pork eggs Benedict! OMG

Great experience despite long wait. Good food, good service. Had the chicken fried bennies.
Good biscuits with cinnamon butter. Some of the best grits around.

The drinks  are the reason for the five stars !! The Bloody Mary with Bacon was delicious. Food was good I was a little disappointed with the shrimp and grits. I felt I have had better but they were okay. I would say out of what we had it was the drinks and the Benedict's along with good service that made the visit worth it. If you haven't been definitely try it for yourself.

3 stars leaning on 2.5. The food is fine but if you wait hours for this you are a dumb dumb aka fucking idiot. We got the chicken Benedict. Somewhat tasty but the chicken was dry AF. Mimoosa was fine and the banana pancake was short on banana and taste oooooh burn. 

There is plenty of other amazing food in New Orleans. If not for the wait this would be FINE but you can spend your time more valuable elsewhere
This place is worth the wait!! From the Mimosa to the Bloody Mary, Irish drink, delicious! The food, the service were also great!!
Best breakfast place in New Orleans!  We loved the eggs benedict (there are so many different ones!).

Great food. Long wait so I would suggest making a reservation thru yelp 40-45 minutes before you plan to eat to avoid the long wait time. My baby had tge Southern Breakfast which was so so. They forgot his toast and then when they brought it out it was white and not toasted. The meal that saved it was the Eggs Cochon and the Chicken St Charles. Definitely will be back.

We went here BOTH mornings for breakfast because it was so great. My fiancé had the Eggs Cochon and I had the bananas Foster French toast. Everything was absolutely amazing. Quick service and no wait either morning (Friday and Saturday morning). The iced coffee was a little too bitter for my taste, but was the only moderately disappointing piece of either experience. Try the pig candied bacon!
I was so disappointed! Everyone talked so highly of the ruby slipper so I gave it a try but I will not be going back!

A breakfast treat you would be upset to miss.   Everything is so good.    Weekend pineapple upside pancakes.... WoW!  
I go every time I'm in New Orleans.

Here's what we got for brekky:

- Cinnamon pancakes with raisins inside:  You don't really need syrup for this since its sweet in itself, but it was OK.  They serve 2 huge pancakes (big enough they almost fill the plate).  It's a pretty heavy portion.
- Bananas Foster:  It comes with 3 big pieces of French bread doused in sauce that's totally full of brown sugar = heaven! Cut banana pieces are on top with 2 pieces of bacon as well.  The portion was pretty heavy and the edges of the bread were pretty hard to chew on, but the sauce they use is fantastic.  It's sooo good!

The portions here are huge, and actually good for sharing.  I love the breakfast bar, its such a good option for those who are on the go!  Unfortunately we weren't too impressed with this place, but glad we gave it a try.  We weren't thrilled with our waitress either, she didn't care to serve us.. but the bus boy was on point!

Excellent breakfast. Great friendly service !!  Poached eggs done well, exactly as I ordered them. Sat at the bar and watched tv while reading the paper. Not rushed to leave even though there were folks waiting. I will go back next time I'm in NOLA.
Waited for 1 1/2 hours but Well worth the wait! The bacon Bloody Mary is amazing and the stuffed French toast was well worth calories

Tried out the Ruby Slipper for breakfast and was not disappointed. Enjoyed sitting outside sipping coffee while watching the city begin to wake up. At the recommendation of our waitress (who was super nice and friendly), I tried a chicken St. Charles and a smoked salmon bennie. Our waitress promised me she had it just last week and wasn't trying to just up sell me--and she was right. It was delicious and left me full and satisfied. And, if breakfast and the service wasn't already good enough, I was offered a coffee to go (always a plus without me having to ask). Thoroughly enjoyed stopping here and already planning a return visit.

The Ruby Slipper sure does serve up a good breakfast! Came here on the recommendation of our hotel concierge when we inquired about good biscuits and gravy - I had a craving, and when in the south, I think they're a must! 

Well, I was a little disappointed when we got there and there were no biscuits and gravy to be had on the menu, but oh well, can't hold that against The Ruby Slipper, so I switched it up and got their house specialty which was essentially a pulled pork Benedict served on a homemade biscuit. Wow it was amazing! And huge! I finished it all, even after I was full.

My boyfriend got a bacon breakfast sandwich with fried green tomatoes served on sour dough. I tend to think breakfast sandwiches are a tad boring, but not this one! This one was absolutely delicious, and the fried green tomato gave it that little something different.

We were seated at the bar, both bartenders were very nice, just not all that aware. We ordered our food which took over 30 minutes, and there was really no acknowledgment of that. Additionally, while waiting for our food I ordered a cappuccino which we were charged for but never came. I told them at the end that if they could make it to go, that would be fine. They were not very apologetic and while they did make it for me, they still charged us for it. Maybe they were just having an off day, because as I said they were definitely both friendly guys. 

All and all, great place, would definitely recommend - just not if you're looking for biscuits and gravy! Ha.
Delicious brunch! They do not take reservations so get there early or just be prepared to enjoy a few mimosas while waiting! Brunch is delicious and very well priced!

I was sooo glad to find this place close to my hotel on my last trip to New Orleans after eating at the worst cafe ever. The eggs cochon were ah-mazing! There is some kind of poached egg magician on staff. It was one of the most perfectly poached eggs ever over shredded pork served with the most most flavorful grits (cooked in cream) that I've ever had. It was a busy place, but totally worth the wait!

Great food. The only problem was everything on the menu sounded so good, we could not decide what to order! Really great breakfast with authentic New Orleans flavors. Fried green tomatoes were superb. Biscuits yummy. Attentive service. Nothing bad to say about it. Get on the waitlist before getting there via mobile phone. We only had to wait 10 min once we arrived. Others waiting 1 hour +.

This is my absolute FAVORITE place. To Die For!!!!  The service is outstanding and warm and such hospitality and the food - haven't had anything I'm not in love with. Justin is our favorite, we come back every time we make it to New Orleans. This is a must on your foodie stops!!!

After an early flight out of SA the group I was with were in desperate need of some breakfast and mimosas,it was a bachelorette party,don't judge. I had found this place prior to our arrival and loved that it is a local place because who wants to eat at a chain restaurant on vacay? So as my fellow yelpers advised to use the no wait app I put our group of six in line.It was a a short walk from our hotel.I checked in and we waited for about 10 mins and we were seated.There was definitely a wait it was Friday morning though. They had a good selection of food I opted for the regular French toast and bacon,and of course a mimosa. The food was great the bread was thick and and not soggy. The mimosa was good but I don't think the one glass was really worth $10 IMO.The others with me had everything from chocolate chip pancake,steel cut oatmeal, and the cheesecake stuffed French toast.everyone was really pleased with the food and I was glad I suggested we eat there.the only reason I didn't give five stars was the service was just okay it took a while to get our drinks and our waiter only came by when necessary.But I would definitely return.

My goodness, there actually IS somewhere in New Orleans where they know how to make good french fries!  These were simple and darn near perfect in both taste and texture.

My burger was less amazing, simply okay.  I wish they'd opt for making a skinnier diner-style burger rather than the larger pub style, as I think it would fit the atmosphere better and I prefer them, but that's personal preference.

I'll definitely be back, but not for the burger.

8:00 am on a Monday, we just missed having to stand in line. I ordered the BBQ shrimp and grits: not reminiscent of BBQ sauce at all, but a strong rosemary and white wine flavor. Came with an enormous and delicious biscuit. Wish there was a meat free benedict.

The food was somewhere between mediocre and poor.  My wife's Pancakes were raw in the center, My eggs were overdone and rubbery.  You had to know somebody who knew somebody to get a glass of water.  It took 45 minutes to get to the door, then  another 20 minutes to be seated, 20 minutes for horrible waiter service..  The we had another 30 minute wait for our food/  Orders were wrong. Sides did not come and had to be begged for.  It made me wish for an egg McMuffin.  Go any where else even if there is no line.

Very good breakfast. The place is busy. Either expect to wait a bit or sit at the bar as I did. Tables do turn fast tho. Friendly staff and delicious food. The 3 pigs omelet with a cake is certainly a reason for me to return.
First place we tried when we got to town. Service was amazing. We went back two days later for breakfast and was just as good. Food was average but the service is what got me the 5 stars
I got the eggs Benedict with pork (can't remember name). It was amazing. One of the best brunches ive ever had. Definite must if you're in New Orleans

Great brunch spot. The food is really tasty, we had the fried chicken and the pork benedicts and loved them. The portions are huge (including the mimosa, which I ended up taking to go). Nice staff and a useful texting/check-in process as well. Would gladly return.

Loved this place! Downloaded Nowait and got on the waiting list before we left our hotel. Only had to wait 15 minutes which was great. The cheesecake French toast is awesome! Great place for breakfast and brunch!

This was a decent brunch restaurant. I had the pancakes and corn beef hash. The hash was great, the pancakes were so-so. We had to sit at the bar because it wasn't a ton of space available and it would have been a longer wait. The bartender was a nice guy. He let us try the Bloody Mary, which wasn't that great. My girlfriend had the Eggs Cochon, which was good, she also had the Chicken St. Charles, but it wasn't as good. A couple things I didn't like were, there were a bunch of flies and they didn't have a huge selection on the menu for food and especially for drinks.
Food was good service was great had the French toast wasn't anything crazy but was ok wait is long suggest you check in on waitlist so when u arrive u walk right in
A great place to start your mimosa Sunday Funday!

Went here for breakfast at 11am on a Monday and had a 45min wait. 

The menus was fairly extensive with a lot of unique options for any breakfast lover. 
I ordered the - bacon and egg sliders.  The mini burgers were pretty darn good but the massive short fall was the cold fries they served me. I had to send it back and they replaced it fairly promptly. The fresh fries made a world of difference! 

My girlfriend ordered the omelette and she had issues with her meal also. Her omelette was undercooked and had to send it back also.  I remember the waitress noting that the kitchen has a tendency to do that. She had it replaced and enjoyed the rest of her meal. 

In defense of the restaurant, they were jammed with people that morning so I understood. 

The service was great - coffee constantly refilled, water topped up, and plates cleared. 

Overall a good place to eat. Just be sure to quality check the food a little and don't be afraid to send stuff back if needed.

I'll admit, it could be my inability to stomach 7 days straight of Cajun and Creole food when I'm used to eating lettuce. Or the 30 minute wait. Or eating outside in the hot humidity while it was also raining, and a large truck had toxic fluid spewing out of it. To be honest? the food was so rich it just made my sister and I feel sick. I tried the BLT with fried green tomatoes- though delicious it was way too rich. Bottom line: don't go to this place if you're looking for a healthy meal!

Yum!! Party of 9, no reservations. Waited about 45 minutes to be seated on a Saturday afternoon. While we waited some of us order mimosas and bacon bloody marys. I'm not a fan of bloody marys, but it definitely was worth it here. I believe I'm a fan now because of this place. Blood Marys were awesome. Just amazing. I had ordered the Pulled Pork Po'Boy which was great. Again I wish it had more of an authentic New Orleans food on the menu.

We searched for a place that is closed to our hotel and found this nice place. We waited for 20 minutes before we were seated. Our server was Jackie, a very nice waitress. She made us very comfortable from the beginning. If I would go back again, it would be mainly for the service.
However, my only issue with this place is the food. It was good but not great. Nothing really special about any of the dishes we ordered. Everything was cooked perfectly but there wasn't anything special.
This place deserves a try for sure. I would love if they can replace the chairs.

I love this place, so I always try to come when in town.  It's super popular but it's worth the wait for the creative and delicious fare.  This time I had the Migas (scrambled eggs with onions, tomatoes, cilantro, pepperjack cheese, spicy chorizo, garnished with sliced avocado, pico de gallo, chipotle sour cream and crispy tortilla chips). Seconds please!
The mimosas were a great start to my day as well, haha.

Well this place was top notch. Especially for breakfast.

They have a specialties section and everything on it is fantastic.

Mimosa and Bloody Mary with a real punch.

Glad we tried This on a recommendation from a fellow Yelper.

First decent meal we have had in NOLA since getting here yesterday! Mimosas were on point. I had the chicken Benedict (sorry, I don't know the specific name, there was only one though). Fantastic fried chicken, poached eggs were a little overcooked, but not unbearable. Sauce on point. Everything was just completely delicious. Service was great, very friendly. Downfall: the wait to get a seat! That is the only reason why I would not do a 5 star. But the food was definitely worth the wait.

The food was quite mediocre at best. After reading all the wonderful reviews we decided to give this place a chance. The biscuit had an aweful after taste. Very much a tourist trap. IHOP would've been a better selection. Hopefully if you decide to go your experience is better than ours.

I had really high hopes for this place. I mean who doesn't love a good southern breakfast at a cool restaurant with a  neat message...

We arrived at 11:00am on a Monday and like all the other reviews there is a wait. Our wait was only 20 minutes so it  wasn't that bad. They do have a way to check on your place in line through your phone so that was kind of neat.

Once we were called we were shown to our spot. Our waitress promptly came up to our table to get our drink order. She might have been annoyed or overwhelmed but we couldn't quite put our finger on it but she did not have the most welcoming demeanor. She was nice but something was off.

They are VERY pushy about the Thanx app which was slightly off putting  as we were told multiple times about it. We looked it up but you have to enter a credit card, no thanks.

The food is reasonably priced and we had an idea of what we wanted. The waitress brought our drinks and asked if we needed suggestions to which we said we had an idea of what we were going to order and she didn't seem to happy about that which was odd. However, I was torn between two entrees and asked her advice. My fiancé got the Southern Breakfast and I ended up going with the Bam Bam Biscuit. They were both good...I mean just good. There was nothing spectacular about either.

Our waitress seemed to cheer up towards the end of our visit. 

I mean overall it was an average experience. I just expected so much more. I was slightly disappointed but the food was decent.

Stepped into the new location this morning (12/3 - soft opening) - very nice atmosphere, nicely decorated, very roomy. They have a big wrap around bar for plenty of single dining/imbiding & plenty of tables. 

The service was awesome - so friendly & personable! 

& of course the food - sooooo tasty - I got the Europeon Omlet - Portobello Mushrooms and Brie accented with fresh thyme - so tasty!! The grits were yummy! I danced! (well, in my chair) (happy tummy, you know!)
So good! Gillis (or Gill) was seriously the nicest waiter ever!  So kind and attentive. Also their biscuits are the bomb!! On my next trip I would def come back
Friendly staff and tasty food. Super busy place, but well deserved. Unfortunately, is not terribly vegetarian friendly, but build your own omelette saved the day. Portion size was worth it.

Great brunch/lunch Saturday of Decadence Festival. They appear to have a festival menu, so I can not comment on the extent of their regular menu. However, to be a limited menu, it was great! We began with the shrimp romelaud served with fried green tomatoes. The shrimp had an excellent flavor as well as the breading of the friend green tomato. The homemade biscuits are some of the best I've had. All of their breakfast options are fresh, hot, and tasty. And any establishment that will serve me red velvet pancakes places a smile on my face! I will return!

popular benedicts, can split as the peacemaker option and select any two such as the shrimp boogaloo one and fried chicken one.  while proteins not the best, the slathered, bacon chunks sauces are tasty.  party has to be arrived fully before seated.

Everything about this place is amazing! Get the Trifecta if you don't know what Benedict to try; it's terrific!

Service: A+
Drinks: A+
Food: A+++

Amazing food. Came here twice during my trip. The first time was to meet up with a friend and he really wanted to eat here for Saturday brunch. 45 minute wait at 11:30 so I was a little grumpy because I was starving. He convinced me to stay and we were seated in exactly 40 minutes. It was well worth it. The food was AMAZING. I got chocolate chip pancakes, my husband got an omelet, my friend got french toast and grits, and his friend got the bacon and egg sliders. All of them were fantastic. So good. So filling. I hate leaving food behind but I was so uncomfortably full (but in the best way). Decided I had to come back on Monday AM with my group. There were 10 of us so it was a bit of a wait but once again worth it. Everyone really enjoyed the food. And the prices are definitely reasonable. If I come back down to NO I will definitely be eating here again.
An hour wait and then another wait after ordering. Good food, wait staff was good. Recommend putting your name on the wait list BEFORE you arrive.

Cool breakfast cafe and a must see for your trip to New Orleans!!!!  Food was excellent and service was great as well. Only drawback would be a very long wait to be seated as this is a tourist draw. I recommend using the call ahead option as the wait is usually over an hour.

Quick seating for a Saturday morning though there were only two of us. The ruby mimosa is amazing. My husband wasn't impressed with the pancakes nor I of the bbq shrimp and grits. But the order of fried green tomatoes were pretty good. Will try it again when in town but try other dishes. Service was friendly!

Outside bloody Mary's are smaller and more expensive than inside! Wait! 

Eggs Benedict (poached egg) was not even close it was basically hard boiled.

Aside from Hansen Sno Bliz which just blew us off the charts, Ruby Slipper was our fave among our different foodie stop in a a recent 4th of July weekend visit to NOLA. This is just way beyond your usual breakfast and brunch place. They made my kids simple chocolate pancakes with egg and bacon to a whole new level. The bacon was the best they've ever had. I got the egg cochon while my wife had the salmon counterpart. Both were phenomenally superb! Service was also very efficient and friendly. This place truly deserves the "Best bfast in NOLA" distinction in the numerous guidebooks we used. :-)

This place was awesome!  Amazing food.  Great service.  It's busy so be prepared to wait.  I still don't understand why with all this southern food I still can't find a place that serves sweet iced tea!!

Waited 1hr 25 mins. To eat brunch. Decided on this restaurant given the crowd waiting outside. Really glad we waited. Our meals so delicious! I had the Costa Rican, my husband had the peace maker-combination of 1 eggs cochon and 1 chicken st Charles. Both meals delicious, However next time I would order the Eggs Cochon.

I have to be honest, I was reluctant to come here. My first experience at the Ruby Slipper wasn't memorable, for me that means the food was "meh". 

Two of my girls convinced me to go anyways.  We went on a Sunday afternoon for the brunch. This place was crazy packed.  I over heard some customers complaining that they have been waiting for over 2 hours for a table. The host asked if we would mind sitting at the bar area together. Considering the 2 hour table wait, we took it right away! So we were actually sat within the first 5 minutes of getting there. (Winning!) 

I had the St. Charles, a fried chicken egg bendict. I'm not a fan of runny eggs so I got mines scrabbled. The chicken taste just like someone's grandma fried it. The muffin was pretty dry in my opinion. Portions are huge, I only finished half of my meal. Over all the food was good!
Not bad. The service was good. Very pleasant staff. Food felt slightly rushed, likely due to the busyness. Overall was one of the better breakfast meals I've had while visiting New Orleans.

After a loooooong wait, I ordered the French Toast. It was very thick bread, with no flavor other than the syrup. I would not recommend. The rest of my party all ordered the shrimp & grits!! They LOVED it!! This is one of those times it didn't pay to be different

This restaurant was within walking distance of our hotel and was highly recommended by locals of New Orleans. We waited for about 45 minutes to get seated but it was worth the wait! (I'd recommend going around the time it opens because this place is really popular) I got shrimp and grits and my father got pancakes and bacon. The service was quick and the food was delicious!

What a find! We were staying at a hotel across the street and noticed the lines on a Thursday morning-a good sign!
Our server,Caroline,was great-answered questions about the menu and her recommendations.
The lady sitting beside us had the Benedict with fried chicken-when my partner saw that ,he was sold.
I did the Benedict with corned beef hash.
Both dishes were phenomenal! We also did a bacon Bloody Mary-WOW!
We are believers,and will definitely return on our next NO visit!

Wonderful customer service. Had the smoked salmon omelet. It was fresh and delicious. Hash browns were over cooked a bit but tasty nonetheless. 
You can get on the waitlist before you get there to reduce your wait time. Little to no wait for 1-2 ppl. A little busier today due to the 5k race.

So during our stay in New Orleans we had breakfast three out of the four mornings here. If that doesn't sum it up I am not sure what else would. We loved the atmosphere here! The place was packed each morning we went, which is always a good sign. The service was very good as well. I ordered the Costa Rican Breakfast two of the three mornings with scrambled eggs and avocado. Yum! Was perfect. I also ordered a breakfast special the other morning which was awesome. My fiancé is a breakfast sandwich guy so he had that all three mornings. The chicken sausage and home made biscuits made the sandwich! I 100 percent recommend checking this place out while visiting New Orleans.

We were staying nearby for a convention and wanted a breakfast option close to the hotel and the Ruby Slipper Cafe was the perfect fit. We found it through our yelp app. 

I saw a previous comment that there was a line out the door - we went on a Thursday morning and arrived around 8:15AM and there was no line but when we were leaving about an hour later it seemed to be forming, and for good reason.

The breakfast menu is diverse and has something for everyone. 

I ordered the BYOO (build your own omelette) and was very happy with the size, taste & fresh mushrooms that they used. I ordered a side of bacon and it was perfectly crispy. 

Our coffee cups never emptied as the server was very attentive and came around frequently to make sure we were satisfied. 

Overall the service staff was professional, polite, and helpful. When the runner came with our food he knew exactly who ordered what so none of the typical "who has the...." which is fine but nice to avoid. 

I highly recommend this as a breakfast option if you are in the area. We may go back tomorrow.
Fantastic breakfast not as much of a wait and go enjoy some New Orleans authentic food and great service

I ordered the smoke salmon Benedict which was served semi warm, the salmon was dry and over cooked. It had good flavor but wasn't really that impressed with it. I am not too sure I would go back here.

We decided to try the Ruby Slipper this morning after receiving multiple recommendations. We arrived at 9am on a Saturday (Labor Day weekend) and were told the the wait for six people would be 30 minutes. About ten minutes later the hostess called our name, however we were still waiting on half of our party. I had read the rules of the Ruby Slipper's wall while waiting and noticed that they wouldn't seat incomplete parties, but figured I could finagle my way around that rule. Nope! I couldn't do it. But the hostess told us our name would remain at the top of the list and when our friends arrived we would be the next ones to be seated. This is a pretty nice arrangement for what could have been a frustrating wait if we had been bumped to the bottom of the list.  My first order of business was coffee. It was bold and hot just the way I like it. My second order of business was the food. I ordered the corned beef hennie which you would think would be made with corned beef hash, but it was surprisingly made with brisket.  I can't complain it was pretty good, but bring your appetite because it was enough  food for two people. My hubs ordered the shrimp omelette. I mean who doesn't have some shrimp when in New Orleans? My mini-me ordered the chocolate pancake. She surprisingly finished her meal which means it must have been good. All in all we enjoyed our experience and recommend you try this place.

Big pros:
-Food is outstanding!
-Great value for the money!
-Breakfast all day!
-Strong cocktails with the option of bringing them to-go!

Big cons:
-They do not take reservations.
-LONG. ASS. WAITING. TIME.
-No indoor waiting area.
-"Breakfast all day!" means until 2pm, when they close.

Our party of five arrived around 11:30am on the Thursday of Mardi Gras weekend. (I know, I know.) We were told it would be a 25-minute wait, give or take. We weren't seated until 1pm, and no one give any updates before then of how much longer we'd be waiting. (Plus, we had a pregnant lady in our party, and we practically needed to cross the street in order to avoid smokers.)

All told, our meal was outstanding. I had the Bananas Foster Pain Perdu, and if I were on death row with a scheduled execution in the morning, I might want this as my last meal. I'm salivating thinking of it right now. Friends got the BBQ Shrimp & Grits and assorted omelets and each one of us was stuffed to the gills. Bloody Marys (Maries?) were VERY strong and my to-go mimosa was about 90% champagne. So needless to say, we were quite the happy bunch!

If the wait hadn't been so long (with zero indication of when our table would be ready), this would be a five-star review. Service was wonderful, food DELICIOUS, ambience great, but the crazy wait...not for me.

Man this place is a mad house! We came here around 10ish and the line was super long. We were 97 on the waiting list with a wait time of 1 hour and 45 minutes! Crazy!!!

We had the fried chicken eggs Benedict, scrambled eggs and bacon, and ice coffee. Can't go wrong with scrambled eggs and bacon. The chicken fried eggs Benedict was delicious. Chicken wasn't greasy or heavy.! It had a nice light batter. 

Great experience! Best time to come around is before 9am or after 12 noon. At least that's what I've been told.

Yum yum yum!! The banana fosters french toast is DELISH and should not be missed. It is very rich, and would be best shared between 2-4 people. My boyfriend and I shared it and loved it so much, although it was a bit much even to split between 2. I wasn't crazy about the other dish I got, but I was so happy with the french toast that I can't complain. Plus, they have a good amount of vegetarian options which is awesome! It can be hard to get a seat here, so come early!

Loved it.  Went down to New Orleans for Mardi Grad and found this little place.  Great atmosphere, delicious food and fantastic drinks.   I had the Catfish St Peter and the bf had the Bananas Foster French Toast.   Both were fantastic.  Service was great and all the staff were friendly.   Definitely recommend

I'll make this quick. Yes, this place is super touristy and the lines are usually out the wazooo but the food is tasty.

Most of the breakfasts menu is super Indulgent and leans heavy on southern cooking. Grits, biscuits, gravy, you know the usual suspects.

I was however delighted to see a few healthier options. I had the Skinny Migas with a side of bacon. The dish was good, eggs were well cooked bacon was tasty and best of all I didn't burn through all my calories for two days in one meal. 

Servers were friendly and attentive and the food come quickly. You won't find me here on my own I would return but I would stick to the healthy side of the menu.

We ordered The Trifecta (Shrimp Boogaloo Benedict, Chicken St. Charles and Eggs Cochon) and the Grilled Fish St. Peter. The Shrimp Boogaloo Benedict was my least favorite. The Chicken St. Charles was kind of dry. The Chochon pulled pork was tender but too saucy. The grilled fish was pretty good. Fish was cooked well but nothing special. 

Use Yelp to check in to avoid the long line.
Awesome place for brunch. The wait is long if you dont go early but it is definitely worth the wait.

Just got out of here for breakfast.  We thought we timed it pretty well with the nowait app.  We waited an additional 15mins at the door after our name was called.  Once we were seated we ordered right away and literally waited about 45mins for our food.  Food was alright/avg.  I got the salmon omelette and wife got the Florentine.  The breakfast potatoes were delicious and I wish there were more.   Was the food worth the wait?  I'd lean towards 'no'.  Will probably find a different place tomorrow.
Friendly, crowded place. Lemon-curd-stuffed French toast: excellent idea, bad execution. Soft bread barely egged or cooked or hot.

As a foodie or someone who loves to eat good food, this is not the place to visit. Food taste like high school kids are cooking the meal, microwaved, box or frozen meal thats been heated up. They had the worst tasting cat fish and grits and poorly cooked benidicts. Sorry, I rarely write bad reviews but after this experience and noting how high this place is rated, I disagree highly with these high rating.

Not disappointed at all. This food was phenomenal. It was  so good that my husband had to tell me to stop eating because my face was telling that i was full! 

This was fried fish and fried grits. I'll definitely be back as this has been my favorite meal.

Wow! This place is amazing!! There was a line of course but the staff were all very pleasant and welcoming. We sat at the bar and service was great. Now on to the food. I had the eggs cochon, it's pulled pork on top of a split biscuit, with poached eggs and hollandaise sauce on top. Truly incredible, perfect portion and perfect brunch item. My husband had the migas, and gobbled it up! Then we split the bananas fosters French toast which was the real show stopper! I can't even do it justice by describing it, it is a must have! This place is a gem and definitely worth the wait! Will recommend to anyone traveling to Nola

I stayed at the Best Western St Christopher next door the weekend of Jazzfest and went to this place with 3 friends for brunch before the concert.  I'm from Orange County and I have had numerous top tier brunches and I would have to say the Catfish eggs Benedict dish with artichoke and bacon was one of the best dishes I've ever had.  We loved it so much we asked our waiter if he could thank the chef.  Instead he actually brought him out for us and we were able to thank him ourselves!  (Maybe it was the booze but we did it). He was so appreciative and cool about it.  I believe his name was Will. It was a while back. Will, if you see this please go on Master Chef! You will crush the competition!!
Went here a few months ago and loved it. Just remembered to post a review but I will definitely be back.
Love the breakfast menu here and the atmosphere! Drink selection is awesome!  Bananas foster pancakes are great!
The service was friendly and fast. I had the Bananas Foster French Toast. It was amazing. I arrived early so it wasn't crowded but I headed it gets crowded there.

Thanks to the no wait app via yelp our wait time upon arrival was fairly short! The high top seating is overall slightly awkward, it's like one really long family dinner table, only with a bunch of strangers. The ruby slipper mimosa is a good choice! I forget the exact name of the plate I got but it was the option of choosing two different egg Benedict's. I went with one pulled pork and one fried chicken, both were alright and The side of potatoes was bland. Overall, probably not my top choice of breakfast places in Nola.
Amazing food and amazing server Michelle!! She even recommended a few other restaurants for us to try out during our stay in NOLA. Ruby slipper definitely a must!

Like with many restaurants in New Orleans this one has consistency problems. First visit we had omelettes with French toast, chicken sausage and multi grain toast. All was do delicious we couldn't wait to go back.

Second visit we changed up to a BL2T (was all tomato, no bacon) and I had a Costa Rican breakfast. I asked the server for tortillas to go with that, he thought the fried plantains were tortillas. All had little flavor and left much to be desired.

Our last visit we decided to go with the original orders. The omelettes were not as good, bread tasted like saw dust and the sausage was completely different and hard as hockey pucks.

Service always good and friendly. Drinks are yummy. But we'll be trying some other breakfast spots instead of wondering if today's breakfast is going to be good or not.

Unfortunately - I had to give it a single star to be able to write the review. However, I wouldn't even give it a single star. The eggs Benedict were ice cold - probably not even made fresh. The stuffed blueberry cheesecake french toast was just a sugar cream concoction put in between two pieces of french toast - it was completely inedible due to how sweet it was. On top of that, you can see the presentation of the eggs Benedict - a biscuit with a sole poached egg on top - nothing else to add any flavor or anything to it. 

Now, my sister is an artist and was able to make it taste so much better - see the before and after pictures. This review was being written half way through the meal - now let me complete it when we got the bill.

We see the bill and we've been mischarged for our Irish cream coffee - when asked, the server told us that most people like it with whiskey so I got that one for you. None of us asked for it but she felt that it would be what we wanted, which it was not. I would avoid at all costs - probably the worst brunch I've ever had.

Where do I start?! We got there about 10am on a Wednesday so we waited all of five minutes for a table (we also sat outside which was nicer because it was way less noisy than inside). I ordered a double mimosa which was AMAZING ($10). Mostly champagne (which I like) and fresh orange juice. I ordered the Puerto Rican plate based in another yelpers suggestion which was OUT OF THIS WORLD. The beans and rice had such good flavor. The eggs were cooked perfectly, the avocado was so outstandingly fresh, not a single brown spot. The salsa wasn't as spicy as I would've liked but that's ok! I think it would've been too much if it had been. My mom ordered just the normal breakfast type platter and even she was in love. It's hard to make plain old American eggs, bacon, potatoes interesting but this place blows it out of the water! We both agreed we would've waited the two hours if there had been a wait.

So, I actually visited 2 of the locations... at the start and end of a recent trip.  The first time I got the chicken st Charles. It was SO GOOD!!! The second trip I went for the shrimp and grits... which were just ok. I just don't think I'm a fan of their grits or all the rosemary on my shrimp. It was a bit overpowering. It was very filling each visit... if I'm in town again, I will go back. Oh the Irish coffee is really good also ;)

I ate brunch here and ended up getting severe food poisoning. I had a fruit mimosa , bbcue shrimp and grits, and a pancake. Between those 4 items, Im not sure what had my stomach doing flips the way they were. However the bar staff were really entertaining and nice. My friend had the catfish with all this tomato and garnish on it. By the time she removed all of the extra stuff, there were two small pieces of fish that was only enough for an infant. The total for what we had was 60.00 but not worth what we ate. The food was very bland and nothing to rave about. I definitely wont be going back to this place. They need to step up their seasoning on the food.

Incredibly popular post-Katrina brunch spot, watch out for huge, rich tasty portions that are completely shareable and blow any notion of heart healthy or diet out the window. Great coffee. Great service with southern hospitality and friendliness even on a jam packed 75 degree sunny sunday. Ordered the super fresh local fish over spinach tomatoes with hollandaise and two giant bricks of deep fried cheese-laden grits. So rich I had to share out the heavy cheesy grits after the first delicious bite. The biscuits were light and fluffy served with a tasty maple butter. Ordered a side af Cajun slaw .. for 3.00 it came out in a scant quarter cup dish, but was so good and seasoned just right. 

Use the Nowait app to reserve your table as this place is crazy packed with 1-3 hr wait times. There are three locations in New Orleans. One of the three off the main drag is not as busy.

Worth the wait!  The food and service were great!

Had the banana, pecan pancakes and they were SO good!  The double mimosas are also a must have!

Be prepared to wait for a table, but they make the bar available with plasic cups so you can drink while you wait!

I was in New Orleans for a conference this March and ate all of my breakfast meals here. Not one was bad. The service is good, the food came out surprisingly fast, and was delicious. My favorite meal was the Chicken St. Charles. I still look back on my pictures and yearn for that meal again.

This was one of the best places I ate at during my time in New Orleans.

Out of the three days we were in town we had breakfast here twice because it was that good. Both times I got the migas which is soo filling and tastes soo good. The first time my husband got the bananas foster pain Perdue and he liked it a lot but he liked Mine better so he ordered the migas the second time we came.  I think this will be our to go place when we are town.

My son and I started our visit to NOLA with the Ruby. We walked up to a 30 min wait. We gave our names and to a seat outside. I've grown to appreciate that if its good it's worth a wait. 

This time it was a mixed review. First the place has a great vibe. The waiter was excellent. My son had pig in a blanket. An omelet that's the star of this visit. My  eggs Blackstone was so so. To much biscuit for my taste. My fault for misordering. Other wise the place rocked.

Yum!!! What a great place! Service was awesome from beginning to end! Fun menu, cool drinks! Coffee drinks, drink drinks.... oh my! Milk punch... get one! They have veggie options, super cool pancake options, stuffed French toast! I had the triple threat Benedict! Yum! Served on biscuits!! We left full and satisfied! Definitely try this place if you're hungry and in the area!!

A must for brunch when visiting NOLA! The Gulf Fish 'St. Peter' is great, not only is the fish and shrimp
craftily seasoned but the cheesy grit cakes are a great spin to cheese grits.  My husband also raved about the Bloody Mary with bacon. We we arrived at 10:00 a.m. the Monday after the NBA All Star Game and were met with a long line down the side walk plus a 30 minute wait. After a quick walk around the area, we returned and were quickly seated. The service is fast and friendly. KUDOS to the Ruby Slipper team!

Don't waste your time. Wait was long,  Food was average, and drinks were disgusting. I would have been happier going to the I hop a block away. Ordered the belinni and it was cheap champagne with syrupy peach purée and a lot of peach schnapps. I couldn't even drink it. When I tried to send it back I got an argument. I never send stuff back and rarely complain about a meal, but this was a HUGE disappointment. I worked in the food service industry for 10 years as a bartender and know what a belinni should taste like. Please, go somewhere else and don't waste your time and money.

I was excited to try this place because of the great reviews that I saw on Yelp!  One of the few places that didn't have a long wait either!  I ordered a traditional breakfast with eggs, bacon and toast, but it was still great!  The eggs were cooked perfectly, the bacon was thick and crispy, and it came with a slice of fried green tomato.  I'm not even a fan of tomato, but the breading and great seasoning made me a fan!  I also ordered a side pancake- it was super fluffy and tasted great!  I'd definitely recommend the iced coffee.  It was slightly sweetened and had great flavor.  If you've got a large group trying to find a place to eat, I'd definitely recommend stopping by here because they've got the seating to accommodate everyone!  The staff is also very friendly and helpful.  Our server even recommended many places for us to take a look at while in town!
Alberto was exceptional and very entertaining. The food was delicious. We will definitely be back.
Visited The Ruby Slipper for a Bloody Mary....it was awesome! Wonderful service from Jake at the bar. Go the Bacon-infused Bloody Mary route. You won't be disappointed!

Wonderful menu.  Something for everyone,  scrumptious frenchtoast and pancakes,  flavorful and spicy migas or Coasta Rican,  and light delicious spinach omelette.   Try the best bloody Mary or have a latte.  Staff is friendly and fast.

Sadly I didnt like this place. I went here on a recommendation and just did not have a pleasant experience. I sat at the bar.

First the service sucked.  I felt very ignored most of the time.  I kept looking for people for this or that and the guy next to me got great service.  How do I know? Because they kept coming back to him to offer this or that. He was even served at the same time as me even though he came in AFTER me and he got his check before me.  FAIL.. I have my theories as to why but I wont say but yeah I guess i wasnt the right....

Anyway, worse than the awful service my food came out cold, like completely cold.  I cant even call it luke warm it was cold like maybe it had been sitting in a refrigerator and warmed up to room temperature.  I dont understand even how a breakfast can come out cold when breakfast food cooks so quick (especially what I ordered).  I ordered the southern breakfast. I mean it doesnt even make sense that it would be that cold from them waiting but I dont understand how the man next me and my order came out together even though he came after me, it still shouldnt have been THAT cold. The grits were were room temp. gross. the bacon was undercooked and floppy and cold!! just straight cold. The fried green tomato was mushy all around.  The more I type the more Im coming to realization, Im starting to think this was someones breakfast from earlier and they sent it back or changed their mind and the cafe left it sitting there and decided to serve it to my black self later. The biscuit was room temp and the worse this is what really did it for me the eggs were cold.  HOW ARE EGGS COLD??!!!! when they supposedly just came out of a skillet, clearly these were not.  Even the coffee wasnt hot it was just warm.   


I was so disappointed in this place.  After coming here on recommendation and it getting great reviews I did not have a good experience.  A shame too because I love breakfast but not this one. Im glad to see majority did not have my same experience.  As for me I wouldnt  return or Ill try to other location.

P.S. I didnt send it back as I never send food back at a restaurant no matter how cold or awful because Im terrified of them doing something to my food so I just deal
I love their hospitality! Busy but the wait time was pleasant with Ruby Slipper mimosa. Always order their shrimp and grits! Wish the bathroom was cleaner.
Best service we had in a while. Good breakfast food. Well deserved 20% tip.
Amazing brunch place!! Food was great - pancakes, grits, fried chicken.... Bellini and mimosas were excellent. Waiter was so polite and nice.

Ate here with the wife and kids. Read the reviews on Yelp the night before and the food sounded great despite all the mentions about the wait. The next morning i added us to the Yelp waitlist and 90 minutes later after we all got dressed, we were at the restaurant. There were at least 20 people waiting but we were seated in less than 5 minutes thanks to the waitlist. Love that feature! Anyway, the food here is really good. We ordered pancakes, french toast, and omelettes and everyone enjoyed their food. Real tasty and nice portions too. Glad we checked it out.

Nice spot for breakfast.  Starts getting busy after 930.  Had a bacon martini to start... still not sure if I liked it or not.  I guess I did.  had shrimp and grits... pretty good.  Service was good.  Other people at table were happy and enjoyed and went back the next day.

We got there at around 7:40am  - they open at 8am. It was a Sunday morning on Memorial Day Weekend. There was already a pretty big crowd on the sidewalk, but when they opened at 8am, basically everyone was seated and the entire restaurant was immediately filled. I think they should put up signs so that people can form a line down the sidewalk instead of congregating on the corner without order.

The service was efficient and good. Breakfast was great! Nice story behind the name for this restaurant (there are 3 of them in NOLA).
