No gluten free menu, but some options like eggs or omlet. The omlet with potatoes was good and fresh. Nothing amazing. Good place for breakfast early in the morning since it opens at 7am.

The hotel staff told us about this place.  They open at 7 in the morning which is great for being a tourist. Have had 3 breakfasts there. Food great. Wait staff helpful, friendly and great. Portions are plentiful. Price is reasonable.

Love the chorizo and plantains in the Costa Rican and the goat cheese medallions in the slipper salad.
Always did pick up.

on our final day in New Orleans we followed the reviews on Yelp and TripAdvisor and so glad we did.  We just walked from our hotel and got in line to wait for nearly an hour to sit down.  The line was quite long on Saturday am, The wait was well worth it.  I had bananas foster and hubs had the southern breakfast.  All were scrumptious.  I was surprised at the turn around time to have our food served after ordering.  
The atmosphere was very cheerful and much talking everywhere.  
I would recommend this place.  Definitely use the NoWait app to put yourself on the wait list so you don't have to wait in a long line.

You know those places where the menu read amazingly so you get excited about ordering that fish that calls out to you but when it finally arrived the food does not live up to the description? This is definitely NOT one of those places. The food was just as good as I had hoped, and Lance, the server, was incredible. He was friendly and attentive. YOU MUST CHECK THIS PLACE OUT!!!
Great food, good drinks, fast service. Right next to Mother's Kitchen. If you cant get into Mother's or are tired of edgy service (the servers fight, its entertaining albeit slightly off putting)

Waited for over an hour. But that's ok since texted me when it was our time. They sat us at bar with my wife. Service was relatively fast. Ordered Costa Rican and salmon.
Both eggs came out cold. I called over waitress and she said since salmon on a baguette, it's supposed to be kinda cold?  Then walked away. Listen this place is total hype. Food exciting on menu if your not from New Orleans, but not very good when you start eating it. 
Don't bother eating here.

The food was not bad, but I was not overly impressed with it like I was at other restaurants in NOLA. I had pancakes, eggs, and bacon. 
Bacon was delicious and good quality cut, but pancakes were a lil dry and less fluffy than I like. 
The place is always packed, but you can get a spot in line through yelp. However, it's not really worth the wait otherwise.
It's very noisy in the restaurant and I didn't like that. The hostess hospitality left a little more to be desired, but the actual waiter was engaging and quick with his service.

Yesterday the wait was 193 minutes. Everything bougie in me rose to the service and I politely walked away. 

Today I added myself to the waitlist thru yelp and was seated within 5-10 minutes after arrival. 

The food is worth the wait. I had 2 signature dishes via the Peacemaker - Egg Cochon and Chicken St. Charles. The Cochon reminded me of why I cannot be a vegetarian. I took one bite and ate it so fast I forgot to take a picture of the whole dish but I remembered halfway thru lol. 

I will fly back to Nawlins for this restaurant. 

Just make sure you add yourself to the waitlist and you'll be good. Enjoy!
Amaaaaazing. Granted, the wait was 2 hours, but the biscuit made it ALL worth it. Had a BYO omelette, and the potatoes. Best in NOLA.
Use the no wait app to get on the list instead of waiting 90 minutes there. Food was fantastic, awesome brunch.

Food is great but the seating situation is atrocious! They allow people to linger at their tables long after the bill has been paid and even as customers are waiting in the heat at the door. There's very little seating that's not at the bar or in uncomfortable, high top wood chairs as it is. It's a gimmicky "local" spot and NOT WORTH THE WAIT OR THE TROUBLE - go elsewhere.

Came here one morning on my visit to New Orleans hoping for a good plate of food and The Ruby Slipper delivered. There was a line of people waiting at the entrance but, because I was only a party of one, I was seated immediately at the bar. After several minutes, one of the bartenders was finally free to take my order (patrons in the line outside  walking up ordering drinks while they wait kept him busy). I ordered the Bananas Foster with Chicken Sausage and side of scrambled egg. The first order of Bananas Foster came and it seemed a little underdone to me, the bread was softer, mushier inside than I expected. I asked a host about this and he agreed to have someone remake my order. The second time around, the bread was cooked evenly all the way through. The Chicken Sausage was also very tasty and eggs cooked well. When in New Orleans I would definitely come back to eat here.
I didn't speak with the manager because I had other plans scheduled and to be honest I don't think your staff would have service me properly. There were several staff standing around socializing.

This place! Incredible. Even though the place is packed pretty early in the morning, wait staff will take drink orders while you're waiting in line; huge plus. Hands down the best breakfast you'll have in town. I had the pancake flight (genius!) and the hubby had the Benedict trio. Absolutely delicious!

What more can you say about the Ruby slipper.   The BL2T is the best breakfast sandwich going with bacon, fried green tomato, tomato, and lettuce on toasted brioche.   Also had the cheesecake French toast topped with fresh blueberries.  

Service was excellent even at the bar and it was such a great way to start the day.

Favorite breakfast spot! You know the food is good when the fire alarm goes off and everyone keeps on eating.
We checked in on No Wait to avoid the line while getting dressed and our table was ready by the time we walked down the street.

We went in on a Friday morning with a group of 11 people therefore, we had to split the group into 3 tables. There was not a huge isssue with that, but the service was slow.  Our table ordered appetizers first, but if we had not we would have waited for 30+ minutes for our food.  The other two tables waited for at least 45 minutes for their food (no appetizer).  I order the Cochon, which is a restaurant speciality.  I'm not sure if the pulled pork on a biscuit was suppose to not have any flavor, but I added some hot sauce to the meal and everything was fine.  Food was okay because our group wanted to eat something different.  Overall, the experience was just okay mainly due to the slow service and wait times.  This is to be expected at a New Orleans establishment in the French Quarter I suppose.
OMG- the pulled pork eggs benedict were life changing! Go hungry, and make sure to use their app to put yourself in line prior to arrival.

The best breakfast/brunch restaurant I've ever been to. If you're in New Orleans you owe yourself a visit to this place. Mr.B's is also quite wonderful for Dinner too!!! I never leave New Orleans without experiencing these GREAT,GREAT restaurants.

One word-ish: Nowait. Such an amazing app! I remember yall had it the last time I ate here. It was such a helpful tool, and it allowed us time to finish getting ready instead of waiting outside for 45-minutes! We walked right up when the app notified us and got seated immediately. Service was excellent. Food was delish as always. And the drinks hit the spot! See y'all the next time we're in town!

The Ruby Slipper offers a unique take on traditional Southern dishes. We ate breakfast there and were truly impressed with how great everything we ordered was. The Bloody Mary I ordered was very spicy, as they should be. My wife's mimosa was tasty! 
The service was excellent! Our waiter was a southern gentleman who even was wonderful with our 11 month old son. It was a 25 minute wait, but was worth it.
If you are looking for a truly unique and delicious breakfast spot in New Orleans, please consider The Ruby Slipper Cafe. You will not be disappointed.

Nice location. Good service, especially considering we got there less than an hour before closing, we were not rushed. Shrimp & grits bland, but punched it up with some hot sauce. Wife's pecan and bacon pancakes were better.

I had the salmon an kapers benedict and tried a bit of the pancakes. Both were delicious and the service was great. The only thing that was not hot was the grits but the super waitress got that fixed before the first bite. The coffee was not bad either.
Great food. I ordered the BBQ Shrimp and Grits and it was well worth the 75 minute wait. Highly Recommended!
Love this place, food was fantastic, one of the best bloody mary's we have had and our waitress (from Connecticut) was super nice. Going back for brunch.

Great atmosphere.  According to the waiter, these people opened up their first restaurant in the recovery of New Orleans after hurricane Katrina.  They wanted to remind people of good home cooking at a reasonable price.  

First time I went I had the Eggs Blackstone.  It was fantastic.  The second time, I ordered the Chicken St. Charles.  It would have been better than my first visit, except they over cooked the center of the egg so there was no yolk to balance the really good fried chicken.  The taso cream sauce was spot on though.  Oh well, I will go back fo show!

Definitely a GREAT brunch spot. Got there around 12p on a Monday and the hostess added a table for two on the waitlist. Checked my app and there were 35 PEOPLE ahead of us aka an hour wait. Now, normally I would look for a plan b, but I could have avoided the wait if I would have added myself to there waitlist on yelp. 

We stuck through it since they had good music going and a waitress was taking drink orders outside which was super nice. We enjoyed our iced drinks and hung around on the sidewalk as they called out names. It actually went by super quick and we waited about 45 mins. 

We got to sit at the counter which was a fun experience since we got to see the hustle and have great conversation with our waitress. 

The food is AMAZING and super comfortable in pricing! We ordered the Eggs Cochon, Banana Pecan Pancakes and Breakfast potatos, which I died and went to Ruby heaven!! Perfect for a sharing for two. Get the Vanilla Iced Coffee and don't skip on the whipped cream. 

Enjoy!

If you want a made from scratch made from scratch New Orleans style breakfast, this place is worth the wait.  My reputation was on the line with my friends as I made them wait with me in bitter cold temperatures outside for an hour before we were seated.  

Our first order of business was coffee and Irish Coffee to warm up our hands and insides.  Our waiter was great and very knowledgeable and helpful.  The menu was diverse enough that we had a hard time choosing what we wanted.  We kept seeing things come out that looked fabulous!  

Ok so I decided on the Costa Rican breakfast and my husband the Bananas Foster Pain Perdu.  Talk about mouth watering - both of them!  My beans and rice were perfectly cooked with my over medium eggs oozing through them after I cut into it.  The chorizo sausage is not that hot and there wasn't a lot but it is worth the extra bucks to have it added.

Let's discuss the French Toast - I could barely talk after taking a bite as I wanted to savor that flavor.  Being a rum girl - that syrup is out of this world!  

My friends - they had the shrimp and grits and the Egg Cochan.  My friend's comment when we left ....."ok you were right, that place was definitely work the wait - good job"

This place was right up our alley. My husband and I came here for brunch off of a referral we got from a local bar tender. It did not disappoint. There was plenty of seating, no wait, and GREAT service from Ronald! When visiting, you must eat here!
Great service! Food was wonderful. We sat at the bar, bartender was busy but took the time to explain menu and give us great suggestions! Can't wait to go back!
The food was really good and the service was great. We saw a rat fly across the floor at like 12 am so that's that. Alcohol is good too
This is a terrific place to eat....friendly, fast service and excellent food!  Worth the drive and hassle of little parking

I have three little words for you - Three Little Piggies. Holy yum.  

I'm a huge fan of the piggy, so an omelet packed with ham, bacon, sausage and Swiss cheese? Ummm, yes please! I'd like mine with egg whites only...not because I think I'm being healthy, I just prefer whites only. 

Super friendly servers who love to give advice on where to go in their great city. 

We went twice on our extended weekend trip to NOLA and both were great. They were busy, but no wait on Monday or Tuesday mornings.

Decided to come here for a nice brunch on my birthday. I put my party on the wait list from yelp and waited maybe 15-20 minutes after arriving which wasn't bad at all considering the crowd outside. This place is one of the best brunch decisions one can make if in New Orleans. I ordered the shrimp Benedict which was amazing. The biscuits soaked in the Cajun tomato sauce and the egg and melted in your mouth. My friend got the chicken st. Charles which she loved as well. With the out of this world food and great service, this is the perfect NOLA brunch spot.

The line was quick, friendly server, and food came out not too long after we ordered it. 

We ordered:
Mimosas and Blinnie to drink.
Coffee was clearly from the bottom of the pot, a very bitter taste.

Catfish 'St. Peters' - tasty and VERY filling 

Cafe Couchon - the pulled pork was EXTREMELY dry, thankfully my pouched eggs were undercooked, as they added moisture to the pulled pork.

My wife and I had brunch here two days in a row.  The first time I had the Chicken St. Charles which I really enjoyed and my wife had the Gulf Fish St. Peter whuch she said was very good.  The second day, I had the Eggs Cochon which was delicious and my wife had the Eggs Blackstone which was also delicious.  So why 4 stars instead of 5?  The Gulf Fish St. Peter comes with a skewer of grilled shrimp, and sadly the shrimp was NOT fresh. Very fishy tasting.  For that reason, I have to knock it down a star.

Being a local, I've always heard of Ruby slipper and I didn't go there until today. It will not be my last time! Freaking amazing! 4 yr old was happy, mama was happy and food was amazing! Highly recommend!

Was in New Orleans for Essence Fest and wanted one last New Orleans breakfast experience before we hit the road. We found this gem on Magazine St. on Yelp. It was a very long wait but the food was great! There was so many offerings so my friend and I decided to look like pigs and ordered 2 entrees each. I mean that's what to-go boxes are for, right? I got the Spanish omelet and my friend got an omelet and asked that they use smoked salmon. She also ordered the bananas foster French toast and I ordered the stuffed French toast! All was great! The omelets come with this huge homemade biscuit. Oh we were in carb heaven. Definitely returning the next time I'm in New Orleans!
Great food and service from Jacus!!! Try the signature benedicts!!! Long waot but really worth it!!

This place is hyped up to the max. I'd suggest anyone that's planning on visiting to reserve ahead of time! If not, you'll be waiting nearly a hour, maybe more depending on the day (like I did) 

THE FOOD:  really mediocre. I had the corned beef Benedict, didn't like it. the corned beef itself was dry as hell and the hollandaise tasted like a spicy mustard sauce. I will say, the biscuit was delicious! And there's this maple butter you can ask for 
(yumm) 

Also tried the fish and grits, I mean, it wasn't horrible. Although the fish was a little bland, I actually liked it. Very crispy. 
The grits are a little too watery. Theres the sauce that goes over it; it should be put on the side. 

 Bottom line, this Food Is too mediocre for it to be this overpriced. If you're in the area and have no place else to go, hey.... but if you go here and stick to simple stuff like eggs and bacon with pancakes. Keep it simple. Other than that, blah.

Great spot for simple and quick breakfast. Common breakfast menu items, no eggs bene. The coffee is exceptional! After talking to the waiter, found out the coffee is sourced from a local roaster with an exclusive special blend for The Ruby Slipper.

The food was just okay, nothing special. Definitely a tourist spot, very over priced. I had the breakfast sandwich which was bacon and egg on a biscuit. My husband had the shrimp and grits which was good but not $13 good, small portion. The sangria was very watered down, you couldn't taste any alcohol in it at all. The service however was pretty good given how busy they were. It was good to visit but I don't have to go back the next time we are in NO and probably won't.   Definitely not worth the 45 minute wait.
This place was great! Got on the waitlist while I walked over and then got seated right away. Casual atmosphere, big portions and delicious. I had the bananas foster.

Mediocre at best.   They staff argued that they already put jalapeños on the burger when they were not there.  No tomatoes either.   Server insisted not to order what I wanted and told me to get a boring turkey croissant.  Of course she made it sound good but never came back to Check to see if I even liked it.   Last visit for us there.

The place has a nice atmosphere. The food that I had was nowhere near authentic. They advertised the gallo pinto entree as the "Costa Rican" which is really a Nicaraguan dish. I was willing to give it a try. Big disappointment, the rice and beans were quite soggy. The fried plantains were not crisp and fresh but chewy and stale. Also, they covered half the plate with salsa, the kind that you can buy at the grocery store. It was a failed attempt to make Gallo Pinto. I wouldn't recommend it, especially at $12.00. The other offerings seemed to be fine.

We had a very nice breakfast here. The wait was no more than 20mins but it was worth it. Our server, Steven, was very helpful and most pleasant. 
He recommended the Peacemaker combo of half Cochin and half St Charles. It was delicious and more than I could finish. The chicken is crispy, but not over done. The Cochin (pulled pork) was moist and tender. 
This is a busy place during Mardi Gras so get there early or plan to wait. 
The food and our server made me want to come back for more.

It all looks and sounds good but just trust me on this: the eggs Benedict with the pulled pork is insanely delicious.

We tried samplers to get a taste of multiple items and while it was all tasty I would rather have had just that pulled pork. It melted in our mouths.

Round up your friends and arrive early. My party and I got here at about noon which was prime time for brunch so the wait was 2 hrs and 40 minutes. I've visited New Orleans numerous times but hadn't had the chance to eat here. I finally had the opportunity so I didn't mind the wait. They text you how many parties are ahead and an ETA at your table so we left and made the most of the free time we had. I went with The Peace Maker choose two Benedict's: Salmon and Chicken. They were delicious! I'm not usually a fan of Benedict's but it's one of the most popular dishes so I had to try it. I absolutely don't regret it. Nothing like I have had before. They were flavorful and tasted even better with Louisiana hot sauce! The plate  presentation was nice and so was service. 
I had two vodka infused ice coffees with my meals They were on pricey side for the size you get and the amount of alcohol in it. ($10 each)  Other than that I definitely recommend if you're looking for a casual brunch spot while in Nola. I did visit the busiest location as it is closer to Bourbon st so I would suggest visiting one of their other locations which won't be as long of a wait.

Had the breakfast special, it was perfect. Crab cake was fresh and delicious, perfect amount of hollandaise. The biscuit was home made, great texture cooked very well. Service was quick & friendly. Only complaint is they want to turn the tables over quickly, but won't dock them anything for that since the food is that good, the wait is usually 15-45 min.

It was my first visit with the husband and a friend.  We only had to wait a few minutes for a table and were served right away despite the full house and large tables.
I ordered two breakfast to try multiple items for a proper review and it was way too much food. Between the 3 of us we had five breakfast entrees and a couple sides.
All the food was well prepared and the wait time was limited. I was impressed how well they served the large tables.
The portions are large and with one or two sides you could share one entrée.
Coffee and a fresh squeezed juice and you are good to go.
Went back on this trip just as good as the first! My wife got the banana foster for the second time and the kids loved the double chocolate chip pancakes.
Waiting in line paid so well. We loved the breakfast. The blood Mary is a must. The staff was nice and friendly. Food was fresh and yummy.

Best restaurant to have breakfast in! It has a very cozy feeling and the food is excellent. This is my second time here and both times my experience has been great. I've had the French toast and the chicken St. Charles. If you come to New Orleans, it is a good place to have breakfast and brunch.
Absolutely delish!! Definitely have a Bellini, eggs black stone and bananas foster French toast!! Our waitress Lindsay B. was super nice and super cute! Will definitely come back!!!

This place is a must go. The location  is great the food is amazing the staff are super nice. The drinks are soo good. I would def come back. We tried the brandy milk punch {wow sooo good} , grapefruit and champagne drink, bacon infused bloody Mary and  a very boozy Iced coffee {not sweet, great strong coffee flavor} . The peacemaker Benedict meal which brings your choice of two. I chose chicken st Charles and shrimp Boogaloo. Also tried the salmon and capers omelette. A must try!
Gut busting breakfast. Even the salads. Laid back and locals love it, too. I wish they were open for dinner or post drinking hours.

Another visit to the Ruby Slipper and it did not disappoint!  The variety of eggs benedict make it a difficult choice, but ours were fantastic!  The shrimp boogaloo benedict  (with fried green tomatoes) and the eggs cochon are quickly becoming our favorites!  
There is a wait, but it is easier to put yourself on the waitlist with the Yelp app and then get cocktails if you arrive early!  Our server was great!

Oh my God! This place is absolutely amazing. The breakfast or brunch was so delicious. I love how you can choose between two of their specialty Benedict. Because honestly I don't think I could've chose one over the other. The fried chicken Benedict was probably one of the best Benedict I've had in my life.

I wish I found this place my first day in NOLA! This was the best breakfast I had during my stay. The banana walnut pecan was fluffy & delicious. Grits were creamy & seasoned perfectly. My gf said her breakfast was amazing. Prices were reasonable & you get a good portion of food for your dollar. Long lines to get a table so call ahead to get on the waiting list & cut the line once you get there. I highly recommend this place for breakfast & brunch

3.5 Pros- shrimp and grits delicious. Pancakes (plain) were great. The French toast were airy and tasty. Our waitress was a sweet heart and the reason why the rating is as high as it is. Long wait but using the yelp sign in system came in handy.
Cons- food took a while coming to come. The group behind us found a roach on the wall crawling towards us then it fell so no telling where it ended. The mimosa was nasty. It could have been the OJ, but either way I did not like it at all. 
Being that it was my first time, I would try it again when I return back to New Orleans.

Ummm...more please.  Loved this place so much that my friends and I came back twice in the same week.  With all the wonderful restaurants in New Orleans, that's saying a lot.  I got the Eggs Cochon the first time with a double Bellini of course.  The food was fabulous and the Bellini left me with a good feeling too.  I got the Croche Madame on my second visit.  While it was good, the Eggs Cochon was better.  I'll be back in NoLA for Mardi Gras and Ruby Slipper will definitely be on my list.  

Some advice -- plan ahead.  We had to wait both times for seating.

This place was right next to a hotel we stayed at for one night, and we made our way back to it because the menu looked excellent. I'm glad we did! While we had a bit of a wait for breakfast on a Tuesday, it wasn't too bad. We went around 11AM and were seated in about 20 minutes. They sat us at the bar, but we didn't mind because my husband and I like the ambiance of bar seating. 

Started off the day right with a mimosa and it was exactly how I like mine! It was huge first of all, and mostly champagne with a little bit of OJ (less mim and more osa I always say!). 

I ordered the eggs blackstone - 2 poached eggs over applewood smoked bacon, grilled tomato, and an open faced buttermilk biscuit. Topped with hollandaise sauce and served with breakfast potatoes, this dish was filling and I couldn't stop eating it! Hubby got the Spanish omelet, which was stuffed and he ended up bringing some back to our place for later!

I had a traditional breakfast here it was good.. except the sausage was really hard.  But the thing you HAVE to try here is the Benedict.  They had this pork Benedict that was AMAZING, I've never had the combination and it made us wanting to come back everyday for breakfast (though we didnt because of time constraints), this was by far my favorite breakfast we ate when in NOLA.

The food was excellent but the wait was painful even with the Nowait app. Was it worth the wait, yes and we were not disappointed. Big shoutout to the young hostesses who kept many of the frustrated and pushy customers waiting informed about their place in line. Those young ladies should be compensated extra for dealing with some these customers or at least I hope they are.
Tasty and very filling breakfast options. Go early or be prepared to wait. Great waitstaff and unique menu. Quick service and good quality food. I like supporting local business.
Great cocktails, the eggs Benedict was lovely, and fun atmosphere. Only side note, cocktails are a bit pricey...but totally worth it. Hello Ruby Sunrise!

Came here twice during our 5-day stay in town. They have a massive, tasty Bloody Mary if that's what you're into -- almost a meal in itself. The real draw, however, was the EGGS COCHON. It's been a year since my visit and I still dream about that fish regularly. Oh my god, do yourself a huge favor and order it!
The drinks, service and food was all fantastic!  It's a loud place but great atmosphere!  Got a nice buzz from the boozy coffee...what's not to love about that!

If you love french toast, then you need to get this under your belt, literally and figuratively.

They are simply the best french toast out there. Big slabs of spongy soft bread coated in eggs and sugar and buttery goodness. The french toast had a crispy edge. I am on a diet and have to stop writing this review because I am started to salivate.
My 2 favorite breakfasts are eggs Benedict and corned beef hash.  This place combined those 2 into 1 delicious dish.  Service was great.  I will return on my next trip to New Orleans.
Great brunch!!! I ordered the Banana Foster and it was perfect. There is a little bit of a wait, however it's well worth it!

Food is great, Service is great but the wait.... worth the while! 

We had omelets, mimosas and a stuffed French toast was to die for!. The waiter accommodated our vegan friend which was a PLUS!

Food, atmosphere, drinks, were awesome.  I had the Benedict's split decision and it was fabulous in every way.  Make sure you check in on Yelp and place your name on the waiting list, if not you will be waiting over an 1.5 hours to eat.  Food does take a bit of time to come out so make sure  you order Drinks.  Managers were great in fixing any mishaps.  I will certainly be back..........

Great place for a tasty and hearty breakfast when in NOLA. Had weekend special-root beer braised brisket eggs Benedict on biscuit. One word Yummy! Get here on a weekend before the line forms. 

Second visit and was equally good last time. Active and fun vibe. Great service from behind the bar.

Recommended by our hotel for breakfast. Very busy on a Saturday morning. Food and service were average, despite the impressive and overflowing plates that went out around us. Ordered the Eggs Cochon and it was ok. Double mimosas are definitely doubles! Probably wouldn't revisit if we were in town again.

Friendly service and big drinks. They get really busy so make sure you add your name to their online booking app, however if you do have to wait they have a lady going around bringing out drinks which is a nice touch.

This place is great. Fun atmosphere, good coffee, delicious food.  I ate myself silly. Get one of their versions of eggs Benedict. The biscuits are amazing.  Service is very friendly - they bring you drinks outside while you wait.  Be sure to use the nowait app to get in line before you go! A must because the lines are out the door.

This place is well worth the wait. There is always a long line here but the Yelp app allows you to "cut the line" with their wait in line feature. 

First of all, all of the food was good. So good, that I can't remember the pricing. Please see the photos to visually see the goodness. The food came out hot, the flavors were phenomenal and the service was fast. 

My mom had the shrimp and grits and I wanted to snatch it from in front of her after tasting a little. The grits were cooked to perfection and the gravy was unique to that place and had a delicious New Orleans flare. The pancakes were like country cooking pancakes rather than commercial. The catfish was flavourful and not salty. I could go on and on about this place. But I will leave this review at it's a must visit in New Orleans. 

It looked like it would be very hot in there since it was so crowded, but it wasn't.

Ruby Slipper is consistently GREAT! Every time I've been I've gotten amazing food and equally amazing service. Seriously, the food is so good. My favorite brunch place in town, although I usually hit up the one in Mid City because it's closer to home. If I have friends in from out of town and we're going to spend the day downtown I'll always go here though. 

I pretty much always get the skinny migas (cuz I'm veg and it's delish) but I know my meat eating friends are always drooling over the Chicken St. Charles. They always have amazing looking specials as well, so be sure to check out the board on your way in. 

Download the NoWait App to be put on the wait list on your way over. You just have to check in with the hostess when you arrive but it usually helps with getting in a little quicker I think. Then just grab a cocktail and your table will be ready in no time!

I suppose it's my fault that my visit to Ruby Slipper wasn't as amazing as other reviewers, and it's likely due to what I ate, which is a standard breakfast anywhere in the U.S. The exception in this case, were the fried green tomatoes.

I am a big fan of eggs, bacon, and homefries, and that is what I ate. They made it pretty well, but wasn't anything to write home about, but didn't deserve to be knocked for what was good enough food. The biscuit wasn't perfect, but still tasted good. The service accommodated me, given I was alone and sat at the middle bar, so that was a big positive. 

Otherwise, the ambiance was nice, tall ceilings, bright and clean. It was packed, so expect a line.

Spent the majority of the morning researching the best brunch spots in Nola. Landed on the Ruby Slipper and decided it'd be worth the 1hr wait to try the best spot in town. That 1hr turned into 2 and our waiter gave us the check with "no rush at all" but proceeded to harass us every min by asking us if he could process our check. Food was well inspired and cultured, but executed with a great deal of mediocrity. Overall, not worth the wait.
Fast service. Funny server. We had a great breakfast here. The bananas foster French toast was excellent.
went to the Canal Street location. The food was very good and the morning cocktails were great!

I bookmarked this spot a week prior to my trip to New Orleans.  I'm a big breakfast fan and wanted to try it out.  Tried going two different times and there was a line, even on a Monday morning!  Accidentally went and sat at the bar when I was supposed to put my name in at the host stand for bar service.  Whoops!  They nicely told me it was wrong and that we had skipped the line, but served us anyways.

Best part of the meal was the Bloody Mary!  Pro tip, get the Bloody to go and then walk to the French Quarter, it was an awesome way to spend a morning. 

Four stars because my breakfast wasn't as great as I'd hoped.  The real home run was the side of bacon though!

So the "world famous" Bloody Mary was not very good. However the stuffed French toast was the BEST breakfast meal I've ever put in my mouth. I literally had to have it removed from my table so I didn't over stuff myself to sleep. HAVE IT AND THANK ME LATER!!!!!!
Nice place to go for breakfast if you're visiting... Bananas Foster French toast was awesome. Quick, friendly service and nice atmosphere. Would definitely return again!
Very good place for breakfast. Had the Cochon Benedict, (pulled pork). Very good and just enough.  Good service and coffee.

Great atmosphere very hipster with great dishes that are not ordinary. The eggs with brisket and hollandaise sauce were amazing however the shrimp and grits lacked flavor and were a little runny. Mimosas and bellinis were great. I would come back.

YUM!! The iced coffee with vodka was a great hangover cure. Then the Benedict's came and they were so good. Eggs Cochon (pulled pork) and the bacon and tomato ones were DELICIOUS. You will not regret that. The server was awesome too. Would totally come back.
I was in NOLA for 10 days. I had like 3 of my 7 brunches here. Too good to miss.
Holy shit good breakfast. There is a long wait but well worth it. Go online and get a spot early. They have several options for the eggs Benedict and they are all good.

Best breakfast in the City of New Orleans,  Hands down with Chef  John Currie who is a beast turning consistent five  dishes daily.  With 5 locations around the city running a different special every single day so make sure you like Ruby Slipper on facebook and check their website for every locations bomb specials.  Fantastic job John & @the ruby slipper cafe!

The ladies who greeted.me at the front door were warm and friendly. Put a smile on my face. The lady that took my order was very nice. I've eaten here before and the food is great. Now that I'm that I'm reading this, I'm moving it from a 4 to a 5.
This place have good breakfast food and a great menu! It's also located in walking distance from bourbon street and a lot if main attractions!! Great place!
Great food. Devin was fantastic. He made it a perfect start to the morning. Need more people like him in the business.

Great Breakfast (stuffed french toast...reDONKulous!), great vibe (waitress was super cool), great drinks...not sure what else is needed!  Only issue we had was checking in...I checked in via Yelp! then when we got there we checked in again with the hostess, and finally I ended up checking us in again with the lady that actually seated us.  On a bad day that would have probably been an issue but the waitress, drinks, and food definitely made up for the mix up.  All in all I would recommend and definitely come back.
Had a great breakfast here. Kid friendly, great pancakes. Had the BLT with fried green tomatoes and it was delicious. There's parking right around the corner and we got seated within half an hour

Long wait time (1 1/2 hrs) so to circumvent it's the Nowaiting app add yourself to waitlist ahead of time. I got the Trifecta and the Eggs Cochon was the best out of the three but the biscuits were dry, sauce congealed and the food was cold. Bloody Mary was delicious. Points taken off for food temp and mediocre food.

Stumbled on this when searching for a cafe for breakfast, good quick service and a delicious breakfast (I had the florentine  omelet & OJ). Would recommend it and would definitely go back for seconds!

My favorite breakfast in New Orleans during my last visit. Bloody Mary was ridiculous - the pickled green bean and bacon just put it over the top.  Lots of room, friendly service, quick wait times, some outdoor seating for nicer days. Food was fantastic. Wait staff offered excellent recommendations and were helpful in pointing out a Yelp special they were running for a coupon towards the Bloody Mary for a check-in.
I had the best pancakes (banana pecan) and bacon at this restaurant. The service was great and I definitely will be back to try some other things on the menu!
Das warscheinlich beste Restaurant zum Frühstücken in gesamt New Orleans. Unbedingt Southern Breakfast probieren. Unglaublich lecker. Und Preis/Leistungs Verhältnis ist auch supergut!

Excellent place for breakfast. You can get an open face biscuit with fried chicken and Tasso gravy which is great!  Very good coffee which you can also buy a bag of and take home with you.  My wife and I sat at the bar and had a fun and delicious breakfast here.

Go early.  We went at 7:30 and did not have to wait at all.  Every time that we walked past later in the day, the line was ridiculous.  That being said, his place is worth the wait you may have.

The milk punch was really good: think less creamy, boozy eggnog.  The Bananas Foster Pain Perdu was why I went, and I was not disappointed.  It was delicious and a lot.  By the end of the last slice, it started to feel like Man vs. Food.  This was the only breakfast I had in New Orleans, and really the only one you need.

This restaurant was a recommendation and it was very good, friendly waiter and good food.  We ordered the shrimp omelette and eggs Benedict item. Go early and there's no line or you can go to their website or yelp and get yourself on the list to get in. Highly recommend

Going to go against the current here and give this a bad rating. Maybe they were having an off day, but I did not get a good first impression. 

We decided to go here because of the long lines we saw on a different day. Long lines usually mean something good. So we came back another day before they opened and waited in line. 

Once inside, the staff was so energetic and friendly, which was really nice. We ordered as fast as we could so we could get the orders in before everyone else did. 

I ordered a double mimosa which tasted more like a half mimosa, and a croque Madame. The food took a fairly long time to come out, but that was understandable because 40 people had just walked in at the same time. Once the food came out, it wasn't fully cooked--parts were cold, and the whole thing just seemed slopped together.

I was expecting it to take forever, but I was also expecting it to be delicious. Just because you have 40+ people to feed at once, doesn't mean you should do a half-assed job. I won't be back here again.

If you want brunch, if you want a brunch that will hold you well into dinner time, if you want a huge variety when it comes to lunch, come to The Ruby Slipper Cafe.

We recently came here on a Friday morning for some breakfast/brunch.  They do not take reservations but they do have a list where you can put your name down.  One catch: if your whole party is not there when your name is called, they give your spot away.  Our group of 7 only had to wait about half an hour.  The space is large and beautiful.  The menu includes typical brunch staples such as omelets, pancakes, and French toast.  It also offers the southern breakfast (which I had), shrimp and grits, and a bunch of other goodies.  My breakfast left me full and satisfied.  The biscuits were perfect without butter.  The eggs were fluffy.  The bacon was crisp.  And the fried green tomato hit the spot.  Everything that everyone at our table ordered looked amazing.  It also was pretty easy on the wallet, which is always appreciated.  

I only knocked off a star because they "forgot" my order when everything else came out.  No biggie, it was waiting for me in the kitchen.  They also offer the usual brunch drinks (coffee, bloody mary, etc.), as well as soda and other mixed drinks.

Ate at both locations while in New Orleans on a business trip, and loved both meals. I had the Louisianan Omlette the first time, and absolutely loved it. Had the regular breakfast the second time - the potatoes are perfect - crisp and delicious. Great coffee, tasty bacon, and apparently the Bananas Foster Pan Perdu is heaven on a plate - according to a fellow diner!

The wait is worth it. Great ambiance. Creative menu too. I love the Croque Madame for breakfast. Delicious and unique.
Try the mimosas too :-)
Yummy brunch items! If I ever go back to New Orleans I will definitely stop here. Great food, atmosphere, and staff.

This place NEVER DISAPPOINTS! Got to the Cafe just at 8 a.m. and was seated immediately (a first). Service was provided with a smile and a heaping topping of Southern hospitality.  

Today, I had the smoked salmon omelette; a nice sized omlette (maybe 2 eggs) loaded with goat cheese and smoked salmon, topped with a dill hollandaise and flash fried capers. It was perfect. I can not stand an overcooked omlette so i was pleasantly surprised that in a place with this much business, the cooks were able to  prepare with such excellence. The biscuits are larger than life and remind me of my grandmothers. And the cheese grits?? Old fashioned and slow cooked; didnt need to add a thing. 

There is a reason why I visit this restaurant during each and every one of my annual visits to New Orleans.

This was my second time at Ruby Slipper. My first visit was great but my visit today was disappointing. After waiting for an hour and a half (I didn't mind waiting in anticipation of a great meal) our service was very slow and our food came out cold! I loved Ruby Slipper the first go around but now I am hesitant to return again.

We ate here around 1 PM today. The restaurant was full but we were seated fairly quickly. I had the St. Peters fish and my wife had a turkey croissant sandwich. We sat at a table of seven. They brought out food for 3 people in our party and we waited another 20 minutes for the rest of the meals to arrive. The server was absent for long periods of time and was simply unaware that the food wasn't out and that our drinks were empty. My fish was cooked to kingdom come. My wife's sandwich was nothing to write home about. Needles to say, we won't be returning. I suggest you skip this location.

This was really good for breakfast. I had the banana pecan pancakes. I sat at the bar and the servers were great! The cook came out and asked about the food. Pancakes were biiiiiiggggg! Couldn't eat it all. Bacon cooked crisp like I like it.

If you love a big southern style breakfast, you'll love The Ruby Slipper Cafe. The staff was attentive and friendly.  The food really good and plenty of it.  The coffee and tea kept coming without delay.
The omelets were delicious and all the sides as well: fried green tomatoes, grits, applewood smoked bacon, biscuits.  All very good.
Popular place so you may have a short wait but it's worth it.

Ashley was a great server and had great suggestions for us! We got the migas scramble and the cinnamon swirl pancakes. Sooo good. Huge pancake portion. The coffee mugs are huge which is so important for me because I need at least 2 big cups. Definitely get here as early as possible to avoid the line!
Food is very very good, staff is super quick and friendly. We went early, so the wait was minimal (less than 10 minutes) and convenient to Bourbon Street where we stayed. We will be back.

This place was so busy for a Saturday but we were able to put our name on a waitlist which was 1 to 1.5 hours. Service was good since it didn't take long for her to bring drinks and take our order although it was extremely crowded in the restaurant. I ordered the gulf fish St. Peter's and it was delicious!! I do think the fish was a little too chewy than the usual. Definitely a place to check out if you don't mind the waitlist!
So...the tea was great. Period. Not a fan of dense pancakes, uncooked bacon & weird sausage. Eggs were alright, but in all not a good breakfast. Shame cause ppl were pumping it up. Oh well.

We loved the Ruby slipper! It's a fast-paced and very crowded spot for a reason! Really incredibly delicious French toast and chicken and waffles that we shared. I also got a little drunk on their Mamosa, but I felt welcomed and at home rather than judged for getting tipsy at 10 AM LOL.
We got the eggs Cochon and the chicken st.charles. Both were great but the later was better. Nice flavors, portions and friendly service. We were repeat customers.

Best breakfast we had in NOLA! We ordered two benedicts: Cochon and Shrimp Boogaloo. They were cooked to perfection. We actually couldn't decide which we wanted so we ordered both and shared halves. Amazing! If we weren't working we would have had a mimosa too!

Omg, totally worth the 40 minute wait on a Friday morning. I ordered the fried chicken eggs Benedict and it was incredible. Served on a biscuit with Tasso gravy. It filled me up until dinner time! Prices are reasonable for the portions they serve.

Well... It was good but not quite 4 star good In my opinion.  I'd give it 3.5 stars if Yelp would let me.

Again... Great and nice service. 

However; the pics people posted of the food looked way better than it tasted.  I felt tricked...  Or perhaps I just went in expecting this place to blow me away.  It didn't.

I ended up ordering one of their biscuit concoctions drizzled with their rendition of a hollandaise.  The biscuit tasted dry. The tomato was overly soft.  The bacon was token.  The poached eggs... Not as good as say... Jimmy Js. 

Coffee?  Again... I'm not sure what it is; but you will have better luck sighting a unicorn. 

The OJ was my favorite thing ordered.  

Last but not least.... Guess what flew out of the kitchen?

Give up?

A pigeon!

Ha ha ha!!! Now that is hard to beat for entertainment value.  The pigeon gets 5 stars for entertainment.

Service was great, Ashley took great care of us. We found this place on yelp and checked out the menu online before walking over, it's a very beautiful building and the restaurant serves breakfast lunch and dinner, the bar is huge.

We ordered from the specials side of the menu and nothing disappoints. The Costa Rican, the chicken St Charles and then bananas foster pain perdu were probably the best best, best breakfast items we've ever had. The portions are large, and every bite is amazing. I've had brunch at some very amazing upscale restaurants, and I thought nothing could top the brunch at the blue duck tavern in Washington DC, but I was wrong.

If you're visiting for a few days or a local, this place is a must !!!!! Highly recommend !!!

N'awlins is a city with many sensory delights- The Jazz on Frenchman street, the debauchery of Bourbon-there is truly something for everyone. For me, the food is some of the best I've ever had. I fast  for an entire week before going to New Orleans and spend the subsequent week post-visit doing a food detox. Ruby Slipper is THE best place to grab breakfast whilst in the Crescent City.  I have friends that recommended the restaurant after stumbling across it and after their first meal they dined there every single day for breakfast. Every.Single.Day. The menu is complete with N'awlins breakfast staples such as eggs cochon ( my favorite!) and includes huge mimosas that will leave you buzzing for a good hour post breakfast. If you find yourself in New Orleans, make a point of visiting one of the three locations of the Ruby Slipper. Your belly will thank you.

We needed a place for a quick lunch during a conference.  This place was convenient, quick and turned out some really tasty food.  

I saw so many different plates coming out of the kitchen and they all looked fantastic, there were even families have breakfast for lunch.
Yes it's worth the wait. The food was excellent both times we ate breakfast here. Bananas foster, poached eggs, even the sandwiches.

Delectable little breakfast spot - it has a wait even in the pouring rain so definitely put in a reservation early! Had the banana foster (decadently sweet and. Utterly) and the pulled pork (not overly seasoned and lean) as well as the fried chicken (delicous) egg benedicts. Only complaint - the cappuccino was lackluster the milk foam was uneven and cold.

I was new to this breakfast location and asked like I do every waitress for breakfast location that I go to is do you have  Eggs Benedict  she suggested the one with the pork debris, which is shredded pork .
Best eggs Benedict ever, ever!!!!

Amazing food! I ordered the chicken St. Charles! It is a biscuit topped with fried chicken and a poached egg. Finally it is topped with a ham cream sauce! In addition, Chanel provided excellent customer service. I will be back!

Amazing.  Hands down some of the best eggs benedict I have ever eaten in my life.  My husband and I had breakfast there this morning.  My husband ordered a bloody mary that was mixed PERFECTLY.  I had a bellini which was delicious.  We then split a mix n match benedict.  We ordered the Chicken St. Charles and the Eggs Cochon.  They were both amazing.  We arrived at approximately 8:30 AM on a Wednesday.  The wait was approximately 15 minutes.  They took down our phone number and sent a text when we were close to being seated.  It is kid friendly, the food is fantastic.  This is a can't miss in terms of breakfast in NOLA.  Please eat here.  You will be so happy afterwards.

Sensational!!!!!!!!!
We waited close to 2 hours to eat at the Ruby Slipper and it was well worth every minute. 

For starters, our waitress was amazing. Sadly, I don't remember her name. But, she had an awesome personality, almost theatrical. She kept our big group of 7 entertained the entire time. 

On to the food---- Truly derrrrrricious! 
I had the Cost Rican: Rice, beans, salsa, eggs and plantains. Blasting with flavor! the eggs were cooked perfectly. I added chorizo to mine and it totally hit the right spots. 
I also tried the CB Benedict and that was amazing as well. I'll probably order that next time. 

If you're craving something sweet I would recommend the the Smores French Toast. So good! and such a unique spin on a classic favorite. 

Don't forget to order the bloody mary! They garnish theirs with fresh pickled green beans. Freakin' awesome! 

Here's my tip: If you're in NOLA you MUST MUST MUST eat HERE!!! Disregard the super-long wait and just suck it up and wait. It's worth it, trust me! Put your name on the list and go for a walk around the area. Do a little window shopping, or some real shopping and time will fly by.
Super long wait but you can put your name in online then walk around the French quarter with a Bloody Mary or mimosa in had while you stroll! The food was awesome!!
Busy breakfast spot in the NOLA business district. Worth the wait. Lovely people run a tight ship, serving up serious and srsly delicious plates of traditional and Southern fare.

Was right across the street from the hotel. Mom and my sis went for breakfast and I had some of my Mom's leftover pancakes the next morning--delicious! A former colleague invited me to breakfast here two days later and she, my Mom and I all ordered the Southern Breakfast. All three of us clean off our plates, it was so good! The grits were some of the best I ever had. The bacon, thick but still crunchy which how I like it. I made a little breakfast sandwich out of the huge biscuit, putting in the fried green tomato, some eggs and some bacon. So yummy. The Ruby Slipper can truly claim being one of "the best breakfast" places in New Orleans. We went on a Thursday Am at 10 AM and still had to wait about 20 minutes, but they send you a text with a link that keeps track of your place in line. Service was friendly and excellent. Definitely would return!

Brunch places are my favorite!!! This place was literally a 10 minute crawl from my hotel, which equates to about a 3 minute walk. Got the shrimp and cheddar omelette and it was delicious, but the orange juice is v expensive.

Really enjoyed this place. This is one of the best breakfast I've ever had. I ordered the eggs Benedict, one with corn beef hash and the other with pulled pork. The hollandaise sauce was fantastic, and I would've bathed and if I could have. The place was lovely and the service was excellent. I highly recommend coming here for breakfast.

Amazing. To die for. A must-go. Benedicts are bomb! Fun atmosphere and delicious drinks to accompany your food. It's delicious down south fare and you won't regret it. Long lines but well worth the wait. Definitely get an eggs Benedict.

Really enjoyed this place! Hilton concerige recommended we try here and another place for brunch, both were packed so we waited for Ruby and it was well worth the standing outside for 35 min! My bf and I split the BBQ shrimp & Grits   and the hazelnut cream pancakes. Both were delish! Wish we ordered the banana fosters dish but maybe before we leave we will. Their Irish cream coffee was amazing too! Hit the spot. Check this place out if you are ever in N.O

We went here for the Banana's Foster French Toast...AMAZING! We had a slight wait 15 minutes'ish but the food was delicious! I also love the house coffee from French Truck. Friendly staff, would definitely go again!

Amazing service, good food (BIG portions) and the Bloody Mary's were ON POINT!!! All the accoutrements that I like (celery, olives and a hot pepper). The server we had was fantastic: her name was Keira and she was super attentive and very friendly. We split the veggie omelette with potatoes and toast. It was enough for two people: and coming from Silicon Valley, the price point was amazing. After 2 Bloody Mary's each, plus breakfast, I think we walked out for about $20 per person including tip (and we tipped nicely).

Would absolutely go back. PS - there's a sister restaurant on Canal Street. Go to this one. It's more "authentic" and seems more cozy, IMO.

Great restaurant! We went for breakfast as it was right across thr after from or hotel. The cafe is cute and the food was excellent! I had the bananas foster french toast and it was fantastic. My girlfriend had crawfish grits and that was great as well. We were both very pleased with the meal! Our waitress was great! Very attentive but did not hover nor was she annoying. I will definitely eat here again!

The best thing I can say about the food is that there was a lot of it. I had "The Louisianan" omelette and my wife had their pulled pork version of eggs benedict (the house specialty, apparently).  Neither tasted like much, and the shrimp in my omelet tasted like they hadn't been rinsed. Really disappointing.

Oh man...soooo delicious

The Ruby Slipper has some darn good breakfast. I'm from NOLA and had never been here before. Recently we came for a vacation and had breakfast here 3 times over the few days we spent in NOLA. It was that good I promise! The line can get long so try to get there early. The earlier the better. This is one of the best breakfast spots in NOLA so expect lines if you don't come early. They do a great job of getting the food out so you should be seated in 40 mins or so regardless. So just walk around and they will give you a call/text.

Ok so what to try:
-The first day I tried one of their signature benedicts. Absolutely delicious. You can either just get one or try multiple benedicts. I tried the salmon, corned hash and the chicken St.. Charles. 
-The buttermilk pancakes are really amazing as well. I tried the banana pecan and my god it was good. 

Can't wait to be back here!
Best breakfast spot. Hands down! Go with their signature dishes! Long wait but worth it. Just sign up on the waitlist here!
Yes! Just go there! No questions asked everything tasted great, the service was great! Stop reading this and just go experience the Ruby Slipper for yourself. I will be back soon!

This good is so damn good, I'm cussing! How is this legal?  Really?  If you are in New Orleans, come here for breakfast.  The food is so darn delicious, it sent me into a violent rage. I wanted to steal from everybody's plate. 

Must haves:
The buttermilk biscuit - you will need therapy for the ecstasy you experience. 

The Louisianan - this shrimp omelette will make you want to smack the chef. Delicious!

The pancakes - beautifully golden browned and tasty. Only the devil would make something so tempting. 

Eat here!

Bananas Foster French Toast!!!  It was extremely sweet, but VERY good!!! 

Husband had  Chicken St Charles   Chicken, on a biscuit with a poached egg on top. He loved it!!!
Delicious brunch place and the best bloody Mary's ever!! The line is insane though...

Delicious, absolutely delicious! We sat at the bar and ordered eggs cochin. Two poached eggs sitting a on a pile of pork debris sitting on flaky buttermilk biscuits, topped off with a melted cheese sauce. What a treat. The people were friendly and the atmosphere was casual. Sad that is is so far from my house but happy to have had a chance to eat hear. I recommend this place!

Chicken St. Charles and Corn Beef Bennie Benedict's were UHMAZING! This was our first stop in New Orleans and had great drinks too. The bacon infused vodka Bloody Mary was delicious. We had such a friendly waitress, Julie! All around great place.

Atmosphere here is very cool and relaxed.  The staff is awesome and very helpful
The bananas foster was fantastic!  (Warning it is very sweet so get a side of eggs or something to balance it out) the eggs coubion is amazing as well 
Definitely a cool place

The Ruby Slipper is a staple in New Orleans. 

They have amazing fresh squeeze mimosas with the option to mix grapefruit or pomegranate juice in addition to the traditional orange juice+champagne. 

They have unique options for eggs Benedicts over a homemade buttermilk biscuit vs the traditional English muffin. The egg conchron was pulled pork with thicker non-traditional sauce and the fried chicken Benedict lacked flavor. 

Overall, the food was pretty average.
The specialties are very good. Overall a bit pricey. $3.50 + tax for 2 strips of bacon!!! Ridiculous.

I went to the Ruby Slipper on Sunday 6/28/15 for breakfast around 10:30-11:00AM. Waited about 30 minutes, but definitely worth it. Probably the first time I've waited for a table. I had the special, blueberry cheesecake stuffed French toast. It was absolutely amazing. I also had a side of cheese grits which were good. Everything was great and worth the wait!

First meal in NOLA and it was delicious; typically not a Benedict person but the chicken st Charles was to die for. Service was great; iced coffee was refilled quickly and online check in was smoother and convenient.

Solid bet for a breakfast spot. The eggs Benedict are spot on no matter which one you get. The Bloody Mary was delicious as well. This spot gets packed a bit less than other locations I have  been to but it's one of the larger locations as well. Friendly and efficient service!

this is the only breakfast place where we were able to get a made to order food. it was good, it wasn't super expensive like all the other places around here. they do not take RSVPs so you have to give your name to the hostess and wait in line. we waited over 40 minutes for a table of 2. i had their daily special which was louisiana creole( shrimp and andouille jambalaya with poached eggs, with croutons and spinach) it was as good as it gets. also had the pineapple upside down pancake which was also great

We ate at the Magazine location for breakfast. They say you can't drink all day unless you start in the morning. We started with a Bloody Mary and a Brandy Milk Punch. 

Mom had the Blackstone and I had the Costa Rican. I was a little unsure about Costa Rican in the Big Easy but the waiter said it was good. It was. The bacon was delicious  

Service was good. 

A little noisy though.

A very LONG wait, but it was worth it.  The bloody mary is great as are the peach bellinis.  We were offered drinks while we waited, which was nice. Great food. I had the Bananas foster, my friends had the different Eggs benedict.   So good!!

Great brunch, busy but well worth the wait. Pancakes were outstanding as well as French toast, bacon, and killer biscuits.
Service is good, and very comfortable setting. We visited the canal location.

Had a late breakfast here and it was very good. Loud place with lots of activity. Kid friendly. When you see a line outside of a place you know it's gonna be good. All the food was fresh tasting and enjoyed the mimosas before our meal.

Even with the 20 min wait for seating, this place is worth a visit! 
Food was delicious and so were the mimosas! 
Everything is in extremely large portions! 
I had the Eggs Coublon, and was I glad I did! The catfish was a perfect compliment to the egg and the vegetables! 
I thoroughly enjoyed the meal!

The brunch menu selections are diverse, unique, and scrumptious. The coffee is smooth and plentiful. The Big Easy Mimosas are intoxicating, both from their flavors and the alcohol content. I had two, and thank God for Lyft! The waitstaff was friendly, attentive, and accommodating. The "line" was 70 minutes, but I used the "NoWait" app, and the actual wait time was less than 15 minutes. I definitely will visit again when I return to town.

Went here on a weekend jaunt to nola.  Perfect place for a hearty artery clogging brunch! The wait was surprisingly long for a non holiday monday morning--but worth it (waited 30 min).  Recommended dishes; any of the eggs benedicts especially since can get two types of benedicts in one order, candied bacon delish!! The bacon bloody mary is also good.

I didn't want to go here as my wife made me walk all over New Orleans for 3 days. But alas we did (happy wife happy life!!) and I'm glad we did. I got the hot salmon omelet and she got the pancakes. We did the Yelp waitlist check in which was VERY convenient. 

But ya'll, the biscuits and spread they have made me wanna praise the man upstairs (Jesus and the chef)!!
Good solid place for breakfast. Worth coming back. Shrimp omlet is good. Try the eggs benedict too. Very busy place but that because it's good.

The food here was great. With the exception of a slightly inattentive hostess eating at her stand  at the beginning, this was a great first breakfast in New Orleans. 

We were quickly seated at the counter/bar. While I'm not a Bloody Mary drinker, this place looked to be selling a lot of them. The huge container of the mix was right in front of me. 

The man behind the bar, didn't catch his name was a great server and helped my wife pick something that she thoroughly enjoyed. (She's more adventurous with food than I). 

Everything coming out of of the kitchen looked good and the waitstaff was quick and happy. Might stop in again before heading home.

Restaurant is open until 2pm & it is located on commons and magazine st.

It gets packed especially on the weekend (my hubs and I went on a sat afternoon), but it's totally worth it.  WHIle you wait, you can go to the bar and grab $10 double mimosa or bellinis or $11 double champagne.  We waited about 40 min before we got a bench outside.

My hubs and I shared a Costa Rican breakfast with black brand, tomatoes, sunny side eggs, plaintains and chorizo... Yummmmm!!!

We also shared a corned beef benne and chicken st.charles which was kind of the same thing with 2 buttermilk biscuits drenched in some gravy sauce and poached eggs on top. The chicken st Charles had spinach on the side while the corned beef benne had potatoes. Each entree was $13 each.


Everything was flavorful and totally worth the wait. 

If we were to come back to NOLA, we would definitely come back here again.

The Ruby Slipper was a hit for Sunday brunch. The wait was long (a hour), but worth it. The mimosa was strong and a full cup. We enjoyed the eggs Cochon and a make our own omelet. The biscuits were a bit odd and not like your normal heavy southern biscuits. The service was great and the food was very yummy.  Not sure I would wait an hour again, but for one time it was ok.

What can I not say good about the ruby slipper on canal street. Amazing customer service, I became a regular there. I work in hospitality and they always took care of me with my discount. Please try their French toast or their banana foster, to die for. I would recommend everyone to go the canal street location, because less of a wait. The magazine street location wait on a weekend is crazy. ^-^

This place is FTB (for the boys). Walk up to get a table and there is a 40 minute wait - that is always a super duper good sign. 

Any tits, we snagged a Bloody Mary (we like em bloody) - the bartenders were sarcastically funny. Made fun of our Ohio state roots but I don't give a fughhhhhh. Go Buckeyes! They make drinks as strong as "tits." 

Anyways - snagged the three pigs omelette, because I like fairy tales. Taking longer than usual. Not a great fan of long waits due to my impatience.

Side note: broke the seal midway through my second drink. Bathroom wasn't too bad but I'd never drop a deuce here. Moving along... Bacon is digging on point. Toast was garbage. 

It was good. Not great. But def good. Great base for the boozing I'll be doing from here on out in the big easy.  


Prices were good. Aura was good. I would come back vetches. 

Cheers!

I ate a late breakfast two days in a row here, while I usually try to spread the love by sampling as many restaurants as possible while visiting, the offerings were too delicious.  Tried three different benedicts and all were great.  Those banana pecan pancakes! That Bloody Mary! See ya next trip... like Jazzfest!

The expectations climb pretty high when you wait over an hour to be seated. The anticipation that you are about to be amazed overwhelms you. Then the food is just okay and you start thinking why did I wait an hour for this? 

Between the 4 in our group we had the Salmon Eggs Benedict (with one egg solid - cmon!), a three meat omelette, the 2 of the regular eggs Benedict (both eggs nice and runny, seconds tries a charm?).  We sampled each of our plates and again, just wasn't overly impressed.  Two plates had the biscuit as the side and both were burnt on the bottom and doughy on the inside. 

Regret not getting the French toast because it did look and smell fantastic on the table next to ours. 

Hey, at least our waitress was on point. Kudos for good service. 

Personally, I wouldn't buy into the hype of the other reviews. I wouldn't wait over 15 minutes to eat here.

Great place for breakfast. We were able to check in on YELP which made our wait time much shorter. You must be prepared to wait a long time though. Cute little place with great service. Our food came out quickly and it was pretty tasty. Our omelets were delicious. I ordered the Florentine omelet with goat cheese, and it was delicious; it was Very flavorful. My son and husband had the 3 little pigs omelet which included sausage, bacon and cheese; they were very satisfied. We loved the brown sugar butter. It's a must if you're in New Orleans.

Excellent food, friendly staff, excellent service.

Tips: 
1) If you're a late-riser, take advantage of Yelp's service by putting your name on the list to be seated when you're getting ready to go to the restaurant.  That way when you get there, you might only wait 3 - 5 min to get a table!
2) The RS makes their own biscuits, & they're incredible.  Huge & fluffy.  IMO, the buttermilk biscuits are reason enough to visit this restaurant.  
3) If you love Eggs Benedict (and who doesn't?), Ruby Slipper is the place to get it.  Perfect poached eggs are challenging for any kitchen, as is a good Hollandaise sauce, so it's always a pleasant surprise to find a place that gets them right.  The Ruby Slipper takes it a step further, though.  Instead of using English muffins for the base, they use those heavenly biscuits I mentioned.  Next, they offer 6 deliciously creative takes on the classic EB.  Here's the best part: can't decide on just one? No problem.  They have a 7th option called The Peacemaker; pick two, & they'll put one of each on the plate.  How's that for service?  I had the Eggs Cochon EB & the Chicken St. Charles EB, & both were absolutely incredible.  The fried chicken was crisp on the outside, juicy on the inside...details, details, details.  The apple-braised pork debris on the Eggs Cochon was to die for.  I regret not ordering a pound of it to take home.  FYI: "Debris" a term used in Creole & Cajun cooking to refer to a braised meat. Best known for use in a hot po-boy sandwich, RS has used it here in an EB, and it's out-of-sight.

My dining companions ordered a florentine omelette (gigantic), a biscuit, and the Bananas Foster French Toast respectively - all were hits.

Do yourself a favor & make Ruby Slipper one of your breakfasts on you next visit to the French Quarter.

Great place within walking distance from most hotels.  Just opened the second location. Buy one get one free mimosas were great. You'd think with buy one get one they'd be cruddy. Watched our waitress hand pour them and they were great and strong. Husband had banana pancakes and they were good. He's a big guy and he couldn't finish them. I had the big breakfast with eggs, potatoes, bacon and toast. Was good and fresh. I ate every bite. 
Owner came over and chatted and was very friendly. Place was nicely decorated and very clean. Waitress was nice and friendly. All in all we'll definitely bookmark ruby slipper and be back next time we're in town.
Great food and customer service... no American cheese which I was very sad. I had the shrimp, bacon and mushroom omelet.

The people were great!  The food was even better. When we travel we like to eat at the bar so we can chat with others, this was no exception. The apple pancakes were ridiculously wonderful. I can't recall exactly what they're called but they had some caramel sauce I believe. The CBH Benedict was also good although my husbands Eggs Blackstone was a little better.

So I'm sad to say that I didn't actually eat here. I would have been willing to wait the 90+ mins to check it out, but one of the staff members/hostess was so incredibly rude that I won't be able to support this place. I've read several reviews about it being a tourist trap and that's ok, but folks need a little more training. I know you're busy and I know your job is not easy, but what a way to ensure that people don't eat here.

Great service! Amazing food! We were staying at le maison hotel right across from Ruby slipper and since we got here we saw they were always busy so we had to try it! I looked at their reviews and everything looked really good. We were not disappointed! Come early i think brunch time gets a lot busier than their breakfast time.

I want to start off by saying I'm a regular patron of RS' Mid-City location. Great service, great food....Unfortunately one day I had a horrible service experience at this CBD location. I know (or thought I knew) how the seating worked. There was no line of people waiting outside to be seated. When I came in the hostess had just left from her station to seat a family of 5. I saw several empty seats at the bar so I went ahead and seated myself. I sat there for almost 3 minutes with no acknowledgement from either of the two workers behind the bar. There was a guy that seemed pretty busy but there was a woman who appeared to be free. I managed to make eye contact with her, she came over, I asked her for a menu she told me I would have to be seated by the hostess...I would have to get up from a row of empty seats, walk back to the welcome booth and ask to be seated?!?

I did so....The hostess apologized and stated I could have stayed put as there was no one waiting to be seated. While waiting to be acknowledged (again) another patron came in and made the same "mistake" as me by just sitting at the bar. The rude server also instructed them to see the hostess to be seated, their response "I have to ask to be seated at the bar???". After the person got up, she rolled her eyes and began complaining to seated customers about how she has to "answer that kind of question all day" and how "people think they can just sit wherever they want". I was looking dead in her eyes in disgust. How dare you complain about customers!!! There was NO LINE. I'd understand if it was a busy time of the day. The rudeness was just uncalled for. I placed my order with the order server at the bar (luckily) and had pretty good service from him throughout my short meal. The rude server picked up my check (rolls eyes) and did not utter a "Thank You" or "Have a Nice Day". I won't be returning to this location, I don't care how much I'm craving RS while in the area, no thanks!!!

Great location for people downtown in the CBD. We had lunch there and I had the Buffalo Shrimp salad and a cup of gumbo. I had the shrimp grilled instead of fried. It comes with the buffalo sauce and blu cheese crumbles. The gumbo was really good. The portion was good size.

Server was friendly.

So before I arrived in NOLA I bookmarked lots of places to eat and this happen to be one of them. I was happy it was walking distance from our hotel. I arrived the wait was short we sat at the bar. The place was packed for a Thursday morning. The menu was awesome the food took a while to come out but I rather it be fresh. I had the eggs, fried GT, biscuit, grits and bacon and it was delicious. I also had a mimosa I'm not a drinker so I had a sip and my boyfriend finished it for me. Now I wanted to give this place a 5 but there was a few flies that would not leave. We were fanning them away the entire time. I wish they would have done something about that. The staff was friendly and apologized about the flies but my arm gained a muscle by the time I left lol great place to visit if you're ever in the area.

This place was recommended by our lyft driver which is one of the breakfast and brunch spot and she was right. The place was packed around 11 am on a weekday, only waited like 15 minutes, was seated at the bar, started out with the Irish coffee which had baileys cream In it so it was nice to be tipsy at 11 am. The food overall was very comforting and made me feel southern to have such a tasty dish, the eggs Benedict was to die for with different meat below it. I would recommend this breakfast spot to any new NOLA visitors.

I had the eggs Cochon - a pulled pork eggs Benedict. It was $13. The portion was quite large - definitely a big brunch. It was very tasty and I would definitely recommend. The only con was the long wait for a table.
Food is delicious, Irish coffee is a must, super friendly staff. Can not go wrong eating here.

This place is very crowded but the breakfasts is very good and the aesthetics are typical New Orleans. I enjoyed taking my client there even though we had to sit at the bar to get in at a reasonable amount of time. It's a fun place to go

Staff was friendly, menu was fun, food was delicious! The drinks flow early and often so don't miss out on this great location when you visit New Orleans! Also, ask for Roxanne - she is friendly, east going and will take good care of you. I will definitely be returning!
Long lines but you can reserve a table in advance using the Yelp app. Trust me you can split the dish easily as the biscuits are fantastic. Recommend early morning visit.

Big, homemade, hot biscuits cooked just right. Delicious grits. Rich, steaming coffee. Excellent service. What's not to love??? Prices were reasonable, too. The manager even helped us get a cab. Love this place!

I decided to eat here because of the location, but was surprised by how great everything was. Excellent service from the front door to the excellent and friendly bartender. I sat at the bar because it was almost noon and busy. I ordered coffee and Jake asked if I wanted Irish cream or Irish whiskey? What a brilliant idea! Ended up drinking 2 with Irish cream and whipped cream! I told Jake I was torn between the St. Charles Chicken and the Cheese burger with candied bacon and goat cheese. He said I should get the chicken with a side of candied bacon. Holy Moly that was the best brunch I have had in a long time! And I was going to get a salad.

Fantastic brunch spot in downtown New Orleans.

In summary, get here early or expect quite a wait.  We went for 11am Sunday brunch (I'd rather wait than get up early, whatever) and waited a little less than the 35 minutes they told us.  Pleasant that they give you a wait time, so you can decide if it's worth it.  My biggest complaint is that they don't advertise that you can get a drink at their bar (not seated, just order it) to have while you wait.  I would have loved to ease the wait with a bloody mary (hell, it's NOLA, okay!), and it would be more profitable to them, anyway.  I only realized they allowed this when I saw several people get seated with drinks in hand (and they both state and enforce you can't enter with outside beverages).  Their rules are posted, and are legit: no outside drinks, no reservations, and have your whole party ready.  We watched a number of ignorant patrons try to break all three, but they do it to keep things moving, and really, they're quite efficient.

Food is great, as everyone says.  Bananas foster was invented in New Orleans, so if you're a tourist you have to get that.  It's amazing, and the bacon is a nice salty compliment to the sweet dish.  They make a good bloody mary, not really hot but very peppery and spicy.  Also, their founding story about coming back after Katrina and doing their part to rebuild the city is nice; a feel-good yummy NOLA Sunday brunch.
Brunch was amazing! A little bit of a wait, but not bad, well worth it.  They take good care of you. Been here several times and never been disappointed.
Awesome authentic southern breakfast with grits. Eggs and bacon done just right.

We have visited Ruby Slipper for breakfast three days out of four. The portions are quite large and the meal is prepared from scratch. Service is outstanding and if you sit at the bar you will be entertained and amused. The Bloody Mary's are a specialty at this restaurant.

This place is simply amazing! I did quite a bit of research on the best breakfast spots throughout the city and this restaurant certainly lived up to the hype!!!

We were lucky in that the wait was less than 5 minutes on the morning of our first visit. In addition, the place has a cool laid back atmosphere and nice bar area (if you happen to have a wait for a table).  

After being seated I ordered a great tasting mimosa and then went with the recommendation of my server... the shrimp & grits. As others have mentioned, the plate is the best version I've had.  Decent sized shrimp, a perfect blend of herbs, spices, and grits that were perfect in texture!
