My kids ordered the French toast and candied bacon. The serving size was HUGE.  I joked that our table had gone silent as we were busy cleaning up every morsel of our delicious breakfast entrees! We decided it will be the go to breakfast spot whenever we're in New Orleans!
One of the best brunches I ever had. Servers are super nice. Great food and very cozy atmosphere.

Loved this place! The hostess was not very welcoming but the waiter and other staff were great. He explained everything and was very friendly! Me and my husband both ordered the Trifecta. It was delicious!!!! Pancakes were sorta plain but my sons had their burger with the candied bacon! I would definitely eat here again!

This place was well worth the wait. We had an hour wait and a line just about down the street. However once we were in and seated the customer service was great and very insightful! The food was awesome! I got the pancakes and chicken sausage and those pancakes were jumbo! I would definitely suggest stopping here for breakfast/bunch.
This is a great little place to have Breakfast. It's "off the Yellow Brick Road" location adds to its mystery and obviously it's popularity. We really enjoyed the food and the atmosphere.

One of the best breakfasts I've ever had! Ruby Slipper is so good. It's only open for breakfast and lunch so if you want to try it, you have to go early! Or else there will be a wait. My girlfriends and I went one morning. They give you so much food that I was able to create a "to go" sampler platter for my husband (who is opposed to waking up so early in the morning but still likes breakfast :) ) of 3 untouched food items. I ordered the Gulf St. Peter which is 2 cheese grit cakes topped with grilled fish, a shrimp skewer and topped with a luscious Hollandaise-like sauce served on a bed of sauteed spinach and tomatoes. So so good. My girlfriends ordered The Cuban breakfast and the pulled pork benedict. Both were also amazing. Servers behind the bar were pretty ho-hum, but the food makes up for what could have been more attentive service.

This is a fabulous breakfast place to visit in NOLA.  As many reviewers have stated, the Bananas Fosters French Toast is amazing - an absolute must!  The menu us fairly small, but all items were great choices and the few we tried were all wonderful.  They also make great mimosas with fresh squeezed juice and pomegranate that shouldn't be missed - especially if you use the Yelp 2 for 1 checkin special with your phone app.  Don't miss this place - we will go back before we leave.
Great breakfast, great service and always a good choice.  Biggest disappointment is the wait but I feel like they are really trying to make that better by adding an app called Nowait.

Great breakfast spot. They have their own take on traditional fare and some different items that really stand out. I got the costsa  rican breakfast, awesome. Heart-warming back-story about the place too.
Jacus was our waiter and was absolutely fabulous- as was our meal!  The Blood Mary and the Costa Rican- a great way to start the day!!!

This spot came highly recommended by many different people for a must for brunch in New Orleans, so I had high expectations. We were told there was a 1 hour wait, which was expected - but that turned into 2 hours. When we were finally seated we ordered. The place is cool from the inside. We all had double mimosas - i watched them make it and there was a LOT of champagne in those - good call. The menu was OK, nothing crazy stood out to me and when our meals came out no one raved about anything. Two of my friends had plates come out cold - when they requested to speak to the manager and told them it was cold, he looked at them like they had 3 heads. He just took the plates away. We were so shocked he didn't apologize or offer anything else. He came back later with the plate which looked soggy and we're sure he just heated it up - he again said nothing dropped the plates and then left. I saw him go in the back and roll his eyes - maybe if the food wasn't cold no one would complain, just a thought. 

I went to the bathroom and overheard a woman talking about how this place is a scam - she worked at the hotel next door and apologized when i told her about our experience. She recommended other brunch spots that she assured us we would have a better time at.

Overall, food was eh and management - horrible - i have never seen a manager of a restaurant act that way - at least not right in front of the customers!

This restaurant was awesome. The first time visiting, we went to the one on Canal Street and it was delicious, we had four people in our party and we all ordered the same two entrees. Two of us got the weekend special: creole Benedict that had chicken, shrimp, and andouille sausage piled on a house-made biscuit, and the other two of us had the Saint Charles Benedict that was fried chicken on their house-made biscuit with a porky hollandaise.
These entrees were both delicious and perfect for a hearty breakfast for tourists that were walking all day long. We decided that we would return the next day for again a hearty-breakfast before heading to the airport to go back to Phoenix. When we visited their website to see what time they opened, we discovered they had a closer location on Magazine street and decided to go there. We arrived about 8:30 and they sat us right away. As we started looking over the menu, our waitress Neoka came and asked our drink order. My mom proceeeed to tell her that it was my 21st birthday and I need a drink. I ordered the Bloody Mary as it was a rewarded drink of theirs. It was very flavorful and we ordered the same entrees besides one. My mom also got the gulf fish St. Peter and it was delicious on  the corn cake which was like a polenta cake. Finally, Neoka had the kitchen staff make me a chocolate chip pancake with the number 21 written in melted chocolate on the pancake. This was the just the perfect touch: not only was it so sweet of her to do, but it was the perfect amount of sweetness after a deliciously savory breakfast. I will recommend the Ruby Slipper to everyone after this experience.

I am soooooo glad that i tried this place early in my stay so that i could eat here as many times as possible! Believe the hype.... i love breakfast out, and Ruby Slipper is the absolute best!!  i only visited the one on Magazine St (next door to the Pelham Hotel, also a great place). Staff were awesome - friendly, warm, on point, kept the coffee coming! Do be prepared for a  wait at breakfast time, or get up and get there early. Love love love the Ruby Slipper!!

The best eggs Benedict ever . I had the corned beef on homemade Biscuit with breakfast potatoes and Hollandaise sauce and the other half of the meal was  fried Chicken breast  Benedict. Same delicious biscuit . Great southern fried chicken breast and topped with their
Signature hollandaise sauce . 
They are known for their selection of eggs Benedict choices. 
Excellent

Long wait but pretty good food. We waited about 45-60 minutes for brunch on a weekday and were able to get in right before they close at 2pm. Service was good though and our food came out quickly after we ordered. The portions here are huge! I got the eggs cochon and bananas foster pain perdu. Eggs cochon was soooo good. The bananas foster pain perdu was just okay. It lacked enough syrup so it was just like eating bread. Although we didn't get to try it, the couple sitting next to us said they had the best bloody mary in town. Will definitely try it next time.
The salmon benedict is to die for! The biscuits are fresh and the pancakes are made from scratch! It's well worth the wait!

I've read a lot of great reviews of Ruby Slipper, and we were pretty excited to have breakfast here, but we found it pretty disappointing.

Our bacon was overcooked, our pancakes were undercooked, and the grits were downright unpleasant. The Bananas Foster Pain Perdu was okay, but we ended up having something similar elsewhere that was better. I wouldn't go back.

After waiting almost an hour outside, we were placed in a table at the back busing section of the restaurant where they immediately opened the back door we were seated next to (this was the end of December). Staff pushed by our table constantly and I, along with my meal, froze in the cold wind that blew in directly on us. My omelette I waited forever for? Cold and inedible in minutes due to the rude service. NOT WORTH IT.

I had the breakfast special of a crab cake with grits, biscuit and eggs. Grits were ok but a little too salty and too crunchy. The crab cake was great as well as the biscuit. Overall,  not bad but a little pricey.

Carolina, Carolina, Carolina!  She is the next l best server in the world! 
Great service, very attentive, and extremely funny!  She understands what it takes to run a successful restaurant!  You can tell that she was trained right!  I enjoyed my time at this place because she made it an amazing experience!

The Benedict were wonderful.  I had the one with the chicken, and then I also had one with pulled pork. I sampled the shrimp and grits and it was an extremely tasteful entree.  I also had a cappuccino and it was fantastic. I used to be a fan of Mother's Restaurant down the street but it looks like I have a new go to place in the city of New Orleans while visiting here!

Great selection and iced coffee! The ambiance is electric even before you get your coffee. The house brew is solid, but the ice coffee is better! The poached trifecta gives you a good overview of the poached/ biscuit combos available. They were a little light on sauce/ gravy, but I'd definitely visit again next time I am in NOLA.

This restaurant is great and has good eats... However I took one star off bc the greeter at the front of the door was not pleasant at all and definitely not the smiley friendly face you want to experience and say hi to in the AM... They also have a rule that EVERYONE in your party has to be there before getting seated so FYI!! You might be able to get away with it like we did by ordering for them..

Anyway on to the food... We chose savory vs sweet this morning I got the pork cochon with a side of cheesy grits, my friend got the fried chicken, my other friend got catfish with the fried cheesy grits and some shrimp and my other friend got the Colombian breakfast!!! Everything was delicious!!! Now I'll be back for the sweet menu items next time!!!

This is undoubtedly my favorite breakfast spot in the entire world. I've eaten at the Ruby Slipper every time I've visited New Orleans and not once have I been disappointed. I generally get one of the daily specials because they're always absolutely amazing, but anytime I've tried the other breakfast options I've loved them all. I would eat the Costa Rican Breakfast everyday if I could. The wait is always long, but I personally enjoy grabbing a drink at the bar and sitting outside while I wait. I can promise you that it's well worth it!

I went to brunch here on my last day in Nola. I ordered the Shrimp and Grits and I was blown away. I told the manager, that this was the best version of Shrimp and Grits I've ever had. My friend ordered the Salmon Benedict and she was gracious enough to let me sample her dish. Again, blown away. The crust on the cake itself was the perfect thickness and the mixture of herbs with the salmon where perfection. Service was fantastic. There were so many choices to choose from and I look forward to goign here again to sample each of them. Worth every. single. penny.

Be prepared to wait, but the food is well worth it. Enjoy a cocktail or coffee while you wait.

I will give it a 3 star because my husband really liked his French toast but my shrimp and grits tasted like cafeteria food the service was great but It was a total disappointment when I heard all the hype about this place and my s/g tasted blahhhh! If you want GOOD s/g go to "Two Chicks Cafe" I had that at emerils too and they weren't even that good either. It was ok @ emerils.

Not worth the wait. Gross and cold food.

I had big expectations for this place. Many people recommended it to me with rave reviews. Especially after waiting for 30 minutes for a table, you expect it to be worth the wait. Sorely mistaken.

Our server was mediocre. I am a server, so getting okay service is usually fine with me because I understand, but it actually seemed like she didn't care and kept forgetting about us. The other server outside was far more attentive and even checked on us more often than our server. 

I asked for a recommendation between the skinny migas and the Costa Rican, and the server pointed me to the latter. The menu said that it could be served with or without the meat, and she didn't ask so I assumed it was an add on (I'm vegetarian)

We waited about 30 minutes for our food. Absolutely ridiculous, we were starving and we're hoping it was worth the 60 minute total wait. My food was cold and flavorless!!! My boyfriends croque madam was overly soggy and sweet. I sent back my food and didn't want a replacement, even when the manager came over and offered, that's how terrible it was. My boyfriend was a little nicer and at least tried to eat his... At this point, the server finally seemed to care a little bit, but only barely. Took item off the check but this meal still ruined our morning.

Very good breakfast. Definitely not a "light" breakfast. Some awesome specialty dishes. Benedict options are crazy. The also have some pretty fancy bacon infused vodka Bloody Marys if you are into that kind of thing.
Love the place, visit here every time I'm in NOLA. Expect a wait, but totally worth it. I'm not a usual Bloody Mary drinker but the ones here are delicious! Are the brandy milk punch is good.

Went here with six youths during our stay for the ELCA National Youth Gathering. This was one of the closest restaurants to our accommodations at the Doubletree, so we went here for breakfast. We had a short wait and had to be divided into two smaller groups to secure tables. I ordered the special Peanut Butter French Toast, which was quite possibly one of the best breakfast dishes I've ever had. The others seemed to enjoy their food as well, particularly the biscuits. I liked my cappuccino, but I'm no coffee expert. My only beef was with that no prices were listed with the specials, and so I was not expecting my meal to cost quite as much as it did.

LOOONG wait, but good food use the Nowait app feature to get in line (I misread it that the location didn't have any wait time - don't make the same mistake). Mimosas are poured heavy, my husband said the bacon Bloody Mary was to die for!

There's no place like home!

Thanks Yelp! Returning the favor now, b/c my Bo found this place through the good reviews on here. This taste is to perfection, true story folks! 

After all the debauchery from Fat Tuesday I was craving a nice meal that would fill my tummy with warmth and love. This place is so cozy and cute, with a menu that wants to nurture your craving. 

I ordered the chocolate chip pancakes and I drenched them with syrup cause that's what I do! I also had the ruby slipper club to soak up all the alcohol in my body & the bartender made a mean breakfast cocktail to cure the morning after effect. 

We felt very well taken care of here and intend to return when we visit NOLA again.

I wanted to have breakfast here since I last was here in 2013. Unfortunately, this is the case when too much success is killing the experience. Food is ok, but not worth waiting 45 minutes in automated line with a risk of loosing your table if you do not get back within 10 minutes of receiving a text notification. If not everyone in your party arrived on time, you lose the table. If you want to switch places (damn, it is cold near the entrance), you go back on the waiting list. Mimosas are $10. Bar tenders are great though. Cocktails are good as everywhere around. These guys got lucky with the location and unlimited supply of tourists. Been here. Put a tick in my imaginary itinerary. Done with it. Also my wife did not feel well after that.

Looking for breakfast near my hotel and found this on Yelp. Thanks, fellow reviewers! I was dining solo, and it was pretty early, so they seated me immediately at the bar. I ended up ordering the shrimp and grits, which came with a biscuit on the side, and coffee. Shrimp was perfectly cooked, biscuit was tender and flaky, grits were a treat for a Utah girl. I wish they had better jam for the biscuit, not just the weird jelly in a tub. I am just spoiled by the homemade jam at my neighborhood joint (Park Cafe!)

The guy next to me ordered some pork concoction that looked and smelled really, really good. I will be back Ruby Slipper!

Loved that they gave me coffee for the road, helped keep me awake through a long day of work conference.

Soooooo good! Yes, there was a wait (about 25 min when we got there, it was up to an hour a few minutes after we arrived) but it was worth it. Love that they take your number and text you when your table is ready - allows some freedom to roam when the wait time is high. Waitresses will also take drink orders while you wait so you can sip your coffee or bloody Mary outside in line. Food was just great - I had the Eggs Blackstone (biscuit topped with poached eggs, bacon & Hollandaise). Their Hollandaise was a little different than (what I would consider) a traditional Hollandaise, but in a really good way! It's a little orange-ish in color and just darn tasty! So, buck up & get in line - you won't regret it!
This place was pretty decent. Got a to go order from here just because it was packed as all. Seemed like a lot of people definitely like this place. I'd recommend for great brunch.

Worth the wait ...but register on yelp to reserve ur spot ahead of time .... this was THER absolute best fish and grits I have ever had in my entire life!!!! Can't wait to come back this is a must stop every time  I visit New Orleans.
Really liked this big/little breakfast restaurant. The food was good, the service was better. I liked that you could get cocktails w/Breakfast!! I had an omelet and grits which were both delish.

Adorable diner ambience! Had an open and fresh layout. Lots of natural light to get you ready for the day. 

Started with the FRIED GREEN TOMATOES and had to say they were interesting. They had a wonderful crisp to them...tasted like the breading had fresh thyme in it which overpowers all other flavors. But I liked it. 

Daily special that day was the SOUTHERN PEACH PANCAKES. I have to tell you their pancakes really have that homemade taste to them so that was great. However the peaches don't really add much to the pancakes. 

My nieces ordered the BANANAS FOSTER PAIN PERDU which was heavenly but then again I'm a sucker for anything covered in freshly sliced bananas and caramel sauce. Definitely want to order this again.

Visited during early morning and had a short wait. I had to try the bananas foster French toast. It was so flavorful and lived up to the hype. A friend of mine had the eggs Benedict which were also great. I even bought a coffee mug as a souvenir. Great overall experience. A must for anyone who wants to experience a New Orleans brunch.

We both at the southern breakfast, great biscuits! Food was delicious can't wait to go back. The yelp call ahead function was excellent we only had a two minute wait when we get there even though the line was very long.
Favorite breakfast place.  Service is awesome and food is great.   Grits and pancakes are delicious.

Things to know: great location, great food. Will likely be busy when you visit. In other words, this place has earned the reputation that it enjoys.

I like the Southern Breakfast. Migas are also good. If you have to wait, try to sit at the bar and order a Mimosa or something to pass the time.

We found this spot on yelp and decided to give it a try based on its high ratings. Upon arriving at the Ruby Slipper there was an extensive wait and this was visible by the swarms of people surrounding this corner gem. We waited about an hour and fifteen minutes. As soon as our table was ready we were greeted by our waiter who was friendly and courteous, he quickly received our order and delivered our drinks promptly. I ordered a mimosa and my husband had the latte. The mimosa was as expected and the latte was good. We waited about 10 minutes until we received our food, both my husband and I ordered eggs blackstone, which consisted of eggs benedict on a light fluffy biscuit, with bacon and tomatos. This was beyond delicious and a great take on the traditional brunch favorite. We also had the cinnamon swirl pancakes, which were amazing!!! Think cinnamon pancakes with cream cheese frosting, simply sweet describes this dish. Once we devoured our food, our waiter gave us the check after upon our request and out the door we were, continuing our day to sight see New Orleans. Definitely recommend this wonderful spot for breakfast/brunch.

Waited an hour for this gem.  Totally worth the wait.  Everything that went by looked amazing.  Had the pancake trio.  Absolutely delicious.  Friendly waitress and manager.  Hostess wasn't quite as friendly but was probably stressed out whit the line up of people!  Definitely a must if you are in the area!!

They told me the could accommodate a large party, however, when I got there we waited forever. Once seated my party was split up I got three tables, which was not what I wanted in my moms birthday. 
Other than that, good is amazing and I'd go back with a smaller group.

OMG. Please open one in Miami. The food was beyyoonnndddddd delicious. The drinks are amazing as well. It was worth the wait. Speaking of making sure you join the waitlist on Yelp. But the food is definitely worth the wait.

I don't know about other meals but breakfast food and choices amazing!!! 
Awesome friendly and quick service.  Loved the crab cake special for breakfast!

Here on vacay and decided to try out this "highly-rated" establishment. We got inside and service was ok. I start asking the server questions and she states that she has to check with her manager. My order was two eggs scrambled hard with cheddar cheese, spinach, and tomatoes. 

Homegirl came back to the table and told me she can't make any substitutions, the manager said, the menu stands as is. I should have walked out, but dang it, I was hungry. 

Be prepared to review the menu and figure out what you want. #nosubstitutions

Holy Benedict! This New Orleans bruncherie is one of the best ways to start out your day in the Big Easy. Start off your meal with some good-side-of-average coffee or, if you please, something stronger (can't speak to the Bloody Mary, but they're supposedly top notch). You can't go wrong with any of the benedicts but the Shrimp Boogaloo was our favorite. Another winner was the Gulf Fish St. Peter. This was more on the "unch" side of "brunch." One spectacular cheesy grit cake, I might add. The perfect take on a southern classic. The owners were ready to come back to NOLA and get the Ruby Slipper going after Hurricane Katrina. Whether you come from near or far, this gem will truly make you believe "there's no place like home" in NOLA.
Food was good. Strawberries didn't look very good. It was really crowded. And there was no air circulation so it was really hot inside. But over all it was good! Try the banana foster!

Oh ma gaahhhhhhh. I'm SO sad we only ate here on our last day. THE BEST food. I wish I could package them up and take them home to San Diego :( this is a MUST when in New Orleans. We opted for the Benny special and French roast special, but looking at other plates, I'm thinking you cannot possibly go wrong. It is worth the wait! Go as early as possible!

This high rating is an example of the YelpMob effect, which can be very tricky.  I was super hungry and found this spot on Yelp.  I ordered the cochon special and ended up with a glob of mediocre pulled pork with a few eggs on it.  Sounded amazing, just wasn't.  Expensive, I didn't get a drink and paid almost $20 for the equivalent of a pulled pork sandwich.

Plan ahead. Wait is usually 15 to 30 minutes. 
Good food. Nice portions. Good mimosas and margaritas. Short walk from canal and bourbon.
First meal when we arrived in NOLA, loved their spicy Bloody Mary. Breakfast was quick and delicious the biscuits amazing

Met there early for a quick breakfast meeting. It was easy to get a seat and the food came super fast. The portions were mostly large and heavy, but good. The music was loud, but we asked them to turn it down a bit and they were happy to comply.

Great atmosphere, friendly service. My Eggs Cochon were correctly poached, but the hollandaise had completely separated. I didn't bother with requesting another plate, though perhaps I could have. The Bloody Mary was wonderful--two pickled green beans and an olive, accompanied by a half lemon and half lime slice. I was very disappointed to find out that they were sold out of T-shirts in almost all designs.

Tip: put your name down either via the no wait app (didn't know about this) or go walk around after putting your name down. The hostess is very good at giving you a time estimate and they text you when your table is ready. Food here is pretty good. Would definitely come back again to try more.

We stopped here on our family vacay in NOLA, we took the advice of fellow yelpers and got on the waiting list, we literally waited about 5 min once we got there, I was a very cold day and it would have sucked to stand in line for 45 min, so I highly recommend you get on the list! There are plenty of pay to park parking garages near by.
Great service and delicious food. I would recommend this place. When I visit New Orleans again I will be definitely coming back here.

So I found this place on Yelp...um duh! where else do you think I would look?! To nobody's surprise...of course it was fantastic! There is a reason this place has an incredible amount of good or great reviews. The food here was just brilliant.

This place quite popular and gets busy early, and stays busy...so come as early as possible in order to avoid the long wait. I was impressed by the techno savvy hosts & hostess that were running the place. They take your number and text you when your table is ready in addition to calling your name out loud. My friend and I got lucky, I think we waited for less than 15 minutes, while we were told it was going to be about 45 minutes. Maybe, because we were OK with sitting at the bar.  

So guess what...we sat at the bar and had the pleasure of being entertained by one of the bartenders; Jacob, real personable, genuine and helpful guy...apparently into fishing as well. 

To start I got a Bloody Mary Bacon. Excellent choice! One of the best Bloody Mary's I had! The  Bloody Mary mix is made in house, perfectly balanced...salty, spicy, tangy...pretty much how an excellent Bloody Mary should taste, topped with a piece of Bacon! BACON!!! 

I got the Gulf Fish 'St. Peter' - The fish of the day was a Big Red Drum also called  Channel Bass, Redfish, Spottail Bass, or simply Red (Information was from Jacob...free of charge). Its a local Atlantic fish, which happened to be exactly what I was looking for...something local. The Pan Seared Fish was excellent, light flakey perfectly complimented by the mustard sauce. I only wish the piece of fish was a bit more generous. Never had a Cheesy Grit cake before, this was something foreign to me...tasted like a lighter hash-brown, the inside was softer.

My buddy got the BBQ Shrimp & Grits. I got to sneak a taste of his dish. This was simply amazing...pretty much perfection! This is exactly how I pictured Shrimp & Grits in my head. Fresh local plump and juicy sautéed gulf shrimp with creamy flavorful grits! Yaassss! Even the buttermilk biscuit was delicious, light fluffy and full of flavor...bravo!  

Big fan of this place, I will endeavor to return here every time I visit NOLA
Food is really good- have to wait sometimes, but worth the wait! Bloody Mary is spicy good! Enjoyed everything I had here- will return- service was on point during busy time also! Way to go-

Five of us had breakfast there...overall a hit!  Food was generally delicious - I had a BL2T sammie, with bacon (heavenly), lettuce, and fried red & green tomatoes, all to make a delicious sammie. Came with fries, which were disgusting...very under cooked and cold.  Others had biscuit sandwiches, eggs and such, and loved it. Service was very friendly and quick....although the restaurant is super busy and chaotic, so be patient.
Ruby slipper was not worth the hype or the wait.  We were told 30 minutes and waited an hour.  The food was very heavy - large portions but little taste.

Great food, great service.  Perfect for Sunday brunch.

For our last morning in New Orleans, on a whim we went for the Ruby Slipper Cafe.  It was Sunday morning around 9:45 or 10, so there was already a fairly large crowd waiting outside of the cafe for tables.  For a party of two, it was estimated it would be a 30 minute wait, but it ended up being only 15 minutes (yay!).  

No question, I got the Eggs Cochon (a twist on eggs benedict with pork debris on buttermilk biscuits topped with poached eggs and hollandaise).  With some splashes of hot sauce, perfect.  My husband got the bacon and egg breakfast sliders -- he is still talking about them.  One had "pig-candy bacon" and cheddar on top.  The other hand a fried egg and roasted red pepper.  And he loved the picked red onion on the side.    

The service was super friendly without being overbearing.  Our coffee cups were always full and the mimosas include generous pours of champagne.  Despite the busy-ness of the restaurant, we didn't feel rushed to leave. 

Really enjoyed our experience at Ruby Slipper Cafe.  There is a lot of other items on the menu that we want to try, so we'll be back.
Food OK, but shouldn't have taken 45 min to serve bacon and eggs, even on a Sunday.  To top it off, they ran out of pancake mix just before I was seated at noon.

We stayed in New Orleans for 3 days, 2 nights. Dined at a different Ruby's Slipper each morning. I got the same eggs cochon at each one. Definitely try them! You don't have to get them 3 days in a row like I did, but try them at least once.  The main difference at this is location was our waiter. Alberto, I think, put the icing on the pancakes! He cracked jokes, made us laugh, and we could tell he enjoys his job.  He was a nice upbeat way to start our day.  Not a huge fan of the mimosas because they have pulp in them, good flavor, just not too into pulp in my OJ. It's obvious why this restaurant is so popular, delicious breakfast, nice atmosphere, and good drinks.

Whatever you do....do not go far from the hostess. We were sitting in the waiting chairs right inside the door for 45 minutes waiting for our table. One of us went to the hostess stand to check when our table was coming up and she said she had just given it away because she called our name and no one came. What?? We've been standing behind you the entire time! What's the point of having chairs inside to sit and wait if you don't go inside and call names. We needed up having to wait another 15 minutes for them to get us another table. 

The food was good. I had the eggs Cochon which was delicious but if you love a lot of Hollandaise sauce then you better ask for extra when you order it. 

Overall the food was good but this is the second time I've had such a ridiculous wait to eat here. I don't think it's worth it anymore.

Everything about this place was great. The decor is like a casual diner, nice high ceilings and some outdoor seating. I had the eggs cubion which were unbelievable, a lot of their dishes include poached eggs and they do them well. Had a delicious double
Mimosa, friendly staff, not too loud or crowded. It is definitely a great place to stop and get some great food.

I was in NOLA for a long weekend and ate breakfast/brunch here twice......Sure there was a wait, but it went by quickly.....My first visit I had Migas which was really good (the tortillas were crunchy & the avocado fresh).....and on my second visit I had a sandwich.....it's small, tight but eating at the counter makes you feel like you're eating at your neighbor's breakfast nook

The prices are reasonable and you can partake of a mimosa or Bloody Mary while you wait to be seated.
This place is so good. It took me forever to decide what I wanted because there were so many great choices. The Florentine omelet was delicious. I am definitely going back!

In planning for our vacation to New Orleans, I knew we had to make a stop at Ruby Slipper to brunch.  We decided to stop in after checking into our hotel; I should have put in for the waitlist via the Yelp app,  as there was about a 30-40 minute wait for a party of 2 upon putting our names in.  No big deal, as we were able to grab cocktails to-go and walk around with a Bloody and Mimosa in tow.  Their system text messages you with a 5 minute notice when your table is ready, so don't wander too far away.

The menu is a good mix of Benny's, omelets, and breakfast plates with a southern twist.  We both opted for the "Peacemaker" Benny option, which allows you to get two different types for $15.  I got the fried chicken and the Rueben, while my date got the salmon and shrimp. All were great, with the fried chicken being the favorite between us.  The biscuits are the bomb, and I regret not ordering a few to walk around and eat.  Maybe later.  The drinks were great, with 3 different Bloody Mary options and a handful of Mimosa variations, in addition to Irish coffees and other adult drinks.  We sat at the bar to eat and I was amazed at just how much orange juice and champagne they went through in our time there.  

All in all, our service, food, and price point were great.  I would definitely recommend this as a stop for anyone looking to brunch in the area and wouldn't be surprised if we made a second visit for the biscuits.

Stopped here on our last day for breakfast on the recommendation of  our hotel concierge that we had to try the fried green tomatoes - which my friend was dying to sample. When we looked at the menu we noticed that they were on the lunch menu that started at 11 am and we were ordering around 10:45. 
We asked the server since it was so close to 11am, and we explained we were leaving that day, if we could order - she came back from the kitchen and said no, that there were none prepped. Disappointing and not very accommodating.

Then as we're waiting (after having already ordered), I asked her for the wifi code - she replied that they did not give it out to the public?? 

This irked me, because I'm not the public, I'm a paying customer and every single other place I went to willingly gave the wifi code if you had ordered/paying customer. I know it may seem petty but it struck me as poor customer service at best.

Atmosphere was nice and the food that we did order was good, but don't know that I would necessarily be back.

Not that this place needs another raving review, but I just had to post! During our recent trip to NOLA, we couldn't get enough of their eggs cochon and bananas foster pan perdu and ate breakfast here all three days of our trip. We also tried the grits, eggs blackstone and pineapple upside down pancake (as a side). I suggest getting there really early on the weekends (Fri-Sun). We first went on a Thursday morning and the wait wasn't bad, but there was a line out the door on Friday and Saturday.

Perfect brunch spot for our last day in NOLA.
If you don't wake up early..be sure to add your name to the online wait list. We stayed across the street and were able to walk over (avoid standing in the massive crowd) and sit down immediately. The coffee was hot and strong (perfect morning-after pick me up). Cochon benedict was delicious (hollandaise had just the right amount of tang) & just the right portion to feel full but not overstuffed.

Ruby Slipper Cafe is located right off of Canal Street on Magazine.  A friend of mine who used to live in Nola recommended that I try it.

My friends and I headed there for brunch before leaving Nola.  We walked in and were seated pretty immediately.  I ordered Ruby's Basic Breakfast with bacon, grits, and toast.

I had a lot of grits in Nola, but I think my favorite would have to be from Ruby Slipper.  There was a lot of flavor, and the consistency wasn't mushy or clumpy.  The breakfast was basic and delicious, the bacon was cooked well--not burnt or crispy, just the way I like it.

We let our server know that we were in a time crunch as we were trying to catch a flight, so she got our orders out relatively quickly and we were able to pay for our tab right then and there.

The other girls ordered the Costa Rican Breakfast & Migas.  The portions were HUGE and looked so delicious.  Both of them pretty much finished their entire dishes, so I can imagine how yummy it was.

All I can think about are the grits, drooooool.

After reading reviews about this place I was super excited to try, especially since it was only a block away from where I was staying. I didn't mind the wait: it's Sunday morning, I am on a business trip, and had the time to spare.

I was by myself and got seated at the bar. No problem with that. I ordered coffee, a Mimosa, and their specialty dish: Eggs Cochon. Within 5 minutes of ordering the food was in front of me. This is good but at the same time made me think that it was already made and just waiting for pick up like fast food.

While the food looked really good it desperately lacked in flavor. The biscuits tasted and felt stale, not flaky and buttery as biscuits are. The poached eggs were over cooked. The pork had no seasoning. To top it off, after getting my drinks, food and the check in front of me, no one asked me if I needed anything else, if I wanted more coffee. Very disappointed!

This was the breakfast spot while visiting New Orleans. I had an omelette, grits and a homemade biscuit. The food was stellar, and could not have been better. Because of the popularity this place gets busy quick. I recommend downloading the app "NoWait". You can put your name in and get notified when your table is almost ready. This kept us from waiting in line 45 minutes. Worth the wait, but why wait if you don't have too?

The first time I was disappointed in the shrimp and grits. My grits were chunky and the shrimp were tough. I now repeatedly get the bananas foster French toast. My husband had the eggs cochon. The eggs Blackstone is also delicious and their brandy milk punch. Weekends the line is out the door.

Fantastic breakfast food.  Wonderful atmosphere and friendly staff.  I wish I had time to try their lunch menu too.  It is very crowded, so be prepared to wait for a table, and keep in mind they close at 2.

Food was decent, nothing to brag about, service was okay and the mimosas were worth the wait. Sorry not worth elaborating about. Just ok
But that damn biscuit amazing. Fat boy in me just wanted biscuit and mimosa lol
Wonderful place to grab breakfast!! I usually get the Bananas Foster Pain Perdu.  It is very sweet but delicious.

Got here earlyish (8:30) on a Sunday & had no wait. Ordered the Eggs Benedict Cochon & the Chicken St. Charles.  Very pleased with both meals. Cochon was tender & flavorful.  Service was pleasant & efficient.  As we were leaving,  we noticed that the line was significant.  Pleased with what we had & would recommend.

Very good food. Nice dining atmosphere but there is a Longgggg wait and out waiter separated my party. Half of us were sitting in the doorway and the others were in the back of the restaurant. NOT COOL. NOOT COOL.
AMAZING!  The Ruby Sunrise was a great start, bananas foster was to die for and the waiter suggested an egg dish(mexican like) it was fantastic!!  With definitely go back when we return to NOLA!

Not sure what all the hype is about this place. Wait lines to get in could range from 45 minutes to an hour. When you finally get a table the food is just mediocre, nothing to wait that long in line for. So many other amazingly flavorful brunch spots in new orleans and this is definitely not one of them. Other than food the server was very nice.
Very rude waitress and manger. Would never eat there again. Kept interrupting our meal and acting impatient for us to finish our meal.

Just what we were looking for. A friendly, homestyle breakfast place with a great menu and delicious food.
    If you're visiting New Orleans, don't eat breakfast in your hotel's restaurant or anywhere corporate-y. Treat yourself better. Go here.

If I could eat breakfast here everyday I would. The team here brings a whole different meaning to Eggs Benedict - for centuries people have asked which came first: the chicken or the egg? Today I say it doesn't matter the Chicken St. Charles may have been the greatest thing I've ever tasted. It's like someone took Chick-Fil-A and injected it with steroids. Select the peacemaker (after which you'll need a pacemaker) and grab the Eggs Cochon as well.

AMAZING. It was worth the hour wait in line. Good things come to those who wait!! I just hopped off the plane from NYC and was HUNGRY. This was the most filling and delicious brunch I've had in the longest time. I ordered the Eggs Cochon, which is an eggs benny with pork debris under it. That pork, oh my god. That pork flavor was bursting, melty and savory. I wanted more and more but my stomach just couldn't handle all that greatness. I also got the cheese grits and a latte. My mom got the Banana Foster Pain Perdu, it was delicious. I'm not a sweets person so I couldn't do the entire thing like her, but if you are. It's amazing. 

Please take me back. You were so delicious.

Wait 1hour+ to have a seat, but the dish has not disappointed my expectation. The food is distinctive. The whole dish is like a open Big Mac. The difference is that the food is fresh, not frozen, thus it is more healthy and tasteful. 

Ordered hot-smoked salmon. Poached eggs is soft with juice outflowing. The salmon is fresh and yummy.

The Ruby Slipper was great. Our server could not have been sweeter. She was very attentive and had that southern hospitality. The food was good- the pancakes were delicious. As an added bonus, the food and coffee came out very quickly. I would suggest this for breakfast.

It was good.  i had the southern breakfast and eggs were well cooked at medium.  loved the fried geen tomato.  Biscuits were decent, and coffee very good.  one issue- the "skip the line" app seems to get lost after check in.  i used it and on arrival was told 2 parties in front of us (we were party of 2) and 4 went before us  (3 of which were parties of 2).

Waited an hour to get in and was disappointed by the experience. Incredibly loud inside, which was OK but everyone seemed in a hurry and frenetic, not a great dining energy. I ordered the eggs cochon, a signature dish and the poached eggs came out hard, not runny like I expected like most benedict style dishes I've had. There was very little hollandaise sauce and the biscuit had some hard areas. The pork had a good flavor but was dry, as was the entire dish. This is a restaurant that has obviously gone viral and is now focused on cramming through as many tourists as possible and have lost respect for their own cuisine. I wouldn't return even without a wait...
Excellent! Little bit of a wait but worth it. Would def go back if I can take the smell of the urine soaked sidewalks of New Orleans again.

I like good restaurants and good food some one said to try this place personal I don't think the staff like to work and the food is average and I was served a cold coffee don't wast the time New Orleans has way better restaurants in the same price class

Get here early or come when you're not in a rush. It's always packed. The breakfast is okay. Nothing I'd stay up late at night thinking of, but oh Lordy their pancakes are amazing. I had the chocolate chip buttermilk pancake and it was so moist and flavorful I'm going to have dreams of it. The service was also very attentive and warm. Good job red!
Awesome brunch spot. Great service. Definitely worth the wait in line. Started with a Bloody Mary. Pulled pork Cochon Benedict is heaven on a biscuit!
Went here during a Bachelorette brunch, awesome and worth the wait! Try the mimosas with French toast!

Can this place come to Denver!!! Please!!
I ate there for the first time this morning. It was my last day in Nola and I wanted a non-hotel breakfast. It was delicious! We went early enough and got right in. I suggest eating before 8:30am if you want to sit immediately. Anything later, you'll be waiting. 
We did have an issue with our order. The wrong plate arrived and it was sent back. Due to their mistake, I politely waited until everyone got their food to eat. my food was room temp by the time I was able to actually eat. They didn't actually comp their mistake or offer anything due to the mistake either. The three star was due to the general customer service regarding an issue that was clearly theirs.
Great for brunch. Fun vibe and great service. Outdoor dining option. Causal. Large menu.

I came here a few days after Fat Tuesday for breakfast. We sat at the bar and I asked the friendly bartender for a breakfast cocktail based mainly on bourbon. He thought for a moment, then whipped up a milky concoction that had a hint of vanilla and nutmeg. It was fantastic! On to the food (see photos)... I had the Eggs Blackstone ("A duo of poached eggs, tomato and bacon on biscuits, finished with housemade Hollandaise sauce"). It was delicious.. I'd like to confirm that the bacon was crispy! My gf got the Ruby Slipper Club ("Slow-roasted turkey breast, ham, bacon, arugula, tomato, avocado, swiss cheese & mayo, served on brioche") and that was very good, too... what a great combo of ingredients! We shared a chocolate pancake for desert... yummy. To top it off, who would have known, but the bartender was a pretty good photographer, too! He took one photo of us, then he was like "oh wait, gotta take another one to be sure!". Photos came out great! haha. So all in all, a great breakfast spot that shouldn't be too overly crowed since it's semi off the main street.

Came here for my last breakfast in NOLA. A friend suggested it after she came a while back. The place is clean. We were seated quickly even though the only options we were given was bar seating or a high top (still near the bar). We chose the high top. We were served quickly. The waitress wasnt rude but she wasnt overly friendly either. This was day 5 in NOLA and we had come across some super friendly people. Cant add her or the hostess to that list. Their grits are GREAT!!! I dont eat grits much anymore but they are a food from my childhood so I LOVE when Im in the south again and can find them. Not a bad place though. Good food, fresh seafood, fast service, and it was super close to the hotel. 

Oh wait!! The weird thing is their bathrooms! I opened the door marked "restrooms" and it led to a hallway that connected to a hotel. I closed the door to read the sign again to make sure I was in the right place. I was really not expecting that. Dont wait until the last minute if you have to potty. There are only two stalls and since its a pretty sizable restaurant and its sharing with another business, you WILL be in trouble. 

They had bellinis though. Didnt see them anywhere else while dining in NOLA.
I chose to venture off of the New Orleans fare and had a made to order Cobb salad for lunch.  It was crunchy fresh goodness!  Didn't care much for the Bloody Mary.  It was too spicy for my tastes.

We sat at the bar for brunch and got served in a good time span. I ordered the Costa Rican  breakfast and it's taste just like Costa Rica I have been there a couple times and I was so impressed by the Ruby Slipper. I love it I can't wait to try more dishes when I go back. The mimosas are pricey but strong they do the job.
It was too hard to choose just one Benedict- which is why I had to try multiple. Can't go wrong with any of them!

If you are in New Orleans and haven't done yourself the favor of eating here... I don't know what to tell you. This is undeniably some of the best breakfast food in town. We waited about 35 minutes to be seated but after consuming this heavenly food... I would have waited 2 hours. It is worth the wait, worth the money and worth being the hero that makes everyone tough it out to eat here.

We had to wait 45 minutes, but the French Toast Bananas Foster was worth every second. Every bite was better than the last.

Don't leave NOLA without giving this place a shot.

Amazing breakfast!!! I had the Banana Foster French Toast and it was probably the best French toast I've had! The service is great and the staff are very friendly! The only thing is that you have to get there as soon as they open the doors because the line gets really long, but definitely worth the wait!

This place definitely lives up to the hype!

The menu offers a huge variety of breakfast specials and items. There is literally something for everyone. I had the French toast sticks , a scrambled egg, and a biscuit. It was all delicious! The portions are huge and everything looked so good. I'd come here everyday if I could.

Wait staff is super nice and the food came out quickly! 

Also, yes the wait is long to use the app "no wait". We were able to hangout in our hotel until we saw that there were only 5 parties ahead. Overall, verb pleasant experience!

So first let me say the food was amazing. We planned our entire trip around Sunday breakfast here. Be prepared to wait tho. It's worth it. We love the chicken St. Charles. It's by far our favorite. We had the carrot cake pancakes. Which were to die for. I'm giving 3 stars bc of the server Derik. Customer service is HUGE.. Each one of us at our table works in customer service. Even had someone who waits tables in our group. The service was horrendous. We all ordered our drinks of water and a dr. Pepper. They do not have dr. Pepper. We jokingly told Derik he ruined the morning while laughing by not having dr. Pepper. We never saw Derik back at our table after he took our food order which took more time than it should have. He waited on the table that came in after us, refilled their drinks, served their food, and even took their picture. He never came back to our table until I had to wave at him to give us our checks. I am very disappointed in the service. We've had amazing customer service since we've been here. I'm from Memphis so good customer service is hard to come by. I felt like we are short changed today. Good thing this isn't my very first impression of the Ruby slipper or we might not have ever returned..

Delicious breakfast while in town on our first visit to New Orleans.  I had the Bananas Foster Pain Perdu - this is what "French Toast" should be.  My husband had the Eggs Cochon, also delicious.  Service was served with a big smile from Raquel.  The only downside is the noise level is very loud so it's difficult to hold a conversation.  Other than that, terrific meal.
Great brunch spot. Quick service, lots of choices and good food. Eggs Benedict and omelet a were wonderful. We will go again.

Like someone else said... More hype than substance.
Lotta sauces and crowded plate etc seems to kinda disguise to make the presentation "Seems" more than it actually is. Because we visited New Orleans few days ago and this breakfast was absolutely HORRIBLE. Even my cranberry juice wasn't cranberry juice that I know of. It was just horrible.

Last meal in New Orleans and was somewhat disappointed. The price was right for my BLT but the bread was so thick that I couldn't taste anything in between the slices. I ended up taking the bread off and eating it wrapped in lettuce. My friends ordered a fried chicken sandwhich and stuffed french toast which they enjoyed. Service was good but it was also closing for lunch time so slower.
Worth the wait! It's our favorite place to come every time we are in town! The food is excellent and if you get Julie you are in for a treat, she's the best!

A freaking amazing!!! Eat here today. The waiters are super cute and charming, drinks are amazing and reasonable priced, the food is down right delicious!!! Everything was amazing from start to finish. What I will say is to put yourself on the waiting list ahead of time. You'll be seated much faster!

Great breakfast place with plenty of seating and huge open bar.  I got the banana foster French toast - three large flat pieces of bread smothered in sliced bananas, raisin, and amazing caramel sauce.  It comes with your choice of protein and I chose corned beef hash.  I was pleasantly surprised that the hash was actual large chunks of corned beef with a few small bits of potatoes.  Definitely something made fresh - the beef was cooked perfectly and was well seasoned - I think it's necessary to have a savory side dish to balance out the sweetness of the banana foster.

Service at the bar was prompt and attentive - got coffee refills quickly.

Yep I'm a fan!

Amazing food at a great price. 
Service was attentive with out being smothering. Can't wait to come back and work my way through the menu.

This place is popular for good reason. Our hotel was just a block away so it was an obvious brunch choice.  Be prepared for a lengthy wait- nearly 2 hours on a weekend.  We actually came back on a later date and still had to wait 20 minutes.  Food was definitely worth it, though. Knowing the quality now, we would wait the 2 hours.

Wow!  You know how you go to the same place multiple times and at some point you expect to be disappointed?  Well, that hasn't happened yet!  

This morning, my wife and I went with another couple to Ruby Slipper for breakfast. Two of us ordered the Southern Breakfast, mine with eggs over easy.  Great, thick bacon, excellent biscuit, great quality eggs, a fried green tomato and tasty grits.  My wife, Mary Lea ordered the Three Pigs and reported a great omelet.  My friend,  Marijane ordered The Peacemaker which included the Eggs Benedict Blackstone and the Eggs Benedict St. Charles.  The Peacemakers allows you to have more than one type of eggs Benedict.  I highly recommend the Blackstone!

Great restaurant, great food, great service.  I will be back multiple times again!

Though I find it bordering on expensive for a brunch spot, I love the ruby slipper.  

We had a lovely server who was patient with us even when we couldn't make up our minds to order mimosas or not.  Of course we did.  

I had the cochon de lait with poached eggs and holandaise over a  home made biscuit.  Let me tell you this is hangover food of the gods if you needed it.  The slow cooked pork was smoky and flavorful, not to mention the heaping amount that basically surrounded my eggs.  The eggs were poached to perfection, nice and runny, and the holandaise was spot on.

My GF got the bananas foster pancakes which were incredible...the rum in the sauce not cooked out too much, sooo many bananas, and the pancakes were airy and delightful.

the greatest brunch of my life

simply the best! pulled pork eggs benedict! cookies and cream pancakes with oreos in the batter and melted down oreo filling as the frosting on top!!

Great food and service!!! Danielle was very sweet and attentive. Breakfast was delicious!!! Ordered: Pork Cochon, Bananas Fosters Pain Purdu and added eggs and bacon. Food came out fast and our coffee & water were always filled quickly. Location is wonderful next to the hotel and shops. A must go place for Breakfast/Brunch!!

This was the best brunch I've had in any city in a long time. I love that you can mix and match the different benedicts. I got the cochon and chicken st Charles. Both had so much flavor and texture. The men working behind the bar are fantastic and entertaining. Shout out to Jake for being hilarious, hospitable and very helpful with his menu suggestions. I recommend saving room for the French toast sticks or cones for dessert. Their stacked like Lincoln logs and are the best way to end your savory meal. I definitely will be back here again on my next visit!
The beat breakfast in NOLA. Fried green tomatoes are the best!!  Great mimosa!  Friendly staff!  A jewel on Magazine Street!

What a gem! My friends and I stumbled upon this place thanks to our Yelp app while staying one block away at the Royal St. Charles hotel. All the food looked so good and the crowd covering the sidewalk and even across the street confirmed we had made a good choice. We only had to wait about 30 minutes despite the large amount of people waiting and took it upon ourselves to get bloody marys to help pass the time. They were very reasonably price ($6 I believe) and well worth it! 

We all had a variety breakfast items including a couple of their signature dishes. Everything was so good and a lot of food! You really can't go wrong. Next time I am in town, I am going to stop in for yet another great brunch.
Best breakfast ever!  Our server was the best.  Long wait but worth it!  Catfish and grits, biscuits, French toast, best we've had and we've traveled the world
Good food, good atmosphere ask for Monique great service and have all recommendations

I have been to both MidCity and downtown locations and it is always AMAZING. 
I have tried several things off the menu and have never been disappointed. 

Prepare for a long wait!!  If you have only 2 people it is much faster but if you have a larger party you will be waiting.  Get a mimosa!

This is the place to go for a great, healthy breakfast in the CBD. If you are staying at a hotel, go for a very short walk and end up here. The house specialties are very tasty and original which is a welcome change. No 1100 calorie salt bombs here. Everything is made with simple, fresh and very savory ingredients.

In town for a wedding, and we decided to spend the time before our friend's big day with a few mimosas. This place was recommended so we gave it a try. We could see the line from our hotel room, but still went down to put our name in anyway. They said the wait would be 45 minutes...nothing a few mimosas couldn't solve in the meantime. 

You can order drinks from the bar and stand outside while you wait on your table to get ready. Perfect time to make new friends in a great city. We actually took this opportunity to exploit New Orleans relaxed liquor laws and strolled the quarter with our drinks before our table was ready. We came back to only a 5-minute wait. 

The mimosas were great. They came in about a 16oz cup and 95% of it was champagne. No skimping here. Well worth the money. The food was delicious as well and didn't take long at all to come out considering the amount of people at the restaurant. We sampled so many items...banana pecan pancakes, andouille sausage omelet, strawberry and chocolate chip pancake, biscuit, and roasted potatoes. I'm no food critic, but all I have to say about it was that everything was delicious. 

A tip however is to have your whole party there when seated. We had two at the table and a friend came to join us but was not allowed to order as they don't allow late additions to keep the crowd moving. Definitely a must-stop if you are in the area.

Really good place to eat with your basic breakfast fare - plus other off-the-beaten-path choices. I had the eggs benedict with a Bloody Mary that was cooked to perfection. The other omelets and pancakes at the table also got good reviews, but I think I had the winning dish. Very good service and nice outdoor seating, too.  They have TVs there, but with classic old movies playing. Nice touch!

I had high hopes due to the lines I see every day while I stayed at the hotel across the street. I made it a point to eat here on my last day. It was mediore at best. I've tried numerous restaurants in the same area over the past week and every single one had more flavorful dishes and drinks. I've had mimosas and eggs benedicts (same things I got from here) from restaurants in other cities that tasted far better, and I certainly cannot say that with the other places I tried in New Orleans,

This place is another must stop when visiting NOLA.  This place is always packed,no matter the morning.  We came on a Monday morning around 8 ish and it was already getting packed.  We were sat quickly, and they offer a yelp check in service.  

The biscuits from here are AWESOME! THEIR BLOODY MARY'S ARE ALSO AWESOME.  I highly recommend you try both.  Their serving sizes are quite large and they are good for sharing.

Love the atmosphere of this place but maybe the experience and food depend on the server you have.  The Bloody Mary I ordered was forgotten until we reminded her and eventually it came after I was halfway through my meal.  Eggs Benedict was good although served luke warm and eggs were a bit over poached!  Brioche French Toast was nice but needed to be cooked a bit longer.  Overall it was "ok" but not rushing to go back.
Really good food and excellent service. Our server Lisa was very nice. Will definitely come back!
This is a must whenever I come into town! Their coffee, Bloody Mary, and food is out of this world

I am so happy for the Ruby Slipper Cafe!

My wife used to work at the Mid-City location when we lived in New Orleans. I loved visiting the small neighborhood restaurant for an occasional breakfast that never disappointed..  When I found out that a CBD location was now open, I knew we had to pay a visit.  

First off, the location, decor, and atmosphere of this restaurant is perfect.  If you are a tourist or visitor to the city, this restaurant is likely within walking distance of your hotel.  Make that walk! 

I ended up ordering one of their classic dishes, the Bananas Foster Pain Perdu.  In layman's terms, this dish is French Toast covered in bananas slices and a sauce that usually consists of butter, brown sugar, cinnamon, dark rum, and banana liqueur.  Needless to say, it was wonderful!  The dish came with a side of bacon which was great to cut the sweetness of the dish.  I also ordered a side of grits and they were solid.  

Our server was very friendly and helpful.  Overall, A+ experience.   I wish this restaurant great success.  Now go visit!

Very creative menu.....my fave is the pancakes and Skinny Migas!!!! The wait was not that long...20 minutes. So we had more time to walk to CVS 2 blocks away. The place was full, not too packed. The service, value and quality overall cannot be beat!!!
Love going here for breakfast on wkends! Good food and service! Luv the bloody marys!

This is my new favorite breakfast place in NOLA. The Banana Foster French Toast was amazing! Bananas, raisins, caramel sauce...yummy! My boyfriend ordered the Three Little Pigs and he ate every bite (he's a picky eater). We got a large pitcher of mimosas which have pomegranate juice in them. It was delicious as well. Cute little place, great service, great food and great atmosphere!

Best brunch ever!!! We waited 45 mins but it was worth it! Eggs Benedict is my favorite and they have a great selection and you can even mix and match. I got the pork one and the bacon one and omg soooo good. The mimosas and the bloody Mary's are fantastic too, be sure to get those while you wait for your table!

Terrific brunch if you want flavorless food. We had a rather large party and were told we'd be seated in under an hour. Two hours later I had been asking every fifteen minutes for an update and had been told any minute now. We didn't want to give up and go somewhere else just to start our wait over. Finally after over two hours waiting we were seated at a table that only fit most of us so two of our party had to stand near us waiting for seats to open up. We all ordered immediately and asked for anything he could bring to help those of us near fainting like maybe bring us a biscuit? Never happened. Most of our meals were completely flavorless and when I mentioned this I had to suggest to our waiter that he take it off the bill. I also suggested doing something else for us to make up for this awful experience but nothing else was taken off the bill. It's the first time in my life I paid only what I owed and left zero tip. Terrible experience. I don't know what others on here are tasting.

Update for Jennifer--I'm not sure there is a "reply" function...we were a party of 8 which was why I was surprised to be quoted under an hour. Still, if I had been told after that hour that they honestly didn't know when they could seat us I would have cut my losses. Our server knew what was going on and was very nice and apologetic. However we told him numerous times anyway that things were severely messed up and we were pretty bummed about it (two less chairs than needed, one person about to faint and had to leave to go home because she was getting light headed, mentioned specifically that bringing something fast like biscuits would be a good idea, didn't happen, mentioned a few times how bad the food was, only got mine comped after I directly suggested it, etc etc). I did not ask for a manager and I probably should have but our server was so sweet and kind to us I honestly thought he would do something more or that his hands were tied. After the amount of time we spent there we just didn't have the energy to try anything else. We didn't even get a drink comped.

We ate here twice during a recent girls trip to NOLA. We couldn't get over how great the breakfast was. We tried four different things (candied bacon sandwich, corned beef hash over biscuits with horseradish sauce, chicken and biscuits, and the breakfast platter) on the menu and couldn't decide what was best! I also recommend an Irish coffee!
Great shrimp omelets and breakfast buritos.  The midcity location is a wonderful neighborhood place for breakfast and lunch, easy to meet others at this location.
The Crab Cake was divine...the biscuit even more so!   Only complaint was that the service as a tad slow and i was heading to a meeting, so I could not have one of the delicious looking Bloody Marys!

Super cute place! Stumbled upon it because it was close to our hotel.
 Cute and clean. To die for banana fosters french toast. My mouth is watering thinking of it!
Nice service too.

Walked in for an early breakfast on a weekday morning. I was seated immediately at the bar and was immediately asked for coffee (an absolute must). The house coffee was strong and not overly bitter - good enough to drink black. Did not get to try the espresso, unfortunately. 

I ordered the Peacemaker - mix and match 2 of the benedicts a a combo. I went with the Eggs Cochon and the Chicken St. Charles. 

Damn. 

I don't usually get full from eggs benedict, but these were pretty substantial. And amazing. Their house biscuits and the hollandaise give you enough butter for a year. And then you throw in fried chicken and pork debris... thank heavens for the coffee. 

Will definitely come back here when I return to New Orleans!
Great place for a quick breakfast. The service is wonderful - and the corn beef hash is even better. Do yourself a favor and try it if you get a chance to go here.

Wow, Sooooooo DELICIOUS!!! We ordered Eggs Cochon and St. Charles; 2 eggs benedict plates. First of all it's more food than you can eat. Second and more important is it's the best tasting thing you can eat for breakfast. We ordered potatoes and fried green tomatoes as sides and they both were very delicious as well. Our server was awesome and we liked it so much we came back the next morning and probably would've continued going back daily if our flight didn't leave after our second visit. Thank you and see you again one delicious day.

Delicious brunch! The benedicts are amazing with perfectly poached eggs and delicious toppings (especially the St. Charles chicken). The stuffed French toast was huge and amazing (stuffing of the day was vanilla cheesecake topped with apple compote). The pancakes were ok, id stay away from those. The bacon was really good but the candy bacon wasn't anything special. The service was overall good except I had to ask for water 3 times. Still recommend this place!

Waited about 20min to be seated.  Very well worth the wait.   If you have a sweet tooth I highly recommend the cheesecake stuffed French toast.  The combination of the French toast and bacon together tasted amazing.

Came here on a Monday morning for breakfast and had to wait 45 minutes for a table for four. "This better be good" we all agreed.

Wow. It was. The eggs were fluffy, the cheese grated nice and thick, the biscuits were soft and delicious, and their signature pig candied bacon (its baked with brown sugar or something) was amazing, and it combined for the best breakfast sandwich I've ever had. Side note: I am not a bacon enthusiast--I'll normally give it to someone else at the table--but I couldn't get enough of this stuff. 

It's worth the wait.

Overrated! Solid 3.5 stars. Strong coffee, variety of menu options, available outdoor seating and really great service. It wasn't a 4 or 5 star for me because NOLA just spoils you with so many great spots for food. There are so many delicious options for breakfast and this spot just fell short for me compared to the others. Jimmy J's Cafe was by far my favorite spot for breakfast and I would wait in that line all over again for the food. 

I came here because it seemed like a staple spot in NOLA and had to come see for myself. I added myself to the waitlist on Yelp and that was helpful to see my place in line. We went on a Monday around noon specially to eat breakfast. We got seated sooner than expected which was a nice surprise. 

Order & Reviews: 
*Coffee - strong, hot, yummy. 
*Blackstone Benedict - solid, not the best Benny. 
*Peacemaker- (order 2 Benedict's of your choice, good idea for a menu item) I got the...
        -Salmon Benedict  - No! Don't bother. 
        -Chicken St. Charles - Yes! Out of everything this was my favorite menu item. 
*Regular French Toast - solid. 

Pros: Friendly service. Option to add to waitlist through Yelp. Coffee and Chicken St. Charles Benedict.  

If you're someone who has FOMO (fear of missing out) like I do then come here and try it for yourself. Either way you can't go wrong with food in New Orleans. ;)

Great, great place for breakfast!!! Wonderful service, generous portions and fun place to wait and to eat. The 'No wait list' on Yelp is such a helpful tool. My favorite breakfast place in New Orleans, year after year.

Another great breakfast spot in New Orleans.  After my 2nd time here, I have picked up on a couple tips

Get here early - anything past 10 a.m. you'll be waiting for a table for awhile. 
Lots of options for seating (bar seating, both indoor and outdoor tables
Great waitstaff, friendly and pretty attentive
Lots of people come here for Bloody Mary's to-go! If you don't want to wait for a table, you can order that at the bar
check out their specials on the wall - we had their banana chocolate pancakes and their 
chocolate creme brûlée stuffed french toast. Those were AMAZING but something they didn't offer on their regular menu. Glad we saw it!

We arrived in New Orleans from a cruise today and decided to Yelp a great restaurant. From the moment we walked up and saw the line outside we knew we made the right decision. We waitlisted our group and immediately were offered drinks outside. Then their waitlist app syncs with Yelp so we knew exactly when we were being seated. Getting ready for our food now and I cannot wait! So far, they have earned a 5 star.

So I came to this spot on a Saturday morning and boy was it packed. I'm glad I did wait to see what the big thing was about this spot. 

I ordered the Shrimp Omelet added bacon, grits with cheese & a double mimosas. Let's say it was awesome!!  One of the best omelets I have ever had! I really enjoyed my dining experience. The only thing it's a small establishment.

Snarky, fun, meltdown level popular -- and deservedly so. This place was packed the morning after St. Patrick's Day, by people massaging their temples and groaning softly into their bloody Mary's. It is perfect morning after brunch when you are determined to be just as decadent as New Orleans encourages you to be. One disappointment: the smoked salmon eggs Benedict should be avoided at all costs. The salmon was not what you think you're going to get it - not like the smoked salmon on a bagel - more like the salmon that you put into your cats food bowl as punishment.

However, the Migos and the French toast and the other eggs Benedict more than make up for it. The waitresses are undiscovered stand up comedians, constant delight. It is very very loud so if you are nursing a hangover immediately start to dose yourself with the wide variety of breakfast cocktails. As they say, how can you stay drunk all day if you don't start drinking first thing in the morning?

Everyone we spoke to said this was the place to go for breakfast.  This place got it's name after Katrina when the owners came back and rebuilt.  The sign which of course is a huge pair of ruby slippers and on the sign it says there's no place like home.  The owners said when they came back and rebuilt they realized there was no place like home.

No reservations taken and unless you go at a very strange time, there's a line.  We got there about 10:00 and of course had to wait but since there were two of us didn't take long.  It's in an old building, but what place isn't in New Orleans, it's loud and everyone seems to be having a great time.  I had been craving shrimp and grits so didn't even look at the menu.  Yummy.  The dish had a slight taste of sweet with a hit of heat at the end.  I could have eaten two helpings of grits.  Came with a huge and I do mean huge home made biscuit that was so good.  My husband had an eggs benedict that was a bit different he said but I never could figure that part out.  It did come with a biscuit on the bottom instead of a muffin which bothered him but apparently not much since he ate every bite.  

It wasn't expensive, plenty to eat and if you want a Bloody Mary to start the day, they are more than happy to serve you one.  This is a must stop for breakfast in my book

We ate breakfast here on our first day in New Orleans and it was a great way to start the food weekend. Though there was about a 20 minute wait, it went by much faster than expected based on the amount of people waiting.  I got the CBH Benedict which was yummy, but beware if you are a poached egg purist, my yolks were solid.  My mom had eggs with grits on the side, and though I'm not a grits fan, she said they were great.  Overall a good atmosphere, friendly staff, and good food.

I ordered a bloody mary and the fried chicken on biscuits for breakfast because the waitress said it was the MOST recommended. I thought the bloody mary was great and the biscuits were AMAZING, but the overall dish for being the MOST recommended was not impressive. The biscuits were, but the fried chicken plus a biscuit made the meal so dry, even with the sauce. I think they have plenty of good stuff here though, but I doubt that was the best thing on the menu like the waitress said it was.

My DH and I dined for breakfast at the Ruby Slipper on October 3, 2015.  Breakfast was great!  There was a 35-45 minute wait, but it was well worth it.  I ordered the the 3 Pigs Omelet with Fruit and one Buttermilk pancake on the side.  DH had tall stack of Buttermilk pancakes with bacon.  

Hot chocolate topped off the wonderful breakfast.  

My only complaint was that we had to work to get our waiter's attention.  But with so much demand, I could understand that he was doing all that he could to take care of his tables.  One of the busy guys saw that we needed some things and helped us without us needing to ask.  

I will be back when I am in town again.  PS- I loved the hostess.  She helped me keep warm with heaters as I waited.

It's a great breakfast spot! We checked in online since there was a wait. When we got there, we were seated within just a few minutes. The waiter was great! We had a younger male and he had a great personality. I ordered the French toast sticks and there were enough for a least 2 people. I will be back!
Great breakfast with one of the best biscuits that I have had in a long time. We enjoyed the good old southern comfort food!

Totally worth it. This place has a good feel. We had no trouble getting a table for three at 8:15am. Coffee is good. Two of us had the eggs Benedict and one had an omlete. All were great. We shared the Eggs Cochon and Chicken St. Charles. One plate is a lot for one person so next time we'll split one dish. The omlete comes with a big biscuit and fruit. The staff are friendly and we felt very welcome in the restaurant. Will be back again.
Fantastic breakfast. BBQ shrimp and grits breakfast was phenomenal and their biscuits are flaky and delicious. Good coffee and large breakfast sandwich portions.

I had so many recommendations and it was totally worth it. First off, you need to download the NoWait app that their website recommends. It saved us so much time. We got in line before we left the hotel so that we would get there just in time to sit. I checked in and we waited about 5 mins. A waitress was outside taking coffee orders so we grab a latte and a mocha. They were both very warm and tasty. We got to our table and our waiter Devin (Devon, Devan?) was the best. He was very helpful with navigating the menu when everything looks so yummy. The food was so good and it was served timely, hot, and correct. With it being so busy- it is easy to make excuses about why the quality will decline so when it came out perfect, we were impressed. I got the banana fosters French toast with the candied bacon. It was so great! The portion was huge. I had lots to share with the group which was so great because I don't share well. Haha The other items we got was the Trifecta, Peacemaker (Chicken St. Charles, Salmon Bennie), and another Peacemaker (Salmon Bennie, Eggs Blackstone). They all enjoyed their Benedicts! They said they would highly recommend those! Our waiter made sure we always had our drinks full and was a pleasure to be around. Highly recommend Ruby Slippers. It did not disappoint. Come hungry and reserve ahead!

Great breakfast/brunch choices.  Had the Louisianan omelette stuffed with fresh shrimp and thyme, accompanied with fresh hot fried potatoes and a beautiful fresh biscuit.  The stuffed French toast looked delicious and decadent.  Service was fast and friendly with Brandi.  She helped with sightseeing tips too.  Great spot!!
The food was just alright. The wait wasn't worth it, overhyped for sure. Nothing to write home about, there many better places to try. Service was great though, very kind waiter.

Eggs Cochon - start with a biscuit, top with pork roast bits, top that with poached eggs and finish with hollandaise sauce...filling and delicious! Service was quick and friendly. Loved the atmosphere - raised ceilings and decor made for a comfy experience. Will be back!

For a Mardi Gras weekend Ruby Slipper was easy to get a table at 9 am.  They were turning tables fairly quickly.  They place filled for awhile, tables cleared, more folks seated, etc, etc.  With plenty of open seats at the bar  they never reached capacity.  Of course this was early in the day but it shows the staff was on a roll.

We were all happy with breakfast.  Most of our party stuck with good ol' grits n' eggs type dishes. Shrimp n' Grits for myself.
