The grits were almost unsalted which some folks may like but I kept hitting them with the shaker until the flavor brightened up a bit.  Other than that it was good but mine is better.

The crab cake breakfast special sounded great. Guys at the next table raved over the burger with fried egg.

We checked this place out on a Sunday afternoon based on the number of reviews. We joined the waitlist on the app so we were able to reserve a spot without having to physically wait at the corner with the other 25 people trying to get a table. Fortunately, we only waited 30 minutes to get a seat, but this place is definitely overhyped.

I ordered the shrimp & grits and was not pleased. It was about 6 pieces of tiny shrimp that didn't taste too great for $15. The "grits" tasted like a mix of cereal and salty oatmeal. To reiterate, the meal was very salty. As you can see from the photos, it just looks like a hot mess. I thought I was at a credible brunch spot, not a soup kitchen? It got to a point midway through where I just ate it because I was hungry, not that I actually enjoyed the meal. Maybe I should have gotten some mimosas to cloud my judgment on the awful food. The biscuit and honey butter were good, however - I would have rather ordered a dozen of those.

Absolutely loved this place. I came here specifically because our hotel was close by and our flight came early in the morning and we wanted somewhere to eat breakfast. This place had the best reviews on yelp and it is definitely the best place to have breakfast here. Of course the wait is really ridiculous. And as I was waiting I was really debating if it was worth the wait. But there is a bar towards the front of the restaurant that you can enjoy while waiting with an open tab. What's crazy is that we arrived about 30 minutes after they opened and we waited about 40 minutes for a party of two. But we ordered the eggs Benedict I forget what it's called but it comes with their homemade English muffins or something and it just melts in your mouth. We also had their coffee which is very good as well. I not much of a big coffee drinker but the coffee here was fantastic. Even though it was really busy, the food and customer service made up my whole experience. We sat towards the back on this long table that was kind of like bar seating which I wasn't a huge fan of because of elbow room and the seats are pretty tall and of course privacy. But overall I was too hungry and the food was too good to even complain about anything. Honestly come here to eat breakfast. It's worth the wait. Trust me!
Yummy breakfast/brunch place. Nice casual atmosphere and service was polite and frequent (I did sit at the bar so that may have some bias).
Average breakfast. My sausage was cold and the biscuit was doughy. Eggs and grits were good. My wife had the corned beef which she did not like and couldn't eat it.

The staff is really nice and welcoming. Our waitress Summer was a delightful and very helpful with the menu selection. The food is delicious. I had the Peacemaker (my choice of two different Eggs Benedict); shrimp and hot salmon were my selections. It was extremely savory and delicious. I would definitely have it again. I had the Irish whiskey hot coffee; it was just as tasty as the food. I enjoy my coffee on the sweeter side so I added a little sugar. It was still great. The waitlist function on yelp, definitely helped in being seated faster because no matter the time of day you visit this establishment, there will be a line because it's just that good. The only reason I couldn't give 5 stars is because our food was only warm. So it must have been sitting for a while, but it was crowded, so we didn't make a fuss about it. Other than that everything was outstanding.

Right next door to our hotel. Went for breakfast twice during our stay. The migas are a must try! Also tried the stuffed french toast with peanut butter and chocolate ganashe. Delicious! Highly recommend for breakfast to anyone visiting New Orleans.

Great place for breakfast.  The coffee was good and our table had a wide variety of great things.  Biscuit with maple butter YES.  I had bananas foster pain perdu it was pretty good.  There were several different versions of pancakes and french toast.   The lunch menu looked good as well.

We definitely had to wait for a table, but the wait was so worth it!!! A lot of people do different takes on the eggs Benedict, but most of them fall short. This place KNOWS how to make all kinds of eggs Benedict! The st charles and the eggs Cochin are killer! Bananas foster and the stuffed French toast are also ridiculous If you like sweet for breakfast.

Long line, doesn't take reservations.....Absolutely worth the wait. Service was excellent (Justin was our server).  The Egg Cochon Benedict was hands down the best egg benedict I've had.  We are definitely coming back.
Wait was super long and talked to someone after we checked in and they said it is overrated. Ended up going somewhere else for breakfast so we didn't have to wait so long.
went to the 200 magazine location and waited around 15 mins to be seated.  gulf fish st peter was the best dish i had while in NOLA!

I've eaten at the Ruby Slipper on Canal and loved it. I normally get the Eggs Cochon (which is out of this world) but today I tried the Chicken St. Charles. It's like I died and went to heaven. Perfect!!

Awesome experience. I live here in Nola and I have passed this place a thousand times. I wish I wouldn't have. Wait time wasn't too bad. We were able to get beverages while we waited. Our waitress, Kelly, was awesome, funny and thoroughly helpful. She walked us through the menu and had many recommendations. I went with the Spanish omelet. I'm not an omelet person at all and I was surprised. Our drinks were always full and service was amazing. Couldn't ask for anything else. I will be back. I highly recommend this place!

Delicious breakfast, great sized drinks, and a bustling atmosphere await you at this New Orleans staple. I came here for breakfast based on many recommendations for brunch and I did not leave disappointed. 

The only issue I had was some confusion regarding their system where they can send you a text when a table will open up. I opted into that but I never received a text and I think I heard her call my name a few times, but since I was waiting for a text I was across the street and had trouble hearing her. If you don't respond to your name after two tries, they move on quickly.
It was not a huge enough deal to effect my review, just be sure you're paying attention and don't rely on that text!

Anyway, once we were seated at the bar, the bartenders were quick to take our drink orders. I got a mimosa, and it's $10 for a double! I was pleasantly surprised as in Sacramento, CA, that is a common price for ONE. I ordered two of those and they were strong! 
For eats, I ordered the Corned Beef Bennie. The corned beef hash on it was amazing. No canned stuff here! This was made with thick slices of fresh corned beef and nicely sized chunks of deliciously seasoned potatoes and onions. The buttermilk biscuit it was served on was buttery and flaky and the hollandaise was creamy and divine. 
I enjoyed every bite and wished I could enjoy more! I only ate half because it was so filling. 
I tried some of my boyfriend's French toast and that was also delicious. 

I highly recommend this place to anyone visiting New Orleans! If I'm ever in the area again, I will be back.
Good Nola dinner with wonderful simple cooking.    It brings me back to grandmas cooking and I would make this a daily venture if I could.

Ufdah wow YUM YUM YUM!

What a send off for a great culinary vacation in new orleans

Why did we go on the last day you ask?  we couldn't get in on sunday (12pm)  so we went on monday

The Migas and the Bananas Foster were brought to our table and they were the perfect breakfast fare -- if you only get one take the Migas the BF is just too sweet on it's own -- so make sure you bring someone along to share both with

The Migas, for those of you Midwesterners who don't know is a chorizo and vegie omelet served on a  bed of tortilla strips -- wow -- a little tobasco and you feel like you're in Mexico  -- great taste and not too heavy

The Pain Perdu - BF - is just unreal, caramelized sugar all over the large slices of french bread with bananas and pecans and raisins -- the bacon does a good job of leveling out the salty and sweet

you owe it to yourself, and your mouth, to go here

Great place for brunch in the CBD. If it's the weekend though stop reading this review and go back to the restaurant description to add yourself to the waitlist. You can do it right from Yelp and it's a great feature, because the wait here is gong to be a loooong time. Alright, now that your name is on the waitlist you can finish getting ready in your hotel room and read the rest of the review. 

 Brunch prices are reasonable here. I was sold after scrolling through just a few pictures here on Yelp. The food was delicious and the service was great. I ordered Eggs Cochon which were Eggs Benedict over pulled pork. If the Benedicts sound too good for you to make a decision, they have a peace maker where you can have choose two and have one of each.

It's going to be a long wait, but they'll text you when your table is ready so you can go for a walk (I hit up a nearby museum) or get a drink from the bar and hang out outside with it, so the wait doesn't seem so bad - and it's worth it!  Great Bloody Mary and double mimosas/bellinis (heavy on the champagne, woo) so you're guaranteed to have a nice happy tipsy brunch!  For food, they had a mix and match Benedict special which was a DREAM - I can never make up my mind so I was able to order 2 different style Benedicts, a smoked salmon and a fried chicken.  The chicken one was good, but the salmon was disappointing - I like raw lox-style smoked salmon, but this was a huge pile of overcooked salmon and an overdone egg.  Super sad, but then our table shared the bananas foster French toast which was mind blowingly good - still drooling - so I definitely left happy.

Started with brandy milk and Irish coffee which were both delicious! Breakfast was amazing! I ordered the eggs crochan and substituted the potatoes with grits. Everything was perfect the only thing I'm disappointed about is that I live in texas and I can't go every day.

We stopped in for breakfast and Raquel greeted us promptly, was so sweet and took our order in a very timely manner. The place was packed for 7:55am considering they just opened at 7am!  I started off with a cappuccino. For breakfast I indulged and order the Banana's Foster. Let ms just say that it was everything I had hoped for an more! It was an ample portion and tasted amazing! I can't wait to go back and try something else!
Came here after a friend's recommendation. Loved it!!! Fantastic mimosas and bloody Mary's and the benedicts were awesome! Great service, too!
Great brunch joint. Delicious food. Friendly service. Eggs Cochon and Eggs Coubion were great!

This place made me happy. There are few things as great as two large chunks of perfectly fried chicken on top of a biscuit with poached eggs and cream sauce. I even got caught up watching other people eat their food. Ty was great.

Decided to go based on reviews, and it was yummy! There are 2 on Magazine St. - one in the much busier French Quarter, and one further away that we went to. We had NO wait at the farther location at 12 on Monday! We had just gotten Starbucks, but you can't bring outside drinks in, so don't make that mistake like us! 

Anyway, I got the Trio Benedict. 2 of the three were awesome, the shrimp was just okay IMO. The St. Charles chicken, and pork were great. It was a lot of food, and I couldn't eat it all. My husband got the shrimp omelette, and added a side of chicken sausage which he really liked. He said the omelette was good, but didn't blow his mind or anything. 

Service was pretty good, our waiter was friendly and got our food correct. I felt like once they realized we weren't ordering drinks though, they lost some interest as is the case in many restaurants we went to in NOLA sadly. Overall, I'm glad we went, but also glad we didn't make a trip specifically for it. We had wanted to go to some shops on Magazine, and thought it was a perfect opportunity to go.  I would have been disappointed if we had gone just for it.

This place does brunch extremely well, thus justifying the long lines we witnessed outside the restaurant during each pass by. Our server was friendly and ever-present for refills and inquiries, despite having many tables to look after. After mulling over the menu, which was filled with deliciously described dishes, I arrived at their take on Eggs Benedict, which I was very pleased with. This dish is served with a house made corned beef hash, flaky buttermilk biscuits, and a delicious horseradish cream sauce that melded beautifully with the hollandaise. The next time I find myself in NOLA, this will definitely be a place I revisit.

Went on Valentine's the day after Fat Tuesday. Expected a sloppy mess and poor service because that's just the reality of every restaurant on that day. Was surprised by the peppy, upbeat staff. Renee was our waitress and she was an angel. Super fast service, she was on top of her game despite the noisy crowd. The fried chicken hollandaise was the best thing ever. Also, weird thing to review, but the bathrooms were spotless and smelled good. One detail that, on the biggest hangover day of the year, was very impressive. Well done, Ruby Slipper. Thanks again, Renee!

An exceptional breakfast or brunch place. Very fresh food with interesting dishes (such as eggs Cochon, a variation of the Benedict with pulled pork and a biscuit), and each dish we had was excellent. Negative points are the noise and a very long line (they don't take reservations), which however flows quickly and smoothly.

Also a particular praise for the service, warm, nice and genuinely friendly.

Absolutely awful service. After waiting for two hours to be seated (which they warned, that's okay), waited for over an hour for food and it never came out. Walked out to eat anywhere else than this overrated tourist trap. The waitress said: "I don't even know why it's so packed, there's so many other places to eat around here." AKA: DON'T DO IT. 

The little things that we did receive, orange juice and hot tea: hot tea was actually not hot at all, had to send it back, and the orange juice was not fresh even after asking if it was.

Long wait on a Sunday, but that was to be expected for brunch. We waited about 40 minutes for 4 people, and we had a group of friends that waited a bit less than an hour (got seated around 1pm). My friends got the eggs blackstone and eggs cochon. I had a taste of the eggs cochon and it was pretty good. The portion size could have been a bit bigger but the Louisianan omelette (shrimp, cheese, and thyme) that I ordered more than made up for it. They must have used a whole carton of eggs because it was HUGE. It was also delicious and fresh, but I couldn't come near finishing it. I got a biscuit and a side of potatoes with it, which were amazing. Coffee was awesome and much needed free refills made it even better.

I don't get it.
Being from NYC, I would like to think I have developed a thick, oiled skin for rude hostesses and disgruntled servers. I must say, the hostess' pretentiousness is outstanding! Bravo! At least at Per Se the host/hostess graciously decline your rumbling, empty stomach with a smile, rather than a yelling, meth and/or tobacco stained RBF. Seriously girl, the hostess on the morning of Sept 14th needs some Crest whitening strips, STAT! Moving on, we were told there was over an hour wait on Sunday morning by the meth girl wielding an ipad. I was apprehensive to give it another try the following morning but the yelp reviews (and proximity to the hotel) swayed me. Upon arrival Monday morning, there was a 15 minute wait. Ok, great! We were asked to wait outside bc of fire hazards, yadda yadda. I had no problem with this however, I think the older couple wheeling their oxygen tank should have received preferential treatment. Making two octogenarians wait outside in 100% humidity (no joke, my iphone said so) is just WRONG! When our time was up, the hostess (the one that looks like the boss-lady on Workaholics, for real) called our name and began walking us past the podium asking "Is the bar ok?". In unison, we responded "NO?!" We just waited 15 minutes for a table!!! We could have sat at the bar upon initial arrival!!! WTH?
My bf and I had decided on what we were going to order while we waited to be seated. Being so efficient blew the waitresses mind. I ordered the house specialty, Eggs Cochon. I can't even remember what my man ordered, it was so blasé. My plate was literally covered in a layer of grease. The way the biscuits were plated made me think the server pulled the plate prematurely bc they had been huddled on one side of the plate, leaving the other side completely empty, aside from the grease layer. The meat was flavorless. It speaks volumes that they cook and serve flavorless pig! Yes, it was juicy and tender- really fabulous texture, BUT flavorless! This makes me very sad. The poached eggs were poached eggs. Frankly, if you cannot cook an egg properly, you should not own a breakfast/brunch restaurant, so I don't feel compelled to give exemplary marks for such a simple task. Onto the hollandaise... What a joke??! Hollandaise should NEVER be highlighter orange a la Kraft Singles! I don't care if your yolks are so friggin vitamin/lutiein rich, cage-free fresh! Anyone who has ever eaten a real/proper hollandaise would find what the Ruby Slipper serves to be disgusting and an insult to eggs, chickens and palates. Without a doubt, it started off as a pre-packaged powder that morning. The foundation of this food tower was a biscuit. It was good but heavy- not in the "I just soaked up some pork juice" heavy but more like "the butter was not cold enough when baked" heavy. I also ordered a double mimosa, which, I must say, was amazing! I must have gotten a bottle that was freshly popped bc the drink was crisp, refreshing and just what a girl needs before a three hour flight! The coffee was nice and hot but upon asking for a refill, we were met with a chilly response. If the décor wasn't so in your FACE about "home" and "hospitality" I probably would not have found the service to be so rough. The fact that the menu preaches about coming back home after Katrina to serve the community speaks volumes. The hospitality we received made it crystal clear they have ZERO interest in serving anyone but the locals.
***For a good time and AMAZING FOOD (and no wait) try Red Gravy- just a block away! We went after being rejected from RS on Sunday and were introduced to Southern Hospitality with a NJ flare. Everyone working was wearing their warmest, most sincere smile. My goodness, what a gem?!

I was just here yesterday (visiting from Florida) for brunch.  We heard about the great reviews and it was all true!  They say there is always a wait, and for us that was about 30 minutes, which wasn't bad.  We spent that time observing their menu!  Everything on the menu looked delicious, but I ended up getting the Chicken St Charles and it was outstanding!!!! The wait was very well worth it.

10 minute wait which was OK since I wanted to look through their menu.  Seated at the bar.  

Large warehouse with high ceilings.  T-shirts for sale.

Corned beef bennie and Irish coffee.  Any day is a good day when it begins with coffee.  With a supplement like that...hmm...it's a good day accelerated.

Don't even know where to start with the benedict.  Crisp home made corned beef on a buttermilk biscuit which is almost an inch thick.  Hmm!  Perfectly poached eggs, horseradish cream and hollandaise sauce.  Scrumptious.  I admit defeat and I couldn't finish my biscuit.  I will be back!!!

The waiter spilled a glass of water with  ice cubes next to me as he was clearing the counter.  Good thing I grabbed my phone and other stuff in time otherwise it would have been nicely soaked.  And who needs a wet lap!!

Maybe you'd need to watch where you sit.  LOL.

Wanted one of their t-shirts but didn't have my size.

Another successful day in NOLA food wise. I heard from about 3 different people that I had to try to Ruby Slipper Cafe and I'm so glad that I did. I ordered the southern breakfast and substituted the grits for breakfast potatoes. Everything was yummy (just wish my potatoes and egg whites were seasoned a little more). Although the place was crowded, I didn't have to wait long at all. Can't wait to go back next time I'm in the area!

I've been here a few times, and the wait is always worth it. Although I've never had to wait longer then 30 minutes, even on a Sunday for a party of 6. I recommend the Shrimp and grits or french toast!

Great breakfast, I went with the bacon/praline pancakes, 2 huge pancakes very tasty.  Tempted to go with one of the southern egg dishes but couldn't do meat after last nights dinner.  They looked awesome though.  My wife had the banana foster French toast also delicious.  Get there before nine to get on list or the wait is up to 2 hrs.  Can use check in app also. Great service too. Enjoy!

Been meaning to come here for breakfast for a couple of years now.  It's a nice little place, located right off Canal St serving some classic southern meals and then some. I've seen long lines of people waiting on weekends, but on a weekday Thu morning there was no line at 8am.  Sat at the large circular bar in the center

The food looked really good and from reviews and photos from other Yelp reviews, I was stuck between the Chicken St Charles and the Egg Cochon from the Eggs Benedict section on their menu.  I ultimately decided on the Egg Cochon, with the poached eggs lying on slow cooked pork and finished with their hollondaise sauce.  I did not regret it, and enjoyed the flavors as they melted together.  I even added some Southern Louisiana hot sauce and it was great.  You get 2 of them, so if you're not that hungry or want to try something else with someone, it's a good order to share.

The food was worth it, and I could see why there was a wait. Service was excellent and food was great. Will definitely come back to try other menu items.  Highly recommend.

Shared the eggs blackstone and banana foster French toast with the boyfriend. Both very tasty. We didn't care for the tomato with the eggs though. We also had coffee and it was amazing!!! Great service and atmosphere!

I really can't say enough about this spot. From the food, service and welcoming atmosphere, you HAVE to stop for breakfast.  My kids begged me to go back everyday. The portions are pretty large and the Eggs Benedict dishes are creative and delicious.
I like the vibe here better than the one by Canal, It's least touristy IMO. Personally, the Bloody Mary felt like it needed more tomato juice but other than that, everything was on point.

Good solid breakfast with friendly service. The poached eggs were poached dead on but the pork was a bit under seasoned. The kid enjoyed the double chocolate pancakes and the hubby tried the French toast. Both were well executed. The coffee was great. We would certainly return.

This morning for breakfast, I wanted to try something different, so I ordered the Smoked Salmon Bennie and my wife ordered the Banana Foster Pain Perdu. Fortunate for me, my wife's meal was amazing and she had a lot to share.  The salmon was Smoked TOO DRY which was disappointing.  Aside from that, the service was excellent and did I mention my wife's meal was amazing?

Come try this place! Super friendly staff, they give you very good recommendations and the food is delicious! The place is a casual, grab some breakfast and keep going kind of deal. Definitely coming back..

Good food and service. Great local chain when down in the Gulf. My wife and I were looking for a local lunch spot and came across the Ruby Slipper. 

We loved the variety and environment. Staff was friendly. The benedict trifecta for $20 was just what I needed.

It is worth the wait ! put your name on that app, come early get a mimosa while you wait in the sun. Since coming here, no breakfast spot in my hometown of Seattle can compare. Can't wait to visit NOLA again, will certainly be at the ruby slipper
The bacon bloody Mary, AWESOME!  I know my Bloody Mary drinks, this one has been the best thus far! Food, ok.. 4 stars for the drinks!

Be prepared for a wait. You can get in line on their website or app before you get there which makes the wait even less. When we got there we maybe waited 20 min and were seated. They have seats inside and outside on the street. The food was very tasty. I ordered the BBQ shrimp and grits and it was a savory sauce and creamy grits. It comes with a homemade biscuit and honey butter it melts in your mouth. It is worth the wait which is a common thing here.
We had a good experience here at brunch. One of our dishes was not warm enough so the manager took notice and remade it. Also gave us a 20% discount. It was nice of them. A must visit.

Hostess staff was great and efficient. Our server was so friendly and welcoming. Food was great. Highly recommend the Fried green tomatoes and biscuits! Also you have to try their signature mimosa. My boyfriend had a delicious Bloody Mary too!

Use the yelp app to get on the waitlist because there will definitely be a wait!!

I was informed that the ruby slipper provided the best breakfast in town....Long lines in front and a crowded restaurant apparently bolstered that opinion. After consuming my order of the louisiana omelet- stuffed with cheddar cheese and shrimp, I was not impressed..The food was bland...something I would've never expected in the big easy.....perhaps another time another dish..
Found this place on Yelp and it was worth the walk! Extremely friendly staff, nice atmosphere and great lunchtime food. I'd definitely go back.

Can be a long wait but food comes out pretty quickly. Started with a mimosa of course. Wanted to try the cheesecake stuffed French toast, wasn't quite cheesecake but I liked the filling more anyways, it was a creamy sweet filling. My friend got the egg Benedicts with the bacon and grilled tomato and added spinach and avocado (we're from Cali obviously) and it was really good. I had the pulled pork Benedicts and they were amazing also. Pork was a little dry but the hollandaise helped.

Look Just do yourself and your taste buds a favor and have breakfast/brunch here. We Were headed to Mother's, but the sinfully delicious scent of pancakes, coffee and syrup led my sister and I to do otherwise and boy we sure are glad we were distracted. The wait had to be at least an hour or so, but it went by fast. Keep in mind this was Essence Fest Weekend also. The smell alone kept us salivating outside. I wish there was a sample entrèe on the menu b/c there was so much that I wanted to try lol. I kept it simple with a mimosa and a create your own omelette with a side of grits and a biscuit. Let me just say that right there on my plate felt like a little piece of heaven. Sorry Mother's i'll check ya out next time i'm in town. 

P.S. RS is within walking distance to pretty much any hotel in the FQ!! Enjoy

Tune your radar to the tourist trap channel and you will find yourself staring at the front door of the ruby slipper.  Not to be confused with Cindarellas slipper, this one is to be avoided at all costs.

This restaurant has terrible food and even worse service.  The staff are cranky and seem annoyed at having to do their job.  

We arrived at 1 and our food was finally all on the table at 2:20.  Mine was 20 minutes after everyone else's.  

We sat down and were greeted promptly but it took a while to get our order.  After I ordered my food the waiter came back and said they could not make it without onions.

He came back 10 minutes later to tell me his other recommendation also had onions so I ordered something else.  A full 30 minutes later my food came out covered in onions .   After he took it back he returned another time and said that even that sauce had onions.  Strike 3.  Meanwhile the kids are starving and getting fussy because it apparently takes 45 minutes to make French toast and grilled cheese 

The server was highly frustrated and apologized while blaming the kitchen and noting he had noted onion allergy on his ticket.  That did not change the fact that we have been sitting waiting with little kids for over an hour.

Then finally the chicken eggs Benedict came out.  It was mase with TOUGH not tender chicken and boring sauce.  My wife said the fried green tomato was good but everything else was nothing special or yuck.

I feel like we got totally duped by all of the other good reviews.  The people sitting next to us also said their food was bad and they couldn't even get a cup of coffee because the machine was broken.  Hello?!  If your coffee machine is broken head over to a store and buy a coffee maker to use while yours is repaired!  Or go get a few gallons of starbucks.  I guess that would require a basic understanding of customer service which clearly is an ignored art at this awful restaurant.

After the waiters apology and explanation that he had noted allergy in the system and was sorry about the chaos, I thought for certain there would be a visit from a manager.  Nope.  Nothing.  I hope some of you fellow yelpers can avoid this awful tourist trap.

I visited the Ruby Slipper once in January 2014 for breakfast.  

I had the Spanish omelet, which consisted of three eggs, chorizo sausage, red onions, pepper jack cheese, and topped with a red pepper sauce.  The omelet was quite large, however the amount of filling was just adequate.  The chorizo was good, but it wasn't the super-intense style (which was OK, given that it was in an omelet). Overall my omelet was very good.  

The omelet came with a choice of grits or breakfast potatoes and toast or a biscuit.  Since I'm not from the south, I opted for the potatoes and (multi-grain) toast.  The toast was ordinary (but isn't most toast ordinary?).  The potatoes were large-ish chunks of small red potatoes.  They were likely partly cooked by boiling, then finished on the flattop.  They were moderately browned (but not crispy) and had a hint of rosemary flavor. Overall they were quite tasty taters. 

The coffee was better than average. A nice touch  -- my server gave me a full to-go cup of coffee when I left. 

I sat at the counter; service was prompt and courteous.  My coffee cup was kept full.  

Decor is pretty old school. The high-ceiling space has a nice feel.  Everything looked clean and in good repair.

The food alone would be four stars, but taken as a whole, I'll give the Ruby Slipper the full five stars!

While the food was outstanding, there was a terrible mix up with our order. There were 3 meals ordered and each came out seperately so we all ate alone. The waiter started off great but did not follow thru and so we were EXTREMELY  disapointed. We sat for well over an hour unnecessarily

Came here for breakfast on a random Tuesday. It was packed with a waiting line outside the door. Luckily, I was alone (business trip) so I was seated promptly at the bar. The service wasn't fast BUT the place was packed so its understandable. I had the cheesecake stuffed french toast and it was delicious. The coffee was decent as well. The pricing is reasonable. I would come back here again.

I must say that couldnt be more pleased with my visit to New Orleans and the long distances walk, after I went to this place. So delicious. The Brandy Mix Milk, or something like that is delicious.... mimosa is really double and delicious as well. Coffee??? Mehhhh, it was cold and weak, but not everything can be perfect. Waiting time was about 40 minutes on Labor Day. Next Day, it was 0 minutes waiting. ;)  try the Fried chicken on muffin...
Great breakfast.  The best seasoned grits I've had all trip.  Justin is a great waiter: attentive, friendly, great smile, and so damn cute.  Will come back to 200 Magazine.
Great service & atmosphere! I had the peacemaker to try the shrimp and chicken benedicts. Such unique flavors and paired nicely with the bloody mary!

Don't waste your time. It's way Overrated people are so rude. I was by myself just wanted to sit at the bar. I Mary seats in sight and the hostess still told me 40 to 60 mon wait. Way not nice people.

The food here is great! Had brunch here with friends and we tried different entrees and shared. I really enjoyed the Chciken St. Charles and the banana foster French toast. Thanks for the good service.

100% recommend if you are in the vicinity. My boyfriend liked it so much we went there three days in a row! Everything was good, but we especially loved the milk brandy punch and blueberry mimosa for drinks. The gulf fish st. Peter was the star of the entire three days, along with the bbq shrimp and grits.  The service was friendly although some days slower than others. (That's to be expected when every table is full). Definitely use the yelp app to put your name on the list before stepping foot out of your hotel. The wait was easily an hour each day but we didn't wait at all.
Just had the grilled chicken ceasar salad for lunch - this place continues to re-create simple menu items into great meals!
Yum!! First time in New Orleans and was told this place was a must. The food was great and the drinks were delicious. A very unique and different menu which was what I liked so much about it.

This is my first time visiting but surely not my last! Whatever you do, make sure you eat here! 
I highly recommend the stuffed French toast, Shrimp and grits, and The Louisianan Omelette. This food was so good! One piece of advice is to put yourself on the waiting list. The lines are LONG!!!!! Arrive by 8:30 am for the shortest wait time.

Corned beef Beeni was good minus the hollandaise sauce to much mayo and tang for the saltiness of the corned beef... The Corned beef was really good and the biscuit if you don't like runny eggs I suggest you ask for your eggs cooked the way you like the pitched eggs was too undercooked for my likings... My cousin had the Cochon it's roasted pork on a biscuit with poached eggs and hollandaise sauce hers was better than mine lol... I would definitely come here again great service and there menu is really interesting...

OMFG this is the best brunch I have ever had. We went there on a Monday morning for brunch and the wait was for 20 minutes. After 20 minutes we were seated and we ordered 2 egg benedicts and it was both great!! It just melted in my
Mouth. We did have to wait for 30 minutes to get our food but it was just worth it. Will be back when in NOLA.

Our last day in NOLA, and this was the PERFECT place for breakfast!!  We went with their "famous" dishes, what they're known for, and boy were we not disappointed!! The pork and chicken benedicts were outstanding! And the BBQ shrimp and grits were so delicious, especially with a side of ham. And service made the experience so much better!! Jane gave us awesome suggestions, described things great, was prompt, and so sweet! I wish all of our service in NOLA was as good as hers! Thanks Jane!!

This review is for a to-go order around 1pm on a Monday. 

I was in a big rush. Only had 20 min to order and get the food so I called to place an order but couldn't get ahold of anyone there which was a bit annoying. I walked over and then was able to immediately order at the bar. I told the bartender my situation and he said it was doable. I got my food in 5 MINUTES!! Awesome! I had about 15 min to spare. 

Had the Eggs Cochon. A bit difficult to eat with plastic utensils but the dish was delicious.
Touristy but decent. Just came for eggs so it's hard to mess that up. Cannot justify the wait so go if you can get their early and are staying very close by.

Definitely worth the wait (tip: use NoWait app to book your table and then go grab a drink somewhere and they'll let you know when your table is almost ready)

This place was packed and very popular. Great vibe and location. Boozy coffees were a great way to start the day. I had a chicken and a salmon eggs benedict with a side of grits and it was delicious. 

Their sweet breakfast items also looked great but I didn't get the chance to try one.

Yelp has served me right again! 

Stopped in to Ruby slipper Café for a quick breakfast before my conference began. I was luckily sat right away at the breakfast bar. The young man server was very attentive and accommodating to my requests. I ordered their specialty banana foster French toast, and substituted a side of grits for the bacon. ( I am a vegetarian). The French toast was better than I had imagined, nice crispy crust with a bourbon caramelized syrup that was just sweet enough. I think the only thing that could've made it better was a scoop of ice cream on top... But then again it was breakfast :-) 

The grits were just okay, I mean I ate them so I'm not going to complain. 

Overall great service, delicious French toast, and a solid cup of coffee equals a breakfast win!

Fantastic place. Had lunch there. Best sweet potato fries anywhere. The fried green tomatoes and shrimp remoulade are amazing. Shrimp and grits are highly satisfying. The giant warm biscuit on the side? Now you're having an out-of-body experience. Unbuckle that belt another notch and enjoy. If you can't snag a table outside, sit at the bar. Great servers, and there's sunlight in abundance.

It was ok not sure why so many people wait in line. The pancake however was really good. the bread they used on the benedicts was stail. The bloody Mary was good too. With so many breakfast options in new Orleans I would be hard pressed to come back soon.

So there are two locations but this is the one I finally ate at. I heard this place was good and every morning I woke up just a little too late so the wait was always way too long. I recommend you getting there by 9:30 if you don't want to wait. In my mind I'm VIP so I hate waiting too long. Lol. 

Anywho...food here is great and I see why the line is always long. This place is sooooo worth the wait. Bellini's and Mimosas are good so check that off the list. I ordered the Costa Rican breakfast...what an amazing combination of flavors. You can get it with the spicy chorizo sausage which really set it off! (I miss being Vegan sometimes but today was not the day!) My friend orders the Southern Breakfast and it was perfect. I love good bacon. The person next to me ordered the Bandanna Foster French Toast. He has plenty to eat and once again that bacon was looking good. 

If you look around, you will notice everyone has cleaned their plates. This is a must stop for breakfast and its right off canal street so its close to most of the hotels. And finally they had a good friendly staff.
I was told this place was a must while in New Orelans but I wasn't all that impressed. It wasnt bad but nothing to rave about either.

My host was great and my mimosas were amazing. I wasn't a huge fan of my shrimp and grits. It was ok, but not breath taking like all of the other food I had in Nola. I most likely won't return because I wasn't impressed.

One of the best early morning meals I've ever had. The staff are friendly, the decorations are hip and the menu is extensive. Props for the lengthy list of morning alcoholic drinks.

I customized an omlette which was out of the world. It came with a heaping of potatoes which were nicely seasoned and a larger than life biscuit which was stellar to say the least.

If you love breakfest or brunch this is surely your spot. 

This was by far one of the best meals I had in NOLA overall!

Everything was amazing. We had to wait an hour to get in. But it was worth the wait. We had the chicken benny on biscuits, corned beef benny and berry french toast that was on special it all tasted spectacular.

Ruby Slipper is a great place to have breakfast or brunch on the weekends. They have great mimosas and outstanding food. The wait can be long but is worth it. The staff is also really friendly and helpful.

A MA ZING! I'm home, and wearing the t-shirt I got there right now! 

There is always a line and a wait, but the first time I went, I was by myself and got seated right away at the counter. I asked the counter man whether I should have the Bananas Foster Pain Perdue or the Three Little Pigs omelet. He said I could get an omelet anywhere, so I get the Pain Perdue and it was sooo good!

I talked my friend into going back the next day. She hates to wait on line, but I told her it was worth it (and you have to wait on line for most good things in NOLA). She had the Pain Perdue and I had the Louisiana Omelet (Gulf shrimp and cheddar), which was also amazing! I also had the bacon Bloody Mary, made with bacon infused vodka and with a strip of bacon as part of the garnish. I would go back in a second.
Had such a yummy breakfast one morning had to come back for a second time. The BEST ever! You won't be disappointed with anything you order on their menu.

The food was ok . We ordered the southern BLT and they didn't even put the deep fried tomatoes on it . So it was a BLT but with a southern price tag . The service felt rushed and distant. Not friendly at all . Did not see what the hype was about. Not something i would go back to . Maybe the other location is better .
Amazing food, the portions are great. The taste amazing and lets not forget the mimosas! YUM!

D.E.L.I.C.I.O.U.S. I had the banana's foster french toast, which was spot on. Definitely a lot to handle at 8:30 in the morning, but so worth it. The other items on the menu looked tasty as well - I'm disappointed I wasn't able to go back for seconds! I ordered my food "to go," so I didn't have an experience with the waiters, but the guy who took my order was very friendly and chatty. Highly recommended!!

The wait was worth it! We wandered around for 45 min, got a seat at the bar and were promptly greeted and given our drinks. The coffee was delicious and fresh, although when I got a refill it was cold and tasted old, but they were very busy. Didn't try the Bloody Mary, although they were almost out when we got there at noon, so they must be good. My boyfriend got the signature dish, Eggs Cochon, which was piled with pork and tasted amazing. I got the stuffed French toast, and it did not disappoint. I'd definitely come back!
I love a restaurant that uses "Waitlist". The estimated time for our table to be ready was accurate. This is a great brunch! The service is good. Definitely will return for brunch.
The Banana Foster was delicious!  As a non-pork eater, I love the fact they have chicken sausage.  The wait was only about 15 minutes.  The prices are fair.  I will return the next time I'm in NO.
The breakfast here was absolutely wonderful. Everyone enjoyed their food. The service was great and the people very friendly. I would recommend this to anyone wanting a great breakfast or lunch.
Do not sit at an outdoor table, or you will be stuck with the unpleasant odor of city streets for your whole meal.

If you want something sweet and delicious run don't walk to this place and get the Bananas Foster Pain Perdu. There was a lot of sauce, but the bread still has the right amount of bite and was savory enough to hold up to the sweet awesomeness of the toppings!

This place was so good We went here 2 days in a row for breakfast. Their mimosas are huge and only cost $10. I recommend downloading the app to get seated sooner. The wait can be up to 2 hours at a time.
We've gone two days in a row!! The food is delicious, highly recommend the strawberry & white chocolate pancakes, Costa Rican, and Migas!!!
Sat at the bar, the guys were hilarious and the food was amazing. Definitely check in the Nowait or you'll be waiting outside for a while.
Pig-candy bacon and the peach Bellini was amazing. I also had the shrimp and grits which needed some hot sauce. The bday girl loved her chicken sausage and so did I.   The French toast was great
The best breakfast place in Nola! The wait was really long but that was only because it is so awesome! The atmosphere is amazing and the best Bloody Mary's anywhere in the city!

Saw a crowd outside waiting, decided to take our chances on a long wait. Thrilled to get in within less than 15 minutes. 

Ambiance loud but pleasant. Menu offers both standard fair and adventurous choices. Definitely something for everyone. 

Our waitress misty was quirky and upbeat, knew the menu, made great suggestions and really took care of us despite having a crowded room. 

Food impeccable, everything well prepared. Large portions at good prices. 

Will definitely be back!
Long wait, but the check-in buy one get one free mimosa deal rocks! Also, the food is decent and in a neighborhood beset by tourist traps, Ruby Slipper Cafe presents tasty food at reasonable prices.

Great breakfast place. Glad I read the reviews and knew to try the eggs cochon. They were delicious. Will definitely go back before I leave. Went on a Wednesday morning and there was absolutely no wait for a table.

This is one of the few places to get non Cajun spice and is reasonably priced and fun. The wait is crazy long but you can add yourself to the waitlist prior to going. They are known for their vanilla iced coffee and for good reason. It was soooo good

Went in for a very late brunch on a recommendation from a family member and wasn't disappointed! The omelettes were very good ( 3 little pigs, Florentine ) as well as the Costa Rican, and service was fantastic. Great place to grab breakfast/lunch for a reasonable price!

Always top notch food and service!! We always visit Ruby Slipper whenever we are in town, wouldn't be a real visit without having breakfast here.
It doesn't matter what you get on the menu, you'll love it.  Reserve on the no wait app because you could wait for over an hour. Thank me later:-).

Very good.  I had shrimp grits. Hubby had the 3 little pigs omelet. My food was good. Hubby food was over cooked.  Both omelet & potatoes when I told the waitress she said that's how they cook them. This wasn't true as we went back the next day and saw this wasn't true.. this day they got a 3, the next day better waiter, better food.  They get a4 star

We were sat quickly, however service was slow... I think our waiter forgot to put our order in (people who were sat much later than us were done eating by the time the 3 of us were served). We got the Bananas Foster to split and it was pretty good. The chicken and biscuits meal was ok. Staff was friendly.
First time here. Had a little wait but not too long. I had chicken and biscuit that was so good. Also at the table was the corned beef eggs Benedict. Best breakfast and great location!

All 4 of my family members were disappointed. It was not terrible. It was just ok. To much salt in everything for my taste.

With all the reviews being so good I guess we was expecting more. Nope.

The staff & waiter were great though. Love the Yelp access to reservations!

Chowwed down here at 9:00am on a Friday - no wait. Long line once we finished. Split the Shrimp & Grits, and the Cochon Eggs Benedict & the Corned Beef Benny. The Shrimp & Grits were good, not great, and were a very poor imitation of the Cake Cafe's I had yeaterday- they were unbelievable. Preferred the Corned Beef Benny over the Cochon Bennie. Both were  biscuit laden gooey goodness. Service was great. We'll do it again.
Had the Eggs Blackstone and was extremely impressed. Great restaurant and worth the 40 minute wait. Great service as well! We would come back again.

Just a great breakfast in a nice atmosphere. I love the building's big windows and bar.
I highly recommend the breakfast sandwich. The biscuit is top-notch and the coating on the fried green tomato is so tasty.

I come to NOLA frequently for work. This place is just around the corner from my hotel. I've had my eye on it for a while. 

I went there with the intention of trying their Eggs Bouchon. They were out... D'oh! So I opted for their weekend special which was called The Aztec: 2 eggs over black beans & rice, mixed with a roasted salsa and served on jalapeño corn bread. I was promised a kick, never got it. Temperature of the food was cold-ish. Corn bread was kind of hard, like it was old. I also ordered a side of cheese grits and bacon which were great. Service was great too, even when they were filled wall to wall indoor and out.

I'm not discounting this place entirely, maybe just stick to their house goods. If available.
The wait is worth it. Some say "go where the line is that's how you know how good it is", some say "it's so busy, nobody goes there anymore!"  The food and ambiance is NOLA.
Great place. The food is tasty. Service is good. And drinks, not meaning coffee, wonderful. Check it out!

Yet another great breakfast / brunch place. 

The wait here can be very long, so feel free to grab a drink and wait outside and enjoy the weather. The ability to do this made the wait much more enjoyable. 

Prior to ruby slipper, I have only had a bloody Mary once in NY and did not like it. I figured what the hell and gave it another shot and I loved it!

Additionally, the french toast here is to die for!

I wish there was a place like this in NY! 

Cheers

This place was so packed, I think the wait was 20 mins long. We had a event this week and this place was recommended. The food was so good, I would definitely come back. Our waitress was very nice and was there to help us. There was so much food, and definitely enough to share. I ordered the southern breakfast and I was satisfied, my friend ordered the Benedict and she mixed and matched them and she loved it, we did find a egg shell in her food, which was weird but we didn't really complain. We also shared the cheesecake stuffed French toast topped with blueberries it was so delicious. The only thing I wished for was flavored coffee, but that wasn't a big deal.

We always try eat at the Ruby Slipper when visiting NOLA not only because we like the food, but also because we like the staff and service. Today's stop, before heading to the airport, was the perfect way to end our visit. The food was good, like usual, but what really made it great was or server Jill - She was hands down the friendliest and most hospitable person we encountered in NOLA. Thanks for making our last morning in town a great one!

Great food and atmosphere. Easily one of the best places I've found in New Orleans so far. 

Reminded me of a San Francisco café. Something about the blackboard wall menus, the business-casual clientele, and the general tone just resonated in that way for me. 

I ordered the Migas, a Tex-Mex breakfast special they serve, which was amazing. It was pretty much an omelet with small tortilla chips and chorizo sausage embedded in it. On the side I had some applewood-smoked bacon, which was delicious and cooked just crispy enough for maximum awesome. I also had a pancake, which really stood out for me  because it was a bit more cooked than I'm used to, and definitely to its benefit. It wasn't a sloppy flapjack, and more of a pan cake, which is what I always figured they should be anyway. 

The coffee was pretty good too. Nothing to write home about, but satisfactory and better than any others I've had in this city (ahem, Café Du Monde). 

I definitely recommend the Ruby Slipper Café if you're in the area.
Very packed and long wait to get in during mornings but well worth it. The Eggs Cochon was Amazing!
Delicious and great service. Devin our server had us laughing the entire time. Great drinks too.

This place is well worth the wait. There is always a long line here but the Yelp app allows you to "cut the line" with their wait in line feature. 

First of all, all of the food was good. So good, that I can't remember the pricing. Please see the photos to visually see the goodness. The food came out hot, the flavors were phenomenal and the service was fast. 

My mom had the shrimp and grits and I wanted to snatch it from in front of her after tasting a little. The grits were cooked to perfection and the gravy was unique to that place and had a delicious New Orleans flare. The pancakes we're like country cooking pancakes rather than commercial. The catfish was flavourful and not salty. I could go on and on about this place. But I will leave this review at it's a must visit in New Orleans. 

It looked like it would be very hot in there since it was so crowded, but it wasn't.

So so delicious! The food was amazing, coffee was eh but wasn't expecting a whole lot out of it. The mimosa was gigantic and delicious, came with a to go cup  all around great food, nice people and great place! There's always a bit of a wait on weekends but it's worth it
Great place to eat.  I had The Costa Rican and it was excellent.  Would come here again and again.  OJ was delicious as well.  Fiancée has the oatmeal and potatoes.  Large portions.

Came in just before lunch (11:30) to avoid lunch rush. Fail. Instantly feels like a cool place. Seated quick only because I'm Flying solo and sat at bar.  Lots of curb traffic. Bartender (ticket says Jared) greeted me immediately and put my order in pronto. shrimp & grits Delicious.

I absolutely love this place!  in 4 days in NOLA it is the only place we went to more than once.  Fantastic eggs - I had the Eggs Cochon (basically Eggs Benedict over pork debris) the first day and loved it.  Eggs Corned Beef Hash today and even better.  My son had the eggs over smoked salmon - amazing.  I would buy this place if I could :)  Come for breakfast and you won't need another meal until dinner.
The food, service and atmosphere is amazing! I only wish the place was double the size it is. The line is always huge and wrapped around the block so I would recommend waking up early. It's worth it!

Ruby Slipper happened to be within walking distance to our hotel. There was a line forming 15 minutes before opening, probably earlier! Luckily we got in the line so we were able to be seated when they opened the doors.

When we finally made it inside our waiter was really great. He kept apologizing for how long things were taking and thanking us for our patience which I guess tells you how cranky people are when they come here lol.

They've got an array of morning adult beverages that sounded pretty good (mimosas, bloody marys...) but I wasn't interested this time. I got coffee which was pretty good, nothing too special though.

Our food was excellent! I got Eggs Blackstone which is a biscuit, a slice of tomato and poached eggs with hollandaise. I was a little disappointed that my tomato wasn't grilled as was stated in the description (I was envisioning a thick slice of heirloom tomato with some grill marks but instead it was just a regular slice of tomato that did not appear cooked at all). The hubs got the St Charles which is a biscuit with friend chicken and poached eggs - that one was delish but a little salty, probably due to the Tasso gravy. Overall though really good food. I would definitely recommend!
Absolutely in love with the cochon Benedict! Such delicious options on the menu and large meals with reasonable prices!
Ordered Chicken St. Charles and it did not disappoint. Was in town for a few days and this was by far my favorite meal.

Best brunch/breakfast of my life! Bloody Mary (through the garden) with a bacon stirrer and the "surf and turf" Benedict special I invented myself (Cochon and Shrimp Boogaloo benedicts combined) were both amazing!! Other family members had shrimp and grits and pancakes. Service was attentive and friendly.  We all walked out happy and stuffed! Will definitely return the next time we are in the Big Easy!!
The food was great! We were seated outside at the picnic tables. Our waiter was very kind, and on top of everything as busy as it was.

We were told by a few people to come here for breakfast and it does not disappoint!! The wait was long, but totally worth it. Our server was very welcoming and fast. Food was amazing. We will definitely come back for more!

Great service and food. Very popular location that was definitely worth the wait. Had the 3 little pigs omelette and a short stack which was very good. Now I'm too stuffed to move but I definitely enjoyed my experience.

Great atmosphere, and very good bloody Mary.  The staff was fun to deal with.  I ordered the pulled pork eggs Benedict which were tasty and plenty.  I left the place stuffed and happy.  It is a little pricey, that's why I gave 4 stars instead of 5, but that is to be expected.  You are in NOLA.  I would recommend this place to anyone traveling to New Orleans.

We stayed in New Orleans for the weekend, and googled "restaurants around me". I'm so happy that this was one of the closest to us... In walking distance. The food was DELICIOUS. Well worth the 15-20 minute wait that we had. This is the perfect brunch place. Be sure to try the French toast!

When we arrived were given a wait time of an hour.we didn't mind waiting because i read many good reviews on this place,and was just determined to dine here.as we were standing around waiting a server came out to take our drink orders.my friend and I ordered the ruby slipper,and my husband had some margarita drink.his drink was delicious ours wasn't so great.turns out we were given just a regular mimosa not what we ordere,oh well.when we were finally seated my friend and I ordered the catfish and grits,my husband had the bbq shrimp and grits,and we ordered the migos to share.the grit dishes were very bland we all tried adding hot sauce to give it a lol flavor,but hot sauce couldn't even help these dishes.The only thing that was good was the migos which is an egg scramble.it really saved the day.I don't know if we just picked the wrong location,but its out of my system.I never have to dine here again

We are from out of town and picked this place based off of the reviews and we were not disappointed. There were 8 of us and everyone LOVED their food!!!! We will be recommending this restaurant to people back home in St. Louis!

Since we had heard so much about this cafe. I had to catch it before my flight. Got a seat at the bar and ordered Gulf fish St. Peter. The ordered arrived quickly. If you have a medium appetite the order should easily fill two. I was not a huge fan of the grits being fried as it made the whole meal super heavy. The presentation however was nice. The fish blended well the grits and spinach/tomato.
Very good breakfast / brunch option steps from the French Quarter with decent gluten free choices.

I can't say enough about this place so I will say all that matters: this place rocks. I went twice for breakfast while in town. I went on the early side, shortly after they opened, to avoid the crowds. I had a few of the benedicts each visit. They have an option where you can mix and match two different styles. I highly recommend trying a few. They were delicious. This place lives up to the hype!

The Ruby Slipper did NOT disappoint one bit. We took advantage of yelp's service to add our name to the wait list and once we got there only waited 5-10 minutes for the next table to clear. Our waitress, Sandi, was super spunky and gave us excellent suggestions from the menu. We tried a little from 4 different dishes. All amazing! The Peacemaker is the way to go to try two different styles of eggs Benedict. We ordered the Cochon and the St. Charles. Both were divine. The shrimp and grits were bursting with flavor as well. The biscuits were oversized and yummy with their sweet butter. If you have a sweet tooth, the cinnamon pancakes were delicious. No syrup needed. Overall, we highly recommend it, even if you have to wait a little longer than we did.
Amazing food and great service!! I had chicken st. Charles with a mimosa! Delicious! !

We came here based on reviews. The staff was awesome. they have a great new Orleans menu. I had an omelet with shrimp in it. I saw people with red velvet pancakes. My friends all enjoyed their dishes. My party was a bunch of catty gays who kept coming in and they bent over backwards to help.

We have eaten at the ruby slipper in Pensacola so we were delighted to find the ruby slipper one block from our hotel in NOLA. We were seated immediately, but then had to wait about 10 minutes before anyone approached us. We were ready and ordered drinks and food at once. We got our drinks pretty quick. Had to wait a little on food, but we expected that, because we know it's good. Well, we asked for extra crisp bacon, but what we got was more like warmed up bacon, just barely cooked at all. We returned the bacon asking for extra crisp. The waitress returned after we were close to finishing our meal with the EXACT same bacon we had given her to cook. We just let it go. Waitress, I realize was not at fault, but she really could not have cared less. She was not very attentive and we finally, after paying our bill and asking for a receipt had to get another waitress to help us. We were very disappointed in the ruby slipper.

I reviewed another location but this time around (two years later) I am still in love with the food. I tried new things this time around and I was very pleased. This restaurant also allows for the yelp check in. That's again a total win. 


We visited twice. I got the Benedict mix and match, my husband got the omelette and grits. The following day I got banana pancakes and he got the oatmeal. 
The restaurant was clean  and our wait staff was polite. 

PS. My husband is insisting that I mention how delicious the latte was. He ordered one all five days we visited.
Really good breakfast place, popular for anything with eggs on it, their bloody mary's and their great service... can't go wrong!

Very popular place from the wait. Amazing smoked salmon made it well worth it. The biscuit was also very delicious. The cajun bloody Mary... #awesome. Reasonably priced with a great variety of menu items. I would definitely eat here again.
Totally lived up to reviews!!! It was a party of 9 and everything was deelish!!! Only disappointment was the shrimp & grits, outside of that! Yummy!! B

Hit the lotto on brunch. Double mimosa was fabulous to wait outside with. Ordered eggs cochon and was blown away. Perfectly poached eggs over huge amount of pulled pork and homemade biscuit. Added tons of hot sauce to the already tasty hollandaise sauce and I was in heaven. Note that the waitress/bartender recommended this over the shrimp and grits when I couldn't make up my mind. Then the fiancé and I shared the bananas foster French toast for desert and I was on cloud 9.  One of the best brunches!

This was our first stop in NOLA.  After we dropped off our bags in the hotel, we just walked down the block and was seated shortly after since it was still really early.I had the all american breakfast which was good, the migas was yummy, I tried my frieds banana foster pancake which was a bit sweet for me but he liked it a lot.  The waitress was really nice, what a complete sweetheart!

Now I know why people wait in line over an hour for this place. YUM!! We went on a Tuesday morning so the wait was only about 20 minutes. I got the Eggs Blackstone and it was absolutely delicious. our waitress was very sweet and attentive. I also got a mimosa which they put in a plastic cup for me since we were ready to leave, but still had a lot left because of how much they gave me! This place is a must when visiting NOLA!

My uber driver recommended this place coming in from the airport, and I was not let down. They were super crowded, and had many people waiting outside but being a party of 1 I was able to get a spot at the bar. This was my first time trying "country breakfast" and elected to get the Peacemaker (two different Egg Benedict): SHRIMP BOOGALOO BENEDICT and EGGS COCHON. It was sooo good. 
What was even better than that was the prices. I got an excellent breakfast and leftovers for only about $20 including the tip. I loved the style of the restaurant, and will definitely come back here on a return trip to NOLA. The bartender was also fast, and courteous.

Très bon petit déjeuner américain 
Les œufs Benedict au saumon sont parfaits avec la sauce hollandaise entremêlant quelques petites câpres et oignons
Le cinnamon swirl is just amazing ;-)
So good! I could drink their bloody Mary's every morning. And the food is delicious! Large portion sizes with reasonable prices.

The Ruby Slipper is where it's at on the brunch front. If it weren't so busy I would eat here three or more times a week! I've been here twice and both times had the Corned Beef Bennie. I admit, I was really skeptical about this dish, but it's amazing. 

The service here is really great. The hostess is always rushed; because well this place is packed. However, she's always been friendly and attentive. The servers are great. Not once have we had to request a refill on coffee or water.  The food comes out really quickly. My estimate would be from the time we ordered to the time we received our food was no more than ten minutes. 

The only reason I've knocked off a star is because their menu is a little limited. My boyfriend and I love this place but my Mom has some dietary restrictions and had some difficulty finding something she could eat. If you or someone in your party has an allergy or a food aversion; take a look at the menu to make sure there's something here for everyone.

Edit: the restaurant messaged me to advise that they do have options for those with dietary restrictions. I've edited my review to five stars due to this info.

A great breakfast for a fair price. Let's start with the bloody marys. They were fresh, tomatoey and spicy, and you can get them with a bacon garnish. That's a helluva way to start the day! And the food was flavourful, the portions generous. I had their house special, which is described as "pork debris on a biscuit." Now, many in my California party were scared off by the word debris, but I saw "pork" and did not fear. The whole damn pig is delicious, right? Right! Turns out we would just call it "pulled pork," or maybe even carnitas. Once you pile it on a fresh made biscuit, and top it with perfectly poached eggs and just the right amount of hollandaise it is pretty damn scrumptious. Yum!
Great breakfast spot. There was quite a line  that we waited in, approximately 35 minutes. Service was friendly. Food was quite satisfying but not amazing.
Best cup of coffee in NOLA yet. Good service. Very well run place. They have a great system for moving a lot of people thru the restaurant without feeling rushed.

Very good.  I had shrimp grits. Hubby had the 3 little pigs omelet. My food was good. Hubby food was over cooked.  Both omelet & potatoes when I told the waitress she said that's how they cook them. This wasn't true as we went back the next day and saw this wasn't true.. this day they got a 3, the ne tday better waiter, better food.  They get a4 star

Originally we planned on Brennan's for breakfast since our experience at Commanders Palace was incredible, but... they didn't open till 9am and my pregnant wife was getting "hangry". 

The ambience was warm and inviting and our waitress was very attentive and sociable. As for recommendations I got a combo of the Eggs Blackstone and the Chicken St. Charles. Both were amazingly delicious as was the Irish coffee to wash it down. The Mrs. indulged in their signature Bananas Foster Pain Perdu. 

Although it can get very noisy, I highly recommend this neighborhood establishment.

Great breakfast. They do a great job managing the lines. The staff was awesome and Erin was a fabulous waitress. I highly recommend the Migas a great Mexican scramble.

A must do in NOLA.

I had the basic breakfast witha mimosa.  Nothing special about my breakfast and perhaps the wrong choice of meals.  This place was packed and the reviews were much better than I can afford this place.  The breakfast was meh.  If I wanted this meal, I could have gone to a denny's or IHOP.  Was hoping for a little better.  I wouldn't recommend the basic breakfast, but that doesn't mean that other breakfast options are not better.

Interesting meal combinations but the food flavor was bland and the wait of 1 1/2 hours was not worth it. I had the drum and grit cakes (Gulf fish St Peter). The drum seasoning was nothing to boast about and the grit cakes were dry. The atmosphere of the Magazine St location is extremely noisy and the decor is fitting for New Orleans.

Good coffee, tiny glasses. Slllloooowwww service, mediocre food. I got potatoes, bacon and a bagel. Dry bagel, under seasoned potatoes, and tasteless bacon. My boyfriends eggs seemed decent. Not worthy of its wait or it's high yelp rating. I have had hotel breakfasts that were better.
Had the cochon benedict for breakfast and it was amazing. Loved the atmosphere as well.

Amazing breakfast here! I had the Louisiana omelette and the shrimp was big, juicy and deliciously smoky. Grabbed a cappuccino with it and was in heaven. Breakfast was big enough to take me through the morning & well into the afternoon, which is good as I had a tour to catch. Great servers, and not too busy at 9am - we were seated right away (on a Tuesday). Our hotel concierge highly recommended it.
Excellent brunch! The eggs Benedict with pulled pork was amazing! Fast seating and service, even though we went on a Sunday and they were super busy.
If you come to Nola and don't come here, it means You didn't visit the New Orleans. Strongly recommended.
Who cares if you have to wait a few minutes for a table... brunch that can satisfy any pallet and great bloody mary's. Ask for Jacus!
Must visit if you are In NO. Sure fired hit!!!! Make reservations if you hate waiting!!

What a nice brunch spot! Even though there's a couple of them around the city, there's still a line (that shows how yummy it is!)

- - s e r v i c e / / a m b i a n c e - -
They were pretty busy, so at times it was a little hard to flag down the waiter/waitress. But overall it wasn't bad. I understand!! They were all so nice and tried to their best to get everyone in as soon as they could. There is a good amount of seating so the flow of customers does move fairly quickly. They have seats at the bar, in booths/tables around the restaurant, and some seating outside. 

- - f o o d - - 
[ [ e g g s   c o u c h o n - $ 1 3 ] ] 
The apple braised pork is omg...it melts in your mouth with every bite! I personally prefer my poached eggs to be more on the undercooked side so it'll ooze out. It was actually a bit more on the cooked side, which was a bummer. But overall this benedict was good! Thanks for the suggestion Yelp!

[ [ c o r n e d  b e e f  b e n n i e - $1 3 ] ]
Also a well done benedict! The poached eggs were more runny when we ordered this dish. So basically, they're not very consistent with their poached eggs. So it could be a hit or miss. The corned beef was cooked so nicely. Since it was a corned beef hash, the potatoes make this a more hefty bennie. And of course the hollandaise sauce to top it off makes the bennie just oh so delish!

Overall this good! I'm a fan :)

Had brunch here twice: both times there was a tasty pancake special and a benedict special: fried green tomato benedict one day; cinnamon pancakes; apple pancakes. For the money this is the best I have ever seen. Even the coffee was good. Ample seating; no wait either time. Super friendly service. Great t-shirts but they were out, boo hoo. And the best grits I had the whole trip.

Great brunch spot! After reading the reviews I used the yelp app to add myself and my party to the wait list and I can only imagine how much time I saved us - this place is BUSY. Like "30 people standing outside on the sidewalk" busy. The Ruby Slipper has a good-sized menu with lots of choices, from Southern specials to standard-fare pancakes and bacon. Our waitress Julie was excellent- one of the best waitresses I've had anywhere in a long time! I ordered coffee and the Bam Bam biscuit, which was fried eggs, pepper jack cheese, a fried green tomato and two strips of candied bacon on a huge biscuit. It was delicious - no fuss and good home-style cooking. My friend got the cinnamon swirl pancakes which were also delicious and a huge portion. If it had been later in the day I would've loved to have tried one of their mimosas, but sadly, although it was 5 o'clock somewhere, it was 9:30am here. I would definitely go back to the Ruby Slipper!
The best Cochon Benedict I have ever had! Theresa was our amazing waitress. She made our day and really the whole week lol
Got breakfast here, it was pretty good food. But found it lame that they would not let me sub french fries for potatoes.
Amazing brunch spot in town and it's a must visit. The big crowd is a big indication of how good their food, specials, & service is.

We arrived at 7am and they opened promptly.  Waiting were a few other people and it quickly filled up. We ordered the classic breakfast with side sausage. Everything was delicious!  Grits nice creamy. Eggs over hard Applewood bacon and sour dough toast instead. Very plant staff great experience.

I came to Ruby Slipper Café for brunch on a Saturday morning in January. The wait was over an hour but my crew and I put our name down and decided to go get coffee and do a little shopping while we waited. We came back and only had to wait about ten minutes for a table. The host was pleasant and informative. Our server was knowledgeable, friendly and answered all of my group's random menu questions with enthusiasm. I enjoyed a few Bloody Mary's that had just a hint of spice and my personal favorite, pickled green beans. For my entrée, I had the Catfish St. Peter, described on the menu as "pan-seared Mississippi farm-raised catfish over cheesy grit cakes, topped with poached eggs, sautéed spinach, tomatoes, a skewer of grilled shrimp, finished with a Creole mustard hollandaise." Don't waste your time and order another dish. This one is over-the-top! I cannot stop thinking about my meal and would order it week after week if I lived in the area. It has everything you could want in a southern brunch; grits, local fish and shrimp, and perfectly poached eggs. 

My friends and I sat at our table for a while after we finished eating and did not feel rushed at all. I recommend everyone to try the Ruby Slipper Café. The service was fabulous, the food was beyond amazing, and the overall experience I had was great.

My wife and I were in New Orleans for the weekend and were pointed in this direction by a tour guide. Nice, loud ambiance and had the southern type of charm. Service was good. I ordered the cochon Benedict (it think that's what it was called, it had the pork debris) and Benedict with the fried chicken. Unfortunately mine barely had any of the sauces that were supposed to be "smothered" on top of it. The pork debris tasted great, but unfortunately the chicken was underwhelming. Both of the biscuits that they were on were good but not great. And the egg was poached very nicely to a medium.  My wife had the BLT but asked for a fried egg instead of the bacon because she does not eat pork. She felt the bread was too thick for what was inside of the sandwich. And looking at the bread, I felt the same way. But again, who orders a BLT with an egg and no bacon?? Haha. The iced coffee was nice and strong and tasted delicious, according to my wife. I don't drink enough coffee to really have a great opinion. But tasting it, it did taste delicious to me. Strong, sweet and a nice aromatic, crisp taste. I feel they prob just were running low on the sauce and was unable to smother mine. Or at least I hope that's the case. THe lack of sauce didn't give me the "all warm inside" feeling that southern food and Benedict's give you. It was unfortunate because I saw the guy next to me get the same things and his Benedict's were oozing with sauce =(. Service was really good and food came out in a timely manner. Yelp came clutch with letting us book a table so we didn't have to wait in the rain forever. This place has all the potential but didn't quite meet the hype it was given when we were served. If they have me enough sauce and the fried chicken wasn't thin and didn't taste slightly over cooked I would've Gave this place a 4 or four and a half star rating. Just constructive criticism. Sorry ruby slippers! I know y'all work hard to protect your reputation and I'm not trying to bash that. Just feel I got slighted on my food. Maybe it was my fault for not asking for more sauce.
Amazing breakfast here. I always come for the breakfast. Popular spot in NOLA. Great variety of dishes and while you wait...the BEST Bloody Mary's in town!

Slowwwww.  Like I know we're in the south but damn everything was so incredibly slow.  I'm content if you get me my drink and food takes a bit.  20 minutes after being sat we still were waiting to get the drinks flowing.  Food was great when finally arriving, yet being in the service industry it was painful to watch.  Servers attitudes all need an adjustment!!!  Lady forgot one of our parties coffee and when we asked it was like "ugh omg".  Like you're the one that is slow as all hell and forgetting everything.  I ordered fruit and my omelette came out with grits.  Then asked for my side of fruit...to see I was charged $5 for the side of fruit.  I NEVER tip 15% and even doing that was painful.  Not genuine and poor poor poor attitudes all around.

Stopped here for late Brunch after conference.  Staff was friendly!  Food tasted great.  I had Chicken St Charles and a Double Bellini.  My only issue was with the poached eggs - they were poached hard. I prefer them runny to ooze over everything on the plate.  Biscuit was excellent.

Wayne was our server.  I got the Eggs Coubion & I MURDERED THAT ISH!!!!!. A Magical blend of sautéed spinach, Tasso, poached eggs, fried catfish, juicy bits of pork all on top of toasted bread &  some kind of delicious sauce. Mm!!!!!! They lost a star for the nasty hostess. Everything else was EXCELLENT!!!!!

AMAZING FOOD!!!!! I have been here multiple times and the food is unbelievable. Extremely long wait times but the food is well worth it. I have gotten almost every Benedict they have and my favorites are the chicken St. Charles and the corned beef hash one. Also, in my opinion, this is one of the best bloody Mary's in the city. Bacon infused vodka with strips of bacon in it!?! What else could you ask for? I just keep coming back here, I love it.

Go, go, go!  My last lunch on my trip to NOLA definitely did not disappoint.  Food was great and the environment is casual, laid-back, and inviting.

A good place for those that like breakfast, lunch, or brunch that won't break the budget.  

Our service was quick and there was a lot of variety in the menu.  My sister and I both got the croque madame sandwich that came with a salad with lemon vinaigrette.  This was the perfect pairing.  The food portions are generous but not overwhelming. 

The cafe is located before the french quarter so it seems a lot less touristy than most places.
There is a long wait, but you can put your name on the list using the Yelp app. We were seated within 5 minutes of arriving (just enough time for a drink). The food is pretty good

Has outside seating. The crew was friendly and the food was great. Looking for a good breakfast around the convention center area? Come here. It's a lot closer than going to the French Quarters from there also.
