Amazing food! We ate there this morning before leaving town. I had the eggs cochon. After a week of drinking and debauchery, that meal was like God telling me that he still loved me. Like a warm hug letting me know that everything was going to be alright.  Made me feel human again. Thanks ruby slipper!

So glad that we stopped by there for brunch! 

We waited for about 20 minutes before we got seated. The wait was manageable. Plus they have benches outside. I love so many things about this place: the location, the decor, the ruby slippers, and they were playing the classic version of Taishan when we were there. =)

I got a cup of coffee which was really good. I also enjoyed the fried green tomato which is probably the best one I have ever had. The European omelet was perfect with melted brie cheese inside along with some portobello mushrooms. The potatoes on the side were seasoned very well. No need for ketchup. We also shared the Banana Froster Pain Perdu. It's interesting how they made french toast with french bread and have bacon on top of the toast. I am not sure how I feel about the bacon but the Banana Froster topping was delicious.
The Cajun pork Benedict is amazing. Kids loved the mega French toast. We can't wait for breakfast tomorrow.

Trendy place, with mediocre food. 

You really work hard to screw up something as simple as breakfast foods, but the "chefs" at the Ruby Slipper did a great job at it. Eggs in the omelet for both me and the person with me were overcooked. Person next at the bar to me sent eggs back for being undercooked. Person across from me at the bar sent her breakfast back for something. Must have been a bad chef day. 

The "creamy stone ground grits" were hard and lumpy rubber. My 3 little pigs omelet with "applewood smoked bacon" tasted like regular bacon and for the $10 it cost - the Denny's grand slam would have been the better option.  As I read the other reviews I wonder was it just a really bad day for them, or do I expect a $10+ breakfast to actually taste good? The food was over priced for quality and portions. 

The decor is nice if you are into style rather substance. Bottom line is: go somewhere else. You are in New Orleans there other better options for breakfast at that price point. Also, be prepared for attitudes from everyone working here from the minute you walk in to put your name on the wait list.

The "Waitlist" offered by Yelp was Great!!!  There was an hour wait (It was a Saturday) but we were in route from the airport.  The Waitlist allowed us to sit in line without being present.  That was VERY helpful.  

If this was just based on the food it would be a 5 Star review, but we sat at the bar and the service failed us.  The bartender just wasn't friendly and you could tell they could care less about customer service because the place is busy regardless.

The "Corned Beef" benny was the worse thing we had, it was a "Corned Beef Hash" benny and WAY too many potatoes - Very little Corned Beef.  Other than that our food was delicious.  I had the 3 different Benny's on 1 plate and we shared the Banana's Foster French Toast.  That was all amazing.  

If you don't have time to kill, "waitlist" from your hotel while you walk to Ruby.  Very convenient!!!

This place so so worth every minute of the wait,so glad we made it here.And the best grits ive had in years.I feel sorry for the employees that had to deal with the a.. H..... that didn't have patience to even wait for there awsome ,and i mean awsome bloody mary drink And did i say how awesome the grits are.Thank You All

The wait is worth it. We waited 15-20 minutes for a late breakfast. Conveniently located just minutes from canal street and our hotel. My mom had the coffee and said its good. 

The French toast is made with real French bread - simply divine. The florentine omelet was light and fluffy. Service excellent and friendly.

I will come back later for a ruby slipper mimosa.
The wait was long but the food and service was good!  The "Southern Breakfast " was official!!! So delicious.  Pancakes so fluffy.   Orange juice was fresh!  Worth the wait.

Loved the Ruby Slipper! It is definitely worth the wait! Make sure you waitlist beforehand through the Yelp app to save yourself from standing in line. I had the Cochon Benedict and it was amazing! The bits of pulled pork are so yummy! Sat near the kitchen and watched as the dishes came out and everything looked delicious! Run don't walk (and arrive early) to the Ruby Slipper.

Worth the two hour wait. We went to the casino and rolled some dice while waiting for our table. You can also book ahead online but we didn't know that till we got there. Best breakfast I've ever had! We did the mix and match bennies and they were all amazing. Also split a praline pancake, yum! Excellent service and amazing food! 5 stars all the day.

The first morning I tried to go in the line was too long. So, came back another day since it had been recommended. Got there early on a Sunday morning and walked right up and ate at the bar. 

Friendly staff and good food. They had some red velvet pancakes that tempted me, but instead I built my own omelette that came with grits and a buttermilk biscuit (after the first one I ordered a second biscuit). 

Definitely recommend anyone visit and on my next trip I'll stop by again.

Great food and drinks! Fun vibe and nice service. Took a while for my food to come out, but everything else was so nice and I had time to spare so it wasn't a big deal. I was solo and was able to get right in and sit, groups were about a 45 min wait. Suggest using the Nowait app and getting inline before you actually get there.

I don't often five outa five stars . This place is great and I'm definitely coming back . I had a Bellini and the corned beef Bennie . Can't wait to try other items on the menu . I ate at the bar . Super nice and friendly bartenders.
Ruby slipper is my favorite local breakfast spot. I am hooked on the eggs benedict. This place is always busy but I never wait long for a table. Until next weekend.
French toast one of the best.  Great staff. Good prices. Large portions.
The food was ok. I had the shrimp Benedict and some grits. Service is slow but waiter was nice. I'm only giving it a 3 because roaches were crawling in the bathroom.
Best Breakfast in New Orleans.We made a reservation on Yelp and when we got there we were seated right away at the bar.Bartenders were very friendly.I had the salmon olmettee that was delicious.

The food here is great (I got the Catfish St. Peter) . Service was good for the most part. The mimosas are mediocre at best. They run out of food towards closing and the lines are long as hell so get there early if you can. Otherwise,  you will be waiting an hour or so to be seated.

This place is incredible.  The food is absolutely worth the hr and 15 min wait! Sat at the bar (though we weren't drinking) - good coffee, friendly service and the Peacemaker... whoa.   Got the fried chicken and shrimp with fried green tomatoes (don't remember their actual names). Both were unreal! Left fat and happy and feeling like tmrw average prices were more than fair.  Def going back!

Another delicious brunch place in NoLa, no surprise here. This chain is consistently delicious and we had some really good service this time around. The benedicts are no joke! A little on the pricey side for mimosas but you get what you pay for!

Omg!!! The southern breakfast is amazing!!! The buttermilk biscuit and grits are so good!! The story of how they got their name is on the menu. It's great!!! I cannot wait to go back again for breakfast before I leave town!!! The staff is super friendly and helpful!!! So much love for that place it's not even funny!

This place is okay.  I've definitely had better breakfast before, but it wasn't horrible.  Our server was very nice. I had a a build your own omelette with spinach, roasted red bell peppers, cheddar cheese, and ham.  The best thing about that was that the ham was cut into thick cubes.  The biscuit was well made, but not outstanding.  Overall, it wasn't horrible, but definitely not one of the best I've had.  Would I go back? Eh, probably not.

Loved this place. Customer service was great and the waiters had lots of NOLA charm. Based on their recommendation, I had the regular French Toast the first time I went and the shrimp and grits the second time. Both were really good and well-seasoned. The cheese grits were my favorite. Overall, a wonderful experience.
Everything was bland, the grits taste like famine and the fish was tasteless. The polenta cake was very good.

Short wait at 9 am (abt 10 min) but well worth it.  Hubby had the Spanish omelet with chorizo.   Mildly spiced.    I was undecided between the eggs cochon and corned beef Bennie.  The waitress suggested half of each.  What a great suggestion.  Both were absolutely delicious.   AND the best biscuits ever

This is the best brunch place in town! From the brunch items to the drinks and off course what's brunch without drinks. Everything was outstanding including the service. It's does get busy but it's definitely worth the wait.
Great breakfast food and strong cheap drinks! Excellent service and a great place for authentic southern cooking!

This was the best place we ate while in New Orleans/ Mississippi! Everything was amazing! Our waitress Nicole was soo friendly fast and accommodating. Our complicated orders were perfect and the wait was only 15min. If we had a longer wait it would have been worth it because it was just that good. Definitely must dine here if you are in the area!!!
Great food, Large portions. Worth the wait! Kool system they'll text you when your table is ready, that's a plus! Will definitely come back!
Great brunch, fast service and well worth the wait! We all tried something different and I must say not one person was disappointed.
The best Bloody Mary's! Everything on their menu is delicious....Very large portions. The Cochon Eggs are my favorite.

What a great breakfast! Ive never been a fan of grits but the ruby slipper has made me turn around. The shrimp and grits were fantastic and the bisquit that came with it was to die for. My wife likes her pancakes a bit more on the crunchy side so she didnt quite finish her pale pancakes, but i had no complaints about them.

Good food and very good space. Our waitress was pleasant and quick. Easy walk from any of the downtown hotels. 

I had the shrimp and grits and they were pretty good. The others had the migas (very good) and the banana nut pancakes (very good). 

I'll be back.

Get Nowait app & sign in before you go....loooong wait! Go here for breakfast every time we visit N.O. (After we hit Red Gravy - #1 breakfast spot - get the Polpetta!). Ruby Slipper is a much more hip environment with much better waiters! Michelle rocks. Had the fried chicken Benedict....very good. Mimosas are The best....filled to the rim of a huge red wine glass. My husband got the breakfast sandwich (has candied bacon)...was good too. Got a short stack of daily special pancakes - cinnamon roll pancakes. Pass on these....go for cream cheese stuffed French toast. Had these before and they are awesome! Will be back next time we are in town!

During our extended stay in NOLA we've been here 4/5 times, each time we leave wanting more (well maybe not right away, we're usually stuffed to gills!). 

The cocktails are great, LOVE the mimosas! 

Food - Our favorite has to be eggs cochon. If you love the sweeter side of things you have to try bananas pan per du and I recently had a special of root beer creme brulee stuffed french toast - woah! 

Service is always great, we love sitting at the bar! We usually have to wait 30minutes to 1 hour but it's totally worth it - trust me, I'm the last person to spend a hour waiting to get into a restaurant.

Delicious my husband and I were very pleased about the experience we had. It was absolutely delicious.they were very nice and friendly and funny. The best hot chocolate and whipped cream I've ever had. We had banana foster and eggs blackstone
This place is amazing.  The food was great of course there is a long wait however, it is worth it. The service was timely and delivered with a pleasant demeanor.

Great experience! The food was delicious, the atmosphere was great! They told us it would be a 1 hour wait, but we only waited 30 mins. Totally worth the wait. We had the St. Charles Chicken and the Banana Fosters French Toast!  Would go back for another meal!

Loved this place. Was by myself, friendly waitress let me sit at the bar. How cool is that! There are many many good restaurants in French Quarter, though the wait line discouraged me. 
I had an excellent breakfast and coffee sitting away and above from  rest of the tables. Cool!

If I could give this place 6 stars I would.  I ate here every morning for the week I was in New Orleans. The wait staff is super friendly and I'm not sure which Benedict was the best as they were all excellent.

Came here for a late lunch and was quite impressed. Although there were a lot of people waiting, they told us the wait was only about 15 minutes, which wasn't underestimated like many other restaurants. Once we were in, the staff was very kind and helpful. I got Migas, my friends got the Shrimp & Grits and the Chicken St. Charles. The Migas was tastefully spicy and quite flavorful. I would've licked the plate if I could. Shrimp & Grits were good, nothing noteworthy though. The Chicken St. Charles had deliciously crunchy and moist chicken, but the eggs benedict which was completely overcooked, the yolk was hardly runny. We also had a double mimosa and bloody mary. Their bloody mary will surely give you kick.
Great good and and great place to go have some good breakfast. I recommend the bananas foster French toast.  It was delicious and you won't be let down.
Very good Bloody Mary's.  The rest of our brunch was also very good.  3 of us had the Migas and they were wonderful.  The sauce is divine.

You have to try this place!  There will be a wait even with the no wait app, but you have to try this place.  I highly recommend the St. Charles Chicken.  I was very pleased that they were able to make one with an overhard egg because I was pregnant.  Eventhough it was overhard, the dish was delicious as if it was made to be served like that.

Also, get the Bananas Foster Pain Perdu w/ candied bacon: add the candied bacon bc it has to be one of, if not, the best bacon I've ever had.  Only down side is the bread was difficult to cut into as my husband said it's almost like he needed a steak knife.

Our server, Devin, was awesome! He was great at making recommendations and making conversation without being awkward.  Food came out timely even when busy.

This was a good brunch, but we're not the only ones who think so, since it was a 50-minute wait to get a table for two on a Friday morning.

It's a Goldilocks and the Three Bears kind of place.

Too sweet:  The Bananas Foster Pain Perdu dish was good, but thank goodness it came with a side of bacon to tame just how super, super, SUPER sweet it was.

Too salty:  The Three Little Piggies omelet was good, though a tad on the salty side.

JUST RIGHT:  The Eggs Cochon dish is the house specialty, and it was greater than the sum of its parts. Individually, the poached egg, hollandaise sauce, pulled pork and southern biscuit are good.  Together, however,  the ingredients combine to provide the perfect bite and mouth feel.  It was love in my mouth.

The place is super loud, so you'll have to shout to be heard by your dining companions, and the service was inattentive because the place was just packed to the gills.

I'm glad we ate here, but I'm still on the fence about whether it was worth giving up almost an hour of the day.
Oh wow this food is excellent and so is the staff! Helpful and friendly. It's a must stop for brunch or breakfast.

They were pretty attentive to our request. Our server gave us extra attention.  I had the eggs cochon. It is really good,had shredded pork on it .With extra side of slice plantains.  Great place for breakfast.

Try the pancake specials - there is always a decadent choice such as double chocolate chocolate chip pancakes, snickers bars pancakes or bananas foster pancakes. I also love the biscuits - they are almost a meal alone! I'm giving 4 stars instead of 5 because it would be so easy for some of their dishes to be made without meat and if only that option would be available, it would really expand the menu for vegetarians or those who avoid pork. Do go there! The food is delicious and the wait staff are so nice!
I enjoyed the food it was really good. It is worth the wait. Id go again.  The staff was friendly and accommodating. The atmosphere was really nice.

Two stars only because of the service. I don't see why there is always a line of people waiting here. The food was underwhelming.  I ordered the eggs black stone with grits and he got the same with fruit. Our waitress told us they were out of the biscuits that it normally comes on (though I saw plenty of people on our way out with biscuits....) so I had to settle for sourdough. It took awhile for us to get our food, but our waitress did tell us that the kitchen was backed up, so we weren't left wondering. When it did arrive, it was cold and the bread was already soggy. We both ended up with grits even though he should have had fruit. The manager was nice enough to comp one meal and was very apologetic, but we had been waiting long enough and were on a schedule so we didn't have time or really even want to wait to get something different. Maybe we were just the unlucky table that day, but not worth the wait in my opinion.
Just tried this place for the first time and the shrimp boogaloo and Chocon were awesome. Combined with great service it rates 5 stars. I highly recommend this place.

This place was soooo good! We used the yelp app to put our names on the waiting list, so we didn't have to wait at the restaurant. When we got there we still had to wait briefly, but we were able to order a drink until our table was ready. Try the fish, shrimp, and grit cake entree. You won't be disappointed !

We stopped here for lunch and had breakfast.  The bananas foster was to die for. We also had the Ruby Sunrise and their special Bloody Mary. Put this on your must-do list. Ask for Jay Acus. He provided outstanding service and was very helpful and responsive.

The first time we went here the line was long, long, long. Always a good sign in ann area where there are many choices. So we ended up passing on it that day.
Mid week we tried again. While it was still quite full we got a table in quick order. The wait was reasonable, the waitress personable, and the food delicious. Someone joined us midway thru our meal and the waitress had a menu sitting waiting for her. She was also served quickly even though the place now had a short wait at the door.

If I'm in town... Don't go there.
I want a table!

The food here was absolutely delicious and the staff was very kind and attentive. Even when the place was packed full the kitchen produced quality food at a very reasonable pace. 

During a 5 day trip to New Orleans we ate at the Ruby Slipper a total of 3 times for breakfast because of how much we enjoyed it. I had the Eggs Cochon (house specialty), Eggs Blackstone, and an order of the Banana Pecan pancakes. All three were delicious however the Eggs Cochon was by far the best. Highly recommend it.

The 3 other people I was with all enjoyed every single one of their meals here and if we ever end up in NOLA again we will definitely return to the Ruby Slipper.

Thanks to a local for recommending The Ruby Slipper to my husband on his flight to NOLA. I had already been in town for 3 days and hadn't noticed the sweet little café right around the corner from our hotel (just off Canal).

First, let me say that all the food we had during our visit to New Orleans was superb. We had delicious fish, Cajun, pasta, steak (and that's saying a lot coming from an Iowan), and of course beignets. The two meals we had at Ruby Slipper were bar none the best of our entire visit.

Details:

The wait:

The line for a table appeared to be long each morning (we could see the front of the restaurant from our hotel room). We waited for the line to die down each morning, and visited around 11:30 on a Sunday and 10:30 on a Monday morning. We got right in on Sunday and waited about 10 minutes on Monday.

The service:

Good on our fist visit and fantastic on our second. Our fist server was attentive and our order was correct on our first visit. The server on our second visit was personable and proactive (my coffee cup was always full--my #1 priority). 

The food:

The real star of the show. Between our two visits, we tried the sliders, French toast, breakfast sandwich, and an eggs/grits/bacon breakfast. It was seemed to be "normal" food...we should be able to get an equivalent meal somewhere else, but it wasn't normal. It was delightful. The bacon, for example, was maple-y and cooked to perfection (again, we live in Iowa, home to Baconfest, so us raving about bacon is not to be taken lightly). The French toast was warm and melted in my mouth goodness, and everything else was just magical. 

Drinks:

The coffee was great diner-style coffee, and I also had a mimosa, which was strong and had what seemed to be fresh squeezed OF. 

The cost:

Affordable! Each plate was about $10, making our meals not only the best of our visit to NOLA but also the most budget-friendly.

Be sure to visit The Ruby Slipper next time you are in town.
Fantastic breakfast food right downtown, but be prepared to wait.......it took about 20 minutes for us to get in, but super fast service and great food.

I had two phenomenal breakfasts here. I ordered the Chicken St. Charles the first time and was over the moon. We also let the server know that one of us had work in an hour and she brought our food with plenty of time to spare AND with a smile on her face. I wish I knew her name so I could post it here. She was a rockstar.

On our second visit, during Sunday brunch, I got the Eggs Blackstone and a lovely double mimosa. The double bellini was well-received at my table as well. Our visit was very different on a busy Sunday because of our wait time, but the service and food was consistent.

When I return to NOLA, I will definitely be stopping here.

One of the best brunches ever! Waited about 45 for table for 2, but definitely worth the wait. Service was a little slow, but you have to expected it if the restaurant is slammed. Wifey had Bananas Foster French Toast and I had the Chicken St. Charles Eggs Benedict. Seriously amazing! Everything about my dish worked and was perfect. You have not lived if you have not had breakfast here! We'll visit again next time we are in town!

Good morning and Happy Sunday! I had the pleasure of dining at the Ruby Slipper Cafe in New Orleans last week. It was an amazing food experience with outstanding service. I enjoyed the Bam Bam Biscuit with Fried Green Tomatoes and Pig Candied Bacon and A Runny Egg. OMG It Was Everything! I highly recommend trying the Pulled Pork and Hash Benedict! #itsgonbedope #eatingwithchefsean @chefseanandre @therubyslippercafe
Oh. My. Goodness. Two words, "The Peacemaker". Get chicken and corned beef and thank me later.

We waited about an hour and a half which was what we were expecting and not a problem. I ordered the peacemaker - got half salmon and have pork Benny. It was absolutely delicious. The service however was mediocre. Bloodys were strong which is a plus. I recommend "claiming your place in line" through the Yelp app beforehand.
Came on a Saturday morning. Got there early before crowd. Were seated outside. Food was good, coffee was great. Good, local option while in town.

While the "tourist trap" comments may be valid, the food in the trap is worthy of ensnarement.  The mimosas will also ease your pain.  I recommend you download the Nowait app and check in before arriving.  My wait was 1-2 minutes once onsite.  Try it out!
This hands down my favorite breakfast spot. They have the best Southern breakfast is the city. Eggs are cooked perfect, bacon crisp, grits are stone ground, pancakes are fluffy and crisp!
Had the Eggs Blackstone and was extremely impressed. Great restaurant and worth the 40 minute wait. Great service as well!

This place came highly recommended, so I was excited to try it my first morning in NOLA. We got there just before the big breakfast rush (about 9am) on a Tuesday morning, so we didn't have to wait. Our server was awesome, very helpful at recommending items on the menu, etc. My fiancé and I both ordered one of the specialty items (variations on eggs benedict), his with salmon and mine with brisket. He loved his, I liked mine. The homemade biscuits were AMAZING. However, the brisket wasn't hot, and one of the eggs was over cooked. Still damn delicious, but not quite 5 stars for me. I'd definitely go back and try some more!
Good food, fast service, worth the wait!  Definitely use the yelp app to put yourself on the waitlist.  We were seated in less time than the app claimed.

I unfortunately did not have the pleasure of eating at this restaurant because the line was so horribly long and I was only a party of two.  The hostess was only seating large parties of four or more I suspect to maximize ticket sells. After waiting 45 minutes and witnessing only large parties being sat I left. I wouldn't eat a an establishment like this even if the food is said to be great. I understand businesses are in the businesses to make money but first come first serve should be business sense 101.
Great breakfast of bbq shrimp grits, a side of bacon, OJ and coffee. Hit the spot!
We had the Banana foster french toast and the corn beef hash with eggs for breakfast. It was delicious! Fast service! Great breakfast place!!

This is an absolutely adorable place to eat breakfast with delicious food and drink- worth the wait! The wait definitely gets longer as the day goes on, so if you can get there earlier in the morning, you're better off. I also recommend adding your name to the waitlist on yelp on your way there to cut down on wait time. My sister and I sat at the bar and the bartender was very helpful and friendly. I got a peach Bellini and she got a Boozy Iced Coffee which were both great. I got the Migas and she got a Bacon and Cheese omelet and both were delicious and the perfect sized-portion. This is such a great breakfast spot and definitely worth stopping at, even despite the sometimes-long wait.

French toast and banana pecan pancakes tasted good bit the food was only luke  warm at best. Even the people sitting next to us commented that their food was not very warm. Maybe the staff was recovering from Mardi Gras.

Amazing place. So fun. Bloody Mary's are spicy but really good
Selections are awesome. Many are Fattening but come on it is New Orleans.
The best meal I've had in a long time. Prepare to wait about an hour but if you check yourself in Prior to arrival it's not so bad. My group got the pork Benedict and pancakes and it was amazing.

Right across from our hotel. Huge crowd trying to get in every morning we were there. We found out why after we ate there. The food was great and their bloody marys may have saved us. 

Don't be scared of the big line. Put your name in and they will text you when your table is ready. You don't have to linger. The service they use for this has an iphone app too and it will tell you where you are at in line.

Great breakfast, but you have to get there early or be forced to park that booty on the curb. The wait is long, and I am not a patient person. Stayed at the Pelham Hotel right next door and every morning we saw a bunch of people gathered on the corner waiting. Our last morning there we decided to wake up early and try it. We just had bacon, eggs and biscuits. Good stuff. The biscuits are awesome. They've got some pretty decadent dishes that look amazing, but after 4 days of eating in NOLA I couldn't justify it. Definitely worth checking out, especially if you don't mind waiting.

Service was quick. Long lines . Big portions . Catfish and grits was crispy and well seasoned  not fishy . The fish and shrimp trio was great with spinach. The French toast with rum and banana sauce was very good, very flavorful . 3 larger portions of French bread. Irish coffee was delicious . Mimosa was just ok

Nice location by our hotel, St. James. Hopping place with plenty of seating. Good coffee.  My wife did care for the breakfast but it is tolerable. Bacon and grits were good. The biscuit was dry and hard, needs work. The atmosphere and service overrode those minor issues.

I travel to NOLA a few times a year for work. This is my go to spot for breakfast. The key is to get there before 8am, after that you are probably in for a wait.

The food is pretty standard New Orleans breakfast stuff. Grits, eggs, etc. All of it is executed well. The challenge is finding something a bit lighter, but that is true of most places here. The one negative: their biscuits leave a lot to be desired. 

I definitely recommend Ruby Slipper!
This place is amazing! The food is all freshly prepared and cooked to order PERFECTLY. All of the staff including Devin were the best! Definitely coming back.

Went to this restaurant on a Tuesday around 10:00 am. Was seated right away, no wait. There was a good number of people in the restaurant and our server Justin L. Came over right away and took our drink order. I must say he was very nice and pleasant!!! The menu has a lot of pork and being that I don't eat it I had to search but actually found something. I ordered the Louisiana omelette which in itself was actually light. It had cheese and shrimp, but came with a huge biscuit and my choice of grits. Would definitely recommend for a "southern" breakfast.

Great spot for breakfast/brunch away from the madness of bourbon street and the French quarters. The Chicken St Charles was excellent!!! Maybe the best brunch meal I've ever eaten. Definitely worth a stop when you're in the area. Also a few steps away from the Sheraton, which was a huge plus...

Visited during an off season.
30 minute wait for breakfast, which I belief is typical for a place that keep the mimosa and bloody Mary's movin!

Mingas breakfast was delicious! 

Suggestion ---- order off the speciality menu.

Absolutely delicious breakfast and service. We stayed in the Warehouse District, signed up for the waitlist online and only had to wait for our table once we arrived for about 5-10 minutes. I got the Peacemaker, with the eggs black stone and the chicken st. Charles. I also got a side of grits with goat cheese (my favorite!) we had a great time and would definitely return!

The best breakfast in New Orleans. Yummy. Dont miss it. Great service. Don't sleep in. They open at 7:00 and close at 2:00. After about 8:00 there will be a line. Try the praline pancakes, the shrimp omelet or the French toast. Delicious

this was our 2nd visit to this location, we came here last year as well. We loved the food, but not the service last time, but this time we came again for the food and got the service as well!!! The ambiance is great, the food is delicious and it is always packed!! We sat at the bar, which was nice, but they have no order for that so we got beat to a seat once, so I was like eying people at the bar to ensure I got next available. It was kinda strange of me, but I was hungry... Next year when we go I will have to try the fried green tomato's!! I recommend this place for sure!

The food was so good. I waited 20 minutes for my food but it was worth it. 

Came back again and it was even better. The service was great and the food came pretty quickly. Would recommend using the nowait app to see how busy the restaurant is.

Stopped here while on vacation for brunch due to the immense amount of awesome reviews and needless to say we were not disappointed! For how busy this place gets the food comes out fast and is amazing! I recommend checking in using Yelp, first time I used this feature and it was super convenient. We saved our place in line while at the hotel and there were 40 parties ahead of us, kept track of the time and Yelp tracker, headed over and got right in!

Literally as good as it gets. This was, without a single doubt in my mind, the hardest breakfast decision I've ever had to make while staring at a menu. Good thing we went back more than once. The first morning we stopped in I got the Eggs Cochon, which was one of the recommendations from our waitress and it was phenomenal. Everyone was more than pleased with their meals and we had to stop in one more time the morning we left. We practically had to be rolled onto the plane.

Note: This place fills up fast and even though there are multiple locations. Call ahead and find out the wait. My bit of advice: Go early. It's worth it.

The peacemaker wins! Two types of eggs Benny? Yes please! I ordered the cochon and chicken st. charles... loved the cochon, chicken was OKAY. Next time would get the cochon and corned beef hash bennies. Great coffee too, and friendly staff.
Grab a great spicy Bloody Mary or Irish Coffe (with whiskey, it will pack a punch to start your day) while you wait.  Food and service is incredible and portions large!
Not really worth all the hype..tried the gingerbread pancake but it was nothing over the top

We ate here three times during our stay in NOLA. The food was great every time the service was good most of the time but not perfect. Overall I would definitely eat here again. I liked the Eggs Cochon and hubby liked the southern breakfast. Very tasty.
Spoiler Alert: The rumors are TRUE... this place is great and I will return. Great service and better food.

After leaving the first day because of a long wait time, it made it worth the second attempt! Food was great as well as the server. Jake was behind the bar and he was very friendly. The manager also took the time to have a conversation with us and recommend other eateries around the city. Awesome place!
Had breakfast there. Great service. Great personnel. Thanks Rachael. The food was wonderful. Definitely will return.

The bacon-infused vodka Bloody Mary is amazing and reasonably priced. The food was fine. I think my croque madame would've been much better if it was warmer, but the service was great, even on a busy morning. The place is pretty loud so don't go expecting quiet conversation, but it's a nice atmosphere.
Wait time is HORRIBLE! Almost 2hrs! Plenty more great restaurants around but have to try out their food but they were alright...

It doesn't hurt that New Orleans is one of my favorite places in the world.  Also, i love breakfast.  This place wonderfully combines my love of breakfast, with the kick of New Orlean's southern cooking and a great breakfast drink list.  I've been there both of the last 2 times I have been to NOLA and plan to go again!

One of our favorite brunches. Amazingly long line but worth the wait. We ordered the stuffed french toast, eggs cochon, and breakfast sandwich. All great! They had some drama with an employee while there which wasn't cool but you can't control everything. Our waiter was friendly and helpful so we left happy. I wish they would control the chaos while waiting a little better but the food makes it worth it. I'd def go back!

One word - YUM! Perfect breakfast/brunch spot.  We had the Chicken St. Charles and the Croque Madame.  Both were delicious! The chicken was crispy and moist but it was the tasso cream sauce that made the dish! DIVINE! The challah bread on the croque madame was perfection and the portion was huge. Great place to go in the morning after a night out on Bourbon St!

We randomly found this restaurant and there was a line in front of the door so we assumed it's a good restaurant, but it was just ok. nothing especial about their food. there were lots of coffee ground in my not warm enough coffee and when I asked for refill, I asked for new mug. the new coffee was a little bit warmer but again lots of coffee ground in it.
Madame Sub was ok and the Cochon Benedict was just fine. I didn't find it as exciting as many other places that you can eat in NOLA.

I went on Sunday for brunch, and I thought it was great.  There was about a 20 minute wait, but I expected to wait a bit at that time of the week.  The food was great, but the service was a little slow.  They had a nice selection of both breakfast and lunch foods on their brunch menu.

My wife and I ate there a month ago, so this review will be slightly brief. 
Every now and again, you find a place that has a 5-Star Yelp review, and it's actually correct. This is one of those places. First, they have an online wait list that tells you the time they think you'll be seated, which was super handy, as the last thing I want to do is hang out in a restaurant foyer waiting for my table. So the app told us it was a 46 minute wait, and we waited a good half hour before heading over there. My goodness, there were 100 or 150 people in front, waiting for their table. This place must be something. 
It is.
Because it's New Orleans, you can get an alcoholic beverage right on the street in a to-go cup, so they had a person getting people cocktails. I had the Bloody Mary with bacon-infused vodka. Yes, bacon-infused vodka. It was as spectacular as you would imagine. 
We sat at the bar when we were called, exactly at the time quoted. I don't know what kind of magic that online wait list works on, but it's something special. The bartender was super friendly, and gave us huge mugs of coffee. My wife ordered the shrimp and grits, and I had the Migas. The shrimp and grits were simply to die for. There was tremendous seafood flavor in the grits, and the shrimp were enormous, yet tender. The dish comes with a biscuit and some kind of sugar/honey butter. Fabulous. If you're hung over, this is the dish to eat (we were). 
As for the Migas, I thought they were okay - not really a composed dish, rather it was a bunch of stuff I like that I had to kind of put together myself. I ordered wrong. I should have had one of their signature Benedicts, which my neighbor had. It looked like a work of art. Oh well, I guess I'll try one next time.
Loved this place. Great selection of ordinary & extraordinary breakfast. Iced coffee is yummy. Nice wait staff. Generally a wait. But worth it.

Late start to our day,  as we didn't leave our hotel until almost 1pm. So we checked Yelp to see what to eat for brunch, and boy am I happy we came here! Food was sooo yummy, I wanted to go right back to my hotel and crash afterwards lol
We got the French toast sticks, pancakes and bacon, and the chicken st. Charles...all highly recommended!!

Ok this was a great choice for breakfast in our last day. However, I'm a breakfast man and I have high expectations of breakfast because really how can you screw up eggs. Two thing 1) the biscuits were hard 2) the stone ground grits were cold. The staff was fantastic and the southern hospitality I've experienced here NOLA has been unbelievable!!!
Really exceptional breakfast. My son has the St Charles Chicken Benedict and I had the Costa Rican. We both enjoyed our meal and we'll make a point of coming back if we're ever in New Orleans again.

Best breakfast on our 4 day NOLA visit.

I've never tried fried green tomatoes. I just had one since I'm always calorie conscious without the sauce. Absolutely delicious. On the Southern Breakfast.  Yes.

Biscuit crispy outside; light fluffy inside as a biscuit ought to be.

Eggs, bacon,  catfish another friend had the friend catfish/grits/gravy and biscuit grits all perfect. Everyone liked their choice best.

I had fruit instead of potatoes.  Mehh...not their strong suit. 

My friend got the mimosas instead of the fruit. Smart girl.

The food here is so incredible!! The drum fish with cheesy grit cake and shrimp is probably the absolute best thing on the menu! I can't get enough of this place! Check out the Ruby Slipper Mimosa with your breakfast and the crab Benedict also!

I stopped by and ordered bananas foster pan perdu to take out and it's supposed to come with bacon. When I got back to the hotel it didn't have the bacon:(.  Although disappointed the reason I gave 4 stars was that the bartender that took my order was friendly and patient.The bananas foster pan Perdu was not too sweet and I love the sauce.
First time customer and was referred by locals. Awesome food that I will visit next trip to NOLA. Price affordable for a family.

Yum!  Absolutely delicious food and awesome service!  The Bellini and mimosa my husband and I got were awesome.  I would highly recommend the BL2T!!  So so good!  Check in on no wait and save yourself the time.  It was so nice to be able to walk by the huge line outside.
Amazing food! The food, drinks, and service were amazing! The staff was super friendly - Veronica & Tim were great! Highly recommend the eggs benedict with pork!!
Ummmm not so much. Long wait totally not worth it. Poached eggs overcooked. Impossible to get the waitress to fill our coffee. Loud and very limited ambience. Feels like a tourist trap. Avoid.
Delicious! We went in for breakfast, at first i was a bit uncomfortable with sharing our table with another group. Everything on menu is wonderful.

Great food, great service. Definitely worth the wait. As you wait they come around for drinks and coffee. And they use yelps waitlist, so you can wait in line as you walk the city. Highly recommend trying one of the peacemakers egg benedict's.

Online waitlist is very helpful - this place had a long line when we arrived! There was a waitress to handle drink orders for the people waiting outside which was a nice touch. Line moved quickly, but the hostesses clearly hated what they were doing and were mocking people's names, which was distracting during the wait outside. 

Food was amazing. Stuffed french toast was delicious. Corned beef hash side was AMAZING. My boyfriend got the Louisiana omelette and enjoyed it. Prompt service from friendly waitstaff - Shanna was friendly and wonderful. Great experience. So glad we came!

The reservation person was not honest about the wait time for our party. We wasted 37 minutes waiting to eat, and we have two diabetics and a prior engagement we could not miss. After inquiring with her several times since yelp showed as we should have been called next. The person seating people finally read the monitor and told us the proper wait time. There was an additional 15 min wait. This is after we even asked the party to be split to accommodate. Being honest never hurt anyone, especially in a business. This review is most likely going to help those with health issues and those in a large party. Don't go if you are larger than a 1-4 crowd, you'll just waste your time.

Yummy!!! Be prepared to wait but there is a good reason.. Food is good, heavier than what I'm use to but what can I expect I'm in the south, home of grease! The lattes are very, very tasty.  Only reason why it's not 5 stars is because I got a tomato with a gross core and I wish there was more attention to detail, plus people were taking pics of my baby without asking so it made for a bit of a strange experience.. Still super yummy and the mozzarella is very good!!

Alright so this place is hard to go to seeing as it closes at like 2 or 3 everyday-  being in a city with open container laws and bars that never close will make you nocturnal realllllllllll quick ;)

So set your alarms and crawl over here to ride the wave with bananas foster french toast and ruby mimosas.  The omelets are fan-freaking-tanstic as well.  DELICIOUS delicious brunch!

Came here early to beat the rush at about 8 am and we were promptly seated at the bar. Ordered the mimosas which were large and strong. My friend and I shared two entrees. Definently would recommend the Cochon! I am not a big eggs Benedict fan but this was amazing. It comes on a flaky biscuit instead of English muffin and had pulled pork on top and the perfect amount of hollandaise sauce. We also ordered bananas foster French toast which comes in a ginormous serving. This will be sure to satisfy your sweet cravings. The bread was buttery and rich brioche smothered in syrup. Service was friendly and fast and the people we met at the bar were friendly as well. Definently worth a visit if you are looking for a solid brunch in a casual diner style restaurant.

Assuming day after Xmas accounted for the quick seating and service, as it seems this place is typically very crowded. Ordered the St. Charles chicken. I would go out on a limb and say it was one of the best breakfasts I've had. Staff was friendly, and place has a nice laid back vibe. The visit to Ruby Slipper got our trip to N.O. off on the right foot.

This was one of the best breakfasts I've had in NOLA, really delicious and a lot of options to fill your belly.

The biscuits are rich and light at the same time and a great base for the variety of benedicts.

I had the Benny corned beef hash and the pulled pork versions and both were delicious. I would have given them 5 stars but my husbands breakfast came slightly cold and was missing sauce but despite that every bite was yummy.

The bacon vodka Bloody Mary didn't hurt either, those pickled green beans were my favorite!

Loved this place, food was really good, our waitress Arielle was very friendly and personable! She made the experience so much better! The only thing I would say is the cups used for the mimosa should be replaced at some point, they look like they have been around for about 5 to 10. Other than that everything was good, drinks strong enough and food hott!
I wasn't overly impressed with the food, but the service was great. The place seemed to be packed all the time, so maybe we were expecting something more.

Migas was the best breakfast meal I had in New Orleans. The eggs scramble was so good. We were a little oversold on the Eggs Cochon (maybe not into pulled pork in the mornings?). Cute bright and clean on the inside. Our server was great. There was about 30-45 minute wait in the morning.

First impression...The wait time is both insane and awful!!!!! I used the NoWait app on yelp to check in and IT STILL took forever.  

Front desk ladies: AWFUL, RUDE, AND HAD THE WORST ATTITUDE.  Not HELPFUL OR WELCOMING AT ALL.

FOOD: I had tried at least ten other restaurants around the area and this was by far - not the best.  I ordered the croque madame. I had eaten one the day before at another restaurant so I decided try it here. There was so much meat, I lost the flavor of everything else that usually made it a pleasant combination. The ham was too sweet and it made the bread sooooooo soggy I sent it back. (The waitress had to ask for permission... Ridiculous..if a customer isn't happy you should respect their wish within reason).  I requested to order the combination Benedict, AFTER the manager approved of course.  That was a lot better, but nothing special about it. 
In all, I checked this place off my list.  Would I come here again??? Probably not.  
If you're like me and want to try this place, go to the one on canal st. Maybe you'll get better service at least.  The wait time was not as crazy... The food was not WORTH THE WAIT!!!

I do not understand the hype here.  The hosts here hate their job, understandably so. The waitlist app is really helpful and really does considerably shorten your wait.  Server was friendly.  The food was just ok. Bananas foster pain Perdue was inedibly sweet with overly mushy spots and also dry hard spots. Limp, sad bacon to accompany. The Migas egg scramble was good but nothing special.

Terrific brunch if you want flavorless food. We had a rather large party and were told we'd be seated in under an hour. Two hours later I had been asking every fifteen minutes for an update and had been told any minute now. We didn't want to give up and go somewhere else just to start our wait over. Finally after over two hours waiting we were seated at a table that only fit most of us so two of our party had to stand near us waiting for seats to open up. We all ordered immediately and asked for anything he could bring to help those of us near fainting like maybe bring us a biscuit? Never happened. Most of our meals were completely flavorless and when I mentioned this I had to suggest to our waiter that he take it off the bill. I also suggested doing something else for us to make up for this awful experience but nothing else was taken off the bill. It's the first time in my life I paid only what I owed and left zero tip. Terrible experience. I don't know what others on here are tasting.

So, to say the very least - The FOOD was absolutely, freaking AMAZING!!!!  I believe that timing is everything with this place; I understand that the wait can be a BEAST some days - however my party, I believe just lucked up and our wait was only 10 minutes.  At any rate, I'd definitely wait though - This was probably the very best brunch/breakfast food I've had in a very long time.  AMAZING!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!

The food was delicious and filling. Friendly staff all around. Travis was awesome! It's definitely worth the short walk from the French Quarter and the short wait. Don't miss this gem when you are in town.
Very good food here! I would definitely go back. There is normally a wait but if you get the NoWait app you can check in before you get there!

I went in with high expectations.  The Canal Street location was closed due to weather so this location was packed.  I sat at the bar.  Food took 40 minutes to come out and it was cold as if it had sat for a while after it was cooked.  The server behind the bar was very nice and doing her best.  The food tasted good but would have been so much better warm.  Coffee was delicious and super hot on a frigid day.

If you go here you have to get some of their elaborate plates. I was with a group of people and we ordered different things. Honestly, the best thing on their menu are their benedicts. Pancakes and french toast are good, but not mind blowing; I've had better. Their coffee is phenomenal since they use French Truck Coffee (a personal favorite). 

I really suggest using the yelp app to put your name on the waiting list so that you don't have to wait for 1+ hours. Also, be prepared because when I went they warned us it was taking 30-40 min to prep food orders and they were out some of their menu items.

Just not worth the wait/time... Sad because it's a hit or miss on each location. I do t believe in trying one time and deciding anything so I'll try once more tho this is my 2 time on canal && 3 on magazine

Ordered the BBQ shrimp and grits and the itis hit instantly. Cheese biscuits were bomb! Service was great even it was packed which was refreshing! Nice place to eat but way to noises to sit and chit chat! I would go again! Highly recommended.

I haven't been to visit their new Magazine Street location in person yet, so I can't speak to the service, decor or atmosphere, but my boyfriend brought me home a surprise treat the other morning - Bananas Foster French Toast and a taste of his BBQ Shrimp & Grits. Holy cow, was that good! (I do wish he had brought a second whole serving of the shrimp & grits though - he should know by now that's one of my food weaknesses.)

The food and drinks were amazing, but the wait is long and the service can be a bit slow.  
I think it's a little too pricey and crowded for me to start the day off with breakfast and brunch.
Lots of fun, cheap drinks, and dog friendly outdoors! Had a great time, recommend their awesome brunch, available all week. Although, wait times can be quite long on weekends.

Ugh... Disappointed... I so wanted to love this place. I went after church and was excited I was put on the waitlist by Yelp. I arrived and I had a seat at the bar in 5 minutes. I ordered a mimosa and took the bartenders suggestion and ordered 2 different eggs Benedict. The chicken and pulled pork with sauce on the side and a side of grits. The food was lackluster... and I don't think it was because I hyped it up too much. Actually I didn't have dinner the night before so I was Hungry! It just wasn't great! I mean for all the great reviews on Yelp I was expecting Awesome food! I got mediocre food. I mean it wasn't bad, but it wasn't great. The service was great! The food not so much. If your in the area check out the Ruby Slipper but try something else on the menu.

Talk about an amazing brunch!

I've tried dining once before on a weekend but it was insanely packed, with a line outside the door. Ended up not going that day, but seeing the line convinced me it had to be worth trying. So I tried again on a Monday afternoon and was seated almost immediately.

Highly recommend the eggs benedict, and wash it down with one of their amazing bloody marys. Service is great, everyone's friendly and the food comes out fast. Would definitely recommend!

Late review here.  But better late than never.  
This place is worth the wait!  Wait was roughly 30mins but we were updated often and we're seeing customers being seated so we knew we weren't being missed to be seated.  

Anywho about the food... I can't believe how awesome the food is here. After we got our table, waiter got our order and food came.  Small portions? No! Breakfast bites? No! I couldn't believe how tasty and great the food were.  Price was reasonable and service was exceptional given that this place was so busy. 

I'd definitely return again if ever in Nola.

Delicious. Pay attention to your host/hostess, or there will be issues when they say "We called you!" You can also opt for a text, which we also didn't get. Or you can just get in line and have a drink while you wait. 

Wanted everything on the menu. The Chicken St Charles (enough for two) and the Southern Breakfast were delicious and the cold brew coffee very good. Biscuits are enormous but light and fluffy. Fried green tomatoes outstanding. 

Our wait staff were quite competent and personable. There's probably never a slow time at this place, but if you don't like noise, try to go at off-peak hours.

All Ruby Slipper establishments get extra karma points for their socially-responsible policies on feeding hurricane-displaced people.

Great breakfast spot. We came here twice during our 4 day stay in NOLA. The first time we waited about 15 minutes outside in the windy cold rain with the other patrons. The hostess wouldn't let us wait inside because she said then everyone would want to wait inside. Uhhh yeah... It's freakin cold out here. But anywho... The bf ordered the shrimp and grits at the recommendation of a Yelper. Big disappointment. Tasted very shrimpy and flavorless. He also got the Three Little Pigs omelette which he raved about. A lot of meat and a lot of flavor. I got the Bananas Foster which was good, but nothing special. We also ordered mimosas. Our waitress brought us our bill in the middle of our meal which we felt was like a "hurry up and get outta here" move.

We came again because the boyfriend wanted the best omelette he's ever had. We came earlier, so there was no wait and less busy. The hostess remembered us. And we got the same waitress who remembered us too. Sadly, the omelette was not as great as the first time. Not as tasty and less meat. So his quest for the best continues. I got the CBH Benedict which was good. Though I've never had CBH in chunks instead of more mashy like. The waitress again brought us the bill in the middle of the meal so I don't know if that's just what they do there or what. 

Decent breakfast spot away from the French Quarter.

Avoid the magazine location. Breakfast was average at best. Service specific to us was terrible. Took 30 mins for our order for 2 adults, 2 kids to arrive, as we watched others order after us, receive & finish theirs. When our coffee came, creamer was empty & took another 15 min of us waving down waitress to fill. No apology what so ever for anything. She really didn't care she was doing such a bad job (didnt get her name but she was the thin brunette). Manager never once asked us how we were doing, just walked around "looking" busy. Not sure why we had such bad service but did want to let others know our experience.
It took 15 minutes longer than quoted (35 mins) to get a table, and even then was almost 10 minutes before we saw our waitress. The food was good, but I probably wont go back.

The service was friendly and attentive.  I could see this being a regular eatery if I lived in NOLA.
Glad to see that we weren't the only visitors toting luggage .

The price point is reasonable , nice selection of items..and the drinks are strong! My mimosa had me smiling all the way to airport . 

I had the Costa Rican plater,  with a side of goat cheese, and a side of ham steak..I was full after eating just half ...my only disappointment is the fact that I was too stuffed to try the pineapple upside down pancakes . But there's always next time!

This is my second time visiting this place. As usual it didn't disappoint! The shrimp and grits were amazing and the biscuit was EVERYTHING! The service was very good and the wait wasn't long at all. The drinks were good and just the whole atmosphere was good energy! This is definitely a place I will continue to come to and invite others to enjoy with me!

I had the steak and eggs, and my steak was perfect!!  Although my eggs were a little over done and my drink tasted flat it was a good restaurant.  If you are ever in NOLA and looking for some good breakfast food, then let me suggest this place!!

This was really good!  Had to wait a bit for a table, was very bustling on a Sunday morning.  There is a yelp bonus of a 2 for 1 mimosa offer (or a double mimosa instead of 2 glasses, which I did).  A couple employees recommended the Eggs Cochon, 2 of us had it, and it was amazing!!  It was like pulled pork on a fantastic biscuit, with eggs on top and a hollandaise sauce.  Super good.  Pancakes were great too.  A lot of people had the bananas foster french toast, which I want to try next time, looked awesome.   Very friendly servers; this was a happy find!

By far the best brunch spot in New Orleans. Prior to coming here I had already walked by it once and I had already saw it on yelp but skipped over it. My girlfriend suggested we come here so we did just that and I couldn't be happier that she picked out The Ruby Slipper. They had by far the best catfish and grits I have ever tasted and the biscuit with the butter (can't remember exactly what they call it) was to die for. The portion sizes are big, I had to learn the hard way after ordering both the shrimp and grits and an omelette with shrimp. The entire staff were all friendly even with how busy it was. My one recommendation to all my fellow Yelpers who plan to come here is to JOIN THE WAIT LIST AHEAD OF TIME IF YOU PLAN TO COME ANY TIME AFTER 9:30 A.M. There is always a wait here of at least an hour even if it's just a party of 2. However it's well worth the wait.

My family's go to breakfast spot . We get 4 orders of catfish and grits because it's everyone's favorite, one order of French toast Baton and 2 orders  of the candy bacon which is to die for. I also love the bacon Bloody Mary.
Delicious food and great clean spot. Only slight down side is the customer service which can be hit or miss. Dealing with it can be worth it for you because the food IS THAT GOOD.

This place was really good.

Solid breakfast, a plus that they had chicken sausage

Very fast service, very friendly service

A little frustrating. All the great reviews and line for brunch on the weekend gave us very high expectations. Grits was plain and tasteless, just cooked. Biscuit was dull and the omelet was also tasteless. Not worth the wait.
Breakfast Was awesome ! Maybe the best you'd find in the tourist trap of New Orleans . definitely worth the try !

The Ruby Slipper was the best New Orleans breakfast experience so far.  My party ordered several plates and they were all wonderful.  Our waiter was very attentive and provided us with top notch service...gotta check it out if you are in NOLA!

So good! Be prepared for a wait.  Get on the waitlist through yelp if you can get's you in much faster.  They have staff that offer you beverages while you wait which was neat.  The peacemaker is so good.  You can choose two eggs bennies for brunch if you cannot decide on one! We went twice while we were there.

Although there wasn't a wait for a party of two on a Tuesday morning, the place was busy and we sat at the bar. 

The bartender/waiter was extremely attentive, and guided us through the menu with suggestions. I was oscillating between the Eggs Cochon and Chicken St. Charles benedicts. Imagine my delight when I saw the Peacemaker was an option! Basically you can choose between two different benedicts and get one of each (for $15). Wish that was an option everywhere. The biscuits were so delicious and moist. None of that dry crumbly business here! The Eggs Cochon had delicious apple braised pulled pork that had a hint of sweet. The St. Charles was your quintessential delicious fried chicken and biscuit. The two were an outstanding combination. 

We also got the BBQ shrimp and grits. They do NOT skimp on the shrimp! And the flavors are fantastic. It comes with a huge biscuit and sweet whipped butter (it was mixed with maple syrup or something like that... YUM). 

All that plus an iced tea? $40!

This place has the most amazing mimosas!! Served in a large wine glass, just enough to start your day off on a good note. 
The food was good. Perfect for the morning after a long night of fun. 
The best part was how quick and attentive the server was, we had out food with in 10 min of ordering, Amazing! 
I will definitely be going back!!

Great breakfast spot to hit after we flew in to New Orleans! Was able to put our name in through Yelp on the way from the airport, huge plus! Lovely waitress served us drinks outside while we waited (delicious). Super helpful waitress at our table that offered good recommendations, I got a southwestern dish that I loved except for the fried plantains, they were very difficult to bite and seemed stale (the only reason this is not a 5-star). However everything else was perfect and the atmosphere was lovely. Great way to be welcomed to New Orleans!

First, the wait was 90 minutes, so we decided to go to the Museum first and come back for lunch. Rushing through the museum and hurrying back at 2.53 pm, the hostess told us that they could not accommodate us as they are closing soon. First time that a restaurant turned us away when showing up during posted business hours.

Fantastic breakfast!   Got the you make it omelet and it was amazing!  My daughter got pancakes and they were fluffy and light.  The service was great, portions can be shared if u aren't a big eater.  Just get their early because there is a line out the door to eat there.  I've had breakfast in 3 locations during my trip and I can see why everyone runs to Ruby Slipper!

We went to the new location this morning, mentioned Yelp!, and got two free mimosas and a second one on the house for letting Yelp! film us while we had breakfast.

The service was great today: our server was friendly and attentive, which is not the most common quality of New Orleans servers, who could often take you or leave you. 

The food was good, if uneven. I ordered the BBQ shrimp and grits, and it was pretty good although I had to add salt and pepper. My husband got the special, the eggnog pancakes. "The eggnog pancakes were sublime," he says. They WERE pretty good, much better than my shrimp and grits.

Get a mimosa, for sure! Go somewhere less "downtown chic" if you want fab shrimp and grits.

Their eggs Benedict are incredible. But be prepared to wait and totally worth it !!!!! The food is tasty always packed in any location and delicious food I'm getting hungry just to think about it !!!! I wish they opened until late is hard to wait when I'm hungry:)
One of my favorite breakfast spots. The food amazing. Make sure to get here early. The food does take awhile to get out, but it's totally worth it.
Omg this place is a must! But call ahead get on the list there is a wait but it's worth it. A delicious way to start the day!

Long wait. There is an app they said and you can check in before even getting there. I highly recommend it. When we checked in at the door the host was a young man that wouldn't acknowledge anybody and would've even answer you with yes or no answers just nods and grunts forget being greeted! I wasn't sure what our experience was going to be after meeting the host. We were finally seated it was really loud  in the establishment with pleasant chatter and hustle and bustle going on (we didn't mind it) and employees all over the place. We were promptly greeted by Joshua and he turned our dining  around from the negative start we had. We ordered a child's cinnamon swirl pancake, St. Christopher I think eggs Benedict and bam bam biscuit. DELICIOUS!!! They did forget to bring the bam bam biscuit plate and our beautiful manager came and apologized personally. They still brought the plate out but took it off our check. We also let her know about their host and she assured it would be addressed and thanked us for the input. She chit chatted with us for a couple minutes. I would go back the only reason it's getting 4 stars is for their horrible host checking people in.

When you are in NOLA, you got a lot of great options for getting some breakfast. But you will find nothing better than the Ruby Slipper. The specialty benedicts are worth every penny. The traditional southern fare of grits and eggs are great too. My family chose this as our last meal for our weeklong trip. And with so many choices that is saying something.

Awesome bkft again. This is a must bkftstop if you have time while here in NOLA. The Benedicts are awesome. My favorite is the Saint Charles, and the Shrimp Boogaloo was great. Their special pancake was blueberry with cream sauce and was phenomenal. Don't forget to download the free "NoWait" app to use to sign in to avoid a lengthy wait. Happy eating.

The staff was very accommodating. We showed up with our luggage straight from the airport and they were able to get us seat so we weren't in the way with all of our stuff. The food was great. I wasn't a fan of the spiced iced coffee, but I did enjoy my shrimp omelette. My potatoes were over cooked. The thyme sprigs slowed me down with eating. Overall, the atmosphere was good and the service was great.

On a recent treat to New Orleans, my boyfriend and I stayed at the nearby Omni Royal Crescent. Every time we walked by this cafe, we noticed a huge crowd, so one morning, when we did not feel like walking back up to the French Quarter for the umpteenth time, we decided to stop by Ruby Slipper.

We were there on a Saturday around 11 so the breakfast crowd was just starting to leave while the lunch crowd was beginning to trickle in. As soon as I opened the door to the cafe, I was greeted by a blast of noise from the multiple conversations going on all at once in a large echoic building. Since we were there for a nice romantic weekend together, my boyfriend and I did not feel up to sitting in such a crowd shouting at one another just to have a conversation, so we opted to order to go. Unfortunately, the cafe does not take to-go orders on weekends, so we decided to get a table and hope for the best. 

After about a fifteen-minute wait, we were of course seated between two large groups of young men who had arrived to cure their hangovers. Nevertheless, we felt that if we could not enjoy the atmosphere, we could at least enjoy the food. We took advantage of their breakfast-all-day menu. Since we were both big fans of the original egg benedict, I ordered the eggs cochon, and my boyfriend ordered the CBH Benedict. The eggs cochon basically consisted of pulled pork, with eggs benedict. Unfortunately, I was not a fan of the dryness of the pulled pork, especially since I was expecting braised pork, and the way it sopped up the egg yolk so that it became just one very salty, soggy mess. I was only able to stomach one of the two I was served. My boyfriend, however, did not mind downing his CBH Benedict and my remaining eggs cochon. His CBH Benedict consisted of beef hash and an egg benedict. The one bite I stole from his plate revealed a very moist and tender slice of beef that surprisingly complimented his egg benedict. But, like my eggs cochon, it seemed rather salty. 

While the Ruby Slipper was conveniently close to our hotel, had quick service, and had an impressive menu, I was disappointed by the fact that we spent the entire dry, salty meal in silence. On our next trip to NOLA, we'll have to pass on revisiting this cafe.

On my last day in New Orleans, I had to come here. Yeah it's a chain and I was reluctant. But I was grateful I gave this place a chance. I had their Signature Dish the Eggs Cochan which is slow-cooked braised pork served over buttermilk biscuits, topped with two poached eggs, and finished with hollandaise sauce. It was just so good. The pork just melted in your mouth. So flavorful and bomb. I would want to come back try their other items at some point in my lifetime. I also had a glass of grapefruit juice; it was typical.

Amazing breakfast in New Orleans! We stayed in the Pelham Hotel right beside the restaurant, so we came for breakfast early one morning.  There was no line because we go there super early, but usually the line is around the block.  I really wanted to try the Bloody Mary, it has bacon infused vodka in it, and has won numerous awards but I felt that it was too early, so next time I will try it for sure.  I had the French toast with bacon, and it was outstanding. I would definitely come back here for breakfast or brunch in New Orleans. Just be sure to come early.

My wife and I came her for brunch one day and enjoyed ourselves for the most part. I had the corned beef Bennie (which was very good and had a nice horseradish cream, however it was a little cold upon delivery to the table). She had the Chicken St. Charles which was probably the better choice (but could have used some type of sauce so she asked for a side of hollandaise). 

Overall, this is your typical breakfast cafe with a New Orleans flare. They offer breakfast, lunch and brunch closing at 2:00pm daily. The service here was pretty good, although we did notice that one of the bus boys was drinking on the job... Not a good look! 

I don't think the food impressed us enough to come running back anytime soon. Perhaps we will meet again one day in the future, Ruby.

I remember in elementary school the teacher's lounge at my school had a sign on the door that read "staff only - no students beyond this point". I wanted to know so bad what was behind those doors. I finally got the opportunity to visit the teacher lounge after school one day, and was sadly disappointed that the lounge was nothing more than a sticky table with four chairs, and an old beat-up refrigerator. That's exactly how I felt when my husband and I visited the Ruby Slipper. Whenever we visit New Orleans there is always a long line waiting to get into this place. We were intrigued and wanted to see what all the fuss was about. The service was terrific, but the food was disappointing. I refuse to believe that people would wait in line to eat mediocre food, so maybe it was just what we ordered. My husband had the strawberry cheesecake French toast, and I had the shrimp and grits. New Orleans cuisine can do no wrong in my eyes, but our choices were nothing to write home about.

Love this place for breakfast,  I usually get the banana foster french that is out of this world however this time opted for something a bit lighter and boy am I glad I did! My husband and I both enjoyed the bagel with the inhouse smoked salmon WOW wonderful! Not overly smoked, light perfection just as smoked salmon should be and served with cream cheese, capers, red onions.. I was in heaven

I have been wanting to try this place for quite some time and the list time I was in New Orleans 3.5 years ago, time did not permit. This time around I knew I was not gonna miss the opportunity to stop in here. 

Me and my buddy was just recuperating from a very good evening on the town and I mentioned this place and he was like, lets do it! It wasn't far from the hotel so it was an easy 10 minute walk. Walked in and grabbed a booth and took a gander a the menu. Our server Demetra who was very awesome gave us the low down on the good menu items as there were so many to choose from. She started us out with some Big Easy mimosas which were bigger than normal mimosas...more like 4 mimosas in one glass. I started out with the Ruby Slipper mimosa which is OJ + pomegranate...pretty good! Then I did the blood orange mimosa which was much better. 

Now onto the food!!!!
I knew I probably was gonna go with the BBQ shrimp & grits, but Demetra did a great job of not letting me sway away from that idea. I was a little weary as some places don't do shrimp & grits well, but dammit this is Nawlins!!! Very good dish and a nice size! The shrimp were sautéed along with an amber beer and rosemary reduction. The dish came along with a big ass biscuit. My homie got the Gulf Fish St Peter which came with Drumfish in which neither of us ever had...it was pretty damn good and one of the best pieces of fish I've ever had. The dish came with a pretty good cheesy grit cake and a grilled shrimp skewer. 

I love this place and would definitely return again when in New Orleans

The food was good but the service is what killed the experience. We added ourselves on the waitlist because we were told there is always a wait. We waited for about 10 minutes after we arrived and then got seated. We waited  45 minutes after ordering before our food finally came. The waitress was not attentive, never checked on us or went to the kitchen to see what was taking so long. I had to approach her while she was doing her side work too let her know we were waiting entirely too long for breakfast for 2 and that parties who arrived after us got food before we did. The bussers and food runners were really kind and apologetic but the waitress barely apologized and didn't even offer to discount the meal.

I'm not sure if our level of service was not to par because we looked different from the typical demographic most customers, but as someone whose worked in hospitality for 10 years it was unacceptable

We waited for about an hour for a table. This place is decent size but limited on tables. More bar and stool kind of tables well at least half of the restaurant was. They had some picnic tables outside. 

We had to try this place since my brother-in-law was recommended by ESPN Michael Smith to come here! But I felt like it was a lot of hype. We ordered a lot of different kind of foods to try but nothing really stood out for me. We ordered the 

Eggs Coubion- I felt like there wasnt much catfish in here. I Loved the artichoke hearts though.
Hot Smoked Salmon Bennie- The salmon was pretty good
Eggs Cochon- The apple braised pork wasnt so bad either
Catfish "St. Peter"- The cheesy grit cake was interesting
Pancake- Cant go wrong with a buttermilk pancake

Don't get me wrong the food was good but no BAM in your face deliciousness!
Misspelled our name and the hostess was rude about the whole thing. The service was not the best. The French toast was soggy and cold. The eggs black stone was ok.

the best breakfast I have had in New Orleans! I love their Irish coffee---the best I have ever had at all! Their Benedict eggs are famous---if you cannot divide which one to try, take the 'peacemaker'! Then you can try two flavors at the same time!

Friendly staff. Long lines BUT we used the NoWait app and just showed up when our table was ready! So convenient! Slightly pricey (mimosas were $10 A PIECE) and they don't have regular old OJ and champagne (but the other flavors they had were alright) Good food, worth a shot for a brunch/lunch type deal if you're in the area.

Went here for breakfast and it was really good. Great menu variety, excellent tasty food and happy friendly service. You may have to wait a while for a table, but you will be glad you did. This place has a stated mission to help revitalize New Orleans after Katrina and they are doing a wonderful job achieving that!
Eggs cochon was amazing.  This version of eggs benedict takes a buttermilk biscuit, shredded pork, eggs and hollandaise to amazing heights.  Worth the wait.

The shrimp omelette is the absolute best omelette I've ever had. The potatoes are delicious too! The waiter was a little forgetful. The service was good not great. The server mixed up our order several times .

We went there on our last day! How sad for us! To make up for lost time we had two meals there (early breakfast and lunch) and both  times it exceeded our expectations. Our waitress was friendly and attentive while the restaurant exuded a great atmosphere. The first time I had the banana fosters french toast and absolutely loved it, it was simply scrumptious. When I returned I had the catfish (and ate the whole thing)! My daughter had the chicken St Charles and (I kinda wished I ordered that too) We also tried the pork po boy and it did not disappoint! In short this place is a MUST when you are in NOLA! But dont wait till your last day!!! :)

Holy delicious. The coffee is locally roasted and absolutely great. The menu has a big variety and all five of us loved our meals. We only waited a half hour at prime breakfast time. And our waitress was fantastic. Win, win, win all the way around. And the "to go Bellini" was awfully nice.

Get here early because the line gets long after 9:30 am.  I had the croque madame and that was awesome. The grits was creamy and not buttery and the natural taste of the ham, egg and their Mornay sauce all just fused into my mouth. The portions  were not too much so that was good because it didn't ruin my lunch appetite.  I will definitely hit this place once again when I get back to NOLA.

It's a typical brunch place with an extremely long line ,and the poor servers are doing their best but it leads to poor service with the amount of people jammed in there. Use the app to order ahead, we didn't and waited for an hour and a half when we were told it would be an hour. Get the boozy coffee to keep you sane and awake in line.

Simply amazing food that is fresh and flavorful. The bananas Foster Pain Perdu is a MUST. The bacon adds some savory to all that flavor of butter, maple syrup and rum. Absolutely dee-lish. And the Eggs Cochon the pork and that yummy biscuit. Simply divine. The portions are large and you definitely get full. 

Don't let the crowds scare you. It's definitely worth the wait. So good we went back the next day. And in this town of lots of yummy eateries, that's saying a lot.

The food was good. I had the combination eggs Benedict platter consisting of poached eggs on shredded pork and a biscuit on one and a poached egg on a fried chicken and a biscuit on the other.  This meal was an acquired taste for breakfast.  I had to try it since it's a signature meal here.  My sister had a basic southern breakfast that was really good.  The coffee was strong and the mimosa was really good.  I personally was all that impressed for the price but if you want to try something southern, this is the place.

Went here based on reviews on Yelp. Long line, but it moves fast.
