Food was great and tasty. Service was prompt and knowledgeable.  Our only gripe was both of our coffee and mimosa glass were noticeable dirty . The wait staff immediately offered us new drinks and apologized.
Best fried chicken ever! The service is quick and the portions are huge. The wait time was minimal despite the long line for breakfast.
OMG! Awesome & well worth the wait. I had the Chicken St Charles it was amazing I had a bite of the pancakes & they were fabulous! Good Bloody Mary & Ronald our server was fantastic

Good food. Great service. Nice place to start the day. I had the bananas foster and thought it was good. I got served at the bar and the bar tender did a great job. Engaging & attentive. I look forward to working my way around the menu on future visits.

I've been here about 3 times in 3 days, so you can see I'm in love. The banana foster is to die for! I also got an eggs Benedict dish, and it was very good but the portions were massive compared to other places, mostly due to the use of a biscuit instead of an English muffin (which is a better substitute and inline with southern cuisine anyway). I also came alone all 3 times, and skipped the line to sit at the bar, which usually has space for 1-2 people instead of waiting. Really got nothing but good to say about my experience. 
The downside: it's noisy and has a lot of commotion, which is typical for any similar establishment.

Well worth the 30 minute wait. We ordered the Eggs cochon and  chicken St Charles. Very good! Would have liked a larger egg to be used but that did not take away from the dish. Friendly wait staff and efficient service. Best meal we have had on our trip!

Lovely breakfast brunch, great options and huge portions. I went with the Costa Rican brunch even though some other yelpers said it was overpriced- I think it was fair. Came with eggs, two heaps of rice and beans and four or so plaintains and part of an avocado. I really really liked the coffee here, smooth and unburnt. We may come back here tomorrow for brunch because there were other options on menu we wanted to try

This place was definitely worth the wait. We came for breakfast and got exactly what we were looking for! I had the shrimp which came with a fried green tomato, a giant biscuit, and a poached egg, all covered in a red sauce. Everything was cooked perfectly, fresh, and seasoned to delight. I'd highly recommend this place for some authentic Cajon breakfast.
First meal in town ! I loved it , the people are friendly the environment is cozy , the waiters and waitresses were nice and the food was delicious! Also, ate brunch here before leaving town

The hostess was absolutely a bitch. We waited 1.5 hours for a table for 10. Two people ran to the room and we were finally called. She almost kicked us out because we weren't all here, even though the ones who weren't were only next door.

The Ruby Slipper was a great little find.  Most people stick north of Canal in the French Quarter but The Ruby Slipper is located just south of Canal on Magazine Street (which is Decateur St on the French Quarter side of Canal Street.)

We were looking for breakfast and the Ruby Slipper fit the bill.  The meals were reasonably priced and tasted great! (I got the three pigs omelette). 

Our waitress was always there to refill my coffee before it was half empty and the food came out quickly.

Definitely go check it out when you tired of beignets.

My girlfriends and I visited The Ruby Slipper before hitting the road to Houston.All the staff was friendly and I loved the concept of The Ruby Slipper. We all loved the food! I had a BYO omelet and it was delish. Next time I'm in NO I'll definitely be back.

The Ruby Slipper was just around the corner from the apartment we rented in the Warehouse District on Magazine Street. I highly recommend reservations, since any time we passed by it in the morning, we saw very long lines. We waited around 20-25 minutes then were seated at the bar. The place is very cute, has a nice ambience and friendly bartender who waited on us. Because we were at the bar and the restaurant was busy, our service was a bit slow. I had the Southern Breakfast which included two eggs, grits, bacon, biscuit and fried green tomato. It was good, not great, and I take umbrage at being charged several dollars more for the simplest of breakfast plates over what one would pay at a local diner or Cracker Barrel. However, I understand this is in a tourist area, so they could probably charge even more. Our entire visit lasted about 1 1/2 hours, so it was good we had a flexible schedule and weren't looking for a quick breakfast to get us on our way for the day.

Came back on my next trip to NOLA and it was just as great as the first time. LOOOOONG wait on a Sunday morning, but worth it for those awesome bloody marys with bacon and pickled green beans. Get the tequila mary if you want something stronger, but the vodka mary worked perfectly for me. Food portions are HUGE, so consider sharing if you're not such a big eater; I couldn't come close to finishing my bananas foster french toast. 

You can sign up for the wait list online, and they'll track your spot in line--we learned this when we arrived, and had time to run to do some errands while waiting for our table--thanks RSC!

We wanted to try an authentic NOLA breakfast place so we sought this place out. We joined the waitlist on Yelp so that when we got there we wouldnt have to wait as long. On the list it told us to check in by 12:10pm so we did and when we got there, there was a huge line surrounding the host stand. We waited in it and finally checked in and still had to wait ~30-40 minutes outside. It was about a 2.5 hour wait overall. 

We sat at the bar so it was cramped quarters. I had an irish coffee which was good and strong. Then we both had one of their massive mimosas. For food I got the eggs benny 3 ways. Surprisingly I liked the pork one the best. I thought the fried chicken one was just okay and I really didn't like the shrimp one. It seemed like the sauce on the shrimp one was canned tomato sauce or something. It was really plain and unappealing. My friend got the bbq shrimp and grits and didn't love them. Overall the food was good but definitely over-hyped. I wouldn't wait 3 hours for this place, but I would go back if there wasn't a wait.

This beautiful restaurant in the heart of the French Quarter grabs you with its bright colors and whimsical reference to the Ruby Slipper that Dorothy wore...click your ruby slippers and find yourself in this restaurant (or anyone of its three locations). 
While the decor is whimsical and unique, the food is just average. I had the biscuit, cinnamon swirl pancakes, and the french toast batons - a balanced meal! :) What I expected was tons of butter and sugar, and while each dish seemed to have loads of both of these ingredients that can help elevate even the mundane dishes into guilty pleasures, the food missed that mark - leaving you feeling more guilty than happy. The portions were large. The biscuits fell a little of shy of being flaky goodness, the cinnamon pancakes were average and nothing unique that you would remember after you left the establishment, and the baton sticks were on the greasier side. 
Given the popularity of the restaurant, as seen by the number of customers patronizing the establishment, and the fact that there are three locations within a short area, my opinion definitely seems to be of the minority of customers rather than a majority of customers...so proceed forth with caution and decide for yourself if you are in the majority or in the minority.

Overpriced, underwhelming place. Avoid. Starting with the person at the entrance - I used the inline app to sign up - she acted as if we had just shown up & put me behind 15 people. And was being very unfriendly. Later 2 folks from our group of 6 had gone to a gift shop when our turn came - she refused to sit us till everyone was there. Even if they were 2mins away. The food took forever to arrive. And when it came, there was nothing great. Just about the level of the ordinary local Dennys. And all for very expensive prices. Very disappointing. We wanted a quick brunch before heading to the WWII museum. Ended up spending 2 hours and had a terrible experience

YES!!!! EGGS COCHON ARE THE MEANING OF LIFE!
The best eggs benedict I have ever had. Being a third-generation Cuban-American, pork is a sacredly delicious meat to me. It is not often that I come across pork (at a restaurant) that knocks my socks off. Everything about this was perfect. Soft english muffin, perfectly poached eggs, not too runny. Amazeballs hollandaise sauce. 

The boyfriend got the french toast, which was made with french bread. That was also a winner, and the perfect sweetness to counteract the savory eggs. There is a wait to get in, but this is a definite winner in my book.

This place is so good and a must if you are in New Orleans! Anywhere I can get breakfast all day tends to make me very happy!! Also, if there is a wait that is normally a good sign since people are willing to wait for a long time to have a meal. Being a party of 1 worked in my favor and I was able to snag a seat at the counter. The place was full but service was not lacking which I appreciated. I ended up going with the special of apple pancakes which was a very good choice. It was fantastic and reminded me of a local place in Austin I like to go to. The chicken sausage was also great. 
The second time I went it was pretty empty and I opted to get the Three Little Pigs omelet! Again it did not disappoint and was fantastic!!! This is on the list should I ever find myself in NOLA again.

We are well traveled and love finding great food in remote places. We don't look for much but as long as the food is great and service is adequate, all is well. 
Here, we found none of the above. Unfortunate since it seems like this is a well visited spot around nola.

Vibe: okay, cool atmosphere if you're looking for a quick diner meal. 
Drinks: mimosa's looked good but iced coffee was abysmal
Service: most rude hostess we'd met in all of Nola and waitress had attitude

Food: cold!! And grits were horrible as well as our scrambled eggs which were seriously only just passable. 

The best part was the biscuit. Yum. But a part from that I can think of no good reason to ever come back

Had a great experience at this restaurant.  My husband and I ate at the bar and got their shrimp and grits and Blackstone eggs benedict.  Both were perfect and flavorful.  I liked the sauce over the shrimp and grits.  The grits were cheesy and cooked just right. Their biscuits  are massive and very good,  try them if you get a chance. 

Come early as the line forms quickly.  We recommend using the app called "No Wait".  You can reserve your spot from your phone and not have to wait in line as long.  We reserved our spot as we were walking over to the restaurant and cut down our wait by 30 minutes.  They send you a text once your table is ready.  The app was extremely helpful.

Second day in NOLA and no better way to start my day than with a BACON VODKA BLOODY MARY. Literally perfection, for me all it was missing was the spice! I just didn't ask for it, slipped my mind. BUT WOW, how delicious. The BANANA FOSTER FRENCH TOAST was "melt in your mouth, fall on the floor, marry the food" good! It wasn't over powering sweet but tasted like banana foster in all of its glory. Must visit for brunch! Our bartender Michael was awesome and let us know what was the best of the best! Thanks Michael!

Worth the Wait! Although the wait is long (waitlist on yelp ahead of time) this place lives up to the hype. The food is awesome and the service is fast and friendly. If you cant decide on which Benedict to eat, order the peace maker and choose two. I went with the eggs cochon and the shrimp boogaloo and loved them both equally. Great hangover cure!
There was a wait on a Monday morning but was so worth it! Food and service were phenomenal. Atmosphere was great :) a mimosa was the right touch! We will definitely be back

Great breakfast spot, but busy right from opening. We arrived maybe 7:45 and had a half hour wait. Sat at bar area and had fast but not super attentive service. Had to ask for silverware and flag down for coffee refills. Food was good though. Make sure you get a biscuit. I had the florentine omelet and didn't love that the goat cheese was just plopped in the middle.

Ruby Slipper is so unique in taste! When we got there around 9AM on a Tuesday, we had to wait about 10 minutes for our seat. There were so many choices on the menu that I couldn't choose! I ordered the Cochon Benedict and the Shrimp Benedict because they both sounded so good! The portions are pretty big so I had to take one home. The Cochon had pulled pork and it was so soft and juicy! The biscuit the Benedicts were on were delicious! It was definitely different than normal benedicts. We also tried the BBQ shrimp and grits. The grits were great! The BBQ shrimp I expected it to taste a little different, but it was still good. I realized the food in New Orleans is a bit salty everywhere you go, but it was bearable. Our server was funny and attentive- the food did take a little while to come out, but for authentic food it was worth the wait.
I love their breakfast choices, they are so good. And you gotta try their bacon bloody Mary, it taste so yummy in my tummy. Would recommend

Only in NOLA for 2 days, definitely coming tomorrow morning also! The wait was about an hour and the food was Egg-cellent! Ordered the Florentine; egg white omelet with goat cheese, spinach, and mushrooms.

Awful service! Rude waiters! Long wait time! Oh and ya, after all that, I didn't even get any food. 
After asking for the banana cream french toast, the waiter went to go check if it was available...it was, yay! So I ordered that. After ten mins, he comes back and says "sorry, no go..we are out. what do you want?" I ordered the migas in a rush with one pancake on the side. My migas came with sausage, which I don't eat, so he apologized and took them away. I was waiting to get another plate without the sausage which never came. The bill came, no food. We asked where my plate was "ummm... you didnt say you wanted us to remake it?" What?? So I waited over an hour to just sit here and not eat anything?!?!  Even the side of pancake NEVER came. My husband's chicken sandwhich was rubbery and the caprese sandwhich had no flavor. The best thing was the fries. As my friend was eating his food, a busboy came over and  as he asked if he was done, took his plate away with fries still on it. My friend said no, I wasn't done yet and the guy said "that's why I asked" and threw the plate back down. It was obvious that coming late screwed us- they were out of food and clearly just wanted us out.  PS: I'm still hungry!
Over the top breakfasts!  Wide menu with tasty presentations. Plan ahead as it is mighty popular. Consider using the online reservations as it can be mighty crowded. A great place!

The corned beef Bennie is absolutely delicious. Eggs were cooked to perfection and the corned beef was seasoned just right. The staff was very friendly and accommodating. Demetra was our waitress and she was awesome! The wait was long but that's expected when food is so good. If I ever come back to NOLA I'll definitely try the St. Charles Benedict. Hubby got the Costa Rican but it wasn't as good as the Bennie.

Amazing breakfast and brunch place! TIP; use the No Wait line app to secure your place in line because it will be a long wait otherwise. I started with Bacon infused Vodka Bloody Mary and it was delicious. For breakfast I had the peacemaker which gives you a choice of 2 different eggs Benedict's. I chose the 2 house specials. Cochon and st. Charles. I like the st. Charles a bit more because their fried chicken was delicious. The Pork was delicous as well but I was already full from the at. Charles. Definitely recommend it! My husband had the bananas foster French toast and they were amazing. A bit sweet but nonetheless good! My mom and son each had pancakes and while it is only 2, they are huge! Great experience overall and would definitely come back!!

Call me Dorothy and I will take these ruby slippers any day. Seriously though this breakfast was wonderful.....between the eye opening cocktails, the eggs Benedict , I had chicken St Charles .....they even had brown sugar bacon....yes just pause for second on that bacon part! I see they get mix reviews on here but as someone visiting the area I was not disappointed at all would recommend others to try and would definitely come back!

Just had breakfast here since it was walking distance from the hotel. Friendly service, spicy Bloody Mary, and a sizable egg white, spinach, and chorizo omelet. Their biscuit was ginormous so I decided to pack it with me on my flight back home (just like another reviewer did). The only criticism I have is that their grits were a bit more bland and corn-mealy than ones I've had (and preferred) in Charleston, SC.

The fact that this place has such high ratings is beyond my understanding. Me and family had the worst brunch experience ever. This place has nothing for vegetarian people at all and we asked for substitutions like bacon with avocado , firstly the waitress simply refused then got the worst made food. I would highly recommend please don't spend your precious time waiting in line for this place if you looking for any food vegetarian. The staff was extremely rude and really felt out of place.
I LOVE THIS PLACE!!!!! They have so many types of eggs benedict! Listen to the specials! Great service, great food!

Underwhelming. 

With a wait like that, I expected to be wowed. So many people recommended this place to me. There is so much GREAT food in New Orleans, I was shocked at how disappointing this meal was.

Ordered the eggs cochon...the pork was GREAT! Wonderful flavor, could totally stand on its own. But the biscuit...meh. And the mere dollop of hollandaise...disappointing. Even the poached eggs were a let down- over cooked and gummy. 

Also got the French toast. I love French toast. This is the first place I think I've ever been to that couldn't even nail that. It was overcooked and after asking for and not getting any syrup, I had to get some from another customer. 

Ordered an Irish coffee to go... And it was cold. Cmon, really?!? They did remake it for me, but I shouldn't have had to ask. This was the only blight in an otherwise epic food journey through New Orleans.

Nice breakfast/brunch joint a little bit off the main drag. I arrived at around 12:30 on a Sunday, and with a party of four, we were seated within five minutes. The seating arrangements were comfortable, and the service attentive and friendly. After we placed our orders, our waitress, the hostess, and someone else (the owner? Manager?) came to check on our drink refills and see if we needed anything.  The food took a little bit longer to cone out, but it was busy, and it was still within reason. 

As for the food, portions were generous, but I have to echo a minor complaint that I saw in another review.  I ordered the Eggs Cochon -- like an Eggs Benedict but with a biscuit instead of an English muffin, and pork debris instead of Canadian bacon -- theirs were the most well done poached eggs I'd ever had. The yolk was completely solid without a hint of runniness to them. I also had the breakfast potatoes, which had good texture, but were a tad bland.  The other folks in my party were happy with their orders, though, and over all, it was a good dining experience.  If I were to return, I'd probably try something different from the menu, like the Bananas Foster french toast.
By far the best breakfast in a while. Cheesecake French toast and pulled pork on a biscuit...!! Atmosphere is great service was great as well. A must DO! We will be back.

I'm a fan of this restaurant! The food was so good and definitely filled me up until dinner time. Just a heads up, the line gets pretty long so I'd recommend getting on the wait list beforehand so you don't have to wait when you get there. 

I came here for brunch and had a pretty difficult time deciding what to get since everything on the menu looked amazing. I ended up choosing the Chicken St. Charles- fried chicken served on buttermilk biscuits, topped with two poached eggs and a pork tasso cream sauce. This dish was so incredibly tasty. The chicken was crispy on the outside and juicy on the inside. The buttermilk biscuits were flaky and buttery with a slight crunch. The sauce tied the dish together- it was creamy and super savory. I'd highly recommend this dish. In addition, I had some breakfast potatoes and they were pretty good, but they were a bit under seasoned in my opinion. I also tried the french toast and I really liked it! To be honest, I feel like you can't go wrong with anything at this restaurant. Solid place to satisfy your brunch cravings.

The food was to die for. But most food in NOLA is delicious. We were seated at the bar next to the 'to go pickup register'. I spent the whole time being bumped into by far to many people. And it was so loud in that area my friend and I couldn't hear each other talk.  I know this is not the restaurants fault (noise and rude customers) but it made the delicious meal unenjoyable.

We were in the mood for a southern breakfast and we were not disappointed.

The Chicken St. Charles was delicious! My husband has the breakfast sandwich and really enjoyed it. The candied bacon was so good! 

The staff was very friendly and knowledgeable. Ruby Slipper will be my go to breakfast spot when I'm visiting New Orleans.

Wait time was quick even though the restaurant was quite crowded on a weekday morning. I ordered the Croque Monsieur sandwich and it was MASSIVE (and delicious). My counterpart couldn't decide between the Chicken St. Charles and the Eggs Cochon, so the waitress offered her a split plate combo so that she could try both dishes. Both items were wonderful as well. Great service, waitress was very nice and brought everything out quickly. Overall great meal. No fifth star because it didn't blow anyone's mind but it's a great breakfast/lunch if you're in NOLA.
Food was off the charts. I had the peacemaker with pork and chicken.  I was scared about the types of sauce but they were good also

We had a great experience from the start - the moment we stepped into the cafe. The staff is very patient, warm and welcoming. While the wait was long, a server was taking drink ordered outside the cafe while everyone waited for their tables. The food also met our expectations. We ordered the cinnamon swirl pancakes, breakfast potatoes, biscuit with cane sugar butter and an omelette. Would highly recommend the cafe! We are vegetarians and we were able to get good food here.

7/24/12. First time to New Orleans, went here for breakfast because of the reviews.  Ordered the  Bananas Foster french toast...Found a Dead  Cockroach in the middle. Told the manager, he did not apologize and I had to ask for it to be taken off our bill.  Will never be back !

What can I say? I have been in love with the Ruby Slipper since I saw the sandwich board sign from the window of my hotel that read "Pineapple Upside-Down pancakes". The absolute best brunch spot in NOLA!

Absolutely wonderful, delicious, amazing, decadent and savory food. When I sat down I immediately looked around at plates and couldn't decide what to eat. My mom of course have the classic southern brunch plate. I had the the Benedict pick two... Shrimp Boogaloo and St.  Charles chicken... plus added candied beacon... and my server was the awesome and I liked her blue hair. Even more, a guy apologized to my mom if he sounded disrespectful, but he wanted to tell me how beautiful I was. So yes definitely going back!!! I do miss southern food!

Can you say slammed busy?

Yep, that's this place!  It was slammed early AM, Mid AM, late AM...... get the idea? 

I ordered a traditional breakfast - that's a no brainer on taste. I will say the texmex dishes around us were huge and looked incredible. 

I'll be back to visit again (in warmer weather) lol.
Great spot off the main drag - breakfast was much better eating at a hotel restaurant. Id come back again

Worth the wait -- which really isn't bad because they text you when your table is ready & you can check how many parties are ahead of you on the yelp app. Possibly the best brunch we've ever had & friendly, great service. We had the Ruby Slipper mimosa, praline pancakes & fried chicken benedict. Excellent!
A great place on Canal Street.  Good service and a great breakfast !!

Wait - probably the worst part but not too bad and it was worth it!

Food was excellent, especially the banana pecan pancakes! Definitely tasted fresh like a homemade southern breakfast!

Service was good. Realtively prompt. Staff was nice!

Atmosphere is fun and loud/lively!

I'm writing this review not so much for prospective customers, but mostly in hopes that someone from the establishment will read it and consider making some changes...

First of all, your hostesses are completely personality-free/bordering on bitchy. In fact they are some of the most non-personable, unpleasant, unwelcoming hostesses I've ever experienced in New Orleans! (Last year when my sisters were visiting from Atlanta, one of the hostesses was so unfriendly they vowed never to return--right before hitching a taxi across town to Atchafalaya;) Perhaps these girls should be reminded that this is not Lilette, Le Petit Grocery, or Revolution so there's no need for the snobbery. Secondly, there's a "bipolar" bartender that's sometimes very nice and sometimes considerably bitchy. (Though the other bartender MJ is the cat's meow.) Thirdly, on two occasions my eggs have been brought out completely cold, and the last time I visited I had to wait over 30 minutes for the Southern Breakfast (eggs, grits, a biscuit, and a flavorless fried tomato) when people sitting around me who'd arrived way after I ordered seemed to have only waited 10-15 minutes for their more elaborate meals...

Now clearly this place is not suffering from a lack of patrons, with endless winding lines around the corner almost every weekend (though my guess is that it's gotten lots of possibly outdated press and has become a trap for tourists who don't know any better), so maybe there's not much of a motivation or desire to improve/modify anything going on there. But if you guys don't get it together and start treating us locals with a bit more care and respect, you're gonna eventually start leaving us with a "bad taste" that even warm, promptly-delivered eggs won't be able to get rid of.

The ruby slipper, catchy name! 

This is a really cute local spot.  I came in one morning for breakfast before I was on my way out of NOLA. I kept it simple and ordered eggs, potatoes and chicken sausage (I was surprised to see this - very rare).

The food was average, nothing really special except for the potatoes. I really liked their version of home fries/hash browns or whatever you'd like to call them. The eggs were a little cold and didn't taste that fresh. The chicken sausage was actually pretty good, first time ever trying that!

I would say to give this place a try if you're ever in the area and you're looking for a place to grab a quick bite to eat. I've read through a few of the other reviews and it looks like they might be known for their "specialty" omelets. Omelets aren't my cup of tea but maybe it'll do it for you!

Total foodgasm... the croque madam is to die for and the migas are a delicious take on a timeless Mexican dish.  Well worth the 30 min wait to get in! Will definitely remain a staple for breakfast in this amazing city

Five stars for the food and drinks... 3 stars for the wait staff. Slow, no sense of humor, and rude. Had a couple of big easy mimosas and and a ham and cheese omelet with only a 15 minute wait. Bartender was stupendous, waitress not so much. Try to remember you work in hospitality, maybe try to not act annoyed when I ask for another beverage. I know you're busy but I deserve quality service too.

Really great breakfast! The reviews are not kidding when they say this place is great. The food is great and the staff are incredibly friendly. I took the advice of the other posters and ordered the eggs cochon. IT REALLY IS AMAZING! Best breakfast I've had in New Orleans!

The presentation of the food was great however I ordered the St. Charles and Shrimp Bugaloo benedicts and felt that both were lacking in the seasoning department, especially the St. Charles. The fried chicken was on the bland side. I would return to try one of their sweeter dishes though.
This place is amazing. Great atmosphere. The service and the food is terrific! This is a must visit for when you come to NOLA.
Ruby Slipper is the place to go if you want a wide variety of food choices! The food is amazing! I've eaten there numerous of times and I was never disappointed!

Had a cappuccino it was not sub mediocre.  The bananas foster was good but could have used more bananas and thicker slices. Wasnt many on there and would have made it better. The bacon was tasty and a good pairing that came with it. Also ordered lunch apparently I was hungry so got the catfish St. Peter. That was good but I think creamed spinach would be even better then just sauté spinach. the shrimp on top was a little odd. Not sure how they prepared it but still decent. The fish had good flavor and seasoning. Overall decent but could have been better with some tweaking.

You know when you're so full you really need to stop eating but the food you're eating is just too delicious so you eat until you are on the verge of popping? Well, if you don't come to the Ruby Slipper and you will. Just gorged myself on the eggs Blackstone - a variation of eggs Benedict - while my husband snarfed the Migas down. Fantabulous. Pure and simple. The Eggs Blackstone was incredibly flavorful and the bite I had if the Migas was light and tasty. Definitely a wise choice for a breakfast stop when in New Orleans. Don't wait til you're starving though. This popular local restaurant typically has a line out the door. Well worth the wait!

This spot was recommended by a few friends and I can totally understand why. It's located right across the street from the sheraton (which made it really convenient during the heavy rain we just had).  The food & service was on point. We ordered the egg cochon, chicken & biscuit, & the cochon poboy- all tasted great.   
I would def. recommend you put yourself on the wait list first. We had to wait over 2 hrs for our table.  Luckily, we did it through yelp & just hung out at the hotel till they texted us when our table was near ready.

L-o-v-e-d this food! If it weren't 5 million calories, I'd eat it for breakfast, lunch, and dinner. Service was really fast and nice!

Note: This place gets packed so get there early. We waited 45 min for a table, but totally worth it. If you drink, you can buy a cold one inside and sip away outside as you wait.
A weee bit disappointed with the food..was not what I expected. Maybe an off day?

We were on vacation in NOLA and found this place near our hotel. We came in around 8am on a Friday and knowing we were being picked up at 8:45am. We were seated right away and our waiter, Derek, was nice enough to take our orders right away.  We mentioned we were rushing due to a tour appointment.  He got our orders in and about 15min later, we got our breakfast.  Needless to say, the service was great.  Food was excellent as well.  We ordered the 3 Little Pigs Omelette, Buttermilk Pancakes and Southern Breakfast. I had the Buttermilk Pancakes which were about 12", double stacked.  They were cooked just right. I was told the Omelette and Southern Breakfast was good as well. 

We came back the following day around 9:30am and the wait was an hour.  Unfortunately, we had to take a pass this second time as we didn't have the time to wait.   

This place is located at the corner of Magazine and Common St.  Parking may be a challenge.  There is a paid parking lot on Common St nearby.   

Overall, this is a great restaurant to have breakfast.  Keep up the great food and service. We would definitely come back if we're in town.

If you eat breakfast in New Orleans and don't come here, you are missing out on LIFE. Third time eating here and it's 5 stars every time. I went and was seated right away which is a rarity. Then it was the food. Oh man the food. 

I had bacon pecan pancakes. BACON. Pecan. Pancakes. I didn't need the syrup they were so perfect. I swear this place never disappoints. I have also had the Migas and Eggs Cochon in the past and those were also amazing. Between the friendly staff and food, don't miss eating here. I can't say that enough.

Ate here two days in a row for breakfast because the food was great. Had their eggs Blackstone and eggs Cochin and they were very tasty. Pancakes were good, biscuits great. Iced coffee was excellent. Also had the shrimp and grits, which honestly were a little underwhelming. Flavors were fine but I got around 6 or 7 medium shrimp and not much sauce. Not worth the price IMO. But, worth repeat visits from me so overall a great place.

This place lived up to its 570 reviewed 4 star reputation.  The service matched the great quality of food.  I ate at the bar and was constantly being checked on.  The grits were so creamy but not heavy.  The biscuit was a bit doughy but very comforting.  I balanced the decadence with an egg white omelette with spinach, mushrooms and goat cheese and I didn't feel like I was depriving.  Thanks Ruby slipper cafe!

Completely worth the wait and price! Excellent creative and accommodating menu with plenty of choices to mix up or combine dishes. 

Tables are high and low of solid wood. Service is friendly and quick. Tables are turned quickly and the wait averages 60 to 90 minutes. Full round bar service available serving mimosas, Bloody Mary, or tequila shots, to name a few. Yes this is breakfast in NOLA. 

The food is generous and the breakfast potatoes are chunky. The Peacemaker Benedict offer a combo of two different Benedict of your choice from the menu. I got one of the Chicken St. Charles and the Blackstone. The chicken was lightly battered and crispy. Very juicy too. The Blackstone was excellent as well. Hubby had the salmon and the other was corn beef. Portion was plentiful and flavorful. Overall, excellent experience!

Huge tip, get on the waitlist using Yelp! By the time you get here and get on line to check-in with hostess, you will only need to wait another 15 minutes. Worth the wait and totally NOLA!!
Ruby Slipper is an awesome way to start the weekend.  Friendly with really amazing food. I know you need to wait but go to the bar and get a bacon infused bloody. It's all good!

Came here excited to try it out.. Sat at the bar with friends.. Well service was horrible, ALL three bartenders had an stank attitude. We ordered coffee and that was an hassle for them. At one point the guy snatched the receipt out of my friend's hand because we needed to split the ticket and also order food. We never ordered food, we just  paid for the coffee and left because the rudeness was ridiculous. So this was a disappointment mostly because myself and one of my friends are Chefs.
Unbelievable, the Chicken St. Charles and the Eggs Blackstone were our favorites. John at the bar is great! There will be a wait, but it's worth it.

This place deserves 6 stars. The customer service was great, they have oprtioms for non-pork eaters. The food was under priced if you ask me! 

$8 breakfast... Can't beat that!!

The three pigs omelet - seriously the best breakfast of my life, I cannot get over it

It came with some pans roasted-ish potatoes and a biscuit, but clearly, the star of the show was the omelet

The sausage, ham, bacon, eggs and cheese were amazing and typically I don't like sausage, but this was a perfect compliment.

Eggs has a slightly buttery taste, but it was amazing.  

Service was great, long wait even at 11am on a Monday, can't imagine the weekends, but the food is that good, worth the 45 minute wait, in the heat

Great spot for brunch!!! My wife and I came here and got the Peacemaker which lets you pick two of their awesome Benedicts (we got the chicken and the salmon Benedict) and we also got the banana foster French toast.  All I have to say is AMAZINGNESS on a plate.  Service is also spectacular...def has some southern hospitality.  This is a must-go place in NOLA.
Food was good. Service was AWFUL and very rude. Waitress didn't bring us silverware, then they practically threw us out as soon as we finished.

We finally got to the "Ruby Slipper" location on Magazine Street, in the space just off Washington Avenue, which had been remodeled then vacated by the short-lived "Brick & Spoon" out of Lafayette.  

Place was packed at 1:00m PM Saturday, very, very noisy.

We both had bacon cheeseburgers, which were just "OK".   Other menu items seemed too "yuppie" for us.  

Brick & spoon had better burgers.  The nearby "Down the Hatch" has better burgers.

We don't see what gives "Ruby Slipper" it's great reputation.

You pay your money, you take your chance. . . . . . 

Rick

+ Service was friendly and attentive. 
+ Ambience was nice and open.

Eggs benedict and variations of are my kryptonite so I opted for the Eggs Blackstone with a side of breakfast potatoes.  [ Poached egg, grilled tomato, and bacon on a biscuit with hollandaise ] Maybe I shouldn't have and gone with something a little more nola-esque.  Overall the dish was bland and required hot sauce (it's a good thing hot sauce is ubiquitous in any nola restaurant) but worst of all the eggs weren't runny! It ended up being a hard boiled egg, tomato, bacon, on a biscuit with hollandaise on top.  

My friend got the eggs cochon with a side of chicken sausage which I sampled.  His eggs also weren't runny but the pork debris was a nice topping making the dish a little less dry.  

If I find myself in the big easy again I may try this place one more time but I wouldn't go out of my way.

Delicious and great service. We went here three times during our trip, and even bought shirts. The food was delicious, and there's quite a variety to choose from. Here's a tip: use the app NoWait to get your name on their waiting list before you leave home. We did that every time, and it was perfect. We waited in our hotel room, then they text you when your table is ready.

Love the servers here! They're top notch. They knock themselves out for you. Definitely hit the Ruby Slipper Cafe.
very good food, Demetria was great server but only two pancakes for $10..how about three ?  Worst was the day old fruit that was nasty and not fit for consumption.
We ordered the eggs conchon and oatmeal. The food was good (seriously, some of the best oatmeal of my life... Served with cobbler on top!) And the prices weren't bad. Cute ambiance.

What an amazing food experience this was. I'll admit it, first time eating "real" southern food. I was pretty much in food heaven from the moment we walked in the smell gets you. 

I had the banana foster w/out the raisins, AMAZING! My friend had the chicken St. Charles and his mom had the BLT-T (fried green tomato) and they were both amazing as well. 

Recommend this place to anyone visiting the area.

My entire experience here was amazing! Absolutely worth any wait. The hostess was outstanding, our waitress was friendly and knowledgeable. The food was terrific. I had a corned beef Benedict with a side of grits. Quite possibly the best corned beef I've ever had. The eggs were perfectly poached. the hollandaise was great. All on top of a satisfying biscuit. Also, the grits were superb!
We had great breakfast and cocktails!! I had the cinnamon pancakes - delish!!

The food wasn't bad, it's a casual brunch place. Nothing I would write home about. But really friendly staff and things move efficiently. MUST use their app to reserve (you can do it through Yelp) otherwise you wait forever.

My husband and I are from Baton Rouge and we went to the Ruby Slipper about two years ago as we were staying in New Orleans just to have some fun. I must say around 10ish it is packed!!! We were lucky to get there before the crowd and that was a 30 minute wait even then! However, I had the fabulous shrimp and grits my husband had the stuffed french toast( peanut butter and candied  bacon infused into the bread)!!! Do I need to say more? I love New Orleans! I wish they would build one in Dallas! Deep Ellum maybe? Love this place! Next time I'm in New Orleans the fam and I will raid this place! Yum

I am in New Orleans for the first time. The staff is Excellent!!! The food, I ordered a dish called the Costa Rican. Two of us Latinos ordered it. It was ok..not real Costa Rica food. Close imitation.  But the atmosphere was amazing

This place is super cool. Ambiance: kinda noisy, lots of energy, fun place. Service: they're busy but they get it done with a smile. Food: Cochon eggs Benedict are killer!  Drinks: bloody Mary's are excellent. 

You might have to stand in line to get in but it's well worth it! Can't wait to go back to NOLA.

We ate there twice for breakfast. The food was delicious. The mimosas were yummy. We had Louisiana omelets, stuffed french toast, Southern breakfast with the best biscuits and awesome fried green tomatoes.

This place is really good. We spent about 90 mins in line but it was worth it. Everything in the menu seemed as regular brunch dishes but it was so delicious. The service was pretty good. Drinks were amazing. I loved the place. I would like to come there again.

Food was delicious!!! Bacon Bloody Mary's were awesome. We did the online waitlist thru Yelp and showed up checked in w host stand and only had to wait about 15 minutes. Can't wait to come back and try again!

Great breakfast spot in NOLA although waiting for an hour and half is not for everyone. Really good service, large portions and amazing coffee. If you got time and the patience to wait it is worth it!

After landing at MSY (after a 5am flight out of BOS), the young guy and I were exhausted and famished.  He specifically asked to come down here for food.  Kid is a crazy foodie and not sure where he gets it, but I digress.

When he suggested it, my first thought was, "It's a chain... Ugh".  After reading some of the reviews here, I was really intrigued.  The menu had some great looking options for brunch.  Now you might think this BOS breed guy might be all about beans and chowder but I seriously dig good southern food.  There were so many appealing dishes... Benny, Omelets but give me some nasty good shrimp and grits and I will beg like a 2 year old Lab staring down a rib eye.

So let's cut to the chase, this interesting "BBQ" shrimp and grits maybe a bit of a misnomer but out of this world.  The shrimp was cooked perfectly.  I always get concerned that folks over cook and I would rather eat a rubber eraser off the end of my ole #2.  This shrimp was moist, great texture and a grilled flavor that was a scrumptious add.  The BBQ sauce was a savory coating of velvet loveliness that I could put on my crusty hat and make it yummy.  If you do order, get the house made biscuit - to die for.  Finally with the outstanding grits that had a creamy yet stable texture made it a home run.

Paired the whole thing with their Bloody Mary (sans the vodka) and it was a great start to a gastronomic adventure in the big easy.

Interestingly my maps said this location was closed but on 1/5/14 it was open.  

A must for both locals and tourists alike.  5 star food, service and coffee.  Great menu with sweet or savory dishes and tasty daily specials.  

Enough searching, this is the place to go shake off your hangover.  Now pick up and go already!

Another great breakfast/brunch/lunch spot in the business district.  Place gets extremely busy in the morning but its worth it.  Went with eggs benedict on a recommendation and was very pleased.  She had the bananas foster french toast, this was essentially desert for breakfast and it was amazing.  Left about half on the plate as the portion is huge and you kinda feel terrible eating something like that for breakfast.  I would recommend this place to anyone!

So what's not to like about Cheesecake stuffed French toast, or Pig Candy Bacon?? Or try the Corned Beef Hash eggs Benedict.  Four of us stopped there and none of us were disappointed. And it is not far from the riverfront where there is lots to do............
The wait at the place is absurd. Bloody Mary's are good but the food is so good in New Orleans that there is nothing unique here to rationalize waiting for 90 min. Your call.

The breakfast was so good! we found this little place on our last day, which is a bummer. My husband got the traditional breakfast, but I was a little more adventurous and tried the Costa Rican breakfast. It was beyond words amazing, I highly recommend it for something a little different. The name and story is pretty cute too, "there is no place like home".  We tried their double mimosas and they were perfect (I like my mimosas mostly champagne and just a tiny bit of juice, also I'm pretty sure they used fresh squeezed juice)

It was a little busy, and we would have had about a 20 minute wait, but we decided to sit at the bar and eat right away. 

All the different Benedict varieties that came out looked amazing. Its a shame I didn't have more time to go back and try them.
Coffee still sucks, beef hash was good flavor but for 3:50 as a side it was too tiny for that price. All of two potatoes in the thing. Always busy too

I reaaaaally wanted to like this place..... I loooove french toast... But i DO NOT love soggy french toast.... Actually theres nothing i hate more than soggy french toast...the waiter was ook..... Maybe on the next trip ill try the cochon which is what they are known for..
Amazing breakfast spot! Diner feel, great southern dishes, the Cochon Benedict with debris was amazing!

Starting this review off with the Bloody Mary. And it is delicious! Not too spicy not too salty. It's just right! We are at the one at 200 magazine in New Orleans! Now on to the food! I had the rubys basic breakfast and it was great! I don't think you can go wrong with this joint! Everything our party had was great! Oh and the biscuits are huge and amazing!
amazing I've been here for 5 days. unfortunately we didn't find this place sooner we would've ate here every meal! hands down best place we've eaten out the entire trip!
Very good breakfast. My wife had a bloody Mary (loved it) and the Louisiana Omelet with shrimp and cheese and loved it. Don't be intimidated by the lines. They seat you very quickly
OMG the St. Peter was delish!  Where else can you get fried catfish on fried cheese grit cakes!  YUM

Great food. Great service.  Terrible policy!

Got rude attitude from the hostess.
Cannot bring any outside beverages.

Ate there 2 times. Great!
Spent $200. Worth it.

Policy ruined my 2nd experience and wanted to warn others. Not coming back.

Definitely worth the wait! It was very crowded and loud, so if you are looking for a quiet breakfast or brunch, this is not the place for you. If you want a lively meal with amazingly sinful food, this is wonderful. You must try the candy bacon!

Arrived in New Orleans Friday morning, cabby recommended Ruby Slipper Cafe for brunch.  Our group of friends, 10 of us, met there. They did a great job getting us seated. While I waited I of course had a Mimosa, which was good. I had the Eggs Cochon, well worth the price.  A homemade biscuit with braised pulled pork on each half each topped with a perfectly cooked poached egg and a layer of hollandaise sauce lightly covering.  The blend of flavors was amazing. It was a lot of food but ate it all!!  The service was good.  I would definitely go back!!

Great, great food. Long line. Recommend you use the No Wait App. Rude female bartender who gave bad first impression of the service. I'm glad we stuck around and disregarded her bad attitude because everyone else was super sweet along with yummy food. The egg Cochon is amazing!!!!!!

If you ever visit New Orleans, you have to go to Ruby Slipper.  I've stopped at the French Quarter one and the one in Baton Rouge, and now I've the one in Uptown New Orleans. All are great but nothing beats going to a New Orleans one. It's the birth place of the cafe!

The pancakes are delicious but you have to taste the egfs benedict(any variety) amd the candied bacon. You will be full after any visit and whoever you with will be satisfied.
It was good but not amaaaazing how people say. My husband's fish he ordered was really good, I got a mix one, and frankly it was okay. I guess I was expecting more seafood

If you look for best eggs benedict's in town that is it. 
Visited mulitiple times and quallity was always on point same as service . True 5 star

We really enjoyed this place - loved that we could have an option to choose two types of eggs Benedict because there was so much to choose from. Also the French toast was amazing - recommended. 

I highly recommend getting on the waitlist via yelp on your way there. The line is long because this place gets a lot of people and this is your way of jumping in the line right away.

Breakfast on our last day in town. Good, home style cooking. My wife and I both had pancakes and eggs. She had the pork sausage, and I had the bacon. We also both had orange juice and coffee. 

The food was good, not great. I'm not complaining, it just wasn't exceptionally awesome. The pancakes are thick and filling. I couldn't finish them, though I would have liked to. 

The service was appropriate. Our waiter was attentive, but not overwhelming. 

My biggest problem is that it was freezing in the dining room.

Overall, I would recommend this place to anyone wanting a simple, diner breakfast. Four stars instead of five because it was unbearably cold.

fantastic nola breakfast.

awesome service... but a v e r y long wait!!
Pepperjack omelet with a biscuit and potatos were to die for. So were the eggs cochón and blueberry and cream cheese stuffed french toast. Highly recommended!

7:30 am on a Thursday and no line with our choice of where to sit.  

Had the peacemaker with eggs cochon and corned beef bennie.  It was hard to decide which I liked better.  One of the poached eggs was over cooked, but I'm not knocking off a star because that doesn't bother me and it still tasted great.  

I was also glad that they had almond milk for my coffee instead of milk or cream.  

Most importantly, the staff was incredibly nice and attentive.  Already planning on going again.

Extremely too long wait
They give waiting times that are inaccurate 
Was told 1 hour to 1 hour and 15 minutes but waited over 1 hour and 50 minutes 
When you do not have time to wait around doing nothing
This place is not for you

Had brunch here twice, last two days.  Was busy which was a downer, but the great food explains this!  Had shrimp Blackstone the first time, was totally blown away, as also my wife was by the incredibly yummy peach stuffed french toast.  Today was not as spectacular ..but still very good overall.  Had Ruby's Crabcake today which was again, quite good, and my wife had eggs Cochon which she liked a lot but is essentially a meat bomb.  

Anyway this place had stellar food overall and is priced well.  It's a bit noisy inside, I enjoyed sitting outside on a nice day better.

My husband and I had breakfast at the Ruby Slipper on Saturday and Monday this week. Both times we ordered the Chicken Saint Charles. I decided that if the Chicken Saint Charles was so amazing, I should try something else. I ordered two eggs over medium, bacon, potatoes, biscuit, and a fried green tomato. The eggs were cooked to perfection, biscuit was delicious, and the fried green tomato was divine. Unfortunately, the potatoes and bacon were not up to par. The potatoes were not very good. The potatoes seemed slightly burned and had no flavor. The bacon was very fatty and could have been cooked longer. The fat was still white. My husband orderer the same thing except his eggs were scrambled. His potatoes and bacon were the same as mine.
The bartender, MJ, was attentive to our drinks and very friendly.

IMHO - Ruby Slipper didn't really live up to the hype or the long, long wait. 

I started with a Bloody Mary with the House Bacon-Infused Vodka. Quite a tasty bloody! 

I got the Corned Beef Hash to pre-game my main dish with and it was just OK. I actually took a few bites and decided to just pass on it all together and wait for my meal. I ordered the BBQ Shrimp and Grits and it was good. That's just it, good. 

I think the food was good and so were the drinks, but do I think they are wait around the block for an hour good? Maybe not. Service was great and sometimes it is fun to try a touristy spot. So, if you have your heart set on coming to this place and are prepared for the wait, I say go for it! They come around and take drink orders while your waiting, so that will help a little. ;)

We had an amazing experience at this restaurant. Just happened to stumble upon it on Canal Street when taking a walk. We were greeted by an amazing server Amaris. the food was really good and they have a unique menu with choices for all types of diets. Our server was more than polite and very knowledgable. Service was great. Food was great. For the smart eaters, try the egg whites and smoked salmon. We had to back for seconds before we left town. Definitely on our list of favorite restaurants. Thanks Amaris! ;)

If you're a brunch fan, Ruby Slipper is sure to impress.  First, a pro tip.  Make your reservation through the No Wait app and then you don't have to wait for over an hour outside the restaurant (though the nice servers will let you order beverages while you wait).  My friend read through several other reviews on Yelp! that suggested the same and it definitely helped us out.  

Second, come with friends who like to share, because there are so many good things to try here.  My friend and I split the Chicken St. Charles, the Eggs Cochon, a side of the grits, and a side of the breakfast potatoes.  All pretty remarkable.  Also, portions were large and I struggled to finish everything!  Lastly, the brunch cocktails looked deelish, but I opted for the grapefruit juice.  Not sure if it is squeezed in-house, but it definitely hit the spot and came in a ginormous glass.  Overall, a must-try for brunch!

My friends and I were in town for the weekend and this was the last breakfast we had in New Orleans. We loved it, we ordered the Croque Madame, Egg Cochon, buttermilk pancakes, and French toast. I had the Croque Madame and it was delicious! It was so much that I didn't get to finish eating it. Our waitress Rachel (if I remember correctly) was so nice and great. They have great food for a great price, just be prepared to wait a while even on a Monday morning. Definitely, would recommend to anyone, it is worth the wait.

Stopped in for breakfast, saw a huge line but was a single so was able to get right in and sit at thr bar. 
This place was popping. Every plate I looked at looked like enough food for 2, as well as delicious. Their bloody mary's are a hit and they usually have about 2 giant buckets of the mix made.
I ordered the Southern Breakfast, which came with 2 eggs, grits w/cheese, a friend green tomato, a biscuit and bacon. OMG!!.it was so tasty and filling for only $9. The biscuit wqs my favorite part. I would say this was my favorite breakfast I had while my trip in the city. 
The prices range from $8-$14 per plate.
I gave only 4 stars because the lady behind the bar who was serving me was not the nicest and seemed like she did not want to be there (she got nice when she handed me back my bill.
Next time I am in New Orleans, I will be back.

Waited an hour for a table for Sunday brunch. The four of us ordered four different omelettes with sides, and pancakes to share. It was all good but not that special... I got a spinach and goat cheese omelette and it was really loaded with cheese so that was good.

The mimosas stood out - mostly champagne, with a splash of OJ - yum!!Service was quick and friendly and didn't feel rushed despite them being very busy.

Frankly as I was preparing to leave NOLA, disappointed by virtually everything, I thought I'd give the town's cuisine one last try so decided to brunch at Ruby Slipper Cafe. There was a 45 minute line but the wonderful hostess sat us in 10 minutes! What a delightful person, and genuine not fake! I ordered the house special Eggs Cochon, my daughter the Migas. 

The Mimosa and Bellini were delicious and plentiful - not a ripoff like most places in NOLA - and the food, manna from heaven. It was one of those situations where you're full but can't stop eating because it tastes soooo good! Pork debris on a wonderful biscuit with a poached egg and hollandaise!! Let your imagination, and taste buds, run wild!!! I'LL BE BACK!!

This is as good as it gets for breakfast in NO. Great wait staff, fast service, great food. I had a southern breakfast and it was just great. Kid had chocolate pancakes and loved them...wife wasn't hungry but she said even the toast was better than most toast she has had...I certainly recommend.

Warm welcome from all and great atmosphere. Our server Ashley was very nice, fast and professional. Wife had Spanish omelet and I had CBH Benedict. Both to die for. All in all an awesome place. 5 star earned.

This was our first meal when in NOLA in early May 2013. We tried to find a few other places via Yelp but they were both closed. This was our 3rd choice and it said it was closing at 2:00. we got there at 1:40 or so.

We got 2 things, 1 recommended by the waitress (and people here) and the catfish special. Because I wanted catfish and it looked good. 

First was the eggs cachon, as recommended by several people and the waitress. This was average. I liked the toasted roll as a base and the meat was obviously well-thought out, but it lacked flavor to bring it all together. The eggs were poached too long so they weren't very runny. And there was too little sauce. On that note, too much meat threw off the balance because it didn't have enough flavor, not enough sauce, and not enough egg yolk. 

I love the concept though. Maybe it was rushed because it was too close to 2:00? We didn't get the feel from anyone working there that this was the case. They were content to let everyone just sit there and enjoy the day. 

Second dish was a catfish special, which had plenty of sauce and some pork and spinach and tomatoes and artichoke hearts and was nothing short of incredible. Go here, get this, if it's on the menu that day.

Overall I'm a fan and it's possible I go back to try the Migas or the lox, but there's so much good food in this city I try not to go back to the same place twice.

In edit - I changed this from a 4 to a 5. After spending 5 days in NOLA I appreciate this place more. The food was fresh and innovative, and in light of everything else we ate it was a 5 star breakfast place. Since it was the first meal we had here it was hard to judge it in any context. After 5 days of fried oysters I realize now this is a bit above & beyond many of the other places here.

Waited an hour to eat here.  I am not sure I would do that again.  Service is ok.  Saw our waiter 2 times that was to take our order and to bring the bill.  The food is good but nothing spectacular.  They charge $4.00 for a 3 oz cup of black coffee and there are no free refills.  The highlight for me was listening to the amazing jazz player on the street while standing in the heat for an hour.

Best food ever.  Great breakfast. Our party had the stuffed French toast, creamy cheese cake filling with blueberries. Fantastic!  Fried chicken, poached egg on a biscuit, to die for. Chicken was cooked to perfection.  Bananas foster was out of this world.  One of the best meals we had so far.  
Went to Ruby Slipper in Decatur two days later 
Food was good but poached eggs were over done, hardly any blueberries on the French toast. 
Recommend going to the one on Magazine, seems to be a better chef.

One of my favorite brunch spots when my family comes to visit from California. It has many standard breakfast items but also New Orleans specific renditions. The mimosas are wonderful and they have a very good system for being on the waitlist so you don't have to physically stand in a line you can get notified on your phone and know how far you are on the wait list.

We were so excited to explore on Magazine street and after a slow start to the day we knew we needed food fast. Right off of canal, Ruby Slipper was calling our name. Luckily for us the wait wasn't bad at all! We got a table right away and were ready to order. Since I had been having already heavy food on our trip, I wanted something a little lighter for breakfast. I opted for the breakfast sandwich which had a fried green tomato, two pieces of bacon, pepper jack cheese, and scrambled eggs. As soon as I got it i knew I wouldn't be happy. The eggs were cool and thrown haphazardly on the sandwich. The bacon was definitely delicious, but that was the only thing. This was super dry and I would have appreciated a suggestion for a sauce or topping. Even doused in hot sauce this was great. On the other hand, my partner had the Catfish St. Peter and that was to die for. She was such a happy camper as her food was hot and saucy and those are the things that we love! My suggestion is to not skimp on brunch here and get the hearty meals!

We went to the location on Canal St. It took about an hour to be sat, but the food came out quickly and was delicious. Honestly, I was a little disappointed in the shrimp and grits. There wasn't much shrimp, and I would have liked to have had more reduction sauce. But the biscuit was huge and delicious. The service was wonderful and we left full and happy!

I'm not sure this place was worth the wait, but they do take your phone number and text when the tables ready. My party of 5 all said they enjoyed their food. I however got the smoked salmon Benedict (which turned out to not even be smoked salmon but instead canned salmon) and it was very dry and fishy.

We ate breakfast here and glad we did.  I had eggs, grits and pancakes and they were great.  I had an Irish Coffee to start the day off with a bang.  We heard it gets crowded so we got there at about 7am and there was no waiting.  We were seated quickly, order taken and food delivered just as we ordered.  Would go back if in town again.
First time in New Orleans and I was not disappointed by the food, by any means. The food was amazing, atmosphere was super nice and everyone was having an amazing time! Coffee was also delicious!
Great service and food was amazing! Recommend you use app for reservation to avoid long wait.

The manager (tall, thin guy) wanted to force my daughters onto the street during a windy storm after a 90 minute wait outside in the cold.  Food is good, and fast service once inside, but lacking gentlemanly manners.  I don't understand.

If you are in NOLA and miss the Ruby Slipper, book another flight here. Awesome food, awesome service, awesome drinks.  Shrimp boogaloo/eggs Cochon Peacemaker combo platter is incredible. Perfect spice/flavors and eggs will make you cry.  Our server Freddie was hilarious and attentive. He took our customer experience from a 10/10 to 11/10.

Nothing spectacular but the food was decent.  and the service was good. I ordered the Bbq shrimp and grits but there was too much sauce so I changed to a shrimp omelette with a side of grits, which was good and filling

My mother and I went to the Ruby Slipper for Breakfast on Thursday. We ordered the Eggs Blackstone, Eggs Cochon, Grits, and Bananas Foster Pain Perdu to share. The Bananas Fosters Pains Perdu (French Toast) was delicious. The grits were nice and creamy, but a little cold. And the egg dishes were yummy, but we thought the hollandaise sauce was a little bland. Overall the meal was very satisfying and if we find ourselves in NOLA again we will definitely go back to the Ruby Slipper for a good breakfast.

Had to wait to get inside for Sunday Brunch, but it was worth it! We had a pretty good size group too, probably 8 dudes, post bachelor party. Everything on the menu sounded fantastic. Trying to order was the worst part of the whole meal. I walked over and asked a few other customers what they were eating. Everything looked delicious. Ridiculously good food. Friendly service & atmosphere. An overall great experience.
Delicious insanely good. I highly recommend the Banana Foster French toast! There was not a wait there were lots of tables available and the wait staff was very quick.

This has got to be the best breakfast place around!! The wait is definitely worth it :) i got the chicken st charles bc i was dying to have southern fried chicken. So delicious. 

The atmosphere is cute and cozy and the wait staff is very nice and helpful.

4 stars only because of the long wait! You can order drinks & sip on a margarita while waiting to be seated. The food was delicious. French toast sticks + the peacemaker has to be my favorite! Will come back whenever I visit New Orleans again. Staff were nice as well!

Very good breakfast. We ordered the chicken and pulled pork benedict sandwiches and they were both delicious. Mimosas were served in a huge goblet - sort of like 2 mimosas in 1. We went back for breakfast again the next days. Yum!
I had the bananas foster French toast... OMG it was soo good!  I had to order extra bacon, though.  Their bacon is awesome, too.  Next time I'm in New Orleans, I'm so going back to this place.

Came here on 4/1/16. While my bff was at work, I came here for breakfast/brunch.  It was a downpour!  I was trying to navigate with my phone, holding an umbrella that was ineffective from the wind.  It was a struggle! I admit I got lost but what matters is that I found the place. 

First thing I saw was the freaking line outside.  Since it just me, I didnt think it would be a problem getting a table. 45-minutes later, I sat at the bar.  To say this place was busy is an under statement! I learned while in the plane headed for NOLA, and walking around.  That NOLA is the place for bachelor and bachelorette parties!  So ruby slipper was bustling with the two groups.  Of course a family here and there.  Lucky for me they sat me next to another lone woman. After scrolling through the menu and looking at what others were getting, I decided on Gulf Fish St. Peter.  Everything about that dish was freaking amazing. My tastebud was having party at each bite.  Fish and shimp was soft/tender combined with the crunchiness of the grit cake was texture heaven.  I didnt think I would like the mustard hollandaise but I was wrong. The dish just meshed to form one awesome dish.  

Everyone I encountered there were very nice.  From the waitress, bartender, and hostess.  The woman I sat next too was very nice too.  We started talking and became really chummy during our meal (she was visiting too, her husband was at a conference).  Totally weird and awkward, but she offered some of her food to taste and I offered mine. In the end they thought we were dining together and put our bill in one. hehehehe.  Love to visit this place again.

Good place for brunch, give it a try if you have time.. not the tidiest restaurant for sure but it's NOLA! I had 'the peacemaker' (chicken and egg cochon benedicts) and my gal got the banana foster pain perdu. Both of them were really good. (I liked the Egg cochon better than the chicken)
See my tip on this place. There was a wait but it was worth it (and it was Jazz Fest). Very nice staff and excellent food!!! Highly recommend it!

If you are of the light skin color you can be seated quickly but if you're of the darker skin color they will seat you right before closing . They have a app that shows how many people who are to be seated before you, and it doesn't keep up with the seating properly. Fucking terrible..... I clearly watch the run hostess put people before others that had been waiting for hours. Plus to top it off the biscuits were not fully cooked. The food wasn't worth the wait.I definitely wouldn't recommend this restaurant.

I've heard so many good things about this breakfast spot and every time we come to New Orleans the line is very long for this particular location. We made it early on Christmas Eve 2017 and I'm so happy we woke up early to come here. We were seated quickly and our waitress was very attentive. The food was amazing and I had a wonderful iced coffee. Will definitely come back to this location!

I ate here twice while in New Orleans for breakfast and thought it was excellent. The service and food was great as was the atmosphere. 

The first day I had the Shrimp & Grits. It was outstanding and a true local dish. The next day I had the Eggs Cochran which was also outstanding. Everyone in our group had nothing but positive things to say. It's a short walk from Harrah's New Orleans (our hotel) and we felt safe during the walk. 

I highly recommend the Ruby Slipper for breakfast.

The only reason I didnt give this amazing restauarnt a 5 star is because the hostess was extremely extremely rude. We had 7 of us and it was extremely hot 102degrees and we wanted to get a beverage from the bar and when someone in my party asked when she thought we would be sat is, she said in a very mean way whenever you stand outside theres no room in here for you! She was very very rude and she should be fired...she had a nose ring in the center of her nose if it helps to describe which one. However our server was great and the food was to die for! VERY VERY GOOD! I will be back but I hope when I do you would have replaced that rude hostess!

Great place for a breakfast, brunch or lunch that doesn't break bank.  We went to the Ruby Slipper because it was right across from our hotel.  At first I was hesitant because of how close it was to our hotel and thought it'd be a boring breakfast compared to all the fancy brunches in the french quarter.  Well, I did not regret this place.  Seated right away.  Ordered.  Had food within about 5 - 10 mins.  I had the Eggs Blackstone which was delicious- ate the entire plate.  Never knew tomatoes and eggs were so perfect together.  My boyfriend got the Bananas Foster Pain Perdu.  He is not a fan of rum but said he couldn't taste it and thought it was delicious.  I would definitely recommend this place to anyone.  Wish they had one in the Northeast.

Great Food! The butter for the biscuits was AMAZING! There is definitely a long wait to be seated. I would suggest using the yelp feature that allows you check in online. It notifies you of how many parties are in front of you. You can explore the city while you're waiting. The wait is worth it. I definitely recommend experiencing the food here. I would come everyday for brunch if it weren't for the long lines and wait!!

Love this place!  I can't tell you how much the wait is worth it and if you are an eggs Benedict fan then this is it!  The drinks are amazing and the food is what you expect from a brunch place!   Be sure to get something from both sides of the menu!  You will not be disappointed!  One of my new faves for them is that you can put your name on the waitlist on Yelp and save some time!  Good job Yelp and Ruby Slipper on that one!  Must try when you are in New Orleans!!!

I came here for brunch for the first time with three friends, and we had mixed food experiences. I had the banana pecan pancakes, which was in my opinion the best plate on the table. One friend ordered BBQ shrimp and grits. The shrimp definitely did not taste like BBQ, and the grits were really bland. Another ordered the eggs blackstone, and rather than having it accompanied with biscuits as described in the menu, the "biscuits" were like grits in patty form. It was strange, and it also tasted a little bland. I would definitely come back for some more pancakes, but be wary of ordering a savory dish. 

Also, be prepared to wait a while during busy hours.
BANG! BANG! BANG! That is its. I had the best grits at the ruby slipper.The food is excellent. The service is good.

The slipper on Canal is a lot slower and has a lot less atmosphere than the other two in town. The food was ok if bland. We had a Blackstone eggs Benedict and the bloody Mary. The beacon infused was by far the best if the two. Service was ok if a bit inattentive given the time of day and the crowd size. The wall seating had a postage stamp of a table that was elevated to the point of needing a ladder. My date was a short woman and it was challenging for her both ways, up and down.
This is my favorite place in New Orleans!! Great Service! Amazing Food! Wonderful Atmosphere! Ask for Allen! He's wonderful and is easy on the eyes!

Everything was plain plain other than it being doused in butter. No herbs or spices to be found in either omelette we had, the sausage tasted like a meat stick, and the latte was a rather typical milk float.

We were not at all impressed. Oh and the 'bartender' who was making coffee beverages said he couldn't make an iced latte because it would be 'too watery' or some bullshit. What? Even the waitress was confuses trying to explain it. We said okay hot is fine.

Our waitress was friendly though so bump a star.

The concierge at my hotel told me this is the best place for breakfast. I can't say that she was incorrect!  I had fresh orange juice and benedict cochon. The pulled pork was tender and flavorful, delicious sauce on a fresh southern biscuit.  Oh, and the Fresh orange juice was.. fresh! No place like the the ruby slipper!!

Love this place! We come here every visit to New Orleans now. The first time we ever visited, I tried the Benedict with pulled pork....YUM!!!! This time Chelsea helped me decide on the cheesecake stuffed french toast with blackberries. It was absolutely delicious. I was afraid it would be too sweet but it was not...it was the perfect blend of savory to sweet and it didn't put me into a sugar shock like most other fruited pancakes or such anywhere else. One of my son's had the migas which was also delicious. Chelsea is an excellent waitress and the rest of the staff was all smiles and welcoming. Absolutely worth the visit!!!

I've heard and read so many great things about Ruby Slipper that I'm inclined to believe my experience there was a fluke.

Still, for a 70ish% full lunch rush with a theoretically full staff on board, I should NOT have had to stand like an idiot for 5 minutes before seating myself.. had to wipe my own spot at the bar clean before sitting down ... and asked for a menu. At that point I should have just left, but curiosity got the best of me. I waited over 20 minutes to order -- and finally, 20 minutes later my plate was wordlessly left to me by a food runner.

The food was 3-4 stars-worthy. The portions were small, but I much prefer to be served a plate that actually fits in the finite confines of my stomach than the piles of food typically served at your standard greasy spoon. Because let's face it -- I will eat it. 

Biscuits were dry, but the eggs were perfectly poached. Bacon -- obvious ace. Hollandaise -- lacking. The fruit was cantaloupe, watermelon and pineapple -- better than I expected. Overall the staff, when present, were friendly, though clearly rushing. But I left completely underwhelmed, $20 the poorer, with a satisfied stomach and palette, and a somewhat passive desire to try them on another day. This place has potential, and I've heard only excellent things, but something was seriously amiss, and I'm thinking it's a seriously beefed up lunch schedule. 30% more employees would have made a huge difference.

The brunch was amazing!  We waited 35 to 40 minutes  for a table, which was 5 less than quoted. Once seated we were greeted by a smiling waitress who happily explained the specials. We tried the cochon benny and the fried chicken biscuits. They were equally wonderful. The service was consistently good throughout the mean which was incredible considering how busy they were. The busser cleaning the tables around us was smiling and greeted the customers warmly.
Awesome breakfast! Cool vibe. Banana french toast rocked... and sitting at the bar, my coffee cup never went dry!

This place so good! Awesome service and awesome food. I had BBQ shrimp and grits and really enjoyed it (I'm a shrimp and grits snob). I highly recommend this restaurant and plan to take my sons there today!

I'm so glad we got the chance to be added to the waitlist before going. The wait wasn't too bad once we got there. For those whose just walked up and got added, the wait was much longer but it is worth it! The staff was friendly, the food was amazing, and the prices are good! I got the cinnamon swirl pancakes, chicken sausage, and cheese grits. It didn't last long enough for a photo op. My girlfriend had an omelette, biscuit, cheese grits, and absolutely loved the pig candy bacon. We thoroughly enjoyed everything and it looks like you can't go wrong with anything on the menu. We will definitely be back!

Say at the bar and had a very good Bloody Mary and tried the Chicken St. Charles. The chicken was lightly breaded and the biscuit was great, not too dense or heavy. Completely full dining room but the wait wasn't bad. The staff was very nice.

Was looking for a breakfast spot that served it all.  Well I found it! Shrimp or catfish and grits are a must!  

My boyfriend wanted the traditional pancakes and bacon, and he loved every bite.  

Great servers make it even better!
The food is delicious here. There's nothing terribly original about any of it, but what they do they do well. Next time I'm in town I'll gladly go back.

Great locals hot spot for breakfast.  Highly recommend the eggs blackstone on a biscuit instead of english muffin like they make them in CA. Friendly waitstaff and worth the wait if you go at a busy hour.

The shrimp and grits and omelets are fantastic. This particular location is home to a Bonnie and Clyde bank robbery, once upon a time, though the atmosphere is much more laid back now. Service is fantastic. Don't miss this spot for breakfast. They also have a location near the Superdome.

We ate here twice during a week in NOLA.   We loved it.  Our waiter Jake was totally fab.  He took pictures of us, and went along with the silliness of our group (we had 2 Brits who have never met a stranger)  We enjoyed the food very much.  

The second time our Brits went, they didn't have the wonderful Jake as their waiter, but still persuaded him to take pictures.   It will be on facebook I'm sure

Don't waste your time and energy on this place we waited for over an hour cocktail server that brought us to bloody Mary's specifically stated there were only serving doubles outside which was not true... Once we were seated inside we ordered A bloody Mary that was served with no garnish as well as no straws which the Server never  brought back and ordered our food! The food took some time to be served and when it was brought out it was lukewarm at best as well as nothing to write home about! Spending $70 on breakfast and walking out not feeling satisfied with no management on the floor or at least presence is completely wrong!
