I proceeded to call the establishment which nobody answered the phone all day Sunday as well as Monday morning when I did finally get a manager Jennifer on the phone she basically had attitude and act like she was doing us a favor don't bother going to this establishment it is very poorly ran and they're much better restaurants to eat at that appreciate your business and this town! Try Jimmy Jay's it's fantastic we ate there three days out of eight days of being here and had great service and food as well!!!

The food was amazing! Pork on the St Charles was juicy, eggs perfectly poached--excellent! Tipped off to us by locals and didn't disappoint. Need to use Nowait app to get a good place in line as you head over there.

The location in the business district was quite busy, but got us in and our in no time. I chose the Florentine omelet with potatoes and Applewood smoked bacon. No disappointment on my plate. Service was fast and friendly and the food was worth every bite.
Awesome food and worth the wait. Had shrimp and grits which came with a maple butter and biscuit that was to die for! Great mimosa too. Highly recommend if you are in NOLA.

Our concierge at  our hotel suggested for us to go to Daisy Dukes.  THat's a breakfast joint I went to on my last visit so I knew what and where it was although my husband on the other hand was making me take another direction.  Although, I knew where this place was my hubby didnt but than couldnt find it anyway.  He remembered from a earlier walk this place when we past it and and we right down the road from it and said let's go there.  So glad my hubbys memory served us both right.  :)

There was a little bit of a wait, but I have found all good places to eat have to be waited for so I was A-OK with that.  When we sat at the bar we ordered a Mimosa, go double!!  The single will go to fast on ya and no one goes double in Nawlins.  Besides, it's so damn good!!!

My breakfast was a bit simple but still very good!  I had a Biscuit topped with bacon and egg, tomato and Hollandaise sauce (I know I spelled that wrong).  It was simple and I liked it!!  The sauce was very good and the mimosa complemented it.  

Cant remember what my hubby got, Im sure it was something I wouldnt order for myself but I know he liked it as well.  Something with a lot of meat in it.  But it was good to him.

I've been to NOLA back to back years. I've waited forever to try this place. (Coming from Dallas). First year, we didn't get the chance to try it because the wait was nearly 1-2 hour wait. This past weekend, Thanks to Yelp for placing us on the waitlist, we finally got our seats and got to try this place out. Overall, this place is great. As you're waiting outside, you'll have a server take order for drinks as you wait patiently for your table. Server was wonderful. Food was awesome! I had the Smoked Salmon Omelet. The flavor of the Smoked Salmon and omelet was such a great combination! Definitely must try if anyone wants to be spontaneous and try a Smoked Salmon Omelet.

Came here for breakfast on a Sunday morning. Nice little spot.

There was a really long wait but we were able to find two seats at the bar and sat down right away. I felt kinda bad watching all those people wait outside in 90 degree weather while I enjoyed some really delicious grits. 

They had some really nice menu options such as crabcake and eggs, and banana's foster french toast. I just had grits and bacon but the guy next to me had the crabcake breakfast and it looked really good!

The coffee was a bit bitter, and though the bartender insisted that we had half & half in our little cream pourer, I'm certain it was milk. Cream would have helped the coffee.

Order: Shrimp Boogaloo Benedict, Pineapple Cheesecake Stuffed French Toast, Cappuccino
Pros: Delicious food, crazy variations on standard breakfast items
Cons: Really heavy food

Thoughts: The Ruby Slipper is an interesting, and delicious, blend of creole and southern breakfast comfort foods. Most of their menu consists of those amazingly delicious, gut wrecking, artery clogging amazingness (think biscuits, gravy, sauces, fried, and butter). Then, to give it their own unique take on things they add a creole flair to it. For us this meant adding shrimp and andouille sausage to the eggs Benedict and stuffing the french toast with a pineapple cream cheese concoction.

We went here for our final breakfast in NOLA and I feel like that was the best time we could have gone. The breakfast was very heavy and we spent the next few hours walking around the city burning off the breakfast. Heavy DOES NOT equate to bad in any way, in fact the food was delicious. What it means is that you definitely wouldn't want to eat here each day, and you probably wouldn't want to eat here and then sit for a long time, unless you want to fall into a food coma LOL. 

I really enjoyed their unique take on breakfast items but would definitely hold off on visits for days I either really need some comfort food or when I need to only eat 1 meal that day.

Would give 5 stars if they invested in a space heater by the door. A restaurant of their caliber should know that their tightly spaced seating will be affected by the elements when the door opens and closes. Today it was chilly in the morning and the cold air kept blowing on our backs during he whole meal. Service was above average and food was above average. I had the black stone breakfast w grits which was excellent. Best part was the pouched eggs. I get pouched eggs the majority of the time I eat out for breakfast and they were done perfectly. The biscuit however was slightly stale and crusty. The ham and cheese sand which was great though.
Not sure about the food but the Bloody Mary's are excellent... We got one for the walk and it was great.

Wow!  If you're looking for a crisp and fresh experience in NOLA, come to the Ruby Slipper.  I had the classic southern breakfast.  It was fast and good.  Classic old fashioned breakfast.  Too much to finish!  Loving this place.  I will be back.

You really can't go wrong with Ruby Slipper. The service is fast and friendly,  and the food is generous and decent for the price.  Their biscuits are a little on the doughy side by virtue of being enormous, but they come with a bomb ass cinnamon butter.  And their omelets are flush with filling.

The line can be crazy but if you use the app you are told a time to show up with little to no wait. If you do have to wait they will serve you drinks outside. The food was JUST what we wanted. The best homemade biscuits!! Amazing Bloody Mary's! Friendly, fast staff. Very efficient for how busy they are. Our food came out so fast!

Ah-ma-zinnnggg!!!!!! Had a crazy night on Bourban street so we needed a good place for breakfast to cure our hangover. This place was honestly one of the BEST breakfasts I've ever had. I had the eggs Benedict. They allow you to choose two different ones. I had the one with the chicken and the Cochon one (can't remember the exact names but it was their two specialty Benedict's). My boyfriend and I also shared the stuffed French toast with bacon. I am not a bacon fan but I had both bacon strips because they were to die for. If you are in Nola, DEFINITELY check out this place for breakfast/ brunch. I wish they had one in Miami, fl!!!!!!!!!

We came here for brunch on a Sunday morning. It was a 35-45 minute wait for 2. We decided to go ahead and wait and I'm glad we did. We were seated in about 30 minutes. I had the Eggs Blackstone. It was a biscuit topped with tomato, bacon, and a poached eggs. It came with breakfast potatoes. I also had a Bloody Mary which was really good, but made me remember why I don't drink them anymore. I tried Lauren's mimosa which was good as well. Will definitely return if I have the chance!

Man, this was an amazing breakfast experience.  We got a coveted seat outside and the service was incredible!  I had poached eggs with shrimp and a delicious sauce over fried green tomatoes and biscuits- stunningly delicious.  If you are even slightly inclined to get the cane butter, do it. It's creamy and sweet and good on anything.

Ruby Slipper is entirely overrated and not worth the wait at all. I came here at 9:30 am on a Monday morning, was given a 30-45 wait estimate which turned into an hour. Hour-long wait aside, service was slow and unattentive (but very pleasant when received) and the food was extremely mediocre. I ordered the shrimp and grits, and while the shrimp reduction sauce on the grits was tasty, there wasn't enough of it to add flavor to the grits. The biscuit that came with the shrimp and grits was a large, soggy mess that is surprisingly disappointing for it being made in the South.

Its location in the middle of chain hotel central should have been a giveaway to its mediocre quality.
Brunch on New Years Day with my family. The place was packed, food was great. I had the chicken St. Charles because the server Jo recommended it. She was spot on. Excellent service as well.

I visited New Orleans for the first time two weeks ago for a Bachelorette Party. While there, half of our group went to breakfast at The Ruby Slipper Cafe. The wait was about an hour but did not bother us. We put our names in then headed over to Starbucks to grab some coffee to sip on while we waited. The restaurant was not big which would explain the wait. Our waiter was personable and very helpful with the menu. We all got a morning beverage to continue the Bachelorette fun. Two of our friends opted for the bloody mary which they thoroughly enjoyed and the other 3 of us got the mimosa. The mimosa was memorable because it was made with orange juice, champagne and pomegranate juice. The pomegranate juice was a pleasant surprise. A few of us asked the waiter for a suggestion on the menu and recommended the Catfish "St. Peter." We were sold. When our meal came out, the presentation was beautiful. The catfish was cooked to perfection and the cheesy grits melted in our mouths. The waiter knew what he was talking about!! Our experience at the Ruby Slipper Cafe was great and we were able to take our mimosas to go, which is an added bonus. I would highly recommend this restaurant for some good old New Orleans cooking!

I am saddened  to begin this review before we have even received our food. The check-in feature from Yelp is awesome....and thats where the goodness stopped.  We were seated at the bar...and waited on service. Two other couples were seated after us and both were served before us. My mother is diabetic and we informed the staff of this....still no food arrived. A third person sat, ordered and was served...my mother is still waiting. 

When i asked the server about my mothers food...she said okay and commenced to putting away dishes and checking on other customers. Our food arrived before she actually checked. 

I ordered a floretine omelet...i often modify my orders due to food allergies, so i didnt much understand why i couldnt modify my omelet in any way. I simply wanted 2 egg whites and 1 full eggs. My mom also wanted her eggs cooked over medium well (just a little runny egg yolk). They were unable to accomodate either. Rather, they were unwilling to. 

Once the food arrived, neither of us were impressed. I was so disappointed because the reviews were awesome. My mothers eggs were too hard, her fried green tomato was unseasoned. The only redeeming quality was the Ruby Sunrise.

Now, to my surprise the guy next toe noticed me typing my review and asked that i add the wait to get your bill. He mentioned others around us who were seated after us had their bills AND had left. Even as i am writing this, i am waiting for the server to take my payment and EVERYONE who was seated after us (with 10-15 mins) have ALL left.

Unfortunately, i must rate my experience as a 1 star. The fact that there was no urgency behind my mother's  ( who is elderly) condition is enough to get my blood boiling.

Can't miss this spot. Love that they have a bar to eat breakfast at. On a recent trip from Texas to Florida I made sure that I had stopped and enjoyed breakfast hearing going and coming.  Any of their breakfast specialities are truly just that.  Wonderful spot.

The staff is extremely friendly. The restaurant  is clean with a fun atmosphere.  The food looks picture perfect.
I had the Croque Madame. The ham and cheese are delicious.  The only complaint  would be  that there isn't  enough sauce.
 The varieties of eggs Benedict  that we saw all looked amazing.  I will  probably try one next time.

This place was so good we ate there twice in three days. It didn't hurt that our hotel was directly across the street but we were certainly lucky to have been so close. Best bloody mary's in town and very delicious unique takes on breakfast classics. I tried there catfish and grits and I never in my life would have thought catfish for breakfast would be good but hot damn was it tasty. The fried chicken eggs Benedict is sinful, but you can go to church when you get back home. One of the best breakfast spots in town. You won't be disappointed.
The Benedict's were divine. Get the one where you can get two different types. Make a reservation otherwise your in for a long wait.

Warning: DON'T FALL FOR THIS TERRIBLE TOURIST TRAP.  

Rachel the server, or lack there of, said "this is the most overrated restaurant in New Orleans."  It took 2 hours to get sat down (we checked in online).  The waitress quickly took our order for some eggs benedict and tea.  When the "hot tea" came, Rachel brought us...cold water.  She explained that they don't have fresh hot water and that the same issue happens every day.  

After an hour wait for eggs...Rachel was right all along, "who, in their right mind waits 2 hours in line for eggs?".

Rachel mentioned that "this place is always like this" 

SO WE LEFT.  

If you own a smart phone, look up any other place around (like El Patio) instead of letting the Dementors at Ruby's suck your soul and time.
average diner felt like a chain because it is

Before traveling to New Orleans, I read many great reviews about this restaurant, and the Ruby Slipper Cafe definitely lived up to the hype. I ordered the bananas foster French toast, which was delicious! The meal and service were worth the short wait. (approx. 20min).
Apparently you can place your name on the waiting list online, prior to arrival, which I would highly recommended.
I hope to return.

Wait time too long
To be seated too long to eat too long 
By the time your food comes you're so mad can't even enjoy

Service was friendly when it came but not attentive.
I watched others enter, wait and walk after no greeting or engagement. A simple hello, we will be right with you would have worked.

Food was great and served quickly. Not many patrons at the time. With creative menu options built on local favorites this chain beats most breakfast options around!

What a Horrible Experience!! The service was good and so was the food. The Horrible Experience was we waited over 45 minutes for our food. Which we forgiven.  But, when they the brought our food out. It was wrong. They forgot my wife's potatoes and pancakes and they forgot my hash. And the worst part is they made us pay for the whole bill and didn't comp us anything!! I will not and would not recommend this place to anyone. Its one thing to louse our food ticket and another not to make it right other than giving you 1 free side of ham and biscuit. At least a one our of meals if not both should have been free!! Which we shouldn't have to ask for after the Horrible Experience we had...!!!!! A company that cares would reach out to people like myself and would want to make it right..!!!! 

Update: 12/26/16: 
I received an apology. Like that's suppose to make up for the Horrible Experience we received..?? NO. These companies have a lot to learn about making customers Happy or making things right when they don't...!!!!

Servers and hostess were really nice, prompt, and the coffee while you wait was a really nice touch. Coffee was local and yummy. 

This was likely the worst place we ate at in NOLA. The server was super late with our orders, I'm talking 45 mins or so, and then turned up with a plate of shrimp benedict without any shrimp! When he got back, it was 4 pieces of measly boiled shrimps with a splash of bland tomato sauce that tasted out of a can.

Horrible experience will not be back. If you do want to give it a try, for the love of god, don't try shrimp anything.

The food was AMAZING! Definitely recommend, great place for brunch! BUT, Here is the reason I gave them 4 stars and not 5. I used the NoWait App and saved my place in line while on my way to the restaurant. Once I got there I confirmed with the hostess to make sure my name was on the wait list, she told me I had my place in line and that she would send a text out when my table was ready. I was told the wait time for me was 15-25 minutes. After waiting for about 35 minutes I found it odd that I didn't receive a text or hear my name. I go back and ask the hostess, she tells me that someone came and said they were me and took my table. I didn't understand that because I should have received a message to my phone for when the table was ready and I was standing there and I NEVER heard my name get called. However, we all make mistakes and I really appreciated how they handled the situation. They were very apologetic and accommodated us immediately by giving us the next available table. After that small hiccup, the rest of the service was great!

Great seating and vibrant environment! 

Came here Memorial Day weekend (Make reservations in advance on Open Table) and it was quality service with the food and the staff!

This place can highly recommended during our visit! It was right across the street from our rental house and was very inviting! I had the eggs Benedict with fried green tomatoes and the fried chicken variety! They were amazing!!! The flavors popped and the spices were expertly crafted . I have recommended he Ruby slipper to my friends coming to NOLA. A must have is the boozy iced coffee. It was just what I needed after a long night on the town!

OMG this place is amazing Sean was great the service was great just 5 min. Walk from the French Quarter I had the French toast and the fried chicken benedict. Yummm... Sharing I'd the best thing you can do to try everything.

Went here for breakfast  - clean, great prices, good selection and great service.

My wife had the steak & eggs, I had the poached eggs on a biscuit with pork "debris" - due to a mistake by the server I actually ended up with two entrees (and both were great).

Really wanted to get back here again before we left town, but didn't make it :-(

The place is cute and clean.  I got seated right away.  I ordered and my food was out within 5 minutes.  My only complaint would have been that the food and the coffee were not especially hot like I like stuff to be.  But they were both delicious.  

I went with the house special, the Migas, and was quite happy with it.  It was flavorful and the sausage had a little kick, but not horrible as I'm pretty sensitive to spice.  I would definitely recommend to try this one.  The shrimp and grits looked divine as well, but southern shrimp and grits is not the best dish for someone as sensitive to spice as I -- if you like spice, though, I would definitely try it as I'm sure its fabulous.

Very good food but expect to wait or call ahead and put your name in. We went for lunch with 8 people, everyone was very impressed with the food.  I got the Reuben. It was great not traditional style and they seem to put there own Creole spin on the food and it's got great flavor. Looking forward to coming back for breakfast, which is what they're know for.
The staff was so nice at this location and being able to make a reservation through Yelp was a major plus! But the food and drinks weren't really anything that special.

I went to the Magazine Street and the Canal Street locations.  I liked Magazine Street better, but the food was similar at both.  The best thing I had was actually a biscuit!  The counter guy didn't seem to know much about the food, but he doesn't have to as long as it's good.  Had the "corned beef hash bennie," which was good, though there could have been more beef in the hash.  The coffee was pretty good vs. other coffee I've had in New Orleans.

Words cannot describe how amazing everything was. I couldn't decide which Benedict I wanted so for I believe $1 more they will give you 2 kinds since it comes with 2 on a plate. I got the salmon and fried chicken. The salmon has a really rich flavor so I wouldn't recommend ordering it without being split. The fried chicken Benedict was amazing. 

Also, they had the best service of all the places I visited. Jacus was our waiter and he did a phenomenal job serving and recommending what to get.

Delicious Bloody Mary's and amazing service. We had the sweetest gentleman when we visited shortly before Halloween. He had glasses and was so friendly, helpful and offered tourist recommendations. 

The food was delicious and I plan to return upon my next visit to my favorite city.

Amazing food and service from Alex - he even acted as a mini NOLA tour guide with his recommendations for events and restaurants! We shared the cheesecake French toast (heavenly), chicken st. Charles and Migas. Everything came out hot and delicious. The coffee and drinks were great, too. Ruby Slipper is one of the most unique and delicious places to eat in a city full of amazing food.
Great service and food... The Costa Rican and French Toast breakfast is a must try

Great brunch spot in Nola. This place is always packed, so you know it's good. They say their Bloody Mary is "world renowned" and I can definitely see why. One of the best I've had by far. The service was great and everyone was extremely friendly. This will for sure be a go to place when I'm in New Orleans. 

Make sure to get the stuffed French toast as well, for those with a sweet tooth, this will hit the spot.

This was recommended to us by some friends who spend time in NOLA, the original was across from our hotel.  We noticed lines the first couple mornings, so on Sunday we got there 15 minutes before they opened and we were in a line of about 20 people.  
For all the buzz we were a little disappointed.  My wife ordered the 3 Little Pigs omelet It was a whole lot of food, but she thought she would have enjoyed the Banana Foster more.  I had the Eggs Cochon, pulled pork on top of biscuits, topped with poached eggs.  I expected more flavor from it, since on the menu it is their signature item.  Both of us had biscuits served with our meal and thought that they were very dense.  

We had planned on going back the next morning for breakfast, but after our first breakfast we decided not to.

The Ruby Slipper was a great way to start a busy Friday of sight seeing. We arrived when they opened at 7 and were seated right away. The options on the menu were terrific- it was hard to choose between the Cochon eggs Benedict and the Costa Rica platter. We enjoyed our good and the coffee was tasty. Our server was happy to provide us with coffee to go. A great spot for convenience and flavor!

This place was amazing. We waited 35 minutes but they offered us drinks while we waited. Once inside we got our food in about 15 minutes and it was fresh and nice presentations. I ordered the Costa Rican place it was to die for! And my husband ordered eggs Benedict with fried chicken and one with corn beef hash! It was all an explosion in our mouths definitely must go here for breakfast!

Definitely don't use the waitlist through Yelp. This is a review of that service. We waited an hour. Checked in when told and they told us at the door it would be another hour and a half even though the waitlist and app said 20 minutes. No one cared to update us. We couldn't wait any longer so didn't go. Huge waste of time and the restaurant couldn't care less.

This place is great. Family friendly. Food is excellent. Can be long wait. But worth it
Use the Waitlist option in Yelp that really made it easy. Great service. Good food. Good drinks.

Soooooooo good. The hostess staff was a bit off in their estimates wait time to seat us and the texts didn't seem to be happening but no big deal as we got seated still. We sat at the bar where both bartenders were wonderful. The menu was interesting and hard to make decisions from. We ended up settling on the pick two benedicts and the Costa Rican with a side biscuit. Everything was amazing!! Make sure you get a biscuit.

Loved this place.  Arrived just after 8 a.m. on a Saturday and it was perfect timing.  We were seated immediately but the restaurant filled up very quickly after that.  Our server, who was fantastic btw, recommended the bananas foster French toast and it was amazing.  Regular coffee was also good and refilled quickly when my cup ran low.  Wish i had more chances to try other breakfast items because they all sounded fantastic.

We actually ate breakfast twice at the Ruby Slipper during our visit to NOLA.  Yep, it was that good!  On our first morning in town we decided to try it out.  We choose it both because it was right across the street from the hotel and also because they seemed to be a popular spot with the breakfast crowd.  I waded through the crowd and the super friendly hostess took my name and said it would likely be 10-15 minutes for a table.  

I wanted something different and local so I went for one of their signature items, the Eggs Cochon.  It starts with a homemade biscuit that's halved, then each half is topped with a pile of pulled pork debris, a poached egg, and finished with hollandaise.  It was freaking great!  The biscuit tasted very fresh and the pork had a nice hint of smoke to it.  The whole thing was just what I needed as a base for a busy day of bar hopping.  I tried their grits and wasn't too impressed, but that didn't take much away from the great meal.  My brother got the Eggs Cochon too and loved it as well, and his wife got the Eggs Coubion.  Hers was "Thin-fried Mississippi farm-raised catfish over French bread  spears, topped with poached eggs, a sautè of spinach, tomatoes, artichoke hearts and tasso, finished with a Creole tomato Courtbouillon".  Wow, she shared some of her catfish and it was awesome.  At first it seemed weird to get fish and eggs for breakfast, but after seeing it I could see trying it out sometime.

The next time we had a longer wait, more like 30 minutes.  Probably because we had a couple of more people then, making a party of five.  I went for the Bananas Foster Pain Perdu.  I wanted something sweet and it fit the bill nicely.  They use French bread spears and cover them all with the rum-flambéed bananas & raisins, with some bacon on the side.  It was great!  Everyone else loved their choices too: a couple of Eggs Blackstone, Louisianan omelet, and a Spanish omelet.  

I can't vouch for all their locations, but this one in the CBD was awesome. I would recommend it to anyone looking for a great way to start their day!

I went with the Peacemaker.  I did a combination of Eggs Cochon and Chicken St Charles.  The place is noisy but fun.  I also had the candy bacon which I highly recommend as a dessert entrée. The food is phenomenal and it easily explains the high ratings that this restaurant deserves. Expect a line at the Ruby slipper but it's well worth the wait I highly recommend this place!!

This place is fun! We sat at the bar and had coffee and a Bloody Mary to start. The Bloody Mary was great and we felt it when we stood up!

For food we ordered the st Charles (eggs Benedict with the protein being fried chicken, can't go wrong!). I love hollandaise and I felt like there could have been more. The eggs were also a little overdone (not really runny) but the flavor was there!

We also had the bananas foster pain perdu which was very good. It comes pre dressed with syrup and could have used a little more (probably something we could have asked for more but it was pretty busy).

We had to try a side of the pig candy (basically caramelized bacon) which was pretty good but not mind-blowing like we were thinking it would be. 

Overall we loved our food and spent $52 for all of the above (including tax and tip).

I love the one in mid-city but was downtown and tried the one on Magazine.  Food was cold - eggs were cold and appeared not to have been scrambled to order and they were crumbly, not a good texture.
Our food came minutes after we ordered so it must have been cooked in advance.
The fried green tomato was cold so I know that was cooked long before.
The biscuit was cold and very white - not browned on the bottom.
Service was good and the waitress was nice and attentive - and it wasn't cheap.
They need to step up their game or this place will lose its popularity.
I'll head to mid-city next time.

Of course I'm going to say the same thing as everybody else.  This place is really amazing. Between the food and the staff there is no way you're going wrong. DEVIN our waiter is the epitome of New Orleans fun.  Part of dining out is the experience and he had our whole table laughing  from start to finish. If you are even questioning if you should come here then you don't wanna have good food or fun.

The shrimp and grits here are BOMB. Might've been my favorite thing I ate during my weekend NOLA trip.

Also ordered the banana foster french toast. It was too sweet for my liking I could only eat a bit so definitely share it with friends!

My girlfriend and I went here recently on our mini-vacation to Nawlins and while heading back to our hotel after our second trip to the casino, we happened to walk by this place. I was starving and since both of us love breakfast food we decided to give it a try because it seemed to be pretty poppin' judging from the huge line we saw there earlier that day. (Unfortunately, when we're on vacation and we've been walking around all day, sometimes we make our decision on where to eat based on how packed it is inside. ) The wait was only 15 mins when we got there and when we sat down it took a little while for our server to find us. Our food came out surprisingly fast (probably 5-7) mins after we ordered. I got the corned beef hash and my girlfriend ordered some sort of pulled pork benedict. The corned beef hash was pretty salty but the benedict was pretty good.

Pros:
Interesting decor and clean
Friendly staff
Pricing wasn't killer
Breakfast food
Serves alcohol lol
Tastes pretty fresh
Speedy service

Cons:
Salty food (for me at least)
Pretty darn loud. 
Doesn't do take-out (I think the hostess said only on the weekends but idr)

Overall I would give this place a 3-3.5.
We put our name on the list via yelp so didn't have to wait in line for brunch. Food and service were both great! Would highly reccomend when in the area.
This new location of Ruby Slipper did not disappoint. Hospitable waitstaff, delicious food and mimosas (per usual).

We came here because yelp had such amazing reviews!  The location is great and easily accessible.  We sat at the bar because the wait wasn't as long.  My husband and I both ordered the eggs Benedict's. We did the mix and match.  I got the shrimp and chicken, and he got the pork and corned beef hash.  They were all pretty darn Good!  My husband ordered iced coffee which we didn't know was not refillable and he drank quite a few cups which added up quick.  Our waitress also said, "you want that with potatoes or toast?" Which I assumed came with the Benedict's, and they did not.. They were extra.  So we left paying about $60 for breakfast which was a lot!

There was a 30 minute wait for a two-top table on a Tuesday morning around 10:30a. The wait was worth it: we sat at the bar and had great, attentive service. The coffee was good and the brunch HEAVY.

I had the smoked salmon benedict on their prized biscuit, and my fiance had the fried chicken and biscuit. I must confess my food jealousy: the fried chicken and biscuits were better than my smoked salmon. The mimosas (like all the drinks in NoLA) are generously poured with a full cup of champagne and a splash of orange juice. If it weren't for the daylight outside, you'd thinking everyone was having breakfast for dinner as the crowd as lively and jovial, drinks flowing, and the amount on the bill at the end of the meal.
This place will be packed most days. Be sure to use Yelp app to get on the waiting list before you go. It cut our wait time in half. It is worth the wait !

Upon arrival, there was a waiting list but we were warned forehand so we expected it. Our server was nice. Service was good for a busy restaurant. Two of my friends got the Eggs Cochon and they said it was alright. My other friend got Croque Madame but she was too hungover to enjoy it so her boyfriend helped her eat it and actually preferred that over the Eggs Cochon. My Eggs Blackstone was good, nothing spectacular~ Nice experience though for someone who's just visiting in town.
Stellar place! Costa Rican breakfast was spot on, and the chorizo scramble was even better!!

This place is good but I couldn't taste the love in the food. 

Our server was amazing, the kitchen forgot my food and we had a hair on some food. It was okay I just wish it was better!
Everything was really good. It's packed. Getting a place in line via yelp was excellent. Eggs boudain, scrumptious. I rode solo this time. Definitely bringing the family back!

I would have put a picture, but it would have been an empty plate shot. Jimmy our server was awesome, such a great place such a great choice...the food is cooked to order and cooked perfectly, you will love this place

Great spot for breakfast.  Put your name on the waitlist before you arrive.  Our wait wasn't that long at 1 pm on a Monday. 
Food was fantastic. Shrimp Bugaloo Benedict and Bananas Foster Pain Perdu  are not to be missed ! 
Bloody Marys amazing.  
Our Waiter Jake was helpful and friendly, made excellent suggestions.  Very helpful navigating the menu with food restrictions.

Well worth the walk from the Convention Center for friendly service and big, tasty  breakfasts at a moderate price. And yes, worth the walk even in August when it's over 90 and humid - the breakfasts are that good.

Overall a great experience! I had been to the one on canal years back and remember a great meal. Our serve at the bar was awesome and super informative. I ordered Benedict but the both eggs had completely hard yolks which ruined the entire dish. By the time the server was able to come back and quickly offered some fresh poached eggs, the rest of the food was cold. Small mistake that ruined the experience.

Went there on 7/23 with great expectations because of reviews, and having seen the long lines of people waiting. I ordered the banana foster french toast and was very disappointed due to the lack of flavor and substance. My wife ordered the Costa Rican breakfast and was also a disappointment,  no flavor whatsoever. Mimosas were overpriced at $10 each....
Great food. You will definitely wait in line, but they move the lines pretty quickly. French toast was amazing and I recommend the mimosa!
Can't say anything about the food, we didn't stay long enough to order, the music was so loud we couldn't carry on a conversation and left

Nic breakfast spot that has a flare of a Cajun twist on the menu if you have never tried or if you have tried eggs Benedict this is a really good spot for breakfast it didn't wow but didn't disappoint at all!!! Enjoy and go early!!!
Long wait on Sunday morning, but well worth it. I had the chicken St. Charles and it was delicious.

If you are a breakfast lover this is the place for you.  Sit at the bar, get there early, or prepare to wait for a table.  Service is excellent at the bar and the food is superb.  Reminds me why I LOVE breakfast so much!

THE best Sunday brunch for the price. We intended to go to another restaurant down the street that had an absurd wait on a weekday morning, so we turned around and walked back to our hotel to find another spot. On the way back we passed by the Ruby Slipper Cafe, which had cute outdoor seating and -- a short line! We only waited about 15 minutes to be seated and our server was there shortly after.

I got the simple Ruby's Basic Breakfast, pretty much standard breakfast food after a night out. The only thing I didn't love was the breakfast potatoes, I like them a bit crispier than they were. But I still can't believe how little I spent for the amount of food. Anyone who's been to NOLA knows how expensive the restaurants can be, especially in this area. I'm coming back here next time I'm in NOLA, which will hopefully be soon!

On a completely unrelated note (but there's no Yelp account for it) the nail shop down the street, Escape Spa & Nails, is awesome!

My husband and I were encouraged to go here and we are glad we went! 

We went here for breakfast on a Thursday. They have multiple locations and this one was extremely packed. We used the No Wait app, but honestly our wait was just as long as if we showed up and put our name down. 

Was it worth the wait? 100% yes!

I ordered their signature Ruby Slipper mimosa which was a classic delight. I also ordered the Grilled Fish St. Peter which was fish and grits and a suggestion from our waiter. I also got a side of eggs and a biscuit (greedy, I know, but I needed it!) The  fish n grits was mouth-watering good. The fish was grilled perfectly - juicy, done and not dry! It was a filling dish and every bite was perfect. The eggs were good and the biscuit is a must have! It comes with their house-made honey butter!

My husband ordered two meals (he also needed it lol). He ordered The Peacemaker which lets you choose two of their signature eggs Benedict. He chose Hot-Smoked Salmon Bennie and the Chicken St. Charles. The poached eggs were perfect and the flavors were amazing! He also ordered the Hot-smoked Salmon omelette which he really enjoyed. 

Out waiter was such a sweetheart and very attentive to us. The hostesses were also very nice and made sure we were seated ASAP since we waited for so long. I'm really glad we chose to stop by as it made our honeymoon even sweeter!
Great mimosa, outstanding breakfast.  A must try if your in the big easy.
came with the bike tour and had the egg cochon and it was good!

Just had a wonderful breakfast. One of the best things about it was our server, Freddie. He was the most attentive and genuinely nice server we've had in a long time. He couldn't fill our coffee fast enough and the restaurant was packed. The "cane butter" for the biscuit was great. Can't say enough positive about our experience.
The stuffed French toast and the grits are the best!!! I will be going every time I visit!!
Great place for delicious food.  You can mix and match the Benedicts, so get try at least two!  Unique flavors and dishes.  The bacon is FD!  A must go place each time in NOLA.

We went to ruby slipper for a late drunk brunch and it was typical NOLA style.  The drinks were made strong and to our liking by our hilarious waiter, including our to go drinks!!  My lady and I shared an eggs benedict dish because the portions at this place are ENORMOUS.  Splitting was the way to go. We were stuffed, satisfied, and happy with the wonderful food. Highly recommended!

Felt like I was home!! The Ruby Slipper is a great place to eat. I always come back here every summer when I'm in town for the #Essence music festival. The Brandy milk punch is delicious along with the banana pecan or double chocolate pancakes.  Great atmosphere and location. Prices are well within the budget. A lot of food for under $12.

My go-to brunch place in the CBD.  So many awesome menu options, but faves include:
- Eggs Cochon
- Chicken St. Charles
- Corned Beef Bennie
- Bananas Foster Pain Perdu
They also make a delish brandy milk punch.

I always leave stuffed, smiling, and with enough leftovers for second breakfast.  Don't expect to take a jog or do anything active that afternoon though -- the food is very heavy and will weigh you down for the next several hours.
Wow! I would eat breakfast here every day. We had the stuffed French toast and the bananas foster French toast. Both were fantastic! Everything looked amazing. Definitely worth the wait.
The line to this place is long but worth the wait. Food was good. Buttermilk pancakes was delicious. Chicken st. Charlse was great and savory. Gcany bacon was tasty. The meal was great.

We got to this place 20 min before they opened which was the best time because by the time everyone got in it was already full and there was a wait for anyone who had gotten there late. 

I had ordered the Bananas Foster French toast and she ordered the egg cochon. Mine was so delicious and made to perfection. They use French bread instead of regular bread which made the bread crisper and could withstand the onslaught of syrup. The bacon slices were really thick and were made just how I make them at home with not too floppy and not too crispy. She didn't finish hers but I got to finish hers and it was amazing as well. The pulled pork was so tender and it paired well with the poached egg and biscuit. it was really an amazing experience and it set the mood for the whole day.

Entering the Ruby Slipper Cafe I felt as disoriented as Dorothy must have felt upon setting foot in Oz.  "I don't think we're in Louisiana any more" is what I thought to myself.  With its public commitment to the environment, composting, recycling, and buying locally, the Ruby Slipper seems more like the restaurants back home than those in New Orleans.

As I am not from the South, it also came as a surprise to have a waitress call me, "Mah dahlin".  In my book that's good for a few extra points on the tip.

The Bananas Foster French toast was simply the best french toast ever.  I am accustomed to French toast that comes with a heavy syrup that makes my stomach hurt half way through.  No such problem with the Ruby Slipper rendition.  I like French bread, so it only makes sense that French toast from French bread would work well.  

Visually, the Bananas Foster was also a treat.  It has the appearance of three lengthwise slices of banana (the toast) topped with round slices of banana.

I could eat this all day.  Nirvana.

Love love love!  This place is a great place to come for breakfast and a Bloody Mary (or whatever your drink is) just outside the French Quarter.  Britain was our server at the bar and she ROCKED!  Great service, food and drinks. Can't recommend enough!

Great Experience.  Eggs Benedict choices are amazing.  Especially the Cochon.  And use the "Add to Waitlist" option on Yelp!  Best thing ever invented.  It puts you in line (and their is always a line) and tells you when to check in and how many parties are in front of you.  So instead of a hour and a half wait in line, you get a 10-15 minute wait.  Way to go on that idea Yelp!

This place is fantastic, the line was very long and we didn't have reservations. Fortunately, the que moved relatively quickly and got seated in under 15 minutes of waiting. To my surprise, it was worth the hype. We came to try the Banana Foster Pain Perdu and the Benedict Cochon. What a treat! I was a little bit hungry and wanted to eat more than the Cochon Biscuits. I'll have to come back and try the others.

They accept credit cards, the service was friendly and the fast. Most of the patrons dining there seemed to be in a hurry to make a quick stop in for work. There didn't seem like there was that many eateries so early in the morning for breakfasts in the CBD.

Had a wonderful brunch here.  Much has already been said of their wait system and app.  It was great to get some delicious cappuccinos while we waited.  Wasn't going to drink but was persuaded by the not so subtle motto "you can't drink all day if you don't start in the morning"!  Very generous pours on the Bellini and mimosas, love both but really hate that you end up paying $10 for a thimble!  These aren't in skinny minny champagne glasses so worth the $.

Food was delish.  I had the signature " eggs cochon".  Eggs Benny topped with applewood smoked pulled pork in debris on biscuits.  Hubby had hash Benedict.  

Hats off to Rakhal our lovely server who made my day by asking if we needed any dental floss!!!  How's that for unique service.  She literally carries around dental floss--genius!

Heard multi times that this was the best breakfast hands down. So of course I had to pop in this spot. I ordered the peacemaker cause I like eggs Benedict but the shrimp one was the best I ever had I wouldn't even mess with the others on the menu.
Food was good. Margarita was strong for 13 dollars.  Long wait, but the app was helpful and accurate.

We put our name on the list ahead of time online for brunch (strongly suggest you do this!). The wait ended up being a bit longer than we were told, but at least we got in in a reasonable amount of time. The food was delicious, the service was spotty but not bad, but it did take awhile for our food to come out (not a huge deal, except that we had already waited for a long time outside). I loved that you could mix and match the eggs benedict- and the Chicken St. Charles was pretty amazing. I'd definitely come back for the food and atmosphere, but anticipate a long wait and keep your service expectations low.
So delicious, esp the banana pecan dish and Salmon Benedict ! We enjoyed the food and vibe at the restaurant. Yum!
Great food and no wait times. Really friendly staff!!  Came twice on my first trip to New Orleans.

Great place for breakfast. 

I got the Bananas Foster Pain Perdu. It was so delicious. However, it was bit sweet towards the end though.
I've seen so many good reviews for this place so I was expecting to be wowed but I was really underwhelmed. It was nothing special or worth coming back to but still a solidly good breakfast.

Great comfort food and great service! We went to the location on Canal Street and it was fabulous! Eggs Benedict of all kinds and coffee was hot, strong and kept flowing. If you are in the mood for a great breakfast without a diet conscious this is the place to go. Yum!

We stayed at the Pelham Hotel so it made sense to eat breakfast at the Ruby Slipper which was just downstairs from the hotel. I ordered The Peacemaker to get the Eggs Cochon and Chicken St. Charles, a great combination for Benedicts. The Peacemaker was flavorful and tasty. The meal was big enough to last through lunchtime as well. My wife got the Catfish and Grits, which tasted bland.

Firstly- AMAZING Bloody Mary.

 Also, the wait staff was exceptional- fun, friendly, and super attentive. If you don't mind a bit of a wait to get a table, totally worth it. Next time in New Orleans I am definitely coming back here for brunch!

Had the shrimp and grits. I usually don't like grits, but I wanted to try this since many reviews had mentioned it. To my surprise I really liked this dish. The shrimp was delicious and packed with flavor. I wish I had more shrimp!! The sauce the shrimp is cooked in really flavored the grits. Boyfriend had the Migas, which he thought was pretty good. Overall, our food was good and we weren't disappointed.

Our server Kevin was great! After our meal, I remembered to check in and found out that we get a free mimosa. I showed it to him and he was nice enough to give me the free one after we had paid for the check. Thanks!
One of the best breakfasts in NOLA! Great vibe and awesome staff. It's hopping all the time so be sure to check on yelp for wait times and put your name in before you head over. It's worth the wait!
Visited Ruby Slipper for our last brunch while visiting NOLA. It was fantastic. Fruit mimosas are a must have.
Delicious food! Amazing. Didn't give 5 stars bc I found a small hair. Would still recommend

It's a shame that our experience didn't even make it to the table to enjoy the food. But my number one is service, and because the restaurants food is good, it doesn't compare to the way your treated because that has a significant impact on your visit.

We were really excited to try the food cause we had heard such good things about this place. We had bought Starbucks on our way to the restaurant. The hostess told us it would be about 20mins for a table yeah sure fine. Our group of four all had Starbucks in our hands. So it was clearly visible to the young lady we had them.

We waited the 20mins and my friends all finished their Starbucks before me and I still had 2/3 of my latte left. When the hostess sat us down she said "oh by the way there is no outside drinks allowed" there all of us were dumbfounded like uhhhhh NOW you tell us? I just spent 6$ on this and she is telling me I can either throw it away or she can hold it at her little host stand. 

I get it you don't want to take away from your business of your crappy auto drip bland coffee but she should have told us to make sure we finished the drinks before we were called in. My friend far from ok with this got a separate cup to put the coffee in so I don't have to throw it away. Of course the hostess being a major B word decided that's not ok and my friend asked for a manager. And I spent four years in food service and I still haven't forgot the days that the customer is always right. But this guy started arguing with us claiming we were verbally 'attacking' him. What? Look if taking away from your business of the Starbucks coffee is threatening to you why is the big deal putting it in a damn cup a problem that has no logo on it? 

In the end the manager caved giving us the cup but by the time we all sat down we were so emotionally withdrawn with two horrible service contacts one including a manager we decided to leave so they didn't spit in our food. By that time after all the arguing I had already finished the latte.

The situation could've been handle so much better then the way they presented it too us. It all started by us checking in, if the hostess told us when we asked for a table to finish before be walked in there would've been NO issue at all.

We came here based on the reviews... One star because of the ambience. I ordered the eggs cochon and it was just ok - pork was underseasoned and biscuit just bland. Hubby ordered the puerto rican and the rice and beans tasted like they had just came out of the boiling water - no salt whatsoever. Seriously, no idea why it has so many good reviews!

I wasn't too impressed with the food here. I was really excited to try their breakfast, but honestly, it was nothing special. I had the carrot cake pancakes (A special), brother had the bananas foster pain and hubby the original french toast. The pancakes were ok, nice and fluffy, however, they overloaded them with cream cheese icing, so that was the predominant taste. The bananas foster pain wasn't that good either; the foster sauce was overcooked so it tasted burnt and the french toast was too hard. The really disappointing part was that they had the same specials all week so there was never an opportunity to try any of their other famed specials.

A must do when visiting the Crescent City! The food is delicious and served quickly.  Try the St Charles Benedict , Shrimp Omelet or the Bannana Foster French toast.   They're all detectable.

Prepare yourself for at minimum a 45 minute wait on the weekends.  However you can circumvent long wait times by downloading the NOWAIT app.  This app automatically places you on the guest list an provides up to date notifications of your line placement.

The restaurant closes at 3 pm so start your day early.

Three of us went for breakfast on the recommendation of a Sheraton staff member. We were pleasantly greeted and the staff continued to be friendly and professional. All three dishes were delicious but the cappuccino wasn't hot enough. The waitress was apologetic then brought a new hot one immediately! The general manager was friendly and helpful when we asked about other restaurants. Great place to eat at.Family friendly. A definite return!
Simply the best. I will dream of the The bene St Charles forever and ever and everrrrrrrrrrr
Great food. Great service.  Freddie greeted us with a smile and made sure our breakfast was perfect.

Was worth the wait!  Small place, probably only 9 tables inside.  I had the eggs benedict and it was amazing.  Also had a carafe of mimosas which were delicious as well...will definitely visit again next time in town!
More food than I ever could have considered consuming, and a way better breakfast than I could imagine getting from just about anywhere else. Loved this.
Absolutely fabulous! We sat at the bar. Employees were fun, efficient, helpful and just plain great. We ordered omelets - 3 pigs and Florentine. Both were great
If you're visiting NOLA this is a must!  Get here early or add yourself to the waitlist via Yelp. No regrets just amazing bennies and mimosas!!!
Food is so so good.. I forgot what it's called but it had pull pork and was some sort of Benedict! Sooo amazing.. I had the bacon infused Bloody Mary.. so delicious.

Disappointed!!! Had a rock in my coffee cup, order was sent back three different times, cook doesn't know the difference between soft scrambled and hard cooked eggs. Biscuits were undercooked, I will notbe going back. Wish there was a way to give zero stars. 

G.B.
Arlington, Tx

I really wish we discovered this place on our first morning in NOLA because we would have gone here two days in a row. We tried the poached eggs over jambalaya, the eggs cochon, and the peaches and cream french toast. The two savory dishes were out of this world and I recommend both of them highly! The french toast could have used more peaches but was still very delicious.

The highlight were the mimosas... we watched the bartender split an entire bottle of champagne just for our two drinks and then splashed in some OJ and pomegranate juice. So strong and yummy, we got two to-go when we were done with our meals! Basically, go here. I will come to this place every time I am in NOLA!
Run, don't walk!  Download the "no wait" app. Amazing food. Some of our best bites in NOLA.
Very good food friendly staff. Had the treo. The pork Benedict was the best of the 3.

I went out of town not too long ago; to meet up with a friend for a quick getaway vacation.  I had never been to New Orleans before, and so my friend and I were just literally touring around, and looking for unique restaurants to eat at.  As we were walking around for about an hour, we stumbled upon this gem, and I am so glad that we did!  The food was so good, we went twice in the three days that we were there!

I loved the ambiance, the waiters were friendly, and it was just a cool environment!  I ordered the brioche French toast, which came with Applewood bacon.  And I ordered a side of Fried Green Tomatoes.  

I plan on going back to travel to New Orleans again this year, so I will definitely try to go back to this restaurant.

Love love love this place! Great atmosphere, delicious food, and amazing service. I came on a Sunday morning, and even though the place was packed and there was a line out the door, the staff was attentive and at ease handling it. I was offered a beverage while waiting outside...heck yes! I ordered shrimp and grits, which was delicious and not spicy like I would have thought. The service was good inside, and the server even offered me a to go cup of water, coffee, or mimosa. I highly recommend this place!

The Ruby Slipper was recommended to me by several people in the French Quarter, in particular for their breakfast items. While there are multiple locations in New Orleans, I went to the Magazine St. location as it was closest to my conference hotel.

Our group of 2 (yes, tiny I know) was promptly sat and we were greeted in seconds by our server Sommer. I'm not a morning person, like at all, so breakfast at 7:15am is more like torture, but our server was so polite and bubbly, it totally set the mood! She quickly got our our coffees and was totally able to read body cues when we were ready to order food. 

I personally had the Peacemaker. I think the Peacemaker was created for people like myself who consider ourselves foodies, but we can't make a damn decision. In essence, the Peacemaker allows you to pick 2 eggs benedict option out of the 8 total options they offer. So one half of my eggs benedict was called the Eggs Cochon (pronounced koe-shawn) and the other half was called the Shrimp Boogaloo. The eggs cochan was delicious, and started with half of a biscuit, shredded pork, a poached egg, and hollandaise sauce. While it was quite tasty, my taste buds exploded when I had the Shrimp Boogaloo! It consisted of shrimp cooked in/with pork and tomato, a fried green tomato, a poached egg, and a delicious buttery, tomato sauce all over a buttermilk biscuit! It was savory, rich, but not overwhelming, and had the perfect amount of seasoning! And I think what really sold it was the fried green tomato!! The fried part didn't fall off when you cut it, and had just the perfect amount of tartness that complemented the richness of the dish. WHO KNEW A GREEN VEGGIE COULD PACK A PUNCH???!!!

Needless to say, I was a really happy person! The only reason I didn't give this place a 5 stars was because the hostesses seemed more concerned about texting or talking among themselves rather than helping us right when we entered, but then again it was 7 in the morning. It would be hard for me to be super attentive at such an ungodly hour.

Our favorite breakfast place in downtown NOLA.  Food is outstanding and the service is attentive and pleasant.  Never let the line deter you - it moves quickly and is worth the wait.  Special thanks to Jonathan for making our visit this morning a truly fantastic experience.

This food is absolutely worth the wait.  This place was packed when we got there but people didn't seem to mind and people leaving gave us the thumbs up to wait.  They were right! French toast was incredible and staff was super friendly!

I give this restaurant 3 stars because I wasn't very impressed with their breakfast. First off, there is always a wait but they do have app that you can download on your phone to hold your place in line, which will tell you what time your table will be ready. I got their shrimp omelette with cheddar cheese & potatoes as the side. I also ordered the Ruby Slipper which was a mimosa. Would I go back? Probably not. The service was great though.

First place I tried in NoLa. We were starving and I was having a hard time deciding between Eggs Cochon and Eggs Blackstone. I went with Cochon and it was extremely filling. The biscuits tasted a little bit different from what I'm used to but very good. Overall it was a great dish but super filling. Definitely be hungry if you order this! I thought the coffee was really really good too. My friend also ordered the brandy milk punch was awesome. Definitely something different to try.

I recommend putting your name on the list via yelp. Not sure how much it sped things up for us, but I can't imagine how long the wait would have been if we hadn't put our name on the list. 

Bloody Mary was excellent, even good if you get a virgin Mary. 

Husband and I split the Shrimp Bogaloo Benedict which was great. The only thing that was very sub par were the french fries, which seemed a little strange that everything else could be so good but the fries kind of sucked. 

We sat at the bar, and the bar tender Julie was amazing at her job.
We waited 90 min plus.      Good food great service.   But not worth 90 min.  But they will bring u drinks outside while u wait so that's a plus

Found this place on yelp and was close to our hotel....excellent atmosphere with GREAT food....our waitress (Ashley) was very kind, attentive, and informative with other restaurants to try later...our only regret is that we found this place towards the end of our trip...will recommend to our friends that frequent NOLA on a regular basis

This place is truly worth the wait.  The food was absolutely delicious!  We were blown away by how tasty the biscuits here are.  It is well worth the $1.50 to order a biscuit of the ala carte menu.  We also loved the Tex-Mex Migas as well as the Bananas Foster French Toast.  Such a delicious breakfast in the Big Easy!
Great hip atmosphere. Friendly staff, reasonably priced. Amazimg benedict choices! Will come back!

Delicious food. I had the shrimp and grits which was wonderful. The other dish that my fiancé had was the eggs, potatoes. The potatoes were a bit over cooked. But other than that it was great and staff was very friendly.

The menu options were outrageous ... It was one of those time you wished you had a large party to taste more than one dish.

That said, I went with the bananas foster and it was epic ... I loved the blend of the french toast bananas and maple syrup ...

For the coffee freaks like me, the Java was very good, strong and flavorful ...

An all out epic culinary experience ...

The bananas foster was good.  I ordered the sauce on the side & was very glad because it was so sweet.  The Apple wood smoked bacon was very tasty.  We also ate the Migas, it was OK, but nothing very interesting or spectacular.  The pieces of chorizo were so small & there were so few pieces it was difficult to know it was actually there, certainly didn't taste it.  The chipotle sour cream is a good start but falls flat.  If they added more chipotle & a touch of salt this could be a great condiment.  The buttermilk was large, tasty & had good texture & density.
Loved it! This place is essentially elevated breakfast.   The lines to get in are brutal on weekends,  but try coming in during the week.   Great service,  and a truly inspired and unique menu.
Amazing brunch!!! My favorite spot for brunch in NOLA. Friendly wait staff and great decor

We came for breakfast and no wait at 9am on Thursday but line formed soon after.   It's very loud in here so u better speak up lol . The bacon has good flavor but a little undercooked and the grits just warm not hot. The scrambled eggs were decent and biscuits too. The best was the chicken and biscuit though called chicken st Charles. I felt so happy eating it omg. Service was excellent

The vibe is really nice. I'm into the whole post-Katrina revitalization thing. There's been some thought put into the menu but everything is on the heavier side. The food is good, but tends to the sweet side. Like, the savory dishes are still sweet. So, ‍.

3.5 MAX - but there are some extras 

Ruby Slipper, no matter the location will keep waiting on line. One of the many highly recommended meals that totally fell short, like most of the others, Ruby Slipper is really no better. 

On our last day in NOLA, we lucked up on the NOWAIT App and were able to skip the line, a tactic that saved us 30+ minutes.  

The hostess (not sure of her name) was amazing - like the best hostess ever known to man! This girl was quick, sugary sweet and professional. I genuinely fell in love with this woman within my first 30 seconds of speaking with her. 

As you wait on line to get in, there is a full menu posted on the outer window. We were seated within 5 minutes so we really didn't get a chance to truly peruse. A gent consistently works the line and gets drink orders for those who'd like a beverage (or four ) while they wait. 

Our server Michael was great. He was extremely knowledgeable of the menu, gave great recommendations and worked quickly to get us our meals/drinks.  

We had:

Grapefruit Mimosas (ok. Not strong)
Irish Cream Coffee (sooo good. Strong) 
Banana Foster Pain Perdu (good)
Bam Bam Biscuit - sub egg whites/fried green tomato on the side (delicious!)
The Peacemaker - St. Charles & Eggs Cochon (I did not sample this but my companion enjoyed this 1/2 1/2 combo a great deal 

I deducted a star because though fresh, none of the food was hot. Everything came out a level above lukewarm. Appears that's the norm here. 

Good but nothing too special. Definitely give it a shot.

Meh. It had previously been a pretty good place to eat. I recommended it to my out of town friends and was disappointed. I had chicken and biscuits. The chicken was super dry. I only ate half. My friends both god different things and were not impressed. It is not worth the long lines or getting in a queue.
Might be the best breakfast I've ever had. Must do for eggs bene! Loved the staff too. Popular place, but wait time was reasonable, and worth it.

I have yet to get a bad meal there.  My bf & I have been going since they opened.  It is hard to choose because we love everything on the menu.  Sometimes there is a bit of a wait, but so worth it!  Yummy!
Amazing breakfast; if you have a group larger than 2 be sure to come early otherwise it's packed. Perfect sized portions.

I think that something must be wrong with me..I really love brunch...fav meal! Truly! Came here based on reviews....has anyone actually eaten here?

The eggs are soaked in butter, the sausage has no flavor, and the toast tasted like it was sitting next to an onion. 

Didn't appreciate the stomach ache post eating either. Head somewhere else.

The 45 min wait was worth it as well as driving 78 mikes. The staff is supper friendly and attentive. The food presentation is spectacular.  The portions are on the larger side,  be ready to eat! Everything used in the meal is very fresh. The drinks are a must with the meal.

Delicious breakfast. Good coffee with free refills. The Bananas Foster Pain Perdu had plenty of bananas, and tasted very much like Bananas Foster, made with long slices of French bread. Highly recommended. The side fruit was fresh and tasty. Scrambled eggs, ordered soft, were solid. Fair price for a good meal. Get there before 8am or expect a wait.

Went here last October while colleagues and I attended a conference. We requested separate checks because we had to charge them on different business cards. The waitress told us "Just so you know,  we don't do separate checks.  It's noted on the menu." All three of us missed that note and understand the policy. But the way she said it was rude. Breakfast was regular fare, nothing special. If you're traveling for work, not such good service. Surprising to see this in a town with conferences and people using business credit cards.

So very good!  The long line is daunting but my husband was there yesterday check out Craig G's review and he put in our name online. His review really says it all plus with only one day left in NOLA, he insisted we eat there. He was right!  The menu is extensive and we went with biscuits with shrimp, one with pork, one with corned beef and one with fried chicken. Each had its own sauce and each was delicious!! I had a tequila sunrise made with oj and Pom. They could go a bit easier on the ice but it was made well and it was cheap @ $7. We ordered a fruit bowl which had cantaloupe, pineapple, strawberries and grapes. Great compliment to the savory breakfast. The hostess named Jay perhaps is a ray of sunshine on a cloudy day. All the servers seemed attentive and professional. I liked their array of Ruby Slipper shirts. I like the sentiment behind the name too. There's no Place like Home--happy to return after Katrina. If I had another day, I'd be back tomorrow too.

Everything about this restaurant was great especially the food. The wait is worth the food and environment of people. Michelle was our server and she was so friendly and helpful. So pleased best place for breakfast in New Orleans!!!
The long wait is worth it. We didn't know about the app to get on the waiting list. Such delicious unique dishes.

Amazing! The food is incredible and the service is also fantastic as well. Big shout out to LANCE our server for great service and warm hospitality, his service skills were on point-regularly checking in and filling up our coffee. I tried the eggs Benedict combo, one with the shrimp and the other with the pork debris. Also had the cinnamon and cream cheese pancake and breakfast potatoes. I officially have food coma! Can't wait to come back soon!
Great food, wonderful drinks. Very popular and the wait can be a big issue. Several people left after a 30 minute wait. Would definetely go back.

This a must for any trip to NOLA.    Consist service and food is always on point.  My hubs always orders the Eggs Cochon.    I tend to order different items each time.  Shrimp and grits are great as well.  If you are new to NOLA, grab a seat at the bar.  MJ is awesome.  Great conversation and local advice on new spots beyond breakfast / lunch.     I have been coming here for 5 plus years and today was absolutely the best.  Thanks MJ!
Love it!  Great food, unique menu, always a hit! Staff is always so welcoming and prompt.
A week in New Orleans and we found the best food in town on our last morning! The Ruby Slipper is awesome, delicious, has huge portions, and great servers. Don't miss this place!

We ate here 2 mornings while on our 5 day vacation to New Orleans. Breakfast was pretty good and overall we had a decent experience. I had the southern breakfast platter one day and the other I had the omelette platter. My guest had the omelette platter both days. What brought us back were the delicious mimosas...$10 each and a range of flavors.
Excellent service. Very good coffee. Oatmeal was good and huge. Bacon was a bit fatty, biscuit was enormous but doughy in the middle.

Been jonesin' for brunch for a while now, so when I realized that my hair salon is only a 5 minute walk away, I was stoked to stop here before my appointment. 

We were told the wait was going to be 15 minutes. As there is only one small bench outside to wait (forget about waiting inside, not gonna happen), Hubby suggested we take a short walk around the block. As I was already the gnarly kind of hungry, I made him stand there with me. I'm glad I did, because we were called in about half the time. 

We were given the option to sit at a table or the bar, so we opted for the table, a high two-top next to the bar. We were quickly greeted by our server and our drink orders were taken. The Yelp Bloody Mary certificate was staring at me in the face, demanding that I order the Bacon-Infused Vodka Bloody Mary, so I did as I was told. 

OH.EM.GEE. The bacon bloody mary is SO good. Maybe the best bloody mary I have ever had. It has just the right amount of spice and topped with green beans, lime, olive, lemon, and of COURSE a strip of bacon (Note: No crappy celery stick). I could just drink these all day and be pretty damn happy. Be careful though, that sucker took a long time to creep up on me. I didn't feel it until I stood up to leave, but man, I felt it. Good thing I didn't order a second one!

Our food came out in a fair amount of time. I was, and still am, a little sad that food was not very warm. More like warmish. I had the Eggs Cochon. The biscuit had the perfect texture and just the right size to not overwhelm the dish, the pork debris was sweet and delish underneath the egg, and the hollandaise sauce was divine. But it would have just been so much better if it came out hot. 

Hubby had the Corned Beef Bennie. He also found much joy in the hollandaise sauce, but did comment that he maybe should have tried the chicken. I am not a big fan of corned beef, so I have no comment. 

The service was friendly and wonderful. It was fun watching the bartender pour 17 quarts of vodka into a bucket for the bloody marys. 

Wonderful spot for breakfast/brunch. Take warning, though, the food was so rich and filling that I was only able to finish one of my eggs cochon, but Hubby happily devoured the second one for me after he finished his. I was still full until dinner, so if you are on an eating tour, you will want to plan to share.

My husband is from NOLA and on a recent visit we went to this place upon my request. Although he knew all of the BEST places in the area that we could get a bite he gave it a chance and we were NOT disappointed. EVERYTHING we had was FANTASTIC! Would love to try everything on the menu eventually. A MUST try!
Great breakfast!! Packed on a Thursday morning - but not a long wait. Michelle was our server - she was great. Highly recommend!!
This place is loud.  The food was great.  The staff was attentive and the double bellini's were the bomb!!

Hands down my new favorite brunch spot in NOLA! First off the waitress, Teresa was the absolute sweetest, she took time to walk us through the menu and daily specials, while recommending her personal favorites. She was extremely attentive without seeming like she was trying too hard. Let's get to the food, there are soooooooooo many great options on the menu it was hard to choose. They are well known for their benedicts so of course I had to try one, one problem there are so many great options and it's hard to decide. Well problem solved, they offer "The Trifecta" which offers three different benedicts, one shrimp that has a fried green tomato, one cochon with braised pork, and one chicken st. Charles (my personal fave). My boyfriend had the stuffed French toast of the day, which was filled with vanilla and cream cheese and top with baked apples, I would like to give more info on that but he devoured it all pretty quickly, so safe to say it was delicious! Will definitely be back!!

Went to Commerce for a solo breakfast, but they stopped serving breakfast at 10:30, (bummer...lets just say I am not an early morning kinda guy).  So the gal at Commerce suggested Ruby Slipper, and here I am.

Lousianan Omlette:
http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/oBNrLz4EDhiscSlbOl8uAw?select=mCVgMjHG5PeEa4cSMU8-og#fr-uhD4gFds7Qgwgmh7v0w

Underwhelming. The boiled gulf shrimp were plentiful & plump but flavorless. Cheddar cheese was also lacking is anything resembling flavor...I did see and feel the cheesy gooyieness, just couldn't taste it.  

Potatoes:
Red potatoes, quartered, seasoned and crunchy from the grill.  I would have enjoyed them if served right after they were cooked, but I was 90 minutes too late for that.

Buiscuit:
Cold and Rubbery.  Sounds like from other reviews that the biscuits are real "hit or miss" from day to day.   It looked amazing sitting on the plate. I grabbed it to pry it open, anticipating hot, flakey steamy goodness.  Nope. Sad face :(

Grits: 
Delicous and creamy.  
They got cold pretty quickly though, along with everything else.

Going to return another day to try the pancakes, they look phenomenal.

Meh. Thank god for yelp's check in because this food was not worth the 60+ minute wait we would have had otherwise. My wife's Louisiana omelette had no taste, my shrimp & grits were super greasy with a soured taste. The biscuits, iced coffee & chicken sausage were amazing but don't fall for the hype, at least not for this location. 3 stars at best.

I've been intown from Houston for 2 weeks working. Friends and coworkers tell me try this place try that place. I have not been impressed with there sugestions. I have had a good meal at only three places. This is the only one I felt was good enough to yelp about. I had the Migas and it was delicious. I will go back.

My boyfriend and I had heard about this restaurant from friends who have visited NOLA so we decided to go since it was conveniently right by our hotel. The food was good and the wait wasn't long since we decided to sit outside. I didn't get a heavy meal since I was recovering from food poisoning a couple days prior. I got the migas without cheese & I don't remember what my boyfriend got

3 stars based on service...but food was so great that it deserves 4.  So good!  Visited this location and the location on Burgundy St. .Food at both locations was awesome!  The service at the Burgundy St location was MUCH better.  However, although tasted the same, food at the this (Magazine St) location came out more hot.  Loved the pancakes, chicken sausage, cream cheese filled French toast, and eggs Benedict on top of biscuit with bacon and tomato.  Would definitely recommend Ruby Slipper Cafe to anyone looking for a great breafast or brunch experience.

Food was great. We had Banana Fosters Pancakes, Apple Pie Stuffed French Toast, French Toast and Catfish & Grits. Cons- all of our coffee cups were dirty..my hubby's had lipstick still in the lip print position. Wait was long but we chatted with the bartender while we waited. We would return again bc the food was delicious.
Very cute place! Great energy and great food! A perfect place for a Sunday morning brunch with your mom. Potentially long wait so get a spot in line!
Great place food was awesome the eggs Benedict where great highly recommend this place
Went in for brunch and was absolutely amazing. When I visit New Orleans in the future I plan to stop here again for brunch!
Wonderful atmosphere, vibrant and alive. Killer huge mimosas, omelets and biscuits. Can be the one meal you have that day.
Awesome! Food is great and the drinks are strong. Staff is super friendly!!! Keep up the great work
my dad and I are in town from Phoenix and WOW!!!!! there breakfast is amazing! I got the Saint Charles and it was delicious! I highly recommend coming here when your in town!

The breakfast here is very good! I got the Benedict sampler (I think it's called the peacemaker, choose types). I got pork and the fried chicken - yummy!! The iced coffee was actually really good as well. Great location and good breakfast spot.

Got there erly morning so there was no croud. I had the roobin and frys and there pretty good. The servise was nice the watestaff was super frenly and the atmosfear was awsome the ambeyance worked well with the expeerence. There was quite alot of good looking plates going by our table the eggs bennedic look AMAZING. The pig candy bacon was AMAZING. And the water (free refills) was AMAZING.

I had a sunburn from the nite b4. 

If your thinking about going id suggess you add your name to the wait line on line so you can by pass alot of the line with everyone wading in line. 

Definately going back. 

*The grammar freaks are going INSANE right now. And I'm sure we lost a few before the end of this review. Cheers!

Amazing food! We did the smart thing and checked into the waitlist on Yelp. Almost got seated immediately at the bar. I forgot our bartenders name, but she was extremely nice and treated us well. Despite being super busy she was calm and never rushed us with our questions. I recommend the shrimp and grits, and the bacon praline pancakes!
Awesome food. Long wait but we could put our name on the list and then go in. Great service and the buy one get one Mimosas great deal ($10 free mimosa). Will come back next time in town!!

This awesome cafe was right next door to our hotel. After seeing the amazing reviews we tried it and that's what it is. Amazing. They have a pancake flight with 3 different flavors and they are huge . They also have a mix and match Benedict plate. Soooo good . Try the pork Benedict . Wow. Check this place out !!!!!!

You will love there breakfast I recommend the Cochon Benedict it was amazing.  This was by far the best breakfast of the trip.  If you choice to get on the electronic wait list u have to keep bugging the hostess or she will take u off the list a little annoying but it was worked out.

Ate at two locations. Preferred Magazine Street. Service was above and beyond and service was outstanding. Cannot remember server's name, Edwardo?, but he was SO impressive. Great service, environment, and food.

Nasty place to eat, the kitchen looks to small for one. I was seated at the bar, couldn't help but notice the kitchen area.
