One of the cooks came from the kitchen to spark up a conversation with my friend. A light skin big guy, with a gold tooth. Smell him before he even came to the bar. Place was already pack, plus we had to wait 45 minutes for some warm food. Banana foster was nothing like the picture, cochon was horrible. Plus the st peter dish wasnt cook to perfection. Thanks for the worse breakfast ever.

This place is a morning breakfast can't miss!! Be prepared for a wait as the crowd starts early, even on a weekday. Food is very good, although they were out of brioche for my choice of Brioche French Toast. They did, however, sub some good french bread for the brioche so no harm no foul. Bellini and the Bacon (YES. BACON!!!) Bloody Mary were delish with the pickled green bean garnish (AMAZEBALLS!!!). 
Service is very attentive and Jake was awesome and took great care of us. 
Don't miss this gem. Worth waking up for!!!

I went for breakfast and sat at the bar. The service was very good and food was awesome. I got the shrimp boogaloo and it was very good. Great feel for a breakfast place and great experience. This will be my go to place when in town!
My husband and I come here every time we come to New Orleans. Be prepared for a long wait....... excellent food, excellent service and great bloody marries!! Well worth the wait!

My....my.....my. One of the best breakfasts I've had anywhere, ever. My wife and I shared two dishes, the special stuffed French toast which had vanilla cheesecake filling with blueberries on top. And the eggs benedict combo with chicken and corned beef hash.  My son also had the stuffed French toast, we each loved every bite of everything. Even the side of bacon was cooked perfectly and my coffee tasted great! Service was awesome, line was worth the wait. Highly recommended stop while in NOLA!
Could you get worse service? Literally we waited at the table for over an hour

Ordered the skinny Migas (no chorizo) and it was great. My friend had a build your own omelette and thought it was good. There was not an extensive drink menu so we had mimosas.  The line was long but it was managed very well. The staff was approachable and we had an amazing time. 

*Bloody Mary served with bacon )

I had about as good of a BLT as I have ever had at the Ruby Slipper!  It really was first rate.  I think if I had any criticism it would be that the hours are not long enough.  Sometimes it is hard to get everyone organized and out the door at the same time and we end up having to go someplace else.  We will definitely be back regardless!

This.  Was.  Amazing.  
I dined at this restaurant at the suggestion of my friend's husband, and he was right.  I had two benedicts called "The Pacemaker", one was the fried chicken and the other was the cochon with a poached egg on top with hollandaise sauce.  I loved the cochon a lot more than the chicken but hey...  I'd do the same combo again next time.

Friendly service (sat at the bar), made you feel at home.

One of my absolute favorite places for breakfast or brunch!  We have been there several times and have not been disappointed. Large portions, delicious food  friendly staff, and yummy mimosas. You can't go wrong here!

Worth the wait!  We sat at the bar and Shana and Britain (the fab servers bartenders working their behinds off) were so wonderful. They helped us decide which "benedicts" to have--and we tried four different ones. The Eggs Cochon was TO DIE FOR and the chicken St Charles was a very close second. Bloody Marys with bacon-infused vodka (amazing) and mimosas finished us. One of the best breakfasts we have had and the service was terrific.

I went here for breakfast. I had the Banana Fosters Pain Perdu. It was one of the best French toast I have had. You get 3 large pieces of French toast covered with bananas and a sweet sauce. There was also some bacon on the side. I was stuffed after eating my meal. 

Service was good. My coffee cup was never empty. The food came out quickly. This place is very close to the French Quarter.
Great service and big portions. Everything was delicious. Their coffees/espressos are better than Starbucks!

Our breakfast was outrageous! Try the pig candied bacon!!! Our server Jacus was personable, and very friendly. You must try this restaurant for breakfast/brunch while visiting the Big Easy. Our favorite breakfast place during vacation!

Places this great will almost always have a wait, so... Important TIP: download the free 'nowait' (no wait) app and you can put yourself in line before you head down and save yourself the wait! 

WOW - The Ruby Slipper totally knocked our socks off! I am always hesitant to try a place that has multiple locations over a place that stands all on its own, but this place absolutely smashed that rule. 

The first thing that really impressed me about the Ruby Slipper was how genuine and friendly the staff all seemed to be. They all were very busy but completely hustling to take care of people. It was sort of a team effort; multiple servers topped off our coffee & water, cleared plates, etc. I think it says a LOT about a hospitality crew when they all work together like that! 

Next up: the beverages. When in NOLA... Well let's just say they go all out with their bloody Mary's. We're talking whole huge strips of bacon, large pieces of lemon and lime, whole veggies pieces... It's like a salad in a boozy, tomato-y cup. Also, the coffee was darn impressive for diner coffee! 

We had the salmon benedict breakfast and the country breakfast. Both were outstanding. And the biscuits.... Ugh, the biscuits. They have absolutely ruined all other biscuits for me. They were just the perfect amount of dense, yet fluffy. Flaky, yet moist. Buttery, but not at all greasy. Just off the charts great biscuits. The grits were super tasty as well with good corn flavor, and not too mushy or sticky. My eggs were cooked exactly how I ordered them, which almost never happens because I have an oddly specific order that most chefs just can't or won't do: 'over hard, fried, dead, browned, solid, cooked all the way through'. Sorry, but that's how I like them! The ruby slipper nailed it. I finished my eggs for the first time in I can't remember how long. Yay! The salmon benedict was just bursting with meaty chunks of smoked-in-house salmon. Really, really nicely done. 

Lastly - for this incredible breakfast experience, the price was very reasonable! About $30 all in for the two of us. 

I absolutely will go back any time I'm in NOLA and can't recommend this place highly enough!!

Everything was great!  If you are looking for a casual spot, with good hearty food, this is your place.  You must plan, because there is always a wait.  The dining room is pretty big, so the turnover rate is pretty fast. Grapefruit mimosas/ berry mimosas were nice!  Fresh and tasty.    Try to go with something on the specials side of the menu, the combinations are so enticing and work so well together.  My entire party of seven, loved the entire experience.  
This is a must visit, while in NOLA.

Absolutely fantastic. Best breakfast in NOLA. The service is fantastic. The alcoholic beverages are awesome. Went 2 days in a row. The second day I had Cochon and that was delicious as well. I would definitely recommend this place.

Wow & Wow! Such yummy food here! Everything we ordered was so flavorful and delicious to eat. We ordered the Egg Cochon and the Bananas Foster French Toast. These are both signature dishes and did not disappoint.

The service was great, we didn't have to wait too long to get seated. I ordered the Peacemaker - choose two of your own Benedict's and I got the Eggs Cochon and the Chicken St. Charles. A little hot sauce on the fried chicken takes it to the next level. 

I also ordered the creamy vanilla iced coffee and it was delicious! The Nola roast was well brewed and the nutmeg was a yummy spicy addition. 

My friends ordered shrimp boogaloo Benedict and loved it. The bbq shrimp and grits were not amazing, just kind of average but the biscuit on the side was delish. 

Definitely a must try restaurant.

This place was great! The breakfast was absolutely delicious.  The portions were huge, the staff were wonderful, the service was on point.  We ordered :
1. the Eggs Cochon (Slow-cooked apple-braised pork debris sitting on a homemade buttermilk biscuit, topped with poached eggs, finished with hollandaise), 
2. the 3 Little Pigs Omelet (Applewood-smoked bacon, ham & sausage with swiss cheese), 
3. the Hot-Smoked Salmon Bennie (Salmon smoked in-house served over a buttermilk biscuit, topped with poached eggs, garnished with red onion and capers, finished with a dill hollandaise).

According to my friend, the iced coffee was smooth and made to perfection (high praise from someone who adores Starbucks lol).
We had the bar seats, and because the majority of us are short, we had fun climbing the chairs and the jumping down from them; of course, we couldn't move our seats closer or further from each other/the bar without fearing we'd tip over, but hey, what's life without a little risk?
The eggs were done perfectly, not undercooked, not overcooked. I loved the slow-cooked pork. It was melt in your mouth perfection.  One bite of that pork and all I could think of was "diet, what diet?" 

This is definitely a must try place.  You won't regret it. But beware, it does get crowded and it does get loud.  There is outdoor seating, but that's only if you can handle the heat (and I don't mean the hot sauce, I mean the actual heat).

Shrimp and grits were delicious. Corned beef Benedict and shrimp Benedict were good not great. We sat at the bar, bartender was really funny and attentive. Overall good experience. Love the yelp waitlist!!!! We got a table fast while everyone else waited over an hour

Came for brunch and we were not disappointed! Long wait but so worth it! Heaters and tables outside helped the wait!  I had two of the eggs Benedict and the rest of the table had sandwiches. Bloody Mary's were on point! Super friendly and attentive wait staff even though the place was super busy! Great atmosphere and first-class food!

Great place for brunch, mimosas are amazing. I had the pancakes with applewood bacon and scrambled eggs. My cousin had the chicken eggs Benedict!! Both were scrumptious !!! Place is trendy and atmosphere is eclectic !!

pretty nice breakfast place..eggs, bacon, special po-boys

must try: eggs blackstone

Long line, good food. Service is friendly but rushed. I get the feeling that due to them being so busy cleanliness isn't always their top priority. I live by the motto what doesn't kill you makes you stronger, so I'll ignore the fruit flies and shady looking glasses and be back for breakfast tomorrow.
This is the second time I have eaten here and the food was just as great as I remembered. I got the eggs cochon and it was absolutely delicious!  I highly recommend it!
Absolutely amazing food. Server was very nice. Had a 30 min wait. Ordered the shrimp n grits..

This place warms your heart!  Throw-back atmosphere is practical and comfortable.  Drink selections, even for breakfast, were spectacular.  Food is a clever twist on your old favorites and portions are huge.  Consider sharing 3 for 4 people and trying a bit of several.  But cost is very reasonable for the portion served and service is very inviting and prompt.  Don't walk away if you see a line.  It moves quickly and is worth the wait!

We visited the Ruby Slipper this morning And the experience was awesome. We came when they first opened and were at the end of the line but were seated right away. It's very popular so timing is key. I had the bananas foster pain Perdue. It was amazing. My wife had the shrimp and grits. Our son also had a chocolate chip pancake, but chocolate syrup was subbed for chocolate chips. Wasn't a big deal but I wish they'd been upfront about that. Other than that, service and food was top notch. I also liked the decor. It was very charming.

My wife had the Eggs Cochon which was as amazing as advertised. I went sweet and had banana pecan pancakes. She normally doesn't like pancakes because they're too mushy for her but these had a nice grilled crispy edges so even she had a few bites. The spicy Bloody Mary's were a must to start with as well.

Great food and very friendly service. Previously 4 stars due to service but it has improved since. Our favorite breakfast in New Orleans! PS get the app "NoWait" we got in line 90 minutes prior to arriving only had to wait there for 15. Much better than waiting at the street for over an hr. But yes it's that good.

I love breakfast at the Ruby Slipper! Start with the Cochon Benedict

Also, try the Chicken St. Charles Benedict, top it off with some Cinnamon Swirl Pancakes and Banana Foster French toast. The Cochon Benedict was fantastic with a mix of butter, pulled pork, eggs, and bread perfection. Replace the pulled pork with fried chicken, and you have the St. Charles. Thanks, Ruby Slipper for an excellent breakfast. BTW- I didn't love the coffee, it was lacking flavor or watered down both visits. However, I'd show up just for the Benedicts.
It's solid, I prefer Surrey's breakfast when I'm in town but this place is slightly easier to get into, more spacious and friendly. Food is solid, coffee is average. It's worth visiting .

Best breakfast I've ever had!!!  I had the Bananas Foster French toast and it was amazing!!!  And the iced coffees are to die for!!!  I highly recommend going online and making a reservation as the wait can be very long!  But worth it!!!
Soooo good, you just can't walk by! I think this was the first time I had Migas, and I wasn't disappointed.  Our server Freddie H was all that and a bag-o-chips. They treat you like family visitors!

This establishment is the benchmark for first class service. After suffering through the hostess errors, the wait staff and bus service was fantastic. The chefs behind the scene have also met the standards of all the reviews previously read. The food was outstanding. We had a wide variety of dishes served and everyone was extremely satisfied. Jennifer the owner messaged me through Yelp instantly and was apologetic and the manager payed us a visit to also apologize for the long wait. That type of service goes above and beyond the standard. I am extremely happy with the way the business addressed the problem so promptly and the experience from there on was great. Thank you again for the experience. That type of service is not expected but much appreciated. I would definitely return the food and service was great.

Return visit after 4 years. We tried the location on Magazine street again and there were easily 30-40 people outside. Don't be afraid to walk a few blocks as they have MANY locations around the French Quarter. We walked right in and sat at the bar without a wait. Blood mary is amazing, fried green tomatoes are a must, and literally anything on the menu, sweet or savory, will leave you more than satisfied. My friend had the coconut mango french toast and scraped her plate clean. The Eggs Creole other September special is to die for!

I had the pancake flight and all 3 pancakes were excellent. My husband got the trifecta and said the pork eggs Benedict was awesome, the fried chicken one was good not great and the shrimp one was ok. Lots of food.  We couldn't eat it all. Waitlist yourself with the yelp app to cut down your wait time. We went in busy time 10:00 am on Sunday and the app said the wait was one hour plus.  We got in 30 min after we waitlisted even though the app said there were 30 parties ahead of me. Check in with hostess when you show up. The food was a little slow coming but service was friendly and attentive. I would definitely go again on my next trip to NOLA.

Thoroughly enjoyed the atmosphere, staff and food at the ruby slipper.
The cafe is quite simple in appearance but has a nice rustic look. Felt like I was in a true southern cafe.
Food was awesome and we went back twice for this reason. Delicious Cajun breakfast and eggs hollandaise.
Staff were very friendly and accommodating ! My favourite food place in New Orleans

The wait was long, but it was worth it. While you are waiting there is a server asking if you wanted a drink. Friendly staff. The food was delicious. Everything that we saw come out of the kitchen looked great! Definitely try it out! We will be back!

Great food!  There was a long wait during breakfast rush hour, but it was a good indicator that this is a good place to go if others are waiting to get in.  Food was very tasty and filling.  The eggs cochon were hardy and flavorful.  Ordered the stuffed french toast off of their specialty meals menu and was not disappointed.  Biscuits definitely taste homemade.  The potatoes were more flavorful than some other places that I've been to in the area.  Grits were standard.  Added cheese to them for extra flavor, but the texture was good.  Would recommend this place and/or come back again for a great breakfast with great service.  Just keep in mind there will be a wait, but it is worth it!

I  had a very, very, very good breakfast experience there! My friend ordered the special Bananas Foster French Toast and  I ordered Eggs Blackstone. Her french toast is amazing! All fruit is fresh and maple syrup is delicious. And also 3 bacons with it. Something salty with something sweet, my favorite. My eggs blackstone is pretty delicious too! But personally I don't like the tomato inside --- the sour flavor is too strong and it masks up everything else. But it's just personal. Also, the side fruit is really good. In general restaurant services the can- fruit; but they gave REAL fresh fruit! Very, very great breakfast.

I got there when they opened in the morning and it was already popping! However, the service was not that good as the waiters pretended to be busy and like they never saw us trying to get their attention at our table. I was fork-less for 30 minutes straight so I could not tip as much as the service was bad. The food was okay.

By far the best breakfast place! I wish i could pack this place up and bring it home with me!

Get there early if u dont want to see a huge line when u walk up. Service is great. Food is fantastic with portions you wont leave hungry with! 

If your looking for just a coffee or mimosa to go.. They do that too!

Was there a couple of times in July 2018. Long wait but checking in on yelp helped! Shrimp and grits was good but not great! The ones I had were a little too runny but the flavor was there. Went another time and three of us shared several flavors of pancakes... all were excellent. Also the cheese grits were on target

I wanted to like this place but I really didn't. We rocked up for breakfast/brunch to a massive line. Best we could get was a table outside. The fact that it was a little chilly wasn't their fault but the uninspiring food and indifferent service was. My 3 pig omelette could best be described as 'meh', coffee was terrible but my companion's French toast was deemed to be excellent. I won't be back, sorry.

The service was okay (I felt super rushed the entire time I was there). I got my coffee after reminding them and they request payment while I was still clearly enjoying it. 

 I felt like my Benedict's could have been hotter as well-- it seems like they were sitting under a light. They were tasty but I would have preferred them hotter.

I use the Yelp app and when I get here, I didn't have to wait. On top of that, the food was delicious. I had the stuff vanilla French toast with bacon and eggs and my wife had the pancakes with bacon. Awesomeness
Great service! The place gets super busy but worth 30 min wait. I had eggs Benedict and others had the shrimp and grits. Very tasty ! Also had pancakes . Fluffy but too much pancake for one person!

Amazing food! The service was great and putting my name in on the app made it go faster. Everyone was friendly and took care of us well. We will be coming back in a couple days because there were too many things on the menu that sounded good!
Food was good. I wasn't really impressed it's just another breakfast so if you miss it you won't miss much. Pricey for a ordinary breakfast. Stick to the norm, Dennys, iHop.
Good service, great food. A little bit of a wait to get in (45 minutes) but I think that's expected. Luckily, the weather was beautiful.

One of he best breakfasts in NOLA!! Definitely worth the wait (side note: if you get there before 9:00-9:30am, there won't be a wait!!!). Our waitress, Rakhal, was AMAZING and made the meal that much better. 

I had a custom omelette, and others in the party had the Croquet Madame and Cheesecake French Toast. Everything was delicious!!! The buttermilk biscuits tasted like my great-grandmothers (which I haven't had since I was 13).  It's definitely worth the trip and I will be visiting again!

I was in NOLA on a Sunday morning and we had reached there very early as my friend & I had to drop off 2 of our other friends at the airport before 6am.
We were sleepy and hungry. While scouting a good breakfast/brunch place we met an elderly couple who suggested this place.
Right off the bat, we could sense that this place was in huge demand because there was a queue outside the restaurant and the hostess was taking down everyone's names and phone numbers and telling them to wait for 25-30 mins which is totally normal.
I was given a wait time of 25 mins and I was told that I'm in the queue. I even received a message with a yelp link which allowed me to check my place in the queue. I went away and kept monitoring my place in the queue. And I was back at the restaurant  entrance 5 mins before my waiting time was up & before the app showed 0 parties ahead of me in the queue. I kept waiting patiently for my name to be called out, but that never happened even when the app showed that I'm up next. I was standing right there in front of the hostess. She never called out my name and finally I went up and told her that my waiting period was up already and I've waited an additional 10 mins and still my name hasn't been called. She took down my phone number again and told me to step in and wait there.
Then I waited for another 10 mins inside the entrance of the restaurant, only to be seated at the bar, which was still fine. It was my friend's birthday and I wanted to at least sit at a table with her, but I let it go as both of us were super hungry.
Then we ordered food. The guy who took our order was very enthusiastic and nice and great to talk to.
I read the menu very carefully and ordered an omelette which clearly did not have bacon as one of its ingredients.
I received my food and my omelette was stuffed with tiny pieces of bacon, like the most finely chopped bacon and way too many of those tiny pieces. The guy who had taken our order was very polite and so I didn't complain about the food right then. Plus I was super hungry and didn't want to wait another 20-ish mins just to get the right food. I ate it the way it was, by separating out the bacon pieces as much as I could. I have nothing against bacon, absolutely no restrictions as such but I just choose not to eat any type of red meat. Our interaction with the person who took our order, was the only pleasant part of our experience here.
The food was good. The place was crowded which meant that it was a very sought after brunch place. The ambience was good and easy going.
The restaurant seemed good overall, but I couldn't have a good experience majorly because of the mismanaged queue system and the screw up in my food order.

If you want an amazing breakfast in New Orleans, then this is your stop. The line is totally worth the wait. Eggs Benny is "my thing" so I was very excited to stop here on my trip. 

I ordered the peace maker and was sure to include the fried chicken benny in my selection, and boy was I happy I did! The chicken was so crispy and perfectly cooked through. Their pancakes were also perfectly fluffy and warm. Service was quick and friendly despite the crowd!  I'll most certainly be back if I'm ever in town!

Yum!!!!!!!  So good.  We did the online waitlist, which I highly recommend.  Staff was polite.  The front of house bartender was adorable with her pink hair & amazing bloody Mary's.  I had the southern BLT.  The fried green tomatoes on it was delicious.  Rest of the table had several kinds of Benedicts & pancakes.  My son & husband had the bacon burger & enjoyed the candied bacon.

This is my second time coming here for breakfast and their food is really delicious. Their biscuits are huge! AND super buttery and fluffy. Yesterday I got the catfish and grits, the catfish was flaky and the grits were absolutely delicious. Today I made my own omelette and the ingredients were very fresh. 

Our server was Freddie and he was friendly as well as accommodating since our friend was running late, but we already put our orders in. 

I would 100% recommend this place to friends, family, and anyone that comes to NOLA.

I ordered Eggs Blackstone and was honestly not impressed, especially not by the stale and dry biscuit that I could barely cut with my knife, even after letting it soak up runny egg yolk and soften.

Also ordered sweet potato fries. They were okay but I don't know how anyone could mess up fries.

Really can't think of anything else to say about this place. Very average.

This place was recommended by my Uber driver to try.  I went here with my mom for brunch on a Sunday around 9:40.Be ready to wait...but it is worth it!  Our wait time was around 45 min.

Tasty food!  We tried the Charles St. Benedict and BBQ shrimp and grits!  Both awesome dishes!  Flavors were spot on!
A excellent choice for breakfast/ brunch! Very nice to get on waitlist through Yelp app. Wait was minimal. Biggest Mimosas I have seen. Excellent chicken Benedict. Would highly recommend
The service and food was very good.   We went at 12:30 pm and there was no wait.  We had items from lunch menu.  Looking forward to going back tomorrow for breakfast.

Went to RSC for breakfast and so glad we did! Breakfast was delicious and drinks were so great we each ordered one for the road. I ordered cinnamon pancakes and my husband ordered grilled fish 'St. Peter.' OMGEE you must try grilled fish 'St. Peter' it was absolutely delicious! So good we may just go back tomorrow.

Hands down one of the best breakfasts I have ever had. Everyone here is extremely friendly and accommodating. Even though you have to wait, it's well worth the wait.  Do yourself a favor and grab a bacon Bloody Mary at the bar while you wait. Can't wait to come back.
Good brunch on lower end of $$ scale especially for NOLA. Both of us enjoyed our order even though the eggs were closer to over easy rather than medium. Probably because it was crowded at lunch hour.

I have been here for brunch four times over the past year and have really enjoyed it each time.  The wait could be very long if there is a big event or conference going on in New Orleans but the food is worth waiting for.  

The portions are generous and the food is delicious.  I ordered the Louisianan (cheese omelet with gulf shrimp) and a specialty pancake with bourbon sauce.  Both are so good that I usually order the same thing every time I visit.  The entrees are very flavorful and unique.

The service has not been very consistent.  I have experienced a range of really good to horrible service.  I gave them a pass because I'm usually in NO for very large events and the restaurant has always been super crowded each time I've visited.

The food is always very good and definitely on my list of places to visit whenever I'm in New Orleans!

Probably my favorite breakfast dish I had when visited New Orleans. We came at a good time as there wasn't a wait and were seated right away. I think I came around 8ish. It definitely got super packed with long lines later on after we left. I got the famous Eggs Cochon which was incredible. Eggs Benedict with pulled pork for breakfast? Heck yeah. The pork was super moist, tender, and had a perfectly balance sweet yet savory taste to it that was amazing. The eggs Benedict just made it that much better. Definitely a must try.
Well worth the wait. It was too crowded yesterday. Less crowded today and worth the wait. Omelet was great. Service was fast and friendly.

{Ventured out of my Riverbend bubble for breakfast and was not disappointed}

At 10:45am on a Saturday morning,we headed over to Ruby Slipper fully expecting to wait for 30-45 minutes. We also knew they had a bar so on a gorgeous Fall day, waiting was not a deal-breaker. The hostess was incredibly sweet and let us know the wait would be 20-30 minutes (even better than expected!). My friend and I headed over to the bar and within 2 minutes our bloody mary's were in production. The bloody's were great, pickled green beans and a good kick, just how I prefer mine! 

Within about 5 minutes two people departed from the first-come bar seating area and my friend and I swooped in - total wait time = 7 minutes. 

I let the hostess know we found a spot at the bar and at that point we were third on her list. Not too shabby for a Saturday brunch downtown. Now, onto the food. We started out with the fried green tomatoes. I don't know what they put in the crust but it was stellar. Not the least bit soggy and I am near certain there was thyme and some other fresh herbs in the breadcrumbs. I went with the Classic Breakfast for my main course and selected the corn beef hash for my meat. It was fresh and a generous serving of meat and potatoes. Served along with eggs, grits and a biscuit - it was more than enough food. 

If you are looking for a well-prepared and simply executed (this is not your fancy plate/sexy garnish type of establishment) breakfast I highly recommend Ruby Slipper. There are options for everyone and the specials change daily.
I absolutely love this place and visit every single time I'm in town. If there's a long line, don't be discouraged.  It's definitely worth the wait.

Had a quick bite before we got on our cruise ship. Biscuits were very, very heavy! They really should be light.
Eggs, bacon: A-ok. Bloody Mary's were awesome. Service was excellent & the manager spent time speaking with s which was nice.
We had a great time. Will go again & hope the biscuits are lighter and more tasty.
We had a very good breakfast here. The service is ok. The chicken sausage tastes and looks like it was made on site. It was very good. I would definitely go back here.

After waiting 30 minutes in uncomfortable seating,  was given an hardly edible cheese grits with a meager serving of poor quality fish. Girlfriend ordered French toast which was somehow far too sweet, and also a big let down. Don't recommend
Awesome bananna foster pancakes!!!  Easy to get a table. Service is adequate and quick.

This place was worth the wait. The bam bam breakfast sandwich was great - I love a good fried green tomato. The biscuit was good, definitely made from scratch with some southern lovin'. The breakfast potatoes were (and looked) much better than the French fries. Nice and crispy! The atmosphere was cool, just very crowded.

We were just looking for a breakfast place. Prolific as the New Orleans restaurants are, unless it's a famous place, the good "local" places can be hard to find without an assist. Yelp displayed Ruby Slipper as a close breakfast place near the hotel, which actually wasn't too exciting since I already know Ruby Slipper to be somewhat of a chain. Using Waitlist, we got in line online and took our time getting there. There was still a little wait - the customers were crowding the sidewalk and street, even across the street... like waiting to see a band - but not too bad, and well worth it. The wait staff are super friendly. No matter the crowd, they're not freaked out or rushed. Cool cucumbers be they. The food was served quickly, but again, not rushed. The place was filled up at 10am. While waiting outside, they take drink orders to help tame the otherwise ravenous savagery of hungover partiers. Bloody Marys with bacon were everywhere. Were I not with my son, I might have partaken. The coffee was great, but even bad coffee in New Orleans is better than anywhere you're drinking it. My son had two pancakes (yum - I tried them and recommend them) that hung lazily over his plate accompanied with scrambled eggs (good) and smoked bacon (me making Homer Simpson noises) and a hot chocolate. I had the southern breakfast. Good scrambled eggs, creamy and delicious grits, a biscuit that weighed a pound and a memorable slice of fried green tomato. The biscuit kept me fed all day. The food was great. The wait staff very friendly and accommodating. And the eclectic, bohemian ambience made the experience truly New Orleans. Can't wait to go back.

I think Ruby slipper has outgrown itself. The food now just seems average compared to when it first opened and only had two locations.  The last two times we visited different locations, the wait was way too long and in New Orleans there's just too many fantastic restaurants.

In Oct 2013 I would've given this experience/restaurant 5 stars for breakfast. After just leaving today, I would give it 2 stars. I have been here 5x and each previous time my French Toast breakfast was delicious. Today?! I sent back my french toast because it was so mushy, wet, and eggy that it was inedible. I could barely keep it on the fork. When it came back out (new order) it was exactly the same...terrible. I explained that it wasn't like this the 4x I had been to The Ruby Slipper in October, they couldn't explain why. The waitress just said that they soak the bread for a while before putting it on to cook. I ended up just eating one pancake. My boyfriend enjoyed his Louisianan omelet but said the biscuit wasn't good. I also didn't appreciate the attitude I got for disliking the french toast. It was as if they could NEVER send out something that someone dislikes. Even the couple beside me commented that it looked inedible and soggy. I would've sucked it up had it at least been edible, but it was extremely undercooked...nothing like good french toast. Welp...I will be trying Jimmy J's tomorrow.

If I'm lying I'm flying and I'm currently sitting on my counch writing this review Lol but I absolutely loved everything about this place;  the atmosphere,  the friendliness and most of all the food! I had the Catfish St. PETER'S and I ate every bite of it!!!!!!!!!! This was my 1st time having fried grits. Ohhhh and they give free refills !!!

First let me say the service here was awesome. Very personable waiter who was also very attentive. I had the Migas Tex Mex egg scramble, my wife had the salmon Eggs Benedict, and waffles for the kids. Super crowded, so it took a little longer to get the food, but the waiter kept us informed on when the food would be coming. Everything came out great and the prices were reasonable. Will definitely be coming here again on our next New Orleans visit.

Love how they use the no wait app- it makes going here way easier. 

However amongst all the hype I saw of the reviews, I was disappointed with my bbq shrimp and grits- or maybe I'm not used to the style of shrimp and grits but one of my 6 little shrimps still had their shell on it :/
However the fried chicken on biscuits was amazing! 

If I had to wait, I'd have been disappointed... I'd return for the fried chicken and biscuits though!

I love this place. We walked here from a friends house before catching our flight home. We sat in the room with a cool fireplace in the center. It took me 10 minutes to decide what I wanted because all the brunch items sounded intriguing and delicious. I got a shrimp omelette with a side of grits and a biscuit. We got giant cups of coffee and the food tasted outstanding. My only concern would be the amount of butter in the grits. After they were all consumed there was still a layer of butter floating in the bottom of the bowl. It was overkill EVEN for New Orleans. Regardless, I would definitely return and know I would leave completely satisfied. I also have to note that our waitress was a doll, and I would hang out with her if I lived in the area.

Very busy little breakfast/brunch dining experience. Great service, even better food. My wife had the short stack with bacon and I had the Ruby Classic Breakfast with scrambled eggs, bacon, grits and toast. The eggs were great. The bacon was very fresh and tasty. The toast was some crazy delicious 7 grain concoction. The grits were the best I have ever had in my life. Seriously. Great food. Decently priced. I would recommend this to anybody and everybody that comes to NO.

My sister found this place on Yelp and made me walk quite a ways to get here because it had such good reviews.  There was a huge line outside.  I attempted to get a cup of coffee from the bar and the hostess yelled at everyone who was waiting to be seated to get back outside.  When our name was called she told my sister to get rid of her coffee because no outside drinks were allowed.  

There were three of us in our party. We quickly ordered.  I ordered a cup of coffee.  It was luke warm at best. Shortly after, two people next to us were sat.  They received their meals and cashed out ten minutes before ours even showed up!  When our meals finally did show up they looked awesome! I was so excited to dig in! I ordered the eggs cocoon and my sister ordered the croque madame.  Both were huge and looked appetizing.  Again, they weren't even warm!  

All in all, the service was very friendly and accomodating once we were sat.  Our food took at least 45 minutes to come out (crazy for a breakfast joint) and when it did it wasn't warm.  If they could get this under control and put a coffee stand outside to cater to people waiting, I'd give this place four stars.

Food was delightful had the mix & match eggs Benedict. Amazing! Service was subpar, could have been better considering it wasn't busy and we know how busy it can be! Blackberry mimosas are my recommendation for sure!
Michelle took very good care of us. Quick, efficient and friendly.  Food was great, Louisiana omelet,  fried chicken Benedict to name a few.  Drinks awesome as well.  Will go back today!

The food is out of this world.  Make sure you sign up to be on their wait list on Yelp cause It can be an hour plus wait at peak times.  Their stuffed French toast was beyond wonderful but only have it when your overly hungry ( or split it ).  The corn beef hash is some of the best ever.  Great service.  Noise level is high - Come for the food but not the quiet atmosphere.

We dined here for breakfast on Mothers Day morning! My Bananas Foster French told was sinful! Cute restaurant, good service.  My husband couldn't decide so he ordered both the special pancakes that contained both strawberries and I believe bananas and an omelet. Very reasonably priced ($33 for three breakfast entrees

Bloody Mary with pickled string beans!! Delicious! The corned beef hash was good. The shrimp and grits were ok. They need some crumbled bacon on top for some texture and the grits needed some flavor. It's really loud in here when it's crowded, so don't expect to carry on a serious conversation.

Great spot to stop for breakfast. The service was quick and friendly. There was a bit of a wait for a Thursday morning, but it was within walking distance of the hotel, and the food was good and worth it.

Will not be back. I like hot food and my pancakes came out cold, sausage and bacon we just warm. I tried my honeys biscuit and it was dry and still had that under cooked flour taste. I also felt that the menu options were a little limited. This was on a Wednesday at 11:00, so it's not like they were slammed as to have an excuse to serve cold food?

Awesome eggs Benedict served on top of fried chicken breast on top of biscuits!  Think it was called st. Charles.  I'm craving it right now.  Great service and reasonable prices. Well worth the 15 minute wait.  Best breakfast I have ever had.  girlfriend had the cornbeef Benedict.  Also excellent.

Good service and great food! The "Skinny Migas" was a little bland, but had a nice fresh taste. The pancake was absolutely incredible! My husband got the "Gulf Fish St. Peter" which was divine, and had a huge portion of fish.

After waiting an hour to get in I had very high expectations. I am happy to say they didn't disappoint. The trifecta which is three different types of Benedict is a lot of food plenty to share but each had distinctive flavors and were very good. We also ordered a side order of chicken and biscuits. The chicken is delicious add a little syrup on top and you have the perfect meal. There is a lot to choose from so go hungry!

We loved this spot for brunch so much that we went twice! Check in online to save on your wait time when you arrive. Being able to pick two on the eggs Benedict is a game changer, we had the one with the Chicken St Charles and the Eggs Cochon. They were both great but the Eggs Cochon with the pork debris was probably my favorite, a must stop for brunch in Nola!

DELICIOUS. GO HERE.

But be prepared to wait.  This place is always packed and for good reason.  We started off by ordering some coffees and Bloody Marys at the bar while we waited for our table to be ready.  Everything we ordered exceeded our expectations.  I'm not even a huge breakfast food fan (blasphemy, I know) but everything was amazing.  You can't leave NOLA w/o trying Ruby Slipper.

Great service. I had the egg omelette and it was really good and healthy. The eggs were done perfectly. There does tend to be a long wait time. Sometimes a hr. GREAT NEWS: use the Nowait app. Puts your name on the waiting list and just walk from your hotel whenever you have a couple people ahead of you. We literally got there and were set down immediately.

Quite recently, the family and I decided to take a ride on the St. Charles Avenue streetcar starting at Carrollton and Claiborne, and rode it to the end of the line so that we could enjoy a late breakfast at Ruby Slipper.  We arrived a little later than expected, as the restaurant was slated to close in approximately 1 hour; however, the restaurant was packed and in "full swing", and we were seated immediately.

Our server, whose name escapes me, was super friendly and appreciated the fact that we were locals.  My son got an order of their classic buttermilk pancakes, and kudos to him for being such a light eater, as I was able to polish off the remaining 1/2 platter of fluffy delicious hotcakes. My wife got the "Southern Breakfast" which looked like the typical egg/bacon/biscuit breakfast you'd find nearly anywhere south of the Mason-Dixon line.  However, their "made from scratch" biscuits are definitely worth mentioning.   I opted for a more flavorful fare and ordered the Peacemaker, which gives you the flexibility to mix and match any 2 of their Signature Benedicts.  I got the Shrimp Boogaloo Benedict and the Chicken St. Charles, both of which left me wanting to come back ASAP.

Ruby Slipper is not where you want to go if you are looking for a quiet breakfast spot, as the restaurant is crowded and loud; but not so loud that you can't have a normal conversation without yelling.  Our food was great, our server was good and she even sent us on our way with three (3) "to-go" beverages.  It's a win-win in my book.
I'm sorry, just not a fan. The hype is an overreach and folks need to get out more often. Average food and drinks. Monster wait. Nothing special.

The three of us attended the ruby slipper cafe today and thought it was amazing as our first stop in Nola. I forgot my backpack and left the cafe, and stopped down the street. One of the hosts came down the street and brought me backpack as he saw me outside and remembered me putting it on the back of my chair. It had my MacBook Pro, chargers and hotel information all inside. Thank you so much for returning this and helping me avoid the worst start to a vacation ever! I'd like to note this was the best brunch spot I've had in years!! #brunch #Nola

This restaurant was right outside the window of our hotel, and boy were we happy we stumbled upon it. After a long night out on Bourbon street it was the perfect brunch to wake us up for another day of adventuring in New Orleans. Apparently this place gets very packed but we came at just the right time and were seated in less than 15 minutes. When our server described the house special, all of us started drooling. Three of us ordered the special which was a biscuit, with fried chicken on top and a chorizo sauce. We were blown away by how quick we got our food and the amount of food we got as well. Nobody was able to finish even though we hadn't eaten all day. We were very happy that our hotel was right across the street because we took our leftovers to-go and ate them that night when we returned home. The bacon was delicious as well. A great brunch place and well worth the wait.
Solid place to get breakfast.  Creative dishes and good service.  Worth the small wait for a table.  I use the No Wait phone app to put my name on the waiting list which is convenient.
Way over rated. The food was just okay. The wait time is crazy long. Go somewhere else. Your time isn't worth the wait.

Lets start with
 Positive: Best southern biscuits ive ever had. Coffee lady was super nice.  My husbands Chicken St Charles was very good and he would order it again. My daughter made an omelet that she liked. The bloody marys everyone had looked amazing, I should of gotten one. 

Negative: 1 hour wait, hostess was rude, my food was a weak disappointment. I had the Costa Rican with chorizo, stewed tomatoes ,rice and beans with fried plantains.  First, my chorizo was not spicy and everything on my plate was flavorless. This was my first meal in New Orleans and not what i expected.  I had to load everything up with hot sauce. 

We will try it again using the wait time app called " Nowait " , try a signature item and for sure get a bloody mary.
Oh my goodness! You must try it for yourself just to give it your own opinion. It was tasty to me. The mimosa of the day was blueberry. Of course, I had to try it.

Brunch at Ruby Slipper Cafe was the culinary highlight of a recent trip to NOLA. My husband had observed the lengthy line out the door each morning we were in town, and we were afraid we might miss out on the delicious fare b/c there is a timer on our toddler, which doesn't allow for waiting to be seated. So, imagine our happiness when we stopped by Ruby Slipper on Sunday afternoon around 2 p.m. for a late brunch. We were thrilled with our cocktails -- Bloody Mary for my husband (he pronounced it good and spicy but not at all "gritty" as can frequently happen when too many powdery spices are added) and a Bellini for me. To eat we ordered the Eggs Blackstone (poached eggs, tomato and bacon on biscuits, finished with house-made Hollandaise sauce) and the Shrimp and Grits (the portion looked a little small but the plating was deceiving -- the dish was chock full of flavorful, juicy shrimp -- and even through I was full by the end, I wanted to lick the plate). The waiter was incredibly helpful with our son -- promptly bringing us some milk and crispy bacon to appease him. The ambiance was warm and friendly. I'd highly recommend this place.

The wait to get into this place was ridiculous and the waitlist was a big bit of a mess. The menu had lots of options I was interested in but the Benedict's seemed to be what they were known for so I went with the Trifecta which included the 3 Benedict's pictured. The big difference with their bennies is that they're served on biscuits instead of English Muffins and the biscuits are pretty good! My favorite was the eggs Cochon as the pork was crazy flavorful. The pig candy bacon was sugary porky goodness and the catfish and grits was amazing according to my friend. Service was decent except for them getting an order of ours wrong

Had a long wait, but it was worth it! The staff was friendly and helpful. The food was really good and had a great atmosphere! They were super busy, but food was out in a reasonable amount of time!!! Definitely would go back when we are back in New Orleans!!

I enjoyed my visit to the restaurant on Magazine St uptown. Great food and milk punch! However, my last visit was to their location downtown on Magazine and didn't enjoy it so much. The same dish just didn't taste so great! It was the biscuit was corned beef and hollandaise. Maybe I had a bad taste in my mouth because the parking situation was less than ideal being downtown! Anyway, go and give it a try!

Unbelievable!  The 40 min wait was well worth it.  Fried green tomato BLT was delicious with both FGT & red tomato on a buttery bun and bacon...best ever.  Side of grits and bacon.  Grits were creamy and more flavorful than I've ever had.  Finally we enjoyed the bananas foster pain pain du.  It was the perfect amount of sweetness enhanced by raisins and caramel, plus it's made with French Bread!  5 stars

Never disappointed here. The food is always amazing and the atmosphere is so NOLA. The bloody Mary's are nice and spicy and the food is to die for. I've never had a thing I didn't love. The wait is well worth it.

Ruby slipper is a hot spot to do brunch at on the weekend. We couldn't make a reservation or call ahead so I walked over early to put our name down for a party of 8 which was quoted hour and a half. They take your cellphone number so they could text you when your table is ready. I actually just walked back to my hotel and alerted my party what time we should be at the restaurant. We had grandparents with us which and they offer no real seating for people waiting. Guest just crowd the corner waiting to be seated. They do offer a drink waitress that goes around to order cocktails from the bar and brings them to you while you wait. 

Our wait went over the time quoted. We finally got seated and service was quick and helpful navigating the menu. The food was amazing our grandparents are hard to please and they loved it. If you can manage to stand waiting possibly over an hour or send someone early to put your name down it is worth it.
So far best service and food during my stay in New Orleans. Considering how busy it was waitress was great.

Be prepared to wait! The wait is SO worth it. The iced coffee is amazing but these are hands down the best eggs Benedict I've ever had. They have an entire section on their menu of different Benedict's. I mixed and matched and you can't go wrong. When in NOLA Ruby Slipper is a must.

I thought it was just a bad day. Then I thought it was probably just busy. After 5 tries in 7 years -- I'm like 100% that the food is just... The staff was nice and polite, but dude you can click your heels together as much as you want, it ain't ever feeling like home. Not all it's hyped up to be. Biscuits are like rock-hard....

This is the BEST food I had in New Orleans! OMG! Where do I even begin! 
I guess I'll begin with the wait time, which was an hour and a half -- no joke! So we made a reservation on yelp while still at home, walked around the french quarter for a bit and then walked to the cafe! So if you plan it, the wait isn't that horrible! 
I had the pacemaker, the choice of any 2 Benedict you like, and it was fantastic! The st. Charles was by far my favorite and one of the best food I had in NoLa. 
** Definitely try their honey butter with the biscuit! It's such a wild experience and a full dessert on its own!

If eyes are the windows to your soul, the hostess is the window to a restaurant's. We signed up for a table for 9, an hour and half later when it was our turn the hostess expressed her extreme annoyance at the fact that we did not want to split up, her exact words "y'all didn't say y'all wanted to sit together) Excuse me for wanting/ expecting to sit with my family during brunch... Then she made us go back outside and waited another 30 minutes no exaggeration. After talking to the manager he gave a mediocre "sorry, unfortunately this is not the first time we've heard complaints about her today, i will keep and eye on your table" speech. But I'm guessing she will get a slap on the wrist(maybe not even) and continue her rude ways. 

The hostess treated me like a nuisance and the manager failed to alleviate the situation. A great disappointment for a well know restaurant with a beautiful "there is no place like home" story. I wonder if the owners of this place still care about the restaurant and the people/community they serve or just the money they make and turn a blind eye on the bad employees.

Went to this cafe twice last week,that almost speaks for itself.Staff,a lot of them!Were on their game.Menu was interesting.Had the catfish on the first visit and the three pigs the second. No complaints.Went to the Ruby on Canal Street Friday,same great service and excellent food.

In reality, this place is 4.5 stars, but customer service is the determining factor for this rating. 

The first impression:
 Their wait time is atrocious - make sure you call ahead or use the waitlist feature on yelp. We used the yelp waitlist and were able to walk in without an issue. If you're in a party of 3 or less, just go ahead and take a bar seat. It's very open concept and WORTH it. You'll get better conversation with the bartenders, your drinks (alcoholic or nonalcoholic) will come out faster, and there are three TVs hanging strategically so you can watch the games from any position at the bar. Also the noise level was lower at the bar than the floor seats. 

The food: 
  We got The Trifecta and The Skinny Florentine. The Skinny Florentine tasted extremely light, save the healthy portion of goat cheese in the middle otherwise a very good omelette. The Trifecta was chicken Benedict, pulled pork Benedict, and a shrimp Benedict. In my personal opinion, the chicken was the best tasting one, although two out of three eggs were over cooked and the pulled pork was a little dry. The bottoms of the benedicts were biscuits instead of English muffins, so they have the potential to be a very thick dish. However, as far as the eggs, people sitting near us got perfectly cooked eggs on their Benedicts, so it was probably just a mistake. 

The service: 
 They were military friendly, extremely attentive, answered all our questions, and made small talk that was inviting. Ended up getting a discount and several dinner recommendations from our server. 

4.5 out of 5, would definitely come here again!

Three words , do not be scared. chicken salad sandwich... best thing I have ever put in my
Mouth

As far as breakfast goes, this is super delicious!  There will likely be a wait to get in, but it's worth it.  And, at least for us, the line moved pretty fast.  It might have been longer if we had demanded a table, but my friend and I were happy to take stools at the bar.  And thank goodness we did, because our stool neighbors informed us that the first parade of Mardi Gras was that night.  Had we not run into them, we may never have known because our hotel sure didn't tell us.  (Funny story, we ran into those same guys and their wives later that night after the parade.  Small world!)

Beverage-wise we ordered hot tea, a bellini, and a bloody mary.  The bellini was ho-hum.  The sip I had of my friend's bloody mary was excellent.  And, she loved the spicy green beans that were in it so much that she bought a jar.  Yes, you can buy a jar of spicy green beans here.  How fantastic is that?!

I ordered the migas.  So yummy.  Not super spicy, but it had a little kick.  I had to stop myself from inhaling everything on my plate, because it tasted so good but was a giant portion.  Friend got the eggs blackstone and they were delicious as well.  And they came with fresh fruit that she was kind enough to share with me.  I was intrigued by the BBQ shrimp and grits (love shrimp and grits), but wasn't feeling it for breakfast.  Maybe next time, because I know I will certainly be back on future visits to NOLA.

To top off the great experience, our bartender/server was super friendly and also pretty easy on the eyes.

So, there's definitely a reason for the line, but you won't be sorry you waited in it.
Best food. Our waiter Freddie was VERY friendly and attentive. Tip is to make the reservation online with yelp.

Great local ambiance, OUTSTANDING Shrimp & Grits!! I highly recommend seating at the counter, where you can rub elbows with a fascinating cross-section of New Orleans culture. The biscuits from Ruby Slipper deserve their own display in the SMITHSONIAN. Also: T shirts, like those worn by the staff, are available for purchase!!!

Honestly a good place to enjoy breakfast.  It can be as simple or complicated as you make it.  The menu was just the right size with just the right amount of options.  He got the Eggs Cochon and enjoyed it.  I had a basic breakfast with one pancake.  It was as good as it could be.   

Easy

Wide open inside, big bar you could order take-out from, and outside seating.  Far enough away from the French Quarter that you're not bothered by vagrants.
Good experience  Recommend putting ur name on the waitlist before coming. Food authentic Louisiana cuisine.

Eggs Benedict all the way. We came here on a whim and are so glad we did. We even bought a shirt because we wanted to remember the name of the place where we ate the most delicious eggs benedict. We will come back when we're in the Big Easy.

I meant to hit up a different location and plugged the wrong address into Lyft. Ended up right in front of the perfect spot for brunch! Thankfully, I was flying solo, so it took no time for me to snag a spot at the bar. The bloody Mary with bacon is not to be missed! Ruby slipper definitely knows their clientele, because they've added a mixed benedict to their menu. It's the perfect way to try some of their best-of items. I wouldn't miss their fried chicken-it's lick-the-plate delicious.

Wonderful breakfast! Was recommended on the idea I should try their shrimp and grits. That was OK. Had a bbq sauce base I think. The wife got the dish named Trifecta.It was absolutely Epic! I recommend exploring their menu. If we are back in the area we certainly will!

Visited today for brunch at the advice of a coworker. Long wait, but the food was good. Had the Migas and it was fresh tasting, sauce was great! Service was slow but that could have been because the place was packed. Overall great impression and I'll be back next time I'm in NO.

Love Love Love this place! Delicious food and bloody Mary's! My fiancé and I always try to make this our first brunch while in New Orleans. The food is out of this world comfort food (I'm normally a very health conscious person, but this place is so good I always make it my Super cheat meal, though they do have lighter fare, I like the skinny migas if I'm feeling the need to eat a lighter meal). That being said, coming here I almost always get the Cochin Benedict, which is SO filling (I've never been able to eat more than one half of the food) and SO dang delicious it's hard to beat when your looking for a hearty, comforting meal, pair this with the bacon infused Bloody Mary and you'll be in comfort brunch heaven (and food coma). We almost always pair our trip to Ruby Slipper with an afternoon of strolling through the Garden District to burn off some of that phenomenal hollandaise-sauce

Awesome hang over brunch spot.  There is normally a wait on the weekends but well worth it!  Highly recommended any of their beendicts!

Also the place is very kid friendly and has nice outside seating so that's a plus

Very delicious breakfast. I got a bacon and cheddar omelette with potatoes and a biscuit. One of the best buttermilk biscuits ever had. Our waiter was great but the hostess was a little unhelpful at the beginning of walking in. Would go again!

WHAT?  WHAT???  I CAN'T HEAR YOU!

This place is LOUD.  I think it could benefit from some astro turf on the ceilings, walls, and floors.  It would not only be appealing to the eye, but but my ears wouldn't bleed after a meal there.  Ok, so it wouldn't be appealing to the eye but this was an unpleasant accomodating location for a pleasant meal!

There are so many different things to try on this menu but I was feeling awfully guilty for the gluttony that had occurred already so I sampled some of the shrimp omelette and salivated over the ruby cristo (play on monte cristo) and just had a side of fruit and potatoes.  

This place is known for a variety of things: shrimp and gritz, banana pancakes (well they call em something really fancy), and so many more items... but try their pomegranate infused mimosa - tasty.

Just make sure to have your sign language and ear plugs ready.  Bon appetite!

My boyfriend and I came here THREE times during our stay on St. Charles because it's THAT GOOD. We had the eggs Cochon, Eggs St. Charles, Shrimp Boogaloo, BBQ shrimp and grits, and fish of the day "St. Peter". All were beyond anything we could have anticipated. The staff is incredibly accommodating, friendly, and attentive. The only reason we didn't go every day was to try some new places. GO HERE. YOU WONT REGRET IT.

Great place for breakfast. Egg couchon was delicious, staff was friendly, and it was very nice to be able to check your place in line from your phone. The restaurant sends a text message with a link. Once clicked, you can view how many parties are ahead of you. Wish more restaurants offered the same.
Here for breakfast. Food was fantastic. Service was good. Ordered the skinny migas and would highly recommend.  I can only assume the traditional migas may be even better.

We went to the one on Canal. 

Breakfast was so good we came back twice! Combination of traditional New Orleans and creative combinations. 

Great service. It does get crowded. 

Our waitress Melodie and the manager Ethan went out of their way to make sure our order was correct and everything was perfect.

As fas as delicious diner-style breakfast goes, this place has got it down. I ordered the Migas with spinach in place of chorizo, and it was fairly easily accommodated. The lack of enthusiasm for my substitution was quickly made up by the fact that my coffee mug stayed well attended while I waited, and, my god, it was DELICIOUS. Chipotle sour cream...total game changer. What have I been doing without it on my eggs? Well deserved as a top breakfast spot in the city. Decent prices, too.
JACUS was our waiter and he was the best. Definitely my favorite server I've had, very knowledgeable and funny and so sweet. And there food was amazing . Had a great brunch !! Highly recommend

Definitely use the "join waitlist" feature on Yelp! We only had to wait a short bit after arriving because we were already on the list. We were seated at the counter and the bartender was super friendly. I got iced coffee and my husband got the boozy iced coffee. I ordered the bacon praline pancakes and he got bbq shrimp and grits. Everything was outstanding, from the drinks to the food to the service. If you are in the area, check it out.

The food was good, this review is about their service. 
I was recently in New Orleans for a work conference. My first time in New Orleans, I skipped Ruby Slipper because their line was crazy long. I was pleasantly surprised when my coworker friends called and said they were seated promptly, menus in hand. It was a less busy time of the morning. 

When I arrived, I was greeted by the hosts and let them know that my party was already seated. I found my friends center of the dining room, I took a seat, and browsed the menu. 

Their server approached the table and quickly informed me that "there are no joiners." She repeated this line several times before I realized what she meant. I said, "Ok. That's fine." I smiled passive-aggressively and proceeded to find loopholes to this ridiculous rule. (I thought, surely she doesn't expect me to just sit here and watch my friends eat). I ordered at the bar and clumsily walked back and forth from the bar to my friends' table. 

Another server brought my food from the kitchen. He explained the "no joiners" rule, which is in place to to minimize confusion on their busier mornings. My friends' server continued to check on my friends, but she did not look at me, ask how my food was, did not ask if she could bring anything. I didn't even get coffee or water. We had zero contact for the duration of breakfast.

My first impression of this restaurant was a server telling me no. She did not offer any solutions on how I could be served. It seemed like she might have look around, saw they weren't swamped, and thought of how she could have said "yes" that day.

Good But Cold Have Been Better

I ordered the CORNED BEEF BENNIE and found the dish was not temperature hot enough and the corn beef was hardly noticeable. They make this in house and there was hardly a trace of corn beef hash. The other dishes that were served with the party I was with appeared very good. I also found the dish a bit on the dry side as the biscuits weren't covered enough with the sauces. The eggs were a bit over cooked and not runny enough in the yolks.

Ate here 3x's while in NOLA for a week for a conference.   The chicken is to die for either in the Benedict or as a sandwich, can't go wrong either way.   Use the waitlist thru the YELP app as there is ALWAYS a huge long wait

Wow! Just wow! Waited an hour for a table but they use common sense and modern technology to text you when your table is close to ready to give you time to walk back. They have a staff member take drink orders while you wait out front. Nice touch and thoughtful for waiting customers. Nice inside your order was prompted my taken, food came out lightning fast and very fresh.

The food was just unbelievable. I had their specialty which is a biscuit with your choice of meat and sauce and a poached egg. Essentially multiple variations of a Benedict. I got the pulled pork and the fried chicken (separately). You can pick 2 or 3 I think but 2 are filling because these are rich in favor. The pulled pork was something to brag about and the fried chicken was crisp and properly cooked. So good. Please, it's worth the wait.

Awesome brunch with my hubby! He had the Bananas Foster French Toast and I had the signature Eggs Cochon. They were both awesomely delicious! Kevin our server is also great; came back to check on us often and ensured our needs were met.

Amazing service , prices and southern Breakfast fare.. DO NOT MISS the Pork Cochon it is fantastic. You could split any Biscuits entree as they are gigantic. Can't want for my next trip down to NOLA..

Definitely one of my favorite meals
In NOLA. The Ruby Slipper serves up one hell of a meal that fuses Cajun Classics with all your brunch favorites. The place is actually situated in an old bank building that is rumored to have been robbed by Bonnie & Clyde.

First up, and perfect for kickstarting any brunch, the Bloody Mary is legit the best I have ever had. I find that most bloody Mary's tend to either be under seasoned, too watery, or too cold. But this one suffered from none of those. It had a thick consistency, and the perfect blend of spicing, pepper and horseradish, as well as taking compliments from a rasher of bacon, pickled dilly bean and olive. Seriously tasty, and you also get a choice for it to be made with either normal or bacon vodka. Rave reviews and we're only at the drink!

Foodwise, like I mentioned, it's Cajun classics fused with Brunch. Think blackened shrimp Benedict, red beans and rice hash, and pulled pork stuffed omelette. I had probably one of the best sounding (and tasting) brunch dishes I've ever had - Catfish tails with deep fried shrimp grits, served on a bed of tomatoes and spinach, with a grilled shrimp skewer and Mustard Hollandaise - seriously, I do not have one bad thing to say about this dish, and special shout out to the deep fried shrimp grits. Truly amazing food.

This is definitely a must go food spot for any brunch fans.
Not worth the two hour wait.  Signature benedict dish was not hot and eggs were hard.

We walked by here and it looked busy so we stopped in. Wow... awesome service for a place that so busy. Chicken Saint Charles Benedict. The sandwich with a fried egg on top. Both a must. Great beacon bloody Mary's!! So glad we came here!!

Wonderful, wonderful, wonderful.

As soon as my husband and I walked in, he said "didn't this used to be a Mexican place the last time we were in town?"  Thank goodness that the Mexican place is gone because Ruby Slipper is WAY better.

The bananas foster french toast was sinful.  The "double" Mimosa was refreshing.  The service was friendly and quick.

Great breakfast spot in CBD.

Simply delicious. Get there early as lines form. Also need to be in by 2 to sit and order as the door close as the prepare to close at 3
Try the French bread bananas foster. Wow!!
Great place that seems to be very popular. You have to be ok with long wait. Great build your own omelets.
I loveee their food!! Always get the Louisiana omelet add bacon with the Irish coffee!

With a party of 10 we had the typical. Note 45 minute wait. Hostess was pleasant and courteous. The noise level was a cacaphonic din. The wait staff was decently efficient given the noise and crowded furniture and press of customers. The menu choices were sufficient and varied. The wait for the food was longer than I expected. Upon arrival, the food was slightly shy of Danny's standards. My wife's pancakes were raw in the center.  They were banana-pecan. This was a one dollar premium. Instead of the bananas and pecans in the batter,  there were two thin slices of banana and a teaspoon of crushed pecans strewn on top. They were served with three small pieces of fruit. . My fried green tomato wasn't served until several minutes after the rest of my breakfast. The crust on the tomato was tough,  dried out,  like warm. My scrambled eggs were lumpy and lukewarm. My biscuit was heavy, of little taste and tough and rubbery. My bacon was soggy and cold.  The monkey bowl of fruits was pretty good.  Lumpy but taste. Overall the food was on the poor side of mediocre.

One can say if there is a line out the door and around the corner it must be good, right? 

Well here's the thing, Yes Ruby Slipper does have some great dishes and The staff handles the crowd pretty well (especially at this location.) However there are plenty of other great eateries in town.

So, if you truly must eat here go early.

What I recommend:

-Pig Candy Bacon

-Eggs Cochon (Eggs benedict with a swiney twist)

-Ruby Mimosa
Worth the wait for a table. We waited almost two hours but were served with cocktails on the street while we waited. The food was unbelievable and I would recommend the iced coffee!!
Loved this cute cafe! Great breakfast food and service! Sat outside along the street- great people watching and scenery.
Space was a little tight and it was very loud. Food was delicious though and we will most definitely be back next time we are in town. I'd definitely rec

Visiting NOLA for just a few days and stumbled onto this place. On a Monday late morning the wait was about 45 minutes. The staff comes around while you wait and you can order a drink. They text you when your table is ready. The menu has all the breakfast favorites you would want. The service was great and so was the food!

Great breakfast!!

Nice ambiance 
Waitlist worked!
Great chicken st Charles!
Light & tasty...
Southern breakfast terrific.. 

Loved the place!
Come to the Bay Area...!
Catfish and grits, BBQ shrimp and grits, chicken st Charles. All delicious! Packed in there, but Lance made us feel like we were the only table. Definitely a great experience!!!

We waited a solid 45 min and it was so worth it! The cinnamon pancakes were bomb I got an omelette which was wonderful too! We also sat at the community table and meet a super fun couple that my hubby and I met up with later that night! All in all we would go back for sure so great for breakfast just gotta get here early!

Best breakfast in New Orleans! Our group ordered a sampling of menu items to share since everything looked great! Had the pancake flight which included three pancakes - the pancake of the day (ours was raspberry, bacon pancake, and then a cinnamon roll pancake. Each one was Heavenly. Had the Migas which were very tasty. Lastly had the blueberry cheesecake stuffed French toast. The French vanilla lattes were so delicious, we could have gulped them down really quick! Friendly customer service. Come here. You will not be disappointed. Tip: We checked in via yelp on our way there and that helped minimize our wait time!
This was one of my favorite meals during my visit!  I was so excited to wrap up my week with their shrimp and grits! So good!

Long wait time (1 1/2 hrs) so to circumvent it's the Nowait app add yourself to waitlist ahead of time. I got the Trifecta and the Eggs Cochon was the best out of the three but the biscuits were dry, sauce congealed and the food was cold. Bloody Mary was delicious. Points taken off for food temp and mediocre food. 

I did ask to speak to manager but took long time to come to out table and after waiting so long. I left

There creamy vanilla spiced latte was the best coffee I had in New Orleans.  There was a little wait, but the staff was friendly and everything was well managed.  The food was good and the service was fast.  We will come visit again the next time we're in New Orleans.

Came here for breakfast, and it was a long wait! Food here are big portions, the shrimp and grit seems to be a must try dish, but it's just okay to me! The biscuits were a surprise, so yum, and the pancakes were puffy

5 stars service/staff = awesome!! Kid friendly. The food is fresh and unique, but the potatoes and grit cake were overdone, I didn't care much for my catfish entree --wish I'd ordered something simpler like a pancake breakfast. Husband loved his eggs Blackstone entree (particularly the poached eggs, biscuit, and bacon). Wish they had chicory coffee. Overall, it's a good breakfast place - enjoy!
The shrimp and grits with cup of coffee as just hat I needed to start my day!  Great vibe and good eats!

My husband and I tried to go here for breakfast a few days ago, but the line was too long. So yesterday, we got up early and arrived just after 8 -- no line! My husband ordered the eggs cochon, a flakey biscuit covered in a ton of pulled pork, and topped with a poached egg and hollandaise sauce. It was delicious. I ate the eggs blackstone, a biscuit topped with grilled tomatoes, bacon, poached eggs and hollandaise. Also delicious. The prices are a little high, but the quality of the food is fantastic.
The hype is real! Everyone at our table got a different dish and loved loved loved it.

Another amazing breakfast at the Ruby Slipper! 
Stuffed French Toast was the perfect combination of sweet and savory and the Mardi Gras theme made it a great morning entree'!
The Crawfish Benedict was amazing! Perfect poached egg and plenty of meat made this an amazing meal to remember!!
Can't forget to mention Sandi, our server. She brought the friendliness of the city to our table and made us feel right at home. Her smile warmed us through and through!!!!!
Thank you for making our stay in the Big Easy so memorable. The Ruby Slipper is officially our favorite restaurant in New Orleans!!

Came her for breakfast and ordered the Eggs Cochon and French Toast.   

The Eggs Cochon is a must!  The eggs are topped off with pulled pork. 
Breakfast is usually an easy meal to make but I cannot make this dish at home.  Once you break the egg and it falls into the plate.. mmmm.  Goodness.  The French toast isn't your usual slice of bread, but it's shaped into long thick strips.  Similar if you cut a banana the long way.  It is a little bread heavy for me.  The service was great and thankfully there were spots in the bar so no wait at all.

My favorite breakfast and lunch place in NOLA.  Everything was incredible!   Can't believe I'm saying this, but the Banana Foster Pain Perdu was awesome!  I ate most of my wife's breakfast the first time we were there.  The House Bacon-Infused Bloody got me stared at 10AM. .  One hint, there is always a line there, go to the website and GeT In LINE before you leave the hotel.

We had a great experience! Our server was amazing and made the experience that much better. We got the pancake flight for the kiddos, which was great. We tried the shrimp and grits- delicious. I got 3 different eggs Benedict (the trifecta). The pulled pork one was my fave. The food was lukewarm when it got to us. Not a big deal but I prefer it to be piping hot. We got there early and we're seated immediately but when we left there was a line. Overall, definitely a place I'd recommended to visitors!
The omelette was outstanding and the sauce to die for. Super service, great atmosphere and a breakfast worth waiting for. Will definitely go back here upon my return to New Orleans!
Freddie was awesome, best server!!! Really nice guy, food was made quick and perfect.

May have been our least favorite spot we tried in NOLA. The server was great! But our food was not at a level that would make us want to go back.
I had the cinnamon French toast. It was good, no complaints there. They gave a big portion of French toast. 
My husband got the pulled pork Benedict. The egg was not poached as it should have been, it was more hard-boiled. He tried the Bacon Bloody Mary, drink and hated it. It's VERY rare my husband doesn't like a drink. This may just be his preference though. If you like Bloody Mary's, maybe give it a try.
They have a few of these restaurants in NOLA, and again the service was great, but there are better places to eat for breakfast/brunch.

Concierge in my hotel said this is where he goes for breakfast or lunch.  Nice local feel to it.  Nothing fancy to look at, but a clean nice place.  Good friendly helpful staff.  The Eggs Blackstone is worth a try - poached eggs, bacon, slice of tomato on a biscuit with hollandaise sauce.  Next time gotta try the crab cakes - people rave and they sell out quickly.  Definitely try this place.

The food here was delicious. I had The Peacemaker. Which is the breakfast where you can mix and match their eggs Benedict. I had one with fried chicken and one with pulled pork and they were both phenomenal.

Very good local place. It closes at 2pm weekdays. Based on the reviews I had the Egg Blackstone - bacon, tomato, hollandaise sauce and breakfast potatoes- and a Latte. Both were very very good and while not "excellent" I would have this same meal again. 

Not that I wish rain on anyone but on this rainy day I was able to be seated right away (I've heard that you'll usually need to wait).  If you're in the area try to get here.

If you're ever in New Orleans and in search of brunch this is the place to go! They have great service and the food is consistently good every time I'm here. The only bad thing is the wait, and you can't make reservations. I will say that they now have an app that will help speed up the waiting process (wish I would've known ahead of time). Other than that, they're great! Try the banana foster French toast and any of the eggs Benedict, enjoy !

A breakfast/brunch staple in New Orleans! Be prepared to wait if you don't get on the list ahead of time (requires using an app on your phone). The food is good with large portions. The drinks, however, may be even better. The Morning Margarita was the best!
