Their bacon burger is probably the best I've ever had. The prices are reasonable and service was great. The waitress kept our sodas full before they were empty.  Their BLT was also outstanding! Great place!

Started our day of NOLA sight-seeing with a deliciously hearty breakfast at this fabulous place.  They mix up a mean Bloody Mary with bacon, and the Candied Bacon was like dessert!  The Corned Beef Hash was amazing, and adding in some Creole mustard pushed it over the top!  Every plate that came out of the kitchen looked scrumptious, so we will definitely be returning to try some of the other menu items!
Got an omelette that was huge and amazing a filled with bacon, spinach, goat cheese, and tomatoes. Came with potatoes and a mouth watering biscuit. Definitely coming back!
Great food, great atmosphere, and worth the wait! The bananas foster was perfect though the coffee is pretty standard "diner" coffee.

Went to the ruby slipper for breakfast and after peeking in decided it was worth the 30 minute wait.  Was fantastic top to bottom, from the spicy bacon bloody Mary to the coffee to the st James Benedict special.  Kids meals were appropriately sized and priced.  Great breakfast!

Absolutely the worst experience ever! We were very patient. New the wait would be long. Had cocktails. Then watched people who came after us continue to be seated one after another. We understood the Yelp app but we were told over and over that we were up to be seated. After over 2 hours we spoke with the manager who proceeded to tell us how much the restaurant makes a week and how many people they seat. Rude and SUPER unprofessional!! He told us we were the next 3 top to be called. Guess what? They called a 3 top next and NOT US!! By the way, according to the manager they pull in about $120,000 a week. Joke! Would NEVER visit this establishment again! It requires me to rate this place. Just know that it is a minus 5 and not a plus one.

I had been eyeing the menu at Ruby Slipper since we first started planning our trip to New Orleans. There are several locations around town and this was an easy walk from our hotel in the business district. The cafe utilizes No Wait , and I'd recommend using it as the area around the hostess stand is pretty crowded and no wait keeps you out of the crowd. 

The cafe is small and probably not a great choice for large groups. 

My husband ordered an Irish coffee and I had a Bellini. My Bellini was a little strong, but that's more on me than the restaurant. I'm pretty picky. I orders the Cochon Benedict and our waitress let us know that you can split the benedicts. I opted to order half a Cochon Benedict and half a corned beef Benedict. My husband did the same and added an order of hash. 

The food was a little slow to come out, but not overly. It arrived hot and well plated. The breakfast potatoes were good. I wasn't a huge fan of the hash. It was just okay. The corned beef Benedict was extremely good. The eggs were perfectly poached with runny centers. The hollandaise was very good as well. I ended up not liking the Cochon Benedict as much. It was, well presented and assembled, but the pork was sweet. Next time, I'd stick to the corned beef Benedict instead. 

Service was good be attentive even though it was quite busy.

I'm in love with the Ruby Slipper.

It's so good that when me and my friend went there was a good thirty minute wait to get into the packed, tiny diner so be prepared for that but I assure you it's worth the wait. And while you're doing so there is a bar with probably the best mimosa's I've ever tasted. Be warned, it's a little pricey!!!

When we got in and sat down, ordered our food and were given different sets of beverages you could just tell that everyone loved working here, and that the customers were really enjoying themselves. It's incredibly laid back; something that legitimately surprised me after living here for three years and trying a handful of different restaurants. 

The food was delicious and you could tell that the chefs really put their heart into their craft. My only complaint was that the bread on my plate was a bit stale and hard to bite into; but everything else on the plate was so delicious that it was easy to leave it behind. As both me and my friend were both tipsy on our mimosa's, we decided to order a share of the banana foster style french toast and were not disappointed. Not too sweet, not too under seasoned, just right.

I CANNOT wait to come back for brunch again.
Excellent quality breakfast spot but crowded, prepare to wait 25+ min for seating. Tasty southern dishes including grits.

I ordered the French toast with bacon and had a side of potatoes. My oh My those potatoes were delicious! My brunch also included a double bellini, it was a nice giant glass and great flavor. This was one of the smaller plates they offer. while I was sitting at the bar, I noticed other options and they were huge serving sizes enough to share.
I came here on a Tuesday and it was a wait of about 30 in for a group of 2 or more. I was dining solo and sat at the bar and was seated in about 5 min. Very friendly atmosphere. Will  be back on my next trip to NO !

This place is a good option for breakfast. I always forget why we come here every single time we are in the area. This food is good but not amazing. They have good options for Benedict's. Like I said, it's good but not amazing. And the long waits and crows make this place appealing. They do have good bloody Mary's

Loved this place! DEFINITELY use the nowait app to get a place in line without actually having to make the line, especially since you may have to wait more than an hour which is not so bad if you are doing it while exploring the city or getting ready at your hotel. You can also get into the waitlist through yelp! We got there for brunch on a Saturday and were seated within 5 minutes of arriving there (using the app of course). Our waiter Alfredo was amazing! He had such a great sense of humor and was so attentive with us, even with us being his last customers for the day. I had bacon with Eggs Cochon and Chicken St. Charles, however if I had to pick between the two I would choose the Cochon although both were delicious. One of the highest rated places for breakfast/brunch in NOLA and I can see why!

We went around 10am, it wasn't too crowded . Coffee and service were great. I had the Salmon Bennie. One egg was over cooked and I had to ask for more dill hollandaise but over all I would order it again. Hubby had the southern breakfast and devoured every bite.

Recommended to us as the best breakfast in town.   We waited 45 minutes to get in,  worth the wait,  it was very good.  My daughter had the eggs cochon, the poached eggs were a little more done than we prefer but it was still very good.  My wife had the Puerto Rican breakfast, that was good and the chorizo was fantastic.   I had the Bananas Foster Pain Perdu, my hopes were probably raised a little high from reading the reviews on here, but it was still good.  Service was excellent.   Prices a bit on the high side.   We all liked it but we all agreed it wasn't the best breakfast we had here.

There are several of these locations, but I reckon this one is the best, at least that's what our cabbie suggested, and after eating here, I concur. It may be a bit of a wait during busy times but don't fret, you can grab a coffee or bloody Mary while you wait. I'd say the best thing to get, if you are a Benedict fan, is to go for one of their Signature Benedicts. My choice: Eggs Cochon. Don't even question ordering this if there are no dietary restriction, just Do It! You can pair with a second choice, like the house-smoked salmon if you are second guessing. I wanted to try the shrimp and grits, but that will have to wait for another time. Like many foods here, be sure and dabble on copious amounts of Crystal or Tabasco sauce.

Waited for 45 mins for a table. Waited over an hour for food. Service was friendly but 4 groups that sat after me got their food first. Makes me think this was a mistake. They did their best to make it right. Had the stuffed French toast and it they were good not necessarily worth the wait.

Solid good basic breakfast menu items.

Ordered eggs, biscuit and corned beef hash. All were cooked well and tasty. The buttermilk biscuits were a little too hard for my taste...makes me wonder if they were thawed (chewy). The flavor was good/spot on and the portions decent.

I would recommend for good location, fair prices, good service, and solid food options.

Great breakfast place. We ordered shrimp and grits and eggs cochon. Both were quite good, the coffee was really good too. The sauce on the shrimp and grits was a little odd and the shrimp were on the smaller side, but overall it was tasty. The eggs cochon had plenty of meat on top of large fluffy biscuits. I'd come back for sure and give the french toast or pancakes a try.

Amazing! Went on a Saturday waited one hour to be seated but it was totally worth it. The breakfast plates are huge. Everything is super homemade, the make your omelet is my favorite you add all you want and get pancakes the original they are buttery and fluffy! The best

Long wait. We ordered classic short stack and the southern breakfast. Our waiter was Wayne. He was very nice and good with is customers. The food was good. Worth the wait. The staff did a good job with their service to the customers given there was huge crowd waiting and inside. Manger greeted everyone at their tables and helped clear off tables to seat customers. I will visit again when I'm in New Orleans.

Don't ever bring a group bigger than 4 people. One of the servers was a total dick about me bringing a chair over to my friends table or pushing two tables together. Calm down folks the world isn't ending. The staff must not be much of morning people.
Great breakfast! And amazing service, loved our waiter and the stuff he recommend us, he's name was Justin.

Amazing!  Great service, good coffee, great selection of NOLA-inspired options.... great food!  Hubs got the Migas and I had the shrimp boogaloo benedict! I highly recommend you sit at the bar for the friendliest service around. Dont forget to buy a t-shirt!  So cute...will be back!

Good, but overpriced breakfast.  2 entrees, a mimosa and an Irish coffee cost $40.  The service is bad.  We were seated at the bar (a 20 minute wait on a weekday, and yes you have to wait outside), and we ordered drinks.  The waiter responded with an awkward, "uhh, okay.  I'll tell the other guy.  I'm in training."  A few minutes later, the other guy came over and asked us what we wanted to order, even though we didn't get our drinks yet.  Our drink order was never relayed.

My entree, the Three Little Pigs omelet, was cooked well and generously filled with bacon, ham, and sausage.  The biscuits were very good, and the Irish coffee was a hell of a way to wake up!

My husband's entree was brought out incorrectly.  Twice.  It wasn't a special order by any means.  He ordered eggs over easy, they gave him scrambled.  He asked for a biscuit, they gave him toast.  No apology, no "I'll get that taken care of right away," no attention to detail or service at all.

It really wasn't worth the wait after the shoddy service.  The only memorable part about this meal, aside from the waiter with training wheels, was the Irish coffee.  Stop in for that, and then have breakfast elsewhere!

Heard great things about this place so we decided to go, 2 mornings in a row! First morning service was good and the food was great even though the hostess was a little iffy and I was about to leave! The 2nd morning ordered the same, egg Florentine, but my stomach was like "ummmm no not today "! The potatoes were a little greasy and I'm just not sure what happened. Overall it's always crowded so reserve a spot on yelp or get there early, the servers are nice and the service was good!
My favorite joint every time I go to New Orleans.  Get there early unless you want to stand in line

I am a huge breakfast food fan.  It is my favorite meal for sure.  I went here a few days in a row while I was in town for a conference.  The next time I am in NOLA I will make it a priority to eat here.

Sooooo, definitely use Yelp to get you a spot in line ahead of time because on a Saturday this place was packed!! And rightfully so. The food was delicious, I got the smoked salmon omelet and my wife got eggs cochon. Both were delicious, the candied bacon was a bit too sweet for my taste and the Bellini was average but all things considered this place did not let down. Food quality was excellent, it is a bit on the pricy side so expect to pay $10-20 more than a typical breakfast joint. Would definitely recommend it if you like something fancier than your average breakfast spot.

We heard of this New Orleans classic and since it was across the street from our hotel, we decided to try it for brunch on a Sunday morning. Luckily, they have an app where you can get your name in line without ever showing up. At 9am, the wait for 110 minutes. We were able to kill some time and arrived when the app told us to. From there, it was another 20 minutes but it was all worth it.

We got a table inside and was waited on immediately. The menu was awesome! So many enticing choices that I could not decide. I was fixated on the benedict section and luckily, there is an option to get 2 different benedicts (one of each). I ended up with the Eggs Cochon and Chicken St. Charles benedicts. They were amazing!! The best I've ever had. My only complaint here is that we were double charged but they fixed it quickly.
Food and atmosphere is absolutely fantastic! Love it! Definitely a CBD favorite!
I enjoyed the fried chicken eggs Benedict and bananas foster French toast. Nice service. Long wait, however you can't complain since the food is so good.

Waited 20 minutes to sit, another 25 for food when those seated after us received their food much before us. Over rated, over hyped as I could get a better bfast at a greasy spoon diner. Omelette was greasy, had to send toast back as was cold bread and potatoes were frozen, fried. Much better bfast spots in NO and for about the same price.

Our waiter, Mario, was super sweet.  I ordered the pancake sampler...The kings cake pancake was the special of the day (which was a week before Mardi Gras of course) and it also came with a bacon praline pancake, and a cinnamon swirl pancake. The bacon praline was my favorite. The chicken with poached eggs was amazing as well. 
Very clean place and the chef brought the food out herself (nice n hot!). 

Wonderful breakfast! Would recommend. We did join the waitlist via yelp and it said the wait time would be 6-19 minutes, but we were seated right away

What a disappointment of a place !!! The food was nothing special...
Long wait not worth it...
The only good thing was the service !!!
I've eaten in a much better places for a lot less $$$

-Beautiful atmosphere 
- Double Mimosas (um, yeah) 
- GREAT FOOD - Biscuits did NOT disappoint 
- Staff was super friendly and informative 
- Food was delicious

I was a tourist in the New Orleans area and this was an absolute gem.  Definitely a fantastic place to go when visiting NOLA.

Delicious, filling and a great price for the amount of food you're getting. You're a true champ if you finish it. The wait is a little long as this place is really popular, so make sure you're not in a rush.

Went for late breakfast on a Tuesday, and it was only a 15 minute wait. The atmosphere is great and the service was good.

The biscuits were exceptional, and I didn't even order those. I caught myself trying my wife's and we had to order more! 

The grits were very bland though, and just a little more salt and pepper made a big difference.
Amazing food and coffee. Super nice waiters, waitresses, and staff. Would totally recommend it to everyone! Definitely kid friendly. If you get the chance go here for breakfast or brunch!

This place has a crowd waiting outside from the time they open until close, and I see why! Service: our waiter was great. He was friendly, seemed like he genuinely enjoyed being there, and was very attentive. The food came out within 10 minutes, and the online checkin/reservation thing made the line a non issue. Food: TRY THE ST CHARLES! The chicken was cooked perfectly, crispy outside and juicy inside. The biscuit is rich and delicious, and not too flaky. I ordered the Bloody Mary and it was alright, could use some more spice.

This place just felt like they were grateful to have you - guess that's what southern hospitality is all about

This place was out breakfast spot the whole time we were visiting NOLA; it was attached
To the lobby of our hotel (Pelham) so it had that going for it right off the bat. 

What can I say, it's good but if it wasn't so convenient it's good only in that it wasn't bad. Wonderfully average if you would. 

It's not cheap, and for what it is an argument could be are that it's pricey.

Just okay and definitely not worth the wait if you find yourself there during a rush.

With Tom petty's song " the waiting it the hardest part" blaring thew my (hung over) head, my husband and I were informed that the wait for any seat in the restaurant including the bar was a going to be a while. We took our place in the 30-45 min. line and waited with the other loiterers outside. Three years ago we were told to try this little place called  "the Ruby Slipper" for breakfast...now they have several locations. This trip we were excited to find a location near our hotel the Marriott JW but we had a plane to catch. Still, we felt determined to complete our mission. I was pretty surprised that there was not a solid fried oyster option on the menu, although the menu did offer many delicious options with easy pricing. I wanted to order the fried chicken breast with hollandaise sauce on poached eggs etc. etc. but I chickened out no pun intended. I ordered the bacon lettuce tomato fried green tomato sandwich on toasted brioche roll with shoestring french fries. Because it was breakfast and because of other reasons that are obvious I ordered a over easy fried egg to go with the sandwich. Even before the fried egg sandwich was too big to eat as a sandwich. It was delicious and every way and if it were not for the guy sitting next to me at the counter eating the fried chicken with sauce and poached eggs I may have been completely satisfied. My husband enjoyed his dish and loved the homemade sausage. I had a bite and it was very interesting as he described it with lots of herbs. 
We enjoyed the Ruby slipper immensely and Will keep it in the rotation for next time.

Here's the reason for the poor review. 
Ordered an omelette the print out didn't show goat cheese. Then the omelette shows up and doesn't have the right ingredients. Dude goes and asks for another omelette vs. asking us how to proceed. When two people get food eating separately is annoying. Then the bill comes and they don't comp the food or anything. I think you missed the mark on customer service and if you are going to have build your own omelettes you either get the order correct or remedy the mistake to the customers liking. I don't think comping an omelette that is incorrect isn't unreasonable. I would have left a five star rating as mistakes happen and I am all about giving the restaurant an opportunity to handle. 
Omelette - goat cheese mushroom spinach roasted red pepper 
Omelette received - no cheese, no spinach, sausage, tomato mushroom. 
This review is for the restaurant. Here is some feedback.

This place is worth the wait and you will never been disappointed!!! If you make your reservations through Yelp you can actually bypass many of those waiting in line to eat their delectable foods!!! You can have your boozy drinks and coffee while waiting in line! Our service from waiting in line, ordering our waiting in line drinks and our server are dedicated towards customer service! 

Now the order menu....where do I begin????

We are always torn what to get but we always ask the staff for help and we are never disappointed!!! So far we have been to two of heir locations and both times the food and drinks are spectacular!  I rolled out of their in a food coma!!!!

All I can say that all the food their is so good and you just need to know what you want to get! I do recommend the bloody Mary's- any kind- very yummy!!! The breakfast food- so so good so depending what your taste is, they will not disappoint! 

I give this place 10 out of 5 stars - just because I left in a good coma and needed a nap!!! 

We enjoyed hr experience and will head back again! 

A true NOLA experience!!!

This is one of the best restaurants I've had during my stay in New Orleans! I tried a mix of two of their signature dishes and all I have to say is that I was mind blown by the flavors! We received  great customer service by our waiter Freddie he extremely nice and attentive, he gave us the best quality service. I am very satisfied with this experience I will definitely return!

First off, the only reason why I knocked off a star is because checking in through Yelp doesn't do anything at all - we were placed in line with the general crowd - however, this may have just been because it was Mardi Gras season. 

Besides that, great service for being an extremely busy hub, and the food (especially the specialties indicated) was amazing. The pancakes looked great from afar, but I was super satisfied with my Eggs Cochran! 

Would recommend, but bring a granola bar or fruit for the line!
Very busy, generally a 1 hour plus wait.  Server staff was great food.  The food was over priced.

The most important thing about this place is that it is in high demand. Knowing this, my wife and I went there right after it opened at 7:00 AM. It helps when we stay across the street and we can see the place from our room. It gets crowded quickly.

My wife ordered the Peacemaker, where you can pick 2 items from their eggs Benedict menu. She got the eggs Cochon and the Shrimp Boogaloo.

The pork was done very well. It was rich, and the flavor was great. The Shrimp Boogaloo was not so much shrimp, but more fried green tomato. We both agree that we wouldn't pick that one again.

I ordered the Chicken St. Charles, after seeing a number of positive reviews. It was very good. The chicken was tender and flavorful. This is a definite go to if you're looking for something savory and can't decide what to pick. 

The coffee was nothing spectacular. My wife ordered a cup and it was lacking flavor. I'm a fan of dark roast, so I found the coffee wanting. I ordered a cold brew iced coffee and felt I should have just stuck with the water. 

The server will want your full order since they may not allow additions later on because of the crowds. I was thinking about getting French toast, but wanted to see if I was still hungry after the other dishes. 

Now the reason I did not give a 4th star is that we felt that we were a bit rushed to finish up and leave. I understand that a restaurant wants to turn over tables, but part of the dining experience is to enjoy your time in the restaurant too. It is a very beautiful setting, but I didn't feel welcome to stay and enjoy. Mind you, I wasn't planning on spending my day sitting around and lazing away, but when I don't feel welcome, why stick around.

Overall, food is good, very crowded so get there early, and be prepared to be ushered out as soon as possible.

May go back for the French Toast, but when you have a charming local joint like Commerce around the corner with prices half that of Ruby Slipper, and make you feel at home, well you be the judge.

Really good food. Went for breakfast. Shrimp and grits were out of this world. St Charles Chicken and biscuits were a solid eat too. Don't be fooled by the bacon infused vodka they literally stick a piece of bacon in the Bloody Mary. Still a really good sip though.

This was absolutely worth the 1.5hour wait on a busy Saturday morning. We were offered a drink menu while we waited, their boozy iced coffee was just what I needed for a morning pick me up. The wait allowed for some time to wander off to Bourbon for a couple more. I went here for the first time and May and I'm not even kidding, I want this brunch every single weekend. It was that good, seriously. I'll have to check out their other locations throughout the city, I heard they aren't as busy.

I was here for business and walked right in on a Wednesday at 9am and was seated at the bar right away. The reviews made me nervous for a long line so this was a pleasant surprise. 

Great food!

We Have been in New Orleans At least 10 times and this is the first time we made it to the Ruby slipper because the recommendation we got from some of staying at our hotel.  If you haven't been to the Ruby slipper are you are missing one of the best breakfasts of all time.   Julie was or waitress and she was amazing.   So if you go to the Ruby slipper On magazine street., Be sure to ask for Julie.   

And don't miss  out on one of their Benedict's.

The food is GREAT!!!! Be prepared for a long wait, but it's all worth it. 
We visit the location back to back. 
Day1: Louisanan Omelette & 3 Little Pigs.
Day 2: Blueberry French Toast & Smoked Salmon Bennie
Both days, the food was delicious.

Check them out if you are ever in town.

Don't let the casual/normal look of this place fool you.  This is an absolute gem of a breakfast spot.  The fried chicken Benedict was the bomb but both days I went I needed to go for the peacemaker.  Tried both the cochon and the corned beef as the flip side both times.   Super tasty.  A must do.
Awesome place for breakfast. Always try to come when in Nee Orleans. Food always good. Usually a line and wait but so worth it.

Service, food and drinks were good! My only complaint was that they ran out of shrimp, which two of their most popular items on the menu contain shrimp. 

I had their Bacon Infused Bloody Mary, which was good. Their mimosa's are lovely, especially the fact they use fresh squeezed orange juice. We had the Peacemaker, which it allows you to choose two benedicts to try. I had the St. Charles (which is fried chicken on a biscuit) and the Eggs Cochon, which is a braised pulled pork on a biscuit) and it was actually really tasty!
If the wait is long, grab a seat at the bar!

This was our first time in NOLA and per some recommendations from back home, we decided to get brunch at Ruby Slipper. It was a great first meal! *** Tip: Put yourself on Yelp wait list as it gets pretty packed ***

I got the Grilled fish St. Peter and my girlfriend got the Peacemaker (chose 2 different egg benedicts). My meal was delicious and definitely one of my favorites during our trip. The fish was cooked perfectly and seasoned just right. The egg benedicts were pretty good as well. Service was awesome even though they were super busy.

This trip has been the best eats I've ever had!!  

Put your name on the waitlist on yelp...  when we got there, the host was saying it was an hour wait. 

Cool thing is they have a cocktail server who serves drinks while you wait! I had a creamy vanilla spice latte and it was perfect with the light drizzle outside. 

For lunch, we ordered the special creme brulee pancakes and the trifecta. While everything was good, the best was the eggs cochon, without hesitation. I only get a few bites to eat at every meal so I ordered the trifecta to get a bite of three different benes. Next time, I'll go straight for the cochon.  Holy crap yall, it was soooooooo good.

This is a great, quick breakfast option. Their king cake stuffed French toast was really sweet, but yummy and festive! Our server was phenomenal and we didn't really have to wait even though it was peak breakfast time.

If you get any dish with a biscuit here - and I CANNOT stress this enough - you will taste it in your dreams for years to come. So be prepared to succumb to your subconscious desires and go back again and again.

Seriously though, this is my mom's favorite place to come to breakfast whenever she visits New Orleans, and I think that is among the highest of compliments. They have an extensive menu for hearty, meaty breakfast lovers, vegetarians, and those searching for lighter fare. The prices are great for the enormous quantity of food you get. I have gotten the Florentine omelet every time and I will probably continue to do so for all eternity. 

The cherry on top? French! Truck! Coffee!

As good as chain restaurants can get. Try it and you'll never look back.
Perfect service from while we waited to the very end. Fresh, hot, delicious coffee. Perfect Bloidy Marys and Mimosas. Best damn brunch ever. Go here. Wait if you have to. It's worth it.
Good price, friendly and fast.  We ate here every day on our trip.  Ask for the pulled pork omelete.

I first dined here on Saturday w my girlfriends who drove up from ATL 2 spend the say w me!! Now, the food -- salmon Benedict was cold and each time I mentioned it 2 the server,  I was told it's coming.  The cooks are preparing more hollandaise sauce... but when it was brought to me--- it was STILL cold!!!  The cooks shld take MORE Pride on satisfying the customer and not allow the servers to take the brunt of the matter.  So basically I enjoyed a COLD breakfast at a highly recommended restaurant in #NOLA.  I'm going to try them again!!!

There is a point were a restaurant's success begins to drag it down.  Gone are the days when I could go to the Ruby Slipper, get right in, have a great breakfast along with great service.  The place always had a healthy local "vibe" without being to overwhelming.  The waiters were always engaging, full of interesting conversation, and always right on the spot when you needed them.  Today, the Ruby Slipper has been overrun with an insatiable following (of course lots of tourist have discovered the place) resulting in hour plus waits,  apathetic servers, and food that takes longer than it should to reach the table.  And you'll be lucky to flag down your waiter to get your coffee topped off.  Luckily the quality of the food has not suffered, and if your willing to forgo all of the fore-mentioned problems, you will still have a very good tasting breakfast.  For me, I'm out and have found a new place that I really love for breakfast - thank you Willa Jean for saving my N.O. CBD breakfast experience.
The food was excellent. Definitely would recommend. Definitely a tourist spot. The staff is very kind and the food is brought out promptly upon ordering!

So I went during Mardi Gras with the girls, good good good girlfriends 50th birthday party, awesome place to have a 50th, I found out  you're only as old as you feel and that we were 26 again. Anyway if anyone took pictures at #CoyoteUgly you better not publish them. Anyway moving on I believe I reserved the table through Yelp but we still had an hours wait when we arrived, that's OK because we ordered Irish creams (spiked coffee) to keep us warm well waiting outside, plus we huddled. Once we were seated (a bit tight for six people) they took our drink  orders immediately.  after a bit of a wait --which is not a problem when the spiked coffee keeps me grounded (pun intended)--the food started to flow out.  Everyone's meals look incredibly delicious.  I ordered the Cat fish and Grits with a side of grilled shrimp, didn't realize it came with a biscuit so I ordered  rye toast so I just used that to sop up the rest of the grits. Everything was excellent, I sampled my daughters smoked salmon eggs Benedict w/hollandaise sauce.  The service was great considering how busy they were. I made the mistake of going to the restroom once my meal was almost complete and upon returning to my table my chair was missing, everyone around us were just as perplexed as I was.  My group were either on the phone or in tents in conversation to not have seen it taken. I stayed for quite some time which is why they are not getting five stars, one of the server said she saw being taken but did not offer any explanation as to why she allowed it. Everyone around us were commenting how rude it was that I had to stand for quite some time. All in all it was an excellent and maybe funny experience.

The lines look overwhelming.... but that food! Goodness!It's worth a wait or a visit a little bit earlier in the morning. You can't go wrong with the chicken St. Charles, the pancakes, the French toast, or any of their other top dishes. There's quite a few. Also, I'm not big into morning drinking but the brandy milk punch and the boozy ice coffee are freakin' incredible. Another must order when you are here.
Service was good, but the food was not worth the one hour wait. Presentation far outdid the taste.
I had a great experience at Ruby Slipper Cafe and the food was amazing! Our waitress was Arielle and she was fantastic! Very accommodating and gave us great recommendations.

When visiting New Orleans, we stayed in the CBD and noticed the long line outside Ruby Slipper on the first day. Hadn't planned on going but we had time on our last morning to do something close by before going to the airport.

The place was packed (keep in mind we arrived at 8:45am on a Tuesday) and had a 30 min wait when we arrived. If you are going to go I would go early- there doesn't seem to be a slow time based on what we saw.

The food was good- not the best we had in NOLA by a long shot but perfectly fine. My husband got 2 different types of eggs Benedict and he loved it, I had the cajun ruben which tasted like every other ok ruben I have had- didn't taste anything cajun at all.

Service was good. It was very busy but our waiter stayed on top of things. Overall, for the people waiting more than 1 hr for this place I don't think it is worth it- at least based on what I had. It was fine, but there are other places to eat where you don't have that kind of wait.

Overrated. Most menu items are fried / oily (not in a good way). I also got food poisoning 2 hours after brunch. I don't recommend this restaurant unless you go for basic New Orleans staples like gumbo or shrimp grit.

Whoa, tourist popular! Worth it. Bloody Mary's were exceptional. You'll need one while waiting for breakfast. Wait was only 3/4 what they told us., 1 hour. We had BananaFoster Frenchtoast, Pork Eggs Benedict and Salmon Benedict, both on biscuit. The Benedict are mouth watering. Loves them. The sauce was unique with New Orleans flair. Service was fast & Efficient, friendly.

Hands down best breakfast in town. The food, service, and drinks were great. They have a server that will bring you drinks while you wait for your table. Bacon Bloody Mary and mimosa were delicious and a very generous pour.  The first time we were there my husband got the shrimp and grits and I had the stuffed French toast with bacon. We shared a biscuit with cane butter.  I suggest you add your name to the wait list on the Yelp App, that way you don't have to wait as long. A must stop when you in New Orleans, it won't disappoint.

Went twice for lunch during my 4 day trip, it was that good. Standouts - Rubyn (aMAZing on the marbled rye bagel) and bananas foster french toast (if you love sweet). 
The Bloody Mary's are delish and the mimosas are made properly.. Almost all champagne!

The food is delicious, high quality, presented beautifully, and just what I like! The service is excellent, the atmosphere is fun and inviting. I love this place. With so many places to eat in New Orleans, we still want to eat breakfast here every day we're in the city!

We were visiting NOLA and wanted to see how this Ruby Slipper compared to our home town - delicious as ever! Our server, Freddie, was top notch, too! I had the Eggs Cochon and my wife the Shrimp and Grits. We each had a coffee with some nutmeg - an addition that we will be incorporating into our home brews now. Both meals tasted great.
Arrive early or check in via NoWait, because the line gets long.

My bachelorette brunch was absolutely amazing! The food was delicious and worth every penny. Our waitress was very fun and made great recommendations. We had a pretty big party but everything flowed smoothly and our food came out within a reasonable time. The French Toast Batons tasted like heaven on a plate! Whenever I'm back in New Orleans, this will be a definite stop. The only recommendation I'd make is to use the online reservation app to reserve a spot before you arrive. Through the app, our wait was 45 minutes and we were able to walk in once we arrived.
We were here for Brunch and the wait was 45 min for 2 people. So we waited and we are glad we did the food was good and the pancakes even better. For 10 dollars you get a big glass of mimosa

The wait can actually go by pretty fast if you wait "in line" on the app first. We were staying at a hotel close by so we took our time walking to the restaurant. The Bloody Mary was so good! I ordered it while waiting outside but we ended up getting seated shortly after anyway. I decided to do 2 mix and match of the eggs Benedict. I got the Eggs Cochon and Shrimp Boogaloo. I preferred the Eggs Cochon. Hubs got the Grilled Fish St. Peter and he loved it. The service was quick and attentive. I wouldn't hesitate to go back there again when I'm back in town.

Nice place and good food. If i could give 3.5 it would be more fair. My wife had the florentine omelet which was just ok with the fresh orange juice that seemed more like fresh out of a box. I had the patty melt which was far above avarage and cooked spot on. The coffee was as always bland but i also do like my coffee strong. Service was nice and attentive. Would consider to come back.

I was very satisfied with my meal here at this establishment. I had the cinnamon roll pancakes with a side of bacon and scrambled eggs. The bacon was perfectly crispy and eggs scrambled delightfully as well. The star of the show was the pancakes, which our waiter said didn't even contain eggs. This is shocking considering how fluffy they were. They were also a huge portion. Only 2 pancakes, so I assumed it wouldn't be enough for this 6'1 250 mammoth of a man but boy was I wrong. I barely finished it all, but my one complaint is that both pancakes weren't drizzled with that wonderful cream cheese icing. I needed syrup to moisten both pancakes. I also could've used a little more cinnamon, but that's just my personal preference. If you can make a reservation on the app, do so. It'll cut your wait time down, and as soon as you check in with the hostess they'll text you when you're able to be seated. The line was wrapped around the corner, but our wait wasn't long at all because we used made a reservation on the yelp app.

Eggs Benedict! Except N'Awlins style.  I loved that they offered an Eggs Benedict plate with two different ones. I went with their two house favorites. The pulled pork with the cochon sauce on a biscuit and the fried chicken on a biscuit with tasso cream sauce. Unfortunately the biscuits were pretty hard on the bottom which made them very difficult cut.  And I would have enjoyed more sauce on each which may not be a problem for people who actually eat poached eggs; I always have mine poached hard. But the flavors were excellent and got me thinking about unusual combinations I could make at home.  My husband savored the Banana Foster Pain Perdu. Sweet and rich.   Truth  be told, halfway though oue meal, we traded plates because neither of us wanted to miss any of the flavors. Add fresh squeezed orange juice and life is good.  Very busy at 10 am on a weekday but we were seated right away and had very good service.
Shrimp and grits(cake) were great. Our server Freddie was excellent! Will come back when in NOLA.

The Eggs Cochon is a signature dish for a reason.  It is out of this world.  They say on the menu that it is pork debris but it is basically pulled pork.  The biscuit is very big and the whole dish is quite filling since that's all I had. My neighbor had the blood mary which comes with string beans.  It looked interesting but not my thing.  

FYI, you can just walk in to the bar and order drinks to go or to have while waiting for a table.

This place is great. Our waiter, Franky, was terrific. The menu isn't that large but it is way above average level of food. I had the pecan banana pancakes and they tasted like my grandmother's pancakes! They have a fried, crispy texture from a skillet. Completely changes the game. I highly recommend this place.

This place had an excellent breakfast. First place in the us I have found gallo pinto (Costa Rican beans and rice) and their Benedict selection was unique and very tasty. Long wait so check in online first but absolutely worth it! Highly recommend.

Stopped here for breakfast and we were very impressed! The food was wonderful, very fresh, and good portions. The service was excellent and the restaurant was cute and homey. There were so many good choices on the menu, I think we will have to stop here again while we are in New Orleans for vacation.

Worth the wait! My 3rd time here so I know the deal... grab a drink from the bar and wait your turn.  It's worth it.  The St Charles chicken biscuit is my go to but everything else we've had there is incredible as well! This place is a must do!

Got right in for lunch, sat at the bar. Had the salmon & goat cheese omelet with a side of cheese grits and a biscuit. Service at the bar was good, despite the bar tenders being busy. I'll go back next time I'm in town.

Best brunch I have ever had. The check-in before you go option is unrivaled. When we got there we still had to wait about five minutes but they brought us drinks outside! Fun! I got a grapefruit mimosa and ordered a second when we sat down. I opted for the peacemaker with is the mix and match 2 bennys of your choice. I got the fried chicken one and corned beef hash with them both being super delicious. Can not wait to go back and have it again!
Everything we had was delicious. Thefood was perfect. The bananas Foster was absolutely delicious. Try the eggs Blackwell it's the best version of eggs Benedict I've ever had.
It was so good we went there twice.  I had the French toast and Spanish omlet. When ever I'm in The Nola I'm going again.
This place is awesome! The service is topself. I got a very clear break down of the specials, they gave a lot of recommendations. I'm having the 3 little pig omlett, a special magareta.

The food is great, this review is about the 2 black women that are the hostesses and the face of Ruby Slippers. They have bad attitudes and yes  it is a long wait for a table but it is a way as a hostess that you don't have to have a funky attitude if someone is inquiring about long they have to wait. It is rare I say someone needs to be replaced but those 2 needs to go! Customer service is the worst!
Amazing service and food. The bartender filled the glasses of champagne to the top. The waiter had excellent enthusiasm and suggestions. Cutest place ever

I'll start this review off with the pros. Firstly the egg chacon is delicious. My boyfriend and I visited from California and went to Ruby's twice during our stay. The first visit was to the Ruby's on Decatur Street. We waited about 10-15 minutes. Not too bad. We were greeted by our waitress, I wish I could remember her name, but she was great! Very warm and welcoming. I got the eggs chacon, I believe that's how it's spelled and my boyfriend got the Benedict with fried chicken. The fried chicken was bland and boring to us. We weren't too thrilled so my boyfriend decided to not eat it and ordered what I ordered since we were both drooling over it. We left and promised we'd return again before we left. We decided to visit this Ruby's and were extremely disappointed with the quality of service we had received. We arrived at about 10am on a freezing 45 degree morning and the wait this time was nearly an hour. I had reserved us a table for a party of four on the app. Our two friends hadn't arrived by the time our table was called and they began to inform us that they could not seat us since our full party was not there yet. I've never ran across a policy so strict. It really made me feel like Ruby's was only after the dollar sign. They want to push in and out as many customers as possible instead of seating those that have already made reservations and sat out in the cold for an hour. We decided to just seat the 2 of us hoping that they would still serve them anyways when they arrived. Once they arrived they denied them entry to us and our waiter said even if they come in he will not serve them. I was hoping for the southern hospitality when visiting Nola for the first time. And while the first experience was great the second one left a bad taste in our mouths. Needless to say we up and left and promised not to return again to give them our money. We're from California where hospitality is little to none but we have not once encountered such a ridiculous policy towards a paying customer.

I love the food at Ruby Slipper! My favorite is the croque madame. I had the biscuit with egg fried green tomato and bacon and it was delicious! I also had the king cake brandy milk punch and it was fabulous!

Yeah man, it's that guuuuuuuuuud! Started out with a Brandy Milk Punch (or was it three of them? )  The Mrs and I split a "Peacemaker" even though we were on great terms at the moment and didn't need conflict resolution.  We chose the "Cochon" and Fried Chicken Benedict's for our plate and they were "punch-yo-Mama-in-Da-face" GOOD!  We shared a Bananas Foster French Toast which was super legit as well as the praline pancakes.  The kicker was a Cheesecake and cinnamon apple stuffed French toast. OMG, I think the term is "it's like a party in your mouth."  (Did that sound weird). This is a definite must stop for brunch when in NOLA!

Average food.

Long wait times. Takes forever to get a seat. Forever to place your order and forever to get your food. 

The food is mediocre to average. Way too much hype. I've definitely had better. 

Had a great time talking with some friends we met at the hotel. :)
This place was excellent! The banana pecan pancakes were amazing! One of the best breakfast places to eat at in New Orleans!!

On a scale of 1 to Panera, I would have to give this place a solid Panera. We were unable to be seated at a table when we arrived so we sat at the bar. The waiter was very pleasant and attentive. The food, above average for breakfast. Also while we dined, we witnessed a princess from another world enjoy her first eggs benedict. Such a treat. Would recommend to anyone who likes food.
Absolutely amazing!!! I had to get up early to be the first customer when they opened the door before the crowds came flowing in. It was absolutely worth it too!!
Aside from waiting for 45 minutes to receive our food and drink orders, I found a curly black hair in my Chicken St Charles. Absolutely disgusting.

I am not a big breakfast fan but really enjoyed myself at this restaurant. The catfish and grits were amazing and I recommend adding cheese to the fish. The options were cheddar, goat, swiss and pepper jack. I tried the goat cheese and let me tell you --- It was soooooo good! Our waiter Devin, was able to provide great recommendations and he did not steer us wrong!
Service, food, and drinks are amazing! Very friendly staff with great food makes this one of my favorite Baton Rouge restaurants! If you go ask for Jimmy he'll get you right!
We were seated right away, the waiter was fabulous and very helpful, and the food was delicious. We ordered the Shrimp Benedict and it was so flavorful!!!

This place was so good we went for breakfast 2 days in a row. 

The first day we were walking towards the restaurant and saw a bunch of people outside. Oh no, is this a line?  Yep it was, and we were starving. It was a little later in the morning. About 10 am and we thought about bailing. However the grumbling in my stomach told me these people are waiting for a reason so we shall wait too. 45 min later we were seated. 

The first day as it was almost 11, I decided to go with a lunch type food and ordered the Rubyn which is served on a marble rye bagel. It was so good and the side of fries were awesome as well however seeing my girlfriends Bannas Foster Pain Perdu, I instantly fell into a pit of despair. We enjoyed the meal however after my taste of her breakfast made a resolve so deep it could not be broken. 

Rise and shine wood chuck chuckers. 

Next day we left our hotel at 6:45 to be there when the doors opened at 7. We were the first people seated and there was no line. Didn't start getting crowded till about 8. 

This time I made the best decision of my breakfast eating life and had the Bananas Foster and lions and tigers and bears, oh my, it was phenomenal. 

The waitresses were awesome both days and we have since started looking at real estate in the area because with these ruby slippers there's no place like home.

went here on a recent Tuesday morning so we did not have to wait. Our group had the eggs cochon, basic breakfast, omelet and mimosas. the basic breakfast was pretty much that- good but nothing special. The eggs Cochon and omelet were delicious. Large menu with generous portions. friendly hostess and waitresses. they also have an outdoor patio on the sidewalk good for people watching in nice weather. would go back for sure

Come here!!! The eggs cochon are a must. You will definitely leave full and happy. Take advantage of being able to add yourself to the waitlist on Yelp before you head over. It's a popular place, and rightfully so, so try to time it that you don't come at peak time and minimizes your wait! We loved this place and found it equally as delicious as its sister restaurant in the French quarter!!

We've heard great things about this place and it did not disappoint! The only reason I didn't give it 5 stars was the service was slow. But I have to admit, it was well worth the wait! I ordered the smoked salmon omelet and it was fantastic! My husband ordered the Spanish omelet and it was also delish!  The biscuits are incredible- if you're gonna splurge on carbs, this one is worth it ;)

If only we had found this place earlier in our trip. We had brunch here our last day in town. Dined here on Thursday around 9am and this was the week of the New Orleans Jazz and Heritage Festival. We were seated right away, our timing was perfect because just a few minutes later it became very busy. I had the Chicken St. Charles, which was amazing! Coffee was great and the service was wonderful.

Fun breakfast/brunch spot in the CBD.  My friend and I sat at the bar and had a great time chatting with the bartender who also took our food order.  Yummy breakfast options with great ambiance for a fun experience.

On a five day vacation in a place know for the food, we went twice. That should say it all. 
We went to two separate locations- the Canal Street and the Magazine Street-and both were fun, upbeat kind of places with outdoor seating at the Canal Street location. Just cool little spots. 
It is known for a few things, one of which is the unique and amazing eggs benedict they have. There was a fried chicken breast, a salmon, a debris-pork type....and I can't remember the rest, but ALL of them were awesome. Because you get two, they let you mix and make so the BF and I got to try 4. I don't think I could pick a favorite but I think the BF liked the salmon the best. They range between 13-15 dollars, which may sound a little steep to some, but it was a mountain of food. Both time the BF and I spilt one order. $15 for a breakfast is more than worth it. We got potatoes and fried green tomatoes, and even though they weren't anything fancy, we both remarked at how good the potatoes were. Really, everything was fantastic. I could have drank a vat of the hollandaise sauce with a straw it was so good! They also have a few funky, unique drinks that I would have definitely tried if I drank, but I don't hence the hollandaise love.

So my brother has been here twice and he RAVES about it. When we made reservations over the app we still had to wait so we made sure we made the reservations when we weren't even close to ready because it was over 2 hours of a wait. 
Now when we got there we still had to wait ANOTHER hour and we got called later than our reservation which is I guess understandable, they were super busy. When we got called finally, we got seated at the bar. The bartender was awesome he made us drinks and we IMMEDIATELY placed or food order too cause we did not eat all day yet and it was already past noon. After placing our order we waited an hour and a half for a plate of basically two eggs Benedict with whatever combos we had with it. Honestly for me it wasn't worth the wait what so ever. It tasted pretty basic like at another diner. I mean it was good but not mind blowing. Not worth the hype.

I live this place. It's a must stop in NOLA for me. You will wait because it's that good. 

I've had the Eggs Benedict with corned beef hash. So good. Fresh hash and eggs cooked perfectly. Most recently the Eggs Cochon which is a pulled pork version. Wow. I was nursing a pretty good hangover so this was the perfect cure. 

Coffee is strong and hot and the service is moving. I don't think that place ever sleeps. Even on a Monday brunch it was packed.

My wife and I were spending a long weekend in NOLA, and wanted to find a good breakfast place near our hotel. I asked a bartender at Harrah's casino (Billy Ray), he said Commander's. I told him we were more "local diner" people, he said can't go wrong with the Ruby Slipper. He was absolutely right! I put my name on the wait list using their Yelp app. Glad I did. This place gets busy, for good reason.  The food was delicious! We can't get biscuits like that in Chicago. Our flight out was cancelled, so we stayed an extra day. We went right back again before we left. Awesome!

I recommend getting here as early as possible because you WILL have to wait, but the wait will be worth it.

We waited about 35-40 minutes which went by quickly as we ordered Bellinis from the bar and reviewed a menu. Once seated, we were serviced quickly and our food was served surprisingly quick.

The Chicken St. Charles was heavenly!!!! Can't go wrong with that.

I popped in for a quick solo lunch, sat at the bar, and had fantastic service and good food. I don't normally have bennies because I dislike hollandaise, but the Ruby Slipper has a fried-chicken-on-a-biscuit bennie with a ham/cream sauce (the St. Charles). I could have easily split it with someone; I ate until I could eat no more... and then ate some more. The service was five stars, the food was tasty down-home fare and a good combination of flavors. Nothing that really stood out, but all very solid. I'd happily go back again.

Not overly impressed, especially with all the hype surrounding this place. Had to wait over an hour for seating-they do not take reservations. It's VERY LOUD, waited almost as long for food to arrive, service was not anything to write home about and the food was just average, especially for NOLA! Ordered the BBQ Shrimp & Grits-very small shrimp and the grits were so runny...ick! Biscuit was yummy, but a girl can't survive on biscuits alone! Don't understand why the place is always so crowded.

A step up from IHOP. We had a nice breakfast.
Service was just ok (i.e. ingredients were missing).

Yummy, yummy!  Enjoyed the "Ruby's Basic Breakfast" - it was the full meal deal. The cheesy stone-ground grits were creamy and delicious, the breakfast potatoes seasoned and delightful, the chicken sausage (never had before) was scrumptious, and the eggs were cooked perfectly.  They open at 0800, so you have to get there early, because the place fills up quickly.  But the food is worth the wait.  The servers were pleasant, the food comes out quickly, and as crowed as the place is, there is not much talking, because everyone is enjoying their meal.  Good eating!

Highly recommend. ....awesome breakfast! 
Suggest downloading the No Wait app  to get yourself in line.  Sat at the bar,  service was rather slow, but that seems to be the pattern here in NOLA.  Enjoy!

Overrated. First, if you come here please make a reservation ahead of time on Yelp. I like the app because it tells you in real time how many parties are ahead of you.

Ambience :it's loud and noisy. 

Service : they put us in the corner with the stroller and he offered me more coffee. He brought the check before we were finished but that was ok. 

We had the egg couchon and banana fritters. Both were good but nothing deserving of a 25 min wait. The banana was overdrenched in syrup.

The host at the entrance counter at 10 30 am on 12/26/2013 told me that my party of 7 would have a 15 minute wait which was fine. He then told us to wait outside which was ok too, though a little rude since there was ample space inside. I asked him if my grandmother could wait inside since she is 85 years old and very frail. He said no. I insisted, he still said no, like a robot. This place needs to hire a host that is a normal human who has basic emotional skills. Some people have special needs and the restaurant needs to hire people who are able to accommodate them.

I can't complain about this place.  I'd recommend tasting one of the specials.  I tried the Eggs Cochon.  It's basically benedict on pulled pork atop a biscuit.  It was pretty good.  The eggs weren't quite as runny as I usually like 'em, but maybe that's personal preference.

The staff was friendly, they have TVs for watching the game, and the space is nice and open.

I guess the only negative thing is, I ordered an orange juice and it came in basically a shot glass.
The wait was super long, but well worth it. Definitely make sure you add your name to the wait list ASAP if you want to get in before 11am. Food was great! Service was great too!

Overrated. Food was average at best.  Soggy pancakes, over cooked potatoes, fatty meats.  Long lines amongst trash bins.  After finishing a $5 latte, they charged $3 to fill the cup with regular coffee.  Better places elsewhere.

Got there just after 7am and was seated right away. Server was very friendly and funny.  The food was excellent.  Trifecta had a nice variety of flavors on it.  The skinny migas was very flavorful and light! This is definitely a revisit when back in town.

We got here early after trying for two days to get in (over an hour wait both days) and was able to walk right in and get seated....so big advice-get here early(we got here right at 8am in a Monday). By 8:30 there was a line to get in. But the food was well worth the wait. Service was great as well. We had stuffed French toast and the French toast brioche. Both were excellent. Comes with bacon. Excellent. Would highly recommend.

At Ruby Slipper this morning, the hosts were pathetically inefficient, spending most of their time talking to each other instead of keeping the seating moving efficiently. We has a nice waitress who got grief from one of the hosts for being polite. Nice place, but the attitude of the hosts needs to be adjusted or replaced.
Amazing food !! Very crowded place.  Definitely worth the wait but plan a ahead and they have several locations.

Quick-tip: Do yourself a favor and add your group to the waitlist through the yelp app!! The wait on Saturday around 9:30AM was 45-59mins for party of 4. The app will tell you what time you should arrive. This gave us time to get ready and walk over without having to wait in line! We arrive when it said we should and we were immediate seated. Love this functionality so this get half a star (3.5)! 

We ordered the shrimps & grits and the peacemaker which is pick 2 Eggs Bendict from the menu for 2 to share. We picked egg cochon and chicken St. Charles. Honestly, the peacemaker would've been enough for 2 to share!!

- Shrimps & grits was good but don't think I would order this in general. It's almost like a rice porridge with shrimp and some sauce on it. I took a couple bites and was done but of course I don't like wasting food. I dipped it with the biscuit. 
The peacemaker:
- Egg cochon was delicious. poached egg was cooked just right and goes well with the pork! 
- Chicken St. Charles was the fried chicken and was just ok. I would suggest to add some hot sauce with this. 
- Big mimosa - Peach bellini $10 meh wasn't peachy at all   didn't enjoy this. I prob would prefer the regular mimosa

We were staying a couple of blocks away and decided to check this place out. On Yelp, the live wait time was 0 so it didn't allow us to get on any waitlist. When we arrived, there was a 35 minute wait. 

I ordered the Costa Rican which is one of the specialties. I ordered with my eggs scrambled and on a different place because I am a weirdo. The food came out correctly and promptly and I have to say I was disappointed. The salsa lacked flavor and the plantain were DRY. As if they had been left out for a few days. Not fried, not baked, just dry. So blah, I ate around them. 

My friend let me try some of his biscuit and it was pretty good. The service was really great and the restaurant runs like a well oiled machine. I'd probably come back just because great service is hard to find and I'm curious about the Boozy Iced Coffee. LOL.
Excellent food and atmosphere. We have eaten at the New Orleans location as well as the orange beach location. Excellent and consistent food and service at both locations.

Eggs Cochon and Migas and Bacon Oh My!!  You had me at Cinnamon Bun Pancakes... Thank you yelpers!  You done us right.  Great location - easy walk from the hotels on Canal, lots of seating, great service.  I was sad I didn't get to be in town on Sunday for Jazz Brunch at the Commanders Palace... But after brunch here on a week day - I'm happy!

Just OK! Service is not great. Super busy. Food is good.
Great place for young people and small groups.

This review is based on the Ruby Slipper in the CBD. 

One of only places on our trip I would give 5s. Stuffed French toast...phenomenal. Cinnamon Pancakes...crave-able. Omelettes, overflowing with flavor. Iced coffee could have been better but overall this is definitely worth the wait. Do yourself a favor and check in through Yelp to get on the waitlist, otherwise your wait is typically 45-75mins. Place is always busy so don't be in a rush. Service takes a minute and it's definitely not a quick in and out.

Came here based on a recommendation.  

Ordered the Ruby Slipper Mimosa and the Brioche French toast. 

The atmosphere was pleasant. Casual and busy... nice city feel. I sat at the bar inside but the place was cool and breezy. Wish the music in the background had been a little louder, but the lively chatter from the patrons made up for it. 

The Ruby Slipper mimosa was just okay. I wouldn't order it again... it was missing something. I asked for ice and it tasted a bit better. I think the champagne being at room temperature didn't help... perhaps more pomegranate? Everyone seems to order one, but they are slow to be drained. The plastic wine glass made the glass look dirty but I don't think it was. 

The French toast was tasty and done as well as expected. Nothing new or fancy but it tasted good. 

Now I eat a plant based (mostly vegan) diet so I don't know if it's because I hadn't had bacon in over a year, but the applewood-smoked bacon was really good! Wish the dish had come with more than two slices. I was tempted to order a side but resisted temptation!!

Service was attentive and the waitress apologetic when my silverware was dirty. Would I come again? Probably not, but now I can say I've been to the Ruby Slipper!

Quite possibly the best breakfast I have ever eaten! Fantastic food and great service. Long wait, but the No wait app really helped by letting us check in before we left the hotel. We had the signature dishes that were marked on the menu and they amazing.

SO GOOD! My mom recommended this place, and I put myself on the wait list via yelp. (Cool feature!) and there's definitely a wait. So I recommend it. The host was very nice, gorgeous eyes, and she remembered my name, and said "have a nice day, Tuesday!" On the way out. I thought that was very sweet. Our server was Caroline, who was funny, sweet, and attentive. Gave great recommendations. I ordered a mixed berry mimosa, and it was strong. Reaaaaally strong. It's New Orleans though, so that's to be expected. I got the classic southern breakfast plate, and it was awesome. My friends and I cleaned our plates in a maximum of ten minutes. That's how good it was. I spent 24$. The total bill was 55$. For three people with a 10$ mimosa, that's pretty good. Would definitely go back.

This place seems to be known for their breakfast food as when I checked in with Yelp their special offer was a free mimosa with the purchase of one. Also, although I was there for lunch, the waitress recommended the cochon eggs benedict. (I tried it and although the eggs benedict part was decent but not great, the cochon part was pretty damn good!).

My co-worker had the cordon bleu chicken sandwich, also recommended by our server, and he said it was good.

Our server was very nice and pleasant to talk to. I would definitely come back.

I am a big fan of local places to eat. Having said that, a friend of mine recommended this place for breakfast on our trip to NOLA. I was a little turned of about the long wait times, but was lucky enough to notice this "heads up" on this app. So I waited all of 3 mins while others waited almost an hour. The food was delicious. The coffee was excellent!! I like my coffee black. It was so delicious I brought a bag home. I  ordered the Costa Rican. It had excellent flavor and hit the spot for my breakfast craving. The only part that I wasn't fond of was the busyness. Everyone was crowded in. But it was definitely worth the 10 minute walk from our hotel. And I'd eat there again. A lot.

To start off, its amazing that they have the waitlist option, save yourself time and use the waitlist option. Also, there are 2 locations, make sure you go to the correct location. The food here is very delicious. I had the shrimp and grits, its a healthy portion and flavorful. The fried green tomatoes were okay. I did not order an alcoholic beverage, but saw the bloody marys being made, the look tasty and many people were ordering them. The staff was very friendly and moved quick. You can tell that everyone has a job and everyone is doing it. The quality of the food is top notch! I recommend going here!

Bomb!!!!!!! The potatoes was so seasoned y'all AND I Don't eat potatoes like that.  Fries tomato was "whatever".  Bacon and grits great. I got a fried egg over hard and they cooked t to perfection.  Marisa was my waitress and she was extremely nice.  Biscuits be thick like a sponge very big.  Eat it with the cinnamon butter, you won't be disappointed!!

Expect a long line, especially weekend brunches but it is so worth it! On a Saturday morning our party of 5 was about a little bit more than an hour wait. You leave your name and number and you can come back when you get a text from them. You can also put your name down in advanced with the 'nowait' app that they use. 

We started off with some drinks. We got some of their specialty cocktails like the Bacon Bloody Mary and the Ruby Slipper mimosa. I'd say the mimosa was just average, nothing special but the Bacon Bloody Mary tho! I usually do not like bloody marys at all but if I ever come back, I'd get the Bacon Bloody Mary. 

So we ordered the Eggs Cochon, Chicken St Charles, Migas, BBQ Shrimp and Grits, and their daily chef special for that day which was an eggs benedict with smoked brisket and lastly a cheesecake stuffed French toast. My favorites are def the Chicken St Charles and the eggs benedict with smoked brisket! The eggs are poached perfectly. Dip the meat into the runny yoke with some Crystal's hot sauce! It's the bomb!

Our doorman at The Monteleone recommended we try this place for breakfast. April 9th. Lovely decor, incredible menu. Our server was Allen and he was right:  a lot of things they serve you can get anywhere. But our Benedicts are our specialty and you should give them a try. He was a fantastic server!!! I highly recommend this place, but get there before 8am or the line will be out the door.

Trifecta- three different types of eggs Benedict. Eggs cochon, chicken St. Charles, and shrimp boogaloo. Every single one was delicious. 
Classic buttermilk pancakes- two pancakes were think and buttery. Came with two slices of smoked applewood bacon. Bacon was sweet and crispy.

This should be a must on your list when you are hungry for breakfast. The food, the staff, the drinks. The waitress was amazing. She had a great personality, very attentive. I had the BBQ shrimp and grits with a biscuit. I've been to the restaurant twice and ordered it twice. My husband had the special which was the pumpkin spice pancakes. I had to take a couple of bites to try it out. Very nice flavor. He also ordered two sides of bacon. Said that it was the best he's ever had.
Breakfast is good, but very busy place. Don't like queueing up an sat squeezed in a corner. Few tables outside, if you like it more calm recon to try to get a seat there.
The banana Foster's French toast. It was THE BEST French toast I have ever had! The peach belini gave me a buzz. This place is now on my must visit list when I come to New Orleans.

Not a bad wait after using the app's remote wait list (so you're on the list while you travel). Very busy place,  good food, only downside was that they don't do blended drinks. Generous with the alcohol in our cocktails,  food nicely prepared.
It is a little ordinary comparing with its popularity. The waiting time on yelp is extremely underestimated on holiday weekends. We ordered 4 dishes. Only egg cochon was good.

eaten here twice while on vacation. came highly recommended prior. menu has a decent amount of choices. for being a busy place,  service is decent. friendly. food is good. biscuits are super heavy to eat. but that is probably a southern thing lol

Highly recommend this place for anyone visiting NOLA. There are multiple locations so be sure you're at the right one, and definitely make a reservation, as it's usually packed. Totally worth it though.

The best breakfast destination in NOLA. Been here twice, every time just perfect. Eggs are perfectly poached, the biscuit is just another level of fluffiness and goodness,  the pork in couchon just melts in your mouth, could be the best egg-benedict in my life!

With food like this...you don't need a man...just some stretchy pants and some Sprite. We were singing to our food. Singing. I have pictures of everything but I can't remember all the names...I sampled all of it (except for my mom's cheesy eggs ewwww). French toast, eggs benedict, happiness on a plate. I miss this food. This is months after I was there and I still miss this food. I am planning my next trip to NOLA just so I can have this food. So yeah. Pretty darn tasty.
The service was awesome, the food was hot, the drinks were strong. What more can a person ask for?

Food  was great .  Service was quick,  we sat at the bar.  We went for lunch on a Monday and were  seated right away. Friendly  staff. Tried the French toast, a side of eggs and bacon, also had the corned beef Bennie , and the bloody Mary. Be aware they close at 2 everyday
A foodies delight! Very attentive staff. We only went for breakfast but I would definitely recommend for any meal. Not good for dieting but they know how to cook! Very touristy and busy.

Reservation! Reservation! Reservation! (Make sure your party is there to be seated) Save yourself some time, other wise, get ready to wait in line and the line is out the door. Friendly fun staff, food is great, drinks are DELISH! 1st time here, been to NOLA several times, can't believe I haven't been here before. Highly recommend!

Wow-- this place is totally worth the hype. It's not going to break the bank and there are SO many great breakfast options. You can fiend diet specific options or totally indulgent options.   Loved to be able to try two eggs Benedict styles on the same plate!  We didn't try the breakfast drinks, but they seemed to be a fan favorite-- we were early enough to still just need coffee. Get on to the line (wait list) they YELP when you're on your way over, line goes quickly, we were 7th in line for a table and it took about 15 mins.   The demand is high but the server staff does NOT rush you through your meal. Fantastic!!
The best breakfast I have ever had in my life, comes from this place... Egg Cochon!!!!! Get it!

Busy spot! We made sure to put our names in online. We sat at the bar. There were two bartenders and servers. They did a good job balancing drinks and trying to be attentive. Took a while for our drinks and to order food but that's okay, it was a Saturday breakfast rush and my company was nice.
We both got the southern breakfast and it was delicious. I loved the biscuit and special butter that was with it. I ordered the iced latte recommended and enjoyed that, too! 
The menu sounded so good. Next time I have to try the banana foster!!

Oh my gosh! Soooo worth the hype! If I could give them 20 stars I would! Service, food and atmosphere on point! The food was amazing! We all had breakfast and enjoyed it! The biscuits are a must try! CAn you say homemade? Recommend reservations because it's a hour plus wait. We used the call ahead app and it was true to time! A definite must go in New Orleans!

Super fun breakfast joint. Loved that they text your phone when your table is ready as there are lots of places to explore during the wait. 

Had the omelet - awesome! Servers were friendly & attentive. Great atmosphere & lots of people looking for good food. There are at least 2 Ruby Slippers just a few blocks from each other that we saw..... both had a crowd waiting to get in!

Host stand was very friendly and accommodating. Food was delicious. Server was very friendly when he took my order and gave me the check, but there was no communication that the kitchen was behind, my food took almost 40 minutes and I don't recall him checking on me at all until around the 30 minute mark after I asked a different server about the delay.

The service here was great the waitress was very spunky and didn't mind that we had an odd order. The food was good the potatoes with my omelet were great but the omelet itself didn't really have anything special about it except that it was loaded with meat, cheese, and mushrooms. The Migas was good for the odd combination of flavors. The general manager came over to our table and was super nice and I don't eat very much in the morning and was truly concerned that the food wasn't up to par which it really was I just wasn't hungry. The portions are generous as well. It also has a homestyle feel that makes you feel comfortable.

We had brunch here on a Sunday about 11am. The wait was long (1.5hrs), but the food was amazing. My husband and I got the Chicken St. Charles and the Eggs Cochon and shared them. They were both delicious and I cannot decide which was my favorite. We also has the cheesecake stuffed French toast which was sweet and rich. The mimosas are a good size and had a good mix of champagne and OJ. Our waitress was so happy and friendly that it made the experience that much better. I would definitely recommend this place to anyone!

Had breakfast here our first morning and luckily not a long wait. Our waiter, Jake, was excellent and the food across the board was great. It was also one block from our hotel, so super convenient. Jake also told us to use the Nowait app for the next time and we would get in line with the app. What a amazing concept and we did it the next day. Our server the  next day was terrible, didn't even look at us. People that sat 15 minutes after us but with a different waiter, ordered right away and got their food before we could even order. We spoke with the manager, Wayne, who rectified things right away and told us when we come back it won't happen again. The next day we had David who was a great server.  We loved this place so much we ended up going for the 4 of the 5 days for breakfast and never had a service issue again. It began to feel like home by the 3rd day. What was great: pan perdu!, benedicts, migas with oysters (a special), cinamon roll pancakes (also a special), mimosa, bloody mary, in fact everything we ordered. The one other day we went to Stanley and though they have Nowait, you have to get in the line in person and we waited for 45 minutes. The food was very good, but Ruby was better. They had all hands on decks from locations outside Nola to help out during Jazzfest which was very smart of them. 
Thank you Ruby Slipper CBD for helping us start each day off with an amazing breakfast (and it was reasonable too)
As long as you are OK with poached eggs this place is a great hit, five stars..

Recommended by my Uber driver when I asked him for the "best" breakfast in The Quarter. It did not disappoint. Fantastic "Bennies" (Benedicts). The Peacemaker lets you sample two smaller versions of their benedicts. The corned beef was some of the best I have ever had, and the fried chicken was moist and tender. Great atmosphere!  Great service! You have to eat here if you come to NOLA!

Great cafe for breakfast.  Fairly busy but the wait was short for 2.  Seated in 20 minutes.  Really enjoyed the catfish and grits, which were rich and creamy (probably not something to eat regularly).

Wow. What can I say. Thos is southern cuisine at it's best. Crispy, savory, sweet and rich. The drinks are potent over flowing with generous portions of libations. 

We had the Catfish and Grits, the Stm Charles Benedict and the Stuffed French Toast. All of it was amazing and flavor filled. This is brunch anc breakfast petfectly wedded together. Enjoy!!
Great atmosphere- great food - delicious Bloody Mary. Staff is engaging. Long waits but worth it. First time I had eggs Benedict very impressed

Great food, good service.  I don't really have anything negative to say about it.  You can join the waitlist on your phone so when you get there you don't have to wait that long. I had the Peacemaker with a poached egg. I hate poached eggs but I tried it anyways and I loved it.

Solid breakfast, I can see why this place is so popular. Long wait even on a weekday but service was pretty good. They seated parties that put their name in after us which is frustrating when you wait an hour already, which is why I'm giving 4 stars. Wish I had enough stomach to have tried 10 more things on the menu!

Really great little brunch/diner place.  Try the banaas foster.  Huge portions and delicious to boot.  Avoid the mid morning crowds, especially on the weekends if you don't want to wait forever.  I went at 8am and had fast service and little company.  It was great!

DELICIOUS.....AWESOME....GOOD...TASTY are a few words that come to mind. I was here on Saturday,11/24 for breakfast. PLEASE use the app to put yourself on the waiting list! While waiting outside for a table, I was asked if I wanted a beverage. I  ordered the blood orange margarita with a  double shot and I was slowly transformed into my happy self lol. The drink was tasty, strong, and hitted every nerve in my body. I was a lil disappointed that I wasn't given more than one fried green tomato with my breakfast but nevertheless I was fat full and deeply satisfied!
Excellent service...and delicious food!  The Benedicts are inspired.  Pancakes huge and flavorful.  Create your own omelet..perfect.
