We went for an early morning breakfast on a sunny fall day. We sat outside and had a delicious meal. Two of us had the bananas foster French toast and it was delectable!  The service was great, extremely nice staff and timely. I will definitely go back on my next visit!

Labor Day weekend, two days in a row had 1-2 hour waits, learned about the No Wait app, stayed in bed until it was our turn. It was pretty noisy but nothing crazy, the food was fantastic but the seating the chairs to be exact were unbearable. I decided to stand at the bar and eat the majority of my meal. 
I say give it a whirl.

I hesitated to review Ruby Slipper since it was so busy when we went. It was hard to take in the atmosphere or quality of service. We were sat at the bar, right next to the entrance to the back area of the restaurant.. so we had servers rushing by us the whole time yet still forgetting we were there. It was a 1.5 hour wait, even utilizing the wait list on Yelp. We were offered a drink while we waited outside and it was so small for a $6 coffee. I decided not to let these details weigh on my opinion too much since they seemed overwhelmed with the amount of people waiting.

The food was very good and reasonably priced. We ordered french toast and a southern style chicken sandwich. The toast was soft without being soggy, and came with tasty candy bacon. The sandwich was delicious. The chicken was spiced wonderfully and the brioche bread was a nice added flavor. I overheard a waitress telling a customer that she recommended one side of the menu over another, which I understand after our order. They're renowned for their benedicts and dessert breakfast more than anything. While our food was very good, I wish we had ordered some staple items. The coffee served when you're seated is bigger than the to-go cups we had and the same price. Kind of felt a little let down by that, but overall, this restaurant is worth the hype. It's good quality food, and the mixture of New Orleans cuisine into breakfast food is something I think everyone should try.

The Ruby Slipper was exactly as expected. I had read that this place was the go-to for brunch and breakfast, so I knew we had to try it out when we  went to NOLA. I am glad we did. I was able to put our name on the wait list through Yelp, so we didn't have to wait when we got to the restaurant. And it looked like it could be quite a wait. When we got seated, my husband ordered a bloody mary, which he liked but didn't love. He added some Tabasco, though, and said it was pretty near perfect. I ordered the Southern Breakfast and my husband, the eggs benedict. Everything was soooo good and perfectly what I wanted. Being from California, I don't usually have fried green tomatoes or biscuits the size of my two fists in my breakfast. But both were ah-mazing. Also, I have to mention that our waitress was very nice, very informative, and super attentive. All in all, it was a great experience and I would highly recommend Ruby Slipper!

Great breakfast!  We only had two mornings in New Orleans, going to Ruby Slipper on the first morning and one of their competitors on the second morning.  After our second breakfast, we deeply regretted not just going back to Ruby Slipper.  If/when we go back to New Orleans, I more than half expect that we'll just go to Ruby Slipper every morning.

My wife had the Bananas Foster Pain Perdu, which was a big hit.  I was going to order one of their Bennies.  They have a bunch of these, consisting of buttermilk biscuits, topped with poached eggs, some kind of delicious meat (corned beef, pork debris, fried chicken, ...), and some kind of sauce (hollandaise, pork tasso cream sauce, horseradish cream, ...).  I was planning to order the Corned Beef Bennie, but the waitress suggested the "Peacemaker" instead, which is one biscuit each of two different bennies, instead of two of the same kind.  I'm glad she did.  I enjoyed the Corned Beef Bennie but I liked my other bennie even more, the Chicken St Charles, with fried chicken.

Finally, I had seen many warnings about the wait.  We went on a Friday morning.  They opened at 7 and we arrived at about 8:15.  To my surprise, there were still plenty of tables available and we were seated immediately.  By the time we left, about an hour later, there was a small crowd waiting outside, but that crowd seemed to be growing as we watched.

Great food, especially loved the breakfast options.  Biscuits were out of this world! 
Some unique menu items, great wait staff, incredibly friendly and helpful.  Our food came out fast, hot and delicious.  Actually ate here three times ~ I think that says something.

We had high expectations coming into the ruby slipper, and they exceeded them! On a busy Sunday morning, we did have to wait about 35 minutes, but they served us delicious drinks as we waited in line. The service was great and the food was the best part. Everything was fresh and scrumptious - we wish we could've tasted everything on the menu!!
Service was really great & the food was delish.  The ambiance was especially cool.  We asked the server what we should order & he was spot-on: we all loved our meal.

The service was great!  The waitress was new and messed up a lot of the order.  The food was delicious though! I got the trifecta which was really good.  Bacon infused bloody Mary's were awesome!! The ruby slipper mimosa was pretty good as well.  I will go eat here again just hoping for better service next time!!

The line for this place was crazy. But they have an app so you can see where you are next on line. I had the corn beef sandwich and others had banana pancakes platter with eggs and fried green tomato which he loved. My corn beef was very fatty and so was my friends. It was just ok to me. Nothing that special.

Maybe I'm spoiled by breakfast options back home, but I was so hopeful after reading these reviews, and my food was just meh. Perhaps it's because I didn't start with the mimosa (or two).

I ordered my standard breakfast - two eggs over medium, corned beef hash, potatoes, and got the biscuit.  The bf ordered pancakes and fruit and grits.  I got two eggs over easy plus all the rest of my order at a temperature that was luke warm. The biscuit was probably from scratch, but not particularly good.  Likewise, the corned beef hash was made in house (according to the menu), but overly salty, and without that good melded flavor that the potatoes and beef should get from cooking together with a binder (and also not that good luke warm).  Bf got pancakes that were burnt on the bottoms, artificial maple syrup, and fruit.  The grits never showed up, but were still on the bill.

Service was friendly enough.  Tea was an uninspired tea bag and cost as much as the corned beef hash ($2.50), which was a very bad deal - go with the mimosas, like everyone else said. Skip the tea and the corned beef hash. And probably the eggs, if you're picky about how they're cooked.  And check your bill to be sure that you were charged for the food you actually got.

Ok this is by far the best breakfast and mimosa in New Orleans. We had the banana fosters french toast and was impressed with the taste and plating. this place well deserves the honors bestowed upon it. Will definitely return.

This particular location, though possibly the busiest, is my favorite. The people here are wonderful. 

Whether I show up with a group, or I stop by alone to eat at the counter, the staff here are incredibly friendly. Most of them even remember me and my friends that come to visit. 

I love the Migas plate. Eggs scrambled with chorizo atop tortilla chips and with melted shredded cheese. The plate also includes sliced fresh avocado, pico de gallo, and a chipotle sour cream. I'd like to get a side of bacon. The bacon is cooked perfectly, and it isn't too salty. The coffee is a local brand, it isn't too bitter or too strong. I always get a cup to go when I leave. 

If you don't like waiting or dealing with crowds, my friends and I will often plan to arrive right when they open on a Saturday morning at 8am. However, I would definitely tell you that this place is worth a wait. 

See pics!
This place is so amazing i can't wait to return. Great food and service i highly recommend them never have any complaints

I had breakfast there today.   Eggs were luke warm, potatoes and sausages were cold.   Chicken sausage which really is a patty was not eatable, cold greasy and hard. A guest at a table next to me send her chicken sausage back so hers must have been nasty tasting too.  When I told my waitress that food was cold she was rude.    I am shocked that this place is recognized by Zagat.  Maybe someone from Zagat should revisit it.
Would not recommend it.  Tomorrow I plan to have my breakfast at Luke's.

Real nice breakfast. I'd go back, some standbys and unique selections, priced right and good service. 

Follow my rock & roll reviews and subscribe @ 
https://m.youtube.com/watch?list=LLwfZwS-KNa8u0TxI96tdL2A&v=L4VNn3KCkIE

Walked to this cafe from my hotel after reading reviews. It did not disappoint. We must have gotten there before the rush because we were seated right away. Staff was friendly, our breakfast came quickly and was delicious.
Freddie is THE best! Best brunch. Period. The catfish and grits is amazing. I never write reviews, but this is a 'cant miss' spot in New Orleans.
Amazing food. Ordered the 3 little pig omelette and I loved it! Line tends to get long at around 10am. We were there at around 9am and we were seated right away. Perfect timing.
Loved the croque madame, would be even better with a vegan friendly option.  got in quick sitting at the bar but it can be a little tight.

I found Ruby Slipper Cafe on Yelp. I used the check in option to reserve a seat ahead of my arrival. That was a good idea because there was a long wait time (I went during the Essence Fest weekend). 

We were seated shortly after we arrived at our scheduled time. 

The mimosa was on point (a must have). We were seated outside which was great for "people watching". 

I ordered the peacemaker which is an option for two eggs Benedict (mix & match). I chose the Chicken St. Charles and the Eggs Blackstone. Both were good but I preferred the Chicken St. Charles over the other. 

Good spot for a traditional breakfast or if you want to try something new.

The food was good. There was a short wait but the catfish and grits was worth it. My drink was the pomegranate mimosa.  It was good as well 

Note that you can put name on a list before arriving so that you dont have to wait to long.

When you put your name in waiting list, they get your phone number to let you know whenever your table is ready. So you can manage your time.
Food was good. But it didn't have any special feature. So Next time I prefer to try somewhere else instead of coming back there again. It is good for one time try.

The food was so good! We got here just as the doors were opening Sunday morning so we didn't stand in line long. The hostess was a little distracted after we sat (dancing, on the phone, etc.) but it was hard to get our waitress to pay attention to us. No straw when we sat down and ordered drinks and had to ask for a refill. Then we waited on a check for 10 minutes. Great food though and worth every minute! I would recommend this restaurant to everyone.

This brunch is all that and then some!
This place has two to four locations here in New Orleans and they stay busy! It's not impossible to eat here, but reservations are highly recommended! I was able to do call ahead seating through Yelp and it worked smoothly. I was quoted one time to be seated and actually was seated way sooner. As soon as we were seated Theresa & Derrick graciously assisted us. We ordered the following...
Southern BLT  (Fresh green & fresh red tomato, applewood-smoked bacon, lettuce & mayo served on brioche toast 
Fresh Fruit 
Pancakes
Chicken Sausage
2 Eggs Scrambled Over Hard
Breakfast Potatoes
Everything and I mean everything was so good! We left no leftovers! That southern BLT was like no other BLT that I've ever had! I would definitely return to order the very same thing! We waited less than 10 minutes for food to come out, I wasn't even ready to eat yet! I was still trying to do my yelping! Our service were so generous, they checked on us every moment they could to make sure that we were pleased and comfortable. I completely understand why this place has nothing but great reviews regarding this location as well as its other locations here in New Orleans! I definitely recommend this place to anyone that's looking for a good quick brunch w fantastic customer service!
Great breakfast with excellent service. Our server, Markus, was friendly and helpful with choosing a breakfast among their expansive menu.

We went to Ruby Slipper Cafe for brunch.  It was a few blocks from our hotel and had wonderful reviews.  I loved the meaning behind their name!  It was a return home from hurricane Katrina.  

The food was amazing.  We both had the peacemaker, which is a combo of 2 different eggs Benedict options.   I had the Eggs Cochan (pork) and the Chicken St. Charles.  They are served on buttermilk biscuits, instead of English muffins.  Both were amazing, not sure which I liked better!!  This place is very busy and is only open a few hours.  My suggestion is to get yourself on a wait list before you get there.  Also, we got seated at a large table in the back with other customers.  It wasn't a big deal for us, but if you want to be only with your party, you need to let them know.  Otherwise they seat you whatever is available.  Great spot to check out for breakfast or brunch.
Service was great however food not so great. Cold eggs and under cooked bisquit. Disappointed.  I was  really looking foward to something extraodinary for my first meal in new orleans. Bummer

It was our first time there. The bbq shrimp and grits were good. The praline and bacon pancake was big and delicious. However, the Louisiana omelet could have used some flavor. But overall, it was a great experience.

Unfortunately The Ruby Slipper did not live up to the hype with us. Really wanted to like this place, but the food was sub par.  I got the Famed Eggs Cochon, the biscuit was dry, the beef was tasteless and they may have been the smallest eggs I have ever seen.  Ended up scraping the meat off and trying to salvage the eggs, hollandaise and biscuit, but in the end it was not worth it.  Left 3/4 of my food on the plate.  Also got the bacon bloody mary.... After a few sips, left that as well.  Not a good experience.

This is the best place in New Orleans to have Brunch. Right at the corner of Magazine St. & Common St. in the French Quarter. Not only the food was amazing, but also the great customer service of our server, Rachel, was beyond exceptional. We did have to wait about 30 minutes before getting a table, but the wait was worth it. 

We had the Spanish Omelet, the Skinny Florentine and the best one was the Hot-Smoked Salmon Bennie. We also had the cheescake stuffed french toast which is good and not as sweet as the Bananas Foster Pain Perdu.

I'm definitely visiting this place again in my next visit to New Orleans.

My friend and I had a 20 minute wait to eat here during a Wednesday afternoon, which was quicker than the original wait time we got! The wait for the food was a little long but this seems like a pretty busy place. The iced vanilla coffee kept my taste buds busy, while my friend enjoyed a bloody mary with bacon, long green beans, and olive toppings. We shared the trifecta and it was well worth the wait and enough to feed two people. With the trifecta you can choose three different benedicts. We chose fried chicken, shrimp, and pork benedicts. My favorite was the fried chicken one but they were all flavorful and well cooked. The prices were also good for the quality and quantity of the drinks/dishes. This is a chain restaurant and we chose this location because someone had told us it was cheaper since it is located outside of the French Quarter. I can't confirm if that is true but I was happy with the prices.

This place was delicious, and the service was great! After having the restaurant recommended to us by an airport shuttle driver, we went two days in a row. One day I had the Eggs Blackstone, which I recommend wholeheartedly! The biscuits were delicious with the hollandaise sauce. The waitress kept the water, juice, and coffee coming to our table, and the food came quickly. The prices were reasonable.

I think our visit was best described by what the waiter said as we walked in the restaurant: "best decision you've made all day!"
Waited 20 minutes.  Our server Chris was cool, he recommended the trifecta.   The trifecta was delicious- a little bit of everything. Great blood Mary!
Love this place. Very energetic great atmosphere great purvis will be back.  Excellent options for healthy choices as well

This is a nice breakfast place. Make sure to join the waitlist on Yelp before arriving. We came on a Monday morning so the wait wasn't too bad. 

The eggs Benedict are definitely a must. You can even order two different kinds of Benedict if you can't decide. I opted for the hot salmon one. I wish the salmon had more flavor but overall it was good! The portion of the salmon was huge and the biscuit was large as well. It could've used more hollandaise and I think it would've been better if the biscuit had been grilled. 

The eggs Benedict does not come with homefries so I ordered a side of breakfast potatoes and they were delicious and perfectly cooked! 

We also ordered the banana foster French toast. The flavor was good but I did not like how it was Italian bread because it was kind of rough and difficult to chew. 

The service we received was average. Our server was very busy so we had to flag her down for some water. Overall, we had a good experience.

This was a spur of the moment decision after checking in to the Westin. On the way over, the cabbie said The Ruby Slipper was a good choice as I was relaying the information about surrounding restaurants to my man. 

It was on the corner and once inside it was quite open, with a bar in the center. Seating was swift and service was prompt. 

We both chose the Eggs Cochon, which was to our table in 10 minutes. There was a biscuit cut in half with tons of shredded pork, poached eggs and hollandaise sauce. There was a ton of pork! Half filled me up, and we both wish we would have shared. 

The only thing - I had two iced coffees and when I looked at the bill, it was $6. Kinda atrocious. Otherwise, great meal, $13 a piece for the egg cochons.

Starting your wait online is A MUST! The wait is really long, but not if you get yourself in line online. The drinks, food, and service were all 5 star for us. Lance is an exceptional server and was knowledge. This favorite did not disappoint and we'll return on our next visit to NOLA.

Really good eggs benedict varieties. We liked that you could mix and match the options. We were definitely stuffed by the end of the meal. The batch of cold brew coffee we had was extremely bitter and not drinkable, but the bartender gave us a refund without asking.

Great breakfast! Service was fantastic, Freddie H. Was our server and he was fantastic. We ate at the 200Magazine location in New Orleans. Biscuits are delicious and the egg Benedict with the applewood bacon was fantastic. The grilled green tomato was switched out for a fried green tomato. Would go back again!

My first time in NOLA and the Ruby Slipper. We went about 11:30 on a Tuesday and the wait was about 10 minutes. We started with a bloody Mary. So far, NOLA hasn't disappointed with the Mary's. I had a a 2 Bennie sample for breakfast, corned beef hash and egg Cochon. The corned beef hash was good and self explanatory. The Eggs Cochon was exceptional. Slow roasted pork. Phenomenal!! I tried the salmon omelette as well and it was great. It was a fun place to eat. I'm not sure how I'll ever appreciate food in San Diego again.

A very yummy place to eat at. I'm a huge sucker for eggs Benedict and the NOLA twist on these really lured me in. The bed of apple-braised pork pairs seamlessly with the poached eggs and hollandaise. We also got the shrimp and grits and they were also very delicious. Let me tell you guys, I love me a good biscuit. But, the biscuits here are on another level. It comes with this cane syrup butter; it's SO GOOD. I would give this place 5 stars but I felt very rushed during my visit. I was halfway through my meal and the receipt was already printed and at the end of our table. Who said I didn't want another Bloody Mary? After waiting an hour to be seated, I think I deserve a leisurely meal. TIP: join the wailist on Yelp before you arrive so that you don't have to wait as long!
Awesome food....worth the wait. Freddy H is tha man!!! Bacon-infused Bloody Mary. The bacon pancakes are great as well

This breakfast place has amazing biscuit Benedicts and delicious omelets. I ordered the salmon Benedict which had fully cooked smoked salmon. It was the best salmon Benedict I've ever had! The service was outstanding as well. There is outdoor seating which we needed for our two pups. Everyone loves dogs at the restaurant. They even brought water out for them. I will recommend anyone who comes into town to head over to ruby slipper.

Ruby slipper is a must try. The line is usually out the door so an online reservation is your best bet. I cannot remember the name of my dish because I was still full of alcohol from the previous night but it had a nicely seared red fish filet on top of a grit cake with an amazing sauce. It comes with your choice of bread. My buddy ted has a eggs Benedict sampler. This place was great but beware they charge your per glass for iced coffee which was a bit of a turn off. Service was decent but I felt our server was bit overwhelmed with the sheer volume of people inside.
Lots of hype but didn't deliver. The biscuit was too big on the Benedict not baked evenly. I had the crust o it was good but the bread was so thick and dense I couldn't eat it all

Kept coming back!  Coffee is hot and strong.  Had the breakfast sandwich several times.  The biscuit is light and the balance of flavors between the egg, sweet and salty bacon, and tart fried green tomato is outstanding.

Great brunch place! It gets a bit busy but worth the wait. The Bloody Mary and ruby slipper were so good, along with the banana pecan pancakes. I did wish they put more pecans and bananas on top, but still good.
Biscuits are huge & delicious. I had the shrimp & grits, there were 6 big creole seasoned shrimps & the grits weren't bad either. Wait staff was very friendly too

MUST GO TO place when in NOLA! The food here is absolutely amazing and perfect for everyone from families to couples to singles! The staff are very accommodating and friendly even though it gets super busy on the weekends! The fried chicken Benedict is definitely the best in town and very good portion size! This is my go to place for breakfast brunch!

Honestly I wasn't that impressed. I thought I would be. The food was just okay. I was looking forward to the brandy milk punch and have to say it was disgusting. For breakfast or brunch in NOLA I would suggest Stanley's.

This place is without a doubt, one of the biggest disappointments I've had choosing a place to eat via the help of Yelp. Absolutely terrible service, and food was maybe 1.5-2 stars. I'd rather eat at McDonalds and I haven't eaten McD's but 2-3 times over the past couple years. Perhaps we came in on an "off" day.. but, be warned, have low expectations and maybe you'll be pleasantly surprised-- we weren't.
Any two Benes in the menu is a great choice. Everything was delicious and the portions are giant.

There's a reason wait time is so long here...the foods awesome!  And I'm not easy to please!  Moreover, our waiter, Alberto, was attentive, helpful,  talked to us, looked us in the eye, knew the menu, made suggestions, checked on us at least 3 times....ans when he brought out our dishes - all at same time btw.....(other very busy restaurants pls take note - ain't no excuse bringing out two of three plates just cause you are "very busy in the kitchen").....he said "see you tomorrow".  At first I didn't get it, but then we ate....mmmmm....first time here.  Will return. Use Yelp!
love this place, the food is so yummy and mimosas are huge!  Chicken St. Charles is to die for!
We love this place! We always come when we are in town! Great food, drinks and atmosphere! Definitely worth the wait!!

The food & staff are fantastic!  Mother's Day rush with over an hour wait & Freddie took care of us like we were his only table.  Every time he passed he asked if we needed something, even with arms full of dishes.  The biscuits are huge & could almost be a meal on their own.  Ask for Freddie!

Love me some Ruby Slipper, for some reason when in NOLA I only come to this location. Although there is always a wait, they are pretty close to quoted waitlist times.

Once seated the average time from ordering to dining is pretty standard.

The drinks are great and food is good too. I drank my margarita so damn fast I forgot to take a pic of the presentation  but trust me order a Morning Margarita better than coffee..get your day started proper

Went based on reviews. Loved the ability to waitlist online, saved time! The server talked me out of what I was gonna order into what they're known for. I should have stuck to what I originally ordered. Food was ok, had good flavor but looked like it was sitting in the window for a bit. Not as good as expected.

EVERYONE's food looked amazing and my BL2TT's was awesome....only problem was I clearly said no MAYO and the server knew it and it came with mayo....she felt bad that was obvious...............however now my husband's food is getting cold while he waits for mine..........I insisted he start eating but I know he felt bad eating while I waited for my  remake. 

KNOW THIS:  I never ever like to send food back.....come on you hear stories..... you just never know!   

Anyway, so as not to ruin the morning when my sandwich finally arrived I ate a portion but really was not comfortable doing so....I truly just don't like sending food back.....so I can't give this place 5 stars!  it truly looked good, the server was great.....the atmosphere fun.........but mayo on my food makes me ILL and I just couldn't shake it!

my husband loved his meal and so I didn't say a word except I was finished because I was full.
I was turned away at the door because I holding a Starbucks coffee I had just bought. I was told I could finish it then I would be allowed in. Absolutely ridiculous policy!

Make a res or wait in line. Either way it's worth it! The Bloody was quite tasty and a nice way to start. My corned beef Benedict was to die for. All ingredients made in house and the bernaise sauce spiced just right everyone in the party loved their breakfasts and our server was outstanding. Reasonably priced as well #nolaskjc18

When the biscuits are fresh out of the oven, they are scrumptious. You dont have to add salt and pepper to the eggs. Scrambled to perfection. And that candy bacon..... I'm sticking licking my fingers an hour later. Next time, I think I just want a plate of bacon, hold everything else.

The service was decent and most of the food looked good but this place served up the worst shrimp and grits I've ever had.  The shrimp had been frozen, the sauce was watery and there was no cheese, no bacon and no flavor.  The biscuit wasn't any better.

Man do they feed you here, the portion size was big. We came for breakfast, parking was not so bad but it was during the weekdays. Our waitress was nice and service was fast.

We ordered some pancakes,  eggs, bacon, biscuits, grits, the usual American breakfast.

Subpar experience here for breakfast. The southern breakfast is a great idea, but the grits were flavorless --no salt or anything! The biscuit was nice and fluffy, eggs cooked properly to my order but the fried green tomato didn't have much going on besides the batter. Shrimp and grits were similarly underwhelming and could've used more flavor and creaminess.

There's a reason there's a line outside. It's good.  Ask to be seated in Devon's area, you won't be disappointed unless your an a**hole.  Banana's Foster won't disappoint, bacon anyway is great, links good.

This place was decent but far from the best brunch I've ever had. My friend and I came here on our trip to New Orleans when we saw the high reviews. However, neither of us loved our meals. I got an omelette while my friend got the cochon Benedict. My omelette was fine but nothing special. The potatoes it came with were on the bland side and the biscuit was a little too floury and lacked salt. I stole a bite of my friend's dish and thought it was bland. It could have used a salsa verde or something to accompany the pork. In fact, my friend had to get extra hollandaise sauce to add more flavor to the dish. The service was good and our waitress could not have been nicer. However, I would not come back here and would check somewhere else out for brunch instead
I truly love this place. And everyone is so happy and the food is delicious to boot. The cold brew coffee is a must and the choice of benedict's are just the bees knees.
My hubby and I both got the BYO omelet. Food came out quick and hot. Nice waitress. Reasonable prices. Healthy portions.Only thing I didn't like was my omelet had a lot of excess oil.

We love this place for a late breakfast. Always good service and good food. 
The cinnamon pancakes are like a huge plate of cinnamon rolls. And the Migas skillet is delish with the spicy mayo.

I really enjoyed myself when I ate here. When we got here we seen a bunch of people outside, thinking the wait was going to be long. However they ended up seating us fairly quickly. We asked to sit outside, it wasn't hot yet so the heat didn't bother us it was still early. And plus not as crowded or  noisy outdoors. Our server was great and really sweet. She was very accommodating as well.

For my dish I got the trifecta. It was three different types of Benedicts on biscuits instead of English muffins. It had braised pork, fried chicken, and shrimp with fried green tomatoes. I enjoyed the braised pork and shrimp however the fried chicken was on the bland side. It could've used some seasonings like tony chacere's or slap yo mama. But I still enjoyed my food. My friend got the praline pancakes, she let me try some and I thought that was delicious. I didn't even think it needed syrup, it was fine just by itself. It was a lot to handle for one person tho.

Overall, the prices here are reasonable and you get a lot of bang for your buck. Definitely worth it!

Great food, great staff, great atmosphere. We found this gem just across from our hotel and were disappointed that there was a 2 hour wait the first time we stopped by. We were smart and got here just after they opened the next day and were able to get a table right away but the restaurant was already getting full. Tip: you can check in on the No Wait app and I highly recommend doing so. 

We ordered the Eggs Cochon and the Bananas Foster Pan Perdue and both were excellent. 

I'm not often a fan of dining in restaurants that have multiple locations when I travel, but this place is definitely the exception.

Touristy and average..in my opinion.

Service is Great but Can't Stand the Wait!

Food looks great and the dishes are great pictures to share with friends to make them drool. There are so many great local places I do wish I skipped this place.

Benedict Dishes.. both the chicken sst. Charles and pulled pork were meh. Flavorless actually and the chicken was dry without any taste. 

Pancakes are pancakes. AoK. No big woop..just like any where else.

Fried green tomatoes..meh. poor example of what Loisianna has to offer.

Lofty Prices and long wait times. They do have the app to checkin and put your name on the wait list. 

I have had better.. just my opinion. The service was good so AOK. If you're looking for homestyle food that Louisiana is known for, your best bet is to check out some of the other places on yelp.
I got the bananas Foster French toast and it was amazing! We sat at the bar because everything was full but we still got great service and were well taken care of!

While I was happy to wait 20 minutes to eat brunch, once inside I was appalled by the service. The waitress served my boyfriend coffee in a cup with fresh lipstick stains. I had to inform her that it was dirty. Then the ketchup bottle had a white substance attached to it. The server slammed down our plates on the table in a rude fashion and put my boyfriend's plate in front of me. I had to move the plates and nearly burned myself.  The waitress failed to bring cream for coffee to the table and did not check up on us. In addition,  I found a fiber in my biscuit. Avoid if you appreciate clean eating environments and dishware. For quality of food and service, you are better off at IHOP.

My first breakfast in NOLA was here. The hostess with the beautiful braids was very friendly setting a great atmosphere and firsr impressions.  After we were seated we were blinded by the biggest and brightest smile in all of New Orleans! Julie introduced herself and made us feel like we were old friends coming over for breakfast.  She explained all of the local foods and what was all in it. She gave amazing recommendations that were spot on. She had set such a high standard for your restaurant that I was excited to see your other location on canal street. Let's just say that they did NOT live up to Julie's standard or the quality of food at your location.  So the next day we decided it was worth the 15 min walk (I have two bad knees and my husband has two bad hips) just to see Julie and have that expert level of customer service and human kindness again. She embodies what my Memaw and my Mamaw said was southern hospitality . Even though we did not get her as are AMAZING waitress today,  she remembered us. She took time out of her busy day to come say hi and make us feel just as welcomed as she did when we were in her section.  I am simply shocked and baffled by the fact that she is not the regional trainer for waitresses.  If you staff showed 10% of the service skills that she has, you would be a national chain! She is epic! I was bragging about her to other guest in line as we waited for our table! I could go on and on but I fear that I am unable to give her a review that is worthy of her kindness, skill and her heart! Thank you so much Miss Julie for giving us the best dinning experience in NOLA!

Really great brunch spot in the CBD of NOLA. 

Tip: definitely check in ahead of time on Yelp app to get a jump on the line (which can be pretty long), especially since they don't take reservations. 

Amazing and friendly service and Southern hospitality. 

Great specialty Benedicts and waffles/pancakes. 

Definitely will be back!

Looking @ Yelp for "best southern breakfast" on our last day in New Orleans...Ruby Slipper came up 1st. Read the reviews, prepped for the wait & headed out. Polite check in person, waiting outside & waitress came & asked if we wanted coffee while we wait & they would refill at our table. Wait was about 30 minutes...no issue! Called inside at 12:16, seated at bar...waited & we waited! Finally about 10 minutes with no one even speaking to us, I asked a waiter if we were supposed to order on the iPad laying on bar, didn't know since we had never been there before! He said he would take our order. Person with me went & asked if we could have a table since there was such bad service at bar.  After this waiter I asked about ordering finished washing glasses & silverware he did take order, but I guess he was mad because we complained. Quick order, rude waiter, took another 30 minutes to get food. Then had to ask for coffee refill! Laid the ticket on bar & never asked if we wanted anything or if order was ok...I had to ask another waiter to take our payment! This "Michael" that took order was apparently a bartender that was being put out to serve food! He never spoke to us!! If we ever go back to New Orleans, I would eat at Ruby Slipper but never at the bar! 2 stars because food was great! Could have been 5 except for rude " Michael". Left him $1 tip & he did not deserve that much! Also spoke with check in person as we left...she apologized & said she spoke with him & would tell manager.

Food was ok, it took forever to come out! We went for lunch on a Sunday. I got the fried chicken on a biscuit, good flavors but nothing left me wanting to come back for more. I was kind of disappointed, honestly it was overpriced for the amount of food you actually get. Glad I tried it tho.

I heard people rant and rave about the Ruby slipper so I thought it would be a definite must try while visiting New Orleans. I was wrong. I was very disappointed, maybe it's because the place was hyped up so much I'm not sure. I tried the chicken St. Charles and the corned beef Bennie. I did like the chicken but I took one bite of the corn beef and was not impressed (I didn't even take another bite of the corned beef). My husband had the eggs cochon -he said it was "ok" (he only ate one of the two). On the positive side the portions were huge; we probably only needed one entrée and could've shared. Overall not impressed and wish I saved the meal for somewhere else.
This place was hyped. Didn't really like it. It's honestly really watered down NewOrleans food in Mew Orleans. Probably will not visit this place again. Don't understand the hype at all

The line wrapped around the corner was a pretty clear indication that this was either a really good place to eat or a complete tourist trap.  Turns out it was the former.  Although we had about a 45 minute wait to sit (group of 9), the time flew by between the outside conversation with friends and the waitress they send around to those waiting outside for drink orders.  The Bloody Mary is a must.  A nice twist on the traditional Bloody Mary with a house mix and nice garnish of lime, a seasoned string bean, queen olives, and one or two giant pieces of bacon.  The service was great, and if you're lucky enough to draw Devin, he's pretty hysterical.  The menu offers a mix of what you would expect to find at any breakfast place (omelette, eggs Benedict, etc.), but also offers New Orleans/Southern-style dishes like chicken biscuits and gravy and shrimp and grits.  Highly recommend The Peacemaker, which is a pick-two option for Ruby Slipper's take on eggs Benedict.  Pictured in the review is the Eggs Blackstone (applewood smoked bacon and grilled tomato served on a buttermilk biscuit topped with 2 poached eggs and hollandaise sauce) and the Hot Smoked Salmon Bennie (hot smoked salmon served on top of a buttermilk biscuit topped with 2 poached eggs, finished with red onion, flash-fried capers and a dill hollandaise).  It was out of this world.  It is a little pricey if you're not watching how much you're ordering, especially the drinks, so keep that in mind.  Do yourself a favor and endure the wait.  It's well worth it.
Worth the wait. The choices are unique but yet still have a classic flair about them. The staff was attentive and friendly.

There is a reason why this place is always crowded while no other places are -- because their food is good! 

During our 4 days trip in NOLA, all 4 of us agreed that is probably the best food that we ate in NOLA. The food is not salty at all, just right. The portion is huge as well. We got 2 egg benedicts, a chicken sandwich, a banana pecan pancake, and a grilled fish chef's special -- all for $125 with tips. Highly recommend the creamy vanilla iced coffee or just their NOLA iced coffee. Both tastes amazingly great. Do not order fresh fruit -- $3 for a mini bowl of fruit is a waste. 

Great service so you don't have get pissed off first thing in the morning with a hungry tummy. 

This is definitely a must-go place in NOLA, I'm not sure why many foodie websites don't recommend it.

We eat here everyday we when in New Orleans. 
THE BEST BREAKFAST EVER!!
You must try the Eggs Cochon. It's eggs Benedict with pulled pork that is out of this world. And the Bacon infused vodka Bloody Mary is great too.  Make sure to ask for Devin's section he's a blast. 
There's usually a wait to get seated. You can put your name on the waiting list via yelp. Highly advise it.
Perfect for a casual brunch! The st. Charles chicken is amazing..very extensive menu perfect for breakfast or lunch.

Had a combo of bene - the Cochon and the corned beef hash.  Both were spectacular but I have to tip my cap to the Cochon.  The mix of sweet and savory will stick with me.  My daughter had a real nice scramble of pork, beans, creme, and guacamole dressed with some tortilla fragments...nice touch.  Loved it.

Coffee was awesome...hot and fresh.  Service was efficient and friendly.  Vibe of the place was hopping...a good mix of locals and touristas.

A must-eat place in NOLA!

We went here on 8/8 I think we got in maybe an hour before they were closing and felt kind of rushed. I had an omelet and he wanted shrimp and grits which they were out of. So that was a big disappointment with him.. The service and food was good. We may give it another shot the next time we are visiting.

Checked in on yelp at 8:30 quoting a 30 minute wait. Walked from our hotel to Ruby slipper cafe and waited. Checked in with host at 8:55. Waited another 45 minutes waiting on a text saying they were ready for us. Checked in with the host and she said we didn't check in and it would be another 30 minutes. Forget this place, went to Marjoria's Commerce and got a better experience and meal.
Good food and friendly wait staff. Orange juice was fresh squeezed and the food came fast.

The wait wasn't that bad as we read it can get super busy. The waitress was super nice. The peach Bellini was sent back but our waitress took it off the bill. You get a tremendous amount of food so be prepared to share or take it with you.

This has been a total disappointment. After calling in to get on the waiting list it was an additional 60 minutes wait after check in. The food was mediocre at best. I ordered the southern BLT and they gave me two pieces of Texas toast with half of the sandwich with no bacon and no fried tomatoes on it. The fries were cold and greasy. My father ordered sausage and breakfast potatoes but they were out of potatoes. The only high point about the entire experience was Devin the waiter. He was energetic and funny making the experience somewhat palatable. I would never recommend this restaurant to anyone.
Our server, Monique Hebert, was our kind of people. You couldn't ask for better so you should just ask for her. The food and drinks are amazing too.

Food and service was fast and amazing. The entire table enjoyed their meals and were shocked at how amazing their meals were. We enjoyed the cocktails as well. The waitress was really sweet and was able to answer questions

Best brunch in the city. The Ruby Slipper Cafe gave our Father/Daughter Weekend the right flavor.

Great atmosphere good way to start the day

We had breakfast here twice so it must have been good.  Seating is a little crowded, but we were there early and didn't have to wait.  The pecan praline pancakes with bacon were so good but sweet.  They somehow have little pockets of caramel in the pancake.  The BLT was huge!  It had the best flavor with the fried green tomatoes.  Their biscuits are light and fluffy, we also enjoyed the grits.  We would definitely go back, next time I'm getting an omelet!

Line = crazy. 1.5 hour wait even when you check in online and get on the list!

Food = worth it!! I really don't think much food is worth a wait over an hour, but everything we had was beyond delicious!!

Dined at this restaurant three times during my vacation in New Orleans. The food was fabulous on most days. There was one day when my food was not hot my drink was not hot it was just lukewarm.

The pancakes have a good flavor for the most part. They were a bit undercooked in the middle for my liking however I ate around the edges which was good.  I was able to indulge in the bananas and pecans and also the pralines and pecans pancakes. The servings were humongous. I don't know if anyone should eat that many pancakes in one sitting.

The shrimp and grits and the cat fish and grits were really good. My favorite was the fish and grits. They are both served with a humongous biscuit with some type of sweet honey butter which was fabulous.


I also tried the peach Balenie. It was not good to me. Neither was the Mamosa. I think the type of wine ruined it. The sweet tea and lemonade was really thin almost taste like water with a tiny bit of tea.  I would stick to the sodas.

It took us 45 minutes to get seated the first time we visited. One of the waiters alerted us to the fact that there was a way to add your name to the list through yelp. Once we learned that, we only waited about 10 minutes at the most.

I would definitely visit again. But I would avoid the drinks and I would be more vocal if my food arrives lukewarm. But, you can't deny that the food was flavorful.

I have never enjoyed breakfast as much as I did here. Everything was amazing! From their mimosas to their French toast, this Cafe did certainly not disappoint! It's got charm, hospitality, and all around southern comfort. 10/10 in everything. Whether you're a local and know the life or you're a tourist looking for a bite to eat, I will ALWAYS recommend the Ruby Slipper!

I went to New Orleans with my best friend and we ate at the Ruby Slipper Café 3 days out of 5 (only because we HAD to try something new for the other two). The first day I went we both had the Southern Breakfast. The eggs were fluffy (I got them scrambled), the biscuit was one of the best I'd ever had (AND IT WAS HUGE), and their grits were probably my favorite (If they came from a box, don't tell me). The chicken sausage was a delicious alternative to bacon. Their drink menu is fantastic (loved my Bellini and the cranberry mimosa) and the service was quick. Overall, the experience was so good the first time, we had to come back a second and a third time. 

The second time we went I built my own omelet and had double the grits (duh) but it was the third time back that stole the show. Let's talk about the Chicken St. Charles and how it was a symphony in my mouth. The chicken was done exactly how chicken in the south should be done - fried to perfection - crispy on the outside, moist (bad word I know, but apropos) and delicious on the inside.  Add an egg, sauce and put it on a monster biscuit and you've found the star of your show. 

These are only a few of the dishes on their extensive menu and I have no doubt that the next time I visit New Orleans it'll be a Ruby Slipper everyday kind of trip. 

5 stars - great service, awesome atmosphere, amazing food. I went back three times, joined the rewards program, and bought a t-shirt that should tell you something.
Amazing food and service! 10 min wait and the service was very friendly. You definitely won't leave this place hungry. The portions are so big!!
Herionne was a great hostess! This place is amazing and the staff was extremely friendly. I enjoyed the BBQ Shrimp and Grits and our server had a great sense of humor.

Great breakfast !!! Had the house special (boudin Benny) ! BEST BISCUIT IVE EVER HAD!!!! Wow! Was super tasty and service was great! I recommend getting the wait app so they can keep your place in line! That way your not waiting 2 hours!

This was the first place we stopped to eat in NO, food is great, good size portions and the staff are really friendly and helpful. The price isn't to bad about $40-$50 for to with drinks the only thing letting this place down is it is not vegan friendly.

Checked in ahead on Yelp.  Got there edited 20 more min.  Seat at bar.  Pancakes not done.  Salmon Benedict good.  Asked for biscuit on side never came.  Manager gave me a few to go for that.  Gave to some hungry homeless.  They were thrilled.  I'd go back again.  I wouldn't order pancakes anyway.  Bf did that.

We waited long even though we put our names on the waitlist online. I still give 5 stars because the food was SO good and the waitress was really friendly. I actually forgot my purse on the chair and she put it aside for me. The chicken Benedict sandwich was soooo good. Also the mimosas were $10 which seem expensive but they Re ginormous and the grapefruit one was awesome.
Wonderful place to have breakfast. The menu is small but each selection is packed with wonderful flavors! Lindsay took such good care of us . Thanks for a great meal!

Awful. Skip it. If they can serve hockey pucks for biscuits what else are they doing wrong? I tried to cut the biscuits (3 halfs on my plate and 2 halfs on my husband's plate) and literally could not get the knife through them. We just ate some of what was on top of the biscuits. Did not care for the shrimp. They tasted frozen, not fresh. How hard can it be to test a biscuit when the batch comes out of the oven? Too many other places to take a gamble here. Two stars for the latte, zero stars for the food and the server's reaction "Really? We bake them every hour". Even more reason to get them right. Wow.
All I can say is AMAZING!!! Definitely the best breakfast spot! If you're ever in NOLA, going to the Ruby Slipper is a MUST!!

As many times as I have been to New Orleans, I had not been to this restaurant. Although the wait was considerably long for two people (45-60 mins), it was worth the wait. There isn't a waiting area, however there are tons of things in the surrounding area to do while you wait. They send you a text when your table is ready .  Once seated, our server was very accommodating, as we had lots of modifications to our order... we wanted to try EVERYTHING LOL. The food was delicious. We ordered the bacon pancakes and biscuit platters. I would like to visit this restaurant again when I visit "nawlins" again.

Arrived here around 8am on a weekday. Waited 5mins before being seated. 

Like most of NOLA, this place is loud, booming and $$$. Our server was fairly attentive but went missing for a little bit. When I asked another server for some syrup to go, he acted shocked and was very dramatic. Didn't end up bringing the syrup anyway.

The food was really good. Ordered the stuffed french toast - too much sugar on top but you'll like it if you love it sweet. The fried chicken sandwich was delicious as was the St Charles. My daughter loved the french toast batons. Coffee was kinda weak. They were very accommodating of our special dietary needs though, which was nice. 

You pay and tip the waiter on a portable terminal which I felt was kind of weird and off putting. I would have liked the back door to have remainedopen or shut, not keep banging shut at odd times and letting the cold air in. Otherwise, a good experience.

This place is a solid choice for breakfast if you're staying at a hotel on Canal Street for a conference.  The service is pretty quick and it's not very busy on weekday mornings.  The food is good. I went here twice in one week. Once I had just some eggs and bacon with home fries. It was OK, but it's difficult to grade a place on such a standard boring order. However, on the other occasion I ordered the migas. They were fairly good, but the chips tasted very stale which was annoying.
Great start to my Birthday.  Trifecta and OJ/Pom Mimosas.  Freddie H took amazing care of us!  Definitely one of my favorite spots in New Orleans!
Ordered delivery and it came rather quick! The food was good, good flavor, and great customer service.

So many people told us we had to eat breakfast at the Ruby Slipper. We did...It was good. I had a bacon & Cheese omelet with cheese grits, fries, and a biscuit. The cheese grits were the best thing on the plate... 
I also had a Iced Vanilla Coffee which was the best thing I had...

We came here for breakfast because it was close to our hotel and we saw the reviews on Yelp. Best decision we've made since we've been in NO. 

Freddie was our server and he was extremely patient with us while we were trying to decide what to order off of the menu. I had the banana pecan pancakes and my bf got the shrimp and grits...THEY WERE AWESOME! The pancakes weren't too sweet and the shrimp and grits were just incredible!

The customer service was awesome as well! Our server, Freddie checked on us regularly and even suggested some things for us to try next time we visit the restaurant. We'll def be back and we wanna sit in Freddie's section!
The wait was long but the food and service was good!  The "Southern Breakfast " was official!!! So delicious.  Pancakes so fluffy.   Orange juice was fresh!

My friends and I came here for brunch on a Saturday. The actual place is not that fancy, but was very warm and inviting. We had great service at the bar. We got the trio and the banana's foster French toast. Everything was fresh and delicious. Our favorite part of brunch was the Bloody Mary's. They were PERFECT. The bacon vodka definitely adds a unique flavor to them that I didn't expect to like, but ended up really enjoying. I wish they made Bloody Mary's that good in Mass where I'm from!
Food was heavy. Very tasty. It was a nice experience for a visit to New Orleans. Can for the thousands of positive reviews. Good area. Recommend.

Boy, am I glad Ruby Slipper opened another location downtown! It is equally as wonderful as the mid-city location. Nothin like a Brandy Milk Punch and that omelet with brie to get you over last night's indulgences!

We visited from Texas and our hotel recommended. We arrived at noon and didn't get seated until 1:25. We waited with hopes that the food would be worth it. Hmmm not sure I can say it was nothing more than average. Plus the staff at the front...were not friendly at all. We felt as if we were bothering them when we came in to place our name on the list. Very rude. Good thing we had the sweetest and most attentive waitress Farrione to save the first time experience. You need the entire staff to model their service after hers.

Extremely busy.   But once seated you def get things timely.   Went with 2 other people and everything we ordered was on point.  I had the eggs benny sampler.   All three types were great.   Service was solid.  Personality and politeness is what keeps this from 5 stars.

Service was amazing and food was great. We got the pancake sampler and a build your own omelette. Both were amazing! The biscuits are to die for, glad we found this place. We waited for about 20 minutes but it was worth the wait. Service and staff were friendly.

How can anyone not like this place? Good portions, delicious breakfast/brunch options, family friendly. I know the reservation app didn't accept more than 6 people but at the restaurant they seated all 8 of us. I recommend the French toast...it tastes like donuts. The corned beef eggs Benedict was delish. I think my friend's family liked it so much they went back the next day for breakfast :)

Not sure why all the hype and a line wrapped around the block for a wait anytime you check. My cousin and I had been looking forward to trying this highly sought after breakfast joint that is blocks from the French quarter. We'd been bamboozled!! 

So they do have a waitlist feature on yelp you can do-very convenient and we were seated within five minutes of us arriving. Five stars for that.  Once seated, we ordered drinks-big easy mimosas, one reg and one pomegranate- then perused over the menu to make a decision about the best way to satisfy our cravings. We make our order. Then wait, and wait, and wait some more. What I can good about the wait is that the mimosas were delicious and not weak at all. We sipped while pondering over if they had to go slay a pig and grab the eggs from the coup in order to make our meals. It's only breakfast!! 

Our meals finally arrive- I had the Costa Rican and my cousin had the French toast batons (which were swimming in syrup), grits, bacon, and eggs-yes she was hungry. The meals were ok to good but not spectacular and worth the hype or wait a typical person would have to endure. There are SO many great places in the Big Easy to eat, I couldn't see myself coming back unless the company I'm with just has that burning desire to try the place out. Staff was friendly enough.

This place was recommended to me by a couple people I stopped and asked but nothing stood out to me, we sat for like 10 minutes before our server came over to us, our oj got to us faster. Grits were good
Great service. If u want your morning drink fix. They've got morning drinks. The egg chacon (pull pork with poach egg on top) was cooked well and tastes really good. I would come back here

Stopped by for what we thought would be a quick breakfast before heading out of town. We ended up waiting 30 minutes for our food from the time we ordered. Sure, it was busy, but so were most of the places that we ate at in the city. Seems to me that the longest wait for all of our meals shouldn't have been for eggs and bacon. When we asked the bartender about the wait, he made the obligatory walk to the kitchen and said it would be out soon but didn't seem too concerned with it being too long. People around us ordered after us and received their food before us and we never even got any kind of apology or concern. Don't get me wrong, my wife and I have worked in restaurants and know that things can happen in the kitchen to delay food getting out, but someone checking on us without our having to ask would've been nice.

In the end, the food wasn't enough to redeem the 30 minute wait.

Chicken St Charles was the best! Freddie H was an excellent waiter and super helpful with suggestions! Fast and super service spite the busy atmosphere! Do yourself a favor and try the candy bacon!!! Thanks Freddie!

Had breakfast here when I got back from a cruise. The portions are huge the price is very reasonable. There were four of us and we each had something different and everything was good with no complaints. We had to wait about 30 minutes to get in, but they sent us a text to let us know when our table was ready so we were able to wander while waiting.
Yowzaa, phenomenal  food and drinks. Bacon infused vodka in the Bloody Mary? Heck yes! Wonderful service, cheerful atmosphere, reasonable prices, excellent food and drink choices.
This place was okay.  The food was good but our server messed up our order and was slow.

Soooo good! To avoid the long wait we saved our spot in line using the Yelp App.  I had the mix-match eggs Benedict.  I ordered my sauce on the side, which is what you see in the pic.  My friend ordered the Costa Rican platter. Both very delicious

This place was recommended by a local in NOLA. I thought it was ok, maybe a little overrated. Had the Spanish omelette with potatoes and a biscuit. Biscuit was almost too doughy and omelette did have enough cheese. There butter for the biscuits were good.

I put my name on the list through Yelp before heading over, thankfully, because the place was packed. Over 1 1/2 hour wait when were seated. Despite the craziness our server was pleasant and efficient. The food was delicious, I had 2 different eggs benedicts and both were amazing. My daughter has stuffed french toast that was to die. Will return so long as I remember to put my name in ahead of time!

Great place! You can put your name on the waitlist via yelp before you go. We went for breakfast around 930 am on a Tuesday, and there was practically no wait. We sat at the bar and were served quickly. The iced coffee is amazing and the eggs benedict are great!
Excellent food, drinks and service! Our waiter Freddie was awsome!!!! Would highly recommend this restaurant at this location even if you have to wait for a table.

Wow pretty much sums it up.  Great breakfast fare and fast service.  We have had pretty much everything and it's all good.   Many locations,  get there early - relatively or stand in line.  You can check in using the Nowait app and get seated quicker.
I don't want to confess that this is my all time favorite restaurant in New Orleans. Every time I come back the wait is longer and longer. I just can't keep a secret. The breakfast is to die for.

This a "must visit" breakfast spot in New Orleans. The food is great and service is fast! 

I had the "Eggs Blackstone" meal and potatoes were the best I've ever had. 

My boyfriend had the "Eggs Cochon" ... Delicous!
Great customer service, great vibe. I ordered that BLT with fried green tomatoes (to go) and it was outstanding.
Great place for breakfast.  The Benedict selection was outstanding and the Candy Bacon was unique.  Would go here again without question.

Bloody mary's are the best so far! Breakfast is to die for. I mixed and matched my eggs Benedict so had a fried tomato and fried chicken with this gravy.....yummy! Long wait but so worth it just check in early from hotel and go when it's your turn! 
Highly recommend

Went here for breakfast and had the most delicious French toast. It was stuffed cheesecake I believe topped with Vietnamese cold brew syrup. It was so good! Their nutmeg Cold Brew was good as well. Will say they need to work on their waitlist. Waited almost two hours to be seated and when we asked what place in line we were they said they already notified us that our table was available. But I never got a notification on my phone so that was very frustrating. Besides that the food, atmosphere and staff was awesome. Definitely loved the vibes.

A friend made the recommendation of this local spot for breakfast. There are several locations. Our group of 4 was planning to meet here. 2 of us arrived early, but we had to wait for the rest of the group to be seated. They had some seats outside while waiting, Steady groups of people arriving and leaving. 

Rest of our group arrived and we were seated quickly. Sassy & friendly server greeted us quickly and took our drink order. A round of Ruby Slipper mimosas were ordered. OJ, pomegranate & sparkling wine. Too sweet for me, but festive.

Next up, breakfast. The plentiful selection of signature Egg Benedict's made it difficult to make a choice. Thankfully, they have The Peacemaker. This allows you to mix and match any of their signature Benedicts. Perfect.

Eggs Cochon-Delish. Apple braised pork on a buttermilk biscuit, poached  eggs & hollandaise sauce. Sooo good.
Hot Smoked Salmon Bennie-hot smoked salmon over buttermilk biscuit, poached eggs, red onion, flash fried capers & dill hollandaise. Good, but I found the Eggs Cochon more flavorful. Plus, I was too full to eat both.

Great way for our group to start the day. As we were leaving, found out they ran out of biscuits. What?! Glad we made it in the nick of time.

Long wait so I recommend making reservations before arriving. We did but ended up sitting at the bar. The banana foster was not a hit, it was chewy, soggy and saturated with too much sauce that had no real flavor. It also had way too many raisins. I thought the omelette was ok just needed some seasoning and the cheese wasn't melted. The waiters were not attentive at all. I did love the peach Bellini.

If I could give TRS 6/5 stars, I absolutely would. This restaurant is phenomenal & worth a visit. I can only speak for the one dish I had so if you ordered something else & didn't enjoy it, don't blame me. 

Service:
Sat at the bar all by my lonesome because Josh G. was busy at a conference. Waitress was very sweet & attentive. Helpful too! Helped me decide between two different catfish dishes & boy, was I happy to take her advice. 

Prices:
The Catfish St. Peter was about $15 while the other catfish dish was $14. Most of the meals hover around $10-15 & the drinks were anywhere from $3-7. 

Total bill was $27 (catfish + Bloody Mary) including tax & tip. Not a cheap brunch, but absolutely delicious. 

Food:
How do I put this without sounding like a real twat? Ummm, yeah unavoidable sooooooOooOo my mouth was having a mouthgasm. The explosion of umami from the cheesy grits & hollandaise sauce was magnificent. It was like a symphony of beautiful melodies coming together as one, like Beethoven's Fifth. You've got creole flavors, spinach, tomatoes, cheesy grits in pan-fried triangles, pan-seared catfish, 3 shrimps lightly grilled on a skewer, perfectly poached eggs, & a creamy hollandaise sauce to top. It was the best damn brunch I've ever had & the first catfish & grits brunch I've ever had. If you're a fan of grits, poached eggs, & catfish, you must try their Catfish St. Peter. A first time trip to NOLA cannot go without trying TRS. 

Environment:
Large restaurant with lots of charm. Chalkboard menu boards, bar in the middle, lots of tables around. Casual & friendly. 

10/10 would absolutely recommend. I'll never have another brunch that'll top that Catfish St. Peter. So sad.

This brunch was extremely disappointing. When we were told there was a wait a few of us went to the bar to order drinks and the hostess told us to come back from the bar, that those seats were saved, without telling us there is actually a specific place where we could stand and order from the bar. Later we got bloody Mary's and they were, in gag inducing fashion, literally just tomato juice, ice and vodka - so gross. I tried the cheddar and shrimp omelet and it was bland and uninspired; plus it just didn't taste that fresh. I had to force myself to eat some of it.
Fabulous! Had the shrimp and grits,  really good. Staff is wonderful and friendly. I went early so no wait. Sat at the bar and had great service.
Food amazing, service and entry sub par. Definitely have to use the book/wait list via yelp app. Worth visiting but I won't be in a hurry to go twice.

Absolutely amazing food (we recommend the catfish & grits and the shrimp boogaloo Benedict). The biscuits alone will have you coming back for more. We had to wait just about 15 minutes (I recommend you join the waitlist on Yelp b/c a wait starts at 8:00 am on Saturdays), but while we were waiting, a server took our drink order and delivered the most delicious "bacon Bloody Mary" I've ever had. Service was great, everyone was very friendly and the atmosphere was upbeat and fun. Definitely recommend!!!!
Amazing food and even better service and southern hospitality. A special thank you to our sexy rockstar server Freddie!
Absolutely fantastic. Amazing coffee, amazing food!! Worth the wait. I live over an hour away and would happily drive that distance every day for their delicious food and drinks

This place is INCREDIBLE! The shrimp & grits and benedicts are the way to go. Also, the boozy coffee is great. Our server, Freddie, made sure we were taken care of. Fast service, great food, great atmosphere.

Great idea to serve drinks while you wait. It makes the wait time go by faster. We've had amazing food in NOLA, but not here. French toast batons were oily, flavorless and the old tasting oil was off putting. The side of potatoes were simply cubed potatoes fried in the same old oil with no seasoning and were only about a quarter of a spud. The fruit was slimy and old. My husband ordered the fish dish with grits, he did not eat the fish or the adorning shrimp. The smell alone was not OK!!!! 

Needless to say, sort your yelp by date to get a more accurate take. 

Cute t/shirts and delish drinks! 

Just can't vouch for the food.

This is an absolute must stop in New Orleans! My husband and I were down for 5 days and did not discover this gem until halfway through our trip. Our waitress, Lindsay, was FABULOUS! She was extremely familiar with the menu and was able to help us choose our perfect breakfasts. Food was delicious!!! I would go back for the homemade biscuits alone. We loved it so much that we made a point to visit again and had yet another fabulous waitress, Joe. Both these ladies made us laugh, were attentive and clearly loved their job. 

The hostess, unfortunately I didn't catch her name, was also fantastic. She made sure she seated you quickly and comfortably! You will probably have to wait when you get there, but I promise it's worth it. We may just come back to New Orleans so we can get breakfast at The Ruby Slipper!

Packed on a Friday morning which is a good sign. Great selections. Coffee is really good and fresh. I ordered the BYOO and loved it. If you thinking of coming maybe use a dining app to reserve a spot so you don't have to wait or call in. Nice staff!

If I lived in New Orleans, I would come here for breakfast every day. My family and I stopped in here on Friday morning because of all of the high ratings on Yelp and I am so glad that we stopped by!! Everything here was fantastic, especially the service. Our server, Alberto was beyond wonderful! He checked in throughout the meal to make sure that we were taken care of! My mom and I ordered the mimosa which was delicious because a large portion of the drink was champagne (just the way I like it!). Then I ordered the pancake trio which had blueberry danish, cinnamon swirl, and bacon praline and these pancakes were HUGE!!! I couldn't even finish half of it! These were definitely the best pancakes that I have ever eaten. They were so full of flavor. Even writing about them right now makes me hungry!  
Overall, I had a wonderful experience. Food was impeccable and service was wonderful and attentive. Next time I am back in New Orleans, I will be coming back here for brunch!
Awesome eggs Benedict and bloody Mary's. Fast and friendly service from our server Freddie! He was awesome! Nice atmosphere.
Super fun atmosphere and amazing food and drinks!  The service was great too- friendly staff and good at communicating wait times, etc. A must while in NOLA!
Great atmosphere and huge plates! Also have "bacon infused vodka" for great bloody Mary's! We had the banana foster French toast and it was great!

We had breakfast here for the first time this morning. It is truly one of the best breakfast I have had in years! I had the Southern Breakfast with fresh fruit and biscuits. Delicious flaky biscuits with cinnamon butter yum. My husband had fried chicken biscuits with eggs. Delicious fried chicken I can't wait to go back. Our waiter was very helpful with his recommendations since it was our first time here. Service was excellent with a friendly knowledgeable staff.

Great food and wonderful service from Nicole. We are visiting from Nashville and heard about this place from a co worker. 
The Ruby slipper drink is highly recommended. We had the Hot Smoked Salmon Bennie and the Corned Beef Bennie. Both delicious and plenty of food!

This is the only restaurant we visited twice during our 4 day stay in sin city...or should that be sinfully good food city!?  We ate out three meals a day for four days and never even got in the neighborhood of a mediocre meal, I can't say that about any other city i've visited or lived in, these people know how to took and I know how to eat...a match made in heaven.  Both trips to the Slipper were for breakfast, the first go round my wife had pancakes...liked them so well she repeated herself on the next visit.  I has a bad ass breakfast sammy, a buttered biscuit filled with two eggs with american cheese, a slice of fried green tomato, two strips of candied bacon, changed my mind about 12 times before blurting out bananas foster on french toasted bread...to say these were two of the best meals we had on this trip would be repeating myself.  We'll definitely need to plan another trip to this city of food heaven.
This location was super busy when we arrived. About a 35-40 min wait. The food was good. Mimosas were excellent. Service was pretty quick and our server was very friendly. Parking was horrible!!!
Amazing food but it takes awhile for the food to come out. I got the Migas and it was amazing! I highly recommend it as well as the breakfast potatoes.

This was one of my favorite restaurants on our trip. Maybe I was just in the mood. I really enjoyed the food, ambiance, and service.

Ordered: 
1) Pancake flight: 5/5, so GOOD! Their special of the day was really good. I think they called it black and white, and it was poppy seeds, I think, but it was GOOD!

2) Chicken St. Charles: 4/5 Very tasty. The fried chicken was made to perfection! Perfection seasoning and portion too!

If I am in the area, definitely hitting up Ruby Slipper Cafe!
One of the best brunches I ever had. Servers are super nice. Great food and very cozy atmosphere.

Wow what a breakfast! Wife started with a bacon infused Bloody Mary. I had a giant mimosa. Nothing like a breakfast box when in Nola. Wife had the bananas foster French toast. It was a huge serving and delicious. I had the Benedict combo. One Shrimp Booglou, a buttermilk biscuit topped with a fried green tomato, a poached egg and creole shrimp...damn!!! The other was St Charles Chicken. Again a good southern biscuit topped with perfectly fried chicken, a poached egg and Holland's sauce. Every bit was awesome. Top great food with great service and you have a must visit eatery.

The best breakfast place I have ever had! The atmosphere is like no other breakfast joint I have been to. The staff is excellent, and the food and drinks are to die for! Went there both days I was in New Orleans. Can't wait to go back!
Great spot for breakfast.  We put our name on the list and when we arrived we sat down immediately while 40+ people waited outside.  Thank you yelp.

The food is excellent. We came for breakfast and I ordered Eggs Benedict. The one I ordered gave you the option to choose two different Benedict's from the menu. So, naturally, I ordered the Fried Chicken and the Corned Beef. Both of them tasted great but the corned beef didn't quite look right. I think they gave me the one that had pork instead. I didn't really realize it till I almost ate the whole thing so I didn't say anything to them. It still tasted great, I just wish I got what I ordered.

Had breakfast at the Ruby slipper on two occasions during our recent trip. First breakfast was just my wife and I. We put our name in and almost immediately we're greeted outside by a staff member asking if we would like to order a drink. Well yes I do. Coffee was a necessity at this point and it arrived moments later in a blazing lay hot fashion. We were seated a few minutes later at the bar. Several staff members checked on us throughout our ordering process and meal. Water and coffee were refilled prior to requesting. I ordered the whites chocolate bread pudding pancakes while my wife ordered the bananas foster pain perdu. Both were fantastic. I requested an insulin shot however they were not accommodating.  our experience was very good.  The only potential drawback for some patrons may be the volume in the restaurant.  It can be loud and would not be good for lots of

I've found religion. Who knew it was in New Orleans?  the corned beef Benedict was a goddamn religious experience. And when Devin, our incredibly competent and charming waiter asked how my food was, I just moaned. He said "you're not the first woman to look at me that way."  Do the yelp check in, makes everything much easier. We will be back.

This place had the best food The BLT southern-style was delicious I would recommend that you check in before you go cuz we did have a wait for about a hour but it was well worth the wait next time we visit New Orleans we will be stopping there again

There was no wait, I went there for brunch. I ordered the BBQ Shrimp and grits....It was very good, but it was mediocre in the warmth of the food it was slightly cool....the french toast and bacon were great. overall it was decent.

Casual place with about 15-20 min wait. Ordered the catfish St. Peter and it was amazing. The ingredients fit very well together. My boyfriend had the corned beef Bennie and preferred my dish. Overall, wonderful place to dine.

Really enjoyed our brunch at RSC. Waited just shy of 15 minutes for a table on a Sunday which I thought was impressive. Waitress was great and took our orders shortly after seating. 

My husband ordered the vanilla ice coffee and he really liked it but he has a huge sweet tooth. I gave it a taste and it was good but crazy sweet. We both agreed that it tasted more like a milkshake then coffee. 

My husband had a breakfast sandwich and I ordered the eggs Benedict. The biscuits here are great; very flaky and tons of flavor. My only slight comment about my meal would be to request a little less hollandaise. I personally don't like tons of sauce on my food and by the time I got to the second egg the biscuits was very soggy. 

Overall a very solid meal, great service and cute cafe.

I arrived about 20 min from closing for a late lunch and sat at the bar.  At first the service was lacking and the staff didn't make any eye contact, although they were polite, the servers didn't seem very happy.  Things warmed up after a while (maybe they all got yelled at just before I got there?).

I got the patty melt and it was VERY good.. not the best patty melt i've had, but maybe 2nd or 3rd; it was pretty good.  I wasn't blown away, but I liked the food and atmosphere enough that I would go back here again...

This was so with the wait! We got there around 1030-11 so it was pretty busy! Luckily they have the system where they will text you when you're table is ready which is nice so you don't have to stand around! I got the special which was amazing! It was my first time having crawfish since I'm not from NOLA and it lived up to the hype. It was a grit cake topped with an egg of your style with crawfish tails and a crawfish sauce, served over a bed of spinach! we sat at the bar and the bartenders were great and super friendly. I had a Bloody Mary and it was so flavorful typically I ask for them spicy but since they had a great amount of spice in the mix you didn't need that extra heat! We are planning to go again prior to leaving the city!

So many great choices for breakfast it's hard to choose! I settled on the breakfast sandwich with candied bacon. The bacon was indeed candied, and the biscuit was light and fluffy. Eat breakfast here, and you can skip lunch.
Never let you down for a great Bloody Mary and to die for breakfast! Staff always friendly and accommodating.
This food was excellent! I had the Louisianan with a pancake. My husband had the Big Bacon burger. We use the app to reserve our table in advance, and walked right in when we arrived.

Great omelettes! Three of us all chose to build our own ... The 4th had the wonderful French toast. 
Grab a Bloody Mary while you wait.  It takes a while to get a table ... Guess you can tell where the good food is when people are willing to stand around outside until their name is called.
The Miami Slice sandwich was amazing! Slow cooked apple-braised pulled pork, sliced ham & swiss, dressed with pickled green tomato, Creole mustard on french bread

The long wait times during large events are guaranteed to turn you away. But, if you go during a regular time, the experience may be much better. Our service was slow and rushed. I felt like the food would've been much better if we had went during a less busy time. However, it just wasn't all the hype. Very touristy restaurant.
Always a wait!  Service is really good, food is good.  Did not have a Bloody Mary but they looked good.
