Long wait for decent food. Worth a visit to read/hear their story bringing life back to NOLA after Katrina. Benedict's are served atop buttermilk biscuits which was a nice change. There's no place like home.

This was our last stop of our trip and we were not disappointed. We went early on a Monday morning and were seated immediately (group of 7). The service was great, Freddie, our server was efficient and accommodating. The biscuits are amazing!! Our group enjoyed the croque madame, st Charles chicken, skinny migas, and the salmon avocado toast. All great and we had a reasonable wait for our food.

Great food, unique flavors just not hot. Plates need to come out hot and stay warm for at least 15 mins. I wanted to get bananas foster one more time but the French toast bananas foster just as awesome. I had the eggs Cochon and it was so incredibly tasty - highly recommend. Been here a couple of times because the staff is warm and inviting and intend to come back again.

Visited this place while I was in New Orleans for my bachelorette. Our waiter was awesome!! It was packed and the food was great. If you're looking for decent breakfast this place is a must. I had ordered pancakes and it came with bacon. The waiter also brought us this candied bacon that was to die for!!!!

It's no wonder that this place has been voted best breakfast in New Orleans 3 years in a row. 

Okay the plus side - reserve your table through Yelp and go on a weekday if you can. The wait was only 12 minutes.

Everyone is really friendly.

To be honest, if you are from New York, it doesn't worth the wait, spend the time on some other food that you can only eat in New Orleans. We ordered the shrimp and Grit and egg Benedict. The source on Grit is a little bit bitter, not sure if they add too much spices in it. The egg Benedict is just very very normal. I guess the best i like is their specially made butter for the bread. The coffe

Food is delicious. We ordered catfish with grits meal and the trifecta meal. Amazing. The only reason I wouldn't give 5/5 is because it was just dirty by the bar area and it smelled bad. Kind of hard to keep an appetite, but again, just the food was 10/10.
Very over-hyped. Long wait time, even when placing a reservation via Yelp. Not impressed with French toast.

Awesome breakfast!!!

A must try is the Banana Fosters Pain Perdu (french bread french toast).....other regular breakfast items are also really good & they have great mimosas...They also have daily special, such as upside down pineapple pancakes.......With all the great places to eat in NOLA, this is the only place where we ate at twice during our visit. Dont miss this awesome breakfast!!

Great food great service. Check this place out. Had the french toast batons to share with our table. We all had a variety of eggs benedict. Three of us had the peacemaker where you pick two separate egg benedicts of your choosing.

Food is absolutely delicious. I had the breakfast tacos and the wife had a BLT, both were fantastic. Next time we're in the area we will definitely come back. The atmosphere is super chill and the staff was really friendly and hospitable.
Food and service was excellent!  Thank you Freddie!!!  Will return!!  Wait was an hour but worth it.

This is not a bad place at all. I give it 3 stars becuase its typical fanfare food. It is more hype then bite. The long lines, the 4 and better star reviews on Yelp. Just imagine a Denny's, IHOP, or Waffle House that serves the same food but with fancier names.  Its right off Canal,(PRIME REAL ESTATE.) So the line will be long. Thats pretty much a given.  Its more a Tourist spot then anything else. Eggs will be eggs and bacon will be bacon, i dont care what fancy name you give it. I was disappointed and not impressed at the least. Hour long waits are not worth my time for ho-hum food.

We used the app NoWait to reserve our spot in line before leaving the house and when we arrived we were seated almost immediately! We sat at the bar and the service was great. We got the Trifecta and the Peacemaker both a sampling of the different eggs benedicts! They were amazing! The eggs were perfectly poached. Our coffee was delicious as well! We would definitely return on our next trip to New Orleans!

The food ok and definitely with a nola twist. I had the skinny migas. The staff was very nice and attentive but food took almost 1/2 hour to come out.  Just plan extra time. Think brunch times for wait not typical breakfast wait times.
Awesome place to eat breakfast, wait can be long at times. Food was fantastic.

Super breakfast, I was curious but reluctant to order the Louisiana omelet with Gulf shrimp, cheddar cheese & thyme.  Curiosity won and I'm so glad it did!  No fishy taste at all, just lots (7-8) big firm tasty shrimp, perfect amount of cheese and thyme. Grits were good, not special, but the pancake on the side -WOW. Big, with cinnamon cooked in, delicious.  I was full the rest of the day! I ate at the bar, service was friendly, food took awhile to come out, but worth it.

Really tasty food. The wait long was extremely long so be prepared to wait and trying to just get a drink while waiting was long too but once you sit down you'll get some amazingly rich and decadent breakfast. 

I tried their french toast special but it was WAY too sweet. It tasted more like a cake or a dessert than actual breakfast.. it had whipped cream, sprinkles and my friend and I were only able to take a couple bites before turning it away. Besides that the food was great. So I'd definitely ask for more of a description of the food (how sweet something is) before ordering it. I have a major sweet tooth but it was almost like eating pure sugar lol.

I am in New Orleans on vacation and I came here on recommendation from friends. It was delicious. I have had some good bloody Mary's but this one was definitely a top pick. I just wish that I didn't get a bacon infused vodka as I am not a big bacon fan (sorry world). The shrimp and grits was phenomenal and I might just think about it daily until I have it again. Perfect Cajun, a great portion and overall the service and atmosphere was great. 
The biscuits were also incredible and super dense. I have never picked up a heavier biscuit. Do yourself a favor and wait the 10 minutes to have a delicious brunch. Only downside- only open until 2pm. I mean really? Most people drink fairly heavily in New Orleans but the Bloody Mary should do the trick ;-).

Single star for the food, that I was able to get. As a restaurant manager, I'm well aware of all things that can go wrong, and seems today at Ruby Slippers they hit all the marks! 

We are visiting NOLA and had bookmarked all places we wanted to visit, and were looking forward to this place. Unfortunately, this place was a mistake and we definitely should have gone somewhere else. 

Everywhere else we've visited has been such a hit, with warm and friendly service, but not here. 

First, we were seated at the bar, which is not an issue if bartender pays attention to newly seated guests. Next, we had to wait quite long to get our drinks but no water which we'd requested. Had to flag down second bartender and ask for water, which he went to grab the glass to refill, and only then realized there were no glasses to begin with! 

When tried to order the food, they'd run out of two items I wanted to try, which was fine. But the way information was delivered seemed like I was inconveniencing them by ordering items they don't have on purpose. 

Once our food arrived, we got no check backs from either bartender - though white guy on my left got two in the time we were sitting there, as well as elder white couple to our right also got several. 

At the end of the meal, we had to once again, flag down the bartender to have our card swiped. 

The most lackluster service I've ever received. I shall use this as an example of what not to do when training our own servers. 

Food was great, the biscuits were so warm and tasty! Definitely would go to a different location for food, but will be avoiding this place and telling everyone else to do the same!

Not sure what the rave is all about.  Food is mediocre. The line was really long every morning we walked by so we decided to give it a try.  

IMO, NOT worth it.  The biscuit and gravy weekend special is "blah" not much taste to it at all nor is there anything special about it.  Husband ordered the EGGS COCHON. It was also ok. 

Oh,  forgot to mention it's pricey!

The food tastes good, but there are a plethora of places that are just as good without the wait like this place has.  I used yelp to reserve my party's spot in line and it said to be there at 1121.  We were not seated until just after 12 and immediately ordered our food and drinks   we didnt get our food until 100 pm. An hour to wait for food seems like a really long time when most of our group got french toast and eggs. Our waitress did a fantastic job of trying to cover for the kitchen, but it was way too disorganized. I cant give 4 or 5 stars when this is the norm of each time i come here.

Delicious! Nice authentic ambiance with a big center round bar for those that like counter service and tables for others.   great service and food. I had the special pain perdu which was blueberry and marscapone stuffed French toast. Best I've ever had! Usually I don't prefer stuffed items bc they fall apart but this didn't.  The chef has talent! My husband had chicken and biscuits and it was ahmazing. Had a little bit of kick to it. And the coffee is delicious too. The place is clean and the service prompt and friendly.

Long wait and was told it was a great breakfast/brunch place.. but it wasn't great wishing we had went somewhere else, the wait staff was rude and in a hurry to get people in and out and super pushy. The food was ok but very dry and pretty bland not was I was expecting from a city with lots of spice. No worth the wait..

Went here for breakfast this morning. Fantastic food, equally fab service. Try anything on the specialties area of the menu and be sure to order one of their double mimosas or specialty non-alcoholic bev's. I'll definitely be back again.

This restaurant had been recommended to us several times, so we had to give it a try. Expect a wait any day that you go. It's a lot shorter on weekdays though. We first tried to go on a Sunday morning for breakfast, but there was a huge wait, so we decided to wait and go on Tuesday. On Tuesday we only had to wait about 15 minutes for a table. Their signature dishes all look great. I can vouch for the Eggs Cochon and Bananas Foster Pain Perou. Both were delicious and different than I had ever had before. They have a lot of different options for Eggs Benedict! It was good, but I do not think it would be worth a 45 min or more wait because there are a ton of great breakfast options in New Orleans!
Food was delicious. However, even though the food here is delicious the hostess with short brown hair is straight up ignorrant and rude to the customers. Which brings the experience down.

Sorry to say that we were looking forward to breakfast at the Ruby Slipper today and it really disappointed.   We were there early,  so no wait for a table.  However,  the time to get our food was much longer than usually experienced - over 15 minutes for french toast.   We were excited to get our food,  then discovered the filled french toast was the worst french toast ever.   It was dry bread through and through.  Luckily, the bananas foster french toast was good and we shared.   The bacon was delicious as usual.   Told the server the filled french toast was awful and he offered a remake or another selection,  but who wanted to wait another 15 minutes.  The server was polite,  friendly and kept our drinks filled.  He did remove the bad item from the tab,  but the experience was still a disappointment. Not sure what went wrong today or if we will give them another chance.  Sad because we know it can be sooo good and just wasn't.   This is one place we always try to take guests and recommend to friends that haven't tried it.
Get breakfast here at least once, if not everyday. Sit at the bar. This is an amazing place to eat.

Great solid breakfast food, but a very long wait.  I ordered a southern breakfast and it was great. Eggs, biscuit, grits, and bacon. The waiter was friendly and efficient. No complaints on food or service.
Great food, awesome service from Freddie. A definite must try when you come to the city.

The waiting staff are very kind and courteous. Rachel was an absolute pleasure to talk to and had us excited about the food and drinks. She recommend the Irish Cream Coffee and the Big Easy Mimosas and they did not disappoint. Rachel also recommended the Peacemaker to eat and I cleaned my plate! The Bam Bam biscuit is also very good! We will definitely return to this establishment on our next visit to New Orleans.
Sooooo good!!! Packed so I suggest using Yelp's waitlist feature. This saved us a lot of time standing around waiting for our table. The food was well worth the wait. Nice portions and so delicious.

Really good local brunch chain. Side note, They also just opened one in Mobile, AL. They have a lot of interesting special big specialty southern brunch meals. You can go here for a late breakfast if you want the works! Hollandaise sauce heaven
Special thanks to our server Caroline she was awesome! We had a party of 8 and her recommendations were perfect! The food was awesome as well as service! We will be back again
Everything at our table was to die for! Shrimp and grits, catfish and grits and the shrimp bugaboo and chicken eggs Benedict were all fantastic. Orange juice was also delicious!

Excellent breakfast place, probably the best in New Orleans.  The poached eggs and spicy sausage was just what I needed.  Love that they have fresh squeezed orange juice.  Big space, long line, and great food.
Love, love!!! The Praline and Bacon Pancakes are scrumptious.  This was my second visit when in town and definitely a visit worth having whennin NOLA.
Great brunch spot, over an hour wait but was worth it. Great pancakes, solid Bloodies, will def come back! Just be patient...!

I've been to two other locations so I knew what to expect when I spied this place from my hotel window. We stopped by here at 8am NYE to beat the crowd. We were seated right away at the bar which was new to us but fine. I got the dish I always get( I know, BORING)-the southern Breakfast while my boyfriend got shrimp and grits. Both were as expected and full of southern flavor and seasoning. There could've been more shrimp but that's at any restaurant‍ the bartenders were super attentive and made great convo with us while we ate. There was a crowd in town for the Sugar Bowl so this place was buzzin inside and outside where the sidewalk tables were. I'm never disappointed when I visit Nola and The Ruby Slipper!

This place is definitely worth the wait!  My husband ordered the Grilled Fish St. Peter's, which is amazing! It should have a little ruby slipper next to it, but it was suggested by the refreshingly, knowledgeable and friendly waiter.  I ordered the BBQ SHRIMP & GRITS  and it came with a little too much sauce on it(see photo) it was good but, the reason there are only 4 stars.  Other than that,  every item that came out the kitchen looked delicious!!!! A must go in NOLA!

Our breakfast option Sunday morning.  A real special New Orleans vibe here and story of a come back to the city.  Plenty of enticing breakfast options.  We went for the Banana Fosters Pain Perdu (French Toast) and Banana Pecan pancakes.  I also added a side of grits which provided a counterbalance to the sweet French Toast.  Our coffee was also locally roasted by French Truck Coffee - I like the support of other local businesses.  A good breakfast option in New Orleans.

Place was excellent staff was friendly wonderful atmosphere...enjoyed the time with family, food was awesome, server had excellent personality and looked like Tupuc..cannt wait go back...biscuits to die for!
First time at Ruby Slipper from out of town and the service/food was great! Quick and efficient for a hustling group.  Shout out to Freddie H for providing great service and being welcoming

Thanks to yelp for having the live waitlist. We put our name down for our large group of 6 on the app and was told there was about an hour or so wait. When we got there, they sat us immediately--OUTSIDE. It was a hot day and we didn't want to be outside, but it was the only seating they had because this place is PACKED! We were hungry, so we sat at a small table made for 4 and crammed 6 adults into. 

The menu was extensive, but had all the breakfast essentials. Most of the group did the mix and match with the egg Benedicts. They were hit or miss depending on which Benedict you chose. 

Food takes a while to come out, probably because they're so busy. Service is lackluster and sometimes rude. We heard our waitress yelling at a couple behind us because they wanted to switch tables since their fan wasn't working.

Our seats were uncomfortable, food was ehhhh, and everything just underwhelming considering all the good things we heard. I think we'll just go to a less busier, but more delicious breakfast place next time. This is a definite pass. Don't fall for the hype. And yes, all locations are just as busy because we checked them.
The best part of this place was our server Devin he made the whole experience great with all of his witty sass. It's breakfast food made with quality ingredients everything was pretty standard.
The food is very appealing to the eyes!! However most important, it taste great on your palate .. Great choice for brunch !!
Great food and quiet dining room.  Waitress was super attentive. Eggs benefit your way is the way to go. Shrimp boogaloo and cochon Benedict's are amazing.

Arrived at 854a, seated by 925a on Saturday, April 2, 2016. Get here early (7a-3p Sat)! The line is usually wrapped around the building but moves quickly.  Once you check in, they will text you the link to the NoWait app if you want to keep an eye on your spot in line.  Otherwise, they will call your name when your table is ready.  There is indoor and outdoor seating and there are heating lamps for outdoor seating; however, they did not keep the customers warm.  I recommend outdoor seating when the weather is warmer.  

Of course I reviewed all the pictures and most of the reviews on Yelp prior to arrival; therefore, I had an idea what I wanted to order.  The prices are reasonable and the portions were adequate.  I ordered the Eggs Cochon ($13) and had sautéed spinach added to it and I also ordered the Bananas Foster Pain Perdu ($11).  Yes, I was being greedy and I could not finish it...but I tried! Lol. 

Eggs Cochon - the biscuit was very flaky and buttery, the pork was very tender with lots of flavor, the egg was fried to perfection (I don't like poached eggs) land the hollandaise was creamy and cheesy. 

Bananas Foster - the bread was soft and fresh, there were a lot of raisins but very few bananas; however, the rum sauce was very nice, it was thick with a little cinnamon and nutmeg flavor, yum!.  And it came with two slices of bacon on the side.  The bacon was nice and crispy just like I like it.

I also ordered a mimosa and asked for more champagne that OJ and our waitress informed me it is a double mimosa but she would make it a triple! And at no additional charge! She made a new friend that day...lol. It was great!.  

My other friend ordered a short stack of buttermilk pancakes (2/$7) which were golden brown and fluffy. She really enjoyed them.  And the other had the Gulf Fish St. Peter ($15).  The presentation was awesome and the smell was even better.  She killed that plate! So I guess it was good.  

I would recommend this restaurant to everyone, all ages were represented and seemed to be happy with their food.  Lots of smiles could be seen and laughter to be heard.

We had a great experience here! Our waitress was really nice and gave us local recommendations. Also, the food was amaaaaazing. I had the migas and it was one of the best brunch meals I've ever had. My friends all got different meals and they all liked them. Also- it's hard to find gluten free/vegetarian friendly restaurants in New Orleans but they were very accommodating.

Tastier than free pop tarts! And those ARE tasty! I did the CBH and my lady had the Eggs Blackstone. We timed it right, there was a long line so I snuck around, waited for an old couple to get called, pushed them down, and took their table. GANGSTA! Kidding, but I did see what time they closed and we slid in fairly close to that, waiting MAYBE 5 minutes. Lucky! The staff seemed cool, and their beer slection is crazy...beers like PBR and Miller High Life. We had bloody marys too, which rocked. A great way to start the day down in NOLA. We will be back.

Damn good breakfast with a bustling atmosphere well staffed with people pleasers. That's all I need. The eggs were perfectly cooked, nice meaty bacon, crispy tender green fried tomatoes and TO DIE FOR biscuits with a cinnamon butter. This was my favorite breakfast over the week!

If you are not going to order the shrimp and grits, go to iHop. Seriously. The Bloody Mary's are insanely good. Wait staff is friendly and will give you the inside scoop, not just touristy places. My meal was outstanding, the service was unexpected and great. 5 stars all the way.
Food was amazing! Waitress was nice and knew the menu! it was just a little hot inside but I expected that overall great experience

A staple of the New Orleans community. Can I start by saying what a staff, great people serving great food. Matter of fact, I went twice while there. With a town full of restaurants and food, this was my favorite. I enjoyed an awesome chicken sandwich, covered in signature slaw. You take a bite, feel that southern chicken melt. The slaw is so good, get a side of it as well. My boy FREDDIE C is the only server you should ask for. He was by far one of the nicest and most helpful fella I met in the big easy. Let me tell you about the banana French toast. Everything in this dish was delicious and worth every penny. Look at the picture it'll speak for itself. Enjoy a coffee or enjoy a beer. but I will tell you this: "you can't drink all day if you don't start in the morning!" Goooooo nowwwww
Delicious pancakes! I had the seasonal pancake which was kiwi berry chantelle filling and did not disappoint! Waited a little while for the food but overall great service and place!

We walked all the way to this location and was told the wait would be at least 30 minutes and should go to the other location since there's no wait. So we headed to the other location only for there to be the same wait. Who cares what the food tastes like when the service begins bad!

Highly NOT recommended. Restaurant is a tourist trap. Food was greasy. There was a hair in my eggs and the server immediate got me a new plate, but unfortunately I lost my appetite. My other two guests ordered eggs. Same situation, scrambled eggs were small and greasy. The reason for 2 stars is because the server was impeccable and kind. The other reason is because you can wait on a list with Yelp. Go to another spot for breakfast, not worth the wait. Glad to see management responded but no need to provide anything, I will not be back.

This review is actually two years old I never got a chance to write about this place!! I was in town for a convention and was going on a food tour around NOLA. Till this day I'm still raving about Ruby Slipper, it is THE best breakfast I ever had!! The place can get really crowded and I can see why!! Luckily for us when we walked in we had a couple of friends sitting at a table with two extra chairs so we didn't have to wait! I ordered the Eggs Blackstone, the biscuit was soft on the inside and toasted buttery on the outside. The bacon was nice and crisp!! The eggs was poached perfectly when I popped the egg the egg yolk streamed right down to the biscuit. The star of the show was the grilled tomato, anyone who knows me knows I hate eating tomatoes but boy was that tomato one of the juiciest, best tomato steaks I ever had. My mouth is watering just writing this review! I cannot wait to return to NOLA just for this meal!!!

A cool authentic New Orleans breakfast joint! It's always fun to find out of the ordinary places while traveling, and this place did not disappoint. The plethora of locals was a sign that the food here would be good. The only negative was no refills on the iced coffee. However, the excellent food more than made up for this blip.

OMG. I'm writing this fresh after eating a delicious meal. This was the first time I've ever gotten an Eggs Benedict, and this spot was AMAZING. I got both the Eggs Cochon and Chicken St. Charles. Both were delicious (its agreed by everybody at my table that the biscuit was A1). My preference was definitely the Eggs Cochon. They have a good special where you can pick 2 different ones for $15. Literally delicious. I would advise against getting the shrimp and grits here, though. My friend said that wasn't that great. Also, I got a bellini and am truly shocked that it was strong. I'm not used to one breakfast drink doing the trick. Also, we were seated quickly even though there was a long wait. Well done, Ruby Slipper!

We used Yelp to get on the waitlist and it worked out great. We walked up to check in and were seating very quickly. The food and service was good. Their egg benedicts (we got the chicken and the pulled pork) were great and so were the pancakes. We weren't blown away but we will be back.

This place is a great breakfast spot! I got the trifecta. One fried chicken egg benedict, pork egg benedict, and the shrimp egg benedict. It was good. The reason I did not give 5 stars is the eggs were slightly over cooked, the yolk did not run upon being cut. Other than, good food. Also, the waitress and customer service were great. I would definitely go back.
Worst experience of NOLA. My biscuit  was so hard that I could not cut through it with a knife. I was getting very frustrated since it was inedible. The bloody mary did not taste good either.

I am not really big on breakfast, but I was curious about the hypes of this restaurant. We came here for breakfast on Monday so didn't have to wait for a table!  We ordered St. Charles and foster banana French toast. It was excellent choices. We enjoyed both dishes very much. Fried chicken was crispy outside and tender inside. It was delicious. Homemade biscuits were good too. And Poached eggs made it taste even better. At first, we were hesitant to order their famous foster banana French toast thinking it would be too sweet. We were wrong. It was delicious. Their fresh coffee was good too. Our server was friendly and attentive. Will come back next time I am in town.
Awesome breakfast spot! Eggs Benedict with fried chicken - delicious. Went for brunch on Christmas Eve and the food & service was great. Use the NoWait app to save your party time.

Definitely worth the wait. 30 minute wait and then our birthday celebration began. First drink at 21. The mimosas are great and the food enjoyable. We had French toast, Cobbler pancakes and southern breakfast.  Every bite was enjoyable. Our service was spot on and it was an upbeat ambience. Definitely will return.
This place was recommended from several locals for breakfast. Last day in town and we decided to enjoy a full breakfast. The food was good and so was the service.

Yes, you do want the candied bacon on your bananas foster French Toast.  You're going to spend all day walking it off, right?!  At least that's how I justified it.  I almost wrote this place off as typical diner food, but I'm glad I gave it a shot and was pleasantly surprised by the care and attention to detail that is put into what would normally be diner food options.  Other breakfast places can't even offer you real maple syrup, but Ruby Slipper lets you douse your pancake flight of praline bacon and cinnamon swirl pancakes in the good stuff.   We arrived at 8:30 on Monday with a party of 5 and had no problems being seated immediately at a booth with a chair on the end.  Diner traffic picked up quite a bit after 9am.

Very bland, not hot and overall not good. Biscuit was cold and tasted like straight flour. Recommended to us by several people, but was not impressed at all. My friend found a piece of hair in her food and nothing was taken off of her tab, nor did the manager come over to at least apologize. Had better breakfast. Didn't get the hype.
Great place for breakfast n brunch.. The on letters were great and so were the speciality entrees.. Service was very Gud n quick!

Our experience here was great! Our waitress, Arielle, was very helpful and went above and beyond for us. I had the smoked salmon Benedict and the boozy iced coffee and both were yummy! Portions were large and quality was good. Very pleased.
This was amazingly enjoyable.  Their Bloody Mary was delightful and strong, and their specialty eggs benedicts were yum!  Loved it.  Service was super friendly.

Went here for breakfast this morning. After waiting for 45 minutes in the wind and rain, I checked to see where we were on the list and the hostess didn't have me on the list. She did add me to the list and seated us next. Server was very nice but we were sitting right by an open door. More cold wind and they wouldn't close it. Ordered hot chocolate. It would have been great if it was hot. Food arrived barely warm. They did replace cold food with another item and didn't charge me but not sure waiting was worth it.

My second time here and I still don't understand what is so great about it. I used Waitlist and still had to stand outside for 50 minutes.

Just finished eating my Croque Madam.
Mostly bread. 
I've given this place two tries. 
I doubt I'll be back.
Don't know what all the fuss is about.

This was a breakfast spot near my hotel that has positive reviews, so I decided to check it out. 

I got there around 8:30am and it was already busy there. I was able to get a seat at the bar right away still, though. The restaurant seems to be more family friendly than many of the restaurants around the French Quarter, because there were several families with young kids when I was there.

I ordered the Ruby Slipper mimosa, before I looked at the price, and I got the eggs cochon. The mimosa was good, but the eggs cochon almost looked too good to eat! I didn't know what eggs cochon even was before I ordered it, so I wasn't expecting something that like that. The eggs cochon tasted great, too. It wasn't overly fried and everything tasted fresh. 

The staff here were friendly here, too, even though it was so busy. I'd definitely stop by here again.
This place is delicious no matter what you get off the menu. I've had the bananas foster french toast, the St. Charles, the southern breakfast... all delicious!

Flew into nawlins very early so room not ready. Decided to finally try Ruby Slipper which was just across the street on corner for breakfast. Always busy and long wait in mornings for breakfast but worth it. It is a "tourist trap" but even locals come here! Food good, portions big and prices fair. Had the 3 little pigs omelet (bacon, sausage&ham), side of grits and a big biscuit...very good! She had the banana foster pain perdu...French bread french toast with flambed bananas&raisins with a side of bacon...also very good. Ruby Slipper is open 7days but only from 7am to 2PM and wait may not be as long after 1pm

I think Ruby Slipper is ok. It's overrated, the long lines honestly had me thinking the food was amazing. I've been here as a visitor of New Orleans and now living here, I don't like going there. The salmon Benedict is bland, the salmon is not seasoned. The best thing I've had thus far was a chicken sandwich which was pretty good. If this is your last option then it's ok, but if you can plan for better, you should.

So good! I had the banana foster French toast with the  applewood smoked bacon! It was wonderful! John had his grits and eggs country breakfast! I tried his fried green tomato, Yum the seasoning was so tasty and it was nice and crispy with a firm tomato! Cooked perfectly! Would definite come here again!

NO fN stars here !!!! 
NEVER Have we ever had an awful experience! Waited 1hr ok that's a given ‍ then another 1 for our FOOD! Because we are  9er fans ? One young African American young man keep yelling Who dat Who  dat, ok ok I get it but then he looks over at us as he gives the couple next to us their breakfast ( they where seated 25min after us ) so I say to him that's how your going to be ? So by them I'm annoyed! So I say sarcastically ya know we can leave right ? He walks back and says ya you can leave your not joining to hurt my feelings ! I was furious! For being 1st timers in this area and get spoken like that at a 5 star breakfast restaurant.... wow ! Just great hospitality! It really doesn't matter who you are what race you may be or what teams you support that is just uncalled for. This is one place we will never stop for breakfast or anything for that matter. Just a bad taste in my mouth.

I was visiting from out of town and was able to visit several Ruby Slipper locations. This location was our favorite by far. The atmosphere, service and food (cooked the exact way I ordered it) was great. Will definitely return when i am in town again

This day 2 of our trip to New Orleans trip and we started the day off right with breakfast at the Ruby Slipper Cafe. Our service was great Eric is a sweet heart, patient and a professional. We really enjoyed our food everyone got something different and everything was plated beautifully and it was delicious!!! We will be back!!!

The wait was really long but worth it!  We had the banana foster French toast - AMAZING!  Server suggested we split one order since it was so huge!  It fed the two of us and we ordered breakfast potatoes on the side.
I really love the fact that I could get on the waitlist before even arriving! Awesome Awesome Awesome!
Bomb.com the food was excellent! No complaints. Get there early or you will have to wait which is very well worth it! Great service from staff and great price for quality of food! Will be back!

Yum 

We walked in and it was a 45 minute wait. Flew by while having a Bloody Mary and enjoying the weather. Very well managed machine. 

We had the bananas foster French toast as well as the smoked salmon omelette. Mimosa and and a Irish coffee. 

Perfect lively spot in the CBD
It is everything i expected and more!! The food is really good and the service is amazing. Our server Rachell was sooo nice and friendly she is the perfect person to start your day off with!!

Do not sit outside. Tables were roach infested. Waitress has the audacity to ask if I'm put off. What do you think?! Roaches crawling in and out of the crevices of the table. I moved tables and the same thing.

Not what it's all cracked up to be. It was nice to reserve your spot on yelp bc there was an hour wait. But inside you can't even hear each others conversation it's so loud. I ordered the shrimp Omelet it was honestly gross and I had such High hopes for this place. My husband had the Benedict pick 2 he said it was just okay...

The other yelpers were right about the Bananas Foster French Toast! YUM! The place is bright and cheerful for a morning breakfast. The service is great (and fast) and the food was soooo good! On my recent trip to New Orleans I wanted to try as many places as I could, but I had to come back to this one for more! Everything was delicious! On my second stop I had the Southern Breakfast (complete with cheese grits and friend green tomato) and took a BL2T to go for my plane ride home (red and friend green tomato). ALL GOOD. Just wish I lived close by. (Get there early -by 8a- it gets packed)

Oh man, Ruby Slipper, you are just what a visitor to 'Nawlins needs! The boyfriend and I decided to stop by as it was just a few blocks from our hotel-when we arrived we were told there was a 25 minute wait but I think we ended up waiting maybe 10-We got mimosas at the bar, and at first I was totally thrown by their $10 price, until I saw how huge they are-full solo cup of champagne? yes and yes! 

When we sat down our waitress came quickly and gave us a run down of the menu, and left us to decide. Let me be clear, deciding on what to eat was no easy task! I eventually went with the Catfish St. Peter and it was just.... just get it. My god, it was so good. It was intense: grit cakes, blackened catfish, poached eggs and creole hollandaise but man-it was one of the best things I ate the entire trip.. at least three people stopped by to ask what I got. Be prepared to walk this sucker off but mmmmmmm it was good! The boyfriend went for the Chicken St. Charles (fried chicken, eggs, biscuits and tasso cream) and it was sooooo tasty! The chicken was cooked perfectly, and seasoned so well-perfect little bite of spice, the cream was light but the perfect amount of tasty. Decided to cap it off with an irish coffee, and I was one happy little traveler! 

Do yourself a favor and stop in while you're in New Orleans.. don't let yourself be deterred by the wait and get ready to grub down!!!

Went here for breakfast this morning. After waiting for 45 minutes in the wind and rain, I checked to see where we were on the list and the hostess didn't have me on the list. She did add me to the list and seated us next. Server was very nice but we were sitting right by an open door. More cold wind and they wouldn't close it. Ordered hot chocolate. It would have been great if it was hot. Food arrived barely warm. They did replace cold food with another item and didn't charge me but not sure waiting was worth it.

We have been here 3 days and we have gone to the Ruby Slipper all 3 of those days. Food is outstanding, service is great and the iced coffee is delicious (Request Devin, he is our favorite! ) Get there early because it fills up quick but even if you have to wait it's so worth it.

Food was fine. Long wait, good biscuits. Pricey - saw a live roach crawling around the filthy bathroom... Needless to say, kind of ruined my appetite; hope it wasn't a reflection of what the kitchen is like. Service gets this place an extra star. For the prices, keep the roaches out.

I was in New Orleans for four days. The shrimp and grits at The Ruby Slipper Cafe was my favorite dish here. Oh my heavens. I was audibly groaning with every bite. I'd I could bring it home with me I would. 

Great service. Great mimosas. 2-4-1 before 10

It was located across the street from where I was staying. My wife had heard about it and we decided to give it a try. There was a waiting period, but it was worth it. The food was really good. This is our second morning and wedding anniversary.

I'm a native NYC lady who rarely take time out for a good home cooked breakfast. While on vacation the concierge staff at my hotel suggested this place!  He didn't disappoint meat all!  The breakfast was a step back in time of when breakfast was served by your grandmother who gave you the works!  From the buttermilk biscuits served with honey butter to their praline infused bacon and stone ground grits, the Ruby Slipper is a place you must visit while you are in New Orleans.  Fair warning call before you go the wait is at least 30-60 minutes long, but it's worth every mouthful once your seated.  Everyone there is very friendly and great at suggesting what good to eat!

The food is always so good here, my poached egg was overcooked, but the bartender/server noticed it without me saying anything and offered to bring another, and did within 30 seconds, and it was perfect.  It is always busy here, but the yelp app helps for saving your place in line.

Coffee was an elixir of yumminess! 
Fresh squeezed OJ mmmm! 
Trio of Benedict's artfully created pork debris , fried chicken, and my favorite fried and grilled tomato's! Wow! 
Hubby had... oh heck what ever! I was too busy enjoying my marvelous meal to bother noticing! 

We will return with high expectations again! 
Our waitress was wonderful and I hate that I can't remember her name! She was short and had a really cool hat on! A huge kudo to the fellow customer who ran out onto the street as we left to bring my cellphone I'd left on the table! Ugh! 

The biscuits are heavenly moist, and substantial! Nothing wimpy there!
Space was a little tight and it was very loud. Food was delicious though and we will most definitely be back next time we are in town. I'd definitely recommend!

Food had great presentation and easy to use "get in line service" via the site since they do not take take reservations. Wait time was minimal. Service was fast and restaurant was clean. Food was not, pancakes were not good. However, the biscuit was amazing. I would go again and maybe order something different.

We were willing to wait for this place. 

Even on a Monday morning, it was poppin' with guests. They ask for your phone number to text you when your table is ready, so it gives you freedom to walk around while you wait. 

Omeletts: yummy, fresh, lots of options
Toast: they're bread is unreasonably great
French Toast: great bc of the great bread
Mimosas: look beautiful!

Service was very friendly as well and our server had someone training with her, who was also very kind. This place is busy and pretty loud, but everyone there is happy and smiley because well, it's brunch.

Our waiter Freddie was great! I got the chicken sandwich and added bacon and it was amazing! We had a party of 5 and didn't have to wait long at all! It is a very cool atmosphere inside very busy and a lot of people all over! We have had this place twice since we've been here and it's been great both times!

Was in NOLA for my birthday weekend and tried this place out, it did not disappoint! Try to do a reservation if possible due to how long the wait can get. We ordered drinks while we waited for our table (abt 10 min wait bc of reservation). NOLA has good food everywhere but this was probably my favorite. I'm a sucker for a good brunch place and this hit the spot! I got an omelet and nibbled on some salmon toast and french toast. Everyone i was with was super satisfied with their food as well!

This place was super delicious. I would make sure you check in on line because it gets busy fast. My wife wants us to go back tomorrow because we just could not order all the good things that were on the menu.

Extremely long wait, but I went during a festival so that was to be expected. Food was just so so for me. I ordered the Trifecta but didn't really enjoy it. I would go again but next time stick to another dish.

Been meaning to check this place out since day 1, we came after the lunch rush just died. The host was friendly and got us two seats at the bar right away (no open tables available). My friend and i sat at the bar, it looks like it was busy/short staffed that day. We were totally cool with waiting a bit to get service. It took our bartender server 8 minutes to greet us. We placed our full order right away and asked for two glass of water when she had a chance (she never gave us water). Our food came, it was delicious but we left unhappy because both of the bartenders never checked on us, asked us if we need a refill on our drinks, never gave us water until we asked for a second time, they also didn't check on other people of color guests around the bar either. Are they racist? I'm not sure. 

My friend and i are also in the industry, so we understand how tired/hard it is after a busy lunch rush. But a simple greeting from our server, water, a simple check back would totally be enough for us. All those take only a few second to do. I hope other people won't get the same service as we did (or lack of). I would be willing to give other locations a chance. Unfortunately this visit left us a bitter taste in our mouths. 

1 star for the food and 1 star for the friendly host at the door.

Dear lord what an amazing place! We came here on a friends recommendation and were not disappointed. Walked up and put our name in.. a server took drink orders while we waited. We were seated at the bar, and MJ and Jared took care of us. I'm sure MJ sees his share or out of towners, but he made my wife and I feel at home. We had the Bacon Bloody Mary and Pig Candy to name a few of our favorites. Go you won't be disappointed and to to MJ, thank you for a amazing experience!!
Freddie our waiter was excellent. He was fun engaging and welcoming. He made our visit an awesome one! Thanks Freddie
You will not be disappointed!  The food is worth the wait. You have to have their Bloody Mary!  Just make sure you go hungry!
Crazy good breakfast!!!! Very nice server, locally inspired menu and not your standard "restaurant coffee." We had a great experience

It is a bit overhyped, but maybe that is because a lot of people recommend it to tourists.  We had a morning left in NOLA and I thought we would grab a quick bite and maybe see the French Quarter one last time.  Nope.  We had a 30 minute wait and the service was very slow, so slow we asked for our check to pay before our food came because we still wanted some time to do some quick gift buying before we left. I had the Banana Foster French Toast that was truly French on baguette bread and it was very good.  Since Brennan's was closed and I couldn't get Banana Foster there, I had it at breakfast on my way out!   Decent food.  I wasn't too excited about the theme, though one waitress had Victory rolls in her hair. Awesome!   It reminds me of a 50s sort of diner with a French twist.  But the wait makes me want to drop it down to three stars.  It doesn't have the old world atmosphere enough for me to want to wait two hours to do a meal.

Grits were also good, forgot to add that.  The French Toast is so large you could split it between two people.
Used the waitlists app worked like a charm good coffee nice eggs grits good bacon outstanding fun well run machine

Food and service was great! Pancakes were delicious and large. Can't go wrong with candy bacon. Expect a wait for a table, but it went faster than expected. Once we were seated, the food came out quickly. I enjoyed the cinnamon swirl pancakes and my husband loved the variety of the Benedict.

I eat breakfast every Tuesday and Wednesday morning when in New Orleans.  Service is top notch .  Breakfast is also top notch.  The French toast is really good .  I actually changed the hotel I stay at to the Pelham so it is easier to start my day.  Pelham is hotel attached to restaurant .

All of their breakfast dishes are amazing!! This time I had the shrimp and grits. Always do the online seating option. It works really well with no long wait upon arrival. My Bloody Mary was nice and refreshing with a little spice. A must do!!

Wait time: 0 min. Server (jayda) 5 Star   Menu Selection: 4 star. Food Quality: 5 star. Serving Proportion: 5 star
The food was cooked perfectly and ample is size.  Quick and non rushed atmosphere

Hit this spot up for brunch, pretty good...
VERY busy
Tourist trap

No bottomless mimosas :p

Nonetheless a good experience, food was good, drinks were strong, service was good.

Colorado Springs is a dead town for foodies and as a New Yorker in exile I suffer greatly. Thankfully, I am visiting New Orleans, a town that seriously understands great food.

Hit the Ruby Slipper on Magazine for breakfast today. Joletta was our server and she was as amazing as the food! Had the famed Eggs Cochon which is a New Orleans twist on Eggs Benedict. The potatoes were honestly some of the best ever!  

Great food, great people, great vibe = 5 stars.

We went to the Ruby Slipper Cafe on Magazine Street on 3/13/19, and had very good food and service .  Checked in online and ate outside which was a very good experience.  I have nothing negative to say about the restaurant itself or the food, but I am disappointed in the experience I had paying the bill.  I paid with  an American Express Gift Card.  I didn't want the tip to be on this card, so I gave Chris a $5 tip cash instead of adding it to my card.  I told Chris that and he thanked me.  My bill was $30.49 and that was the amount I signed for.   Last night I checked my card balance online and was surprised to see the amount $35.49 subtracted from my card instead of $30.49.   Why was $5 more added to my card without my knowledge?    I wasn't offered a receipt and I am surprised that I didn't ask for one.   I don't expect anything more from this but only hope you can follow up to make sure this doesn't continue to happen to others.    Again, I really enjoyed having Chris as our waiter and whatever happened, I am very disappointed.    Thank you

Went on a Tuesday morning around 9 am no line seated right away. Food was awesome service was even better. Not a long wait for food. Totally enjoyed the atmosphere it was a beautiful restaurant the food was delicious. Will definitely be back.

We used yelp to check in and only had to wait a couple minutes when we got to the restaurant, despite the line out the door.  The croque madame was huge and could've easily fed 2 people- the coffee glazed ham was a great touch.  The pig candy bacon was dangerously delicious.  We could've eaten an entire plate.

The location at Canal Street is much better in terms of layout. My friend and I had a bomb brunch at the Canal Street location and on our last day in New Orleans we visited the location on magazine street. Unfortunately some menu items are better than others. I had the Spanish omelette which was pretty lackluster. I was super disappointed.  It was supposed to have chorizo in it and I just didn't taste much meat. It wasn't particularly memorable and lacked flavor. They definitely loaded it up with cheese. I would not recommend the Spanish omelette. The pancakes are definitely a safe bet.  The award winning Bloody Mary was much better at Canal Street.  

Justin our waiter was polite and funny. And the staff did a great job getting people through the waitlist and they even came out to see if folks needed drinks.  The hostess at the front door was a bit sassy and not in an adorable way. 

In between a hit and a miss this time.

This is a great spot for breakfast. Their food is over-the-top and their service is awesome. I have eaten here many times and will continue to return. Never disappointed and will highly recommend Ruby slipper.
Went for breakfast. The Skinny Migas was amazing and different. Cute red picnic tables outside were a great place to eat on a sunny Spring morning. Service excellent.

An amazing place!  A must see when visiting this fantastic city!   Food is always hot and the quality is by far some of the best!   Get the candies bacon, the bananas foster waffle, and treat yourself to one of their famous bloody Mary's or a mimosa!   You're welcome

I came here for brunch with a group of eight. Let me tell you, this place is popular. It had a wait time of about an hour before our party could be sat. There was a line out the door at this place, so we thought it must be worth it if all these people are willing to wait. 

And were were glad we did. Their bacon bloody marys are to die for, they really hit the spot with  morning brunch. I ordered one of the eggs Benedict options and it was delicious. I can't remember the name but it had pork and I really enjoyed it. Our server was super friendly given how busy it was. I would definitely recommend a trip here during your visit, just be prepared to wait.

5 Stars for food and service. Waiting time took that last star off. The wait was totally worth it but again...45mins-60mins is kinda annoying if you have other plans as well. 

Food was definitely great. I ordered a latte and Shrimp Benedict which came with their signature Fried Green Tomatoes. Did not disappoint at all and the server was very friendly. 
Would definitely recommend this place to my friends.

I stumbled upon this completely by accident and I am so glad I did!  Eating alone, so I was seated at the bar...the waitress was super paitient while I scoured the menu because there is so much deliciousness to choose from!  I settled on the special which was crab Benedict, served on fried green tomatoes.   Anyone who knows me is well aware that I do not...I repeat do not eat tomatoes....but these were done to perfection!  I chatted with a few former police officers in town for the FOP convention over a cup of hot coffee!  I may have to return for a bloody Mary!
Breakfast was outstanding! We arrived early and were seated right away! The "Trifecta" was incredible! Loved, loved, loved! The staff was so nice and friendly too!
Delicious brunch and great customer service. Chris was our server and Candace took our group picture. I had margaritas and the shrimp and grits. Go get you someeeeee. Biscuits are bomb too!

I stopped in for a Saturday brunch with my little cousins. We had a 30 minimum wait and I was able to grab a Bloody Mary and OJ for them while we waited. The wait is definitely worth the food. My cousins had the kids French toast (which was delicious!!!!) with hot chocolate and I had one of the eggs Benedict dishes (can't remember the name) with grits on the side. YUM!! Our server was very accommodating and the food didn't take too long to come out. 

I'll definitely be back but next time I'll use the app to reserve my spot in line.

Great place for breakfast and brunch, good bloody Marys, eggs Benedict and their candied bacon is a must have. Very crowded but definitely worth the wait! The virtual line helped us cut down the waiting time by checking in in advance.
We went to the one on Canal street. The people were very friendly. The food was ok. Make sure you put yourself on the waiting list before you go otherwise you may have a loooong wait.

The Bloody Mary's were an excellent way to utilize the time while awaiting a table to open up for our group of four.  We each had a different variation of an eggs benedict style dish all a top a fabulous buttermilk biscuit, one made with pulled pork, one with bacon, one with catfish and the last with fried chicken.  All food was tasty.  The service was quick and the recommendations spot on.
Freddie Howard is the man! Awesome food, real New Orleans feel but make sure to reserve in advanced.

The food here was pretty decent. The sangria was tasty. The server was really awesome. He made the overall experience a memorable time. The only con of this place was the wait time. We had a 90 minute wait, however you are able to track your place in line with Yelp.

Great experience. Excellent food, with my Sisters and very helpful staff "Sandy thank you for your Excellent CS skills. Highly recommended!

Eggs whites, french toast and Delicious chicken sausage. We Would happily come here again.

A group of us went on Mother's Day Sunday, so it was a little busy & the wait was long. However, totally understandable because of the day.

I got the pacemaker, chicken St. Charles & shrimp boogaloo Benedict.

Chicken St. Charles - the poached egg was a little over done. The fried chicken was also a little overdone and dry. With the addition of the biscuit, everything felt one note. 

Shrimp boogaloo - the egg was perfectly runny on this one. The shrimp was a little over done for this one as well. I was not a fan of the fried green tomato because the batter got soggy with the sauce. I feel like if they grilled the tomato, it would be a lot better. You can get a little bit of the char from grilling it to add a smoky flavor to it. 

The biscuits was probably one of the thing I liked most about both Benedicts. It was soft and buttery. The top layer is crunchy and remained crunchy despite the sauces. What really gave the biscuit the extra "umf" was the cinnamon butter. The cinnamon butter isn't too sweet and the cinnamon was not overpowering. You get bits of the sweetness and hints of cinnamon.

I went with a group of friends and we all fell in love with this place. There is up to a 45min wait depending on what time/day u go, but it is well worth it.

Since we were on vacation our trip was focused on trying as much of the famous cajun food as we could, but it was a nice break from the usual gumbo and po boys. We needed to try as much as possible so we decided to do it tapas style and all get a different breakfast to share. There is no going wrong there, but my favorites had to be the eggs cochon, migas, and croquete madame (we went there twice).. Highly recommend. Just go and you won't regret it

Food was overrated biscuits are too big to be cooked thoroughly. They were mushy food was lukewarm at best when it came out. Wouldn't recommend. Bathroom disgusting smelled like sewer almost threw up just from walking in. Water was running from the kitchen on the floor into dining area

I'm giving this place 2 stars. Our party registered on the wait list and arrived 10 minutes prior to checking in. Once we arrived we had less than 5 minutes according to our host. We waited another hour and 15 minutes to be seated. The prices are fair the food looks good, goods options.

Waited nearly 2 hours. If you are planning a visit, make sure to waitlist yourself on yelp so you don't have to wait for a long time at the restaurant. Ordered as soon as seated and waited for another 30+ min for food. Ordered Hot Coffee, Creamy Vanilla Spice Latte, The Peacemaker (Eggs Cochon & Chicken St. Charles), and The Big Bacon Burger. Coffees were okay. Refills are included with hot coffee. I hated Eggs Cochon. I would not recommend it to anyone. Same for the Bacon Burger. Chicken St. Charles was just okay. By no means, their food is worth the wait or the visit. I visited because many reviewers recommended it. For the amount of hype and wait, they should have so much better food than they do now. Never again!

My wife suggested this place and I've been thanking her ever since. Of course we had to start with the signature drink (the ruby slipper). The catfish and grits were pretty good as well as the fried green tomatoes. My fave for the evening was the stuffed blueberry cheesecake French toast that my wife ordered. Truly delicious. Make sure to try the biscuits with their housemade cane sugar butter as well.

This place is awesome, service was great, and our server Freddie was the best!!! Highly recommend it! 
Great food and drinks!!! Loved the Bloody Mary!

This place was FANTASTIC! Went here for brunch on my last day visiting New Orleans and I wish I had tried it on the first day so I could go more than once. The wait was about 45-50 minutes but my group joined the waitlist from yelp and had barely any wait when we got there, I'd say 5 mins.

Our waiter was extraordinary, unfortunately I do not remember this name. He was charismatic, attentive, and really cared about us enjoying our visit. He recommended the Croque Madame to me and I'm so glad I listened to him. It was jaw dropping delicious. The rest of my group was also very happy with their dishes: French toast sticks, Eggs Cochon, and the Southern Breakfast. 

Overall, we were thrilled with our brunch experience and wish we had a Ruby Slipper back home in NY to enjoy.
Great breakfast!  Little bit of a wait to get a table. The biscuit is the biggest I've ever had.  Great service too.

If you don't know already, I travel A LOT. Anytime I visit New Orleans I make it a point to visit my friends at The Ruby Slipper Cafe (the location on Magazine St.). The folks here are always welcoming and the food...AMAZE-BALLZ! The BB2T is a must try, trust me! As I sit here in my underpants in my hotel (asking you to trust me) writing this I can't help but come to the realization that tomorrow is my final day in New Orleans, for it's off to the great state of Texas next! You best believe I'll be stopping by the Ruby Slipper bright and earlier tomorrow morning. 

Food...my take on life! Eat on!

Wow!  A phenomenal place with great food. The portions and huge, the food is delicious and the service is wonderful!  We waited over 30 minutes for a table and it was worth every second.  Do yourself a favor and don't miss out on this great place.    Came back twice during our most recent visit and the quality and service were as wonderful as ever.  Our server, Ashley C. was by far one of the best ever.  Her outgoing personality made a great dining experience even better!
Food was great and they easily accommodated our group of 7. Try the corn beef hash. Overall our favorite. Freddie was a great server. Highly recommend. We will be back.

We waited for an inside table for about 30 minutes. Our waiter was extremely helpful and courteous. He offered suggestions of what to try. The food was definitely worth the wait. Catch of the day St. Pete style was out of this world and you better have a big appetite for the sampler!  The bacon infused Bloody Mary was great and good NOLA coffee! Definitely stop by if you get the chance. A winner!
Central location with one of the best breakfast places. Huge interior. Spacious and comfortable. Friendly staff. You can sit at a table or by the bar. Very long lines.

What can I say but absolutely amazing breakfast and mimosas! Do yourself a favor and go to yelp and add yourself to the waitlist prior to coming here, line is always out the door and if we didn't use the online waitlist, we would've waited an hour and a half. But the wait would've been worth it. Friendly servers, great service, and great local food. Some of the best corned beef hash I've ever had and their fried chicken Benny is amazing.

i went there for breakfast in a weekday morning. I know there are a lot of ppl suggest this place but im just ok. I ordered the french toast which a lot of people recommend, but I think it is too sweet and I do not want all the food are soaked in the maple syrup. The price is not too high, but the taste is just ok for me.
I walked in about 30 minutes before they stopped seating. I was at the Canal St. location. I had the skinny omelet with coffee. It was tasty. The bartender was friendly.

JUST GO EAT HERE!!!!!!!! stop reading all the reviews and just go eat there!!! you will not be disappointed!!! the wait is long buttttt well worth it, get a mimosa or bellini while you wait. 
I had the st Charles egg benedict, I don't like runny eggs so I got mine scrambled and boy was it good sooooo full of flavour! my boyfriend got the French Toast and that was good as well, not too sweet and just right. this is how you do brunch right, promise! my waitress was awesome and steered us in the right direction.

Went here for breakfast. The later you go the longer the wait is. We got there around 8am so didn't have to stand online. We were seated right away. However I had attempted to go the day before and the wait was 30-45mins so we walked away. I had the blood Mary with the bacon which was super tasty. It was my 1st time having it. I ordered the grilled fish St. Peter's which was catfish with the grits which was delicious. My waiter was attentive and gave us great recommendations. Service was prompt.

The worst thing about this place is when you run out of food. Best brunch spot hands dowwn! I would suggest getting on the waitlist in your Uber to avoid the wait, but it's well worth it! Nicole P. is a rockstar, slanging drinks! Honestly it's impressive to watch her make so many drinks back to back!

My family and I are visiting from California and we were so happy with the quality of the food and the friendliness of the staff! The wait was definitely worth it! We have gone back twice already and I can promise we will hit it one more time before flying home! THE BISCUITS ARE TO DIE FOR!

This place is worth the hype & I see why the line can wrap around the corner. We got lucky early Sat morning & got in before it was crowded. The red dress run was that day so the place filled up fast. Ok, let's get down to business. The set up is homey & rustic. I ordered the eggs Cochon and it comes with chopped pork BBQ, a perfectly poached egg, a huge homemade my momma biscuit and the best hollandaise sauce ever. I wanted an extra bowl of it. The portion was huge so It took me a few days to eat it. The hubby ordered the banana stuffed French toast with caramelized bacon, drool, and our son had a huge stack of pancakes the size of a dinner plate. The service was great, the food was too & we will definitely be back. The $$$ was right and our teenage garbage disposal aka son left full. That right there was worth it.

Have you ever had some Egg Benedict's?!? I can assure you not like this! Not a fan of runny eggs? That's okay because they can make the eggs any way you want. I ordered the peacemaker which allows you to pick two different bennies. Shrimp Boogaloo and Chicken St. Charles Benedict. AMAZING!!! The gravy on the chicken and biscuit exploded in your mouth. The shrimp sauce with the green tomato and biscuit. Another explosion in your mouth! My boyfriend had the cinnamon swirl pancakes they just melted in your mouth!!! I don't think you can go wrong with anything on this menu. To top it all off the service was excellent!
Amazing!  Exceeded expectations in terms of food quality and quantity.  Well worth the wait.

Huge let down. We were super excited by the stellar reviews and line out the door but the food was pretty awful and the people working there seemed so unhappy to be there. It seemed to rub off on the guests too. We got the biscuit breakfast sandwich and the pancake flight. The biscuit was dry and hard to eat. The pancakes were overly sweet and nothing special. We would not recommend this place.
OMG breakfast. Crazy inventive breakfast dishes, served with a Cajun flair, and huge portions. Great after a night out for sure.  Quick and friendly service and plenty of seating.
The staff was great and the food was excellent, brunch is my favorite meal so I will be back here the next time I am in town!

My favorite place in town for breakfast & brunch. I like the atmosphere there. It makes you easy and refresh. Little pigs Omelet is nice and I really enjoy it. My waitress Britain is a sweet girl and will be helpful if you are the first time there.

The Migas...that's all you need to know. Order it and don't even think twice. I'm not a huge fan of breakfast but something like this is exactly what I could get used to each morning. The iced coffee was also delicious. 

I know there can be a bit of a wait sometimes so you may want to consider making a reservation. Also there is outdoor seating; we sat there and enjoyed the people watching. Just go, you won't regret it!

Ruby Slipper has my favorite brunch food in New Orleans. If you are the sort of evil person that doesn't like mimosas, this will be a 5 star place for you. If you are a millionaire, this will be a 5 star place for you. For the rest of us, we have to gaze longingly at the $10 mimosas and hope that one day we'll make that first million

Granted there was a long wait time but I was so happy we were able to get brunch at 1 PM on a Friday. We were visiting for my boyfriends birthday and my friend that they sent and the staff is very knowledgeable and the food was amazing. The only complaint like I said where is the wait time which was like a said about one hour. They do have an option for you to drink while you wait but it's not awkward because you have to pay for the drink
Our waiter Freddie H was great and the food was amazing. Will definitely be back. The entire menu is good so it was hard to decide what to pick

This is just one of those lucky finds when you are walking the streets in New Orleans. We passed by and checked out their menu and decided to go the next morning. Man were we glad. Their drinks were amazing. If you are a Bloody Mary drinker, splurge and add the bacon. My husband loves Bloody Marys and had many on the trip, but this was by far the best. As far as the food...it was excellent! I'm not one to leave many reviews, but sometimes things just need to be said. I had the eggs Benedict with fried chicken and another with pork. I don't remember the exact name on the menu, but you got to select two if you have a hard time making up your mind like me.  It was very shareable. The portions are huge. Everyone in our group said it was by far the best meal of the trip. Their Biscuits are soooo flaky and moist at the same time. Also, make sure you add a side of candied bacon. It's vacation right? Our waitresses was super helpful too. She was energetic and joyful. I don't believe I got her name, but she had a tiny spider tattoo on the back of her neck. Just in case anyone from The Ruby Slipper reads this, give her a high five!

The food was great and my server Freddie made my first experience, amazing! Nowadays, customer service is obsolete but Freddie gave me hope that there are still great  people who love what they do and are more than willing to serve! Thank you sooo much Freddie! You are the best! We will be back!
Not bad, the pancakes where really good that my friend got.  A little under seasoned for my liking, but still good

This place was a neat classic to visit! Our Lyft driver recommended this place to us and we dined here for breakfast. They have a variety to chose from and tif you like eggs Benedict, definitely get the Peacemaker. You get the option of trying two different Benedict's! I thought this was unique and excellent for someone such as myself who was torn between two different ones to order.
I ended up getting the Eggs Cochon and the Corned Beef Bernie. The corned beef was my favorite for sure! I also got an extra side of Hollandaise Sauce to add to my Benedict if I needed to. It came in handy since I love sauce! 
We enjoyed Creamy Vanilla Iced Coffee and it was great! I would get this again for sure! The staff were very helpful and nice which was great for us considering we weren't locals and had questions.
Amazing food and service.  A must when in New Orleans.  Highly recommend their specialty items and mimosas. And the bread pudding pancakes were to die for.

JERRY JERRY JERRY!!!!!!!

Jerry took great care of us. Made us feel welcomed from the very beginning of of experience at ruby slippers.Jerry even went out of his way to fit my large group feel comfortable.The food was great, great service. I highly recommend Ruby slippers when in New Orleans

Seat at the bar was super quick & efficient.  Friendly servers. 

Got the combo eggs Benedict - awesome.

Cool vibe - great visit!
Bomb food and great service! Nice and friendly! Check out the bananas foster French toast- mouth wateringly good!

I got the Florentine omelette and it was really flavorful and good! The serving sizes are large and fair for the prices. My boyfriend got the shrimp boogaloo and says the eggs were perfectly cooked, and the shrimp was seasoned beautifully. Overall, a good experience and would highly recommend.
Wish I could give zero stars, waiter was awful, food, mediocre at best. Save some money, go elsewhere

I got the trifecta, boozy coffee, and blueberry mimosa and when I tell you in lived.. I freaking loved!!! Some of the best food I've ever had!!! The pork is so juicy and tender, the eggs were perfectly poached and the bartender Nicole P. was absolutely everything to us and she didn't even know it was my birthday! Highly recommend anyone to stop in!

Came here after everyone in my sorority told me about it and when I saw that there's a billion "ruby slipper cafes" in the town, I chose the one with the most amount of reviews and this was the place to go. I saw online on the app that the wait was 11-20 minutes so when we were 10 minutes away, I put myself on the waitlist but then ended up waiting an additional 10-20 minutes when I got there because the waitlist was going by slower than expected- no big deal (wasn't in a rush). Anyways, the area reeks of vomit so we waited away from the actual entrance and once we were called, we were seated inside at the bar area with high chairs (whereas there are actual table areas inside as well as outside). The waitress served us drinks fairly quickly, but when it comes to the food, it took a good while before it came out (probably almost another 20 minutes). My sister ordered the southern breakfast (which was not bad at all for the price-although we didn't eat the biscuit or most of the grits as we weren't big fans of it- didn't taste bad though) while I got the benedict trifecta which includes eggs cochon (shredded pork)-my least favorite, chicken st Charles (fried chicken)-pretty good, and Shrimp Boogaloo-my favorite!! Although the service in general was slow, overall they had pretty decent food for the pricing. Wouldn't mind coming back.
The staff was great. The food looks really good and tastes great. All ways busy, but using the waitlist capability makes it seem fast. I wish I knew name of the hoatrrss

I went back again and not to my surprise, it was great!

Went with the 3 pigs omelet!  Delicious and they were not stingy with the meat. Came with an amazing biscuit and some potatoes!  

Very filling and tasty!  Job well done Ruby Slipped!

Wow. No doubt about the 5 star review here. I guess I should say more though, right?

Let's just say this. YOU MUST HAVE THE EGGS COCHON! I want to go back to NOLA just to have this again, at this restaurant. Service was fast and friendly. Mimosa was delish too.

We may have been lucky because we didn't wait at all. A must do while in New Orleans.

Love Love Love the food, it was amazing! The service was fantastic, so many great dishes! My suggestion go with a group of friends so you're able to sample a variety  of dishes, I tried 8 different dishes and everything was delicious prices are great! Environment is awesome, a bistro style with southern hospitality! The food was out of this world, you have to, you just have to try it!!!!

Amazing food - I had the St Charles and it was so good.  My friends had the Peacemaker and loved their options as well. Service was excellent as well. 
Definitely earned their reputation in my opinion.
I love this place for breakfast, a real hearty meal never leaving hungry great service and consistent with their food I've tried 2 locations and both are just as good!

There's definitely a reason why there's a huge line that builds up outside this spot. We were staying nearby (literally next door) at Pelham Hotel and noticed the line, so we decided to stop by the morning of our last day. They open at 7 and we showed up around 8 on Sunday and there was no line (thankfully). We were seated immediately and you can tell what a bustling place it is, even when it's a "quiet" time. 

I had The Southern Breakfast which was delicious (though I had fruit instead of grits). but nothing beats what my boyfriend ordered... the Pancake Flight (I kind of expected fireworks to go off just now as I typed that) 

IT. WAS. UNREAL. 

Cinnamon Swirl pancake was hands down the best. It wasn't too sweet but had the perfect amount of cinnamon sweetness to it and it was just fantastic. The Bacon Praline was phenomenal and we really want to recreate this at home! The pancake of the day was a chocolate orgy which I can't remember the name for but it was also superb. 

The name of the Cafe has a really cute backstory as well, tied to Hurricane Katrina & how coming back into the city afterwards was a "there's no place like home" kind of feeling. 

Would recommend that you either get there early or prepare for a 30-40 min wait depending on the size of the party!
So delicious! Near 1:00pm on a Saturday, we waited about ten minutes for a party of 2. It was great and as was the food and service!

This place was very good overall. Service was fast and friendly. The different eggs benedict were all cooked to perfection and had so many options. They also have different options for different needs (lactose intolerance and vegetarian changes). The only thing that wasn't a 5 star were the pancakes which were burnt on one side. Aside from that Ruby Slipper is the perfect place for a breakfast lover.
Not gonna make this review a long one because I want to get straight to the point... hands down THE BEST fried chicken sandwich I've ever had.

Sorry, but this place just doesn't fit me. I'm okay with greasy food and wasn't expecting a fit/healthy meal. However I didn't count on that my egg white omelette would be swimming in oil on a plate. I can't understand why you would use that much grease in a dish no matter what you're trying achieve unless it's a record for the world record book of Guinness! Wouldn't recommend this place unless you're trying some of their specialties that looked way better and ironically seemed to have less oil than my egg white omelette?! Service was ok and the wait wasn't that long to be seated at the bar. However our food took a bit too long if you ask us.
Great place. Very friendly staff, fast service, and excellent food. Eat here everytime we come down sometimes 2 or 3 times.

This is a good place to meet for breakfast if you're in town for a conference. It's not a "touristy" type of joint. Stick to the basics of the food and you'll be just fine. I'd say that their drinks are kind of ehhh. They use really cheap orange juice from a gallon plastic jug for mimosas and some pre-mix for the bloody mary's and I watched them add the vodka to the bloody mary's and was SHOCKED how little alcohol went in there. 

On the plus side, if you are going in for a quick breakfast by yourself, there may be room @ the bar. If you're coming with folks you may want to meet a bit earlier than you think you need to b/c they get very busy.

Regardless of what this person from Ruby Slipper says who attached a comment to my review , the pours were VERY light and there is NO information about the quality of their juice. It seems a bit mysterious to me.

The eggs Benedict here were amazing. This was a great place for a fast breakfast, at least around 7am. Kid friendly. They had a simple egg, bacon, toast breakfast for my kid for a reasonable price. I was able to pay at the table via iPad and get in and out. 

Casual bench seating. And this was a great location. Easily accessible.

Good food. They don't take reservations and it was FREEZING while we waited outside (no waiting indoor :() The ceilings are very high and there is a decent amount of larger tables, so it's extremely loud in there. Minus one star for that. The food was good...enormous portions and very filling.  Service was a bit slow and our waiter wasn't really good or bad, but it was a very busy day...I'd come back but it wouldn't be my first choice in the area.

Not impressed. I say this restaurant was very average. It was very busy and they serve alcohol very early so I think that was a big draw for many people who go here. Myself excluded. They are very popular for their Bloody Mary's which I normally enjoy trying but unfortunately wasn't feeling upto one. To me the food was just average, the service was poor, and after waiting 1 hour to be seated, than another 30 mins to get our food it wasn't worth it. Also, the food came out lukewarm and sloppy presentation. 

If you do go here, definitely reserve your place in line on yelp. If we didn't we probably would have had to wait an extra 30 mins to 1 hr. Which is crazy. This restaurant is definitely very touristy, but wanted to try it since it was walking distance from our hotel. They have another location down the street so they do a lot of business. To me the food wasn't good enough for the wait or the price. I'll pass and don't recommend it.
