Overall, the vibe is great, the service is excellent, and the Egg benedicts are to die for!! Would definitely recommend to anyone asking for good places to eat in NOLA.
Besides the long wait....the food was really good.  I had the Banana Foster Pain Perdu and if was really tasty.

The breakfast was disappointing. Potatoes and grits were cool to the touch. The omelette warmish-at least the goat cheese was soft. The biscuit w cane butter was quite good.  I had to fetch my own coffee refill-twice. I've had better breakfasts as Denny's where at least the food is served hot and you don't have to walk for coffee. Not worth a 5 minute wait, much less the 30 minutes we experienced. Sad to leave a bad review but it's fair.
Stick with Banana foster. I should have listened to the other yelper; the BBQ Shrimp and Grits was truly bland. Love the bar and atmosphere though.
Food was great! And bloody marry was espectacular !!!!! Extremely friendly and fast considering was a super busy day. Will definitely recommend this restaurant !!!!!

We had to wait an hour but it was worth it. The food and service were excellent! 

Everyone in our party had delicious dishes. 
The Trifecta was phenomenal! Way too much food unless you're super hungry. 

I would recommend you try this spot. You should have someone from your party leave their cell # and they can text you when your table is ready instead of standing around waiting in front. I hope you enjoy

Great vibe, full of life and this is what a breakfast joint is all about! 

Friendly staff and cool menu/offerings is a huge score.  I loved being able to be added to wait list via Yelp AP cuz when we arrived and saw the sea of folks waiting .. it was maybe a 5 min wait before we were escorted in.. nice!

Southern breakfast was good.. biscuit was light, fried green tomatoes refreshing and I loved the scrambled eggs - best I've had! (only tip is the recommended  candied/maple bacon and cheese on the grits weren't worth the slight uncharge).

Can't go wrong with The Miga breakfast - it was simple and packed with flavor.  

The Bloody Mary (I'm told) was good and my mimosa was huge n hit the spot however, The black coffee was a watered down miss .. oh well.

Good portion of the restaurant seating is around a lively and open bar.. make a friend, have a heartfelt prepared good ol' breakfast and start the morning off on a fantastic note!

Our waiter, Mario, was super sweet.  The kings cake pancake was the special of the day (which was a week before Mardi Gras of course) and it also came with a bacon praline pancake, and a cinnamon swirl pancake. The bacon praline was my favorite. The chicken with poached eggs was amazing as well. 
Very clean place and the chef brought the food out herself (nice n hot!). 

Wonderful breakfast! Would recommend. We did join the waitlist via yelp and it said the wait time would be 6-19 minutes, but we were seated right away.

Visited ruby slipper while we were in NOLA for a short trip. Chose this breakfast spot based on the great reviews it had and we definitely were not disappointed! Everything was phenomenal and the service was even better. Hats off to Lance for making our first time at Ruby Slipper so memorable. We will definitely be back and recommend to others traveling to the area.

This place was AWESOME. We really enjoyed the Fish St. Peter and the Eggs Benedict and the spiced vanilla lattes. Everything that was coming out just looked amazingly delicious. Everyone there seemed to be enjoying there meals. The servers were doing a great job of keeping the drinks flowing and ensuring everyone is getting taken care. We really liked this place and wish we had one near us back home. There are a few locations, so find one that isn't too busy and check them out. Except maybe the one in the Garden District...They need to work some kinks out in the service dept.
Banana Foster Brioche French Toast was so delicious! Come hungry because it is very filling!
Great corn beef Ruben great chicken sandwich. I would recommend this place to everybody

What a wonderful atmosphere and experience. Our waiter Freddie H was so helpful explaining the menu and was very attentive about making sure we had what we needed. It was our first time to the Slipper so we tried the dishes that gave us the most variety. The trifecta was excellent! My compliments to the chef for wonderful presentation and distinct flavors. The shredded pork was my favorite. My wife had the pancake duo with the banana pecan and bacon and praline buttermilk pancakes. We are going back tomorrow morning for sure!
Quite the breakfast after a night of butt chugging huge ass beers on Bourbon! Great service by Freddie H! Highly recommend the breakfast, butt do not recommend the butt chugging.
Ordered an omelet as well as pancakes. Both were excellent. I would recommend reserving a spot in line on yelp, because they tend to get very busy
Food is great - bacon!!!  Bloody Marys okay so four out of five.  Nice big portions - try the biscuits.
Great brunch options, I love the various eggs Benedict options, shrimp, crab, vegan all tasty. You hv to try their bloody Mary's  the bacon recipe is my fave.

BEST. BREAKFAST. EVER!! My absolute favorite is 'the Peacemaker' with eggs Cochon (braised short rib) and Chicken St. Charles...followed by the BBQ shrimp and grits...can't go wrong with either...you're welcome in advance ;)

Breakfast was good with a good crowd.  Both my husband and I had pancakes.  He had the traditional ones and I had the choose two.  Mine was one seasonal and one cinnamon swirl.  My knock would be they forgot the cinnamon in the cinnamon swirl.  The base pancake was good and the icing tasty but no cinnamon.  We had great bacon and a side order of breakfast potatoes which were very good.
Server Freddie was extremely helpful with great services and i recommend the Crab cake Benedict.

Had Sunny as our server and she was absolutely amazing great service friendly engaged us... I was extremely happy with my brunch and this is why I keep coming back to this location and I look forward to next time!!!

Found this on yelp and had great reviews. Seated right away and service seems fast. Placed order....however ten minutes later told they don't have oatmeal which is what I ordered. Then asked for Omelet with no cheese. 15 minutes later received omelet with cheese. Was remade again as I told them I can not have milk or cheese.  20 minutes later got them meal. Food was very bland and expensive. In addition discovered dairy in the omelet and got very sick shortly after the meal.

YOU MUST COME HERE WHEN IN NOLA!!

And yes, it is worth the wait. 

Just leave your mobile number and they will call you and you can run like Usain bolt and get back there just in time to enjoy the best breakfast you are likely to ever eat!

Oh and yes they will laugh In your face if you do t order any alcohol with your brekky, this is New Orleans afterall!
The food was just ok and nothing special.  For the price I felt you could do better.  You could tell they are trying to be a chain which New Orleans is not about.

Unfortunately even after checking in online 45 minutes prior to arrival there would've been an additional 45 minute wait. The line outside was chaotic. Once we found the hostess we stood for 10 minutes behind 1 party of 3. No idea why it took so long for them to give their info or what the holdup was but when another lady jumped in from of us from the side of the hostess stand we decided to leave. There's was no structure & the wait was insane. I suggest you get there as soon as they open if you want to try this place.
I had to wait over 40 minutes to get in, but it was worth it. Even a simple bread tasted better at this restaurant. Delicious and friendly staff. Love the name of the café concept. Will go back.
This is a great spot to get brunch but expect a wait.  The prices are fair, between $8-$16 range. They don't have a fully stocked bar. I would definitely recommend trying the candied bacon.

Great service, awesome food!

This was our second visit to one of the Ruby Slipper locations.  The food is consistently great between the Canal location and this location off Magazine.

Went for breakfast on a Sunday morning, around 830am - no wait all, seated immediately (but get the NoWait App just incase).  

Wife and I split the bananas foster french toast and the eggs cochon.  Both were freaking amazing!

Service was great - ask for Michelle if you head here.  She was no doubt the best waitress we had during our stay in NOLA!
Food is great loved everything. And good service overall. I would eat there again anytime.

when me and my friends visited NoLa we came here twice for brunch. delicious coffee and french toast options. our main dishes were really good too. a bit of a wait so better to enter your name into the waitlist via yelp as you're getting ready to go there. the benedicts, the biscuits, the pancakes are delish.
Great food ! Awesome little Cafe We had eggs Benedict and the Cinnamon sugar pancakes both were delicious. Our waiter Freddie was spot on and very attentive.

The host/ hostess did not know what to do, she was all over the place. While tables were clean and empty she didn't serve the tables. When we finally got our table the waiter didn't show up and we sat there for about 15 minutes. When she got the coffee it was soo watery just by looking at it. I ordered a pancake flight which was good expect for the bacon praline, it was disgusting! I adored the cinnamon swirl and the pancake of the day which was a classic buttermilk pancake with blueberries on top. My dad got a croquet madam it was delicious. My mom got a omelette which she really liked. A booth close to ours got there food dropped by the waiter, it was a mistake but still they should have been more careful, the same waiter hit me in the head with glasses of water!! Overall the place was loud, service wasn't great, and most of the food was good.

The food was pretty good here, but nothing that left me thinking I had to come back. I got an omelette and my boyfriend tried their eggs benedict.
I was pretty bummed by the wait, she told us it would be 45-60 minutes, which resulted in an hour and a half. I get it, things happen. But here they favor larger parties for sure, she told us more than once that there were two parties ahead of us, which wound up being five names called, all with bigger parties. Kind of disappointing to be pushed to the bottom of a line just because you're a party of two. The wait mixed with the mediocre food dropped off the two stars.

Wow pretty much sums it up.  Great breakfast fare and fast service.  We have had pretty much everything and it's all good.   Many locations,  get there early - relatively or stand in line.  You can check in using the Nowait app and get seated quicker.

Amazing breakfast! We had the fried green tomato egg sandwich, corned beef hash Benedict, red beans and rice skillet, and the bananas foster french toast. Everything was delicious! The only thing I do wish is that their ice coffees had a milk alternative but other than that I would go back again, SO GOOD!
Always delicious with friendly service, use yelp to elevate long wait times.  My wife loves the Mimosas and there Bloody Mary is delicious.
First time and our overall experience was great!!! Freddie is a connoisseur of food with top notch service.  Thank you for the memorable experience.  Please bring Ruby Slipper to Los Angeles.
Incredibly friendly staff, amazing food and lates! Super impressed by the service and hospitality!
Decent food, great mimosas, good service despite being extremely busy. Bathrooms were gross and needed serious attention! Overall a good experience.

Ruby was great! Here for a work trip and stopped in here with colleagues. Freddie (our server) was super attentive even though the place was packed on a Saturday morning. Definitely order the Peacemaker with the fried chicken and the Cochon.

The Good
* Service is spectacular!!! Even though we had a huge party.. our server was patient and attentive
* Food was bomb! Mhmmmmm MmMm... I had the Eggs Benedict. It was good because usually by the second half of the eggs benedict the sauce is just over whelming for me. However at Ruby Slipper Cafe.. they've managed to find a balance in the sauce itself. Wonderful. Light and creamy. 
* There's a breakfast bar! for those that just want to go in out fast! -- that's usually me.. *wink wink*

The Bad
* No reservations

The Weird
* The first time we tried to eat here.. it "flooded"... wonder what that looked like !!! O__O We ate there after 2 days of that note of flooding!

Lizette G was our server. She was fantastic and gave really great recommendations. We ordered the chicken st. Charles. It is a friend chicken Benedict. It was delicious. The fried chicken was perfectly cooked, not soggy and the chicken was not dried out. They were out of the bread for the banana foster French Toast so we opted for the regular French toast. It was really good! Additionally, we got mimosas (really strong), iced coffee and a drip coffee. Service was great. I recommend putting your name on the yelp waiting list before heading over as it can be an hour wait during peak time!

This place was awesome! The breakfast food is so goood!   The ambiance is great and if you are staying in the financial district it should be close. Although if you are staying in the French quarter or near the convention center this might be too far for a morning walk.  The food is great and priced fairly.  It is quite enough to have a conversation with someone while you eat

Went here for breakfast. The food was really good.  OMG the egg Cochon was excellent!   It is an open face biscuit with applewood smoked pulled pork, a perfectly poached egg and and a bolinaise sauce.  Soooo goood!!!  The Bloody Mary was great and spicy.   The atmosphere was very casual.  Really great place for an excellent breakfast.
I ordered the brioche French toast and what came to my table was just regular toast not brioche. The candied bacon is great! Overall, the food was just okay, but our server was great!

I'm not sure if the location for this restaurant , but it is directly across from the Le Belle Maison hotel.
We ordered the pancakes, with a side of pork sausage. 

Loved the pancakes, they made them large.
The sausage hit the spot and was cooked perfectly.
I also liked their coffee.
They were very busy the day we went , but had a  waiting list system that worked great.
Only criticism is that they left the front doors wide open, making it chilly in the dining room. I noticed a lot of customers eating with their coats on.

The most popular location of the three currently existing in NOLA. They've got really good Nola inspired food items. Definitely try their fried chicken cause even if you've had it, you've never had the ones from NOLA. I would recommend the red slipper cocktail which is OJ, pomegranate juice and sparkling wine. I love how yelp has the waitlist option. Works very well, just make sure to check in before the time.

Slow inattentive service. Loud. Good food- not great food mind you.  Wanted to live it and make it a daily start as we are staying very near here.  But we have gone elsewhere to start our days after one visit to Ruby Slipper.

This place gets really busy and for good reason. We were able to make a reservation online, which was nice. When we arrived, we were very happy we made the reservation because the street outside of the restaurant was packed with folks waiting for a table. I checked in and was told we would have another half an hour, which we fully expected. The great part about standing outside to wait was that there was actually a waitress who came around and took some drink orders outside. We were able to order coffee and Bloody Marys to sip on while waiting for a table to be ready.

When we got inside and looked at the menu, everything looked amazing.  Finding delicious food in New Orleans that doesn't include meat or cheese can be quite difficult, however I was able to ask for modifications to The Costa Rican in order to make it what I wanted. Everyone loved their meal and said it was one of the best brunches we had in the area. Our server was very friendly regardless of the fact that she had many tables to serve.

I've been here before but for some reason Ruby Slipper missed the mark on my last visit. My wife and I actually came two days in a row. My largest let downs and rooms they could improve on were the biscuits being cold and very tough and my food being pretty cold. Almost as if they had been sitting for a while. My server did bring out a fresh baked biscuit once I mentioned this to here that was pretty good. 

I will say that I've been before and the food was amazing! Huge portions and hot food. We will visit again and try but my last visits were let downs.
Service was a little slow. Otherwise fantastic food and very friendly. Speed up seating to wait staff time and would be 5 stars easy.

Excellent brunch!  Came at 2pm an hour before they closed so were able to get in no problem. Also got to sit outside where they only have like 6 tables. I had the Bananas Foster French Toast which was amazing.  I contemplated ordering another plate! My wife had the Costa Rican breakfast which was very authentic and savory!  Orange juice also tasted freshly squeezed. 
And enjoyed a side of their breakfast potatoes. The pancakes looked like there were good as well, nice and larger and fluffy, will have to try next time. Everything hit the spot!

Saw this place on our way toward Cafe Dumonde, halfway there turned around and went back. Best decision. The staff are super friendly, Jackie especially, the ambiance is great and the food delicious. The biscuits are the size of a softball and really good!!!
Good place for breakfast.  The are located in a few spots.  No complaints the service was great and fast.  I'm a fan of fried tomatoes and theirs was really good.

Excellent food and service!  The Cochon Benedict is out of this world!

Our server, Freddie, was awesome!!  Highly recommend this place.

I had the shrimp and grits with rosemary sauce. It was absolutely delicious.  It has a nice strong (but no too strong) rosemary taste. The candied bacon was very good too. The biscuits were ok. I had mimosas but they have a bloody w/ bacon vodka that looked great. The wait is insanely long. The restaurant recommends an app you can download to see how long the wait is. I don't know if they take reservations.

Great place for breakfast and lunch..I had the crispy chicken sandwich and it did not disappoint   my friends had breakfast and their homemade biscuits were huge and great.  Our server was great as well .a must try

So disappointing. I ate at the Decatur/French Quarter location in January, and the biscuit was life changing. I couldn't wait to come back. But the biscuit this morning was tough, chewy, and tasteless. I gave up and ate my kid's leftover pancake. (One plate of pancakes was great but the other was unevenly cooked and also tough to cut.)
Great service . Got to go early at 7:00am. This place gets packed. Last time I came to Nola the line wrapped around the corner. Eggs Benedict are amazing here.

I get the hype now.  I've passed by Ruby Slipper many times, but was turned off by the long lines.  As I read more reviews on Yelp, most folks indicated that the line moves fairly quickly and the food is worth the wait.  Our lodging is typically right around the corner from the Magazine (CBD) location, so we decided to give it a shot w/ a group of 6.  I went first to get us on the list.  I think that I was told 30min.  Staff floats around outside to take drink orders while you wait.  Our party assembled and we got our table around the 30min mark.  The menu (see photos) consists of breakfast and brunch fare.  Think shrimp and grits, eggs/omelets/migas, blt, burgers, french toast, pancakes, sausage/bacon, hash, killer egg benedicts, coffee/tea, cocktails, and juices.  Most people will find something that they would like.  Our group had a good variety of dishes including benedicts, pancakes, shrimp & grits.  Everyone's plate was presented well, and was hot and delicious.  I thoroughly enjoyed my peacemaker benedict (one salmon, one shrimp) and a spicy bloody mary. We happened to show up on the Sunday morning of the Saints vs Falcons game.  Every table was taken and it was quite busy.  Despite this, we received our food in a reasonable amount of time and the order was spot on.  Overall, I was impressed with the experience and plan to visit again.

My co worker told me this was the place to go while visiting. I must say we arrived just in time because right after they were on a wait ( arrived at 8:15 am). The service was fast and the food was even better. I ordered the shrimp omelette which came with your choice of potatoes or fruit. The cost isn't bad either. All and all it was worth it!
The food was amazing and the kitchen was great at accommodating our dietary restrictions!
Stopped in for a Sunday breakfast just after they opened.  Good fresh omelette, and a nice spot.  The biscuits were in fact ....

We had a group of 9 and they were able to accommodate our group. We had the best server ever who goes by the name of Freddie who made sure our cups were never empty and that our bellies were full. He gave us great details about the menu and his favorite dishes to order.
Use your yelp app to get in line!  Wait in morning can be up to 20-40 minutes. The eggs Benedict dishes are all good.
This place is fabulous! The food is top notch and the staff is very friendly and helpful. I've made this a must visit on my next trip to New Orleans!

All I can say is "Wow!"  Our concierge said "go to Ruby Slipper; there will be a wait (breakfast) but it's worth it!"  
He was right!
Yep...the line out the door usually means the food is great.  That was true.  
The drink menu was out of this world with perfect sounding specialties.  So many drinks ... so little time.  I had the iced coffee and was not disappointed.  But my wife had the Bloody Mary and it was The Best I've had. 
If you want eggs Benedict, this is The Place.  Get the Peacemaker and you can get two of their creations.  So my wife and I had four ... and they were all awesome!  
Finally, service was fantastic.  Chris was perfect, conversational, and took good care of us!
This was our last breakfast before heading home from a great week in NOLA.  Don't make the same mistake we made and wait to eat here.

I thought I'd reviewed this before but I must have had too many daiquiris and forgot. TOP NOTCH breakfast/brunch with a large variety of gourmet Benedict's and house specialties. I haven't tasted anything I didn't like. It's always hard to pick only one from the menu. Fortunately the offer mixed plates for those of us who have trouble narrowing our choices. The house specialty Bloody Mary's are definitely worth writing home about too.
Food aside, the service is impeccable. This visit, our server was Rosefield. She offered great recommendations and never missed a trick. She was so attentive and anticipated our needs: no empty glasses, extra napkins  more Hollandaise...
Come here while you're in town. You'll want to come back again before you leave NOLA. 
TIP: Get on the wait list in advance.

It depends on the location.  The one on Canal seems to be the easiest to get in quickly (if there is not a matinee at the Sanger), but the least consistent food-wise.  My favorite location is the one in Mid-City, but Sunday brunch line takes forever.  No matter the location, the staff is always friendly.

Hoooooo boyyyyyyyeeee!!!! Okay first off - I read some of the 1 star reviews and the people complaining are talking about attitude-- this is New Orleans peepz- you give attitude and they will dish it right back-- also-- you don't come here to order scrambled eggs and a side of grits -- ask for the most popular items and go for it! -- so much good food here -- but go to Denny's if you're looking for a grand slam special -- because this is authentic New Orleans cuisine in a big family dining atmosphere.

Food was excellent and Freddie, our server, did a phenomenal job offering suggestions for what we might want to enjoy for breakfast! He has an infectious personality and checked on us an appropriate amount of times! Would definitely recommend this place if you are visiting! Side note: definitely join the yelp waitlist to cut your time in line shorter. It's a popular place for a reason!
We wanted a true Southern Style Breakfast and Ruby Slipper did not disappoint!  The buttermilk biscuits were to die for!  Best OF City Bloody Mary was amazing  we will definitely eat here again!

first day in New Orleans and I decided to have an early breakfast here. the staff was so friendly and I loved the cute set up. it's very chilly inside but it's refreshing when you've been walking in the sticky humid weather. I was thrilled to see the many types of eggs Benedict they have and it took me ages to decide which one to get. I got the peacemaker which is an option to get 2 different Benedicts of your choice. I got the salmon and the corn beef. the presentation was mouthwatering and they tasted divine. the side of fried green tomatoes have a great flavor as well! the hot chocolate was yummy and overall I'm extremely happy with my decision to eat here.  I will be back one day

Awesome place to eat. Got this recommendation from the bartender at our hotel and it didn't disappoint. And what makes things better is how the polite the staff is even though they're crazy busy. Will definitely be back on my next NOLA trip.

My first visit to this restaurant did not disappoint, the food was amazing. I had the bacon praline pancakes with a side of bacon. Although I wanted to finish the plate, it was more than enough for one person. I didn't need syrup just use the maple glaze. I wished I would have tried the restaurant before my last day. Great place to eat

The food is so so. Definitely not worth the long wait times. We had banana foster French toast, bam bam biscuit, shrimp Bennie, and a hash bennie. My fiancé had the Bloody Mary as well. Candied bacon was actually really good. Our server was busy but attentive other than being kinda rude when I said the French toast wasn't great and when I asked about the creole Rueben he said "well I wouldn't come to the ruby slipper for a Reuben." Well I can guarantee it would've been better than the items we ordered. I can say we've been, now would I return? No thanks, too many other places that are probably better options!
Very good! I definitely would go back. Food was consistent and service was excellent.
That was amazing! We asked our server, Justin, for a recommendation... So glad I did! The Migas was amazing!! Wish it wasn't our last day in town, I'd come back 2 days in a row.

I had the eggs Benedict sampler and it was really really great. What great tastes on all three! And the service was really great also. I didn't care for the coffee that much, but I can see how other folks might like it. One tip would be to look at the predicted wait times chart on Yelp and get there before the rush. It went from no wait at all to a line going down the street pretty quickly.

Very tasty! I would 100% recommend getting in the waitlist early. Our waitlist time was about an hour. There are quite a few locations so make sure you are going to the correct one....we made that mistake.

After being told that the wait was gonna be like 90 minutes, our group of four tried to eat at Red Gravy...and that wait was long, so I bailed on my team and came back to the Slipper and just squeezed in at the bar as a solo act.  Got the Croque Monsieur and a $10 mimosa.  Food was fine; the salad with the sandwich was very welcome this past weekend since it was the only reasonably healthy thing I ate all weekend, and the sammie was big enough to leave me happy.  The $10 mimosa felt like a jack move given the prices of other drinks in the city (hell, Jazz Fest had cheaper drinks) but it was the right thing to do to start the day.  Great service and a cool vibe, but ultimately, $28.15 for a ham and cheese sandwich and a mimosa served in a stadium cup brings the rating down at least a full star on its own.
The food was the TRUTH! It was a slight wait to be seat but it was worth every second! We going back today for a double up visit!

i had the peace maker with the chicken one and eggs cochon. let me say this. just get the chicken one. i mean eggs cochon was a'ight but the chicken one was just *chef kiss*. the mimosa was eh but i'll let it pass because i loved the chicken eggs benny so much.
I expected more from there food. Not sure what people tend to like from this place. There is better places in Nee Orleans to eat. They are ok but not the best.

When I say that the food was the BOMB, it really was! Best ones! 

Big shout out to Freddie our waiter. He gave great recommendations and attentive. Thank you for being our waiter for my friend's birthday squad. 

If you have a big party, then I would highly recommend putting your party on the wait-list using the Yelp app. When my party of 6 arrived, we only had to wait for less than 5 minutes to be seated!

Street parking is limited. However, you can pay and park on a lot across the street.
Second time here. Food was pretty good. Our waiter Freddie was great, very polite and attentive! I'd come back again

Food was worth it but even with the Yelp "book ahead" we waited 1 1/2 hour in line. Rainy day and had to stand outside to wait for a table. Was able to get a Bloody Mary while we waited ... actually had time for 3.

08/09/2011  -  09:55 am

After settling down at the Country Inn & Suites, a hunger for Breakfast developed as the Complimentary Breakfast was over @9:30 am, I had to look for outside alternatives under the ultra-strong-UV-radiation that is the New Orleans scorching Sun.  

Not far away resides Ruby Slipper Cafe which has somewhat English Pub-like exteriors however the insides look completely Long Weekend Brunch at the Cottage relax feel.... Aside from the CNN news Stocks watch on the Flatscreen that is.

Took a seat near the Kitchen/Washroom/Bar area to ponder if I should have Savoury(Shrimp & Grits) or Sweet as first meal of the day.  The MALE server was quite useful pleasant overall while the other ladies seem slightly on-edge for some odd reason.  Unlimited refill Coffee($2.00) kept pouring like Niagara Falls from the Dude without asking, sweet.

SWEET, yes that's what I'll get...

Bananas Foster Pain Perdu($11.00)  -

"Pain Perdu", or lost bread, is a French Bread-based French Toast served with Applewood smoked Bacon and topped with our Bananas Foster topping.

French Bread was unexpected as I usually vision Baguettes to have a hard outer shell but this was soft and the French Toast application was done well.  The Bananas didn't seem to be cooked down at all as from the Bananas Foster method while the Powder Sugar dusting onto the Foster Sauce made the PS crunchy like eating Granulated Sugar by itself.   Don't forget the RAISINS.  :P

Satisfactory Breakfast?  Absolutely!

Now where should I go next??
The Ruby Slipper is a must do. Great food good  atmosphere. When ever I come to NOLA I will ABSOLUTELY eat here!

So, the second day of our girls trip was starting and we needed good eats. We wanted a good authentic New Orleans breakfast so after seeing the reviews, we decided to go here. We thought we were in for a treat but this turned into the worst breakfast I had ever had. 

First, the food took a while to come out. Then when it did, my friend got the wrong omelet. She bit into it and told the waitress it was wrong. They took FOREVER bringing out the correct omelet. Then when that came she said it was nasty. We spoke to the manager and she then recommended a third dish. My friend said this was better than the Mexican omelet but not the best. So, out of three tries, the amigo breakfast but the best - but it was still mediocre. 

I got the catfish and grits. The grits were plain underneath, no butter, salt or pepper or cheese. The fish was barely seasoned and the sauce on top was not enough. I had to ask for extra to try and her some flavor. When I mentioned to this manager, she said she knew the seasoning was low on the food and that was HER number one complain. MA'AM.. Smh

Lastly, my sister got the meal with three different biscuits and she for hers comped because it wasn't good, either.

All in all, I wouldn't even recommend this place. Hopefully, they make some necessary changes in the future. I have never had a breakfast so bad before. Try anywhere else! I urge you.

When Ruby Slipper came up every single time I asked natives and tourists for recommendations, I made sure that I wouldn't leave New Orleans without paying a visit. Word has clearly gotten around about this place because the lines are tremendously long. If you're not a fan of waiting outside in the summer heat (as I am), PLEASE take the advice of fellow Yelpers - sacrifice just a little bit of space on your smartphone and download the NoWait app, which allows you to remotely hold a place in line from the comfort of your air-conditioned space. My husband and I were in a hotel a block away and just walked out to the restaurant when we were shown as 'fifth in line'. It was incredibly easy and made me wonder why on earth people would choose to wait outside for hours. 

Brunch is the name of the game here and the menu is rife with enough delicious sounding options to make your head spin. After perusing many, many reviews and photos here, I went with the Gulf Fish St. Peter, which featured a pan-seared catch of the day (I believe mine was bass) on top of a cheesy grit cake, with a grilled shrimp skewer, sautéed spinach and cherry tomatoes with a delectable hollandaise sauce to blanket it all. It's a beautifully composed dish and elicited quite a bit of order envy from my husband (who went with the 'Skinny Migas' tex mex egg option and enjoyed it very much, but there's really no competing with my dish). We were both blown away by how fresh the fish was and how beautifully everything on the plate came together and regretted that we could not eat more, as the serving sizes are certainly generous here. 

Service from our waitress was pleasant and friendly and there was no pressure from the wait staff to rush out of our seats, even with the incredible line of hungry folks outside. We enjoyed our meal very much and would highly recommend it to anyone who plans a visit to the Big Easy.

Ruby slippers was delicious. The egg Benedict's were great and the portion sizes were huge. We wanted to try more on our trip to NOLA but we weren't able to. I would definitely like to visit again.

However I do have to say that our server was a little rude. I had an allergic reaction on my lips that burned and I had completely forgotten about it when I ordered orange juice. The acidity of the juice burned my lips a lot so I asked for a straw from the server. She never brought it. When I asked for it again, she had an attitude towards me as if she was judging me for asking for a straw.
Great food, it's reasonably priced but watch the drink prices they sneak up in you, I paid like $20 for milks and kids juices.  The eggs Benedict are amazing

I don't care where you're from or why you'd be up at breakfast (judge free zone here all the way) but get your ass to Ruby Slipper.

First of all they are local. One of the first resturants to open after Katrina. The name comes directly from the spirit of New Orleans. We will not waver, we will get past this and we know this is our Home Sweet Home.  Make no mistake about it, New Orleans gets in your very being and STAYS there. I could wax poetically about my beloved city but this is a restraunt review.

I'm definitely a creature of habit and normally get the eggs Benedict so I ordered their verision which was  the eggs Cochon. Ummm. Hello, breakfast of my life. If you were a man I would probably propose. This is definitely a must have! It's so tender, flaky, spicy all at once. Perfection, y'all. I mean really. I ordered the mixed fruit as a side and again was blown away.  It was sweet and juicy and oh so fresh.

If coffee is your thing (mine really isn't) theirs is on the weak side, but still all in all I highly recommend Ruby Slipper for a great breakfast.place. Just jet your self over there. You are welcome.

Plan ahead with an online reservation to skip the long lines for this fabulous eatery. Bring your appetite and sense of adventure for a culinary treat that will leave you satisfied and planning a return visit. Excellent staff and delicious brunch! One of my favorites in a city that has more than its fair share of great food.

A really cute place for brunch in New Orleans! I liked how it was a typical brunch menu, but with a Cajun/Creole twist - so I felt like I was getting some tastes of New Orleans.

The waitstaff was friendly - while we were waiting to be seated, someone was coming around offering to take our drink orders. Our waitress was honest about the menu, and recommended the St. Charles Benedict instead - fried chicken on eggs benedict (how could you go wrong?!). The chicken was juicy, the biscuit was soft and buttery, and the poached eggs over the top were cooked to perfection.

The only downside was the wait - which I think could be tremendously improved if seating was organized more efficiently and effectively. For example, we were a party of two, seated at a table for six. And there were plenty of outdoor seats and picnic tables, but those weren't being utilized. 

Overall, a great place I'd recommend for breakfast or brunch.
Good food, even better drinks. Awesome waiters and waitresses! Try the bacon infused bloody mary!! Its soooo yummy!!

I was trying to decide where to eat breakfast with so many options available. I started to walk past the Ruby Slipper but had to stop and see what the menu looked like that held such a crowd. Let me tell you there is plenty of options to choose from! The eggs Benedict and pancakes options really caught my interest. I went to in and was seated right away since I was just a table for 1. I sat at the bar and the bartender was so nice and super friendly. I decided to go with the eggs Benedict mix and match. Unfortunately I didn't take a picture of the menu but I had the two most popular choices and it did not disappoint. I was so full after one that I saved the second one. It was delicious and the cost was only about $15.

Phenomenal food. We had to wait for about 15 minutes, I would suggest putting your name on the list so you can get right in. They don't do reservations, but you can call on your way there, or
Use the website...very tasty. The bacon is crispy, the French toast is freaking delicious.  You won't be disappointed!

Absolutely love this place! Came for the first time two years ago and it was the #1 place I recommended to my fam when we came back. This kitchen is a machine! With the amount of volume they do on a Sunday morning for brunch, they still find a way to get food out fast and right! I work in the restaurant industry so I know a powerhouse when I see one. Love the people, the drinks and the food. Plenty of good times.

Food was good. Service was great. Tucker was a great waiter. Food was very filling. I ordered the Pigs in a Blanket omelet with pancakes and potatoes and French Vanilla Iced Coffee. Food was hot and flavorful. Staff was very friendly.

If you love long wait times and RUDE waitresses, BOH staff, and managers, then this is the place for you! We waited entirely too long for our food to come out, with no updates from our aloof waitress. Many people who were seated after us received their food before us. When we asked the manager why this was so, he was very defensive. When our food FINALLY arrived, our orders were messed up... not surprising. Rather than asking them to re-cook my eggs, I simply asked for a side of cheese. One of the BOH staff brought me a side of cheese grits instead and had the audacity to roll his eyes at me because he brought me the wrong thing. I ordered the Basic Breakfast (eggs, choice of meat, biscuit or toast, & grits or potatoes) and the meal was super bland... especially the grits. It's pretty hard to mess up such a simple breakfast but RSC surely did. Don't waste your time here. Did I mention how rude everyone was?? Just an absolutely ridiculous experience!

Ideal für das Katerfrühstück ist dieses Lokal, das sich den Luxus leisten kann, am späten Vormittag schon wieder zuzusperren. Es bilden sich regelmäßig Schlangen. Wenn man einen Platz ergattert hat, dass warten typische Spezialitäten aus der Region, dazu gibt es Kaffee in rauhen Mengen. Der beste Weg, um den Morgen nach der durchgemachten Nacht im French Quarter abzurunden. Das Service ist sehr zuvorkommend, die Größe des Lokals hat einen Lärmpegel zur Folge, der zu große Kopfschmerzen eher noch verstärkt.

Three Little Pigs is seriously the best omelette I've ever eaten. Biscuits were huge and tasted amazing. Everything was fantastic. Servers are very attentive and have impeccable knowledge of the menu. Highly recommend for breakfast/brunch.

Breakfast New Orleans style with friendly service. We tried the Spanish omelet with chorizo and the eggs Benedict with shredded pork -- both were unique breakfast dishes. We left full for the day, totally satisfied and happy!

We came to this place on football sunday.  Wearing my 49ers jersey while sipping on a beer across the street during the wait was fun.  Waiting for 45 minutes was not. 

The GF got a shrimp and grits which I thought was a little fishy.  I got the eggs cochon which were very good.  The eggs perfectly cooked.  

We got $10 mimosas and wow, they were not worth it.  

The food is ok, the prices are high, and the service is polite, but slooow.
The Ruby Slipper on Magazine St is to die for. The bennies are huge and fill of flavor. Our server Julie was awesome and attentive. Will definitely be back and highly recommend.

Food and service was good. There was a promo on yelp for a discounted bloody that they did not honor as they said it was old, which was a bummer. I think this is somewhat of a tourist trap place... because it is very overpriced. Food was good as was the Bloody Mary!

Yummy breakfast! We ordered the Bananas Foster French toast and the Chicken St. Charles. Both were good. The biscuits are delicious! Freddie our waiter was great and if you can request him! The place is lively.

The food was ok. It was super crowded so since we were in town we decided to sign the waiting list & tour the area. Once we got our seats (1hr wait), we still had to wait about 7mins before our server greeted us. The ambiance of the restaurant drew me more than the actual food or service. Our server may hv bn frustrated due to the place being crowded so she wasn't the happiest or the quickest of the bunch. I would recommend going early, maybe the experience would hv bn better.

Wonderful!  We go here every time we're in NOLA, usually more than once.  I love the brandy milk punches and the shrimp and grits.  My husband usually gets a special; always good.  We've been to the Midcity and Downtown locations.  The Downtown is roomier, the Midcity is more down home.  Don't miss this placeM

Ruby Slipper is a solid choice for breakfast and always a stop when in  NOLA. I am usually not a fan of benedicts but this reestuarant made us a believer. My husband got the St. Charles and I got the Peaceemaker-- St. Charles Chicken and Shrimp Bugaloo. It was delicious and should have 5 stars (per my husbands opinion) but there were some minor issues that stopped it from reaching perfection for me. The chicken pieces were a little small, my poached egg was cooked too long and didn't run like it was supposed to and the Shrimp Bugaloo was a bland.

This place is always a solid choice but it was maybe just an off day for me. And pro tip: if you order the Chicken St. Charles, ask if they can put a fried green tomato on it for a true southern experience.

Food was mediocre.  Their pepper jack cheese is shredded without any peppers in it...tastes like American cheese!  Doesn't live up to the hype!  Sat outside at the most uncomfortable table and chairs and literally had a garbage truck in our ear the entire time...not a great ambiance.

45 minute wait for what amounted to average diner style food. Staff was friendly but didn't check on our food quality even once after delivering our meals. Both dishes were cold and unappealing. The atmosphere seems grungy and the whole restaurant looks run down and dirty. Don't bother. Two thumbs down.

Loved this place!  It was highly recommended and it wasn't a let down. The customer service was great. I wasn't sure about the seating as we were squeezed into a long table with strangers but soon we were chatting with everyone close. We would definitely return.

This was our 1st meal in NOLA. It was our Lyft driver's recommendation.  The host was welcoming, friendly and energetic.  I couldn't wait to taste the food. Our waiter, Eric is very knowledgable abt the menu n area. He is an excellent server. I ordered the shrimp online with biscuit, potatoes and biscuit. Everything needs seasoning.  I'm so disappointed...I was expecting food full of flavor n spices.  I didn't finish my food.  My boyfriend had the same omelette with pancakes.  The pancakes was hard, he didn't finish it. The service is great but the food is lacking seasoning.
Government shutdown 2019 this place showed up. Top notch folks over there! Thanks for all you did for everyone in the area affected by the shutdown

Good breakfast places are not hard to find in NOLA. That is because the bad ones go out of business.  A friend of mine reccomended The Ruby Slipper as an alternative to the popular Mother's Restaurant. It met and exceeded my expectations.  From the quaint breakfast ambiance to the very tasty and flavorful food, I was impressed.  I ordered the Pork eggs benedict served on the buttermilk buscuits. My colleague ordered the Bannanas Foster French Toast and Wow did it look good. The service was excellent, friendly and prompt. I will definitely return again.

Decent wait time for a table. I ordered 2 eggs scrambled with crispy bacon (which came not as crispy) a biscuit (which was too thick not as soft for my liking) and fried tomato. Okay breakfast as far as being the specialty for this place. Ruby slipper mimosa was nice. Took forever to get our check and server in the end. Decent experience.

I am in love with this place, I had the migos which is like a mexican style breakfast with scramble eggs, pico de gallo, tortilla chips at the bottom and avocado on the side and I also had the banana foster pain pardu french toast, it was exquisite. If you are ever in NOLA this is a must. 
I would describe it as the ideal brunch plus they have very good signature drinks not just the same old same old mimosa like every other brunch place they have much more than that! Like delicious bloody marys with bacon on top, bellinis, Irish coffee, etc. This place reminded me a lot of Central Perk from friends lol it has that atmosphere and i loved it!!

Alberto is quite simply the best bartender/server in this place. His menu descriptions and attentiveness to the customer's needs are unparalleled. His charisma is refreshing. And his passion for food is contagious. 

Now for the food - the pig candy bacon is delectable. It's just what it's name states: candy. I wish the serving was bigger, because I could've eaten it as a meal itself. 

The salmon avocado toast was not what I expected but absolutely delicious. The skinny migas is a perfect egg scramble that's not too heavy or overwhelming. 

Their iced coffee is fresh, velvety smooth, and perfectly refreshing for a hot summer day. The ruby slipper cocktail is blatantly the best beverage on the menu - a must order for any boozy brunch. 

I know there are multiple locations, but you have to come to this one for Alberto's service alone.
Wowzers! Delicious food, causal atmosphere, very friendly staff. The pecan and praline pancakes will make you weep with happiness. Eggs Benedict were also a winner.  Can't wait to return.
Freddy Freddy Freddy. You want Freddy as your server. Great service. Great food. You won't be disappointed
Server was excellent. Food was just meh. Not bad by any means but not worth the 30 min wait. Ate at a breakfast place close that was much smaller and food was A bit tastier.

My friends and I were on vacation and heard great things about this place. I nervously ordered Chicken Saint Charles, with my egg fried hard, without the sauce and with a side of Breakfast potatoes. The potatoes were ehhh but the Chicken Saint Charles was amazinggggg! I'd go here again if ever in New Orleans and had time to spare.

The wait to be seated was A LOT! In the time that we waited we were all able to buy things at the gift shop and change our flights home (during hurricane season) and there was 10 of us!
The wait to get the food was even worse!!! Damn near passed out before getting it. Because the food was good we didn't complain but it is what made me take a star off.
Ramona was the best! Putting our names on the list through the Yelp app took about 45 minutes off of our wait. Definitely the best breakfast food I've ever had.
Great food just make sure you use yelp to put your name on the list as it gets incredibly crowded.

While visiting NoLa I was told by numerous people to try Ruby Slippers. I was glad I did. The place was packed yet the service was phenomenal and the food was delicious. I ordered an omelette, a side of their candied bacon (de-friggin-licious) and a breakfast margarita. Though the food is amazing, be warned that the wait time can be long (ridiculously long). I used the Yelp wait list and even with that we waited about a good 45 minutes. It could've been due to the timing (this was during Essence Fest) but please know it's worth it. Will definitely be back.

Tourists have made this a destination but it was not worth waiting an hour standing outside on the sidewalk for breakfast. 
It was crowded. The atmosphere was hectic and rushed. Our server was friendly and efficient but he was busy. I actually told him to take a breath. 
Like all the food in New Orleans, it was greasy, sweet and heavy.
Perfect for brunch, they keep the drinks flowing and the food is out of this world, everything is absolutely delicious! They tend to have a bit of a wait so get there early!!

My first food stop in NOLA was at Ruby Slipper Cafe and they definitely did not disappoint! The service was incredible and the food was even better. I pretty much judge all breakfast spots on how good their pancakes are and... WOW. Will definitely go again on my next NOLA visit.
Red velvet pancake had no taste! My potatoes were cold and my date's were hot! My black stone eggs were nothing special!!!
The food at Ruby Slipper Cafe taste pretty much like any other chain restaurant.  It is not a must try type of food unless you enjoy mediocre food.

Pancakes tasted like flour; eggs with cheddar blah; corned beef hash had too much potatoes, not enough beef or flavor.  My husband ordered the catfish plate.  He said, "it's okay".  

Ummm...this stop was a dud.  I'm from NJ and our diner style breakfasts is go hard or go home type.  The cook must have gone home @ this spot.

service was great though and the sangria was awesome.

I was sure to have a great food experience based on the Yelp reviews - WRONG!  My friends told me to go to Mothers, but the reviews weren't great.  So, I am on my way there this AM.  Screw this...

I normally just read reviews and never leave them but this place is phenomenal. As in, we had different breakfast plans for tomorrow but now, we're coming right back here to eat the exact same things. It was that good. We split the bananas foster pain perdue, the breakfast potatoes, fruit, and a biscuit. The hostess and our waiter were super friendly and there was no wait at just before 9am on a Tuesday morning. Definitely recommend.

Other yelpers had this place right.  With limited quality breakfast / lunch options near the convention center, this was a great find.  Menu has both some creativity, but also the standards you'd expect.  About 10 beans a person for good breakfast and a cup of Joe.
Dear God the Benedicts. Not much to say about this place- it's just great. We loved the Cochon benny and the chicken benny the most. The Mimosas were spot on as well. Put your name in ahead of time!

The boozy ice coffee is boozy in a good way.  It comes with crushed cocoa beans on top.  
Our waiter Freddie was attentive and cheerful. He noted our food allergies.  
Since I can't have gluten he substituted fresh fruit for the biscuit.  
Their biscuits are huge and according to my friend delicious.

Great breakfast spot!  Candied bacon was great, mimosas were good, service was prompt and friendly.  Im 280lbs 5'10" and couldnt finish my plate so show up hungry and be prepared to leave in a mild food coma.  If you intend to walk the city after you'll probably wanna split a meal with someone.

Absolutely incredible! I got the fried chicken eggs Benedict and wow... some of the best hollandaise I've ever had. They use biscuits around here vs an English muffin so it fells apart a little more but still delicious. I went on a Tuesday morning during the off season so there wasn't a wait but I could easily see there being one.

I'll keep this short and sweet...

Servers/service was great
Food was best meal while visiting NOLA

It's ways busy so expect to wait about 30-45 min but WELL WORTH IT!

The wait was a little long, but we just did the online wait list and had to wait 20 more minutes when we got there. But it was worth it!! I had an Irish coffee and the bam bam biscuit. The food and coffee were sooooo good. Especially the candy bacon!

Heard so many awesome things about this breakfast spot. I must say it definitely exceeded my expectations. So happy I didn't pass it by. Lately I love eggs Benedict and here you can mix and match. I applaud you for not only your selections but for how amazing my dish was. I believe it was corn beef and pulled pork which are two dishes I have never liked. But I loved every bit of it.
Great food and service. Went twice during my Labor Day weekend vacation and i will be going back when I'm in town

The food and service is amazing!  We were in town for 8 days and ate here three times. Great breakfast with huge homemade biscuits. Make sure you get on the wait list on Yelp before you head to the restaurant. That helps with the wait...but the food is definitely worth the wait. We will go back every time we go to New Orleans.
We went here because my son seen it on a tv show. Did not disappoint. The food was amazing and service was fabulous!

The bacon Bloody Mary is what I came for but the food is why I'll be back! Very creative menu. And the food is so flavorful. This place was packed but they have an app that notifies you when your table is ready. So explore New Orleans or sit and enjoy the delicious bacon Bloody Mary... Either way you won't be disappointed and this place is worth the wait!!

We went to the Ruby Slipper for breakfast and I can't say enough about the experience. The wait to get in was short(assuming you get in line on yelp) and pleasant. Drinks were served outside to waiting diners. Once seated the atmosphere and meal were excellent. The variety of egg Benedict selections was incredible. I had the trio of top choices and found them all excellent. Don't miss this place!
Absolutely love having brunch here! The breakfast is phenomenal and the service is great. Always hot and ready and leaving you wanting more !!

Buttermilk Pancake & Chicken St. Charles with scrambled eggs. The pancake was deliciously light and fluffy. If they warmed the syrup like IHOP, it would've been even better. I loved the Chicken St. Charles, especially the chicken. It's made with poached eggs and has a Tasso bacon cream sauce over the top, but I opted out on both. Besides the Sunday brunch wait to sit down, I have no complaints.

Very friendly staff, quick wait time with text message service, average food. It was delicious but nothin special. Our waiter was very attentive though and free refills for my lemonade! The sides portions were rather small, the smoked salmon is just cooked salmon on the avocado toast, the benedicts I will say looked pretty tasty and the croque madame was tasty too.
Simple food done right. The portions are hefty and the drinks are filled to the rim. Although a bit louder than many prefer, it's tolerable due to the food
Delicious!  Service was a little slow but they were super busy.  The drinks were great and the server was polite and very helpful.  Definitely recommend!  Long lines though!
Everything was delicious!! Can't wait to visit again. Iced coffee is waaaay better than Cafe du Monde.

We randomly found this restaurant and there was a line in front of the door so we assumed it's a good restaurant, but it was just ok. nothing especial about their food. there were lots of coffee ground in my not warm enough coffee and when I asked for refill, I asked for new mug. the new coffee was a little bit warmer but again lots of coffee ground in it.
Madame sandwich was ok and the Cochon Benedict served cold in a dirty dish. I didn't find it as exciting as many other places that you can eat in NOLA.

Party of 6 in the house!

Please take advantage of the waitlist option on yelp so that you won't have to wait 7 years (exaggerating) in line. You'll get a chance to see where you are in line and everything on the app! 

Moving on.. The price was very reasonable and you got a lot of it. If you're hungry this is the place for you. Our waitress, Jai, was super nice. It didn't take long for us to get our food and it came out hot. You know how normal brunches you get a bite size food, no ma'am no sir, you get a lot of bang for your buck. 
My recommendation is to order whatever it is you love!  But be open minded and try something different, I promise you everything is delicious! 

I would most definitely recommend anyone to The Ruby Slipper Cafe.

What a great breakfast ! I had the Migas breakfast and it was sooooo good ! We walked in on a rainy gloomy New Orleans morning and this breakfast really brightened my morning! There is a wide and diverse selection of yummy food for just about anyone's palate. Also don't let me forget to mention i had a Brandy milk punch instead of my usual coffee and it was so good! Give this place a try !
Freddie was awesome and food was great!!! My friends and I all loved the atmosphere and had a great time.

Excellent service and the eggs Cochon is AMAZING AMAZING AMAZING. And the coffee black and perfect. Will try this place again. Sat at the bar as I was party of one but it was great to watch folks and the bartender. Lots of regulars come in here
Long wait but worth it. Excellent service by Field Rose.  We were group of 11 and all enjoyed the food.

This is (to me, at least), the best breakfast place in NO.  Breakfast is great, huge portions, completely home made, and delicious.

As far as I can tell - you can't go wrong here - service was spot-on, food was phenomenal.

We'll be going back again!
I loved this little breakfast spot!! The French toast was delicious and the service was quick. The best part is that it's super affordable. I highly recommend this restaurant.

Had breakfast at the Ruby Slipper Cafe on two occasions during our recent trip. First breakfast was just my wife and I. We put our name in and almost immediately we're greeted outside by a staff member asking if we would like to order a drink. Well yes I do. Coffee was a necessity at this point and it arrived moments later in a blazingly hot fashion. We were seated a few minutes later at the bar. Several staff members checked on us throughout our ordering process and meal. Water and coffee were refilled prior to requesting. I ordered the whites chocolate bread pudding pancakes while my wife ordered the bananas foster pain perdu. Both were fantastic. I requested an insulin shot however they were not accommodating.  Our second trip to the Ruby Slipper was as a group.  Mimosas were ordered and a variety of breakfast food items.  I went with the St Charles breakfast.  It was fabulous. Our experiences were very good.  The only potential drawback for some patrons may be the volume in the restaurant.  It can be loud and would not be good for lots of conversation.
Freddie H. was awesome! He was very knowledgeable of great menu options. He was also quick on his feet. We asked for things and he was right behind us with it! This place is a must visit!!

really crowded. i mean really, really crowded. particularly on weekends. but great food, particularly the migas, and the staff is relentlessly friendly. I'm  not sure i could be that friendly if i was working that hard.

This is the second morning in a row I have ventured out to this establishment. I love the open air and vibe! Wait staff is very friendly and accommodating. I am gluten-free and they offered two servings of fruit instead of the gluten options! Omelettes are really good. Will be back again!

Visiting and heard GREAT things about this place from the locals. Liz and Jerry know how to show some love. The food is AMAZING...we had The Trifecta,  pancake duo, Spanish omelet, brioche french toast with some Ruby Mimosas.  Mercy, Lawd. It was all good.

Ruby Slipper is a must for brunch. Although the wait is always long, it's worth it. Everything is divine. We always prefer the french toast and the pancakes. I tried the cheesecake stuffed blueberry topped french toast this time and it was good. Their latte is also very good.

Always a great stop when we first get to town.   Coffee is the best around.  This time we ordered more to sample.  Everyone recommended the St Charles Chicken Bennie.  We found the chicken a little dry but the flavor profile was amazing.  My favorite was the 1 tomato 2tomato.  Coffee and mimosa was always a NOLa winner.

Pro tip: Join the waitlist and walk around prior to your check in time. It's so worth it. Service was awesome and the food was great!! Everyone in my party enjoyed their meals. I have a new brunch spot in NOLA.

The best breakfast in New Orleans, period. I am an eggs Benedict fiend and this place specializes in creating a breakfast masterpiece. 

I ordered the salmon an my boyfriend ordered the Cochon eggs Benedict. He's not as taken in with Benedict's in general but even this dish had him standing on his head with praise. Both entrees had a generous portion of protein. My boyfriend's  plate was covered in pulled pork. You definitely get your money's worth here which is another reason why this place deserves 5 stars. You can pay more for breakfast in NOLA but why when you can have an awesome meal here!

The best French toast I ever had... Was here. Not a huge portion, so you can enjoy your eggs and have room for this deliciousness. 

Only downside - you will be waiting to eat! So get yourself a mimosa for that line!

Great restaurant. It is always packed, so I would suggest putting your name on the waitlist, rather than arriving and waiting there because you'll have to wait outside. I got the pulled pork Cochon Benedict & it was fairly good, but the pork was lacking some flavor so I just added hot sauce & it made it much better. The Irish cream coffee was delicious though!

Don't miss out on one of Nola's top brunch spots!  The Benedict 2 ways - "peacemaker" is amazing.  We did it with the friend chicken and codon style and it was amazing.  The bloody was really good but a bit pricey.  Will return when I make it back down south!
Freddie was awesome as our server. Spent brunch at the ruby slipper celebrating my daughters 21st Birthday. Thanks Freddie.
You can't miss the biscuits with maple butter! The drinks and plates are all delicious. The wait can be a little long so make sure the pit yourself on the yelp waitlist

Used the waitlists app worked like a charm good coffee nice eggs grits good bacon outstanding fun well run machine have gone there 4 times found a little inconsistency in prep like eggs being too done one tomato instead of 2 2 slices of bacon 1 day 3 the next 2 1/2 the next but must have been a shift change all in all good food and great service great price will return
Amazing breakfast, huge portions and very friendly and kind staff! There are so many options and the food is wonderful! A must try!
Food was good. Service too. Line gets CRAZY long so come early! Be flexible withxseating preferences & bring your appetite!!

This place was amazing! You have to do the eggs benedicts (they will let you mix and match styles!) Devin was our waiter and he was fantastic! Funny, attentive and extremely knowledgeable. Will make this our go to breakfast stop in New Orleans for now on!

If I could give this place 10 stars I would!!!! Ate here every morning while on vacation and never had the same thing twice and everything was DELICIOUS!!!! SERVICE IS AMAZING!! You may want to get on the wait lits about 10-15 mins before you get there (or long on the weekend. Lines can be an hour long). But definitely worth the wait!! Can't wait to visit again!
This has to be one of the best breakfast places I have enjoyed!  The biscuit was awesome! 3 pig omelet, awesome! And our server, Freddy, was awesome!! Super recommend the experience!

This is the best restaurant ever in town! Being from Lake Charles, LA and going through a rough Hurricane I'm very honored to find amazing food and spend many bucks at this place oh my gosh food is phenomenal, staff is awesome, and the experience of a REAL NEW ORLEANS STYLE MEAL IS THE BEST PART!! I LOVE YOU RUBY SLIPPER CAFE!!

The food was great but the bloody mary was not the best. 

All my girlfriends ordered different types of benedicts and they said they were all good but the serving sizes were a little smaller than they were expecting. I ordered the french toast sticks + side of bacon. My side of bacon was only 2 pieces which was disappointing since bacon is my favorite thing. 

I'd go back but wouldn't want to wait in a huge line to eat here again.
Freddie was the bomb and so was the food! Great service and atmosphere! Would definitely come back!

Freddie was the man! Great guy and funny too. The food was great as well. Biscuits were huge. Shrimp boogaloo and eggs Cochon has a great sauce. Food 4/5. Service 6/5 props to Freddie!!! Bathroom 5/5. So overall 5/5.

We were in heaven! Of course, we yelped before arriving in New Orleans, but there are so many good places to choose from. This was recommended by our uber driver and conveniently located across from our air bnb. There are many restaurant locations around the city. It can get popular so make sure to come early or use the wait feature on yelp.

Our waitress was super friendly and attentive for how busy it was when it first opened on a Friday. She quickly brought us drinks. If you are a coffee drinker, try a strong coffee.

Now onto the food... my boyfriend got the peacemaker. You get to choose two different Benedict's if you can't decide on one. Both the Shrimp Boogaloo and Chicken St. Charles were fresh, savory, and well flavored. The Bananas Foster Pain Perdu hit the spot. If you love banana foster, this is the treat for you. It reminded me of French toast with banana foster and raisins. Sooo good. My only complaint is I wish it had more bananas with the amount of bread.

This is a must hit breakfast spot! We will return on our next trip!

The best breakfast and breakfast cocktails. Really long line but we were willing to sit outside at a very small table with skinny high chairs. The coffee was delicious. The menu was very diverse. Next time in New Orleans, I will definitely go back.

Great restaurant! I sat at the bar for breakfast and the servers were delightful. I only had to wait for about ten minutes for a spot - I would wait an hour for food here though! The eggs Benedict were, quite literally, the best I've ever had. Seriously - if you have a chance to go here for breakfast or brunch, do it!
Simple food done right. The portions are hefty and the drinks are filled to the rim. Although a bit louder than many prefer, it's tolerable due to the food.

I recommend getting the eggs Benedict here. Our server suggested it as one of the most popular items and it was definitely tasty! I choose the hot smoked salmon Benny. One of my dining companions got the fried chicken and the pulled pork Benedict combo and it looked delicious too.  A few others had omelets and said they were also very good. Food here was a little on the expensive side for breakfast but the portions were large. Expect there to be a wait to get in, but at Least you can get coffee ($3) While you wait!

Freddy, our waiter was great! He anticipated our needs and was very quick to help. I asked for minor adaptations to my meal and they we very quick to accommodate. It is noisy but the vibrant atmosphere is worth it. I absolutely love the meaning behind the name- There's no place like home.

Joined the waitlist on our walk there and got seated right away. The staff was friendly and the food was great! I had the southern breakfast and it was fresh, hot and delicious. My husband got an omelette and said it was the best he's ever had. The ruby red mimosas were so good. Highly recommend
Good brunch, and great coffee. Only reason for 4 stars is that the poached eggs were over cooked/not runny for the Benedict and an omelet we had was slightly undercooked. Service was great though!
Great breakfast! Skinny Florentine was incredible, a great breakfast choice! Wait staff was super friendly!

The wait is long. I didnt know that you could join the waitlist,Great idea to join Prior to your arrival. The ladies outside were a great help and very happy it seemed.They do offer drinks outside if you like while you wait. It took forever for anyone to take out order once inside. People that came in after us was able to order before us. I feel like our waiter Jared wasnt interested in working or just serving us. The food was good. The grits I've had better.He didn't come to check on us after our food came out. We tried to pay and he also seemed like he wasn't interested. For that sevice idk if I would return.

I visited the cafe with two girlfriends on vacation during the afternoon and made a call ahead "reservation" that we missed. We arrived and as busy as they were the hostess greeted us with a smile and was able to accommodate. We were greeted promptly by our server who was quick and knowledgeable. She guided us through the menu and made some recommendations we took. We order some of the Benedict's and i believe my friend ordered one of the omelets. Everything tasted amazing. The biscuits are to DIE for! Highly recommend the option for choosing two Benedict's of your choice to try out a little bit of everything. As we waited for our food we were entertained by the structure and decor of the restaurant which was very nice. Thank you Ruby Slipper cafe for the experience!

Ruby Slipper is delicious! We were there two mornings in a row for breakfast. With it being such a busy place we got seated very quickly. The food was great and our server Freddie was awesome! Our drinks were never empty and he checked on us to make sure everything was good, and to see if we needed anything else frequently. A must for breakfast!

Delicious, filling, and with friendly staff. What more could you want at breakfast? Oh yeah, fresh squeezed OJ!

Oh, and thanks RSC for not mocking or scolding my dislike of hollandaise. Got it on the side,  and yep,  I still don't like it,  but I appreciated the lack of judgment.

Great great place!!! Very busy and you will have to wait! Put your name on the list via yelp to help expediate the process! The food is so so good though!!! We sat at the bar  both days we went. The drinks are great too! I got a peach Bellini...very good and refreshing! We did the "peacemaker" the first  time. It's one of each of the Benedict's if you're choice. Great idea! The second time we did the trifecta where we did 3 different Benedict's! So so good!!!! You will love it!
Always amazing! St Charles chicken is fabulous! Every thing on the menu is delicious!

Blessed are the peace makers, for they shall inherit the earth... the last time we were in town I ordered the Benedict  "peace maker"... this is where you can pick 2 different Bennies from a creative selection of innovative eggs Benedict's.  There was never a doubt that we wou go back to Ruby slippers during this trip because it is THAT GOOD in a sea of other fantastic brunch spots Ruby slipper stands out. Before we were seated I had my self confidence that I would order something different this time, Maybe i felt like it was my civic duty as a person who yelps. But in the and selfishness set in and I found myself back to ordering the same thing as last time. Peacemaker! The house cooked smoked salmon is meaty and tender, with crispy capers, the ideal poached egg and just the right amount of hollandaise sauce. I recall that it is a very rich dish so I would  balance it out with  the fried chicken bennie.  A few dashes of self imposed hot sauce and I was all set. In the end, I wanted to try something else
 but again, I was Not disappointed woth my cave. In-fact, I believe that my over all experience at Ruby Slipper might just make me a better person over all. I left feeling upbeat and more positive about the human race.  It could be the simple things in life- a delicious meal, lively, friendly, diligent service from all the servers especially Brandy or from the friends we made in the rest room and at neighboring tables. My experience was warmth all around in-spite of the snow. (Yes snow) I am grateful. Maybe next try one of the epic dishes  I witnessed being served to my husband and neighbors... maybe but I can not promise.

I love all Ruby Slipper Cafes. Always get an entrees with a biscuit, they are about as big as my face and have a great texture. The downfall of this location (and the reason for the knock on stars) is due to the cleanliness. I get that this is one of the busiest locations, but we got seated at the bar and it was not cleaned before we were seated... then when I asked if we could have it wiped, they used a napkin to just brush it off. Nevertheless, I still enjoyed my breakfast (especially the biscuit and cinnamon butter), and my husband loved his Benedict taster. I will continue to go to the uptown locations.

Super delicious. Definitely worth the wait. The food is excellent and the prices aren't bad. The mimosa was one best I have ever had. I recommend putting yourself on the waitlist to shorten the wait. Freddie was our waiter and he was great, super attentive, helpful and funny.

I've been to several Ruby Slipper cafes throughout New Orleans and have always had a great meal. Went to this one the day before new year's eve and had a blast, as usual. I can't remember her name, but my server was very personable and made sure the me and my family enjoyed our meal.
Awesome place for brunch. Unique options. Delicious. Reasonably priced. Freddie H is an awesome server.  Thanks.
My favorite breakfast place of all time. Best Bloody Mary. Eggs Cochon is to die for. Once had a pork belly benedict special. If I have any complaint is that  I wish the pork belly was on the menu.

We went here strictly from the yelp reviews. 

I got the eggs Benedict Combonation called the peacemaker and I my wife got the chicken salad sandwich. 

Both were pretty good. I think because we came towards when they close, the food was not as good. Still, the food tasted great for me and what made it a four-star visit was the service. 

Our server was on it and have a great recommendations. 

I really want to go back in the middle of the morning and try it again.

Delicious biscuits with the best butter!!!!! Everything we had was pretty good- a little on the high side for pricing- my drink was more expensive than my meal, but I did get a buzz off it!!! I'd go again

Food was decent. I think it might have been better if the food was actually hot and didn't seem to be sitting out. The wait wasn't as long as they told us which was great. Our waiter was great and everything came out pretty quick. The only downfall as I mentioned was the food wasn't hot.
Had the Chicken St. Charles with mimosas...so good & So hits the spot.  Had to split, was too much food

This place is definitely worth trying.  I loved my salmon omelette and Irish hot chocolate.  The atmosphere gives off a really great vibe.  The service was just okay.  Maybe because it's mardi gras time, everyone is uptight around here in NOLA. Will definitely return.

Only 4 stars because the host and server were a little too rushed. I understand that they close early in the day but making customers feel like they need to order, eat and leave in under 15 mins was a but much given that this is a popular restaurant for visitors. The banana foster could have been warmer but it was indeed delicious. I wasn't a fan of the $2 per egg pricing, but I ordered two scrambled to go along with the bacon that was included with the French toast. We only had a 15 to 20-minute wait, which was good given the time we arrived. After our name was taken the wait time went to 30-40 mins for guests. I'm happy I was able to enjoy the food that so many people have raved about and it lived up to my expectations.

Waltzed in here having no idea what this place was while on a weekend getaway from Texas. Honestly, it reminds me of an Egg & I on steroids, very new Houston diner vibe, not so much like the old Austin diners I'm used to.

Didn't wait more than 10 minutes on a Saturday morning for a party of two which is apparently great!

Food was on the better side of average, I had shrimp and grits, my partner had an omelette. Everything was going great until she got food poisoning shortly thereafter and we spent the rest of the trip hoping she didn't die. We didn't eat (or drink) anywhere else that day so I really think it was the eggs here that did it.

Giving 3 stars because the food wasn't expensive and didn't kill her!

I join the wait list for a party of 6, it said to checkin at 1035am. When we arrived she said with ill be another 20mins. At the twenty minute mark they offerred us a table outside or we could wait on one inside. We opted to wait for one inside. We finally got seated around 11:15am. 

I order the BBQ shrimp and grits and upgraded the meal to get a pancake instead on a biscuit. The shrimp and grits was bland and the pancake was to doughy for my liking. I also had a peach Bellini, which was excellent. 

I gave 3 stars because the staff is nice and patient. Other people in the party like their food.

This is my favorite brunch spot in all of New Orleans, and there are so many options. The menu is perfectly curated with a little bit of everything. Anytime we visit, we make sure to stop at the Ruby Slipper.

AMAZING. Nursing a particularly vicious NOLA hangover, we decided to find a breakfast spot in walking distance of our airbnb. This place will change your life. Candied bacon. Spiked iced coffee. A million kinds of eggs benedict. I would fly back down just for the bacon and fried chicken bene.

This is horrible Heather!!! DO NOT order from here... PERIOD

Waited an hour for our food and received the wrong order, plus the food was cold as hell!!! Called Heather and her only answer was "Take it up with Uber Eats"!!!!
