Well, Heather never worry about us ordering from you!!!! THEY ARE SCAMMING CUSTOMERS... BEWARE

Very busy. 
Highly suggest placing yourself on the waitlist via their website 30+ minutes before you want to eat. 

You are able to order drinks on the sidewalk while you wait, which is cool. 

The entire staff were very friendly.  

Food looks great, especially the Benedicts but it was not the best we've had. But definitely the prettiest lol. 

Overall, I'd go back and try something else. To be that busy the food has got to be good

I was so disappointed with the expectations of the hype on this restaurant.  Almost a 2 hour wait. Then, our waitress Jada had an insensitive attitude. The corn beef hash was dehydrated. Her excuse was people like it like this..Girl please! It's been sitting to long or over cooked. Food was cold! Just not happy.

The place stays busy, I used Yelp to check in while driving into town - highly
recommended. I had banana foster - though heavy and sweet....it was delicious. Wife got chicken St Charles - loved it. Service was great. Fun, busy place. Good stuff!
Amazing eggs Benedict's. Get the peacemaker. Pig candy isn't worth it...too sweet and made with white sugar

The wait for this place was crazy! We used waitlist to reserve our spot and it was completely worth the wait! I had the salmon avocado toast with the vanilla spice latte. It was so delicious! I would absolutely recommend this place to anyone looking for a good spot to grab breakfast!

This is a must try breakfast spot while visiting New Orleans. Go early and get on the waiting list  if you're with a large group! Food is delicious - try as many of the Benedict's as you can & the Bloody Mary (pickled green beans included )! Service was very good and attentive, especially with the restaurant being as busy as they are. Will be back!

Went there for brunch
Very busy place, we put our names on the waiting list online, and went there on time, but we still had to wait for one more hour.
Food was good, i had smoked salmon bennie and we shared BBQ chrimp and grits, that was rich, probably could share, our server Justin did great, and did do his best to take care of us.
My go to spot for brunch on a weekend. Very well priced, check in before going as lines can be over an hour long

We waited for an inside table for about 30 minutes. Our waiter was extremely helpful and courteous. He offered suggestions of what to try. The food was definitely worth the wait. Catch of the day St. Pete style was out of this world and you better have a big appetite for the sampler!  The bacon infused Bloody Mary was great and good NOLA coffee! Definitely stop by if you get the chance!!

This place was across from out hotel so we ate here twice.  Both times we sat at the bar.  Both times I had a sandwich for breakfast.  

The rubin = amazing 
The chicken sandwich = meh - the piece of fried chicken could have been bigger.  

The place gets mobbed so go early.

This location of the cafe is right by lots of big hotels, so in the morning it was pretty busy. Your whole party has to be there in order to be seated, but you can add yourself to the waitlist on Yelp. I only had to wait for my friend to arrive to get seated at the counter, and it was definitely worth the wait! I love that in the eggs Benedict menu there's an option to mix and match so you can try two of the awesome flavor combos. I did the shrimp and the chicken versions and loved both. Also, the biscuits!! If I had more time in the city, I would have gone back.
How can you come to New Orleans and not eat here. Omg soooo good! We actually ate at two different ones. Both of them very good. They were packed but the service was very friendly and fast!!
Great staff, great food... staff was helpful, friendly and the food was all amazing. The selection is perfect... we loved it and will definitely make it a come back place when visiting New Orleans

So damn good! We came to Ruby Slipper twice in three days! Service was great, especially on our first visit. The waitress overheard my daughter saying she wanted some strawberries and we were telling her we were going to walk to the supermarket to buy her some so she brought her over a dozen strawberries in a to go container! The food is amazing as well. Everything we had was delicious. If we head back fo New Orleans we will definitely be having breakfast here again.
Awesome breakfast in NOLA!!!!!  Big portions and good drinks. You have to make reservations unless you mind waiting 20-30 min
The lines are long so go early but so worth it to check-in early put your name on the list! The breakfast is delicious unique  and filling!

O M G.... this place was AMAZING!  The wait was quite long but well worth it.  They do have a cocktail waitress that walks around and takes drink orders while you wait....I strongly recommend the bloody mary with bacon infused vodka. My boyfriend had the Trifecta... was delicious and the chicken was the best I ever had, he thought the pork was the best he had ever had.  I had the salmon and goat cheese omelette which was delicious however looking back I wish I would have ordered something more New Orleansy.  Waitstaff, bartenders and hostesses were all fabulous and upbeat

Just an awesome F'n place!

Right next door to the Pelham where we stayed. Each morning I bought a latte. The lattes are great and the customer service for to go orders is great!. By the time La Diabla was up & ready, there was a line.  

When we returned to stay at the Best Western across the street after our cruise, we made it a point to eat there 2 mornings in a row. The Eggs Cochon are mind-blowing. La Diabla loved the grits with her meal. I had the Eggs Cochon the 2nd morning and La Diabla loved the french toast!

A great atmosphere. I talked to some of the line cooks 1 afternoon, they love their job! They say that they are treated so well.

Don't let the line scare you away, the food and service are outstanding! They make a mean bloody Mary also!

This place is always busy and we only waited about 10 minutes! Arrived around 1:20, sat around 1:30. Food was amazing, got the Blackstone. Mimosa was huge and fresh. Service was also great, laid back. This place has a lot of hype for a reason!
Great food great service .. had to wait on tables but service was organized .. biscuits are the bomb .. everything was great food and service rocked . A must for when visiting

I have to give this place a two-star review, although my experience was probably atypical and may not be an issue for other folks. I checked in at the hostess stand when we got here. The hostess was friendly enough and efficient. There was another employee at the stand, a man, who proceeded to make fun of the way I pronounce my own name, not realizing, I assume, that I was still standing close enough to hear. I'm sure I sound funny to folks who are from this area, but it was rude. We elected to stay anyway, as we were on a tight schedule. The hostess also took my phone number to text me when our table was ready, but then just yelled my name when the time came, so it seemed like I shared my info for no reason. Our server was friendly and attentive, and the food was good. However, watching someone make fun of me soured my experience here all around.

I came here for breakfast during my visit to New Orleans. The place was very clean and quiet, with nice colors and decor, and conveniently close to my hotel, which was about 1 block from the French Quarter in the central business district. My waiter was very friendly and helpful. I ordered the bananas Foster French toast (see picture) and, sadly, it looked much better than it tasted. I'm definitely a dessert person, I definitely have a sweet tooth, but this dish was too sweet for me. I'd been looking forward to it after reading about it online, but it was disappointing. I might try Ruby Slipper again for breakfast if I were staying nearby, but I wouldn't order that dish.

My friends and I came here for brunch and all agree that it was the best meal we had our entire trip! It may be a bit touristy but the food was amazing, the location close to the hotel, and the service fantastic. I would absolutely recommend it to a friend! The biscuits were especially good. They were true butter biscuits -- you didn't need to add anything to them!

This was my last meal in New Orleans.  I wasn't sure what to expect, but it looked busy and I figured that was a good sign.  We were told the wait would be 15 minutes,  it actually were seated in about 5 minutes.  

I had never even heard of fried chicken eggs Benedict.  I love traditional eggs Benedict, but wasn't sure this would be for me.  Let me tell you, it absolutely was!  The chicken was cooked perfect, the biscuit was delicious, and the sauce was flavorful and amazing.  I also tried the candied pig bacon.  If you like the mixture of sweet and savory, this is definitely and must try.  

The service was excellent, and quick considering how busy the place was.  I wish I had discovered this restaurant earlier in the trip so I could have returned to try other items.

I was so happy that I looked this restaurant up and saw there was a wait list to be added to. When my group arrived at our designated time the wait was over a hour. I really enjoyed how the waitress walked around and asked for drink orders. After eating the food I could
understand why people were waiting. It was absolutely delicious. I ordered the pecan pie stuffed French toast and OMG. I could have definitely split it with someone. I couldn't finish it all and the ice coffee was also very delicious. This is a must eat at place if you are in New Orleans but make sure you call ahead or get on the wait list through Yelp.

I had a Croque Madame while I was here, as well as a mimosa - and both were excellent. The wait was a little long, but service was friendly and quick. My one main complaint (which, frankly, was true of most New Orleans restaurants that we frequented) was the flies buzzing around our table as we ate.

Otherwise, would recommend for excellent breakfast food, but perhaps not anything particularly NOLA-specific.
Not going to lie, The chicken St. Charles May look like a sloppy mess,  but oh my gawd! If you are especially hung over and looking for a good UberEats meal from here I would suggest this!
I was not blown away.  The waitlist option on Yelp was a plus!  The food was okay, but it took over an hour to get our food after we ordered it.  Nothing to rave about.
Honestly just go here this place is the bomb. Com highly recommend it best breakfast joint in Louisiana

This place wasp so good that my fiancé and I went twice! The first time we for the shrimp and grits (not the best because it was really loose and soupy--don't do it!) and the stuffed French toast (good but needed more meat!). 

The second time we both got the friend chicken and pork Tasso Benedict--- BEST DECISION EVER! Definitely get the Peacemaker and mix-and-match your Benedict! You will not regret! 

Pro Tip: Check in on on the waiting list via Yelp to save you some time! My fiancé and I did this and helped us get in quicker. Wait times can be 30-60 minutes.

Also, make sure you get the mimosa!!! It is not the little glass of mimosa we are used to. It is well worth the money.

Took a walk here from the Cambria for breakfast on my own one morning.  As one person, you get in much quicker...I showed up and was seated in 5 minutes at the counter, which was awesome, bc I can chat it up with other strangers in from out of town, which I did.  I got the Banana Foster Au Pain, I believe.  It was AMAZING!!  So good.  It was a ton of food--I cannot eat that much, but everything i managed to put in my mouth was delish!  I would definitely come here again if back in NOLA.

My first breakfast in NOLA and it was excellent.  The place was packed but I didn't have to wait long. I'm traveling alone so it was fairly easy to get a place at the counter.  EVERY ONE that works there was super friendly and the service was outstanding.  I had the Eggs Blackstone with grits, which is a house special.  Poached eggs with a special hollandaise sauce, bacon and tomato on a crisp buttermilk bisquit. The eggs were a little more done than I like but the flavors were excellent. I would definitely recommend this place.

Wow. What a place.  We came here after seeing reviews online rom our hotel and they did not disappoint. The wait was about 20 minutes so not too bad! My table ordered the catfish and fried grit cakes dish, bbq shrimp and grits and catfish and grits. The biscuits are AMAZING. It's like eating a cloud. Our server was fantastic!!! Alberto made our first experience here a memorable one and I can't wait to come back!! 

We also had 2 bloody Mary's and a local beer. All delicious.

PS. Use the waitlist app on yelp to secure your place in line! It helped us out a ton!
Still amazing coffee every single time. Food is delicious. I love this place. Packed around 9am so be prepared wait for breakfast.

Almost no wait, and the most friendly staff I've encountered in any NOLA spot. Some of the best restaurant poached eggs I have ever had, my wife also highly enjoyed her pancake trio.  Excellent place to stop and get great food.

Super delicious food! Amazing atmosphere and great waitress and service. Great way to start the day. This was my first place after arriving for the first time in New Orleans.    eggs Benedict (pick 2) it was for me plus Ruby Mimosa!
If you are looking for Breakfast or Brunch in the French Quarter, look no further! They have you covered on drinks and food! Its a blessing to your taste buds! Trust me!

There is a long wait, make sure to check in on yelp to be added on the waitlist to save time. We got seated instantly since the bar was available. 

Corned Beef Benedict: This was SO GOOD!!! Let's start with the biscuits. I don't normally like biscuits, but this place made the biscuits so moist and soft. It was the best combination with the egg yolk and the hollandaise sauce. The corned beef was made fresh. The overall combination could not have been any better. 

3 Little Pigs Omelet: The eggs and meats were cooked to the perfect texture. It was good!

I must recommend the benedicts. It was just so delicious and so well put together with all the ingredients. I'm excited to go back to try out the other benedicts. 

Friendly staff!! Would definitely recommend coming here and worth waiting in line for!

We were staying at the Marriott nearby and we ate here 4 out of the 5 days we were here. Our favorite was the chicken eggs Benedict. I liked the fact that you could mix and match the benedicts. Yummy food!

Went to the Decatur location. Holy breakfast! What a wonderful place to start the day. Good coffee, friendly staff, and the biscuits. Oh good lord the biscuits. Fluffy, buttery goodness topped with their cane butter...heaven. Fried green tomato? Buttery grits? Oh yeah. Delish.

Great breakfast! Our waitress gave us a tip on one of the breakfast plates that I could replace the biscuit for one if those yummy pancakes for an upcharge which I did! So glad she told me that. Best of both worlds! Definitely recommend. I used yelp to put my name on the list which worked beautifully.
Jerry displayed excellent customer service. During our time at Ruby slippers we had a couple of accidents and Jerry was right there to assist.

Fantastic!!! I was going to check in for breakfast but the app said no wait time at 8a on a Saturday. I walk up and it was packed with a 15min wait. I went up to the hostess and told her it was just for me. She said to hang tight and as soon as a spot at the bar opens she'll get me seated. She didn't ask for a name like she did with the other parties. Ok, no worries, i had enough time until my tour...30mins later I ask her if I can nab the open seat at the bar (I had seen multiple parties being seated at the bar and elsewhere that showed up after me). The hostess says "there is no open seating- you have to get on the list." I told her it was just me and you could see the lightbulb click-she had forgotten about me. I get it- they were busy and it happens, but it was frustrating because I now couldn't take my time eating.

I sat in a spot covered in syrup that no one wiped up, so I did it myself. The bartender was very attentive. I ordered the boozy iced coffee (is crack were a breakfast drink, this is it) and they did NOT skimp on the alcohol. I ordered the Peacemaker (Chicken St Charles and Shrink Boogaloo). It took a while to come out, which told me that they were making it fresh and oh myyy was it fresh!! It was so delicious and the portions were generous. While I had to eat and run (with a boozy iced coffee Togo), I wish I had more time to really sit and enjoy it. 

I would totally be back as everything on the menu sounded and looked amazing. I love the idea behind this cafe and the fact that it is thriving makes me so happy.

Best choice of Eggs Benedict around.  The waitlist function on Yelp made our wait time 12-15 minutes by the time we arrived instead of what was a 35 minute wait line..
Service great.
Fantastic find. Teresa was a great host.  Got the praline pancakes and trifecta sampler. Worth the wait.
I've been to New Orleans 3 times to visit and be a tourist in the last 2.5 years and every time I find myself eating here for one brunch... most times I go twice... Shrimp N Grits are top notch

This is one of the top spots for brunch and there is almost always a wait based off the locals and research I have done. And it rung true on our visit here on a Sunday.

My friends got seats at the bar but I had to wait for someone to be finished eating since I met up with them. Unfortunately need to start off by saying the hostess, which I wish I got her name, had a condescending attitude. When I asked her if a seat can be added next to my friends at the bar she looked at me with disdain when I was nothing but polite to her. Very rude. BUT our waitress behind the bar was awesome; great attitude, genuine smile and engaging. Wish I got her name too.

I ordered the Croque Madame-coffee-glazed ham, which I opted out of, with swiss cheese put in between 2 brioche breads which were huuuuuge, and topped with mornay sauce and a fried egg. This dish was larger than life and true essence of brunch lol and it was delicious. I couldn't help myself but drown it with maple syrup. This came with your choice of french fries, creole slaw or fresh fruit which I had the french fries. 

On their yelp page is says there is vegan and vegetarian options. For brunch this isn't so. Almost everything had meat, hence opting out of the ham in my choice. And if there isn't meat it surely isn't vegan. But overall it was a good service. Maybe not the optimal brunch experience but a good breakfast fix.

Kamara must have eaten all the oatmeal todaywhy even put it on the menu if you don't serve it?  

Update: last time I was here I ordered the chicken biscuit:( biscuits were hard as a rock: note to fire martial: see attached picture of door

My husband and I stayed across the street and ate here for breakfast. They were pretty crowded bc of 4th of July and Essence so the service was a little slow but understandable. The only real problem we had was the waiter at the bar got our drinks and our food order wrong. But he was obviously not that great at his job as he was very slow and had a poor attitude. I wasn't sure how I felt about bacon praline pancakes but the bacon was a nice touch. I would definitely get them again. So as long as you don't get the same waiter we had you will probably have an amazing experience here.
Water / condensation from the ceiling was dripping on my table and my food - they said it was fine ( what's the worst that can happen- legionnaires disease)
Stopped for breakfast with a bigger group- Freddie H. Was a great server! Food was definitely worth the money, and there was plenty on the plate!

The highlight of this experience was how nice the staff was. Honestly super kind people, who are doing their best to give great service. As for the food- I was underwhelmed by the experience. It lacked flavor, texture, & in my opinion was a bit overrated given the hype around it. It came out a bit cold, & in some parts undercooked.
Outstanding cochon Benedict, matched only by the quality of the orange pomegranate mimosa. Great place for breakfast

If you love breakfast, do yourself a favor and head to the Ruby Slipper.  This is a real New Orleans gem and is loved by locals and tourists, alike.

Eggs Cochon is my favorite dish, but I love all of the Benedicts offered.  The pork debris is perfect!!! It's sweet, but not too sweet, and the flavor is so rich. The buttermilk biscuit is fluffy and melts in your mouth. The hollandaise is smooth and buttery. OMG - I swear - now I want to make a trip to the Ruby Slipper in the morning. 

Oh, and the Bloody Marys are delicious!  This is a great place to follow a great night - that leads to a rough morning - with a hair of the dog and some delicious hangover food. Skip the McDonalds sausage biscuit and do it like a grown up.

Apparently this is the spot for Brunch in NOLA! I was with a group of friends and we all really enjoyed our food. The food was colorful and flavorful. Everyone in our group seemed really happy with their food. There was something for everyone. Unfortunately I think I erased my pictures but trust me it was good. Lol
Freddie H -  he's the man.  Great service and and great attitude.   The food is fantastic

Ruby Slipper is a favorite of our family anytime we are in Nola.  The food and service are tops! Freddie our server this was friendly and helpful making sure we all were happy.  My coffee cup never went dry!
Thanks for another great meal.

I went to the Magazine St location. I used the online wait list which worked perfectly. I arrived at the time stayed and was seated within a couple of minutes. Had a Bloody Mary and two types of Eggs Benedict. Prompt, courteous service and everything was delicious!

Omg .... the best iced coffee I have had in a long time. I am a huge coffee person and this place has amazing coffee. The food was so good too. My friends and I had cheesecake stuffed frenchtoast with blueberry compote, the blt on brioche, and I had the bam bam biscuit with fried egg, fried green tomato, pepperjack cheese. Really good. Long line so make plans to go early. I liked it alot and obviously went back for a togo coffee the next day

The food was the best. It was close to our hotel (westin) and we went early on Sunday around 9:30 a.m. As we left we saw the super long line. Reasonably price for the best food for brunch.p.s. strong mimosa's!
Everytime in NOLA we stop by here and it has never let me down. Would recommend almost everything on the menu.
We ate breakfast here two mornings in a row when visiting New Orleans for a conference. The biscuits are amazing! It's been our favorite "away from home" breakfast place.
On my honeymoon trip.... We visited this establishment once. It was so good, we decided to come back. Love the food. Come check out when you're in the New Orleans area.

After a morning of chaos, this was the perfect place to go!!!! Our bachelorette group needed some drinks and food!! We joined the waitlist on Yelp, and they sat us very soon after arriving. We went back and forth on what drinks to get, and what food to get. Everyone was completely satisfied with what they ordered!! Such great food!! I had the St Charles Chicken with a fried egg.... Oh. My. God. Absolutely amazing!!!! Celeste our waitress was fantastic as well!!!! So helpful for even one in our group who was Vegan! This was such an amazing experience, I cant wait to visit NOLA again and go back!!
Awesome food... Freddie is the waiter you need to have.... Make sure to join the waitlist so you're not waiting long.

I've been to New Orleans twice and so far have eaten at The Ruby Slipper on Magazine Street four times.  We have found the Magazine Street/central business district to be more vivacious and attentive.  Love the food.  I've had the Nashville Hot Chicken (a special that day, which is one of the favorite meals I've ever had).  I've also had the Chicken St. Charles, the Eggs Blackstone, and the Egga Cochon.  The dishes are sumptuous, yolky, and flavorful.  The drinks are reasonably priced and tasty.  The staff is friendly and they do amazing work for having to turn so many covers.  I highly recommend this place, and to make life easier, you can check in online ahead of time to start your "wait" before arriving.

This place was recommended by one of my friends and it didn't disappoint me. I ordered the St. Charles Benedict with the Morning Margarita and my boyfriend ordered the BBQ Shrimp and Grits with a Vodka Bloody Mary. The Shrimp and Grits was very flavorful, different from your traditional Shrimp and Grits. The St Charles biscuit was a little hard to cut through, wished it was a little softer for cutting. Overall, food and drinks was pretty good. No wait at this location, came in around 12:20pm.

Definitely worth the wait. If you get on the guest list before leaving your hotel, it will decrease your wait time at the restaurant. Our wait was 90 minutes but we actually only waited 20 minutes there. Such a game changer. 

Order a drink while you wait and enjoy the views outside. 

Very packed inside, but the other travelers there are just as interested in what you ordered as you are. 

Shrimp and Grits - very unique flavor. We were told they added beer to the mix and rosemary. The rosemary is extremely strong, so you must like it before you order this dish.
Outstanding breakfast and service! Highly recommended!!! Freddie made sure that we were informed and happy with out choices. We were so impressed that we are going back before we conclude our trip.
ordered the southern breakfast and it was okay but nothing amazing. the fried green tomatoes, the biscuits, and the orange juice were great though.

I was really excited to eat here and the 2 hours that I waited for a table on a Sunday morning showed it. The food was amazing, really amazing! The service was horrible. Th guy waiting on us only seemed to have a few tables but had to be asked over and over  and over again for simple items. Then, at the end of the meal, after paying, they give you a tablet to sign your credit card receipt and tip while the server that just performed so poorly that he didn't deserve the minimum option of 18%, stared you down while completing it. The food is the only reason that i'd consider getting food here again, by way of take out, or maybe I'll try a different location but will not be back to this one to eat in.
My boyfriend and I shared the salmon eggs Benedict and the bananas foster French toast. Perfect amount. Food was amazing!

If you want a filling delicious meal, then this is the place for you. I had the eggs cochon ( pork and eggs basically) and it was extremely tasty. Our waiter was incredibly polite as I fumbled the ought the menu and asked a million questions . After we finished I was pleasantly surprised at how nobody rushed us out the door and the buser was super friendly. Just good vibes all around and incredibly reasonably prices. My bf and I each got coffee, food, and a boozy drink for under $40. Definitely going back

I love the food here! I dine in here every time I visit Nola. Everything on the menu is amazing. But my favorite dish is the chicken benedict. The service is hit or miss, something excellent or other time subpar.
The best thing about my food was the biscuit it came with. I got the southern breakfast. Crab cake was cold and the grits had no taste and they were watery.
Awesome food service setting. Loved everything props to our server Freddie. Hope you win the competition!

I enjoyed my breakfast here. I had the gluten free French toast with a side of fruit and it was made perfectly. I recently began eating gluten free and I love French toast, so being able to find a place that has gluten free French toast that is enjoyable was a pleasant surprise.

Overall:  First morning in New Orleans and chose this location based on closeness and reviews.  Arrived at 8:40 am ish with just a short wait.  Close to rounding to 4 stars but didn't make it as you will read. 

Food: 3 stars- Ordered Southern Breakfast (scrambled eggs, bacon extra crisp, biscuit, fried green tomato, and cheese grits) with coffee.  Regular grits came out and cheese placed on eggs (NP for me).  Huge biscuit was so dense it was still a doughy in center.  Fried green tomatoes and extra crispy bacon spot on.  Coffee was fine.  Overall, standard meal.

Service:  4 stars- Greeted warmly at door.  Prior to seating, hostess cleaned top before seating.  Seated within 2 minutes.  Servers/bartenders got our drink menu within 1 minute and had our food ordered in another 3 minutes.  So pretty expedient process.  Coffee refilled PDQ.  Both servers were more on the matter of fact side rather than friendly and welcoming.  Great service just need a bit more "personalization" while serving and would have been a 5 Star easily (which would have given the establishment overall 4 star for sure). 

Environment: 3 stars-  average restaurant with Open seating area with some outdoor seating.  Sat at bar.  Restaurant is very noisy since it has no or to limited sound absorbing material so everything reverberated; therefore, was hard to communicate to server.

The my favorite breakfast place in NOLA. Amazing coffee and eggs Benedict. Our server Freddy was amazing; super friendly and attentive.

The waitlist feature in Yelp works great !!  I would recommend it any day. Join the waitlist early, is always full..

Candied bacon. Just do it. While it's only 2 slices, it is very tasty. I split the 3 eggs benny with my mom and it was the perfect amount of food for breakfast. 
Their cold brew coffee was delicious, drank it black and it didn't need a single thing!
Definitely get there early as it does get busy, we enjoyed an outside seat as the weather was cool.  Though not much to see view was, besides some big trucks and street cleaning, it was worth the short trek like the FQ.
Great place with tasty food. The lemonade was not great taste salty. My next trip to NOLA I will be going back to Ruby Slipper Cafe for the food only!!!

Eggs Benedict were amazing! Love this place in New Orleans. We had very good service from our waiter Freddie. He was very attentive and nice. Couldn't have asked for a better experience for our Sunday brunch.

Favorite breakfast place this visit. Not an expert on grits but these were tasty. Biscuits really good with that brown sugar butter. Loved the fried green tomato. Favorites were the Eggs Benedict Cochon and St Charles. Super friendly staff.

I don't know if it was just a bad day/time for me to visit, BUUUUTTTT! I was not happy. Service during the 20min wait was excellent with the ladies in the front. When me and my guest set at the bar the staff only greeted/recognized us at that time. We were looked at crazy when asked for a refill of coffee. Everyone around us was recognized and checked on throughout their time of being there. Place is overrated, the food was not good (pancakes was not fluffy and grits was gritty. Basically, no tip was left and will not be going back when visiting NOLA.

On my New Orleans trip, I ate here twice for breakfast (the second time because it was close to my hotel and my buddies did not want to venture too far away).

There will be a line and a wait on a weekend morning around 10:30am.  We waited about a half hour - we passed the time by having a bloody mary at the enormous bar (which I found strange for a breakfast/lunch restaurant).  The bloody was solid - had pickled beans - and a decent kick of horseradish.  I like my bloodies a little spicier, but a little bit of crystal did the trick.

I tried the Louisiana omelette - which has shrimp and cheddar - not fantastic - I hate when I get cheese in an omelette and it has no flavor.  The shrimp were cooked fine, but also not too flavorful.

My second trip, I ordered eggs over easy (Mother's should take a page from the Ruby Slipper recipe book) with chicken sausage.  It was a simple meal but very good.

Coffee was good and bottomless.

Cost was in the $12-15 range - definitely pricier than something like Denny's but several notches above in quality.  Overall, pretty good.

This spot is a MUST TRY when in nola!!! We came here twice during our trip because it was just that good. Make sure you come to this location at Central Business District because it's more busy so the food is fresher. We ate at the Mid City location for our 2nd time and the bananas foster french toast wasn't as great as the one a this location. So seriously....make the trip here because it's WORTH IT. 

There may be a long wait but that can easily be combatted with the Yelp waitlist! We put ourselves on the waitlist through our phone while we were leaving our airbnb and it takes ~35 minutes to get to the restaurant, so by the time we got there we were seated immediately. Onto the food-

Southern breakfast - AMAZING!!! We went with this one since it seemed like a safe choice and we were mindblown. The highlight of this meal was the biscuit. It's enormous and fluffy on the inside, crispy on the outside. The cinnamon butter that pairs with it is incredible. This was also my first time trying grits and they were so good! 

Bananas foster french toast - there's a reason why this is one of those popular items here...because it's just that great. Hands down the best french toast I've ever had! I was afraid it'd be overly sweet but it wasn't at all. Even though my body was stuffed, it was so easy to keep going and going....we even got this again the 2nd time we went because I couldn't stop thinking about it. 

Chicken St. Charles - fried chicken benedict on a biscuit. Another popular item and definitely a must-order. Not a huge fan of fried chicken or overly greasy foods but this is the one exception I'll make. The chicken is tender and seasoned well, and the batter is crisped to perfection. This dish seriously made me think twice about fried chicken..

Ruby slipper mimosa - Beautiful looking drink...looks like a sunset and holy mother F this drink is STRONG!!! I'm not much of a drinker but I really enjoyed stealing some sips of this from my boyfriend. 

All of the items we had were absolutely incredible that I can't even choose a favorite. I highly recommend ordering any of the menu items here as you clearly cannot go wrong.

Used Yelp to "join wait-list" - the best idea. Great food.  A little slow to get to you, a little slow to get the bill paid.  The EL CACHON was excellent or egg-cellent depending on what you think.  Poached eggs were the only was to go.  The chicken tastes great, but was a little small.  And the biscuits will leave you full for days.
It was ok. The servers seemed so overwhelmed. The food was plentiful. One of I think two restaurants. I think this is the original spot.

Ruby Slipper Cafe is a little gem hidden away down a back alley in New Orleans.

We got up at 1:00 AM to fly into New Orleans, landed at 8 and (obviously) our hotel room was not ready when we arrived.  We decided to fill out bellies while we waited and the hotel concierge suggested Ruby Slipper. 
 We walked the 10 minutes to the cafe, and it was packed.  Sure, we had to wait to be seated... but it was so worth it.

 We had the Bananas Foster Pain (French Toast), pancakes, bacon, biscuits, and coffee glazed ham.  Everything was amazing.  They even make a special honey butter for the biscuits.  The coffee was good, too!

Can't recommend it enough!

I've never left a 1 star review before. I was so frustrated with my experience this morning... I sat at the bar and was asked what I wanted to drink, and then I was able to order quickly after that! It started off good. A couple then sat next to me, and that's when the waitress completely wrote me off as her attention was with them for the rest of my dining experience. They got their food a good 30 minutes before mine came out. I ordered just a simple eggs Benedict. My drink was never refilled until someone else noticed who wasn't even my server. I was never asked how my meal was, if I needed anything, nothing. I paid and left. With so many amazing dining options in NOLA, I was disappointed that my fun morning with the parade ended with such a negative experience.

I've been to the Ruby Slipper on Canal Street a couple times when I stayed at The Saint Hotel and I've always been pleased; I came to this one in Central Business District because I'm back at my preferred hotel nearby. 

I thought this location would be a little less crowded because the one on Canal Street gets really busy but it's the same here. Not a bad thing just saying you will probably have to wait but the wait is always fast. 

The menu is a lot of typical breakfast items plus a bunch of unique dishes. I normally make sure to order something that includes a biscuit but the one that came with my dish was kinda hard. Overall I liked my food. My eggs weren't cooked right but at least the bacon and potatoes were perfect. I always liked that they offered me a take out cup to leave with my fresh cup of coffee.

Such a great place. Very crowded, so make sure and get on the wait list before you head over. The food was excellent and the staff was friendly and fast. Creme Brûlée pancake is so good, as are their unique Eggs Benedict selections.
The best bloody mary i've had! Wonderful menu, love the benedicts!

The wait for this place is CRAZY and not worth it in my opinion.  I can get better breakfasts elsewhere without having to wait over an hour.  I assume it's popular due to location and trend.  We tried the Benedict sampler of some sort, stuffed French toast and pancakes.  The food was just ok but like i said earlier, you can get better breakfasts elsewhere.  Not to be a hater but I wish we had tried Coterie or some other place that was on my bookmarks instead.  Live and learn.  We don't live in the area but if we return to N.O. we won't be returning here.

Great experience. Excellent food, with a friendly and helpful staff. Highly recommended!

Great Benedicts with interesting ingredients. Super good coffee. We sat at the counter which was easy. Would happily come here again. 

FOOD ALLERGY FRIENDLY: I have a multitude of food allergies. As soon as I mentioned it, the manager came right over and helped me make safe choices. They were knowledgeable and super helpful about it. Couldn't ask for more!

Life changing biscuits. Everything we had was absolutely incredible! Our waitress Celeste was very helpful in helping us decide between all the delicious options and the Chicken St Charles Eggs Benedict, Corned Beef Hash Benedict and Croque Madam did not disappoint! The attention to detail on every single element of our meal was evident, from sauce down to the biscuits. This brunch was truly worth the wait and hype! I cannot wait to come back and try something new.

Guys!! If you have never been to The Ruby Slipper you need to change that ASAP! It was a 3 minute walk from our hotel, but I would have walked 3 hours! It was phenomenal. My lady friend got Brioche French Toast sticks and I got a Louisiana Shrimp, bacon, and cheddar omelette with a side of breakfast potatoes and a biscuit with CANE SUGAR BUTTER! After that 3 minute walk back to the hotel turned into 20 minutes since we were so stuffed. We sat at the bar and our sever/bartender Jared was amazing and answered all of our questions!
Hands down best breakfast/brunch in New Orleans service good. Just a long wait but worth the wait
Great food and great service. Just make sure you getting on the yelp waiting list before going or you'll wait forever

There are a few outposts of the Ruby Slipper.
I have to assume they are all great. We both ordered the Southern breakfast, needing a way to power through our day of sightseeing and drinking, and to soak up the damage from the night before. The place was packed. We didn't wait too long for a spot at the counter but knowing what I do, it's worth the wait. Perfectly buttery grits, eggs cooked exactly to your specifications, one of the best biscuits I've ever had(I was born in New Orleans. I know Southern breakfast.) Iced coffee with booze in it and whipped cream on top. F your PSL. 

Just go here. Eat a lot.
Food was amazing and service was amazing by our waiter Freddy. Freddy went above and beyond to make us feel welcome and food was delicious!

Large pour for a mimosa,  great way to start. The corn beef hash Benedict and the fried chicken Benedict were both amazing. We went here 2 days in a row. Both times, sat at the bar and had good service.
The food was so good, I was trying to figure out how I could have a second breakfast here after we got back from a cruise before I made it to the airport!

On Friday 24th of May, 2019 we started hubby's birthday celebration on our trip in New Orleans, Louisiana with Brunch at The Ruby Slipper, which he chose. This place is very popular so make sure you join the wait list before strolling through the streets to this establishment, which we did. Hubby ordered The Trifecta- 3 different style Eggs Benedict. One serving each of the Egg Conchon (apple braised pulled pork), Chicken St. Charles (fried chicken) and Shrimp Boogaloo (creole style tomato sauce) Benedict. They were served on freshly baked Buttermilk Biscuits. The eggs were perfectly poached and Aaron loved the entire dish. I ordered the Hot Smoked Salmon Omelette with Goats cheese, topped with dill, hollandaise, red onion and flash fried capers. My meal was absolutely delicious and I will say the small piece of Buttermilk biscuit that I tried was the best I've ever had. It was soft and not dense at all, in saying that I'm not a huge biscuit fan. You can order potatoes or fruit as your side with this dish too. Bloody Mary's and Mimosas are very popular over here when enjoying a Brunch. I order the Ruby Slipper Big Easy Mimosa which has OJ and a dash of Pomegranate added to the champagne. I must say this is the best mimosa I've had yet since moving to the States. They were not wrong when they said easy pour mimosa either! We sat at the bar so I watched them being made. A large wine glass 3/4 full with champagne then topped with juice for $10. Hubby had the Vodka based Bacon infused Bloody Mary which also was amazing! Overall the staff were fabulous, friendly and very accommodating on a usual busy long weekend Brunch morning. The menu has lots of choices and the meals were a fantastic price. A great birthday brunch was had and my husbands iced coffee on a very warm NOLA day to go was also very good to top it off!

What a great little place to get breakfast!! Coffee was strong, staff was fast and friendly, and food was cooked exactly how I like it. There was a wait to get in on a Sunday morning but it didn't take long to get seated. The food was worth the wait.

Literally the best food I think I have had in my life. Ever. If I am on death row and get one final meal I would like for it to be here. The eggs Benedict (I think I got the St Charles Chicken?) were to die for. Bloody Mary's were good, especially for during the wait. Food was served quickly- service wasn't overly attentive but to be honest it doesn't even matter the food speaks for itself.

This place is open for brunch on the weekdays (huge plus!)

I split two orders with a friend: banana fosters French toast and the migas (a Tex Mex egg scramble)  Yum yum yum! Both were delicious. To drink I had a mocha iced latte (Unlike most mochas, they didn't go overboard on the chocolate, which I was fine with)

Atmosphere is open, bright, casual urban sophisticated with a huge bar in the center. 

Server was friendly and very accompdaing 

Total was 63$ for four people, so $15+ each plus tip.

I am giving the restaurant five stars because for what it was and for what I was looking for in the moment, the dining experience was absolutely flawless.

this place rocks! 1st day ever in NOLA... sat at the counter...ordered mimosas and Irish coffee....EXCELLENT...Michelle was our server....(she was great) i had the eggs Blackstone and wife had the salmon bennie...both were out standing.. coffee too was outstanding..  FRENCH TRUCK... bought a bag to go..Outstanding service and food...will be back!

Great food, great service and drinks, expect a long wait in the late morning on the weekend but there's an app for that and cocktails to make it bearable.  It is worth the wait!

The Nowait app makes a difference.
Order was incorrect, refused to fix the order. Manager had an attitude and said  I can either eat it or leave
The wait was an 1.5 hour but it's worth the wait. They also have the NoWait App that I wish I would've known about. But the food was delicious!!!
Long wait.  Food was average.  And a service was a little slow.  I felt like it was a little too much hype for what you get.

Was told they had the best Bloody Mary's. I couldn't tell you if they did because I haven't had one before. By definitely not my thing. The breakfast was okay. We shared a few plates in our party of 4. The chicken benedict was my favorite. The candied maple bacon was impressive. Everything else was...okay.

Had bananas foster - a little heavy and sweet....ok, delicious! Great service and a fun, vibrant atmosphere. 

Use YELP to "get in line" before you arrive. Wait was an hour per YELP , so we signed in on the way into town. Cut our sit-outside time in half!
Very good place to eat. We got lucky and arrived before the morning rush. Food and service was fantastic. Omlette's, pancakes are awesome - biscuit's are a good size - Njoy!
This Ruby slipper is inferior. Plantains weren't fully fried. Food presentation was sloppy. They got my partners order wrong.

Breakfast was delicious!  The bacon with caramelized sugar is ridiculously good!  Service was great too. Our server Freddie was polite and got us our breakfast quickly. We just found our New Orleans breakfast spot!

The best breakfast ever. Even though we had to wait over an hour to be seated it was well worth the wait on a Sunday. We had the candied bacon, bananas foster, bacon praline pancakes and stuffed french toast. Everything was delicious. Highly recommend.

Excellent food and service at this New Orleans institution.  Like the CBD location best, but all are great.  Breakfast and brunch is all I know them for (along with good drinks) but should try more another time.  Thanks!

Oh My Gawd.....who would have thought that my best dining experience in New Orleans would be for breakfast?

My mother and I decided to visit New Orleans to take in the culture, the people and the food...I asked the woman at the front desk of our hotel what breakfast places she would recommend and Ruby Slipper happened to be right around the corner. The next morning my mother and I decided to check it out, I ordered the Crab cake brunch special...it came with one crab cake, eggs, potatoes and a yummy biscuit. I seriously scraped my plate eating my meal. The crab cake was seasoned perfectly and featured jumbo lumps of crab meat, it was topped with a hollandaise sauce (I think). 

I topped this off with the best orange juice I've ever tasted in my life...completely a great dining experience. 

My mother was jealous and tried to eat my food so we ended up ordering her one to go..overall my experience was great. The greeter got us a table within 10 minutes during what seemed to be a pretty busy day (Saturday at 10 am). After we finished our meal the line was wrapped around the corner, so word to the wise...go early!

Happy Dining!

We tried to eat here twice while in town. The first day there was an hour and a half wait. We left. The next day it was only a 30 minute wait. The food is good and worth the money but I'm not sure it was worth the wait. It wasn't the best pancakes and bacon I e ever eaten. It wasn't the worst. It was just ok to me. If there's a line, go someplace else. If not, you won't be disappointed. It's average tasting to me.

This is a great place for breakfast! I would doing a reservation ahead of time as wait times get long, especially if you want to sit at a table. 

Fortunately, we got lucky by sitting at the bar! 

The food here is excellent! You won't go wrong  with any of their selections

I NEVER liked hollidaise anything... I came here & it was the MOST AMAZING THING I HAVE EVER HAD IN MY LIFE!!!!!! The food here, regardless of what it is.... AMAZING is understatement! I am from IOWA people

Atmosphere was amazing!!  FOOD was amazing!! I ordered the corn beef hash,grits and eggs OMG!!  My man had the little pig omelette and potatoes.  He also had this syrup butter spread for his biscuit-OMG!  Gotta go back!  I also only waited in line 5 mins due to the Nowait get in line app!!! I will be back!!!
Food is great, service is good.  We had fun there too and there is enough variety to please the entire gang.

Didn't have to wait, got right in due to the fact I was a party of one. If you have 3 or more people, there most likely will be a wait.  The menu has a lot of choices, their thing is southern breakfasts and creole twists on benedicts.

I ordered the fried chicken benedict. It was ok. The chicken didn't really have any flavor to it.  The eggs were delicious.

The biggest issue that I have with this place is that the service, although friendly enough, is inattentive. Once they take your initial order, good luck getting refills on your coffee or anything for that matter.

My advice to management: you need to retrain your servers to make eye contact with all of their guests and check on them regularly.

For this reason, I probably won't return.

This place is amazing! Fantastic food and service. Our waitress Dida was so sweet and welcoming and couldn't have asked for a better end to our first NOLA trip! My father even said the bananas foster French toast was one of the best meals in his life!

It was ok...the service was good. 

Portions are WAY too big. I ordered the bananas foster French toast, it was three large diagonal slices of French bread. My meal was really good, the bacon was amazing. 

Their fiancee got eggs Cochon, the "signature" dish.  Tens out its basically just eggs Benedict with pulled pork added. And bland pork at that. Very "meh" dish, quite disappointing. Also VERY oversized. There were two "stacks" of biscuit, pork, eggs, etc, but they were so big that one would have been plenty.

Well Ruby u did it again u took oatmeal off ur menu again ? I was very disappointed today to stand in line only to be told once seated that u no longer serve oatmeal I am allergic to eggs so it is a chore to order at Rubybut when u served it it was good sorry I wasted my time with u

Celeste was our server today and she was such a delight! 
We were in town from Ft. Worth, TX celebrating a friend getting married next month. Being the only vegan out of 7 gals, Celeste helped me find some food to eat on your menu and recommended her favorite. I had the Dish with beans and rice and added potatoes. It was so so good. The cocktails were freaking amazing as well. 
We just had a really great time and wanted to thank Celeste for helping us out and making it an awesome lunch!! 
Thanks again.

Exactly what I was looking for. Hot cup of coffee. Friendly and helpful service. Lively cafe environment. And a belly full of eggs Benedict. I went with the Corned Beef Bennie. Eggs were done just right and just the right amount of hollandaise. I don't like things doused in sauce. Went because of proximity and will be returning because of how good it was.

A bit of a wait but that was to be expected because the food was super delicious!!! We loved every last bit of our eggs cochon and eggs st Charles! It was definitely a great breakfast and a great start to our NOLA trip.
Freddy was our waiter and he was amazing!!! I have never had that good if service in my life!  Great Bloody Mary and biscuit. The shrimp and grits were really good but very rich.

Excellent! The spirit and vibes are awesome. Freddie is definitely the definition of southern hospitality. My partner ordered the banana pecan pancakes and was in absolute heaven. I'm in a very restricted diet so my order was definitely lack luster. But I understand their specialty are pancakes or other amazing goodies and I wish I could tried. But I will be back.

Fast service even with a large party! Helpful and answered any questions about the menu. We always take our out of town guests to ruby slipper and everyone leaves happy and excited to return! 
The iced coffee is also delicious.

Tried to come here a few times during our trip and there was always a long wait. Today (my birthday) we got in and now I know why this place is always hopping!! The food was so delicious. I couldn't decide what to get to my sister and I split a few different meals. Best way to try a little bit of everything. Definitely visit this place! Totally worth it!

Amazing!  Definitely use Yelp to get on the waitlist ahead of time.  Special was cranberry orange pancakes which were amazing.  Other has BamBam sandwich and shrimp Benedict.  The service was great. For being very busy we were not rushed at all.  Got served drinks ahead of time while we waited.  The food was fantastic and would strongly recommend to everyone.

Best breakfast in the town of New Orleans.  Food and service are excellent.  For a chain, it can't w beat! We all had something different so we could try more than one dish and everything was delicious

Came to New Orleans on vacation and happen to stay across the street for Ruby Slipper and OMG!!! Yassss!!! The waitresses all three days (Yes 3 days) was very nice and gave wonderful suggestions to the menu. I started with the trifecta and I thought that was good until I had the Grilled Fish St. Peter ... then the cinnamon pancake ... on my last trip I ordered the bananas foster pain perdu I dare you to try it... Thank you Freddie and Thaddria !!!

This place lives up to the hype! The service is great. Food took a while to come out but it was busy and our waitress kept us updated. I got the Southern Platter with a side pancake. The bacon was great, fried green tomato was a unique nice addition. Grits and eggs were good. The biscuit was massive (I took most of it to go and it made a great post-hurricanes snack). A great brunch spot.
Kamara must have eaten all the oatmeal todaywhy even put it on the menu if you don't serve it?

Love love this place! I always come here whenever I'm in town for breakfast. Down side is the wait if you come anytime after 10. We waited and hour and a half to be seated the last time I was there. Staff is very friendly.

The Food was great! Our waitress Courtney was freaking awesome. We also heard it was her 1st day on the job and her Birthday. Thanks Courtney for the great customer service. And thanks Ruby Slipper for the great food.  l think we all cleaned our plates!

Great food.  The wait is 100% worth it.  

I had the eggs Benedict combo and it was super delicious.
Best breakfast in all of New Orleans, to me. The Cochin ay lait is PHENOMENAL!!! I crave it while I'm away and get excited every year I'm in town to taste it again.
Amazing breakfast! This place had a wait and I can see why. The breakfast/brunch food is great. I would recommend the shrimp and grits or the French toast.
Food was delicious & our server(Freddie H) was so attentive! Everyone from the host to other servers were genuinely nice people and happy to help. Worth the stop!
This lil gem in New Orleans was perfect. The wait was worth it, their French toast sticks were amazing and the shrimp and grits were good as well...would def get brunch here again

Oh heavens, this place was devine. The biscuits were the best we've ever tried. The Cochon Bennie was out of this world and the massive Croque Madam sandwich was To.Die.For. I'll be dreaming about this brunch spot for awhile! Top it off, the service was awesome. Despite the long wait, we did the No Wait App and walked right in and were seated at our reservation time.

Very busy place to go for brunch but well worth it. I enjoy walking down magazine street and going to eat at different unique spots. When we visited here it was a wait at least 30 mins before we were seated at a small table by the window. The waiter was very friendly and we had good service .It was a bit crowded wish it was more space.  My husband and I had the shrimp and grits and it was delicious. My husband said that he would order the shrimp and grits every single time he came because it was just that good. My son had something simple like pancakes and fresh fruit he is a sucker for both. I enjoyed my meal thank you very much.
A MUST for dining in New Orleans!!! AWESOME Bloody Mary's and the food.....indescribable. You got to go to know!!

This place is amazing! I had a Florentine omelet and it was perfect. It came with a biscuit and grits. The biscuit was huge and fluffy. It was easily the best biscuit I've ever had in my entire life. They have maple syrup butter to put on it. Wow. The grits were also perfect. The iced tea was flavorless but what kind of dummy orders iced tea at breakfast and expects it to be good?
Service by Annabel was perfect. This place is so great.
The food was awesome!! The grits taste like my mama made them! The mimosas are sooo refreshing!!! I reccomend this place.

Loved this place!  A great place for breakfast or lunch, the Ruby Slipper Cafe is a find in the warehouse district.

I went a couple of different times during my recent visit and both times the food was good, the service friendly and the prices are definitely right!!

For lunch I had a simple BLT and some fried green tomatoes, and for breakfast it was an omelet with ham, cheddar cheese and tomatoes.  Both were quite tasty and served by some of the friendliest people who actually remembered me from my earlier visit! (I secretly love that when it happens!)

Both meals cost less than $15 and there was plenty of food and free drink refills on soda, tea and coffee.

But what I really loved about the place was the name.  The owners have a sign on the wall explaining what the "Ruby slipper " idea is from.  Hearkening back to the "Wizard of Oz" when Dorothy would click her heels together and say, "There's no place like home", the name is to honor those who lost their homes in Katrina who only wanted to "come home".  Love it!

Go for breakfast or lunch.  There is always a line but they move through the people quickly.  Or know that the bar is first come, first served.  I ate there both days and never had to wait.  And the food comes up quickly so you can be in and out in only 30 minutes if that is what you want.

Ruby Slipper is a true New Orleans find!
Amazing breakfast spot!! Loved the food and checking in on line was great. Get the bananas foster French toast and fried chicken Benedict

We walked 1.5 miles in the 32 degree and windy weather weather (it felt like we were going to school in the snow, uphill, both ways, but we persevered). It was so worth it. We had shrimp and grits, the trifecta eggs Benedict and an omelette- & fried green tomatoes for a breakfast appetizer.  Who has appetizers at breakfast?? I guess we do, but we deserved it because we were freezing. It was all amazing.  Truly. Renee, our waitress, was very nice. We were way less cold on our way back and I'm guessing our pleasantly full bellies helped out!!
A-MAZING food. Always packed. I've been to several of their locations, and none disappoint. Great boozy brunch drinks. Fantastic food and fun environment. A must stop to any NOLA visitor.

"There's no place like home. There's no place like home."  That's the story behind Ruby Slipper and how they came back to New Orleans after Katrina.  It's the pork cabochon that keeps me coming back!  And the double mimosa's aren't too shabby either.

I've had their steak and eggs for breakfast before too, also yum.  The servers are generally super nice (Gina's awesome but unfortunately I missed her the last two times I was here).

Personally, I really enjoy this breakfast place, good location, nice open interiors, and just generally a good atmosphere.  I always eat here at least once whenever I'm in NOLA.
My meal was delicious. I really enjoyed myself. This location was super busy (which it might always be) you could tell some of the meals at my table were rushed. Overall great experience though.

I had brunch here twice. 
The first time it was on a Friday morning and we sat at the counter and service was quick. I had the eggs blackstone which was so good I couldn't stop thinking of them. We had to come back a few days later obvi. The only negative was that the fan or vent was right above us and we were freezing, like thought we wwould turn into blocks of ice (It was the first week of September and like 100 degrees out). 

Our second visit was on a Monday morning and the place was jam.packed. The wait to be seated wasn't terrible though. When we were seated the waiter took forever to take our order. Our.food also took a super long time. I ended up eating eggs blackstone again because they were so yummy. I highly suggest this place for brunch if you are ever visiting nola

This place is poppin' on a Friday morning! The wait was 45 minutes even though we checked in ahead of time via yelp! 

As we were waiting we really liked the waitress coming out and taking our drink orders while we waited for a table. The coffee I ordered was really good and strong. 

The food we ordered was good! Everything tasted fresh and tasty. The best dish was the shrimp and grits, the grits were cooked to perfection and seasoned well. I ordered the trifecta to try all of the top dishes ruby slipper has to offer. My favorite was the fried chicken one. Next time, I would just order the fried chicken Benedict. 

Service was fast and friendly.

Used yelp to find this restaurant. Was able to use the live wait time to see how long it would be for our party number and was also able to join the waitlist while we walked there. Checked in to let them know we arrived with no issue. Very busy day for them but the kept the line moving quickly and were very courteous. Was also able to watch the waitlist on yelp app to see the number of parties I front of us until we were seated. Would visit again!
Great food... all four of us loved it! I had the Eggs Benedict combo... one with pork and one with fried chicken. Never had those before but they were soooo good!
Enjoyed the atmosphere here. Service was good. Drinks were strong but flavorful. The only knock was the food seemed a little bland for our party but that's more of a personal opinion, maybe.

Ruby Slipper is the go to spot for cheap breakfast eats. The line is always long at each of the restaurants and you have to hang around for your name to be called should you decide to put your name on the list. We dined in on a Thursday around 10 and there were several people ahead of us. We waited about thirty minutes until our name was called. The food is good not great but it certainly hits the spot if you've had a long night. I love to order a variety of items to share so I went with the French Toast, Croque Madame and an Omelette. All were good and what you would expect from a spot like this. I wasn't blown away but I would try it again if my usual breakfast spots aren't available.

A must do for breakfast in New Orleans. I had the Ruby Slipper mimosa and the Peacemaker Benedict - half Chicken St. Charles and half Shrimp Bogaloo. The peacemaker is great for benedict aficionados who want to try more than one benedict. I was very pleased with my choices.

The Ruby Slipper Cafe in Central Business District was my breakfast destination on my last day in New Orleans.  They open at 7am, which I appreciated, though I did not take full advantage since I ran a (failed) errand on the way over.

I like eggs benedicts.  And I like variety.  So of course I had to go with The Peacemaker $15 (Mix & match any two of our Signature Benedicts), since I also have a limited appetite, otherwise I would have seriously considered the Trifecta (featuring 3 different specified benedicts) $20.

For my twosome, I went with:

Eggs Cochon $14
Slow-cooked, apple-braised pork debris served over a buttermilk biscuit, topped with two poached eggs, finished with hollandaise

Chicken St. Charles $14
Fried chicken breast served over a buttermilk biscuit, topped with two poached eggs, finished with a pork tasso cream sauce

I loved their buttermilk biscuit and preferred the chicken over the pork.  The eggs ranged in hardness of the egg white, though both yolks were appropriately runny.

Singleton diners were seated along the bar where service wasn't prime, but was okay.

3.5 stars.

This is a must go place when visiting NOLA. They have an amazing selection on the menu and everything was delicious. From the drinks, food and service everything was great. No wait when we arrived and seated right away. Service was excellent and food was beyond delicious. Would recommend and return when back in the area.

Everything was OK but we sat at the bar and watched 5 staff members stand by the drink window and talk while two coffees with whip cream were slowly dying in the window. Took 8 minutes till someone finally picked them up. Made me nervous we might get cold eggs for breakfast. Our eggs were not but seemed to be a lot of just hanging around by staff that weren't bartenders. I know that's a weird thing to be concerned about but when your meal takes 30 minutes to come out it really makes you wonder.

Food was great but don't know if I'll come back. Nothing too special but nothing too terrible either.
Freddie H is awesome. Great food AMAZING drinks (especially the boozy iced coffee)  biscuits are dope.

This place is just okay. The line was long but used the yelp app to put my name on the wait list. Took about 10 minutes to seat us once we checked in. Once we were seated it took about 15 minutes for anyone to even acknowledge us. Our server wasn't very attentive. From the reviews I was so excited to try their food. I was kind of disappointed. Eggs Cochon was a little salty. husband had The banana foster French toast which he ordered without  raisins but plate came out with raisins . He didn't really care for it said it wasn't as good as it  looked.

The food here is amazing. The wait staff are very friendly and outgoing. They made the entire experience wonderful. We had Chris as our waiter and he made sure everything came out correctly and in a timely matter. We had the French toast, shrimp boogaloo, egg cochon benedict's and praline pancakes. Their mimosas were good too.

Ruby Slipper is by far the best restaurant we visited in NOLA!!! The food AND prices were excellent. I'm going to suggest you join the waitlist via yelp. We waited 2 plus hours for our table and made sure to utilize yelp to know when to arrive back at the restaurant.

This place was great! Drinks, food and Service was awesome. They chatted with us and gave us some suggestions on places to go in the city.
Will definitely be back!

OMG! So the first time I heard about ruby slipper I went to the one in Marigny... super lack luster. During my second visit in town I decided to try this one in the central business district. Let me start by saying... utilize yelps waitlist! The line was out the door. Also be advised that the food does take a little long to come but omg is it worth it! I had the catfish and grits - PHENOMENAL! They also serve the biscuits with this amazing sweet butter so you don't even need to put syrup or jam on your biscuit. I had a Bellini and you'll be happy to know that it was more champagne than anything. 

I tried some of my moms eggs Benedict and it was good but dry compared to my meal. 

EAT HERE! YOU WONT REGRET IT!

Last meal in New Orleans? Grits and mimosas? Yes, please, and thank you. There were so many good things on the menu but I just went with a basic breakfast to try it. The Ruby Slipper mimosa was a perfect end to our trip!

Food was decent. The wait was astronomical on a very cold day in NOLA. Once inside the staff was less than friendly to myself and my guest. Got our bill before we for our food. Never asked if we wanted any drinks, or a refill on drinks. When we paid our tab, the waitress barely even looked our way until we said we didn't need change. Gave us a smile and was all of a sudden polite. At this point really not sure if we will visit again when we come back.

I went early in the morning on a weekday and even though it was packed, I was seated fairly quickly at the counter. Outside, they can take drink orders while you wait! Service was fantastic, the atmosphere was fun, and my food was delicious! Will definitely be back.

Best brunch ever!! This place is definitely worth the wait. The good thing is, you can always put yourself on the waitlist from home. And even while waiting out there, you can buy a drink from the bar. Highly recommend the Bloody Mary!
Great place for breakfast. service and food are all good be prepared to wait though if you're going in the morning. Go  inside grab a coffee at the counter and wait.

This is my favorite breakfast place in the central business district. A big plus is that you can put your name on a wait list, and there is always one, check in when you get to the restaurant, and they will let you know your place number, it obviously ticks down from whenever you make the reservation online.

Their bacon vodka infused Bloody Mary's are some of the best I've ever had, and any of their egg Benedict dishes are a great choice!  My favorite place to sit is at the bar, it's great people watching, and the bartenders are lovely.
Worth the wait,  cute place,  always looks busy.  Great coffee,  bacon bloody Mary's.  Large portions.  Wonderful food

Wow. What a meal. I ordered their famous St. Charles Chicken and it was AMAZING!!! Loved the biscuits and chicken combination. Their bacon was also cooked to a delightful crisp. The iced coffee they are known for was also SOOO good. Perfect mix of vanilla, sweet, and coffee.
Best brunch here. Worth the 90 minute wait. Service was excellent as well as the food. Will definitely be back!
Shrimp and grits are amazing! The fried chicken eggs Benedict is great. I always come here for those 2 things.

I ate here about a week ago and LOVED everything about. Wait was minimal even though there was a lot of people waiting to be seated. Our server Joelle was excellent! Very friendly and knowledgeable of the menu. She was able to answer every question we asked. We settled on the Slipper salad and the Peacemaker with a corned beef Bennie and st Charles chicken. Our food was delicious and came out quickly. Would definitely recommend the restaurant AND our server to any friends visiting the area.

The wait can be pretty long, but you can drink while you wait.  They serve the most alcoholic bloody Marys and mimosas I've ever seen.

- Florentine omelette: egg whites, goat cheese, spinach. It came with a giant biscuit, which was good with jam 
- Ham steak side: honey glazed, nice caramelization
- Shrimp and grits: grits were a little off in texture 

Portions are super big.

Keep in mind they close at 2pm!  but they'll still seat you if you get your name on their list in time.
The service is consistently amazing....and the food is absolutely worth the wait every single time. A must eat anytime you can!
Freddie crushed it today! On point with refills and service, very knowledgeable and friendly! Will definitely be back.

Totally fell in I've with this place! The atmosphere is friendly as well as charming.
The food was out of this world! I would eat  here everyday and not mind the extra pounds.
I highly recommend it!
Freddie H is simply perfect. Great service and great conversation ! I will definitely go again , as long as he is still there !

If your looking for a great breakfast place then look no further. The banana pecan pancakes are a must and the 3 pig omelette. Portions are huge so two people could share these two dishes. Our server unfortunately was not very attentive but the food is worth going for and the story behind this places is unique. A must do. They have t
3 location and we ate at the one on Decatur so maybe the original had better service..
Ruby slipper was awesome.  Food was great and so much to eat.  I really like the atmosphere there.  It's designed for feeling like you are with a community!

Used the waitlists app worked like a charm good coffee nice eggs grits good bacon outstanding fun well run machine have gone there 4 times found a little inconsistency in prep like eggs being too done one tomato instead of 2 2 slices of bacon 1 day 3 the next 2 1/2 the next but must have been a shift change all in all good food and great service great price

I regret that I never tried this place until I moved away!  On a recent trip where I was staying in the CBD, I actually stopped in twice for breakfast.  Unless you show up when they open, there is likely to be a wait.  They will add your name to a list which you can check online for the number of parties ahead of you on the list and the estimated wait time.  They will also bring you coffee and other drinks while you wait outside.

The first time we stopped in, my SO and I split the Trifecta benedict and non-stuffed french toast.  We skipped the french toast a couple days later and went straight for the benedicts because they are amazing!  We both loved the Chicken St. Charles and the Eggs Cochon.  I believe the coffee we ordered was nothing special, but we were there for the benedicts.  We will absolutely stop by here again if we have to be downtown.

Came here during Mardi Gras. Yum! We had to wait in line because it was packed but we were able to to order our drink and have them as we waited. Waitress was super nice and honest about the menu & recommended her favourites. We really enjoyed them and cleaned our plates. Would recommend and definitely return when in the area again!
We came here last year and had the Eggs Benedict.  We are here with the family for breakfast.

Just from walking by the restaurant and seeing all the delicious food and smelling the amazing aromas ... I expected the food to taste amazing. But, I didn't expect the wonderful show. Nicole, the bartender, was an incredible sight. She hustled like nobody's business. The woman is a beast!!!

OMG! The applewood smoked bacon was crispy and amazing. We had the BYOO(build your own omelet), banana foster French toast and my dgtr hamburger and fries. Everything was simply delicious. This restaurant utilized the wait app which is pretty cool as it sends u a text message when u check in and one when ur table is ready. It also allows you to check your place in line via the link sent. I will say our wait time fluctuated in the app but we were definitely seated before the estimated time given.

Tried to go for breakfast there the day after Essence Festival 2019. BIG MISTAKE-lol. The line was wrapped around the door. Went back the next day and it was much better! The food did not disappoint at all! I had the bbq shrimp and my husband had the Cochon dish. The biscuits are the size of a baby's head- LOL. THE shrimp and greats were good. I ordered a pancake on the side( Carb overload!!!) but it was good.  My husband said he food was phenomenal- "next level" to be exact.  Great staff our waitress was funny.  Would go back again.

I would've given this 5 stars IF they would serve fried green tomatoes before 11 am. We went here for breakfast and it was delicious.  There was a wait of like 20 mins even early on a Saturday morning.****GET THERE EARLY AND EXPECT A WAIT**** Our waitress was awesome even though she was a Florida State Grad [Go Gators].  I really wanted fried green tomatoes but apparently they don't serve those at 10:20 am only at 11 am.  So I had to opt for the crab cake breakfast special, side of cheese grits, side of sausage...I was hungry and extremely hungover don't judge!!!!!  [see my pix]

Cheese grits were amazing, I could've ordered a whole bowl of those.  Crab cake was delicious too. My friend's husband got the Pork Debris Benedict and would not stop talking about it. IT was good, but he mentioned it 2 more times that day, and wanted to go back the next morning just for that.  He even sent some fellow colleagues there for breakfast too.

my suggestions are 1) serve fried green tomatoes before 11 am and 2) make a fried green tomato bennie 3) take reservations and only hold them for 5 mins

This has become our favorite breakfast spot to visit when we are in NOLA! The food is consistently delicious, and the service is wonderful! We enjoyed Freddie as our server!  He was very polite, attentive, and conscientious about our service making it an even more delightful place to visit! We will be back next year!!

Back in March I went to another Ruby Slipper location, I should have went back there. BECAUSE this location was Not worth the TWO HOUR wait...yes, we loved our food. But, I'm sorry the wait and hassle to check-in, be seated, and then wait for the food is NOT worth all the hype or two hours of my day to get it. When I gave the host my name he asked for my # and if we preferred indoor or out, I stated whichever gets me seated quickest. He said okay, we have a system that will text you when your seat is ready. I though okay that's nice smart on their part. The system failed! I got my initial text, and had the option to download Yelp so I could keep tabs on what number I was and how fast the line was moving. I was #38 in line to start. Then i started slowly getting closer. About 45min passed the. I was #8, perfect I'll head to go check in. Mind you i never got a text, I only knew this because I went the extra mile to download the app. I got to check-in and the host told me they already called my name and cancelled my reservation. Excuse Me! So, I showed him my app and how it still said I was #8 and to check in now. He then said oh I'll put you back at the top of the list and you'll be seated next. 4 tables of 2 say down, a table of, and a table of 6. So, was I really put at the top of the list?! I asked the host again. He then spoke to another worker and said we will seat you for the next table of two. Are you sure, can I believe you...another host came out "Samantha, party of 2. Is outside alright?" At this point I didnt care anymore sure. We sat. We got a waitress who said it was her first day..she guided me wrong when I was ordering I did not get what she told me. It was still good, but not what I thought I was getting. She didnt check up on us. We got 1 refill of our drinks after chasing her down. My crabcakes Benedict  seemed a little overpriced for the size. And it DOES NOT come with a biscuit. All in all the food was good. NOT worth a 2 hour wait. So, plan accordingly. Take a # and wait!!!

It is always so beneficial going on food adventures with friends...I got to try some pretty amazing food as a result! Before going to NOLA, I did some thorough research on breakfast joints in our area and stumbled upon The Ruby Slipper Cafe.  Let me just get straight to the point on what to order and what to pass on: I would definitely order the Eggs Cochon and Corned beef benny.  I think the Banana foster pain perdu was too sweet and I got sick of it pretty quickly so I would pass on ordering that one unless you're craving sweets.  The egg dishes on the other hand are cooked to perfection, especially when it comes to poached eggs.  We came on a Wednesday morning and were seated right away.
