I can understand why this restaurant gets good reviews.  A pretty good extensive menu and I would definitely return to try some other menu items next time.

The eggs Benedict with pork was amazing. The vanilla iced coffee was great. My kids had meals that were lacking on a good day. The grilled cheese was blah frozen fries. The plain pancake was generic at best.
Great Breakfast/Brunch Spot! The food was amazing, waitress was great. I do recommend getting there early! The only downfall to this place is that they don't do reservations!

This was the best and most unique that I've had in a while!! Myself and three other people went to this place based off of Yelp recommendations. IT DID NOT DISAPPOINT. I had the Gulf Fish 'St Peter' which was a pan seared gulf fish of the day over a cheesy grit cake topped with a sautéed spinach and tomatoes topped with a skewer of grilled shrimp, finished with a creole mustard hollandaise. Scrumptious, tantalizing and fulfilling . The others had the shrimp egg omelet, and the Costa Rican. If you are in New Orleans you must try this place! We went on a weekday morning and it was packed but not busy. On the weekends I hear that it gets pretty crowded. For 4 people we spent $80. Credit cards are accepted and the service was great also

The weather this day was terriblllleeeeee & we sat outside. They definitely need more heat lamps to accommodate guests. I got the chicken & French toast- French toast was a little too crispy but overall it was a great combo super good. My bf got the st Charles Benedict which he said were amazing but should come with something on the side for the price. Would go again!
Delicious food and I love that I can have drinks with my brunch. I'm in love with all the sweet and salty combinations that are on the menu

This is another restaurant I will always eat at while I'm in New Orleans. The staff is ALWAYS super friendly, the food is just phenomenal, and even when it's busy the wait is never bad. HIGHLY recommend The Trifecta which is three different eggs Benedict on one plate. A great dish to figure out what you like, or a great dish to enjoy more of what this restaurant has to offer.
The food was very good.  We had 2 different types of eggs Benedicts. Their hollandais sauce was nice and light,  homemade biscuits were light and fluffy. Service was good.

The food was flavorful. The drinks are tasty. The service from the hostess to the waitress was terrible. The hostess was eating while checking us in and showing us to our table. I'm going to try the other location tomorrow. I heard they have a totally different vibe.

The wait was about an hour, but well worth it. They have a mini bar right by the front door to have a drink while you wait.

The food was so good!!!

Great food and service. Definitely worth the wait. Our server Freddie H was fantastic and very friendly. Our hostess gave us great recommendations. The shrimp & grits and grilled fish st Peter were amazing.

Solid brunch spot for sure. We came later in the day around 2pm and didn't have to wait to be seated, although the place was still quite busy. We each went with the benedict trifecta and boy, we should have just shared one. These were heftyyy. I liked the shrimp and chicken benedicts over the cochon. Coffee was okay. Service was good. I would like to come back and try more items.

Had a really great breakfast/lunch here on vacation. Sat by the window, it was super busy so we waited for​ about an hour. For coffee,​ I had their Creamy vanilla iced coffee, recommended by the server, so good. I am not a huge fan of cold brew, but this was different, it was vanilla syrup and nutmeg. Thank god for the menu item called The Peacemaker​ which allows you to mix & match any two benedicts. My boyfriend and I wanted to split but also get something else, so we settled for the Shrimp Boogaloo Benedict which was shrimp with pork over a fried green tomato​ on a biscuit and the Chicken St. Charles which was fried chicken w a pork tasso cream​ sauce, both were so so soooo good. ​We got their special french toast at the time as well to split, it was a banana fosters stuffed french toast, and lord do I tell you it was beyond amazing. It tasted like it should have been dessert.

Wow!  A phenomenal place with great food. The portions and huge, the food is delicious and the service is wonderful!  We waited over 30 minutes for a table and it was worth every second.  Do yourself a favor and don't miss out on this great place.
It was all great I've eaten here several times the wait staff hardly ever changes which is a good indicator that these folks care for employees and their customer base I loved all their food so far
Every time I come here I'm deeply impressed by the quality and care of the waitstaff and chefs. They are true professionals who care about highlighting local food and culture

Justin our server was super friendly and very helpful. My friend and I split the trifecta. It was amazing. We both agreed that the egg cochon was our favorite. Side of grits and fresh fruit rounded out our NOLA breakfast.
Outstanding food and service..highly recommend the mimosa..Bloody Mary..eggs Benedict  with fried chicken and Migas..so worth the walk

Was a great place went because it was right next to our hotel.  Actually just went in for a coffee but stayed for breakfast because everything looked and smelled so good. Good service and very reasonable
Awful the place was worn and uninspired for was lackluster at best. The biscuit was so rubbery it would've bounced

The wait to get into the restaurant was extremely long. The larger the party the longer you wait but it seemed that if some people buttered up the hostess to get their seat quicker. That was a bit discouraging but all in all the food was good.

The wait to be seated was pretty long however they provided outside games for everyone to enjoy until seated. After waiting about 1hr to be seated it took another 30-45 minutes before our food came out. I've only been to this establishment once therefore I'll give it another try. The food was a little above average but definitely not worth the wait.
I really liked my food. But there wasn't anything above average about the food, service or aesthetic. I wouldn't dissuade anyone from visiting, but you do have many other higher options.
Had a lot of character. Was not too busy. Food was good. Price was right. A winner!

Freddie was awesome.  Inviting, accomodating, + first class all around.  Mind you, on a busy ass "Saweeeet Pwussay Satday" -Plies voice.

Thanks Freddie!

My first time coming to Ruby Slipper even though I've been coming to NOLA every year for the last 2 or 3 years straight. I used the Yelp app to get on the waitlist before we even left the house. After we checked in, it did take another 30 mins before we were actually seated so COME EARLY. 
I had the Southern Breakfast which included two eggs (made to order), bacon, Stone grits, a fried green tomato and a biscuit. 
I also ordered a Grapefruit mimosa which was excellent. Jake was our waiter and he was very sweet and accommodating. I'm glad that I tried this famous local spot finally.

I'm not sure if it's just this town but the portions are huge.  My husband and I split the trifecta and we still had plenty leftover.  The trifecta consists of three biscuits, one had a fried green tomato, one had fried chicken breast, and the last one had roast beef on top. Each biscuit also had a poached egg on top.  They were all good just too heavy for me.  After eating we had to walk back to the hotel, probably needed to walk 5 more miles.
The food is always so good! The wait sucks but it's worth it! We always try something new and never seem to be disappointed. The bloody Mary's and mimosas are also great for your NOLA hangover!
Definitely worth a stop. Came around noonish on a Saturday so there was a wait. The Trifecta is huge, definitely could have been shared  with 2 ppl. So much food from that - got food coma.

Best breakfast in New Orleans.  Expect a wait but it goes fairly quite.  Order a hurricane and people watch. I had of course shrimp and grits and they were as good as expected.  Service is quick and good.  We will be back
Not worth the money if you are a tourist. The food they serve can be found in any brunch restaurant. If you are interested in NOLA food, go elsewhere.
Possibly the best breakfast I've ever had.  Bloody Mary was amazing as well. Highly recommend.
Amazing brunch spot, huge drinks, good service...this place gets crowded quick but was so good we went two days in a row! Highly recommend their mimosas and omelets!

Food was good, but the wait was ridiculous!  They had outdoor seating, but with the wait, some patrons were just taking the seats as available...management did not seem to care.
Were told maybe an hour wait...it was 2 hours!!! NEVER AGAIN!!

I am a big fan of the Ruby Slipper on Canal. I decided to try out this one on Magazine street. Excellent food and atmosphere. The Southern breakfast was perfect. Of course the biscuits are sheer perfection. The fried tomato was a pleasant surprise as well. All in all a fabulous experience. Kudos to Mandy and her trainee who did a great job.
This place was well worth the wait to get a table. The food was delicious. The bacon Bloody Mary was the best!! Wish we had this place in Florida!!

The food is delicious! If you come later in the day around 8:30-9 it's a bit of a wait but if you put yourself on the waitlist in yelp while you're on your way here you shouldn't have to wait too long. The Chicken St. Charles is wonderful as well as the Bacon-Infused Vodka Bloody Mary (according to my mother). Definitely give this place a try if you're here!
Order was incorrect, refused to fix the order. Manager had an attitude and said  I can either eat it or leave.

First of all, you HAVE to get on the waitlist on Yelp. The line is really long without. The food is totally worth it. This was our first meal in New Orleans and one of our favorites. Once we sat, the service was pretty quick and our waitress was super nice. This is an amazing place for brunch and not in the thick of the chaos of the French Quarter.

We have been there twice for breakfast.
The wait staff is very friendly and the food is fresh  and very good.  Go early !!
A great spot for tourist.  I sat outside enjoyed a wonderful breakfast and people watched.  The food is amazing!

Salmon Avocado toast was disgusting. Only tiny pieces of avocado that was brown and old and the salmon tasted super fishy. 
Benedict's were good.

It's worth the wait!! Make sure you do the yelp waitlist before you go.  Had the trifecta with a side of grits and cheese.  I must say I truly enjoyed each bit an explosion of favor and taste.  Each one was unique and provided its own taste.  I really loved each bite and ate it with a smile.  The wait was long but consider its a very popular place the wait wasn't bad 45 minutes.  Make sure you book ahead using the Yelp wait list. Not expensive and worth the money you pay.  Enjoy it because I did and I will return.

First time in NOLA and this was a MUST!! We went for brunch, I ordered the bbq shrimp and grits.. SO good! And what's even better is the fresh warm soft biscuit with this amazing sweet butter spread that they give you on the side! Staff was sooo nice and very attentive even though we sat outside. So relaxing to sit outside and sip on a mimosa. Prices were ok, I will definitely be back next time I visit New Orleans because there are so many good things on the menu it was hard to just pick one! Oh last thing, which is awesome since I'm in NY and we have the open container law... but when you're about to leave here they will ask you if you want your drink to go! How nice!? I just thought it was nice of the waitress to offer my girlfriends and I our drinks to go and even topped them off!

My wife and I found this place from the raving yelp reviews I read looking up best breakfast in New Orleans.. We ate here on our last morning in town and wish we had been sooner. I seriously would eat here everyday if I could. I ordered the Shrimp and Grits and the wife ordered the Eggs Cochon. My god, the Shrimp & Grits were some of the best I've eaten, but my wife's Eggs Cochon stole the show.. Two eggs over a biscuit with pork debris.. I hate eggs, but the pork debris was beyond amazing!!! I kept stealing bites off her plate and putting into my grits!! The biscuits are a whole other story, buttery and flaky goodness!!!! Overall I'd say this place Quickly became a favorite spot of mine for breakfast...

A great place to grab an excellent breakfast while visiting.  I was here for a work conference and it is very close to multiple hotels.  This is my 3rd time here over the years and the comfort food is always great.  Also they have a bacon infused Bloody Mary that is all the rage.  Definitely try if visiting New Orleans!

VERY good fried green tomatoes. :) 

Excellent eggs benedicts too. :) This is a great place to stop for breakfast before doing the French Quarter.
Absolutely fabulous food.  Everything we had there was superb!

Had BBQ Shrimp and Grits with a Biscuit. Other order was Fried Chicken and Biscuits. The shrimp was so tender and the grits smooth. Sauce was wonderful and the biscuit delicious. The Chicken and Biscuits scored just as high. Freddie took care of us and was so attentive and friendly. Thanks to all of you and we will be back!
I am sorry. I know these are local icons but I have never been impressed with either the food or the wait staff.

Loved this breakfast spot! Visiting from Jersey and the food was delicious. I got something that I didn't think I would ever eat and was so happy I did. I got the st. Charles chicken which was delicious and we also ordered the French toast botons which were almost like a dessert! The vanilla hot latte was so good but I wouldn't recommend the cold one. Didn't have that much flavor. But everything else was great and wasn't super packed which was nice.

Had breakfast here today and got the basic breakfast, eggs blackstone and pancake. Food was decent but we were very unhappy with the service. First our daughter got served spoiled milk, and then they kept trying to take our plates away before we were finished eating (like 8 times!). Lastly, we asked for the milk to be comp'd, and manager argued with us about whether it was actually spoiled or not.  We are definitely not coming back here!

Very delicious food and very good staff service. I would definitely come back. It was cold outside but didn't want to wait for an indoor table. We got our food hot enough to be yummy and a good temperature to the last bites even at an outside table. We don't dawdle though when we have a full schedule. Had the peacemaker (great idea) of shrimp boogaloo and eggs black stone   Hubby has the bananas foster pain Purdue. Both were delicious and filling to last us till late afternoon.
Larry Dembrun this place is always a good time and the food is amazing!
Amazing brunch. Recommend appetizers before breakfast!!! Fried green tomatoes and mimosas. Freddie H provided amazing service. Great place

Bloody Mary's while you wait on the street, boozy iced coffee to go, and large portions of fantastic food await.  Recommend getting on the wait list online, makes the process much easier and faster.
We had the bananas foster pain perdu, Benedict trio and bbq shrimp and grits.  3 platters for 4 people was plenty of food and we left in great shape.  
Prices very reasonable, overall.
Great place! Food is amazing and environment is awesome. Service is super fast even though there is always a wait.

This was my favorite breakfast place in NOLA! I HAD to have that spiced vanilla latte every morning...  Everything we had was amazing. The Bananas Foster French Toast and Chicken St. Charles is mouth watering. This place is always jam packed but honestly worth the wait. We went and sat at the bar a few times (hubby and I) and then we one day waited for a table with our entire group (12 of us) and they did not disappoint. Cannot wait to go back in April.

Both food and staff were amazing. I will give this place 5/5 rating. Our waiter Nabil was so kind and made sure that we got our refills for coffee/water. The portions are awesome and the food is fresh. While we were waiting for our table a waitress came outside and started us on drinks.
Surprisingly good. Had the salmon avocado salad. Waiter was friendly despite the fact he was ready to go home and we were sat in his station.
Jackie was great! We had a large party and she made our dining experience a breeze. Highly request asking for Jackie as your server! Will definitely be back!
Excellent food. Excellent service.  Freddie was our server and he did a fantastic job. Kept our drinks full. Very pleasant and had great recommendations. A must stop when in NOLA.

So close to a 5.

We landed shortly before 1pm & took a taxi to our hotel. We decided to walk in for a bite, since it was less than 10min from our hotel, check-in was listed as 4pm & we had yet to eat. Sure, we probably could have gotten an early check-in, but as I'm sprawled on the bed typiing this, I think it's safe to say we would have gone to sleep.

Walked up to a huge line at 2ish, 1hr til close. We expected a wait but since we were good with sitting at the bar, we got right in. 

Service was fast, friendly, efficient & sanitary. The bloody mary was fabulous. Water was offered along with drink 2, as food came up. Staff offered to answer any questions and checked in frequently. We were never made to feel rushed & were even advised to take our time, as closing takes a while.

We both ordered bacon-infused bloodies & combos of benedicts - giving us a total of 4 varieties. (Tried changing the picture caption to Trifecta, instead of Trificient, but it wouldn't stick.)

It was an excellent first stop. The deduction is for something that certainly didn't ruin our dining experience, out of 5 poached eggs between us, 1 yolk was hard cooked. I've no doubt we'll be there again before we head back home.

This place is incredible. First experience in NOLA and it's a must go to. Devin hands down the best waiter. So personable and completely transformed our first experience here at the Ruby Red Slipper. This place was worth the wait. Ask for Devin, he will not disappoint.

I got the Trifecta of course. I must try as much as I can. The shrimp flavor was amazing. That sauce was my favorite I think. And the fried green tomato had a great breading. The fried chicken was good too.

The cochon was OK, it's a lot of pulled pork which didn't seem super special. 

The special was a creme brulee pancake which was a pancake with creme brulee on it. We wished it came all over the pancake instead of a little gloop on top. That was what made it really delicious but there just wasn't enough.

The first day we picked this place because it was close. We went back the next day because the food was awesome! Not only was the food great, but the manager came over to a table with an older lady that wanted to tell him about her experience as a child. He sat down and had a ten minute conversation with her. You could see a light in her face as she left. I will eat here every time I visit!

There was some confusion about the location. I reserved our party for the Decatur street location and was in fact registered at this location. After some scrambling and another 40 minutes later we were being seated in the hustle and bustle that is The Ruby Slipper. Plates piled high  roamed past us as to entice us and confirm that we were in a good place for our hunger to be satisfied. Be warned that the wait on the weekend is intense! I'm sure Thanksgiving weekend exaggerated the feeling. The Ruby Slipper makes sure to serve you alcohol as you wait outside to blur the minutes (definitely a plus to being in an open container city) Peach mimosa was so worth it! The food is wonderful. Banana French Toast, Three Pigs Omelette, Benedict, truly unique and one of a kind experience. Justin our server was the icing on the cake!!
Expected a long wait, and it was about 40 minutes, but the bacon Bloody Mary, the food, and the service were well worth it.
Amazing place to eat! Food was fantastic and service was good. I come to New Orlean on work and this will be a regular stop from now on.

What I liked was the ability to get on their waitlist via the Yelp (well before arriving). When I arrived, I only had to check in with the host, and waited an extra 10 minutes (meanwhile others were waiting 45+ mins). 

I got the Trifecta and it was tasty. Eggs  Benedict done three ways. I got mine with the eggs scrambled vs. poached (I know, defeats purpose). Anyway, the entire dish was tasty and VERY filling. Truth be told, they could've used smaller biscuits. I also got the Ruby Mimosa which was good and well balanced; neither too much or too little alcohol.  

While the gals I was with seemed to not as enjoy the restaurant as much, I liked it and would return.

This was our groups first breakfast restaurant in NOLA, and it was a great choice. Our breakfasts plates were all delicious. The Mica was flavorful. Every-bite was savored! This place could improve their "buttermilk" pancakes. Pancakes were cold and flat. So maybe skip on those and just know that all the main plates were delicious and filling!

A very solid breakfast joint. The hostess said our wait would be 20 minutes but took our name/number for Yelp's new waitlist system (which is great btw) and we were seated within 5. We both ordered bennies: he had the fried chicken one and I had the fried green tomato one. The biscuits were huge. The hollandaise wasn't great (admittedly I'm a snob about this) and there wasn't enough of it. But my meal was excellent. Service was good.

Blood Mary's here are the best in at very least 6 cities. Including Miami Savannah and NYC. Spicy and perfect. 

The food is also delicious, try the banana foster French toast, eggs cochon, Migas and chicken st. Charles. You will not be disappointed. 

Have as many bloody Mary's as you can cuz they're not as good anywhere in the city. 

Also if your coming to New Orleans bring stretchy pants because the food is irresistible!

IT IS SO EFFIN COLD IN HERE!  IT is 40 degrees out...you do not need the air blasting. So 1 star.  Other than that...I Loved me some grits and over easy eggs...The Man did Shrimp and Grits.  4 stars.  Yes it was all delish...but I was trying to eat really fast bc it was getting cold really fast.  1 star.  Can you guess why?  We sat at the bar in the middle and watched the peeps.  4 stars. Friendly staff...they are not in a hurry so do not expect them to be...which we did not care...we were on vaca.  However this high maint tramp with a fake tan, bagged out eyes with her alcohol induced walk of shame looking self, came in and with all the seats available took her overly bathed in purfume nastiness and squeezed in next to us with her sugar daddy.  We left after 5 min of listening to her complain about everything and being a total B to the waitress.  The best part was the waitress snapped back and said..."you can go sit somewhere else or I can take your order"  lolol  The guy was hungry and ordered and the tramp was not happy but we know that not all that glitters is gold...poor thing could not afford to buy her own bfast...so she was trapped.

I stopped in at this place while on break the other day as part of my periodic search for good breakfast and lunch places downtown.  Upon entering, I was greeted by friendly staff and an inviting atmosphere.  While it was noon, I was still in a breakfasty sort of mood, so I ordered one of their specialty omelets, with the title of "three pigs", as it contained three pork products, with grits, biscuit and coffee.  The omelet was tasty, and large, with the aforementioned pork products being bacon, ham and sausage.  The grits were also fine and of a higher quality than what you can by at most grocery stores.  Plus they were prepared by someone who knows what the proper consistency of grits should be.  The biscuit had the right light and fluffy, but I thought it could have used  little more butter.  All in all, a really good  place.
The atmosphere was great! The food was amazing! Huge portions very filling. I would most definitely go back here again and recommend it to anyone visiting New Orleans.
Great food! I wish we could have visited again before leaving. I'll definitely be back when I return to NOLA!

Great food and great service. Almost didn't eat here as most dishes have meat in them but they are happy to make anything without meat (pescatarian style)  so happy we gave it a go. Julie was an excellent server and and very attentive. Recommended.

Omg, the reviews aren't lying. This place was outrageously good. We had a hearty breakfast that filled us up until dinner (and that's even with walking around this great city!) I LOVED the unique creations here and was impressed one could order two different styles of their benedicts on one plate! That's excellent for indecisive people like me. I ordered the Gulf Fish St Peters - a fantastic egg-less (but still protein packed) filling breakfast with the most amazing grit cakes I've ever had. This experience with grits was a first for my travel companions (they're city slickers from NY) and I'm glad to say it made them grits lovers! Do come here (or to one of their other locations) for breakfast if just visiting the area or even if you're a local - the menu is interesting, the portions are big, and the prices are what you'd expect. Excellent service makes this place a winner as well!

This was my first time in New Orleans, so I relied on Yelp to find a good breakfast spot. Ruby Slipper Cafe caught my eye because of the high reviews, and it did not disappoint! The food was absolutely amazing! Freddie was our waiter, and he was awesome! Everyone in the restaurant was so nice and accommodating.
OMG! So delicious. Best brunch spot...try the Banana Fosters Pain Perdu or the Louisianan Omlet or the Chicken St. Charles.

French toast batons are the right combination of sweetness with a crisp in every bite.  Batter was delicious, and if you like deep fried this is for you. 
Bacon was cooked right. We added potatoes, which needed a bit more seasoning, in my opinion. Scrambled eggs are just your typical eggs. 
Mimosas had the right amount of champagne. You do have to mix it since they do add a touch of grenadine. 
We shared the French toast batons and didn't finish it! Definitely join the waitlist through Yelp. It helped!

I loveddddd Ruby Slipper so much that I went twice during my 3 day stay in NOLA. I went to different locations but still had the best service. The food is good & the drinks are great. Definitely a go to place for brunch! 

The wait is pretty long but it's definitely worth it. 

Ps.. come to NYC !

Definitely worth the wait! I had the croque madame and drum with grit cake. Everything was hot and delicious. The grit cake was so delicious - it was a large cake that was cooked to perfection, golden crispy on the outside and flavorful and creamy on the inside. The drum was delicious! The brioche of the croque was delicious, the ham was perfectly sweet, and the yolk of the perfectly cooked over easy egg made a creamy sauce that pulled it all together.

We had breakfast @ Ruby Slipper CBD area wait time said 50 min but were taken 30min early. Freddie was our waiter. He was FANTASTIC!! Super attentive and got everything out in record time! The food was superb as always.
Great authentic Southern Style food service and food 5 star. Well worth the wait. We ordered the famous buttermilk biscuits with all the fixings including grits. Welcome to NOLA

Obviously one of the most famous places in the town. Lines are long, they don't do reservation, but you can download NoWait app or just join the waitlist here in Yelp. Service was on point. My friends got Spanish omelet, Migas and lighter version of Migas (i guess without yolks). They liked it a lot. I am vegan and i am well aware that New Orleans is not the Vegan-friendliest place in the US with there famous seafood dishes. I was offered B.Y.O omelet without the actual omelet but with sautéed veggie. I changed my mind when I found out I would have to pay 10$ for omelets I won't get and actually pay extra 0.75 for each vegetable I pick. I ended up with side dishes - breakfast potatoes and fruit bowl

Amazing!! Tried this gem for breakfast and we loved it! You can always tell good food when the line is long and people are willing to wait outside in cold weather for a seat. Fortunately we only had to wait about 15 min. They are famous for their eggs Benedict and now i know why! They looked so delish, I decided to try 2 different ones: sausage gravy egg Benedict and corned beef hash egg Benedict. Both were so dang flavorful I savored each bite. Their biscuits would be delicious alone as well, which is what my eggs were served on. My friends each tried a fried chicken egg Benedict and fried green tomato egg Benedict...they all cleaned their plates as well. They also tried a creamy vanilla latte, which looked Uber yummy. The waitress explained that they make their own mixture of cream and milk and vanilla to come up with the creamy part. And even though we were all beyond full, we had to have something sweet, so we decided to share white chocolate pancakes. We were all so full, we thought we would each just take a bite, so not to waste food. Those pancakes were so good we devoured them. If you are ever in NOLA make sure your stop here!

This place was as great as the reviews!!! We had the bananas foster and cinnamon roll pancakes! Who doesn't love a place that gets you drinks while you wait on the sidewalk?? They are onto something there!!

My wife and I come here all the time. We get a giant mimosa while we wait and the staff is always very friendly. The food is top notch breakfast food. The eggs Cochon in particular is ridiculously good. For a quick breakfast this isn't where you should go but if you're in New Orleans having a big breakfast where do you have to go?! This place is awesome

The food was just ok for me.  While they're Known for their  benedicts, I was in the mood for pancakes.  Not quite worth the 1+ hour wait.  I think you can be added to list before you arrive via Yelp.  Everyone at the table did enjoy their benedicts tho but I didnt try theirs. The service was great tho.
Amazing food amazing service. Loved the atmosphere. Try the  Eggs Benedict the pork one was delicious
Was so tasty! I got the St. Charles chicken Benedict and my friend got the bacon Apple Blackwood Benedict and we both loved it! I'm not a huge Benedict girl but I loved it and highly recommend.

I know people rave about this place, and I had a solid okay experience, but not over-the-top. Didn't wow me like most NoLa institutions. I sat at the bar towards the end of brunch time on a Saturday. I had the shrimp Benedict, which was alright, but I think I would have enjoyed traditional hollandaise, which this particular Benedict did not have. I did enjoy that it was served over a biscuit though, instead of an English muffin. I also had a grapefruit mimosa, which was refreshing. It is very loud in here, so I wouldn't necessarily recommend this placer if you are trying to have a conversation. There was a bachelorette party and other large groups of people here. The bartenders are friendly. They are super busy, but not too busy to attend to everyone. I may try it again one day, but there are lots of other spots on my list before this.

I thought I did a review on this but I was looking for a cute brunch spot and found this place. It was an hour wait but it went by fast and I didn't know I could click the join waitlist on yelp! Lol the customer service was great, there was also a server taking drink orders while we waited that helped a lot! Because we needed coffee. I got the st Charles chicken OMG so good! And my boyfriend got the breakfast plate and we were able to replace the toast with pancakes. It was a cute spot and not very expensive either.

Fluffy pancakes and fresh coffee! I had the banana nut pancakes with a side of bacon. Both were delicious! My boyfriend had the southern breakfast and he really loved the buttermilk biscuit and grits that came with his meal. Convenient location close to our hotel and the French quarter.

Expect a line for any worthwhile brunch place in NOLA. I came with a group of ten girls after a night of drinking. This was the perfect meal and well worth the 45 minute wait ( with ten people the waits long everywhere). They also came out and took our drink order of bloody Mary's and mimosas while we waited in line!!!! The eggs were perfectly cooked and the biscuit was literally the size of half my head and super delicious. The home fries are nothing spectacular but they were crunchy.  The French brioche dippers ( actually
Name escapes me) were amazing, 5 of us split them as a breakfast starter.  Great price, great portions!
This place is amazing, food is so yummy. Recommend the bread pudding white chocolate pancake!! Get here early, gets packed!

Brunch at the Ruby Slipper on Magazine was amazing! I had the Spanisb omelet with a side biscuit! Amazing. Newman was our exceptional server. Ruby Mimosas served while waiting for your table. The manager Talaris told us there is another in Orange Beach, Al. We can't wait to try it next week!

This place got one star because it was needed for the review to post. Short story this place was in fact  a nightmare.  
Long story:
We come to NOLA several times a year, each time we pass this place there is a line halfway down the block so we make another choice.
Today the line wasn't so long so we got in line for a 30 minute wait, 5 minutes in a guy came out and called us for outside seating although we had asked to be seated indoors, hard pass so after another 30 or so minutes we were called and told to stand inside, mind you there were 3 other people calling folks and seating them while we waited, after about ten minutes of watching other people being seated we stopped a hostess and asked if we were to be seated or not?  In a huff she told us that we were in the staging area and we needed to stand there until the table was cleaned...Soooo another 10 minutes we go to our table . We sat for another 8-10 minutes before our waiter came to take our drink order.  He dropped off the drinks took the food order and vanished..............We sat for 30+ minutes...our waiter then stopped by to tell us that " every time I pass you I feel like you want your food"  ... "Your food will be ready in about 19 minutes which is pretty gold for us when we are this crowded"  another. 20 minutes and the waiter brought the food by now My husband was not happy with this and it showed on his face " the waiter then said" what's your problem?" .... "I feel like you have been mad since you got here!" So that was the end for my husband he asked to see a manager , spoke briefly with her and we left it was too much the chaos, the loudness, the poor service, we couldn't take any more. Two hours+ and still no breakfast.....I'm writing this as I sit in another restaurant waiting for my breakfast. I don't ever have to go here... ever

Ruby slippers was an overall great experience. The menu had so many great options! they literally had a little bit of everything to offer. The wait wasn't long considering there was a big Steelers vs Saints game going and the restaurant was PACKED. Our waitress was really friendly. She made sure we had everything we needed and in a timely manor. 
The food was well seasoned and the shrimp and grits had a great flavor but I was jealous of my boyfriends plate after tasting his pulled pork and fried green tomato biscuits! If we ever went back I'd try that.
I highly recommend the margarita! It sounds strong and it is because of the amount of tequila but it's masked well. The mimosas are better than most I've tried but I'm not really a mimosa fan. 

My only complaints are that the stuffed French toast can only be stuffed with whatever the "stuffing of the day" is at the time and if you're looking to drink, the drink menu is very limited which was odd to me considering New Orleans is known for their alcohol!

Nah, you can do better. Over rated and priced. I think my shrimp and grits had 3 shrimp in it. It is the hip spot, but we will not go back. The croque madam was a dry disappointment. I did not see anyone in the group in breakfast bliss.

This was not as good as I expected. Our waitress was clearly not happy when we had 2 friends join our group. The look she had on her face said it all. She didn't ask if we wanted one check but put it all on one. It's pretty bad when everyone at the table noticed her irritation. The bathroom was DISGUSTING but the Bloody Mary was good.

Great open space and big menu. Had the costa rican and wasn't sorry (despite waffling over all of the choices). Would be nice to have gluten free options called out and maybe some bread options, but couldn't fault exection on what they served. Coffee was decent if a bit on the weak side (I still drank 3 cups so good enough).
My family and I had an amazing breakfast at Ruby Slippers. The food was great but our server, FREDDIE H was spectacular!! His service was quick  and prompt and the charm was an added bonus!

A major throwback to my weekend in NOLA back in July '18, but just like brunch...better late than never! I'm literally always the person who orders the sweet option on the menu, so no surprise I went for this dish - cinnamon swirl pancakes. This spot is seriously POPPIN' and if you're going to NOLA for a bach party, you'll want to make a resy here & make sure everyone starts off the day with a boozy iced coffee*~ I can't say you'll get the best hospitality I've ever experienced, but the food/drink/vibe is on point.

The food was good. I would recommend the peacemaker with the Chicken St Charles and the Cochin. The grapefruit mimosas were great. We got in line ahead before arriving with the online service so we had short wait.  There are lots of great place for breakfast and brunch in NoLa but this is one that is worth trying. Great service!

This place is okay but it is a tourist trap. My friend got the fried chicken & biscuits and she didn't really wanted to eat it when it first came out of the kitchen. The fried chicken looked a bit sad to me too. I, on the other hand got their other special, their BBQ shrimps and grits. It was okay. I liked the bacon butter and biscuits better than the actual shrimps and grits. The grits was like mash potatoes to me, it was not good compared to the grits I had at cafe amelie. And the shrimps are just shrimps that tasted and looked like it belongs in a Vietnamese spring roll. Nothing special. I also got their award winning bloody mary, which I thought was okay, nothing good or bad about it.

Yeah, should of gone to a hole in a wall instead of here...
The 50 minute wait was well worth it. Our server, Freddie H, was awesome and attentive. The food and drinks were amazing as well. Definitely recommend coming here!

I think I got really lucky because my hotel was just around the corner from Ruby Slipper.

I ordered the Peacemaker: Chicken St Thomas and Eggs conchon. Both were very flavorful. The Chicken St Thomas was slightly creamy from the sauce and crunchy from the breading. The pulled pork from the eggs conchon was mildly sweet and savory.

Though both were really good, I think the portion could've been slightly bigger. $15 is a little pricy.

Service was decent. We used the waitlist option on yelp and were seated pretty quickly after arriving at the time we were told to arrive. The only thing is that you gotta finish your food and LEAVE, otherwise they will come tell you to go. Place is super busy so I completely understand. So if you want to eat longer, eat at a nice pace :)

The food was AMAZING!! Our wait time was long.....however you can put your name on the list via their website & yes you will still have to wait a little bit when you get the Ruby Slipper. Just remember it WILL BE WORTH THE WAIT!! The candied bacon was the BOMB!! I will definitely return to the Ruby Slipper!!
Got coffee, mimosas, banana frosted perdu, n Louisiana style omelet. Sat at bar, John helped us out. He was very attentive n friendly person. Definitely worth it!

Come hungry!  This was the perfect breakfast to end our nola experience. The food was delicious and the staff was friendly and attentive. Only wish that we tried this place sooner, don't make the same mistake we did.

Crazy busy, but you already knew that about this place.  The menu is great and the food tastes good, but I was sorely disappointed with my dining experience.  

We wait over one hour to get a table for seven.  Staff was friendly enough, but incredibly unattentive.  Water glasses were empty most of the time.  The servers were busy, but hey, that's the deal when you work at a popular restaurant.  No excuse.  

The men's restroom was hideous.  Filthy.  Worse than a port o let.  The smell was like raw sewage.  

The food was pretty good, but totally not worth the effort we put in to dine there.  On the plus side, we dined with great friends and left full.

By far the best brunch in New Orleans and Kyra is an amazing waitress, I would recommend this restaurant to anyone the service is amazing and the food is a Match. 

5/5 ask for Kyra
Really good food!!! I go here mainly for the bacon blood Mary. It's the best Bloody Mary I've ever had!

Man I go to all their locations so you can't go wrong with Ruby Slipper.  Great service, a creative menu, and the food will never disappoint.  This location was the first I ever went to.  Make sure you check out the one on Magazine in the upper side of town.  Oh...their mixed drinks are on point!

My first experience with Ruby Slipper was a well worth it long wait to the Garden District location in March.  Seven of us shared our entree and found nothing lacking.  My husband and I visited the Decatur location on Saturday morning, split a flight of pancakes and the triple Benedict platter. Again just fabulous. The bacon and the cranberry mimosas were top picks as well. Went again on Sunday so we wouldn't have to compare another brunch and find it lacking. Lol

The place to go food breakfast. Hands down best in city
Love the bloody Mary's and daily specials

Two days later before my flight out I decided to give breakfast another try since it's basically next door to the hotel. 
I'm glad I did. 
This time I went down the eggs benedict side of the menu. 
I went with the shredded pork eggs benedict without hollandaise sauce, you don't need the sauce, it's flavorful enough without it. 
The biscuits they serve with the benedict are nice, large and full of flavor. 
BTW: the regular drip coffee is really good, not too strong or bitter with great flavor. 
4.5 stars on this meal.

A great breakfast location on the edge of Warehouse Quarters and French Quarters in NOLA.  I am an early riser so there were no lines to be seated.  The restaurant is much like a cute diner and service was great The portion sizes are hearty and enough to even share.  I enjoyed my sunny sided up eggs however I felt my biscuit was very dense and I was not able to finish my food. Go on an empty stomach and walk off the food shopping in the French Quarter afterwards.

This is a great spot! The wait is long but completely worth it.  My friend and I went for brunch on  Saturday and were quoted 1 hour 15 mins, they use the "no wait" app so you can leave and keep tabs on where your spot is.  They have a cocktail server for all those waiting outside the cafe.  She was extremely knowledgeable on the area and their spot! She suggested their Peace Maker to us which allows you to mix & match the Eggs Benedict (what they are known for).  They were amazing!!!  They also were running a promo that sent $1 of every mimosa purchased to Baton Rouge in their efforts of recovery.    
The place was started as a homecoming after Katrina as they built the pieces back together.  All and all, I would return to this spot time and time again.

I've been to this particular Ruby Slipper twice now--once as sober as a church mouse, once ready and willing to Sunday Brunch hard, which is a politer way of saying I got drunk. Five stars both times! The migas are A+, better than migas I've had in San Antonio. The BBQ shrimp and grits are pretty good--I could drink the sauce by the shot and the grits are perfect, fluffy and silky at the same time (how?! how they got such good grits?! witchcraft probably), but my shrimp were a little rubbery. I tell you this because if you're a square who lets something as innocuous as slightly rubbery shrimp ruin your time, you're not allowed to eat here. I'm sorry, but we don't need you hogging good table room just to be fussy Gus. Go somewhere else and I'll get in all the more quickly because of it. Eat at the bar if you can, because it's fun for people watching and conversation with others. Peach mimosa, ruby slipper mimosa, iced vanilla coffee all good good good. They do NOT rush you out of here on Sunday. We were there for an hour and a half and could've stayed longer. Use the nowait app ahead of time if you don't want to wait, as we waited in the comfort of our hotel before trekking out in the rain and when we arrived, it was only about 15 mins before we were seated (with 15 parties ahead of us, according to the app). Wait staff will come outside and ask if you'd like a cocktail (you do) so I don't wanna hear any moaning about wait times! If you want good food, drinks, atmosphere, and a less fussy (but no less delicious!) Sunday brunch, go to the Ruby Slipper.

Ruby Slipper Cafe has a noisy boisterous atmosphere. It seemed to be breakfast party time for some people who like to start their drinking early.  Meanwhile, I was enjoying sweet and tasty bananas foster, which comes with bacon.  There was a long wait for food even after we were seated. It's a bit crowded and no privacy. Good dark roast fair trade coffee. My side of egg over medium was cooked just right with runny yolk and firm white for $1.50. 
Small portion on Migas for my husband but he enjoyed it. 
Tv is on but no way can anyone hear it. (-;
Was an ok experience but wouldn't go out of my way to come here. We found that if we went somewhere else that takes reservations, we could get seated right away, and the food comes faster as well.

There was a booth full of hungry ladies next to us, and even though they had arrived before us, they seemed to have an endless wait for their food, and I felt sorry for them. We ate before they did.

I don't mean to complain too much. The food was enjoyable and our busy waiter did try to please. Ruby's is a fun place, just a bit too busy.

Place was completely packed, so we figured it had to be good with the size of the line outside.  The shrimp and grits did not disappoint.  Food did take about 40 minutes to come out, but I was not disappointed once it came out.  The server did apologize for the long wait and kept us informed on the delay which helped ease some of the pain.

The last time I was in Nola we were unable to dine here and I made it my mission to change that this trip. Ruby Slipper Cafe has great food and staff and I see why it's one of the most popular restaurants in Nola.

Food: Southern Breakfast, Buttermilk pancakes w/  bacon and a side of breakfast potatoes 

Drinks: OJ and Sweet Tea

Pros: Pancakes - super fluffy and not overly sweet. Biscuit - moist and tasty. Bacon - cooked perfectly and almost taste candied. 

Cons: Waitlist. You add yourself to the waitlist and it gives you a wait time (1-2 hours). Then at the 2nd hour you get a text saying are you sure you want to dine with us, send Yes. Sent yes and 5 mins later I got a text saying sorry you've been removed from the waitlist. It never said you have to check in to be kept on but I guess that's supposed to be insinuated? Grits - my friend said they were lackluster.

Overall we enjoyed our experience but I'm not sure I'll do it again.

On vacation from Los Angeles and we stopped in for breakfast. Was so very good! The Chicken St. Charles was one of my favorite dishes of our trip. Service was very good and we enjoyed it so much, went back a second time. We will be back on our next trip to Nola.
This place is amazing for breakfast. Get there early or expect a long wait. It's worth waiting for.  Make sure you get the Ruby Mimosa

The food was amazing and our server Freddie was extremely helpful to someone who has not been to the restaurant before. Freddie had high energy and really made us feel welcome and was extremely attentive. At our table of 5, not one of us had a compliant about the establishment and we all loved our meals!

Freddie was our server today! He was so lively & fun & energetic. I've never been to New Orleans but he was super helpful on not only recommendations for food but for places around the area to visit as well! I HIGHLY recommend going to this cafe & asking for Freddie as your server!

Omg! I loveeeeee this place. I crave the bloody Mary's almost everyday. It's def worth the wait! Our hotel was right around the corner so we put our names on the list early and waited at the hotel until it got closer to our spot. Sooo good!! You cannot go wrong with this place!

No complaints at all!! Must give this place a try. 

We checked in on Yelp to reserve a table while we were on our way and waited no more than 5 minutes upon arrival. Sat at an outside table which was quiet and nice. 

Service was on point and we never needed to ask for anything additional. The food came out quick and hot and was delicious. We actually had a hard time making selections because everything sounded so good, so our waitress was really helpful in answering questions and finalizing our decision. 

Would definitely go back to try more items on the menu.
Fun , delish different breakfast . French toast is to die for. Banana Foster and cinnamon are pieces of heaven.
Long wait. Host didn't seem to know how to accurately determine how long it would take to seat people. Food was delicious.
We've been waiting for one hour and find out that the bartender forget to order our dishes

I was so excited to finally try Ruby Slipper since we were not able to on our last trip to NOLA. I've heard so many great things from people who live here that this is the place to go for breakfast. I was less than impressed with my meal, actually our entire party of 7 was. Most of us ordered different versions of the Eggs Benedict and all of us thought it was just blah. The Fried Chicken Eggs Benedict was super dry and had no flavor to the seasoning whatsoever. The omelet was way overcooked and was brown looking. 

I have to say though, service was on point. Just wish I felt the same about the food.

Omg! Delicious.
To start the best bloody Mary. I didn't even have the bacon infused one but standard one is unreal.
The Benedict with two tomatoes (I'm vegetarian) was so freaking good! I will be going back Over and over and just order the same thing as it was perfect.
Went at 9am on a Tuesday and no line and got a nice area of the bar.
Service was also A+. Everyone was so nice.

Frankly, don't understand the hype for this place. Good sized portions, long wait, diner type ambiance. I had the smoked salmon Benedict and it was good ( the biscuit was harder than I expected but the portion size was huge)...
It was just ok.  I had to send my meal back and when the second one came my eggs weren't done. I was over it by then.

There was a 30 minute wait and I'm so glad we waited.  We were just ecstatic with the variety of the menu.  The food was sooo delicious.  We had the peacemaker Benedict with the Cochin and smoked salmon.  Very very tasty.   The the banana foster french toast was to die for.  The biscuits were the best I've ever had.  Highly recommended

It was SUPER busy! But the environment the ambiance made the time fly by. I sat at the bar area and most people were in town for the Essence Festival, the food is AMAZING! I got the cinnamon swirl pancakes, and it really tastes like a Cinnabon turned into a pancake. Amazing place to dine, would definitely return
Great food and service! It was one of the best breakfasts I ever had in a long time. Their staff were so accommodating and nice, too!!!!!!!

Visited NOLA for a few days, and came here for breakfast one morning. No Ragrets! Lol the food was delicious, and we had an awesome server on top of that! Will be a go to spot of mine again next time I visit. Went in sober, came out buzzed with a full belly of food. #foodcoma
Overrated! Do NOT waste your time waiting over an hour for this place. Food is not bad but definitely nothing special to wait for at all. It's literally just food.
Horrible customer service.  Spoke with the manager about it and all I received were excuses.  This was my first time at this location and I won't be visiting this location again!

Great breakfast place. Very large interior but still there may be a line outside. I was by myself so I found a seat by the bar section easily. The food was really great and the staff was very nice. Great for a breakfast visit.

Absolutely amazing food and great atmosphere! Freddy gave great services had great recommendations and made us all laugh! I would love to recommend something to order but everything is so good, you can't go wrong!
Low wait time! Amazing Benedict's and mimosas! Super staff! Must go to when visiting NOLA!

I added myself to the yelp waitlist at about 11:40 on Friday and the expected wait time for 6 was about 35-45 minutes. This waitlist feature is super awesome for busy places like this. It's also live so you can get a fairly accurate determination of how long it will really be before you get seated. All in all I got called at about 1215 when there was a table available outside but I opt to wait for a table inside which took another 20 minutes so we got seated at about 12:35. 

I ordered the trifecta with the boozy ice coffee. I had the coffee while waiting outside for our table so I was slightly tipsy by the time I got seated. It's a good drink that was essentially an ice cafe Au Lait with a shot of alcohol. It hit the spot since I was on an empty stomach. I ate the Chicken St Charles and Shrimp Boogaloo Benedicts while at the restaurant but didn't make it to the Eggs Cochon since I was so full. The chicken was a bit hard. It definitely had a lot of batter and not enough chicken but the flavor was good. The shrimp boog was flavorful, moist and delicious. I definitely liked it better than the chicken. 

The staff was very nice. Considering how busy this place gets, it's always wonderful to see that the staff can maintain their composure and great attitude.

This is THE spot for breakfast/brunch! They aren't open past 2pm, so everything served here is in the breakfast/ brunch category. 
Be aware! This is a very busy location! Make sure to make a reservation through yelp to get sat much quicker. I sure did! When I arrived I was sat right away. As I walked through the dining room I could see the many delicious plates. My server recommended a slew of dishes, all sounded just as scrumptious as the next. 
They have a Benedict sampler. Make sure to try it! They have a creative take on eggs Benedict and the biscuits they use are just the fluffiest ever!! Also, the pain perdue topped with the bananas foster is amazing!! The caramelized bananas are so good! 
This spot came highly recommended by locals and they did not steer me wrong! Make sure to check this spot out!!

I don't the hype...

For all the praise I got about this place I was completely underwhelmed. After a very long wait, seated at a table that wasn't clean, and a server that made a member of our party completely uncomfortable in under 2 minutes it leaves a lot to be desired. When the food finally gets to the table it's just OK. 

Maybe I was suppose to be drunk before I got there. While I found the food pretty heavy it lacked salt, seasoning, and just felt held over from the day before. Hollandaise sauce couldn't even help my eggs or very dry salmon. Bread pudding pancakes smelled great but tasted - ok. Plating is great though because the pictures looked nice. 

My best take away from the visit was good a/c and at least they are thinking about the environment by using paper straws!
Life-changing shrimp & grits.  Awesome Bloody Marys.  This place alone is what would bring me back to NOLA.

We were so excited to visit the Ruby Slipper, got up early, reserved our spot. Upon arrival we were stared at by several workers yet no one spoke to us for over 20 minutes. A walk in party behind us then were seated ahead of us. All good and well, no biggie it's time to eat! Or so we thought....a waitress tossed silverware on the table and we weren't greeted for almost 15 minutes plus, once greeted we ordered immediately. Our waitress was sweet but we waited what seemed forever for our food to arrive, enough to sip down two rounds of water and soda. We get our food, finally and it's COLD! Not warm, cold. At this point we're starving so we dared not to complain but as I sit here with my sad stale Benedict's I can't help but cringe that I have to pay for such lackluster food and service.

It is worth the wait... I was stuffed when we left.  Everything was awesome. If you're in NOLA you have to stop by!
I LOVE FRENCH TOAST!!!!

Because I have to give your location 1 Star. 

We placed our name on the list for a party of 6.  After waiting 45 minutes and 2 of our 6 were not able to join us due to a presentation at our time share, we were told "Tell is when everyone is here and we can seat you."  Not what happened.   The short and slender hostess told us sorry, you have been removed from the list. That's not what she said.  Then another hostess went looking for our name on the list and couldn't find it on the list. We changed our reservation to a party of 4 and then were told to wait longer.  We watched 4 more parties of 4 sat and they wouldn't provide us a table.  Multiple people stated that this place has Terrible guest service and I agree.  

Terrible service, hostess didn't care and shouldn't work in the hospitality industry.  Both of them have zero guest service skills and the sanitation  standards of their restrooms and staff, Yao g the restroom and leaving without washing their hands is inexcusable.  I will never go back, and I hope everyone reads this and understands how terrible an establishment this is as management doesn't care for their guests!!

It was great to start out on our 15 min walk from the hotel to this cafe having already added our name to the wait list. There was a cocktail waitress outside to take orders so a Bloody Mary eased the remaining wait time once we got there. The dilly beans in the Bloody Mary were crisp and awesome and spice level was perfect. When my name was called there was only a table outside and we were a little cold so turned it down to wait for the next table for 2 inside. After several parties were called and I wasn't one of them, and according to yelp I had been sat, I had to go re-add my name to the wait list as the host had apparently marked us as having been sat. 
We sat at the bar and were given more than ample time to look at the menus. After ordering, the bartender who had taken our order didn't really make eye contact again. Had to get his attention for a coffee refill. Watching other bartenders tells me we would have had a different experience with someone else. 
I had the corned beef Bennie - it was good, a little rich for my taste I think because I got an extra egg because one of the poached eggs had broken.  There were only a couple of bites toward the middle that had any sense of horseradish cream - had their been more of that tang I think it would have brightened up the dish a bit.  
All in all, it was fine.

This was my last meal before heading to the airport and it was a great way to go out.  I had the bbq shrimp and grits and it was so delicious -- oh that gravy!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!  I paired it with the bloody mary infused with bacon vodka.  When I saw the bacon dipped in the drink I just had to shake my head and sip.  It was so damn good!!!!!!!!!!!

Yes all day long to Ruby's breakfast!
Soggy french toast was bad and we had to wait in line. side of bacon was small.
Everything was delicious had the southern breakfast and the shrimp and grits services from Freddie H made the experience great
The food was excellent but the service could of been better . I didn't really get a refill till the end of my dinning but overall the food was delicious

My husband and I ate there for Sunday brunch. There was a small wait, but after eating there, it's not hard to see why! Sammy was our server, and he was FANTASTIC! He was super friendly, engaging, knowledgeable about everything on the menu. All the tables on the patio were talking to each other by the end of meal, which was due to Sammy's winning personality.

The food was amazing, and even with how busy they were, came out very quickly. My husband, who is normally a slow eater, finished everything on his plate before I was halfway done with mine. Flawless service, fabulous food-we will be back the next time we're in the area!
We stayed in the Pelham Hotel above the Ruby Slipper. The Bloody Mary and Ruby mimosa was the best and our brunch was delicious. We went there twice on our trip.
Found this place withe help of Yelp!  Nothing fancy but the food rocks.  The Eggs Couchon are awesome. Give it a try.

Wow. What a breakfast! Irish Coffee, Banana Fosters French Toast, BBQ Shrimp & Grits with Biscuit (YOU HAVE TO HAVE THE BISCUIT) with cinnamon butter. Everything is so delicious, I just want more. But I'm so full... So I'll come back tomorrow.

I ordered the "Grilled Fish St. Pete," but they were out of the grit cake, which is apparently a major flavor booster for it, lol. I actually enjoyed it without, they doubled up on the spinach for me, and the flavors were good. The menu was impressive too, being a breakfast/brunch place, they have a good balance between sweet and savory. The only reason I don't give 5 stars is the waitress was rather rude and kind of had a "whatever" attitude.

What a gem in NOLA for breakfast and well worth the wait if there is a line.  My wife had the Bananas Foster French Toast and I had the Chicken St. Charles.  Both cooked to perfection and delivering big taste.  Highly recommend  Ruby Slipper Cafe and they have a few throughout the city, so you don't have to wait in line to eat great food.

Worst service from the two front ladies, do yourself a favor and go elsewhere. We had put the right number of people in our online wait-list, they projected a 30 minute wait, and then messed up the order and made us wait an hour to sit down with two pregnant ladies and a baby in our party.

Food was mediocre at best, service was worse, and after they made us wait an additional hour and finally sat us the front staff barked at us for not having our full party and when I said my sister was changing her baby because her kid couldn't wait an hour, she rolled her eyes at us. So yeah, we won't be returning.. I'll go to the butcher or Stanley's instead.

Awesome brunch!!! We ordered the skinny Florentine and the Hot Smoked Salmon Bennie. Both were outstanding!! The goat cheese in the Florentine was the perfect touch! Alberto was a fantastic server, very knowledgeable about the menu and made great suggestions. We thoroughly enjoyed our experience. A great stop if you're in New Orleans that's a little off the beaten path.
A must have brunch if your ever around....good food good service good people good vibes....ask for shawn he wont let you down

Freddie was our waiter and he was really good and cool! I liked him and how helpful and welcoming he was towards me and my family. Now on to the food... my gosh it was awesome. I had the corned beef eggs Benedict and the only thing I would have changed is to add more cream. But other than that and the paper straws it was phenomenal! I would totally go back here!!
Amazing food and service! Well worth the wait we had the Southern breakfast and shrimp and grits. Our server was Rakhal and she was so attentive given such a large crowd truly an awesome experience.

We waited around 20 minutes to get in on a chilly morning. Needed to keep our jackets on, as our table was near the door.
I had the Shrimp and Grits and they were sublime! Perfect blend of savory shrimpy goodness married with the creamy grits. A very dense and crunchy biscuit was a nice foil to the grits.
My wife had a double Bellini that was just o.k.  

Her Eggs Cochon, their signature dish, was impressive to look at, but contained too much pulled pork, which basically dominated the flavor of the whole dish. You couldn't taste the hollandaise and the poached egg, soaks into the pork and underlying biscuit, creating a dense and unappetizing combination. Less pork and more complexity is needed.
Love the Ruby Slipper. Every time. It's usually a little busy. But if there is a wait it isn't long. The food is always great. The service is always great. Great vibe.

My husband and I needed breakfast and we were told to try The Ruby Slipper. We are so glad we did. He got the crepes stuff with pineapple cream cheese and I got The Peacemaker which is two different eggs benedict of your choice. We loved it so much we went back again the next day. The meals were amazing and the staff was exceptional. IF you are in New Orleans and want a place that will be your go to spot every time. This is the place to be. I would go early in the morning, we got there around 8 and by 830 there was a line down the street. It would be worth the wait if you were in that line.

The food was very good but the service was horrible my waiter was very rude, continuously getting our orders messed up, told us plenty of times that we could not do certain substitutions, When we asked for staws he told us that they were of of them but when we asked another waitress for them she gave us them with out a problem. He never checked on our table and didn't even know his name. We told the manager about our service she was really nice about it but the guy never came and apologized and honestly he needs to be fired I will never return to this restaurant I was very disappointed.

The food here is great and the service is also awesome. The waitstaff is kind and honest/forthcoming about menu items. We had a variety of  different dishes from savory to sweet and enjoyed it all! Would return.
Service was terrible, my potatoes were burnt. Nothing to rave about. I had the gulf shrimp omelet. Tasted like salt water, not a fan.

Excellent food. Large fun hole in the wall atmosphere. No reservations, but can put name on the list in advance or go by 8:30 mid week.
It's for breakfast but has sandwiches and a few other things if you want lunch food. Any of the  Benedict are outstanding or mix it up with half and half called the peacemaker. Pancakes are delicious and huge. Stuffed French toast is like dessert. We went two mornings in a row because they open early.
Freddie at the Magazine St. location is the absolute best. Great service, huge portions and amazing food!

We had an early breakfast, (got right in- no wait at all), at the Burgundy location this week.   Great service, best breakfast we had this past week in New Orleans.  I'd definitely recommend that you go- I don't think they take reservations but I saw that you can get on their "wait-list" online.  We arrived right at opening so no need for that, for us.  I will go again, for sure.

Definitely underwhelmed with food quality here. Love the idea of the " double' mimosa but it tastes cheap. Had the " smoked salmon" Benny which was actually canned salmon Benny. I was thinking.... Uhmmmm... Where is my dill and capers? I guess...ate it anyway. Place seems clean. Server wasn't the best. Not rude but slow and uninterested. She smiled and was pleasant but seemed disconnected. Maybe not her day. Won't go back. Chicago brunches set a high standard.

Not really sure about the hype around coming to this place for brunch. I did the online waitlist through Yelp. However once I got to the café the waitlist told me I was fifth in line and to check in with the hostess. By time I checked in with the hostess from getting the notification to check in, the hostess had already taken my name off of the waitlist. This was pretty annoying considering I had already been waiting on the waitlist for an hour. Due to this inconvenience, the hostess did say that she would put me back on the list and then I would be the next person to be called. After actually sitting down and being able to order and to eat, the food was not all that good. I had the French toast tower, it was decent but it wasn't the best French toast. My friend had the cat fish and grits and it was majority grits and not enough catfish. Most likely would not come back to visit, especially since the wait was so long and the food was not worth the wairs
The food was good, the coffee was good but the place is a literal Petrie dish. Needs a thorough cleaning.  Also a very loud joint that could use some sound abatement.
The Benedict's were awesome! We all got the peacemaker and chose two of them. We got sat quickly with the waitlist option on Yelp. Had it twice since being in NOLA!

Yum! This place lived up to it's hype and was worth the wait for me. Try the Grilled Fish "St. Peter"! The redfish of the day was cooked perfectly and was served with a delicious hollandaise. We also ordered the Peacemaker which allows you to choose 2 different kinds of Benedicts. The Eggs Cochon (pork with hollandaise) was my favorite: so creamy and flavorful. The Chicken St, Charles was not bad, but a bit drier than I would have liked.

Ruby Slipper
I really wanted to like this place! I walked by this restaurant a couple days ago. There was a huge line wrapped outside so I thought it would be good and decided to give it a try. They have a couple outdoor benches which was perfect because I had my dog with me. 

The bacon Bloody Mary was a perfect drink to start off my morning. After reviewing picture on Yelp, we decided to get the:

Shrimp and grits - probably my favorite thing I ordered today. Shrimp was cooked well and the sauce complimented the shrimp and grits well. 

Madam Croque - basically a French toast sandwich with ham goodness inside. This too was also great however it was a lot of bread. We dismantled it and poured maple syrup all over the French toast. By the way, the fries were cold when we got it. 

Then we mixed the benedicts
1/2 St. Charles (fried chicken)
1/2 corned beef
It looked great but when I cut into the egg, I saw that the egg was over cooked. After a couple minutes, our server came by and we asked for poached egg. No problem! Instead of taking the dish back, he said he would bring us a side of poached egg. We removed the over cooked eggs with the sauce on it and after waiting for a while, our dish became less appetizing. When the poached eggs came, we asked for extra hollandiase  sauce. He never brought it out even though we waited for like 10 minutes. Our benedicts got cold and dry so we just picked at it. 

Our server a asked us if anyone brought out Hollandaise sauce for us and when we said to forget about it (because it took so long) he already had our check ready in his hand. Boo! Super disappointed in that last dish. Wish it was better service!
Great place! Worth the wait!! Benedict's were amazing. Service was excellent-shout out to Freddie our server!!

This place is awesome! Great food and drinks but the SERVICE was EXCELLENT! Our server Freddie really provided an experience for us. I highly recommend the Redy Slipper! *its a good idea to join the waitlist prior to arrival, you'll save a few minutes on line.
The reviews tell it all. Wonderful service with a smile, fairly priced, and good food plus the coffee was great. Loved it and except for the wait would be 5 stars

We ordered the banana pecan pancakes, shrimp and grits and the shrimp benedict. We confirmed that the pork products could be left out so felt comfortable and excited about our choices. 

The pancakes came out with two slices of bacon right on top (no problem, we moved it to the side and dug in). After my husband consumed basically the entire thing, I notice a few finely chopped up bacon bits in the remainder of his pancakes. We were really bummed out as we avoid pork products for religious purposes. This made me nervous as to how pork free my shrimp benedict was. 

For those with no dietary restrictions I say definitely come try this place out and be prepared to wait if you don't show up early. For those with dietary restrictions (I could see vegetarians being pretty bummed out if they discovered bacon in their pancakes) I say go but be very clear about your requests.

It seems like there's a million of these around town so we had to try it. When we arrived there were crowds of people waiting outside, but they let you join the waitlist in advance through Yelp, which is nice and allowed us to get seated just a short wait after actually arriving. Its a big space with a lively crowd, they have some high top and picnic table style seating outside too, which we were lucky enough to get.

They have a long menu with everything from breakfast sandwiches to french toast to many different egg benedicts that you can mix and match between, this is kinda their specialty. For my meal I went with the shrimp and grits and since our group was feeling ambitious we also got the bananas fosters french toast to share among the table. The shrimp and grits were pretty good, they had a nice flavorful cajuny sauce with a good amount of shrimp. The biscuit it comes with is huge and dense and almost a meal in itself. The real winner was the french toast though, which was 3 huge pieces of french toast, this is definitely a shareable dish. The french toast is smothered in syrup, bananas, and these sweet raisins which make it soft and so delicious. This is definitely a fun and popular place to come in the new orleans with some yummy options.

Definitely worth the wait! Came here the day before we were #46 in line. Used the waitlist and got in so much quicker #11.  Food is absolutely delicious and fairly priced.  It's a must go when in NOLA.

I ordered the Chicken St. Charles eggs Benedict.  It was out of this world good.  The fried chicken breast was crispy , well seasoned and very tender.  It was totally worth waking up super early to beat the rush. Our server was very attentive.   This is a place I will return to !!

This Ruby Slipper location is my favorite. The food is always delicious, and the staff is always superb. Fred was our server, and we came back twice to see him!  His positive attitude, attention to detail, and spirit alone would bring me back time and time again. (Get the cochon benny  You're welcome).
AMAZING  Overall a great experience. A special thank you to Freddie for his recommendation for the mix and match eggs Benedict

The people of New Orleans are so lucky because they have access to Ruby Slipper Cafe any day! Right now, I'm at home reminiscing about this amazing breakfast. 

Luckily, Yelp let me know that the wait was over an hour. Since my hotel was only a few minutes walk away. I went ahead and put my name on the list via the Yelp app and finished getting ready for the day. When I arrived, I had a short wait and was able to keep up w/ my place in line w/ the Yelp app!

Yelp (and the bartender) also helped me decide that I had to have the Chicken St. Charles if this was going to be my one and only trip to the Ruby Slipper. It did not disappoint. Everything about this dish was well thought out. The flavors (such great flavor!) and textures all worked well together. My favorite breakfast while on vacation in NOLA.

Have had breakfast here many times and we are never disappointed.  Menu has a variety of options and all are delicious and presented well.  Service has been very good and attentive.  Recommend it, even if you have to sit at the bar.

Had the Bananas Foster...Fantastic!  My wife had pancakes and she really enjoyed them. Too much for her to finish. Hostesses and waitress were great. I definitely recommend Ruby's for a great breakfast/brunch!

Don't get me wrong I loved beignets.  I could eat them every day, but sometimes a girl needs bacon and grits.  Thats where Ruby Slipper comes in.  Fantastic service, cocktails looked great, but I'm not a fan of the hair of the dog.  Long wait, but worth it!!!!!  Table of 6 and the winner star plate was the eggs cochon.....poached eggs, over pork debris, on a biscuit and layered on top hollandaise sauce.
Shawn is the most awesome waiter. Love love love Ruby Slipper. Get on the wait list and go..

A MUST WHEN YOU VISIT NEW ORLEANS!! Came twice in the weekend of my visit and it was worth the wait!!! Amazing food, our waiter Freddie was just so pleasant and made sure our food came in a timely fashion. I got the peacemaker Benedict--AMAZINNNGGG!!!
The food was good! The biscuits were soft and moist! The waiter Devon was very attentive!

5 Stars for Arielle alone! She made my experience EXCEPTIONAL! Her warm smile, amazing stories, knowledge about the menu and food in New Orleans is something I will never forget. She made my boyfriend and I feel at home here, even though we are Niners fans (haha). The food was good, I'd give it 3-4 stars . I had the shrimp & grits, and my boyfriend had the trifecta. The biscuits are thick and rich, and fill you up fast . The customer service was amazing from the friendly hostess Mackenzie, to the sweet bartender Theresa. Ruby Slippers has a GREAT TEAM here, and I will definitely be back!

What a great place to grab a bite to eat, be prepared to wait 30-45 mins before getting seated but believe me it's well worth the wait. Great atmosphere, the service was great but the food was a 5 plus. I had the BLT which was the best i've ever had. The bloody Mary infused with bacon was out of this world....will be back for sure...
This place is awesome a must come and enjoy the atmosphere, staff, and food!! We got the shrimp boobaloo and grilled fish St. Peter

10am on a Saturday morning and the place was packed! We had added our name to the e-waitlist, and were seated at the bar within 10 minutes. Not bad for a place with the lines overflowing to the sidewalk.

The bartender was very friendly and we started with the Ruby Slipper mimosa. It was fine, nothing special. The coffee was typical diner coffee.

When it came time to order, the bartender recommended the bennies. My husband ordered the Chicken St. Charles with a poached egg. It arrived on a massive split buttermilk biscuit with hot, crispy chicken and a perfectly runny egg. He loved his meal and cleaned his plate. I ordered the peacemaker, which is a mix-and-match of two different bennies. One half of my biscuit was the shrimp boogaloo, which was perfect! There were shrimp, fried green tomatoes, sausage, and a sauce heaped onto the biscuit, and I couldn't inhale it fast enough. The other half was the smoked salmon Bennie, which I did not enjoy. The flaked salmon was dry, I didn't get enough capers to cut through all the fattiness, and it wasn't seasoned well. If I had to do it again, I would definitely get a full order of the shrimp boogaloo and leave ten pounds heavier and happier!

We ended our meal with bacon infused Bloody Marys. According to our bartender, the vodka is infused in-house with bacon, and the drink itself is tangy and spicy and just right.
