There are multiple garnishes, including lemon, pickled dilly bean, and a perfectly crispy slice of bacon. This drink alone is worth coming back for.

Overall, this place is cute, friendly, and the food is worth coming back for.
This place did not disappoint. The bacon praline pancakes were amazing, but a bit much for me. Bring your appetite when you come here, you will enjoy.

Amazing service and great location, the entire staff at this restaurant was very welcoming and friendly from greeting, seating, placing orders and up till the end when you depart the restaurant. Walking up to get confirmed a seat and waiting a minimal time considering the high rush from the crowd is great work ethic from the Ruby Slipper Team. I would eat here every time I come to New Orleans and that's not common for me to want to frequent the same restaurants. Food was delicious and came out to the table in a timely manner, the seasonings were done just right. The biscuits were slightly hard and did not seem baked fresh but decent to eat. All of our order was prepared exactly to our liking (there is a picky eater I traveled with- and he was very happy with his meal) I was impressed with how the cleanup service was, the folks working here truly were pleasant.

This place is amazing. We had the salmon omelette, the bacon infused Bloody Mary and the salad. It was all delicious. We went three of the eight days we were in Nola and there was a wait each time but well worth it. They won't seat you until your entire party is there even for a party of 2. I highly recommend. A must try when you are in town.

Visited in 2016 and back in NOLA this past week. Visited again and were just as pleased as the first time.  Migas were great and a nice portion but not too big.  My son had the chicken biscuits and they were the best he's ever had. Short wait time on a weekday visit.

Enjoyed an awesome Sunday brunch at Ruby Slipper. Peach Bellinis are excellent!! Fieldrose was an awesome waitress. She made suggestions for food and drinks and she was 100% spot on with what we asked about.

Have been in NOLA for three days and have been to Ruby's two of them! We had to have the delicious white chocolate bread pudding pancake and the egg benedicts one more time. You won't be disappointed stopping at Ruby's!

Looking up the reviews prior I knew that the food at this place was going to be incredible and i was right. Although we had a wait time of 2 hours i can honestly say it was worth it. We ordered the fresh toast, cinnamon swirl pancakes (omg), chicken st Charles and the food was AMAZING! This place is definitely worth hype.

Worst service I have ever experienced. I sat at the bar waiting to order for 10 minutes while the bartenders walked past me without making eye contact and then after ordering my breakfast sat and waited 50 minutes for my eggs over medium with bacon. When it hadn't come out after 30 minutes, I inquired about it because the gentleman next to me, who had come in after me, was already eating his omelette. At 40 minutes, I requested it to go because I was going to be late for the opening of an exhibition. At 50 minutes it finally came out with no apology or explanation. Once I got to my exhibit booth and opened my to go box, my order wasn't even right!!
Great food. It is perfect for anyone, and has lots of options. It has anything from breakfast to lunch items and everything is good. I recommend if you're in New Orleans to come eat here.

If you're looking for a good breakfast and some drinks...look no further! While waiting in like an extremely waitress came out and let you order drinks while you waited. 

GET THE BRANDY MILK PUNCH!!!! You can thank me later! YUM!!!

I had kept it simple and got the pancakes with bacon.  Just a regular breakfast classic they pulled off great.  Good pricing, clean, and friendly service.

Again!!! Get the Brandy Milk Punch!

Found this place on my first day in NO using Yelp!  It was very good!  Very good indeed!  The first day I got a breakfast sandwich to go which wasn't great by the time I got it to my destination, but that was my fault.  it still had a lot of flavor, but it was cold -- which again was my fault. 

The next day I ate in-house at the bar, which was delicious.  Friendly service and a lot of selections for breakfast.  I didn't try anything that didn't involve eggs, but it all smelled great.

The coffee was good, not spectacular, but for those of you who want to support a local business they give the cups to-go at the bar! 

give it a shot - I bet you'll be hard pressed to find a better breakfast place in NO right now!

Excellent place for brunch. Don't get scared away by the long wait it goes really fast. Once inside the smell will draw you to want to try everything. My waiter was amazingly friendly and so knowledgeable about everything on the menu he definitely steered us in the right direction. Must try when in the big easy!!!

Before I went to Nola I've heard so many good reviews of Ruby slipper Café. So I made it a mission to make it my first breakfast place when I was in the city. I checked in on the live waiting list through Yelp which I thought would be pretty helpful but when we got there it was so packed we had to wait about 30 minutes to be seated. It was possibly because we had a large group with us so that may have been the reason why we waited so long. When we finally got seated we were offered water immediately which was pretty nice. My table then ordered and our meals came out At a decent time frame. I ordered the country breakfast which consisted of grits, a hot biscuit 
,eggs,bacon and a fried green tomato. I also ordered a slice of avocado on the side for just one dollar. The prices were pretty decent which I enjoyed and the food was also great.
If you go make sure you join the live waiting list because it is a very popular location.
The mimosas, food, and service were excellent! We would definitely return next time to New Orleans.

A touch of Capitol Hill in New Orleans is how I would describe this family friendly brunch spot.  
Ruby Slipper??  The Horse of a different color?  There is no place like home?  I am not sue I understand the name.  However, their eggs, and fried catfish is a real treat.  Excellent coffee, and OJ make this a wonderful brunch place.  I cannot say much more until I try some other things.  However, a restaurant that makes families and kids feel welcome is highly rated in my book.  Oh yes, the home style corned beef hash is as fresh as you will find.  Looking for a family brunch in the Big Easy!  Ruby Slipper is as good as you will find, and will not disappoint you.

Food was overall delicious. French toast bites are a must. Grits were bomb. Bacon was on point, eggs were great.  The regular French toast was a little undercooked and the mimosas didn't taste the best.  Service was outstanding.

Incredible breakfast! I had the smoked salmon & shrimp boogaloo Benedict and my hubby had the bam bam biscuit. We also enjoyed the espresso, Bloody Mary and mimosas! Definitely eat here, just know it may take 2+ hrs.

Jason the manager/host whatever greatness he is..... Absolutely wonderful!!! He's diligent with getting everyone sat as quickly as possible and SUPER FRIENDLY even in the midst of absolute chaos (as is expected on a Saturday in New Orleans). 

Wonderful recommendations and demeanor.
The food is delicious, but check in on Yelp well in advance, and arrived at the suggested time and were told we had a 20 minute wait that turned into almost a hour.  Our server was great

Food is great. Service was great. Slow, but our server was alot of fun and made it a good experience despite the crowded restaurant. Don't spend your time waiting around, they will tell you how long your wait is and then text you when it's time. Spend that time looking around the area or go back to your hotel until they text you.

This place was great. DEFINITELY LOOOOOONG wait. But totally worth it. We used the Yelp "Waitlist" option and put our names in that way for an hour wait. They do serve drinks while you wait, so positive. But its totally worth the wait. We honestly are debating on going back for breakfast.

It's a small spot but there's so much going on. The staff is super nice, and the food came out super quick. I ordered the french brea french toast..wow that was SO good! I didn't even finish the whole thing and it was definitely different than your normal french toast. Recommend if you are looking for a breakfast spot in the NOLA area.
We had a fabulous breakfast at the Ruby Slipper on our way to the WWII Museum. Freddie waited on us. Aside from giving us excellent service he was very knowledgeable about the area and quite helpful.

There was a long wait. Get on the list prior to actually showing up using Yelp I believe (my wife handles such affairs). We were seated at the bar. Don't be in a rush, or you'll be upset. That being said, the food was pretty good. I had a BLT with fried green tomatoes, and it was pretty darn good. I checked out the orders of those around me and all looked pretty good.

Great breakfast/brunch food with excellent service. I got the bbq shrimp and grits, which was delicious. My only complaint is I wish the grits had been cheese grits.  And the biscuit that came with it??? Omg. It was the size of a saucer!!! Soooo good. The Hello Sunshine cocktail did not disappoint. Neither did my husband's Bloody Mary.  Our server Freddie was very attentive and did a great job. Check in online for less of a wait.
Freddie's service was 5 star.  Great service & recommendations.  He was patient and caring and took his time to ensure that we were satisfied with our meal.

I placed an order online for pickup because this is the only way to order. I received a confirmation text for my order and walked to the restaurant. I was left at the bar when asked for my food. I asked another lady who was really nice and she checked but had to get the manager. The manager said they didn't have my order and she would check another location. My order was never found. She said I could wait another 30-40 minutes in line and pay again or she could try to figure out later today what happened. She could not give me a refund at the time so I was left hungry. I called the website that took the order and they said I would have to contact the restaurant. Almost 2 hours on the phone with my bank and everyone acts like they don't know what to do. I just want my money back. I paid and tipped but got no food. The manager could have accommodated me better after I showed her my order screen.
Pretty good! I had the Pacemaker which is 2 different Benedictts! I had Chicken St. Charles and the Eggs Cochon. Both were good! Chicken was a bit dry but the hollandaise sauce helped! I'll be back!

This place was just OK I was a little underwhelmed by the food. I've seen it all over social media and always wanted to try it so I finally decided to. The service was good the food was alright.. I feel like I could've made it just as well as they did maybe even better because it was pretty room temperature. I also didn't love the hollandaise sauce but I guess that's just my personal opinion. Also the wait for the food was pretty long and I was very hungry at the time it just wasn't everything I expected maybe I will try again someday and order something different.
(I ordered the st Charles Benedict btw)

Always a great breakfast. Been a while since we have been there with the Covid-19, but since they were giving free breakfast after hurricane Sally, we stopped in while walking around looking at the damage to our great town of Pensacola. Great crew here in Pensacola! We return sooner.

Bloody Mary's were among the best I've had-- the bacon infused vodka was incredible, very flavorful. We loved all three of the eggs Benedict's we tried-- the seafood on the green tomato was fresh and delicious and the fried chicken was juicy. Service was slow but it was jam packed in there. We waddled back to our hotel after our breakfast and had to take a food coma nap. Yum.

This is best breakfast place in NOLA. The wait is worth it. The service was outstanding, quick and friendly. The food was served quick had tastes put of this world. I highly recommend this place for a NOLA breakfast experience.

Tourist trap! People are nice but service isn't great and food was less than average. Consider it the independent "Dennys". When they safe advertising on Yelp, it's a sure sign that it's not very good!

We visited New Orleans for a weekend and we were looking for a breakfast place. We used the online reservations and were seated within a few minutes of arriving. Great environment, very clean, friendly staff. I had the French toast with the filling of the day which happened to be banana pudding. Amazing. We also ordered some Ruby mimosas that were great. We really enjoyed our time here.

The mimosas were big and the food delicious. I would highly recommend both the St Charles Chicken and Cochen Pork eggs benedict. You'd be smart to get on the waiting list before you arrive so that you can basically just walk right in. If you're into brunch, this is the place for you.
FREDDY IS AMAZING! Extremely kind and excellent service, made the Ruby Slipper experience absolutely amazing

I was in New Orleans a couple of years ago and didn't get a chance to try out the Ruby Slipper Cafe. This time around, I was super excited to make it out. I'm a sucker for eggs benedicts and the RSC has plenty for you to choose from. I had looked at the menu before even stepping in line. Oh... the line, even though Yelp tells you that there's no line... you'll be waiting at least 10 mins. I sat at the bar and ordered the Brandy Milk Punch which was light and delicious. For food, I had the stuffed cheesecake french toast that came with a side of bacon. Yaassss!! Give me some bacon! The french toast was not as sweet as most places so I was very happy with it. I couldn't decide between a few of the bennies so I opted for the "Peace maker" which allows you to choose two different eggs bennies. I chose the Chicken St. Charles and the Cochon. I didn't care for the chicken, it was just boring. Should've gone with the Shrimp Boogaloo ... fun to say and it looked amazing! The Cochon was reallly good. I would recommend the Cochon, for sure, it's pulled pork. The only thing I was kinda disappointed about was the eggs were overdone. 

The staff was friendly and efficient which kept the place running like a well oiled machine especially with the traffic they get.

If you are traveling by yourself, definitely sit at the bar because there are so many people from all over the place!

This place is BUSY for brunch time so reservations is a must. We made reservations while walking and our table was ready by the time we got there. The chicken St.Charles was decent. Fried chicken was good. Eggs were good. I just think the biscuit could have a little more flavor. The portion size is very good. I couldn't finish my food and the pricing is reasonable. I wanted a hot black tea but they didn't have any hot tea available which was a little weird but that's okay. Worth trying!

The food was delicious!! I HIGHLY RECOMMEND getting on the waitlist (offered on the Yelp app) before you leave for the restaurant!! There was a line out the door & down the street but our wait wasn't too long because we had our name on the waitlist before we left the hotel. The restaurant was crowded and a bit loud but the food was EXCELLENT!! We had the shrimp & grits, banana foster French toast, grits, omelette, biscuits & a butter mixed w/cane syrup!! EVERYTHING was scrumptious!! We normally have brunch at Brennan's when visiting NOLA but this spot was definitely a tasty replacement (and much cheaper ).  We plan on going to the Baton Rouge location.
I truly can't see what the hype is over this place. The food is terrible, the wait is ridiculous, and the service sucks.
Great service-food- coffee was the best. We went back the next morning. Highly recommend this restaurant.

Came here for brunch with a group and was unable to make reservation ahead. So was understood that there would be a wait but not as long as we waited. Luckily we were able to order a couple drinks in the meantime. After being paged for our table we were the told that our table was given away and that we had to wait for the next one. By this time of course everyone is pretty Hungry. Finally sat down and had a nice server that was patient n helpful with our party. I order a mimosa and the st gulf Peter. It came with a filet fed fish on top of two cheese grit cakes with a skewer of shrimp with spinach and tomatoes nestled on top of a mushroom Cream sauce. Delicious down to the last bite. No complaints about the dish at all. Although the people I was with weren't too impressed with their meals
Great breakfast spot. Excellent food, but not sure why hoards of people queue up for hours to wait for it- there are other good breakfast options too!

Absolutely loved this breakfast/ brunch. 
The menu has a variety of dishes sure to please anyone's palate.  They have vegitarian and light options that are packed with flavor. The menu item names are funny and pay hommage to New Orleans. Service was excellent and the waiter offered suggestions and gave more details to the items because you will find yourself overwhelmed! But the trifecta and peacemaker are my favorite. You pick 2 or 3 of any off the famous Benedict options this way you can taste a variety. 
The wait time is long but worth it you want be disappointed.  You can get on the waiting list via yelp they will give you a check in time and once you check in don't be surprised you will still have to wait but you are still ahead of the walk ups.

Here on vacation during Covid and Halloween. This is my second time being here for the trip. The food is hot, flavorful, and the customer service was great for how busy this place is. The first day being Friday we had Anielle as our waitress. Great small talk with excellent service. Food was amazing! So amazing we decided to come a second time. There was a longer wait but understandable it being the weekend. Make sure you join the waitlist on the Yelp app. 

This time our waiter is Jared. It was busier this day being Sunday. He still did a great job making sure we had everything we needed. I ordered a morning margarita and a mimosa. Both very refreshing! I ordered the same thing I had gotten last time. The peacemaker is a mix match eggs Benedict choices. I got the Bayou Shrimp  and the Blackstone options. Both times very delicious, seasoned well, and hot. Food arrived in just enough time. This was one of my favorite spots on my trip. DON'T MISS OUT!

Nothing has changed.  Ordered oat meal, the bowl gets smaller and smaller, toast came out untoasted. Mike why do you go back there? My wife and daughter love this place.  Fire marshal special is still there see photo taken yesterday (July 19, 2019)

Super friendly staff, loved the cocktail waitress that served drinks outside while you wait. Ordered the Peacemaker, which is genius because you are able to order two different types of Egg Benedict's. I ordered the St. Charles Chicken and the Corn Beef Hash. Definitely preferred the St. Charles Chicken compared to the Corn Beef Hash. I ordered the mimosa with grapefruit and it was delicious. I would definitely recommend this New Orleans staple for brunch.
EXCELLANT breakfast spot in New Orleans. Don't be turned off by the line. It is well worth the wait. Order a Bloody Mary & enjoy the crowd.

I had high expectations for this place. The reviews are great, the food looks delicious, and the prices were reasonable. The first time I visited I was able to skip the line and sit at the bar (I was on my own). Having perused the menu and pics online for days (I was in NOLA for a week and had planned my food stops carefully), I decided to get the CHICKEN ST. CHARLES for $13 (fried chicken breast served over a buttermilk biscuit topped with two poached eggs, finished with a pork tasso cream sauce). Sadly it looked and sounded better than it was. The biscuit was stale, the chicken was over-breaded and the cream sauce was nothing special. And I could not finish it, and not because I was full, but because I couldn't handle the staleness of the biscuit and the breading on the chicken - and I love fried chicken! The second time I visited (felt I had just come on a bad day the first time), I had the EGGS COCHON for $13, which is one of their signature dishes (slow-cooked, apple-braised pork debris served over an openfaced housemade buttermilk biscuit, topped with two poached eggs, finished with hollandaise). This dish was better than the fried chicken Benny, but the pork was really dry. Good thing I had taken a friend's recommendation and asked for extra hollandaise. The biscuit this time was not stale and enjoyed the dish well enough. Now, do I recommend this place? Definitely go once to see what all the hype is about, but I don't think I would return if I visited NOLA again. Also, the service is hit or miss. First time it was great, second time my server pocketed my change ($5 from a $15 total bill) and had to ask the manager for my change because "I" wanted to be the one to determine the tip amount, not the staff!

This place is over rated. I don't understand how there are so many locations because there are so many better breakfast places in New Orleans. There is always a super long line. I think it is a little bit of a tourist trap.

Last time I went I got the Costa Rican and it was just fine nothing great. I've never had the pancakes of french toast so maybe that's why I just don't understand the frenzy.

Didn't even know I like eggs Benedict. Now I try everything I can in New Orleans has had some great options. Here I had the peacemaker., One with pulled pork, the other with shrimp. It was awesome. Loved the bacon infused Bloody Mary and the vanilla iced coffee. But the best grits were at 2 chicks cafe.

The food was absolutely amazing! Our server Freddie H was attentive , offered assistance on picking out items on the menu and was very kind. I got the skinny tex mex and pancakes and my friend got the French toast. Everything was yummy. We used the Yelp waitlist which was EVERYTHING. Saved so much time. *Note everyone in your party must be there to be seated!*

Stopped for breakfast on a Sunday morning, as we were staying at a hotel across the street. They told us it would be a 30 minute wait but it was more like 15, as many of the people whose names were called had left (sad for them... good for us). Once seated (we sat outside), the service was fast and the food arrived quickly. I order Eggs Cochon and hubby the Migas, and each of us ordered a side of bacon because, well, it's bacon. We were both very satisfied and enjoyed a unique downtown NOLA dining experience. If you don't mind spending $40 for breakfast, we highly recommend.
Stopped in for breakfast while visiting NOLA. The wait was about 45 minutes, but it was expected. Ordered the pancakes and order was enough to share with hubby. Service was great.
Freddie was a great server! He was attentive and helpful with the menu selection. Food was amazing!

Great breakfast- first meal in the City! Ask for the specials, there are off menu sweet and savory options! The benedicts are amazing. The biscuits really are perfect. 

Our waitress, Fieldrose, was wonderful. She took care of us but also left us to enjoy the food! Considering going back tomorrow...
Good food, excellent customer service, wide variety dishes offered. Don't be put off by the long lines in front of café it moves fast.  You will be inside in no time.

The atmosphere is wonderful! While waiting before we got seated, the server asked if we needed anything to drink. Freddie H. was my service this time and he was PHENOMENAL! He went above and beyond to make sure that we understood the menu, constantly refilled our drinks, & checked on us. Most times, it's very rare that you find decent service. This location has GREAT service!

Food delicious, Angela our server was the best.  Make sure you put yourself on the waitlist because the wait can be long! We waitlisted ourselves here on Yelp and got seated right away! The BamBam Biscuit is the bomb!!

The cinnamon pancakes are delicious, not to sweet but just the right amount of sweetness. Does need a little more cinnamon added. Would advise to share it, because it is a big serving size for just one person. 
The  chicken st. Charles Benedict, which was good, yet the chicken was a little dry, but the sauce made it more flavorful. Also we had ordered the eggs cochon, which was suppose to be spicy, but honestly was not. At the end it was still good with all the juices it came with. 

Our waiter Caroline was very nice, in the beginning, being very helpful. Yet, she did have her downfalls for when we had ordered a cappuccino and their was a piece of paper in it. Although, it may have not been her who made it.

Great food and dining experience. I only left off one star was for the amenities during your wait time. 
We scheduled our breakfast knowing we'd have to wait from our hotel after reviewing other Yelp reviews that this was the place for breakfast and it was. It was amazing for the food and our waiter who was also our bartender.
My only issue was waiting outside in the freezing rain and when people tried to stay dry and stood at the doorway they were instructed to move by the hostess. Granted she was doing her job by getting people out of the way so we could come in. Yet, you figured have some benches outside or a enclosed awning attached to the building would be permitted or allowed just to shelter waiting patrons.

Other than that. Our food was hot and amazing!!!

We went to the Ruby Slipper based on the recommendation from a family friend.  Boy were they right. 
The wait was not bad because of a yelp check in.  It's certainly a great way to start the process of getting in.  The restaurant is very successful as is evidenced by the line ups.  Lots of people recognize a good thing when they see and taste it.   
The meal was an example of great quality and generous portions. 
I had a delicious omelette and my partner had the steel cut oatmeal.  Both exceeded our expectations.  It's not easy doing simple well consistently.  
The next time I return to NOLA, I fully intend to be back at the door of The Ruby

Oh my goodness, I can't even believe how great this breakfast was! We rolled up early on a Sunday and were told that it would be a 30 minute wait for a table of 4. I don't think we waited nearly that long. We were seated at a pretty large booth and checked out the specials (root beer french toast?!)

Most of us did the ruby slipper mimosa which came in a nice hefty cup. I'm all about the quantity so I appreciated that. Their iced coffee was also very yummy. Just some pre-added cream made it perfect.

I chose to do the migas for breakfast and I was not disappointed. So good! I would love to come back again and try some of their funkier options. 

Make sure you get there early and are prepared to wait and check out the specials!

Well we came here today before heading to the convention center for a parade. Thought we could sit and eat with friends that were already here but we're told we couldn't. Had to put our names on the wait list and get a new table. Ok. Then another person told us no put yourself on the list and if u want to sit with your friends we will serve you. Confusing. I went to the bar just to get a drink there were three empty chairs. The bartender wouldn't even take a drink order. Told us the hostess had to seat us at the bar! The damn bar! Just wow! Not sure if it's like that due to Mardi Gras but we won't be back. That was ridiculous.

Best brunch in the city and Freddie H was an incredible server! The bananas foster French toast, 3 pigs omelette, and the St Charles Chicken Benedict...That's the winning trifecta. Their bloody marys are amazing as well!

We came here with friends who have been to Nawlins many times. It was our first. I am only giving it a 4 because of my husbands food. Mine was amazing. He had shrimp and grits and I had eggs Benedict two ways. Wow wow wow. His not so much. Too much gravy and drowned out the grits and couldn't taste the shrimp. Should rethink that one. But mine was wow wow again. Started with a Bloody Mary made with bacon vodka. Wonderful. Would definitely come back. He would too. He would get my food though.

The drum fish with shrimps on a skewer and grits cake is too good! Best fish I have had in a long time. Two big pieces of fish. Served with spinach and cherry tomatoes. Hollandaise sauce on top. The fried grits is very heavy and dense. The shrimps are BBQd. Seems to always be a long wait here and I say it's worth it. We sat at the bar and were served by Mandy who was friendly and helpful. Prices are not bad at all. All food I saw coming out looked good.

The service is great- hence the 4 stars, and if you like Bloody Mary's you would love theirs. I tried it, just to say I did, but as I am not a tomato juice fan- it was not my favorite. 
I ordered two different eggs Benedict -the one with fried chicken and the one with shrimp. The fried chicken was so incredibly dry. Just WOW, dry. 
The shrimp was tasty and I loved the fried green tomato. The biscuit was nice. Overall, it was fun to try something I would not get anywhere else, but I would not order them again. 
Next time, maybe the banana foster, fried catfish, or pancakes. 
And this place is beyond LOUD!!!! Super loud. Busy, and again, service is excellent!

Freddie H was AMAZING!! He suggested the best dishes and my mother and I enjoyed him as well as his genuinely great service!!! 

Once we came in the whole staff was catering to my mother who has a hard time walking! They went outside to help her walk inside and sat us right away!!! Despite it almost being 2pm they told us to take our time eating and didn't rush us out (like some restaurants)! 

We were visiting from the DC,MD, VA area and will be more than happy to come again because the food was AMAZEBALLS and the overall service was OUTSTANDING!!!!

Great vibe, great, friendly and fun servers. The food was amazing too. Worth the 20 minute wait for a Sunday brunch experience you'll remember. Get on the wait list before you arrive for this short of a wait!
Enjoy!
An hour wait but worth it ... food is amazing .... friendly service workers & hosts are great ... they served us drinks on the curb while we waited too

Not a bad place for breakfast in New Orleans.

The french toast was standard (French baguette). The fruit left much to be desired (limited variety and not the best quality). The bacon was delicious, the grits with cheese were actually really tasty and the biscuits with tomato, poached eggs, bacon, and hollandaise sauce were scrumptious.

Check it out. I'm sure you won't regret it (unless you have a stomach ache from too much food afterwards!)

Nice selection of brunch foods and great service. So many options to Choose from and it came highly recommended so it was hard to decide.

If you like eggs Benedict youll love the Ruby Slipper.

Definitely making a point of coming back when I'm in NOLA.
Excellent service, huge delicious biscuits, wonderful corned beef hash, and a constantly full cup of coffee.

Staff is very snooty.  Made us feel like they didn't want us here and we were a bother.  I asked for cheese burger and fries. I wanted my fries extra crispy... im winding if they'd still been frozen if I didn't ask for extra crispy. They were close to raw. 
Bloody Mary is not that good. My husband had two different eggs Benedict's and one with chicken they over cooked the egg and the chicken. 
Just not impressed at all.

The pancakes are huge, and the cinnamon roll ones taste like just that. Shrimp omelet was ok, but with perfectly crisp bacon! Then the chicken, egg Benedict was massive and over a great biscuit! Overall great, along with Freddie's service!

Absolutely amazing for brunch! I checked in on yelp before we arrived so we wouldnt have to wait long! We waited about 15 minutes before we were seated. I ordered the peacemaker with eggs cochon and chicken st charles and my friend ordered the bananas foster pain perdu. It was absolutely amazing. The chicken and cochon were soft and moist, and the bananas foster was delicious and not overly sweet. This brunch place is a must when in New Orleans !!

AMAZING BREAKFAST!!   AMAZING SERVICE FORM FREDDY!  Eggs Benedict options were off the hook.  tried two and both were incredible.  Tried candied bacon.....no words...just huge smile.  Thank you, Freddy!  You made our first trip perfect!
The WORST breakfast I've had in memory. AWFUL pancakes, fatty bacon, bland chicken salad. Never, ever again should this place be recommended. Tim, you're a great server, but you deserve a better gig!

Massive portions equaled only by the massive wait.  Whether or not that's worth it is something only you can decide.  I'm not a patient person but putting my name on a list for a 2 hour wait for food in a city where there's plenty to do for 2 hours didn't seem to bother me and I wasn't disappointed.  If you go with the stomach filling biscuits and gravy, it's worth the extra four bucks and I-don't-want-to-know how many calories.  Drinks are small but stiff, the staff is friendly, but the service is slow (which likely leads to the wait times).
Wow!  Had breakfast here one morning and it was delish.  We had the bananas foster French toast and the corned beef hash Benedict. Service was great. Loved it.
Freddie is very friendly, helpful with menu options and overall hospitable! Food is amazing also

Really enjoyed our new at Ruby Slipper. Sunday brunch (11am) was packed so make sure you get their app and put your name down in line for a reservation. 

We tried:
- salmon eggs Benny: slightly smoky, with capers and dill; try it!!
- fried chicken eggs benny: chicken was perfect; try it!
- Mexican style eggs Benny (that's not the name, can't remember): had fried green tomato and soy chorizo. This one was just ok. Not a must-try. 
- banana foster French toast: our table shared this (between 4 people) as our brunch appetizer and it was delicious. Not the best I've ever had but definitely worth trying. Comes with raisins which must be a southern thing. 

Our server was very patient with us and even split the bill among seats. Kudos to her.

This place is LEGIT! They were able to seat our party of 3 as soon as we walked in. They have a Bloody Mary made with bacon-infused vodka. If you've never had it, GET IT. In all, we had Eggs Benedict, a Florentine Omelet, and two different kinds of pancakes. Everything we ordered was tasty and fresh and the service was very efficient and helpful. I've been lobbying my wife for another trip in the morning.

Very tasty brunch place with friendly attentive servers. I got the Bananas Foster Pain Perdu which was really tasty, although extremely sweet. The portions are very large so you could easily share one dish between two people. It's a solid brunch spot!
Service was great! Food although wasn't really worth the hour and 15 minutes we waited to be seated. Only giving 3 stars due to the staff being so nice.

8am I was there for breakfast this morning and it was empty. Nobody at the door so I sat at the bar figuring service should be more effective there. After sitting there for 10mins I ordered a cup of tea. For sum reason I couldn't even get a cup of hot water, hot tap was broke or something? So I ordered the tomato/tomato eggs benadict. "Note"; They did give me a complimentary cup of luke warm tea after a 1/2 hour into my wait. I Had to ask the server three times where my meal was. Each time he checked on it. Nice guy, he wasn't the cook. By the 3rd time and an hr later my blood was boiling. I dropped a few singles on their counter and hit  the door. Hostess did ask me why I was so angry? My Response was; you figure it out I've been sitting in here for an hr waiting for sum eggs. Be cautious and speak up or you'll just sit there with a cup of cold tea! Employees have to quit BULLSHITTING and do your jobs. I know there's no concern but I'll never be back or give recommendations.
Kind, humorous wait staff and some of the best biscuits in the city! They make it very easy for you to split the check and have great brunch cocktails too.

Ruby Slipper is probably the best brunch I ever had! My husband and I both had The Peacemaker with the chicken and egg benedicts. Fantastic. Can't give it enough stars. The vanilla cream spiced latte was also so good I ordered a second one. We also got a side of pig-candy bacon, which was really good. The bacon itself is really, really good...the candied part put it over the top. My husband said the coffee is the best he's ever had. 

Atmosphere is noise is above average, which is expected from that type of building. Service was super attentive and fun. Causal clothes/tourist attire are fine here. The bar looked like they could fix you right up, but we didn't partake this time. I imagine dinner would be just as good as the breakfast.
Weekends u may wait an hour for a table, plan for it, have a mimosa.  During the week, Monday to Friday , walk rite in and have a wonderful breakfast.  Very good place for breakfast.

Was in town for business staying at the Sheraton and wanted to try a local place for bfast. The reviews on this place were pretty good so decided to give it a shot. 
Had to wait about 10 min, so not too bad. 
Ordered egg white spinach omelette, chicken sausage patty and a pancake. 
Food was good, not great, average if I'm being honest. 
Not sure what all the hype is about and why its so popular. Maybe its just good marketing.

On my first ever trip to New Orleans, I wanted to try as many highly rated restaurants as possible. Ruby Slipper Cafe had been recommended to us by several people,and it happened to be 2 doors over from our hotel- perfect! We literally rolled out of bed on a Sunday morning and walked over. We were told there was a 30 minute wait, but that we just had to check Yelp to let us know where we stood in line (so cool!). We just walked back to our hotel room, waited like 5 minutes, and just like that we were notified our table was ready! We walked back over and were seated almost immediately. 

I ordered a hot green tea and my husband went with coffee. We had both read reviews on how good the benedicts were, so we knew we had to go with those. I was super excited to see that you could order "The Peacemaker" which allows you to try two different benedicts. I selected the Chicken St. Charles and the Shrimp Boogaloo. Sam went with the Chicken St. Charles and the Eggs Cochon. 

The food came out surprisingly fast! The benedicts looked amazing! I tried the shrimp boogaloo (Gulf shrimp sauteed with pork tasso and creole tomato sauce served over fried green tomatoes, a buttermilk
biscuit and two poached eggs) first and OH MY GOD that creole sauce. The shrimp were so good!!!! And on that biscuit! Ugh! Amazing! I then tried a bite of the Chicken St. Charles (Fried chicken breast served over a buttermilk biscuit, topped with two poached eggs, finished with a pork
tasso cream sauce). This was also very tasty, but not nearly as mind blowing as the shrimp. My only complaint is that the eggs weren't runny. They were basically soft boiled. Runny egg yolk mixing with the sauce and sopped up by the bread is my favorite part of eating eggs benedict. I didn't get that with what we had at Ruby Slipper Cafe. Sam loved his Eggs Cochon (Slow-cooked, apple-braised pork debris served over a
buttermilk biscuit, topped with two poached eggs, finished with hollandaise), and was happy, but not blown away by the Chicken St. Charles. 

Overall it was a good visit. We had very attentive servers and tasty food. I would definitely come back. I would just request that they not cook the eggs as long.

Loved this place! Highly recommend getting yourself on the waitlist through Yelp, super easy and we were seated soon after arriving. Restaurant was packed; our waitress came and left just the right amount of times. Loved that they had options to mix and match different menu items; we wanted to try everything! Ended up getting the trio Eggs Benedict and the Duo Pancakes. Delicious and a must try if you are in New Orleans!!

Eaten here twice because of its proximity to the hotel I was staying at but it's very good. I've tried, either by ordering or sampling from friends plates, quite a few items and I don't think you can go wrong with anything here!

This was my first stop in NOLA! They were open at 10am (and almost full!) on a Tuesday which was great because I couldn't check in to my hotel until 11. The BBQ shrimp and grits were great, they kind of skimped on the shrimp but the grits were excellent. The STAR of the dish was actually the biscuit...I wish those came in a big bread basket

A must every time I am in Nola! 
Staff is always great and food is ALWAYS AMAZING!
Praline pancakes are to die for and So are the bloody Mary's. Best corned beef hash in life!

Worth the wait! Pro Tip: get on the wait list via the yelp app prior to going!  

My mom and I recently visited NOLA and this cafe was highly recommended by many locals! The food was amazing. We ordered the shrimp and grits to share and it was more than enough food for the both of us - the biscuit itself is HUGE! Get the blood mary - it's loaded with goodies and perfectly spiced!

Service was top notch! Highly recommended!

Wait/waitlist: it's amazing that you can put your name on the waitlist... I think if they didn't have it, it wouldn't be worth coming here & waiting the entire time. So definitely use the yelp app to add your name on the waitlist!! If you have a party of 6 or less, you have the option to put your name on the list. However, if your party is 7 or more, you have to go see the host and put your name on the list. We came on a Sunday and put our names on the waitlist around 10 am. They said it'd be an hour and a half wait but it was an hour and 45 min wait. There were 64 parties ahead of us (gasp)!! The waitlist is live so you can check on the yelp app how many more parties are ahead of you. If you have 7+ more people in your party, you can try calling them and putting your name on the list or the host told me you can choose 6 people in your party & then in the notes, say the actual amount of people in the party. When you get to the restaurant, checkin with the host and have the host update the correct party size. I wish I knew that beforehand!! We sent our lovely brother in law to hurry there and put our names on the list. So definitely do that so you don't have to waste your time walking there & physically putting your name on the list. Also, make sure to get there a little early so you're there when your table is ready. There were 2 groups that kept getting called & no one was there so they gave the table away. Also, if you're no longer going to go there, take your name off the list! 

Food: we ordered SO many meals... there was 7 of us and we all got one drink & we ordered 9 entrees.. it was almost $250!! Super expensive. However, the food was AMAZING! One of us got the trifecta (3 Benedict's) and the chicken st Charles (fried chicken) Benedict was everyone's favorite Benedict. We also liked the eggs cohon Benedict and stuffed French toast. The BLT was really good. The pancake flight (mix of 3 pancakes) was alright... not that good. Our favorite meal though was the banana foster!!! SO good! Omg. Drooling just thinking about it. It was super sweet though so I suggest getting one to share with the table... it might be a little too sweet as a whole entree for one person. Vegetarian wise, you can order something without meat. I got a Benedict without meat & just added avocado. Boring but it was still good :) Make sure to order ASAP. We ordered around 12-12:30 and the Benedict special was sold out already and one of our guys in our group got the last one!!! So since you're waiting for a long time, I recommend you figure out what you want to eat & order ASAP after sitting down. The food also takes awhile to come out so it's nice to order sooner rather than later. 

Service: I think you might be able to split bills which is nice. The waiters have tablets and they select what each person/chair wants. I hate when you go to a popular restaurant & the staff sucks... not the case here!! Everyone was so friendly!!! The waiters and waitresses work hard & are all so nice. The hostess was so friendly too! I'm sure they get bombarded with people repeatedly checking in/getting updates on the wait, etc but she was so friendly!!! It was such a delight to have such friendly staff! 

Overall, we really liked our meals here. I'd definitely recommend going & putting your name on the waitlist. Do not miss out on coming here!! Especially when the restaurant has a chain of them, you suspect the meals won't be as good... not the case here! Everything was amazing & super filling!!

Okay, so let me start by saying I had high expectations with all the great reviews on here.  We were seated within 10 minutes at 8am on a Friday.  I also put on name on the waitlist through yelp as we were walking over.  Once we were seated, we ordered some coffee.  I got the NOLA iced coffee and my boyfriend got the vanilla iced coffee.  They both lacked much flavor and we ended up only drinking about half.  Our waiter was great and quick.  I can't remember his name.  We ordered the stuffed French toast with a side of bacon and eggs with cheddar cheese and the peacemaker with the chicken benedict and corned beef benedict. 
When our food came, that's when it really went downhill.  My boyfriend's French toast filling tasted sour and looked old.  They also put the strawberries in a bowl on the side instead of on or in the French toast.  the worst part was the side of scrambled eggs.  They brought out a small plate with scrambled eggs and they must've put the shredded cheese on 2 seconds prior to us receiving it.  The cheese was not melted and cold on top of the eggs.  It was gross and we didn't touch it.  The peacemaker wasn't bad, but it didn't live up to the hype.  Needed some more seasoning and better sauce.  Overall, we definitely wouldn't recommend.  We paid our $50 bill and took a lyft over to District Donuts for an amazing fresh breakfast for $20.  I highly recommend that place over Ruby Slipper Café.

This place truly lives up to its name. I had the Spanish omelette (the best) and the biscuit comes with a maple butter spread that's to die for.Don't forget their signature Bloody Mary. I must visit if your in the area!
Very cute theme, nice wait staff too. But I don't understand the lines for this place, the food is merely ok. Sitting outdoors was pleasant though, so thats a plus.
GREAT food...great service....THOMAS S., was the perfect knowledge employee......u should hire more folks like Him!
In addition to a great breakfast I wanted to note the observation of excellent sanitizing of tables, perhaps the best ever seen. Excellent awareness and customer service. Thank you!
We were seated quickly. The service was excellent and Celeste was a great waitress! I would highly recommend!

My go to for a scrumptious breakfast! My favorite thing to order on the menu is the eggs cochon with pork, I have gotten it multiple times and it has never disappointed! No one I have ever eaten here with has had any complaints about their food. The wait can be long on the weekends so it is best to get here early. They do have a bar as well if you need your daily dose of orange juice!

4+ We came today for lunch and didn't have to wait for a table.  We first sat outside which would have been enjoyable if not for the very noisy street construction.  Our server let us move inside without any issue.  Staff were very friendly and accommodating. All four of us enjoyed what we ordered--excellent Reuben sandwich; omelette; banana pancake.  The food portion was just right, not too small and not too much...But the pancake was huge and very fluffy. Prices were also reasonable. Best part for me were the two ladies who greeted and seated us when we came in and our very patient and friendly server.

This restaurants food and service were phenomenal. There was a 20 minute wait but you didn't even mind because someone came to take a drink order immediately as you were waiting. The hostesses were friendly and welcoming to the restaurant. Our hotel "The Cambria" suggested the cafe for breakfast and it didn't disappoint at all. Nicole our server helped to make breakfast choices and they were scrumptious.

Got here early enough and only had a 15 minute wait.  Good food and service for brunch.  Able to order drinks outside while waiting.  Wait list available on the website.

We also ate at the one on Decatur St., smaller more quaint, also excellent.

This place is great.
So many good choices and lots of alternative options like vegan, turkey instead of pork etc.
I highly recommend the pancakes special!
Service was great... Like really really great. It's so important to them they they give you a card with their name on it. So thanks Freddie!
Once again Ruby Slippers did not disappoint. Our server Julie was great and attentive even for a packed house.

Updating my review in reply to the comment by a Ruby Slipper Representative.
Thanks for reaching out! I'm sure you do, but I didn't mention in my review when I visited... We dined around May 31st, 2018.

My review:

Waltzed in here having no idea what this place was while on a weekend getaway from Texas. Honestly, it reminds me of an Egg & I on steroids, very new Houston diner vibe, not so much like the old Austin diners I'm used to.

Didn't wait more than 10 minutes on a Wednesday morning for a party of two.

Food was on the better side of average, I had shrimp and grits, my partner had an omelette. Everything was going great until she got food poisoning shortly thereafter and we spent the rest of the trip hoping she didn't die. We didn't eat (or drink) anywhere else that day so I really think it was the eggs here that did it.

Giving 3 stars because the food wasnt expensive and didn't kill her!
Went for breakfast on a Monday morning and the place was packed. Service was great and the food was too!

Worthwhile visit.  I was reluctant to dine at the Ruby Slipper because they are a multi-location operation.  I was glad I did because the breakfast food hit the spot and the service was prompt.   The diner is bright and festive and, of course, you can order a morning drink - it is New Orleans after all.  The biscuits along with all their calories were a welcome addition to the meal and were served with some good strawberry jam.  Yum.

The Ruby Slipper has always been on our breakfast foodie radars for weekend trips to NOLA. Food is always good and the waitstaff are amazing. However... for breakfast this morning, I ordered The Costa Rican! The meal had great flavor but lost major points for the instant rice. INSTANT RICE!!! This is Louisiana. We grow up around rice fields and you have the nerve to serve instant rice instead of hot and fresh rice. No way. No sir. You have sinned. You should be ashamed.

Excellent food! The service was awesome. The real time ordering process made sure all food got to the table in an expedient amount of time and we were in and out in a short period of time. Excellent choice

Touristy and always busy but downright delish brunch spot! Get there early or jump on the Yelp waitlist! 

Visited in town and we got seated quick at the bar since it was only two of us. Great brunch options and cocktails. They don't skimp on the mimosas that's for sure! Bloody Mary equally great.

Tried the pancake flight....drool .
Egg Bennie's are delish! The biscuits are flaky . You will walk away with a food coma that's for sure!
A must go for breakfast/brunch when in NOLA. So convenient to add myself to the wait list from my hotel room! Friendly staff and amazing food!

This was our second time at the restaurant but first time at this location. It was great! Service was great staff was friendly and all the covid rules were being followed very well. The food was amazing!!! We will definitely be back and really love the location for sure!

This place was less than average. Going in a group of 8 isn't what this place is built for; a group of 4 or less seems to be more it's capacity. We ordered food and waited over 45 min. By the time the food came out, you could tell that it sat under a heat lamp for a while. Plastic plates shouldn't be hot to the touch. Overall, the food is ok and service could be better. Going in a smaller group could change my mind. 

Came on a Sunday at 10:15. Left at 1:00 P.M.

Freddie was a wonderful waiter. He was attentive, friendly, and courteous. You would've never known that it was his first week working there. The food was delicious (we ordered the French toast, sausage, breakfast potatoes, and eggs). Keep up the great work Freddie!

This place is a great example of "the yelp effect". Thousands of great reviews. Food was good no doubt but they make you wait outside and then they make you wait inside. I feel my time is more important than the quality of their food. They need to find a better way to manage people.

Walked into the restaurant and saw there was a two hour wait time and I thought to myself the food must be delicious if all these people are out here waiting. Well I guess i was wrong, the food and server was not up to the par. I ordered a starter item and made it very clear that i wanted it to come out before my main entree and it was brought out with my food. No problem. I let that go. Then everyone at my table had a bad experience with the dishes. I ordered the chicken and french toast bites and the chicken was superb but the french toast bites were a little sketchy when they first brought them they looked like croutons. and they were very hard like croutons also. Then I simply asked for scramble eggs with cheese and i was informed they were not serving me real eggs which was very disappointing because they were not cooked the way i asked. They are mostly focused on presentation and status.

Great brunch spot. I joined the waitlist on our first visit (we visited twice during our 4 day trip), and only waited about 10 mins. My daughter had the crab cake benny, I had a cochon and a smoked salmon benny.  I also had a bacon Bloody Mary, and we both had espresso lattes.  Food was excellent, service also excellent. Will return on our next visit to NOLA.

Very good.

Got the french toast (Pain perdu)!  So good...

Service was friendly and fun.  I had some questions and they went above and beyond when answering.

Cool atmosphere.  

Great experience!

This place is amazing. Great food, service, and atmosphere. You get the feeling like you are just one of the regulars here. Fire chief sitting at the first table , everyone coming in, shakes his hand. They wave hi to a couple of regulars and sit. Service always gave the feeling of knowing exactly what you wanted before you knew to ask for it.

I realized there's an advantage to being a solo diner in New Orleans, which is that no matter how busy a place is, it's usually pretty easy to get a spot at the bar.  Walking up to the Ruby Slipper I was a bit worried because there was a huge crowd outside waiting.  On a Thursday at 10AM.  

But I got right in, sat at the bar, guy helping me was really cool, food came out fast, and while it's hard to get super excited about breakfast, it hit the spot.  Just what I wanted.

It was good, but may have been hyped up for it. The service was alright, could have been better. We got the benedict sampler platter. I could have passed on the shrimp Benedict, but loved the other 2. We also got the fried green tomatoes, I'd pass on those too.

After waiting almost 2 hrs to eat breakfast...our food tasted horrible. I've eaten this establishment every time I've visited to New Orleans. This time the menu was unfamiliar, and the recipes weren't pleasing to my palette. Our server ghosted us, then seemed annoyed that we weren't pleased with our food. This review was based on an actual visit on March 7, 2020. We were in town for a Cheer Competition at the Ernest Memorial Convention Center.

I mean. I MEAN! I was in New Orleans for my Firth visit. This time for almost a week and I'm a good FREAK! I must say, the bananas foster pain perdu is the best thing I have ever put in my mouth. Really. Really really.
This place has some of the best brunch in New Orleans, hand down. Amazing service paired with even better food. Worth the wait that it sometimes takes. Freddie H was the man!

Likes
- Grilled fish of the day was sheepshead, which was really tender. I would order it again!
- You can order drinks while waiting for your table. The bacon infused vodka bloody mary and the regular bloody mary were a hit with our group. There were a bunch of stuff including pickled string beans
- You can pick two different types of eggs benedict. My bf got the pork and shrimp one but the pork was way better. 
- Our friends got the banana foster french toast which they liked

Dislikes
- There is a wait but you can get in line via the yelp app
- My friend didn't enjoy her bam bam biscuit and the pork sausages

Service took a long time to both order and get our meals.

French toast was just okay....

Wow. This place is amazing. I ordered the Spanish omelet with a side of potatoes and a biscuit.

The omelet was delicious. The eggs were soft and fluffy. The chorizo wasn't too spicy or overpowering, as it can sometimes be. The pepper jack cheese wasn't too prevalent, but I still got a few peppery tastes here and there. The remaining ingredients -- the red onions, tomatoes and roasted red pepper sauce -- added a hint of sweetness. Overall, it was one of the best omelets I've had in some time.

The potatoes were crispy on the outside, soft on the inside and seasoned perfectly. 

But the star of the show may have been the biscuit. It was one the biggest I've ever eaten. It was dense yet fluffy. The honey butter served with it added a sweet glaze to each bite. I easily could have eaten and entire plate of them.

The service was great -- everyone was hustling to handle the large crowd. I highly recommend using Yelp's online waitlist feature so that you don't have to wait outside the restaurant (there is little room to wait inside).

Everything on the menu sounded amazing, so I hope to return soon to explore more of it.

Glorified Denny's. Not sure what the hype is about. The line gets crazy long after 9am. I would never wait in line for this place. We went when they opened at 7am. Breakfast was average. Blood Mary was ok. I got the bam bam biscuit. Tasted like something I could have made at home. Bill came out wrong and waitress couldn't break a $100 bill for a $50 tab. Not impressed .
Always a great breakfast dining experience at the Ruby Slupper and the mamosas are the BEST!

First off, what a wonderful name for a restaurant, Ruby Slipper Cafe has the inviting sound to it.  The shrimp and grits in New Orleans at Ruby Slipper Cafe, that has both the sound and the taste to go together.  The pancakes and omelets are good choices as well.  It's a lovely restaurant to enjoy breakfast or brunch.  I also like their coffees.
One of my go to spots for breakfast. I would recommend you to try everything on the menu. Go back and pick up where you left off!

Been hoping to RS for 10 years and the quality continues to drop IMO.  Frustrated to see so many other great breakfast places as the crowds pour into the Slipper.  Wait.  that's probably a good thing so that I can easily get into the places I love.  I do like the setup at RS and the wait staff are friendly, so I do try again when close by.  Today my eggs tasted bland and pre-prelared.  2 tiny pieces of bacon.  The grits were good.  In fact, the ice tea seemed more watered down than before.  I'll be elsewhere.

I came into this restaurant at like 8am fresh of a night of bad decisions, I was still drunk, looked a mess and was all alone. I was sat at the bar, probably because they didn't want anyone to be able to see my face when they walked in but whatever. My server, whose name I don't 
Remember  because and that's point I didn't even know my own name, poured me a cup of coffee. I got the mix and match eggs benny and a Bloody Mary. Bloody Mary was amazing!!! I was served the eggs benny and they too were awesome. It was not until the chef himself came out with another eggy saying that he accidentally served me the wrong one and promptly served me what I had actually ordered. I told him I would have never known if he haddent come out!! I also asked for a glass of chocky milk and was given the whole gallon because apparently I looked like I needed help. Anyway, bartender was so nice and accommodating and the fact the chef came out and corrected my order unprompted was super cool.
Great place to eat- food is amazing atmosphere is great!   Be patient - all of NOLA wants to eat there.
Go to spot whenever we are in new Orleans.  Good food,  friendly staff,  and attentive service.

Wow! This is one of the best breakfast places I've been to! Ruby Slipper does it right and has options for anyone--satisfying any taste that you may have! I decided to get their eggs Benedict and was very happy with my decision. I completed my meal feeling full, yet still healthy (lol). In addition, our waiter was pretty on top of his game and provided exemplary service. Thanks Ruby Slipper!! I wish I had one by home!
Goodness, they serve a great breakfast! Everything was cooked perfect! Go here if you visit the French Quarter and want a great quality breakfast.
Freddie was awesome. We loved the food. Great service. Good prices. Good location. Seated us right away.

The food here was awesome but what really stood out was the service. Our waiter, Freddie H., was absolutely amazing. Super personable and even gave us recommendations on other local eats. Safe to say, when ever I'm in town, the kind folks at the Ruby Slipper Cafe make it necessary stop!

I heard about this  place from a good friend who used to live in New Orleans and thought we'd give it a try this morning. I had a HOT-SMOKED SALMON OMELET - Hot smoked salmon and goat cheese, topped with dill hollandaise, red onions & flash-fried capers. I didn't feel hungry enough for any of the sides so I just had it as a stand-alone w/ some coffee and a Mimosa. My wife enjoyed their CINNAMON FRENCH TOAST BATONS - Brioche bread sticks, dipped in custard & fried, tossed in cinnamon sugar. We thoroughly enjoyed both our plates, the excellent service and fun atmosphere!

I plan on returning more hungry to attempt the THE TRIFECTA - Taste of Ruby Slipper featuring Eggs Cochon (Apple-braised pork debris served over a buttermilk biscuit, topped with a poached egg, finished with hollandaise), Chicken St. Charles (Fried chicken served over a buttermilk biscuit, topped with a poached egg, finished with a pork tasso cream sauce) & Shrimp Boogaloo (Gulf shrimp sautéed with pork tasso and creole tomato coubion served over fried green tomatoes, a buttermilk biscuit and a
poached egg) Benedict plate.

We were striking out with our dining selections.  Fortunately we met Ray and took his suggestion to come for breakfast and we are certainly glad we did. The breakfast was delicious and the hospitality great. 
Make sure you check it out

We had a superb breakfast here!  We started with an orange/pomegranate mimosa and bacon bloody marry between us and each had an omelette that was very well made!  I loved the skinny Florentine omelette and grits!

This was my second food stop in New Orleans. The service was great! They had a waitress going around outside to those who were waiting and she was taking drink orders. The food came out quick despite how packed it was. I ordered the Chicken St. Charles Eggs Benedict whole my Fatjer order the Grilled Fish St. Peter's. The food was good! Although the Grilled Fish St. Peter's was AMAZING!!! The balance between the fish and hollandaise was just... so good. The mimosas were also very good!

This was a recommendation by a friend to check this place out! Boy am I glad we did! They have so many options it's hard to narrow down what you want. The eggs Benedict was delicious! I would recommend going multiple times to try all the food you couldn't get the first couple times. There are loads of drinks to choose from as well. Service was wonderful and our meal was delicious!

Being a Wizard of Oz fan,  I couldn't resist. The name is more symbolic (returning Home after Katrina) than a tribute to the movie but nonetheless heartwarming. We came for a Wednesday breakfast. No wait. Friendly attentive waitress. Surprised to see a lot of alcohol options on the breakfast menu. Black coffee for me!
I had two of a multitude of eggs Benedict options, the cochon and the salmon and both were delicious. My wife had  Florentine omelet and cheesy grits. Kudos to the brown sugar,  cinnamon butter! Warning: Big portions!

Every single bite of every single meal in our party of 22 was scrumptious!! It was so worth the 90min wait. Tasso cream sauce... have some!!!! The salmon avocado toast, the biscuits, the Benedict's. My goodness it was delicious!! 
The chilled boozy coffee & bloody Mary's helped with the wait

Please believe the hype about this place. We had the opportunity to eat here during Essence Festival and it was nothing short of amazing. Thanks to the Yelp app, we were able to get on the waitlist for a table while still shopping. There is a nearby parking so the walk isn't far. Once I checked in with the hostess to let her know we arrived, the wait time was an additional 20-25 mins. Sara was our waitress and she was super nice and sweet. It was a lot of people dining in, but there's ample seating and a bar area. While waiting, there was a nice waitress that took drink orders if you were interested. I LOVED the French toast. So yummy!!

Just okay- the longer wait was expected as it was a busy Tuesday morning. However, after our party of 6 was sat, 4 other parties were sat anywhere from 10-30 minutes after us and they received their food first, one being a party of 7 right next to us. It took 15 minutes to get our drinks (she forgot our order) and over 45 minutes after ordering (an hour after being sat) for us to get our meal and the server didn't seem bothered about it when we asked what was taking so long or why other's received their food first. She commented that it depended on what station we ordered from, but the party of 7 had eggs Benedict selections as well, so we weren't sure what she meant by that. After the long wait, One of our orders was wrong, and it took about 3 minutes for her to replace it with the correct order which made us wonder what the hold up was in the first place. The food wasn't that impressive. My biscuit was hard as a rock and tasted old, and the chicken on my Benedict wasn't as good as other places. A friend's plantain's tasted like cardboard and the specialty Bloody Mary wasn't worth $10. Overall, for the price and wait, not worth it, which was very disappointing as this place had great reviews. Seems like they need more staff and someone directing orders and checking food in the kitchen on the busy mornings. Don't recommend it.

Incredible breakfast!  They even have a great selection of cocktails for breakfast (but it's New Orleans, right?!)  It was so hard picking from the memo.  Staff were friendly, helpful, and service terrific.  Will be going back on future trips.  Best breakfast options I've found in NOLA.

So nice we had to go twice!
If I ate like this at home I'd have some serious issues.
What a great find!  The food was SO flavorful and fresh that we decided to return again on our last day.
Be prepared to wait though.  Apparently, it's a local hotspot but for good reason.
Can't wait to return!
Food was very good.  Much more than I expected.  I liked the fact that you get a text receipt right after you paid.  A little loud.

We decided to try this place for brunch on Christmas Eve as it is highly recommended by our uber driver. We escaped the line as you can sign yourself on the waitlist online before going there.

Once seated, our server gave us a quick introduction about today's special. I was thinking about trying the spicy chicken egg Benedict as part of my duo Benedicts but was told that I cannot order that as part of the combo. It was totally fine.

I decided to go with the fried chicken egg Benedict and pulled pork egg Benedict. Both were incredible but I highly recommend the pulled pork Benedict given the unique mixture of textures among pork, egg, and biscuits.

Overall, great brunch place!
Everything was as delicious as expected! The ruby mimosa and croque madame were exceptional!

This is a fun place. They do a clapping routine for people's birthdays which is way less embarrassing than singing and gets everyone in the restaurant involved. Food is very good. Can't beat the boozy coffee and eggs Benedict menu. Great service and great atmosphere.
The service was great the food was amazing (order the "Grilled Fish St. Peter" amazing!) I couldn't say more

Had a DELICIOUS breakfast at this place. Saturday morning surprisingly wait time was not bad, just 15 minutes. It was 9:15am. It became more busier after that. We also checked in before we visited. Server Nicole was absolutely amazing.  She suggested that I try catfish St Peters on grit cake with mustard hollandaise dressing.  It was EXCELLENT.  Also ordered banana foster pain perdue without the bacon for veggie husband.  yummms!  

I wish these guys were in Dallas :-(

Come to The Ruby Slipper if you're ready for a phenomenal breakfast that'll knock your socks off! I spent two mornings here eating the Costa Rican. I had the first time I came and completely fell in love with it. I had to come back for more. The portions are ample and the taste of the food is fresh and yummy. I would say a good time to come and put your name down would be 12:30/ 12:45. I came around this time both days and the wait wasn't too terrible the second day it was only a 30 minute wait. This fab cafe has something for everyone; sweet, salty, savory and everything in between. There are also specials to choose from if you wanna spice things up off the menu. This is a must-eat destination for any New Orleans tourist. This was by far my favorite breakfast/ brunch place from my trip there.

Everything was so good and delicious. You cannot go wrong with anything on the menu. I had the brioche French toast omg foodgasm in my mouth. My sister had the  catfish  with grits it was well seasoned and tasty. Definitely worth a visit for brunch

First stop on our vacation and it didn't disappoint! Had the Cochon slow cooked pork egg Benedict and the corned beef Benedict. Despite it being super busy service was quick and attentive. Our food arrived promptly and was delicious. Can't wait to visit again!

If there's anything I love more than brunch itself, it's when a brunch place has a pick two benedict option. Guess what... Ruby Slipper has it. It's called the peacemaker, and it's great to split if you're not super starving. I chose the shrimp boogaloo and my boyfriend picked the chicken St. Charles. Both were great! I'm not usually the world's biggest biscuit fan (too much bread), but theirs weren't too heavy. The shrimp was cooked perfectly and I loved the savory tomato sauce. The fried chicken was great and seasoned well. I definitely would order both again as I loved them both. We also got a side of bacon and a cup of fruit, as well as a Bloody Maria and a peach Bellini mimosa! Everything was delicious and I wanted to try so many things on the menu. Our server was super sweet and provided great service. We got there early and only had to wait about five minutes for our group of four. It's not a huge space so use the Yelp waitlist!

Food was delicious!  Atmosphere was great. Staff was courteous. Highly recommend. It is a definite must to get there before the rush cause the line is long. 

I had the Benedict Conchon which was rich and decadent. Braised pork excellently seasoned and served with two spot on poached eggs.  It exceeded my expectations. 

The environment was fun and exciting. Kitchy items are displayed all over which kept your eye flowing throughout and entertained.  Staff was pleasant and courteous. 

If your in "Nawlins" it's a must stop amidst all the other restaurants.  I give it 4 stars only because i was over looked and was sat after another group that got there after me. Definitely great food.

The best Breakfast/Brunch in New Orleans, hands-down. Home to the best Bloody Mary I've ever had. The Chicken St. Charles is heavenly goodness. Service is fast, even on days when then the place is jam packed.

I had the trifecta, three different tales on eggs Benedict. It was delicious and I would recommend it to anyone, but it was a lot of food. Expect a wait here on the weekends, but it's worth it. Service was great too, kept the coffee full.
Long wait almost 3 hours ordered corn beef was cold not very good egg over cooked coffee was great

After revisiting our past at the Deep Purple concert at the Seanger Theater we decided on breakfast at the Ruby Slipper. It has been quite a while since I had eaten here. Somehow, this place had fallen off my radar but with our fabulous server Demetra to help guide our choices its back on the radar with renewed strength. Demetra was quite delightful even though she was obviously very busy. Everything g we had was great and obviously for our "to go" boxes ....worthy of take home!

The drink service outside was nice since we had a one hour wait. We were willing to stick it out because of the food reviews.  The Bloody Mary was good and our server was great but our breakfast wasn't. We both ordered the Skinny Migas. The food took a really long time to come out and when it did, the plate was hot but the food was cold, the portion was small and the avocado was like rubber.  We actually amused ourselves with it for awhile. All of our slices on both plates were like plastic. Lol! We ate what we could and moved on with our day.  Oh, the side of corned beef hash was really good!  I would go back for that if there wasn't a wait.

I'm from New York and would consider myself to be a foodie! I was able to put myself on the waitlist without actually being there. By the time I arrived, I only had to wait about 20 minutes to be seated. The drinks were really good. I got the boozed iced coffee and they gave me half off another drink for waiting. I ordered a signature dish, which was the grilled fish and grit cake with grilled shrimp on a skewer. My fish was salty and very greasy, they ran out of grit cakes, so I had to settle for cheese grits. The cheese was thrown on top of the grits, not melted at all. I ended up asking for more cheese. I had to add salt and pepper to give my grits some taste. The shrimp tasted undercooked. Overall, I didn't enjoy my dining experience. The food looked extremely good on yelp and considering the long wait, I had high expectations for this place. I'm so disappointed and already looking forward to my next meal elsewhere.

Had a 5 star experience today. Food was DELICIOUS and service was great. Fieldrose was our waitress and she was fabulous because our group was a little high maintenance. She was awesome. Everyone should order the Cochon Benedict breakfast. It is amazing. Will definitely continue to come back here.

I stayed in New Orleans for 3 days and four nights, I ate at the Ruby slipper two out of my three days that I was in town. My first experience was unlike anything I've ever tasted so I had to make sure that I came back one more time before I left town and decided to try a different location.

Upon arrival our server was lively, funny, and more than helpful with any questions that we had. She honestly made our entire experience so much better which I did not think was possible because the food was so amazing.

We originally were going to try something different but if it ain't broke don't fix it right? We went with the cat fish and grits with a homemade biscuit on the side again but instead of coffee we got bloody Mary's with bacon flavor and hey are deliciousssss !!! I would definitely prefer this location due to my experience with my server, I wish I could remember her name but she had a ton of glitter & colorful makeup and I believe it started with a J. Love her !!

Amazing.  Simply amazing!  

There was an Incredibly long wait time.  We were a party of 8 trying to get in on a Sunday the day the saints had a home game however the hostesses were on top of things, kept us up to date on our status.  It also helped there was a waitress whose sole job was to take drink orders for those of us waiting outside. We met some really nice people as we huddled under the outside warmers and that made the wait go by quicker. 

Once we were seated, our waitress was incredibly welcoming and attentive. We had some dietary restrictions in our group and she patiently and thoughtfully helped us craft our orders. We felt well taken care of. 

Food wise, everyone loved their meals.  The portions were huge. Eggs cachon were delicious, biscuits were light, fluffy and flavorful, bacon to die for.  I don't usually like fried green tomatoes, but these were wonderful. 

We will definitely go again next time we are in town!
This food was awesome and our server was even better! Freddie was amazing and made the experience awesome. I will be back next time we are in New Orleans!

My friends and I wandered into this cafe based on a glowing recommendation. This location was bigger and therefore a better option for our group of 9. We split up and sat at two tables of 6 next to each other. 

The restaurant has several tables and a bar area. Around 12:30 pm the place was pretty busy. This place has a fun drink and food menu.

I started with the boozy coffee (a double) and it tasted great, yet effective. The morning margarita also was delicious.There was a bit of a wait for the food, but well worth it. Before leaving, some of the group got boozy coffees to-go. 

If you love eggs benedict this place is for you! They have several varieties of the dish and options to mix and match. Most of hte table I sat at ordered the peacemaker (you pick two) or the Trifecta (get all three). We had some debate about the best options but hands down it was the Fried Chicken (chicken st. Charles). Followed closely by the braised pork (eggs cochon) one. The bar for non-traditional benedict has now been set higher for me.

Our server let us split the checks and was enertaining!

I had the Bananna Foster breakfast which was excellent. Melted in my mouth. It was worth the wait. It comes with nacon. I added egg which was ok and juice. I look forward to eating here everytime i come to  NOLA from Melbourne, Fl
 Use the yelp waitlist to save time getting to your meal

Food is outstanding.

Get in line, or get there early- waits get extreme fast.  For good reason.

Great cinnamon swirl pancakes and one Charles Benedict!! Got all nine of us seated in a jiffy and served quickly. Not my favorite Ruby Slipper location, but it got the job done on a Saturday morning at 9.
Best eggs Benedict I've had. You can have two different kinds from a choice of six. I had eggs Cochon (apple braised pork) and corn beef Bennie. Best biscuits!

This place OMG the food was great, the service was great. Oh the 2 BloodyMarys did  help lol while we waited.
