We were told the wait can be long but we went around 9am on Friday an we waited maybe 30min to be seated. This place is a must to eat great breakfast. The smoke salmon omelette very good. We left went shopping an on the way back to the car stopped an got another bloody mary lol. 

Love it love it
Hostess Demertuis is great..

Memphis
Great food.incredible service and friendly staff..very clean . and great prices with one of the widest variety of breakfast choices I've ever seen ..and specialty dishes are great .

Just checked into NOLA and yelped this treasure.  I know this is part of a chain, but NOLA takes the cake. Solo traveler for business, I waited less than 5 mins for seat at the bar. Ordered the mimosa and the Gulf fish St.Peter. Absolutely delicious. Great spot for brunch!... The size of these drinks and my meal was great, def not your NYC version of portion control. A lil noisy.

We ate twice at the Ruby Slipper on our recent trip to New Orleans. Both times were great. I highly recommend getting on their online wait list as soon as you get up if you want to go there fir brunch. I had the breakfast tacos both times - very delicious. Large servings. Great service.

Poor service is what stands out to me here. For being such a popular place (60 min wait via Yelp; another 25 min after "arrival" time), I would think they'd have service pretty dialed in. After the long wait, we sat at our table for a good 10 minutes more before being greeted or offered coffee. Our server (nice) arrived and we placed our order right away since we've by now had plenty of time to review the menu. After another 10 minutes, coffee arrives. No cream. Getting someone's attention in this bustling place was near impossible. Another 5 min, after a busboy grabs from another table. Finally a sip of coffee. Order arrives. Request for more coffee. Another 10 minutes. Food is OK, hence 2 stars. 1 order at our table included over-med eggs, they were barely over easy and pretty much ruined that person's meal. When finished, we sat looking at our partially finished plates for the rest of our time, no one ever cleared or checked back in with us. We had to get up and track down our server for the check. You would think for such a long waiting line here, they'd be pretty good at moving tables and getting folks in/out. Not the case, I suppose the reason for long lines. Tourist trap and lots of hype. Not even close to being worth the wait.

Sooo first the ruby slipper mimosa was very good I think I had about 2. I which they had bottomless but we would probably never get inside. There was a long wait but I added my self to the wait list on yelp so it helped a little. This place is very good and a must go to for brunch if your in New Orleans.

The food and atmosphere and service were awesome! Came here for brunch during a bachelorette party with a party of 10. Freddie was an awesome waiter and made sure we had everything we needed/wanted. We had a ball! And they split checks without an issue!!! Definitely come here!

Just go ! 

No frills great breakfast. The Benny choices are crazy and they have a mix and match so you can get two different ones... try the corned beef one for sure.
This is a must eat at breakfast spot!! I mixed the chicken St Charles and shrimp bamboloo (name could be wrong ), crepes and milk brandy lunch, perfect!!!

Second time here and still love it and would come back again. I always get the Conchon Benedict and Cafe au Late. It's always crowded with lines out the door. We got on the wait list prior to arrival and waited less than 10 minutes for our table. Other friends got the breakfast tacos and the chicken Benedict. Always will be our NOLA go to breakfast

Yum!!  The Morning Margarita is dangerously delicious, my eggs Benedict perfection and our server was super friendly and prompt.  

I'll be back!

I went here over Mardi Gras, 1 block from the parade, and only had an hour wait! We put our name in before we even left the hotel and once we got there only waited about 10 minutes! 

They were very busy of course, so it took awhile to get drinks, but food came pretty quickly. 

I ordered a mimosa for $10 And it only filled half of my cup. It was amazing but I was very disappointed in how small for the price. Friends got bloody Mary's, also $10, and those were more worth the price. 

I wasn't impressed by my food at all. Potato's were plain, bacon wasn't very crisp, and eggs are eggs haha. Biscuit was pretty good! Friends all liked their food. 

Friend got the special, stuffed French toast with the king cake. Way too sweet and about half a cup of sprinkles on top. Not a fan haha

I came to a different location a few months ago, and this location was just as good as the last one! 

We were sat shorter than the given wait time which is always great. We ordered the catfish and grits, bacon praline pancake, and the Benedict Trio and all of them were fantastic! Great texture, wonderful balance of flavors, and very creative dishes. 

Our server, Fieldrose, could not have been more 
welcoming, fun, and enjoyable. Be sure to ask for her section!

If you're visiting NOLA, Ruby Slipper is a must-go.
Amazing food great drinks - great service from Freddie on a very busy morning. A must stop
Always have great food, service and atmosphere. The food options seem limitless and so far, all the dishes I have tried are well beyond good. It's a showcase of New Orleans great food and atmosphere!

Just finished an outstanding meal from this fine establishment. I felt safe to eat outside on their patio. We were happy to witnessed the staff execute their cleaning protocols before and after each group came and went. Krya took care of us and provided excellent recommendations. The BBQ shrimp and grits and the Pancakes were delicious.

This place is a must try. The food was delicious. So many options. The eggs Benedicts options will have your mouth watering.  Freddie, our server, was attentive and always smiling. Will definitely be back.

This place is pretty darn good!

This place is just about a couple feet away from the main street, and once you turn the corner it is hard to miss, especially with the large crowd right in front of it.  This was probably my only complaint as the crowd was huge and the wait was long.  There is no actual waiting area so every one is either standing on the sidewalk or just spilling on to the streets, waiting to be called by voice (they need an intercom or a better way to notify).  Once they did call our name, we were sat in the counter area, which nice as it gave an old diner feel.  Our order were taken with no problems

I had ordered the Banana Fosters Pain Perdu, which was very delicious and not overly sweet.  My girlfriend decided to be slightly healthier and order the Catfish Coubion, which was refreshingly tasty.  Both dishes were hefty in sized leaving us stuffed!  Prices were pretty decent as well with items ranging from $10 to $15.

If you can stand the wait, definitely worth checking out and trying!

If you are in NOLA this is a must stop for breakfast!  Wait out the line if there is one!  Worth it!  Awesome Grits!!!  Fun atmosphere and fast service with incredible food!!  Ate there three times during our stay in NOLA!

Try the crawfish Benedict!! To die for!
Get there early as they get packed fast for breakfast!

Food was fantastic as always.  The kids really enjoyed the cinnamon French toast batons.  The eggs cachon has been a long time favorite of mine.  Our server, Freddie, was personable and very attentive.  Can't wait to come back.
This is an amazing brunch spot that's unpretentious and has an inventive menu that makes you want to try everything. Sit at the bar and experience true southern hospitality!

At first I was annoyed because of the thirty minute wait time at 10:45 a.m., but OMG!   BEST Breakfast I've ever had!   The chicken St. Charles was amazing!   Thank your for the great recommendation by our server Neoka.

Very cute spot , the workers had a great attitude! The beignets weren't  what I expected very over priced and small, the Benedicts were pretty sub par , they tasted a little  bland, but the presentation was nice ! All in maybe I ordered the wrong thing. I may go back and give them a try !

We had the best brunch at this restaurant while visiting NO. The food was amazing and Louis, our waiter, was so great. He was so positive and fun and he clearly is passionate about what he does. They should give that kid a raise!

I'll admit that I've actively avoided The Ruby Slipper because of the long lines and variety of options that NOLA has to offer but I'm happy to say that this brunch spot is worth the hype! 
I used Yelp to hold my place in line (definitely use this feature during busy times) and it was busy when I came for brunch on a Saturday. Even though I used the app to hold my place in line, I still waited a good 10-15 minutes to get a seat at the bar. 
I ordered a big easy mimosa with grapefruit juice which was delicious and very big! It was plenty to drink on while I waited for my food to arrive. 
I decided to get the Peacemaker where you can choose two eggs benedicts. I chose the Chicken St Charles and Eggs Cochon which was pulled pork and absolutely delicious. It was way better than the chicken and I wished I had ordered two Cochon's! 
Overall I was happy that I made it here for brunch and it was a solid choice, but the line is a beast so be ready to wait and plan accordingly!

No better way to cap off my birthday celebration! Decided to have brunch at the Ruby Slipper on our last day in town. From start to finish Veronica was amazing! She was extremely friendly and tentative. (Drink never made it to the bottom) 

10 stars for service

5 stars for the food!

Thank you so much h

This place is always busy but I like how they text you when your table is ready so you can just wait outside. Moving on to the food... I went with my group of girlfriends and they all got the pick any two egg Benedict deal. The most popular ones are the eggs cochon, chicken st. Charles and the shrimp boogaloo. I opted for the bbq shrimp and grits and we all pretty much had a bite of eachothers plate. Every dish was delicious and so flavorful! Service was impeccable too. Worth the wait. Will be back next time I'm visiting NOLA!

Absolutely love the ruby slipper. I highly recommend the special pancake of the day especially if it is red velvet. Banana fosters French toast was superb. 
Yummy!!

I stopped in here on my way to work and was happy to see a rectangular bar that I could nab a seat at. I ordered the Louisianan omelet, which came with boiled shrimp and cheddar cheese- how can you mess that up, right?! They didn't! I got a side of grits with no cheese and mixed it in with my omelet- perfection!

The coffee was decent and the service was good. No complaints here, as I got what I came for and was in and out very quickly. 

Note: This place is part of a hotel and can easily be passed up if you don't see the sign facing outwards. A good thing to look out for is people waiting!

The brunch was phenomenal. We ordered a little bit of everything off the menu and had a fat fest, the biscuits and grace with the sweet and spicy chicken was my favorite of the spread. The waitress was very nice and helpful. Highly recommend getting on the wait list before showing up like we did cuts the wait time down.
Worth the wait! Make sure to jump on the waitlist from yelp before showing up. Delicious food! Very vegetarian friendly.

Crawfish Benedict was great. Salmon was okay just not what I expected it was in a cake or patty. Service was really good. I signed up for the waitlist and I was sat down almost immediately after I checked in

This is the 2nd time going to Ruby Slipper Cafe in 2 years,they didn't disappoint me. 
The best Bloody Mary and wonderful biscuits and egg dishes, especially "3 Little Pigs Omelet" , a must visit place in NOLA.

After reading the rave yelp reviews, we headed over to the Ruby Slipper for a delicious breakfast. Or, we tried to at least. 

When we got there, the wait was twenty minutes. This wasn't a problem so we crossed the street to wait in the sun, like so many other patrons. More diners came after us and, after twenty minutes of waiting, we went to make sure we hadn't missed our name. "One more table ahead of you," we were told. 

So we moseyed back over and resumed waiting. Then, a couple who had arrived after us got called. Since they were two and we were three, we assumed we would be next. Over the next fifteen minutes, however, we saw at least 4 groups of three and a group of six, all of whom arrived after we did, get called in to eat. 

Befuddled, we headed back into the busy restaurant to see what was happening. We were first ignored for a solid five minutes before anyone even looked at us. When we finally were spoken to, we were frustrated and we may have expressed that in our tones. We will admit that. However, instead of being apologetic, the host was curt and abrasive, putting his hand up and shrilly exclaiming, "give me a minute!" Seriously, dude?

After he and the other host talked quietly for a minute, the host said "it will be another minute." We were over it, so we left. Why should we want to give our money to a place where we have to throw a fit to get served? The food may have been good, but we'll never know. 

Instead we hopped on the 11 bus and found our way to Surrey's, where we were seated and served promptly and had a wonderful breakfast. 

My advice on the Ruby Slipper? Avoid, if at all possible.
There is always a wait so pre check in prior to arrival!! Bloody Mary's are amazing..our waiter wasn't very attentive or friendly but none the less food was delicious

Hands down this is one of the best brunch places I have ever been too. Their egg benedicts are the best combination of a crispy buttermilk biscuit as the base, very tender apple braised debris, a perfectly made egg, with the most bomb ass hollandaise sauce. No joke, my 1 week trip there we ate here 3 morning out of the week. This place is a must go if u are in the area.

Their bacon infused bloody Mary is quite good too.
We visit each time we come to New Orleans. Great food, the only problem is you get more than you can eat. Love it

First, let me say that I don't feel this review is a great outlook of this restaurant as there are several breakfast items I do not eat and the menu is scarce here. I don't eat eggs, sausage, grits, not pancakes and this seemed to be the highlight of the menu. I settled for a chicken salad sandwich on multi grain bread that came with fries and a blueberry mimosa. The blueberry mimosa was refreshing but lacked the flavor I was expecting. The chicken salad was nice it had the perfect amount of grapes and raisins but lacked the amount of chicken breast I was looking for. It was an okay meal. The atmosphere was very busy and bright lighting throughout.
Jessica was great! My chicken sandwich was fabulous! Thanks Jessica for making my daughters bachelorette party great

Thank god my friend knew of the NoWait app and was able to put down his name for a table, which did not make the wait too terrible. I would definitely recommend any of the eggs benedicts, which you can mix and match. We got an order of one chicken st charles eggs benedict and one eggs cochon, which were both fantastic. We also split an order of the bbq shrimp and grits, which was good but lacked a little flavor in the grits. Despite how full we were, we also ordered the stuffed cheesecake french toast, a definite highlight to the meal. The whipped cream was delicious and complemented the sweet cheesecake filling. And the salty bacon was also a nice contrast to the overall sweetness of the dish.

I'm local, so I don't typically come to this location because of parking and tourist crowds; however, a friend visiting is staying near the Quarter. After our own long, patient wait, we dine and pay. What we were not expecting: OUR SERVER ASKED US TO LEAVE ~5 minutes after we paid. Who does that?!?? We were still finishing our coffee and chatting. I get that servers want to make their money, but (a) there weren't that many folks waiting to be seated, and (b) we waited a long time to have the opportunity to be seated, just like everyone else. Major turn off. I definitely will stop recommending this location to my friends who come to town. My guest today was also put off by the server's request that we leave.

Great location inside the French Quarters! 

Ventured uptown for some delicious brunch -- accompanied with creamy bananas and mimosa. The french toast was so delicate, flooded with cream and cinnamon. I swear I spooned the syrup like ice cream. Covered gently with white sugar, I retreated to my bowl of fruit for refuge. Despite the entree being incredibly sweet, it was intoxicating, though the portion was huge! I would recommend splitting an entree with a friend. As for the mimosa, it was quite refreshing. Hung out on a table next to the bar and watched some soccer on the TV. 

The staff was incredibly friendly and helpful. Really cute spot.

If you're looking for a convenient place to eat, this is one. The pancakes were good, the French toast wasn't all that great. Their hot salmon dish was okay. The bread was soggy and it seemed like everything was thrown together. The capers on the salmon dish tastes old. Maybe their drinks are better than the food. Grateful to eat, but for the price and results, I would have gone else where.

Holy mackerel, this was so good!! Helpful hints: 1. Take advantage of the waitlist option on Yelp. The wait is no fewer than one hour. Better to wait elsewhere than the sidewalk outside. 2. If your table is not ready when you get there, take advantage of the server offering drink service for those waiting. It comes with a "half off your next drink" coupon to use once inside. 3. Go hungry! I mean really hungry. And order anything that comes with or on a biscuit. You won't be disappointed!!!
Def have to go here! The food is amazing! The biscuits are amazing! I also had the bananas foster French toast and that was excellent! The food here is made with love and it's a must try!

Great food. It's even a favorite of NoLa natives. The waitress patiently talked my travel partner through creating  a order that accommodated his many dietary restrictions.  He had fish and veggies and said the sauce was really good.  I had the Louisianan omelet and grits, which were super tasty.  They had mimosa with fruit purée which were yummy and much larger than the standard mimosa.  

TIP: Check-in with the app before going.  Despite checking in on the app, we still waited about 40 minutes for a tables. However, others said they waited for over an hour.
Don't believe the hype, they place is extremely overrated and definitely overpriced for what it is. I thought it would be an experience,but that wasn't true at all.

Brunch with a fun vibe! They broke out in song a few times during our meal. Outstanding full bodied house coffee.  You can buy their house blend at a local coffee store. Yes, I grabbed a bag to take back in my suitcase. Food was as yummy! I ordered Chicken St. Charles.  I definitely will be back.
Excellent food and atmosphere! We went twice on our short trip to NOLA because the food was that good! Our server, Freddy was friendly and attentive.

Came to town for a work conference and found this place via Yelp.

When I arrived at 7am there was a line to get in but I found seating right away.

Service
Eating alone, I sat at the bar in the middle of the restaurant. The service was friendly and attentive. Some wait staff were at the end of the bar putting cocktail garnishes together and chatting. They all seemed happy; one was even eating breakfast. It's a good sign when the staff eat their own food.

When I was cashing out the waitress asked me if I wanted a coffee to go.  Hooray! What a great offer!

Food
I was going to order pancakes but the waitress pointed out I can get those anywhere and suggested one of their specialties. I chose their housemade corned beef hash and eggs.  The portions were large and tasty. The chunks of beef and potatoes were just right and very flavorful.  The horseradish sauce was perfect - not too spicy for the morning, but full of flavor that went very well with the beef and potatoes.  I wanted more! The coffee was great - not the typical diner fare that tastes cheap and like cardboard.

Overall I would definitely recommend this place and definitely return.

I loved this restaurant! The staff was pleasant and helpful, and the blood Mary was delicious! We loved every plate of food we ordered. The community table was a new experience, and I enjoyed sitting and talking with new people! Will definitely be back
A wonderful place to eat. The wait wasn't too bad. The food is phenomenal and a very friendly staff.

5-star breakfast, 5-star location and 5-star service. We had a 30-minute wait (which I never do) and it actually added to the experience. There is an outdoor wait staff moving through the crowd for drink orders. We ordered mimosas and bloody Mary's.  We favored the bloody Mary's over the mimosas but note they were all generous pours. The biscuits, grits and eggs were our favorite orders. This place is very well organized and managed. They managed the crowd and overall experience like a 5-star establishment.

just yum... 3rd trip to NOLA and I finally made it here and my gosh am
I happy I FINALLY did. It's best to arrive circa 7:30 AM (when they open) to avoid the wait. The fried green tomatoes are southern and decadent, the subtle sweetness of the maple bacon paired with the texture of
the breading that doesn't crumble when forked was appreciated. The French toast l, which is a special I believe, is so good (the cream cheese.. ) and the colored sugar is not an overpowering addition, even if it looks like it. I'm pretty sure good food is just a thing here so whatever you have, enjoy!
Delightful cuisine. My husband loved their shrimp and grits. Be sure to go hungry! These portions are crazy big.
Very nice breakfast.  Food is very good  and service from Julie was outstanding!  Definitely southern hospitality!!!  I'd come come back again if I was staying here longer...
Breakfast was perfectly. Expect a long line if you come at peak time. Next time I'll come later.

Seating was only about 5 minutes from the usual 30+ so that's a start. I was immediately greeted and taking care of and when it comes to restaurants, I require attention as a customer. The drink and food I ordered took no time to come out and both tasted absolutely amazing. 

Freddie was my server, he did excellent

Fantastic food and service, after a terrible experience last night at another restaurant that is not to be named. Kyra definitely turned this trip around. She helped us start our day on the right foot and treated us with southern hospitality. Freddy (the Busser?) was very kind and kept our table ready for whatever came next. 
Would definitely recommend.

The food is great the poach eggs in the Benedict are perfectly cooked. Living in vegas I'm kinda critical when it comes to food but this definitely has the taste of New Orleans in a breakfast plate... the outside seating is nice and literally stone throw away from Marriott where I stayed.

I went to the restaurant based upon the positive reviews.  My husband had there  eggs and biscuit and raved how delicious it was.  However, my experience was not the same! I ordered  bbq Shrimp and grits, which gave me food poisoning!   Food poisoning so severe I had to go to the emergency room.  There was the only food consummation in the last 12 hours.  Therefore,  strongly indicated  the restaurant as the only source.

Some of the best southern breakfast places around.  Get the "peacemaker".  You get to select two of any specialty Benedict's.   We selected the coachen and the shrimp boogaloo.   

The coffee they use is from their local French truck coffee company which is smooth and bold.  We came here twice during our trip because the food and drinks were that good. 

Get a ruby slipper mimosa.  Too good to not try.
Great food at very good prices. The service was also great. I highly recommend Ruby Slipper

200 magazine street location. While the wait was long the staff were awesome. Food was good. Truly enjoyed the experience. Thank you Freddie for being great at service, friendly and responsive. Vanilla ice coffee was yum and the goat cheese omelette was amazing.

Ruby Slipper Cafe offers breakfast choices for every taste. Make your own omelette is great. There are other creative dishes too, from sweet to savory, with twists on some classics.  Good food and reasonable prices for tourist area of the city. The interior has high ceilings and the space just feels welcoming, not narrow or hodge podge like some of the older buildings can be. Has some high top tables, banquettes, and a bar for seating.  Everyone I've gone with has agreed that this is a delightful, delish place to recover from a hangover or get fortified for the day.

Our party ate here twice in one week while visiting New Orleans.  Awesome breakfast for a fair price.  I normally like to try different things on the menu when returning to a restaurant but I couldn't stay away from the Banana Foster French Toast for a 2nd time.  It was amazing!  Wait staff was very friendly and did a great job.

I can see why Ruby Slipper is such a popular brunch spot after our phenomenal breakfast here last month during Jazz fest weekend! It's the kind of place where you bring your friends and family because you know you're getting quality.

We sat at the bar, which was bustling with activity along with the rest of the (understandably) crowded restaurant. Our waitress was nice and made great drinks! 
My Peach Bellini Mimosa tasted like it was made with real peaches. After our first night in NOLA drinking a bunch of horrible sugary drinks like hurricanes this refreshing fruity drink was a godsend. My bf's "19th hole" cocktail which is basically an Arnold Palmer + vodka, was tasty but STRONG! 

As for food, I had the BBQ shrimp and grits and bf got the 
mixed eggs benedict plate with the shrimp boogaloo and eggs cochon bennies. Honestly, ever since our breakfast here I have been unwilling to order shrimp and grits anywhere else because I know they won't compare. The dish was actually quite simple but the flavor of the seasoning, the meatiness of the shrimp, and the perfect creaminess of the grits was unparalleled. And they didn't have to add globs of cheese to give it flavor. The bennies were amazing too! He preferred the shrimp but I have never tasted such tender, flavorful pork before. 

I liked that they gave us the bill as soon as we put our order in because it explains why they're relatively fast here and don't have ridiculous lines.

We most certainly will be back to Ruby Slipper cafe next time we're in our favorite city :)
Food was ok not worth the wait the bloody Mary on the other hand was worth going to get and walk to another establishment

Sunday brunch was everything! Great ambiance and the fried green tomatoes were to die for! Please  add yourself to
The waitlist on Yelp for faster service

Our friend who works in NOLA 5 days a week recommended this brunch place to us and we're SO glad to have taken his advice before leaving the city!!

I got the peacemaker (choice of 2 benedicts): The shrimp boogaloos (my fave) and chicken  St. Charles eggs Benedict. Bf got the banana  fosters French toast and they were ALL solid. There was no leftovers and I wish we'd came by the day prior so we could have it 2 days in a row!! We will def be back whenever we're in NOLA again.

I also got the Irish coffee bc everyone raved about it on Yelp and my lame self had to ask the server to add more coffee or sugar or whatever to hide the alcohol taste more bc that's all I could taste.. so it's boozy for sure which I think is supposed to be a good thing??

Pro tip : make a reservation on Yelp if you're plan to go during peak hours or you just might get yourself a free hydrating sauna tan standing in the line outside. We did just that and waited for about 5 minutes after arriving before being seated.

Parking: this is the middle of NOLA, equivalent to DT NYC.. or really anywhere in NYC.. which is to say pretty nonexistent. There're random lots a couple of blocks away and I didn't think the rate was crazy high.

Service was friendly but I was not a fan of those eggs blackstone.
Latte was good.
Freddie is THE BEST!  Amazing drinks and eggs Benedict options.  Our favorite brunch spot when visiting NOLA  always busy but for a reason! Worth the wait and the warmest environment for all ‍‍

Glorified Denny's at best. Waitress was rude and inattentive. Pancake was tough and very overcooked. Bacon was cold and like rubber. Orange juice was fresh and very good which is why I in reader the rating to 3 stars!
Trust the reviews this place is great! Its the only restaurant we ate at multiple times during our three day trip.
Great eggs Benedict! Loved the chicken Benedict!! Very good service always attentive. Cant go wrong here for breakfast.
Any of their locations is worth a visit large portions at reasonable price good soulful food! You won't need a lunch after this meal!

Oh just another place in New Orleans with phenomenal food. This time we tried the Grilled Fish St. Peter and the Peacemaker with the Eggs Cochon and the Chicken St. Peter. The biscuits were perfect. The chicken a d pulled pork were juicy and flavorful. The sauce was a good amount and delicious. Grilled fish that day was Red Fish. If you've never had grilled Red Fish you are missing out. The grit cake was similar to a polenta cake. The shrimp skewer has that wonderful gulf shrimp. You really can't miss with either of these. Our server was a mom and shared a ton of websites and nursery rhyme videos on YouTube with us for our son. She was enough to make you want to come back. I highly recommend this place.

Only place opened close to our hotel that was open at 7:30am.  We did not have reservations so we were fortunate they were able to seat us.  By 
8:30 am they were packed.  Recommend you call for reservations due to covid restrictions.  Service was excellent.  Brandi our server was friendly and prompt with our food and check (we had to be somewhere at 9am.)  I ordered chicken breakfast sausage sandwich.  It was delicious and it was a good portion.  

The restaurant did a great job with covid restriction regarding mitigation of the tables.  I also noted they had a UV light on the wall.  I felt very safe.  We went during Mardi Gras weekend.  This year they did not have their parade so the restaurant had everything decorated in Mardi Gras.  Very festive.  

Highly recommend for a place to eat.
Wonderful food.  Freddie gave us great service. One day in and NOLA has shown awesome hospitality.

came here and the grits were amazing. as was the chocolate milk. friendly waitress. cute place. I'm easy to please for breakfast most of the time. the omelet was okay. my grits and the yummy goat cheese made up for it.
The food and service is great. The bacon is the best. The bacon infused blood Mary yummy. Must go there to eat. We went twice it was so good.

This place was right across the street from our hotel. We walked in and sat at the bar for breakfast. Our servers were very attentive and friendly. They have amazing food. I got the bananas foster, and my husband got the chicken st Charles. We both loved our meals. The coffee was also on point. For those looking for brunch drinks, they had it all: bloody Mary's, screwdrivers and mimosas. Highly recommend.

Meh.
It's a chain. 
One star for the biscuit, half star for the pulled pork flavor and half a star for the yelp add-your-name on the waitlist service.
The bad.... Even if you get a large booth they don't allow your family and friends to join you at the table. Lame. My sister arrived ten minutes after me and was seated way across the room while I was at a large booth for six.
The food is just average. It was served luke warm. The biscuits were great though. The Benedicts were dry. Had the trifecta , it was big but bland. 
Pass.

Where to start!?!?! We were seated immediately. I ordered a Bloody Mary with bacon vodka-it was amazing. We ordered stuffed French toast and the Southern breakfast. The eggs and fried green tomato were an excellent pair. The grits were tasty and the biscuit was HUGE! The cane sugar butter that came with the biscuit was the cherry on top! The stuffed French today was savory to say the least! The staff was friendly to say the least! I would definitely come back again!!!!!!!!!!!!

Breakfast #2 was a huge success again! I had the shrimp boogaloo and my wife had the migas. Both were fantastic, and the perfect amount of food. If you're in NOLA and wanting breakfast, this is your place to go!!!
The wait is worth it!  Unbelievable service.  Ordered and not 3 minutes later, food was here! Michael was quick and efficient.
Great breakfast! In NO for a conference and ate every breakfast here. The infused butter is amazing. I kept bringing more colleagues each morning. You will not be disappointed!

(This review is based in a Mardi Gras 2015 visit... looks like I saved the review instead of posting)

After a few "not so great meals" in order to avoid the long lines/waits, we decided to go ahead and wait in line for The Ruby Slipper, and we are glad we did. 

Drinks: since we had 30-40min to kill we decided to treat ourselves to a mimosa and bloody marry... Even though it was 9:45am. These were not amateur beverages. We were served 16oz of strong "time to wake up" drinks, which we were feeling 1/2 way though sipping them.

Service: fun, friendly, and sociable staff. They were great. 

Food: with so many delicious looking things on the menu, and amazing looking food coming out of the kitchen, it was hard to choose what to eat. After much deliberation, and a suggestion from our server, I went with the Breakfast Sandwich. 
It. Was. Amazing. One of the best I've had! This scrumptious sammy had two fried eggs, pepper-jack cheese, outrageously good pig-candy bacon,and a fried green tomato sandwiched between a housemade buttermilk biscuit. 

I highly suggest Ruby Slipper if. We discovered they have a few locations and since this place was so good we ate at two of them. 

Give it a try!

The BEST breakfast we had while in NOLA! The biscuits were incredible (still drooling over them). We had French toast and made to order omelettes, and although basic compared to the rest of the menu still very satisfied with quality. The iced French latte was delicious. Although we did have to wait awhile outside and while our food was being made, it was well worth the wait.

Amazing food and amazing service.
Thank you Freddie. 
The St. Charles chicken and the French toast bites.
Delicious and unique little spot! Ordered the peacemaker eggs Benedict and the iced coffee with a Bloody Mary. Did not disappoint!

Food: 5
Service: 4
Price: 4
Ambiance: loud

I'll keep this review short n sweet. The eggs bennies are divine here, and they do it in many variations.  Craving fried chicken? They got that. Hankering for some cochon? They have that too.  Can't make up your mind? You can make peace with two to mix n match. All topped with perfectly poached plump egg oozing with runny yolk.

If I lived in Nola, I would easily be dinning here at least on a bi-weekly basis. I'm a sucker for eggs bennies and they've perfected them here.

Items Selected:
Coffee
Cinnamon Swirl Pancakes - Applewood Smoked Bacon
The Peacemaker Benedict - Half Shrimp Boogaloo with Taso, Fried Green Tomatoes and Coubon Sauce / Half Cochon with slow-cooked Apple-Cider Braised Pork Debris with Hollandaise over Buttermilk Biscuits with a Poached Egg
Bananas Foster Pain Perdu - French Bread-French Toast, Rum Flambéed Bananas & Raisins, Applewood Smoked Bacon
Buttermilk Biscuit with Maple Butter 

With three New Orleans locations plus restaurants in Pensacola Florida and Orange Beach Alabama, The Ruby Slipper Café promises diners a worthwhile breakfast, brunch or lunch of Southern Staples reinvented, the popular Magazine Street location proving decent, if not memorable, in a city with no lack of great alternatives available.

Attached to The Pelham Hotel, though not affiliated in any perceivable way aside from sharing a restroom, The Ruby Slipper Café is a family owned and operated restaurant known mostly for its encouragement of day drinking and hearty plates of comfort food intended to accompany it, the ever bustling space often featuring waits of up to an hour on weekends, though the 'nowait' app has recently given diners the ability to check-in online and spend their wait checking out downtown New Orleans shops or looking for parking spaces.

Seated at the center of a room completely packed at 9am on a Tuesday, the father & daughter pair to our right a stark contrast to a quartet of Seahawks fans sporting a two-day hangover just a few tables to the left, it was with greetings from a friendly server that orders were placed for three plates, one side and two coffees, the roast from French Truck smooth and lightly floral but nearly impossible to have refilled without repeated requests.

Turning away incomplete parties, though happy to let singles or those waiting for others belly up to the bar, it was after perhaps twenty minutes of chatting and listening to music play over the din that plates arrived from the kitchen, a quick look at the Pancakes immediately raising suspicion that someone had ordered poorly, doughy bites not dissimilar from Bisquick not seeing the minimal amount of Cream Cheese Frosting or Artificial Maple Syrup do the item any favors.

Finding the biscuit to be better than some, though not as well laminated as many of the best, it was onward to better things that the meal progressed as plates were shared amongst us, the ability to mix n' match The Ruby Slipper's two most popular Benedicts a welcome option that showed both to be well crafted with preference for the tender roast Pork, a pile of custardy Pain Perdu nonetheless stepping up to steal the spotlight with a generous helping of Bananas Foster Sauce infused with Rum and plump Raisins.

YUCK! What is it with people's obsession with fast food and then calling it amazing? This was not delicious soul food, this was not delicious cajun food it was just a disgusting slightly more expensive version of Denny's. I ate about 1/8 of mine and threw it out. It was DISGUSTING, over salted, greasy, and sour. My stomach refused to let any more of this garbage in.  I ate some of the fries but even they were pretty below average run of the mill standard frozen fast food fries.

SOOOOOOOO, this place by far after visiting NOLA 3 times has the BEST breakfast IMO.   We had breakfast here 3 days in a row during our stay as it was right across the street and it was DELISH.  I tried to taste everything!!!!! The first day I was not happy when the server would not take a togo order at the end of the meal.  He said that I had to go over to the bar and place it.  After spending almost $200 on our family meal that day needless to say I was a little bit upset, but I kept it moving.  We were not going to hold up the table but just wanted to place the order.    Freddie on the other hand, we got him day 2.  He was GREAT! Very accommodating and took my togo order right from the table. My adult special needs child struggles with large group settings so we needed to take her food back to the resort.  Freddie apologize about the prior day and took care of my family.  He made us feel like Ruby Slipper Cafe WOULD always takes care of their guest and be accommodating.  We will be back.

I'm only a little sad giving this place a two because while the food was fantastic, everything else was lacking and negligible. An estimated 45 min wait for TWO PEOPLE for breakfast turned into an hour 15 min. Strike 1. And the host seemed less than concerned. We waited 15 min at our table before we were even greeted. And by then we were more than ready to order. Strike 2. We tried to enjoy our food while eating it quickly because we had plans to see a show at French Qtr Fest and only caught the last 15 min of an hour gig. Strike 3. Don't think we will be back. One and done.

Amazing service, friendly wait staff and lets tsk about the menu. It's packs a punch with some amazing options. I feel like you can't go wrong with anything on the menu. Great atmosphere and fair pricing. Go get you some!
Brunch was great here!  We waited an hour or so to get seated but it was well worth.
This place is unbelievably exceptional.  Menu is very diversified and service was very quick and she was very nice.
Great breakfast and Irish coffee! Try the 3 little pigs omelet  Freddie H was an awesome server!
The line was around the block so we expected great food. It was not good food.  The fried green tomato on the eggs Benedict was good.  The service was ok.
Loved this place the wait was extremely long but oh sooooo worth it I ordered the heat chicken and French toast I have no complaints everything I ordered was delicious

This place was awesome! We were able to put our name down and check our place in line using Yelp, which meant we got to stroll around and explore while we waited for a table. The wait for 2 was about 30 min at 11am on a Friday morning. We ordered the skinny miga, which was so satisfying with the soft texture of the scramble and the crunchy tortilla strips. If you want to get the french toast cinammon sticks, they are similar to churros and it is best to share among a few friends as they are very sweet. We could barely have 2 of them and boxed the rest. The sweet vanilla cold coffee is refreshing and not overly sweet. This is a great brunch option in the Quarter for vegetarians as they don't focus on the typical New Orleans seafood here. Walkable from the major hotels, which was a nice plus. My friends had some great drinks here, too, if that is your thing.

I went to the ruby slipper during my trip to New Orleans I gave it three stars because it was mediocre service but good food. We had to wait a long time for her to get a menu and then to take our order the food was good I got the fried French toast bites which are really good.

Stupid good... I mean just stupid good. We stayed right across the street from it at Touro and it wound up being our go to place for breakfast and snacks. The Benedicts are fantastic, and the cocktails are great as well. Over our three day stay, we never had a bad experience at the Ruby

Went here for brunch twice while in New Orleans, once on a Thursday and two days later on Saturday.  The wait time Thursday wasn't bad (or used the online waitlist feature) but Saturday it was about 45 minutes, which is to be expected on a weekend. Staff is friendly and welcoming... better service on Thursday then on Saturday, but again they were busy Saturday so NBD.

Thursday I have the eggs Benedict with pork debris, and it was delicious! Not nearly as heavy as you would expect... The business very light and there was just the right amount of rich, salty pork. The hollandaise almost tasted like cheddar, but it was really good. The coffee drinks are a little underwhelming... The vanilla iced coffee was pretty weak and the spicy vanilla coffee was covered in canned whipped cream, but their regular old coffee is pretty good and definitely better than the fancier ones IMHO. 

And my second trip back I had the bananas Foster French toast, and I was not impressed... I think my expectations were too high because of what I had read online, but the bread was tough, there weren't very much bananas, and it was REALLY sweet (more sweet than flavorful). I couldn't finish it. Again, I don't know if that's because it was the weekend and they were slammed, but I think you could find better bananas Foster French toast in the city where it's famous.

All in all, really good brunch spot with great staff, but I wouldn't recommend their sweet options.
This place is a tourist trap. Overpriced. Better food can be found else where, like at bearcat.
Amazing food. Staff was great and controlled the line very well. Shrimp Benedict was great. Honestly enjoyed their beignets better than CDM.
Food was delicious, drinks were great and our server Freddie was awesome! Thank you Ruby Slipper!
One of the best breakfast spots in town. Love everything I've tried. Great service. Funky spot.

Do yourself a favor now and download the "NoWait app" and get yourself in line here at least once during your visit to NOLA. The Eggs Cochon, the amazing cocktails, chicken St. Charles, all of it is outstanding.  I have never had better food than I did during my visit to NOLA and this was the perfect last breakfast before we flew out.

Join the waitlist online and believe them when they tell you it will be a 3 hour wait. The food was great, but the wait was outrageous. It also appeared as though those who joined the waitlist online took priority over those who joined the waitlist upon arrival.

Big line, lots of pics, lots of let downs. Too crowded inside, sooooo slow food service.  I get it, it's a NO fan favorite, but this traveling person didn't see the fuss over a overly soggy banana fosters something.  I just think 90 mins to spend on a breakfast is wrong, even worse for this mush of a meal. Staff were very friendly. 
DOS: 11/11/19 at 10 am.
Omg every thing on the menu is delicious, just sit and enjoy, service is excellent friendly staff, delicious drinks.

I'm not too sure what the hype is about this place. Did we order the wrong items? Maybe our taste buds were off?

We sat at the bar and the food took seemingly long to come. I was noting to a friend maybe the bartender forgot to go back and check since it didn't seem like a waiter was going to bring out our food. When our food came it was room temperature for most part and maybe lukewarm at best. It seemed like our food had been sitting somewhere for a long time because the biscuit and bread for the sandwich was completely soaked. 

The food itself was a disappointment, partly maybe because the room temperature thing didn't help with the taste and texture. I had the egg cochon which was their signature dish. But the pork was rather bland. The catfish sandwich was completely soggy and the BBQ shrimp and grits changed texture a bit since it was cold.  We left feeling disappointed.

Try the blood Mary. This was my first time stopping here. I used yelp to save me a spot in line since i saw that there is sometimes a wait. We were seated at the bar. The bartender stated to try the Bloody Mary. Sooooo good. This was my first Bloody Mary ever. And decide it was with a shot. The breakfast was delicious. I had the stone cake grits with the fresh catch. So yummy. My cousin tried the shrimp and grits and it was also delicious. The servers were all so nice. We also decide to be greedy and split a pancake. The pancakes are huge and so good. After eating all of our food we ended it by enjoying 2 peach bellies. So worth the trip.

This was soooooo good!  We had breakfast.  I had a mix of shrimp and chicken benedicts.  The shrimp had a tomato based sauce.  I am not a big fan of tomato dishes and cautious when trying one.  This one was done well.  The shrimp were plump unlike many breakfast shrimp dishes, and both benedits were delish!  Hubby had the fish and grits.  Delish again, light airy fish and rich creamy grits just like a southern girl deserves.
Incredible breakfast. The banana foster French toast and the spinach Florentine omelet is amazing! The French toast was so good and rich
People were nice- food was great! I strongly suggest it. I also ate some of everything because they let me order off the kids menu. So fun
Was DELICIOUS  I had the bacon praline buttermilk pancakes, they also have candied bacon yummy,  we went with a group  of 7 people and sat comfortably grits taste like they are made with sweet cream

Pros: Friendly & customer oriented staff. Sat immediately once our reservation & attendance of our entire party was confirmed. Staff wore masks. Clean & cute establishment. Great variety, good portion sizes, & tasty drinks! I ordered the Chicken & French Toast bites and a Peach Bellini - delicious!!!

Cons: Limited parking, but we lucked up & got a spot right in front of the restaurant!

My GF recommended this spot & I'm glad we came! I'd love to visit again, enjoy!!
Perfect place to grab a tasty breakfast. Popular and staff attentive.

Amazing amazing aaammmaazzzing food! A lot of locals will suggest this place for brunch but be aware that you have to be there early to avoid a big line! The fries grits were perfectly cooked and creamy and definitely recommend. We had the banana foster French toast and it was good but it was also a lot, recommend sharing this one. The service was phenomenal even though it's a busy spot. Definitely recommend!

WOW! Only one word can really define this brunch. My friend and I made our first stop on our NOLA trip at Ruby Slipper Cafe and it was WELL WORTH IT! I ordered the stuffed french toast of the day and it was soooooooo good! I def was having a sugar rush, but it really was much needed. Their coffee was also very good. It was my first experience getting a "to go" container in NOLA. My friend ordered a ruby slipper a(a mimosa) and the portion size was very generous. Please go here!
Jerry the manager was super helpful getting our party of 11 seated quickly... the Ruby Mimosa was great- the biscuit with the maple butter was delish...

When you see a line out the door on any given say then you know the food is bomb! Came here through many referrals. Did a res through yelp for the first time had the breakfast sampler the peacemaker that was phenomenal loved every delicious bite. The staff was super friendly sat me right away. Its super easy to find just follow the line of people and the smell of great food. Had a great conversation with a local then headed home back to Cali what a great way to end a wonderful trip!

There was a waiting line. The Yelp get in line feature helped us. It's accurate and the restaurant respects it. You do have to check in to make sure you have arrived. They received us well and the service was quick. 
The place is always crowded and theres frequent shout-outs for special occasions(birthdays and anniversaries etc.) from servers.

We listed our names on the waitlist prior to leaving the hotel- and once we arrived to the actual restaurant, we checked in- our actual wait time? 10 mins. While waiting- we had some ruby mimosas- once seated, we enjoyed much more flavor food. The menu is a bit overwhelming- we ordered the gulf fish is St. Peter and some Cochon/chicken biscuit Benedict plate with some candies bacon. The only reason I didn't give that 5th star: the meals came out very lukewarm- so it was underwhelming, in that sense.

I've eaten here more than once during my time in NOLA. It's located a block from my hotel and super convenient. In the beginning, I had no idea how famous the Ruby Slipper Cafe was, and I'm glad I stopped in more than once. This cafe is always packed and since I was dining alone, it was easier to grab a seat at the bar. 

I love their mimosas; they are heavenly and I don't know what they do to them, but they are delicious and don't taste like any other mimosa I've had (in the best way possible).

For my meal I enjoyed the Eggs Blackstone, which is Eggs Benedict on a biscuit and tomato. It's good, but I wasn't crazy about the hollandaise sauce. Maybe it's just made differently in the Northeast. 

This is a pretty casual joint that attracts both tourists and locals. Despite how busy they are, the tables are turned quickly and the service is top notch. I've heard that people have waited to get in and I've seen the line on a Sunday afternoon while I was walking around, but I was lucky enough to not experience that during my visits. 

My meal was way too much for me to eat, but I wasn't super hungry and I was eating around 2 pm and needed to leave room for dinner later on in the evening. 

If you are spending time in NOLA, I would add this to your list.

First time in NOLA and everybody recommended this place. So luckily we were able to add ourselves to the waitlist (courtesy of Yelp) and we were seated upon arrival. The place was pretty packed and there were a lot of people outside. The food was amazing!!! I ordered the egg Benedict combo where you get to pick two. I had the chicken and the pork I think and it was heaven. I did asked that my eggs were fried as I don't like poached eggs. My side was grits with cheese which were just ok. We had the ruby mimosa. My cousin ordered the Banana Foster French Toast which she really liked. I would highly recommend this place. The food is fantastic!

Do not come here. It was a horrible experience. Greta the manager is a total bitch. She has horrible customer service and people skills. She insulted everyone at our table and threatened to call the police on us. I will never come to this establishment again. The food was terrible. Waste of $

This was my first time at this location and I was simply blown away! I loved being able to get on the waitlist and wait from the comfort of my hotel! Once we arrived we only waited about 20 minutes to be seated. Now on to the food...the food...the food!!! MAGNIFICENT! We came for a girl's brunch and all ordered different menu items and each and every items was impressive. You could literally taste each ingredient. The flavors were authentic and bold, but not over powering. The fried green tomatoes were fried to perfection and topped off with a sauce that will make your mouth sing! The Trifecta was also a wonderful choice. It gave us a nice taste of what the Ruby Slipper has to offer. We also ordered the salmon, sliders, French toast and multiple drinks. Please don't let the wait turn you away from enjoying what this place has to offer. I'd gladly wait again! On a side note: It started to pour while we were eating and the manager ran outside in the pouring rain to help patrons! Great customer service and a servant leader work ethic!
A friendly and inviting space with lovely food and coffee.
Amazing food! Amazing service! This will definitely be a first stop when we come back to NOLA

This is going to sound uppity- but this is New Orleans and I typically don't eat at chain restaurants because there are local places that need our support. However, want a brunch that will put food in front of you with no surprises and is always perfectly cooked and delicious? Go here. Shy away from the "Mardi Gras benigets" because that made my friends 4 year old really sad- there was no purple green and gold it was just a schmeer and a jelly. But if they'd have sold it to me with that description instead I wouldn't blink twice at it. It was still yummy.

This location is not my favorite.

They are way over crowded. The servers are being pulled in a million different directions so they don't have the time to do more than grab your drink and deliver your food. The food is thrown on the plate without any attempts to make it look nice. Make sure it's your food though before you dig in because I've had other people's order brought to me before. I think this place just needs to decrease the amount of seating so that they can slow down the traffic in the place. I was seated at the bar but still hesitant to move for fear of bumping a server that was balancing an entire table's worth of food at once. Direct people to the one around the corner if you're that pressed for business.
Love Mix and Match Eggs Benny paired with the Morning Margarita is the perfect combination!!! Join the wait list before arriving to make your wait shorter but it's definitely worth the wait!

Definitely the place every tourist in town seems to go. The wait time is outrageous along with the prices. The food is good but I ordered a Mimosa while I was waiting and got a plastic cup not even close to full that wasn't even chilled. Definitely was overpriced. The waitress outside was friendly but the one we had inside was distracted and not very friendly. We decided not to go back since it wasn't worth the wait,
Wonderful place, be prepared for a wait. Use the no wait app and it will help quite a bit. Friendly staff and excellent food. Ashley was an awesome server. Cocktails were on point!
The breakfast was great and the service was awesome! The food left my girls full and happy! Thank you Ruby Slipper Cafe!! This visit was one of the best stops on our Essence Festival experience!!!

We stopped here based on the recommendations and this experience was way more than expected. There were 4 in our group and we got inline through yelp which is highly recommended. We all ordered the Benedict's but the winner was definitely the Chicken St. Charles. If you get the chance definitely try this place. The staff was awesome from the hostess to the waitress to the bussing staff. We will definitely be back on our next visit.
Where to begin... this place is perfect. Great food, great service, and even better coffee. Worth the long wait. Will be back next time we're in NOLA!

We are visiting NOLA from Dallas and loved the Ruby slipper.  Our kids had the French toast bites with bacon and I had a southern BLT.  Fried green tomato is a special twist on this BLT!  The Bloody Mary was fabulous and worthy of their award.

Everything was so delicious!! We got the eggs cochon Benedict and the pecan praline stuffed French toast. Mouthwatering. Our friend got the chicken Benedict and it was even better! So flavorful. We waited a little over an hour for a table, but they text you and you can watch your place in line while you do something else. I would go here 20x again! Samantha L was great!

Wow came early 8-9am on a Thursday and it was already getting busy, we sat inside because we are from California and cannot handle the heat or humidity. The service and the food were out of this world! The food is so worth the wait! We only have a few days in Nola and I'm ready to go back a 2nd time!!

This place is a chain and has multiple locations in the area, within reasonable walking distance to each other. I only tried this location TWICE because I couldn't get enough of the cuban sandwich (I forget what they call it, I think it had Miami in the name). The first day landing in NOLA, I stopped in and grabbed something to eat while waiting to check into my room. I immediately fell in love. They have great cappuccino as well as great food. Unfortunately, their plantains are dry and not sweet, but that is my only complaint. Everything else is on point. Before leaving, I decided to have brunch once again at this location to try and get my fill. But, I don't think that is possible. This is another chain, that I wish would come up north to NJ. The menu is simple and executed exceptionally.
Nice outdoor seating, food was pretty good. Service was good. Solid restaurant overall would recommend for breakfast.
Great food and service.  Getting there early always helps. One of my go to spots in NOLA. Love love love!!  Got the souvenir mug too!

Benedicts. Benedicts. Benedicts. Benedicts. Benedicts. Benedicts. Benedicts. Benedicts. 
Holy moly. They have the best Benedicts around. You can mix and match which is fabulous when your indecisive. I love their salmon and pork ones the best. Also their mimosas are on point. The wait can be a bit but luckily they have multiple locations. Just give a few a call or check the wait on yelp!

Second location visited. It was within walking distance from hotel and was able to enjoy the scenery on way there. The food was delicious and hot. The pancakes were not super sweet but I did take off as many of the white chocolate chips I could so that may have helped. Fries were salty though. I had to take off the seasoning of all of them but they were crispy. The wait time was not bad for the time of day we went, Sunday around 1230. Service was not horrible but we had to flag the guy down for refills and he just checked on us once and then brought check. The Bam Bam biscuit I was told was filling and good. Would recommend this place for sure.
Great spot! Food was delicious and our server Max was extremely attentive and helpful! This place is a must!

Unbelievably delicious, Freddie made us feel at home!
So glad to have found this place as tourists

Our Uber driver recommended Ruby Slippers to us and she should get 5 stars just for the recommendation. 

Casual brunch atmosphere with a server who circles around the waiting area taking drink orders (a nice touch and great way to appease the inevitable crowd you will encounter.. waiting to get in). 
Note: We (party of 6) got there on Sunday around 11am and only waited about 15-20 to be seated. 

The food was amazing! They have a great mix of Louisiana/Cajun dishes (BBQ shrimp and grits, crab Benedicts, catfish, etc) and traditional breakfast options like eggs, bacon, corned beef hash and pancakes. 

The biscuits and honey butter were worth the trip!
Great breakfast/brunch spot. A little salty when it came to the fried chicken for their Benedict but overall delicious spot that is sure to fill you up!

We should have just planned to eat here everyday of pur trip! We did mamage to eat here twice! The morning bloody marys really hit the spot!
The bacon was well cooked as was the french toast and pancakes. The food was filling and lasted us past our lunch time and therefore we skipped lunch until later in the afternoon.
Looooooved the trio eggs benny!! The chicken Benedict was my favorite. Probably my favorite brunch item in town.
Freddie was an excellent server. Knowledgeable, friendly and fun! Get the Cochon Benedict or Chicken St. Charles. So good!!

I was not expecting much being in the french quarter but they sure delivered more than they promised. It is a very pack place and now I could see why. They offered very New Orleans inspired meals that fits for my vacation. I ordered the banana foster french toast and it was impeccable. I sure tasted that bourbon with the banana. I convinced my husband to get the conchin egg Benedict and the pork meat was savory and tender. Plus he asked for extra Holendaise sauce but it was done perfectly. Then I tried the biscuit with egg Benedict and I was so soft and delicious. I would tell you that breakfast here would guarantee a memorable meal that make you want to come back for more. You only have to wait in line for almost 30 minutes or more.

The st Pete is where its at. It's a life changer. The waffles and pancakes were just that,  waffles and pancakes. Really good coffee. The wait was fairly quick even though it was stacked up in there. Deff a must visit spot.

From a perspective of someone visiting NOLA, this place was great! It gets very busy so I would suggest checking-in through Yelp. Otherwise, when you show up they take your cellphone number down and text you when your table is ready.

Service was great! Our server, Kristen, was extremely friendly, informative, patient, and even though she was wearing a mask due to Covid Rules you can see her smile through her eyes.

The food was great! An explosion of flavors in every bite. Everything was cooked to perfection.

There is a reason this place is one of the top breakfast spots in New Orleans!  Came here for breakfast on Fat Tuesday and it did not disappoint.  We got there shortly after 9am and by 9:30 the wait was over an hour. They did a great job offering drinks while people waited and had a great vibe from all staff.  I ordered the bananas foster French toast and it was delicious.  Great spot to enjoy breakfast!
Very good food and great service . Mimosas are so good . Nice options for vegans too !
Amazing food. Great service. Amazingly delicious food :-) Yummy drinks. Reasonable wait on a busy day. Oh, and really delicious food!

OMG...the best version of Eggs Benedict we had while in New Orleans...Bayou Shrimp Benedict. Poached eggs on a fluffy, freshly baked biscuit, stacked with pork Tasso in a Creole tomato sauce, fried green tomatoes and shrimp. To. Die. For. The Bananas Foster French toast was the perfect side dish, and the cafe au lait rich and creamy. Service was impeccable and the staff were friendly and accommodating. Definitely a must while in NOLA.

Man, I wish this places lived up to the hype. Maybe I got a dud, but the food I ate was unacceptable. If it wasn't for it being my last day in NOLA with time constraints I would have walked out on it. 

First off - I was able to skip the large line being by myself. I ordered a cup of coffee (ok, diner level) and the eggs cochon. Sounded like a winner - poached eggs over pulled pork on a biscuit covered in hollandaise. 

What I got was a mess. First thing I noticed was one egg was a weird shape - turns out their over poached it so much it was like a bouncy superball. The other egg was also over poached but still edible. 

The pulled pork was good! Part of it anyway, half of it was stone cold like it came out of a cold case. The other side was luke warm. Almost like they ran out of warm pork and grabbed some from a fridge to top it off.

The biscuit was alright. And the hollandaise was put on extremely sparingly. 

To top it off it was comically underseasoned. I probably poured a 1/4 teaspoon of salt on it.

I have no reason to ever visit again if I am in NOLA and you might want to take pause as well.
The food is okay. Not too many choices of just regular breakfast. Could use more variety on the menu, unless they like it different like it is.

Definitely wasn't worth the 90 minutes wait. Watery grits, hard pancakes, & my omelette that I canceled after the second attempt of making it. Service was wonderful though.  Otherwise, eff this place!!!!

We had a great time at this restaurant. Our server Freddy was fantastic, catering to our every need! We were in search of breakfast before boarding our train back home looking for a restaurant in walking distance of our hotel and this place fit the bill. It was warm, quaint and welcoming. Freddy welcomed us right away making us feel right at home. 
Great time!

Another breakfast spot that gets packed every day.  Signed onto the waitlist via the Yelp app and had about a 5 minute wait.  while all the food looked great, I was there for the Benedicts.  There is an option to mix and match two, so that was a fun way to try a couple that caught my eye.  I went with the Chicken St. Charles and the Eggs Blackstone.  They were both perfect and wonderful takes on a classic.  Probably the second best breakfast I ate in NOLA.
Amazing food! Our server Jen had great customer service. Would definitely visit again and hope to get the same waitress!! Keep up the great job!

The Benedict's are worth the trip from Chicago!

Especially the fried chicken with country biscuits.

The biscuits were as big as my size 11.5 shoe and every bit as good as any I've ever had.

The "hollandaise" was unique and tasty.

Great spot. Lots of booze.
Awesome food. I'll definitely be back. Big portion for the money. Make reservations to help avoid the line.

These people are BEYOND RUDE. We called days in advance to get a large group reservation, but they refused.  We joined the yelp waitlist as suggested and followed their protocol.  We put our names on the list at 10:40a and arrived at 11:30 as told.  We checked in upon arriving then multiple times after.  We did not get a table until 1:10p. All 3 hosts were extremely mean and disrespectful. They told us we never checked in, weren't on the list, that they called us, that they had a table when they didn't....lies upon lies and excuses for days instead of admitting they were wrong and doing the right thing.  We were standing right next to the stand with 8 people, and the girl actually tried to tell us they called us and we didn't respond. Nope. By the time we finally got in, they squished us in a back corner where we continued to wait. The food was good, but the experience was terrible. I would never recommend this place.
The food was delicious and Freddie H was a great server. I'll definitely visit again.
Delicious! Lots to choose from on the menu. Loved the benedicts and French toast. Coffee is great.

Although we waited 30 mins, our meal was delicious. I had the shrimp and grits, and it was pretty tasty. The shrimp was properly seasoned with the gravy slightly running over the grits to make it even more delectable... yum. Wifey had one of the omelettes and she loved it, it was very large and we probably could have shared. Overall, it was a pleasant experience.

Wow! I'd give this place 10 stars if I could!  We stayed at the Pelham hotel which is right next to the cafe. We came 3 mornings in a row and the service was always amazing! Every staff member we encountered was friendly and went above and beyond to make sure our visit was great. 

They offer a fresh coffee or water to go when you leave! So awesome! I don't even have words for the biscuits and special butter! Make sure you get a biscuit with the yummy butter! Omelettes and potatoes were amazing. We didn't have the French toast but it looked amazing!  Strongly recommend this cafe! The line gets a little long but I think you can get on the waitlist via the app! 

Thanks everyone at the Ruby Slipper!!

Pralines and Pecan pancakes, bacon, mimosas, biscuits and honey butter. This place has great selection and speed of service. I'd recommend getting there early. Definitely a breakfast/brunch location. If you're with a group and can share, sample the families plates. This $$ will add up quickly, but it's worth it.
Awesome Eggs Benedict, Bloody Marys and homemade corned beef hash. Would definitely go there again!

I came here for lunch with a few vendor partners.  Wow.  It's a busy SOB, and it feels special, definitely like your in the place to be.  Counter seating may be quicker, but we waited for a table.

Along with the daily special "Nashville Catfish", the menu has some cool things: Banana Pudding Stuffed French toast, 'Goo Goo' Cluster Pancake, BBQ Shrimp & Grits, Eggs Cochon, Shrimp Boogaloo Benedict, Corned Beef Bennie, Bananas Foster Pain Perdu French Toast, Bacon Praline Pancakes, and a slew of burgers, sandwiches, and omelets.

I went with Croque Madame [$12.00, 4.0 stars].  Described on the menu as "Coffee-glazed ham & swiss served on brioche bread, topped with Mornay sauce & a fried egg".  The ham was a-m-a-z-i-n-g, but the bread was way too thick, extreme excess.  I ate a few bites, then picked out the ham & cheese, and ate the egg.  Served with french fries that were very much like McD's.

Overall: This feels like the south, and it's great for that.  Big food at moderate prices.  Our server was great.

Returned to this site of Ruby Slipper twice on our recent trip to New Orleans.  Great as always, both the food and service.  Ashley C.  was excellent, being both friendly and attentive.  Their corned beef hash was the best I found in New Orleans!  Their food is delicious and portions are plentiful.  Can't go wrong at this restaurant, though you will have to wait since it is a popular eating destination.

Make sure you check in on yelp to save yourself some time! Highly recommend the St. Charles wow! It's by far the best breakfast dish I've ever had! It's a bit cramped but a must do in Nola! The staff was nice and although we can with a party of 10 and had to separate us, they made sure we got the tables next to each other. Look at the walls, they've got quirky decor! Also I didn't get to try their mimosa but dang did I see almost everyone with one! A must for myself next timen
food and drinks were incredible. they have a huge variety of options on the menu. they did lack vegan options though. this was our favorite dining experience of the whole trip.
One of the best breakfast places around!!! So good! Love their pancakes and they have great specials often. This is one of our go-to spots for breakfast
So I need to even leave a review?? Y'all KNOW this is the best place ever!!!! Amazing service too by the way! Clean bathrooms! All around a PERFECT experience!!!

Got on waiting list when we arrived 
Several people were seated before us that arrived long after we did
Waited 45 minutes and never got seated 
Last straw was having to deal with a Rude employee
Excellent breakfast and bloody Mary's! I had the Avocado and smoked salmon toast. It was a delicious treat I will not soon forget.

I got the Shrimp Boogaloo Benedict, and it was absolutely delicious! 
Be warned, there is a 45-60 minute wait in the morning, but its definitely worth it. If you're coming to NOLA as a tourist, I recommend taking a walk to the nearby Lafayette Square while you wait.

YALL, please save yourself from the wait. I've had better food and better experience at other restaurants, even at other Ruby Slippers. I ordered a Croque Madam, and my fries were freezing like they took them from the freezer and so was my sandwich. I've been to many of the Rubys but I am just not a fan anymore. I will say, the iced coffee was my favorite part. We waited two hours for a table and then about another hour for our food. We wasted half a day just for mediocre food.

We came for an early Sunday brunch. The Egg Cochon and Southern fried Chicken eggs Benedict were hand down the most amazing eggs Benedict I've ever had!! I love the bar seating. Service was quick and attentive. The food took a bit of time but good things come to those who wait. This is certainly a meal worth the wait. This is a must go if you're in town. Easily one of the best breakfast/ brunch I've had. The Southern breakfast was really good too...apple wood smoked bacon was incredibly tasty, I even liked the grits. Coffee was a nice dark roast and not watered down.

I ordered the Chicken St. Charles and a side or corned beef hash. 
The wait time was initially 6 minutes but we ended up waiting 25 mins because it was raining and no one wanted to leave.  When wet we're finally seated, our waiter was very nice. He was patient with us and brought the food out quickly. Now to the food.....the corned beef hash was really good, not too much but it was feeling. The chicken st Charles unfortunately was mediocre... the chicken wasn't seasoned at all, I hate to compensate with the sauce to make it edible. I give the service and the corned beef hash a perfect score but my main meal was really subpar

Great breakfast place.  Brought my pup and sat outside, ate here two mornings in a row.  Each day the manager stopped by to chat and mad sure pooch had water.  Service is amazing and food is great.  I always try and grab breakfast here when I visit NOLA.  Highly recommend Ruby Slipper! O

Best breakfast I've ever had! Worth the wait. After reading several reviews Ruby Slipper did not disappoint. It is now a must everytime I visit New Orleans! Freddie H was our waiter and provided excellent customer service! He was very patient and knowledgeable about the menu! Highly recommend!!
Absolutely delish!! This is not to be missed. Give it a try YUM!!! Make sure to get the

Great food! Slow service, but friendly staff! Sat outside since it was nice.  Food was good.  Always a long line but worth it.  I recommend it.  Very delicious Chicken St. Charles Benedict.  Milk Punch was yum, first time trying it. Go early or wait for 1-2 hours!
Amazing food!!! The cinnamon roll pancakes are life changing and the homemade biscuits are life!
Always love the food at Ruby Slipper! Never disappointed! Wait staff are amazing, too! Who traveling to New Orleans, we schedule our day for food at Ruby Slipper!
Ask for Freddie! Great service with excellent menu suggestions! Get the Grilled fish St. Peter... plenty for 2. We split that and the cinnamon swirl pancake. No disappointments!!!
Great breakfast of eggs Benedict. We tried the sampler and had the corned beef, which was my favorite. A definite repeat when next in NOLA.
Bacons great coffee was ok and the food was ok. I ordered French toast and they put all types of crap on it trying to be fancy and it was trash
Pretty lackluster food. Chicken was very very average at best. The wait was obscene. Definitely wouldn't come here again, but it's not bad it's just not good

First time coming here my waiter was really nice the wait wasn't long I do recommend doing the online waiting because when we arrived we were at a table within 10 mins the food was really good I recommend the st Charles Benedict and the cheese grits were also good .. this place I will definitely be back

The food here was ok. I didn't really enjoy the bbq shrimp and grits , it was a bit tangy to me . However the biscuit was my favorite part..nice and soft ! The morning margaritas was also very delicious .

OH MY GOODNESS!!! This place is ridiculous good. My husband and I had the pancake sampler and trifecta. When I tell you it's enough food to feed a small country, I really mean it. The pancakes were so big they hung off the plate. The biscuits are about the size of a small saucer plate. Not only was it huge, it was delicious!!! If you come to NOLA, and you don't go to the Ruby Slipper, you are really missing out.
Food was awesome at the 200 magazine location ...our server Freddie H gave recommendations that were the best. He absolutely made our experience wonderful
Worth the visit to NOLA.  An iconic place with several locations around NO. Food and service were both amazing.  Thank you for the experience!!

You have to stop for brunch at the Ruby Slipper and be sure to ask for Juli! The King Cake Stuffed French Toast was perfection as were the catfish grits! Juli was an amazing server, getting everything right and going above and beyond to make sure we had a great time. This was my first time here, but I will definitely make it a stop for every visit to NOLA. **Long wait times, so be sure to join the wait list online before you head over. It worked like a charm. We got there right on time and walked right in!

The food here was phenomenal and there's a video of my dancing to prove it (LOL). I ordered the French toast bites that included a delicious dipping sauce. I also ordered the BLT that came with a fried green tomato and it was simply divine. One of the ladies in my group ordered the fried green tomatoes starter and that was amazing. I planned to visit again during my sixth visit to the city.

Came here for breakfast.  Definitely go early if you want to avoid the crowds.  The service was good, and the food delicious.  You can order ONE pancake which was perfect as we just wanted to try one while we ordered our larger breakfast entrees.  The egg white Mexican scramble with chips were delish and a nice change from a super heavy breakfast.

If I could leave zero stars, I would. Don't waste your time or money on this place. I waited over 3 HOURS in the rain to eat here and i was still 14th in line when we decided to leave. That's 10:30am to 1:30 and still no table. They're doing something terribly wrong here.

*in response to management leaving a comment. We did get on the online waitlist at 1:30am and we didn't show up until our timer said 30 minutes. For the last hour of waiting it said 0-10 minutes.

I liked the Benedict, but didn't love it. They focused more on the obscure additions like pork and chicken than they did on the sauce. I'd go here again, but don't come if you're a big fan of hollandaise sauce.

Don't bother coming here if you don't have 3 hours to wait ! It took 2 hours to be seated and another 1 hour to get out food ! Food was also not that great ! Totally overrated ! Better off visiting a Starbucks or one of the less hyped restaurants. You will save 3 hours and about 100
