Excellent food, great selection. The bananas foster pain pain Perdue was amazing; not too sweet, great flavor. The BLT is delicious too. While the food is very good, I'm not sure it's worth the wait because there is so much great food here that may not have as long a wait.

I'm visiting from LA and what
 a fantastic find!!! This place is wonderful and the staff especially Greg was wonderful!! The atmosphere is amazing and the food was great!! :)
Food was great and our server Freddie was awesome ! Banana foster pain Perdue and the Benedict's are must haves.

I really enjoyed this place for breakfast.  Everyone recommended for us to go to Mother's but the concierge at our hotel advised otherwise. He said this place is much better for breakfast. And he did not disappoint. The only reason I removed a star was solely on the wait time to get a seat. We waited probably 40 minutes. BUT... with that said, FYI apparently you can be put on the wait list via YELP and they text you when it's almost your turn so you can hop right over then. We didn't know that at first. So we had to wait. 

Our party mainly got the Benedict dishes.  And boy were they yummy. I recommend the fried chicken one way more than the pulled pork one. But the biscuits were heaven. Just what the doctor ordered.

The food is very good. But be prepared to wait around TWO hours to eat. We signed in online with a 45-60 min wait and still waited nearly 90 minutes. The service is slow, they forgot my tea, and dropped my wife's plate. They did bring her another one. The biscuits and gravy are great, the breakfast sandwich is good. But, be ready to wait two hours to get your food. I'd recommend the food, but not worth the wait.
The food is delicious and so are the Bloody Mary's. Waited 15 min to be seated and it is soo worth it. Our server was amazing as well. I will be going back often.

Easily the best omelet I have ever had! Hate to have dry eggs and these were anything but! I had the mushroom Florentine omelet and substituted pepper Jack cheese for just a little kick. Delicious!! The candied bacon was good as well. Hubby had a house special eggs cochon and almost licked the plate. The biscuits have to be scratch! Would definitely come back. A must for breakfast or post drinking brunch.

Holy mother of NOLA, this place is busy.... get your reservations in on the "open table" app if you're not there by about 9-9:30... otherwise you'll be standing around for an hour... however, this may not be a bad thing if you doubt mind having a bacon infused vodka Bloody Mary or two while you wait. 
This place can move some folks in and out without any issues.   The staff is a welled oiled machine from the time you check in until you leave.  Super hospitable staff and eager to serve the hungry and hung over.
The food was warm and delicious upon arrival at our table... we had the banana foster French toast and bananas and pecan pancakes, all delicious!  
We'd go back again for sure.

I could not be more impressed. They had exactly what you are looking for in a good brunch. Good local coffee, unique breakfast choices and a fun decor that makes for great ambiance!  I had 2 different eggs Benedict, both were soooooo good!
Amazing food, great atmosphere, and Kyra gave us awesome service! She recommended the banana fosters french toast and I was not disappointed.

I heard so much about this restaurant- first we had to get on a 45 min wait - understandable - once the 45 min was up we went from #17 to #4 and still had to wait another 15 min - this was while the Saints were playing in New Orleans - once inside it took another 15 min for Server to take our drink order - coffee and a water - 10 min passed till we placed our order - I must say the Biscuits are out of this world - the rest not so great - I got the Corned Beef Hash and Potatoes Biscuit - awesome poached Egg on top and hardly no hash but plenty of hard chunks of potatoes - took us 22 min to get our food - our Server - Deramy never checked on us or asked how the food was - he was too worried about watching the Saints on tv - the Syrup bottle on the table had more customer service than he did - didn't know his name until I saw the receipt -don't ever ask for him - Coffee and Water were awesome and atmosphere!!!  Not a return...

The menu has a great selection of breakfast foods, and when the food arrived i ordered the salmon and shrimp Benedict, my food was cold. I was so hungry because of the wait, i think if the food came sooner it would have tasted amazing. My experience wasn't worth the wait/ the hype.
This spot was amazing the food was great the service was good the flavors were great the biscuits were flakey everything was great !
So good. Go to the location off canal st.  A great breakfast spot.  You will not be disappointed
Wait wasn't to bad, you can get drink service while you wait outside. Really good service. Food was pretty good. Had the biscuits and gravy and the sweet heat chicken and French toast bites.
I'm just not a fan of really commercial food so instead of ruby slipper I would go to probably horns or Elizabeth's or Panola Café

Probably the cleanest place I've been to in New Orleans. Great food. Try the beignets! Cute setup outside. Overall a great experience. If you want away from the typical experience of New Orleans this is a good place to go. Feels like a different town!

Fantastic place for brunch, coffee, and other adult beverages. We went there twice during a 3 day vacation. The line to be seated may seem daunting, but it moves fast and is well worth the wait. I had the Migas one day (beyond fantastic) and the Benedict cochon. Super yummy. Great service
It was not worth 1.5 hour wait but it was okay food but not 5 stars! The food presentation is up to par.

I thought the food was great and unique the wait was about 20-25mins during a time where it wasn't so busy in New Orleans but busy enough for lines. The only reason I didn't give it a 5 was because the seats are hard they hurt making it hard to enjoy the ambience and food. The food was a 5 in my book so definitely worth it
This place is amazing, I highly recommend it if your looking for good food. My advice to you is join the waitlist before going

Went here for brunch on Sunday with some friends. We originally had plans to go to a different restaurant that was booked out for hours (Covid restrictions so makes sense)  So we immediately jumped on Yelp and decided to come here! We were told we had an hour wait but decided to stick it out. 

While waiting outside we were greeted by a waitress with a drink menu. She made it super easy to order and pay while waiting. 

I got a boozy iced coffee and it was delicious! It tastes like strong coffee. I would definitely suggest if you are into that sort of thing but also want alcohol! I ordered 

I ordered the eggs cochon and it was delicious and great size! 

(I would also like to include that as someone from New Orleans and still lives here, I appreciate that this is not a tourist trap restaurant. The food is really good and great priced! Which can definitely be hard to find within the city.)
The wait list is a scam. It told me it would be 45 minutes and I've been waiting almost two hours. Food isn't that great for the wait time to be so long and inconsistent
Food was great...join the waitlist before going. It cut forty minutes off of our wait!

OMG! This place is great! Yum!
This is attached to the hotel we are staying in so we decided to try it for bfast. Wow is the food we had amazing!
I don't normally order eggs in restaurants because I am supper picky about how they are cooked but decided that the special Benedict sounded too good not to try. Best choice ever! Both my hubs and I had the special Benedict which was brisket on biscuits and topped with a poblano infused Holland's is sauce. The flavor was subtle and really complimented the dish.
I don't moan over eggs/bfast but this I did.
The also serve mimosas,bloody MARYS and beer and wine.
Highly recommend.

FOR EVERY MINUTE YOU WAIT, IT IS WORTH EVERY BITE YOU TAKE.
That should be the motto for Ruby Slipper Cafe.

A recommendation from my good friend Gina P. from Yelp Fort Lauderdale that Ruby Slippers Cafe is the BEST breakfast place in the French Quarter, but beware of long lines!!!  She was right on both fronts!!!

Regarding the line,  my wife and I had learned once we got to the hostess stand which is just right in the doorway for the restaurant with a lovely, patient hostess, that you can either put your name in at the door or use the Yelp App to put your name in and track where you are in line to be seated.  We put our name in with the hostess and used the Yelp App to track where we were in line to get seated.

As we were waiting I had a chance to look inside.  Plenty of seating, but quite the busy place. A large U shaped breakfast bar in the middle, surrounded by 2 top tables on the left and a larger dining room to the right of the bar with 4 top tables and booths. There is also outdoor seating in the front and side of the restaurant. 

After looking at the menu, and seeing the great breakfast dishes all around me, I can definitely see what all the hype is all about. People were PATIENTLY waiting outside like this was "the attraction". And it certainly was.

When our name was called, we thankfully got seated a the breakfast bar which I preferred.  There is a lot to see sitting there and recommend it if you can wait for that.  We were greeted by our vibrant and friendly server, Nicole C. (she never gave us her last name) when I asked.  We immediately knew she was from the midwest and had some fun with that when talking to her.

Coffee Anyone?  Here, like many places in New Orleans, they have the BEST coffee.  We had to have the NOLA roasted coffee which was served in the special Ruby Slippers red Coffee Mugs.  Delicious.

Just looking at the Specials for the day posted on the Specials Board,  which included Spiced Pumpkin Pancakes and Nutella & Raspberry French Toast and looking at the menu, this was going to be a tough choice.  The choices of 7 different "Eggs Traodianary" Eggs Benedict dishes and "Momma can't make this" Specialties alone had my head spinning.  At least my wife was with me so we could both order something different and share.  

It was no surprise that she ordered the Spiced Pumpkin Pancakes. There was no doubt that I was going to choose one of the Benedict dishes, but I was torn between Chicken St. Charles and the Eggs Cochin. Of course, Ruby Slippers had a dish called THE PEACEMAKER, which definitely gave me a piece of mind to be able to get combo of both dishes. The Chicken St. Charles is one of the most popular dishes here; Fried Chicken breast over a buttermilk biscuit topped with 2 poached eggs and a delicious sauce to top it off.  The chicken was a tender chicken breast, definitely fried Southern Style.  Juicy and tender and that Buttermilk Biscuit, well, let's just say, you would remember it after leaving here. The reason for the Eggs Cochin?  I love pulled pork, and to have that on top of the buttermilk biscuit served Benedict style with Hollandaise put me in Heaven. Between the 2 of these, I was in "food mode", for sure. 

My wife's portion of Spiced Pumpkin Pancakes was HUGE, thankfully, topped with a powdered sugar and some special sauce drizzled on top. Amazing amazing, amazing.  I could smell the Pumpkin as soon as Nicole put it down in front of us. 

The menu choices on the Momma Specials can also make your head spin, but as I learned from a gentleman sitting beside me, they have a dish called the Trifecta which allows you to combine 3 of he dishes.  Clever for a menu like this to offer that. Every dish is better than the next and to be able to try 2 of the Benedict dishes or 3 of the Specials is a smart option.

For every minute you wait, it is worth every bite you take here.  The atmosphere is lively with a lot of happy diners.  Nicole C. made our experience special and there is no doubt that a whole lot of love was put into the menu and food preparation.  

ABSOLUTELY the place to go when I come to NOLA, and will again and again. After all, there I a whole lot more to try here.

Thank you for the long line outside the restaurant that made me notice this restaurant! I could see a crowd outside the location from my hotel and it was pretty much there throughout the morning. Perks of being on yelp though are that you can check into the line before getting to the restaurant. We came here on a Sunday morning and the total wait time was about an hour for 5 of us but we only spent about 20 minutes waiting at the restaurant since we checked in at our hotel. There was a server outside though taking drink orders if you wanted something while you wait.

Our server was amazing- I wish I remembered his name to compliment him. He was super energetic and able to provide helpful suggestions for menu favorites. Definitely one of the best servers I've ever had- he really just seemed like he loved his job which makes the dining experience that much better. 

I am always hesitant to try new things so I had a cheese omelette with breakfast potatoes and a biscuit. The food was good and actually really enjoyed the potatoes and homemade biscuits but I tried some of my mom's "Trifecta" and it was AMAZING! So much flavor and I instantly regretted not trying something new. You get to try one of each: Eggs Cochon, Chicken St. Charles & Shrimp Boogaloo Benedicts. I still am not sure which of the 3 was my favorite- they each were so flavorful. The chicken wasn't too greasy, the pulled pork had a great flavor and juicy, and the shrimp reminded me of a typical meal that would be found in NOLA. This meal makes me want to start planning my next trip to NOLA- along with the fact that their mimosas were very tasty as well!

My family and I thought this was going to be a great restaurant, but it was just average. I thought it was great they had a wait list, but that fell short also. When we put our name on the list it stated we had 80 minutes and 40 parties ahead of us. We arrived and I checked in. We still had to wait  another 45 minutes. We finally got in and we sat for another 15 minutes before our waitress came over. We ordered our drinks and it took another 15 minutes for some of the drinks to come out. We received water and regular coffee. My husband had coffee grounds at the bottom of his cup.It took another 10 minutes before my husband got his Bloody Mary and my Cappuccino came out. We ordered our food and while we waited I noticed small fruit flies crawling all over the hot sauce bottle. Our food came, but it was just average. The food was nothing to write home about! My family and I did not feel that this food was worth the wait! We won't be eating here again!

After getting multiple recommendations from friends and colleagues, I tried this place. Customer service deserves 4.stars. I was seated quickly and the staff was great. They were awesome and attentive.The food was blah. I had BBQ shrimp and grits. My food was lukewarm and under seasoned. A couple of shrimp still had the shell on them and  grits were very watery with no salt or anything. I'm not a fan of the sugar cane butter. The biscuit tasted like salty dough. The coffee was ok I guess. A huge let down for a $20 breakfast. The long wait lines are not worth it. I guess I should stay away from tourist traps.

Wanted a decent breakfast before leaving New Orleans. I'm southern so I'm a harsh judge on fried green tomatoes and I wasn't disappointed.  They were good and very well priced at $5. The drinks were fine, but way over priced. The trifecta was so good! My hubby lo Ed his Ranchero, but I thought the chorizo was under flavored and the rice was just okay. In general it ended up being very pricy around $70! But you cam eat here for cheaper and obviously not drink and have some seriously good food. Plus it wasn't over crowded and the service was awesome. Oh plus the eggs were absolutely on point!! I'd give a 8 out of 10..but I'll sit with 4 outta 5.

Also right around the corner from my hotel and had such a unique breakfast! The menu had so many things to choose from and sadly they didn't have the Cochon Eggs Benny ( have been DYING to try this) but the rest of the menu was so interesting they didn't leave me hanging! 

Ended up ordering the Shrimp Boogaloo Benny. MAN! The flavors in this were unreal! I am certain I've only eaten fried green tomatoes here in NOLA and I am now highly addicted. The creole tomato sauce that was generously smothered over the poached eggs and jumbo gulf shrimp was so tasty! 

Can't wait to go back because the shrimp bbq grits are still a high on my list! If you're staying on Canal this could easily be your daily pit stop before heading down the French quarter! Don't get stuck in one of the tourist traps! This is the best.
This place is a MUST for breakfast! The service is great, the atmosphere is charming and relaxing. You won't be disappointed with anything you pick. I had the St. Peter Fish...OMG DELICIOUS!!!!

OMG !!!  DELICIOUS !!  The Best !!  How am I gonna get here every weekend for breakfast !?!  The Benedicts are awesome :  mix and choose .. Eggs Cochon , Chicken St Charles , Eggs Blackstone .. Hour and a half wait ...  WORTH IT !!!!  And last but not least ...  Double Bacon Bloody Mary's !!! ....  To go !!!   Thank you so much for a delicious meal.   Always coming back !

Great coffee!  
Yummy biscuits!  
Awesome breakfast. Their Bloody Mary and coffee cocktails delicious.  Service was good and fast. Beautiful clean restaurant.

The food and is incredible, and if you sit in Freddie's section, the service is just as good. We went here twice during our trip, and had almost every variation of eggs benedict they serve. The Sausage Gravy Benedict and Chicken St. Charles are my top choices. Just be sure to check in ahead of time, as there's always a wait, but it's worth waiting for.
Great breakfast. Had costa rican with chorizo. Good coffee. Nice place. I would go back in a second, but not sure if its worth the hour wait for a bigger group.
Freddie was our waitress and he is AMAZING! I'm also pretty sure Jesus is the head chef!

That wait was with it. Friendly staff, great food and drinks. The place is busy and a little noisy so if you want to enjoy your conversation at a low tone ask to sit out side and the vibe is totally private and intimate; minus the passer by's from the foot traffic. Be prepare for great fresh food, well prepared and served with good service.

The biscuits in their Benedict's are amazing. The hollandaise sauce was exquisite. My new favorite place for brunch when I go to New Orleans. You might have a long wait time but it is totally worth it!

All I have to say is that Our waiter Freddie H. was phenomenal! He recommended the Eggs Benedict combo with the fried chicken and pork debris and it was so delicious! Definitely recommend checking this place out, and if you get Freddie as your waiter, tell him that I'm still bitter that Zion is coming to the pelicans haha but then again, I wouldn't mind playing in this beautiful city with so much culture and amazing places to eat like this.

My wife took me on my very first trip to NOLA. From the hostess to the waitress, from the time we checked in til the time we left we really enjoyed our experience at Ruby Slipper. Laura, our waitress was NEVER NOT SMILING. She. Was. Excellent. Very helpful in explaining questions we had about unfamiliar items on the menu. Gave great suggestions on improving the taste of menu items with the different sauce choices. Perfectly succinct in checking in on us in passing while dining. The food was excellent. The beignets starter was excellent. Goes great with the saucer of praline sauce. I had the French toast bites that were the perfect blend of crunchy outside/soft inside. Great location just around the corner from Canal Street. The online waitlist is a great way to check in and walk the block on canal street til they text you when the table is ready. Excellent place for brunch. Couldn't have been a better place to end our visit giving us a reason to make the trip back again soon. And again, a special thanks to Laura for giving us such great service and pleasurable experience. Wish I knew the young lady's name we checked in with as hostess. Great attitude. Very helpful in checking in and communicating the check in process with us. Highly recommend this place. And ask for Laura's section...again, she was excellent
We had a great breakfast and our server Freddie H was extremely attentive and made sure we had a great meal.

I came inside this beautiful old building and was served immediately. The staff was cute, friendly, and courteous. Lindsay (our server) was helpful and recommended the Banana Foster Pain Perdu. It was incredible! The bananas were fresh, the French toast was delectable, and the mimosas complimented the dish for a perfect late summer brunch. 

Prices were fair and the smiling atmosphere was contagious. Loved every minute in this beautiful corner cafe.
food was a little heavy but my friend looooooooooooved her pulled pork benedict. but the french toast was everythingggg!!! i definitely recommend
Decent food and nothing special that's worth such a crazy wait. Cinnamon break sticks need some sauce or something. Good prices.

The service was good but the food wasn't spectacular. The food was underseasoned. The presentation was pretty good. Prior to eating I was eager to come back for other dishes but now I don't see myself returning for a meal. Theres a certain expectation of flavors one has when they come to New Orleans. That expectation wasn't met. 

The food was cooked well and was good quality however the dish was bland.

Good selection. Would have loved more vegan/vegetarian options. Our waitress was very accommodating, along with everyone who was working! 

Recommend: Banana French toast, grapefruit mimosas, chicken Benny 

The Bloody Mary was average and came with green beans as a garnish...first time I've seen such.

Came across this place by using yelp! Was in NOLA this past month, and I'm so happy I got to go here! Make sure you take advantage of getting on the yelp waitlist. This place is poppin' and has a long line! 

The service was good. Our waitress, Theresa was great! She told us a lot about the menu, and by then I wanted to order almost everything. I've been on a pancake binge, so I got a side of pancakes and BBQ  Shrimp and Grits. The Shrimp and Grits was delicious! The pancakes were so good!!
My boyfriend got the Chicken St. Charles. He really liked it, he doesn't like poached eggs so he requested scrambled eggs, and they were able to do it. 

It's LOUD in the restaurant, but the food is delicious!

The food was delicious! We shared the French toast special(cream cheese stuffed with praline topping), bananas foster French toast( not quite as delicious as the stuffed but till very good), the Migas(sort of a scramble nachos combo) and the trifecta (benedict combo). 
Our waiter, Freddie was attentive and delightful!

I'm very disappointed with my overall experience at this restaurant for 1 it was extremely cold today they had heating lanterns outside that were not working appropriately. I waited over two hours and when we were finally seated the whole entire place was cold. they had on sealing fans on and when I got my food I had to take it to go because I couldn't take the cold inside of the restaurant and to top it off as we waited the hostess called me miserable because I told her that I was cold. I understand that Covid is a big inconvenience to a lot of businesses and restaurants but at the same time restaurants are responsible to accommodate their guest accordingly their whole entire waiting system needs to be upgraded desperately. The food was OK but my overall experience was horrible. I'm only giving it a 2 star to be polite. I've done my research on this place and traveling from Atlanta Georgia I was looking forward to visiting this restaurant. We got to the restaurant around noon and left around 3pm.

Amazing brunch!! Well worth the wait. House bacon Bloody Mary is a must have!
Freddie was awesome. Gave great recommendations & provided excellent service. Will come back again!

I Was expecting a lot of this place, but I can say that is ok. I thought that I was coming back but there are other good places to try. We ordered different plates to try all of them, but the corned beef bennie Benedict's had to much horseradish sauce, too strong overtaking the real flavor of the hollandaise sauce. The Croque Madame was ok, like a regular sandwich, soggy, nothing extraordinary. The cheesecake stuffed french toast .... I was expecting a lot more. The coffee, well I am no Barista, but something I do know is that if you don't take the expresso shot at the correct time, it will get more bitter, well that's how it was.... For the amount of people they receive they are under staffed.
Far exceeded our expectations! Yelp waitlist was perfect to avoid standing in a crowd.
Good food. Not a wait, we were the first customers. Waitress was great. My hubby did not like his French toast - it was too doughy for him.

Although it was a nice vibe, the food was meh... Especially for the price. I ordered the shrimp bbq grits. It had a great flavor, but the shrimp was overcooked. My boyfriend's potatoes were cold and eggs were nothing spectacular.
This location was a high energy restaurant.  The food is great and the wait staff are awesome!

We were in town visiting from Houston and this brunch did not disappoint. First off if you like to drink this is the place for you! There drinks are delicious and massive. I tried the ruby and big easy mimosas which both were delicious but the drink I recommend the most would be the Irish Coffee. It was surprisingly refreshing but dangerously good you do not taste the alcohol at all! The food was very good and full of flavor. I took advantage of the seafood and got the Gulf Shrimp Omelet. I want to preference and say that I am not the biggest seafood fan but this omelet was calling my name. It was delicious and full of flavor. My boyfriend got the Hot Smoked Salmon and that thing was so good. If you are a big Eggs Benedict person I would definitely recommend grabbing that. Overall, super friendly staff and clean restaurant. We had a great time and the atmosphere is fun and inviting.

Best breakfast we had during our 4 day stay in New Orleans! Go early because it gets very busy but the 4 of us all enjoyed our food and drinks and especially our waiter. I wish we could remember his name but he literally made the experience amazing! So accommodating and just a great personality. The food was on point and drinks were large and good. It can be pricey but when it's good and you all vibe with the waiter it's worth the 150 price tag it cost us. Now don't get worried, we ordered a lot including alcohol so you can do it for cheaper but we went all out. 

Food we got was the Trifecta, the blt, the Migas and classic pancakes. By the way the biscuits are MASSIVE. Not the best biscuits I've had but huge and still good. 

Definitely recommend and wish we went back another day but we tried a few other places but they all fell short of this one.

This place seems to have quite the buzz. I sat at the bar and the service to me as well to the gentleman next to me was poor. The servers did not engage with us we had to reach out and be what I believe to be pushy to order drinks, get coffee, place food orders and cash out. The food was great, I'd recommend sitting at a table where I imagine the service is much better.

Our server was Jackie & she was absolutely fabulous. We were visiting for a bachelorette party and the service was pristine. We were wanting breakfast shots & she came back with a New Orleans original deliciously concocted shot. Our food was great & would highly recommend this restaurant.

Ruby Slipper was the first place we visit in NOLA while we were waiting for our Air BNB to become available. It did not disappoint! The mimosas and bloody mary's were excellent. For my meal I had the Bam Bam Biscuit which was a fried egg with pepperjack cheese, pig-candy bacon
and a fried green tomato on a buttermilk biscuit. Everything about it was perfect besides the biscuit which was a little bit dry. The fried green tomato was so good and the bacon might be the best bacon i've ever had. I'd definitely come back here!

Wonderful!  My wife had the eggs couchon and I ate the breakfast sandwich with sausage -- both were fabulous.  Also,  the bloody Mary's were spicy and full of alcohol... Nice string beans and olive in the Mary.  Love it.  Service was great!

RUBY SLIPPER CAFE = EASY FIVE STARS!! 

My wife and I were so happy we found this gem in the French Quarter. Atmosphere is perfect; clean, roomy and decorated with class & fun. The service was first class all the way, genuinely friendly people who truly appreciate their customers. The food.... EASY FIVE STARS. We actually asked our server to let the chef know how happy we were with our plates, and we don't normally do that.  I am telling my family and friends about the Ruby Slipper Cafe and I strongly recommend this place to ALL! 

Thank you Ruby Slipper Cafe, we can't wait to visit again! 

Our best to y'all, 
Mike & Pam Z.
Breakfast was excellent!  Noisy, which made dining with kids a cinch.  Joined waitlist via the yelp app and table was waiting for us when we got there.  Truly enjoyed our breakfast here!
Had a great breakfast. We hope to come back again to explore more of the menu. Coffee was great and the French toast bites were too. Highly recommend Ruby Slipper Cafe.
Food was delicious! Freddie was outstanding! Excellent customer service. Place was so busy & he was on top of everything. Bloody Mary was delicious! Great experience. Will definitely be back!
Excellent!  St. Charles Benedict was amazing as well as the seasonal stuffed French toast (looked like King Cake).  Staff friendly.  We will be back.
There really isn't much to say other than the staff was very nice and the food was very tasty. I would definitely recommend this place.
Excellent breakfast that is inexpensive.  Wait time is short especially if you use the yelp app.  The biscuits are off the hook.
Great service and food. Make sure to call in for a reservation and/or prepare to wait.

Came here for breakfast on the morning we were leaving New Orleans. Kavin was our server, I might be spelling that wrong. He was super nice, attentive, and answered any questions we had. I ended up ordering the Chicken St. Charles, my friend got the Sweet Heat Chicken and French Toast Bites, and my husband had an omelette. Everything was great! My eggs were perfectly poached and my chicken was seasoned well and juicy. The biscuit under my chicken was soft and buttery. I really wish we had one of these where I live. I would be there all the time. It's really good breakfast at food with a Southern Twist. The Sweet Heat Chicken was to die for! My food was good, but I almost preferred what my friend got over mine. The French toast was crispy on the outside and soft on the inside. The chicken was flavorful and moist. OMG, you just had to be there. I don't remember how my husband's omelette was, but I'm sure it was great! I will definitely be back if I ever come back to New Orleans.

Freddie was the bomb server and highly recommend whatever the special is because it's always amazing no matter what it is. Get the stuffed French toast special as your appetizer for the table. You will not regret it

The ladies at the front of the restaurant were so accommodating to a change in our reservation. The staff were all friendly and helpful. 
Melody and Sean were excellent!!! We miss y'all already
Delicious brunch! Everything we had was delicious, I specially loved the eggs Benedict (pork and chicken) we will be coming back next time we're in Nola

This Benedict was AMAZING. The biscuit was so so so delicious and flavorful, as well as the fried chicken and nearly perfectly poached eggs. It came out within 10-15 minutes of ordering and was warm. The Bloody Mary was also good but nothing too exciting for me. Would love to return and try other items on the menu!!
Recommended to the restaurant had a great breakfast with a great waitress Melissa. If you're in NOLA and need a nice place to have breakfast/brunch Ruby Slippers is the place.

The food is amazing! Everything we've tried: The Trifecta, the Peacemaker: Eggs Blackstone and Salmon Benedict, and the Corned Beef Hash Benedict, the Bellini, the Vanilla Spiced Lattés, the Ruby Slipper.... we may not yet be done sampling the menu! The service is friendly, good and swift. No complaints at all! A word of warning: it's popular so get there earlier than later! But not until after we leave town
Fantastic! Great service, delicious food, couldn't ask for a better breakfast stop during our trip. Definitely recommend!
This place is awesome for breakfast. My friend and I came back twice!! The staff are super nice and we got in and out quickly because we did the wait list early.

I had brunch her with my family & we had a great time! They had lots of comfortable outdoor seating & they took all of the COVID precautions (social distancing, masks, cleaning, etc.). 10/10 recommend the fried chicken eggs Benedict!

Great place to enjoy brunch! We went two days in a row! The line can be a little lengthy, so try to get there early. But it is definitely worth the wait, nonetheless ! They made sure everyone had waters/drinks while waiting!
Best breakfast in New Orleans. Many original dishes and great Ice Coffee on a hot summer day!

The one that is on Commons was absolutely delectable! My boyfriend and I found this gem on yelp, and I would like to say it was one of the best brunch places ever! I had the breakfast sandwich, and my boyfriend had the croque Madame. The only downside was that we had to wait about an hour, so we walked over to the mall with our bloody mary's (from Rubys).

Don't come here if you're hungry or don't have 3-4 hours to spare. Got here on a Saturday around 1PM. Didn't get seated until about 2:15PM. Got food at 3PM. Food was unremarkable, maybe even bad, especially considering the total time spent waiting. The people were nice though. Service was okay. Wouldn't recommend, wouldn't return.

Eggs benedict, wow! I got one with roast beef and one with corned beef hash... so good! And they are perched on a giant biscuit, perfectly cooked and fluffy on the inside. 
You may have a bit of a wait, but it's worth it!
So delicious. Staff was super sweet. Food is fresh and tasty. 10/10 recommend. Also try the seasonal specials, pricy but 100% worth it.

This place is full of awesomeness, I choose today the pancake flight with a scrambled eggs with cheese on the side. Our waiter Lance was very helpful on suggestions and recommendations. The Brandy punch is one of my favorites here, when visiting the city this is one of my must haves here. I would definitely recommend to family and friends.

We were only in New Orleans for 3 days and after having breakfast here on the 2nd morning, the food was so good, we went again on our last day!  They are only open for breakfast and lunch, but the lines can be long so get there early.  We were very lucky as we got there before 9am, both days, and were seated immediately both times.  When we left, the line was down the street.

The wait staff is fast, friendly and helpful.  They will give you all the time in the world and as soon as you need them, they are there.  They had daily specials on the days we were there and the prices were very affordable.  

On our first trip MY DH got the crab cake with Hollandaise Sauce, 2 eggs, grits and a huge biscuit.  The crab cake was nice sized with huge lumps of crab meat, all that for only $8!  I  I, on the other hand, was experiancing my first trip to New Orleans and had to have the Shrimp and grits.  The grits were the best I ever had, creamy and delightful!  The Shrimp weren't too small, nor too big, they were just right!  They were in a sauce made from an Abita beer reduction with Rosemary, Delicious!  It came with a biscuit, which I really didnt need, as there was too much food, but it was good.  


On our second morning I ordered the corm meal pancakes with green onions and Bacon.  WOW, it came with a side order of hash that was huge.  Their hash was large chunks of Corned Beef and smal chunks of potatos,maily all beef...  My DH just had to get the Banana Fosters French Toast and it was so good..

If you are in New Orleans, its worth the trip and wait.  The food is affordable, ecclectic and down right delicious!

This review is just for breakfast but it was so good we went every day while we were in New Orleans. We tried the migas, the smoked salmon on a homemade bagel, an omelet, the standard breakfast and the French toast over the course of three days. Everything we had was delicious and tomorrow when I wake up far, far away from the Ruby Slipper I will be super sad.

My favorite dish was the smoked salmon...they make it in house and it was super tasty.

The only thing that disappointed me was the commemorative t-shirt sizing. They are sized for people who can't possibly eat at their restaurant. Our teeny, fit -- think size 2 max waitress -- was wearing a LARGE, which is the largest size the women's came in. Are you joking? I've eaten your array of pig products, your biscuits, your bagels smothered in cream cheese and you can't make a t-shirt to fit a normal-sized girl? 

That said, I'll be back for sure! You are just too delicious to pass up.
Had Eggs Cochon, t'was tasty.  A bit pricey for breakfast, but tasty none the less!
Food was delicious I ordered the fish and grits everything was fresh and hot definitely would recommend to friends

hit or miss.  eggs blackstone, a west coast favorite, is a great dish for breakfast.  but when its a miss?  don't serve it.
hard biscuit, and hollandaise cold?  doesn't make for anything special.
great grits...

usually, this place is right on the money.  love it.  but hit it on a miss, and disappointed.  if the biscuits don't turn out?  don't serve em.

I'll be back tho.   everyone makes mistakes.

The Ruby Slipper offers superb southern breakfast favorites!  It's a small, cozy place, and it's popular so it can be very crowded with a long wait, but well worth it.  

I started with a Bloody Mary that kicked off the bachelorette weekend in NOLA, delicious.  The server was extremely attentive, personable and friendly.  He was also very nice about splitting checks since there were 10 of us.  Food wise you really can't go wrong, the biscuits are out of this world, DELICIOUS.  I had the southern breakfast and everything about this dish was complete perfection, eggs, grits, fried green tomato, and applewood smoked bacon.  This was my favorite breakfast spot during my weekend in NOLA.

Visited the ruby slipper on a Thursday around 11. We were quoted a 30-40 minute wait and we waited about 35 minutes. During our wait we were able to grab drinks at the bar (which was quick) and walk around and explore NOLA. I recommend the Grapefruit Mimosa- it was perfect for the hot day, so refreshing! I also tasted the bacon Bloody Mary which was pretty good too.
We sat at the counter and the service was decent. We ordered 4 types of eggs benny- the salmon, shrimp and fried green tomato, corned beef and friend chicken. They were all good- the egg was a little over done on one of them but overall a solid Eggs Benedict. I would hands down recommend the fried chicken though- this was perfectly season and exactly what a twist on eggs Benedict should taste like. Also, the biscuits were SO GOOD. 
Over all great experience at the Ruby Slipper!
The food and atmosphere are delicious and fun! The wait is LONG!!! The staff were fun and engaging.

We visited this restaurant 3 times for brunch during our week long stay. Tried something different every time--never disappointed! The pancake flight was a huge order (not pictured here)...two of us shared one order and still had leftovers.

Love the food here but hate the wait. It would recommend going first thing or checking on Yelp to put your name on the list. We went 2 days in a row and I loved everything I ordered. My favorite however is the biscuit with brown sugar butter. The brandy milk punch is my new favorite drink. The first day I tried Catfish and Grits although the server tried to steer me to the Shrimp & Grits. So I had the Shrimp & Grits the next day. I preferred the Catfish as the cream sauce was more my speed. The grits in my shrimp and grits were clumped together and I wondered if they were just leftover grits from the day before.

OMG I F-ing love brunch~!!~~~!!!!

This place serves pretty solid brunch food.

I got the Gulf Fish St. Peter. It's a lot of good food, usually can't finish it all. The meal will be stellar, depending on how heavy or how tarty the sauce is that day. The shrimp, fish, grits, and veggies are normally cooked to perfection.

This place was so damn good I came back for a second time before I left Nola!!! 

The first time I ordered the shrimp and grits and because I was feeling greedy, I also ordered one cobbler pancake that I shared. Those by far were the BEST shrimp and grits I've had in my life and I've had my fair share of shrimp and grits. I didn't get as much of the BBQ taste as named in the meal description but I did get a tasty and strong rosemary flavor. I could've eaten the meal on my own. It was that good!!! The pancake wasn't your average pancake either. It was just delicious! I originally thought the blueberries were cooked into the batter but it was actually topped. Originally I was disappointed but that disappointment was quickly eliminated once I tasted that pancake!! It was amazing! To wash it all down, I ordered the peach Bellini which was huuuuge and had a nice surprise of diced peaches at the end of the drink. 

Needless to say when I returned, I ordered the same thing. One word of advice is to use the help app to reserve your seat because the wait is pretty long if you don't. The app allows you make a reservation and it tells u what time to be there.

Ruby Red Slipper was fantastic! I came here for bunch on a whim and when I saw the wait I knew it would be worth it. Thirty to forty minutes is nothing when you get to enjoy a fabulous pomegranate infused mimosa at the bar. 

Moving on to the food, I have nothing but praise to give. Breakfast is my favorite meal of the day and the culinary genre I enjoy the most. Their dishes were such a fun, and sensational twist on the average eggs Benedict or French toast. Skipping the menu entirely I choose their special of the day- poached eggs over French bread, fresh spinach, seasoned artichoke hearts and plump champagne cherub tomatoes. The sauce was a red pepper purée and while that sounded spectacular enough to a Texas girl visiting the Big Easy, I'm a sucker for hollandaise and the heart wants what it wants! Not wanting to miss ANYTHING I ordered both sauces and was in heaven. I actually thought to myself whether the looks I'd potentially receive would be worth licking the plate clean- it was that good! My friends had the classic scrambled egg breakfast with homemade buttermilk biscuits. They were in love with the red pepper purée and found themselves adding it to everything- roasted red potatoes, eggs, sausage...

 If you are in NOLA do yourself a favor and try this place! I promise you won't regret it. And don't worry about the wait- get yourself a French press or bloody merry to start your day off nice.

The Ruby Slipper is SO BOMB. I came from California to New Orleans for my Cuzzin graduation. Our timeshare was literally across the street and so I decided to visit since there was always a loooooonnnnnnggggg line. We got there about 10:30am and had no wait. We got the trifecta and it's soooooo delicious. Our server Sarah made the experience even better with her great customer service. I wish they would bring ruby slipper to Cali bc they would make a lot of money off that good food. Thank you again ruby slipper for a great experience.

Love love love this place.  Be ready for big helpings and strong drinks.  You are in NOLA so you know they have to go cups of whatever you are drinking.  The ambiance is fun and inviting the staff are great. 

Tip - put your name in via yelp line so you don't have to hang around until your name is called.  

Everything and anything on the menu is with it. 

Bacon Bloody Mary - must of your are a lover of this drink.

Must go to for breakfast.
Get the eggs Benedict with the fried chicken and bacon. Wait is not too bad .They said 45 min wait but only waited about 20.

Great staff, great food.. Expect a long wait even with no wait app. Hostess' are amazing they way they stay so cool while trying to quote and seat a bunch of hangry people.
Waiter was quick,  efficient, friendly and had a sense of humour..we were there NY day..
Would be great if they served Tito's! Good food, fun experience. Worth the wait for the Magazine Street location. In town for #BoycottBowl and it's all Saints fans here--who dat!
Very long wait but worth it. The french toast appetizer was amazing! We got the Coast Rican Special and the 3pigs omelet! Do yourself a favor and order some chorizo!

Absolutely loved the restaurant from the minute my Lyft pulled up to the building. Ordered the fried chicken egg Benedict and it literally melted into my mouth. I also ordered the morning margarita and it was amazing. Not only were the drinks and food were superb, but the scenery outside was truly comforting. Will definitely be coming back here on my next trip to the Big Easy!!

Always good to return. Enjoyed the Bananas Foster Pan Perdu. Wish they had a half order as the sweetness gets to be tooo much.
My Husband went for the Trifecta but concluded the pork is still the best!
On the downside....it took 55 minutes from being seated to get our food. AND sit inside if smells (streets..) bother you.

One of the best eggs Benedict i have ever had! I am that girl that if eggs Benedict is on the menu i will always get it. I loved the southern twist on the food. Line was out the door which is a good sign. They have fun mimosa flavors there to. Service was top notch.

First stop in New Orleans!

Fortunately we were able to reserve a table on Yelp before arriving.  But even so, it wasn't that busy.  But time is valuable so I'm glad we were able to save some time with that feature.  

The service was awesome, our waitress was super nice.  I ordered the Apple Pie French Toast and my husband ordered the Trifecta Benedict witch had one of each Benedict they carried; Cochon, Chicken St Charles, and Bayou Shrimp.  

Both dishes were amazing and totally recommend to anyone visiting the New Orleans area. And be sure to use the Yelp wait-list feature! 

Bonus point: They had NOLA cold brew coffee with sweet cream which my husband loved.

Man, oh, man, did we like our brunch at Ruby Slipper. We arrived and anticipated that we would have a wait on a Saturday at noon, but it honestly wasn't too bad. They told us 45 minutes, so we took some pics, got drinks at the bar, checked out the menu, and were actually called back within about 30 minutes. The waiter was pretty friendly and even helped me choose french toast over pancakes--a great choice;) 

We loved the Eggs Cochon, their take on Eggs Benedict with shredded pork---deeeelicious. Also had the aforementioned french toast--they use yummy brioche--alongside scrambled eggs and bacon. Everything was great, and we can't wait to return. Do be aware that it is a busy, noisy spot, so be prepared to shout a bit if you sit inside.

Enjoyed how they have a waitlist system on Yelp. But what took the longest was getting our food out. We waited over 40 minutes to get our breakfast. Just felt like the combined normal wait time to get a table and to get our food of over 1.5 hour was unreasonable. Got the egg cochon and St. Charles. Fried chicken was soggy and falling apart by the time it reached the table. The egg cochon was good, but something about the flavors didn't click for me. Was dissatisfied with the quality and freshness of the food.

only good thing was that our waitress was friendly and helpful

This is a must go when you're in the city! So glad that we came back while visiting this past weekend. I had the hot honey chicken French toast which was AMAZING!  I also had the mimosa flight, which although good I wish you could pick which flavors you wanted included in your flight. It does get packed quickly so make sure to get there early or allow yourself the time to wait.

YES!!! We randomly walked into this place, it was hopping around noon. They have a great menu (everything looks fantastic). I ordered an item from the "lighter" menu, but the order was hardly light.

Egg white omelet with veggies and goat cheese. I was expecting a few crumbles in the middle, but the whole middle was filled with goat cheese, not crumbles, but melted, it must have been a 1/4 C. AMAZING!

WOW. INCREDIBLE. This place has redefined the breakfast experience. If you are in New Orleans, you are doing yourself a disservice by not dining here. Incredible food. Amazing food, awesome staff. 11/10 would dine here again.
Great food! The pride flight was worth it!Taranesha is an amazing host and super sweet. I got the breakfast sandwich, very tasty! I'll definitely visit again on my next trip to NOLA

Crowds every morning, but is it worth the hype? Maybe.

Don't do Yelp waitlist. Their quoted wait time is way off compared to putting your name down with the hostess.

Pig candy bacon bites? Salty, sweet and delicious. But just enough for a group of 4 to sample a taste.

I started with a hello sunshine which was nice and refreshing. Not too sweet, but lots of grapefruit flavor with a hint of rosemary.

I had the BBQ shrimp and grits, which were ok...but the wifey's crawfish and grits benedict was definitely the better choice.
I dined in and Lyndsey was my waitress. She was very courteous and attentive. She was also very well versed on the menu and gave some great recommendations. We will be dining in again.

In short - for a pretty high price point for breakfast ($15-$17) a plate, we were disappointed.

The pros: 
A server offers you drinks while you wait outside that can be paid for with cash. You can check in online and cut your wait time down significantly. Their menu has something for everyone, and the plating was great. The biscuits = excellent.

Order your mimosa with juice/puree on the side to get a healthy pour, otherwise its 50/50.

The cons: 
It took 30+ minutes to get our food, which was a catfish benedict, a smoked salmon benedict, and a side of fried green tomatoes. The salmon had the same texture as canned cat food. If we weren't as hungry as we were, or knew we could get a replacement quicker, we would have sent it back. My gf is Jewish and eats lox/nova once or twice a month, and I grill/blacken/pan-sear fresh salmon at least 3x a month. Sadly, we both agreed it was unanimously the most disgusting salmon we've ever eaten.

There was a definite shortage of holl sauce. A biscuit as tasty and as large as a cinnabon needs some lubrication going down. We would have liked more sauce. 

Our side of fried green tomatoes were served with cold sour cream. I would suggest a cajun queso served hot, or a warm roumelade. Definitely ditch the sour cream.

For $15 & $17, neither one of our bennies included a side of ten cent grits, hash browns, home fries, or fresh fruit, which were extra. In visiting a dozen states in the past 4 years, I don't think I recall seeing bennies not include at least half of an orange wheel on the plate to balance the savory.

This place was awesome, one of the best places we've eaten in New Orleans. First off...great service, the waitress really interacted with our children well, which really added to the overall experience. I had "The Trifecta" eggs benedict, it was great, but easily my favorite was the Eggs Cochon, it was amazing, I'll be getting that next time. My wife had the special which was "Peppermint Chocolate Stuffed French Toast", she worried it would be too sweet and heavy, but it was far from it and was very well balanced, and she enjoyed every bit. Of course we started with Bloody Mary's...both were solid, if you're a bacon-lover get the bacon infused vodka.

Great place to bring visitors for a New Orleans breakfast. Diverse menu options with southern classics. Their Benedicts are killer! Make sure to join the waitlist before you get there, it significantly shortens the wait time!

This is one of my favorite brunch spots in the city. The setting is small and intimate. However,  it gets packed really fast.  The customer service is really good. The food is delicious. Do yourself a favor and check this place out.

Amazing food. Amazing service. Nicole, our waitress, was the best waitress ever. We had a large party of 15 people & she was so accommodating & sweet. They even allow you to split the bill which is rare.
we had a tour at 10 and sat down at 9:15 and they got our food out quick! the food and service was great!

If I could leave more than 5 stars I would for sure jump on it to do so. The food was beyond amazing, our server Aniel was such a sweet person with a great personality. She was very attentive and always sure to check up on us! The whole staff was amazing. This is a go-to spot if your visiting NOLA!!
Delicious food, excellent service.  The Atmosphere was wonderful.   Cochan and One Tomato, Two tomato Benedict's were excellent.
Great food and customer service! Joined the online waitlist before we got there and only had to wait about 10 minutes to sit. Freddie was great!

Food first, very good but that fried green tomato stole the show for me. I'll be back and will have an order of just those alone!  
I don't normally comment on staff, but for me it stood out.  They all came across as happy and wanting to be there!  I don't often see that.  Always checking on customers and even helped each other's tables out. I wish I had a local restaurant like that.

Lewis! Bartender making the best blackberry lavender mule mimosa ever! He's full of joy that these drinks are made with love!! Fresh purée is the secret! The food so much to choose from that his recommendation of the peacemaker where I got the crawfish and the shrimp eggs Benedict was absolutely incredible. Flavors collide with spice and crisp with soft fresh biscuit and a tangy fried green tomato with the tasty shrimp and fried cheesy grit patty for the crawfish. All topped with the perfect egg. Sooooo good!!! Great potatoes too! Worth the wait for this meal.

I am so glad I had a chance to check this place out. The place was lit with some of the waiters dancing along with the diners, music blasting, and it was such a nice vibe all around. The service was okay as I had a hard time understanding the waiter in a busy environment and her wearing the mask created a barrier for me as a deaf individual which I could have use my phone to type out what I wanted to say. But all in all, the food I had was delicious. I ordered the Costa Rican, French toast bites, and a side of breakfast potatoes. The Costa Rican were really delicious and I kind of wish they had provide different versions of plantain instead of the plantain chips. The French toast bites were absolutely divine! The fries were solid and ofc their mimosas were delicious as well.

Just great southern breakfast with super service, great bloody Mary's, and reasonable prices.  "You can't drink all day if you don't start in the morning!"  

Good times

Smart decision doing the online check in because we were able to wait at our Airbnb for about 30 minutes while our table was getting ready! Great food and wonderful staff! Highly recommend the St Charles Benedict and the bananas fosters pain perdu! Great place for breakfast or brunch!

Great choice for a hearty and delicious breakfast. Multiple locations around New Orleans and options to get on the waiting list online. I won't say it's my first choice based on the food itself, there are better spots. But overall hit the spot and the service was wonderful.

Amazing food; AMAZING service; and the ability to put yourself on an online waiting list. What else does a place need. Get the house specials and the spiked iced coffee. Don't do yourself a disservice of getting a brunch classic.

First of all, they have Crystal hot sauce!!  I'm from CA where I have to special order Crystal hot sauce from Amazon in order to have it here, so that was a pleasant surprise.  For the most part throughout the rest of my trip to LA all rest had Tabasco sauce (which in hot sauce ratings Tabasco comes in near the bottom).  Anyway, enough hot sauce talk, let's get to the food.  The meal I got was a nice mix of options: fried green tomato, grits, bacon, eggs, and biscuit.  My girlfriend got the same, but the celiac friendly version.  Just the right amount of food to hit the spot before you head out to museums.  

LGBTQ friendly. Celiac friendly.  And friendly staff to top it all off.
Long wait, but it was worth it. The food & drinks were really good and the service was exceptional as well. I see why so many people rave about this place.
The best breakfast and breakfast choices I've had in a long time. Ate there 3 out of 4 mornings. Regret we didn't on the 4th! A great breakfast hangout spot too! Just be expected to be tipsy by noon!
Listen... the food slapped, the drinks knocked you out and Brandi W the server was the Muhammad Ali of servers

I came because of the reviews. I used No Wait app. While the hostess had a funky demeanor.. I ignored her & pushed forward. The breakfast was to die for! The combo Egg Conchon & Chicken St Charles were the bomb.com! My son had the catfish & grits & he said "it is better than good, this is awesomeness". Jacus was our waiter & he was friendly, gave attentive service, and the atmosphere. Justine came by & we had great conversation! This is a "must eat" in NOLA!

Super great check in/wait list. We were able to get on wait list from our hotel. When we got there, the wait time for a table was one hour to 1.5 hours BUT NOT US.  Because of the waitlist we were seated within 10 minutes and we got a drink while we waited. Super easy!

The food was awesome. Best eggs Benedict ever
Food was fantastic ambiance was totally New Orleans would eat here again if I was in town.

So glad we went here! We'd been bummed about not having yet had an amazing "foody" experience during our New Orleans visit.   We got there at 8:30 am on a Wednesday so we had no wait.  Blown away by the banana foster French toast and the Bloody Mary.  Great way to start the day.  We tried the Decateur location the next day but for some reason, neither the food (including coffee and drinks) nor the location seemed as great as this location.  But the food experience at this (Magazine St) was one of the highlights of our trip!

Eggs Cochon... oh my... So, I managed to sneak in here on a Saturday morning and get a table at the bar. Apparently it can be quite a wait for a table, but I was flying solo and the bar suited be just fine. the drinks are spend, but the Eggs Cochon (think Eggs Benedict turned into NOLA street food) was INSANELY good. I will be coming back.
The bartender Lewis made what started out a bad experience great! He was really awesome!
Great coffee, delicious food, be prepared for a line to be seated, but it goes quick. Ruby mimosa and bacon candy!
Darling little restaurant. Great local cuisine options. The sauce on the Bayou Shrimp Benedict was incredible! Every plate that came out of the kitchen looked amazing.

Loved - loved - loved this breakfast spot when we were in NOLA....  Great food, unique choices, wonderful service, the staff was very attentive and loved the positive - happy faces, there is a wait as it's a popular spot, but we thought it was worth it!!!!

They were too picky about not holding a table for five when two of us were there. The other three got interference for their GPS amongst the tall buildings. They were ten minutes away. We watched five tables disappear

Then they told us we had to wait 45 minutes to sit inside for breakfast

I was in town celebrating my 20th Deltaversary with my line sisters. Sunday was our final day and the ones left in town decided to have brunch at the Ruby Slipper. We arrived around 12:30pm and expected a wait. The hostess took my number and informed that I would receive a text once our table was ready. About 30 minutes later, not a bad wait at all, I was texted and we were seated in a booth. Our server was lovely and informed us that they are known for having a good bloody mary. Well, then, no need to persuade me any further, bring over that award winning bloody mary sir! I love being in Nawlins for bloody mary's because they usually add either a shrimp, a crawfish or something pickled such as okra or green beans to the drink. Additionally, the tomato base is always on point!! I was NOT disappointed. My linesisters ordered the peach bellini. They weren't that fond of their drinks and thought it to be syrupy. I tasted it and... it tasted like.. a bellini LOL. They changed to a mimosa instead and were satisfied. I order the gulf fish dish. It came over a grit cake with a hollaindaise cream as well. It was good but not the explosion of flavors that I am used to receiving in NOLA. My line sister ordered a side of a grit cake but was given cheese grits instead. Somehow something got lost in translation during the ordering and the server informed us that they don't provide the grit cakes a la carte. Whatttttt? Oh my, if I can make one suggestion, add the grit cake to the a la carte menu or offer as a side.

It was a busy Sunday afternoon so service was slow but actually a lil slower than I would have liked but hey, I had my bloody mary. I'll visit again for sure and will try something else. I enjoy working my way through a menu. Until next time... Laissez les bon temps rouler!

As soon as we walked in there was a very sweet hostess and sat us with in 15 mins. Their Mamosa's were great. The chicken sandwich was a hit and the server was extremely friendly and on point with her Service.

We always visit Ruby Slipper for brunch while in New Orleans. My husband and I had the southern breakfast and fried green tomatoes for appetizers. Food was delicious as always!!  Definitely enjoyed the peach Bellini and house mimosas while waiting to be seated for brunch. We waited for two hours. The food is definitely worth it! Those grit with cheese are amazing!! We will be back!! Sorry I didn't get a picture of the main entrees !!

Well worth the wait. Once we learned about wait list was fast. Food is delicious! Bartender was awesome. Bad at names but has been in New Orleans for 22 years! She cured my hangover and was very entertaining!

Once we discovered this restaurant, we ate there 3 out of 5 days.  Learned after the first day, to put our name on the waitlist before we left our hotel.  Cut down on the wait.  Food was excellent as was the service.  We all loved the Vanilla Iced Coffee, and everything we ordered was so good. Bacon was great and is served with most entrees. Would eat there a lot if there was one near our home in Texas.  Of course, we'd gain a lot of weight too.

We found this place by asking a local for a good spot for breakfast. And boy was it!! There was 4 of us and everyone order something different... Freddie our waiter went over the menu with us and gave his recommendations... Not only was the food hot and fresh, but the service that this man provided to us that early in the morning (7:30) was humbling. We can't wait to come back for those killers EGG Benedict's! Thanks to the staff for a wonderful experience and that you Freddie!
Good food & fast service. The banana foster French toast is a favorite. Glad they were open on Black Friday
Nicole, Jared & Louis were awesome! Packed house, gracious, nice & service was over the top! We will definitely be back!

a bartender told us we had to try this place for breakfast and we walked into a super busy restaurant..we were seated right away and our server was very pleasant and my water was filled each time i was half way empty (this is a pet peeve of mine) i had a southern breakfast..this comes with two eggs that i had scrambled, bacon that i subbed for sausage, a biscuit, and a fried green tomato..the biscuits here are a situation..huge and hearty and buttermilky good..i had mine with some jam and loved it..the fried tomato was really good also..we also had bloody marys that were really spicy..i like this place alot..the vibe is cool and the service was good..i love the story about the name, and i loooove the ruby slipper with the fried egg as the logo..

So.... this spot in NOLA is a must for breakfast and brunch. We walked here from our hotel on canal street and were not disappointed... the only disappointment was that we couldn't come back a second time while we were In town. Get here early cuz it's poppin. I had the combo Benedict with the special and one with smoked candy bacon. Wifey got the Migas. Next time in town we will be back

Definitely use the Yelp Waitlist if you plan on going here! It came in clutch when I was in town for Mardi Gras weekend. I got on the waitlist right when my friends and I woke up. We spent an hour getting ready and by the time we walked to the restaurant, we had to wait about 10 minutes to get seated. There was a huge mob outside waiting and there's no way I could have stood outside for that long. 

Overall, brunch was really great here. We enjoyed everything here from the Spanish Omelette to the Salmon Avocado Toast. The best item was the Gulf Fish St. Peter! It's a very unique brunch item and perfect for NOLA, so I definitely recommend trying it out if you're a fish fan.
I had the bam bam biscuits and the pain perdu and omg absolutely delicious. Super close to my hotel and fast service.

This was well worth the wait! We went on a Sunday morning right before noon. It was busy several parties already waiting so it turned into a 45 minute wait for 2 party table. I was starving! We found a bench to sit and they text you to advise to start heading to the restaurant. We ordered coffee and juice. Fried green tomatoes starter. It was topped with lettuce, tomatoes, candied bacon and fried well. A little crunchier than I preferred but the flavors together were phenomenal. I had a medium burger topped with over medium egg, dressed with trimmings. I did it was huge I only finished 1/2. I did not get a decent pic but it was delish, the fries are shoestring and we're not greasy or salty they were crisp and just the right temperature. My guest had the BYO omelet with spinach, shrimp, and ham, grits and a biscuit and he did not take long to devour the plate! The service was great, and quick once inside. The restaurant itself was clean and very well decorated, with TVs in all views. The football game was playing. I look forward to returning and trying more breakfast. I like to eat breakfast early am or late after midnight.
Excellent foot, service, and coffee! After a few says in NOLA we needed some "real food" and the 3 little pigs omelette did the job nicely!

Wait time online was like an hour , then we had to wait another 45 mins to get seated when we got to the restaurant. It was good that they have a server asking for drink orders while you're in line, bloody mary and Irish coffee was sooooo good!!! Food was good but not worth a 2hour wait.
After tying to eat her two days in a row. We sat at the bar and Lewis was so great. He was ready to work qirh a smile good energy made recommendations smile he change my entire mood of having to wait

Very crowded place, which indicates just how good it was. We had about a 25-30 minute wait for our party of 8. They were very accomadating with ALL of our luggage. 

Had the Bloody Mary. And it was so tasty. I had mine with Tequila in it, and boy was it strong! Loved the kick that the drink had

I split the chicken st. charles benedict & the shrimp boogaloo benedict & stuffed blueberry french toast. The benedicts were so delicious. but our french toast stuffing was very cold. 

It look awhile to get our food, which was fine because we had lots of it to spare. We couldn't board our cruise until 130!
AMAZING FOOD; warning waits are usually long but checked in online and it went pretty quickly. Def recommend when visiting NOLA!

Great place to try great food and outstanding breakfast..!  Ask for Goldy she would accommodate
GF and Celiac orders. 
Come by and try it yourself..!  You won't be disappointed!!!

Had a great experience here! The wait was minimal but it was a Friday mid-morning. We used the Yelp app to reserve a spot. The total wait was 30 minutes. I wanted a healthier option so I ordered the Skinny Migas which had lots of flavor! We also ordered the St. Charles Benedict. That was the best item on the menu! The chicken was juicy and the sauce on top was phenomenal!! 

The waitress was friendly and attentive to our needs. She recommended some options (St. Charles Benedict and Egg Chocon). Highly recommend this breakfast spot. It's worth the wait!
I'll start by saying Freddie H. is the best. He was fast efficient, and friendly! The food was great (a big serving) and mimosas were spectacular as well.

Dear people of Yelp, if you are in NOLA at breakfast time & the stuffing of the day at Ruby Slipper is Apple Cinnamon, for the love of all that is good and creamy in this world and the next, GET THE STUFFED FRENCH TOAST! That and the corned beef hash (& a brandy milk punch) are all you need to conquer your day (& possibly the next two days).
Very disappointed! After waiting 45 minutes to get seated then waiting an hour for COLD Pancakes and eggs !!! I'm over it! It's over hyped and overrated !

I had a bad experience at the other ruby slipper on magazine and after a few months decided to try a new location and Nabil and Michael at the bar made up for my experience at the other location and I will be back here and Kennis brought my food out in a timely manner with my extra sauce!!!!
Awesome restaurant! The food is always delicious and fresh. The restaurant is large and spacious and they take COVID regulations seriously. This is one of our favorite restaurants for brunch.

A must for bloody Mary's! They had just won the best in New Orleans for it too. Go for the bacon vodka and if there's a line they have a waitress that serves the booze while you wait!!! Wonderful brunch options to die for. I had the avocado toast and it was an exploration of flavors in my mouth. The other ladies in my party were all voicing the same and highly recommend. I'll be back and they have more than 1 location if you can't wait.

What a great place to get an amazing breakfast or brunch! Lively and jovial, you'll feel welcome once you step inside. It is very popular so you'll likely wait, but get in the virtual queue online and then head over as your place in line advances. Grab a beverage once you're there! It's not like this place needs another 5-star review, but the masses aren't wrong. 
We were well taken care of by Annmarie at the bar and she definitely made our experience more enjoyable! 
We started with some tasty breakfast cocktails and then some French toast bites. Deelish! The cream cheese drizzle was divine! 
I had the Chicken St. Charles, think eggs benedict with a Southern twist. Fried chicken on top of a buttery open biscuit with a creamy sauce and poached egg on top! Sweet, savory and delectable!
The breakfast sandwich also received high marks. Look forward to our next visit!

Visiting from California was told about this spot and definitely glad my husband and I tried it. Really cute place  the Spanish omelet I had was bomb! My husband has a 3 little piggies omelette which he loved.

Well recently visited Ruby slipper on magazine st first off the staff are awesome organized and attentive keeping us up to date on when we be seated which was no long at all the environment is beautiful and fun now for the food extremely good It a definite repeat and recommended to try if your New Orleans  I loved how it tasted Banana foster French toast  tasted  it was not overly sweet or dry at all

Within about two hours of landing in NoLa and dropping my bags I came here because it was close but also because of the funky name. You can not go wrong with the name like Ruby Slipper. Mid day on a Thursday place was packed. Sat at the bar and had a great experiance from the staff down to the most important thing. Food. Amazing. 
Got shrimp and grits with the most delicious butter and a huge from scratch biscuit that was dessert. Shared a great conversation with a fellow traveler and took the Ruby Slipper mimosa to go. It's a must if you are here.

Don't support a restaurant where hostess goes out of her way to be ugly
     We attempted to eat here. We were told it was a 5-10 min wait. We huddled to the left out of the way but were tx we had to wait outside. When we commented that it was too cold, she directed us that if we weregoing to stay inside, we had to go to the bar and get a drink, which we did.  We watcheda few others be seated, but couldnt swear we were there vefore them. After about 15 min, the hostess who sent us to the bar and who walked past us each time she sat a table, approached us and said "I called your name outside. You didn't answer so I sat people. That's how our system works here. We only call your name outside."  So, clearly she knew where we were and admitted she intentionally was being ugly, so we promptly took our money elsewhere. 
Why would anyone support a restaurant that clearly goes out of their way to be ugly to customers?

Absolutely delicious. The key to attending this restaurant is joining the waitlist early in the morning around 9am. Wait was 3 hours but definitely worth it. The French toast bites were heavenly - best I ever had. The rum sauce was delicious. We both did the peacemaker with crab cakes and the St. Charles - I was surprised but the St. Charles stole the show. Added I. Some of the crystal hot sauce, and it was so delicious. Can't wait to return!

The food was really good. It was close to our hotel. 5 mins from the Marriott on Canal. I reserved my spot in line prior to going there. There was a long wait.  I did outside seating. I would definitely recommend.
The Ruby Slipper never disappoints! I had an omelette with bacon, cheddar cheese and spinach with a biscuit. It tasted like heaven!! My husband ordered the smoked salmon Benedict. Pure perfection!!

It was just okay for us.  First I didn't realize (my bad) that you had to tell the host you are there after you put yourself on waitlist on Yelp.  So we waited a while.  We were then seated in the very back of the restaurant and could smell garbage.  Food took a long time and my drink took longer.  I didn't get my Bloody Mary until I was half way done with the meal..  Not counting the wait outside, we were there for an hour (around noon) and we ate pretty quickly. Food was okay but nothing spectacular.  Their espresso machine was out so we couldn't order latte.  I didn't quite understand the hype for this restaurant.
Loved this place!! Wait was a little crazy so check in as soon as you can but it was sooooo good!

We stayed downtown for our honeymoon staycation. Being from nola, it was sad seeing so many restaurants closed or almost empty. Luckily ruby slipper was up and running and living up to their reputation. I love this restaurant and always order the st. Charles Benedict! Freddie H was busy but made sure to check on us to make us welcomed and comfortable.

Absolutely amazing food and even better service from our waiter, Lance. He knows his food AND the kitchen so it was easy to navigate menu options that we could make omit items on. Will definitely be back next time.

We took a tip from another Yelper and use the online service to get in line before we arrived. It was about a 10 minute walk from our hotel and even with getting in line online we waited about 20 minutes because just everyone waiting outside got in line online. The wait was well worth it. Even with the amount of people in this small cafe style restaurant we didn't wait long for our food. I had the bananas foster French toast with breakfast potatoes and my mouth is watering just thinking about how good that was. The food is well worth the wait but I would get in line online because those who didn't were told the wait would be over an hour.

The food was delicious and I can't give enough praise to Angelina who is one of the best severs I've had across the United States and in my international travels. I will definitely return to have more BBQ Shrimp and Grits and to be severed by the best server I've ever had.
Food was a great representation of NO food. Great service! Will definitely return when I come back!

Really enjoyed this place
For breakfast. Food, atmosphere and service
Were all fantastic.
Shitty service meets shitty food. If I could give this place zero stars I would . I suggest firing your staff and starting over from starch .
The food was great, we had the pacemakers, the atmosphere was great. Make sure you add yourself to the waitlist because it can get very busy.

We had an amazing experience! Fantastic food and great drinks. Fair prices, I highly recommend this place. Get a reservation before you come, but the wait is definitely worth it! Freddie was our server, he was INCREDIBLE!! So attentive and accommodating. Five stars
Long wait to get a table, but the food was great! Loved the banana foster pain perdu! So good!

Ruby Slipper was the famous brunch spot that everyone suggests you go to while in New Orleans so my family and I had to try and it out and see how good it was for ourselves. The wait was long but they just give you a call when the table is ready which is better than waiting in line. 

The food was pretty good, they had a large variety of food and the prices were all reasonable. The selection was amazing, but the banana foster I got, I expected more. Overall, the spot and atmosphere was nice for brunch and I'd come again but maybe order something else.
Get there early the line is long the food is good, the customer service is top notch and you can order a latte while you wait!

The weather in nola was uncharacteristically cold this weekend. So we were waiting outside this morning in 38 degree weather. Someone in our party ran back to our hotel (down the block) for a jacket and our name was called. Unfortunately ruby slipper has a policy that they can't seat your party til everyone is there. Would have been nice if they told me when I checked in. The hosts weren't very friendly. Luckily the food and servers made up for it! A server got some drinks started for us outside and our name was called again right after. Drinks were delivered to our table shortly. We had bloody marys, a peach bellini, chicken st charles, biscuits n gravy, and chicken french toast plates. Everything was delish. Our server Freddie gave us excellent service!! Ruby slipper did not disappoint as usual despite the cranky hostesses.
Great brunch spot! I've worked my way through this menu and had just about everything. You can't go wrong with anything you order, but the varieties of eggs Benedict are truly special.

Worth the wait!!! Let's start there. Go to google. Get on the list. Rain, sleet or sunshine get a drink and wait it out! Even if you choose to wait it out, service is speedy once you are sat.
