The servers are polite and explains the menu to a T. You can not go wrong with any option but at a look at the Special Menu too. We ordered about 7 plates because the options were exquisite. I would highly highly reconvened this LOCATION. We went to the one one Board street same menu completely different experience! I could go into details about each individual entree but you see for yourself!!! I will recommend the STUFFED KING Beignets French Toast! It blew our minds!

This restaurant was highly rated so I was super excited to try it. I was immediately met with warm, inviting, and friendly energy from the minute I stepped into the restaurant. From the hostess to the waitress and the bussers, everyone was super nice. I took forever to figure out what I wanted to eat because everything on the menu looks soo good. My waitress did a great job with her recommendations. I ended up getting the bacon pecan pancakes with bacon and a side of eggs. It was delicious. Probably some of the best pancakes I've ever had. You get 3 in a stack. They were so light and fluffy, and they tasted so good in their own, I needed very little syrup. It was a big portion and I could only eat 2 pancakes. I'm definitely coming back here to try more menu options when I return to NO. This is a must try place if you're visiting NO.
tony was absolutely amazing! he was really attentive, really fun to talk to and super friendly. he really made the experience!

Hostess was amazing. Wait was long people were upset and she held it together. Even caught her busing tables and serving food. The food was pretty good as well. Bayou Shrimp Benedict was the best, per my husband. I really enjoyed the Migas, although I feel there could have been more cheese. All together it was worth the wait.

I tried the mimosa flight. Do yourself a favor, just order two mimosas. While they were good, i don't think they had any alcohol in them. The biscuits and gravy and eggs Benedict were both delicious.  Portions are healthy. Great breakfast at a nice place.

Really awesome place for breakfast! Open floor, nice bright light inside! Customer service was superb & unique! Food was amazingly yummy & worth coming back again and again! The drinks wears amazing too! All prices fair & reasonable!

Great service, great food, great bloodys!  Highly recommend checking out this Ruby Slipper location.  While we didn't try any other (yes, it's a NOLA chain... it's obvious this location is a bit off the beaten path, as we passed one on the way and one after breakfast; both of which had lines of people waiting) we were quite happy with every aspect of our meal here.  I of course had to try the Benedict and it was worth it!  The bloody Mary was tasty too!

Ruby Slipper Café is a very popular lunch spot in New Orleans near Harrahs Casino. Our lunch was ok but we waited a long time for the food to come out. Luckily, the best part of the lunch wait was the bacon bloody Mary's.  We ordered several of them and to give you an idea how long the wait was we were on the second one by the time the food came out. A lunch salad and sandwich menu.

Pros
Online wait list
Bacon Bloody Mary's excellent 
Our server 

Cons
Long wait to get in
Long wait to get your food
Mediocre food 
( eggs benadict, corned beef Reuben,  fried fish , biscuit and gravy )
The fried fish awful, the corned beef was stringy 

The consensus of our group was go for the bacon bloody Mary's and definitely sit inside because to odors from the street is not pleasant.

Great food. Wait can be extremely long. Do the wait list before even leaving your hotel. Enjoyed the staff. Waiter was nice and pleasant. With the heat the flies were off the chain. When I return back to Nola. I will return for breakfast again. If in season please check out the fried green tomatoes

The waitress is very rude I couldn't enjoy my meal because it was too cold and she wouldn't not move me so I could be more comforting to enjoy my meal when there was other tables available and she was just Chatting with her other coworker instead of trying to help the customer I highly recommend if you ever come to this restaurant don't ever sit by the door because they will not move you

What a fun place. There is a wait to get in at all hours (open till Three pm only) but worth the wait.  We were served by the fast working Anabelle.  I had the croquet Madame Sandwich which was very good, the fries were ok. The sweet bacon (pig candy bacon) is to die for. It was recommended by the person sitting next to me. Fun atmosphere. Try it. Reasonably priced.  There are several locations.

Visiting Ruby Slipper is like going to breakfast/brunch heaven with wonderful cocktails! The Shrimp and Grits are full of delicious flavors. The Boozy Iced Coffee is such a fun drink and every sip is enjoyable. The menu has a great selection of breakfast and brunch items. I can't wait to return!!!!

Like any great brunch spot there is a Long wait, but it's worth it. Use the waitlist in yelp for sure. 

French toast was amazing and I would get it again and again. 

This was a great place to get some good, warm, comfort food after a night of drinking on bourbon street or gambling at the nearby casino.
Always delicious food!! Thank you for never disappointing! Highly recommend getting on the virtual waiting list.

Im
Sure its great. But set an alarm for 4am to go get in line. 2-3 hour wait times at all time.  There are better places to go
Nicole at the bar is AMAZING, plus it was the best brunch I've ever had! This place will not disappoint!
Utilizing the wait list on Yelp was awesome! Just don't forget to check in when you arrive. The food and service was great! Our server was fabulous and patient.

This location is VERY chaotic! The food was fine. Nothing specific that stood out one way or the other. I think because of the chaos they aren't totally able to give as much attention to the food to make sure it is hot for instance. 

About the chaos:
People were literally waiting for 2 hours and more to get in. There is not a ton of seating, so they can't really accommodate a lot of people, which definitely added to the chaos. Do not just show up, or you will be one of those people waiting for 2 hours. You need to join the waitlist ahead of time, so when you arrive to check in, you can be seated within a few minutes. If you do not join the waitlist before you arrive, everyone who joined the waitlist will continue to leapfrog you.
Fortunately, I joined the waitlist ahead of time, but did witness some angry folks who did not join the waitlist and were upset that others were seated before them because they didn't understand the process. I think the hostesses could have yelled out a few times to the crowd to encourage them to join the waitlist or explain the process some more. 

I probably wouldn't go to this location again, but would be willing to try another location on my next visit to New Orleans.
Such good food. Came to visit and went to both the French quarter and CBD location. I recommend the southern breakfast. Coffee is great, biscuits are amazi
Join the Waitlist online as early before you head there as possible. The service is great for such a crowded place.
Our server, Freddie, was very kind and checked in on us a good amount. This location was fairly crowded, but the wait didn't seem too long. Great food and awesome service!

Let me start by saying that this place is worth all the fanfare. 
You may be turned away by the long line- don't be!

You may be turned away by being 50th on the wait list- don't be!

You may be turned off when you look inside and see how small the place is - don't be!

Folks this place is the real deal. My wife and I spent 4 days I. The area this week and she wanted me to try this place, her advocacy was on point! We had breakfast here 3 days in a row, why go anywhere else! Fortunately we were at the Sheraton, so right out the back door and we're at the restaurant. We'd jump on the waitlist, sit in our room until we were close to being called, then head on over. Their estimation on you being seated is pretty close to accurate everyone. 

What's good?
The service. The folks aren't over the top, but friendly and cordial. Think about it, they have a waitlist from open to close, so to be on that whole time is a lot to ask, but they're all good to me. 

The food- shrimp and grits are heavenly, Benedict's are really good and offer a ton of variety, corned beef hash- incredible, and the pancakes variety and taste was truly awesome. I'm a Starbucks snob and the coffee is even good here. 

Unfortunately they've ruined it for other places in town, whenever I'm back this is our go to. 

Thanks all!

So, when we go to NOLA, this place has become one of our "must go" restaurants. Have been there on two separate trips and it hasn't disappointed yet. Great beverages - both the alcoholic persuasion and not - to start. Super fun (and yummy!) food choices. Always great wait staff...and even though it's busy, the waitlist option gets you in quick.  You should go here...
Service was a bit slow, I think the chicken at Charles is overrated, go for any other and it's pretty good. The beignets are amazing

So good! Was in New Orleans for 5 days and ate here twice! Even though there is always a line out the door, I never waited more then 10 minutes. They also have a text alert system that tells you when your table is ready. Walk up boozy service and food service. I sat at the bar twice and the staff was attentive and friendly. 

The first time I ordered "The Peacemakers" Benedict, which allowed me to choose 2 of their special Benedicts. I had the Eggs Cochon and the Chicken St. Charles. The Eggs Cochon had great flavor and was juicy and the chicken was fried to perfection - the buttermilk biscuit they were served on was AMAZING! 

I enjoyed the Eggs Cochon so much, the second time I ordered just the Eggs Cochon. Again, delicious.

Our server Freddie was fantastic. He was very attentive and gave us great recommendations. This was our second time at the Ruby Slipper, but Freddie truly made the experience 10x better this time. Could not recommend a better breakfast spot.

Stop here for breakfast, had the shrimp Benedict and was really good, my wife had the corned beef Benedict she said it was ok, the wait was 35 min since a lot of people reserve online and we walked in on a Sunday am, service was good.
This is the spot for a good breakfast! The servers are so  very nice and very polite! I absolutely love having breakfast with my friends here and you will too!

Sub-par is kind. The system they used for reservations was not organized properly. No one at the front desk spoke to customers well enough to explain the process. My party and a few others kept asking for information and the staff kept walking away. After almost two and a half hours, we were seated. Our early brunch turned into late lunch

A few of the staff were busting their bottoms to give excellent service, the rest were too chatty and it too more than 15 mins to get our drink ordered and 25 mins for our order to be taken. The appetizers came out relatively quick. However we had to literally flag down our waitress twice and she still forgot to bring our order until I stated loudly, "we are going to leave, forget the food and bring us our bill." It took the other wait staff to hear and get the food brought out.

Once we got the food, of the 4 entrees we ordered, one was edible and the other three were under seasoned and over cooked. We paid and left. The rest of the day we all had the worse stomach pain. Keep in mind, this was our first meal of the day.

We are all about supporting local businesses, especially after the hurricane Katerina but, this place left unhappy and upset.
Soooo good.  My favorite brunch place in NOLA.  I want to try everything on the menu!
The food was delicious and our server, Freddie, was phenomenal! They serve French Truck coffee!

Our waitress was amazing she was on point with everything! And she was in training. She will make a great waitress for sure !! 
Daughter and hubby got the Banana foster French Toast they enjoyed it . 
I got the White Chocolate bread pudding pancakes. 
I wish I enjoyed it but I wasn't a fan... 
Coffee was really delicious! Cute place .

Ruby Slipper Cafe was delicious!! We were lucky that when we went, the place wasn't as busy and we were seated right away. The employees are really nice and hospitable. I listened to them as new people sat around us and they are genuinely nice and welcoming. When your waiter comes to your table, he gives you recommendations and you go from there. Regardless of what you choose, make sure you get a biscuit!! The biscuits are soooo delicious!! I went with The Trifecta, which is three different egg benedict concoctions.  It features Eggs Cochon, Chicken St. Charles & Shrimp Boogaloo. Out of the three, my favorite was the Chicken St. Charles ( I love chicken, lol). I must say though, that the three of them were good in their own way. I have to add that the other items in the menu look amazing as they are bringing them out. The only bad thing about this whole Ruby Slipper Cafe experience was that I didn't find out about it until the day we were heading back home. I will definitely be back when visiting NOLA.

The food was da bomb! However, their lack of time was appalling. My party of 6 wait was 30min which was fine. After a hour or waiting I asked the hostess how long she said "30 more minutes". My sis asked to speak with a manager and we were set in 15min

Disappointing trip on a Saturday after New Orleans, eased mask ordinance.  2 hour wait,  multiple errors in orders, had to search for the peaches in my French toast. Maybe they were overwhelmed, as we have had good experiences here in the past. Didn't feel it was was worth the wait or the price! 
Although the French toast bites were a very tasty starter, and the candy bacon was special as well!

Oh boy.  Well, I really wanted to like this place based on the menu and that I snagged a table at the sidewalk on a beautiful day.

I just wanted a little bit of food so I ordered the shrimp remoulade over fried green tomatoes with a side of cheese grits.  The tomatoes were in a good, flavorful breading, and fried nicely; not greasy at all.  Next to them was a little bed of mixed greens, and then the chilled shrimp remoulade.  If I were plating this, I would have put that over the tomatoes (especially since that's the menu description.)  Instead, it was off to the side and there was barely any sauce to it - I don't know, it just seemed plopped there and I would have liked enough sauce to actually dip more than one bite of the tomatoes in.  The shrimp also had an off texture, even accounting for the fact that it had been refrigerated.  The grits were standard mediocre diner fare, gloppy, and with just a sprinkle of shredded cheese.  They also committed the cardinal sin: no salt.

So I got my bill to put an end to all this, and thought I would just pay it and leave.  But wait, what's this?  Ummmmm, $2.00 plus $8.00 plus 98 cents tax equals a total of $10.98, yet the amount due is $11.00 even?  This doen't add up, literally.  The young waiter's explanation?  The computer does this sometimes randomly on people's bills?  Adds a cent or two?  Uh, no, I'm pretty sure you can't just do that.  I'm pretty sure that I've never seen that done anywhere else, and that if your establishment is well aware of this, then you should probably fix that - unless you're doing it intentionally.  I know it seems silly over just a couple of pennies, but if they do that to enough people, it can add up.  It actually reminds me of those rounding schemes you've heard about with banking computer software.  You know, the ones where people were prosecuted for fraud?

Food was great!! I had the Triffeta, my husband had the Costa Rican. Food was delicious. Wait time is long but the hostess gave me a tip so we didn't get to eat there the first day. On the next day We had to wait about 20 minutes.

The Trifecta!!! I'm in love!! I picked this place for the reviews and it is definitely worth the hype! TIP: join the wait list before you go! Please don't be surprised by long wait times. There is a reason there are a lot of people that want to get in there! And don't be rude to the hosts/hostesses - they are doing their best to get you in and fed, there is no conspiracy to make you wait for forever.

This place remains a not-so-hidden gem with ample parking and super conscientious wait staff. If you cannot find something delicious to eat from there extensive menu, there's something wrong with you and maybe you should be at Denny's instead.

We used to go to the original location a few blocks away but the Broad Street is by far a better and more relaxed atmosphere. The only penalty you will pay for sitting outside is that it can get really hot if the sun lands on you and you will be sharing your breakfast with thousands of flies.
Went on a weekend, so the wait was a bit long, however it's worth the wait. I had the Trifecta, so good.

The food was just okay. The wait staff was friendly, professional, and attentive. I had the catfish and grits, I was not prepared for them to be mixed together. I would have loved to have them separated. The cheese grits just had the  cheese sprinkled on top not cooked into the grits. The biscuits were excellent although a little large for my taste. The Bloody Mary was good with the pickled green beans but I missed having a piece of celery. Reasonably priced but the food falls short of the hype.

Wow Ruby Slipper Cafe was definitely worth the hour and a half wait because of the food. The only reason I am giving four stars is because the host sitting our party of 10 refused to put our 2 tables together.  After our server saw what we were requesting luckily for her she had the sense to put a party of 10 together by just joining the tables. Besides the commotion of getting seated our food was beyond expectation. I had the Corned Beef Benedict and it was served on a soft biscuit. It was the best Benefit I had tasted. The hash was not your canned hash, but actual corned beef and the creamy hollandaise accompanied it well. Everyone loved their food so that made the wait worth it.

The shrimp and grits was soooo good!  The wait was worth it but we should have added our names to the  wait list on Yelp. Great Bloody Mary, too. Freddy, our server was friendly and
Prompt.

WORTH THE WAIT! The only thing better than the food was the service.  Our server, Genie, was stupendous--sweet, fun, knowledgeable and funny.  What a way to end our visit to the Big Easy. And don't worry about the wait...they serve you cocktails curbside (a real treat for Californians...I think that's a felon back home)...thank you, Jen (our cocktail server).

WE LOVE THE RUBY SLIPPER!
The grits were amazing. Banana foster waffles were delicious. So glad I found this place while surfing the web.  I would recommend this to anyone looking for good breakfast and bloody Marys

Let's be real. This is a standard issue Greek restaurant, with prices that match much nicer places because they have a reputation of longstanding in NOLA. 

The food itself is underwhelming, the presentation is, well, most closely related to IHOP; however, the prices are in line with some of the nicer breakfast spots in the area. 

If you want to go to say you've been... Sure, the food is edible. If you want a great breakfast experience, there's better options.

Beyond criticism. Beyond reproach!  Amazing in every sense. Try the chicken benedict and the fried green tomatoes. 
Outstanding!!!!

Using Yelp to hold my place in line while we walked over was pretty convenient. The service was friendly and we didn't wait long for anything. But the food - I've definitely had way better. 

I had the fried chicken on a biscuit benedict. I ordered wrong due to miscommunication and got a hard fried egg on top (I wanted the yellow runny, just not quite as runny as a poached egg). So that's my fault. But, the food wasn't hot and the chicken didn't seem freshly cooked. It was just so-so in the flavor department, and the gravy that should've been on top was a no-show. So little was added on that it just absorbed into the food and everything was too dry. And I was just confused by the random fresh spinach leaves on the bottom of the plate. 

My husband ordered and enjoyed the plain pancakes. 

Coffee was strong, but not that great tasting. My husband ordered the ($4?) glass of OJ and wasn't impressed.

We paid about $35-40 for a breakfast with no booze and I left hungry. FOMO got me again and this place's food does not live up to the hype.

Don't wast your time or money. The breakfast had 2 slices of tiny bacon. I ordered a side of pork sausage which were overcooked, cold, and greasy. The potatoes were also cold. Hubby ordered a sausage omelet which had very little sausage. It was overcooked and brown. The best part was my Irish coffee and toast. Find a different spot to eat.

Holy cow! This was my 1st Nawlins meal & it was bomb! Me & the ole' ball & chain shared the Chicken St. Charles Benedict and an order of the banana foster french toast. They nailed it & defined the true meaning of brunch. 
The Chicken St Charles was one giant biscuit split in half topped with a piece fried chicken breast, eggs over easy or sunny side like ours. And the hollandaise! Yes it's not your typical hollandaise,  it was sweet and tasted a bit on the cheesy side. Soooo good! 
The banana foster was very good! Sweet but not to sweet topped with bananas & raisins. I really can't describe it without mouthwatering details... one to try out for yourself.
The waitress we had... no clue her name, but very friendly! Overall it was a great 1st experience! We will definitely be back!

The food is good for what it is. Ruby Slipper is in the category of an ihop to me just a smudge better. I normally skip this place when I come into town but my friends had to go. For the type of restaurant it is I'll say it's clean, nice looking, and the food is not terrible. Are there better restaurants? Sure. But out of the touristy places this is a good spot. 

I got a standard breakfast bacon, eggs, potatoes, and fried green tomatoes and it was all good. The drinks were my favorite part. 

If your in need of a meal and this place doesn't have a line I'd go but it for sure isn't worth waiting in line.

Whatever your heart desires they got It!! And if you can't decide they got you too. Love that they have options to add on and split menu items because it's really hard to decide.  The food here is always outstanding and quick to come out. Yes there's a wait but that just means it's fantastic.  Great pricing and the staff never lets you  down. Many locations so you don't miss out.  Check out the monthly seasonal options too.

They have an excellent, spicy, blood Mary! Yum! The beignets were recommended. It came with a pumpkin sauce and whipped cream, pecan sprinkled on top! You have to get this! I got the southern breakfast. The grits are the best that I've had in a long time. It came with bacon, eggs, and fried green tomato. And a nice big, fluffy biscuit. Well, needless to say, we will be back before our return home!

So I came in today to have brunch by myself. I ordered Pan Perdu French toast, scrambled eggs with cheese and a side of grits. Needless to say, I sent the grits back 4 times because they were cold... like not even luke warm... like cold... you'd think they just throw them in the microwave and keep going but NO! No exaggeration, I sent them back 4 times. So on the last time, I watched the bartender Camille walk to the back and speak with the manager Lindsay. Lindsay rolled her eyes and shook her head like a child throwing a tantrum. It was the worst experience I've ever received from here. I asked the bartender Camille for my check and I ended my meal. Horrible service from a manager!

The wait is a bit long so download the no wait app to hop in line without having to be there. Make sure your party is there otherwise they will not seat you until everyone is there! The food is amazing and the mimosas are bigger than normal. The ambiance is casual and the servers have great recommendations!!!

I came for my birthday & my waiter Fred had shouted me out for it... it was so great I cried!!! I went back the second day and the egg Benedict was soo good. I recommend the St. Charles Benedict !!!! Yumm!!

There's a lot of hype regarding Ruby Slipper in Nola, A LOT! Every local we asked about their favorite brunch spot, the response was the same, Ruby Slipper. We were told to expect a long wait, 1-2 hours. Ours was 45 minutes. Our server, who was fantastic by the way, said we came on a slow day for it to only be a 45 minute wait, well okay.

Food was phenomenal! My Fried Green Tomatoes were the best I've had, ever! Myself and a friend who ordered the same, cleaned our plates like they were sparkling! Another friend had the Shrimp and Grits. Large portion, full of Shrimp. She absolutely loved it! 

Like I previously mentioned, service was fantastic! My BFF is Vegan, Ruby Slipper does not cater to Vegans.. She knew this coming and didn't mind sitting while we ate,, drinking her water. Our server went above and beyond to have the kitchen whip up a quick Vegan side dish for my friend. Amazing!

Wow!  Best ever everything. Save time and check in on line. Wait was 45 minutes for walk up but we sat down 3 minutes after walking up.  Wonderful service. We shared corned beef Benedict and French toast with peaches.  Had to try grits and thanks to the reviews the made us.  And a large glass of OJ for $3. OMG!

The Ruby Slipper Cafe is darling! First of all, I love the history behind it. After Hurricane Katrina, the owners were inspired by the sense of pride, homecoming, and love for New Orleans, hence the "there's no place like home" attitude there. As for atmosphere, it's a cozy, clean place that truly has a family feel. The service is excellent, our waiter was quite friendly and made excellent food suggestions. I had the bananas foster French toast which was AMAZING, and my friend had the chicken salad sandwich. I was very impressed by the food, it was truly excellent, very filling and flavorful! I'd recommend this cute little cafe to anyone coming to New Orleans!

I clearly got the wrong thing comparing my rating to everyone else's. I started with the candy bacon. The presentation was poor and made it look unappetizing but it wasn't. It came in a large bowl for 4 pieces of bacon swimming in brown sugar. Don't get me wrong, the bacon was good just a bit disappointed in the presentation. I got the breakfast tacos adding in chicken sausage and bacon. They were underwhelming. I even think these could have been presented better (open faced maybe?). They oddly had tortilla chips in them, which over powered the flavor of the other ingredients. The whole thing was lacking flavor. The chipotle sour cream lacked flavor too. On the upside they have checkin via Yelp, cappuccino was good, all food came out hot and correct. I would revisit but try something different.
Brandi W. was an amazing server! She was amazingly attentive to our needs, and just all around a fun person! Food was great! The bananas foster French toast was to die for! Some real voodoo shit!

Food was solid and service was spectacular! We had a wonderful server who was hearing impaired (I'm sorry I forget her name!) 

She was super attentive and helpful when we were deciding what to order. The Costa Rican was delicious along with the specialty mimosas. 
Hosts were also super sweet and handling the crowd well. 
Definitely wake up earlier for this spot and get your name on the virtual waitlist. 

I docked one star because the waitlist system needs a little work.

Must get their mimosa!!! It comes in this plastic cup but oh. My. Goodness. I was so loopy! 

We went Sunday morning and it was packed. Expect to wait around 30 minutes.

I got the banana foster French toast and I swear it was off the charts! I know the mimosa helped but omg fiesta in my mouth! 

My boyfriend ordered the chicken fried steak eggs Benedict with onion strings
We always eat off each other's plate and it was a great mix of sweet and savory. 

I had the urge to order a White Russian that was also deadly! 

Boyfriend was is Sunday DD. Drive safe!

My last meal out of New Orleans and it was worth it. Luckily I found street parking and it wasn't far from the Ruby Slipper. Stepping inside feels as though you stepped back in time with wood panel walls and a bar in the middle. I sat at the bar and tried to figure out what to order. I didn't want to get the boring bacon and eggs which I must admit I usually get when I go out to breakfast places. 

So I decided to get the signature item - Eggs Cochon which I never had and I figure it's something I won't have again in a long time. It's pulled pork with biscuits topped with eggs and hollandaise sauce. I could only eat half of them and I wished I could take home the other half but I was traveling. The coffee was good and the OJ was freshly squeezed.

Ok I'm a dumb ass! Or maybe an idiot savant? So I am a visual guy. I actually DID use Yelp...and typed shrimp and Grits into the Yelp search menu. I then browsed pics of which places grits looked the best. As Andrew Zimern would say, "if it looks good... eat it!"
Browsing images of this place, I saw the shrimp and grits in that sculpted do-hickie bowl along with buttermilk biscuit. But it actually looked too Foo foo-e for me.  

However having worked in the hotel til noon, I looked up at clock, Holy Guacamole! Famished I redid the "shrimp and grits" search and the Ruby Slipper showed up closest walking distance. Yep that's my lazy ass scientific search criteria. It wasn't til I was done eating that I bothered to read my fellow elites reviews; raving about the place. 

When I arrived walking down Magazine St,  I thought there was a street party as folks were hanging out with bloody Mary's in plastic cups and a strip of bacon as the swizzle stick. I Bogarted my way up to the front and a gorgeous young lady all 4'9" of her asked if I wanted to sit at the bar. I was ok doing that. Then she started talking and I couldn't understand so I leaned down and she got mock mad at me for implying she was short and I couldn't hear her way up in 6 foot land. Short Stuff lead me to the bar and literally in 2 minutes I was seated. In another minute I had hot coffee and water and my order of shrimp and grits on its way. 

I then proceeded to search for "Dubs" tickets on line since they are playing the Hornets 2-nite (sorry ya'll, I can't bring myself to call them the P-bird word).

The bar is a great place to hang, catch up, make new friends, and score some hella good seats for a fraction of Oracle prices to see the Dubs!!! The waiter delivering my plate saw the section I was purchasing and said "Score.. great seats".

The shrimp plump and well seasoned the grits were no big thang except I like the rosemary they used to  season them. I'm totally steeling that idea! It's not like the grits were bad, they were perfectly cooked but pa-leeze when do you ever rave about toast or mashed potatoes? Only when they suck! Well these grits did not suck. 
The biscuit was as big as an 8 month pregnant hockey puck but cutting into it was light, flakey and moist as a cloud. Great with some buttah and Honey. 

The coffee was awesome; had two there, and my waiter hooked me up with a fresh cup to go. 

The meal was uneventful except some dude in a Chiquita Banana outfit apparently delivered a banana-gram to someone in the restaurant. Also Short stuff stopped over to inform me two ladies wanted to speak to me. I told her to tell them I was her squeeze and to back off. That got a big hug from her. 

Feeling stuffed and accomplished that I scored Dubs tickets and likely saved $500-1000 smackers, I headed out coffee in hand and managed to get another big hug from short stuff on the way out as well. I assume that was the signal to whomever those ladies were to back off jack!

Woke up this morning with a hankering for some awesome brunch. Found this place while still in bed, joined the waiting list. By the time we got out and walked over we probably waited 10 mins! Such an amazing feature! (Total wait time was 50-70 mins)

We got greeted by a cute lady working outside getting people drinks while they waited. My boyfriend got the traditional Bloody Mary, and I got the Irish coffee with two shots of Baileys Instead of one baileys and one whiskey. Super yummy and mild!

We were greeted by Sandy who was very sweet. We ordered the peacemaker with one fried chicken Benedict and one pork Benedict. Both were great but we both agreed the pork was better! Followed that with the bananas foster friends toast (I don't remember the name of the actual dish) which was surprisingly not as sweet as it looks. It's definitely sweet, but considering it is drenched in maple syrup, it was very tolerable and nice. 

I wish they would have honored a regular drip coffee refill with the order of my $10 Irish coffee but oh well.
So good! And amazing customer service! I'm a bland eater so I ordered a la carte, but my husband loved his chicken
Long wait. Incredibly uncomfortable chairs but you will forget all about that once the food comes out. The best shrimp and grits I've ever had.

I'm from out of Town . To be honest it's not worth the wait they say me and my daughter by the bar area the waitress was very rude and phony didn't check up on us about our food. A little racist would not recommend or go there again.

Terrible cold food. Wait hour for terrible breakfast.  Asked for re-heat or cancel.  Only allowed to give 50% off.  So if you want cold food and not eat, expect to still give them $59.00 and leave hungry to go pay foe good food and service up the road.

Fantastic spot for breakfast/brunch. A friend recommended this spot to me since I was in the NOLA area and they did not disappoint. The food is delicious comes out hot, full of flavor. The atmosphere is clean and the staff is friendly. Would highly recommend if you're in the area. There's the restaurant or the cafe check with both to see which has a shorter wait time because they do get busy!
The service was amazing ! This was my first time and I can't wait to go back. The food was cold the first time that it came out. However they corrected  it and the food and service was amazing

There are always lines here!! Do yourself a favor and log onto their website and put your name down for a check-in to reduce your line wait. The restaurant is pretty small and most of the seating is bar seating but I can promise you, the food is worth it! I love that you can pick and choose two different Benny's! They even have a triple Benny that let's you try three different kinds. (All were delicious!!)

I got the fish of the day - catfish and it was cooked perfectly, though I did not love the grit cakes, I rather have had regular grits. My husband got the hot honey chicken and it was phenomenal. The real MVP was the french toast bites. Wow these were good - crispy on the outside and soft on the inside with a dip that had the perfect ration of butter, syrup and sugar. So good!

Also make sure you try some of their coffee drinks!! The milky bourbon was amazing as well as their non-alcoholic vanilla iced coffee. Yum!
Absolutely good customer service and the banana foster french toast were to die for! What a way to go out!

This was our second time here at Ruby Slipper Cafe. My Quartet came here for our breakfast on Contest day. Demetra was our server and she was absolutely amazing!!  The food was great and the service amazing!!

Believe the hype. We requested the waitlist before we left our apartment so when we actually headed over, we were sat pretty quickly. The Benedicts deliverrrrrrrred. We had 3 variations - shrimp, chicken and corn beef and they were all delicious, and a ton of food. We're going to try to go back once more while we're in town.
Great food & great service! If you have the opportunity to stop by and try it out do so, you won't be disappointed.

The big question: is it worth the 2 hour wait? Being a major foodie and having high standards for brunch, I would say no. However, it was a good breakfast and we enjoyed being outside. The service was great. I highly recommend getting on the "waitlist" on their website before you go. And make sure you're within a few minutes of the restaurant otherwise you might lose your spot if they call your name and you're not there.

I came to this restaurant because I heard it was a New Orleans staple. I don't typically leave reviews but I particularly felt inclined because the food was just..... dry. bleh. A "C"at most & frankly, I'm disappointed because everyone suggests the restaurant but truly off the basis that it's "famous" & not because the food is quality. 

I ordered the fried green tomatoes & the batter instantly tasted like they dipped the tomatoes in the same deep fryer they've been using for a week.

Ordered the bacon breakfast sandwich & the bread.. stale. It was a thick & dry hamburger bun. Lol like i can make a better sandwich at the house. 

Ordered the French toast bites... crunchy. Stale.

Only thing I'd recommend is the mimosa. The bartender was also cool. That's it.
Great food!  We were so glad we made it to this hot spot.  Go early to avoid the wait time!
Always a great meal, service and atmosphere when eating at Ruby Slipper.  It's a must visit when in NOLA!

We had an absolutely wonderful experience we went to the Ruby slipper restaurant at 200 Magazine Street in New Orleans. We had the most fabulous breakfast of Migas and the special sauce and the breakfast was fantastic and I had the crawfish shrimp Benedict that was out of this world! And we had the nicest server her name was Angelina M she made the breakfast over the top!
Definitely a must to return visit
Wish I could give  higher than a five star !!

Went a weekend in Nee Orleans 

Amazing breakfast with unique dishes 
Crawfish and grits Benedict and Migas 

Both amazing 

Angelina M was the best server! Super friendly!

Ruby Slipper
200 Magazine St

Must go to for best breakfast done Nola style

I couldn't recommend it more even if they paid me

Seriously a must stop brunch spot! On a super rainy NOLA day, what better to do than have mimosas and bloody Mary's underneath a large awning while waiting for a table. The wait was super short from using the "yelp wait list"! I highly recommend using it (but make sure you know which Ruby Slipper you're going too, there are multiple ones all within a blocks of each other.)

We got a table under the awning with super fast service and a great waitress. She recommended the fall specials and the duel eggs Benedict- you can pick two single type Benedict's! Best option ever!!!!!

We already told each other that we want to come back here before we leave to have one more bunch, since we KNOW it'll be amazing
Always love the Ruby Slipper for breakfast when in the Big Easy. French toast bites and Bayou Shrimp were both very tasty. Our hostess was amazing and brought great energy to the restaurant.

Ruby Slipper has to be the first restaurant I've ever eaten at the delivered the food poorly and simply didn't care. Banana Foster waffles, drowned in syrup, barely any banana and no ice cream. Who does that?

I really enjoyed my breakfast and cocktail.

This place is popular, so much so that there is a wait as soon as it opens - I think it opens at 7 AM.

You would think that they would struggle to manage such a large crowd, but I think they did a wonderful job controlling the crowd. 

At around 8 AM, we had a 30-45 minute wait and it was worth it.

The food was delicious!

The strawberry thyme mimosa needed simple syrup as it is not sweet enough.
Un poco ocupado , pero no fue mucho la espera que tuvimos. Vale la pena ya qué el  es genial, y el desayuno y el café estuvieron deliciosos.

The meals were really great! 
I ordered the corn beef eggs Benedict. The cheesy sauce was amazing and the biscuit was perfect. The corn beef lacked flavoring and was dry, but the sauce helped with that.
We also got the shrimp and grits, which was awesome. It tasted like a vinegar bbq sauce, which I really liked. 
Lastly, we got the fried green tomatoes. The aioli sauce was wonderful. I loved their play on the dish with salad and fresh tomatoes on top. I'd say my only issue is that the green tomatoes are cut too thin and thus, the breading takes over the flavor. So, the flavor of the green tomatoes are lost in the dish.

This place is an incredible place for brunch!! The food was absolutely fantastic- and the hollandaise sauce on the benedicts was fantastic. 

Tony our server was absolutely fantastic. Not only were our water glasses always full and we were all taken care of- he and a wealth of knowledge about great places to explore while visiting NOLA.

I am a lover of all things eggs and breakfast, and this place blew me away. Warning: you won't want lunch. Egg's Benedict is rich, flavorful, and cooked with perfection. Every sauce we had was different from the last. Would recommend the peacekeeper for the sampling, especially if you can coordinate with a partner to multiply your tastes.

On a recent trip to NOLA we were searching from some morning grub. Morning grub on vacation is not like your regular breakfast... bloody marys and fattening everything required. :) So, naturally, I Yelp'ed it and came up with this place.  A hop, skip and a jump from the hotel and we were there in mere moments. They told us the wait would be about 15 minutes. No problem. Actual wait time... 4 minutes. Awesome.

This place was freakin' delish. I loved my Bananas Foster French Toast almost as much as that AMAZING Bloody Mary. You know the food is good when your normally very chatty table falls to silence, with an occasional sigh or comment on how wonderful everything is. 

The service was great, the ambiance adorable and the food was excellent. Try the applewood smoked bacon. You will not be disappointed.

This place was an amazing brunch experience! A group of us went during our girls weekend and we were not disappointed! We did wait a little over an hour but they have the bar set up so you can walk up and order drinks while you wait. The food was very good and service was great too. Definitely recommend a trip here!

Popular place. I had my name on the list but still had quite a wait. French toast bites- yum! My husband had French toast. Great. Sat at the bar and the two bartenders were hustling. Great food and drink. 

Not all the staff are wearing masks. One waitress got very close to my husband without a mask.

This place is definitely a tourist trap dont waste your time. Service sub par along with the food. 1st we arrived at 8am to find out they already ran out of stuff seems odd since they open at 0730. Also the waitress doesn't even tell you they ran out... for instance my french toast came with strawberries, after my french toast came to the table the waitress said oh we ran out of strawberries for topping that was clearly on the menu. Waitress had an attitude when i even asked her about it. Bad customer service.

This is my spot now whenever I come to New Orleans the breakfast is very good and the staff are nice and friendly it my third visit and I must say it's worth the wait but I have learned to get on the wait list after the first visited
Great food, our server was fabulous. The coffee is endless and the biscuits and gravy was delicious.

Wowwowwow. Where to start?? The bloody, we couldn't stop ordering, I recommend the bacon infused as it added smoky flavor. Then as if that wasn't enough, both entrees, the bam bam biscuit (that buttery flaky crust) and the croque madame (savory, sweet, and very filling) my friend and I ordered were to die for. Like "eyes rolling in the back of your head" good. The atmosphere was friendly and fun and our waitress had a great sense of humor. Easily the BEST breakfast place in NOLA if not  the best restaurant all together. Well worth the wait!!!

Hey this is TakeFlightFoodie! Follow my Instagram for more reviews!


This was my first time at Ruby Slipper. I got there early to avoid the long wait due to their popularity. I sat at the bar and the service was great. The bartender checked on me to make sure I was alright with everything. I seen another person ordered the "Creamy Vanilla Spiced Latte" and I had to get one myself!  It was amazing! Perfect drink for the holidays. They known for their Benedict's but I wasn't in the mood for one so I ordered "Shrimp & Grits" with bacon on the side. The gravy or sauce for the dish had a tangy taste to it that I didn't like. I can't describe it, but I didn't expect that taste from some shrimp and grits. Every thing else was good to me. Crispy bacon and a fluffy biscuit. Overall my experience was great just couldn't adjust to their sauce in the shrimp and grits.

This place has the absolute worst service out of any restaurant I've been to in any place, at any time in my entire life. We reserved a table a day before and the hostess gave our table away "because it was raining". She proceeded to twist the knife of bad service and didn't give any effort to explain why she gave it away. I'm now soaking wet eating at another place, kitchen bar and grill- much better!

We stopped in for breakfast this morning and there was about a 30 minute wait.  Well worth it. The food was amazing. A lot of variety, including many variations on Eggs Benedict. All of our food was delicious. The biscuits were probably the best part. Absolutely amazing! Excellent service too. Freddie was our server and was very good. All of the staff was friendly. Highly recommended!

I Had the French Toast and Hubby had the Cochon Eggs Benedict.  The French Toast was meh and lukewarm at best and the bacon was over cooked for my taste.  The Benedict was warm and nothing to write home about. Our server was not as attentive as most and I had to ask several other servers for a coffee refill.  The coffee was AMAZING and the best thing about this place.

The food was incredible including the smaller than advertised beignets. Chicken St Charles was amazing. The service was very slow. Understanding it's Covid but the server was not attentive to greeting us after sitting for 10 Mins. Other severs didn't offer to get us water or find our server. Good was really good though!
Excellent service from Freddie!! He was an awesome waiter. Helpful, friendly, and funny!

One of the best breakfast joints in NOLA! No frills, just amazing food!

THE TRIFECTA: Perfect dish to get a taste of Ruby Slipper. I liked Eggs Cochon, Chicken St. Charles, and Shrimp Boogaloo in that order. I enjoyed eggs cochon, which was pork debris, almost like a braised pulled pork over a buttermilk biscuit and topped with poached eggs and hollandaise. The Chicken St. Charles was an exquisite fried chicken topped with a decadent cream sauce. Even though I am not a big fan of fried chicken, it was crispy and still moist. The shrimp boogaloo was also good with big gulf shrimp over a fried green tomato and creole tomato sauce. My only complaints were the bottom of the buttermilk biscuits were very hard and my poached eggs were a tad bit overcooked that the yolks were hard, not runny. 

CORNED BEEF: A underrated dish at Ruby Slippers - corned beef hash served over a buttermilk biscuit, topped with two poached eggs, horseradish cream, finished with hollandaise. My SO favorite diner dish is corned beef hash and this did not disappoint. His eggs were perfectly cooked and biscuits were flaky and soft. Highly recommend!

The place gets filled up quickly so be sure to get there early. The menu is quite extensive, so there is something for everybody whether you are trying to eat light or having a cheat meal.
Newman was awesome, very accommodating and super helpful.  Thank you for making my first breakfast in New Orleans so enjoyable.

Had brunch here twice during our visit to New Orleans. They have a few outdoor tables if you're concerned about sitting inside. I would recommend getting on the waitlist before going there. Had the eggs cochon, breakfast tacos with chorizo, make your own omelette, and French toast bites. The breakfast tacos were really good and filling. Their biscuits are also incredible, but the best thing of all was the French toast bites. They're so tiny, delicious, and a large enough quantity to share.

I truly enjoy the food here but not the long waits. Quite often we check the wait time and if it is over  1/2 hour we just go down the street and eat someplace else. When I'm hungry at 10:00 I'm starved at 11:00

This place is super busy but worth the wait. We were skeptical as it came across too touristy but the crawfish and grits Benedict did not disappoint. Also the big chief carnival cocktail was pretty delicious. Just don't chock on the baby...

Get here early bc the line gets long!!! Was here for Sunday morning brunch, they told us an hour but we got in around the 30 minute mark!!
Once in we needed the coffee for a wake up and it did not disappoint. I was relieved it did not have chicory in it, which many shops in New Orleans do. Had the shrimp and grits, the stand out was the made from scratch biscuit..fantastic. The gravy was pretty mild and the grits had a thin consistency. Perfectly balanced. Next was the pulled pork eggs benny. Smoky savory egg yolk goodness!!!

First let me say that this place was on my lists of places to visit when I came to New Orleans and I wasn't disappointed. Before you come here I strongly advise that you join the yelp waitlist. I ordered the peacemaker (corned beef and Cochon), someone else I was with got the pancakes and lastly someone else got the BYOO. Both of my eggs Benedict's were delicious and I was pleasantly surprised to find potatoes underneath my corned beef Benedict. The pancakes and omelette were great as well. My only complaints about this place is that the BYOO isn't worth the money you pay for it, being that you will literally have to extra pay for everything inside the omelette. Next thing you know and you've spent 18+ dollars on an omelette that was originally priced at $11. My only other complaint is that the food took longer than I expected it to take at least 20-30 mins, but hey it's New Orleans and it was busy.
Ask for Freddie !!!  His service and smile was amazing !! Food was on point !!! Drinks are a go

Came here at 800am and it was slight busy but still good amount of seating.  We got seated right away and freddy was quick to get our drink order and give us time to look over our menu.  My husband got the the 3 pigs in an omlete breakfast which came with a huge biscuit.  I order there season trio plate that had the king's french toast, a benedict of some sort and the cereal&milk pancakes.

Both dishes were good and very filling.  I couldn't finish my pancakes.  Service was good and fast with refills on our drinks, and  with anything that we needed.  We will be coming back for sure when we visit again.

i personally love the potatoes section of the menu here so i decided it would be a good place to enjoy some time. as soon as i was in there are many tables that are not wiped down. as i was ordering my drink, hot coffee, the lady proceeded to talk me out of my order. after about 3 minutes of looking at other options i had to tell her that i was good with the coffee. by the way... it was awful. after i ate/ got my food she said, and i do quote "y'all need to get some greens after that." is she saying i'm fat?? anyway then i had one measly potato left and she had the nerve to say.... get that last potato. ugggg

Excellant food and service.  Had drinks taken out to  us while we waited for a table. Very busy, but definitely worth the wait. We would definitely return when we visit New Orleans again. The Hello Sunshine was awesome!!!

We walked from the hotel to the Ruby Slipper on a rainy morning and were seated immediately by the friendly staff. Coffee and a bloody Mary ordered and delivered to the table with smiles and great small talk. I ordered the corn beef hash eggs benedict. 

This is a small restaurant with a big heart. Everyone was made to feel welcome and relaxed. 

The bloody mary was eye-opening fabulous, and the coffee helped keep them open early morning. The biscuits used to anchor the hash and poached eggs were crisp and delicious; the corn beef hash and eggs smothered in their hollandaise sauce made this one of their premier dishes. 

I enjoyed our visit.
Wow! Now I know what the hype is all about. My friend had Southern Breakfast, which was cooked to perfection and I had the Peacemaker, which are two Benedict's eggs of your choice. Must try place!

A good breakfast spot with good service. Our waitress was attentive. She was new but found out all the answers to our questions we had. The blackened catfish and grits are no longer on their menu  and that's what I had come there for, but I still enjoyed their Shrimp and grits. The sauce had a lot of good flavor. 

I do not recommend getting the King cake French toast. The description is overrated. It is basic French toast with cream cheese in middle and sprinkles. Not as grand as we were expecting.
One word. Leila. The best server I've had in YEARS. Informational, relatable, and attentive. Like no lie, she was the BEST!! The food was great as well but the service... TOP TIER!!!!!!!!!

1st Time at this Spectacular Cafe! Sat at the bar and Kristy Mills was my OUTSTANDING server!! Great personality, worked very hard with a packed counter and simply rocked it! Had The Trifecta and it was just perfect!!

Coffee cup and Ice Water was never empty!!

I had brunch before I left to go to the airport, and Ruby Slippers did not disappoint. It's a breakfast/brunch spot and they close at 2pm, so I wasn't surprised when I arrived at 9am, and the line was down the block. If you go online you can check into the que to see how long your wait will be. It's not a reservation, but it's something similar. Once you arrive, let the hostess know you are there or you will be bumped from your place in the que. 

There's plenty of seating inside, and outside. Although the line was long, it moved pretty quickly. People were eating & leaving. I was on the for no more than 10 minutes before being seated. I was seated at the bar which is pretty spacious. The bartenders were great, and took my order quickly. The food was great despite some of the negative reviews I read. 

The food was delicious. If you're looking for a good brunch spot, this is it! Prices are also reasonable.

Sadly, this was the one meal I regretted in New Orleans and I hate regretting food choices.

Especially after a 30 minute wait and an even longer wait for food to come out. SO long.

It reminded me of our own The Flying Biscuit local chain, but, not as good. Moreso because of the various locations and popularity with visitors.

With all of the reviews and awards, I was expecting to be blown a way at least a little bit.

I went with the shrimp and grits. And Imma pause real quick for the sadness of those grits.

THEE absolute blandest, most disappointing grits I've ever put in my mouth. No salt at all. if it wasn't for the bit of reduction that it came with, there wouldn't be much flavor. Shrimp were small and few. I was more upset about waiting well over an hour to consume that.

I hope it's only that dish. Surely other stuff muts be better based on the reviews. But, I'm not sure I'd give it another shot.

Had the banana foster french toast and grits from here. Not a big raisin fan but this french toast was AMAZING! The coating tasted great and enjoyed the caramel flavors. I actually got takeout which I was glad about because the lines were extremely long.

This place was amazing, I know you think eggs are eggs but I'm telling you this breakfast is as good as it gets. The omelette I had was out of this world, the biscuits were warm and fresh and the grits were done to perfection. Newman N totally hooked us up with a recommendation for the fried green tomato appetizer, his service stayed strong as I never needed anything and my coffee never ran low or go cold.

It seems unfair to not be able to click my heels and find my way back here every Saturday morning. But the few times I have, have been like a dream. The waitlist should come as no surprise and no wait is too long for a taste of Ruby Slipper's incredible Bananas Foster French Toast--a creation of buttery rum sauce poured over a bouquet of crusty baguette and rum-flambéed banana slices--dotted with plump rum-soaked raisins and covered with a light, snowy dusting of powdered sugar. To add to the magic, Ruby places a crisp slice of applewood-smoked bacon atop of this sugar-butter mountain. 

I knew we would need a little more savory to help balance all the sweet, but nothing, not even the melt-in-your-mouth biscuits served with a side of maple butter and the pig candy--a slightly sugared piece of bacon--and the crispy breakfast potatoes that just burst with flavor as you bite down on them, none of these could come close to touching the greatness of that French toast. I am definitely a savory breakfast person. The last flavor in my mouth has to have some salt, but no matter how many times I tried to end on a salty note, I kept going back for another forkful of that Bananas Foster. 

Since last weekend, I've woken up every day craving that flavor that I can't seem to find anywhere else. Oh, other places have variations on that theme and they're all good, but they aren't haunting. When a restaurant is able to create a feeling of being "haunted," that's when it manages to make followers out of people and I am now a follower for life. But the moral of the story here is that when it comes to Ruby Slipper, Bananas Foster French toast is home and there's no place quite like it.

Come early and/or expect to wait.  For starters I had pig candy bacon bites, very good and sweet like candy.  I ended up getting just 3 pancakes which were fluffy and good.  I was overwhelmed with so many people inside restaurant, and I sat at bar about 1foot between others, I started to not feel well so I got it to go.  I waited about 30 minutes for the 3 pancakes.   You won't go wrong with food

It's a very popular place, so of course there's a wait. But! I'm happy to say that it's well worth that wait! I came with my friends & we basically ordered a bunch of things to share - enjoyed every dish! The ambiance was also very lively & fun! All smiles~ :)

Classic Buttermilk Pancakes with Bacon
The pancakes were super fluffy and, even with the chocolate drizzle on top, not heavy at all! The bacon was nice & crisp - just the way I like it!

Eggs Cochon - Slow-Cooked, Apple-Braised Pork Debris served over a Buttermilk Biscuit, Topped with Two Poached Eggs & Finished with Hollandaise
The eggs were cooked so nicely (imagine the yolk porn), but the pork was even better! I just loved the flavor & it all just melted in my mouth. 

Shrimp Boogaloo Benedict - Gulf Shrimp Sauteed with Pork Tasso and Creole Tomato Sauce served over Fried Green Tomatoes, Buttermilk Biscuit, & Two Poached Eggs
The shrimp & the creole sauce was such a good combo & the eggs were cooked perfectly (imagine the yolk porn here too). 

Bananas Foster Pain Perdu - French Bread-Based French Toast with Rum-Flambéed Bananas & Raisins
I think this was the heaviest dish here because of the syrup, but even so, oh. my. lawd. Who can say no to french toast & RUM-FLAMBEED nanas?

Loooooooooooooong wait
But after days of trying finally got in. Worth it!

French toast bites
Brioch french toast fries and dusted in cinnamon and sugar with a cream cheese icing and praline sauce. 
Best dessert I've ever had!

was on the waitlist for over one hour and got a text with a link where I could see how much longer the wait is. Thats a great system! whatever, I never got a notification that the table was ready, so when I checked the link again it said my name has been removed from the waitlist... I mean after waiting one hour, thats very frustrating and I never experienced something like that!!!

This place was so good! My husband and I were visiting this place from out of state and to was my job to find a breakfast place. There were so many reviews when I looked it up that I couldn't not pass this place up! Everything was absolutely good from the service to the the drinks to the food. I was pregnant on the trip so I didn't get to partake in an alcoholic beverages, but my husband did. He got the bacon infused Bloody Mary ( house favorite drink) and be loved it! He said it was really good, especially the smokiness of the bacon in the drink. From the looks of it, seemed like either the classic Bloody Mary or the bacon infused Bloody Mary were the most popular drinks as everyone in the place pretty much had one or more on their table. The food was very good ! So fresh and hot. The pancakes had a nice little crisp to it, but yet we're still fluffy and filling. My husband said the Benedicts had so much flavor to it and that all the flavors were matched perfectly. There was not one flavor that overpowered the other. Definitely recommend if you are in town and I was also recommend checking in via the waitlist app on yelp as the wait to sit here can easily increase. We used the waitlist app and were placed no longer than 5 minutes after being there which a lot of people didnt like who were there before us butttt technically we checked in before them .
Food was delish! Second day in a row enjoying the delishiness. Customer service was A-1 as well.
Great breakfast spot though it was very busy. Service took a little time but food was delicious. The benedicts had louisiana twists and were a must try.

Wow. Two words: must try! 

Service is great, food is good and drinks are strong. Warning : will leave tipsy

The food and service was fantastic! It definitely took forever for seating and our food to arrive but it just gives you more time to get your hunger level up... trust me it's worth the wait! I had the St Charles and it was so filling and delicious!

A friend and I are in town for the Jay Z concert and I tell the hotel staff that I need some brunch with good food and good drinks.  The wonderful lady at the front desk told us to go to the Ruby Slipper Café, which happens to be right next door to our hotel.  I go to my trusty Yelp app and make a reservation although we were only 500 feet away from the restaurant.  We were greeted by the host that got my reservation and had a table ready for us.  We get seated and begin to review the menu the waitress suggested we try a variety of eggs Benedict that they have.  We both opted to go with the Peacemaker which lets you choose two signature eggs Benedict.  I ordered the Eggs Cochon, the Chicken St. Charles, a side of cheese grits and a Peach Bellini to make my brunch just a little better.  After my friend and I shared some stories and a drink our food came right out.  The presentation of the food had my mouth watering.  The Chicken St. Charles Benedict was a warm biscuit topped with a fried boneless chicken breast, a poached egg and a cream sauce.  My favorite of the day is the Eggs Cochon Benedict also served on a butter milk biscuit, topped with pulled pork, a poached egg and hollandaise sauce. Talk about Heaven all on one plate!!!  If you are a grits fan then you must try the grits with the pepper-jack cheese, just trust me! The food was made with love, the biscuits were moist, the chicken was season and cooked just right and the pork was slow cooked to perfection!  If you are not hungry just from that description I do not know what to tell you!!  Ruby Slipper Café turned me into a fan quick because I ended up coming back the next day for brunch.  We sat at the bar the second day and had the same great service and great food.  I highly recommend stopping into the Ruby Slipper Café for all the yummy goodness that they serve hot, seasoned and with a smile!
I go to the one @ 2000 burgundy st old bank building walking distance and nice to hang outside...

SO GOOD! we woke up right at 7:30am and registered online for the waitlist to reduce our wait time. If you do have to wait outside the bartender comes around on the sidewalk and takes drink orders while you wait. We ordered bloodies which were very good. We got the French toast bites as an appetizer which were tasty. I got the breakfast tacos and they were so flavorful! My husband got 2 different Benedict's and enjoyed them both. Great iced coffee and black coffee as well! Worth the wait or line!!

TIP: Go early or you will be waiting a while. 

This place is solid. If you're in New Orleans and wondering where to eat, look no further. This is the spot! Trust me when I say, get there early. We were there around 7:45 and there was a mini line already. By the time we finished eating, the whole block was busy with people waiting to be seated. It's worth waking up for. 

Here's what we ordered:

Banana Foster Pain Perdu: French bread-based French toast with rum flambeed banana and raisins. If you have a sweet tooth, this is made for you. This was really sweet for me and can only have a few bites. Definitely meant for sharing if you want something sweet in the end. 

Classic Brioche French Toast: This was sooo good. Also on the sweet side. My kids shared one order and they still had a hard time finishing. 

We also got the Crawfish Benedict, I don't think it's on the menu. This was delicious and would definitely order again. 

This is a must visit and would go again and order the other amazing food they offer on their menu. Only if they have one in Los Angeles!

This was our second trip to New Orleans and this time we ate here 3 days in a row before our departure! We are from Los Angeles and our first trip here was 3 years ago and this food has been on our mind ever since!

The wait time is insane so if you're visiting on a weekend put your name on the waitlist when you wake up in the morning and then arrive around 2 hours later! But if it's a weekday you maybe have a 30 minute wait at the most.

All the staff are very friendly and love to share history of the city and must visit locations, the fact they remain so warm and calm with the chaos is amazing! Everything in the menu is delicious and the place is clean!

Good brunch with the family. Weather was beautiful so it was nice they had outside seating due to COVID. Food was delicious. Staff was great. Definitely use the YELP app to get out on the waiting list.

Was recommended this place by some locals & was very disappointed in the service. This was our last day here in the city & we didn't have much time to spare. Was quoted online that the wait would be an hour but the ladies up front said we wouldn't be sat for another hour after already waiting 45 minutes so we sat outside. Our waitress seemed very sweet but her service was not outstanding in the slightest. Was hard for her to take our drink order & get organized with our table. As soon as we finished, we asked for our checks & didn't even ask us how we wanted it split. She just gave us all separate tickets knowing the gratuity would be included already. The only part of the experience that I enjoyed was the food, but we also had to wait a while for that to even come out. Not sure if it was just a bad day or what but not what we would of liked on our last day of our trip.

Wasn't Impressed. Not only were we recommended by our ghost tour host but a couple of people on the tourSo when we show up there is an hour and a 1/2 wait. OK. People are getting their food and we were forgotten about. An hour later our food comes out an hour after we've sat down. The foodAverage. But the best thing was the Benedict salmon. That's it

Ruby Slipper is a great breakfast option in New Orleans. Creative drinks such as bacon infused Bloody Marys and the ability to customize your Eggs Benedicts does not disappoint.  They have a few locations across the city but all items are made fresh from their commissary kitchen.

Great restaurant.  My wife and kids really enjoyed their food.  Kids had French toast and cinnamon pancakes.   French toast portion wasn't very big and my teenager polished it off quickly.  Fortunately the cinnamon pancakes were massive so my teenager "helped" his sister finish them.  My wife had the salmon benedict and the fried chicken benedict.  They were a big hit.  Wait staff was very attentive!  Menus could be viewed on your phone by scanning a QR code.  Paying was also contactless by scanning the QR code on the bill.  Very nice!
Only negative isn't really specific to this restaurant.  I'm a vegan that tries to find something "that will work" so the rest of the family can enjoy their meals.  I thought I'd addressed my issue in this case when I ordered the Southern Alt without mayo.  Unfortunately,  the bread was grilled in butter.  Very tasty for most but not for me.  Withoutbthe bread, all I was left with was 2 small pieces of lettuce, 1 small fried Green tomatoe, 1 red slice of regular tomato  and some avocado.

Can't believe I forgot to be more specific about no dairy.
OMG!!! I loved this place. The food was amazing & Worth the wait (get there early). We tried the French Toast, Skinny Migas, Southern Breakfast, Mimosas, and Margaritas; NOTHING DISAPPOINTED!.
Awesome breakfast place, but gets insanely crowded. Prepare to wait in line for a table.
Definitely a must stop for brunch.! Food was great but you have to get up early and get there or be waiting forever. Hate the straws though

What a great place! The food was spot on and was well worth the wait. The prices were on the higher side, but the food was delicious and appeared to have been cooked fresh. 
I ordered the bananas foster French toast and potatoes and everything was packed with a unique flavor! The sweets weren't overwhelming either.

The food was so good that Ruby Slipper gets 5 stars no matter what, but sitting at the bar, my cup with water had some sort of chili powder residue from a previous drink that hadn't been washed out of the cup correctly. That wasn't cool. I asked for another and the server brought me another cup. My boyfriend's cup was also dirty.

Yes! Eat here for breakfast for sure!!! Amazing food, service, and choices. I had a Bloody Mary and the hot salmon omelette with sauce and capers. It came with a biscuit with choice of jelly and side. I chose fruit as my side and thankful I did as I wouldn't have been able to finish it all. It was an amazing mix of flavors. My husband said the same about his hot salmon Benedict!

One of the many places we tried but this was one of the best Benedict offerings I've had. The Shrimp Eggs Benedict is the first picture and the second is the Crawfish and Grits Eggs Benedict. We always get scrambled eggs and extra sauce so each bite is an equal opportunity situation.  Make sure to add your name to the wait list on here in Yelp/online and confirm the text they send you, so while you're in route it takes up some of your wait time. Took away a star as the drinks were a bit lite for our taste but there are plenty of other restaurants around for you to grab drinks!
This place gets FULL! Come early or you'll definitely be facing a bit of a wait. A couple of their locations are closed because of COVID so ensure you call first. Good for brunch.

I wanted to go here after reading all the reviews and I was glad I got a chance too. I totally didn't know that you could reserve ahead of time online and I wish I did. Do not forget to reserve on Yelp!!! It was an hour and a half wait at 9:40 am so we got seated  at 11:20. Luckily our hotel was nearby so we left and just chilled while they texted us. 
We got the banana foster french toast and the two eggs benefit of the Chicken St Charles and the Shrimp Cortez. And a side of eggs. The Food was amazing. I loved it so much. Who would've thought fried chicken would be good with a poached egg. I absolutely loved it! The shrimp one was amazing too. The sauce on that one was better. However, all of this was INCREDIBLY salty. By the end of it I couldn't take it anymore and actually left some behind which isn't a good sign. 
The eggs were scrambled perfectly. I devoured them. I wasn't a huge fan of the Banana foster french toast because it was drenched in some honey syrup sauce or something and it made it sooo soggy. I like my french toast crisp. But it was interesting. 
The mimosas were pretty good. Nothing out of this world but you have to get the ruby slipper. It's what they're named after! Super strong so that was a plus. 
All in all, they need to cut down the salt. That's why I'm taking off one star. Also horrible lines so reserve  a spot early.

The GOOD: You HAVE to get the Bloody Mary!!! It's AMAZING and they are smart enough to serve it to you while you wait in line!! And if you should get a seat before the bartender returns with your drink...don't fear...they will find you!! 
The food is dope! The fried green tomatoes were yummy. The redfish dish was spectacular. My side potatoes were cold and the staff immediately took care of it and I actually did not need them! My bff had the shrimp and grits and was very pleased but I'll admit she has plate envy when she saw my dish!! Ha! Oh and I finished with an Irish coffee...also yummy! And my bff joined me after tasting mine!! 
The staff is highly efficient considering how busy and crazy it can be' if you can sit at the bar...do!! 

The Bad/Ugly: you can't buy the cute shirts the staff wears.  (Princess Problem!) 

Tip: if you can put yourself on the waitlist ahead of time on their website...DO!! There WILL be a wait...unless it's like a random weekday and the stars align! Lol

Came for brunch on a Friday during Halloween weekend. I called first and the first thing the automated message said was to go to their website and get on the waitlist. When we arrived, we checked in with the hostess and waited about 40 mins. We ordered drinks outside from a waitress to pass the time. The Bellinis are really good. 

Once seated, I ordered the peacemaker ($16). It's two Benedicts of your choice. Out of the two Benedict's I like the St. Charles chicken the best. The service was great and fast. I would definitely come back.
Very tasty Gumbo, nice staff. Open almost whole day. Having all signature Louisiana meal

That Sunday brunch was hitting! 
I am a Benedict addict and theirs did not disappoint! 

The chicken breast was juicy, tender and perfectly breaded. The pork was tender. Hollandaise sauce was delicious on both. Homemade biscuit instead of those crappy English muffins set it apart.  

You MUST sign up on the Yelp app to add your name to the reservation list and then you will be good to go. Otherwise the wait will be extremely long.  Worth the wait so plan ahead. 

So, so good!!!

Ruby Slipper is one of our go-to breakfast spots! I would highly suggest getting there earlier or right when they open. If not you could be waiting as long as 2 hours. We got there early and we had to wait about 30-45 min. It wasn't too bad. The food and service were good! 

I went with three other people so we ordered different dishes. We ordered two different omelettes, Chicken & French Toast Bites, and Biscuits & Gravy. Everything was good as it usually is. I had the Biscuits & Gravy. You could tell the biscuits were homemade. They had a good flavor as well as they were thick. I could have used a little more gravy but I made it work. My mom had the Chicken & French Toast Bites. She let me try them. The French Toast Bites tasted like a hybrid of French Toast and cornbread. It was an interesting taste. The chicken was ok. It tasted good where the spicy sauce was but where it wasn't, the chicken was a little bland. I tasted a bit of one of the omelettes and it was good! 

Overall, Ruby Slipper has a pretty decent breakfast and we come at least once during any visit to New Orleans.

Long wait as to be expected on a Saturday morning/afternoon. They did have someone selling cocktails for the people waiting to be seated. The grits were not my favorite but the omelet I had was good, could use more seasoning though. Drinks were good, food could've been better.
Everything is amazing!!!! Brandi gave a+ service loved her. My pain perdu and Bellini were perfection. Those breaksfast potatoes were delightful as well

What can you say about a New Orleans institution.... Don't walk in yawning expecting your normal eggs and bacon affair.  Ruby's is a kick in the taste buds with amazing Benedicts and a Sweet Heat Chicken on French Toast Bites that's out of this world.  Don't even THINK about putting maple syrup on that dish.

Great staff from the hostess stand to the server and manager!  

PS, is their waitlist app and walk-in like a VIP boss...

This small chain of breakfast/lunch places, in NOLA, rocks.  We were lucky that one of these places was right across the street from the condo we stayed in during a 4 day, family trip.  Had only planned on eating here once but loved it so much we ended up there again.  My wife and I had eaten at another of their outlets last year (before COVID hit) and loved it so we were thrilled to see that this outlet was as good as the one on our last visit.  The place gets busy so make sure you arrive early or plan on waiting for awhile, although I do believe that they have an online waitlist you can sign up for (they don't take reservations).  Food quality is excellent.  Choices are quite varied from traditional to new and exciting.  The atmosphere is fun, upbeat and casual so come as you are.  We were there over Easter weekend so each time we ate there our server "hid" a plastic egg on our table filled with a few pieces of candy and coupon for a free appetizer.  When we come to NOLA we often try to do a high end brunch with all the traditional foods, but this is place is quickly becoming a must do for those other days when we want something less than a multi course brunch but more than beignets and cafe au lait.

Ruby slipper is a must when your in New Orleans. The best shrimp benedict's ever and loved their vanilla latte. The wait is long, but just make sure you have reservations if you don't want to wait, or you can have some drinks while waiting. We came on a Saturday midday and it was super busy. The food itself was delicious and the service was on the spot. Very nice staff and good vibes. Their take on beignets was fire. Absolutely delicious. Like I said, this place is definitely a must.
Nice location, short wait, very nice wait staff, food was the highlight! Great flavors, great portions and it was served hot.  Southern hospitality at its best.

The wait was long but it was very worth it. The service was wonderful and everyone was supper friendly. The menu items were a variety of different types of food. We had several dishes in our large party and they were all delicious.

We made this our first stop, before check in. I had heard great things and wasn't disappointed. The blood orange mimosa and eggs Benedict are a yes for me. My husband had the omelet and said it was a yes as well. The waitress was very nice and informative.

My favorite spot to eat when I come to New Orleans! You will not be disappointed! 
The food is amazing!

-The biscuits.... Delicious!
-The stuffed French Toast.... meh. Not bad but I wouldn't order it again. More of French Toast sandwich, not really "stuffed", it was missing the texture of French Toast and I couldn't taste any cinnamon. 
- Catfish Coubion, my husband LOVED it. 
-Free Refills on soda.
