-Someone ordered what looked like fried chicken on biscuits.... I'm going to order that next time because it looked fantastic and he ate it all. 

-It is EXTREMELY loud in here so if noise gets to you or you are overly sensitive after an extended period of time, bring your Xanax. 
-They really PACK people in here. The tables and seats are literally back to back. It's a little comical watching people try to get out of their spots. It's a little uncomfortable when you are the person trying to maneuver out or are in the other of someone trying to get out.

-Cute place, great vibe. 
-Good food.

If you're looking for a New Orleans experience like no other, do not come here. It's a chain restaurant. Live it up, you're in NOLA! Go elsewhere. 

PS, food is good.

I know I know- a chain. We were in a hurry to have breakfast before our paddle wheel boat tour and stopped in here. Busy but we agree to sit outside in the cold under the heaters and were seated immediately.  Food was as we expected from this chain. Good solid breakfast and good service.
  After a comment by someone from this location I stand corrected. Not a chain but a family owned business with multiple locations. Kudos to them!

Always has a huge crowd and I now understand why!!!!! I love everything I ate and that's not something I say often. Latte was amazing but I've come to realize New Orleans has some of the best coffee options in America. The shrimp and grit were perfectly cooked. My plate was empty at the end of it. I also had French toast bites a bit sweet for my personal taste so didn't finish them but where good. They also have some amazing biscuits! Can't wait to go to NOLA just to go back to this restaurant!!!!
Beat breakfast in NOLA no doubt! The atmosphere is great, the staff are professional and cool, and the food is on point! Never disappoints.

My brother recommended this place to me while I'm New Orleans and it did not disappoint. I had the St. Charles Bennie which was fried chicken on a biscuit with Hollandaise. It was to die for. I also had a HUGE mimosa and was excellent. The wait was about 25 minutes for us which wasn't bad considering the line of people outside. The  wait staff was great as well.

There are a few ruby slippers in Nola making me think this might be a local or regional chain. Either way, the service, bloody Mary's, and food were all outstanding. 

This location was a little crowded and we had to wait but they offered beverage service while you wait which is a fantastic perk!

Eggs Benedict were cooked perfectly. Grilled fish St. Peter was also delightfully flavorful. Would caution against Bananas Foster Pain Perdu for brunch simply because of how sweet it was, but it was also absolutely delicious.

Superb breakfast/brunch spot! Make sure you sign up to get on their waitlist before you come! We loved this place so much that was had to come back again before we went home. The sweet heat sauce is perfection on their fried chicken when it accompanied fries or French toast! Outstanding!!! The French toast bites were like little pillows of goodness. Absolute must visit in NOLA!

Went to the restaurant for Sunday Brunch so it was quite busy. 

Ordered the shrimp and grits which was a bit too watery for my taste. Also ordered the Banana Foster French Toast, this was delicious. 

They were out of Bellinis which was unfortunate so ordered a grapefruit mimosa. 

Service was good. It was very busy and it took us a minute to flag down a wait staff. Like some restaurants the wait staff were so focused on what they are doing they don't look around.

Opened after surviving hurricane Katrina and rebuilding the sense of community in the city, this charming cafe bustles with business. Nothing extravagant, typical diner/ cafe options, but worth checking out. Although they do not take reservations, they offer the option through yelp to be placed in a waitlist prior to check-in. It's definitely worth doing because there is always a wait!

So. Freaking. Good. 

This was our favorite breakfast spot while visiting down in NOLA. I would recommend adding your party to the waitlist on yelp before going because there is always most likely going to be a wait (for a good reason). We were seated at the bar & I ordered their vodka bloody mary. They also have a bacon-infused vodka bloody mary that has won several awards but I didn't try it. I ordered the cinnamon swirl pancakes with cream cheese icing... yummmmmmmy. I couldn't finish them but they were absolutely delicious. Bf ordered the southern breakfast and ate every bit of his food. Said it was amazing. We should've come back here instead of making the mistake of going to mother's.... sadly we will not make that mistake again. Highly recommend this place & plan to return on our next trip.
Went for breakfast. Excellent service and food. Would go again for sure. Bloody Mary was really good.

For starters, I could tell this place was popular from the line outside waiting to be seated. I did not make a reservation through Yelp (but I should have) because I did. It expect to to be super busy on a Thursday mid morning. It took about 20 minutes to be seated (not a problem for me but I encourage you to reserve through Yelp). It took the food a while (about 30 minutes) to arrive but it was good once it hit the table. It could have been a bit hotter (everything was about like warm). The coffee was a little weaker than I would have liked, but I added less cream on the second cup which helped me taste the flavor of the coffee a but more. Overall I would recommend this restaurant but BE SURE TO MAKE YOUR RESERVATION THROUGH YELP!

It was OK, but not great.
There was a lineup to get in. I've had breakfast at other restaurants in New Orleans and this was by far the worst one I've ever had. Not worth the hype. As I said, it was OK, not great.
I tried this place when I was in New Orleans for a few days and their Eggs Benedicts were amazing!  I went with their trifecta and I was not disappointed.
We have eaten at the Ruby Slipper for many years.  Food is always incredible with fast and friendly service.

We received great service from our waiter but was very disappointed in the actual food. Their Bloody Mary was very good but it took over an hour for our food to come out. Once the food came out, it was room temperature at best. There's a lot better options for Brunch in New Orleans.

Best breakfast place around. The outdoor seating is convenient since the whole city makes you show vaccination or negative tests. But the best part of sitting outside is enjoying the locals and the architecture. The overhead music was on point for the culture. Our waitress gave great recommendations and she was right. The food was awesome. 

The order of beignets are tiny so don't get excited. But every single plate of food was giant and so good. The bananas foster french toast was delicious and I wanted to lick the whole plate clean. The kids meals were perfect for kids. Not expensive but plenty of food.

I didn't eat at this facility in this visit but I did in previous visits to New Orleans and let me tell you that the wait time is worth it! I remember having the eggs Benedict and it was mouth watering delicious. Worth the wait time. And if you are  in a hurry but want something delicious that will also make you happy , may I recommend their boozy coffee! Simply skip the lines go up to the counter and order your liquid bliss.  The vodka serving is generous lol. My friends tried the Irish cream coffee and they commented that it was not  as good. My opinion Vodka boozy coffee all the way.

We have eaten at most of the Ruby's in the FQ but our fav is in the Marigny. Love the vibe and food.  Super amazing Mimosa's and Bloody Mary's. The selection is huge. The daily specials are always delish! I love the pick 2 eggs benedict. Go get some!!

We went to Ruby Slipper on New Years Day! What a way to start the 1st day of this year! The French toast bites were the bomb! Pieces of French roast deep fried in cinnamon sugar served w/ praline sauce and cream cheese syrup! We loved it! Due to the witntimes we indulged in the legendary Ruby Slipper Mimosa and Margarita so by the time we were seated those French toast bites were right on time. I had the Fish St Pete which was a tasty grilled fish & shrimp dish w/ grit cakes on a bed sautéed spinach and cherry tomatoes w/ a balsamic type reduction. I asked for the hollandaise sauce on the sauce which was more like a spicy mustard sauce. My beau had the huge ass pancakes w/ chicken sausage that he loved and couldn't eat all of! The edges were crispy just like he likes! Please go here You will love it

We had brunch here today based off of a friend recommendation and past reviews. Boy were we disappointed!!!! Firstly, I ordered a keto friendly omelet, only to be told they were out of avocado. But they could sub for fried green tomatoes! Wait, no, they were out of that too. So I got "double" grilled tomatoes, which was four very thinly sliced tomatoes. Definitely not with the $13.50 we paid. Also, our waiter was rude to us at first. And though he got in a better mood, he still was slow and acted bothered if we asked for more water or tea. And he also practiced bad hygiene! Before grabbing our drinks and bringing them over, he was fooling around and bent down and touched his hand on the mat on the floor. And then immediately grabbed our drinks and brought them over. I can't imagine the floor in that place being clean enough to serve from. I likely will NEVER visit one of these locations again.

Visiting New Orleans for my Birthday and I heard about Bennetts.  It was recommended to check this place out.  I wasn't disappointed.  The food was good - GET THE TRI!

But the experience was even better because of our Server - Teri.  She was by far the best!  Tell her Butter from Chicago Sent you.  You'll thank me later.

Do not waste your time or money. Food was cold, bland and our server was super loud. Dont get me started with the hostess with the short wig with the bad attitude. They make you wait outside in the freezing cold while you wait for your table!!
A bit of a long wait but it was the lunch rush so totally forgivable. Service was great and the food matched. I had the fried chicken sandwich and it was excellent. The Cajun slaw on top was killer!
Extremely overrated and over priced. There are much better non-chain places in the city. I was disappointed with my experience here

This was my personal favorite Brunch spot throughout my whole time at NOLA. The concierge had recommended this place which was literally a 2 minute walk from our hotel, so we decided to walk over and check it out. There were a lot of people waiting, but we were able to get a table in less than 5 minutes. The waiter that attended us was extremely sincere and swift to getting us everything that we needed.

I had the Corned Beef Hash Benine Benedict and my girlfriend had the Cochon. It would be a lie if I said this wasn't the best Benedict I ever had. Everything from the runny egg, to the soft English muffin and the beef was all full of flavor and tasty.

The whole decoration that the Ruby Slipper had and all the quotes creates the perfect formula for beginning your day the right way.  

What I enjoyed the best may be silly, but it was the coffee. I'm a huge coffee person and I like my coffee black with no additives. The coffee had an indistinct taste that made every sip warm and fulfilling.

Next time I visit NOLA, I will make sure to return to the Ruby Slipper and enjoy the amazing food and service.

Amazing brunch spot. We came during a weekday and it was still busy, which was insane to me. The hosts ask for your number though, so no need to stand in line and it's a nice street to walk down in the meantime. The indoor seating is definitely more spaced out than in previous pictures, but it still feels a little cramped, so we decided to eat outside. The reason for my four stars was mostly because of the service. I've worked in similar brunch spots like this and what really makes the experience, in addition to food and ambiance, is service. Maybe our waiter was having a bad day, but you gotta put that past you when you serve a table and he didn't do that, so that's disappointing. Everything came out great, but just his attitude and lax demeanor made it a little less enjoyable. 

Regardless, food was overall good. The beignets were a little disappointingly small, but still good. My friend enjoyed the burger, but said it was a little dry (he doesn't eat pork, so he didn't get the bacon though, which we were told makes the dish, so make sure to have bacon in yours when you order this). The sliders were amazing and to be honest, I don't remember their names because I got four different ones. The best ones though were the chicken and gravy biscuit sandwich and the eggs Benedict with corned beef. Good entrees to make up for the service and disappointing beignets, but that's what makes it four stars. Wholesome southern spot nonetheless.

Y.U.M.  Food was amazing and very filling here!  We sat at the bar (less wait) and ordered pork conchon, fried chicken (both had sunny-side up eggs on top)  and strawberry cheesecake french toast.  It was our first meal of the day and after we finished, I wanted to go back to bed.  It was sooo good and sooo filling.  I dream about this place a lot.
Nothing spectacular. Nothing bad. Its breakfast. French Toast is solid. The wait lines can get long however.
Great NOLA breakfast spot, arrive early to avoid the wait but if you have to wait you will not be disappointed.

The food makes up for the crazy wait times. It makes sense why everyone would wait an hour in the cold. It's THAT good!

Freddie was an EXCELLENT server and I can't rave enough about this place!

Wow- amazing food and beverages - Freddie was the bomb!!!  We had the bam bam biscuit with grits and the mimosas were wonderful loved the berry mimosa- it was a little sweeter than the ruby.. will definitely be back!!

One of my favorite breakfast places not just in NOLA but anywhere. Love their Eggs Benedict anyway they make them they are delicious. Breakfast Margaritas are a great way to start your day. You can't go wrong with this place. Service was great.

Fuimos a desayunar y el lugar estaba lleno, teníamos q hacer fila y una espera como de 25 min. Señal q dijimos es por que está buena la comida y le gusta a la gente. Por fin logramos estar sentados en mesa, pedí huevos Benedict y huevos Costa Rica ( sobre una cama de arroz con frijoles negros, y unos plantanos fritos a un lado) súper rico estos los recomiendo . El lugar por dentro está muy bonito igual.

Had an excellent Brunch at the Ruby Slipper on Magazine Street in the CBD! Great recommendation from our waitress (I believe Natalie?). The St.Peter Cheese Grit cakes, Sheep head Fish, and Cajun Hollandaise over spinach and tomatoes was absolutely YUM!
I had a great time dinning here. The food was awesome and the service was even better. Ms Kyra  was amazing, I enjoyed the 3 pigs omelette and the French toast. Definitely gonna come back

I actually decided to dine in.. but my party was lagging so I decided to get something to go. 

First of all I recommend joining the waitlist bc this place gets super pack.. you would think it's was a Mardi Gras parade or something  going on.

I got the peacemaker which is pick two different items. I got my food to good and made order was good and hot and they gave me my extra sauce. 

I prefer this location waaay! Better than location in Mobile.. been once never returned. This location I would definitely return to. The staff was friendly and helpful. My food was perfect and they were so busy.. might go back tomorrow

Ruby Slipper Cafe was coined after the coming together post Katrina. It's that spirit that is ever so present in the food they serve - delicious flavors  packed in some creative dishes. It's a snug location that attracts lots of people, so make sure to use the luxury of getting on the waiting list provided by Yelp.

Couldn't go wrong with this place! By far the best brunch I had in New Orleans to date. The salmon Benedict was amazing and home fries or potatoes were just as good. We certainly opted for the Bryants beverages and enjoyed those as well. The servers were so helpful and rather friendly. Can't wait to return to New Orleans to experience more amazing food and great culture.

The Ruby Slipper was grungy cute.  It was nice to have it so close by our hotel. The waitlist option on Yelp was nice to have but it did not make a huge difference when it came to our wait time since after we checked in, we still had to wait for another 20 mins or so. 

After reading some reviews and reccomendations I had an idea of what I would order. The pictures were also helpful. Once seated, the waiter informed us that they are known for their Benedicts. Although I am not a runny egg, Benedict person I really liked the way the St. Charles option looked. I asked if I could have my eggs over hard and a non pork hollandaise sauce. Once I was was told it was doable, I was all set with my order.

My fried chicken was well flavored, my egg was not runny, my bisquit was nice and flaky and non doughy plus my side of corned beef hash was a nice compliment.  I will say, they skimped on the corned beef hash because it was more of a garnish on the baked potatoes that it came with rather than a true side on its own.

My sister had the Combo Pancake option: 1 Cinnamon Swirl  and 1 White Chocolate Bread Pudding,  they were really rich and delicious. I know this may not resonate with a lot of people but as a child I enjoyed going to McDonalds for breakfast on the weekends.  I can still remember the taste of those well balanced, buttery, and fluffy buttermilk pancakes. Strange enough, these Ruby Slipper pancakes brought back those childhood memories and I loved it.

I won't say the hype is not warranted but I will acknowledge that this was a solid place for breakfast/brunch and would definitely return.
This place is great. My wife and went two days in a row and we were pleasantly surprised both days.

Oh man! Literally best breakfast of our lives!! Holy smokes! The biscuits and gravy!!! And our waiter Lance was the best! Went out of his way to bring me pickled green beans (because I liked them in my friends Bloody Mary), was on top of keeping our drinks filled and did an excellent job! Give that man a raise!!

Tried this place based on a locals advice and it wa spot on. The place was friendly and fairly clean. The Florentine omelette that I got was really good and filling. They allowed substitution of the biscuit for toast instead, which was very nice. I would highly recommend giving it a try when you are in the area.

Yalllll do yourself a favor and go here! Beware, like other said, this place is busy! We had a 35 minute wait around noon, but that gave me time to check out the menu. Trust me, I used every minute to figure out what I was going to eat since everything sounded amazing!

So, this place is super cute! We had a nice server who told us the Mardi Gras specials (can also be found online because I didn't see a feature menu). I started with the French vanilla iced coffee. Ummmm it was delish!! I always worry when something says it has vanilla syrup, but that was yum!

I finally decided on an entree cause I kept changing my mind. I ordered the Migas and my dad ordered the Chicken St. Charles. The migas...what a tasty breakfast scramble! Just stir in that chipotle sauce and go to town! I could've ate the whole thing but I had to make myself not. I got a side of grits, too, and I was dipping the scramble in it. Mmmm mm!

The chicken Benedict my dad got was also tasty! I appreciate a proper poached egg- which this had. The chicken was crisp! I probably would've added some hot sauce to it for an extra kick. 

I wanted to try so much. My recommendation is if you're with a group, just all order something different and share. So much yummy goodness to share. I truly wanted to try it all. 

I'll be back!
Really good bloody Mary! And love the breakfast menu. It's a win, win situation every single time!!

Me and my girlfriend recently ate at this establishment. everything was perfect I had a shrimp Benedict and my gf had the fish of the day. Everything was great. The service was fast and staff was polite. I would recommend making it reservations if you plan on visiting.

We are in NOLA for a bachelorette party and we were suggested this restaurant. I'm so glad we came because Celeste was absolutely amazing. She was so kind and even helped out with vegan options. I would recommend requesting for her. She was the definition of amazing service.
One of my favorite places to eat breakfast ever.   Trifecta is amazing.   I will return just for that.

Long wait I guess we should have made prior reservations Very windy that day and was seated near the door so it was a lil chilly. Service was good. I ordered the bbq shrimp and grits wasn't too impressed it lacked flavor. We also ordered corn beef hash now that was really good fresh corn beef not can. Breakfast potatoes were good. My husband got the omelette with chicken sausage and grits with a biscuit. He said it was solid. Overall I wasn't super impressed.
This spot is so nice! Great breakfast! Biscuits were the size of my fists, flaky and delicious! Tasty sweet butter. Grits were on point. Awesome breakfast place! Do yourself a favor and stop by!
The cubes of french toast are marvelous. How are they prepared because they have this crunchy exterior and the texture is chewy french toast on the inside. Awesomely fantastic.
This was worth the wait! The service was second to none and the food was even better. Eggs Cochon were amazing as was BBQ Shrimp and grits.

Skinny Migas was delicious.
Breakfast tacos were alright. Rice and beans were bland. 
My family loved the French Toast and chicken combo meal. 
The bacon Bloody Mary was great! Not usually a fan of regular bloody Mary's, but this one was very tasty.

Went there twice while my fiancé and I visited for a weekend. Angelina was VERY nice and so sweet, she kept great communication and the food was amazing!! From the biscuits and gravy to the three little pigs plate that they offer. The spiced latte was decent and the staff was very friendly. Definitely will visit again and start the mornings off at this wonderful place
Fire excellent food and great service and huge portions , very quick service too in the heart of it all

This place was so deserving that I came here twice on my vacation. This time I ordered the omelette and I was impressed. That makes 4 different entrees that I have tried from here and they all exceeded expectations. I definitely recommend this to anyone in New Orleans or traveling there! It's Number 1 on my list for brunch!!

Found this place on yelp. 1st, reserve your spot in line on Yelp! Then make sure you do to the right one! There's two locations. It was packed! Their dishes and drinks are over the top. We had eggs Benedict and a house special "3 little pigs." Enjoyed everything. The margarita wasn't great for me, but my husband loved the Bloody Mary!

My friend and I opted to have breakfast here on our final full day of sightseeing in New Orleans. We were able to walk over from our hotel. We hadn't realized until checking in that we could've gotten on the waitlist through Yelp for seating ahead of time. Despite the growing line outside as we approached, we did not have a terribly long wait. 

Our server was exceptional. She anticipated our needs and service flowed effortlessly. The ambiance is lively. I wanted to try everything on the menu. My savory side won as I settled on the Catfish & Grits (accompanied by a biscuit with cane syrup butter), with a side of Fried Green Tomatoes, and Pig-Candy Bacon (had to get some sweet in there). The portions are ample and I was stuffed. Luckily our plan was to walk throughout the day so I didn't feel gluttonous. I'm already looking forward to visiting again to go back.

I ate here for the first time while visiting New Orleans during Essence Festival and it was amazing!! The Cinnamon French Toast were great. Our server Freddy provided excellent service and was very knowledgeable on the menu. I'll be sure the return during my next vacation.
Amazing! We ordered the French toast bites, crawfish Benedict and the buttermilk sliders duo. Food was incredible and the service from Freddie H was great during a VERY busy morning.
Hands down the best brunch we've ever had. Still dreaming of the Crawfish Eggs Benedict
This was a great little breakfast my 2 year old said it was yummy,  great service and reasonable prices very nice!!!
Wonderful food and great folks!  We stayed in the hotel and were delighted that the local breakfast and coffee shop was so convenient!
Best service ever! Jamie at the Burgundy location was swell--attentive without being hovery or obtrusive. Delicious food and great service!! Would recommend!

Christy was our server and she was so amazing. She was bubbly and friendly and helped us order. She made this brunch so fun and her colleagues Louis and Anne were so great too. Anne was training and she was doing a great job and Louis hooked us up with our drinks while Christie was tending to other guests. Such a great experience and i hope to be back before we leave!

Still delicious! I took myself out for a late lunch and Ruby Slipper was the natural choice. The bayou shrimp Benedict hit the spot - shrimp and Tasso ham in a creole tomato sauce over poached eggs, fried green tomatoes, and a biscuit. Friendly service, amazing food, football on TV...what more can you ask for?

First of all I'm going to start off by saying I need all the energy that Louis brought to us on a early Saints Sunday!!  Louis was great!! 

Everyday we came by the line was long so you have to get up pretty early in the morning to enjoy this gem.

I had the smoked salmon avocado toast.  It had the right amount of avocado and salmon.  When it said smoked salmon I was expecting a lox but it didn't disappoint.  Everything on it made my mouth happy from the goat cheese to the onions.  I'm not an egg person so I didn't get to experience it with eggs.  I had an Irish coffee that was good.  Delicious!!!!!

The restrooms are clean and there was soap and a paper towel Machine that you didn't have to touch.
LOVE LOVE LOVE this Cafe!  The food was out of this world and our server was pure joy.

My annual visit to NO, I was instructed to go to Ruby Slipper. Apparently, everyone else had similar instructions. We arrived the day prior and the wait was 2.5 hours, so we decided to go somewhere else. Today we woke up early to beat the rush and I'm glad I went back. The food was perfect. I got the bananas foster sans raisins with chicken sausage. For rest of the table, omelettes, grits, biscuits, bacon, and bacon praline and regular pancakes. Loved it. Would definitely recommend.
Everything was perfect! Texture, taste, smells..amazing. Go for the trifecta...you won't be disappointed!

Wow! Saturday brunch was ON POINT!

Waitresses were laughing and having a great time - specials were ridiculously fantastic, and varied - now I see where the 5* reviews are coming from, because the Ruby Slipper at this location is what you want a laid back, enjoyable brunch to be:)

Phenomenal, amazing, awesome, literally best food ever. I can't even begin to tell you just how good the food was. I got the Catfish and French Toast, I literally wanted to lick my plate. Staff were friendly. Coffee was hot. I don't think you can go wrong with anything you pick on the menu.

Another great breakfast. Walked right in flying solo and took a seat at the bar with no wait. Great service. The Chicken St. Charles was the best chicken & biscuit sandwich I've ever tasted! Ask for extra sauce though.

Went back the next morning (Saturday). Showed up at 8:15am just in time to catch a mini-rush. Waited 30 mins, but worth it.

Me and my bro split the Salmon Eggs Bennie and I was really sirprised at how much I liked it (extra Hollandaise sauce never hurts...). Prob my favorite eggs bennie here, and I've tried them all. Their shrimp and grits with a side of cheddar were above average but not great - didn't taste very rich though.

Always great service and a fun environment. We'll be back next year!

Loved it. We joined the waitlist from yelp. When we got there we waited about 10-15. Everyone else behind us had an hour plus wait. The food was delicious. Banner foster was to die for. The white chocolate bread pudding pancakes was so good. No syrup needed. The mimosa was sooooo good. Had me tipsy

Best biscuits ever!!!! Kevin and Nabil 
 Bakes them to perfection!! Our waitress Julie was so fun!! Our food was all amazing!!!
Great food, great bloodies! This place is my GEAUX to spot before every Saints game. Freddie is the man!
I normally love the Ruby Slipper but rude employees ruin good food. We're done. This has happened twice and there's too many other great choices in New Orleans with friendly staff.
With lots of restaurants to choose from, it was ok.  The food came out cold and they weren't busy.  The portions are decent sized, service ok.

Went there with a party of 6 people. 1.5 hour wait but it was worth it. The food was excellent and so was the service. I had the 3 little pigs breakfast omelette. Super good. The French toast bites are sooo awesome. Fried green tomatoes are also excellent. Also the drinks were really good. It's really loud in there so be prepared.
10/10 best breakfast I've ever had!  Waitress was great, food was amazing, and drinks were also great. I want to return ASAP!

Excellent service. The Peach Bellini is delish. I ordered the Bananas Foster French Toast. The flavor was good but wasn't crazy about the raisins. The place is clean and the staff is accommodating. Super chill vibe in there. There's outdoor seating as well. The wait is not as long as the other locations in the city. Located in a quaint corner. Stop by!

Visiting from Colorado & the food was incredible. The experience was enhanced by the service & recommendations of the waitress, Kyra! It's cool to see when someone puts effort into their job! She was the best! The food was great
Food was good once it finally came... service was not superb and they had it extremely cold in the joint but the food was good

My word! This is the best breakfast place in NOLA! I could come here everyday and NEVER get sick of it! 

Yum, if you are hungry, this is the place for you! Service with a smile too! 

Don't miss out on this amazing food!
Our server Laura was amazing the food was amazing!! Fun atmosphere great people and food was the best! Hostess was amazing to

The wait was crayzay. Fortunuately they are located close enough to the heart of the French Quarter so that we were able to explore the area while we waited the 1.5 hours. Had some delicious eggs cochon and bananas foster french toast here as well as an egg and ham special, which was also quite nice. The french toast tasted like bread pudding, so good! And I much prefer the "pork debris" to Canadian bacon on benedicts, it looks scruffy but the shreds of pork were delicious.

Are you kidding me? Everything about our experience here was magical including our server Kyra. The fried green tomatoes were amazing, as was the shrimp & grits and to top off the experience the Benedict's. (We opted for the Eggs Cochon and Chicken St Charles) Worth the wait in line and absolutely worth the price point!

Walking through the business district of NOLA we encountered this gem! The place had a line of people so it attracted our attention. We decided to stop by and have breakfast. The place has a beautiful decor with the aroma of bacon, the employees were knowledgeable, attentive and courteous. The food was DELICIOUS!!!!! I really want to bottle this restaurant and bring it home with me, they have created an awesome place for people to eat.

Nice place to eat but service was a little slow. I ordered breakfast with eggs OM but they were OH. The server took a while to check on me so I ate it anyway cause I was hungry and didn't want my food to get cold. Over all food had good flavor and the crispy plantains are a great addition to their plates.

This restaurant was amazing! The Spanish omelette had so many delicious flavors. The biscuit with cinnamon butter was mouth-watering! The blood orange mimosa was excellent too. My husband loved the eggs Benedict (pork & chicken) and my daughters loved their eggs & pancakes. Everyone working at the restaurant was friendly and welcoming. Our waitress gave great suggestions and was extremely nice. Don't forget to add your name on the waitlist through Yelp! The line was long and we waited about 2 minutes!! Great brunch!
French toast was horrible. Undercooked, no egg, and extremely sugary. Gimicky place that is popular with tourists. I would not go back here. The biscuit however, was fantastic.

We have been to Ruby Slipper numerous times.  The food is AMAZING and we enjoy each item that we try.  My personal fav, the french toast batons!  YUM!  This time we were waited on by Freddie H.  He was so sweet and patient with our table.  This was my mom's first time AND her birthday so his service and his charm were right on time.  We never waited for him, but at the same time, he wasn't hovering and pestering us like some waiters do.  We really appreciated his customer service and recommendations.  Thank you for your hospitality Freddie H.  You made our trip special!

There choice of benedicts is so good and the blood orange margarita is well well worth the the money! I will walk here every single visit to the NOLA.. the customer service was amazing the staff friendly and the service was quick! We had our little one with us and she brought his food out first so he could sit and be happy! This is a must when in the NOLA!
So glad we decided to check this place out. It was so good and worth the wait. I wish we had one in TX
The food was really good. The online waitlist works very well when you have children that don't like to wait.
Went for breakfast and our server was delightful! Make sure you add yourself to the waitlist for faster seating.  Food was great, drinks were great portions were what they should be.
I've been here back in 2015 food didn't disappoint. Had the banana foster French toast. Menu has several good choices. Service is good
Really amazing food! The ruby specialties are a must! We ordered the cochon, st. Charles and pain perdu...all soooo good!
The food was great, the service was great.  We appreciated the precautions they took during Covid!

What a delicious way to brunch. Went with a group of people for a late brunch.  Most of us ordered some variation of a eggs Benedict. All the food was delicious. And decently priced. 
I order the Trifecta. Which is a tasting of three different eggs Benedict's. The best thing about this place. They use homemade biscuits rather than English muffins. And then they lather it up with a good portion of toppings, flavors, yumminess. 
The atmosphere was friendly. Our waitress was super cool. Also whole we waited before getting seated, another waitress came to take our order. Yesss to locally roasted coffee while we wait. 

Definitely come here! And come early because they only serve breakfast and lunch. Don't miss this ruby!
Every time we visit the Ruby Slipper (any of their awesome locations) we always leave happy and FULL! Their portions are a great size, and anything on the menu is worth fighting over

It is RIDICULOUS how good the eggs Benedict are!! I got the st Charles and the Cochon and there wasn't anything that could've made it better.. everything was spot on. My boyfriend got the bacon pancakes which were beyond huge. Our server was great, mimosas were delicious. Favorite place in New Orleans by far!!!

The best brunch in NOLA. What else can I say? The biscuits and sausage gravy with side of perfectly scrambled eggs topped with cheddar cheese and side of applewood smoked bacon was scrumptious. Chase it down with a ruby red mimosa and you've just died and gone to heaven.

We took a long weekend trip and this was by far the best place we ate. The Eggs Cochon was phenomenal. I have tried to make it at home but it just isn't the same. The wait time to get in sucks but it's worth it. The staff is laid back and will cut up with you. That makes the place very comfortable to me. It was a little pricey but again, well worth it. I'd go back today if I had the chance.

The Chicken St. Charles was AWESOME!!!!!!!! You could literally have eaten three plates and then happily passed out into the demolished plates. It was busy --- always s good sign, but if you sit at he bar you can get right in. 
The fried chicken was crispy and perfectly set off with the hollandaise sauce on top of southern biscuits.
One additional thing -- 
My wife ordered the Bananas Foster Pan Perdue and it was soooooo syrupy my wife couldn't eat it. Which was not the worst thing -- it was that once the bartender saw my wife didn't like her breakfast -- it was a complete vanishing act. 
Then when we asked for the check another server flicked it toward us and walked away. 
My meal was great but yeah tough to enjoy things when you get mistreated like that. 
The Chicken was a five star meal the service was great at the start but the end the service was two stars

I just wanted to add ownership contacted me several days after my initial review and apologized for the less than stellar service. That alone would make me try this New Orleans breakfast staple again. 
 With that kind of follow up I upgraded my rating an additional star.

Everything I read about this place is true!!! Amazing food, wow!!!! The Bloody Mary is incredible; try the Bacon Infused Vodka...yum! The Bananas Foster Pancackes & the Eggs Benedict are out of this world!! Try the option to choose two types of benedict for just $2 more. Ask for a side of Maple Cane Sugar Butter....oh-em-gee good!! Give this place a visit, you will not be sorry.
Amazing breakfast foods and heat service. If you can handle the wait, due to deserved popularity, try the peacemaker choice of two different Benedict's. The crawfish one is a must!

Southern Hospitality, upbeat and friendly waitresses that know the menu well and are happy to help....its overwhelming! Thats hard to find these days. But it gets even better when they bring you your order. There are no words....its that good. The French toast is perfectly placed, with rum raisin sauce and fresh bananas on top, its the perfect sweetness, not to much but definitely there. The bartenders  are so fun to watch....amazing what they can do. This is a must stop when in NOLO. If I lived there, I'd reserve a permanent table. The atmosphere is exciting, and original and absolutely unforgettable.

The food was absolutely amazing!! The only thing I would say is that the biscuits were big compared to the amount of gravy they give you. Sammy was the absolutely the best waiter I have had in years. He was amazing and if I come back. I want him.
Food was great though our server was not. The wait was 30-45min (manageable) but the experience would have been WAY better if our server was more attentive.

It takes both great food and great service to make everything perfect and to make the food amazing!! The wait is quite long but, by far the best brunch ever. Just make sure you put yourself on their waiting list to get you a spot quicker (they do not take reservations), as soon as you arrive check-in. They will text you when table is ready. 

If you like beignets then I recommend the peaches and cream beignet. If you like peach cobbler well this by far tops that. It's a small portion only comes in 6, enough for 2 people to share. 

We got the Crawfish Benedict (the fried grit cake was dry, ask for extra sauce) and the Bayou shrimp (no complaints here). Both dishes are enough as a shareable, unless you have a huge appetite you can eat the entire thing. 

I would definitely come here when I come back to New Orleans again.

This is ALWAYS our first stop when we arrive in New Orleans. Never had a less than amazing experience here. The staff is absolutely wonderful and the food it incredible! But the Bloody Mary's take the cake! They are the best I've EVER had. Truly a must try!
Great brunch place.  It has lots of options, local or traditional.  The food is fast and the service was great!  Highly recommended

One of the best places to get brunch in New Orleans, but that also means the wait times are quite long. Fortunately, you can order drinks at the bar while you wait for your table. They have a pretty wicked Bloody Mary, filled to the brim with goodies.  The food is excellent, and makes for a great start to your day. A definite must-visit.

The Ruby slipper Cafe is the perfect place for breakfast and brunch.  They have a full bar as well. The line can get long, but that's how good the food is there. The service is friendly and prompt.  Everything in their menu is 5 stars.

This is the best meal we have had on our trip. We have eaten a lot of food- but this breakfast was OFF. THE. HOOK!!!!! So delicious! You can check-in online 2 hours before you want to go to avoid the line. Seriously worth the wait.

We got here on a Thursday around 9am and there was already a 45min wait so we decided to sit at the bar since there were open seats. We ordered the cat fish and grits and an omelet (I forgot what kind ) but were amazing! The service was great will def be closer Ming back for the grits and cat fish !

Hands down probably the best breakfast I have ever had.  I ordered the three meat omelet and my daughter ordered the corned beef eggs Benedict.  I was fortunate enough to have her share a bite with me and it really left me wishing I ordered that instead, absolute perfection.  We also got the peaches and cream beignets which are to die for. Service was also exceptional.  This is a must do breakfast place when coming to New Orleans

Fantastic! I've been here twice for breakfast. Service was great. I appreciate all staff had on masks. The candied bacon was incredible & worth a trip back. The biscuits were delicious. Nice ambiance!

Coming from NYC where brunch is abundant, Ruby Slipper was nothing to write home about but was a great option when we've spent days eating New Orleans staples and wanted something different. We started off with the NOLA style iced coffee and each got an entree and was stuffed by the end of our meal. If you want to try different benedicts, I'd recommend the trifecta or you can get the peacemaker and mix and match two. Eggs cochon, chicken st. charles, bayou shrimp, and crawfish & grits were all tasty. The stuffed French toast was exactly what I needed along with the benedicts for a sweet and savory meal.
Amazing place for brunch, came here while while on vacation. Freddy and Zara were amazing!! I recommend the B.Y.O omelets

I went here for brunch one day and I had the BLT and it was on toasted brioche bread with fried green tomato. Normally I do not get mine toasted, I normally will have mine on white bread but I decided to go with how it was served and oh my God it was absolutely amazing even thinking about this BLT my mouth is literally watering. I also had a Mamosa and my orange juice was fresh squeezed orange juice. I cannot say anything bad about this restaurant. The wait staff kept checking on us to make sure we were good and I had even asked that when my food is brought out that I get a glass of soda to come with it because I don't like to drink my alcoholic beverage while I eat. Most places will just bring it right out to you they actually listened and brought it out with my food rather than bring it out before my food it was A beautiful experience and I cannot wait to go again it is on the pricey side but it is well worth it.

First time there and oved it! Waited a long time. But good things come to those who wait. And we were definitely not disappointed.  I had the eggs Benedict with fried chicken. The chicken was moist and flavorful. The egg was cooked to perfection.  Topped it off with a mimosa. Great breakfast!

If you are ever in NOLA definitely check this place out.

Here in NOLA with my friends for Spring break. It's day two and we've had a few culinary letdowns, but this was not one of them. The Ruby Slipper is absolutely everything we wanted out of a New Orleans brunch experience! 

Our server Erin is just the best! After asking if we were from another city, she launched into a detailed summary of everything you'd need to know about the menu. Super speedy, bubbly, and sweet, definitely felt so at ease here. 

The food exceeded expectations. We ordered an omelette, eggs Benedict, stuffed French toast, and bananas foster, all of which left us so stuffed yet so satisfied! 

The only suggestion I can even conjure up is that the temperature was a bit cold which I think made the food a little cold too. Not a big deal. 

If you're only in NOLA for a few days, don't miss this place!

Best breakfast I've ever had! I had the eggs Benedict and they were amazing! I had one that was shredded hash and other that was bacon. They were amazing. I also ordered the candied bacon bites that were delish! We also tried the fried green tomatoes which were very flavorful. Only opportunity was the mimosas didn't match how amazing the breakfast was, but I still gave it 5 stars! Can't wait to one day come back when I visit Nola again!!

Delicious!!! Thanks to Yelp waitlist, Theresa and Jerry (I believe) it was a GREAT Brunch.
The wait would've been over an hour on a Monday around 9:45a, instead I used Yelp's waitlist feature. My 9yr old and I were seated at the bar. Theresa was friendly and sweet - serving our drinks and chatting. Jerry was knowledgeable and helpful. I was having a fat girl moment- Jerry informed me I could have the Peacemaker (Chicken St. Charles and Eggs Cochon) with scrambled eggs as I'm not a poached egg fan, and I could order a single pancake on the side- WINNER WINNER!!! 
I had a Ruby Slipper- but it didn't have much pomegranate juice, but a good amount of sparkling wine.
Trying to see if I can get up in there again, before I fly home. Yummy!!

Got the BBQ shrimp & Grits as well as chicken st. Charles egg Benedicts and it was great. The wait time was long and the restaurant was super noisy during lunch time. They were super busy on Tuesday lunch hour, but the atmosphere is cool. And it's nice to give it a try. I guess a lot of people go here for lunch and just be mindful of wait time.

One of my favorite brunch spots. They never disappoint! I would definitely recommend either going during the week or putting yourself on the waitlist. There is typically at least an hour wait., sometimes 2-3 hours on the weekend
My first eggs Benedict and it was good. The French toast bites were the best!! Not too fond of the Bloody Mary but want to try it again. I will try after a real hangover.

Our food was cold first off. The food was very bland and nothing special. I wouldn't go again. The only saving grace was the half decent Bloody Mary. There was a wait which was fine and our server was excellent but the food wasn't anything special. I would go somewhere else for breakfast.

This place always seems crowded, but you can check in on the app and get a text when your table is ready.  So much better than crowding around the hostess stand!

I had an eggs benedict special which included spinach and a crab cake.  It was really good and I felt like I got a little vegetable, which I have a tendency to miss when on vacation.

Food was so good came back twice while in Nola! Recommend getting there early, otherwise anticipate a decent wait time. They do have estimated wait time on this app for reference. Everything ordered was delicious.

This place was absolutely amazing! The bar service service is like poetry and a show! Their breakfast was beyond this world,  their chef Jerome seriously knows what he's doing and you can tell because you can taste the expertise in every bite! Go here! Eat here! And make yourself a happy person!

Came for breakfast on 8/26. My sister and I were really excited to come here since we'd been looking at different restaurants to go to for our trip and this menu looked so good! We came ready to eat. We may have ordered a bit too much lol. Even had our own travel fork sets because 1) it's a pandemic & 2) we take our eating seriously. The food network should hire us as traveling critics lol. But anyway, The staff was so friendly and accommodating. And the food was really good. I love me a good crab cake and they did not disappoint. I would say though that the biscuits were really huge and super filling so I wasn't able to eat too much of it. I loved the peaches and cream stuffed French toast though, the filling was delicious! It's definitely worth the trip.

This place is absolutely worth the wait. Insider tip, go to their website and put your name on the waitlist before you make your way to the restaurant. The service was thoughtful and fast and the food came out hot! My boyfriend and I cleared our plates and can't wait to go back. I had the biscuits and gray and he had the Benedict sampler. The ruby mimosa was a must and so was the iced coffee I took to-go. Attached the best screen grab I could get since Yelp won't let me upload a video.
Service was great food was great! The boozy iced coffee was quite tart but overall the experience was wonderful

This was my first stop in New Orleans and despite the crowd gathered outside, we waited only about 10 minutes to get a table for two. 

My friend ordered the eggs cochon and I got to try some. The pork was surprisingly dry, I thought it could have used some sauce to jazz things up. Maybe the yolk from the poached egg was supposed to serve this function but the eggs on both of our dishes were overcooked and not even a little runny.

I ordered the Peacemaker Benedicts. I LOVE this idea, you choose two of their eggs benedict dishes, because who likes to make choices? I chose the chicken saint charles and the shrimp boogaloo. The chicken was perfectly cooked, crispy on the outside, juicy on the inside, flavorful all around. While it did come with a drizzle of tasso cream sauce, between the big biscuit and the overcooked egg the dish didn't really come together.

But the boogaloo was perfect! Shrimp and tasso over fried green tomatoes with a tomato based sauce. Even with the overcooked egg the dish was moist and delicious. I would definitely get this again.

Service was sweet, bloody mary's on point.

This is the best breakfast spot in NOLA. Clearly. 

Can't say much more than has already been said. Will just confirm that all positive comments are TRUE.

Bacon infused vodka bloody mary's are money. They are potent so don't get carried away ...save some room for breakfast.

The biscuits are buttery and flaky just as a good biscuit should be.  We got the St Charles(eggs Benedict with fried chicken), but I was jealous of our friend who got the Trifecta - one of each eggs Benedict including one with shrimp. I was salivating while looking at his plate - while throughly enjoying mine. Chicken was perfectly breaded and still juicy. The combination of flavors and textures was on point. If you have a huge appetite or you're sharing, go for the trifecta OR at the bare minimum settle on the St Charles. You won't be disappointed.
My breakfast was so good we ate here two days in a row!  You must try the eggs benedicts.  Thank you Freddie for such good service!!!

Really nice spot in a covid world. Outside or inside seating. Bunch was delicious, I had shrimp omelet. Device was slow but that's because they were super busy.
Differently would come back.

We got lucky and went pretty early (for New Orleans) and got in quickly. Our waitress Brandi provided excellent service and was on the ball with coffee refills - most important. The decor was simple but cute; ambience was comfortable. It was busy but not noisy enough to discourage conversation. My best friend got Eggs Cochon and I got the two egg breakfast with bacon, grits, a biscuit and a fried green tomato. My bacon was crunchy and the biscuit was perfect. I had never had a fried green tomato or grits in my life. The fried green tomato was delightful; I wanted to order more and the grits weren't bad at all - it just wasn't my cup of tea. I also tried my friend's dish and it tasted pretty good. Not a long wait, great food and amazing service - yeah, we'll be back!

Bloody Mary is a must order.   It was delicious!  The shrimp and grit was just okay for me.   Shrimp was over cooked.  The best one I have had was in San Diego @Breakfast Republic.   I have been here before and their Benedicts are amazing.  Easiest thing to do is to get on their waitlist on line before you even show up.  I stayed 2 blocks away so I was convenient.   It is about an 1 hr wait on Sat around 10:00 am for a party of 1-4 people.

Visiting here and chose Ruby Slipper because of many reviews and proximity to our resort!
It didn't disappoint! People asked about cost as the US fiat worthless dollar keeps getting more worthless each day! Depends on what you get! Expect to pay about about $18 per person sans the tip! Only had one drink - coffee which was excellent!
Service was excellent also! 
So why the four stars? The menus on Yelp were sorely outdated as disappointing so were the hard menus at the restaurant.
Wholesale costs seem to go up each week as these restaurants have to keep adjusting their prices.
The menu also is a tad confusing.
I guess I misread it but it showed build you own omelette and then pick three items for $1!!! Stupid me! They charge a $1 for each item! Poorly written! Misleading at best!
As to the food! The omelette was good and hot! Came with an outrageous biscuit and sugar cane butter which was to die for!
My partner ordered The Peacemaker - a combination of two eggs benedict of your choice! She said they were good! One was a crawfish and the other was a pull pork on a half of biscuit! All items appeared to be made to order and not steam table ready except the breakfast potatoes.
Definitely worth a stop! You won't be disappointed.

We were looking for a breakfast/brunch joint to try in Nola and saw that Ruby Slipper had good reviews. As with any popular restaurants in Nola, there was a line. The restaurant uses an app where you can put your name on the list even before you get there so we took advantage of that. We only waited about 10 minutes to get seated. 

I loved the atmosphere, it is very open and vibrant. I also loved their story of returning home after the hurricane, which parallels the story of Dorothy in the Wizard of Oz.

We ordered the eggs benedict and banana foster french toast. I loved that you can choose 2 different kinds of eggs benedict for your order. I absolutely LOVED their banana foster french toast, drenched in the caramel syrup, stopped with bananas and raisins. 

Service was great, since they were busy, the food took a bit to come out but the waitress kept checking back on us, apologizing for the delay.

I would definitely go back!
This was the best place we ate at our entire stay! Wish we would have found it sooner.

My sisters and I had the pleasure of eating here for the 1st time yesterday. Our waiter, Freddie was outstanding! Although we were uncertain about the eggs Benedict, we all were pleasantly surprised that we liked them. So happy we went by his recommendations! Our table was full of appetizers, drinks and entrees! I was so full when I was done! Definitely place this restaurant for breakfast on your list!
Worth the wait! Perfect for brunch. Make reservations online before you go. They have different menus for dietary needs. I wish more restaurants did that! Extremely friendly staff at all locations!
I have not one bad thing to say about this place. The food is amazing and the hospitality was top notch. If you are in New Orleans please please go, you won't be disappointed!
Food was amazing. Wayne did a great job accommodating for my vegan friend. Would highly recommend!

The food was great. Since the place gets crowded I suggest you put your name on the list online so by the time you get there your table should be ready. I had the crawfish and gritcakes with a morning margarita. It was absolutely amazing.

The host was loud and sweet how I'd imagine a Southern comfort food host to be. They seated us immediately outside on a Friday. The wait for inside was about 45 mins. You can get drinks from the bar while you wait in line though which is great. Waiter was cool and attentive. The food for both of us came out quickly and was phenomenal. I ordered the Trifecta and she got the salmon avocado toast. Highly recommend the trifecta...just friggin look at it.
Brandi W was an amazing help! Great food and yummy drinks! There was a bit of a wait but it was worth it! Fun atmosphere!

5 stars period.  Any restaurant that can sustain a 10+ person line from the time they open to the time they close has got to be damn good.  This place does that.  I had a 30 minute wait for 1, but it was worth it.  Gravy biscuits with the hot chicken, won't disappoint.  I got sat at the bar and the waiter/waitress were very friendly.  I even ended up walking out with two Ruby Slipper coffee cups.  With as many reviews this place has and the experience it's definitely a NOLA staple.
Amazing service and FOOD!!! The drinks were bomb! Loved the authentic New Orleans atmosphere.

Nice staff, superb food. I don't get here enough, but I always enjoy the atmosphere and breakfast environment. Great location and my fav for a NOLA morning. Settle in with a nice up of Community Coffee and slow down your morning at the Ruby Slipper.

This place made many of my friends' recommendation lists and turned out to be right next to our hotel. Tuesday morning in January and no wait. Service was on point, friendly and very attentive (but not overly so) food was fast, fresh, hot and plentiful. It was casual so no need to worry about dress. It was the best first meal for my first trip to NOLA.
Be sure to our you self on the waitlist online . It saved us over an hour of wait time at the restaurant. Menu and food was great . The staff was friendly and efficient .

Came to New Orleans for the Chiefs and Saints game. Decided on Ruby Slipper for breakfast and was not disappointed. I ordered French toast that comes with Hickory Smoked bacon on the side (Yum) and a side of the breakfast potatoes! Soooo good, I enjoyed the crispy lil gems they call potatoes, they were cooked perfectly. Now let's talk about this bacon!!!!!!!!!!! Whewwww the flavor was amazing, it was real hickory smoked bacon and not just something slapped on the menu! The French toast was good and the service was okay. I didn't like that my silverware was dirty, that was a turn off.

Friendly service, good food; however the restaurant's wait time and entire process is completely unorganized. We put our name on the wait list before arriving and we still waited an hour. The hostess even lied about the number of parties before my party; so we left! The entire system needs major work! 

We returned the next morning before opening and there was a line. Thankfully we were able to get seated in a reasonable time. 

Nevertheless, I'm glad we were able to eat here and experience the food here.
Totally over priced and overrated. The staff is also rude. This is a zero start place for me.

The staff were so kind and sweet and the food was really well-prepared!! The eggs were done of the best I've ever had! The atmosphere was awesome and super chill as well! Only issue was the French toast bites, they were just really oily... But I would totally recommend this breakfast spot!!

Great breakfast place, however small. Wait time is 60-120 minutes if you're not there before 845am. They take the app NO WAIT (highly recommend using) Delicious spiced iced coffee! Known for their Benedict's. Bar tender walks around the street during high wait times and offers drinks (blood Mary's, mimosas, etc) while you wait. Definitely a great place to eat

Our favorite breakfast of the trip! We used the NO WAIT app which shortened our wait during the peak times. We decided to try the Eggs Benedict and ordered a variety to try. We ordered the Shrimp Boogaloo, Chicken St. Charles and Eggs Cochon. The Eggs Cochon were our favorite by far. They were so good, we were planning a return visit even before we left!

Coffee and service were also excellent. Cool and hip place too. We highly recommend this place and can[t wait to return.

I hate when reviews start with "I'm in the restaurant business" but, I think this is important as I write this review. The hour wait didn't bother me. The hostess told me how long it would be, I chose to put my name in, I expected to wait. We got our text that our table was ready, we walked up to the hostess stand and we were promptly seated at the bar. I LOVE sitting at the bar. I love the energy of a bar, the activity and he people watching. We had just seen in a local magazine that the Ruby Slipper was voted best breakfast in New Orleans so super excited. I understand restaurants are understaffed, I understand where there are challenges, I am experiencing them in my business. As a restaurant owner, I tend to actually be much more tolerant and give the benefit of the doubt. We get out coffee, there are two bartenders working, a man and a woman. Coffee is hot, bar is great, we place our order. We ordered the trifecta (love the ability to try a variety), sausage, bacon, grits, home fries and a build your own omelet. Awesome, excited! See a couple across from us who order at the same time and a man across from us who orders shortly after. Order on our receipt went in at 10:38. Ok, cool, coffee, conversation, great energy in the restaurant. Fast forward 15/20 minutes, couple across from us who ordered at the same time get their food. Awesome, ours should be soon. Guy across from us gets his food. Um, he ordered after us, ok, ours should be coming. At 11:05 I ask how much longer. I know they are busy, I also know that people who ordered at the same time as us and after have gotten their food. Guy across from us ordered the same thing I got so it's not like it was a longer ticket time item. The bartender comes back and says we are the second order on the screen. I ask when the guy across from me ordered, turns out three minutes after me. The couple who ordered when I ordered is finishing up and getting their bill. Now I'm irked. Another 8 minutes. Now, this is where I'm really not happy with the service. Not once did the servers acknowledge that it was taking a while, nothing like "hey, I'm sorry, that's super frustrating that you see food coming out and it's not yours", not " let me go grab my manager this really is taking a long time". The female bartender avoided us once I asked where the food was. No one went to a manager to say hey, go check on these guests. No manager was required, but the bartender didn't even acknowledge the near 40 minute wait for food. The food was served, my food had been sitting under a heat lamp, plate was hot, top of the benedicts were hot, poached eggs were not hot. The omelette was not hot inside, the potatoes had no crisp and what looked like a beautifully presented meal was disappointing. The food was "fine" but nothing exceptional and certainly not worth the time or money. I realize there are thousands of amazing reviews and mine isn't like the other reviews but, an empathetic acknowledgment or a table touch by a manager could have turned this around. Obviously being voted the best breakfast doesn't happen with experiences like this and my little review isn't going to make it break their business but, I'm sorry to say I was disappointed in the lack of attention to service. I know a kitchen manages a huge part of a meal but the service was less than lack luster and it didn't have to be. I'd like to give 1.5 stars but it's not an option. One star is the kind of place you walk out of. If it had been 10 more minutes I would have.
Get in line on-line, it's a 3 hr wait time!!! The food is delicious .  If you have to wait when you arrive the door have a cocktail server to take drink orders.  Will not disappoint!

Ok so again wandering around NOLA during lunch break and randomly passed this place, checked out the menu and decided to give it a try.
I had the veggie tacos with grits & cheese. The bartender recommended the Gouda cheese in the grits...WoW!! Awesomeness!
The tacos come with eggs, cheese, avocado slices and some sort of delicious sauce. You get 3 of them on soft shell flour tortillas. There is an option to add another protein like chicken or shrimp etc But I got them as original. I was stuffed!
My buddy got the chicken and french toast bites. He said it was delicious as well.
This place has all brunch food so don't go if you're looking for dinner food.
I'd go back again and again!
Amazing people and management! The food is out of this world heavenly! Cant get better service or food in town  oh and the aura here is amazing.

Excellent place for breakfast!! Huge portions made fresh. Our server Brandi W was SO FREAKIN AMAZING! She was very attentive to our table. We didn't wait too long for our food. My youngest child was getting a blister from his shoes and she offered to go get a bandaid for him. She came back with bandage tape and made him good as new. So thoughtful and caring-we couldn't believe how sweet she was. The food we got was so delicious and filling. To top off the experience, she saw I had my military ID and revised the check to give me a discount on what I had ordered. I would highly recommend to everyone to who is looking for an incredible breakfast if you're in New Orleans!! Thanks again Brandi!!!

Love this place! I eat gluten free and they had lots of options! Thank you! They have a dedicated menu for dietary preferences. This place is busy so add your name to the waitlist and you can get in easily! We added our name before we left the hotel and the nice 10-12 minute walk there, we checked in and waited maybe 5 minutes. I had the gluten free French toast, which I really enjoyed! My husband had the biscuits and gravy, with a side of grits and corn beef hash. All delicious! The portions are large and the prices are good! We had Jessica as our waitress and she was the sweetest! She was attentive, had good suggestions and it seemed like she really enjoyed her job! Would go again for sure!

Candied bacon great, Chicken and Waffles Great!

The Hollandaise was only okay, but a bit sweet. I really enjoyed the Chicken and Waffles French Toast with Strawberries, the Iced Latte was also pretty great. I think my Hollandaise was presented well but tasted a bit on the blander side, but not bad at all. Good vibes make a check in ahead of time and be prepared with your choice of food, service and food can take awhile, but it's a busy place.

I wish my breakfast joints were like this. This brunch spot was memorable because of his delicious everything was! Arrived and waited about 30 minutes. There's a Sazarac distillery nearby so we went there to kill time. When coming back, started off with bloody Mary's. I swear to you... the best Bloody Mary I have ever had. I fell in love with this drink after the trip. Ordered three dishes to share because it's all so filling. My favorite of course is their banana foster. I'm just more of a sweets girl and I gobbled most of it up. We really enjoyed to Cochon Benedict with braised pork and the bbq shrimp with biscuit. Everything just was amazing. I'm drooling right now just wanting more.

Yummy deliciousness with a fabulous waiter!  I walked up on a Friday morning and was put on the waitlist. I walked around the Riverfront for about 25 minutes and was texted for my table. Freddie, my waiter, was quick and friendly and encouraging of my Bacon Bloody Mary drink choice!  He also got me a quick cup of coffee to sip along.  The Bloody Mary was spot on, not too spicy - I recommend getting the double, as a single might have been a bit weak.  I ordered the Spring Special of Mandi Gras French Toast and was delighted that bacon came with it - I was sure I'd have to order it as a side.  My order came out quickly and was a perfect amount of sweetness, no extra syrup needed. The colored sugar on top gave it a nice texture as well!  It really did say NOLA breakfast!  My bacon was cooked crispy, just as I ordered.  I'll definitely go back when I return!

Excellent breakfast spot!  We got there early so we didn't have much of a wait. Enjoyed the breakfast tacos and eggs with corn beef. Also enjoyed a couple of ruby slipper mimosas!!  Great breakfast food and excellent start to the day.

I enjoyed dining at this spot. The unique breakfast dishes looked awesome. What drew me to this place was the banana fosters breakfast that they have.  It was delicious. The blood Orange margarita was tasty also.  I'm back for a second brunch today.  And I'm not even the brunchy type.

Do NOT attempt to just walkup and expect to be seated  unless you're going at 8am. Make sure that you add yourself on the waiting list and that you're entire party is ready. 

Now, we were on the waitlist and still waited an additional 20 minutes. They did have a server that was taking drink orders while we waited. Once seated, the service was quick. Fieldrose was our server. She was very polite and gave great recommendations. The food was amazing! The biscuit with maple syrup butter. Ah-maz-ing. I would definitely go back.
Excellent food and excellent service by our Waiter Newman . Definitely try this place ...

The banana foster was amazing. Super sweet. I'd suggest getting the syrup on the side otherwise your bread sits in tons of syrup and just gets soggy. We also got the Trifecta. The fried green tomato and shrimp wasn't as good. I liked the fried chicken Benedict and my friend liked the Cochon Benedict. The bacon Bloody Mary was awesome and my friend liked the Ruby slipper drink. We forgot about the waitlist... make sure to check that out

So good!!! Stopped by for breakfast and had a great experience. Fast and friendly service. I had the Trifecta with the Eggs Cochon, chicken St. Charles, and the bayou shrimp with a peach Bellini. It was all fantastic. My husband had the eggs with biscuits and gravy with the sweet hot chicken. He loved it and the portions are generous.

Came here for an early breakfast date with my mom and we both had a great, filling meal!  
We got here right when it opened on a Saturday morning so there was no line, but the crowds slowly started trickling in - so come early! 
Here are the highlights:
- biscuits : we ordered 2 biscuits and wow they were delicious, just very filling! (1 would've sufficed!)

- the peacemaker (which allows you to mix and match the signature egg Benedict's - loved this concept!) : i got mine with the shrimp boogaloo and chicken st Charles. The shrimp was very flavorful, but my chicken was just okay so I'd recommend going with the shrimp! 

- the Louisianan omelette - very tasty! 

-  Location: convenient!

I had looked up brunch spots in New Orleans before I arrived for a quick trip, and this place made the list. Little did I know that the airbnb I booked was right next door to Ruby Slipper! Reading reviews of how long the line could get, I was a little afraid but on a Tuesday morning our wait was only about 10 minutes. My boyfriend and I were STARVING so we quickly ordered an appetizer as soon as we sat down: fried green tomatoes. They were so good and perfectly crispy. We then over-ordered because we were excited, we got the Trifecta as well as the biscuits and gravy. Wow everything was so delicious. The combination of their benedicts are unique and complement each other well. I had never seen a shrimp benedict offered anywhere before this. We sat at the bar and it was very lively, you could tell the staff was busy but they were attentive enough.

Yo ! Lewis, gave exceptional service , I mean absolutely phenomenal attention to our table, not only my table but all of the tables, I watched him interact and smile (despite the mask) and literally show ample hospitality to my friend and I.  I mean I've been in the industry for yearsssss and even I'm impressed. He challenges me to do a better job. The wait was a bit long but it's New Orleans so be early and reserve ahead. Ask for Lewis ! Get the trifecta and a strawberry thyme margarita or the Irish coffee and thank me later !

To anyone considering coming to the Ruby Slipper, it has been one of the best experiences we have had so far in New Orleans. The staff is both accommodating and amazing. Specifically, Angelina (a waitress) made the entire experience. We will definitely be coming back. 10/10

Amazing food! The staff are very friendly and accommodating!  It's a bit of a wait but well worth it, you won't be disappointed. I would say it was the best dinning experience of my whole trip. Went back every mornIng for bunch, and tried different items every time. Great atmosphere, and the food is 5 plus stars.
Amazing unique brunch restaurant! Can never go wrong! Eggs Cochon is the best! I go once a week.

Best breakfast in the city, service was quick and hot. I really enjoyed the fish and grits. I wouldnt be giving a 5 star if i didnt believe. Only thing was i had bones in my fish but that didnt bother me

Ruby Slipper is the leader of the pack when it comes to brunch.  As bad as I wanted to dine in my friend and I decided to take our orders to go due to the long line and DMV style wait times.  Situated in the New Orleans CBD this location is within walking distance from various hotels and skyscrapers.  The food and the service were excellent but if you are in a hurry bring your patience with you.  There are other locations but this particular one stands alone despite limited parking.  Early arrival is suggested.  Like they say, good food takes time.

Had a delicious breakfast this morning! Everything was top notch. Biscuits & gravy with fried green tomatoes, grits & the Trifecta. One of the best breakfasts that we have ever had. Make sure to try the Bloody Mary!!!!  The service was outstanding from the hostess to the server. Very friendly!!!!Will definitely be back the next time we are in town.

Hello Every One its your friendly neighbor again lets get to the rundown 

Food: A-
Service: A+
Decor: A+
Price: $$

Pros: Freddy the server was awesome does this place justice well knowledge of the menu and easy going. The french toast are good but i would order the french toast bite then some egg dish. Overall food is tasteful but nothing like omg !!!

Cons: Ordered a breakfast spicy sausage sándwich. Im latino i might as well of ordered a chorizo with egg torta. Was expecting am American breakfast sándwich far from it. I think owner need to rename that dish. Chorizo is known world wide now i think they now that flavor profile once they taste it. 

Until the next one 

Stay hungry my friends.

I love NOLA, but you can only have so many Cajun/creole cuisine before you get tired. I wanted some real breakfast with egg and bacon. This place was about 10 mins walk from my hotel. I found it on the yelp app and the cool thing about the app is that you can put your place in line. By the time we got there, there was a long line but we were able to get a table in less than 10 mins. The food here is amazing and well worth the money. The coffee is amazingly strong and will wake you up in no time. Only problem about this place...you can't add on after your order is place. We had 2 friend that decided to join us after we place our order, it was may be 5 mins when they got there but they ended up being turned away because they can't add to the food order.

We were at this chain once before.  Decided to try it for breakfast and WOW!  We visit New Orleans to eat and rarely eat at the same place twice.  But we returned to Ruby Slipper 3X during our 4 day stay!  We couldn't get enough of the Fried Green Tomatoes with remoulade and bacon onion jam.  The Biscuits and Gravy were my favorite.  The biscuits were huge but the gravy didn't overwhelm them and left me wanting more.  Service was excellent every time, even with the trainee.  Treat yourself!
Very Nice Trifecta. Wifey and I are on cup number 3. Really loved the service from our waiter Louis. Awesome beef in the trifecta. The middle one.

The website was down so we weren't able to get in line online. We waited a little over an hour to be seated. Got inside and it was chilly for the both of us. The food could've been better but it makes sense since it is a tourist eatery. They do offer drinks while you wait outside for your name to be called.
Our server Angelina was the best, and the food so amazing. We got the chicken Saint Charles and Bananas Foster Pain Perdu. Both are MUST haves! If you are visiting NOLA, make sure to stop here!

Perfect brunch spot! We used the NoWait app which allowed us to skip the line on a Saturday morning. The coffee was great, I even got to try my friends vanilla latte which tasted like a fall explosion in my mouth! All of the Benedict's sounded so unique & delicious. Instead of the typical English muffin they use their melt-in-the-mouth biscuits. You cannot go wrong with any of the choices on their menu!

This is the best brunch you could ask for in Downtown New Orleans! The server Freddy is the best! Everyone should ask for him! His recommendations are on point and he is so nice. The mimosa and sazerac cocktail are on point.
We had a great breakfast.  Food was great.  Wait staff was even nicer.  It's a place to go

Omg best first breakfast to have in New Orleans!!! Mimosas while we waited (hint use the no wait app! Saves endless time!) 

Group of 5, sat outside. Gorgeous day and great breeze! 

Food is so great! Benedict, biscuits, grits! 

Mary was awesome! Made our first experience great :) gave us the best menu presentation and even recommendations!

The waitress was amazing. We got a table within 15 mins and food was served quick. My husband got a build yourself omelet and I got the biscuit and gravy. Both were amazing! Mimosa was good. I highly recommend this spot.

The wait time is one hour but worth it. We had Bayou Shrimp and Crawfish & Grits Benedict. Both are excellent but the latter is delicious, and so is the side of fried green tomatoes. From the cocktails, the Mambo 75 is really good.

Good here was great!
Indoor and outdoor dining available.
Good selection of seasonal speciality cocktails.
Service was prompt and friendly.

Will be returning here for another visit soon!

So delicious!!!!! Those are my two words for this review! Kidding! But seriously, so good! I had the cinnamon French toast next time I would go for the traditional French toast just because the sugar can be a bit over bearing! It always gets packed here so we checked in from Yelp that was extremely helpful because it gave us a great estimate for wait time!

This was a great brunch spot! The pancakes were phenomenal. The service was a little spotty, but the food made up for it. Definitely join the waitlist online before you go, or you'll be waiting for a long time

Very organized with join waiting list on website to reduce the wait for this popular restaurant. Covid measures taken seriously - bloody Mary's or coffee served outside while you wait. 

Food was great!

What a fun little breakfast/lunch spot on the outside streets of the French Quarter of New Orleans.   This place had been recommended to us by the hotel staff.    It was the next block down, so very convenient for us.
