We were greeted by a pleasant hostess whom asked us for our vaccination cards to ensure a safe environment for us all.  We were promptly seated and our server Norman was with us within minutes. 

Norman was delightful and very helpful to us!  We asked a dozen questions and he was for very polite in answering all of them for us. 

We ordered a Orange Mimosa and Peach Bellini along with fried green tomatoes, side of corn beef hash, and BBQ shrimp and grits.
 
Oh my goodness, those fried green tomatoes were out of this world! They were top with Lettuce, tomatoes,  fresh bacon bits, and their special sauce!  I can't even begin to tell you how fabulous they were. 

My husband had the bbq shrimp and grits and said the flavor was savory and absolutely devine.  The biscuit was super light and not dry or dense. 

The service from Norman was top notch and super professional. 

We are staying in the French Quarter for a week and we will surely be back again!
The food was was excellent. Good size portions. The service was great.....Our waiter Freddie was very good! Would definitely come back!!!
Great place for breakfast!  The bananas foster french toast was delicious.  Large menu and really good food.
If you are in new Orleans for breakfast/brunch you have to check this place out!!!! It was sooooo good! The wait was 45 mins but it was worth it.

I heard the talk about this place around the Essence Feat and I was determined to make it before I left.  When I walked up it was a long line of people waiting but because I decided to do breakfast alone I was seated and had my drink in less than 3 minutes.  The check-in was great.  The greeter greeted everyone with a happy hello and if your party is more than one they take your number and text you when your table is ready.  Seating is available at the bar, inside tables or outside. It didn't take long for me to get my order in and my drink served. The choices on the menu were not overwhelming and after browsing the menu And looking around I made my choice. The place is a bit loud (but the good kind of loud.  People laughing and chatting it up) but worth it to enjoy the great Breakfast. A great place to come with family or friends.  Before I could get anxious or start looking for my food, it was in front of me. Worth the trolley ride and the 3-4 blocks I walked.  I will definitely be back and with friends.

Had a delicious breakfast here! Coffee is also phenomenal. Highly recommend joining the waitlist before making your way over as the wait can be lengthy. Waited about an hour for breakfast (guess it was more brunch by the time all was said and done) on a Saturday. But definitely worth it! Benedict was tasty, biscuits are phenomenal, and the fried green tomato was SO good! Wish I had one of these closer to where I live!
Great food, and our waiter Freddie was fantastic! He was energetic and very helpful with selections on the menu. I would come back anytime because of that reason. Also the food was amazing!

I think this was my 3rd visit to this location over the years. My server (who was also the bartender) was very nice and even told me places to check out. I WISH I remembered his name. I got The Peacemaker (choice of 2 of the eggs benedict styles) I got chicken St Charles and Shrimp Bayou. They were both delicious and filling. I also got a morning margarita.

I am normally not the biggest fan of visiting places with numerous locations when I travel out of town, but man....you gotta out this on the brunch list. 

CHECK IN ONLINE AHEAD OF TIME!

If not you will wait over an hour on the weekends. 

I had their Boozy Iced Coffee which was awesome!

I am a big fan of Eggs Benedict and I was so excited to see they had a "Trifecta" with 3 different versions I was all in! 

Not a let down at all. So freaking good. I could eat the debris one everyday of my life!

I tried everyone else's food too and it was also incredible.

Great option for breakfast/brunch. Food and drinks were good. Best advice ever.... get on the waitlist. People really are waiting hours to get in. I got on the waitlist, slowly got dressed, checked emails, waked to the restaurant and walked in like royalty with lots of people waiting in the street.

Loved it! I have been wanting to come here for a long time. We came around 1030 and were quoted a 10-15 minute wait but we couldn't have waited longer than 5 minutes. We were sat at the bar and although they were very busy the bartender Arin was with us shortly. We were never wanting for anything. She was attentive even under the busy hustle and bustle. Our food was better than we could have expected and we didn't have a long wait for the food. Definitely worth the visit!

The wait is LONG! And they close at 3 pm so I suggest you put yourself on the waitlist very early on in the day or even the day before. Other than that the food was SOO good! The service was even better! I would come here again whenever I'm in New Orleans again. The sweet tea was really good as well. A very quality restaurant

The mimosas are strong and the food is great! Don't go to the one near the French quarter though it's always packed and you'll be in line for days. Try one of the other locations in smaller neighborhoods.

Unorganized staff. Angry and definitely did not want to be working. Did not handle the long wait line well. Whatever time they say the wait is-it's double. We left, didn't even want to see how the staff handled the customers on the inside of the restaurant because it was a JOKE at the hostess desk. We were really looking forward to trying this place and you had the wrong staff managing the hostess desk.

Nice place to eat and sit outside and people watch.  I'm not too sure what there vegan options were so I didn't ask and I ordered friend potatoes and French toast bites.  The food was delicious.  Of course there was a line and we had to wait...but it's all good. You get a barcode to scan the menu  and there's an option to self pay.  Don't forget to leave a tip people.
The food was delicious ... One of the best Brunches !!! They do do call ahead day of seating which I do recommend ...  Walked up as they were calling my name !!!!!  Great !!!

Hit this place up twice this trip. Just love the food there! There's always a little wait but well worth it. A variety of Benedict's and other breakfast foods. Love sitting at the counter and getting to know your neighbor. Try the Bloody Mary there with the bacon infused vodka first thing in the morning. Been wanting a shirt from there but they're always out of my size! Oh well, next trip.
Fantastic food! Great service. Recommend getting on the wait list ahead of time to cut down on time waiting at restaurant (2-3 hour wait at 8:30).

Great place to grab a quick breakfast. This place doesn't take reservations but you can put yourself on their waiting list. I recommend  going early as it can get extremely busy this was my favorite breakfast place in New Orleans

I secured a spot in line two hours in advance. When I checked in with the hostess, we were seated at the bar. I asked if we could sit outside and was told there would be a wait. I wish we were able able to specify where we wanted to sit when I reserved a spot in line but okay. I ordered a Costa Rican without chorizo because I'm a vegetarian. My son ordered an omelette with cheddar, bacon, sausage, and ham. We waited about 40 minutes! The bartender was very sweet and keep my son's sprite and water filled the entire time. Totally loved all of the bartenders. My mimosa was delicious! But my food came totally cold! Eggs over medium, beans and rice totally cold is gross. My avocado was brown. Not a happy camper! My son enjoyed his omelette and his biscuit was steaming, so maybe my food was done first and they were waiting for biscuits...why not make everything to come out at once...very disappointing experience... especially after waiting for two hours

We love this place. It is always busy, so I recommend getting on the waitlist before leaving your hotel. This was my first time getting the Bloody Mary, and it was so good I had a second. I had the Bananas Foster Pain Perdu my first time at the Ruby Slipper 3 years ago, and it lived up to my memories. Each bite with delicious and had incredible mouth feel. I love how the raisins are plump in the bourbon sauce. Definitely recommend checking out one of their locations in New Orleans.

Fried green tomatoes were not good, but the bananas foster au pain was amazing 
Everything is very good!

This place was very very good, food amazing as usual. We put our name on the waitlist ahead of time and got seated fast. I just feel bad for their overworked waiters, when they are they couldn't care less about them and you can tell through the waiters faces. While I was eating sitting a the bar a rat ran across the window seal, food was still good though
Excellent food. The Bacon Bloody Mary is delicious. Worth putting name on the waitlist before walking over from the hotel
Chicken benedict was fantastic (for not big benedict people). Wish we would have known you can join the waitlist online.  Overall solid breakfast.
All I can say is White Chocolate Bread Pudding pancakes and chicken sausage.  I was having a cheat day and it was beyond worth it.

High up on a chalk board written by hand is the sweet story of Ruby Slipper.  After Katrina, the owners returned to New Orleans to help rebuild their city. The heartfelt message is that "there is no place like home". 

They serve breakfast all day and offer lovely items, such as eggs benedict, Bananas Foster Pain Perdu and BBQ Shrimp and Grits. The shrimp and grits dish was a bit disappointing but possibly because I'm from Texas and expected something entirely different. A favorite local coffee, French Truck, is served here and our server, Jonathan, a budding author, never let us see the bottom of our cups. 

The overriding feel of Ruby Slipper is a true appreciation of the people of NOLA, local food and giving back to the city. So, put on your ruby slippers and go early because by 9 a.m. this place is rockin'!
Happy accident!  Looking for a poor boy place and saw a hip crowd enjoying their meal.  Of course we had to stop in.  Breakfast brunch delights!   And the staff is lovely!
The bacon pecan pancakes were great! So much flavor! Make sure to put yourself on the waitlist!

Although I read some good reviews for Ruby Slipper as a brunch place, I wasn't too impressed with the quality of food here. Maybe I'm still trying to wrap my head around the concept of a fried green tomato (where's the tomato?!) but the breakfast special lacked taste. Eggs aren't difficult to make, yet they taste dry here. The bananas foster wasn't too special either, just overly sweet and drenched in syrup. I didn't think it looked appetizing at all. My own Louisiana omelet was fine. Just fine. Like I mentioned before, the food lacked flavor.

Celeste was a phenomenal waitress. If we lived here we'd definitely come back to see her. On top of that, the food was amazing. There was 7 of us and we all enjoyed our food. I got the Fried Green Tomato Benedict and it was ahhhhwesome!
So delicious. No long wait I went around 1pm on a week day so I can't speak to weekend traffic.

This was a great brunch spot in NOLA! This was my first time in Louisiana and having eggs Benedict! The food was very flavorful and delicious! The service was good! It was extremely busy (expected) and so getting seated took a while, but other than that, it was a good time.
Food was amazing and service was quick even though they were packed. I would recommend this restaurant to anyone in the area. It was so good!
service was great, food was really good! the only thing i'd say is to make sure to get on waitlist an hour or two before because it gets crowded quick! delicious savory dishes!

Grilled Fish 'St. Peter'
Grilled Fish of the day over a cheesy grit cake, sauteed spinach and tomatoes, a skewer of grilled shrimp, finished with creole mustard hollandaise.

Delicious dish! I originally wanted fish n grits (no longer serving), but this was a delicious upgrade to the conventional classic I was seeking. Who would've thought a "cheesy grit cake" would make my morning. 

Clean, spaced out dining, with good service!

I will return and have already recommended!

While this was not my first trip to the famed Ruby Slipper - it was maybe my favorite. We had to wait a little bit due to COVID and just the sheer popularity of this place - but it was certainly worth it. Kyra took GREAT care of us - even making sure that my Bacon-Infused Vodka Bloody Mary came with three pieces of bacon. 

Three. 

We both had the "Peacemaker" - a clever little menu option that lets you try two things in a smaller portion - thus calming the internal turmoil of having to unfairly choose between delicious alternatives. So we had a Smoked Salmon Eggs Benedict and Bayou Shrimp combo AND an Eggs Blackstone and Chicken St Charles - combo. 

Lots of peace was made. And a fantastic time was had by all.....

I kept hearing if there is one place to have breakfast in New Orleans, this is it. So I Put my name on the waitlist right at 7:30AM and dragged my husband over. As soon as we arrived we were immediately seated. The service here is great the hostess was friendly our waitress was friendly and most importantly the coffee cups were never empty. I ordered the peacemaker and went for eggs cochon and the chicken st Charles.  Both were excellent. The pork was especially good with a sweet and savory flavor. This is where the 4 stars instead of 5 comes into place......my husband ordered the special they had posted up on the board, biscuits and gravy, only they had no gravy. Just saying, I could whip up a batch of gravy in 10 minutes. They really should have removed it from their specials board if they did not have it. So he just ordered the meal without the gravy. I'd definitely come back here they had some other things I'd love to try.

Great food, even better service! One of the best meals we had while here. We sat at the bar and Nicole took good care of us. The place was crazy busy but she made sure to show us the attention we needed. Don't be off put by the wait, it goes by very fast. This is an must for breakfast/brunch while in NO.

The food was amazing, my husband got the trifecta and each Benedict was flavorful in its own right. Well worth the price. Also, make sure to try their specials- I had the French toast stuffed with pumpkin cheesecake, so delicious and  also had the banana foster drink , which was surprisingly  warm, alcoholic and DELICIOUS. Loved it here.

Really disappointed in the service and wait time. I placed my party on the waitlist and were estimated 30-45 minutes, which we had NO problem waiting. After about an hour, I approached the hostess to find out how much longer and she said about 30 more minutes. Again, I approached the front after 40 minutes. She said they can seat us but it would have to be two separate tables. If we wanted 1 table it would be a little over an hour more. We decided to get split up our party of 6 into 2 tables. When seated, we were rushed to order.

The food was GREAT and I have no complaints about the food. I just wish the service was a little better along with communication.
This spot is a MUST! Eggs Benedict Cochon is to die for. Best breakfast i've ever had.
We had breakfast here this morning. It was good. My wife didn't enjoy her french toast but Freddie our waiter was able to get her order of batons which she did enjoy out quickly.
Gr8 food & service was great.  Wait was long. Suggest getting on the wait list prior to leaving.

Came all 3 mornings we were in town. Quick seating indoor or out, amazing service, and the food.... To DIE for. We were at commanders palace talking about how ruby slipper was better.  get the biscuits and gravy with sweet hot chicken
Food was AMAZING!!! And so was the service. Thank you Kyra P for taking great care of us!!! Biscuits and gravy was a true winner.
Awesome meal! One tomato two tomato... eggs benedict. Definitely the best I have had! We will be back  staff was great!!
The perfect way to start your day in NOLA! Benedict's & Bloody Marys to die for! 5-star YUM!
The food quality was amazing, the atmosphere was great and Brandi was one of the best servers I've had while down in New Orleans. Highly recommend

Originally planned to eat here on a Saturday but could see the line around the corner so that must have meant it was good! Waited until a Monday and put our name on the Yelp - live wait list. This most definitely did not disappoint. The shrimp Benny omg!!! I was nervous for a tomato sauce since I am not a fan but it was SO SO SO good I wish I had more! The pork was so so juicy and the Hollandaise had great flavor! Highly recommended!!

Good Lord this place was so good! We waited over 2 hours, but it was absolutely worth it. Their King Cake Stuffed French Toast special was one of the best things I've ever eaten in my life!! Boyfriend got Eggs Cochon which was also very very very good! Give it a try folks! This place is not nearly as well known as a lot of the other spots in the city, but so much better than all of the tourist trap restaurants!

The food was great other than finding a hair in my butter. The server quickly replaced it. We knew it would be busy as it was a Sunday morning. The wait was 2 hours and 45 minutes and then we waited an hour for food once we were seated. Definitely worth the wait!

Food was 4 stars. Nothing spectacular and not bad either. The biscuit was phenomenal and the shining star on my plate, the bacon was also really nice. 

The service is about a 2.5-3. The hostess was nice and personable but we sat at the bar and he must have been overwhelmed because we had to ask for silverware even after our food came out and had to ask for refills on water which goes to show we weren't really attended too.. 

Overall the place is cute, touristy and i wouldn't say i wouldn't go again (i probably would) but it's also nothing to write home about

This is a great breakfast spot! Would highly recommend and visit again! We ordered fried green tomatoes to start that were delicious! They had a bacon jam on top that gave it such good flavor. I had a latte with oat milk, love that they had this option. For our entrees we ordered the St.Charles Benedict and the sweet hot chicken and French toast bites. Both were delicious! If you like hot honey and some spice and sweetness I recommend the chicken and French toast bites. One thing to note is that the French toast bites are fried. I didn't love that they were fried but it didn't ruin the dish. Service was quick, friendly and efficient. Enjoyed every moment.

Such a good brunch spot in NOLA!! the food was amazing the drinks were so good and the stuffed French
Toast was impeccable!! I had never had stuffed French toast like that, my mouth was drooooooling once it came to my table! Such a fun spot with great food and vibes! Check them out!

We went here 3 times... I suppose I owe them a review. Great place with really good food and drinks. A little over priced ...but then so were many of the New Orleans places. Expect large crowds and long waits, specially for Sunday brunch. Utilize their website waitlist to minimize your wait. Do not be surprized if you wait to long to find out its an hour or 2! Go early!

This place is a great breakfast/brunch spot! Hubble and I stopped here on our honeymoon and we loved it! He got the stuffed French toast (too sweet for me) but he loved it. I got a meaty omelette with potatoes and a biscuit, it was delicious!!! Highly highly recommends the biscuits  service was good, it was a bit busy, but we used the online reservation feature and "waited" during our walk from the hotel.
Great breakfast spot, Newman our waiter gave us great service. Got the trifecta it was amazing perfect if you don't know what to choose from!

We passed by this place in the morning around 10:20am and it was packed with a long line forming. When we were walking back to our hotel we noticed it was a lot less people (around 2:40pm) so we decided to stop in for a bloody Mary. We into know they were about to close and felt bad ordering food but the waiter/or bar staff (we sat at the bar) said it was OK. I had the salmon eggs Benedict and the bloody Mary. Both were good not great. The blood mary here is a little spicier than what I am used to in CA. Hubby had the shrimp omelet (forgot what it's called) and the brandy milk punch. He rated the omelet a 8.5 out of 10 and the brandy milk punch was really yummy but sweet. Think of Taiwanese milk tea with alcohol.
It was okay. The wait was about thirty minutes and you should check in online! The food was too greasy for me and my boyfriend. We did prefer the Mother's restaurant was better.
In a town known for its food, this is a can't miss. An absolute must. The best food I had all trip, and I stayed In the French quarter. The triple eggs Benedict is freaking amazing.

We were on the waitlist for 7 people when but only 5 of us were there we got sat and then the hostess  put the last 2 in place of our waitlist instead of making us a start a new one for them and she was able to seat them at the table next to us! Very thoughtful.  
The restaurant was very busy and our server was not overly friendly on the beginning but as he got caught up he was able to slow down and talk with us more.
We all had something from the bar to start and the bacon candy bits and French toast bites.  A couple of us had The Peacemaker where you can choose 2 different Benedict's! Delicious!! One of my poached eggs was over cooked he brought me 2 more that were perfect.  
This is my second time to the Ruby Slipper when visiting NOLA, probably not my last!

Excellent Food

The peaches and cream Beignets were fantastic.  We ordered the candied bacon is a must order appetizer.  We ordered 3 different benedicts that were all terrific.

Bam bam biscuit is what I got. It was a tiny friend tomato with a biscuit and egg. I was a little disappointed so I asked for a just a slice of tomato to add to it. After that it was good. 
Everybody else's bfast looked great!! 
I almost got the Chicken St Cloud cause it was amazing. A friend got it and tried it. Must try!!

Kira and SANDI is the BEST SERVER EVER! and Lindsey is the MOST LIT GM ever!!! I LOVE THIS BRUNCH PLACE!!! Omg it's like 11:00am and they got us all lit asf! This place is so hip and cool! I mean there was a 90 minute wait to get I , however I only waited 30 minutes and while I waited I got my nails did from next door at Golden nails! This entire block is so friendly sky, happy, and fun!

I twerked on server, i twerked on my neighbor, and the gm started dancing with all of us! My family and I are from Baltimore, MD and this is by far the most WELCOMING, INVITING, and LIT brunch place in town. They are so nice here.

Real talk though, the food here is exceptional, came out very quickly even though they are at capacity and I got the chicken and French toast and it's delicious. I am so that'll wet came here. Our bus driver recommended this place and I'm so glad we came out here. The price and the ambience is phenomenal for literally any occasion?

I HIGHLY RECOMMEND this brunch spot. I might sound drunk and I might be, BUT I am sober enough to know that I had so much fun at whatever time it is right now! Thank you for such a transformative experience!

This is clearly NoLA's best breakfast spot! I went there each morning while on vacation and every time there was a 1-2hr wait ~ at BOTH locations near my hotel. This place gets busy so fast!
My mother and I did end up getting to eat there on our last day. I got the Southern Breakfast and my mum got the Breakfast Tacos. Soo delish! And our waitress (Layla) was so kind and funny. It's worth the wait!!!!
A must whenever I'm in town! Didn't have to wait long in order to be seated, food came out in a decent amount of time. Bloody Mary was a hit as always!

Grilled fish 'St. Peter' was amazing. Well
Above my expectations. Also, if you want PHENOMENAL service, request Sandi. She was kind, attentive and funny!

We are celebrating Christmas in New Orleans with friends and family pre-cruiseship  and had breakfast which was Amazing. Had to break the group of 16 into smaller groups but everyone had a great experience.

Hostess was nice checked us in. Said it would be a wait time est. 45mins but it was to our surprise 15mins only which was great. Tip: You can add yourself to the waitlist prior to arriving. Our waitress has a big party so the wait time seated was a bit lengthy but we waited patiently. We ordered some coffee which is good. The breakfast was great. We had the southern breakfast and egg Benedict Cochon. Also a side of a nice buttermilk pancake. Delicious. The service was good. They are very busy here. Make sure to add yourself to the list prior to getting there.
Tourist trap. One of the 6 breakfast options in New Orleans and definitely the worst man this place rly sucks lol. Only time I didn't leave a tip in my life!

I stumbled in this morning half asleep because My hotel ended up not even having so much as a bagel for breakfast. It was 8am and the place was already getting pretty busy, so I was afraid I was going to end up waiting over an hour for what I needed to be a quick meal. I was promptly seated at the bar by the host staff where the bartender, Kristy, took my drink order and made me feel incredibly welcomed with her down to earth style and friendly and sincere attitude. She offered up a few suggestions before I ultimately settled on the migas. Even though the restaurant was pretty busy, she and Lewis made sure to keep me sufficiently caffeinated and paid as much care and attention to my little party of 1 as they did larger groups (a rare find in my experience dining alone). My migas arrived hot and fresh within 15 minutes of placing my order. Very delicious and very reasonably priced considering the locale, however I will be returning for the exceptional customer service and experiential value rather than for rAnhen-fazbi7-kobhidthe food itself. The vibes I felt that morning cannot be replicated. A truly wonderful experience delivered by a talented and cohesive team. I will be back.

Each time we walked past this restaurant during our stay in New Orleans there were people waiting outside to be seated. We decided to try to stop here before our excursion on a Wednesday. Timing is everything because we got here at 8:30am and sat right at the bar.
Breakfast was fresh, hot and fast. Fresh O.J. started off our meals followed by an omelette, potatoes and a buttermilk biscuit for me. My husband had the shrimp and grits, which came with a buttermilk biscuit.
The portions were just the right size. The seasoning was on point, too.
Breakfast for two was around $30. Not bad. Highly recommend but wait for a slow period. There are too many places to eat in town to be standing out in the heat for a chair.

I absolutely used to adore this place and recommend to everybody that visits NOLA. Every time I visit it's amazing, except this time. 

4 stars because I know they can do better, but today was just not it. Our waitress was new so I give her grace for that because she came off a bit rude but it may have been because she's learning. My friend ordered eggs Benedict and it was COLD. You can not eat a poached egg cold. We had it remade and it still came back lukewarm. I got the shrimp and grits, the portion is SIGNIFICANTLY smaller than it used to be, about 1/2 the size. And honestly wasn't as good, 3 star worthy. The French toast bites were amazing though, 5 stars. 

Lastly, PLEASE DO NOT ORDER THE SEASONAL MIMOSA FLIGHT. They need to take it off the menu, none of them were good. None. I can not emphasize this enough. All terrible.

Ruby slipper is a staple and I love it, maybe Covid has affected things, maybe today was an off day but I was very disappointed.

I'm visiting from out of town. This is my first time in New Orleans. My friend found this place on Yelp so we decided to head there for brunch.

I order the paired egg Benedict's - the smoked salmon and pulled pork, a small bowl of fruit, and a latte. 

In terms of the food, it was really tasty. Unfortunately, our server completely forgot about us and the food was warm, not hot. 

We arrived around 1pm. We had put ourselves on the waitlist and had to wait only about 15 minutes. We placed our order and waited almost an hour to get our food. After receiving our drinks, our server did not check on us once. 

When we finally did get our food, another server was very kind and accommodating. He went out of his way to make our dining experience better. 

The food gets 4 stars from me, but the service left a bad taste in my mouth.

First of all we had to wait over an hour to get seated. We had informed them that it was a party of 15 people. I was disappointed that we had to split up and got seated in two different tables. If we had known that we wouldn't all be seated in 1 table then we probably would have gone to a different restaurant so that was disappointing.

Our sever was very attentive and was super nice. He did an amazing job.

I ordered hot smoked salmon Bennie and I wasn't a big fan of it. It didn't do much for me and I didn't like it. Definitely not worth the hype. I'll probably  come back and try other things on the menu.
Great ffood! Great staff! Had a very pleasant and delicious breakfast while visiting NO. Bananas foster French toast was bomb!

I had high hopes based on the reviews. It wasn't terrible, but it didn't "wow" me either. The food was served barely warm, which tells me most items in the Benedict that I ordered were already cooked except the egg. The hostess and server were friendly. And it's a quaint place. But my food experience was a bit of a letdown.
Manager lied about wait time from under 30 minutes to over 1 1/2 wait.  This was not fair.  It seemed like other people that she knew were being allowed in front of our party of 3
Best Eggs Benedict we have ever had! Bloody Mary was delish as well as the peach Bellini mimosa. Definitely recommend!

Oh, it's good!!! I went with family last weekend on Saturday morning. Fortunately, we were able to get on the wait list from the Yelp! app. Thank Heavens! because when we got on the list we were 57th in line.. the wait was about an hour &15 mins on the app, and another 20 - 25 min. wait once we got there. 

The place was PACKED. The wait staff zipping by as if it's completely normal. The menu is pretty extensive for a breakfast/brunch and everything was delicious.  I had the Benedict plate, called the peacemaker. I chose the crabcake Benedict and Babaloo Benedict. I would definitely recommend this!! 

Enjoy!

This was recommended by a lot of people on Yelp. Welp, I recently dined here on Friday during Essence Weekend and my meal was just not what I thought it would be!  

I ordered Migas aka scrambled eggs, chorizo mixed with pico de gallo and chipotle ranch and chips. Let me tell you, this was the best things on the table! Unfortunately my french toast was rather hard and not something i could easily get down with maple syrup, this could have been so great but its way too hard for me personally.

The bacon was good, but average compared to a diner and my Mimosa was sour or had spoiled orange juice contained in it, which made me tell the waiter to have it removed from the bill. I got regular OJ instead. Just a waste tbh, I could've made that better at the crib.

Since i Came during July 4th weekend, and I didn't try the other menu options here, I can't totally right it off. The crowd was diverse and the waiters were attentive for it being busy as it was, but the noise level killed my train of thought ha. Place is way too loud and food not memorable enough for me, to pass up another option for breakfast on my next trip.

3 STARS

Terri and Quint were amazing. We felt right at home and they took such good care of us. The biscuits and gravy are where it's at. Definitely check this place out for breakfast. The vibe is so inviting and the food/drinks deserve all the hype.

To be honest, I feel like this place is overrated. We signed up for their waitlist online, over an hour before going to the restaurant. When we showed up, we still waited 40 min to be called! It was ridiculous; and the service was not good, they treated us like they were doing us a favor by serving us. They got our order wrong, and they blamed it on us! The food was just okay too. Def feel like this is more of a tourist trap and you can find way better restaurants in New Orleans.

I have no idea where the hype is, and the 5 star reviews LOL get in line online and wait two hours just to be told you have to wait another. The drinks are bad, the salmon benedict is HORRENDOUS, and the front hostesses are bad. I would not recommend AT ALL! Salmon Benedict is canned salmon, not smoked. The only good thing we had was the French toast bites and the Cochon(but even that is subpar, the biscuits are hard and you can't cut them with a fork). Don't waste your time here. Oh, and they forgot my grits and they made horrible grits and sprinkled cheese on top and I'm honestly so upset as a southerner.

UPDATE: For the response I received. I didn't waste my time complaining because no one would have cared. They almost gave my table away to began with and said they reached out multiple times, which they didn't. It was all around a horrible experience and while I appreciate the response, your establishment needs work. I'll continue to not recommend.
Great food. Great service. Never disappoints. Can't wait til my friends come to visit to take them there.

Christy was such a charming server, Luis was super helpful and Anne is adorable!! Loved our brunch here. The Pride flight got us right! and the atmosphere was lovely. Very busy place but they get you in as soon as they can and everyone is very nice and welcoming. I recommend it to anyone visiting New Orleans!!

We visited The Red Slipper on a Saints home day game and it was very busy. We arrived at 930am and it was a 2 hour wait. Great news is that you put your name down and they will text you when your table is ready. A perfect opportunity to walk around the area and plan our day.

COVID requirements: need to show your vax card.

We were a group of 2 and sat at the bar. Appetizers were: Fried green tomatoes and French toast bites. Meal was corned beef eggs Benedict and a biscuit hamburger and fries. Food was very good, well plated, and we had no issues.

The staff was on point. They were friendly and courteous. It was very obvious they were slammed, but they still were attentive and helpful. I was impressed at their work ethic and demeanor.

Thanks for making our lazy Sunday enjoyable by working so hard. :)

I had a much better experience this go around.  I didn't order migas this time but instead had the One Tomato Two Tomato Benedict - I end up being a great choice.  The eggs were cooked perfectly and when cracked mixed perfectly with the hollandaise and having it over a biscuit is so much better than a English muffin.  Also the fried green tomato added a crunch to the dish.  Of course I added the bacon infused Bloody Mary and the candied bacon bites and they were delicious again.

I like how they allow you to purchase drinks outside before you come in. The bloody Mary's were great and had lots of toppings!

The Peacemaker allows you to mix up multiple benedicts. That's a game changer! Love it!

The crawfish is fresh and perfectly cooked. Great service even at a super busy time!

Okay, you have to come here. Tip- get on the waitlist an hour before because the line is crazy . The food is perfect, I didn't have to add any salt or pepper or anything and man my family raved after every bite how good everything is. You won't be disappointed!!!

Follow me on TikTok for more reviews "taneeshanthecity"
Delicious breakfast place in the heart of downtown New Orleans. Usually a wait but worth it! Great place for large parties.

1st go on their website and put your name on the waitlist!!! I got the St. Charles Benedict - biscuit topped with fried chicken and poached egg with a pork Tasso cream sauce. The cream sauce was sooo good I asked for a side dish! We also started with their seasonal beignets, King Cake Beignets, cream cheese strawberry. My partner got the Sweet Heat Chicken Sandwich and loved that too!  10/10 recommend.

Did an online reservation and  when I returned as directed by a text the hostess said I had to wait an additional 30-40 min. For a place supposedly so good and so busy you would expect more accurate communication and a more pleasant experience at the door.  Not that desperate to eat there
We love Ruby Slipper so much that we went there three days in a row for breakfast when we were visiting NOLA. Soooo good.

The wait was LONG it was 3 hours. So believe them when they say it'll be 2-3 hours! I suggest go around town or back to your hotel and wait for a text. They also have an option to join the waitlist online which we did for our second time. The wait was worth it because the food was EXCELLENT! AND both of our waitresses, Layla and Jean, were very nice and fast. I was hangry and Layla had the best attitude despite it being a long day for her. Layla had great recommendations when it came to ordering. I will definitely be back!

Highly recommend the migas and sweet heat chicken and french toast bites. My husband also loved their ice coffee!

I recommend not waiting an hour for food I could get at IHOP.

The only thing decent was the coffee.

The poorly maintained bathroom with a roll of paper towels sitting on the dirty changing table left a lasting last time I ever eat here; impression.

Even though the place was packed there was not much of a wait to be seated.  Staff is VERY friendly. The French toast and mimosa were amazing!  The grits however I would not recommend ...they taste more like sour cream.  We will be back!!!
Good restaurant, good location, great atmosphere, excellent food. Tried what the menu calls The Peacemaker - Eggs Cochon and Bayou Shrimp - both Egg Benedicts. Very delicious. Well presentable.
Long wait but the food is fantastic. Try the shrimp and grits if you want some heavy comfort food. The mimosa has a lot of orange pulp so avoid if that's not your thing.
TIM HOOTERS will be the reason I come back to Ruby Slipper! Melissa and Mr. Hooters (aka Louis) are (bleeping) amazing!! Will totally be coming back for them!!
Great/ fast service with kind host and servers! We got free shots for saint patricks day! Be sure to reserve ahead of time cuz it's a long wait but worth it.

FOOD PORN ALERT. 

Seriously though- we go to the Ruby Slipper once a year. It's always a big deal. It's not cheap by any means, but you get what you pay for. 

The coffee is snuggles in a cup. The drinks are fancies in a class. The food is heaven on a plate. 

That's all I have to say- I'll let the food porn do the rest. 

Ps. Didn't add the pic of the fried green tomatoes because we ate them too fast. No judgments here. BACON ONION JAM PEOPLE!!
The biscuits and gravy were amazing. The staff is attentive. This place gets super busy, so get on the waitlist early.

We came the morning of a Saints games and the wait was crazy! We were from out of town and took a shot based on other Yelp reviews. The staff was great. The food was worth every minute of waiting. I had the Pork Cochon which was basically pulled pork underneath eggs Benedict. YUM! My husband got the Spanish omelette which was covered with a red sauce that was amazing. I would recommend this restaurant to friends.
Great food & service! The server was knowledgeable and answered the questions I had regarding the menu.
Fun! Good enough food. Use the NoWait app to get in line. The Benedicts come in a variety of forms. Loud but a good experience overall.

Getting into this brunch spot can be a 45 minute to hour wait... but honestly soooo worth it!! The food and service were great! This is a must-have if you are in the area and have the time! 

I ordered a mix and match of the fried chicken and salmon eggs Benedict. The mix and match option was such a cool find since it allowed for me to try 2 of the different meats! The salmon was a bit dry, but the fried chicken was amazing! I would suggest ordering the fried chicken Benedict for sure - it was honestly one of the best breakfasts I've ever had! The biscuits were so buttery and delicious! I also had a taste of the rum raisin bread (I think that's what It was called). It was pretty good - I mean how could you go wrong w white bread, syrup, and bananas?? But the fried chicken Benedict will always be remembered! 

My server, Allen, was so hilarious and helpful! He described all of ruby's specialties and helped us order! After the meal, he even recommended to us some other must-have places while we were still in New Orleans. 

Definitely a must try!
Phenomenal food.  Huge portions.  Something for everyone on the menu It's well worth the wait in line to be seated.

Everything about Ruby Slipper was excellent. From the hostess, the waitress, the manager, and the food!! 
We visit N-O often but we never wait to get into Ruby Slipper. However, this time we were able to put our name on the wait list ahead of time which was a plus because we didn't have to wait long outside in the heat. 
When we arrived to put our name on the list the hostess was extremely kind. She even checked to see if anyone wanted water while waiting. 
Once seated, our waitress was very kind and thorough. There was an issue with a friend's order and she wasn't going to say anything about it. The waitress still called the manager over and he fixed it himself immediately. 
We will definitely be coming back!

Good food. Cool restaurant. Nice Server.

Downloaded the app - Nowait - as stated on Yelp and didn't have to wait to be seated. Simply got in line via the app and walked up to the host's stand 15 minutes later which is the amount of time it took me to walk there. Ordered the french toast and bacon and an omelet. Found out when the food came that a pancake came with the omelet. I'm so happy it did because the pancake was phenomenal! I ended up eating it instead of the french toast. It melts in your mouth good with crunchy edges. I also ordered the peach bellini which was also delicious. I couldn't finish it but in New Orleans you can grab a to go cup for you alcoholic beverage and cruise the streets so it was no problem! My server was great too. Checked in just enough and recommended some other good local spots.
The hostess was friendly! They sat us effectively. At the time we didn't know they were a chain. There food is great! All the benidicts are amazing! Omelets delicious! Bloody Mary was yummy too!

Delicious breakfast. So good I only had a late snack in the afternoon.when I realized I hadn't eaten.  Busy and part of a smaller chain local to New Orleans. Great coffee. Definitely would stop in again.

My first impression of Ruby Slipper was not good because the hostess at the sign in table outside the door had her head down on the podium like she was ready to take nap and was nowhere near welcoming at all. There was no smile, no "hello" or "welcome to Ruby Slipper" which sucked. She was also less than encouraging about the 15-20 minute wait that I thought was pretty minimal but from the look on her face and the "Debbie Downer" tone of her voice you'd if thought she was the one having to wait in line!!!

The rest of the staff were quite friendly, smiling and welcoming. We were seated at the bar/counter which I typically don't care for but it was spacious and fun. Our drink and entree order was taken timely and came out within 15 minutes.

I ordered an Irish Coffee w whiskey & whipped crenels which was excellent and heavy on the whiskey, so much so that I had to ask for a little more coffee to mellow it out, lol. I also tried the Bacon Bloody Mary (I had too! It looked so good and I love bloody Mary's). I was disappointed though because it was lacking the flavor and spice I look forward to. (There are much better Bloody Mary's in town - I will not order it again).

The dishes were ordered were the Cochon  Benedict and the Migas egg scramble. At first glance the dishes looked very incomplete and scarce,especially the Benedict - it just seemed like it was missing a side of fruit or something which would have made the plate more appealing. My husband said the Benedict was just okay (not great by any stretch) - the biscuit was dry and the pulled pork wasn't as flavorful as the menu suggested. The poached egg and the hollandaise were good and prepared well, but he won't order this dish again.

I loved the Migas scramble and will order it again & again! It was fluffy, spicy and full of flavor. I especially liked the sour cream sauce it came with. I wish it would've had at least half an avocado instead of the two small slivers and maybe some toast. In hindsight, I should have ordered toast or a pancake with it to make it complete. It was still delicious and very filling.

I recommend checking this place out. The food and customer service (in doors, lol) are worth it.
I went two days in a row during my trip Nola. The biscuits and gravy hit the spot each time. Great hangover food!

4 stars because of the food! The space is a very commercial atmosphere and I think I was expecting a slightly more rugged, authentic New Orleans feel. That being said, the Benedict was great! The friend chicken was my favorite! The chicken was crispy and the hollandaise has a nice flavor as opposed to just tasting like butter. The hash was flavorful as well! The biscuit underneath, was nice and soft.

There's no place like home.  There's no place like home.  Unless your mom doesn't like getting up early to prepare biscuits and has hollandaise sauce ready to rock.  In that case, I would recommend The Ruby Slipper Café.  

I came here on the Friday after Thanksgiving.  It was quite sunny despite all the "black" Friday references I kept hearing... My companion mentioned, as we walked down Magazine St., that they have a reputation for long wait times.  Luckily our wait was quite short.  Maybe 10 minutes.  Granted we were there around 9am.  There were many more people waiting when we left.  

The interior was eclectic with lots of local art (for sale) on the walls.  Counter seating in the middle and many tables.  We commented several times about how happy all the staff seemed to be as well as how friendly they were to us and everyone around.  +1.  Despite being incredibly busy, our server was attentive and ready for action.  +1.  It seemed loud, and we talked about how that was a good thing to us b/c it meant we could talk and cut up without fearing rebuke from our neighbors.  +1.  (my dad said that the other locations are even louder and uncomfortable to him)  We ordered bloody's and they came out fast and were quite spicy.  I like to be able to see though my bloody, but my friend said hers was just right.  +1.  The menu wasn't too big but there were several things I wanted to try...so I guess I'll go back.  +1.  

My breakfast cohort ordered the smoked salmon...benedict?  I tried to look it up for this review but couldn't find the menu on their website.  She was a little let down that it wasn't the thin sliced smoked salmon like you would get on bagels and lox, and because it was on a bed of spinach leaves that soaked up all the hollandaise, but said the flavor was good. -1?  I also had a benedict.  Poached egg, hollandaise, tomato and bacon on top of a biscuit.  I noticed that all of their "bennys" were on biscuit and not muffin, which I would prefer, but I still cleaned my plate.  Hand cut hash browns were hot and crispy.  +1

Doing the math, I'll give this location on this day 5 stars.  The next time I spend the night in the quarters I will come here (early to avoid lines) to try something different.  Thanks.

This food here is really good. I enjoyed the French toast bites even though they were cooked for too long. I also tried eggs Benedict for the first time. While I found out that I'm not a fan of runny eggs, I was still pretty pleased with the other salmon biscuit without the egg. I'd recommend giving this place a try
Great food, amazing and fast service. Freddie was very friendly and gave great recommendations

I was excited to try this place because i heard a lot about it. It's a brunch restaurant that serves brunch everyday. I finally got a chance to try and the food was OKAY. The restaurant wasn't anything special. I also didn't like the fact that they didn't have bottomless mimosas. What's a brunch spot without bottomless mimosas?

This place was amazing! Definitely worth the hour wait. (We tried to go yesterday and it was a 3-4 hour wait) so we knew we had to come back! Our server Angelina was amazing, she gave us honest opinions on the menu and chatted with us about the tours we were booking and good sights in New Orleans. DEFINITELY RECOMMEND and if you can suggest a server, Angelina won't Disappoint!  ***Added bonus that a server was walking around to the many people waiting outside to bring drinks while we waited***
Yep it's worth the wait. Benedict heaven and great drinks. Can you ask for more? What a great restaurant worth the wait. A must stop when in this city
Great place for Breakfast!! Bam Bam biscuit was delicious ! Great atmosphere! The atmosphere at the old New Orleans location ( Pelham Hotel) was classic
My first experience was great! Got a unique birthday shoutout and the food was excellent!

The food is fresh and very delicious! Freddie was our server today, he was very helpful and made some excellent suggestions! The restaurant as a whole is very clean and spaced out pretty well. Definitely would recommend coming here! We will be back!

Excellent service, food and drinks. Can't go wrong here!! Must try for a great breakfast or brunch. I got the corn beef eggs Benedict- the eggs were cooked perfectly and the coffee was hot and strong. Fantastic way to start the day! ThAnks ruby slipper!
Chicken sausage, coffee lukewarm. Breakfast potatoes good. Grits with cheese a-ok. Scrambled eggs and biscuit meh. Service good.

Staff is friendly both times we came here. Wait wasn't to long at all. Their take in benedicts are bomb! Poached egg was perfect, ordered the cochon and black stone and was not disappointed. Their hot chocolate is rich and chocolatety lol.
Breakfast was delicious. Big portions. Coffee was delicious too. I had Pecan stuffed French toast and they were perfection. I would come back next times we come to NOLA!
I love this place!!! We had best breakfast at New Orleans. Mimosa gave me a buzz and ready to started with my day

Ruby Slipper is a nice stop for breakfast/brunch/lunch and conveniently located for those visiting or staying in the area. After a terrible hotel breakfast, we decided to head out and try RS based on generally strong reviews and were very happy with it.

It's not a huge place, and it's very popular so be prepared to wait. Since we visited on a Tuesday AM our wait wasn't long. The menu is full of delightful sounding things which made it very hard to choose - ultimately I settled on a corned beef hash benedict.

CORNED BEEF HASH BENEDICT. On a BISCUIT. Holy Christ, it was the biggest biscuit I've ever seen! Each half was about 6" in diameter and an inch or more thick. That's just crazy, especially when topped with homemade corned beef hash, poached eggs and hollandaise sauce. The flavors were just right. 

Our server was nice and attentive and our food arrived quickly. A few teeny tiny nitpicks - I wish my food would have been warmer and that the corned beef hash was more corned beef and less hash. That aside, my breakfast was amazing - I only ate half and 10 hours later I'm still not hungry. (Also, if you're a wee bit hungover, this dish will set you straight. I'm not saying it from personal experience or anything but....)

Amazing. Don't think twice, just get on the waitlist before you go! Everything is delicious. The Benedict's are perfection!!

Worth the wait. Best breakfast
Drew was an exceptional waiter! Very attentive and made sure our drinks were topped off. Breakfast was delicious and I would recommend the St Charles Benedict!!

Pig-candy bacon, yes please!

The place was packed, however there was no line.
I waited less than 10 min to get a table.  I arrived at 12:30 for lunch on Thursday 2/14/19.  

I love the atmosphere here, it's lively and full of life in here.

My server was fantastic! She did a great job telling me about the menu and pointing out customer favorites.

Order
Grilled fish St Peter $15 - fish of the day (Drum fish) over a cheesy grit cake, topped with sautéed spinach & tomatoes, a skewer of grilled shrimp, finished with creole mustard hollandaise.

Side order
Pig-candy bacon $3.50


My food took 30 min but the service was so good and the waitress kept me informed of the progress.  It didn't seem like it took that long.

My food arrived and what a site it was to see that glorious plate of deliciousness!

It was plated just perfectly!  There were 2 large triangular shaped items that looked like they were baked.  That was the cheese grits cakes.  They were fantastic.

Sticking out of a grit cake was a skewer of grilled shrimp.  They tasted so wonderful I could have eaten more.

The Drum fish was cooked perfectly and tasted great.  I loved the creole mustard hollandaise. It was drizzled over everything on the plate.  Yummy!

The pig-candy bacon came with 2 slices of perfectly cooked bacon covered in a heavenly coat of sugar candy goodness.  You need to get a side of this it's that good.

My visit was perfect from the cheerful greeting at the host stand to the server who provided excellent service.

Thanks!!


** high chairs = yes
** kids menu = yes 
** changing table in the bathroom = yes
I got the salmon and goat cheese omelette, with a Bloody Mary to drink. Can I just say that was THE BEST Bloody Mary I've ever
Other than being very slow the food was great! They definitely need to retrain staff. I still would go back just to eat if nothing else.

OMG!  So Good.  Food Drinks Service 
All extraordinary 
Thank you team for an unforgettable culinary experience

One of the best cheap breakfasts I've ever had. You really can't beat a southern breakfast and this place takes the cake. I went early and had no problem getting a seat, but there was a line forming when I was leaving so plan accordingly. With a wide variety of breakfast choices from carbs to proteins, you can't go wrong.

I must say this is a good place for breakfast.  They take reservations. I would recommend to make one. I waited for 30 minutes. They are always busy as I saw. There was always a line and yes the food is that  good to stay in a line.
    The menu listed a creamy vanilla ice coffee that sounded good. Specifically because I like things that are sweet. It was OK, but wasn't very sweet. 
   We ordered the French Toast Bites. I liked it. Small square French toast lightly drizzled with a sweet cream cheese mixture icing. Had a dip on the side. It was not very sweet.  But now that I read the menu.  My dish did not have powder sugar or cinnamon. That would explain lol. But it was still good.
   We ordered the seasonal beignets. That was awesome.  I recommend them. Fried small bite sized  crispy square dough. It had jam and sweet cream cheese. I liked it.
   My breakfast the corned beef egg Benedict. It came in a bed of spinach and potatoes on the side. It was great.  The eggs perfectly cooked. The corned beef was delicious also. The hollandaise sauce was very tasty. It was one of the best. I had ever had.
   Shawn K. my waiter was great. He was cool, friendly  and helpful.  He also has good taste.  I took most of his recommendations and liked it. Thank you for everything
Went with a party of 24 so the wait was long but they tried to accommodate us... but the food was amazing and worth the wait. Corn beef hash is good... also waffles, bacon, and chicken.
The food is excellent, a little bit pricey but I think it's worth the money so if you have a Louisiana bourbon street please stop by and try out there and the great food and great prices
Still the best breakfast in the CBD.  Period.  Go for the food, love the atmosphere, get tipsy on their great drinks.

This place is very OK. I'm a New Orleans native and I have always heard people talk about this place, mostly friends who were visiting the city. I finally decided to try it for myself, and wow this place is insanely underwhelming. This is a very touristy version of classic New Orleans food, C- at best. The service was nice, and the atmosphere is cute. But the food is nothing I would eat again.

Magazine Street location was TOPS for brunch! Copious food selections to appeal to anyone with an appetite. Who can say no to a breakfast plate that includes a fried green tomato? Not this girl. Perfect, flavorful, straight-up coffee (sorry chicory lovers) and refills galore. This is my NOLA go-to, feel good and feed good breakfast place from here on in.

Breakfast was amazingly good at the ruby slipper! We got the biscuits and gravy and the French toast bites to share, it was a good balance! I wouldn't recommend the French toast bites as a main meal because it was sooo sweet. It would have be a perfect appetizer.

This was directly across the street from our hotel, so we were able to just walk over early in the morning before it got crazy, the lines were so long many mornings
We went around 8am and requested the outdoor seating since it was nice outside. The food was really good and I liked that they didn't offer just the traditional breakfast dishes
We ordered the Candied bacon which was good but the presentation and plating was off and not good at all they need to re-think that 
I got the Trifecta and it was amazing so much flavor! Each eggs benedict was different with varying meats and sauces, I loved it. It was also so filling
My husband had the Bananas Foster PainPerdu, also delicious and generous servings

Best Breakfast in a long time. We will return!!!  We had the Ponchartrain Blue Crabs Cake Benedict and Sweet Heat Chicken and French Toast bites. Gpod to the last bite. Wish we could have refills.  Glad I went here!!!

Ruby Slipper is a great place to eat breakfast/brunch. We were able to join the waiting list online(highly recommended) they have lots of people waiting to eat here. We ordered the egg Benedict (salmon & pork) very good.  We tried also the chicken and waffle(was not my favorite, waffle was too greasy. I was so excited about the French toast bites and that was a bit disappointing, too sweet and greasy. The candy bacon was so good, if you love bacon it's a must try.  Overall, good food!

The wait looked really long but wasn't that bad and they take drink orders while in line. We got the French toast bites as the appetizer and OMGGG they were so good. We also got the candied bacon which wasn't really anything special but still good and only $5. We split the trifecta and it was delicious! All three were made from scratch and savory! I'm typically not a shrimp person but that was my favorite, his was the chicken but the pork was also crazy good so it was hard to pick a favorite. Definitely worth the 15 minute wait!

We drove to Ruby Slipper and found metered parking very close. I put our name on the wait list via yelp. There were a lot of people waiting outside but we were seated outside within 5 minutes. 

I ordered the iced vanilla coffee (it had a little pumpkin spice flavor to it), banana foster French toast without the raisins and the candied bacon. My mom ordered the classic pancake. My food was really good. I enjoyed the French toast and the bacon. Although the bacon didn't have as much crusted or candied coating as another place I went for breakfast. It was still good but not as good. 

I would eat here again if I'm in New Orleans and recommend this place. Just make sure you put your name on the waitlist before you get there because the wait time for others seemed awhile (we were seated outside).
Food was pretty good! Definitely check out the French toast bites! Service was great too!
Loved the French toast bites! Staff super nice! I was extremely hot from walking and they kept bringing me ice water while we were waiting to be sat.
Love the food the service was amazing wishing we had this restaurant back in Las Vegas

First time here, got the peace maker so I could taste two different Benedict's. I ordered the Eggs Cochon and Lake Charles. They were fantastic, the pulled pork on the cochon was soooo good. I got chills with the first few bites. Added a sazerac drink and it was a perfect meal.

I'm never disappointed when come here and it doesn't matter which location. I know I will leave full and tipsy. There was a little mishap with the waitlist system (reason for 4 stars). I usually for the for trifecta, which is...chef's kiss. However, the hanger I had needed something I could grab with my hands. So opted for the breakfast tacos with fries. I needed to add a bit of hot sauce for some flavor...but they got the job done!

MUST TRY!!! The best breakfast I've truly ever had. Everything is made fresh and is full of flavor. You are guaranteed to leave full after eating here. The staff is always very friendly and accommodating, it's best to make a reservation because although there are many locations, they tend to be packed!

This place is amazing! The wait cant be a deterrent and of course the no-wait app helps. The food was great and the bloody mary's did their job. Again, the wait can be a bitch so make reservations or use the no-wait app. If im ever in New Orleans, im definitely going back. Had the Florentine lst time around but i really wanted to try the Brioche french toast. The couple next to us with whom we got chatting and actually ordered it, gave me a piece to try and it was delish! A must have. Share if everyone already has ordered something else.

Everyone else liked their meals just fine (hence 3 stars instead of one or 2), but I asked for my eggs over medium so the whites would be completely cooked. They were so undercooked I couldn't eat them. Our server never asked how the food was or I would have told her. Such a bummer because I got the Costa Rican, so the entire thing was essentially inedible for me (was able to pick around the edges) and you would have thought at some point she would asked why I didn't eat 75% of my meal. The place was packed and service was mediocre at best. Really wanted to love it, but couldn't.

The food is great. Service was a bit slow and wasn't a huge fan of the plastic cutlery (but I understand cause of covid). We got mimosas that weren't so great. But overall cool place to go for a Saturday brunch.

I had a brilliant brunch here when I was doin my solo road trip. They made delicate food, and mimosa is a must for my brunch and it was good. 
Love the staffs here as well. 
They are friendly and cordial.

I'm in New Orleans on a girl's trip...And no one was ready to go to brunch. So I left the hotel to explore until I get the "we're ready to eat" call. I get the call...to go to the Ruby Slipper Cafe. And well, just damn...

First, let's talk about efficiency... I meet my party in line OUTSIDE and they're ordering drinks. (Someone is taking a play from the Chick Fila playbook. Kudos.) I had the Peach Bellini. Strong enough to get you tipsy but not enough to lay you out. PERFECT. 

We're seated fairly quickly. COVID-19 protocols were in place and you can scan the menu. I opted for French Toast bites, lightly drizzled in a creamy icing and with syrup, as a starter. 

I ordered the Southern Breakfast--two eggs, bacon, biscuit, fried green tomato, and Grits. Food is well cooked. Bacon could have been a little thicker quality, but it was still good. Eggs were fluffy. Fried green tomato was seasoned and fried well but small. You only get one, which is fine, but two would have been nice. 

NOW...y'all, let me tell you about these GRITS. I have NEVER in my entire 46 years of life had grits that didn't need something. I little butter, a little salt, a little pepper...you get the point. I had already asked the waitress to bring extra butter. 

But these grits right here...y'all, these grits needed absolutely NOTHING. Had my waitress come back to ask, I would have ordered more. Like enough to take back to Mississippi more and tell others of this deliciousness nestled in the French Quarter.

Verdict. I'm trying to get back over there before I leave New Orleans.

EAT HERE.

This place is incredible. Our server Shelby was phenomenal. She was friendly and made fantastic recommendations. The food was great, the drinks were superb. The candied bacon was delicious. We will be back. Thank you Shelby!

Woah! This place feels like a hidden gem for breakfast. Super close walk from our hotel we came because U saw the Bananas Foster French toast. Oh. My. Gosh. That has got to be the best food I have water for breakfast. Ever. It was hot and crispy. The sauce was gooey and sweet. Bananas were perfectly cooked. It was a 10/10. I also had the vanilla spiced latter hot which was another incredible choice. My boyfriend had the 3 piggies omelette and he enjoyed it as well, very cheesy! I highly recommend you come here and try this !!

Our first breakfast in Nola! We made a reservation through the "join the waitlist" feature on their website. It said that our wait time would be between 60-90 minutes. Before the hour was up, we headed to the restaurant. Once you are there, you have to wait in line to check in with the host. That took us around 30 min. After we had checked in,  we had to wait until we received a text message. That added one more hour to the whole waiting time!!! If you use their "no wait"  to make a reservation, head to the restaurant right after to avoid less wait times. We loved the French toast bites and the fried green tomatoes!! The One Tomato, Two Tomato Benedicts were perfectly cooked and delicious!!

So this place has great word of mouth and many great reviews - I'm staying in an Air BnB right next to it and have seen it packed with lines around the block for the past 4 days.  When I went I had a 90 minute wait - doable for me because I could wait in my room.  When I got there I was seated at the bar - the bartender was extremely flustered and kept taking orders ahead of me particularly at the take out window (it makes zero sense to make the bartender service the bar and the take out window but they do it). After about 20 minutes he finally took my order - I had the Bacon Bites appetizer, migas, and the bacon infused Bloody Mary.  The Bacon and the Bloody were top shelf - totally worth the wait and BS involved.  However, the migas were meh. Migas is my second favorite breakfast food next to only biscuits and gravy - I've had migas all over Texas so I feel like I have a pretty good frame of reference for what makes the dish well prepared.  Here the eggs were generally fine - maybe a little cool when they arrived - but the real disappointment was the tortilla strips which seemed to be either stale or soggy. Anyone who like migas knows that the tortilla really makes the dish otherwise it's just a chorizo and eggs scramble. Any way these migas were maybe a 5/10.  The bacon really saved this visit for me.  I'll also add - this is definitely a brunch spot - do not come here if you are looking for quiet because it is always packed.

Went and waited about 45 minutes to get a table and the wait was definitely worth it! Devin was our server and he was hilarious! He was on top of everything and was cracking jokes left and right. Made our first time experience here just fantastic! Will definitely be back if ever in the New Orleans area again.

We visited on a Saturday morning and needless to say the place was extremely busy. We started with Pumpkin praline french toast and pumpkin praline seasonal beignets, they were amazing. It was nice of them to give the option of mix and match for Benedict's so I could taste crawfish and salmon. Damon Benedict was a winner. The rest of the group had avacado salmon toast, southern breakfast and omelet and everyone liked it. If you are craving milk coffee, do not miss the creamy vanilla spiced latte! It was sooo good! Will visit again
The wait time was treacherous but we stuck it out. The food was beautiful but the plantains were chewy and hard to eat. Service  was excellent and the mixed drinks we got were pretty strong.

The morning of our check out and the wife and I were looking for a breakfast place. On Tuesday's & Wednesday's a lot of places are not open. Ruby Slippers thankfully was open. 

I got the combo St Charles Chicken/Blackstone Eggs Benedict and my wife got the Miza's. We both loved our dish. The food was so flavorful. This was the surprise last minute favorite restaurant we visited in NOLA. Highly recommend.

Food was delicious! Had the Trifecta and the Eggs Cochon (pulled pork) was my favorite followed by the Bayou Shrimp (shrimp, fried green tomato with a biscuit in a creole tomato sauce), and the Chicken St. Charles (fried chicken). The bananas foster french toast was good as well but it already comes drenched in syrup so had I have known this I would have ordered the syrup on the side. I also had the Morning Margarita and it was ok.

Ruby Slipper never disappoints... as always the staff is super friendly and helpful! The food was great. It was a Monday and the wait was still a bit crazy and the temperature took a drop and with the fans and the door open it made for a really cold brunch... that was the only drawback. I understand because of covid leaving the door and fan going might be good but it was hard eating and made food cold fast.
A real New Orleans stable. This is one of the best brunch places in the city. The food and portion size will not disappoint. The only setback is there's no bottomless mimosa option here

My husband and I saw the restaurant highlighted on Travel Channel so we wanted to check it out.   From reviews based off other Yelpers it appeared the earlier the better. 

We arrived on a Sunday morning around 7:45.  The restaurant was already packed but we were able to be seated right away.   

Our waitress was attentive and friendly.   She answered all our questions and gave suggestions.  I had the special which was shrimp and poached eggs with cortez sauce.  My husband had the shrimp abd grits.  We also ordered the banana foster French toast. 

All the dishes were delicious with good flavor.   The shrimp was small but not overcooked and the cortez sauce was not too rich.  The sauce had a little spicy kick.  The French toast was not too sweet and bread was not soggy.
The shrimp & grits was rich.  The flavor was good, but I am lactose intolerant so the cheese was too much for me (which was okay since it was my husband's dish).

I also had ice coffee and my husband had the vanilla ice coffee which were both good and not watered down. 

Bill total was around  $57 not including the $15 tip.

We left the restaurant around 9:00 a.m. and the wait was 25 minutes already so if you can get there before 9:00.

I love that you can put your name on the waitlist on Yelp before heading out the door. We had a party of 5 and decided to put our name ahead of time through the app. We got there within an hour and a half and were seated within a couple of minutes. The line was HUGE out the door so we were getting pretty excited.

Our server recommended any of the egg benedicts which seems to be a staple at this place. I ordered the Peacemaker with the Shrimp Boogaloo & Hot Smoked Salmon. I didn't read the menu correctly but this was definitely grilled salmon instead of the raw smoked salmon that I was hoping for. The biscuits for both were kinda hard to me but everything else wasn't bad. I also go tthe white chocolate bread pudding pancakes...which was the best dish there. I normally don't like sweets but everything in my body was telling me to order this and I was so glad that I did because I loved every minute of it! It wasn't overly sweet and the pancakes were perfect.

Another plus was that they do use paper straws and the Saints game was on every screen -- not a Saints fan but I am a football fan so I loved the energy and pride.
Fantastic food. Always a crowd but moves quick. The CS is usually very good too! No complaints from me

They serve drinks outdoors while you wait for a table.    The Benedict's are very good and will convert those who have avoided such entries.  The biscuits should not be missed. Our service was great and friendly. The vanilla chai latte was good.

Our server, Tony, was wonderful and gave us many tips and recommendations. I had the seasonal pumpkin praline brioche French toast and it was hands down the best French toast of my life, and that's saying something because I friggin love French toast y'all.

The seasonal mimosa flight was also very good, but the pomegranate lavender mimosa was my favorite. I got one to go! We will probably be back here damn near every day for brekkie.

I definitely agree with the yelper who was just as disappointed as I was. We ordered take out and was missing so much, the meal just sad. Besides missing things it was very tiny amounts for the price. I had better expectations. 

French toast 1/5
It was just a fried toast. I asked for the sauces on the side for the toast but nothing was included. I was also suppose to have bacon on the side but was missing. I paid $10 for just a couple of pieces of fried toast sadly. No syrup at the least was included. 

Pancakes 2/5 
They were a decent size on the flatter side and not very special . Very pricey for some pancakes. Again no syrup so it was very bland. 

Breakfast platter 3/5
I can at least say this was good even tho it's the simpler dish. Sausages were a chunky good sausage. Cheesy grits were good. Eggs were made well to preference. Also had was missing the biscuit. Could have rated higher but such a shame.

We didn't wait long to get a table for 4 on a Saturday morning, maybe 10 min. The server was great, I wish I remembered her name. We started out with morning margaritas which had blood orange juice in them.  We had corned beef Benedict, Bananas Foster Pain Perdu w/bacon,  a Benedict combo (St Charles fried chicken and Shrimp Boogaloo with Fried green tomato/shrimp) and Three Little Pigs omelet. My friend who doesn't eat pork was happy to get the chicken sausage patties. Great food all around, I see why people wait to eat there. Deciding what to order is the toughest part.

The food was amazing!!! It was worth the 45 minute wait. On our last day in New Orleans, we stop in for breakfast and I wish we would have went there sooner. The service was quick and the food was great. You won't be disappointed! I had the Fried Chicken Eggs Benedict and potatoes and everything was seasoned to perfection. I will recommend this place to anyone and definitely will be returning on my next trip to New Orleans.

great spot that seats you quickly. my waiter Freddie was definitely kind and worth a good tip. the french toast bites are a great brunch appetizer!! definitely returning to this location the next time we're in Nola!

Excellent breakfast spot near the French quarter. This is the second time we have had breakfast here. Staff is very pleasant and accommodating. The decor inside is old time bank. Husband had southern breakfast and I had their seasonal pumpkin French toast. Both were yummy!
Biggest mimosa in the city. This is one of my favorite brunch spots. I can't wait to go back.

They alright regular breakfast spot.

Fried green tomatoes were bland, I didn't really care for the batter.

Biscuit was hard, eggs were eggs.

Cool location, but want be returning anytime soon.

Although the service was good, on a crowded Sunday morning.
Freddie H was our amazing server. Service was exceptional food was outstanding. This place is a must go!

Omg the wait was worth it! The food was so good and portions were great. Angelina our server was such a sweetheart...she deserves a raise! Everyone was friendly and I would definitely recommend eating here.

A must visit! Thoroughly enjoyed myself at this venue. I've eaten there every day since my arrival. First, let me say THERE WILL BE A WAIT! Not sure why people are upset or annoyed by it. It literally comes with the territory of being in a major city/tourist area, in a pandemic, with hundreds of people wanting really great breakfast. Join the online waitlist. It certainly helps and don't be picky with seating. I ate at the bar and the service was amazing. Gigi took care of me everyday with a smile and real hospitality. Get anything. Get everything. For drinks, I kept it simple. The morning margarita is amazing and the peach Bellini is perfect. The margarita has just enough kick to put a smile on your face for the morning. The Bellini has a fresh peach purée that adds sweetness. The food is so good.  Everything fresh and plated to perfection. I enjoyed the Eggs Benedict. Let me be clear...this was my first time having poached eggs. And I almost cried after I ordered it. Just the thought made me a little nervous to have ordered it. But honey...when I tell you that thang was GOOOOD?!? OMG. I got the corned beef hash with mine. And I couldn't believe how amazing it tasted. The egg and the sauce were just fantastic. I ordered an extra side of the corned beef hash just because it was THAT good. Tried almost all of Benedict's during my trip. And the corned beef was my favorite. The crab cakes were perfectly seasoned. I never reached for seasoning for anything. The gluten free menu is extensive, too. Everyone on the staff was friendly and supportive to each other. Don't know about y'all, but when the staff works together well, the experience is better. These people were a real family. I will make this my first stop EVERY time. This place is a jewel in Nawlins.
We had breakfast serval places in New Orleans this week, but went to Ruby Slipper at 204 Decatur twice. The charming hostess, British, set the friendly welcome tone and the food was exceptional.

The food was so good we went twice! Amazing seasonal beignets, the drinks, and everything we tried was delicious! 
This place is very popular so it's important to get on the waitlist first thing in the morning. While waiting for your table they let you order drinks which is awesome!

This was a brunch delight during our trip to New Orleans! They took our drink order in the waiting line, delivered them to us while we waited for our table. About a 25 minute wait but it was WELL worth it. The food was simply AMAZING! The chicken was out if this world. We will be back next time we are in NOLA!

We were in town for a staycation and my wife suggested we walk here to have breakfast here rather than eat in the hotel.  OK.  We were lucky.  Monday morning after the business people rush so there was no wait for the table.  Our server quickly came by with menus and took our coffee/tea order.  My wife and I both ordered the southern breakfast.  It was we knew and expected.  Service was good.  Tables seemed spread out enough.  Only real complaint was the door was left open (I guess to attract customers) and it was chilly inside.  Other than that, no complaints.

Amazing! Marcus was our waiter and he was the bomb. I got the Smoked Salmon eggs Benedict (recommended by the girl who checked us in). So, so good! My husband got the stuffed French toast and the Black stone egg Benedict. Also amazing! We gave our leftovers to a homeless man.
