The expression on his face when he opened the box was priceless Definitely worth going! Ps we only waited about 20 minutes and we were there at 12:00.

So I'm writing this for one reason, and one reason alone - Jarod.  

Let me explain.  We came here based on the amazing reviews, and stopped by for brunch.  New Orleans has some of the most amazing food, and so we figured this would be a fantastic place to continue our food extravaganza!

We ordered the Green Fried Tomatoes... and let's just say, if this was the last food on earth I'd get to eat, I wouldn't complain.  They were delicious.  So was the - french truck coffee which is code for - here's how good coffee can actually taste!  We sat at the bar, and the service was great - until I got my Breakfast Tacos which were super bland... as I was dissecting my order trying to match the ingredients list (which sounded delicious) to what was actually in the taco and trying to figure out where this whole thing went off track straight into bland town... I realized it was missing the sourcream, and cheese... so what I ended up with was a rather watery, eggy, boring tasting mess...here's where Jarod comes in.  Without me saying a word, and honestly, I would have kept my mouth shut, he could tell something was off, and quickly realized with a glance that it wasn't done correctly.  Without my prompting, or talking him out of it, he took care of it immediately and got me the correct plate...

...This would have been a 1 star review - 2 if I was feeling generous, because despite the coffee, and the amazing fried green tomatoes... this is a big miss.  But Jarod saved it.  Kindly, with empathy, a smile, and without any hassle... if I as running a business, and had nothing but Jarod's working for me... it would be called SPACE X and it would be taking us to mars as we speak... so here's to Jarod, I hope he gets appreciation, kind words, maybe even a hug, and a raise!
Wonderful food - great service and coffee! Try the three biscuit sampler...can't recall the name but it was so good!
Absolutely one of the best brunches I've had ever!  Worth the wait!  Lives up to the hype and beyond.   Make sure to get the maple butter with your biscuits and ordet a Bloody Mary.

Never visited New Orleans and I looked up delicious breakfast spots around my area and found this place. Everything on Yelp looked amazing and excitingly I ordered pick up. Showed up at the time of the scheduled pick-up. Order wasn't ready and without realizing it noticed I had waited 30 minutes with zero update. When asked the status of my online pick up order they stated the order was being worked on...I'm sure the food great but service and staff sucked. Oh and it was 37 degrees outside.

We went for an early Sunday breakfast and were treated to the best meal we had all weekend while visiting NOLA! The crab and crawfish Benedict's were so delicious! Special shout out to Sammie who showed us true southern hospitality!

Shelby was great! Her recommendation of the fried green tomatoes was on point! It was my first time having them and not my last! Food was great! Biscuits were amazing! My first visit to NOLA and Ruby Slipper did not disappoint.

We were visiting for 3 days and ate breakfast 2 days.  There is a reason for the wait and it is worth it!   Our server Nahnah was super attentive.   The biscuits are huge and everything we tried was delicious.  This place is a gem.  It is on my must visit list!

The only downside was the hour and a half wait! Our server was super helpful with suggestions and recommendations. Did not disappoint! Friends got the eggs Benedict and I had the omelet. Great portion sizes. Wish they had gluten free bread!

We came to this location around 9am on a Saturday and it was about a 15 minute wait. Staff was welcoming, knowledgeable and efficient. Loved the big bar in the middle with stools on both sides. Lots of yummy breakfast cocktail options, as well as iced coffees. My husband's bellini was huge - in a full size wine glass! My shrimp and grits were so flavorful and the shrimp were perfectly tender. My husband had the Peacemaker which he loved. He also got a side of grits which he said were perfect and did not need any additional condiments. Our friend got the migas and loved it. There were so many other things that also looked great. Guess we'll have to come back again some time!

The wait for this place is very long so I would suggest joining the waitlist online. We tried going for two days and wait was at least 2 hours. On Sundays, at the peak brunch, the wait was 3 hours. So, plan early. We sat on the patio and that was great for a beautiful day. The food was great!! However, the service wasn't all that. Our server only came to your table a total of 4 times. It seemed like we would see her every 30 minutes. I'm not sure if she was balancing multiple tables or what. But, we had to ask other servers for condiments and drink refills. Other than that, it was conveniently located off Canal St and to multiple hotels.

Round 2! There's a reason this place is impossible to get into with wait times exceeding 1 hour on the weekends. Fortunately we went on a Wednesday morning and only had to wait 2 minutes to be seated. We ordered a round of Bloody Mary's and the biscuit and gravy with fried chicken as well as the Cuban breakfast. I ended up having left overs and it didn't take long before I ate the rest of my breakfast. One of my favorite breakfast places!

Mediocre food and ambience so I am confused as to why there are so many 4/5 star reviews. We ordered the pancakes which were average and luke warm. We also ordered the salmon eggs Benedict - the food was cold and we had to send it back. The waiter at first spoke back when we said it was cold rather than simply apologizing (and continued to provide poor service throughout the meal). When the food did arrive after, the flavors were overpowering and it was not in a hollandaise sauce as stated. The eggs were overcooked rather than poached properly. We even had bad stomachs after the meal (and I can now see another reviewer on yelp who had the same experience). Additionally the restaurant was very cold as they left the door wide open when it was very cold outside and everyone had their coats on, so the ambience wasn't comfortable. Giving two stars is actually generous and mainly based on a different waiter being nice. We wouldn't return here or recommend to others. There is much better food out there

On a Tuesday morning when you have just done a quick staycation with your hubby, this was a great brunch to end our dreamy trip. Bloody Marys were great, migas- fantastic, and the service was spot on.  I highly recommend.

Love love love this brunch place!! I'm not a huge brunch person, but I've gotta say, this place hits the spot. Eggs benedicts galooooore. They have a combo with three bennys, but between my boyfriend and I, we thought it was too much. So instead, we opted for the combo with our choice of two eggs bennys - we chose the chicken and the salmon. I was a little disappointed the salmon was the cooked kind (it was dry), but the chicken was super juicy!! The bread that the put it on is not dry also, so it went super well with the toppings. We also ordered the Ruby Slipper Salad, which I'm guessing is their signature salad. It was the perfect complement to the bennys, although the salad had a bit too much vinaigrette for my liking. Still, the ingredients in the salad worked so perfectly together. Also paired our meal with a vanilla iced coffee!! It was a perfect last meal of NOLA.
Great spot for brunch but gets very busy. Definitely make a reservation prior to coming. The food is good. We got the Benedict and for dessert their special toast with sweet cream and colorful sugar.

Get there early because locals and tourists alike come out to Ruby Slipper for breakfast. I had a wonderful breakfast of beans n rice, eggs, avo, and crunchy plantains. Delish and healthy! Reasonable pricing and our server, Deshandre(?) was friendly and professional. We'll be back during this vacation.

Went to Ruby Slipper this morning. First suggestion get on the waitlist via Yelp because it will help shorten your wait time. Today our waiter was Freddie H, he was great. Very attentive and knew what he was talking about when asking about menu items. This place is a must try.

Staff was okay, had to wait 10 minutes to eat because they forgot my syrup. French toast bites were really hard and I hurt my mouth eating them. The actual french toast was flavorless and tasted like egg. Wouldn't recommend. There are better breakfast places.

My friends and I joined the yelp wait list which was awesome since we didn't have to wait in the cold.

Unfortunately by the time we sat down and ordered....we realized that we had to jet off to our tour reservation. Bad timing on our part obviously, but our waitress Julie was very understanding and canceled our order.

I walked out of Ruby Slipper with only their house special vanilla iced coffee, which was very creamy and sweet! I liked it. 

I did order the Chicken St. Charles and plan on eating it soon!

Food was amazing. staff were great! Long wait time which is expected with a good restaurant. 

Try to avoid outdoor seating, the street smells horrible.

O.M.G.  Came for brunch, really just because it was across the street from our hotel. Let's just start with bartenders MJ and Jake.  Super nice, friendly and helpful.  And darn good bartenders too!  I had the Bam Bam bisquit.  Delish!  The pig candy was uh.maz.ing!  Hubs had a BYO omelette, which got 2 thumbs up.  The Ruby Slipper mimosa was quite tasty as well.  Pretty sure we will be here EVERY morning we are here.
Great breakfast popular spot a bit of a wait but worth it! The candy bacon is amazing! Good drinks would call ahead to see what the wait is like.

We just had the most amazing breakfast!!!! The Ruby Slipper Cafe has the BEST bloody Mary's. It was spicy and came with pickled green beans which I've never had  before but they were incredible. We ordered the St Charles Chicken & the Cochon with scrambled eggs and hollandaise sauce. We are coming back tomorrow- it was that great!!!!!!!

Just wow  we enjoyed the food and atmosphere so much we've been talking about that meal at every other meal since it happened two days ago. We were on Decatur and know there are other locations but just in case, we'll keep coming back to this one.
Go early or end up waiting!  There's a reason this place is so popular and worth the wait.

Its a stop we alway eat while in NOLA.
Our Servicer was phenomenal !!! 
This place never disappoints.
Longs are long, but use their app to skip the long waits.
Delish!  Go early to avoid long lines; however, the food is worth any wait. Serving size is plentiful!  Fried green tomatoes, candied bacon as starters were a hit.

The wait time was not too bad for the many people wanting to eat here. Maybe about 15-20 mins. We were seated outdoors and the ambiance  was chill. We had the Egg Cochon.... super delicious ,  and the Stuffed French Toast with peaches and cream and bacon, also good. Oh, and also a side of Corned Beef Hash... yummy! We ordered a Cranberry Mimosa and a classic Mimosa, the classic would've been better with less pulp, overall good. Kristy the bartender/waitress was very attentive, knowledgeable of the menus and very delightful. Overall the experience is worth returning for and I recommend The Ruby Slipper.

This was my second time eating at a Ruby slipper. I was honestly disappointed in the quality of my meal. Management was great to accommodate and try to make it right, which I give to them . Our food was cold and overall was not great. If heading to this location I would suggest completing a reservation as we were seated fairly quickly due to having ours. There was an entertainer play out in the street which added to the charm of the place. Our waiter was David and the manager was KK. Thank you both for your service during our visit.

First and foremost: there will probably be a line, so plan to wait or use the yelp waitlist feature. We came on Memorial day and thus, waited for a bit. The food was very good- both my husband and I enjoyed various egg benedicts and tasty vanilla ice coffee. Service was a little slow but I understand because it was busy.

Went here for breakfast and was more than impressed. First of all how can you not like  anything with wizard of oz undertones? Second , the food was above your average breakfast.  we tried multiple things of the menu and they were great!  the eggs the bacon , the french toast all way better than avg.  Nice friendly service , was def the best place I have been for breakfast in NOLA.

My first stop after arriving in New Orleans. We got here around 11am ish and there were tons of people already outside waiting. Still we put our name on the waiting list. BTW. Many places in New Orleans do not take reservations. 

There is an option to order and pay for drinks while you wait. Anyways, we waited for maybe 45mins to and hour. Sounds like a lot of time but once you start ordering drinks, the time seems to fly by. Lol! 

There is both indoor and and a quaint outside seating area. Indoors appears to be spacious, however with so many people inside it doesn't appear that way. We were seated at the bar. Our server, can't remember his name, was very nice and attentive. 

We ordered the fried green tomatoes as an appetizer. We'd never had green tomatoes so we had no clue of what was in store. Boy were they good! And the chipotle like sauce thats on it... made it even more delicious. Small appetizer but very filling and tasty.

For my main dish, I ordered the Migas with crawfish. Highly recommended by the server and now highly recommended by me. It's an omelet with crawfish (obviously), diced tomatoes, and shredded cheese served over tortilla chips w/ an avocado on the side. DEE-LISH-US! 

My friend ordered the Bayou Shrimp. Looked great! And my friend said it tasted amazing as well. 

Great job THE Ruby Slippers. First stop of many and we were not disappointed!

Came here for breakfast during our trip to New Orleans during the pandemic. We ordered to share.

The Peacemaker (mix & match between to benedicts)
- Chicken St. Charles was crispy on the outside but still moist for the chicken and the buttermilk biscuit was light and tasty 
- Eggs Cochon had a generous amount of braised pork and the hollandaise was perfect  

Salmon Avocado Toast 
- The poached egg was prepared to a tee, the fried capers on top at the end was a great touch 

But the best part of the breakfast was actually the creamy vanilla spiced latte - this is a must order here !

After running around in the heat and drinking a few beers for running of the bulls, my friends and I were craving a delicious brunch. They don't take reservations, so we ended up waiting about an hour. The wait wasn't too bad. We stood outside in the shade and enjoyed a few beverages. They serve bloody Mary's and champagne with OJ, blackberries, and other yummy drinks! 

For lunch I had the migas. They were so good! The scrambled eggs mixed with onions, tomato, cheese, and chorizo. The eggs are served on a bed of thinly cut crispy tortilla chips. The dish is served with a avocado and chipotle sour cream. It was such a well balanced meal and felt super light. It was exactly what I needed after such an eventful morning! My friends and I also shared a side of the fries and stone ground grits. The fries were so good! Thin and crispy, not too salty. 

The service was okay. They were very busy and may have been training. Our server didn't come by often, but when she did, she promptly followed up on our requests. She was also very nice and split out check by our seat number. Overall, a good brunch and worth the wait!

Food was great! Highly suggest the southern breakfast. The brioche French test was ok, it was kind of thin and not very warm. The best part of the meal is the homemade biscuit and honey butter that it comes with! The service here is subpar, but the environment is great! If you use the online waitlist, the wait will not be long.

This place is a must try in New Orleans! They are busy, so you can expect a little wait.

Service: The service overall was good. Our server was new but very personable and attentive for the most part. 

Food: the food was amazing! I started with their fried green tomatoes, and they were definitely the best I have ever had. I highly recommend them for an appetizer. The mimosa flight was ok. Some of the flavors weren't very tasty. My entree was the sweet heat chicken & French toast bites. Definitely recommend! The chicken was well seasoned and crispy. The French toast bites were great as well. Everyone at our table enjoyed their food.

They would have gotten 5 stars but the service at times was a little slow. Overall must try place!!

This is a busy place with delicious food! We got here around 9am on a Friday morning and there was a big crowd waiting already. Luckily, we were able to snag 2 seats at the bar. 

We got the 3 Little Pigs Omelette and the Migas dish. Both were really good! I finished the entire omelete, something I normally never do. The meat was flavorful, although there was a bit of excess oil atop of the omelette. 

The Migas came atop some tortilla chips. I do wish there was a bit more avocado to this dish. Not sure if the cream sauce is homemade, but that was good as well.

I wish we had more time to come back and try more dishes but we will stop by again our time time in town.

Great brunch spot, especially for the morning where you woke up after drinking ridiculously too much the previous night. You'll get all the carbs here you need to soak up that leftover alcohol and get that belly ready for more debauchery. Had some awesome sausage gravy biscuits and some fried chicken. Definitely worth the wait outside. If you are lucky, you may have Darth Vader entertain you with his music and cool dance moves.

This place was so packed that there was a 2.5 hour waiting list by 9a.  So, you'd think that long of a list meant the food would be amazing, but sadly, all I can say is it was okay. 

To be fair, I didn't get anything fancier than s meat lovers omelet, but it honestly wasn't worth the wait. 

Some good notes:  the service was very good, they did offer gluten free toast (though it didn't come buttered), & my husband really enjoyed his dish - a chicken Benedict - but it still wasn't worth the long wait.
Cool place, nice folks, I shall return. Friendly staff, good food. Great representation of NOLA. Love the place.

Super accommodating, great service, loved the food! Magis (sp?) were especially great and the service was phenomenal. They let us get in line ahead of time and worked so hard to help us enjoy the experience even with young kids. We were indecisive and they didn't make us feel like a burden for one second. They also kept everything very clean. Could not recommend a better brunch stop anywhere!

So nice we had to do it Twice!
Came to Nola with my Mom and my Son for my Bornday and the Ruby Slipper and their staff did not disappoint! 
Day 1- My Son and I came on my actual Bornday June 27th. I followed all of the suggestions to avoid a long wait outside and it worked perfectly. So I would suggest you get put on the waitlist and do a couple of things while you wait. But don't go to far and make sure to check your text messages. By doing this we did not stand in any lines and there were 2 lines on this day. From the Hostess all the way up to the Manager the Customer Service is as excellent!
Day2- We bragged about it so much my Mom insisted on coming back on our final day. And once again they did not disappoint. And getting in went just as smooth as the first time.
Everything was delicious.... Everything! That fried grits patty was AMAZING! Hands down our favorite stop!

Great food, great service! 
Came highly recommended and they weren't wrong! We came here on our last day in the city. Immediately, the outer appearance of the Broad St. location was odd... it looks like a government office building from that side... but that's the way our directions gave us. If you come in from the other side of the corner, that's the way in. Cute little cafe with bright colors and chalk-written signs with fun sayings about food, drinks, and brunch. A hipster's dream, but we found out they have the goods to back it up. 
We ordered 2 bloody mary's and an Irish coffee... my Irish coffee was good, but the 2 bloody mary's looked totally different- one was very strong and almost clear, while the second was much thicker and darker with much more mix. Wish I took a side-by-side photo because it was so obviously inconsistent to serve to the same table at the same time. That being said, this was the one and only mishap of the entire meal. 

We ordered the special crawfish benedict and the Eggs Cochon benedict. Both were amazing! The crawfish version was served on a grits cake and the cochon was piled high on a buttermilk biscuit. They could've used HALF the pork on the cochon- at the end, I had enough meat on my plate still to make an entire second order and I had eaten A LOT of pork already. The biscuit was buttery and the sauce was delicious and tangy. My friends raved about the Crawfish Benedict being the best thing they ate the entire trip... and we tried many different places over the week!

They also have a bunch of really cute logo swag, all made with quality fabric that makes you want to wear it. We bought a couple of shirts to commemorate our awesome meal, even though they were kinda pricey ($26 for a t-shirt and $40 for a long sleeve with a hood).

Overall, this is a DON'T MISS when you're visiting NOLA and we will definitely be going back next time we're in town!

The Ruby Slipper is the quintessential spot to visit for brunch in New Orleans! The staff welcomed my friends and I with warm smiles as we started and ended our dining experience. To kick off my brunch, I quenched my thirst with the "Hello Sunshine" which was Gin, grapefruit juice, and raspberry simple syrup. Excited to try beignets for the first time, my friends and I ordered the "Queen Beignets" which were to die for! Lastly, I order the Trifecta because I simply could not decide which Egg Benedict I wanted! For an indecisive foodie like myself it was the perfect selection.
Worth the wait! The sweet heat chicken and French toast bites were so good. Our waitress, Angelina, was amazing.

This place is BOMB! Eat here and you won't regret it. The Bloody Mary was outstanding. Funny thing about that: our server asked if I wanted the spicy bacon flavor or the regular Tito's flavor. I heard "Cheetos" so I said back to her "Cheetos" and she wrote it down and came back with the Bloody Mary. I told my husband, "This is really good but it doesn't taste like Cheetos" and he goes, "She said Tito's!" We had a good laugh about that. Service was outstanding as well, especially from our server, Brandi. Very personable.

Best Breakfast Spot in Town Not to be Missed. Ruby Slipper was recommended to us by our hotel and did not disappoint.  Great menu with a wide variety of delicious options for both those looking to indulge in a decadent meal and those looking for more health conscious choices.  The place was hopping, but we had not trouble getting a table and never felt rushed to leave.  Gina, our server, was fantastic - attentively refreshing our coffee before we could even notice a need.  Joe, the general manager, checked-in to make certain everything was to our liking.  Could not ask for better service.

Well Dorothy they say if the slipper fits... and the reality is the Ruby Slipper fits perfectly for breakfast.  They seem to know what they are doing and execute well.  My southern breakfast with fried green tomatoes and bacon had me skipping down the yellow brick road. Staff were very chill and seemed to like what they do. They have coffee or hair of the dog if you are coming in from a rough night.
Worth the wait and it makes sense that they'd be located all over the quarter. Everything we had was absolutely amazing. Service was fast just like all other locations.
Great Louisiana food.  Nice Bloody Mary. Wonderful for brunch. Worth the wait. Go there you'll enjoy it.

This place was absolutely amazing and delicious. Had the Costa Rican dish for brunch worth the wait in line . Arrive early to sign in because the line can get pretty long especially if you don't want to sit. outside in the heat and prefer the inside seating.

My friend and I were visiting NOLA (from Massachusetts) in the beginning of March, eager to try all of the best dishes during our trip! We were referred by many friends AND locals to the Ruby Slipper, so we decided to check it out. We grabbed bloody Mary's across the street after we put our names in for a table, so it didn't even feel like that long of a wait. Our waiter was fantastic, the place was slammed, and we decided to split the Trifecta, with sides of chorizo and hash. Holy flavor-fest!!! It's a month and a half later, and I'm still craving that delicious  feast. I'd definitely recommend this place to anyone looking for an awesome brunch! You will NOT leave hungry OR unhappy.
It's alright. the food is delicious but the restaurant gets loud and crowded quickly. I prefer other brunch spots

Food was so so good. I had the fried chicken Benedict and the corned beef one. Didn't love the sauce on the corned beef one, but the fried chicken one was fire. Boyfriend had the Cochon Benedict. bomb. We shared the bananas foster French toast. Wow, the caramel sauce was decadent and amazing. Our waitress was Jackie and she was great. Worth the wait.

Food was great. The candy bacon, biscuits and gravy and the green tomatoes app were out of this world. We had the Cochon Benedict and the pork was so amazing. The only thing I don't recommend was the Gallo Pinto. It's not even close to what you get in Costa Rica. The highlight of my afternoon was our server Adam (Newman). He was awesome and made the experience awesome!

If you are looking for an authentic New Orleans place for brunch this is the original ruby slipper. It can be a wait so use the app to get in line. The coffee is a nice strong Chicory flavor. They have great "breakfast drinks" like mimosas and such. There motto is "you can't drink all day if you don't start in the morning." Then you have to have some amazing morning drinks right!?!? The food is amazing. I recommend the chicken Saint Charles with scrambled eggs instead of poached. We also love the seasonal stuffed French toast. Today it was Nutella cheesecake stuffed French Toast with Raspberry compote! . It was amazing. If you are in Nola you got to go to Ruby Slipper. It's one of our traditions!

Great breakfast spot, all the food was delicious!

It's always the little things about a meal that I love, the omelette had a good variety of filling and lots of  it.  Good cheese ratio too.  Breakfast potatoes had great seasoning and cooked to perfection!  So happy to have great breakfast potatoes.  The biscuit   and butter... Omg if I could just soak it in there... Sso yum.

Praline pancakes were huge, thick n fluffy... Yup just the way you'd like it.  Powdered sugar on top gave a nice light bit of sweet.  Add that honey butter and syrup though for an after breakfast dessert.  Yes I ate two meals for breakfast!

Freddie was  a great server, friendly and hussled!  He seemed like the only server for outside, get the man some help!  I get it though, Covid, restaurant, people... He handled himself and we were cared for.

Thank you for my favorite NOLA meal!
tourist trap. there are LOADS of really good brunch spots in new Orleans close by - pretty bummed I wasted time getting in to this spot.
Food was phenomenal. Our server Jack was great as well. Great atmosphere and service was timely.

This use to be my favorite breakfast spot in the city but these sheep are now requiring vaccine cards or negative test to eat inside. Also, the French toast I had was crunchy and only came with 2 pieces of chicken. The presentation was terrible too. Just dumped in the box.
Great place for brunch and breakfast! Lovely outdoor dining. Contactless ordering and payment.
Food is fantastic. Serving southern creole breakfast and lunch. Our waiter Freddy was great.

Food was delicious! Talores and Freddie really made an unnecessary situation (not due to anything they did) and great dining experience.  I had a blast celebrating my 40th birthday at this location. I highly recommend this place.

Ruby Slipper has always been on our must stop by places when visiting NOLA, we were visiting for my daughter's birthday and NYE, we were seated immediately and ordered water and a bellini, we got the water and 10 minutes passed we watched as the other tables were taken care of finally a different server brought the bellini and we said we were ready to order, they said they weren't our server and would tell him we were ready, another 10 minutes passed and the restaurant was filling up, he finally came by and informed us he was responsible for seating people and they were getting busy and that's why we had to wait. We finally ordered the food came out fairly quickly and as always was very good, we've noticed a downturn in service, we were at breakfast over an hour but will go back because of the food.

First time visiting and everyone recommended this place and woah, there were not wrong. Great service! Which is understandable due to COVID, but the service made up for that and more! Freddie was our server. Very delightful and quick. Thank you so much!

This will be a quick and to the point review... I assume if your reading it your hungry and looking for a spot for breakfast! 
This place is beyond touristy and the wait times can be astronomical so I suggest getting in line on the nowait app... Then you can wonder around the city until its your turn to show up for some brunch! They serve a ton of heavy southern style breakfast options and its in my opinion that this is not the spot to watch for waistline, but indulge indulge indulge!
Bloody Mary's were on point, I recommend going for the bacon bloody! Service was friendly but felt a little rushed, I know they have high table turnover here but I wished they would have slowed service down just a smidge. I tried the combo benedicts and they were average, nothing to write home about. 
Would I come back here? Maybe for a bloody mary to-go while I went elsewhere find breakfast. Just wasn't super impressed and in a city with such delicious food and so many options I would rethink coming here.

Ruby slipper is a fantastic restaurant worth any visit to NOLA. I went with a group of four tourists from New England, and we went here on a recommendation. We tried various drinks and I had the fried chicken French toast bites and thoroughly enjoyed it. Other friends had crab cakes and enjoyed that as well. The service was phenomenal, everyone was incredibly kind. Overall an experience you will not regret. Stop searching haha just go here.

Every time I come to NOLA I make sure to stop & eat here. The atmosphere is fun & the employees seem to really enjoy their job. The drinks are delicious & strong. They are known for their specialty of eggs Benedict & you have to try them! So good.
If you are ever in New Orleans this is the place to have breakfast. It was so delicious and the service is amazing. They're friendly and helpful. Did I mention the food was Amazing!!
The Hot-Smoked Salmon Benedict was good, however, I highly recommend the Crawfish & Grits Benedict...It was outstanding.

This is the local brunch spot you do not want to miss!  Excellent friendly/family atmosphere where the Saints fan gather on game day!  The food and service were amazing and kudos to Ashley B for her sign-making skills, enthusiasm and service!

We got SO lucky the morning we came by here as it seemed to be an almost 30 minute wait for most people BUT since we were only a party of 2 we were sat within 5 mins or so, give or take. 

Once we were sat we were immediately given meals and placed our orders right away. It seems like the waitress' having the mobile devices to enter everything into should be implemented everywhere? I thought this was extremely effective, and honestly just pretty neat.

I had the Sausage Gravy Benedict, with the eggs on the side and scrambled instead of on top. The biscuits were good as was the gravy, but they seemed under cooked. The sausage was a little too greasy for my taste, and the eggs were just plain ol' eggs. Seems a little odd to me that a breakfast place doesn't have American cheese, but to each his own.

The creamy vanilla spice latte was delicious. Perfectly sweet.

Came here for breakfast on Monday morning. We reserved a table through yelp before we got there so we didn't have to wait long. We were seated outside on a picnic table. It was really nice out so it was nice to sit outside. The table was super sticky though which was a little uncomfortable at times.

We got the banana's foster french toast to share for the table (we had 3 people total). It was really yummy! The portion was huge, but it was so good! I loved the bananas and all the toppings. I got the shrimp & grits as my entree. It was soo good. The shrimp was cooked perfectly and I loved the way it was seasoned with the grits. It came with a giant biscuit on the side. The biscuit was soo good, it was warm and soft. It was too big for me to finish, but I would definitely come here again and get the same thing! I also loved that the menu had so many options for different things to try (both local and classic options as well!).

5 star redemption!

We had to follow through on our return visit. Why eat here twice when we were swimming food options, some without an hour wait? Because it really is THAT good! Our 1st AND last stop.

You can add yourself to the waitlist right here, after reading this review, unless everyone else does too & crashes the system. 
There's a server making rounds ouside for drink orders, while you wait. We ordered bacon bloodies & vanilla spice lattes. We had our text for a table before finishing the coffee. 

We sampled food and drinks at more places than I will remember. What I will remember is that the absolute best bloody mary we had was right here.
The bennies are phenomenal but, today we opted to try something else: cinnamon swirl pancakes for the hubs - whoa, huge and delicious. They were well balanced and super tender. I went with the shrimp omelette and they did not skimp on the shrimp. Mine was paired with grits & a gigantic biscuit with their take on butter. Neither of us were able to finish, though we both took several "just one more bite" opportunities after the forks were down. I would still recommend starting with bennies- ideally the peacemaker, where you choose 2 kinds on one plate. (VS the standard 2 on 1 kind on a straight order.) My husband, on the other hand, says you hafta try the pancakes. So, my solution, take a friend and share!

The real kicker for me was when the gent next to us very apologetically ordered a special order: salmos avocado toast, no salmon, no egg, no cheese, add shrooms. There pause no response was met with an enthusiastic "yeah, we can do that - whatever you need!" That is great service!

The food is always amazing and you can't go wrong with anything on the menu. If you want to elevate your experience, ask for Jenn. Her customer service acumen is second to none and you will not have to ask for anything as she is one step ahead of whatever you think you might need. Literally the BEST server.....EVER!  #jennrocks
Amazing food !!! Was Alexis firts day she did Amazing !! Anguilla was superb as a supervisor.. good atmosphere will be coming back...highly recommend this place ..

The front desk clerk at our hotel recommended this restaurant to us and of all the amazing food we ate over the weekend, this was definitely our favorite!! The Sweet Heat Chicken & French Toast Bites was a fabulous balance of sweet and spicy, neither being too strong or too bland. I could have licked the platter clean for the Hot Honey glaze over the french toast bites!  My friend has the BBQ Shrimp & Grits, and while normally I'm not a huge grits fan, she gave me a bit of these and they are literally the best shrimp and grits I've had in my life. I'd be hard pressed not to get them daily if I lived locally!!  My Peach Bellini was delicious as well.  Great customer service from our server and the staff as well. This will be our first stop to eat the next time we're in town!

So, by this time, I've definitely been to a ton of breakfast spots in New Orleans, but I'm finding myself capable of constantly finding more! It's obvious that this place has a ton of business knowing that as soon as I walked in, practically every table was filled! The place has sort of a classic feel, you have your bar, booths, and numerous tables made out of old wood. Sort of nostalgic if you ask me. Anyways, lets get onto the actual review.

Chicken St. Charles (4.5/5)

There's always something so satisfying about eggs when it comes to breakfast, lunch, or dinner. The fact that it adds consistency in flavor and texture is the reason why this was the perfect combination with the fried, crispy chicken breast placed on top of a warm buttery biscuit. I always save the yolk for last, and tend to eat around it until there's only the last bit of food left. So, as I placed my fork into the egg white and got a small bite of the chicken, biscuit, and egg together, my mind was definitely blown. I guess you could say I had got so used to seeing "Shrimp & Grits" on every menu, this was refreshing for me. The chicken was perfectly seasoned and the biscuit was soft, crispy and golden. Once I got down to the last piece of the Chicken St. Charles, the yolk was still sitting on top of the piece of chicken which I carefully placed my fork into. The yolk ran over the chicken and piece of biscuit just like a waterfall in Hawaii. 

That one bite was heaven. It was it. Paradise. Cue mic drop. 

Banana's Foster Pain Perdu (4/5)

Nothing really too different from your regular Banana's foster. The french toast was moist, and the distribution of the sauce was perfect. I liked the fact that they used fresh slices of banana on top of the french toast, other then that, not too mind blowing.

In conclusion, the experience was nice, but I certainly think that the one thing which separates the Ruby Slipper from any other breakfast place is their signature benedicts. So, if you do decide to go there, don't pass them up!

Saw on tik tok the Ruby slipper was the place to go. Decided to stop by , i didn't make a reservation like the video has said i was able to walk in. I did go around 2:15pm and they close at 3 so that might be why. I had the lavender mimosa which was so good it had a slight lavender taste after which i loved. We only got the French toast bites app they were very good. I decided to try the pumpkin beignet because i had never had them and heard ruby had good ones. Although i love pumpkin flavored everything i was not impressed by the beignet. The service was amazing !

Although the wait was long, it was worth it! Once we got seated, Freddie our  server took great care of us. He explained the menu well, was patient, and did good getting our food out to us pretty fast. The food was really good. I got the Stuffed French Toast with bacon 
, pork links, and corn beef hash. Everything was so good. I pretty much ate everything, and I didn't finish only because I was full. The portions are very generous. Overall, I would definitely recommend Ruby Slipper.
The food was great! But the coffee was HEAVENLY! It's really hard to find just a good cup of simple coffee but this is the place to go!

Very good food i was able to get in right away came to the bar. Food was great service everything wasgood today! But the food is amazing ! I say them totally at 1:56 seat a party of 10 that had a birthday and the entire staff didn't get mad they treated them as if they came in at 12.  Very good attitude i will be back!

Everything coming  out of the kitchen looked amazing. I had an iced vanilla coffee drink that was refreshing and tasty. The bananas foster french toast might be the best french  toast i've ever had. It was made with a crust loaf of bread (as it should be) instead of sandwich bread like most places. Service was very friendly. It did take about 40 minutes to get my food, but the place was absolutely packed. Keep in mind you might have to wait a couple hours for a table because this placed is busy.

If you're in NOLA for two breakfasts, this is a must for at least one! The BLT inspired Fried Green Tomatoes are a work of art, maybe the best remoulade I've had ever. (The chef from Tableau needs to check these out, to learn a bit about balance of flavor, IMO.) We also had the Saint Charles... and this not-so-lover of biscuits has been converted! If you've got a sweet tooth but love bacon... HI.. PRALINE BACON. It's too good for this world. Service was off the charts fabulous, we loved Sandi!! She embodies southern hospitality and also took some time to give us some great recommendations. Thanks Sandi!

UH-MAY-ZING!!! Absolutely worth the wait and easy to navigate since we checked in on line and were texted when to return for our table. Freddie our server went above and beyond to explain the menu and give insight into choices. The manager (owner?) also chatted us up about the future and values of the expansion of the chain. Highly recommend the Eggs Cochon. Wish we had this place to visit at home.
Newman was one of the best servers I've had in Nola!  I'm from denver and I have to always come here and by far he was the most attentive server.  Love the fried green tomatoes and BnG

I just left from Ruby Slipper Cafe and had an amazing time. The food was spectacular, and vibes were incredible. I would like to shout my waiter LOUIS "YEA YEA"!! He was attentive, provided exceptional customer service, and a dope guy. This establishment needs to give Louis props and love for real for real! Peace and love .
The breakfast food was delicious. We enjoyed every food item and our server Melissa was amazing.  She was attentive, friendly and treated us well.  I highly recommend this establishment.
Not much more I can add to the thousands of other 5 star reviews. The food was delicious, the price was right, and the service was quick and friendly. Can't go wrong coming here for brunch!

Go to their Marigny location, it is much more friendly and the food is much better- but it's closed on Wednesdays, so we ended up here.

The service was ok- got exactly what we needed and not much more. 

The food was ok--- corned beef hash looked unappealing and lacked the freshness and crispy character of the Marigny location. 

The bannana foster french toast is SWEET. Recommend you get the syrup on the side. I love sweet but it was too much even for me. Delicious, but difficult to eat more than a few bites. 

Overall just paled in comparison to their sister location!

Thanks Tony! Not only was the food fabulous but the service was great!! Some of our favs were really Peach Bellini, Ruby Mimosa, Cinnamon Swirl Pancakes, Pig Candy Appetizer, French Toast Bites and Biscuit and Gravy! We will be back again!

When I come to New Orleans, I ALWAYS go to Ruby Slipper for breakfast.  We ate at the one on Magazine Street this morning.  By 8:00 am the place was full.  We had a most excellent waitress, Kayla.  Even though the place was bustling with customers, she was very attentive to our needs. She also kept our cups full without beverages which is a big plus with me for a waitress.  Kayla andRuby Slipper deserve five stars!

We went with a reservation on New Years Day. Check in process was easy with the online waitlist option, and we were seated nearly immediately once we arrived. Our server, David, was absolutely exceptional. After a poor dinner experience elsewhere the night before, David totally restored our dining experience while in NOLA. Everything we ordered was delicious and timely. Would 10/10 recommend again (just use the waitlist feature online)! DAVID FOR PREZ

Not as much space at this location as the restaurant on Canal Street -- it's a little more narrow, there's a smaller waiting area, and the tables are closer together -- but every bit as delicious and worth trying.

DON'T STOP DRINKING -- The bacon-infused vodka bloody Mary is my favorite drink ever. They are generous with the bacon, and the pickled green beans are sublime. I still dream of that drink. All bloody Mary's dull in comparison. AFTER you've had a bloody Mary, continue your day drinking with the peach bellini mimosa, morning margarita, and the boozy iced coffee.

BRUNCH IS LOVE -- I'm an eggs benedict fan, and kudos to the kitchen staff for nailing their poached eggs every time. I HIGHLY recommend: 

1) the Chicken St. Charles -- delicious, crispy fried chicken, topped with a perfect poached egg and a pork cream sauce of goodness. 

2) the Eggs Cochon -- they call it apple-braised "pork debris," which didn't' sound appetizing to me, but I guess it's just a ton of small but delicious pork pieces mounded on a buttermilk biscuit, topped with a poached egg and traditional hollandaise.

3) The Peacemaker for the indecisive -- if you can't choose between the two recommendations above, get one of each! They have plenty other bennies to choose from, so mix and match to your heart's content.

If you're too hung over to go with a creamy sauce, get some pancakes to soak up all the alcohol in your system -- the Pancake Flight will give you a sampling of all the delicious flapjacks they make, but if you have a sweet tooth, I recommend the Cinnamon Swirl Pancakes. Add the pure maple syrup for $1.50 more and thank me later. 

I also found the Southern Breakfast to be a good hang-over meal. Eggs to order, stone-ground grits, the most divine bacon, biscuit, and fried green tomato. Because, healthy choices.

100% the BEST breakfast/brunch place in the world ! On weekends be prepared for a wait. We waited 2.5 hours in line. I used Yelp to get a spot in line ahead of time but we still had to wait. I got a text at 11:07am saying we had been added to the wait list and we got there about 11:30. You have to check in when you get there. It seemed like even though we put our name on the list and we're given a time , they still wen by the time we actually got there. We were not seated till 2:10pm . But per usual we were served Ruby Mimosa, Peach  Bellinis , and ICEd coffee. Got to get there early to avoid a long wait. But trust me it IS worth it!!!!! There is no place like home !!!! 4 stars only because of the wait.

This was a great spot for breakfast! Great morning cocktail selection and a menu that will paralyze you with the inability to choose from so many tantalizing choices. Jazz was a great server and even in spite of the fact of the place getting slammed made sure we got attentive and cheerful service. Bridge was also an awesome hostess who extended enthusiastic New Orleans affection on all of her guests. The food was delicious. The French toast bites were sinful to start off with. I had a breakfast sandwich with every ingredient prepared to perfection. But that leads me to my only quibble-the sandwich came on a plain white hamburger bun. That's really boring and lacking flavor and texture and even from a visual standpoint made it look like fast food sitting on my plate. But I'll be back!

Definitely worth the wait! 
Upon arriving (after setting up an online reservation) we were not greeted, given ill instructions as to what to do next, waited outside, but then were offered drinks to order while waiting. This was a plus, but a bit futile, seeing as we were seated two minutes after getting our drinks. But that's my only complaint! . Our hostess was a breath of fresh air. She was not only friendly but knowledgeable about the menu and gave her recommendations and crowd faves. The food was hands down the best brunch and hangover food!  So glad we stumbled upon this gem. The long line seemed to be a thing each day if the weekend, but I'm sure because everyone in town knows it's a must. I'd give 4.5 stars if my patience was what it used to be at 25 .  Also we went in August of 2021 a week before Ida hit... I hope this place was not heavily impacted

LOVED THIS PLACE!! 
 we have never been to New Orleans, but I saw all the reviews on Yell and figured we give it a shot. 
 When we got there it was CRAZY busy, which is normally a good sign that it's good. Definitely make Reservations. 
After we checked in, it was maybe a 5 minute wait since we had a reservation. We waited maybe 30 minutes for our food, but the time flew by! They had so many drink offers. We definitely recommend doing their seasonal mimosa float! 
 This place is definitely interesting to look at. 
 We plan on eating here again when we come back!

If you complain about this place you have issues. The food is fantastic service is phenomenal and yes there will be a wait week you're in a tourist city and the restaurant is across the street from two massive hotels and there's probably six other hotels within three blocks. almost anything you get will be top-notch. try going to their website and putting yourself on the waitlist ahead of time we've done it we walked one block and walked right into our table.

Meh...

I heard a lot about the Ruby Slipper and the line is always down the block. So, hey, let's give it a go! 

Use the No Wait app to get a good head start on the line. That was a plus for this experience. The staff is super friendly and full of smiles, love and "baby's". The hospitality that is Nola. 

We ordered the Peacemaker -  Shrimp Boogaloo and St Charles Chicken and a side of Fried Green Tomatoes.   They were both lacking flavor.  There were maybe two shrimp on the shrimp dish. The biscuits were awesome though!  The salsa used on the shrimp dish was good and helped the dish along. If you order this, order an additional side of sauce.   However the sauce used on the chicken was bland also. It wasn't memorable. 

I love the atmosphere here and the story behind the restaurant. It's packed all the time and they've won best brunch many years in a row, so there must be many more elevated taste buds than mine out there.

And...the bathroom could use a serious upgrade and cleaning. Just an FYI...

You will wait to eat here. It is worth it. Definitely go online and put your name on the wait list before heading over to save yourself some time. 

When you roll up you might miss the place. The street side is non-descript but walk down the alley and you'll be greeted by a cute backyard like atmosphere. (see photo) 

I think the coolest part is the walk up window to order drinks while you wait! (and even if you put your name on the list ahead of time, you will also wait) 

All of the food was great and I even had a breakfast margarita! I was having a difficult time choosing an Eggs Benedict when I noticed the Peacemaker. You could get one each of two different benedicts, so I couldn't pass that up.

There is a lot of good food in New Orleans, but I can see why this is on everyone's list of must eat at places

Man great service and honesty.. Thank you Freddie for your honesty and service, thank you Shaun, Evan, Thomas and David (the cooks) for timely good and hot food with generous portions. Ruby Slippers will most definitely be my last breakfast spot before I leave NOLA.

I highly recommend you use the virtual wait list via Yelp. This place gets really busy during Sunday brunch.  The food and service were both superb! I had the margarita for brunch and it was great!!  Definitely try their seasonal items.  The menu is great and our server helped us decide with our decisions! Highly recommend!!

Delicious food!  We had a group of seven and each of us ordered different food and nobody in the group was disappointed.  Service was wonderful and very attentive.  When you have a big group you need to make sure you are all there or they won't put you in the list.  Really great experience overall
Amazing food and service! Besides the wait but don't get discouraged it's worth the wait!!!
Great food. Didn't like the pomegranate mimosas. It had pulp n can hardly taste the pomegranate
Delicious. I got the crawfish Benedict and the St. Charles. So flavorful, cooked perfectly. Bloody Mary and great. Atmosphere was a little lacking but no real complaints. Great brunch spot!
Delicious brunch. Jump on the waiting list located on the website before you head out to limit your wait.

Found this local gem close to my hotel on a stay recently and was not let down. 
We got there at a decent time on a sunday that wasn't too crazy, as I've heard the line and wait can get pretty long. We only had to wait about 10 minutes to get seated.

The menu was a great brunch menu with plenty of good southern flare. I had the Chicken St. Charles, which was a nice southern take on eggs benedicts with fried chicken. It had so much flavor, as well as was very filling. My friend had had to have their Bananas Foster Pain Perdu and was very satisfied with her choice! 

If you have the time and can snag a seat without too long a line I completely recommend this place.

I love this place and every time I visit New Orleans I come to one of their locations!! Awesome food, great attentive staff. Even during covid there was a long line but checking in on Yelp made it shorter as we waited to walk over until we were closer to the front of the line.

This was one of our first stops in the morning before we did a full day of foodie stops. We ordered 3 different types of eggs Benedict's but I ordered the Peacemaker - which allowed me to pick two! The two I decided on was the Smoked Salmon and the Eggs Cochon. Not bad. The egg was still runny - which is a good thing. The biscuit was average. The toppings weren't amazing to warrant a crazy rating. They were just okay.
Worth the wait!!! We had about a 2 hour wait and walked around taking in the area. Freddie took care of us and everything was AMAZING!
Don't sleep on the Ruby Slipper. The food is delicious, the seasonal Praline beignet is a must try .

The Food was good but  I didn't have a bad food experience in New Orleans. We sat outside for breakfast at the ruby slipper. Man if nothing else the free and natural entertainment of the area was worth it all!!! All in all Great breakfast
Good food, large plates, pleasant service, tons of menu options including typical New Orleans fare as well as unusual takes on staples.
Food was amazing ! Staff is on point ! Those coffees I could drink all day and even for dessert! Great spot close to the quarter

Get on the wait list before you arrive! The wait is ridiculous but once you get your food,  you understand why. Yum! Service was great and ambiance is nice. They have outdoor seating which only the most desperate of us took. The heat was sweltering! There's limited street parking.  The drinks are STRONG!  Will definitely visit again.
Freddie was a great server! Everyone was wearing masks and the service and food was great.

As a self-proclaimed "breakfast/brunch junkie!" Ruby Slipper changed the game! On my last NOLA visit, we stopped in for Saturday brunch. The wait was about 45 minutes, but TOTALLY worth it. I never, ever mind waiting on good food coupled with great service! The food looks great, and tastes even better! Our server was amazing, super friendly, and gave excellent recommendations!  We tried the creole Benedict, French toast, and the Chicken St. Charles... HEAVEN ON EARTH! Choosing the Ruby Slipper was definitely one of my proudest moments during my New Orleans visit, and I'll be back for sure!

From the positive reviews I was excited to eat at Ruby slipper Cafe. Sadly it was a disappointment, I wouldn't recommend it to a friend or rush to come back. 
I had a Bloody Mary, the peacemaker eggs Benedict, shared the bananas foster French toast with BF, who also had the breakfast sandwich and a coffee. First off, the portions were laughably small. We left hungry... The meal cost over $60 for two people. 
My Benedict was mushy and lukewarm at best as though it sat there quite a while Before being brought to me. The Bananas Foster I wanted to love but it too was barely warm and didn't taste buttery but tasted of artificial flavorings. My BF's Breakfast sandwich just looked naked/sad and again a very small portion.
I wanted to love this place, sadly I did not.

The food is very good. The woman that is seating people picks and chooses who she wants to go. We had four of us in our party. She sat a party of four that asked us how to check in 10 minutes before us. The hostess try to lie about it when we asked.

Horrid, not one partially positive thing might I offer.   Staff: Horrid,   Food: Horrid,  Location: OK but the inside was unbelievably loud.  

The coffee was cold and so so bitter.   The food was a poor presentation.   Just really, really pathetic.   Both my partner and I have frequented this restaurant in the past.   It was or used to be OK, maybe even good when it was in the little converted house off of Canal. 

But now we give it a big thumbs down!!
The food and service was really great. It was a very long wait, which I didn't like, but it was also a weekend when we went.

We were all pretty excited to try this place because it had pretty good reviews (plus we love brunch). The wait list seems a little inaccurate because when we arrived, there was an hour wait before we could be seated. I did like how there was a drink waitress who specifically placed the drink orders for those of us who were waiting.

I ordered two things (yes I'm greedy): the crispy chicken filet and the seasonal stuffed French toast. The crispy chicken filet (served with shoestring fries) was definitely crispy, but it was a bit underseasoned. I thought I wouldn't like the citrus coleslaw but that and the mayo definitely helped to add flavor to it. The seasonal stuffed French toast was bomb! It was too large slices of French toast bread with the filling in the middle like a sandwich. Also, this came with bacon which was cooked perfectly.

The worst thing about this place was the speediness of the service. Because we waited so long, everyone knew what they wanted to eat. It took just about another hour for us to get our food. Talk about HANGRY. Also, we didn't really get to enjoy our food because it was so rushed. We had a swamp tour that same day, so we were on a schedule which became tight because of the slowness of the service.

Went to the location off of Broad. We were served by Lexy and we had an amazing experience!!! First impressions are lasting impressions. She made the overall experience wonderful. From firstly greeting us to the moment we left. I will definitely come back and ask for Lexy again!!!!!!

This is one of the busiest breakfast/lunch places in New Orleans. Get there before nine or y'all will wait on the line.

For such an excellent place, they lose a star because they are really great at the specials, but they often leave the day-to-day meals, particularly in sides like potatoes, to people who don't exercise the same care and attention to details. Keep someone over that skillet making the skillet potatoes, and don't leave them until they are dry and dead.  You also don't want anyone humming the Blues Brothers "Rubber Biscuit" when you serve yours, and unfortunately, I was going all Dan Ackroyd after trying one.

If you stick to the specials you won't be disappointed. I had a catfish with polenta cakes that was beyond excellent, and a Bloody Mary that was tasty and inventive. They have other nifty specialty drinks that dress up brunch, and roll back 5 o'clock to 9am in the N'Awlins style 7 days a week.

Service was excellent. The wait wasn't too bad during Jazz Fest, about 30-40 minutes, although I hear that doesn't change.

Stanley over on Jackson Square is still the champ in this class, but Ruby Slipper is definitely No. 2.  Rather than getting the slop at Mother's down the street, roll up here and try something a bit more creative in an restaurant that is frankly less dodgy looking.

Visited New Orleans for my birthday weekend with my husband  9/18/14 thru 9/20/14. The concierge at our hotel recommended The Ruby Slipper for breakfast. Pleasantly surprised by this restaurant. Not a super fancy place  - if that's what you're looking for - but the food was great and the staff was extremely pleasant. Demetra was our waitress, fantastic attitude, great service, great food. We actually went back the following day for breakfast as well and asked for Demetra again. Considering we are from NY and very picky about food, we thought this place was great - definitely worth the wait to get seated!

PattyG
Valley Stream, NY
We had a long wait but it was worth it.  The food was delicious, fried green tomatoes a must have !!
popular place for late breakfast and worth the wait.  We liked it that they took our coffee order in line so at least we have while we wait.  One of our to go place and we are glad we tried it.

Although my friends that are transplants from the midwest love this breakfast place I was not a true fan.  They bring all their friends to this local joint for a good breakfast done southern style.  I can say that my migas were just an average breakfast.  The only shining star here was the ice latte.  Fresh cup and ice cold.  It definitely cooled me down and woke me up.

Yooooo this food is so good! The drinks are incredible and service is remarkable. Get there early bc it is v crowded (especially brunch time-had to wait an hr to get seated) but the wait is worth it & u can drink / lounge while doing it! 
I had the crab cake eggs Benedict and oof - forever changed

Who can go wrong with such an adorable name? That's at least what I thought when diving into the special of the day, the Creme brûlée stuffed French toast. Sounds amazing, right?

It was good, don't get me wrong, but it didn't blow my mind like I thought it would. And I've decided why. I think it would have done much better with a brioche bread. I just wasn't digging the baguette. It didn't absorb the egg and flavors that I barely tasted. It wasn't horrible, it just could have been so so much better.

What was amazing was my double mimosa. Thanks for that. Anywhere you can order up a double on vacation is alright with me!
1hr wait to be seated. 1 hr to be searched but so worth the wait!! Delicious food and great service!!
Great food and great service. This place came highly recommended from our hotel. I can't say enough enough good things about this place. Everything on the menu is worth it to try!

This place was our favorite brunch stop in New Orleans for a long time. The eggs Benedicts, stuffed French toast, and different flavors of pancakes are all delicious. I'd highly recommend any of their cocktails as well!

Ruby slipper happens to be the only restaurant where I've eaten breakfast in Nola; probably because it's delicious. If you like fried green tomatoes, crispy bacon, and huge mimosas, then this is the place for you. Did I mention that their biscuits are almost as big as your head?  

There are multiple locations around Nola. At this location, the service is great, and the space is nicely decorated complete with a wall hanging describing the meaning behind the restaurant's name. I won't spoil that for you. This seems to be a hot spot for local business people to grab a working breakfast before heading to the office, but they welcome tourists with open arms, and was crowded by 7:30am. It's a good spot for groups, or just a couple. It's worth the trip just for the biscuits.

When we got here there was a line of people wanting to get in but we did not wait more than 5 minutes to be seated. I ordered their OATMILK LATTE and when I tell you this is the BEST LATTE IVE EVER HAD!!!! And their fried tomatoes were delicious as well!!! I will be recommending this place to everyone visiting New Orleans!!! :)

This was the worst dining experience I've ever had in New Orleans; and my family is from New Orleans so I've been there more times than I can count. 

We used the no wait app and arrived at the suggested time and had to wait an additional hour to be seated. The only seating available after an hour wait was outside (we made it work, after asking to be moved from sitting very close to the dumpster.) 

Our server Nicole was not attentive at all. My mom waited 45 mins for her drink. We had to ask for napkins, to go boxes, straws, refills, condiments, and more several times.  

EVERYONE's food was cold or room temperature. We decided to just deal with it. My aunt's pancakes were so undercooked that you could see the dough once you cut into them. She asked for a new (warmer) plate and the Nicole brought out a new plate literally 2 minutes later. So it was obviously not made for my aunt because how would they have fixed the plate so quickly? SURPRISE SURPRISE ... that food was cold too! 

We spoke to the manager about the cold food...his response? Sitting outside is what caused the food to drop in temp. At this point, we are all scratching our heads. Number one...it's JULY...sitting outside should not cause my food to be cold. Number two...I am from Texas where outside seating is the norm and I'd never had this problem before. Number 3...I couldn't believe a manager was telling me the reason our entire tables food was cold was because our waiter had to bring it to one of their outside tables. A simple apology would have sufficed. 

I've heard people say this place is great. Maybe we picked a bad day. But I was highly disappointed. I travel a lot, and you can check my reviews. I'm not one to just leave bad reviews for the heck of it. But this experience was so bad...I said at the beginning that this was my worst experience in New Orleans...I take that back...this was one of my worst dining experiences in my 25 years of existence.
Ate here twice in one week. Once was not enough. Biscuits are huge.. awesome. Eggs bacon. Also very good!

First off, I was surprised to know there were 3 locations!!!  We tried getting into the big one but unsuccessful.  We left the hotel and turned opposite direction and found the one on Decatur and well worth the wait of 15min!  I got the peacemaker Benedict w/salmon & fried chicken and the Ruby Slipper cocktail and all very delicious.  My poached eggs were a bit overcooked but as soon as my waitress, Liz, saw it, she quickly brought me 2 new perfectly cooked poached eggs.   Next time I visit NOLA, this will be my next stop.

I dream about this place since I've had some of their DELICIOUS eggs Benedict. I got the cochon and corned beef Benedict. My favorite was the cochon because that pork was to dieeeee for. The corned beef was delicious too, but daaang that pork . I really recommend stopping here while in New Orleans. We sat at the bar and had some fabulous service.

Oh, Ruby Slipper. It pains me writing this because I wanted to love this place so badly! I had been planning on stopping here on our trip to New Orleans because my friends had been raving about it. We checked into the waitlist on yelp but still had to wait for awhile when we got to restaurant, which is okay. This place is very popular so if you are going at a high traffic time you should plan on a bit of a wait. One thing I really liked is that you could purchase a drink or alcoholic beverage to enjoy while you were waiting. When we finally got seated at the bar we ordered drinks and food. We got our drinks and waited for our food. And we waited, and waited, and waited. After almost 30 minutes the bar tender noticed our food still hadn't come out and went to check on it. Which is not the bar tenders fault whatsoever, but of course we're hungry so we're getting a bit impatient. Finally when our food came out, the shrimp in my fiancée's shrimp and grits were definitely undercooked. But at that point we'd be there so long we were just over it so he ate what he could instead of sending it back and ate part of my meal that definitely was more noteworthy than his food. While I really was looking forward to eating here, I honestly felt like it left me really disappointed and wasn't worth the wait whatsoever.
Yummie Yummy Yums!!! OMG. The wait was totally worth it. Best breakfast to start my day. Definitely going back in the morning.

Always awesome Brunch spot on a Sunday. We had to wait about 20 minutes, but that went by quickly because Jennifer brought us some fantastic bacon infused Bloody Marys and a blueberry mimosa. 

After we sat down with our drinks, our server Freddy came and brought us waters without hesitation and gave us time to order even during a busy rush. He answered all the questions we had and got our order in quickly.

We ordered A Croque Madame, Southern Breakfast and Light Migas.

All were delicious, the Bacon is absolutely to die for.

The only thing we would have liked is more of the Croque Madame cheese sauce to be on the sandwich, but we got some to go.

We always love our trips to Ruby Slipper, and we'll be back for more!

This place is amazing! The biscuits and butter are delicious. All of the food is fresh and homemade! The vibe is here kind of hipster, but it's very friendly! The staff was always helpful and consistent on refilling our drinks! I can't wait to come back!

The brunch food here was delicious!!

Came here for Sunday brunch, and there was a long wait!  (Tip: on the Yelp app, you can add yourself to their waitlist--it will tell you how long the wait is for your party size and you don't have to arrive until close to that time.)  Lucky for us, I added us to the waitlist, so after I checked in with the host, my party was seated within just a few minutes--it was awesome!

They lost half a star rating because they had ran out of the Chicken St. Charles dish (it was about 2pm when I ordered)--I was so disappointed; was really looking forward to trying this one.  But we did order 3 amazing dishes to share: Eggs Cochon, BBQ Shrimp & Grits, and the Bananas Foster Pain Perdu--all were Ruby Slipper Signature Items.  I do recommend all three--they tasted delicious--but if you don't have a sweet tooth, you can skip the bananas foster (it's a french toast type dish--they don't use the normal thick sandwich bread but instead, a baguette type bread)

My friend had the bacon infused Blood Mary and said it was great (I didn't get a chance to try it).  I had the Screwdriver--it wasn't that great--mostly orange juice and very little vodka.  My other friend had a Ruby Slipper Mimosa (OJ and pomegranate)--it was good--there was tons of sparkling wine in it!

Our server was very friendly but she didn't come around too often--so we were left waiting a couple of times.  However, the food was awesome--I would totally recommend this place for brunch to any friends visiting New Orleans.

Really tasty! I'm happy I walked by here on my way to a conference. I was seated immediately at the bar and had a nice cup of coffee. I decided on the french toast with chicken sausage. It came out shortly and it was a pretty big portion, really enough for 2. Minus the sausage. The whipped butter and syrup was delicious with this meal. I loved the decor and vibe of the place too. I managed to notice on the wall that they named it Ruby Slipper because after Hurricane Katrina, there was a "homecoming" when people returned to the city. "There's no place like home". Indeed!

Okay this place was beyond disappointing....P and I came here for brunch and we waited perhaps, 30 minutes in line.

Okay P love the fact coke was automatically refilled here and I love the fact the Bloody Mary here contained the best thing ever......SPICY PICKLED STRING BEANS. That alone gets 5 stars from me and I wish they would jar this up and sell it. It's so damn good.

But I am sorry, I can't just give this place 5 stars for some garnish or could I come to this restaurant and just order a plate of their pickled string beans.

I came here expecting this place to knock my socks off, but it didn't.

P and I both got the Peacemaker for the Benedict, because we wanted to try more than one and this option gives you the ability to mix and match any two of their signature Benedict.

P got these two:
SHRIMP BOOGALOO BENEDICT - Gulf shrimp sautéed with pork tasso, served over fried green tomatoes & a buttermilk biscuit, topped with poached eggs, finished with Coubion sauce
This didn't look pretty or tasted pretty. WTH is this? At first, I wanted this, but since P ordered it, I didn't want to get the same thing and I was a bit jealous, but after tasting it, we both were like whomp whomp.

EGGS COCHON - Slow-cooked, apple-braised pork debris served over a buttermilk biscuit, 
topped with two poached eggs, finished with hollandaise.
Okay, why is this a popular dish? It wasn't good, I don't know what the hell I am eating here.

CHICKEN ST. CHARLES - Fried chicken breast served over a buttermilk biscuit, topped
with two poached eggs, finished with a pork tasso cream sauce
This was another restaurant favourite and again, why? The chicken is dry and the biscuits are the worst biscuits I ever had in the South. This is blasphemy. I couldn't even eat the biscuits...they were hard as a rock.

HOT-SMOKED SALMON BENNIE - Salmon hot-smoked in-house served over a buttermilk biscuit, topped with two poached eggs, finished with red onion, flash-fried capers & dill hollandaise
Okay, before I even ordered my meal, I was in between what I wanted. I wasn't sure if I should get specialties or the Benedict. When I finally decided just to go with the Peacemaker,, I asked the waitress SPECIFICALLY if I should do the Smoked Salmon, Corn Beef or the Eggs Blackstone. She said, do the Smoked Salmon.
When my dish arrived, I noticed my Smoked Salmon was not smoked at all. It was like a regular cooked salmon, which I hate eating and so I called the waitress over. I said this isn't smoked salmon and she replied, we don't have smoked salmon.
Yes, my bad for overlooking the pre-fix word "HOT", but since I didn't even know it was hot, I kept saying Smoked Salmon to this waitress and she even repeated back to me the same thing, SMOKED SALMON. Why would you now say you don't have it? She could have corrected me and said Hot Smoked, but instead she used the same verbiage as me and Smoked Salmon is totally different than Hot Smoked Salmon.
Yeah, I definitely didn't enjoy this dish at all. Salmon is not done well - I can do regular cooked salmon if you have the skills to execute it properly, but this was not the case.

Yeah....nopes. I would definitely come back just for the pickled string beans.

Visited during one of the busiest weekends: Essence Festival Weekend On day 1. Reserved a spot on Yelp and was 76 in line. From the host to the prep staff everyone seemed to be remaining calm under pressure and very helpful. 

I ordered a cranberry Mimosa while I waited for a seat. It was delish except it would have been nice to have ice in it as I was waiting outside in NOLA heat. Once seated at the bar I ordered a Vanilla iced coffee, which was amazing and cinnamon pancakes. Nothing special about my meal. 

The staff was super nice the Manager Opal came by to chat with us while we waited (after they were closed), someone from staff gave us food tips knowing we were from out of town, and one of the Bus staff members, Lance  went above to get my friend a new chair. 

I will definitely be visiting again.

Shelby is THE BEST!!!!! The bread pudding pancakes that she recommended were the bomb!!!  She was very personable, cool,& gave exceptional service. If we ever come back to visit we WILL  suggest  Shelby as our server. Thank you for your hospitality:)

Excellent Bloody Mary and a really good Bl2T.  The place was packed and we had to wait 45 minutes for a table, but once we got one the service was good, the prices moderate, and the food was good. Can't ask for much more!

Came here right when they weee open to avoid long lines. Got seated outside right away. Ordered The Trifecta, a side of bacon, and a creamy vanilla iced latte. The food was okay, all the yolks for the benedicts were overdone, bacon was good and the coffee was good. Not a very good service at all as we felt like we were forgotten that we were there. Good thing we did not have to wait to be seated. It was only an okay food experience coupled with a subpar service.

Loved the setting! Loved the outdoor seating and heaters! Most of all, loved the food! Will definitely be back. Started with the fried green tomatoes and then moved on and tried the salmon Benedict as well as the trifecta Benedict so we had many options! All AMAZING and washed it down with a mimosa!!
Seriously screams NOLA!!! Great bloody Mary's, eggs Benedict! Worth any wait time!! The earlier you get there obviously the shorter wait. BUT worth the food & experience. Wonderful wait staff.

This was the best brunch we had while in NOLA. The Chicken St. Charles and eggs black stone were fantastic and my husband loved his fried chicken sandwich. I unfortunately couldn't indulge in the brunch beverages but he thoroughly enjoyed the bacon bloody and the morning margarita. Highly recommend this spot! Get on Yelps waitlist to avoid waiting outside for a spot

Ruby Slipper was my last stop bfr my flight home. (after this trip I don't want to see food for the rest of the WEEK LOL). 
But let's get into it !!
First off ima start by saying the food here is AMAZINGGG !!!!! everything was so good, hot, and tasty !!! 
The bacon pieces are a "starter" meal. they do have praline on it so you get this sweet bacon and it is so good !! 
the crawfish Benedict was seasoned well and really good.
but that Hot and Honey chicken with french toast bites is TOP TIER !! i usually HATE chicken but this was so damn good and the french toast bites are covered with cinnamon and have a slight crunchy/fried taste to them. just everything i needed before my flight home !! 
The mimosa was kinda weak ! soon as i saw a dark orange cup hit the table, I knew i was abt to be drinking mostly OJ, but the food is so good i'll let them slide on that one LOL. 

Customer service was on point. Everyone was greeting us with a smile and kind !! 
I came here on a early monday morning, but I've heard this place is VERY BUSY, so if you want to eat with out a wait, GO EARLY !! This place is a MUST TRY !! 
pricing is mid range !! 


IG: Maserati_Holly

Visited this location in the central business district. Absolutely loved it. Best part was they had an online queue for reservations. You didn't have to wait until you got to the lace to put your name down and you will wait. It was extremely busy and although I was there on vacation, it seems like a place that is regularly bumping with customers. 

We sat outside on patio, had a fantastic server who was attentive and helpful. Food came out at a good pace and it was delish. There was a lot of good stuff on the menu to choose from - it was tough! 

Not pictures apps were bacon biter and French toast bites. Pictured is a side of corned beef hash and the Peacemaker, 2 benedicts bayou shrimp and crawfish and grits. 

Highly recommend if you can make it here!

We came here for breakfast on a Friday morning around 830. It's a smaller establishment but we got seated right away.  It became busier later.  I had the southern breakfast of eggs, bacon,  grits, and a fried green tomato.  I also had the ruby mimosa. It was all very good, service was good. I would go back!
