Yum! Went here for breakfast! Tried the French toast and fried green tomato BLT. Also had a Bloody Mary. Buy one get on free for bloody Mary's and. Mimosas Sunday morning! Food was great and flavorful! The French toast was amazing! Wait is long but you can get your name on the waitlist on yelp so that's a great feature!

Excellent food and excellent service!! We were there for a business trip and ate here for brunch. We used the No wait app and put our name in while still in meetings. Got out and only waited a few minutes before being seated. Our server Devon was   Helpful and witty. Made our experience there even better. We all 4 ordered different meals and they were all DELICIOUS!! Plus, a side of candy bacon to top it off. We quickly learned why they have been rated one of New Orleans best for the last 3 years. Highly recommend,  just know that with any good restaurant there is a wait. Our experience so far has taught us if there's a line then it will be worth the wait. Well done Ruby Slipper!

Read about this place before I got to NOLA so it was for sure on my list to try. I downloaded the NOWAIT app which was a huge help! This place was right across from our hotel, and every day this line is out the door. Using the app, we got in in maybe 20 mins. Pretty Big size portions. Friendly service, but it sooo awhile to get our food, which I took as, my food will come out fresh and hot. I ordered the "Peacemaker" which allowed you to order 2 different eggs Benedict's. so I ordered the Chicken St Charles and the Eggs Blackstone which has bacon and a tomato. Both served on a biscuits out of the 2, I recommend the Chicken St Charles. Chicken was nice and juicy, and went well together with the poached egg and biscuits. The Blackstone just didn't taste well together to me.  My mom ordered the Three Little Pigs Omelet with a side of grits and a buttermilk pancake. She ate most of it so it was good

We came here for breakfast on a Friday morning around 9AM and luckily joined the waitlist as we were walking from our hotel. The wait was pretty brief and we were promptly seated at a table outside. 

We had a party of 3 so we ordered 3 menu items to share and try: the fried green tomatoes, breakfast tacos, and the trifecta. Each dish came with 3 items so it was perfect. Everything was delicious and well portioned. I highly recommend the Trifecta if you are sharing and want to try a variety. My favorite was the Chicken St. Charles, but the Eggs Cochon was a close second. 

The fried green tomatoes were a great starter. The breakfast tacos were very filling and good, but we could have probably skipped it because we barely could finish our meal. BUT, if you are craving breakfast tacos, those would hit the spot.
I go to the Ruby Slipper every time I visit New Orleans. It's my favorite brunch spot. I loved the authentic taste they provide.

Friendly service and very clean. Tables are spaced out with an outdoor option. Breakfast was great and the food was seasoned appropriately. We had the Banana Foster Pain Perdu & Grilled Fish St. Peter (healthier w/hollandaise on the side). 
Plenty of parking in the rear.

Popular NOLA brunch spot - long lines...

Huge portion, good food and service. We came twice during our five days trip in NOLA. Many egg options - benedicts, omelettes, etc. ranging from the classics to more unique ones like Egg Cochon, etc.. as well as stuffed french toast, biscuits, pancakes. Overall a hearty casual brunch with lots of selections. Would recommend a stop by if you visit New Orleans - there are many branches in the city. 

Atmosphere a bit loud but lively.

Ruby slippers food was off the charts! We had king cake French toast and the crawfish & grits eggs Benedict and it might just be the best brunch food item I've ever eaten! The atmosphere is pretty cute too! My only complaint was it seemed like they fit too many customers into the restaurant and they didn't have the wait staff to handle all of it so it took like 30-40 minutes to cash out and leave because we couldn't flag anyone down to come to our table. 

That being said the food was so good I would absolutely return there in a heartbeat, they might've just been short staffed that one day or something, you never know!

This is our absolute favorite breakfast spot! If you go on the weekend be prepared for a little wait. No worries, the staff will offer you some delicious mimosa's while you wait, and WOW is it worth it. My husband loves the stuffed French toast and my go to is the Brioche French Toast - Banana Foster style. The food taste so fresh and the flavors are incredible. This is a MUST for us every time we go to NOLA. We prefer the location that is linked with the Pelham Hotel.

Ruby slippers was really good I ate my food up so fast I forgot to take a picture but the cinnamon bites so good fried green tomatoes was good err thang o and great customers service all the way from Dallas

I had heard alot about Ruby Slipper so I was excited to try the popular New Orleans breakfast spot. We arrived soon after they opened in order to avoid the long lines/ wait. We were seated inside and our orders were taken. Service was subpar. Our waitress brought out the correct order for my friend but the wrong order for me, so it appeared she had taken down the wrong order. After finally getting my actual order, it seemed like our waitress forgot about us as I had to try to flag her down a few times to ask for hot sauce, etc. 

As for my food, I had ordered the one tomato two tomato benedict, and sadly my food was mediocre. Actually, to say it was mediocre is being kind. I really didn't like my Benedict at all. It was drenched in what I think was hollandaise sauce, to the point that the sauce overpowered all other flavors and tastes. My stomach also felt a little queasy the rest of the day. 

The only part of the benedict I actually enjoyed was the biscuit, which was good. Honestly I would have been better off if I just ordered a biscuit with maple butter to go. But at least now I know that if I return to NOLA in the future, I can pass on Ruby Slipper.

Order "The peacemaker" awesome worth every penny
(Shrimp and chicken).Wish I had ordered the trifecta ,it was that good.
Wife ordered Banana pecan genache  was also pleased
Great service,food and atmosphere.
Get there early (before 8:00am) as we were leaving lines began to form.
Amazing food.  Visited from California and dined here twice .  I recommend putting your name on the wait list through their website.  First day was a 3 hour wait but the food is really good.

Once you get past the wait the food and service is amazing. The prices are very reasonable for the amount of food. You get just enough food, during my visit I didn't see people leaving with leftover food. Depending on what day your go you should make a reservation using Yelp because the wait can be over an hour and a half. The biscuits are freshly made and  huge and the cane sugar butter is delicious. I would highly recommend this place for breakfast and brunch.

What a fantastic spot for brunch or breakfast in New Orleans.  First, I love the location off of Bourbon Street.  Check in with the hostess, she'll text you when your table is ready, and walk down the street and check out some of the little galleries while you wait.
This place is hopping busy and once you eat here it is obvious why it is so crowded.  The food is damn good and the coffee is spectacular.  I had the eggs cochon and couldn't have been happier.  And the coffee was great for my aching head (hey, it's New Orleans...you need strong coffee in the morning).

Soooo good for breakfast/brunch. I love that I can Wait in line without having  to actually be there. The eggs Bennie is bomb! They also have a fish platter for breakfast that is just so amazing ! Definitely a spot to try when in New Orleans. There isn't really a waiting area but you can hang around outside and a waiter is outside taking any drink orders.

This place doesn't take reservations however we placed ourselves on the waitlist and made sure to be there during the timeframe they recommended. Once we arrived we were seated right away...while walk ups were being quoted 2 hours. The food was good however the candied bacon and biscuits & gravy are the stand outs by far. My husband got the shrimp and grits which were good but not great.
So good! We put our names on the list online and still waited quite a while but super yummy!

I food coma'd HARD after this meal. Holy shiz. The long wait for this place was warranted. Service was awesome. Southern hospitality at its best. Servings are large so 3 people should share 2 dishes unless you want a serious food coma too.

Banana Foster Pain Perdu: Bacon, raisins, bananas, and powdered sugar on top of some of the best french toast I've ever had. Damn.

Eggs Cochon: aka eggs benedict with braised pork. This was da bomb. Eggs were perfectly cooked and pork was melt-in-your-mouth tender. 

Migas: Good, but not as good as the pain perdu / eggs cochon. 

Tip: Come 45 min before closing to avoid the long line. We waited less than 30 mins.
The Ruby Slipper is special--the business district one especially!  They have a great menu, but the bar and ambiance is what I'll go back for!  Now have Laura make you that bloody Bloody Mary!
Sandy our server was awesome! She was friendly and knowledgeable about the food and we enjoyed our experience . Will definitely come back here on our next visit to New Orleans.

After a twenty minute, we were seated at Ruby Slipper.  Our server immediately came over to the table and greeted us.  He was very warm, friendly and accommodating. We ordered coffees and a Bloody Mary that were both very tasty.

I ordered the southern breakfast with eggs, bacon, potatoes, fried green onion and a biscuit.  My husband had bbq shrimp and grits. Both meals were very, very tasty and reasonably priced.  

Although you may have to wait to be seated, the breakfast is well worth it.  Spend your money here because you won't be disappointed!

This location must do better with wait times.  To tell a group of 3 it will be a 20 minute wait and then an hour later they have still not been seated is a bit ridiculous.  Upon requesting a manager, the hostess stated, "she's a little busy right now."  This same hostess never even made an attempt to get the manager.  10 minutes later another hostess was asked to get the manager, Deirdra, who came over after another 7 minutes to finally speak with me.  I expressed my displeasure and the manager asked if she could seat us.  At that point I no longer wanted to eat at the restaurant.  More importantly, it should not have taken a complaint to the manager to get us seated.  This is the second bad experience we've had at this location in less than six months.  The first misstep was attributed to COVID-reated service issues and was not posted in the reviews.  However, today's less than desired experience makes it obvious this location has ongoing service issues.  I hope they get it together!
Racist place. Gave our table away after waiting an hour to cater to other blacks. Host didn't even try to correct the problem. Pathetic
Skinny migas were delicious, and Angelina was amazing! The line was long, BUT you can order cocktails while you wait.

The wait was long. Got here at 8:32 am and was seated at 9:36 am. It was at the bar. Oh well I guess better than nothing. Had Biscuit and Gravy with 1 pc extra chicken. And Hibby had French toast. Had in the house bloody Mary. Pretty tasty. Our breakfast was ok. Ther service is good. And People are all nice and helpful.
Delicious and unique breakfast options. Great friendly service in a very busy place. Loved the maple dipped bacon appetizer.

Brunch. How hard can it be?  Ok, for a server it's hard because EVERYONE wants their brunch NOW!!!!! and half of them show up hangry or hung over even before the 1-2 hour wait for a table at brunch which is what gives servers at brunch such extraordinary power to make or break the Sunday's of people all over the country.  Good brunch means a good day.  Bad brunch ends in tears, recrimination, divorce!.    With the extraordinary power to shape the entire day of a
 person or group of customers comes
extraordinary responsibility which is something that should be drilled into all wait staff and hosts...along with better pay of course, especially for persons working for Ruby Slipper which is a chain, I.e. corporate, I.e. all you CEO's and admins could definitely pay yourselves less and your wait staff more which would let you hire more competent people.  There, it has been said.  Ruby Slipper out in the Marigny has good Benedict everything, really nice corned beef hash.  Typical reheated hash browns, pretty decent Samosas from a great, responsive, fast bartender. The rest of the service was abysmal.  After putting our names in online an hour and a half
In advance the host informed us it would be about 20-30 minutes more then promptly forgot we existed for about 45 minutes. After reminding the host and getting seated the waitress came by and (this one is on us) we foolishly said give us a minute. 20 or 30 minutes later the waitress came back and on hearing our order informed us that the restaurant was out of the special we wanted. Wish we had been told that right off the bat to save time! Etc etc. It took 45 minutes to get our booby prize order. The best part of the meal was when the table next to us, seated well after us, ordered the special that was "out" . It sure looked good while they were eating it.  Since we all know that you get what you pay for, maybe Ruby Slipper could pony up a little more pay for their wait staff and attract more competent waiters. There are a lot more, options out there for Brunch until they do.

Best breakfast I had on my trip to NOLA. The French toast bites were amazing! We had mimosas & bloody Mary's. I enjoyed 2 different kinds of eggs Benedict. There was a wait to get in (even though we got on their online wait list in advance). Very expensive - close to $75 - but definitely something you should do once!

My wife and I are here on our anniversary. I wanted to surprise her and take her to a good breakfast place this morning. What I got was a surprise for me.  The food was fantastic. The service was great. Our server Freddie H., was a cool server and didn't skip a beat. I can not wait to eat there tomorrow. 
Eggs Benedict Blackstone was one of the best benedicts I have ever had. Soo Good. This place is top notch!!!

Oh my goodness, the food is AMAZING and the atmosphere is wonderful! We're definitely coming back before we leave! Our waiter, Newman, went so far above & beyond to meet our needs & ensure we had a fantastic experience. Perfect spot!! Definitely make it a stop when you're in NOLA! #ChiefsKingdom in the Big Easy!

We stumbled upon the Ruby Slipper Café when leaving our hotel and finding it just across the street. There was a long line that had formed so I knew it must be good. I was excited to find that it is a brunch/breakfast place. Although the line is long, you can get drinks at the bar and drink outside while you wait. The line moved quickly and we waited maybe 30 minutes.

The food does not disappoint. I ordered the Pork Cochon because it was a "signature item." It was apple-braised pulled pork on a buttermilk biscuit, topped with poached eggs and hollandaise. It was good but a LOT of food and very heavy. My husband ordered the corned beef benedict, corned beef benny. It was good too.

Solid food, safe bet.

When I tell you the best food in town oh my God. I had the stuffed French toast with peaches with whip cream my husband had fried green tomato and bacon biscuit egg 
Every single thing we ordered was so decadent sounds divine every bite we close our eyes such an amazing place I hate that we're leaving today because we found this place the last day we were in town I highly recommend it highly

Please get here early in the morning or be prepared to wait in line like a dweeb (lol). The good news is that while you're waiting, you can order drinks. 

The food was very delicious and the staff is very friendly. What I do notice about this restaurant and others in New Orleans is that they have a problem with substituting anything on the menu. But other than that, it's a cool place to eat.

The last time I came to New Orleans over 8 years ago, my family and I ate here and the food was amazing. On my recent trip to New Orleans, I couldn't stop talking about this place to my husband. As soon as we landed, this was the first place that we went to. There was a little wait but not too bad. I ordered the crawfish Benedict that I ordered the first time I came and it did not disappoint. The grit cake is so delicious and the crunch of the outer fried part combined with the creaminess of the inside is such a joy. The crawfish and the sauce on top just brings it all together. I had my eggs poached a little hard as i am not a fan of runny eggs . My husband had the shrimp Benedict's and enjoyed it just as much.  If I could, I would fly back just to have this meal. I really love this place and the food. You will not be disappointed.
This was a tasty restaraunt with quick service, fresh hot coffee (sourced locally from French Truck) and food that came out relatively quick! I recommend the pig candy bacon and shrimp and grits.
Delicious as usual.  We Always stop here for breakfast.  Shrimp and grits were good. Kids loved the pancakes.  I had a little bit of everything.

The ambiance was nice and inviting. Staff was helpful attentive and knowledgeable. 

As you can see, the food plating was impeccable but it lacked the "Southeastern soul food" feel taste and texture that we are accustomed to. 

Food was delicious, but oddly different to the senses and tastebuds. Example: Florida's French toast isn't exactly "toast" lol it's a soft piece of bread battered in egg and fried. However, it's actually toast here and I wasn't expecting that. Call me naïve, but I wasn't expecting sweet croutons.

Great breakfast place.

I eat here often and suggest that you do too.

Good food, good drinks good coffee.

I promise you will enjoy it!

Greatest breakfast ever! Our waitress, Britain, was amazing and very informed and helpful when we were ordering. We got there early, around 8am and waited 2 minutes to be seated. We had the Louisianan, chicken St. Charles, brioche French toast and fish St. Peter. All were very happy with their choices. Bloody Mary was awesome. Got one to go too! Will recommend to family and friends. Thanks for a great start to our day, Britain!!
There is a reason they hv so many stars. Service great and food awesome, live it! Must try their cochon (pork)  benedict. craw fish miga/ scramble egg , smoked salmon omelet.
Looove the ruby slipper. Wonder food. Long wait worth it. Sip a mimosa while waiting.

We arrived at 10:50 and weren't seated until 1:15  The food was delicious, but I think it's overrated for the wait! We didn't get our food until maybe 2pm and by that point you're starving so anything tastes good! The staff was very friendly and I know they are probably undermanned due to COVID. The grits and biscuits were fire though! As for the omelettes and Benedict's it was almost like a nacho cheese sauce you get at a movie theater ain't gonna lie...

So much DELICIOUSNESS happened during this breakfast! I can't even tell you! I've had the privilege of living in San Diego, San Francisco, and Las Vegas and I'm not kidding you... I had the BEST BREAKFAST OF MY LIFE here. If you want scrumptious food and excellent service, come here! Ask for Lance, he's the bomb. :)

This place is amazing!  They do eggs the right way! Nicole is behind the bar and she's amazing to watch. I've never seen a bartender work as hard as she does and she's very pleasant to talk to also. We will be back on our next trip to NOLA!
Wow. Just wow. This is a MUST on anyone's list. We were here to tour Tulane and heard good things about the place. They weren't kidding. Wow. Have the Trifecta.
Always a must when we visit NoLa! Had breakfast this morning and our waitress, Brandi W made it an awesome express!

The line had me fooled. We drove by and saw this long line wrapped around the side of the building so of course we thought "we need this in our lives"...I mean, 50 people in line couldn't be wrong. 

Ruby Slipper has a great story; the post Katrina establishment was founded on a homecoming for its citizens and with lots of love. Great concept. 

The wait wasn't bad; the line moved fairly quickly and the host/hostess were very pleasant. Our server was energetic and helpful. She wanted us to have the best experience while visiting. 

We ordered from the eggs Benedict side of the menu...the FRIED GREEN TOMATOES, SHRIMP BOOGALOO BENEDICT and CHICKEN ST. CHARLES. I decided to use all caps because I found that menu items get lost among a bunch of words. Lol. 

So the food came. It was fresh, and alright. The biscuits were very good, but what sat atop of them lacked originality and flavor. The seasoning and eggs never got along. I think they divorced and moved to different cities. The chicken and its flavor had an argument this morning, and decided it wasn't coming to breakfast. The sauce was lonely and tried to help make up for the seasonings disappearance, but it was too late. 

The fried green tomatoes looked like they would be seasoned well...no, they just breaded them and let the tomatoes fend for themselves. 

The shrimp dish lacked gulf shrimp. I had another very large cut of a fried green tomato that overpowered the biscuit and eggs and 2 garden shrimps. 

Because of the constant flow of people and the numerous awards and accolades, I expected to be blown away. I expected to eat, sleep, and eat again in one sitting. I expected the 4th of July to happen on July 31st in my mouth. I expected a second line on my tongue. What I got was a basic meal. One that resembled rainy Wednesday topped with your dish network losing connection. 

Not worth the line, but it has a cool story.
Food was amazing! Get the French toast bites!!! Delicious. Get the shrimp and grits. Biscuits and their butter is amazing!

Best gluten free breakfast and espresso drinks in town for breakfast. The gravy is better than Daisy dukes and the waitstaff gives a shit more so that Daisy dukes. I had the special with crab cakes and fried tomatoes. The wife had the gluten free French toast. Both were great. The lattes were amazing for the price,

This place is honestly trash, I was so upset because the wait was over 2 hours for old, cold food food... the service was awful, everything tasted like dirty grease... not worth the hype, do not wait in line!

Went for breakfast on a recommendation and even though they were very busy the service was excellent. We sat at the bar and from being seated to finishing our meal it maybe took 40-45 minutes. We tried the eggs Benedict, she got crawfish one and I got the fried green tomato and shrimp, both were delicious and made us wanting more. When back in town I will be a repeat customer
Jack is the best waiter I had on my first trip to Nawlins. I am super picky about service. Cracker Jack for the win!

So I was in New Orleans from Mardi Gras I had planned on stopping at the Ruby Slipper it was one of the places on my must stop list. Well let me tell you it DID NOT disappoint it was so wroth the 1 hour wait for a sit for 1 person. There were groups of 2 plus waiting up to 2 hours. The staff was very friendly  and helpful but my server was the most helpful. I dont think he realize that I wish from out of town and that it was my first at the Ruby Slipper. I torn between the Eggs Benedict and the Bananas Foster
Pain Perdu French Toast. So my server Michael L. said his favorite was the Peace Maker which was my choice of 2 Eggs Benedict and he said he would choose the pulled pork and the fried chicken. So that's what I order along with a Bacon infused BloodyMary. OMG that was the best breakfast I have ever had at a restaurant. So I would like to give a shout out to Michael Thanks man for the awesome suggestion and service you provided. 

Now with all this being said I just need for y'all to put a Ruby Slipper in Oklahoma City  PLEASE!!!!!!!

I ended up coming here a few times because it was very convenient to my hotel, and on the way to the French Quarter. I guess having gone more than once in a 4 or 5 day period should say something. :)

I tried the Eggs Cochon - how could I possibly resist something that contains an ingredient listed as "pork debris??" Glad I tried this. It was a bit sweet with the apple hollandaise, but it was delicious. Devoured. 

I also tried the Migas, and I have to say those were the creamiest scrambled eggs I think I've ever had. It was pretty rich and quite filling, and I had a hard time finishing it, but it was SO good. 

The bloody Marys are also amazingly good. I'd totally hit this up again, and I'd recommend it!
The atmosphere and staff have always been amazing. The food and drinks are amazing as well. Highly recommend breakfast and brunch spot.

This place was super hyped up. It was a 5/10 in all honesty. We put ourselves on the waitlist for a table but ended up sitting at the bar. It took 20 minutes for someone to even take our order. And the food wasn't that good. The only thing really giving this place a 3 is the bartender. He was super nice!

I went here today for breakfast and I enjoyed myself. I read the reviews before I made a decision to give it a try and the reviews were all positive.
I utilized the option on here to add my name to the wait list and I must say it was useful.
When I arrived, I confirmed that they received my wait list request and then I proceeded to wait.
I ordered the 3 pigs omelette. It came with a choice of side and a biscuit.
I changed my choice of cheese to cheddar instead of Swiss. My omelette was delish.
However, I did not care for the biscuit because it was a bit doughy.
Overall this place was quite satisfying!

Ruby Slipper Ratings: 4.4/5 

Food: 4.5/5 - Heard a lot of recommendations about this Brunch place in NOLA, so I have to take my siblings to try it out while we are there. We are glad the wait wasn't too long, and definitely order more than we should, and definitely super stuffed afterwards. You can see the descriptions of our orders below.

- Cinnamon Swirl Pancakes [GET]: Three giant pancakes filled with cinnamon and sugar topped with cream cheese icing. Pancakes were soft and fluffy, with a crispy and buttery outer layer, you can definitely can taste the butter. There's two slices of applewood-smoked bacon served on the side, crispy and tender. The maple syrup was high-quality and tasted amazing. I wasn't a big fan of the cream cheese icing, a bit on the saltier side, but just personal preferences. 

- Sweet Heat Chicken & French Toast Bites [GET]: Fried chicken and fresh strawberries tossed in Mike's Hot Honey Glaze over French toast bites. The fried chicken was phenomenal, super juicy and tasty drenched in sauce, but it wasn't overpowering the chicken. The French toast bites were my favorite. It was airy and light, once again crispy too and dipped in that heavenly sauce. This is the MUST get dish, like chicken with waffles, but much better.  

- Chicken St. Charles Benedicts [GET]: Two fried chicken breast served over a buttermilk biscuit. Fried chicken was tender and juicy. I love the biscuit, because it was moist, buttery, and crunchy on the outer layer. They definitely nailed their biscuits. The eggs was poached perfectly with a running yolk, and finished with a pork Tasso cream sauce. 

- The Peacemaker [GET]: Great option if you cannot decide which Benedicts to get, so you get to mix and match two of their Benedicts. We picked the Bayou Shrimp and Eggs Cochon. The Eggs Cochon was our favorite. The shrimp was fresh, eggs are well poached, and the fried green tomatoes added a great crunch to the Benedict. The pork was well-cooked in their apple-braised pork debris, and the hollandaise sauce gave it a great flavor, and added a nice texture to the biscuits. 

Ambiance: 4.5/5 - Ruby Slipper is located on Magazine Street, walking distance to Jackson Square and the French Quarter. This place has a very cute exterior, looks like the Flatiron building in NYC from an angle. The place is lit with a bunch of people standing in line and waiters bussing to get between us. There's a bar area to sit along with some outdoor seatings as well. Indoor is loud, because it is packed with customers. I would say you can't get any more authentic NOLA experience than having brunch here. 

Price: 4.25/5 - The cinnamon swirl pancakes are $12, sweet heat chicken & French toast bites was $14.50, chicken St. Charles was $15, and lastly the peacemaker is $16. The total after taxes and tips came up to be around $73. Portions are huge, especially the pancakes. We do not know how we finished everything, but definitely left with a food coma. Worth the price I'd say.  

Service: 4.25/5 - I think everyone here was friendly and helpful. The lady at the front was nice, and made sure we were on the waitlist. Our server was attentive, provided some good recommendations and let us know that the kitchen is backed up with orders. The food still came out in a reasonable time, hot and fresh. Had a great experience for sure. 

BLUF: A popular and famous brunch spot you should visit while in NOLA. Make sure to put your name down on the waitlist on their website, and check-in with the host for a shorter wait time. I recommend the Eggs Cochon Benedicts and the Sweet Heat Chicken & French Toast Bites, best dishes at Ruby Slipper.

I stopped in here as it was super packed for a Wednesday morning. I figured I must see what the hype is about! It took over an hour to get a seat at the bar. Unfortunately there was a sour smell where I was sitting and the bartender did not pay me much mind. The food was subpar and the iced coffee was more of a dessert than actual coffee. 

In addition, the Bloody Mary seems to be a very popular drink as they keep a large batch stored in bins on the bar. However, it sits for too long and makes a crust around the edge which did not seem very appealing to me. It was very crowded and took foreverrrer for food to come.

This place is so busy! So there's a long waitlist. Get there early and make sure everyone in your party is there to get seated. 

My friends were waiting for me and it was last minute but they still took us in! Which was super nice. 

The food there 10/10. 
The drinks. I'm sorry but not so much. The Irish coffee, cold brew coffee, and margarita. We didn't end up drinking. 1/10. 

I got a sample of two Benedict's! The one with pork and another with fried chicken. And let me tell you my mouth is watering just thinking about it. The sauce was so rich yet light. Couldn't get enough of it! The chicken so crispy. And the pork was marinaded through and through. And the biscuit I don't know where to begin, it was so moist. The perfect in-between of sweet and savory. 

I also got the appetizer French toast. Don't be fooled by how plain it looks but the bread they use is so fluffy and sweet! But not overly sweet. It was so yummy I should have ordered the full portion.
Such an amazing breakfast and great cocktails! Big menu with lots of choices too! Attentive staff and no wait, if you get there early enough!

Cool breakfast spot in Nola, they have a couple of locations. I did the egg breakfast and had a couple of brunch drinks. Definitely worth checking out with a group! Make sure to join the waitlist before going through yelp, it will give you the wait time and how many ppl are in front of you.

Okay there are brunch and lunch places although this is tops in my humble experience. I got to mix two Benedict's!  The hollandaise is superb and ingredients al over the south. Simple surroundings and fun.
Tommi was great and the food was delicious! I had the three little pigs omelette. I love visiting my sister in NOLA and will definitely be coming back to the Ruby Slipper on Mag

I am not going to write some analytical, fluffed up review. This place is bomb AF, just try it. Get a mimosa. And get there before they close, or you'll be sad. Trust me, it's a classic breakfast, brunch spot that is NOLA awesome.

One of the most creative and unique dishes I tasted so far here in New Orleans. Both seafood dishes obviously but that's what I came for. It is supposed to be one of the best places for seafood and in fact it doesn't disappoint.
The mix of creole and seafood it's the right kind of flavor I was looking for. Both specialties-of-the-house dishes were incredible tasteful. One was the lightly fried catfish in a crostini over sautéed spinach and artichokes with pork tasso (which I discovered here and was completely new fort me) and finished with a tomato creole sauce that kicked ass. The other one, a must! The gulf fish pan seared in top of a grit and cheese cake dressed with sautéed spinach, cherry tomatoes and garnished with a killer killer mustard-like creole sauce. They were both amazing and enormous plates. To share for sure but we were very hungry after a long flight. 
Prices are inexpensive for the amount of food you have but the tax is pretty high like 9% or more I'd say. 
Good service, nice and chill ambience and very close to our hotel. What a great way to start the trip!

I found this place from my fellow yelpers and decided to give it a try. We arrived about 7:30 and to no surprise, it was a wait. It wasn't long before were seated in the packed restaurant. There is also a bar area with a few TVs and a good choice of liquors. 

I ordered French toast, applewood bacon and a side of diced potatoes. It was mediocre and nothing about any of the items stood out. Good but not great. My friend ordered the crawfish migas and thought it was good but a bit soggy. Everyone else ordered pancakes, breakfast sandwich with pork, BBQ grits n grilled shrimp and banana foster pancakes and seemed to enjoy their meals. Our server Racquel was great and very attentive! If you're in the area, I'd recommend trying it and maybe doing something other than pancakes or frenh toast.

I loved this place! I specifically love that you can "reserve" using Yelp! My friends and I went here for brunch. There were 6 of us and we had awesome servers. The bartender stepped outside to talked to us while we waited for our table to get our drink orders. *Cough MIMOSAS Cough* it was delicious and strong!  I got the BLT and it was delicious. I posted a bunch of pictures of our food and the menu!

This place is a must for breakfast. It is a long wait but I'd recommend using yelp to hold your place in line because after you give them your name you cannot wait inside for your name to be called. When we were waiting it was a chilly 45 degrees out. The food was soo good. With it being busy we did not have to wait long for food and server was on it for drinks and everything else.

The Ruby Slipper hands down is one of the best brunch spots. The best is their twists on eggs Benedict. They offer a "trifecta" option, which means you don't have to choose between any favorites. This option was a huge hit with our group. I ordered the breakfast tacos and they were great! Melt in your mouth flavor!
only place that didn't disappoint food wise in the quarter.  get there early or you will be waiting

8 of us stopped in on our way out of New Orleans on a Monday morning. We were seated right away and the waitress was very helpful and nice.  For the most part, most of the food was really good.  The bacon, the grits, the gravy, the eggs, the fried green tomatoes, the pancakes, were all excellent and well priced.  My only complaint was that the biscuits were hard as if they were stale and a week old.  Several of us commented on this, and only complained about this.  Biscuits should be able to be cut through easily with a fork when eating "sausage gravy and biscuits." They weren't that easy to cut with a knife as well.  To end on a good note, the restaurant was also very clean and inviting, with a very patient staff.

Wednesday morning at 10am it was a one hour wait. Ok that's a positive sign if ever.

This is a small location. The hostess was definitely overwhelmed checking vaccination cards, cleaning tables and then doing hosting duties but stayed friendly throughout all of it.  Once we sat down it was a bit more calmer. The staff is great and despite the busy morning we had sufficient check-ins.

Food was fantastic. The pictures don't do it justice. The weakest thing we had was a seasonal winter beignets in chocolate sauce. Otherwise everything else was *drool* yum.

The french toast bites were like fried air crisps dipped in heavenly sauce. The crawfish and grits  Benedict was a creative take on the dish and out the very competent salmon Benedict I had as part of my duo to shame. The banana foster pain perdu was decadent. Just about everything was great. Only downside was a limited kids menu. My younger one wanted chocolate chip pancakes which they could not do so she got the regular ones. To their credit the portions were huge.

Definitely worth the wait.
Loved the food, loved the service, loved the green tomatoes loved the ambiance 5 stars all the way. If I'm ever back in New Orlean I will definitely be stopping in

My cousin and I decided to check this place out after a glowing recommendation from our Lyft driver, and unfortunately it did not meet the hype. 
The food was mediocre at best, cold and lacked flavor. However, the service was amazing! The waitresses and manger were super nice. 
The vibes are really good, and the story behind the name was nice and the decor was cute and fun. However, the food was not all that. 
We ordered - 
1. White chocolate banana pudding pancakes 
Overall they had lots of flavor, but they were cold and seemed undercooked. 
2. Breakfast potatoes - overall these were okay, but I don't think they were worth the price. 
3. Fries- my fries were cold, and tasted stale. 
4. Toast - unfortunately my toast was also cold and slightly mushy. 
5. 2 biscuits w the syrup cane butter. - my biscuit was a little cold, but the butter was delish. 
6. I also ordered a coke and it was flat. 
The menu also said that it had vegan options, however they basically sum up to some toast, blast potatoes and oatmeal, which as nice as it is, isn't anything glorious. 
Overall- 
Pros- 
Really nice service- I had asked if I could switch my cold food out for something else and the manger came over and accommodated quickly. 
Cute story 
Good flavors on the pancake, but cold. 
Cons- 
Cold food 
A bit crowded, but just put your name on the guest list on yelp before you arrive and it should be fine. We didn't wait that long before we got bar seating. 
I don't think I would return, but only because my food was cold and it just didn't live up to be what I wanted it to be.

Thanks to Manager KK and server David for taking care of my order and providing me with great customer service. The vibe is nice, very busy place. I enjoyed the food. Thanks again for a great 1st visit. The biscuit n gravy was good and very meaty. The fried green tomatoes... muahhhh delicioso

This place was great. Long line but they come out and get you a drink if you want one, i got an Irish coffee. We sat at the bar, food came out quickly and tasted great! Would come back if in New Orleans again!

Tony, I loved sitting at your table, and you were so spot on about the biscuits and gravy, life changing!!!!

Love you guys, and loved Tony!!!!
Very very good! Worth the wait ! Will go bacc when I visit! Shrimp and grits, and banana foster!

The Banana Foster Pan Perdu is amazing!! I tried everyone's dish and although everything was A-ok, the Pan Perdu was off the charts! I love the flavor of banana foster so the flavors of this dish were on spot.

This place was just a couple of blocks from where we were staying at in the CBD. I've bookmarked this place, so naturally I had to check it out. I heard they normally have lines and the wait can be a while. Good thing for NoWait, we were able to get a table upon arriving. The place itself was a little small and the place is always packed. Our server was good, but could've been better. I ordered the shrimp and Grits and requested to add bacon on the side, when my order came there was no bacon...was going to ask him about it, but he was just busy and all over the place. The other people in my group ordered the cochon Benedict, and souther blt. Both enjoyed their dishes. I must say their shrimp and grits was on point.
WORTH THE WAIT one of the best brunches I've had. The eggs chochon was amazing and my husband and I devoured the French toast bites. Service was very fast and we were seated within 20 minutes too

If Ruby Slipper was located in my hometown, it would be a five-star restaurant. However, there is much better Southern brunch cuisine to be had in NOLA.  Portions were enormous and the servers were friendly, but I did not think it was worth the wait. There are no reservations, but one can add their name to the waiting list.  We did that on a weekday morning in August 2021, and waited about 45 minutes to be seated at the bar.  It's definitely a popular place.
     I appreciated the variety of choices on the menu as well as gluten/free and vegan options.  I chose the Gulf Shrimp Omelette, which came with potatoes and fresh fruit.  The potatoes were too overdone to enjoy.  I didn't love my omelette either.  I love shrimp.  I love eggs. Maybe I just don't like the two together. Maybe I should've ordered something else. I'm unsure but it wasn't my favorite and my brunch partner agreed with my assessment.  The restaurant and it's dining area was clean and all customers had to show a vaccine card or negative COVID-19 test within the last 72 hours to dine.
We had a pleasant wait for a table & they work hard.  Server was awesome and the biscuits & gravy were delish!
We got brunch and it was absolutely delicious their iced coffee was out of this world and the food was well portioned and tasty
I am not a huge fan of biscuits normally, in fact, I never eat them, but these were delicious! During a 4 day trip to NOLA, we had breakfast here twice! I had the corned beef and it was really good.

You have to eat here!!! We ate here our first morning in NOLA & quickly decided to come back everyday. Food is perfectly seasoned, great portions, excellent and nice atmosphere. You must try the corned beef eggs Benedict and the Bananas Foster French toast! Also the mimosas and bellinis were large, not served in a champagne flute.
Amamzing!!!! Our Server Tony was wonderful! Had great suggestions and had us laughing!!! Def the best breakfast of our trip!!!
Not what there sister restaurants are like in New Orleans. Very underwhelming, but the staff was very nice and courteous

Unfortunately, I would like to give a much higher rating for this establishment but after waiting 2 days to come and eat the way in which I was rushed to eat my food and pretty much leave for the next group of people to sit doesn't feel okay to me
There food and service were so good!! Brocade breakfast I have had in awhile. Their twist on eggs Benedict was awesome. So was their coffee.

Food is good. But we waited in line for 3 hours. Even though they told us a two hour wait. Then we we start to order they are out of chicken and the majority or the menu items are great chicken meals. They definitely aren't prepared for a big crowd.

Great place for breakfast! Husband and I are on vacation here in New Orleans and we noticed this was only a five minute walk from our hotel. Seemed pretty busy when we arrived so we got on the waitlist. Got seated sooner than we expected and was a great experience overall. Our waitress was kind and attentive and the food was delicious! Will probably eat here again before our trip is over!
Just leaving now. Breakfast was so good I had the peacemaker chicken and pork.... !!!!!!!!!

SO GOOD. Melissa is so sweet and made our visit x100 better. She recommended a few dishes and all were amazing. The wait was faster than we expected and the iced coffee was good too. We will be back. Thank you!

Biscuit and gravy was really good. Banana foster was fine- brioche bread would have been better than the French bread likely. The shrimp and grits, however, was not good. It was just acidic- tasting a little like canned tomato instead of the rich, flavorful version I've had elsewhere.

Coffee was ok. Long lines at all times and food took over 40 min to come out. Overall not bad but with so many good brunch spots in town we expected this to be better. 

Our waitress was very nice- so rounding this 3.5 review up to 4.

We went really early and easily got a table. But, if you wait until later there will most definitely be a line. That said: it's worth the wait.

We started breakfast with some fried green tomatoes. Way better than we expected. They were dressed with lettuce, tomato, bacon and some sort of sauce. 

We also got the candied bacon....soooo good. and then shared the biscuits and gravy. It had two eggs, two biscuits with a super flavorful gravy, bacon; and one more fried tomato. 

Our server was super friendly and just the right amount of attentive (I think her name was Brandi!)
I love this place and every time I come to New Orleans I have to come here the food is delicious

We can here for brunch during our New Orleans trip.  There was a pretty long wait around 10am even after I had us on the waitlist via yelp.  Since we were able to order drinks at the bar while we wait, it wasn't too bad.  I ordered two different eggs Benedict and the stuffed French toast.  The brisket one was pretty good but the fried chicken one was kinda dry.  My friend thought the fried chicken one tasted freezer burnt but I don't know what freezer burnt taste like.  The stuffed French toast was really good.  I would say it's a pretty average brunch place and the drinks are kinda on the expensive side for brunch.

Last time I came to New Orleans, the wait time to this place was almost an hour and we didn't have that time! We were so lucky to make it this time and it was fabulous! The smoked salmon Benedict and shrimp Benedict were amazing. Generous heaps of salmon and shrimp on top of a perfect biscuit. Coffee was food too but not like cafe du monde stuff ( so I would just walk down there for coffee) but it comes in such a cute ruby slipper mug. 

I saw their banana caramel  French toast on the table next to me which looked soooo good!! Would have had that too if I had a bottomless stomach. 

My friend got the southern breakfast platter which looked okay but nothing special. I think Benedict's are the way to go here?

Excellent service and food. This was our first stop for brunch when we arrived to New Orleans. The food was excellent and although there was a wait we were able to put our names on the waitlist so we were seated within 10 minutes of arriving. Great location and very friendly and engaging staff. I can't wait to come back so I can go again.
Ok if you love spicy and sweet then try their spicy chicken & French toast bites for brunch!! It's an amazing and unforgettable dish.

The wait is literally 45 minutes to an hour and there were people skipping some how. When we finally got seated Lance took amazing care of us and the food took even better care ! I usually share photos but the meal was soo good and after waiting for an hour i was to hungry to do so. 

I recommend the sweet heat but don't expect any heat it taste mainly like honey. My husband loved his meal as well he had the Biscuits and Gravy.

Loved this place. Wait was long (about 45 minutes) for breakfast but it was so good. The French toast bites were a little hard but the chicken, grits, eggs, corn beef hash, biscuits and chicken sausage were on point!  I look forward to going back next time I visit!!!   Oh the drinks are extra strong too!!!
Incredible food, service and atmosphere. Brandi was our server and was hilarious and kept us happy with our large group demands. We will be back!

This place is consistently SOOOO good! Well worth the wait....if you have to wait. The Benedict's are amazing and the grits and biscuits and gravy are amazing as well.  Great service from our waiter Freddie H who was super attentive and super nice! Def don't miss this gem when in town!!

Amazing brunch! I think it's definitely worth the wait. The servers will show you real Southern hospitality. The banana foster french toast is EVERYTHING - 100% recommend it to anyone. To offset the sweet, we got a benedict flight. The eggs were a bit inconsistent across the 3 benedicts we got (some were more cooked, some were perfectly runny), but overall super delicious.

How did I not review this? Back in September, my mom and I came for breakfast. After being seated at the bar, we got the southern breakfast and the stuffed French toast to split.

Omg wow! The southern breakfast is a good, stick to your ribs kind of thing - 2 eggs, grits, a fried green tomato, 2 slices of bacon, and a biscuit with cane butter. The stuffed French toast was a massive portion of French toast with cheesecake filling and blueberry compote. Both were delicious! 

Because it was so good the first time around, and had some interesting local color (the drunk guy at 8am), we decided to back this time with my dad and some friends.

Mom and I again split the southern breakfast, this time with the bananas foster pain perdu, while my dad got the stuffed French toast and my friend got the pancake flight.

We had seen the pain perdu on our previous visit, and man, it's even better than it looks. Sugar rush! My friends pancake flight was also completely awesome - bacon pecan, cinnamon swirl, and blueberry pancakes. Wow!

We only had a 10 minute wait for 5 minutes - not bad.
Great brunch place. Don't sleep on this NOlA eatery. But I would suggest not walking in without calling ahead to be placed on the waitlist.

My Fav breakfast in NOLA. It never fails when approaching this place that there will be some type of wait so just prepare to wait. 
My first visit here was summer of 2014 while pregnant with my son and the customer service was so amazing and the food came out Hot, Fast & Fresh.

Our second visit was during that same summer of 2014 and that visit didn't fall short of the first.

However the 3rd time should be a charm but it sadly wasn't only due to the service. Our server was horrible he barely brought us water we waited at least 35mins for water and ended up calling over another server to take our order just because we observed her momentum and attitude with her tables and we witnessed others who sat after us get their food order taken and drinks brought out all all.

I try to give a place 2-3 shots to get it right before reviewing if I know I'll be in the area. 

My go to dish is the Banana Fosters French Toast with a side of scrambled egg whites. This visit I tried the chicken sausage only to feed to our son but they were not tasty not properly cooked so I wouldn't suggest them. My husband always order a omelet and out teenager ordered the regular French toast which is enjoyed.

Breakfast was extremely limited in NOLA until after Katrina so to find a decent restaurant was exciting which is why we frequent this place.

Went twice for breakfast during my recent trip. 
Their coffee is outstanding!
The cochon benedict was bested by the fried chicken benedict. 
Their biscuits are flaky and BIG. 
The OJ is fresh squeezed but not on premises. 
The grits were tasty but I wasn't a fan of the BBQ sauce for the shrimp. 
A good value and not hard to get a table if you go early.

This place is the most popular breakfast spot in NOLA. There is always a line out the door. I suggest you go online and put yourself on the waitlist so that you don't have to stand around for an hour. That's what we did, and we were seated within 5-10 minutes of the estimated arrival time. There is so much to offer on the menu that it's hard to decide what to choose. I was stuck between the cinnamon swirl pancakes but finally decided on the BYO omelet. I added shrimp, cheddar cheese, mushrooms, and spinach. They gave me a hefty serving, and it also came with a buttermilk biscuit and grits. The food here is amazing.

So Ruby Slipper is a Must Go To in New Orleans especially because the food and drinks are always flowing and good. Expect a wait, as I waited 2 hours one day and 3 hours the next but they served drinks while you waited and Kyra made sure we got the best service.

Make sure to ask for Kyra, she has the best service, recommendations, and answers to all things New Orleans!

Another spot with a wait outside but they have a wait app you should hop on when you are on your way. A plus while you wait a waitress comes out and takes your drink order. That is super smart! Kudos to them. 

We ended up sitting outside and I didn't mind because it was a mild morning and inside air conditioning was very cold :-) 

It was very hard to choose I wanted something lighter but also wanted the Bananas Foster French Toast. My hubby ordered the French toast and I nibbled on it! I got something off the lighter fare which was the skinny migas. Both were delicious. 

I also got the chicory ice coffee and of course it was was delicious. It didn't need any cream and little sweetener.

We had the best time and food at Ruby Slipper!  Newman was the best waiter, he was very attentive and even gave us some tourist options for some incredible tastes of New Orleans!  We will be back and definitely ask for Newman!
Delicious food, fast and friendly service and nice decor inside. We had the egg Benedict and chicken waffles both outstanding!

Umm ummm good!  Go to this place people!  My friends and I went on a Saturday, early afternoon, without a reservation during a busy Essence Festival Weekend and had a 30 minute wait, which wasn't too bad.  Our waiter wasn't as attentive as I would have liked but I got over it.  The place is huge, is air conditioned of course and has some outside seating for those of you who want to brave the elements in the southern heat

I ordered the short stake of pancakes and a mimosa.  Both were good BUT my two girlfriends had the Walnut Pancakes that were TO DIED FOR!!!  Do yourself a favor and order them too!  Enjoy!

Loved this breakfast spot. The place has a lot of character and the wait staff are very cheerful. Had to wait about 20 minutes but was worth it. I had one of their signature dishes-Eggs Cochin. The pork was great and the biscuit was the best I ever had,since I've never liked one before. The Bloody Mary and Mimosas are also excellent.

Set my alarm to get on the waitlist after a crazy night out on Frenchman street. We wanted to get seated by 10:30am so got on waitlist at 8:30am at a 2hour wait. When we got there and checked in with the hostess... she said the wait would a little longer. We waited thirty minutes longer! In morning after hungover time that's practically two hours. But yo! The food made up for it!! Absolutely worth it. We got a mix of egg Benedict's that were just so good. There's a reason crowds of people are always at the Ruby Slipper. Food and drinks never disappoint.

I figured after three great meals at the Ruby Slipper, it was time to share what a great find this little gem is!

Over the past few weeks, I've had breakfast twice and lunch. Every meal was well worth the price paid. Check the special board, as it always had something great to offer. The fruit stuffed french toast was awesome, as was the "three little pigs" omelette. 

The service is consistently good, and you can't beat the location if walking from anywhere in the CBD or FQ.

Expect quite the line when you go, but the process moves at a decent pace. We were told the wait was an hour, but we were sat in about 40ish minutes, so that was nice. We ate and drank at the bar, and the bar tender was amazing. He was funny, and totally on top of the service. My husband and I split the Winter Flight of mimosas, which definitely packed a punch. We also shared the holiday seasonal beignets which had chocolate marscarpone, Brandied cherries, whipped cream, and of course powered sugar. They were heavenly! I had the eggs Cochon, and they were perfectly poached over the braised pork. The hollandaise was rich and creamy. My husband had the Migas and loved it too. He especially enjoyed the chipotle sour cream. The bar tender also gave us the scoop on a few other less touristy places to eat, which was awesome. Definitely make the stop, the Ruby Slipped is worth the wait.
This restaurant was recommended during our visit to New Orleans we truly enjoyed it. We highly recommend it, the service was great and the food was amazing!

We got on the waitlist before leaving our hotel. The seating is very structured and effective. Our wait was between 20-40 mins and I believe we waited 30 mins tops. They are very organized. There is a large bar in the center with seating around the bar. I ordered the Chicken St. Charles. It was mouthwatering delicious. The chicken was cooked perfectly, juicy and crispy! The biscuit was moist and the sauce on top was the perfect touch. I rarely ever finish my food but this meal was not going to go to waste! I'm stuffed! My friend ordered the skinny miss, which was flavorful and if your trying to eat On the healthier side this is a meal For you. The portions are great and filling. Loved this place!

I've been to this place a few times and it never disappoints.  Usually you have a bit of a line but it does move quickly.  I like to start with a mimosa or bellini...both are nice.  Do yourself a favor and have either the banana fosters french toast, the migas, or the costa rican breakfast.  Each is well worth the line.
My spouse and I absolutely love this place!  It really doesn't matter which location you choose, as we have frequent Metairie location, it's always great service and great delicious food!
Ate there yesterday definitely recommend signing up for the waitlist while you're walking over so you don't have to wait long. Hot chicken sandwich and the French Toast bites were delicious.
Like this place for breakfast.  Haven't been for anything else.  Breakfast was pretty creative.  We ate outside which was nice because it was a beautiful NOLA day
Great food, great atmosphere excellent service!   We chose this location over the ones closer to French Quarter and we are so glad we did! No wait and the food was one of the best brunches I've had!

It was worth the wait .. 

Their was a bug queue . But we made it in after 25-30 mins . The staff was really nice and friendly . They suggested some dishes which were good.

I've only been to Ruby Slipper on two occasions. The food was good both times but was particularly memorable the second. The waits here are indeed long. It's probably justified depending on how you order, so order well and maybe you won't mind it so much. Put your name on the list and go for a walk. If you just want biscuits and gravy...eh, it may not be worth the wait. 

Let's talk about the bananas foster French toast. This was the best French toast I've had in my life. I had BFFT at another establishment a day or two later and it was also very good. But it was better at Ruby Slipper. I think my only issue with it was that they use baguette for the bread, which has a high crust ratio. So even with all the rum syrup/sauce, it can be kinda hard to cut. But this is me being a little bit nit picky. If you've got your heart set on sweet, it's worth the wait for this French toast. Shoot, it's worth a another trip to Nola for this French toast. Oh, but get the pig candy too. So flippin' good.

Umm did someone say Boozy Coffee? Ruby slipper did. And they NAILED IT!!!
Loved Ruby Slipper. Loved the vibe, loved the service, loved the drinks, loved the food.
Definitely recommend trying the boozy coffee and mimosas. Great portions for the price.

This became our morning stop for breakfast. The menu is so eclectic that anyone can find something. They take classics and put Ruby twist to it making it to-die-for! The coffee there was amazing. The grits were delicious. The biscuit was too good to leave behind. The portions were definitively sufficient. Now fun fact, don't just show up! Get on the waiting list on your way. And if you're impatient, you can order your drinks while in line! Yes, a bloody mary before stepping a foot inside!

In NOLA for business. Decided try Ruby Slipper on my day off. The line was out the door and an hour wait. Decided to have breakfast at the bar. The bartenders were great and attentive during a business football Sunday. I had the Bananas Foster French Toast and cranberry mimosa. Definitely will return!
This is a perfect place for brunch in NOLa. Our waitress was so friendly and the food was good! I would recommend their Bloody Mary, but skip their mimosa.

Wow! There is a reason that there's always a two hour wait here! I'll start out with a tip, if you want to get a table come here right when they open! Even then, there was a way. The food was phenomenal and the service was great! This is the best brunch place in New Orleans! Definitely recommend any visitors in town, or locals, come down and check this place out! I got the Fried Chicken Benny and an ice coffee, and started with fried green tomatoes... So good!

The service wasn't great . We sat inside and had flys drop into our OJ. When asked to move we was told we would have to be put back on the waitlist,when there was open tables available. I asked for the candy maple bacon but was given regular bacon .  Was so looking forward to the candy maple  ..

Cute little place. Came here from brunch on a Sunday and had about a 45 minute wait BUT you can purchase drinks at the bar while you wait, which never hurts. The waiter was sweet and the food came out pretty quickly. My friend got the skinny migas, which she really liked. I got the Spanish omelet which was just ok. Overall, I didn't feel it was really worth the wait... But then again, there is always a wait for brunch!

When hearing people rave and recommend this place I was so excited to get breakfast. The line moved rather quickly and when we finally sat we ordered coffee. One of the servers forgot my coffee. No big deal. When he came back he gave us one. We quickly ordered and it took a little bit more than normal. When I got our food I ordered the infamous egg couchon. My one egg was already broken.. Which was the severs fault when bringing it back (usually) kinda annoyed. The yolk was pretty dry by the time it got to me is all. However, I checked in and got the cheaper Bacon Bloody Mary. that was fabulous. Would I come here again? I'm not sure, but it was a great experience and I'm Glad we went once. Love the history behind the place. Oh yeah.. My sister got the cheesecake stuffed French toast! Super sweet but yum!

AMAZING!!! This place is all that and a bag of chips! The wait for us was a little over an hour and we have ZERO regrets! I will wait again for this food, service, and vibe. The drinks were amazing but the salmon omelette was DELECTABLE! Chef kisses!

Heard a lot about this place. I was told by many, including yelp that it's a NOLA must visit.  So....I came, saw and conquered. 
So, it's a known fact that the wait is insane, even during the week.  Since we planned to do brunch on Sunday, I used the waitlist feature on Yelp and put my name on the list. At 10am the wait was 50-70 minutes .....shout out to the waitlist. 
Got there and checked in at 10:50, still had to wait for 15-20 minutes. That flew by...it helped that they have someone outside to take drink orders. Sangria to the rescue. We were seated, and greeted fairly quickly. Though our sever was a little MIA. The place was uber packed, so she gets a pass.
The food....yes lawd!  We both decided on the gulf fish st peter. It was phenomenal!!! Drum fish, sautéed spinach and tomatoes over grit cakes topped with hollandaise and a shrimp skewer. The bill was $36, without the sangria. I'd definitely return.  Next time I'm getting the banana french toast.

I don't even know where to start.  This was our top recommendation from local friends. We actually set an alarm to make it before the lines.  First off, David, amazing! He made the best recommendations while ordering. If you don't know what to choose follow his lead. Also the GM Lindsay is beyond. We loved hearing the story behind the restaurant and just another opportunity to meet an amazingly, incredible local.  The food was unreal. Everything was so fresh and savory. We will 110% be back again. Side note: we are big coffee people..... the coffee is amazing. Thanks to Lindsay we wound up with some to take back with us to MD.
Long wait and they got my phone number wrong so it was even longer than expected but other than that everything was so good!  We ate outside and enjoyed everything immensely.

This place was amazing!  From the host taking our names to the servers. Don't forget the amazing food!  We are so glad we came and waited, even in the freezing (literally) weather. Our family felt more welcome there than any other place we've ever been. When they say LQBT+ welcoming they mean it!  Kids loved it  I didn't get any other pictures except my coffee and my sons cinnamon swirl pancakes.

Please come hungry!!!! Every time I've been in I've never been disappointed. The mimosas are perfect and I can never seem to order just one. My go to are the eggs Benedict's served on soft fluffy biscuits. The portions are generous and filling.
